comments: I can't say anything about the hospitality, as I never made it down to Texas.  I missed my flight due to winter weather conditions.  Sylvia didn't refund any of the cost.

I have to warn potential customers about a slight problem I had with Sylvia. On arrival, she asked for a $100 deposit, (which is normal of course) in cash or check form. She wrote a receipt and said we would get it back on departure.

The morning came where we had to go. She overslept even though we had discussed a 9 AM departure. She then said, "Oh right, you know what... I spent your cash so I'll send it to you in the mail"... We found this totally irresponsible and unprofessional.

She ended up writing us a check on the spot and it did not bounce. The point is, she was not a responsible host. A respectful guest shouldn't have to think about whether he/she is going to get their deposit back.

I would consider looking in to other hosts on Air BNB in Austin.

the house was a good value. the weather was crazy cold which had nothing to do with the host but it did color our experience as the house was freezing cold and nothing seemed to help. we used a space heater and the house had electrical problems so that worked occasionally. the internet was down 5 of 6 days so it was very difficult to do business.
hosts were responsive and helpful.

Spent a week here on a business trip, and had a great time. I managed to run along the trails of the lake every morning before getting ready for the day. Staying here also allowed me to avoid all of the poor traffic that many of the locals find frustrating.

Studio tr√®s bien plac√©, pr√®s des arr√™ts de bus. Il s'agit en fait d'un garage am√©nag√©, mais tout confort. Cuisine avec l'essentiel. La literie est tr√®s confortable. La d√©co est un peu vieillote mais l'ensemble est tr√®s propre.
On recommande

This place is always hot the person who lives upstairs controls the air conditioner and never turns it on. So it is always humid and muggy and cause of that has a bad smell. I don‚Äôt recommend it. Then the owner accused us of cutting branches for some weird reason. Like why would anyone do that on vacation. So the owner is kind of weird.
Great quaint neighborhood location still close enough to the highway to get around. My only disappointment was there was not a full kitchen, I suppose I missed this in the listing description.
Got in late, but everything was in order for me to ptfo without any trouble. Thanks!
Electric, colorful funky home! Two thumbs up!

This place does not have any TVs, there aren‚Äôt real beds just cushions on the floor, there is a bunk but the ladder is unsafe and hard to use wouldn‚Äôt recommend children staying here. Had to sleep on the bottom floor bc the top was so hot. We slept on pallets on the floor again there are NO beds. Hot water wasn‚Äôt enough for 4 people to take a shower, hot tub was not working. Really cool design host was nice but not my favorite place.
Lois was very understanding and accomodating when we had a personal issue came up that affected the timing of our stay.
Stylish lodging iff the beaten path.

Dieses kleine H√§uschen ist sehr gem√ºtlich und eine perfekte Unterkunft, wenn man allein oder zu zweit in Austin ist. In der K√ºche sind Marmelade, Gew√ºrze, Milch, Eier, Bier und Wein und Tee zur Begr√º√üung vorhanden, ich h√§tte gar nicht einkaufen m√ºssen. Ich habe Andys Fahrrad genutzt und war nur mit dem Fahrrad in der Stadt unterwegs. Andy und Ellen sind sehr hilfsbereit und haben mich zum Superbowl schauen eingeladen. Das Haus ist liebevoll eingerichtet, viele B√ºcher. Ganz in der N√§he ist das Cafe Kurbylane mit sehr gutem frischem und nicht zu teurem Essen. Schl√ºssel√ºbergabe war unkompliziert, die T√ºr stand offen und der Schl√ºssel steckte. Ich komme gerne wieder.

Tr√®s bel appartement, calme, avec tout le confort et beaucoup de place et d'espaces vides. Vivian est tr√®s sympathique, discr√®te mais facilement atteignable. La cuisine est parfaite pour faire d'excellents repas.
A recommander!

V√•r vistelse hos Amy &Justin var helt suver√§n. Vi hade ju till och med ett eget litet hus, och vi hade tillg√•ng till kylsk√•p! toppen. Eftersom jag har lite problem med mina f√∂tter √§r det sk√∂nt att kunna ha lite mat till hands om jag inte vill slita p√• f√∂tterna och g√• ut en extra g√•ng f√∂r att √§ta.. V√§rdparet och deras lille son √§r j√§ttegulliga, och det blev helt perfekt f√∂r oss att f√• r√• oss sj√§lva de f√∂rsta dygnen, men med m√∂jlighet att f√• hj√§lp med vad vi ville. Vi blev t.o.m. skjutsade till bussh√•llplatsen f√∂rsta dagen. Eftersom Amys mamma skulle komma p√• bes√∂k fick vi sedan flytta till ett annat boende. Vi kunde inte f√•tt det b√§ttre.H√§lsningar Ingvor Carlander och Lars-Olof Lindgren
Die Wohnung ist sehr sch√∂n eingerichtet und hat alles was wir brauchen. Wir haben uns sehr wohl gef√ºhlt.

I was disappointed with my stay at this listing.
Cons:
Foul odor throughout the home.
The photos online are not accurate to the current condition. (Slightly different furniture, decor, etc.)
Amenities are not as listed. For example, wifi did not work continuously and there were no TVs despite being listed as an amenity and included in pictures.
Cleanliness was questionable, despite the high cleaning fee. The sheets in one of the bedrooms were stained and made us question if they had been washed, the bath towels were wet, etc. When we contacted the host about exorbitant food crumbs in the living room he did have the cleaning crew come back.
House is not in great shape overall - cold water didn't work in the bathroom sink, broken blinds, flickering light bulbs, etc. All in all, it's an old house, and the description of "contemporary" is inaccurate.

Pros:
- perfect location
- host responsive to messages during our stay
- easy check in
- parking provided in driveway

I was shocked by the previous generally positive reviews. This listing was misleading overall and not in the described condition.
Stay here! Rented this house for a girls weekend and all the extra design touches were on point! The weather was nasty but the house made the weekend.

Don‚Äôt let the pictures fool you, they are very outdated and this house is very cluttered. There‚Äôs not much space to put any of your stuff, all the space is filled with decorative items. Bathroom & room lights were out when we visited. Host takes 3-4 hours to respond to texts and doesn‚Äôt answer calls. Kitchen and upstairs is hidden behind paintings and curtains. Most rooms don‚Äôt even have curtains so everyone can see your bare booty. Bathroom is small and cluttered, barely any space to put a toothbrush and tooth paste. Wouldn‚Äôt recommend staying here, especially if you‚Äôre traveling with more than 4.
Expect a stay as states and then some! You won‚Äôt be disappointed.

Wundervolle Einrichtung und tolle Lage. Sehr detailverliebte Dekoration und gem√ºtliche Atmosph√§re. Die Gartendusche ist bei den warmen Temperaturen ein absolutes Plus. Gastgeberin ist sehr liebensw√ºrdig und √§u√üerst hilfsbereit. Nur zu empfehlen!

You can expect a good location, the house is right in the middle of downtown Austin and lake Travis. So traveling anywhere was easy. However do not expect to be staying in a clean house. We did not enjoy our stay there due to the house being dirty and has an awful smell that just wouldn‚Äôt leave. Most everything you touch in the kitchen is sticky and most dishes had stains on them. The bathrooms were a disaster, and the floors made you feel gross walking on them.
House is the poor repair. It is he home with a lot of his personal stuff throughout the house

La petite maison jaune de Mary est un petit coin de paradis. C‚Äôest tr√®s propre, fonctionnel et bien d√©cor√©. Les lits sont confortables et les draps sentent bon. La maison est plus belle et plus grande que sur les photos. La cour arri√®re est vraiment tr√®s agr√©able. Tout est pens√© pour que le visiteur se sente chez lui. Il y avait m√™me des fruits, du caf√©, du jus et des muffins √† notre arriv√©e! C‚Äôest un peu loin du centre-ville √† pied (45 min), mais il y a un a bus √† quelques pas de la maison qui s‚Äôy rend en 10 minutes. C‚Äôest un quartier calme, s√©curitaire et vraiment tr√®s agr√©able. J‚Äôy retournerai ! Merci Mary, tout √©tait parfait!

Absolument parfait !
Mary est une h√¥tesse attentionn√©e et discr√®te. L'acc√®s est tr√®s facile, gr√¢ce au code d'entr√©e, et on se sent imm√©diatement comme chez soi dans ce joli bungalow austinien et sa terrasse √† la texane.
L'endroit est id√©al pour une immersion rapide dans la vie alternative d'Austin : proximit√© de SoCo et d√©couverte des tr√®s nombreux lieux branch√©s de la 1st Street (tr√®s bien indiqu√©s par Mary).
C'est vraiment une excellente fa√ßon de profiter de cette ville vivante et s√©duisante.
Apr√®s avoir d√©cid√© de louer une voiture pour la semaine (Texas oblige), nous avons pu avoir facilement acc√®s aux divers lieux, culturels ou naturels, de la r√©gion.
Dallas, San Antonio, Houston sont ainsi √† port√©e de main.
My second time at Mary's home and the experience couldn't be better. Awesome place and host!

Jill is a very friendly and kind lady.  She couldn't be nicer. The room is spacious but, along with the bathroom it was very dirty and smelly.  There was moisture damage on the walls and ceiling, the room floods when it rains, and the toilet cloggs.  In general her place is neither apt, nor appropriate, for guests under any circumstances because it really has so many problems.

Pete was communicative and reliable.

However, during my stay my car was broken into while parked on the airbnb property. Unfortunately there was no additional secruity measures, such as surveillance cameras, on the property that would have aided in protecting my property. The car was directly parked in front of the Airbnb and within view of my windows. I also had items stolen from the front mail box directly located by the front door.

Another uncomfortable discovery, that was only caught when my friend happened to be walking her dog, was that people walking by my unit could see into my house through the thin curtains in the living room. They could also see my silhouette through the thin blinds located throughout the house. This provided a lack of privacy and made me feel unsafe.

Dan‚Äôs place is in a great location and is absolutely immaculate. Very modern feel and comfy bed. The area is quiet, but within walking distance to shopping and entertainment.
A few windows do not have window coverings. They are high enough where it is not a privacy issue in the sleeping area, but if you need complete darkness to sleep, it could be tough.
Clean and well decorated. Will need a car to get places - no Uber in Austin :(

After a sad week dealing with the death and funeral of my grandmother in San Antonio, I found myself browsing AirBnBs in downtown Austin for a quick respite before returning home to Dallas. John‚Äôs place was the perfect spot to walk to all my favorite places on SoCo and Zilker.

Beware!  I booked his room for business travel over a month in advance and then my company asked me to cancel on Sept 20, and come on a later date.  (This was still 14 days before my original trip/ reservation of Oct 3) and I cancelled with airbnb on Set 20 and also wrote to the owner personally and cancelled with him on that date. I did so all online, in the airbnb system and I received a notice from AirBNB of only getting a half credit.  Then, on the date of my original travel plan I get a notice that my reservation was not cancelled with Airbnb online for some reason and the owner collects all fees, cleaning and all as if I stayed there!!!  He is NOT someone to trust!  He was notified IMMEDIATELY <AS WAS AIRBNB<& no one seems to care that I have a print to file pdf copy of the AirBNB message showing that I would get a credit!!  There is no Help for AIR BNB and the owner states he could not rent his room?  Although, I communicated back and forth with him , in the airbnb system on Sept 19-20 telling him that I was cancelling and the reason!  Total  THIEF!!!

If you are looking to spend almost $4000 on a dirty place then this is where you should stay. The location is great but the interior is not. Don‚Äôt let the photos deceive you the last time they probably cleaned this rental was in 2019. The master bedroom was never clean dust bunnies were all over the fixtures above my head the sheets contained the previous renters, body hair and crumbs. The shower had not been cleaned and had soap scum all over the handles and the walls, there was no toilet paper and no spares within the rental and even if you had toilet paper, there‚Äôs nowhere to put it because the toilet paper holder was ripped off the wall. All the buttons for the toilets were broken so we had to use our acrylic nails to try to rig a way to flush the toilets , dirty dishes and trash filled the cupboards. Worst host offered a partial refund and then when we try to communicate about it, they refuse to respond on numerous occasions.
Meh. Not worth the price. Mediocre not special in any way

Didn't meet Elizabeth, but she was very communicative via text. Birdhouse was easy to find and Elizabeth left us a key to get in.

Pros: convenient to East Austin; Mr. Natural only a couple blocks away; plenty of Car2Gos in neighborhood; Oskar Blues in fridge; small space decent for our only need - somewhere to sleep on East side for two nights.

Cons: Didn't like entering through alley - especially at night and after a massive rainfall that made it a bit messy; looks more quaint in photos - could use more interior decor; only one bath towel for two people; $25 cleaning fee seemed a bit much for such a small place in which we only slept - not best deal for $90 a night total.

In the end, it served it's purpose and it proved to be very convenient for a short visit back to our former home town, which is changing so much.

It was totally cute and perfect for us. It is super tiny, especially the bathroom, but I was expecting that and we didn't mind the intimate experience for our anniversary celebration. The hosting was just what we needed and no more. Great overall!

We booked 4 nights in the birdhouse and would have to describe it as an average experience.

Elizabeth is a responsive and kind host who was available whenever we needed her. The location is not far from 6th street nightlife.

However we didn't feel that in comparison to other air BnB of the same cost that it provided the same standard / experience. The futon mattress is lumpy and uncomfortable and the white paper blinds on window's and patio doors were stuck with tape and didn't cover them entirely, so it was bright and not very private.

It has good potential but to us it felt a bit neglected.

Booked to stay here for a long weekend. When we arrived the first night, turned the lights on and a cockroach ran across the bed. The inside looked like it had not been cleaned thoroughly for some time. Including broken boards under the futon, the general condition of the Birdhouse was misrepresented by the pictures. Lastly, the ‚Äúcurtains‚Äù on the doors/windows were thin paper taped on with scotch tape, so we didn't feel like there was a ton of privacy.

Unfortunately, after the first night we packed up and left. Elizabeth was very apologetic and understanding of the situation and refunded us immediately. She was very easy to communicate with throughout the experience, but we weren‚Äôt happy with the condition of the house. Only writing this review to warn others as we researched extensively and didn‚Äôt find anything negative hinting at the experience we had.

I don't love leaving negative reviews, but this was disappointing at best. The neighborhood is so Austin kooky, and the studio itself, though pretty rustic, has a cool funky vibe. But the black mold we found under the toilet seat, the grime we wiped out of the shower, the two-inch roach we killed, and the extraordinarily uncomfortable bed made us feel like we'd been swindled. I wouldn't let a friend stay there for free in its present state.
Exactly as described. Nothing fancy but excellent price!
it was in a very nice neighborhood, but you have to park in front of their house and had to walk around the block to get into the back yard to enter the house.

This is a rustic place in a great location for a solo traveler.  Think rustic and you‚Äôll be OK.  Winter is not the best time to book this since there is no insulation and the small heater couldn‚Äôt keep up. Also,  a very small water heater so shower fast.
The lowest price you‚Äôll find anywhere. A couple small nuances, that‚Äôs all. Worth it if you‚Äôre on a budget.
I would not really recommend this place.  Looks different in the picture than  it actually is.

The Birdhouse is made out of what seemed to be particle board & tin. A few major issues we experienced: 30 degree weather with no central heat (there was a coffee maker size heater that kept turning off), leaking water on the floor near the sink (mold / musty smell), musty sheets (didn‚Äôt smell like they had been washed), stains of old liquid in the trash can bag and a cockroach wing petal on the bedside rug. All in all, you get what you pay for.

It's a small casita--great place to crash if you have stuff to do in Austin. Walking distance from some cool shops and restaurants. Hosts were understanding about me arriving slightly earlier than 5 pm check-in.

My one gripe is that the casita directly abuts the family's backyard, and the door has a big glass window covered by a semi-sheer curtain. So there is a lot less privacy than one might expect from staying in a separate building from the main house.

Good price point, but a few things to be aware of.  If you close the bathroom pocket-door, your knees hit the door if on the toilet, so the door has to remain open.  Using the sink for face-washing was challenging, with the design and obstacles.  Walking in the alley at night alone does not feel safe at all.  That's the only way to access the unit.  Finally, there is 1 blackout curtain and 1 sheer curtain.  A prior guest posted about lack of privacy and the host replied that you can push one to the side so the other type of curtain takes over.  The curtains don't fully cover the doors even when you try to expand them.
Very cozy and everything I needed. It was a bit inconvenient to have to park so distanced but its to be expected with such a set-up.
comfy n private. freezing at night but came with heater. lots of amenities

We were excited to stay in a small house, but found it inconvenient for two people. We did not have use of the hammock pictured in the overview. After a rain, the path that led to the house was quite muddy and it was difficult to keep things clean. It is reasonably priced and close to downtown and the lake. We would not stay here again.

The birdhouse was a great place to stay! As a solo female traveler, I am always skeptical about what I am getting myself into but I don‚Äôt have anything bad to say about my experience here. I personally didn‚Äôt walk around the neighborhood too much so I can‚Äôt speak on that side, but I didn‚Äôt ever feel sketched out during my stay.

The host was quick to reply and
answered all my questions. I was
very disappointed at how outdated
the place is. The picture of the
outside is not true at all. There's no
green grass in the backyard but
there are 2 broken cars in the
backyard. The whole place was an
horrible not to mention how the
place smells. I was not sure if it was
the beddings or the curtains. I'm
glad I brought my sheets, pillow and
blanket. This is the worst Air bnb.
experience I have in Austin.
I really tired to sleep but I am so
sorry, I had to leave real early. The
smell of the place was horrible and
not to mention the mosquitoes
attacked me and the kids helping
me with my stuff. The alley is a dirt
road guys!! I paid $94 total for a
night just few dollars more my
daughter got me into a clean hotel
by the Airport
Please update the outside pictures

This is an typical east side home built in the 50s. Home is very old thus drafty when its cold. Mattresses, pillows and bedding were really low quality and uncomfortable. Rest of the home has good finish out. Also wifi was very weak and spotty.
Kelsey was great and accommodating when we needed a rental last minute due to the bad weather in Austin. Can't thank her enough!

Run down and older place, serviceable but not much else. This condo has not been updated and is full of a bunch of broken furniture. The rung on the stool will pop out when you try to put your feet on it. The table leg is held together by Saran Wrap. The couch is darned. The towels so threadbare that they leave fuzz all over your face when you try to dry it. There‚Äôs stuff everywhere - bird statues, hanging plaques, prayers hung on the wall, just dusty old crap that you have to constantly move and keep clean.

The owner herself admitted to me in a text that they hadn‚Äôt bought anything new for the place in years. The host was another problem. She texted constantly. On my second day she started texting asking me to commit to staying longer. I told her I didn‚Äôt know my plans (true) and it was too soon for me to make a decision. She kept texting and then, on my last day, tried to guilt trip me for not staying - claiming they‚Äôd turned down other renters because they‚Äôd thought I‚Äôd stay (even though I have texts explicitly telling her to do ahead and rent to someone else because I didn‚Äôt know what I was doing !). She also tried to get me to sign another lease and told me if I did stay we could go outside the air bnb platform. She made me very uncomfortable.

The grass in the backyard is gross, prickly and crabgrass. So you won‚Äôt enjoy the backyard space. The area isn‚Äôt walkable, so not great if you bring a dog.

Speaking of dogs...they allowed them but told me they‚Äôd never had them before. The host was clearly uncomfortable having one in the condo. On the last day she insisted on coming for a walk through. I warned her that my dog was still a puppy and might react to a stranger in her place. She said fine.

After I left and after she said everything was fine on the walk through, she texted that she‚Äôd found a small puddle of dog pee. I said that my dog probably peed a little on the floor when the owner came in because she was scared and apologized for not catching it. She tried to charge me $100 for clean up.

She also tried to claim that a pee stain on the mattress pad was from my stay and charge me $100 for that. But I‚Äôd stripped the bed and washed all the sheets for her before moving out, she saw the mattress pad on her walk through and had no issue with it! In short, because she was upset with me for not staying I feel like she tried whatever excuse she could to get more money out of me.

It sucks because this was my first time using Air BnB and id been really nervous after hearing bad stories about it, and this experience wasn‚Äôt great. I‚Äôd even paid out of my own pocket $150 to have it professionally cleaned before I left (they never cleaned it while I was there) because I was worried about having issues with the host.

Poor location (which the host discloses in the listing), annoying host who will text you constantly. Run down, broken furniture, over priced.
Pictures are accurate and Dallas was flexible. Unfortunately we did not have access to the pool.

Joseph is committed to client service. He was always very cordial and followed up in timely during rental process and throughout our month long stay.  The couple of repairs needed during our stay were immediately addressed and fixed.   The location is very convenient to downtown by taking 1st Street and avoiding all the highway traffic.  The house is very spacious, large tiled bathrooms with a backyard patio for outside dining.

If you think crumbling sheetrock, questionable electric wiring, dirty pans in the cupboard, dust and greasy finger marks everywhere, used bars of handsoap in a dish by the sink, etc. add up to "groovy and hip" then this place is for you.
Staying for 5 nights, I asked for some clean towels, and a sheet that would actually FIT the bed; but Veronica balked at complying with these and other simple requests. Since I had booked for 5 nights, and the cancellation policy was "strict ", I decided to tough it out. Unfortunately, it got from bad to worse.
There was a dead possum in the yard the next morning, and Veronica placed it in the garbage can outside the front door of the loft. After a couple of days the stench was so bad you had to hold your nose going in and out of the place, and couldn't open any windows because of the awful smell just outside the front door.
If your looking for a clean, habitable place with an accomodating host, pass this one by.

Spiral staircase gave us a little trouble. It takes some getting used to. Go slow, and use the handrail and you will be fine.

There is no privacy in the bathroom. There is a gap between the wall and ceiling, so you can hear everything if you are in the loft area. Only way to get some privacy is for everyone else to be downstairs.

There were only 2 of us, and we are old friends, so no big deal.
Chris is very fast when it comes to not only responses, but problems as well. We had a problem with the wifi and is was fixed in an instantaneous rate. It's a nice little room too.

Chris is very friendly and communicated frequently to insure all was OK.  Unfortunately my responses to Chris would not go through because his system would not accept SMS communications (iphone).  Did not have a computer with me so had to knock on his door to communicate.  Something that should be changed for the future.

My stay at Jim O's place count haven't been better.   My boyfriend and I  stayed in austin over the weekend and my only regret is that I couldn't spend more time at the rv, exploring the lands and visiting with JIm O. Can't wait to be back.
This is a beautiful bungalow that IS Austin ( from the POV of a new yorker). There is character in every detail of the house. Nothing spared. Great natural light and outdoor furniture and yard too!
Look no further! This is the property you want to stay at and forget about your problems. The night skyline is to die for. Truly shocked my party.

The place it‚Äôs self was nice and was decorated well for the bachelorette party. Kristen was very responsive and let us check in early! Lots of sleeping spots for everyone. Downstairs with the bunk beds was a little tight. Lighting was not great in bathrooms and rooms. Location was convenient for all restaurants and bar but it‚Äôs not a safe area. Our car got the windows smashed while in the reserved parking spot. Kristen was quick to respond and tried to get video footage but was unable to. I would not recommend bringing a car.

It‚Äôs a cute house, but there are several things that subtracted from the stay. The house is right next to a construction site and train tracks, so it was a bit noisy. In addition, there‚Äôs no living room on the main floor. Lastly, there‚Äôs an odd amount of pictures and personal belongings scattered around the house from the owner.

The place was nice . Just the air upstairs went out so we were hot up stairs . Was told about partial refund for it still waiting on it. The house is nice but the neighbors cry about anything we had motorcycles and they said keep it down like all we did was start them up to take them off the trailer . I really think they were just racist because the neighbors were playing loud music all night and nobody said anything about that. The house is clean but a lot of bugs crickets etc in the area that do get in the house not like roaches or ants but just outside bugs.

Trendy house with plenty of space and a lovely fire pit. It would probably benefit from more seating options, especially in the kitchen area. Unfortunately, there was no hot water during our stay, which forced us to take cold showers.
Would recommend this stay for sure! The house looks just like the pictures, if not better! Super cute and spacious, and has all the amenities you need!

The apartment is not very clean throughout... for the price they are charging, guests deserve to experience a clean apartment. When my husband opened the door to start putting our suitcases outside as we were gathering our things to leave, the housekeeper barged in through the door on us without telling us who she was and we were scared... it was very disturbing because we were asking her who she was as she was rummaging around the apartment ignoring us until finally she answered she was the housekeeper... she showed no common courtesy and she was very rude. The location is good but be cautious of the housekeeper as she may barge into the home in a very rude manner, I wouldn't feel comfortable staying here again.
If you're coming to Auatin for an event at the convention center, look no further!

I can‚Äôt recommend this place. It was dirty upon arrival, the grass was almost 2 feet tall, the hot tub was filthy, the floors were very dirty throughout the house.

I did text the owner, he responded very quickly, and sent a housekeeper to clean up, (she was dressed inappropriately). But the house was very dingy still.

There is no shower downstairs, only a tub. The back gate only opens about 14‚Äù, so it‚Äôs hard to get bags in..

$2k for 3 nights isn‚Äôt worth it. I‚Äôd much rather go to a clean hotel.

One of the bedrooms has no air conditioning...

House was older than projected, very worn out, wood rotted on the outside and the inside is not dirty, it was filthy. Parking is either across the street on a busy street or behind on a sketchy alleyway.

So dirty! The refrigerator was covered with other people's food in both the fridge and freezer areas. Open containers of humus, milk, and wine were left. The host claims they were left as a gift for us, but who would eat out of open containers. The microwave had not been cleaned for months and was covered with mold. Cabinets, stove, and floor were absolutely filthy. We had to clean the floor, wipe the counters off and throw away a garbage can full of open food containers. Dishes, pans and utensils had to be washed as they were dirty. We had a party of 7 adults and could not find another place to stay. We spent 2 hours washing up the kitchen, fridge, floors and counters. The house has two small bathrooms and they ask you not to use the downstairs shower so 7 people had to use one shower all weekend. The shower upstairs had a lot of mold on it. I reached out to host who was in denial until I sent him pictures and video of the filth we had to clean. We use Airbnb all over the country and this is the first time we were in a very, very dirty house. With all the houses available in Austin, do yourself a favor and skip over this one. They refunded us $500 for the dirty conditions. Not a good place to go unless you like living in a pigpen. We are not complainers, and I hate being so negative but when you have to take pictures and send them to Airbnb to get a resolution, there is a big problem. I gave one star because you cannot put zero. I have the proof in pictures and videos. Stay clear!

The house is not accurately represented in the photos and description, which was a disappointment. I could have looked past that if it weren't for the lack of cleanliness. The towels smelled like mildew and the sheets were not fresh. We never met the host, but she did respond quickly when I asked to have the bed changed.
Angel was a very responsive host. Unfortunately we didn't get a chance to meet due to busy schedules. Her home is uniquely decorated and had everything I needed for my short stay.

This place has a lot of reviews and many are 5 star which is why we booked it.  It's great that the host allows kitchen use and provides snacks and coffee etc., but my sense is that's why she gets the 5 stars.  But if you're looking for a nice, homey or even hip place, this isn't it.  It really feels like it's just specifically used for Airbnb guests.  Make sure you know that there are three numbered rooms there and that there are likely going to be other guests and no host.  OK location for a taste of East Austin, but doesn't feel super safe at night.

I was unable to stay in the air bnb. I wrote angel quickly asking to cancel with her policy offering a 50% refund

I was stuck in San Antonio unable to make it and to my surprise NO refund. No help from her, no help at all from AirBNB. $104 down the drain

Nice for a quick stay. Small. Very firm bed in Room 1. Bath towels were washed and soured before drying and putting them in the linen closet. As soon as the towel was damp from use, I knew just what happened. I‚Äôd made that mistake before when doing chores at home on my time instead of the way Momma expected it done. Comcast not available as mentioned. Roku remote without batteries. Needed to buy coffee grounds for ourself since the regular coffee was not replenished. It is unfortunate and very disappointing the host was out of the country and failed to replenish and verify the accommodations were as described. It‚Äôs a quaint style but not comfortable furniture. Not a good fit for me considering all I‚Äôve mentioned. If you‚Äôre in Austin to sight see, great location. If you‚Äôre thinking of staying in for some rest and relaxation, I‚Äôd reconsider.

I Had To cancel due to unforeseen circumstances.
I‚Äôve never had this happen so I‚Äôm not familiar with how this works. It would‚Äôve been nice to Receive Some Of My Money Back. That Sucked. So I Cannot Say How it was staying overnight üò≥üò¨
Muy buen lugar, muy bonito el espacio. Solo quer√≠a las gallinas que creo que ya no exist√≠an, pero son detalles. Me gust√≥ mucho y muy f√°cil de ir de patineta al centro por ejemplo.
Very cool, very funky property.  Off the beaten path, lots of room to spread out!

The listing is a little confusing, it's listed as an entire home/ apt which we had access to the entire place except the main bedroom where they sometimes stay.  This was in the documentation in the text description but I overlooked.  Additionally, there is a rule of quite outside after 10 pm which I could not find but trust it was in there somewhere.

I rented Pat's home for 3 of my employees coming to Austin for SXSW. The home was very convenient and a great place to stay for SXSW. Once they got there, and were settled, everything was fine and the girls loved the hammock in the living room.

Leading up to the experience wasn't quite as seamless as I have experienced with AirBnB in the past, which was a little disappointing. Pat was dealing with some personal stuff, so I will cut him some slack, but overall the process was not as smooth as expected with unforeseen costs/charges after the transaction for hotel fees/taxes, inability to drop bags off when arriving in Austin which caused some headaches and rearranging of plans, and it was quite difficult to get in touch the day or two before arriving as we were trying to finalize plans.

Again, I know that he was dealing with some personal issues during this time so it is likely not how he would normally handle a rental and once we arrived everything was great.
Fuck

Luke et Rachel sont vraiment tr√®s accueillants, ils nous ont mis √† l'aise tout de suite et nous ont fait sentir comme chez nous.
Nous avons ador√© leurs 2 chats qui sont venus nous faire des calins ;) La maison est grande, la chambre et la salle de bain priv√©e sont propres. La nuit est calme et nous avons tr√®s bien dormi. Nous avons pu utiliser la machine √† laver et le s√®che linge.
Le quartier est calme, et sympa avec des restos (mexicains) pas tr√®s loin. La maison est bien situ√©e, pas loin de Dowtown (10 min. en voiture) et de Barton Spring (15 min. en voiture).
Notre s√©jour a √©t√© tr√®s agr√©able et nous recommandons Luke et Rachel comme h√¥tes.

I had a group of students stay here for half a week during SXSW. The hosts were extremely prompt to respond to all communication, and were excellent hosts to the group that stayed at the house. The students had nothing but good things to stay about the house, and the hosts.
Funky place to stay near 6th street and walking distance from SXSW

This is an awesome house in a beautiful part of Austin. It's a short walk to town via Congress Ave which has a ton of cool places to shop eat and drink. The house was very comfortable and had everything you'd need for your stay. Whitney was available if you had any problems or questions - but we didn't have any issues or problems so there was no need to disturb here. If I make it back to Austin I would definitely consider staying here again.
Not enough towels  and no water pressure in kitchen  beds in 2 bedrooms not good

Not sure who our host was - Jason or Merideth - received emails from both
Dirty
Musty smell
All windows were opened upon arrival and the air conditioning was running
Hairs found on the sheets
Parking is on the street, not on the property
Drapes see through from outside of the house. Not good when someone is occupying the trailer right behind
Property is shared with another home and trailer which is not mentioned in the ad
Not sure why I had to pay a cleaning fee when guests are asked to put a load of towels etc. in the extremely nasty washing machine?
The mattress was uncomfortable and the mold was a deal breaker for a future stay
Place is adorable, location was not as close to downtown as I thought(not walkable and especially not in the heat) but that is my fault for not mapping.
Cindie‚Äô s posting is 100% accurate; location, room and bathroom. A real steal if coming to Austin!
Entrance was a little hard to find on the side of the house in the dark, but that's the only issue.

Location was great. House was lovely but we had issues with the showers and bathroom. A plumber came and worked on some of the problems but didn't fix all of them. There wasn't a single bathroom I could wash my hair in because the water pressure was so low. The kitchen sink and wine fridge were leaking. The ice in the ice maker was a solid block so we had to empty it and start a fresh. Parking was an issue. There's a school at the end of the block so most of the street parking is taken during the day. There was a big event going on over the weekend down SoCo so there was also little to no parking for most of the weekend. None of these problems were terrible but for the cost and location, we could have stayed at a nice hotel and it would have been easier.

No lighting outdoors, making arrival at night scary.
Uneven walkway makes it dangerous.
An odor of gas upon entering the house is also scary.
No hot water in the master bathroom made it very inconvenient, especially when you paid for a private bathroom.
The washing machine did not work. We had no way to wash clothes, towels or the shower curtain which was left very filthy.
Kitchen drawers broke when we first pulled it out to get a spoon.
The location of the house is great. you are close to events, restaurants and some city night life.

Our group of girls rented the house for a bachelorette weekend in Austin. We had a fabulous time. The house had all the basic essentials that most might forget. Very spacious and the location couldn't be better. Close to Rainey Street bars for going out at night and a very short cab from downtown for the nightlife or shopping and walking around. Would come back and stay here again.
The listing was dead on, and the house was exactly what we were looking for.  Robert has instructions on all major appliances and throughout the house to make it an extremely user friendly experience

The location couldn't be any better and the same goes with Daniel's responsiveness throughout the process. The room was comfortable, the bathroom newly redone (or appeared that way), great local info and instructions and finally some snacks and drinks in the fridge.

While I understand Texas is naturally a buggy place, and everything is bigger there, I would be remiss if I didn't mention the 3 very large roaches that we saw during our final two night. This made my wife more uncomfortable than myself but she wasn't happy to say the least.

DATES: August 8 ‚Äì August 14, 2018. PROS: layout of the house was nice; fast communication and response to shower drainage issue. CONS: Unsatisfactory resolution to cockroaches found in the kitchen.
For the amount of money spent to rent this home, I expect to not have to deal with pest control on a daily basis. I certainly do not expect to have to deal with a sanitation/potential health issue for the entire length of my trip. It seemed as though roaches were an acceptable inconvenience with the host, based on the host‚Äôs communication lag and inability to satisfactorily rectify the problem. However, as a service provider, our problem should have been his problem to solve expeditiously and without excuse. If pest control is a problem whereby service is needed monthly between quarterly visits, why not leave a can of roach spray under the sink for emergencies? At the very least, as a lodging host, hire a service that has better response times.
Saturday morning: We contacted the host about finding 4 roaches over 1 ¬Ω days in the dishwasher and sink. No response.
Sunday morning: We heard back from the host who said the house is exterminated quarterly and was last serviced in July, although the check-in instructions stated the quarterly service was scheduled for Tuesday at 11AM.
Monday late morning: We finally heard back from the host who said the earliest the exterminator can come out is now 6PM Tuesday. Worthless, since check out is at Tuesday at 11AM.
By the time we left: over 20 roaches killed.

It was great! Quiet, not too spacious if you are 5+ people, but plenty of space otherwise. Very well arranged, with a lot of taste.
With two balconies and a little river behind the house. No netflix, but I didn't care too much.
Cute house, great location, a bit small for more than 4 adults. We had 5 and it was a close fit. The screened porch helped, but not sure that's effective for summer humidity or winter cold.

La casa est√° ubicada a 5 min en carro de la ciudad y a unos 25 min caminando. Es un barrio muy tranquilo y seguro. La casa es tal cual se muestra en las fotos, muy limpia y con todos los servicios. La comunicaci√≥n fue muy f√°cil con Leslie. La llegada y la salida de la casa sin ninguna complicaci√≥n.

Cynthia was very welcoming and had also baked some banana cake. Unfortunately my trip was cut short and was quite caught up in the conference and hence could not enjoy her lovely garden/ porch. house is a healthy 1 mile plus walk from downtown. Nice cosy place
The pictures of the skyline aren't as good as the skyline itself. Quick walk to Barton Springs, Zilker park, and about 4 mile walk to the State Capitol.
Fantastic place around. Everything we expected more. Only negative was they were out of paper towels!

The location was close to downtown and setup nicely for a large group.  Unfortunately we encountered lots of spiders and tree roaches and were told we were too loud closing car doors at night and were not allowed to leave the porch light on.  Someone came into the house after we left the first day - which was not expected.  Also, the majority of windows are not covered thus making us feel uncomfortable due to a lack of privacy.

For traveling with small children, this place is hard to beat.  The playroom, the outside playground, the nature trail, where else can you find that?  The location, while it looks remote on the map, really isn't far from central Austin.

Amanda was Rey accommodating even leaving some extra toiletries which came in handy for us that forgot some stuff. About a 15-20min walk from downtown which was convenient. Nothing but good things to say ab my first airbnb experience!
Everything about rice, Pam and their rental property is above and beyond expectation. I can not recommend this experience highly enough! A+++++!
I‚Äôve stayed with Rice several times and the space and hospitality never disappoint. Love the updates he‚Äôs done during the pandemic. Felt very at-home, as usual!

Le logement √©tait propre et accueillant. Il y avait des fleurs, de l'eau dans le frigo, du caf√©, des informations touristiques et des produits de toilette. Amber a √©t√© discr√®te mais nous avait laiss√© tout ses contacts t√©l√©phoniques. Elle nous a rendu visite tr√®s aimablement soucieuse que nous soyons confortables.
Le logement est bien situ√©, tout proche du parc Ziegler et de plusieurs restaurants sympathiques. Le quartier est tranquille et tr√®s verdoyant. Le cadre int√©rieur et simple et agr√©able.
Merci pour ce bon s√©jour.

We walked and biked to parks, restaurants, and shops nearby. The house is on a quiet street but there is plenty nearby. Amber was very attentive and accommodating. One note: If a guest has very bad pet allergies as I do, she may find herself sneezing a bit due to the cat (even though the place was clean and the cat did not enter while we were staying there).

We have stayed at John and his wife¬¥s place before and would love to return. The garage apartment is roomy for two people with a big bedroom. Johns family lives close by, but it is still private and quiet. The location is perfect with South Congress just a short stroll away. This stay turned out to be different and was cut short by the Corona virus pandemic in Europe. SXSW was cancelled and we had to head home prematurely to make it back to Norway before all flights across the Atlantic was suspended. Shit happens, well be back!

Karen was great to deal with. Her house has a very gross smell though. As soon as you walk in. HORRIBLE SMELL. Very BAD for a first impression. Maybe it was from her dogs that was mentioned. We did not stay one night. She gave us 50% of the original cost, which I thought was fair. I would definitely steam the floors and clean the dirty furniture before renting out to another guest.

This is an older condo in need of updates. Although clean it gives the feel of being dirty due to old tile and flooring in the bathroom. Had a musty smell upon entering, dissipated after opening windows but returns upon leaving and renter of.
Andrew's flat is cosy but conveniently located. Unfortunately, the place wasn't clean at all when we arrived, due to an issue with the cleaning service. Besides that, we had a good time.

Tracy‚Äôs place was our ‚Äúhome away from home‚Äù for a month. You can‚Äôt beat the location - on a quiet street, just one block off S. Congress. The house has a great layout, is more spacious in person, and we loved the back porch and backyard.

The house is a bit worse for wear compared to the photos in the listing (which are outdated), and we experienced several issues during our stay (broken washing machine, broken water/ice dispenser, faulty smoke detector, broken front door handle and broken toilet). The kitchen is missing a few key items (like a toaster) and we didn't find the commercial-grade stove/oven to be conducive to preparing meals.

We had a rather chaotic check-in and communication with Tracy was inconsistent and slow (it took her 3 days to respond after we let her know about the broken door and toilet). On the plus side, there‚Äôs a super friendly and helpful gentleman named DJ who lives on the property and shares the backyard. He was great.
Adam and Josh know how to do airbnb! If you're looking for a place in Austin, you should stop the search now and contact them.
The owner and dogs are cool, but the dogs can be a bit noisy. It didn‚Äôt bother me because I was mostly out of the house but it‚Äôs worth keeping in mind if you‚Äôre sensitive to sound.

Bei Adam und Josh kann man sehr gut wohnen. Die Betten sind bequem und sorgen f√ºr guten Schlaf, das Bad ist ordentlich und alles vorhanden. Das Haus hat einen netten Garten, wo man gut drau√üen sitzen kann. Wenn man Tips braucht, geben Adam und Josh gern Auskunft. Sie sind super nette, liebe Menschen.

La descripci√≥n en el anuncio no se acerca a lo que realmente es. La ambientaci√≥n de la casa es espectacular, todo extremadamente limpio y muy acogedor.
Janet y su esposo son unos grandes anfitriones, muy amables y siempre atentos a que la estancia sea excelente.
Muy amablemente nos ofrecieron pan casero, caf√©, jugo y unos muffins deliciosos (todo homemade). Tuvimos tambi√©n una buena pl√°tica con ellos y siempre estuvieron atentos para lo que se necesitara.
Recomiendo mucho este airbnb

Janet hosted my parents for their first Airbnb experience ever! Janet and Harm made my parents feel very comfortable and well taken care of. My parents had nothing but great things to say about their stay and loved getting to know Janet and Harm as well!

We were forced to cancel our visit at the last hour because of the severe inclement weather in Austin which prohibited us from being able to get there as all flights were canceled. Crystal was very understanding and accommodating to the necessity of us aborting the trip. We really appreciate that and look forward to re-booking for our future visit when our meeting is rescheduled. Thank you, Crystal!
Not what I expected. Cancelled immediately upon arrival. Not clean. Smells bad. Price should be about $30 a night.
House was great‚Äîperfect home base for exploring the area. Stop at the food trucks a few blocks away, check out Rockstar Bagels for breakfast and hit the Quicky Picky for local beers.

I was unable to take a hot shower either by design or circumstance and water pressure in shower was low. Bathroom supplies were available, but haphazard.
Refrigerator cleanliness not maintained.
Front yard care not maintained.
Bed was overly firm, uncomfortable to sleep on my side.
Wifi fine. Rustic but pleasant back porch and community near the river.

Vi (tre personer) blev modtaget af v√¶rtsparrets assistent, der gav os en rundvisning i boligen og lidt tips om lokalomr√•det, supermarked, restauranter osv og hun k√∏rte os til et supermarked, s√• vi kunne lave det f√∏rste indk√∏b af forn√∏denheder, med den hj√¶lp kom vi virkelig godt fra start. Boligen levede op til beskrivelsen. Boligen var ren - som i virkelig ren, l√¶kker og velindrettet uden luksus.  Tre gode sovev√¶relser, velfungerende og veludstyret k√∏kken, udm√¶rket stue og fin lille spisestue og en dejlig stor have med overd√¶kket og oplyst terrasse. Badev√¶relset var funktionelt med rigelig forsyning af h√•ndkl√¶der, s√¶be, toiletpapir etc. M√•ske lige i underkanten med et badev√¶relse hvis man er flere end tre i huset. Huset ligger lidt trukket tilbage fra vejen som er en meget trafikeret vej og en jernbaneoversk√¶ring og ligger i udkanten af et parcelhus kvarter uden butikker, restauranter mv. kvarteret fremst√•r uden liv, som den slags omr√•der tit g√∏r og man kan godt umiddelbart f√∏le sig lidt usikker p√• sikkerheden i omr√•det - "er der nogen hjemme hos naboen etc" men for det f√∏rste er huset sikkert dvs alle vinduer kan lukkes forsvarligt og alle yderd√∏re afl√•ses sikkert og efter lidt tid √¶ndrede opfattelsen af kvarteret mere til bare "d√∏dt" - ikke usikkert. Larm fra vej og jernbane aftager aften og nat og var i det hele taget ikke et problem inde i huset. Jeg sov selv i v√¶relse ud til vejen og f√∏lte mig ikke generet. Husets klimaanl√¶g var velfungerende, en instruktion/beskrivelse manglede og gav lidt problemer f√∏rste nat, fordi anl√¶gget har et st√∏j niveau fra indbl√¶sningen af kold/varm luft der ikke g√∏r den egent til nattebrug. Huset ligger centralt ift Lady Bird Lake hvor der ligger masser af dejlige restauranter og god (turistede-) shopping muligheder. Afstanden til Downtown er ca 10 min i bil og $ 10 i taxi lidt mindre med Lyft. Som base for vores intensive deltagelse i SXSW 2016, var huset godt for os.

Got exactly what I expected for the price. Quaint little place, and it's a cool thing to see the capitol building from the windows. Took 30 minutes to check in, though, after receiving the wrong check-in code and having to message host through Airbnb.

Great location and the apartment has everything you need. It was easy to access the apartment with keyless access and communication was great. There were a few cons though too. The shower is tiny - not a big deal but worth knowing. It's also extremely noisy - you can hear every sound from the street so we struggled to get any sleep during our stay. While we were there, there was heavy rain and this leaked in through the ceiling of the kitchen and bedroom. This seems to have happened several times before and apparently cannot be fixed. I would stay here due to convenient location for a quick visit but not for a longer vacation.
Loose toilet, missing kick boards in kitchen and dirty carpet and duvet kept me from giving 5 stars.
Good location and cool space but place was dirty upon arrival.  Owner refunded cleaning fee but staying in a place that wasn't clean isn't ideal.
Lock is difficult to use. Make sure to print out the long instructions before you get to the door.

Accueil tr√®s sympathique de la part de Leia et Keri dont la maison correspond parfaitement √† la description. Situ√©e dans un joli quartier tr√®s paisible, spacieuse et tr√®s propre, vous y trouverez tout ce dont vous avez besoin pour rendre votre s√©jour agr√©able. C'est sans h√©sitation que j'y retournerai lors d'un futur voyage √† Austin.

Ruhiges, sauberes Zimmer mit grosser K√ºche/ Wohnzimmer zur Mitbenutzung. Einfach und unkompliziertes Check-In/ Out. Angenehme, entspannte Gastgeber. F√ºr die 1x Nacht Zwischenstopp f√ºr uns genau das Richtige.

Haus und Garten waren sehr
sch√∂n, leider war der Kontakt zu den Gastgebern sehr zur√ºckhaltend.

Wir haben 3 N√§chte bei Leia und Keri verbracht und die Zeit sehr genossen. Leider haben wir die beiden nicht pers√∂nlich kennengelernt, aber die Kommunikation im Vorhinein und der Check-In haben reibungslos funktioniert.
Das Zimmer und das Bad waren sehr sauber und das Bett sehr gem√ºtlich.
Sch√∂ner Au√üenbereich mit Pool (den wir wetterbedingt leider nicht nutzen konnten).
Ansonsten eine sch√∂ne, ruhige Wohngegend.
Ca. 20 Minuten vom Flughafen entfernt.
Definitiv empfehlenswert.
This place is a small slice of peace. camping here is simple and Jim was nothing but kind.

The property is undergoing some repairs we were told.  However the listing does not come close to match the current state nor the amenities the current listing shows in pictures (ie closed community pool).  The overall condition is pretty poor and if you plan to spend any amount of time at the property - other than say simply a crash pad - I would have pause.

The pictures over-glamorized this property.  The house smelled of anti-bacterial spray for 2 days.  The kids were scared to sleep in one of the rooms.  No chairs for the kitchen table.  The front of the property is a little scary looking when you arrive and at night.  It was not worth the cost.

Sadly, we were not able to take our vacation due to illness in my boyfriend's family.  I made the attempt on multiple occasions to reach out and try to resolve a refund or credit with this host, to no avail.  I also made multiple attempts to resolve with airbnb and was told I would have to notify the host directly for her to lift her "strict" cancellation policy.  (Which she did not)  I have now gone back and forth with both for a month with no resolution. It was very disappointing to be out nearly $400 due to an extenuating circumstance that could not be helped.  I understand hosts need to keep their rentals occupied, but I notified her directly several days before of the situation.  At the time I thought she was genuinely concerned, but I was wrong.  I feel like anyone with a conscious or kids would have been kind enough to at least offer to reschedule our dates.  She was booked nearly the entire month, so I don't feel like it was hitting her to hard in the pocket book...Disappointed and frustrated.

Under no circumstances would I recommend staying here. It was an airbnb plus with lots of positive reviews, but I find that completely baffling. I‚Äôve never felt so uncomfortable staying anywhere. I‚Äôd booked for a month-long stay, but felt so unsafe that I left after one night. The apartment smells terrible (It smells like weed most of the time. Jake says the neighbors burn things and that‚Äôs the smell that seeps into the apartment), and within 12 hours, I‚Äôd spotted and killed two cockroaches. Jake did not react kindly, and I‚Äôve never met a host as rude and disrespectful as him. After some loud banging on walls and aggressive texts from him at 10 pm, I opted to leave rather than spend a second night there.
Stop looking... this is the place!
Todo muy bien ! Ampliamente recomendado sin dudas ! Excelente comunicaci√≥n tambi√©n!
This is our second time at Daniel's. And every single time, we've been met with nothing but warmth. The neighborhood is quiet and the accommodations were beyond stellar.

Not in the good part of Bouldin. Filthy. After staying there, I'd say it's worth 50-75 per night, max.  The bug review from an earlier stay is true. Beyond being dirty, there were little to no supplies (one roll of toilet paper, no toothpaste.) I kept my cup of water in the fridge so that fruit flies wouldn't land in it. I paid 300/ 1 night. Never met hosts, friendly via messanger but the experience wayyy overshadowed that.  Feel like I was ripped off completely. Gross.

The location is a bit further south than the main part of South Congress by about 1 mile; however we were in town for a wedding at Mercury Hall, so for us it was extremely convenient (we could walk to the venue for the rehearsal and ceremony). There's a bar and a Torchy's Tacos in easy walking distance too.

The apartment itself had plenty of space for our stuff. There are a couple of dogs on the property, and we had a little bit of an issue with dog hair on the bed our first night, but other than that they were no problem.

I would warn anyone who struggles with stairs that the bathroom is upstairs in the loft area, up a very steep staircase. It was fine for us, but I could imagine an older person struggling!

The house was as large as I expected. I loved the five large rooms with large beds. There was plenty of space to accomplish my party of 8. The neighborhood is a very nice and upscale. Location is great with the lake within 11 miles from the home and tons of restaurants near by.

Some reasons that I would not book this home again include...

Looking at the photos before booking, there‚Äôs a photo of the community pool that I assumed we would be able to use but we were not. I was told by the owner after paying the full amount that the the pool is for residential use only. I felt that having the photo in the listing was a bit misleading. Also, pool was listed in the Amenities list as if it came with the home during rental period.

The backyard is as huge as described in the other reviews but definitely not safe. There was tons of poison oak and poison ivy throughout. It looked like the trees had not been trimmed back in months. The fence was falling over. It needs lots of work.

All appliances are old and need updated. One of the ovens didn‚Äôt work.

We found bugs in the carpet. Small black spiders were everywhere.

The hot water for showers, were cold

Tina ist eine wundervolle Gastgeberin. Das Haus ist sauber, prima gelegen und gem√ºtlich eingerichtet. Die Kommunikation mit Tina hat immer bestens geklappt und sie hat sogar den K√ºhlschrank vorab allerlei frischen Leckereien gef√ºllt, so dass ich mich bei der Ankunft wirklich gleich wie zu Hause gef√ºhlt habe. Uneingeschr√§nkte Empfehlung!
Photos are not accurate, house is not in great condition and needs a deep cleaning.

Honestly my most disappointing experience with Air BnB yet. During this stay, I felt like an intruder in someone else‚Äôs home, which made for an uncomfortable experience. There are apparently full time residents here, but we only saw the host once, and she didn‚Äôt really even bother to speak to us. Very little accommodations were made to make me feel welcome. No privacy here as the walls are extremely thin, windows look out to the street, and there is only one bathroom for several guests to share. We were told that basic breakfast items and snacks would be provided, but there was nothing left out for us or marked as food for guests. Just a couple of half empty bags of chips on the island. Asked the host about it, and she referred us to the also half empty couple boxes of cereal above the fridge. They were stale. I don‚Äôt understand why you would offer your guests food only to actually make no effort to provide any food‚Ä¶ Just fell way beneath my expectations.
Une tr√®s belle maison, propre et bien plac√©e. Tout √©tait parfait
great stay at Paprika's house. everything matched the description and the house was very centrally located but on a quiet street so we had no noise issues and plenty of quiet when we needed it.

We enjoyed our stay but weren't very happy with the situation of the adjoining apartment unit described to be below, but it's just blocked off. The space is extremely small and there's really not room to spread out. No privacy, but the host was helpful and responded quickly when we had questions.
This place is unreal! Once in a lifetime spot, no place better for a bachelor/bachelorette party.

DO NOT STAY HERE. This was by far the worst experience I‚Äôve ever had with an Airbnb. The property was not what it looks like in photos. There were stains on the sheets and multiple people got bed bug bites. 2 couples left the property to get a hotel room. They were also replacing the toilet in the main house when we checked in but the toilet didn‚Äôt work all weekend. On top of all that Codes stopped by to inform us that the owner has an open case against him because of too many guests on the property. Completely unacceptable, especially at this price point. I‚Äôve stayed in 1 Star motels that were in better condition.
Second stay in one of Herb and Valentia's immaculate and funky places. This one is much larger, even closer to Barton Springs stuff.
Couldn't have been better!

Very Nice place, perfect for sxsw. My only issue is the showerhead in master is a Lil low but then again I'm 6'4 lol..I left a designer jacket and belt behind accidentally but haven't had much success retrieving my belongings .. my fault I guess..

Ryan's place was a nice spot for our group of 6. The location is hard to beat - though like others mentioned - a bit noisy at times. I really don't have any complaints about the place itself but the parking turned out to be a disaster for us. We had 2 cars in our group so I parked in the designated spot for the unit and my husband parked at the hotel across the street (initial emails with host mentioned parking at the hotel was $15/night). My car -in the designated spot- was broken into and completely ransacked and my husband was charged $50/night by the hotel. So between window repairs and parking fees - we were out about $300.  Not sure solution here but did want to give others a heads up.

While we loved visiting Austin end of December 2019, we did not enjoy our stay in this bnb because it fell short of the advertised expectations. Here are the pros and cons we observed so you can decide whether or not it's worth it to you to book this bnb:

Pros:
1. Central location to downtown Austin making it easy to walk around a lot.

Cons:
1. Unresponsive host: when I notified the host that all 5 of us were unable to connect to the wifi, he simply said it must be a problem with our electronics because he stood outside the condo and was able to connect to the wifi without an issue. He then ignored my follow up messages that we still couldn't connect to the wifi.

2. Poor wifi connection: While the host just blamed us for not being able to connect to wifi and refused to look into it any more, we figured out that actually the wifi connection is poor because the router is in a centralized location not in the unit so you might have connection for a few seconds just then you'd get kicked off right away.

3. Poor lighting: the lights are quite dim and there's no way to turn it up. Ladies, you will have a hard time putting on make up in the terrible lighting.

4. Iron has a caked-on black substance on it that got on my clothing when I used it. The host stated he would replace it the next day but that never happened and he ignored my request when I asked about it again the next day.

5. You can hear all the street noise loud and clear because the unit is a corner unit on the ground floor.

We had a TERRIBLE experience - the lack of safety measures/protocol were completely unacceptable and put us in danger. I wanted to write a full blown, detailed review but this whole ordeal with Ryan was so exhausting I am only going to commit to the CliffsNotes version.

Summary:
1) There were other guests sleeping in the unit when we arrived. We entered the unit and their stuff was everywhere, and eventually they SCREAMED at us to leave. Turns out his cleaning team let them in. Serious safety issue #1
2) We booked this 3 bedroom so we could stay together but were forced to split up in temporary units for the first night. Both bathrooms in one of the temporary units were also not in the best condition. The toilets and showers were filthy and we were not okay with using the showers (I have photos of the conditions).
3) Our first morning in the temporary unit, people attempted to enter the unit for ONE HOUR. They tried opening the front door and were banging on the windows. Fortunately we had deadbolted the front door the night before so they weren't able to enter.
Ryan later confirmed that it was his maintenance staff trying enter the unit. He had scheduled work with them prior and failed to successfully cancel once he allowed us to use the unit temporarily for the day. If we hadn't deadbolted the front door, they would have entered the unit while we were sleeping... Serious safety issue #2
4) Ryan admitted fault initially (confirmed (1) that his cleaning crew let the other people into our originally booked unit, and (2) that he never got a cancellation confirmation from his maintenance crew in the temporary unit) but denied responsibility when I asked him if there was any way we could work out a refund/comp for the first night. He denied any wrong doing and responsibility and complained about how he now had to pay for 3 different cleaning services he didn't originally plan (for the random strangers who squatted in our originally booked apartment, and for the two temporary places he offered to us). He had a condescending and terrible attitude.

Fortunately we were able to get a refund for our first night once Airbnb launched an investigation into the case. They reviewed all of the messages we had with Ryan through the app and confirmed that he violated multiple host guidelines.

There is not a case where I would ever consider booking a stay with Ryan again. I know that Ryan has a lot of positive reviews (something I look for when I am booking an Airbnb), but I do hope that you think twice when considering reserving through him. It is easy to click 5 stars when you're able to easily access the Airbnb you booked and it generally aligns with the expectations set through the booking description, but the way a host mediates a situation when things don't go according to plan is all the more important. Clearly Ryan did not handle this situation well and I hope that no future guests have to encounter the issues we did during our stay.
no thanks

Great location for a group looking to stay out late. The location is central to downtown so it‚Äôs convenient for going out, however if you are trying to sleep before 1am it is very loud. We were out late 2 of the 3 nights so it was not an issue for our group but might be for a more low key group.

I picked this place because of the keyless entry.  I liked the location but there was some construction going on accross the street that was very annoying on Friday but they were gone by the weekend.  There wasn't any tv which was disappointing.  I would have never stayed here if her profile was updated.  Hopefully that is fixed by now.

My fiance and I booked this listing for some of our family to stay while they were in Austin for our wedding. The place was a bit disappointing and didn't really live up to the pictures. From the listing and pictures, we thought it was a house, but it is actually a duplex. Inside it is a bit more shabby than the pictures indicate. There were random, half-eaten food items in the cabinets and no trash bags for the tiny kitchen trashcan. The lightbulb in one lamp was burnt out and we couldn't find any spares. Also, the air conditioning wasn't working when we checked in and after calling Laura, she did have someone come out the next day to fix it, however by our last day it was already not working again. All in all, I wouldn't recommend this listing and won't be having family stay here when they visit again.

We were very disappointed with the condition this listing was in. The bathroom had a sewage smell, one of the bedrooms had no carpet, just a concrete floor and overall felt dirty. We unfortunately could not stay there due to these conditions and had to find other accommodations last minute on a very busy weekend. Laura was very understanding when I called to let her know it was pretty bad and told me she was going to credit me but then decided the next morning that she was not going to credit me because she was basically unable to rent it out. I find it really hard to believe that this listing has so many great reviews because it was in a condition that five professional women did not feel comfortable staying in.

The house is actually a duplex.  It was very run down and was obvious that there had been water damage.  The house has a very strong mold smell probably from the water damage.  There was no flooring in the one bedroom.  The bedding was dirty so needless to so we didn't end up staying at this location.  After numerous emails back and forth to airbnb Laura agreed to refund our money.  Not a good experience for our first time using airbnb.

Third time I used airbnb, second time in austin, strangest exprience ever. I am not sure how relevant this review will be as host is attempting to rent out the property in normal fasion rather than through airbnb. How do I know that, the host asked me to show the house to future renters and real estate agent in during my stay, thats normal right? I did it the first time, the second time as my schedule did not allow it, she cancel the showing.

Internet out first night on arrival, instead of host trying to solve the problem, it was up to me, with my expensive international phone and data plan to go through the internet provider trouble shooting system, and of course it was up to me to change my schedule to meet with repair personnel to fix the problem.

And I apprently we took a used comforter with me back with us to China which she has to replace. And when I disputed the claim, all kinds of extra accusation starts to fly, including I had additional people staying with me and what not. This has left an distinct bad taste in my mouth so instead of fighting with her more, I realize I work hard to make enough money to not give a you know what to her petty claim.

There is more I can say about the condition of the house, but it'd seem like petty revenge for her replacement claim, so I have only posted details i can prove interms of message back and forth between me and her with her asking me to show her property during my stay, and the entire internet out debacle.

Laura is a very nice person to work with, however, our experience was not good. Our stay was from a Thursday-Sunday. We checked in on Thursday, stayed the night, and were enjoying our stay in Austin. We had been using the bathroom throughout our stay, and nothing was wrong. We had left the house early Friday morning, and returned around 4:00. One guest used the bathroom, and realized that there was water all over the bathroom floor. We were not sure where it was coming from, but assumed it was from the toilet. We flushed the toilet to test our assumption, and we were right. This time, a large amount of water rushed out from the seal between the toilet and the floor. We rushed to dry it up with the towels form the house. In the meantime, we tested the shower to make sure it was just the toilet. As soon as we turned the water on in the shower, water rushed out from the seal between the bathtub and the floor. At this point, the whole bathroom was flooded. It was so flooded that water seeped into the bedroom next to the bathroom and ruined a suitcase that was in a closet. During this time, we were calling and leaving voicemails for Laura. There was no response. I even reached out via Airbnb, and left text a text message. After sending the text message, we finally received a call back. I explained what was happening with the bathroom. Laura's response was to use the bathroom of the condo attached to ours. We assumed the attached condo was furnished, and we would just move next door. After finding the key to enter the attached condo, we enter to see there is no furniture, no shower curtain, nothing. Laura had suggested that we should use this bathroom for the remainder of our trip. We felt that was an incredibly insensitive response coming from a Host. To suggest that a group of girls have to go outside to another condo to use a bathroom throughout the rest of our 3 days in Austin was silly. We did not feel comfortable doing this at all. We were not comfortable with going next door in the middle of the night to use a bathroom. It was at this point where we asked if she could send a plumber. We had also decided that we will not be staying in this house for the remainder of our stay. We asked for a refund for Friday, Saturday, and Sunday, and received approval for that right away. Eventually, Laura sent a plumber and asked us to stay for the plumber to arrive. By this point it is 5:00 in the evening. Throughout this whole experience, we had been looking at hotels to stay at, since there was no way we could have stayed at the house. We eventually found a hotel that could accommodate our group at a reasonable price. Finding hotel rooms on a Friday...

This has been the worst experience I‚Äôve had with an Airbnb rental! When we arrived at the home, some men were already in the home we were supposed to be staying in. There were lots of boxes and junk in front of that home. Also, the men were shirtless and had large dogs in the yard (very strong dog smell.) We assumed they lived there. Thinking we had received the wrong apartment number, we tried the other apartment which is in the same property (side by side.) The keypad door unlocked with the code Laura had sent us. When we went into the home, we noticed it was not the home we had rented. We had rented a 3 bedroom 1 bath and this was a 2 bedroom 1 bath. Immediately, I try to contact Laura and she was not readily available. I had to contact Airbnb, send the pictures of the home we were in & explain that was not our rental. We were finally able to reach Laura and that‚Äôs when she cleared up that the men next door had gone into the wrong rental. That meant both homes had the same unlock code. I spoke to the men next door and they apologized for going into the wrong home. They stated they could clean up ‚Äúquickly‚Äù and switch homes. I asked how long they had been at the rental and they stated 2 days and 1 night. I went back in the other apartment and another unknown male came knocking harshly asking ‚Äúto see the apartment they were getting.‚Äù He stormed into the home and started to look at the yard ‚Äúfor their dogs.‚Äù I told him this was the home they had originally booked and he walked out upset. We spoke to Laura again and asked her if she could have someone come clean the home, as the men had slept in the beds and also had the dogs indoor. She stated she wants sure if she could have someone come out to clean the home. We also asked her if there was anyway she could change the keypad code as we DID NOT FEEL SAFE that those men knew the code also worked next door. We were all women from out of town. Laura stated ‚ÄúI guess I could do that.‚Äù Laura‚Äôs response to the matter was very nonchalant. She offered for us to stay in the 2 bedroom home and would only discount the first night. However, we needed the third bed. Through Airbnb, our reservation was cancelled. We were left to struggle for the remainder of the day to find somewhere to stay as it was a holiday weekend. We didn‚Äôt find a place to sleep until after 10:00pm that night. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this place as Laura was an irresponsible and unavailable host.

Fair warning - read the fine print.. there are charges in addition to the rental price that are NOT immediately in the listing. Washer/dryer included in the amenities in the listing (although you do share it with the next door maid service so hopefully it's not in use when you need it) BUT 10$ to use it?!?!? I've never been charged for a washer/Dryer that's listed in the amenities of an AirBNB. Why is the fact that you are charged for washer/dryer hidden much further down in the long description of the place.

Pet fee (which is listed) but for what?!? The yard that the listing suggests you enjoy for "sunning and stargazing" was so overgrown we were worried to let our small hypoallergenic dog in it for fear of ticks. I understand the need for pet fees but perhaps the yard should be maintained enough to let our dogs safely hang out in since we are paying an excessive amount for it.

Laundry list of other frustrations - shower control was difficult (especially for children where the warm water escalates quickly), lamp in front room did not work, security light outside the home turned on incessantly throughout the night thus flooding the windows with light, ice maker did NOT work (even though listed in the description), TV was tiny, and finally yard was overgrown and haphazard.

Overall, not a great place, just an "it will do" place.

Laura is one of the least understanding hosts I‚Äôve ever worked with. I scheduled to stay in this Airbnb a month ago without knowing that the first weekend of February would have severe weather in Austin. Weather that was so bad that government offices and schools closed down. All of the guests who were flying into Austin had their flights cancelled the day of the reservation and Laura refused to give a refund. In a world where weather is uncontrollable and the Covid-19 pandemic is still occurring, I would not stay in this Airbnb due to the host not being understanding of extenuating circumstances. Granted Airbnb support team was unable to help me either - I have to blame both the host and Airbnb guidelines.

My stay in Austin would have been perfect had it not been for the offenses and humiliations I'd been through while on Airbnb. I strongly recommend future guests to ask any questions before booking, especially in the long term, so as not to have unpleasant surprises during the stay, such as the ones I had, since certain requirements are not in the description of the accommodation, which injures the community policy. I felt totally helpless. I was expecting more from Airbnb, mainly because I consider its policies of respect and non-discrimination diffused by the platform, which were completely disrespected by the hostess throughout my stay.
***
Mi estancia en Austin habr√≠a sido perfecta, no fuera por las ofensas y humillaciones por las que pas√© durante mi estancia en el Airbnb.
