Recomiendo fuertemente a los futuros hu√©spedes que toman todas las dudas antes de hacer su reserva, especialmente a largo plazo, para no tener sorpresas desagradables durante la estancia, como las que he tenido, ya que ciertos requisitos no est√°n en la descripci√≥n del alojamiento, lo que lastima la pol√≠tica de la comunidad. On the positive, the entry instructions worked well. Stacey, the property agent,  respounded quickly prior to our visit.    The beds were clean and comfortable and plenty of towels supplied.  However the property needs an major overhaul. The furniture was old and tired and looked like it was donated by goodwill with only one sad grubby cushion on sofa.  The garden was in total disarray and unkept, the garden furniture was dirty, basic and uncomfortable. The BBQ was unuseable and filthy.  There were unsightly wires coming out of the back of the TV, (a hazard if you have young children).  The kitchen pans should be replaced. They were old and grubby and no kettle provided. The plates were a mishmash with no thought for family usage.  The internet was patchy and we had connection issues throughout our two week stay.   Overall, very disappointing. They should either reduce their rates to reflect the actual condition of the property or upgrade as the photographs are misleading.  Would not recommend staying here.    Clearly this is just a business to the landlord and doesn‚Äôt offer value for money.

lieu tr√®s satisfaisant, c'est tr√®s joli, bien d√©cor√©, une exp√©rience a faire!
en plus de l'air stream, le petit jardin donne l'impression d‚Äô√™tre en campagne, √©tant tout pr√®s de la ville, on serait bien rest√© quelques jours de plus!
We stayed during the first snow in Austin in 4 years, so we could not enjoy the animals and backyard as much as we wanted.
Marcella‚Äôs place was quiet, cozy, and very comfortable. I had available everything I needed to feel right at home. I was so sad to go!
A magical escape from the madness of downtown Austin
No interest in writing a public review.

The pictures were definitely instagram able! But the RV fell short of what was expected. The bed was lumpy and uncomfortable. Yes we are in Texas but there were 3 large roaches in the bathroom obviously seeking water. I did not want to disparage the host so I did not complain and left early but then I thought of all the money I spent to stay there the whole month and when I complained the host refused the refund. Poor business practice. So disappointed because they host is very kind.
low fidelity place, high novelty factor

The apartment was just as described. Our ride couldn't pick us up till 1:30 and Kristen was nice enough to let us stay till then. My only complaints are that the bed was very uncomfortable and that there was only 1 towel and there were 2 of us.

I have to say, we were pretty disappointed with our stay. The apartment is in a great location, and we knew it would be a smaller place, but the overall quality was not what we expected. First off, all of the previous reviews are 5 stars. Leading us to believe that it would be a 5 star experience, and now we're just suspicious of the ratings provided of the apartment by "previous guests"

When we walked in, the place was damp and hot, she requests that the AC be turned off when you leave, and it was a 97 degree day, so that does not add for a comfortable situation. The room immediately smelled very moldy and musty, not very pleasant. We go to turn on a few lights, but the main light in the living area was flickering and did not work. She did leave a note saying she was trying to get an electrician out and would let us know when someone could come, someone did not come while we were visiting. It happens, we appreciated the effort.

We walked around the unit and noticed that the apartment was not very clean. It was actually quite gross. There was black mold on the bathroom tiles and shower curtain, the shower was dirty, there was a ring in the toilet, a TON of LONG BLACK hairs all over the shower and bathroom floor (I have short dark hair and my GF has long blonde hair, definitely from a previous guest) a large mattress was in the closet preventing us from being able to open the door all the way, and the sheets on the bed were DISGUSTING. They reeked of mildew or like someone left them in the washing machine for days and just put them straight in the dryer after, so we changed them, but the back up sheets smelled even worse! We finally found another bottom sheet that didn't smell, but when we got it on the bed, there was a giant stain on them! I understand that we are staying in someone's home, but if you have people paying a nightly rate, invest in some decent sheet sets. None of the sheets matched, they were scratchy, and the bed was so uncomfortable, we hardly slept the entire visit.

On top of this, we decided to get some groceries on our first night for the weekend and the next afternoon we realized the refrigerator and freezer did not work at all, so about $100 worth of groceries had completely spoiled. We notified Kristen of what happened and she did bring up a mini fridge while we were out, but for the fridge/ freezer and a light to be out and not offer any kind of discount is pretty distasteful.

We still had a great trip, but the accommodations are no where near 5 stars like we were expecting, and we did not feel like it was worth it for the price.
Very disappointed. I ended up calling a friend in the area to pick me up. Did not stay over night here as planned.

Kristen needs to do some updates. Maybe add some extra pots and pans. Fix the light on the ceiling fan. The refrig/ freezer should be replaced or fixed- the sm college size one does freeze but not the best!
Great place to crash at, especially for work trips that will be centered around Moody Bank building.

The reviews said this place was super clean but the reality is that its not. The bathroom smelled like urine. The shower was very dirty as it looked as if it had not been clean for weeks with mold residue throughout the corners and base of the tub. The faucet of the tub leaks so there is rust in multiple places of the tub, not to mention, the entire night you hear non-stop leaking from the faucet in the tub. I'm so glad I brought shower shoes because it is not a shower you want to step in bare foot as it was not clean at all. I arrived at midnight and went straight for the bed, only to find when I pulled back the comforter, hair! There was hair on the sheets and pillow and a stain on the pillow case. The sheets were not clean at all. Needless to say, I did not get into the covers, for 3 nights I slept on top of the comforter in a fetal position with no pillow or covers. When I went to the spare room to grab a blanket, the room the blankets were in, the ceiling looked as if it had been leaking and there was mold. So I opted to just sleep with no blankets on top of the comforter. Not ideal as I was traveling for business and needed adequate sleep. The next day I bought Lysol to at least disinfect the place. But the place was definitely not cleaned before me and its not as it appears in the pictures online. The walls are dirty, microwave was dirty on the panel, the counter tops in both the bathroom and kitchen were dirty, it just was not clean. When I cleaned the counter tops using paper towels, it was so much dirt and residue that came from cleaning I was disgusted!  This was my first and last time I'll do airbnb. All hotels were booked so I thought I'd give it a try. But its a no for me moving forward.
This place was dope nasty

Unfortunately place was not exactly what we were expecting. No tent around the bed and a little more stuff around that you can see on the pictures. Place was very cool looking but unfortunately quite dirty. Shower needs cleaning attention. Same is with refrigerator. House has big amount of little things that I suppose make it difficult to keep it out of dust, but it is not an excuse.
On a good side - location was great, and we hadn‚Äôt have a lot of troubles with parking. Luis was easy to communicate with and he let us to check in late.

I can't say enough great things about our stay at Amy's place; but I suspect anything I would say has been said before! It's probably enough to note that we can't wait to go back to Austin and without doubt we'd come back to stay at the Tiny House.

The tiny house wasn't so tiny! Perfect and roomy for one or two persons. Everything else was as advertised and reviewed. I'll be back.

Patrick

This Airbnb was a great location with all of the restaurants only by a few minutes away. The Tiny house had a cool backyard and snacks. I did not like that most of the tiny house has windows that anyone can look through it did not feel like enough privacy. My main issue with this place is that there were fleas everywhere and, spiders. I was only there for a few minutes, and I had to grab all of my stuff quickly and leave. The fleas were not from me and, they were not just dead but alive too. If anyone has had to deal with fleas its hell to get rid of them and I did not want to bring that home with me. I just wish that the owner of the place let us know before I was going to stay there. The conditions of the bugs were unacceptable and late at night I had to figure out last second where to find a hotel. I would not recommend staying here unless the owner gets rid of the bugs. I wanted to write an honest review because I would not want anyone else to go through that stress.

Asunto oli todella hyv√§ll√§ paikalla, l√§hell√§ kaikkea. Asunnon kuvat eiv√§t aivan vastanneet todellisuutta, asunto oli hieman nuhjuisempi, kuin mit√§ kuvat antavat odottaa. Don‚Äôt take a car to Austin... it‚Äôs a pain in the tush... not that it‚Äôs this places fault. But I would not suggest this location if you need parking.
It is waking distance to: Capital, Starbucks, 6th St, and the convention center!! So don‚Äôt bring a car and stay here!

House was perfect. Location is walking distance from bars and restaurants on Cesar
Chavez and a $6 Lyft ride from Rainey St/Downtown. Couldn't be better. Nice patio at the back of the house and off street parking for 2+ vehicles.

I'm going to preface this review with a simple statement, I spend a lot of time in Airbnbs and have had great experiences overall. So much so, that I was really looking forward to this extended stay at Charlotte's place while I looked for a permanent home in Austin after relocating from NYC. Unfortunately, this ended up being a stay that I was happy to have come to an end. Below are the highlights of the good and the bad. Please take from them what you will. Let's start with some good things: 1) The location is close to downtown and in a nice neighborhood. 2) The property is quiet and backs up to greenspace. 3) The unit is well equipped and has access to laundry. 4) Charlotte added a landline phone to the unit for me as cell service can be spotty and I work from home. 5) Easy access to the Hike and Bike trail and neighborhood pool. 6) The price for the unit was very reasonable compared to the surrounding market. Here are some of the bad things: 1) Although the location is close to downtown it isn't really walkable to anything. You'll need to have a car or access to Uber to get around. 2) Cockroaches. This place has tons of them. The unit was sprayed before we came and we had to have it sprayed while we were staying there. Charlotte was quick to have the service come, but we still saw roaches and other bugs every day even after the spraying. If you're squeamish about bugs, this is not the place for you. 3) Charlotte sent me several messages in regards to issues with Airbnb processing my payments. Unfortunately, the credit card I rented the unit with was canceled due to fraud and Airbnb kept trying to charge it. I updated the payment information in their system and corrected the issue within minutes of notification. However, Charlotte still found it necessary to send me messages that were accusatory and offensive. She seemed overly concerned she would not be paid. Weird, considering Airbnb acts as 3rd party intermediary to prevent just such an issue. 4) The unit has a very clear statement that the renter is on the hook for the A/C cost in the summer and that the unit is metered. However, when it came time to pay that bill, Charlotte yet again sent me messages that accused me of overusing their electricity, yet had no metered bill for that unit to produce for me. She told me I owed her $185 for the month for the increased usage. However, when I asked how she came up with this number she had no real documentation to prove it. I could have paid her nothing, but instead, I paid her the requested $185 plus extra because I'm not the kind of guy who would ever short someone on a bill. 5) I found the bed to be extremely uncomfortable. Maybe it's just a personal preference...

Beautiful space but misleading. Advertised as a private residence but is actually a shared space with a colony of roaches. Owner sprayed but after I woke up with a cockroach crawling on my face, I had to cancel the remainder of my stay. Inhabitable unless you‚Äôre shooting an episode of Fear Factor.

El lugar es muy limpio y acogedor, el dise√±o de los muebles y de la casa en general me gust√≥ mucho! la zona es una de mis favoritas en Austin tiene lugares para desayunar e ir por una cerveza a pie, la zona es muy segura y tranquila.

DATO IMPORTANTE la foto que sale de la cocina no es parte del studio.

Solid little studio with loft. No frills. Perfect for a quick weekend in ATX where you plan to spend less time in the apartment and more out and about. Communication was excellent, value is tip-top, neighborhood is great for those looking for a low key Austin experience, but is also walking distance from all the nonsense. No kitchen meant keeping beers and leftovers cold in an outdoor mini-fridge. No big deal. Overall, we'd stay here again.
Would recommend. Cool space and well-utilized. I didn't realize the studio was attached via a breezeway to the main house, but didn't change how great of a setup it was! I would stay there again.

This space was okay. This is suited for someone who didn‚Äôt intend to spend a considerable amount of time at the Airbnb, which we had intended on doing. A girlfriend and I booked to stay here for the weekend not realizing just how small the space was and that isn‚Äôt any fault to the host.. There was no kitchen, no closet, a tiny bathroom mirror in the bathroom with poor lighting. (We we‚Äôre going out on the town so this made it hard to get ready)
The bed had to be at least 10 years old, we both were rolled into the middle as it was extremely broken in. And there was an empty bottle of body was in the bathroom leaving us wondering how thorough the cleaning process had been...

We ended up leaving after one night of staying out of three because we were so cramped and so uncomfortable.
I had no issues.

Eine gro√üartige Wohnung mit √ºberragendem Blick √ºber die Stadt, auf das Meer, die Br√ºcken und in die Ferne, besonders auch bei Nacht. Nicht nur vom Wohnzimmer und dem kleinen Balkon, sondern auch direkt aus dem vermieteten Schlafzimmer, vom Bett aus. Sehr gute, zentrale Lage aber nicht laut, allenfalls das Bad nebenan.
Sid ist sehr nett, hat uns sehr viel geholfen und den Aufenthalt angenehm gemacht.
Wir freuen uns darauf, bei unserem n√§chsten Urlaub in San Francisco wieder bei ihm wohnen zu k√∂nnen

It's the worst place I have ever lived hahahaha
Kidding, it's amazing, will book again!

Nan hat viel f√ºr uns gemacht! Sie holte uns vom Bahnhof ab und brachte uns bei der Abreise auch wieder dorthin. Infos √ºber die besten Restaurants und Ausflugstipps gab es reichlich. Im Apartment lagen einige Snacks und ein paar gek√ºhlte Getr√§nke bereit - die gab es kostenlos! √úberhaupt ist das Apartment toll eingerichtet. Downtown mit der Kneipenmeile Sixth Street ist auch mit einem Fu√ümarsch gut zu erreichen. Wer nicht so gerne l√§uft, findet bei Nan eine gro√üe Auswahl an Fahrr√§dern. Beim Ausleihen ist leider ein wenig Papierkram zu erledigen, aber gut, damit wollen sich die Gastgeber eben absichern. Alles in allem ein wirklich toller Aufenthalt in einer toller Stadt.

Excellent hospitality. I was unfortunately at Nans place during the latest winter storm that shut down most of Texas. On our expected checkout day, we woke to about 4-5 inches of snow. Unable to leave in our car, and with our flights being cancelled we were in a bad situation. Nan didn‚Äôt hesitate to offer the room to us again for another day. Even though she was dealing with loss of water wand electricity at her own house, she checked in multiple times. I would highly recommend this place for it‚Äôs wonderful location, but most of all Nan‚Äôs hospitality!
Such an amazing AirBnB!! We stayed here while our house was being remodeled and our hosts could not have been nicer and the house could not have been better for our stay.

Blair a √©t√© un h√¥te extr√™mement accueillant. Il a fait le n√©cessaire pour que je puisse entrer facilement malgr√© mon arriv√©e tardive. Il a aussi √©t√© d'excellent conseil pour aller √©couter de la musique.
C'est une maison hors de l'ordinaire, dans un quartier agr√©able √† deux pas du centre ville. La maison est calme, tr√®s bien pour passer de bonnes nuits, En m√™me temps, elle est anim√©e et on y rencontre souvent d'autres gens, car Blair a beaucoup d'amis qui viennent lui rendre visite.
J'ai pu aller √† pied travailler chaque jour.

We were very disappointed with our stay and our communication with John.  Prior to our arrival I text John with no response and had to call twice before I could reach him to confirm the access code. During our conversation he notified me that his dogs are staying on the property and he would be the following night.  This detail was not on the listing when we booked and was added after we stayed here.  When we arrived at the house the dogs were in the laundry room (accessed from garage) and I called John to confirm that we rented the entire house and to ask if we needed to feed the dogs. He informed me that his neighbor would be coming by to feed them.  We are dog lovers and we felt very sorry for these dogs home alone with the owner out of town and gave them fresh water. After going out for dinner we returned to the house - about 5 minutes later the dogs startled my mother - we did not realize they had come inside while we were gone through the laundry room. Our dogs started scrapping but we were able to separate. The house overall was not clean :master bedroom sheets had stains that had not been washed; lacked fresh towels; dusty; bugs/flies in pantry and throughout house. The mattresses in the 3rd br were very hard. I had to use my body weight (125 lbs) to enter the front door because it sticks pretty bad. The neighbor came through a door in the backyard (without letting us know) to feed the dogs but turned around when he saw us. There was a note on the kitchen counter from the previous guests so we do realize that John had not been in the house since those guests had stayed there (about a week or so I think). We feel that John should have had someone check the house prior to our stay to ensure it was cleaned. When John arrived Saturday we expressed our concerns but there was no solution offered.  John smoked in the garage that night and we could smell it in the house. We had to monitor our dogs in the backyard because the dogs were barking at each other through the fence that separates the yard (all dogs being territorial).  Had we known of the dogs & John staying on the property we would not have booked here. We looked into leaving during our stay but could not find dog-friendly availability.    We came to Austin to attend a classic car show my Father had been looking forward to for months.  This was supposed to be a relaxing getaway weekend for my parents (one is caretaker and one has cancer) but was very stressful, uncomfortable and disappointing.

Casa acima de tudo com bom custo-beneficio, grande espa√ßosa, com cozinha bem montada, regi√£o tranquila, com bom acesso. Casa um pouco antiga, que n√£o se percebe bem pelas fotos. Bom anfitri√£o, por√©m ficamos muito incomodados, pois o anfitri√£o, entrou na casa mais de uma vez pela porta cozinha, sem bater, o que poderia ter gerado uma situa√ß√£o de, no m√≠nimo desconforto, se alguma das mulheres estivesse em trajes mais √≠ntimos. Muito desagrad√°vel. Est√°vamos alugando a casa toda, n√£o esper√°vamos tal situa√ß√£o. Portanto apenas duas cr√≠ticas, a casa um pouco antiga, e a falta de delicadeza do anfitri√£o de tocar a campainha, quando precisasse adentrar a casa.

My family stayed at John's place over Christmas weekend along with a family friend.

Overall the house was just OK.

The Good - House is located around 10min from downtown. Locating the house and getting in is very smooth. There is no interference from Chris. He just meets you at check-in time and then stays in his trailer near the garage.

The Not so Good - Its advertised as entire place. So based on my previous experience, I was expecting a house with no trace of anyone living in the house. But that's not the case if you use the Fridge or Kitchen or Bath. Also the house does not looks the same as in pictures. Its looks much older including furniture. The house was not as clean as I would like it to given that there is $150 cleaning charge that's included. The master bedroom bath does not have a door so it was difficult with 4 kids around.

But since we were not around much we managed the 2 days and were out asking ourselves why we did not stay at a Residence Inn...
The house was very spacious and nice BUT it wasn't that clean. There was a lot of bugs and the towels wasn't clean.

John stays in his trailer next to the house and it was incredibly awkward. He still used the house while we stayed there for the night. One of our girls stayed back because she was sick and she was startled by him in the house using the bathroom during our stay. He was inappropriately dressed and thought we were all out for the day. We ended up cutting our reservation short and staying at a new place the next two nights. The location says 10-15 min from downtown but the uber and Lyft rides are really 20-35 min to downtown depending on the time of day.
no thanks

There was dead/half alive cockroaches throughout the house! It was gross trying to get rid of them. Were blamed for confetti that wasn't previously cleaned. I would not consider it as an "entire home" if the host is staying in the garage/airstream next door. Communication was good before the trip, and helped with figuring out the sound system. So many rules that don't seem to be accommodating to guests. Due to his stay at the location, kept getting messages about keeping track of my other arriving guests parking in his spot.
It was not clean, accurate, or accommodating much.

I'm sorry this house was nothing like pictured and very dirty.  Furnishings including pictures have changed greatly.   Most all the dishes in cabinets were filthy and the actual cabinets were dirty.  Oven was broken.  Host was great at communication but house needs a major cleaning.

Lots of rules to follow but not super hard just tedious. Understandable as it is his private home. He does stay on the property in a mobile house on the side which is a little weird but you don‚Äôt really notice.

We rented this house  (the entire house)due to its proximity to our construction project. After the long drive to Austin and working at the jobsite all day, the house wasn't ready when we arrived and the Owner wasn't aware we had rented the house.  We had to go to dinner to wait until he cleaned and got the rooms ready.  The Owner lives onsite in a camper when the house is rented but he entered the house when we weren't there without approval from us.   That wasn't cool so we checked out a day early.   We rent properties in Austin all the time during our construction projects but not sure I would rent this property again.
The house didn‚Äôt seem the same as in the pictures, we were also having trouble with the thermostat and it was really hot.

This stay was fine, nothing extraordinary. But the headache came after we left. Just before checkout one of my guests accidentally broke a small side table that went out over the couch. This table was no more than $50 based on the quality and how easily it broke. The host then charged me $150, and did not accept my $60 reimbursement when I provided evidence of a $40 replacement and insisted on more money. I then received an email requesting $11,760 and spent an hour on the phone with AirBnb trying to understand this charge with no help from the host. Didn‚Äôt find out until days later that this email was a mistake. Not a good experience

The location of the condo is great. Parking is a plus too. There is no elevator so be prepared to carry your belongings up the stairs. The furniture is very worn and the bathrooms were not clean but hopefully that was just a problem during our visit and not an ongoing issue.

I would not recommend unless some things change‚Ä¶ the place was not clean, at all. There was old food and trash underneath the couches, if you walked without shoes the bottom of our feet turned black, the carpets upstairs are badly stained, there was mold in both showers on the walls and shower heads, not sufficient toilet paper for our stay, there were no hand towels any where - for the bathroom or kitchen. I‚Äôve stayed in several air bnb and this was my worst experience for the stay.

Unless ur standards are on the low end I would consider another place to stay.
The apartment is in need of some cosmetic repairs. Not worth the money!

This loft is ideally located for downtown Austin and the convention center.  It is a three-story facility with no elevator, and the leasee is limited to one vehicle.  According to the activity I was attending in Austin, I would still lease the loft if available.

This place is in a great location, and it slept 8 of us really well. Super cute. Unfortunately, there were some things not so good:
1. No spatula in the kitchen. I had to flip pancakes with a rubber spatula. The kitchen was pretty under-stocked.
2. The washing machine was broken though I asked of its location just a few days before we arrived and was told it was in the unit. I believe it had been broken at that time. No big deal, I washed my clothes in the kitchen sink, but then,
3. there were bed sheets in the dryer! We were given no direction of what to do with them. We used the dryer often so we put the sheets on the floor.
4. The hot water lasted for about 3-4 showers. Unacceptable for a place that can sleep 10+.
5. One of the toilets was having issues (more than just running) and when I called maintenance, I got no answer and no call to return my voicemail.
6. I am still awaiting a refund (for a change in number of guests) that I requested before my trip but was asked to wait.

Aside from the location, nothing else about this AirBnB was great. The WiFi connection never worked ‚Äî we were told there was 2 networks and only 1 (which didn‚Äôt work) was available. The walls are very thin, so it was difficult to sleep, even with going to bed after 2am. The bathrooms are the worst part about this location. The master shower handle was broken, the guest bath immediately had standing water in the tub, and got water ran out quickly. While it was nice to be able to walk around town, this place definitely was a disappointing AirBnB experience for all the guests.

This place was everything that we expected from location to how spacious it was to accommodate our family. Even being  close to the busiest areas downtown Austin was convenient, this was close enough for walking but far enough to be away from very noisy areas.

Very loud next to a fire station and loud, drunk people outside. It sounds like they were directly outside the windows. Pool not in working order when we visited. Inside decor is nice but appliances need maintenance and repairing. The dish disposal broke while we were there and we were blamed for it. We could hear water dripping inside the AC unit and the AC filter was extremely dirty and old. There's potential mold on the vents in at least of the 2 bedrooms. We ran out of paper towels due to the disposal breaking. The dishwasher definitely doesn't clean anything.

Great location and decent for the price, but unfortunately the shower didn‚Äôt drain properly, the shower curtain was gross, and the AC filter was disgusting. The floors also could have been mopped and my friends think the sheets were dirty.

Great location and price, but this place definitely needs some work.

There were a handful of minor maintenance issues, but one that I'd consider a major issue is the plumbing. One shower only sends a fraction of the water to the shower head, with the rest coming out of the bath faucet. The other shower was completely clogged so that you stand in 4-5 inches of water while you shower.

Check in and check out are a major pain in the ass. The "garage" remote is stored inside the unit, so you have to either pay for parking to run up and find the remote yourself, or have somebody circle the block for however long it takes you to find the unit - which could be awhile because there is absolutely zero rhyme or reason to the numbering system. Units 349 and 350 are on different floors with several units in between them, etc.

The remote situation ended up being a problem for checkout, too - because you have to go through the same process of taking your car OUT of the garage area and parking out side just to run back up 3 floors to drop the remote off again before you leave. I checked, and the owner DID send me a message through the app the day before explaining the issue, but I didn't read it in time and ended up getting stuck in the garage for half an hour until I saw somebody else in the parking lot who was nice enough to go up to their unit, bring their remote downstairs, and allow me to leave. This particular point just seems absolutely insane to me - that you have to have a remote that belongs in the apartment to LEAVE the property. There should be no scenario that could end with a tenant sitting in the car HOPING somebody wants to leave at the same time as you.

Which brings me to another point. I was given two contact numbers to call if I had any issues (which I obviously did), and out of the 6 attempts to call these numbers over three days, not a single one was answered or returned.

The benefit to this place is that it has a lot of beds and it's a couple of blocks from Sixth Street, but that's about it. It's certainly not a "hotel" and certainly not the "ultimate in downtown accommodations."

Overall, the Cosmopolitan suite is somewhat middle of the road for the price. The location certainly is convenient for getting around to the busy parts of Austin. However, this also means that there are a LOT of drunken activity at all hours during the night. Our party were kept up well past 2 AM Thursday through Saturday night because of the aggressive yelling, drag racing, and emergency vehicles (this place is 2 blocks away from a firehouse). The walls are thin so we could hear everything. The accommodations in the apartments were mediocre. The beds certainly were comfortable, but the sofas / couches were dilapidated, generally moist, and offered no cushion support. 3 out of the 6 dining room chairs were broken, and the dishwasher did not work. The main TV in the living room had an abnormal magenta hue to it and frequently did not work.

If you're coming into Austin expecting just a place to crash at night, I think the Cosmopolitan suite would be fine. However, given the price and how it was advertised, I think you're better off looking elsewhere

Dirty.
Broken glass on floor when we arrived.
Unwilling to issue refund.

We had an enjoyable visit in Austin, the unit is really well located for conferences and other downtown fun. Our balcony had trees all around and we enjoyed the birds in the mornings while we had our coffee.
Unfortunately the unit was not exactly what we'd expected from the pictures and descriptions. We learned during our stay that the building will be demo-ed in a year or so and the state of the building all made sense after that. There were many parts of the exterior and interior of the unit that implied "it's coming down soon, so we won't bother fixing it".
The beds were comfortable, and AC was nice. But the unit was severely lacking kitchen supplies. From dishes, to cups, to utensils, to actual cook ware, it looked like someone had come in and stolen the kitchen equipment because there was so little of it. No cutting board whatsoever, and there was not even a normal kitchen-sized garbage can, only one that looked like it should be in a bedroom or bathroom.
Chairs in this unit were also VERY uncomfortable, and there was a terrible smell upon our arrival that we had to go buy a lighter and a candle to help combat, but we were always coming back to the smell when we'd put it out to leave. Coming out of the vents was also some unidentified type of mold that had us concerned once we realized it wasn't just dust.
I reached out to owners afterwards to inform of our issues so hopefully there will be some fixes in the very near future, but we were not offered compensation for the problems.

The apartment was perfect - exactly as advertised.  The location couldn't be better.  Check in / out was very simple and flexible on timing.  The only warning is that there was no dedicated parking spot and parking is tough in that area.
Communication was satisfactory. There was a sucker waiting for us on the bed!

This apartment is exactly as its described. Its immaculately kept, very well decorated, and has more than enough amenities. The check in and check out process was perfect and more hosts should do it the way Ryan does.

As described in the description there is a bus-stop that is 1-2 blocks away that will take you to and from the airport, and if you use the Austin Metro app it will cost you $1.50 each way and probably takes about as long as an uber, especially if traffic is bad (warning first bus from airport is 6am).

The apartment is close to everything if you are here for the downtown/rainey street scene with plenty of bars and food options.

The closest real grocery store is probably about 10-12 blocks away (whole foods I think), there is a local high-end market with beer and wine around the block and a liquor store about two blocks away.

The only thing that could probably be improved on his wifi speed, but honestly if you come to Austin to do work/or sit in your apt and be on the inet....well that's a shame.

This is where I will be staying if I come back.

When we arrived, the wifi was not working and neither was the stove. Somebody came by the following day to fix the issues, but the wifi was very spotty throughout our whole stay. I was there for work, so this wasn't great.

Pros:
Great location, very walkable to all the sights of Austin.
Easy check-in and electronic locks.
Free parking.
Easy access to the community pool (which was very clean).

Cons:
Internet was clocked at 1mbps.
Thermostat kept the living room cold but the bedroom hot.
Bedroom air vent was covered in gross dust.
Shower would scald if any other water is running in the place.

Renters beware! We had a terrible time with this rental. A week prior to our arrival, I saw that renters were having trouble with the WIFI. We were attending a tech conference, and needed the WIFI for project work. It does NOT work. The owner gave us incorrect server information. When we asked for assistance, he did send someone (Moses) who was very nice. He rebooted the server and it worked for about an hour. The whole week was spent using our cell phones for service. The owner lives in California, so you won't get help. He told us "that he wasn't our babysitter" and that "if we can't follow directions, he can't help us." (We are techie people!) The issue was with the modem.

Additionally, the place does NOT look like the pictures. It is dark and not very clean. Rugs are disgusting and the blinds were bent up. The bathroom was missing a towel bar and we had stained linens.

Finally, the place is LOUD at night. Between sirens, drunk people, and street noise, it's impossible to sleep.

I do not recommend this place.
No communication until the day after check in, only because I contacted airbnb support. The location was the only plus. Would not stay here again or with host. Very rude.

Although this airbnb is conveniently located, I would recommend staying in a hotel or another airbnb. Our check in time was at 3pm, which we had confirmed with the host at 9am the same day. When we arrived to the airbnb the host had failed to give us the correct door code. We attempted to contact them for hours to resolve the issue, but they ignored our calls are we were forced to wait in the rain. When we finally got into the airbnb there were ants in the sink and the additional air mattress was not working.
Excelente casa, excelente locaci√≥n y sobre todo excelente locaci√≥n!!! Sin duda cuando regrese a Austin regresar√≠a aqu√≠

Wir waren mit 5 Jungs auf unseren Roadtrip durch Texas. Das Haus  hat alles was das Herz begehrt  sch√∂ne gro√üe K√ºche und genug Platz zu schlafen .Ich kann die Unterkunft nur empfehlen sauber ordentlich und gut gelegen .Die Kommunikation mit den Gastgebern konnte nicht besser sein .5 Sterne !

Crystal is very communicative, responsive, and helpful. The home is very spacious with plenty of seating in kitchen and family room. Beds are very comfy. Outdoor space is lovely. But we did find things that need improving.  Number one complaint is that there are no dressers in any of the rooms, nor is there shelving in the spacious closets- only rods and a shoe rack. If you look closely at photos you'll notice this.  We missed it, and we were there for ten nights, so it was a huge pain. Also, kitchen is not well equipped.  We cooked a lot while there and pots/kitchen and serving utensils are sparse. I had to buy wine glasses because all they had were stemless ones.  Plate choices are either large and heavy, or tiny. Appliances are showing their age. And the TV in master bedroom has a cord that doesn't reach the outlet.  Lastly, two car garage, but only car fits one because they are storing broken furniture and hardware in there.  Despite shortcomings, we would stay here again.
There ain't any better home to stay while in Austin, than Troy's. It's our 2nd time now, & I'll certainly continue every time I travel here. Highest rating possible.

Though pictures of Troy's place were charming, in actuality my friends and I  encountered multiple dead roaches on site, by the bed in the master bedroom, in the shower, just an overall bad experience.

I came for a visit for the weekend to go to places I've missed after graduating from UT and moving out of Austin. This place was very conveniently located to everywhere I wanted to go and street parking didn't cause any headache and was very easy and safe. I didn't get to see Chris in person but he was very reachable with messages. The private entrance made it very convenient to go in and out at any time without feeling like a disturbance! Would definitely want to book with Chris whenever I come back to Austin!

Chris ist super. Das Apartment ist genau wie beschrieben - sehr gro√ü, das Bad ist gut ausgestattet. Die K√ºche mit Mikrowelle, Kaffeemaschine und K√ºhlschrank ist super f√ºr l√§ngere Aufenthalte. Bushaltestellen und Superm√§rkte sind um die Ecke. Das WIFI ist zuverl√§ssig. Zu empfehlen.
Nice home and hosts; close to bus routes, but so noisy we had to buy ear plugs after losing a night's sleep.
anne came in to see if everything was alright.  the place was small but very clean.  i have a back problem and had trouble with the bed and also the ac units didn't help for sleeping.

Nous avons log√©s chez Crystal pendant notre s√©jour √† Austin.
L'appartement √©tais propre et contient tout se que l'on a besoin pour un s√©jour parfait. Nous avons appr√©cier la laveuse / s√©cheuse.
L'appartement √† sont stationnement √† quelque pas de la porte comme promis.
Nous avons aussi appr√©cier Crystal qui ai disponible pour toute question. Nous avons appr√©cier la liste fait pour nous avec suggestion et recommandations pour rendre notre voyage encore plus simple.
Je recommande fortement de loger chez Crystal!

Meine Tage in Austin habe ich sehr genossen, insbesondere auch weil dieses Apartment absolut toll war!
Tiptop sauber, gut ausgestattet mit allem was man braucht und einem Parkplatz direkt beim Eingang. Die Lage ist ebenfalls tiptop. Mit fasten (analog Uber) bist du f√ºr ca. 9 USD √ºberall. Abends l√§uft immer etwas da zwei Bars in der n√§heren Umgebung sind, das hat jedoch nicht gross gest√∂rt.
Wenn ich das n√§chste Mal in Austin bin weiss ich welches Apartment ich mieten werde :)
We unfortunately had to cancel our trip due to our flight not leaving because of severe weather but Crystal was very understanding about the whole situation.

Crystal‚Äôs place is exacting as shown in the pictures. I like the neighborhood and there‚Äôs lots of interesting things right nearby. There is some noise at night from a nearby bar, but they provide white noise machines that block out the sounds.

Was a very lovely stay. All as is pictured. Although I never met with Matt, everything went smoothly from his side, Turnkey however, is another story.
They never sent the check in email as promised untill after 6 calls to company, and being on hold at least an hour total, then couldn't find me in the system. I finally was able to check in at 6:45pm. Same thing with check out information, which was sent to me 5 hours after check out. Plus they never did call back about a message I left them shortly after check in about the annoying high pitched fire alarm sound coming from attic, which finally stopped 4 hours later after flushing an upstairs toilet?

Noise is a serious issue here. I read other people's reviews, and accepted the host's acknowledgement that you can hear the noise from the unit above this apartment, and even brought earplugs. However, I did not anticipate that this noise would occur throughout the entire night. It is a creaky floor above the unit the reacts to anyone walking around, and of course to items being dropped. The first night at this location was fine, the second however, was awful. I ended up moving from the bed into the living room on the couch, thinking that the person above might not walk above this area, but was wrong- noise was just as bad. When the owner went outside and turned on the car lights around 4am, I told him it was so loud, and he let me know he was up packing for an early flight.

If you know that noise is an issue, and someone is paying to stay at your apartment, a waiver does not excuse simple courtesy and I would hope that a host would do their best to minimize noise during reasonable sleeping hours of say 11 to 5 at least. No such luck here. I was so disappointed, and it made for a very hard next day, with no sleep. If you can sleep through anything, then this could be a good option. Otherwise, the location is ideal, the apartment was very clean and spacious.

Barbra was accommodating but she tried to stick us with a 500$ fee for not cleaning dishes after we ran the dishwasher and Not taking a load of trash out I would be cautious of renting this home she will try and stick you with A LOT of extra fees so what you see is NOT what you get
Excellent!!! I'm tired, hungry, and Chalu asks if I want some supper. It doesn't get any better!!!
Chalu's place was clean and reminded me of my own home. Ill always book with her when I travel to Austin!

Das kleine, feine Zimmer befindet sich in einem ruhigen Wohngebiet. Der Gemeinschaftsraum und K√ºche sind sehr gro√üz√ºgig und sch√∂n hell. Mir hat es f√ºr eine Nacht sehr gefallen. Herzlichen Dank an den Gastgeber! Uta
The reservation was canceled 86 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
great place, nothing fancy but fun!

Ah not sure where to start here. This is the second Airbnb experience I've had where the pictures are quite deceiving. This is an old bungalow. A previous user summed it up as "not the type of place you would want to walk around barefoot in" and I'd have to agree. The floors were pretty dirty. There are holes everywhere, in the floor (one in the bathroom where you can see the ground and foundation), holes in the walls  (covered by paper plates) and holes in bedroom (plugged by paper towels). The whole building likely needs an hvac and electrical overhaul, as there were power strips, cords, space heaters and wires everywhere. When we arrived there, it was like a Febreze bomb had gone off, the smell so overwhelming I was tasting and choking on it. I opened all the doors in an attempt to air out the space, but it definitely lingered, and I'm not sure what other odor might have previously existed that required covering up so extensively.  The "backyard" was like a communal area where there were multiple cars parked daily. Also, there was a regular stream of random men everywhere that didn't introduce themselves- doing chores, painting, like they all lived there (maybe in the teepee?) If I were a woman staying here alone, I definitely wouldn't feel comfortable, as there is limited privacy. Overall, I got a sense that this place was where either a lot of dudes lived, or a place where a lot of dudes crash. Chris himself said he was coming to meet us upon arrival, but we waited around an hour and then decided to just go get lunch because we were starving. He showed up afterwards with a brief rundown of ‚Äúhow the heater works‚Äù followed by a rapid fire list of suggested things to do.  In conclusion, I don't think I will be returning to the SoCo Cottage, next time I'm probably going to seek out something more traditional like the Motel on South Congress, the price is similar & the location just as convenient.

Wonderful time at the SoCo Cottage!! Our arrival was delayed by several hours and Chris was extremely flexible and accommodating. Zero complaints, hated leaved and will definitely stay here next time we're in the area!
Noisy and uncomfortable
Der Aufenthalt im Cozy Allendale Apartment war wie immer sehr angenehm und f√ºhlte sich an wie zu Hause. Kann ich immer wieder empfehlen!
This was our third stay at this property. That says it all. If it was not great I would have returned, but I did and I plan to continue in the future.

Ein sehr, sehr aufmerksamer Gastgeber, der immer f√ºr uns da war,ohne aufdringlich zu sein. Steve ist ein Gastgeber, der immer da ist, wenn man ihn braucht, aber sonst unsichtbar bleibt. Ein kleines aber sehr gem√ºtliches Haus im Stil der gesamten Umgebung, die gepr√§gt ist von Individualit√§t.
Wie aufmerksam Steve war, zeigte sich an einem Abend, als es sp√§t abends noch klopfte und er einfach so noch einmal frische Handt√ºcher brachte.
Das Haus ist sehr kompakt, hat aber alles was wir brauchten - eine gute und gro√üe Dusche, ein gem√ºtliches Bett und eine schnelle Kaffeemaschine.

Travelers Beware:

Cleanliness: 0 Stars
Rodent problem traps and bait everywhere.
Plumbing issues
Apartment had bottles, trash, and dirty linens.

I could post the pictures I took you would be utterly skived out.

Communication: 1 Star
My reservation wasn't even available the day of check-in.
Originally, host said that they had previous guest staying late. Then the problem escalated to a plumbing issue. Host put us up in a temporary space for the evening but said we couldn't stay because the place had been rented to someone else. Original reservation wasn't clean by noon the following day when I also discover that the plumbing hadn't been addressed. And to my surprise there were rodent traps and bait all over. Scary!!!

Host haphazardly kept trying to resolve the problems before I threw in the towel and decided to look for a hotel the next day at noon. Once I reported the BS to Airbnb, host called apologetically.

Check-In: 1 Star
Reservation was not ready at all day of check-in. Fail!

Value: 0 Stars
I was totally ripped off. Airbnb and the host only refunded me a 3rd of the money I spent on the reservation. Utterly, disappointed. Host shouldn't have received anything, under the conditions and I should have been fully reimbursed my hotel expenses that I incurred due to being displaced. WTF!! Where's my $684!!??

Location: 3 Stars
Location was about the only thing this place has going for it. Near downtown with in walking distance.

I had a big problem staying here with not only the large homeless population living right across the street from the entrance of the apartment. This caused us to not be able to walk to all the locations listed on this description. But there was also an awful smell in the hallway leading up to the apartment, as well as something in the apartment either mold, dust or cat dander which caused me to have a severe allergy attack.
Good location close enough to downtown without being super busy!
It is a great location. Small for my needs, but we knew it.   It is really for a couple. The sofa bed is not comfortable.

This location was very nice, however, we felt that the lack of amenities was an issue as the host relied on the guests to leave supplies (shampoo, conditioner, water etc.) as opposed to throwing them away. Also, the sponge was used, the dishes left out from the previous guest, and the base of the toilet was cracked. Also, the ball bearings on the AC were going out, which made a horrible sound and we did not get a response from the host until the day we were checking out.

I was surprised that there were 4 rooms for rent in the same home which I was not aware of and the host was not there as well which made for an uncomfortable situation to share one house with 4 strangers. Not feeling comfortable with the situation I left and rented a hotel room.
Booked it last minute, late at night. Just needed a place to crash before an early flight. Host was totally cool with it.

Great response time from Chalu -- I initially booked her place for the weekend, but had to cut it short. There are several little notes and reminders throughout the house since people come and go. The train dropped me off in Austin in the morning and I was able to drop my bags off then explore the city afterwards.
Our stay was good regarding location. The bathroom cleaning was very very  poor, comparing my previously experience. The host seems like never glance at  bathroom often, It really was disgusting.
Thank you so much for your hospitality and allowing me a place yo crash in spite of everything. Many blessings to you

Host accommodated us with an early check in, but there were a few things not up to the description.  There was no french press coffee maker, and the Keurig was damaged and didn't work well.  The hot water heater was inadequate for even one medium length shower, and the washer stopped 3 times in 2 different settings.  The dryer squealed loudly during entire cycle.  There were only 3 wine glasses, and no dish soap other than the dishwasher machine soap.  WiFi was spotty and inadequate 90% of the time.  Location was great, but the place needs attention.

The location of the unit was great with the ability to walk to Rainey St and 6th. However the unit itself was not what we expected. The carpet was stained and very dirty and the ceiling by the loft had terrible water damage. The toilet also ran the entire time we were there and when we tried to fix it, we noticed the handle was broken. Also, we tried contacting management several times. A few times to see if we could have an early check in, and no response. And then again to see about getting a new hairdryer since the one we had was broken and still no response. IÔ∏è then reached out the host regarding the hairdryer and Ryan responded that maintenance would bring one to us which never happened.

We had zero help or responses from Ryan the whole time we stayed there we had no internet or tv ‚Äî- which was in turn we wished we had never stayed there ‚Äî no internet meant we couldn‚Äôt do any work ‚Äî also we called the company ourselves and his bill was 2months overdue
We had to cancel our stay half way through and go to a hotel because of the poor living conditions

First of all, Ryan is a fake name. The host I corresponded with is Andrea and she said she is the COO. As best as I can tell, this is a San Francisco based operation due to the 415 number she called me from. This operation is not customer focused, but rather focused on providing the least possible for the most money.

Finding the unit was difficult and no guidance was provided, not even which floor it was on. So I spent about 10 minutes walking up and down stairs with my luggage until I found it.

When I opened the door, it was completely dark and the light switch next to the front door did not turn on any lights. So I had to walk into a dark unit in a questionable neighborhood by myself and grope around for lights.

Once I found lights, my stomach twisted. There were stains all over the living room rug. Cracked paint along the ceiling. The bedroom carpet was the worst with some sort of pinkish-red stains all over. The white fabric bed had stains all over it. The curtains were too short to cover the window and the blinds didn‚Äôt close all the way. In fact, in the dining room, the blinds allowed people to see into the unit from the street.

When I tried to use the toilet paper, the holder fell onto the floor and the toilet paper fell in the trash can.

The street noise was unbearable. All night there were extremely loud vehicles, sirens, music with high bass, and drunken yelling and fighting. When I went to see where all the noise was coming from (because it sounded like it was in the unit rather than outside), I discovered a huge gap under the front door.

All of this aside, the worst part was the way the host treated me. Instead of asking how she could make it better, I was told she has no control over the noise in downtown Austin and since I obviously don‚Äôt like the unit, I can leave.

Fortunately AirBnB read the messages back and forth and issued a partial refund. I post this review in hopes that no one else has to be swindled.

DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!! Ac does not work. There was hair and dust everywhere (in the beds) sheets were not changed !!!! There was a 2 inch gap under the door. Pictures are clearly old! I read a review after words saying the host is going under a fake name. Over priced and a SCAM!! We left right away and got a hotel instead !

Cute place and good location close to downtown. Some big issues with heating though and the entire place reeked of egg smell because of that. Really terrible construction noises from next door the entire time and waking us up early/not being able to enjoy the house during the day. I wish that it would have been on the listing that there is constant construction going on next door. REALLY DISAPPOINTED in that because it really ruined our weekend. I think it is just common sense and polite to have that listed.
el barrio era peligroso, los ubers que pasaban por nosotros nos dec√≠an que no deb√≠amos estar afuera de la casa ya que era muy peligroso.
Die Location war super, wie beschrieben, alles da. Der checkin war einfach durch das Codeschloss. Sehr zu empehlen

Jodi‚Äôs unit is perfect for a family visiting the campus area. Parking is easy and available by the apartment (even during a big football game) and the walk to the UT campus was quite short. She has everything you could possibly need in her unit. There is a little highway noise (like white noise) from I-35 but it wasn‚Äôt bad and by the second night we were used to it. We would absolutely stay there again and am already planning another trip to Austin.

The space was nice and in a convenient location, but unfortunately it was not clean. The utensils and dishware were put away dirty and had to be re-washed. There is laundry in-unit, but it is too small to fit the blankets, which added to my suspicion that they were not washed prior to our arrival. Thick layers of dust covered the shelves and windows, and the space under my bed had trash such as water bottles and wrappers.
Excelente lugar. Perfecto si vas a ST Davids o a la UT. Tiene todo lo que necesitas y la casa es muy c√≥moda. La volver√≠a a reservar sin duda. Jodi fue muy amable y atenta.

Julie och Matt √§r suver√§na v√§rdar. Inget verkar vara problem f√∂r dem. Vi hade n√•gra extra √∂nskem√•l som de l√∂ste p√• studs. V√§nligt v√§lkomnande  och ett fantastiskt litet hus i g√•ngavst√•nd till centrum.

Great location!  Had a wierd odor when we arrived and there were definitely some issues with clean sheets...or ensuring the sheets were put on the pillows.  Backyard was great but inside, several things that turned us off.  Guess I didn‚Äôt realize there was no tv or microwave and a few other things that were just kind of annoying (door knob falling off all the time, hitting head on hanging pots and pans, etc).  If you are looking to be in SoCo and not staying inside much, then this will work.

Our view of this accommodation is quite different to others, maybe it's all about expectation. We have been traveling for about a month and this place was the most lacking in modern conveniences. No cable TV (CNN, HBO, Disney JR), no dish washer, no clothes washer/drier, water heater couldn't handle 2 consecutive showers and water pressure is rather low. It's almost 20 km to the Hamilton Pools (pictured with the listing). Interior design was tasteful but rooms are dark.
Great place! Close enough to Bee Cave but enough off the beaten path that it's quiet.

My Waco Texas Airbnb canceled 3 hours before check-in, so I scrambled to find another choice and found this place in Austin.  Beautiful place,great location, nice bedrooms. But I did not like 10 AM check out, no complementary coffee, No soap in kitchen, I just found no hospitality in this place.
My second month's stay went just as well as the first.  No issues, amazing location, and the host was very responsive to anything I needed to contact him for (e.g. new light bulbs).

my boyfriend and I stayed for 5 months in lindas home. the reason I am writing a negative review is because of how linda communicated with us. to be more specific the way she spoke to us was the problem, she was always reachable, but times that I needed to contact her for any reason is what I never looked forward to. she was very condescending to both my boyfriend and myself, was aggressive, and always treated us like we were "problem tenants" when we always paid on time, in full, took care of the place like it was our own, didn't lie or do anything wrong. she constantly accused us of being liars, and cheats and trying to say we were bad people, not to mention constantly threatning to terminate the reservation and kick us out when there was something taking airbnb longer to remit the payment to her which not only violates their terms of service but is just downright unprofessional. not to mention we were told the day after we checked in that we had to make sure the neighbors didn't find out we were airbnb guests because she isn't supposed to be doing airbnb rentals according to her hoa. I caution anyone who is considering renting from linda after my experiences with her.

Great experience and lovely home! Only complaint was the noise outside the complex, but it wasn't bad enough to ruin our time in any way. Walking distance to 6th street (The Dirty), but kind of far from East 6th Street.

Great place to stay and very convenient!

This is a nice apartment. When we booked the listing, it had a queen air mattress listed as the fourth bed. Since then, the listing has been updated to twin air mattresses. As a result, we arrived to a queen air mattress and only twin sheets. The owner corrected this after sleeping with twin sheets on a queen air mattress for one night.

The only downside of this apartment is its proximity to the road. You're on the first floor on 4th Street, so you hear everyone walking past. This was particularly bad on busy weekend nights.
This place is great. Very clean and walking distance to everything. There is some street traffic noise but we didn't think it was that bad.

The location is excellent.  Very walkable to downtown Austin and Sixth St.  The parking really only works for one car.  Many of the things one usually expects were not available or not working.  The Kuerig coffee maker didn't have enough pods for our two day stay.  There were no coffee cups.  We ended up having to buy our own coffee maker and cups and regular coffee.  There was no toaster.  The dishwasher worked intermittently. The kitchen window pane was broken. The air conditioning, a necessity during the Texas summer, struggled to keep the condo cool. There was no dishwashing liquid, dish cloths or dish towels.  There was no ice, ice trays, or icemaker. Most importantly, I initially had difficulty getting into the unit.  I called the number listed on all related emails and was put on hold only to be subsequently told via recording that there was no one to take my call.  I left a message, and no one ever called me back.  Would not stay here again.  Probably would not stay at any Onyx property again.

This host is terrible.  First, my airbnb account was hacked and my reservation was cancelled.  When I went to rebook the same dates and place, it was $800 more - they would not refund.  Second, we had no hot water in one bathroom for 2 days and bugs and there was no response.  Terrible.  Would never stay again...  Airbnb was useless as well.
All was good and went as expected. But photos don't show well the state of bathrooms. They are really old style and almost felt shabby.

If you're looking for a place that's in a location walkable for everything this is it. Even for a deep sleeper though, it's incredibly loud. Can hear people's conversations walking by clear as day. Needed some updates on furniture, the kitchen chairs were falling apart. Was missing a large kitchen trashcan, the only trashcan in the kitchen was a small bathroom one.

The Airbnb location was fantastic, it did smell a little weird inside though.
The listing originally said 4 beds but then when we got there, there were only 3 beds and an air mattress with no extra sheets or a blow up pump.
I asked Ryan about it and he promptly brought over an air pump but no extra sheets. I noticed that he changed the listing as well.

To start, this is on the ground floor with windows on the street level. One of these windows was broken out the night before we arrived, which Ryan did give us a heads up about, however, as we were due to arrive that day, there was nothing we could do without forfeiting most of  our money. So we decided to continue with our trip. We did not feel safe with the boarded up window or the amount of people on the street that would bang on the windows  and yell as they walked by. All night long. The apartment also is not clean. There was old juice/food on the cupboards and splattered on the walls, floors were dirty, etc. I‚Äôm sure one of the upper level rooms would be much better but I would not recommend this one if you have fear for your safety like us or are a light sleeper.

Benjamin was lovely and responsive, but his place was having a bad day when my boyfriend and I stayed there. Some aspects were not clean, which I understand was an exception to the rule.  We lost power on our second day there and headed home early.
No frills, basic room but has everything I needed for some solo travel

If you don't care much about the quality of your accommodations and simply want a convenient place to crash after a night out on Sixth Street, then this is your place. If you expect quality service and amenities, then I'd suggest looking elsewhere. Our group stayed here for nearly two weeks for a long conference at the convention center. On the plus side, the location was very convenient. And to be fair, my bed was comfortable. But our frustrations kept piling up. After we arrived, the remote to the parking garage only worked to get us into the building. But we couldn't get out. I talked with Ryan, who said there was a spare on the wall of the parking garage and we could get batteries to fix it. Alas, no spare. Fortunately a kind neighbor opened the gate for us--otherwise, the five of us would have been stuck inside. We bought the special batteries for the gate (at our expense) but the remote was still broken. We did have a new one when we returned that night. The next morning, as we were eating breakfast, the maid walked into the condo (no knocking. just unlocked the door and came in). She was bewildered that we were there -- and we were bewildered as well -- and wondered if the place had indeed been cleaned before we arrived. While the beds were made, there were dust bunnies and hair in the bathrooms and bedrooms. We told Ryan about our concerns of cleanliness, but he assured us it had been cleaned. In addition, only one of the remotes for the TVs worked -- Ryan said he had just replaced all the batteries the week before. But one didn't even have any batteries (or a battery cover). Two of the metal legs of the spiral staircase loudly vibrated every time the air conditioner came in (which also, to be fair, worked really well). We ended up shimmying the legs with some toothpicks to stop the noise. The kitchen was not very well appointed -- very limited glasses and bowls. The dishwasher was not completely attached to the countertop so every time we opened it, the entire machine dipped forward and threatened to fall out. On our third day, the security system started ringing in the middle of the night (again, a battery issue). And on our fourth day, we started hearing a very high-pitched noise coming from the laundry room. After a few hours of trying to figure out the problem (and even sending Ryan a video with sound of the issue), we finally discovered a smoke alarm sitting on a shelf (again the battery was dead). This was on the Fourth of July and after some texts with Ryan, he asked us not to contact him again. Don't worry. We didn't. The type of service he promises in this ad is not what he delivers. One of my coworkers spent an hour troubleshooting the dryer. Our clothes weren't getting dry after...

The location was great. We experienced it very frustrating to enter the condo. We were given the wrong code so we called the numbers provided for assistance. No response from Ryan until four and a half hours later. I never heard back from the property manager. We ended up calling Airbnb directly and Carlo came through for us. We spent 4 hours trying to move in. We arrived at 4:30 and finally were in by 9 pm. We also wanted to use the pool, but that too had a code to get in which was not provided. One other thing the remotes for the TVs did not have batteries in and no directions how to use the TVs. Besides these issues the
unit had plenty of room to accommodate all 6 of us. Perhaps an in house manual would be helpful to provide detailed information for future renters. I know there was one on line, but did not have everything that we needed!
This place is a HARD pass. Party pad that‚Äôs gross and not maintained. Overpriced with one of the worst hosts I‚Äôve ever encountered.

This isn‚Äôt just a horrible place to stay!  Just needs a little TLC!  Two of the bedding had stains on them. Two of the bedrooms on the outside wall is noisy and you can hear everything. Towels were stained. It wasn‚Äôt dirty or discusting and for the price it was okay.  Host was responsive when told about a door off the hinges in one of the bedrooms. The location is spot on. We enjoyed sitting on the balcony and people watching late night!

The only upside to this apartment is location. It‚Äôs close to everything. Now the downside‚Ä¶the apartment was not cleaned when we arrived, no toilet paper, the beds were not changed, remnants of drugs on a bedside table, closet doors broken, holes in the doors, tons of wall damage, kitchen cabinet hanging off the wall, dried up old rice flung on the kitchen blinds, kitchen trash can is broken, stained dingy furniture, unsafe upstairs railing, and the floors were just so dirty. The host did send someone to come clean immediately when I notified him. For the price we paid on a weekend for this place, it was extremely disappointing and I felt scammed because the photos in the listing are probably 5-7 years old and the place is falling apart. Also, the water temperature while showering was so erratic that you could either have freezing cold or scolding hot at any given moment. So be careful with kids. I am still laughing at the word ‚Äúluxury‚Äù in this listing. Literally nothing in the apartment is luxury except when you step out of the building you can see the 4 seasons hotel down the street which my husband and I laughed and said we should‚Äôve stayed there!

The art is interesting but for a specific taste. There was dust everywhere. This house was completely filthy. The artwork is covered in dust and grime. The bathroom shower was too gross to use. The air vents were covered in dust. There was something very strange/borderline scary in the fridge. The bed sheets were stained and so were the pillows. The towels were stained and unusable. We stayed the first night but could not bring ourselves to sleep there a second night.

During my stay, the kitchen sink was clogged and garbage disposal never worked. They only offered the handyman to come the day before I left on a 11 night stay. The shower light was out when I arrived, they replaced it a few days later but for some reason removed the protection and exposed electrical components in the ceiling. This was a safety hazard I didn't feel they took seriously. There were issues with the microwave that made it difficult to use the light and vent for the stove (as they were controlled and powered by the faulty microwave above the stove). On the day I arrived, various items were missing, which the host did promptly provide once I noted it.
Overall, one issue after another and the host didn't seem to care too much. Eventually, the host just stopped responding to my messages. I got AirBnB involved and received a rather small refund considering how poor the stay was.

I hate writing these sorts of things because I could truly tell the hosts are wonderful people, but the location was absolutely terrible. Keep in mind, we are all from Seattle and are very accustomed to wlaking around day and night and the people/events we see. Anyway, I was with two 25 year old men who did not feel comfortable walking around the neighborhood at night. As a woman, I was very scared walking around the neighborhood WITH a man. It is a couple minute walk away from a main road, where you would totally feel safe/fine to walk around. You can tell the neighborhood is up and coming, but this part was definitely pretty rough. In fact, every single one of our uber drivers mentioned that we shouldn't be walking around the area and that we were just 2 streets away from "the projects". The dogs next door also barked constantly and it was difficult to sleep later than probably 5/6am. There are plenty of homeless people roaming the streets. I know this is a harsh review, but I'm saying these thing to help others. This area is not safe for families, young children, women, and some men even. I'm really sorry to be so harsh. I just need to warn people because I was not properly warned. The location is technically close to downtown, so that was nice.

It is an okay quality house, but has mostly updated things and a nice interior, so it was fine for a rental. The backyard opens up into another person's backyard. The gate would randomly be open as if someone was in our backyard. We even checked the gate to see if it was maybe broken. One room is extremely small. The kitchen is nice and spacious though. Also, the room in the front has a window that can allow anyone to look into the room :(

I hate to write a review that isn‚Äôt stellar, but I have to say that there were some issues with this place that need to be noted‚Ä¶ If this had been a hotel, I would have left it the first night.
First, the place was not clean‚Ä¶ there was black gunk/mold along the edge of the floor by the bathtub ‚Äì so disgusting that I went out and purchased some Tilex spray to clean it myself! Now, this is not from one time of poor cleaning ‚Äì it is from weeks or even months of neglect. The rug in the living room is dirty and matted and needs a good thorough cleaning. And there was half-eaten food in the fridge, which is pretty gross too‚Ä¶
Also, there were a number of things that needed to be repaired‚Ä¶ my son (who is in his late 20‚Äôs) had such a backache from sleeping in the bed in the front room (some of the slats were missing, so it sagged badly), that he got up one night, found a screwdriver, and moved slats from the foot of the bed to the part that supports your torso! Also, the towel rod was broken off the wall in the bathroom (so there was no where to hang your towel out), the door to the laundry was broken, and the yard and the back deck needed to have leaves cleared up so badly, that we couldn‚Äôt use the back deck at all. A day with a handyman and a thorough scrub-down would do this place wonders.
The location was great ‚Äì very close to downtown, and a nice place to walk around during the day (we didn‚Äôt walk at night at all). And the layout of the place was nice. And, the hosts were friendly and helpful via email. If the items were repaired and it was clean, it‚Äôd be a wonderful place to stay!

The house was in a convenient location a few blocks from good restaurants and bars. Street didn‚Äôt have much light/ sidewalks, so could be a bit difficult to walk at night. Plenty of room and a big kitchen.

The location is excellent and wifi was fast, but the apartment wasn't clean and there were insects (dead and alive) inside the house -- spiders, mosquitoes, fruit flies, ladybugs. Seeing the mouse traps in the closet was also off-putting. Despite the amazing location and overall comfortable/modern layout, I would not stay here again.
cant recommend it. place wasn't very clean and alot of stuff needed to be replaced or repaired.

Very spacious and in a great location! We easily walked to food, nightlife, shops, and even yoga classes. We had a great stay. The backyard had great potential but the picnic table and swing seemed a bit run down, also some corners of the home were not super clean. We also encountered a few bugs indoors and got a couple bites most likely from fire ants.
Nicely updated duplex, but smaller than we realized. The WiFi was too slow for basic things like Netflix or FaceTime. Complained about slow WiFi and owner did not resolve during my 4 weeks here.
Tracen's place and his hospitality were second to none. We really enjoyed our time staying at his home.

Before going into the home, I got bitten by mosquitoes on my ankle and finger. The property is surrounded by trees and fallen leaves; a wooden shack and a stone BBQ pitv are outside the cottage. Unfortunately, I didn't stay in the cottage bc the place was not cleaned when I checked in at 3pm. I called 2x and texted the host but she was unresponsive. It was obvious that the place had not been cleaned after the last guest checked out. Dirty dishes in the sink, trash in the kitchen, dirty towels in the bathroom, bed looked like someone just woke up from. I had to contact Airbnb support who was also unable to reach the host. The host later called me 1.5 hours after check-in time to let me know that she was on a flight.
We had a nice time as a family but were disappointed with the poor condition of the home though out compared to to cost for the weekend.   It is defiantly a older house in need of repair.

Expect cockroaches and other insects to be all over the house. In the master bedroom, there is a two inch gap under the door with a rug shoved to try to block bugs coming in. It doesn't work. Great amenities and location, but at the end of the day, it was not worth the amount charged. Hosts were absolutely wonderful until I presented a problem. I was asked to provide what I thought was a fair solution and I did, I received a very rude, belittling, and aggressive response. I still don't understand why they first apologized and asked for a fair solution. I asked for a partial refund and received a rude and aggressive response. I understand the right to disagree. But using CAPS to insinuate yelling and saying NO BUGS on repeat to belittle me like a I'm a child. People think because someone is a stranger, they have the right to treat them however they please. The following is the exact message I received from the hosts Sharon and John:

"Dear Mary, - First, our house is NOT unsanitary. - Professionally cleaned before /after each guest. - Second, you did not report any problems until AFTER you left. - Day 3, you reported everything fine. "We are all good!... my friend coming for afternoon." (your text attached) - You stayed until 3 pm day before your 11 am checkout. From Your first ... 1. You woke up day 3 with bites on feet, below knees. 2. No one else in house had bites. 3. Your attached photo shows you wearing shorts. 4. All other of your group having great time, not wanting to leave. Please note ... 1. Preceding Guests found NO BUGS, very happy, want to return. (see review) 2. Cleaning staff found NO BUGS before or after your stay. 3. Sharon pulled all bedding, mattresses, thoroughly inspected, found NO BUGS. She further walked all parts of house in bare feet, found NO BUGS. 4. Professional exterminator had recently treated house (April 29th - scheduled treatment). 5. Exterminator inspected house immediately after your visit, found NO BUGS. 6. Subsequent guests beginning 1 day after your stay found NO BUGS. It is clear that bites did NOT come from bugs in our house - you would have been bitten on first day. Your bites likely CHIGGERS, a problem this time of year if hiking / walking in shorts, sandals. I am very sorry that you suffered insect bites and hope you recover soon but they were NOT from our house and so no refund is due."

The ceilings are very lows and you‚Äôll find yourself hitting your head frequently. It is serviceable but not comfortable. I don‚Äôt think it was worth what I paid.  On the plus side, the host is very communicative.

I experienced Paprika's hospitality as inconsiderate and quarrelsome.

Paprika scheduled someone to spray for roaches and ants on New Year's Eve. She gave me options to: to let them in, or she would give them the door code. She wouldn't be there. I declined with a hard no.

At checkin, she texted new rules about guests, different than the listing. I had to explain myself to her that I didn't have or want overnight guests.

Paprika came to the door at 9:30p, visibly angry about parking, accusing me of having guests, and demanding I explain myself to her anger. I had to close the door in her face.

I heard a double-tap of gunshots in bed late one night. A house on the corner deals to drive-ups. Homeless camps are throughout the nearby parks. I got spare-changed at the local businesses. Tent cities. Street prostitutes. Boarded up businesses. "Defund the police" ruined this neighborhood and financial speculators like Paprika, and they hate AirBnb guests for it.
Benjamin was very communicative with me throughout the booking process.  I have nothing but good things to say about his spot.  Very centrally located as well.
