Look no further. Great place to stay in Austin and a lot of privacy.

Sehr sch√∂ne Unterkunft. Alles ist super sauber gewesen und die Lage ist sehr gut. Wir haben uns sicher gef√ºhlt. Das Apartment ist sehr sch√∂n gestaltet und gut eingerichtet. Es hat uns an nichts gefehlt. Wir w√ºrden die Unterkunft von Ben definitiv weiterempfehlen.
Couldn't have been better!

Although Scott is nice, the too many rules, the gloom of the house, and my empty and uncomfortable room prevented me too enjoy my stay. The kitchen lack many things, like proper cookware, microwave ... The bedroom was so gloomy, very unpractical. The bed gave me back pains, as well as the lack of anything looking like a desk or a clean chair in the bedroom.

Don't stay here! The host was intentionally misleading about the place which lead to a very uncomfortable stay.

Plus, the room was full of the host's belongings, cleaning before arrival was not done very well, and the room had an odd smell that I could not get rid of despite airing the room out every day.

The host, Scott, seriously misrepresented what the living situation would be in the listing. He didn't mention that he would be sleeping in the main room of the house while I was there, meaning that I could only enter and exit through a back door, and could not use the common space for much of my stay.

The house has two bedrooms, two bathrooms and common one-room living / dining / kitchen / entry area.¬†

For the first few days the host was gone (his roommate met me initially and gave me keys), and the common area was accessible at all times, as expected. On the 4th day of the booking the host sent me a message announcing that he would be returning to the house, and staying in the living room, and telling me that I must keep out of the main for about half of each day to avoid disturbing him.

This was the first time he mentioned that he would be sleeping in the living room, that I would have limited access to the common room, or that I would need to use the back door.

As this stay was during an enormous festival (SXSW) and every hotel in the city was both expensive and fully booked, asking for a refund or moving to a different space were not viable options. This lead to an uncomfortable remainder of my stay (about another week) during which I felt trapped.

In discussing the situation, the host admitted that the post was misleading.

La casa de Diana y Paul es fant√°stica, y se han esmerado en hacer la estad√≠a lo m√°s amena y c√≥moda posible. La limpieza es impecable tanto en la rec√°mara como en el ba√±o, los cuales est√°n bien surtidos de muchos detalles que algunas veces pasamos por alto (utensilios de ba√±o, refrigerios, cargador de tel√©fono), pero que Diana y Paul han tenido en consideraci√≥n, en especial si olvidas algo a la hora de empacar. La comunicaci√≥n con ellos tambi√©n es muy clara y r√°pida. Diana y Paul son una pareja muy amable y sin duda se han esmerado en dar el extra para que te sientas como en casa. No dudar√≠a en hospedarme de nuevo cuando regrese a Austin.

Everything as expected!

Only note- the internet was not the strongest and has been brought to Rita‚Äôs attention. Be cautious if you are remotely working from the Airbnb.

The house was pristine and so welcoming! No detail was overlooked and it would have been a perfect stay even if the cottage itself wasn't stunningly beautiful. The hard wood interior and tasteful decor made it feel luxurious and cozy. My boyfriend and I couldn't have been happier there.

Great and cool little place! Recommend staying there!

Just FYI, the hot shower water didn‚Äôt last and a lamp didn‚Äôt work (it was in an important location but really not a huge deal). The host replaced the lamp quickly so that was great.

What disappointed me was that I shared the issues with the hot water in the shower not working long at all (2-3 min) but the hosts response showed no concern or remorse over the issue. A cold shower is one of the worst experiences one could pay for!

Not life changing by any means but it was disappointing bc I expected more from Airbnb Plus.

Still 5 stars though bc overall he was helpful and helped me get the charger I left after I checked out.
Bad ass place

Es tracta d'un petit estudi al nord de la zona universit√†ria d'Austin, uns 15/20 min en cotxe al nord de downtown. La zona √©s molt tranquila, residencial. A walking distance no hi ha molta cosa, per√≤ s√≠ algun establiment per comprar, alguns restaurants, etc.
L'estudi en s√≠ √©s molt maco. D'un sol espai (menys el lavabo), totalment obert a l'exterior, molt llumin√≥s, petit per√≤ amb tot el necessari. T√© un porx molt c√≤mode on prendre el sol o la fresca i est√† suficientment separat de la casa principal. T√© totes les necessitats de cuina, rentadora, etc cobertes. Ann va respondre r√†pid, i el check in/out no calen la seva pres√®ncia. En resum, molt recomenable.

Allting fungerade smidigt med b√•de in- och utcheckning. Omr√•det √§r fint och lugnt. N√§ra att promenera till downtown och tipsen i infoh√§ftet rekommenderas varmt (s√§rskilt Nau's). Notera bara att det √§r en ordentlig stege upp till sovloftet. Inga problem om man som vi √§r unga och friska men kanske inget f√∂r den med kn√§problem. Snabba svar fr√•n Sean varje g√•ng vi hade en fr√•ga!

The Tiny House is all as advertised. No frills place to crash in a nice neighborhood. A decent amount of places to eat a very short walk up the street, and a longer walk will bring you to West 6th and plenty more choices.
Was a really pretty place. Never saw the hosts once, which didn't bother me but I know that might bother some people.

This tiny house is pretty cute. As tiny houses go, it's not my favorite design but it works well for two people. I wouldn't recommend it for more than that, if you fold out the couch bed you wouldn't have anywhere to keep your bags or to walk. The ladder to the loft is also on the side where the roof is low, so wouldn't recommend this for anyone that is uncoordinated or you may have trouble getting in and out of the loft.

There were some minor maintenance issues, like mold in the AC unit and bike grips that were so old and melted they were sticky and left residue on your hands. If it wasn't for these things, would have been 4 stars. The location is really nice, close to downtown but just far enough that it's quiet at night.
I don't envy the man that tries to get into the loft bed after a few drinks. Not an easy ascent and watch that you don't bump your head!

Not as roomy as the pictures imply. The ‚Äúfold out bed‚Äù wasn‚Äôt an option since one half of it was broken.  Maybe okay  for young people willing to ‚Äúrough it‚Äù but not at all comfortable for an older couple.
A good tiny house experience and location to restaurants and downtown Austin isn‚Äôt bad.

Un vecindario hermoso, bien ubicado y tranquilo. La casa queda al lado de la autopista por lo que afuera hay un poco de ruido, pero adentro es muy silencioso.
La casa es c√≥moda, muy limpia y con todo en muy buen estado.
Absolutamente recomendable y regresar√≠a sin dudarlo para mi pr√≥xima estadia en Austin.

We had a decent 5 week long stay at Christina‚Äôs bnb. It is located in a nice neighborhood, only a few minutes away from great restaurants and the river. There were many issues we encountered during our stay. Upon arrival there was an ant problem, resulting in multiple dead ants falling from the ceiling for the first few weeks of our stay. Christina knew about the ant problem, assumed it was resolved and did not inform of us of this issue prior to our arrival. Along with that, there were problems with the hot water heater. We had two days of cold showers. Including one night when the water did not stop running (Christina reimbursed us for that night). When it comes to the upkeep of the property, the front gate would not close (had to use our own bungee cord to keep it shut) and the bathroom door did not fully close. Christina was very responsive to these issues and promptly contacted plumbers and fumigators. Christina denied our request for a partial reimbursement (beyond the night when the water from the shower ran all night). Our conclusion is that this is a run down house that is covered with a fresh coat of paint. I would not recommend this stay to a friend.

Great location to walk places BUT it is advertised as a 2 bedroom and the 2nd ‚Äúroom‚Äù is a wall they threw up with no ceiling and a curtain in the living room. Made for an awkward conversation when we got to the Airbnb of who gets the real room when we split it the same. Couldn‚Äôt be out in the living room/kitchen without trying not to make noise and wake people sleeping in the ‚Äúroom‚Äù up.

Good apartment for short term but was not a great week-long option for 2 people because one ‚Äúbedroom‚Äù has no door and is only blocked by a curtain. This was not clearly laid out in the description or photos.
The communication was poor and slow.  It took way to long to address our issues, particularly with the WiFi and the code to the house.  Not a premium guest experience from that standpoint.

Don‚Äôt rent this house, they have had years to fix the broken front door. We couldn‚Äôt use the key the entire visit and the garage door needs two controlling units to use it. They of course only have one. They charge a $250 cleaning fee and I‚Äôve sent them pictures of a very unclean house.  Try planning a very busy trip when you can‚Äôt use any door in the house when everyone is coming and going and you only have 1 garage door clicker. It was a nightmare

A good location and enough beds for all! We were a bit disappointed in the cleanliness. The sheets were stained and there were no mattress pads on any of the beds. Additionally the shower curtain in the upstairs bathroom was gross and moldy. We had 8 people there and while it fit us all it is not an open kitchen/ dining concept so it feel a little more congested when hanging out. Directions were accurate and host was accessible.

The neighborhood and location are wonderful, the backyard is fabulous (except for a broken step that was dangerous) and the house is spacious and clean. However, it should not be advertised to sleep five unless you tell your guests what that fifth bed is going to be: it is a Coleman cot with a thin foam pad and it is not suitable for an adult to have a decent night's sleep. The house was not ready at 3:00 and the cleaning people said they needed yet another hour at 5:30. There was no soap in the bathroom.
The backyard stone staircase had several stone pieces shoved back into place but quickly came apart when walked upon and is dangerous. A small but convenient request is that you provide salt and pepper in the kitchen.

The neighborhood is inviting and near excellent restaurants; this AirBnB is not upscale but down-home (plastic plates, micro-fiber sheets, hard bed). It really is like staying with granny except it has a 55"+ TV and an alarm system.

The washer is broken despite being listed. The slate steps on the back porch dangerously broken. The response of the landlord to general maintenance (ants, spiders, roaches), yard, cleaning if you stay for more than a short stay is poor. The unsecured metal grates to keep animals out from under the house are lying in the yard so the feral cats are under there. When the yard people do come, it will be in the middle of your Sunday nap.

The owner was responsive to the broken toilet. He was dangerously unresponsive to our lock-out, allowing the locksmith to leave the door able to be opened with a screwdriver overnight. Then he didn't get repairs started until I called after 5PM the next day - he finally came after 11PM and was there until 1AM putting on a new deadbolt. Good thing this was not our vacation or we would have spent two nights trying to get back in the house (no one checked the back door electronic lock for batteries before we moved in - yet another maintenance issue) and getting a new lock to secure the place.

140 days there. Mostly disappointing.

Ein sch√∂nes Wochenende in Austin. Ordentliche Unterkunft mit tollen Restaurants in der N√§he. Ausgehmeile ca 25 min zu Fu√ü. Zum Capitol l√§uft man 50 min. Es stehen aber √ºberall E-Roller zur Verf√ºgung die man nutzen kann.
Parkplatz direkt vorm Haus. Check in war sehr einfach und unkompliziert. Die Kommunikation einwandfrei und sehr nett. Haben morgens die Unterkunft gebucht und konnten sogar schon um 13 Uhr einchecken. Wir durften die Waschmaschine nutzen und Kaffee und Tee war auch da! Gerne wieder :)

Best place to stay in Austin! Couldn't recommend this spot more highly. I came with my colleagues for what could have been a fairly stressful work trip. Having the house to come back to and unwind made an enormous difference.

Overall we had a great 4 day weekend in Austin. Justin and Becca's place was exactly as pictured meaning spacious with pretty/eclectic decoration. The location was very accessible to all Austin attractions and was very clean.
I hate to mention negatives but there were a few:
1. We had trouble with hot water throughout our stay which our hosts tried to fix but it was never perfect.
2. No dishwasher or microwave in kitchen.
3. Coffee maker wasn't working the first morning but that negative was quickly turned into a positive with delivery of a new machine that evening.

House is very much as pictured. It is located in an up and coming area so the house next door is gorgeous and the one on the other side looks abandoned. Dont let that scare you. During the day it is walkable but I would definitely say to uber at night. The neighbors were a bit loud and the back bedroom is right against their backyard. That bedroom has an window air conditioner so running that helped block the noise. There are also multiple stray cats that scream on the upstairs patio at night. That could be an issue for light sleepers. The house served its purpose for the 7 girls in my group.
There is no more perfect or thoughtfully appointed escape and there are not more wondrous hosts in all the world. Don‚Äôt miss the chance to stay here!!!

As all the other reviews have already said, this place was perfect. It had all of the little touches that make it unique and feel more like a hone instead of a hotel room. Unfortunately I was only there one night but I will be coming back on future trips to Austin. Couldn't recommend this place more.

This flat is clearly recently constructed but was a little lacking in my opinion. The first major issue we had is the location. Given the Austin heat in the summer, this spot is not well situated to walk anywhere. If you do not have a car, I don't recommend staying here as it is a very far walk to get to the major tourist spots and bars/restaurants of Austin. Also, for the price we were disappointed with some of the details. For example, the kitchen is separate, not part of the unit, so you have to walk outside to access. Also 2 of the 7 windows had folded paper window coverings that can't be opened (because they're paper) and 3 of the windows have no window coverings at all. The window situation makes it difficult to sleep in past 7am as the room starts getting light at sunrise.

Nous avons s√©journer 2 nuits √† Austin. Le logement est tr√®s bien, tr√®s confortable. L'h√¥te a penser √† tout... vraiment. Attention il faut la voiture pour se d√©placer dans Austin.
Dommage que la terrasse commune ne soit pas au niveau du logement.

Wir hatten einen tollen Aufenthalt, alles hat unseren Erwartungen entsprochen.
Sauberes und liebevoll eingerichtete kleine Wohnung.
Die Kommunikation vor unserem Aufenthalt war auch freundlich und unkompliziert.

Pros: Unbeatable central location, walkable to everything including restaurants, bars, hotels, convention center. Comfortable beds, sheets. Parking spot.

Cons: Ants in bathroom. Sheets wrong size for the bed and kept slipping off. AC thermostat inaccurate and AC was not strong enough to cool unit. Unit is dark without much light. WiFi provided by condominium Corp slow and difficult to connect to. Expensive relative to hotels in area.

I requested an early check in and was told that was fine. I got to the unit to check in and my code did not work until after the original check in time. I called the host and he never answered or returned my call. I even left a voicemail. The hot water heater shut off two separate times during our stay so we had to take cold showers. Overall, the unit was what we needed for the weekend but I was expecting much more for how much I paid. The unit itself needs maintenance. The carpet in one of the bedrooms was really dirty and multiple light bulbs were out.
We did not enjoy our stay. The apartment needs a good cleaning and update. The kitchen stove did not work and kitchen did not have many utensils. The building is mostly empty and is showing it's age.

Unfortunately this stay was disappointing. We had a few problems when we checked into the appartment. We were desperately trying to get hold of the host. The telephone numbers that he provided seem to be an office numbers, no reply in the evening. Left him several messages on the phone, sent messages via Airbnb, asking for help ASAP. He failed to get back until the next day. For $400 / night I would expect a more responsive host.
Most disappointing.

We found Ryan‚Äôs place to be adequate for our stay in Austin.  The pluses: walking distance to great bars and restaurants or if you‚Äôre at the convention center.  There is a Starbucks across the street There are 2 bathrooms which is ideal for couples. The minuses: The beds are lumpy. We could not get 2/3 of the tvs to work but it wasn‚Äôt important enough to us to contact Ryan. The walls, windows and floors are all very thin and you can easily hear conversations outdoors when inside. The carpeted bedroom is absolutely nasty. The carpet is so gross and the baseboards and trim looked like they haven‚Äôt been cleaned in years. Given how many brand new hotels are close by in the same vicinity, I personally would not stay here again.

This place is dripping with character and eclectic decoration. Short walk from the Convention Center was a plus. The private patio area comes complete with dart-board. I recommend it if you're not overly concerned with being right in the thick of things.

One caveat: The bedroom is in a loft with steep stairs. Fine for me, but guests with limited mobility should probably look elsewhere.

This review is for the room and house, not Chalu. I had to cancel and leave the room earlier than I was supposed to because there was a mold/mildew smell in the room that would not go away no matter how much air freshener I sprayed. Also, the mattress is very sunken in in the middle and was hard for me to sleep on. It's not a flat mattress, it's a very old mattress that should really be thrown away.
I was glad that Chalu refunded some of my money for the rest of the days I had left, but I wish I had known about these major issues before I reserved the room, as I would not stay in this kind of place. There were other issues such as the towels all smelled dirty, even the clean ones, they were very old towels.
i met Chalu once and she seemed friendly. She does not live at this house and the pictures on Air Bnb are older, because the house is dark and dingy, not like in the picture. There were large black flies in the house flying around because nobody took out the kitchen or bathroom garbage the whole time I was there, and it was overflowing. One day someone put the kitchen garbage on the front porch and left it there overnight, then some animals tore it open and got trash all over the front porch walkway to the door.
This is an honest feedback of what happened and this is the first negative review I have had to leave on Air Bnb. I hate to leave a negative review but would want people to know what they are getting themselves in to with this particular property/room.

Chalu was very hospitable and quick to respond. I checked into a terrible Airbnb and immediately left and rebooked here. She responded immediately and I was out of that place and into this clean and convenient place in no time.
La campagne √† la ville. L‚Äôaccueil est tr√®s chaleureux. La maison est tr√®s propre, tout √©quip√©e. Parfait pour se reposer. Merci Mari.

My husband and I were supposed to stay at Mari and Danny‚Äôs for Austin City Limits. Unfortunately, my husband suffered a broken bone in a bicycle accident and we were forced to cancel our trip the day-of. Mari and Danny were incredibly gracious and understanding. We hope to be able to stay with them in the future.

Jon ist super nett und wir haben uns sehr willkommen gef√ºhlt. Das Cottage fanden wir so toll, dass wir am liebsten dageblieben w√§ren.  Die Einrichtung ist sehr sch√∂n und alles war sehr sauber. Au√üerdem hat Jon sich sehr viele Gedanken gemacht, was Reisende ben√∂tigen k√∂nnten: es gab Lebensmittel wie Kaffee und Brot und die neueste Ausgabe des Austin Chronicle lag auch f√ºr uns bereit. Und das Ganze ist in einer sehr tollen Gegend von Austin. In Laufn√§he gibt es Bars, Restaurants und nette L√§den zum Bummeln. Wenn wir nochmal nach Austin kommen, wollen wir auf jeden Fall wieder bei Jon wohnen!

Jon‚Äôs place is quaint, private and very well located. Jon is an attentive host who does not skimp on pleasant amenities.
Parking and check-in are a breeze!

J'ai pass√© un agr√©able s√©jour chez Jaquelyn et Jacob. J'√©tais √† Austin pour une conf√©rence au Convention center et leur logement est tr√®s bien situ√©, √† ~ 15 min √† pied, dans un quartier r√©sidentiel et calme. Ils √©taient absent le long de mon s√©jour mais avaient tr√®s bien pr√©par√© mon arriv√©e en laissant dans la chambre tout ce dont j'avais besoin. C'est une maison cosy, fid√®le √† la description.
Great Space that's close enough to everything to be convenient, but not so close that you have to be in craziness all the time!
Exactly what we were looking for and got exactly what we were expecting. No complaints! Enjoyed our stay in Austin.

On March 20, when booking my airbnb, I made an accident and clicked "March 20" instead of "April 20" for my booking. I realized right away and called Airbnb to get it fixed. Ryan refused to accept my cancellation and forced me to pay anyway. Incredibly disappointing.

We were very disappointed with the unit, especially given how expensive it was. The photos make it look large, but the unit is quite small. Although the location is very good, the building is not nice and you have to walk up 2 flights of stairs to get to the unit.

The biggest issues were that the entire time we were there (4 nights), there was no working WIFI. The host said they share two WIFI hotspots with 121 units, which might explain why it was so slow as to be completely unusable, though half the time the hotspots were not even visible. We had to go to Starbucks to use WIFI every day. The second major issue is that the Air conditioning unit in the apartment is not strong enough to cool the apartment. In the bedrooms and the kitchen, the temperature ranged from 74 to 77, even though the AC was set to 65. So we didn't sleep well. Finally, the towel in one of the bedroom was stained brown and should never have been left for us to use and one of our guests fell through the bed in the middle of the night because some of the wood slats under the bed were missing and others were not aligned and none of them were screwed in.

We reported the issues with the WIFI and the temperature every day, and neither was resolved. Despite our discomfort the entire week and the lack of WIFI the entire week, the host only offered us $50 refund on a $1500 rental, which was insulting. We would have paid less and been much happier in a hotel.
Wifi was a big problem. Would work for a minute then crash. Ended up affecting what we were in town for as people would have to leave to use nearby starbucks for meetings and what not.
Unit quality was markedly different than the pictures in the listing.  The location was nice but everything else was disappointing.
Location was great but thats about it. Dirty, outdated and misleading from the pictures in the ads.

Photos are misleading. The difference between the photos and reality is almost unbelievable. My coworkers thought we were at the wrong condo. In real life it‚Äôs pretty dark and dingy. Seems like the linens may not have been changed as we found hair in multiple beds and old medicine in multiple rooms. Convenience/location is incredible, only a block from the convention center.

The location is perfect, but the photos are misleading to what you'll walk in to. You can tell there has been plenty of use in the suite, but the price was good for a large group of 8 ($100 a head/night). We caught unfortunate timing with spray paint going over a spot where a mirror previously was, but the smell was gone by the end of the weekend. Overall, you will accommodate a large group there with plenty of beds.

Pictures are pretty misleading from what‚Äôs posted. Seems like the place is in need of some updating and repairs. Stains located on the bed frames, holes in walls, carpets torn up, wood flooring heavily scratched, inside cabinets are heavily damaged and gross, one wall was literally spray painted and looks really bad.

The host was fantastic and was very responsive, the actual places just needs numerous repairs and updating.

Not what's pictured. Back yard is a mess. Kinda dirty. Bring your own towels cause theirs are hard as a rock. No drawers to put clothes cause they are full of junk. Only tv is in a bedroom. Definitely do not use the so called cleaning process as advertised by Airbnb cause it's filthy.

The neighborhood is adorable and the home is conveniently located.
The smallest bedroom has no bedside tables or lamps, which was fairly inconvenient.
The home was neat but not clean - carpets were not vacuumed, bathroom trash not emptied, duvet covers were dirty, etc.
From other reviews it seems that this was an anomaly, maybe we arrived on a date where they didn't have much time to prepare for us.

Great location, stylish furniture, but unfortunately it seems that it used to be a nicer place than it is now. We had cleanliness issues, stained linens, broken furniture including broken coffee table (we told the host, she said she was aware but we were not warned in advance). Poor quality dining room chairs in bad repair, our nephew sat in one that was broken and he fell. Carpet is worn and had a large hole.

I debated leaving this review but in the end felt I should share our family‚Äôs experience. Our son started sneezing and having allergy issues the first night and then had an asthma attack in the middle of the second night. We choose to check out a day early and drive home due to this. (His asthma has been previously well controlled for months.)

This is supposed to be an airbnb plus.

Pros:
- cute decorations
- location has several dining options with in walking distance or short driving distance
- neighbor felt safe to walk in
- easy check in/ out

Cons:
- unclean, in this new ‚Äúcovid era‚Äù cleanliness is extremely important, this place was not up to par‚Ä¶baseboards all had dirt, lint and hair. Dirty walls and doors with finger and hand prints, stains on the throw blankets and couch. I took pictures and sent to host.
- the carpet smelled awful and was torn with a big hole, pictures sent to host
- the whole hose smelled like fish and mold, even with the air purifier running
- there were holes in every bathroom where towel bars/hooks were either removed or torn down, missing paint and missing door handles
- the master sink did not drain because the drain was broken
- every single bar stool was lose or almost broken we did not even sit on them for fear of breaking completely
- the ac upstairs did not circulate air, there are no ceiling fans to help either, there was a significant temperature difference between down stairs vs upstairs and when we turned the temp down and called host she said the city of austin was regulating electricity (which was out of her control) and we couldn‚Äôt turn it down past 72.
- there is a lot of construction in the neighborhood for new buildings and businesses

In the end I let her know about everything privately. She stated no one had complained before (which is incorrect based on other reviews) and she stated she would look into it all but told me we ‚Äúover reacted to leaving early and that she had been extremely accommodating‚Äù. WE DID NOT ASK HER FOR A SINGLE THING so her comment really upset me especially when we had to watch my son STRUGGLE TO BREATH because of her house.

I checked out of the airbnb app early so if she wanted to rent it out she could, we get it, its her business, but we never asked for any money back and we don‚Äôt intend to. However in the end her reaction and reply to our concerns felt rude and uncaring. I do think her house can be great, if she finds a better cleaning crew and fixes a lot of the issues.

Great stay overall! The place had a couple small quirks, but nothing that was a big bother. The main thing I wish I had known is that the tv is mounted in the living room and the futon is SO uncomfortable to sit on, I would have definitely rather brought my laptop to watch Netflix in bed.

Meredith and Jason were fantastic hosts, but know that parking is the alley and they can‚Äôt control who blocks it or when.
First, there were ants all over the side table, kitchen counter and sink from day one. Second, there were left over dirty spoons in the sink. Third, there were- what appeared to be- pubic hairs, on the lid and seat of the comode. The bed smelled of stale sweat on night one, which was awful so I slept on top of the covers- but still stripped the bed as per the instructions. The AC should come with a warning- it was so LOUD that I couldn‚Äôt sleep when it was on so I was sweating all night or freezing and being kept up by the noise, as instructions were left not to touch the settings. The grey door covering fell on me 2 times when I tried using it and eventually fell off all together. Lastly, the night that there was rain, water leaked from the roof onto the bed and into my shoes that I had set out. It was quite a rough time...

When we arrived, the place looked untouched by a cleaning lady. There was dust on most of the furniture and smudged handprints across the ceiling and glass windows of the camper. The air conditioning was not working, even after leaving it on for hours. 100¬∞ weather in the middle of a pandemic, the hosts were awful at any sort of communication. They didn‚Äôt get back to me about the camper being hot until 3-4hrs later. They weren‚Äôt helpful with providing any other accommodations, and instead, suggested we tried fixing it ourselves or cancel the booking to receive a refund. By this time, it was already midnight and it was difficult to find any other Airbnb, so we had to get a hotel. My group and I were very excited to stay here, but that went down hill fast.
Cool, off the beaten track locale.
Beautiful place, so sad I couldn't stay longer!! Hope to visit again soon!
Marcella refused to cancel and refund my reservation when I was unable to travel due to coronavirus. So disappointing that the host valued money over health and safety.
Very clean inside but outside was messy, dirty.

The stay at Marcella‚Äôs was a mixed bag. Pros - the animals were super friendly (especially Reggie!), the cottage is conveniently located, so it was easy to get around, and the backyard was cozy. Cons - the cottage itself was not super clean, the bed was uncomfortable, and communication with the host was not the best. I messaged Marcella 3 weeks before our booked date, asking about the possibility of a refund because my boyfriend and I were not sure we would continue our trip to Texas due to the lift on the mask mandate. She never responded to that message and only answered after telling her we decided to go ahead with our trip. Overall, we did not get the Superhost experience we were expecting.
Very cute place to stay! Only issue we had was waking up with bug bites all over us. My bf had it worse with them all over his legs & arms. Was a real shame.
Beautiful house for vacation. But the night time we did not feel easy for driving in or out this place.

* In short: worst housing experience of our lives, ever. We didn‚Äôt sleep a wink. We left after just one day, thanks to Airbnb HQ. The owners are nice people and their daughter is adorable, but I do not feel they should be leasing this place in its current condition as marketed. *

My mom and I are both professional landlords. We didn‚Äôt expect luxury or frills. But we expected a place that met the bar of the description and photos, and a host who took tangible pride in the property.

Key issues encountered:
- Photos do not capture current property condition whatsoever, and appear to be digitally blurred/masked to look nice. House interior had exceptional deferred maintenance and felt to be in extremely poor condition relative to asking price.

- All bedroom windows appeared inoperable (painted shut) - I couldn‚Äôt open a single one - unsafe in fire, probably a code violation. Air conditioning thermostat didn‚Äôt work, so house was scorching overnight.

- Safety: A big stone in the front porch steps is broken off. We did not see any working porch lighting. My mom nearly slipped twice in the tub (no safety mat or anything).

- Sanitation: Dirty oven and fridge (containing someone else‚Äôs food). Bathroom sink filter was filthy and blocked the drain. Cockroach ran around my bedroom at night (uncorrected rear exterior door threshold gap is excessive, enough for creatures to easily walk in). My mother was constantly itching all night.

- Noise: Airplanes going by until midnight, resuming 05:00. Loud music from nearly drivers all night, easily every 15 minutes.

- Neighborhood: Low-income neighborhood with minimal-to-no signs of visible gentification. When we came, there were piles of literal garbage on everyone‚Äôs yards. Not exactly a nice place to walk around. (Hosts were mostly upfront about this by private message, and we were peachy with that.)

As a landlord, I know things are never perfect. While the host was outwardly nice, he didn't seem to get airbnb hosts have material and specific responsibilities towards guests.

- When my mom pointed out move-in cleanliness issues, he did not even enter the property to inspect or correct.

- When we e-mailed major concerns at 2:30 AM and several times throughout the weekday morning, we did not hear anything until literally 12:05 PM.

- When we decided we were moving out and wanted a refund for remaining days, he felt it was unfair that we held his family financially accountable, asserting that nothing is ‚Äúbroken‚Äù or ‚Äúunsafe‚Äù, that we were expecting a ‚Äúmanicured‚Äù home, and the real issue apparently was with us: he requires tenants who are ‚Äúunfussy‚Äù. (!)

- After this experience, we also received a request by text message to not leave them a review ‚Äúand certainly not an unfavorable one‚Äù.

Considering staying here still? Demand precise status updates on above issues, and insist on unblurred, current photos. Otherwise, avoid the risk ‚Äî this nightmare utterly ruined the first two days of our vacation.

let's start with the accuracy of the pictures, not a single picture is a current representation of how the home looks. The shower has no curtain and the entire bathroom is wet when you take a shower.  the bathroom was never properly cleaned.  the 2nd "bed" is an air mattress not a bed, impossible to sleep on for a good night's sleep.  there are roaches in the kitchen, we spotted 2.....in 12 years of using Airbnb this was the worst experience yet

It is a great place in an amazing area, but the washer/dryer combo takes 4 hours to complete, and it doesn't come out dry. This doesn't necessarily make the quality of the place worse, but factor in the price of using the laundromat into your stay.
Nice setup and not far from great places in Austin.

AustiniteB is a very quiet and private unit. The unit was very clean, fully stocked with kitchen, bath & bed room needs and the decor is pure Austin.

Jay was very attentive/responsive to anything I would need...which was not much..

I loved my month long stay here, I was sad to have to leave. I‚Äôll be back!

Pros: Clean, private and mostly quiet location close to public transportation and major sites. Jay had the lights on and some chilled wine waiting when my check in was delayed which was appreciated.
Cons: Poor communication regarding hot tub being broken, contractors needing access to the space during my stay, and slow response to getting check in procedures. However, I was partially refunded for my troubles.
Overall, would book again if the hot tub works next time.

Nice residential location. Helpful and quick communication.  The place (perhaps temporarily) had poor air quality/ventilation inside.  For those sensitive to respiratory irritation, I would double check before booking.

Charmante maison dans un quartier r√©sidentiel est tr√®s agr√©able, √† deux pas de tout √† Austin, commerces, bars, restaurants, rien ne manquait !
La maison est entour√©e de v√©g√©tation, d‚Äôun calme absolu et tr√®s confortable.
Le petit plus, le bo√Ætier Apple TV, id√©al pour regarder les photos de la journ√©e en famille le soir sur grand √©cran.
Niveau propret√© rien √† dire, tout √©tait absolument nickel.
Il y a un petit parking priv√©, id√©al pour pour garer simplement son v√©hicule, et d√©charger ses bagages.
Nous y reviendrions avec plaisir !

We booked this AirBnB in Feb for a stay from April 23-26. Found out the morning we were supposed to leave that this unit hadn‚Äôt been rented for a year and a half and we had to scramble to find a new place last min to save our vacation. We had already paid for the full listing too...very unfortunate and disappointing.

Die Ankunft war problemlos und wir hatten den ganzen Aufenthalt √ºber Kontakt mit Jenny. Sie hatte eine gute Mappe vorbereitet mit Informationen √ºber die Wohnung und Tipps √ºber Austin, zum Essen gehen usw. Au√üerdem gibt sie jederzeit noch weitere Tipps, sie ist wirklich eine ausgezeichnete Gastgeberin!
Die Wohnung liegt in einer netten Wohngegend, aber es gibt auch viele tolle Restaurants, Kneipen und Bars um die Ecke bzw. in fu√ül√§ufiger Entfernung. Die ber√ºhmte 6th Street ist nicht weit, sowie ein riesengro√üer Whole Foods Market.
Wir haben uns extrem wohlgef√ºhlt! Mein Mann und ich haben schon einige AirBnb-Erfahrungen gemacht und wir haben selten eine so sch√∂ne und geschmackvoll ausgestattete Wohnung erlebt. Eher reduziert eingerichtet, aber wirklich ganz toll und mit Liebe zum Detail. Und die B√∂den! Sch√∂ne Fliesen in Bad und K√ºche und ein ganz toller Holzfu√üboden in Wohn- und Schlafzimmer. Eine ganze Wohnung ohne den in den USA leider √ºblichen Teppich! Wir waren wirklich im siebten Himmel! Es war auch alles sehr sauber.
Das einzigste, was ich vielleicht ein wenig vermisst habe, war ein weiterer Spiegel.
Wir w√ºrden definitiv sehr gerne wiederkommen!

Sch√∂nes,gro√ües Apartment in guter Lage. Div. Restaurants zu Fuss (10 Minuten) erreichbar, ein Whole Foods Supermarkt ist 3 Minuten mit dem Auto entfernt. Auch die 6th Street+ Rainey Street sind nur 5-10 Minuten mit dem Auto entfernt .
Das Apartment hat alles was man ben√∂tigt. Es liegt in einem sehr ruhigen Wohngebiet.
Jenny ist sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit. Toll !
Alles zusammen ist sehr empfehlenswert.

If you are not familiar with Austin, let me assure you this is a prime location. I lived in the city for years and knew exactly the area I wanted to be in while visiting. Austin is known for bad traffic, so once I arrived, I parked right in font of the house, put a parking tag in my window and din't have to get back into my car until I left. There is so much to do within walking and biking distance from this place. I would defiantly stay here again .
As described.  No issues.  Price was a bit high, but not high enough to stop us from booking.

It's probably my fault for choosing to stay in a trailer.  It's very bare bones.  There is also a cat there that was constantly trying to eat my food, enter the shed, enter the bathroom shed with me..  I wouldn't do it again.  The place is clean and it has running water and a toilet in a shed.  I also liked the mini kitchen.  It's just not for me.  Again, probably my fault.  I got caught up, I think, in the novelty and ignored the reality
The east side of Austin is in major disrepair for worned do not rent her if you don't like being robbed from
Cute and highly instagrammable little camper for a ‚Äúweird‚Äù Austin experience but not the most comfortable stay.
Very nice place, but was unable to stay due to family emergency. We left right after check-in.

An outdated listing led us to believe that there were bikes available and gave us the wrong code for the key box. The neighbors felt comfortable using our shower and Angel did not respond when we confronted her about this. The camper did not lock well and was missing keys when we arrived. Overall the experience was quite negative.

Stayed for a fall weekend visit with a friend ‚Äî we didn't leave happy campers. Overall, we were disappointed in the condition of the camper space, which affected our stay. Listing photos are misleading ‚Äî the camper (exterior, especially) and bathroom shed appear much cleaner, brighter and well-maintained than in actuality. Instead, the exterior paint was in bad condition, cacti were sick (!) and there were no usable chairs for outdoor seating. The bathroom in the shed was full of storage and has disorganized household items on shelves. Main house back porch was cluttered with residents' belongings. The camper is directly behind (steps from) the main house's back porch, so there was close proximity to the main house's residents throughout the weekend.  Unfortunately, our stay was not as comfortable or as private as we expected because of the lack of cleanliness and conditions.

Do NOT stay here. This place does not look like the photos - she has let it go downhill and obviously doesn't take care of it anymore. It was filthy, messy, and cluttered. Not to mention, the host doesn't even live there at the house (camper is in backyard), she rents it out to a guy and didn't tell us. Not COVID-friendly - water that was provided for us to drink had already been opened and drank from. Coffee, shampoo, soap, ect had already been used. AC did not work, we were sweating and we stayed during the Fall - we would have died if we stayed during the Summer. Inside of camper was fine, but backyard area was a mess - trash, tarps, weights, pet food bowls, junk, ect. were all over the yard, and not to mention, the shed which was converted into a bathroom was gross - multiple mattresses everywhere, boxes, random stuff piled up to the ceiling - it was like a junkyard. Clearly this host is not organized or clean. The chairs and patio table in the photo was broken, and the 2 other random chairs in the backyard were covered in dirt/dust. We had nowhere to sit outside and "drink our coffee" like the listing stated. All of the plants in the photos are dead and weeds are everywhere. There was a random used lufa hanging from the lights, and half of the string lights were burnt out. My best friend and I were visiting Austin to celebrate our birthdays, and choose to stay here because the photos looked so cute, but they could not have been more misleading and we could not have been more disappointed. The host was not friendly and took forever to respond. We had a hard time getting the keys unlocked, it was an hour long process by the time she responded. Needs a different method of obtaining the keys. This place may have looked like the photos long ago, but is trash now. It would just take a little time and elbow grease to get this place looking good again, but obviously the host doesn't care and is just after people's money.
Don‚Äôt be fooled it‚Äôs not like the pictures. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend staying here.
Bad parking, loud neighbors, don‚Äôt stay during summer. Backyard was also a wreck. Poor view.

As two girls we did not feel safe here and cancelled after arriving to find someplace else.  There was no lock on the gate to the street, and the lock on the camper itself seemed very janky and loose.  The proximity to the house and surrounding area is also too close for comfort.  Also the bathroom is literally a shed with bugs and a dirty mattress.  Had we known more of this beforehand we would have not booked.  Looks great in the photos but not in person.  The camper itself and gardens were definitely not taken care of, and in 100 degree weather there was hot air blowing in from every crack including large spaces in the door and windowpanes.  The owner who had previously been easy to communicate with is now ignoring all our messages as well.

I usually don‚Äôt like to complain, but this experience was terrible and I hope other people will know what they‚Äôre getting into before booking their stay. There are a lot of things that were red flags immediately beginning with my stay, but I was genuinely willing to overlook them. The gate to the backyard is tiny and easily able to be accessed and opened. Being on a busy street, this was a little concerning, but even more so when paired with the fact that the door to the camper doesn‚Äôt shut completely. Anyone could easily open the gate to the backyard and to the camper with no problem whatsoever. I‚Äôve seen other reviews stating that they felt unsafe and I‚Äôd have to agree and would like to emphasize that more than anything as something I really wish was brought to my attention before booking. The yard which the camper is located is trashed. Paint cans, weights, various trash is just strewn across the yard. The bathroom is in a shed that is piled high with just junk and dirty mattresses. The bed was unstable and shifted as if you‚Äôd broken it every time you moved on it and the fridge wasn‚Äôt cold at all and still had items in it from either previous campers or the host. Not at all like how the pictures looked in regard to cleanliness. We were notified that the AC had gone out an hour before we were supposed to check in but we would be provided a portable AC unit, which we were very understanding about, things happen. Upon arriving the camper was hot, so hot that it was almost impossible to breathe unless sitting directly in front of the portable unit. ALL of these things we were willing to overlook UNTIL at night when a cockroach the size of my palm flew directly at my face. At that point, I had had enough and my partner and I promptly packed our bags and sat in my car for 2 hours at 10:30 pm contacting airbnb support to help us find another place to stay. While this was happening, the host decided to not be helpful, but further escalate the situation by sending a passive aggressive message about how I ‚Äúdon‚Äôt know about biology‚Äù and stating that cockroaches have no ties to overall cleanliness. At that moment, we cancelled the trip and had to find somewhere else to stay at 12:30 at night. We didn‚Äôt even last a night there. Overall, a completely terrible experience and the treatment we received from the host was absolutely ridiculous. Do not stay here.

The photos look bright and clean online but not in-person. Angel should update her photos. The room was musty, the sheets felt dirty, dirt and dust everywhere. It felt as if the room had not been cleaned after the last person. We were so unsatisfied we ended up booking a hotel somewhere else to stay.

Dear traveler, this review will consist of a pros and cons list of our stay to also help you decide on yours. Mind you we stayed in 3 digit weather.

Pro:
-outdoor shower was AMAZING
-the RV itself was cute but there could be renovations to it
-good location it was close to a lot of places in Austin

Cons:
-we found a roach on the 3rd and 4th day of our stay and while cleaning to find it we found another dead one.
-the AC sucks. We had to buy a tall fan to help cool the RV down (which indeed helped a bit).
-the mini fridge hardly got cold at all
-the pictures were deceiving when it came to the restroom. The restroom is used as a storage area and wasn‚Äôt hidden or anything. So it made it a bit uncomfortable and wasn‚Äôt shown in the listed photos.
-there was no lock on the gate

I don‚Äôt recommend in 100 degree weather.

*The only "privacy" the outdoor shower offers is a flimsy curtain that moves in the wind. The shower is also in full view of the front house as well as the driveway as the side gate does not latch. I did not feel safe or comfortable using it during my stay.
*The "converted shed" where the bathroom is is actively still being used as a storage shed. There is also no AC.
*The portable AC unit in the camper itself does nothing to combat the heat. With most walls being windows covered with very thing curtains the temperature was unbearable during the day and not much better at night.
*The AirBNB was not clean. The lip around the edge of the bed frame was filled with food crumbs, dirt and small pieces of trash. There were also dirty socks under the rolling AC unit and a pair of dirty old sandals on one of the shelves.
accurate photos made for a realistic and accurate stay. had a great time staying here, really enjoyed the outside shower. camper is by a very busy street, but the sound of the AC drowns it out.

The place is fantastic, especially for a large group.
The internet connection is not so great though, there are two wifi endpoints, but neither are good enough to access netflix/youtube/skype.

This place absolutely worked for our needs (lots of beds, easy to access for large group). Where it fell short was 1) The dishes were not clean. There were coffee dregs caked on the inside of the "clean" cups. For a $200 cleaning fee, it should be spotless. 2) Communication was not very responsive. I had to ask about late checkout 3 times before I got any response (thanks for the extra hour though!). 3) Internet was spotty and didn't work for everyone/in all parts of the condo. 4) No luggage storage option ($8 at the visitor center with mandatory pickup by 4:30 is very limiting and annoying). Note also that the windows are paper thin. You can hear everything going on outside even on the top floor (I actually checked whether the window was open!).  So basically it was fine and did the job but I would hesitate to stay again given the shortcomings.
Not clean. Poor communication. No parking. Great location.
Close to so many different trails and parks, but still really close to downtown. 5 min Uber to Rainy Street, walking distance to food trucks/BBQ üòã. Would stay here again 10/10
No thanks.  To each their own.

Great experience!
The place exceed our expectations and was fully stocked! The location was very convenient and very close to downtown. We didn't interact much with the host but there was no need they had everything covered!
Thanks!

Nous avons √©t√© un peu d√©√ßus par le logement propos√© par Mickaela. Il ne s'agit pas vraiment d'une chambre partag√©e, mais de pi√®ces am√©nag√©es dans le garage de la maison. A noter : il n'y a qu'un frigo et un micro-ondes, il est donc impossible de cuisiner. La propret√© √©tait correcte mais sans plus. C'est dommage parce qu'on voit tout de m√™me que les peintures ont √©t√© refaites. Par ailleurs Mickaela et sa soeur sont disponibles et gentilles. Elles nous ont conseill√© des endroits √† visiter et on mis √† disposition deux petits chauffages bien utiles pendant la vague de froid.

I reserved this place for my mom under very unusual circumstances. Micki was just extraordinary: super fast responses, went the extra mile to fulfill my requests, made herself available at all times. I have nothing but praise for Micki. And the place? This is what my mom said: ‚Äújust perfect!‚Äù

The host was very helpful and accommodating, especially when Airbnb screwed up. The neighborhood was as expected except that the convenience store mentioned was closed down. Everything else was as expected.
All round okay, but rooms connected and very noisy due to a sky scraper being built right next door.

This place was as described, but I probably should have done more homework. First, my view was of a big public bathroom and a row of what I can only assume are unhoused people. It was sad to see probably 15-20 people all sleeping or sitting on the sidewalk and surrounding areas. This, of course, is no fault of the hosts, it‚Äôs just something to be aware of. In addition, you should know that this is a place which is run by some sort of corporation and not individual hosts. You will not be greeted or have a connection with anyone. The actual space is dated with popcorn ceilings and very squeaky beds. Also, if you pay for parking beware that the garage is a maze and smells of urine.

The location is right off 6th street and easy to walk places. It was clean, but not particularly comfortable.
very noisy early in the morning with construction work going on in the neighborhood, and nonexistant noise isolation.
Very responsive. Right downtown. Just one warning: no doors on any room except the bathroom

The loft is fine, basic needs where met. Parking is available in the area no need to pay for the lofts parking it‚Äôs expensive and a bit of a hassle. Stepping over homeless to open the front door, watching crack being smoked in large groups, knife fights, drug deals, trash everywhere left from the free food delivery s.. police called with little to no help.
Everything wasn't great about location and room
10/10 nothing to say, everything was as depicted and written no surprise.
Enjoyed our stay. The place is surprisingly quiet considering the location. Only downside is the amount of homeless people around the building at night, but unfortunately, that's just Austin.
Good location next to restaurants and night life, but can get noisy at night.

I loved the place, hated the location. Very aggressive panhandlers that are on the corner 24/7. Had a homeless couple tried to stab me while waiting for doordash to pull up in front of the buildings. I also witnessed two shootings and an over dose from the balcony. Very unexpected wild trip just trying to
Evacuate from hurricane Laura.

The apartment was totally fine, and the host was super responsive. However the location is right on 6th street, which is convenient but also very unsafe. The streets were crowded with homeless and people strung out on drugs. There were about 10-15 hanging out right outside the building which made our group feel very unsafe. They were begging for money, throwing things up to the balcony of the building, trying to fight and even chased down someone in my group. Absolutely insane. This is not something the host really can control just wanted to point that out when considering this booking. If I was with a group of just females, I don't think I would have been able to stay here.

Not as advertised!  This home is in a very convenient location and could have a lot of charm, however it was not very clean and really should be advertised as sleeping 2 and not 4.  We had 2 teenage girls with us and the 2nd bed was a very cheap futon and it was extremely uncomfortable however the master bed was extremely comfortable.  We were very unlucky to be staying at the same time as very loud neighbors above.  The house does not seem to have much insulation and at 12 midnight it was so bad we could not sleep at all.  The outside of the house was very dirty with trash, broken glass and dog droppings everywhere.  All the lamps had been unplugged and we had to move heavy furniture just to get everything plugged in.  Many of the lights had burned out light bulbs as well.  Additionally, we came home one night to a huge mess caused by a bunch of rock, brick, cardboard and dirt that came crashing down from the chimney.  We tried to make contact but never heard back from anyone.  Also, there is noTV, just Netflix.  Overall we were not very impressed with the house but very impressed with the location.

The place was clean. Location is OK.
Construction right outside the bedroom window and neighbors upstairs were quite loud so not the best of rests ever.
The deck and porch were not what were really portrayed... the place is a little dated. The bedroom door doesn't close and there are no curtains on the from door so not the most private either.
Impossible to find a plug to charge your phone unless you shift all the bedroom furniture to search behind beds and sofas. Bed wasn't the most comfortable.
For the price I was charged I really wasn't pleased at all with what I found.

We were very disappointed at our stay and would not recommend. The glasses were dirty and there was hair on the floor. There wasn't drinking water, proper bedding, bathroom essentials or coffee provided. The bed was terrible and the pull-out couch is next to the bed, which makes it unable to use. We rearranged the furniture, but the pull-out couch had a mattress that was about 1" thick. It was so loud from noise upstairs, we were unable to sleep. You can hear every step, even if the guests weren't partying. There wasn't even proper bath soap provided for the shower.

The largest issue we had is apparently there was a change in regulation in parking and the host didn't let us know, so there was no where for us to leave our car, since the upstairs guests left their two cars in the designated spots. ALL street parking is permitted, but the host failed to obtain those permits from the city, we were too nervous to leave our car on the street. The host did not pick up our calls when the fridge broke or when were in the middle of this parking crisis. After 5 hours, the host responded to a text, but not with helpful information.

The location looks like it is in the process of changing. There were a couple homeless people on our street and some construction. You can walk to a couple of destinations but I would never stay in this particular location again.

Everything within the box house looks like it is going to break. It is IKEA made at best and has seen many years of torture. You select to stay at an AirBnB so that you have comfortable home-like accommodations that a hotel cannot offer. This place does not offer the essentials, let alone the home feeling. She didn't even offer filtered drinking water...

We are discussing with AirBnB the next steps... please avoid this property!

A few minutes walk from W 6th Street, and a 10 minute walk to several restaurants nearby. I didn't meet Mireille in person but she was always reacheable via text. The block that this apartment is on is very residential and quiet, and the house is a bit creaky at night, but other overall a spacious place to stay.

After a quick snafu, which was entirely my fault (don't leave the phone with the door code inside the house when you get your bags out of the car, lest you be eaten by mosquitos while trying to retrieve the code), we settled in. The place was spacious and well appointed. It's a perfect location to do and see things in Austin. I would stay here again.

Noise issues... We put our son & daughter in law with their baby here, but the noise issues were so bad that they had to check out after one night, so we ended up paying for two rentals during their stay. From the upstairs as others have noted, but they said the echos within the space made a normal conversation a problem if their baby was asleep.

This place is cute and quaint.  The location is close enough to south Congress; so a short car ride is all you need to get to some good eateries.  With that being said, we were disappointed in a few things.  There wasn‚Äôt any bath soap provided (which wasn‚Äôt promised in the reservation, so it isn‚Äôt a failure to deliver); but this seems like a simple thing to provide.  I emailed the host via the Airbnb app to ask about cable TV service. But I never got a response; that was very disappointing.

Before we arrived the host said there was a break in the window, when we arrived it was a Ive foot long by almost a foot high break totally open that we had to tape a trash bag over ourselves. We were assured it would be fix but it was not even after we waited all day when the host told us someone was coming. What a waste. We asked to leave when we could find a new Airbnb and the host told us we would be refunded totally almost 1800 and to let her know when we checked out. We did and called Airbnb immediately. Then the host advised us to cancel our reservation in which it would have only refunded us around 200$ total. She then stopped responding to us. The home itself is so misleading from the photos. The mattress box spring is filthy and there is no bed skirt covering it. All the walls have marks scratches and filth.  The walls are so thin and if you are relying on this place to be pet friendly be prepared to have a dog from the neighbor that is constantly outside on a leash tied to the front table and mostly always in the back area. There were blankets covering the furniture that clearly hadn‚Äôt been washed and the bathroom shower is covered in mildew and the light flickers on and off. It is so small you have to sit sideways on the toilet. Horrible host and horrible place. Definitely don‚Äôt recommend, we were able to leave and find a cheaper place that was actually clean yet are stilllll dealing with the repercussions of this bad host two weeks later. Never had such a bad experience with Airbnb. Disappointed with the host, the misleading description of the home and Airbnb.

I hate to write a bad review for anyone but I was very disappointed. The all caps DISINFECTED was misleading and so were the photos. The place is not nearly as nice or clean. I had to give it a proper cleaning the day I arrived and nearly every wall, cabinet handle, light switch, etc. was dirty. Every dish in the house was dirty. In fact there was a dirty looking bedpan in with the dishes. Gross. The bed covering from the photos weren't there and were replaced by some undersized, cheap ones.

Also, it was also loud. I heard every word from the shouting college kids that were renting above me. It's an old house so that's partly expected but a host with apartments sharing walls should know better than to rent to college kids. Super disappointing.

I pretty much lost all of my work as a freelancer due to Covid, but saved up as much as I could to try and do something special for my girlfriends birthday and got us an Airbnb for the weekend in Austin, a city she's always wanted to visit. Unfortunately, this was the worst place we could've stayed and we were forced to evacuate and book a hotel room on the second day after 20+ people came knocking on our front door, blasting music and stomping through the building all not wearing masks or following any sort of COVID precautions. The walls are paper thin, the bedroom is musty, the furniture didn't match the description and the bathroom felt like a dorm room stall.

We immediately tried calling our host and after multiple attempts we were unable to reach her. We then texted her and didn't hear anything back for 2+hours all the while the people above us stomped around and turned up their music. People were peering into our windows and ringing our doorbell so we answered to see what was going on and immediately saw that nobody was wearing masks and people were grouped together bringing up drinks and party supplies. We had to go. We then booked a hotel room for our last two nights. After we checked into the hotel, we finally received correspondence from our host.

For the price, we expected so much more from this experience. We paid nearly $600 for a place that we couldn't even stay at and to top it off our host refused to issue us a refund for this horrible experience. We contacted Airbnb and they were entirely unhelpful. They apparently spoke to our host as well and she declined a refund for the second time claiming that she had handled the situation with the other unit in the building.

It says on our hosts profile that she is a "Super Host" but I can attest that she was definitely not super.

We had a poor experience at this Airbnb. It was bad timing, we went on the coldest time possible. Fast communication, but not always good communication. we were leaving around 10 am and told her the electric went out around 1-2am  and it seemed like it wasn‚Äôt a big deal to her. I wouldn‚Äôt say it‚Äôs worth staying one night as the cleaning fee is so high for such a small place, maybe for a longer stay. The wall ac/ ‚Äúheater‚Äù does not work at all, and there are only two very small space heaters. So if it is cold I wouldn‚Äôt recommend staying here. We were freezing all night. The microwave was broken also. The WiFi wasn‚Äôt good, it kept loosing connection. We originally had a place  basically on 6th street which got changed to  the one we ended up staying at last minute when we were already almost into Austin from our trip, because the cleaning people couldn‚Äôt make it from bad weather. We were expecting something way better than we got, or at least more equipped for in-climate weather.
Upkeep was not great, a little dirty and the towels smelled. The bathroom door didn't latch but not a biggie. The location is really close to downtown and the area is fine. It was passable.

I didn‚Äôt have a terrible experience but the pics aren‚Äôt an accurate representation of the unit and as many others have stated, the noise from above is LOUD.
The sofas are all covered in blankets now and the bathroom is not the same. Maybe it‚Äôs from another unit in the building???
But the price is low so it‚Äôs a fair trade.

Here's the deal: I wasn't able to stay in this property due to a plumbing problem.  There was a freeze in early February, more than 2 weeks before my reservation, and they still hadn't fixed it before my arrival on Feb 19.  When did I learn of the problem? Less than 24 hours before arrival.  I was offered a less desirable property instead, with no offer to reduce the price I had already paid.  Or I could have a full refund.  I chose to find a hotel at the last minute, and take the refund.  Which I am still waiting to receive.
The reservation was canceled 86 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
There‚Äôs a reason why Lorna is a superheat! Just book it! It won‚Äôt disappoint.
Place is not worth the cost. Bathrooms doesn‚Äôt have locks and description doesn‚Äôt mention that two of the rooms are in guest house. We found cockroaches in backyard and even in main house.

Only contact was through text and email - no voice or direct contact. The apartment was immaculate,high quality, secluded and private and only minutes away from downtown. Whole Foods one block away good for breakfast.
Yooooooooo Brookes place is seriously the GOAT. DOPE HOUSE, DOPE AREA, YOU CANT GET A BETTER AIRBNB IN THE AREA I SWEAR TO ANYTHING YOU BELIEVE IN!!!!!!!!

I had to cancel my reservation due to the condition of the aribnb upon my arrival. Dirty sheets, trash not taken out, bedroom bathroom bot cleaned etc. Pretty discouraging experience that I would have liked to avoid.
Great location if you‚Äôre looking at staying near campus. Parking was difficult but there may be no way around that in Austin
Good communication. Clear instructions. Bed quality worse than expected. Dont count sofa bed as sleeps 2. Master bedroom and twin beds spring thin depressed mattress.
Maintenance problems were not addressed promptly.

Pretty good location, not a far drive to the airport, downtown Austin, and restaurants, but definitely not a very walkable area since there‚Äôs no sidewalks in most of the neighborhood.

We were pretty disappointed the lack of maintenance to the place. The sliding door is broken, so they added a security bar to the door, which is also completely broken. Multiple remotes were missing the backs, leaving the batteries exposed, and some batteries were dead so we had to switch them from remote to remote. Both pans were so deeply scratched they were unusable. I know I could have reached out about these issues, but I shouldn‚Äôt have to reach out to property managers about this many issues. The place should be better maintained.

The communication was good overall. I appreciated the company allowing us to have a late check out. However we were moved at the last minute to unit #504 which wasn't in great condition (marks on the walls, a big dent in the bathroom door, etc) my sheets had stains on them (though they were clean) and worst of all, there was an insect problem. We killed four giant bugs in the first 36 hours. The company sent a cleaning crew out right away and also set some traps, but since I found one bug in my bed I slept on the couch instead. The location is great -- I didn't mind the noise with ear plugs. But the bugs were gross and the place was not in great condition.

Surprisingly --- the reviews posted here are very positive.  I found renting an Airbnb in this location "Dirty East 6th" very unsavory.  Bars, drunks, homeless, and a shelter with a few blocks paint a dismal picture of Austin.  The apt itself is drab, could use comfy furniture and new carpeting.  Loft style 2 bedrooms upstairs do not have doors, and neither does the bed at the front door.  The patio looks over the public toilets for a rather unsavory view.  The Top Trip Rentals people were wonderful and very helpful!
A bit noisy at night
Location is Right on dirty 6th street. It is very loud especially on the weekends. Also there are several homeless people that either live right out front or close by.

There is one king bed, other sleeping accommodations include a couch and two air mattresses.  She was very accommodating to our request to drop off our stuff prior to checking in.  Would suggest a car if coming to Austin, which you need to get to a grocery store and most locations in town.

Given that Amina's place is listed as Signature Plus, we were sadly disappointed with what we found. First off, the studio was difficult to find. I arrived on a rainy evening and had to walk around in the dark and rain for 10 minutes trying to find the place. The studio is tucked behind the house and accessible on a different street from the actual address behind a carport (which wasn't clearly stated). I had to walk through a dark carport to get to the studio. There was no light left on either inside nor outside the studio, which made finding it extremely unclear. At one point, I called the host for assistance but she did not answer nor call me back. After some frustration, I finally found the place.

The second and bigger disappointment was with the general quality of Amina's studio. At first glance the place seems high quality and posh, but once we looked deeper, we were met with one disappointment after the next:
1. There was no hot water (only lukewarm) the first night I arrived when all I wanted was a hot bath
2. There was what appeared to be black mold or some kind of black stains in the grout in both the bathtub as well as the shower
3. The towels were skimpy and several had large bleach stains on them
4. The bath products provided were low quality
5. The sheets on the kind bed were poor quality. The top sheet barely fit the bed. It was more like a queen top sheet on a king bed.
6. There was rancid oil left out in a white porcelain bottle by the stove (which I unknowingly used - gross!)
7. There was only one saut√© pan in the entire kitchen and the handle was broken off
8. Some of the blinds didn't work properly

There was a general feeling of tiredness and lackluster to the studio, like it was well worn but not adequately attended to.

For a Signature Plus property, we had much higher expectations than we would for a normal Airbnb. Sadly, this place was disappointing even for a normal Airbnb. Unless Amina attends to some of the wear and tear issues and up levels the linens and bath products, I can't recommend this place, especially as Signature Plus property.

To Amina's defense, she seems like a nice person. We really didn't have much contact with her throughout the weekend. She was responsive to the few requests I made - adjusting the hot water, fixing a blind, and giving us a few more saut√© pans to cook breakfast with in the morning.

The home itself was nice and the location too. I stayed with my husband and daughter. First off, there are large blinds in the home which are lovely but one of the strings broke while we were opening them and we notified the host immediately. She wanted us to pay for the $135 repair ourselves without providing any receipt or going through Airbnb host insurance even though we were not misusing the blinds and they seemed to break from regular wear and tear at a point of tension and bending in the string. Additionally, I did not include my 6 year old daughter in the number of people staying but told the host that three of us would be there. The host tried to charge me additional fees for my child even though the home advertises 6 guests. Be aware that additional fees apply and are hidden when booking. Also, we were unable to use or access the covered garage as someone else‚Äôs car was there when we arrived.

This place was not a private home. We rented this home for a small gathering amongst family. Everyone had mask and sanitizer. I honestly didn‚Äôt see anywhere where it said no to the gatherings. So the owner lives up front with bare windows and there are people there who sit and look at you through these windows there‚Äôs absolutely no privacy. Owner comes in taking pics of all the guest in the house. Pics of the decor and said no strong alcohol when the bottles she was taking pics of were part of decor. As family was coming she comes out demanding more money saying she doesn‚Äôt feel safe because of our guest and us being people of color. Comes in and started arguments with people as we were trying to pack up and leave. Never stayed at the place over night . Was only there literally for like 4 hrs. I do not recommend if you‚Äôre a person of color or really looking for privacy.

When arriving in the evening to this property it was incredibly hard to find due to no lights being left on. It doesn't help that the owner parks their car in the driveway closest to the edge, so you have to walk on the dirty to get around despite there being plenty of room to pull in.
The place itself was quite nice and the furniture was comfortable and included a nice layout for guests to feel at home in. However, the place was quite dirty with ware in the bathroom, dirty dishes in the oven, dust and crumbs under the couch, and a napkin that turned black when wiping the floor due to a light water spill. The windows were easy to use, but the gigantic bathroom window that provides a view of the showers and toilet was tied in such a way that it could not be reached to close without a ladder. Additionally, there were no smoke detector in the main rooms, but instead a visible spot where one was previously connected with wires hanging from the ceiling. There was one smoke detector in the hallway, but it would be one of the last places smoke would reach.
Another item I felt was odd were the location of the light switches as they were often on the opposite end of the room from the entrance, or behind the door you open to enter a room.
When we had mentioned that the TV remote batteries were not working, the host provided batteries the next day, but those batteries were equally without power.
When some complaints had been made about the status of the house, the host seemed dismissive as though these problems could be delegated to others.
Lastly, upon opening the storage compartment in the couch, I found multiple loose pills. Although these appeared to be vitamins as I could roughly identify some of them as fish oils, the fact that loose pills can be found like this is not acceptable.

Can only sleep 2 adults (3rd bed is very short).  Neighborhood not very safe feeling (there was a crime scene down the street when we stayed and the police seemed to be ever-present at the nearby convenience store).  We were not given space to park in the driveway and the guest area outside of the camper (garage and yard) were not clean.  It was inexpensive, though! And Austin is  great city.  Lyft drivers were nearby, too.  Angel kindly picked up some drinks I requested prior to our arrival. (Which I paid her for)
You can‚Äôt beat the location or the uniqueness of the camper and outdoor shower.  Not being  able to convert the bed to a table was a hardship for us considering the hot weather.

Would not recommend. Especially if you‚Äôre a couple.

I repeatedly had to set boundaries with the host around intrusions into my time and privacy.

The actual space was dark, depressing and in shoddy shape. The lighting was terrible and my husband and I felt uncomfortable staying there.

The door was also challenging to lock making me feel like I was leaving things to potentially be stolen.

The bed was uncomfortable and creaky.

Access to the place was difficult by foot and by vehicle. My husband hurt his leg on a scooter and we had ongoing trouble getting Lyfts or friends to drive down to drop us off without him having to strain to walk. The parking situation was precarious as well.

All of this made our stay quite awkward and unenjoyable and we left early. The saving grace is the location near the Springs and Greenbelt.

We were greeted by our host, Barbara who gave us a quick briefing on the suite with all its amenities. The suite was tastefully decorated and exactly as described. It is located in a quiet neighborhood just a block off Congress making it a short walk to restaurants, cafes and shops.

Es war einfach nur genial.
Die Kommunikation war einfach nur top und die Lage war ausgesprochen geil. Besser geht es nicht !
Es gibt nichts zu meckern, auch wenn das unserer deutschen Mentalit√§t entspricht üòã

This place is the perfect place to stay in Austin. The location could not have been better and the place was amazing for us. We were a group of four, the place was very spacious and met all our needs. I will definitely stay here again if I visit Austin. The only negative was you have to agree to a contract they provide as they are a real short term rentals company. It was really no big deal but I do not like dealing with anything outside of AirBNB such as this.

LOUD AND TIRED.  This loft is exceptionally noisy. What was described as ‚Äúdowntown city noise‚Äù was - in reality - booming music that lasted until the wee hours, every single night. I am a New Yorker, so typically can sleep through sirens, garbage trucks, etc. however this was almost unbearable. We were there on weekdays, I can‚Äôt even imagine how loud it would be on a weekend. The loft is also located next to a shelter and a free public bathroom, which made for dozens of homeless people you had to nearly step over on the sidewalk to get out the door. The loft was very tired, and in need of renovating. While it was clean, the paint was chipped, cabinets didn‚Äôt open smoothly, and the closet door felt like it was about to fall off. Finally, my shower did not turn off on the first day, and I had to leave the water running full force for a few hours, as I could not wait for a repair person to arrive. It was frustrating and very anxiety provoking for the first day of my stay.
The place did not look how was described, problem with the door key, bugs, no shampoo and much more.

We initially rented 1 unit that held 8 people, but last minute (as in day of arrival), there was construction in our planned unit and in the building, and Top Trip moved us to 2 separate units.
