While there was more "room" by square footage standards and number of bathrooms within the 2 units, it made our girls weekend seem not as cohesive. We didn't want to be in 2 units, we wanted to be in 1. They seemed to not get that, and said that we 'were better off" because other reservations that had were forced to move to nearby hotels. My question is, "Why rent units when they aren't ready?"

The Littlefield Suite Building itself was under construction, and not nearing completion. The balconies they advertised were not usable since there was no glass. The common areas were dusty, and banging and drilling woke us up at 8:00 am on a Saturday. It should have been telling when we checked in when there was ear plugs available all throughout the units.

While Chereen and Cailyn did their "best" to address the situation in the last minute move, they used the City of Austin as their scapegoat. They only informed us a few days upon arrival on the on-going construction (which seemed to have been occurring for several months), and alluded to possibly moving us to 2 units. On the way to the airport the morning of my arrival, I was forced to finalize paperwork on the change in units, because it was not their fault, but AirBnb's fault I was forced to do this.

While the Littlefield Suite has potential when completed, the lack of organization and communication with Top Trip will discourage me from using them again. They misrepresented what the unit was and what we ultimately got. While it was advertised as a "flexible" check in, they could not confirm any check in until the very last minute. Overall, they need to get their act together.

Loved it here, if there is one negative thing include say it would be that the shower is horrible on many levels. First it is nearly impossible to turn the cold water knob therefore giving you scolding hot water then when you actually do get the knob turned, it is so temperamental and is either one extreme or the other.

Good location centralized to downtown nightlife. Had a few issues during our stay, but nothing incredibly unreasonable, just inconvenient. Will likely stay here in the future if another AirBnB doesn't work out.

We were disappointed with our stay at the Lodgewell. The primary issue was the price-value proposition, as well as the listing being misleading.

We had booked what was advertised as a 2 bedroom unit and paid more than $630 / night for our stay. This rate was equivalent to, if not higher than, several other hotels in the area, and based on the pictures of our unit, we had thought the property would be similar if not better than those hotel options.

The day before our check-in, I received a message from Lodgewell indicating that even though the listing was advertised as 2 bedroom, that the floor plan was "open" and there weren't going to be actual bedrooms. I had promptly asked to see if there were any units with 2 true bedrooms available in the building (and offered to pay more), and was told that there wasn't. The sleeping space was essentially entirely located on the second floor / loft floor. There was one bed at the top of the stairwell against a divot in the wall, with a curtain in front of it, and that was the only separation. The second bed was ~12-15 feet away, and against another divot in the wall, with no curtain. Neither of us felt that the arrangement could have reasonably be classified as a 2 bedroom unit, and the experience for all four nights simply felt as though we were sharing a 1 bedroom with two floors that happened to have 2 beds. This was extremely disappointing given the price we were paying to stay.

There were several other issues that while not as fundamentally upsetting as the bedroom issue, still contributed to the Lodgewell feeling like a less premium option, and certainly not a $600+ / night accommodation. These were:

1) Air conditioning was intermittent. I ran into a few other people who were staying in the Lodgewell who had also complained that their AC units didn't seem to always work, as well as one visitor who claimed his AC was entirely broken. Given the Austin weather, this felt unacceptable.

2) Check-in process. I had emailed the Lodgwell on May 9th (2.5 weeks prior to my check-in date) asking if we could check-in earlier (from 3pm to 1pm), given our flight was landing around then. A staff member emailed me back saying that we could either pay a $100 fee to check in two hours earlier, or wait until the day before our check-in, at which point they could let us know if we would be able to check in at 1pm. They explained that if nobody else rented the room the night before our check-in date, we would be able to check in early - this was totally reasonable. On May 25th, two days before our check-in date, I contacted the property again, asking to confirm whether our early check-in would be approved. A staff member responded by saying I would be contacted by phone / text on May 26th confirming. Through the same communication channel (Airbnb message), I followed up on May 26th asking to confirm. Nobody from Lodgewell ever responded to me. On May 27th, after asking an unrelated question via Airbnb, the Lodgewell let me know that an early check-in would not be possible. At this point, we had already arrived at the facility, which had no staff members in the lounge. Given May 26th was a work day and given the pandemic, this significantly disrupted our ability to work (no Wifi, no sit-down common areas). We were highly disappointed that earlier notice wasn't given so that we could look for accommodations between noon and 3pm in advance, particularly since presumably the Lodgewell would have known at least a day in advance if nobody (or somebody) was staying in our room that night. I had also asked that at the very least, we be allowed to leave our luggage somewhere in the lobby for safekeeping until our check-in was ready, and was told we couldn't do that either. Nobody had ever contacted me to let us know when check-in was ready (we were told somebody would let us know).

3) Common Areas / General Amenities. The elevator button often didn't work, and the elevator itself was cramped, fitting just 2-3 people comfortably, which was upsetting given the pandemic. Additionally, the elevator itself had a strong odor to it for all four nights of our stay, and consistently would have spilled food / drink on the already limited floor space. One night, the hallway of our floor had a jar of spilled queso / cheese - this was never cleaned during our stay. In our room, there was only one small ~32" TV. The outlets on the first floor did not work.

4) The entrance to the Lodgewell is a small door, somewhat hidden / tucked away into the corner of a wall. Most nights, there were multiple homeless people who would loiter next to, near, or sometimes blocking the door. This seemed like a potential safety hazard.

Overall, the price we paid for our rooms was fully disconnected to the experience and quality of our stay. The lack of real bedrooms had already felt misleading and alone made the price tough to swallow, especially when benchmarked against nearby hotels and Airbnb's. The additional grievances and lack of on-site staff to address or speak to regarding those issues all further contributed to a below par experience.

Good location! but no windows for ventilation.
and Elevator was not fixed for 7 days..
Elevator broken and the host didn't care to call, explain and accommodate. 12 flights of stairs with luggage. Disappointing!

The office did a great job communicating ahead of time and throughout our stay. They gave me heads up of the location of the area and potential noise but it didn‚Äôt bother our stay. Would stay here again.
We found the place as described and couldn't have been happier. There were plenty of towels and other misc amenities!
We made a pit stop driving through Austin to Seattle from South Florida and needed a place to crash for the night. Luckily even though we came in late our host made arrangements for us!
Excessively over-priced. Shouldn't be more than $60/night. The location isn't great, no sheets for the futon, and all the furniture was cheap and shady.

I want to start by saying that Kristine was very nice to us. When we told her we could use a couple of kitchen items, she went shopping and bought them. She was fun to talk to and recommended lots of good places to visit.
That said, I have to comment on the house. This is an old, shabby place that has not been well maintained. The kitchen drawers don‚Äôt have runners to keep them from falling out. The kitchen counter was made using tiles; now, the grout is shot, tiles are missing or broken, all making it very unsanitary. The toilet sounds like an air raid siren for 30 to 40 seconds when flushed. Whoever painted it, long ago, did so without use of masking tape or even a wet sponge to wipe up splatters. The many things that have been attached and removed from the walls have left holes that have not been repaired or repainted. There are no thresholds to transition from the concrete floors to the tiled floors. The grout in the shower and around the toilet should be cleaned and resealed. The mirror in the bathroom is so old and speckled, it‚Äôs hard to see yourself in it. The sheers over the table in the living room are too narrow for the windows and don‚Äôt offer any privacy. The sheers in the master bedroom are so sheer; there‚Äôs no room darkening or privacy. Despite the appearance in the photo, the patio area is not accessible from inside the unit. It‚Äôs off to the side of the house.
Overall, we found the house uncomfortable. One bed was made from two box springs with a 1 1/2‚Äù foam pad. The other was a cheap box spring with a thin pad built into it. Both were uncomfortable to sleep on. The living room has two old love seats but no footstools, side or coffee tables. The TV only has a Chrome device on it for signal. If you don‚Äôt have the app on your device, then you get nothing.
Without verifying that she has addressed the comments noted above, I would not recommend saying here.
Close to the highway but no highway noise.

This place was dirty. I blame myself because if you stop and read most of the reviews they say the same thing. Honestly I hoped it would have a cool down to earth Austin vibe but in reality the decorations are tacky and the place is dirty and not at all that nice, especially for the price. I had my family visiting from out of town and felt embarrassed for booking this place
AC was broken which we should've been notified about before arriving. Not a great place, but not necessarily a bad place. Just very meh.
Would not suggest bringing kids or elderly people to stay. The two window AC units does nothing to cool down the house.

I would not recommend this place in the summer or warmer months. A/C did not work at all, there is one window unit and one portable A/C unit in one of the bedrooms but still did not cool down the place to a low enough temperature to sleep comfortable. I wanted to open the windows to maybe cool down the middle bedroom a little but there were no screens on them so couldn't due to mosquitoes. So the 5 of us were forced to all sleep in one bedroom just so we could be semi-cool by closing off the bedroom and cranking the portable A/C.
There was a big infestation when we stayed and the host was unresponsive when it got brought up. Bugs were all over the floor and on the walls. I DO NOT recommend

The pictures are outdated, the place is old rundown,  outdated and nasty the neighborhood is not all that great either.  it‚Äôs like staying in a dump! The lady is nice enough, except when I complained, she said we usually have younger more creative guests. I am not a dinosaur!!! And I refuse to stay in a dump. The only person this was fit for, would be a homeless person with nothing else.
No response

Kristine was a wonderful and gracious host. My wife and I are local visitors that utilized Kristine's property during a weekend we had an open house on our property. We chose Kristine's place because of the price and the proximity to our property, but I do wish we'd have done some more research before choosing to book. The property wasn't very clean, there were piles of old dog poop in the grassy area out front, the property is 1/2 of a detached duplex and other renters use the other property so there's a lot of traffic and noise. Kristine was great in letting use bring our pets for an additional cleaning fee, but after entering the place I can't really tell if the original cleaning fee was really all that utilized. The floors were really dirty, like layers of visible grime everywhere, the oven, cabinets, and drawers were in some kind of terrible barely functioning order, and the toilet seat was broken and would pinch your leg every time you sat down. This place is okay if you're wanting just a place to return at the end of the day after touring Austin, but if you're actually going to use the place for a stay-over I might caution you to look elsewhere.

Inaccurate description, says it could fit 6 but only fits three at most. Says there‚Äôs 1.5 bathrooms but there‚Äôs only 1 bathroom and an extra sink. the residential area was not the best(went for a late night walk and got harassed by bums) house lacked overall cleanliness. Not all the amenities were available. Check in was easy and host was quick with communication.
Good if you‚Äôre cheap or on a budget, but Still overvalued for the price paid in my opinion.

The host was amazing when it came to communication. She even accommodated to our early check in request. Very polite and courteous. The place was extremely dirty. And there was an awful smell through out the entire house... almost like something had died in the attic. I bought a ton of candles and scents to spray throughout the house so that helped out a tad. The description states that the place sleeps six counting the futon couch in the living room but the couch looks big enough to sleep a small child at most. So, that was misleading. Also, the house smelled pretty bad and the beds were mostly springs. Not comfy at all. The pics also showed a sitting area on the side of the house that was lit up. There were no lights when I got there and chairs were broken. I think this was a little too overpriced given the condition of the house. Will not book again.

The house was very dirty. We cut short our stay because it didn't meet our standard of cleanliness. In some ways it looked like it had never been cleaned. The floors, windowsills, air vents, furniture, and walls were dirty. The kitchenware was sticky, and there were no plates or a spatula to make food. Fixtures and furniture were in poor repair. The toilet was hard to flush. In addition, mice ate our food. This listing needs a lot of care and attention.

Place has old broken window frames, dirty floors and walls, doors missing, uneven floors, ceiling coming down, tiles falling off kitchen counters and all around scary vibe and lighting. Terrible neighborhood. Huge homeless camp 1 block away.

THIS PLACE WAS DISGUSTING. I read the bad reviews and reached out to the host about making sure my experience was different. It was a nightmare. From doorknobs falling off, dried old condoms, itchy bedding, a homeless camp a block away, bugs, roaches, stains, hair, a crack pipe in the kitchen, missing tiles sticky furniture, sticky dish ware, years of grime on the floors and baseboards, the worst miss matched decor I have ever seen (like a dumpster dive collection), lack of communication, false advertising, and a dungeon-like eerie vibe. If you are desperate and have low standards, this is the place for you. She refused to refund me even after I brought all of this to her attention one night into my 4 night stay. She ignored me and I booked it elsewhere. Her fine print makes it so that she gets your money no matter how long you stay, if you don‚Äôt cancel before you show up. So you‚Äôre getting scammed and screwed. No one in their right mind would willingly pay to stay here again. It‚Äôs creepy and gross. I had to sleep with the ugly, filthy sectional pushed against the front door so nobody could break in. You will leave itchy and as much as she swears she hires a cleaner- your cleaning fees DO NOT go toward this place getting cleaned. I tried to be nice and civil and give helpful suggestions, but she ignored me and refused to reimburse me. A complete waste, and it really ruined my opinion of the resolution center. This place is a scam, the photos look grim but the place still manages to be worse than the photos. RUN! Sleep in your rental car instead!
Its great but the hot water runs out quickly and there was a leak on the roof during our stay

Book this loft only when the price hits $200 or below. For any higher you can stay at a better hotel room nearby. The Airbnb plus accreditation was misleading to me as I‚Äôve stayed in regular Airbnb‚Äôs that had better quality. There were stains on the pillows, noticeable paint scratches on the walls, the top stair was loose causing a safety concern, and the bed was so uncomfortable I chose to sleep on the couch instead. If this listing had been priced at less I would have understood the lower quality in the loft. Aside from the prime downtown location it was a disappointment for the price.

I have mixed feelings about this rental.  While it was clean and the rental process was pretty well organized, there were a number of things about it that were okay to bad.  First of all, I was not expected to have to fill out reams of paperwork after booking through Airbnb.  It was a hassle and not what I've experienced other places.  It was only when I read the "house rules" more closely that I discovered the rental was located in a very noisy area - something that should definitely be included in the apartment description.  Telling me that a "house rule" is that I accept nighttime noise is totally not acceptable; it was critical that I get a good night sleep after flying all day so I would be prepared for a big presentation in the AM, but I would have had to forfeit my deposit of several hundred dollars to change my booking.  So I was stuck with this one.  And indeed, it was LOUD on Friday and Saturday nights.  The place has no ventilation to speak of, so it started to smell bad after a little while.  The only way to get any air circulation in the apartment is by opening the patio doors in the bedroom - there's no fan in the kitchen, the living room windows don't open, there's no fan in the bathroom, and no windows in either bedroom, the kitchen, or the bathroom.  I tried to contact the hosts the night before checkout to inquire about storing my bags somewhere because my flight didn't leave until late at night the next day, but got no response until I was on my way to the airport (having carried them around all day).   There were some nice touches like free chips, but the whole setup is faux-personal - lots of laminated booklets, forms, etc.  From what I can tell, the whole floor is made up of identical apartments being rented by the same company through Airbnb so it feels like a hotel.  Not my best experience.

The actual unit was nice enough but the building had some issues. It was on a somewhat creepy block and a man followed me into the vestibule when I was coming home. I notified TTR about it but they didn‚Äôt do anything. Also, the elevator was completely terrifying and dropped aggressively when you got in it and rattled a lot.

If your staying for a drunk night on 6th street you are at the right place. Unfortunately for my family and I we just wanted a night away with our children during the pandemic. We originally paid additional 30 dollars to use their parking pass. Once we got to the location I had to use my credit card to get in. Which changed 24 unexpected dollars upfront, I was told that u needed to swipe your card but I was not told of the charges. After we checked out we had to swipe our card again to exit for another 24 dollars. In total we were out of 78 dollars that were never disclosed apon paying for parking prior to getting there. As soon as we walked inside of the lodge 702 it smelled like the worse diarrhea known to man. The smell lingered the entire night. I‚Äôm not sure if there were animals prior or someone was extremely drunk and threw up all over the place. The hot water barley stayed hot for a 3 minute shower. Unfortunately because we had to sign a agreement there was no way out of our nights stays. We tried our hardest to have a calm night with the kiddos of movies and a few early Christmas presents while people watching from the living room window. Over all this was the worse experience I have had with Airbnb, however coming from Austin I should not have expected a warm and welcoming stay . Needless to say, I will never stay here again , nor would I ever recommend this to anyone ever!

Our group came to Austin for the F1 Race weekend.  The hosts were kind and communicated well.  The townhouse was sufficient for what we needed, but not worth the price.  Very basic with no nice amenities.  All the bathrooms on the top floor were especially inconvenient for groups traveling together.
Repeat customer. Stayed here in summer 2015 and again last week. Same experience. Host is quick to respond to communications. Pictures and descriptions are accurate. No surprises.

Pas√© unos d√≠as formidables en Austin en casa de Carol. Aunque no iba en plan de vacaciones, si no de trabajo, mi estancia fue agradable. Dado que la casa est√° a unos 4 minutos de camino a la parada del cami√≥n, pude ir a la Universidad de Texas f√°cilmente. Carol y su esposo son unas personas muy agradables, que se preocupan para que te sientas bienvenido y como en tu propia casa.

Even though I was staying only one night before the insanity of SXSW, Denise treated me as if I were staying the entire week. She went out of her way to make me feel welcome. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Die Unterkunft ist sehr stilvoll eingerichtet und super sauber. Wir hatten eine sehr gute Zeit und haben uns sehr √ºber die ganzen bereitgestellten Getr√§nke und Snacks gefreut! Auch die Nachbarschaft ist sehr nett und der Weg in die Stadt ist nicht weit. :)

Peter is a very kind and accommodating host, however the photos of the house are DRASTICALLY outdated. There is no comfortable seating in the living room, and the dining room table is a foldout with folding chairs. There is no hot water in the bathroom sink. This place is fine if you need  a place to crash with your buddies. It is NOT suitable for a family with young children or babies.

The photos look nothing like the actual home. Not one bit of that furniture is the same as the listing right down to the beds - TVs, linen - lamps - couches - tv cabinet - coffee table - even the toilet seat and the curtains and it was so dusty and unclean and run down.... Very deceptive photos . So disappointed

Home is centrally located in a quiet neighborhood, convenient to downtown, and ample street parking.  We enjoyed walking to the corner coffee shop.  AC kept the home cool.  Communications with host and check-in was smooth.  Overall, however, we were disappointed with the condition of the home because of many minor discrepancies which detracted from our experience.  The photos on the property listing do not accurately reflect the current condition of the home.  Cleaning was judged to be average, no better (examples - bathroom mirror had a dried film on it, dust bunnies on the floor.)  Most of the wall outlets throughout the home were missing cover plates and the light switch cover plate in the bathroom was hanging from a single screw.  Artwork in living areas and bedrooms was sitting on the floor and not hung on the walls.  Couch and chair in living room were very uncomfortable.  Construction debris and broken chairs in the back yard was unsightly and should be removed.

If you are truly looking to get away from it all, this is the place...  Everything about this property, and these hosts are second to none...  Beautiful, peaceful, quiet place, and Barbara and Alston are very good at what they do...  The only bad thing about this getaway was having to leave and come home at the end of it...  Can't wait to get back up there...

I usually don't write reviews, but I am obliged to write this one cause this is important that whoever rent the space must know what to expect.

Peter was not hospitable from the beginning. He showed us the room and when I asked to see the kitchen and dining he said there are dogs on the other side so I held back and didn't ask any question. After he left I texted him to ask if there an iron, my wife need to press the clothes for next day for an event. He said the iron is in the garage and he would have to look around and will give it to me in the morning, and then I asked if I can use the kitchen to put milk and he never replied back. In the morning I called him and he said the kitchen is not for us to use, when I booked the room it showed that there is a kitchen, dining area and a backyard, later the pictures have been taken down and now I can see only the picture of the room, so no fridge for me to use to store milk for my kids. Then on top he said that i need to pay extra for my two kids, I asked him three day before that we will be bringing our two kids which was not originally planned and asked if it would be an issue. He didn't reply until the day of our travel and asked me to pay extra for the kids, the way he put it was if I pay him he will take $60 but if I use Airbnb they will charge me $120. I called airbnb and they said there is no additional charges for my kids, it was't in the contract when I book the trip, so he change the terms later knowing that he capitalize the situation. I never got the Iron and he even said he will give us the cooler for the milk and wrote about it on Airbrb to make it seem that he is being a good host by meeting our request.

Another thing my wife noticed that there sheets and cups were dirty. Well why bother putting cups there when you can't wash them. There were no trash can outside for us to at least throw the trash outside.

I didn't complain and kept it quite, I didn't want to ruin my trip by arguing and getting into small things but the last word is mine. I had a very bad experience and I would not recommend anyone to stay there. He was a weird guy and I didn't get a good vibe from him. Another thing to note, the operating license was expired last year in August and was under some Lady name. How ever I want to make sure that Airbrb let the right people post the listing and show the what they are providing.

I do not recommend the place to the people, who are looking for a place so that they can roam around in the neighborhood in evening. The area looks dark and gloomy.

The room looked different than the listed pictures for now, because of actual ambiance and different lights. The bathroom door did not have a lock on it. It was my worst stay till now, among all the BnB's I have been to. I saw couple of mosquitoes as soon as I entered into the place.

The listed price in lower than the final price. Cleaning charge for me was too much in the final price. Lower listed price in the search criteria and the tag of superhost deceived me in opting for this BnB, which I realize after staying was a bad decision. From my experience and stay, I was confused "how can this host be marked as superhost?" Maybe it worked out pretty good for others, but it was not really good.

Among the messages, I had exchanged with the host, he also mentioned about his superhost status. I always find weird and bad, when someone tries to gloat and boast.

I just want to write that for me, It was very bad experience staying at this place.
I'm afraid this was a very negative experience. Among other things, the bed was dirty, and the bathroom smelled strongly of mold/mildew. We left early due to health concerns.

Not at all what was advertised!  Very dirty, mildew all over, awful smell.  Not even the same furniture or dec√≥r as in the photos.  We found dog food on the chair, the place appeared as though it hadn't been cleaned or dusted in months.  Find. Somewhere. Else.
Great location, but that‚Äôs about it. The Airbnb was dirty and not prepared to host guests.

This was my first experience with Airbnb and I have to say, Sunyong will be a tough act to follow. The house, property, and experience was unforgettable. She was extremely accommodating, even offering to show us around Austin. Anyone who is debating whether this is the property to go to, I can tell you that you will have a unique experience that you won't want to end.

Thanks Sunyong!

The listing was accurate and the neighborhood was much as expected. The "Digs" are very conveniently located for downtown and the place is a perfect size for two. The accommodation was spotless and well equipped in many respects. The kitchen is great but inadequately equipped for those who choose to cook evening meals.
Despite this inadequacy we would use the "Digs" again.

I stayed here from 2/28/17 - 3/4/17 and the ONLY problem with this location was getting picked up by fasten drivers. Due to the construction on the highway they would get lost a lot of the time trying to find the place. Everything else was perfect.

I wanted to like this place based on other reviews but I unfortunately did not continue my stay for both nights and did not enjoy my experience. I picked this place based on people claiming it was quiet. There is a quiet time policy from 11pm-7am and the host violated this by making very loud noise, very late at night in the common areas of the home and did not respond to my message about it the following day. I couldn‚Äôt sleep that night and the next day I cancelled for the night. I feel like the listing is accurate as far as the photos go, but due to being being ghosted on by the host, I can not recommend this place.

Also, there aren‚Äôt locks on the doors upstairs which is concerning considering that there are other guests staying in other rooms listed. It personally made me feels uneasy. I‚Äôve stayed in hostels before that have a lock on the door to your room so at least while you sleep, you know you have privacy/safety.
The room that I rented did not have privacy because there was an uncontrollable connecting door. The other guests mistakenly entered to my room from toilet several times.

Me and my friend stayed here for 4 nights. Place was clean and location was great.Ruby was responsive. However I couldn't give 5 starts because she charged me 10$ for keeping light on on hallway. I was ok and accepted charge but was told again and again "this is disrespectful" .I mean you want to charge and still yell at us ?
Second thing - Ruby's BF came to our room at 2 in the morning and told us that we were disturbing their sleep . wtf ? we weren't partying or something just talking..
my room has shared bathroom and you have to be very careful to unlock door after using it unless other person would not able to use it.
Cressida‚Äôs place was spectacular. The studio was spacious and had everything we needed during our stay here. The location is also hard to beat.
Excelente opci√≥n, ubicaci√≥n privilegiada, un lugar muy limpio y c√≥modo, sin duda un fabuloso lugar para hospedarse en Austin

You definitely get what you pay for here. Which isn‚Äôt necessarily a bad thing. We needed somewhere we could just drop our stuff and sleep at night while we explored the city. However the shower was broken. It was still usable but we had to hold down a bar to keep it from spewing water everywhere. And the shower curtain was barely being held up by a wire that looked really unsafe. Other than the shower conditions everything else was as expected.

Rick‚Äôs place was in a really good location, near Zilker.

It was comfortable, clean, and spacious but was sort of sparsely furnished. It was really nice to be able to take the dog.

I usually don‚Äôt leave negative feedback, especially publicly but when we arrived at around 6 pm, there were workers in the house working on the AC. Nothing had been mentioned to us about the workers. It was not the biggest deal to us at the time, so we left to grab a drink and come back.

We came back at around 11 pm and they were still there. The workers actually didn‚Äôt leave until we asked them to at midnight. They apparently planned on working in the middle of our airbnb until 2 am? Which is just really weird obviously. I‚Äôm not sure why they were even up for doing that.

Rick did not notify us that there was an issue with the AC or that there would be workers in the house. He did refund us that night. Can‚Äôt really understand why there would be workers in the middle of the house at 2 am.

La casita estaba en perfectas condiciones, limpia, muy agradable, ordenada y bien equipada. El barrio es tranquilo y a 10 m. del centro. Las fotos muestran muy bien lo acogedora que es la casa. No conocimos a Ann personalmente pero estuvo siempre muy pendiente y respondio nuestros mensajes al instante.

Check in was easy, location was good in a cute neighborhood.  This is an old home, and perhaps our expectations were out of line with reality, but when we showed up, the curtains were drawn, shutters closed, and ac turned off on a 94 degree day.  Inside the house was around 80 degrees and the house was very stuffy and smelled musty.  Additionally, the listing advertised a smart TV, that when attempted to use, did not work, which is a little challenging when you're trying to get settled and have a 3 year old.  The owner did offer come over and bring a different TV, which was appreciated, but was still an inconvenience none the less.  My wife suffers from bad allergies, particularly to mold, and because we didn't want to risk it with the musty smell, we ended up checking into a hotel instead.  When we informed the owner, they offered for us to look at some of their other rentals, which was appreciated, but said offer came a few hours after we informed them of the smell and that we were planning on leaving.  At that point in the night, it was too late to look at the other options, especially with a 3 year old, and we elected to stay at the hotel.  When we informed the owner that we wouldn't need any of their other rentals, there was no further communication, which I believe is in poor taste considering we were unhappy with the accommodations.  I understand that we may be pickier than most, and we booked the hotel knowing that we would most likely not get any relief in terms of a refund, but that said, we feel like the owner should have handled the situation more delicately and with a little more consideration of our inconvenience and cost burden.  For these reasons, I would not recommend staying at the Ann's cottage.
Very cute place! Warning it is near a hospital so you do hear the occasional sirens and helicopters, but as a nurse myself it didn‚Äôt bother me!

The place is great. The location is great. A bit noisy at times because of party people at the pool, but still cool.   It was the interaction/service that fell short for me. had problems with no towels on arrival, no internet signal for last couple days and construction going on next door condo for 4 days.  Problems  happen, I'm reasonable. It's how they are addressed that matters and Thomas (Ryan's rep) was very nice but ineffective and failed to get back to me.  There's a lot going for this place, but I'd probably try somewhere else on my next visit.

The location of the place is very convenient! The description was also very accurate of the space. My only gripe was checking in/out, parking was a little difficult to get in without the remote. One would need to park somewhere else to grab the remote first (or to return it when checking out)

Your safety is not Ryan's priority. First day teetering cable box fell off the top of the bedroom flat screen, striking my wife in the head/eye. My wife's eye blood and blackened for the duration of our trip. A maintenance an was sent to address the issue and install a shelf. To little too late. We reported a missing smoke/co detector in the eating area and this was never replaced or repaired. During our stay, we looked forward to using the pool in the courtyard area. Tuesday morning, landscapers showed up and dumped all the potted plants on the pool deck which closed the pool for the day. Wednesday a crew of pressure washers were cleaning the walkways and walls again closing the pool. The dirt from the pressure washing filled the pool which made it dirty and disgusting and not usable on Thursday either.
we're not asking anybody to stop the maintenance of the area. The pressure washing actually made the complex common areas very presentable. But when you book a vacation for a premium price expecting to use the pool the amenity should be available. complex maintenance stated that the owner of the property received emails. We just would have liked to have known that use of the pool was not going to be available for three days during my trip.
No compensation was offered for the inconveniences.

Pool appears to be permanently closed. Sign says it's due to covid reasons but all other pools in the city are open, there is no mask mandate and all bars and restaurants are open. Ryan should remove the pool from his listing since this is an ongoing issue.
We were unable to use one of the couches as a pull out because it was so uncomfortable.

Not what we expected. The house has so much potential, but the owners need to pay a little more attention to the home. I won‚Äôt address the issues here to be negative as there were many so a message was sent privately to the owners instead. The area is a convenient drive to places (not walking distance to anything) but the neighborhood is sketchy. None of the pull out sofas are comfortable, but the 1 bed in the home is.

Tried to charge me for dirty towels after I payed the cleaning fee ! Crazy this is a straight finesse don‚Äôt pay the cleaning fee they will charge you anyways smh should‚Äôve got a hotel what a welcome to Austin

The pictures make this place look great, quirky and quaint. However, it was a shell and it was SO DIRTY!! Hair and sticky smudges and splatters all over the bathroom, crumbs in the beds, soiled floors and dirty towels in the cupboards! The floor boards are uneven, and there are cracks in the walls and tile grout. The listing price makes sense, but they NEED a new cleaner... by the time you‚Äôre done paying service fees this stay was very overpriced. Would not recommend.
A decent stay for the price. There were some issues with the lock at the front door, and the master bedroom would get stuck when opening or closing, but all in all, it wasn‚Äôt a dealbreaker.

The place is tidy but not as clean as it should be especially given the times we‚Äôre in. Looks better in photos than in person for sure.
We had issues unlocking the door and had to call because our code did not work. After 10 mins of trying, pushing and pulling it finally opened. It‚Äôs an old house, we did not feel very comfortable especially when we heard a strange noise when lying in bed and found a huge cockroach.
Our son dropped the french press and we payed $25 for it but that‚Äôs fair since it‚Äôs obviously our fault.

The place had Cockroach! So discussing! One of the Cockroach‚Äôs landed on someone‚Äôs face. One of the beds was so uncomfortable every time you would turn the whole bed would slide with you. Just a bad experience over all. Even with the check in. I had to ask for the code too and it was confusing to check in. I wish it was a good experience but unfortunately it wasn‚Äôt.

There was literal dog shit left out on the porch in plain sight.

If that wasn‚Äôt even cleaned up I doubt there was too much other cleaning done.
Great location and pictures were accurate, but the bed was painful to sleep on.

The place is clean. However that 125 cleaning fee is outta control. His wife cleans it no wonder. The neighbours next to and upstairs are nuts. The first night the guy and lady next door got in a fight started throwing potted plants at my door. Dirt everywhere I confronted the man he said oh not me my girlfriend like I care which it was. The guy up stairs stomps around d all night till 5:30 am when I looked at the patio the next day beer cans everywhere so you know. There's a wire sticking out the side of the bed I got cut twice. It was cheap except the cleaning fee so it being in the hood ain't that shocking. Good luck yall.

Though there's a lot of good things about the place - the house is a decent size and the location is amazing, right opposite Zilker Park and the Barton Springs pool, near a bunch of great eateries - we had some unnecessary stresses which made the stay frustrating. The pack and play and high chair listed as included were not at the property on arrival, which made things stressful with our 9 month old, and we had to wait around with a tired baby until they arrived (left outside the door without a knock). We found out there was no iron either, despite it being listed, which wasn't ideal as we were going to a wedding the next day. Jay was able to sort the problems by having the items sent over, but it was disappointing as these shouldn't have been problems in the first place.

Walking distance to Barton Springs/Creek (5 minutes max).
Great food nearby. Try Black's BBQ for sure.
Watch out the driveway is steep! About a 13 degree angle. It was a little terrifying that first night.

Great host! I would come back if I visit Austin, TX again!

This Airbnb was great for the location, and the needs we had. Check in and check out were smooth overall. The cleaning service was still there when we arrived, but the kitchen, rooms and bathroom were well cleaned.

There were only two reasons this wasn't a 5:
1. There were 6 cockroaches during our stay here. We killed or relocated them, but that isn't super great at an Airbnb.
2. This Airbnb gets really hot, and you're not allowed (per a sign in the house) to turn the AC down any farther. The rooms were pretty hot at night. There is one standing fan that helped, but whichever room didn't have it was very warm overnight.

Great location for ACL with Austin vibe decor. The age of the house shows though with an odd odor and a weird layout. Very very small living area with uncomfortable couch. Very pricey for an old home.

It's a nice enough space, but it's not what's represented in the photos. If you're expecting a bit of luxe (which as a professional decorator was what I anticipated from the pics), you will be disappointed. The grass was knee-high when we arrived, the patio needs to be hosed down and cleaned up, there isn't much attention to details (dirty dishes, coffee pot drips, dishwasher doesn't clean, paper towels are cheap and rip in half every time you tear one off, shower water pressure is low, the garage is a hot mess), various elements that need to be attended to--again, details, details, details. Give me two days and less than $1,000 and I'd have the place classed up to the level as shown. Overall it was okay,  we made due, and this might sound whiny, but having made this reservation for my family gathering, I was a bit embarrassed to walk in the door and find that it was not what is represented. I understand marketing, but you gotta deliver on the goods.
Everything was as described, but if you want to watch TV, you will not want to stay here. Intermittent interruptions and poor picture quality made for difficult viewing.
I stayed here for a month while looking for a permanent place in Austin, and couldn't have been happier with the space and it's such a convenient location.
Location was great! Near all the major highway, about 20 mins from everything. This property is perfect for a couple, with how intimidate it is. Nothing fancy, but perfect quick long term rental

Had a not-so-good experience. The unit is in a remote location (away from SoCo) with no shops/restaurants within a walkable distance. The front and backyards were unkempt with a broken fence. The bathroom was way too small (think 5ftx5ft). Wifi was unreliable with intermittent days of  no WiFi. The lighting within the unit was poor. The bedroom upstairs is completely isolated with no windows or ventilation. Also the unit had no laundry machine. So I would not recommend it as an ideal place to live for more than a few days unless on a budget. The only good things were that the kitchen was stocked and that Jason was reachable and responsive about issues.

My friends and I planned a weekend at this stay to relax and reconnect during COVID times.
To get right to it, Katheryn came out of her room at 11:30pm on a Saturday night and yelled at us to "take it inside" and that "this wasn't what we agreed upon" because we were swimming in the pool. At the time of booking, there were no listed quiet hours or pool hour restrictions.
The entire stay revolved around what would make Katheryn comfortable, rather than us as guests. The next morning as we all decided where else we should stay on our last day, since she had made us so incredibly uncomfortable, she creeped around outside the cabin appearing to water plants or do personal yard work while peeking in at us through the windows. Absolutely NO privacy.
There was no sense of relaxation or privacy as she was always coming out to redirect us or message me via Airbnb about other details. As nurses during a worldwide pandemic, we just wanted a weekend to enjoy ourselves but instead we were made to feel so incredibly unwelcome, we didn't even stay our 3rd night. Airbnb has also not refunded or taken any action on the complaints and disputes between us and Katheryn (as I assume Airbnb will protect their asset, which is the hosts who bring in bookings/income).
If you're looking to enjoy the pool and outdoor area as advertised, don't fall for her false advertising.
There was also a cockroach in the bathroom, a large spider in the living area, and a beetle on our bed the afternoon we came back to pack up our things and stay elsewhere for the 3rd night.
Katheryn never apologized for her actions and I can't even put into words how frustrating and disappointed this experience made me.
As advertised. No issues.
Stylish place but not the most comfortable place to stay. Good place if you don't plan to spend much time at the place, but not ideal during an ongoing pandemic.

Some of the pictures are definitely misleading. When I arrived some of the pictures that were on the description weren‚Äôt accurate to when I arrived. The bench-like table wasn‚Äôt there and the outdoor 3 piece chair set wasn‚Äôt there. They also are a little misleading with the bedroom photos as they provide two different pictures of a bedroom when of course  there‚Äôs only one. Also the bathroom had cracks/holes in the wall and ceiling that I think should‚Äôve been noted. The pictures definitely make the apartment look so appealing and I was slightly let down when I walked in as the apartment is kind of smaller than the pictures let on and some of the photos were misleading.
Cozy spot nestled right near the drag. Not busy at all very quite and chill location to unwind after a long work day.

The check in experience was a nightmare since clicked the address took us to the wrong location about 3 blocks from the actual location. We arrived late around 1030 pm.

The entire area was dark and we were fearing for our safety.

Repeated calls to the host and Airbnb support did not help. We had no idea that maps was taking us to wrong location. It took us one hour in the dark to find the place. Despite our experience the host did not have the basic courtesy to check on during the period of our stay (3 nights).
Couldn't recommend any higher.

This listing is a great place to stay at for the price and location. There are a lot of little instances that were nuisances though. When we first walked in the tool there was a broken ceiling tile on the floor. The cupboards were coming unhinged from the wall. There was a pipe dripping water into the bathroom sink. The chair arms were wiggly. The internet was VERY slow. The airbed had a hole in it. If you have any problems you can only call from 9-5.

The location and communication of the company were both great. The place was clean. We were warned about the noise because it is 6th street but this actually was worse than expected because of a street performer (a terrible drummer) that would play right outside the window until 3-4am each night. We had a little trouble with our code when checking in but top trip rentals was very responsive and this didn‚Äôt effect the trip!

HORRIBLE, frustrating experience. This apartment is above loud bars and unsafe homeless encampments, and I should‚Äôve ran out of the house when I first walked in and saw a big bowl of ear plugs. Plus I‚Äôd youre traveling with a group, be warned, there‚Äôs only one adult size bed in the house. The rest are random child sized cots in random places in the house (right in front of the front door...so bizarre). If you like sleep, I suggest you stay anywhere else but here.

This place was OK. Beds are not comfortable, there was mold in the bathroom, the kitchen/bathrooms are outdated, and it super loud since it's on 6th Street (even though we were up on the 5th floor). Basically if you plan on being black-out drunk, this may be the place for you.
Pictures oversell the space
Top Trip sent all the info I needed and more, including dining suggestions and parking tips.  They warned about possible disturbance from the 6th Street nightlife, but it wasn't an issue.
The location, space, amenities and staff were more we could have asked for. You can‚Äôt go wrong staying here!
If you are looking for night life there is no better location. You walk outside and you‚Äôre at the beginning of dirty six.
No satellite or cable, the roku is spotty, the unit is very quiet for the location and there is tons to do in walking distance.  Owners need only to spend a little money and that place would be hot.
There is a large homeless population right by the place.  This generally doesn‚Äôt bother me, but I was a little uncomfortable walking around by myself especially at night.

While this townhouse is in close proximity to many shops and restaurants, this block of 6th street is filled with homeless people. Every time you step outside of the building you are harassed for money- it didn‚Äôt feel safe whatsoever. Also, the beds in the space were old and worn- they had huge dips in them which was quite uncomfortable.

Roomy apartment, in the middle of busy 6th street. If you are looking for a party weekend with lots of nightlife than this is the place for you. We had a lot of fun walking up and down 6th at night. Building felt completely safe even with many homeless living right outside the door. No one bothered us at all besides the occasional ask for money, but it is something to note. Very nice touches provided... coffee, water and chips/salsa waiting for us. The only negative I can say is that the master bed really needs replaced. It isn't very comfortable and the springs are very loud when moving in it.
Average apartment/loft.  Clean but dated, smelled of smoke, and the elevator was out of operation the entire weekend that we were there, with no sign of repairs being done.
Communication was poor
Fantastic space and killer location!

We never saw or heard from our host.  The TV reception wasn't very good and channel selection was limited.  I sent Roland a text regarding the TV issue but didn't get a response.  Many of the surrounding homes had bars on the windows and the yards were not maintained

It was a professional stay. The home is well decorated and furbished with all what is needed. The washer / drier is really convenient when you are travelling for a few weeks as I do. Was also pleasant to have basic stuff for cooking, already there. Roland has been highly reactive and very nice.

I did not rally get how to make A/C work. But the season was still not really hot. The area is convenient to go to Austin downtown (15 mins by car) but is not the nicest neighborhood of Austin.

The whole place was very nice and clean, but there is no bed. The couch folds down to become the bed. Their is no mattress, it is just the couch cushions so the bed is very uneven and uncomfortable. It does not fit two people at all, there is no room. By our second night my boyfriend was so fed up he wanted to leave and just pay to go to a motel for our final night. That is how bad the two of us were sleeping, not to mention our sore backs.

Jeanne is very accommodating; she is quick to respond and is able to work around your needs. I didn‚Äôt realize this studio was attached to a small house (private entrance). Without a TV or radio, it‚Äôs hard to drown out the noise of renovation on the opposite side of the wall. Bring a speaker and/or laptop if you need to feel alone in your space.
Ruby & Rafael never disappoint!  Highly recommend their place - and I know this because I am a recurring guest.

I felt very weird and unwelcome when I checked in. I would assume you would want to greet your guest when they first check in. I came in with my friend and felt very weird to walk into someone‚Äôs house and clearly hearing voices and a feet dangling off a couch in the living room but no one came up and greeted us. So I assumed the host did not notice us come in and didn‚Äôt want to freak her out by just walking right in so I went back out to ring bell and knocked. She finally came up and I could see she was annoyed and then I greeted myself and she treated both me and my friend with a very unwelcoming vibe and was just very rude sounding. I told her I didn‚Äôt fully read the house manual which really annoyed her and caused her to raise her voice. I have never felt so unwelcome by an Airbnb host in my life. I just got a link that morning with a long house manual which I intended to read at the house since I have been driving for 8 hours and didn‚Äôt get a chance to read it fully. I get that I should of read the manual fully so I knew not to make noise like ring the bell, but her rude unwelcoming tone was uncalled for a simple mistake.

That was my only interaction with the host and it made the rest of my stay feel super uneasy and I just did not want to stay there. The place was clean and the bed was adequate and had charming vibe. WiFi was terrible, could not watch Netflix or anything due to the video stream not loading.

If it wasn‚Äôt for that poor quality interaction, I‚Äôd would rated this place 5 stars.

As someone else noted, not an actual tree house, but it is a quaint space. We didn't see another resident in the two nights we stayed there. I'm not sure if there was someone else in the other bedroom, or if the roommate was out. We were nervous about parking next to the house with all the tow warnings, but it turned out fine. Good deal!

Sam's lies In a charming neighborhood on the southern extremity of Austin, with a quiet and peaceful backyard.

Considering the fact that 7 people all occupied the same address it is kept meticulously clean.

However, the number of occupants presented a few issues:

The kitchen is well provisioned but cooking is difficult as anything more than a few minutes in the kitchen may result in other guests asking when you will be done, so cooking is a problem. Guests microwave or quickly use a blender and retire to their rooms. Limited space ( one six of the guest refrigerator) means shopping is a daily requirement.

Quiet time is from 10 pm to noon. Normal conversation anwhere but in one's bedroom is not allowed during this time. The guests spend all their time in their bedroom with the door closed. No late night smoothies. In fact we were reluctant to dispense ice 14 hours a day in order not to irritate anyone.

Sam attributes his constant coughing to allergies. If inhaling respiratory aerosols is a concern, this is not a good fit.

Sam is a pleasant host, very accommodating and willing to work with you if you have any complications and is always looking out for his guests.
Helped us out during ice storm when we had lost power!!

Mein Gastgeber war klasse! Wir wurden so offenherzig aufgenommen und allles wurde genauso hergerichtet, wie es gut f√ºr uns war. Sam hat sogar eine Rampe f√ºr meinen Sohn gebaut, der Rollstuhlfahrer ist! So konnte er ganz locker auch zu dem abendlichen Lagerfeuer draussen kommen - 1000 Dank daf√ºr. Er hat sich so gefreut! Und Sam ist ein super Gastgeber - wir haben das leckerste BBQ der Welt bekommen mit smoked pork chops - yummmiiieeee.
Das Wohnviertel ist wirklich sehr sch√∂n, gr√ºn und ruhig, und eine gute Nachbarschaft.
Also - das n√§chste Mal in Austin werden wir auf jeden Fall wieder dort wohnen.
You couldn't ask for better hosts.
Hard to describe how our stay was perfect.thx Ashley and Adam
Weather event cut our stay short! Can‚Äôt wait to return when it‚Äôs not a snowpocalypse!!

Passamos alguns bons dias na casa da Charm e fomos muito bem tratados. Tudo funcionou como combinado. Est√°vamos com nossa filha de 3 anos e, preferindo que ela dormisse conosco no quarto, Charm foi muito prestativa ao imediatamente providenciar um colch√£o extra para ela. Recomendamos a estadia.

Hey, swimmers or people looking for a break from the heat -  there is a free public 33-yard lap pool (unusual length is further proof that Austin is weird!) just a block down the street in a small pocket park!

Read carefully! This booking is listed as 2-bed, but the second bed is an air mattress that isn't mentioned until the 6th paragraph in the body of description. Nor was it provided in the picture carousel. With the amount of money, I could have booked a room with two actual beds. Not worth of the money! The towels provided to us were not cleaned. There are some spare towels under the sink in the master bathroom but they're covered by ants! The location is quite remote from downtown and UT. This is my first unpleasant and disappointed experience with an airbnb host/stay.
parking is  problematic.  expect to leave your shoes outside. Too over priced  and be sure to double check how many guests to avoid extra chargers per guest.

The house was dirty. The owner was creepy. The WIFI password was something like BigBallXXX. It was gross. I sent some of my employees there for a quick overnight. They had a party the night before...."stains" on the couch. Bandaids and other assorted items in the bathrooms. For 800 bucks a night this place is a rip off. Stay away.
Photos are staged photos. Misleading. Lots of space.  Three patios but no patio furniture at all
Listing was accurate that it is an entire home. We checked-in late and Clayton had told us how to get the keys. We were quite tired and had a good night sleep.

The other reviews about this rental do not support our experience in the LEAST. While you may save some money not having to pay a cleaning fee, it may not be worth it. The linens and pillows have seen better days and the towels are in DESPERATE need of replacing. The stink transferred to me after drying off stuck with me all day and I felt self-conscious that other people would think I had a hygiene problem. There were several burned-out light bulbs, including the one inside the refrigerator. I would like to believe that the owner is improving the property, but 10 years of renovation has been a slow process, considering the current condition of the home. The toilet and shower fixtures feel adhoc - toilet has a dual flush lever yet not functional / shower has mismatched knobs and tub filler spouts. My wife noticed a sticky handprint smear on the refrigerator door, and the food left inside was on the verge of turning bad. There is a lot of potential in the property to become a nice rental with modern design, but that day is a LONG way off...

The pictures were misleading and the Airbnb was smaller than expected. There was also the smell of mildew. The lock was broken (screen cracked, would not lock on exit). The benches by the fire pit were broken. The initial listing did not list a no pets policy and airbnb allowed me to book Jesse‚Äôs listing for 4 people and a dog (for my family to stay for my wedding). Jesse contacted me the day before and asked me to Venmo him $100 as a ‚Äúpet fee‚Äù. I asked that transactions go through Airbnb and ended up paying this given that it was two days before my wedding at this point. My family arrived, Jesse came out and was passive aggressive to my family about our dog (commenting again to not let him on furniture and asking them if they had opened a gate that they had not) and they did not feel safe staying once we discovered that the door did not lock. I was late to my rehearsal and had to help find my family alternative lodgings for them, given that Jesse did not pick up the phone when we attempted to contact him. This has been by far the worst experience I‚Äôve had with Airbnb.
Great place to stay. Needs to fix AC issue. But other than that it was killer.
Totally disappointing.

Overall this house was good. Vacasa responds very quickly to any request you might have. The one piece of feedback is that they do not allow any flexibility when it comes to checking in early or out late. We landed at 11am and check in was at 4. We wanted to drop our bags so we could explore the city while we waited for our check in. While we sent multiple requests, it was declined. We had to drag our bags all over the city for 5 hours.

I would stay here again any time! I had a mishap with checkout and not one time did Trish express frustration in ME. She focussed on solving the problem that I caused.
True character always comes out during difficult times.
Book soon, book often!
We missed a grocerystore but than we learned to use Uber...

Daniel was exceptional to deal with and always responded promptly with no delays to all communication and requests.    The house was well appointed for the price.  I will be staying here again in the future.
nuestra estancia fue maravillosa, la casa es espaciosa, limpia y con todos los servicios no duden en hospedarse aqui.

Nice place
Awesome guy to deal with helped however possible
Good place for a group of guys
Very roomy
A lot of things you would have in your regular home so no need to pack extra things to carry around

Nach 11-st√ºndigem Flug und weiteren 3 Stunden im Auto h√§tte der Start in unseren Urlaub bei Amy und Scott nicht besser sein k√∂nnen. Das Einchecken funktionierte v√∂llig unkompliziert mit dem Zugangscode f√ºr Gate und Haus. Als wir dann die T√ºr zum Studio √∂ffneten, haben wir uns von Minute 1 an wie Zuhause gef√ºhlt. Es war gem√ºtlich warm und die wunderbare Atmosph√§re in dem Raum hat uns sofort eingenommen. Alles ist supersch√∂n eingerichtet: Der Esstisch, der Lesesessel, das Sofa, das Bett, die K√ºche, die Bilder, die Teppiche, die Beleuchtung und all die vielen liebevoll gestalteten Details. Unser Top: Der Plattenspieler mit den dazugeh√∂rigen Platten von Simon and Garfunkel, The Hollies, Duran Duran und vielen anderen. Auch ganz wichtig: Heizung/Klimaanlage funktionierten super, genau wie Dusche, Herd und K√ºhlschrank.
Das "Drumherum" des Studios hat uns ebenso begeistert: Drau√üen sitzen k√∂nnen, Eichh√∂rnchen und V√∂gel beobachten, ein Glas Wein genie√üen. Die Nachbarschaft South Congress war perfekt f√ºr uns: L√§den, Restaurants, DAS Caf√© Jo's nicht weit weg. Trotzdem ist das Moontower Studio in einer Wohnstra√üe sehr ruhig gelegen. Die H√§user rundherum auch sehr nett anzuschauen.
Der Kontakt zu unseren Gastgebern war wie das Einchecken die ganze Zeit √ºber komplett unkompliziert und sehr freundlich.
Alles in allem also eine 100% Empfehlung
Marilyn could not be more helpful and the place was packed with amenities! The next time my mom comes to Austin, she will stay in the same place!!

You will not regret staying at marilyns place.  Not only is the location great,  but you will legit feel at home. Marilyn is extremely hospitable and will  answer all questions in a timely fashion. Dont sleep on it, you will regret it

This condo is in a great location near restaurants, downtown, activities and more.  Jeremiah's communication was exceptional.  He provided a detailed listing of local things to do before our arrival.  As an added touch, he provided coffee, cold beer glasses and a 100 things to do list available within the home.  Prior to our stay, Jeremiah informed us that renovations were ongoing at the condo.  Completely out of his control but he was willing to accommodate us for our inconvenience.  He offered and gave us a discount due to these uncontrollable circumstances.  I would recommend Jeremiah's place for a trip to Austin.
Great place to stay. Very cozy and clean. Only problem was the parking but that seems to be an Austin problem

Accurate description of rental. Hosts very thorough in details.
One review mentioned hearing trains, we heard nothing but peace and quiet.

This was a bit disappointing. The host wasn't reachable the day of check in. I called and messaged repeatedly but didn't hear back until after the check in time. The apartment also isn't in great shape.
Was everything we were expecting and more! Just stop looking and book this home already.
My parents really enjoyed their stay here. Quaint and quiet with a killer back yard.
You won‚Äôt regret it
Exceeded expectations.  Doesn't get any better for a large group.

Sara was quick to respond when any issue came up & the place looked exactly as we expected. The only frustration was the lock, which is bent & took three of us working at it each time we tried to leave.

I booked this trailer for a musician who my company brought to town to perform for an event we were hosting. The place was beautiful and check in was easy, but during the day the air conditioning units were unable to keep the place cool, especially in the bedroom area. Our guest chose last minute to bring his wife, and she communicated with me about it saying that they were very uncomfortable and wanted to leave the trailer and stay at a different location. I immediately reached out to Sara and let her know what their concerns were. It was 6:45pm and I needed to hear back from her immediately because I had to either get the AC issue fixed or find them another place to stay ‚Äî and their preference was to go elsewhere. But there was no response. Sara didn‚Äôt pay attention to her phone for 5 hours! I sent numerous messages on the Airbnb app, and I called and texted her phone directly because she had provided the number and said to text with any questions. When she finally did respond at 11:45 pm, she didn‚Äôt acknowledge any of my frustration with trying to reach her or apologize for the extreme delay, she only said, ‚ÄúThe ac is fine‚Äù and proceeded to defend the temperature she found in that moment which was ‚Äúin the 70s‚Äù‚Ä¶.?? By then it was too late! Since I hadn‚Äôt heard from her, I had already booked another location so my guests would have someplace to go after the concert. And Sara took ZERO responsibility for abandoning her post as the host! The only thing she did right was to give us a partial refund for the days that our guests wouldn‚Äôt be there. Airbnb wasn‚Äôt available to help that night, either! So we were completely on our own. It was extremely disappointing, and we have decided based on how poor Airbnb‚Äôs customer service was, this will be the last time we use this app.
Spacious, funky trailer with all the basics for an East Austin stay.
No Public Review.

I was planning to propose to my girlfriend by the pool but the owner saw me bring in balloons and asked what I was doing. I informed him I was planning to decorate the pool area to propose. He said no - and wasn't allowed to do so. I even asked for 30 mins and I will take the decoration down and clean it - still said no. I even asked all the other guests and they said it was ok. Ruined my proposal that was planned for over a year.

Don‚Äôt stay here. Unfortunately the beautiful professional photos do not reflect the state of the place you will be staying. I was most excited about lounging on the pool deck furniture but it was completely dirty, worn and  frankly gross. The furniture in the apartment was extremely uncomfortable and also very worn and sunken in. The black couch was covered in lint, dust and hair from previous guests. The linens were completely wrinkled which isn‚Äôt a huge deal but the little touches matter. Finally, we found a few cockroaches. I messaged Bill about my concerns and he simply never responded. I did not complete my stay here and have not heard from him since.
I would absolutely stay here again! Bill was wonderful, and the place is amazing. I have nothing but positive things to say.

Parker communicated promptly with us at all hours.
Location was very convenient for groceries and close to highway for traveling to/from downtown and airport.
Apartment not as clean as one would expect.

Deanna gave us all the information we need to explore the city.  Her place is cozy and in very centrally located.  Too bad the weekend we were there the weather were too cold to walk to the neighbourhood cafe and food carts. We will definitely stay there again next time we visit Austin.
Very residential neighborhood that was quiet but not far at all from the bustle of Ceasar Chavez.  That alone was worth it but the space was also very tactfully done!
The location was killer. The amenities were nice and Deanna was quick in her responses.

It could have been a good experience but we found cockroaches in the bathroom and in the bedroom, 4 in total, it was something annoying and unpleasant to have to go through our things so that we did not return home with them. The internet is very slow which made it very difficult to work or watch a movie at night.
Place was nice but over priced and not very clean

I had a nice stay overal, and communicating with Nancy was great. However, I think the apartment is not super clean and there are some improvements that can be made. It smelled humid, there was mould in the shower and under the bed needs a serious cleaning. The bed is not super comfortable past the 3rd day (I stayed for a week), and beware that the shower is really small.

Pros: close to downtown Austin; AC in tent; trees are pretty.

Cons: airplanes are *extremely* low flying and screaming noisy. They come every three minutes or so, ruining the rest of the experience. Kayaks filled with muddy water and spiders, so no boating. Broken and filthy kettle, so no hot water for tea. From 11pm to 1am, a woman was screaming?? I thought it was a murder, but it went on too long. A slasher movie? A sports game on tv? Seemed to be coming from the main house - the people in the tents right next to ours were very quiet and polite.

Overall: wish we'd kept our $200 for the night and stayed home with Netflix :/
If you are going to E 6th, it doesn't get much better than this

Balcony's are close together so if people are out on their partying it can be loud.  As for cleanliness, it is not the greatest when you pay the money that this place cost and the comforters are dirty and place is dusty.  It has 1 bathroom so when that sink clogs up which happened all weekend it was difficult for 5 individuals to utilize it.  2 guys utilized the kitchen sink to brush teeth and wash face.  We feel the value of our rental should of been 500 dollars lower that what we rented for.
Loud noises from outside (they supply earplugs). Two levels. No toilet on first level.

The loft is fun and very clean, has all the amenities you need, but the location is questionable. It will be noisy at night, but more importantly the area is surrounded by homelessness. People were camped out right in front the building, up against the front next to the door at night.. it was somewhat uncomfortable and that says a lot for someone who‚Äôs in NYC all the time.
Pay a lot, get very little.

I enjoyed booking Austin for my inaugural AirBnB booking. I went through the reservation process somewhat smoothly. My registration is under my business email but for some reason I had to put in a personal email, so all the AirBnB reservation emails came through my business email yet sporadic correspondence from the rental agency came to my personal email. After a few back and forth emails we got everything ironed out. I did have an issue with the parking. Although it is buried in the fine print I discovered parking was not included and it was $30 a day. What started as a room rate of $85 escalated to a $350 two night stay. $70 for cleaning I think is just a pure profit grab. Not trying to sound ‚Äúone-percent-er‚Äù but I pay twice that for a house four times that size. Again, it‚Äôs just the comparison that I can base the value on. $40 service fee, I guess i got my money‚Äôs worth on this one. I had a late check-in and an engagement to attend, so I was a little pressed for time. I decided to take a quick shower and before I could get the water to the right temperature to transfer the water to the shower head it went cold. I called and their recommendations were: make sure the H and C valves are correct. Sometimes the H is C and C is H, and, we have this problem sometimes and you should cycle the breaker, sometimes it shows it‚Äôs on but it‚Äôs really tripped... isn‚Äôt this a code violation for breakers not to work properly? Fires start because of this very reason. Anyways... she said this will fix it but to call back in 30 minutes if there is still a problem and they will send someone. I told them to go ahead and send someone but make it after 12pm because I wanted to sleep in. so I guess the reason for my problem was because I assumed the breaker flip would fix the problem but wouldn‚Äôt be able to shower until after noon if it didn‚Äôt. The next morning I get up to shower and have the exact same problem. Now I‚Äôm pissed because I have to use a wash cloth to close the drain (it‚Äôs been disconnected), keep my heel pressed against it so the 2‚Äù of warm water I was able to collect would allow me to wash myself and shampoo my hair. My call after my bird bath was met with resistance, interruptive and argumentative responses. The reason I had to take a bird bath was because I didn‚Äôt call after thirty minutes and I scheduled the service call for after noon. So it was my own fault. It got to the point I had to raise my voice and tell her to stop interrupting me. They sent a service guy up who said the exact same thing: flip the breaker and turn the thermostat up. He said to call...

This apartment was of similar quality as my daughters college dorm. Most furnishings and amenities are very tired but if you‚Äôre in your 20s and there to party, it is unlikely to bother you. You hear noise of returning partiers all night but that was expected. They will requirer your email and that you sign a whole other form before checking in. That‚Äôs annoying and unexpected for Abnb. There‚Äôs no staircase light switch upstairs. Again, if you‚Äôre 20 you will recover quickly from tripping down stairs but no so much if you‚Äôre over 30. They lock the tub stopper - I assume to discourage a bath and there was little hot water. I asked for help fixing the hot water issue and got a quick response. Overall this place has lots of potential with some investment, without it, I can only recommend this to college kids looking to party.
This place looked fantastic but I got sick and wasn‚Äôt able to make it. I will try and stay there next time I‚Äôm in town!
Leak in the room and hard to get ahold of but once we did they made it right.
The only place to stay in Austin. If you‚Äôre on this page, and you don‚Äôt book, you‚Äôre making a mistake.
NO surprises, was what they said it wold be.

Unfortunately a lot of the experience didn‚Äôt have to do with the Lodgewell property. We didn‚Äôt have a shower the entire trip which was unfortunate. Otherwise a lot of the circumstances had to do with the Texas snowstorm

Amazing location and around a ton of great places.

It was spacious and convenient but because of the interior, I wouldn‚Äôt stay here again.

PROS:
Location- it‚Äôs less than a 10 minute walk to the convention center. There are plenty of amazing restaurants and bars in walking distance. There is a CVS close by, very convenient.

Great host- We had a couple of issues during our stay and he responded to help within 3 mins.

CONS:
Inside it was very much a cheap motel. The furniture was worn down and cheap. The couch had zip ties on it holding it together. A lot of the fixtures were loose or falling off. The stairs weren‚Äôt level. The towel rack inside the shower and the bottom of the shower curtain were moldy. The paint was chipping in the bathroom.

Hot Water: only got 1 min max of hot water in the shower which sucked if you weren‚Äôt the first person to shower.

Location: There were plenty of homeless people outside so I wouldn‚Äôt recommend traveling alone at night. It can also get loud out night but that didn‚Äôt bother me much.
no comment
This AirBNB is on the night life strip of Austin, 6th St.  That said, we never had a noise problem being on the 7th floor.  I look forward to staying here again.

First off, the location is great. Right on 6th, east walk to bars restaurants and more. We liked the loft style and fit 5 people very comfortably.

A handful of things went wrong, not all were the fault of Lodgewell. Be wary if you‚Äôre checking in late and chose to pay the extra $ for the parking garage. 6th street was completely closed to traffic and there was construction by the entrance to the garage. Someone had to move the barriers for us to get in.

The elevator was broken, they let us know before our stay. It‚Äôs a lot of stairs. The building lobby has tools and shit everywhere. There was water leaking from a pipe above the sink from the AC.

Wir k√∂nnen die Unterkunft von Claudia und Kris sehr empfehlen. Die Unterkunft liegt in einem ruhigen Viertel, von dem aus die Downtown ohne Probleme zu Fuss erreicht werden kann. Die Gastgeber sind sehr freundlich und unkompliziert, die Unterkunft sehr sauber. Ihr freundlicher Hund Macha hat uns viel Freude bereitet. Ein H√∂hepunkt war ein von den Gastgebern von Zeit zu Zeit organisiertes Hauskonzert mit hervorragenden Musikern, welches wir miterleben durften. Wir werden den Aufenthalt in guter Erinnerung behalten.

Mon vol arrivant en fin de matin√©e, Gina m'a donn√© toutes les instructions pour que je puisse d√©poser mon sac.
Bon accueil, logement bien plac√© pour ceux qui n'ont pas peur de marcher une bonne demie heure pour aller au centre.
Seul petit hic, quand je suis rentr√©e de ma journ√©e √† 18h, ma chambre n'avait toujours pas √©t√© faites. Mais tout de suite son compagnon s'est excus√©, √† changer tout les draps, vider la poubelle et √† tout fait pour que je me sente comme √† la maison.

I was really looking forward to the visit to Austin and staying w Gina. Gina responded by emails timely - Unfortunately I felt unwelcomed by Gina and her boyfriend during my stay. When I arrived at least an hour post check in, Gina was still cleaning the floor of my room. I felt very awkward being around them as they gave me the impression that I was intruding. I didn't feel comfortable using any the common areas except the bathroom (it is shared and located in between two rooms with two entries). I ended up staying out as much as I can and avoided coming back to their place til I had to go to bed. I hate to sound this negative (as I did have wonderful other experiences previously through airbnb). Yet I was truly disappointed by the apparent lack of hospitality.
