There was an odor from the cat box that was overpowering. We had to leave after a few minutes. Found a hotel. Close to downtown. Would not recommend
Host was nice but home had a roach problem. The location is convenient and affordable, but you get what you pay for.

The room smelled really weird and it didn't seem very clean. We felt really uncomfortable and decided to stay in a hotel instead. Also, I wouldn't call the distance to downtown walkable..unless you really love walking.

Gina's place is dirty overall (dirty carpet with debris on it, shower with hairs, dirty vanity with hair and dust, linens covered with pet hairs, bath towels with an unpleasant odor), you may have another AirBnB guest randomly in the adjoining room rather than Gina (wasn't aware this was a possibility until it happened to me), and the pictures are much brighter and attractive than the actual property. I booked a hotel last minute rather than stay there for the two nights that I originally booked with Gina because I felt too uncomfortable staying there. If cleanliness is a priority to you, I don't recommend this place. This was an overall stressful and unenjoyable experience.

Judging from the pictures posted online, this place looked cute & quaint for me & my guest. It looked like a completely different apartment when we walked in. The smell was unpleasant. When we found our room it smaller than I expected & the porch area had a lovely view of a overfilled dumpster (I know this isn't necessarily their fault) it wasn't nice to see. The closet wreaked of ammonia & cat pee. The linens that we're provided also smelled of cat & mildew. We didn't want to use the closet at all. My guest sat on the bed & it made a loud 'crack', enough to make her jump off the bed. We both felt uncomfortable sitting on the bed, much less laying down & sleeping. We didn't continue our stay for the rest of our visit. My overall experience was such a disappointment as a first time AirBnB customer.

Gina and her pets are friendly, but there was pet hair all over the place because of them. This includes on the bed/pillows and in the bathroom sink. The ripped up shreds of toilet paper on the floor in the bathroom and hallway weren't as big a deal imo. The biggest problem was the fact that Gina brought home her drunk friends late into the night. They were loud and made it impossible to sleep. I hate to give a mid/bad review, but it just seemed really inconsiderate, and the place didn't really feel clean. It's a good location though, probably worth the price if you'll only be there for one night.

I am writing this review for Airbnb and to share my unforgettable experience as a ‚Äúguest‚Äù of Gina.
I booked a 4 night- 5 day stay at Gina‚Äôs residence/Airbnb. Unfortunately, during that weekend and my stay a horrific Winter Storm hit Austin that left most of Texas without power.
After 2 days of no power, I took a walk to find somewhere to charge my phone, find food etc. Later that day Coming back & noticing her pets were gone I asked if she was planning to stay in her apt. That night. To which she responded ‚Äúprobably not‚Äù. She did not communicate this prior at any part of the day.
I am a young woman who has never visited TX and who has no family or friends there.
That night she left I decided to stay there bc finding a hotel in the middle of a blackout was nearly impossible.

That night a man tried breaking into her apt.

Prior to this I had a terrible gut feeling and I was scared so a chair was placed under the main entrance doorknob which didn‚Äôt allow the man to enter As the doorknob wouldn‚Äôt turn. During this incident I messaged her to tell her this was happening and she never replied. Until this day she hasn‚Äôt responded.

I was lucky to think fast, grab my things and jump out of the balcony and hop into my Rental and lucky to even be safe at home typing this review.

This was such a traumatic experience, and I say this to let everyone know that if things go south Gina will not be the person to help. She will leave you stranded and not even check in on you. Her actions were inconsiderate and irresponsible and she should not be allowed to be a host. I would not stay here again or any place she chooses to manage.
It was no accurate or at least not to our expectations.

This is not a great neighborhood (bars on the windows type neighborhood ) and I would not walk to the downtown area especially at night. The neighbors have 4 really loud dogs that bark all morning. 1 small bathroom and 7 beds. I was disappointed right as we pulled up. Would have rather booked a hotel room. We had a group of 5 and it was not what I was expecting for a weekend getaway.

Could not ask for a house so conveniently located to everything and anything on the east side. Coffee, food and drinks a block away. East 6th is in walking distance and a safe walk during the day and night. We actually walked to and from downtown one afternoon, but also used Uber for cheap rides to Rainey St and night on "dirty" 6th.  No need to rent a car for our 4 day stay. As mentioned in earlier reviews, bring or grab the available earplugs if you are a light sleeper.  The neighborhood dogs and birds in the morning can't be controlled by the homeowner.
The water pressure in the shower was a little low
Great location but I probably wouldn‚Äôt stay here again. Odd layout, one tiny bathroom, small tv.

Was easy to find and great location but there was things i didnt like about the house. So many bugs and ants in back yard crawling everywhere i left with so many bumps on legs. And pictures i feel didnt show some of the bad parts of the house. Dont think worth the price per night.

If anything I have to say that at least Mel was in constant contact with me the entire stay but that said I feel that we were in touch the entire stay and I mean the entire stay.
Instructions of how to get in the gated community and the house were great. Melissa left for us some fruit and water which I thought it was a nice gesture.
The house was big and perfect for our big group however our first complained started with the house being to hot and thermostat being locked, then we had no sheets on some of the beds and what few linens she had where mostly torn single bed duvets covers that didn't go around our queen beds. We had to make some of our own beds with what little we had for that night. Also she didn't provide top sheets (she explained to me that they don't use them). So some of us had our heads or feet resting on the plastic torn bed covers, gross!. We had not enough towels and they were so worn out.
The following day the cleaning crew came and made the beds and gave us more towels. To say the least that entire linen department is lacking quality or is non existent.

Gr√©√¢t place to stay, one block to South Congress, big enough space for a couple to spend a few days in Austin. Our host was available , However, all our needs were met and did not need anything. All was provided.
No
I am sorry to say we found the place unsatisfactory, it was stuffy and there was no air circulation. We ended up staying 1 night and going to a hotel for the remaining 5 nights.

Felt welcome.  Quick responses.  Problems with the door entrance that temporarily caused us to get locked out.  No light over the door at night(made it difficult to get around. The house itself was spotless, but he property it was on was not visibly appealing.

I hate writing negative reviews, and especially because Kevin was a nice host, but the only way to describe this place was "sub-standard." The most important thing to note is that it really isn't a two-bedroom apartment. There's a bed in the living room. I mean, you could see it as a two-bedroom with no living room. In any case you either have no common area, or you're using one of the bedrooms as a common area. The kitchen is small and very poorly equipped. Old cheap cookware and no spices (not even pepper when we arrived - only salt). That being said there was very good coffee and a coffeemaker, which was nice. Although to add on that, there was old moldy coffee in the maker. The place wasn't clean when we arrived, and Kevin apologized because they turned over the place quickly. It wasn't horrific - there were clean linens etc, but stuff like the old coffee, and parts of the apartment that clearly hadn't been swept or dusted for a long time. The bathroom was terrible - the tub was just disgusting and didn't drain. After a couple of minutes, you'd be ankle-deep in water. If two people wanted to shower, you'd have to wait a considerable time in between the showers, or stand in the other person's dirty water. There was no shelf space for any toiletries, and one hook for a towel.

Again, I don't feel good about writing bad reviews, but nearly everything about this place was bad. The location wasn't even really good - the neighborhood was OK (it used to be the poor side of town but it's kind of up-and-coming) but you're certainly not walking distance to the city. This would be OK as a crash-pad if it was, say, half the price (it's over $100 per night as of the writing of this review), but compared to other places I've stayed with Airbnb, this was far below the quality I'm used to in every regard. I wish I had read past reviews more carefully, and I can understand now why the cancellation policy on this property is strict. I showered at the gym while staying there.

Kevin never reached out to us. I didn't think anything of it until right before we left for our trip and I checked the itinerary to get check in details. There were none, so I texted Kevin. He never responded. I later called, and again no response. Eventually AirBnB called on my behalf and they weren't able to reach him either. It made our travel to Austin stressful as we had to quickly figure out alternate accommodations.

My family rented Holly‚Äôs apt for 5 weeks. Before I agreed to rent this apt I spoke with Holly via email and telephone informed her that we were partially on vacation, but the majority of the time we would be working remotely from her apt. We needed internet and a quiet environment to take work related calls and meetings. She assured me everything was in working order in her unit and there would be no issues.

Unfortunately, that didn‚Äôt happen. During my stay, I contacted Holly several times with concerns or issues that she did not disclose of before I rented this property. I felt she was annoyed and dismissive. All in all, the conditions of her unit were poor and host was not forthcoming about the issues we would encounter during our stay. Had we known all of these issues beforehand we would not have agreed to rent this unit.

1. Washer: A few days prior to my arrival Holly informed me that her washer has not been working properly. The drum on the Washer is broken causing it to make a really loud, unbearable noise. The noise is so loud that you can't even hold a conversation, watch tv, or much less take work related calls while doing your laundry.
2. Apt: no hangers, dresser drawers were broken, dining chairs are flimsy, and the ad said cable TV, there is no cable.
3. Bug Infestation: Apt was infested with centipedes and bugs. I killed between 30 - 40 centipedes a day; crawling on ceilings, walls, furniture, beds, floors, everywhere. I contacted the host and she said she didn't know how to get rid of them and that she thought they were entering her unit because of the rains. It rained 4 days out of my entire trip. She could've hired an exterminator.
4. Roofers: host texted me that roofers would be fixing a leak and it would not disturb me. I told her it would absolutely disturb us because we are working from her home and the loud banging and hammering would interrupt our day. I asked her to be sensitive to our work schedule. She said it was out of her control and could not tell me the day and time they were coming so I could rearrange my schedule and calls. She asked me to call the roofers myself to reschedule. When I refused she rescheduled to after I left. The roofers showed up while I was still in the apt and started during our morning conference calls.
5. Cat: ad said she has a cat living in her unit that was self-sufficient; only needed food and water. I was ok with that. Holly left me a long list of instructions to care for her cat. She asked me to feed him, brush him, apply flea treatment, and apply a medication to his nose. I never agreed to be her cat's sitter. She did not disclose this beforehand. I found this to be unprofessional and opportunistic.

Large place with lots of beds. Didn't feel crowded. Bedrooms on street side a bit noisy at night, but should be expected given its central, convenient location to convention center, 6th St. activities. Minimal amenities supplied. On 3rd floor with no elevator.
the apartment is well located, the photos and description are over evaluated, the Internet access is very bad.

Great location.  Feels like a corporate Airbnb - friendly computerized messages before and after but it was very hard to get any real assistance when we were there.  The instructions give two telephone numbers and two email addresses.  We never received any response to our calls our email messages during our stay.  I did get through via Airbnb message re. unclear Wifi instructions, but I was just referred back to those instructions.  And re. a toilet that was not working, I was told that maintenance was called, but no one came for two days, until right before checkout.

The apartment is really old which you can't tell from the photos. The host is unresponsive and unhelpful. The lock is schrondinger's box and only works half of the time. One of the showers is either cold water (turn left) or hot water (turn right). No warm water in the middle because that stops the water. Compared to everything else, the broken ice machine is a pretty minor detail.

Just the facts.
This unit is in a building across the street from the convention center.
This unit is on the third floor and there is NO ELEVATOR in the building. That was not stated anywhere in the description.
This unit does not match the photos - it is in disrepair, has many missing items (cookware, knives, no hand towels or wash cloths or floor mats, light fixtures with no light bulbs, ) and furniture is mismatched and damaged. Rugs are stained. Finishes are worn off of many surfaces - architectural, appliances, and furniture. Only one television is functional and there is no functioning wifi.
There are safety issues - burnt outlets, missing smoke detectors, no co2 monitors, water damaged floors, loose floor board trim, exterior trim missing from front entry door, and a fireplace that allows water to drain into the living room and under the floorboards when it is raining. The metal circular stair is out of code for railing stiles that are broken off. And one of the bedrooms had a rough edge broken glass shade on the light fixture.
The restaurant across the street has multiple speakers pointed at building playing loud music until bar closing hours. The fire station is on the same block (siren response at any time day or night). Street sweeping on the street is between 4:00-4:30 am.
There is street parking in front of the building and one designated space at building parking lot - open lot, access gate works intermittently.
If you are skeptical about this review, read ALL other reviews and you will see many of the same comments noted by other travelers.

We were told 3 hours before checkin that the pool would not be available during our stay which was a huge reason we booked this apartment. When I asked to be compensated for a main feature of the Airbnb being missing I was basically laughed at and told no way. Then the ceiling split open and started leaking water which continued for the duration of our stay. The upstairs bedroom carpet was sopping wet the entire time we were there because of this leak. He ended up sending me $150 back I guess as compensation for the leak which was a laughable amount for what we dealt with and I will be requesting a much larger refund via Airbnb. The apartment is also very dark and we couldn‚Äôt find a way to turn on the upstairs bedroom lights or the main livingroom light. The main shower for the apartment is either scalding hot or cold. There is no in between. The location of this place is awesome and I understand the leak and pool not being available were potentially not avoidable however the way he handled these issues impacting our stay was ridiculous and I would not recommend this Airbnb for that reason.

Host was courteous and the pictures match for the most part. The property seems to be very old and the AC would not work/ cool the house. It was extremely hot and uncomfortable. This booking was our last night in Austin and we elected to forfeit the room and go home a day early to avoid the being trapped in that hot box. Highly over priced for a cramped property that is very old and has no AC.

Pros: Great location. Easy check in and check out.
Cons: Sheets were low quality, and obviously well-worn. Duvets on some beds didn‚Äôt have covers. Not enough bath towels, no hand towels, and no bath mats were provided. Towels were eventually delivered (3+ hours) after notifying the property owner. But the biggest issue was only found after stripping sheets upon check out as directed and finding a gross, soiled mattress. ü§¢ I will forever more be pulling back the sheets on beds to check for soiled mattresses.

Just to let you know we did leave at 5 am and wanted to clarify some of the issues with the house we encountered during our stay. We wanted to leave, however there was no availability elsewhere. When we arrived I had to clean a majority of the house because it was filthy which took me about 3 hours. Walls were dirty, carpets were soiled and stained beyond belief, floors were dusty and not moped,there was water dripping from the ceiling, the bathrooms smelled of mold and had bug droppings, and the ceiling was falling apart over the stairs. The beds were unstable, uncomfortable, and hard to sleep in. It seemed to us like no one had cared for or cleaned the property properly in years. After speaking with you the first day I found you to be really rude and off putting, you also did not seem to care that we were unhappy with the property. Everything was essentially inadequate you were lacking in a lot of household items such as bed linen and towels. To add insult to injury as I was packing this morning I found used condom packets under my bed upstair

Great location but building is older than it appears in pictures. Place is crowded with lot of personal belongings. Insufficient linens and not so clean towels. Additionally, host has reported a damage that did not happen during our stay

The House Advertised on airbnb looks impressive from inside and that prompted us to book that rental house.
But the house is in a very shady area with quite scary and shady characters walking around. I was with family of kids and Infant and i felt completely unsafe staying and spending night in that house with that surroundings.

It might be a million dollar community for some but it no way looked like with the kind of surroundings the house has or else no one in right mind want to lose 1000$. I was ready to lose my money rather then spending 2 days in that house which definitely felt unsafe for family with kids.
Support from airbnb was horrible with me waiting for 3 hours on phone just to get case manager to look into it. The host was slow in responding and i could not risk waiting outside the house for 3-4 hours with infant and kid and with such shady characters walking around.

Horrid experience almost ruined my anniversary, we almost went home after the first night.

*Unlisted camera on property* probably more than just the one.

Broken glass in the backyard plus huge barrels of gravel, making the already small space unusable.

Workout equipment everywhere, to the point you have to step on it to go anywhere.

The only steps up to and connecting the patios is a major tripping hazard, and where most of the glass is located. It was clearly made to be artistic with 0 consideration to functionality.

The master bed is 3 inches off the floor.

The water turned off part of the way into stay, came back hours later a whitish opaque color.

The handle to the master bath fell off the first moment I touched it.

"Please only sample" is not an open bar. I don't drink but this still bothers me.

I'm very unimpressed, it's not worth the price. This is the most expensive place I have ever stayed at, it was the only time I have considered leaving early
Funky place, walking distance to LOTS of things, would stay again!

Appartement conforme √† l'annonce. Tr√®s propre et tr√®s agr√©able . Aucun probl√®me et bien plac√©. Endroit calme et proche des lieux d'int√©r√™t.
Dommage que nous n'ayons vu personne ( communication uniquement par mail) Pour l'√©change, les infos et la convivialit√© c'est toujours agr√©able de parler avec les gens. √âtant Fran√ßais, nous nous sommes donc d√©brouiller tout seul. Dommage.
Mais ce fut un tr√®s agr√©able s√©jour.
Merci.

I've stayed at over a dozen airbnbs and this was the most organized one yet. Cynthia has everything you need in the apartment and leaves plenty of materials with recommendations of things to do around Austin. The apartment is within walking distance of Barton Springs and a bunch of food trucks and restaurants. A ride to downtown is two miles, but without Lyft and Uber was a bit difficult (Get Me is not a good app). You can also walk to a bike rental shop to bike around the lake and to a kayak rental place. Only downside is that you can hear every move the upstairs neighbors make. Overall I'd definitely stay here again.

The space worked well for a work/vacation visit. The host really went above and beyond - leaving a bottle of wine when we arrived late, offering to pick up some essentials when the weather turned bad and we were on foot during our trip, etc.

Edward was een geweldige gastheer die alle moeite doet om het je naar de zin te maken zonder ooit opdringerig te worden. De studio die hij in zijn tuin gebouwd heeft is een heerlijke plek om te verblijven met licht en je kunt bij mooi weer heerlijk de deuren naar het terras open zetten. De keuken is compleet uitgevoerd, het bed slaapt heerlijk en de douche is prima. De studio was schoon en verzorgt. Ik zou een ieder dan ook aanraden om hier te verblijven.

Great little house. Owners were never needed by us and it felt like the place was our own. Downtown was a drive, but not too far. Great coffee shop within walking distance with coffee, muffins, breakfast burritos and wi-fi. We explored after that.

Julian was a great host! Responded quickly! Check in was a breeze since we had a code to get inside. Home was trendy and very clean. The electricity went out randomly but it seemed to have happened to all the houses on the block. Ashley and Julian were very hospitable.

The location is about 15 minutes to everything Austin which was awesome. The room itself is very roomy, but the door to the room does not close properly nor lock. The front door to the house does indeed lock, but I did find it unlocked quite a lot during my stay. The neighborhood feels very safe and there's a grocery store within walking distance. My only negative was the worn bed. I could feel the frame underneath the mattress. My nights were spent changing positions due to discomfort.
The apt matched the pictures. When something (out of the owner's control) broke, he was very attentive and had it promptly fixed.

I have to say that this apartment should not be rented out, it is a safety hazard on multiple levels. However I will say that Wren was very cooperative. But he clearly is not aware of how run down this space is, cracked drywall, mold, dead cockroaches, faulty foundation. We arrived in the middle of the night, woke up and left. Once I spoke with Wren he did give us a refund. I do not mean to be unkind, but as a mother, I did not feel like my children were safe here and he should not be renting this space. Sorry.

We came without expectations as it was a cheap place to crash for one night. Unfortunately, it was disappointing. We addressed our concerns throughout the stay and into the next two. They have yet to be resolved to our satisfaction. My biggest concern was that within 15 minutes of arrival, my daughter's knees, feet and hands were black! If it was cleaned, as we are told it was, it needs a DEEP cleaning. There was only 1 washcloth to be found for 6 people. It was sweltering upon our arrival, and the overhead light and fan did not work in the livingroom. We had to fetch clean towels from the dryer downstairs and lug a hamper full of laundry up a flight of stairs to the unit. One person tripped going up the stairs as there was no outside light. It was just disappointing even with no expectations to start.
Wren communicated extremely well & helped us out when our plans changed last minute. Plenty of room for a big group to crash at when you are looking to explore Austin.

Hours are limited 7pm to 9 am. First I arrived at 5pm, to see it in daylight. no entry allowed.
I arrived at midnight, after my business dinner across town, and was locked out. The lock code did not work. It was raining & for 2 hours I stood in/out of the rain trying to get in. Airbnb requires that guest waits 30 minutes while Airbnb tries to contact host. I sent 7 text msgs to host & 5 messages via Airbnb platform - no response, which makes sense cuz it was late. By 2am, airbnb gave up and REFUSED to help find alternative place to stay. I had to sleep in my car, in the rain. Airbnb is lame. Host needs more reluable way to let guests into room. I never saw the room, so my star ratings are "3".
Ihave used Airbnb 5 times. Results: a. twice the property did not exist (scam listinfs) & Airbnb faultedme for "not checking it out before I booked", which is stupid because I am traveling, hence need for accommodation. b. thus time locked out. c 2 times ok. that is a 60% failure rate.
Inside pictures is different. Inside dirty and mess of kids toys & dogs hair.

Great spot, I recommend for ppl who want a place close to everything -- walking distance to a bunch of stuff -- and don't care much about comfort, cleanliness or noise. I have very low standards so this was perfect for me, except I think it could have been priced a little cheaper. ~$30 maybe, since there's no kitchen access, the bed is just OK, it's pretty noisy from house activity, , and also a huge fence was being constructed outside the room (obvs the last 2 are situational events and I didn't care so much, but someone might; bring earplugs maybe?). My only real criticism would be that the room was kind of dirty with dust/dirt, which made me wish that it had at least been lightly swept up. Still, it wasn't a big deal to me and I didn't say anything. But just know you're getting what you pay for. Any qualms I had I could just bury in tacos from Las Cazuelas, which is very close by. I would stay again no question bc I'm a cheap bastard. Elizabeth was also very communicative and kind!
Communication is great! But there was a dead roach in the shower  &  I have allergic reaction to pet‚Äôs fur but the price is decent enough just to sleep and go.
Sue was a very nice host and easily accessible. There was a small typo error with our check-in instructions, but Sue was just a quick phone call away to solve the problem!

This is a very cute condo and it's conveniently located near a Target, Whole Foods, and lots of fun bars and restaurants as well as other downtown attractions. But the homeless problem in this part of Austin is really bad and made me uncomfortable coming and going from the condo As a woman traveling alone, I wouldn't stay here again.

The house is big and we enjoyed the lake but we found a few live and dead coachroaches, the place smelled like mildew and noticeable water damage throughout the house. Also be aware of the lack of concrete , its very muddy entrance.

Greg war sehr hilfsbereit und jederzeit erreichbar. Das Haus liegt in einer sehr sch√∂nen und ruhigen Gegend, sehr nahe zum Zilker Park und der Innenstadt. Das Haus ist gem√ºtlich eingerichtet vielleicht etwas in die Jahre gekommen und ein wenig Farbe hier und da w√§ren nicht schlecht.  F√ºr zwei Jungs beim SXSW wars ok. da wir nicht so hohe Anspr√ºche hatten und viel unterwegs waren.

Nice place to stay. My only complaint is that there is a camera that the the host monitors on the front door. It felt odd to be contacted and told that as we were leaving. We werent aware that the host watched us as we came and went. She contacted us about being loud on our way in.

Excelente lugar, tal como en mas fotos
Grande, c√≥modo, bonito, buena comunicaci√≥n y buenas recomendaciones de la host. Volver√≠amos sin duda alguna

Cute, Clean, and Cozy home located in an urban/industrial side of east Austin. Only 10 min from downtown! Wasn't made clear on what we could use in the home: (kitchen utensils, phone chargers, restroom toiletries?) Seemed like the owner kept all their personal stuff in its place. From my experience, Airbnb owners will remove their personal stuff and leave travel size for the guest to use. There's inadequate trash bins on premise only 2 tiny itty bitty cans and no city trash bin outside, it needs appropriate trash disposal especially when you're cooking and bringing to-go food home the whole weekend. We had to put the trash in bags outside for sanitary reasons. In the pictures it appears the second bedroom has a bed but it's a mattress on the floor with a worn holes blanket over it. The home appears to be in the middle of remodeling stages, there was blue painters tape on many walls. Suggest maybe finishing the painting/remodeling first before renting it out to guests.
Ideal host. Everything as described. Sheila is a wonderful person. Nothing but gratitude.
Not maintained. Built in the 70s (asbestos) with wall and ceiling cracks. Broken windows with tape on them. Water damage throughout the home. Mold. Not the idea the pictures give off.

Nous n'avons pas eu le plaisir de rencontrer Ben mais il nous avait communiqu√© toutes les infos pratiques n√©cessaires avant notre arriv√©e. Et tout √©tait pr√™t, propre et fonctionnel. M√™me les dosettes de caf√© pour toute la semaine, ce qui est tr√®s appr√©ciable.

Le logement est tout √† fait conforme √† sa description, c'est-√†-dire spacieux, climatis√© (et √† Austin c'est appr√©ciable, 30¬∞ toute la semaine fin avril), bien √©quip√©, muni d'une salle de bain haut de gamme et d'une buanderie bien pratique.

Quant √† la situation, le logement se trouve dans un quartier r√©sidentiel calme, un peu √©loign√© du centre ville toutefois (une trentaine de minutes de marche), mais il y a deux superettes et un restaurant √† proximit√© et un arr√™t de bus juste en face de la maison.
No surprises. Ben's place was as advertised.

Location is perfect...a couple blocks from the walking path along the river and a couple blocks from the main strips for food and drinks. The space, although connected to the main house, felt completely separate and private and has its own entrance. Would definitely stay again next time we visit Austin
Our stay was canceled by the host 6 hours before check in. Very disappointing. We had to scramble to find a new place and ended up paying two times the amount for our stay.
Only negative was the one pretty small bathroom.

Good communication with Host, easy check-in and check-out process, in decent area in Austin for a one night stay. Although the condo is a bit dated and small the Host has it proportionally organized. Unfortunately it is in extreme need of deep cleanliness, the floors were unkept, blinds and ceiling fans covered in film of dust, the bathroom door and toilet lid had hair on it, and the shower has mold/mildew buildup as well as it does not drain well making you stand in your own dirty water while showering. The bed is so low to the ground that you might as well be sleeping on the floor and the lack of space to hang or put away your clothes and belongings is unflattering.

The airbnb was clean and as advertised. After the stay however, the host called a harassed me, yelling and being very condescending and demeaning. They then preceded to lie to Airbnb about things we did not do. Airbnb knew it was false and ended up siding with us. I had communication with the host throughout the visit and they never mentioned anything until AFTER we checked out. I would not recommend staying with this host.
Tr√®s bel emplacement, au calme. Quartier extr√™mement sympathique. Maison tr√®s mignonne. Tout l'√©quipement n√©cessaire pour passer un tr√®s bon s√©jour. Kerry et Carole r√©actifs et chaleureux.

Stylish modern home in a quiet woodsy Austin suburb. A very private and large room with walk in glass shower. Plenty of parking in front of house. There are some pesky mosquitos in the neighborhood so be prepared.

The location and cleanliness were very nice, however the noise from the other guests was very irritable. Lots of yelling and thin walls so anytime someone took the stairs, I could also hear it. Not the best place for someone who enjoys sleep.

Worst experience ever!  Cat trapped in linen closet. When I checked myself in. Towels covered in cat spray. Dirty, dusty room with old everything. Owner had not been at the property in some time. Left to her adult? son  to clean and run. Empty beer case in messy kitchen. Loud music coming from lower level. He never introduced himself. Beer cans and trash could be seen outside my window on the lower deck off the main bedrooms. Room was uncomfortably hot to sleep in and that‚Äôs saying a lot because I‚Äôm anemic and always cold. Worst night of my life. Did not feel safe at all. Owner could see her son left at some point because she has cameras. Said I should sleep with room door open to let airflow from the main house in. Again, it was late so I coped. I could not wait to get out of there the next day. Canceled my second night. Beware!!!!

Die Beschreibung hat voll und ganz zugetroffen. Es war ein gro√üartiger Aufenthalt in Austin bei Chris und wir w√ºrden hier jederzeit wieder einchecken. Chris hat sich sehr angenehm um uns gek√ºmmert und auch w√§hrend des Aufenthalts per SMS gefragt ob uns irgendwas fehlen w√ºrden. Die Lage war auch super. Binnen 15 / 20 Minuten waren wir in der Stadt. Es war einfach perfekt.

Les √©changes avec Chris et Sangheeta √©taient pr√©cis et rapides. J'ai √©galement appr√©ci√© la rapidit√© d'intervention de Chris que j'avais contact√© par rapport au d√©bit d'eau chaude de la douche. La Casita est conforme aux photos mais est adapt√©e √† un(e) voyageur(euse) solo selon mon exp√©rience. Le quartier est agr√©able et calme.

I hate to say it, but I was quite disappointed with the casita which I have booked for my family in town. The place was rather messy and dirty with a leaking bathroom sink (made the place smell moldy), no toilet paper, full trash from previous visitors, carelessly put together beds (sheets were beyond crumpled up and put on the wrong sides), terribly old pillows, cluttered up closets with random tossed in stuff, broken blinds, little room for clothes (just a few hangers), only one set of towels for a 7-night stay, and no outside table which really defeats the purpose of having a nice porch, especially since the inside is very tight.

While Chris has contacted me to make sure everything was fine since they had some issues with their cleaning crew and offered to bring by more bathroom supplies (which I have already delivered from my own house), this is really something that should have been taken care off before we arrived since not everyone is lucky enough to have family live nearby to bring along some basic bathroom (and cleaning) supplies. Also, all the randomly stuffed closets and broken things go beyond cleaning crew issues, just saying.

Location was great otherwise and it had enough room for two people (no more than that). I can see this being a really nice place if better-taken care of, it really doesn't take much.
Don‚Äôt know what was the most unsettling: The dead cockroaches, the stained sheets, or the unpleasant neighbors

This place is cozy and perfect for a few days of relaxation or crash pad for the ‚ÄúMust See Everything‚Äù type. Air conditioning and heaters were provided to control the temperature, we had no issues. Not that I care, but for those who do, the bed is firm. The parking area is large, fits a full size 4 door pick-up - just watch the telephone pole. There are some small details that would leave a perfectionist disappointed, but nothing negatively affected our stay or the quality of the house.

If you like a bed you literally can‚Äôt lay on without being in discomfort and pain, look no further. The house was nice, but the mattress and pillows are in sleep-able. Also the host will not message you back. Worst air b&b I have ever rented. Also, if you are in a pickup or SUV, save the trouble and park on the street. The house, however was very clean.

Close to everything but something I didn‚Äôt like was that it was not clean like it suppose to. There was ants in the kitchen. No toilet paper in the restroom. Hardly no soap in the restroom. Crumbs were found where the dishes were at. No big spoons to cook. Only one pan but no pots. I found hairs on the bed. It did smell clean. No filters for coffee or salt. With covid a lot of restaurants are closed or just offer take out.

We have stayed at a lot of Airbnb‚Äôs in Hyde Park over the years visiting our daughter in Austin.  Most were great, this one wasn‚Äôt.  Highlights: The yard is gravel and weeds.  The small deck is dirty with a lot of mildew.  Inside the placed looked like it was quickly thrown together.  Tissue was stuffed in an area of missing wallboard in the bathroom. From the bathroom you have to step up about 3‚Äù to get into the living space.  Easy to trip in the dark, which is what happened to my wife...she scrapped and bruised her arm.  The electric keypad is a pain.  It malfunctioned our last night in the dark which was a real pain...the instructions warned it may malfunction.  Not sure why they don‚Äôt get a new one!  Many other little issues. Overall we would not recommend.
Cool spot to crash at.

When we first walked in, the place smelled very clean, like bleach. However, as we continued our stay, we noticed many things that needed improvements.

The shower door has mold growing towards the bottom, and there was even mold growing inside the handle of the shower squeegee. There was also only half a roll of toilet paper left for us to use with no spares stocked anywhere! The towels were old and dingy with bleach stains, and there weren‚Äôt any hand towels in the restroom. Also, there were no paper towels in the kitchen.

The TV would also turn on randomly in the middle of the night, and would blast a show or YouTube video without warning. This woke us up many times throughout the night. The bed is rather firm, which didn‚Äôt bother us as much as the squeaking of the bed frame any time one of us moved an inch.

Parking in the back is rather difficult, so if you choose to park by your casita, I highly recommend having a smaller vehicle.

Chris had mentioned that the cleaner was down to just her for the day without help as her partner was sick, but she was still able to get it done in the time frame before normal check in. However, the lack detail was rather appalling and there were also no trash can liners either.

Emplacement id√©al pour d√©couvrir Austin Downtown. A deux pas de la 6√®me rue et de ses innombrables bar proposant de la musique live.
Propre, trois v√©ritables chambres, deux salles de bains (dispose d'une place de parking), la taille et la luminosit√© r√©duite du salon en font un lieu avant tout fonctionnel pour se reposer. Bien que au rdc, nous n'avons pas eu √† nous plaindre du bruit. Nous y avons s√©journ√© la semaine suivant No√´l et elle ne doit pas √™tre la plus effervescente.

I'm surprised by other reviews. Ryan was unfriendly and unresponsive throughout our transaction. I thought I was getting a good deal so I dealt with it. But the apartment was terrible. Uncomfortable bc unit is on first floor with noise from drunken people and cars all night. Light flooding in the windows all night. One bed was so soft it would bend when you sit on it. Large full size window in front door without proper way to provide privacy. Wifi unusable. And other issues.

Pros:
Great location, downtown and blocks from 6th St.
Check-in was easy and straightforward.
The place was exactly what we expected based on the description.
There seemed to be alot of other airbnb renters in the complex.
It was furnished with everything we needed inside.
It was a tad cozy with 9 guys, but we fit and it worked out great.
Everyone had a blast!

Cons:
The gate is controlled by remote, with no code, which you can find inside the condo; that was a little interesting logistically to get in initially and with multiple vehicles to unload.
Parking is brutally expensive overnight....because it is downtown Austin.

DO NOT STAY HERE.  We had no running water in the kitchen, MOLD growing in the showers, and the place was essentially old, battered, and dingy.  Location was great but it really needs work.  Poor communication from the manager as well.  Do your self a favor and stay somewhere else.  One of my party left and got a hotel room because he was so disgusted with the place.  Cost me another $600.

Counting places my wife booked, I've stayed at 20 places.  This had the most misleading, in ways truly false description, and misleading photos, got the lowest rating I've ever given (and may not have deserved it).  Great location, but sleeps at most 6, and if more than 3 you need to bring your own silverware.  Extremely cramped common areas, despite photos.  The kitchen sink would only drip about a teaspoon every 3 minutes, when we asked, we were repeatedly told a repairman was on the way--in 6 days, never came.  Other items (like air beds, cabinet doors, badly needed fixing or replacement before we came, didn't get it during the 6-night stay.
Not as clean as it should‚Äôve been

The best thing about this place is the location.

The unit itself is in dire need of upgrades. Furniture is worn and tattered; cleanliness is sub-par (mold in showers, bug traps in kitchen, stained towels, spillage on furniture, dirty clothes on floor, burned out exterior lights).

The Unit 321 is in dire need of an upgrade.  The TVs should all be upgraded to SmartTVs.  The coffee machine needs upgrading.  The ironing board needs replacing. The washing machine is slow and loud.  The internet service point should be in the unit, not relying upon the unit in the floor above.
Perfekt gelegen f√ºr alle, die den Zugang zum Campus brauchen. Ruhig, viel Platz, die Parkpl√§tze sind viel Geld wert. Einrichtung teilweise etwas ins Alter gekommen.

A/C  does not cool the apartment properly within a reasonable amount of time, no real ammenities, guest shower non working and the upkeep of the apartment overall keaves alot to be desired. Is in a great location near the UT campus but besides that would not recommend it or its patrons!!!

El lugar es como en las im√°genes, las habitaciones espaciosas y bastante c√≥modas.   Tan c√≥modo que no da ganas de salir del sitio. Est√° bien ubicado y accesible a los lugares de la Universidad y al transporte p√∫blico.  Juanita contesta bastante r√°pido.  S√≥lo tener cuidado de no llevar maletas muy grandes ya que el apartamento es en un 3er piso y puede ser pesado o incomodo subirlas.

Our reservation was canceled day-of due to repair work. Why they were doing repairs on the day we were supposed to stay I have no idea. Three friends and I were left stranded in a strange city without a place to stay. AirBnb was incredibly unhelpful as well and fought us at every turn. No commitment to do right by us as customers.

If you are looking for a place in a West Campus area, this apartment is in good location. Everything is within walking distance.

The host was not as attentive as I thought she would be. The place was dusty and there was still trash in the trash bin. Communication with the host was not as fast as she said it would.

However, the host explained that the dust might be from someone who delivered the bed on the previous day. I'd wished she cleaned the place up before we came.

Getting to the apartment is a bit tricky. Again, the host should've communicated how to get to the right apartment in detail.

Overall we had a good stay, but we had to cut our stay shorter by a day. The host has no cancellation or no refund policy, but she said she will refund if there's a booking. We had an emergency and had to leave earlier.

Value-wise, this was not a cheap apartment. But we liked the location.

This was not the home advertised on the page!!

In the advertisement it mentions I would be sharing a place with Lucy only. The day before I arrived she told me I had 2 male roommates. This was very uncomfortable as I was supposed to stay for a month.

Also the photos of the blue room I was supposed to stay in was already taken by one of the roommates. I ended up staying in the "office"(based off the photos) that was quickly converted to a room and was missing overhead lights, had no mirror and barely any space, since a large "office desk" was still there. I also received only one towel for the entire month! Luckily I had my own. The minimalist/ modern living room in the pictures is not what the living room actually looks like. The furniture is completely different.

Also, the page does not mention CATS. They stayed outside mostly but occasionally, I saw them in the laundry area/garage. There was watering bowls all over the backyard that where collected dirty rain water.

Because the office had been converted to another room, one of the roommates setup an entire computer set on the dinning room table so there wasn't room to eat.

Also, Lucy isn't around except occasionally for the weekends. She came back once and slept on the couch with her 4 friends because all the rooms where taken by Air BnB renters. She also had a party with music playing untill 6 AM.

There was always a funky smell coming from inside + a lot of little Nats.

I moved to the area for a new job and needed a place to stay for a month and none of this was ideal for my first month in Austin. I was able to cut my stay short and found an apartment to move into. Making it the entire month would have been very difficult.

I am very disappointed with how falsely advertised this home was!!

The photos are inaccurate, especially the back patio. The area is not very clean, especially the bathroom. The shower area was very moldy and there were little worms coming out from the corners. The host ignored the issue. She was very responsive at first when I was trying to inquire about the place but when issues came about the house, I was left unseen for months, that‚Äôs why I left the place. The bed was mentioned to be new but it is not. It is slightly broken and it makes noise every time you move.

Place is great- Location, size, pool, etc.  My biggest issue is that the house just seems to be very hodge-podge, and not in a cool way.  Mismatched, old, sometimes odd and slightly broken furniture, decorations and housewares throughout the place.  TBH- at $200/night (all in)- probably wouldn't have said anything.  But for what I paid, and I've stayed at quite a few Airbnbs, I really think they should invest a little more in furniture, decor /etc.
Unfortunately the property did not live up to expectations
Had a grate time staying here lost for words
Not a great area of town. Literally have to walk around homeless people to enter the building at times. Did not feel secure.

You can't beat the location. But all in all, I was a little underwhelmed with my stay. The furniture was terribly uncomfortable. The barstools are practically unsittable and there's no real table and chairs for a place to sit. Not even a desk! The couch was also very uncomfortable. I slept in the second bedroom with the two beds. The bed closest to the wall sinks in the middle. It was so uncomfortable that I slept on the bed next to the closet door and it was much more comfortable. The Wifi was also really spotty. I had to keep connecting to different networks to get a decent internet speed. Some nights it was so terrible, I just gave up. Parking in their garage is possible but also expensive.

This place was very convenient for our stay in Austin. The entire seventh floor is owned and rented out by the same company, so they‚Äôve got a well-oiled machine dealing with any of your questions. The balcony is nice, but it does directly overlook the Sixth Street bars (which are noisy until 2 am on Thursday to Saturday night, but we‚Äôre quiet on Sunday and Monday when we were there). You can park right next to the apartment on the seventh floor of the garage, and it‚Äôs also possible to take the stairs up and down if you‚Äôre not comfortable with a smallish elevator during the pandemic.
When we stayed there, the elevator was broken for a week. It was difficult to walk up to the 7th floor every time

Good location for night life if you're interested in the ghetto part of the 6th street. The unit itself seems to have cheap construction and the price is just way too expensive for what you get. But I was here for SXSW weekend so that could be a reason. But I wouldn't stay here again if I had a choice. And the main elevator was broken when we arrived so we had to walk to a separate elevator.
Great spot. Quick communication. Not happy about the cold shower and lack of promised amenities. Pretty bad :(
Incredible location and plenty of space! 8 minute walk to rainy street!

We stayed here for two nights in March, 2016. The apartment is not as advertised. It is not "bright and cosy". It is dingy and depressing. The windows were dirty, with cobwebs, both inside and out. The apartment (one of two in the house) faces north and is poorly lit even during the day and especially at night. Not all the interior lights were working. There is a smell of mildew and mold throughout the unit. The sheets for the pullout bed were mismatched castoffs and the comforters on both beds were polyester. The vinyl laminate floors are of low quality and not pleasant on bare feet. (They are cold and clammy). The front porch was dirty, unswept, and in need of paint. There was a For Rent sign on the front lawn which invited strangers to peer in the windows and contributed to a feeling of insecurity. The owner did not remove the sign during our stay despite my concern about it.

The apartment is not located near the main attractions of the city and so you need a car to get around.

The cost in Canadian dollars for two nights was $573 (after including the $115 cleaning fee and the $75 AirB&B booking fee.) At this price, the experience should be similar to a stay in a high quality hotel, not a college dorm.

In light of my complaints about the cleanliness of the unit, the owner waived the cleaning fee. She also offered to "release" me from staying the second night but it was too late to find alternative accommodation and too difficult to move our party of four.

I would not recommend this place.
you will not find a better place, with everything you would need, and more!
They can except nothing but the best and more.

I cannot recommend this place enough. From the cleanliness the moment you walk in to the many, many small touches that make you feel at home, Tim‚Äôs home was a standout booking. I look forward to coming back to Austin and staying here again the the future!
Finding the entrance at night was tricky.

Well, this is easily the most difficult review I've ever written on Airbnb and it largely has nothing to do with the apartment itself so let's start with the good. The apartment is as described and the best feature is its location. It's within walking distance to almost anything in downtown Austin and very close to the state capitol, yet in a very quiet area. 2 of us stayed here for 2 nights and we had no problem with traffic noise, noise from neighbors, etc. Everything worked as it should and it's spacious enough for 2 people, though any more than that and you're going to be cramped. In addition to the bed, there is a small futon but it really only sleeps one person comfortably. We did encounter a few negatives: 1) the place could really use a welcome manual. Something that lists the wifi info, how to work the cable TV, where extra anything is kept, etc. There was a small binder with a bunch of restaurant info (a print off from Goggle or some similar browser) and a copy of the welcome email Julia sent me, but that was it. 2) The bathroom door was installed at an angle and only closes if you slam it hard. It had a full length mirror hanging from it so we removed this, hoping that would solve the problem. It didn't. 3) Yes, the parking space is as bad as other reviews have stated. It's between a concrete pillar and a concrete wall and during our stay, a large SUV was parked directly across from the space, making it really hard to back up. We had a Toyota Corolla and a driver who can handle weird angles in tight spaces, but if you have anything bigger than a Corolla, I wouldn't try it. There were dings and marks all over the wall and pillar from other vehicles and if you're concerned about your vehicle fitting I took a few pics and can send them to you if you message me. Regardless, for our purposes, this place worked well, which is why I gave it any stars at all. Now, for the bad. I have booked numerous places through Airbnb over a period of 6 years in 4 countries. I have dealt with language barriers, hosts who work very demanding jobs, rentals in obscure places that require 4 pages of directions to locate, all manner of check in instructions, hosts in different time zones who live no where close to the rental-you name it. And yet, I've never before had a problem. I now realize that's because every other host I've ever dealt with had prioritized communication and treating their guests with common courtesy and respect. I can't say the same for Julia and without making this review into a novella, the issue I had with her was that she wasn't going to send the check-in instructions for the rental until the day we checked in. Fine if you have a smart phone, I guess, but I do not (yes, I know that's rare. Still a fact) and would be driving 10 hours the day we were set to check in. I had no way to access those instructions on the day we checked in and needed Julia to send them the day before, when I would have a wifi connection on my laptop. Prior to explaining this to Julia, she had responded to a message I sent her within 2 minutes of my sending it. When I asked if she could send the check in instructions early, I got no response. 24 hours later...nothing. I tried messaging her again...nothing. Calling...nothing. Had to get Airbnb support involved (first time I've ever had to do that!) and they couldn't reach her, either. Finally, after sending her a text basically asking if she was either dead or scamming me, I got my check-in instructions. No apology, no explanation, but whatever-I got what I needed. Problem solved, right? Nope. Get to Austin, exhausted, hungry, still stressed from trying to park the car without damaging it, lug all our bags to the second floor, go to punch in the key code she gave me in the check-in instructions and...nothing. I don't have a smart phone but I do have a cell phone so I called Julia and within seconds she picks up. And wouldn't you know it? She must've forgot and given me the wrong code! And, gee, she also told me to turn the handle the wrong way in her check-in instructions, which meant I could've punched in as many codes as she threw at me-I would never have gotten in since I was basically locking and re-locking the door with each turn. Now, this could have been an honest mistake. Things happen, issues slip our minds. And had Julia treated me with any kind of courtesy at all prior to this little front door debacle I probably would've chalked it up to that. But I don't believe her ignoring me for nearly 72 hours was a coincidence and I don't think I was given the wrong code and instructions by mistake. In my day to day life, I work with strangers all day long so I know that sometimes people behave in ways that have nothing to do with you. Maybe there are issues in Julia's life I know nothing about that caused her to treat me this way-maybe I was a convenient target, I don't know. But what I do know is that I don't go on vacation to get stressed out and treated like I don't even exist. In all the time I have been using Airbnb I have never encountered a host like this or a problem like this and the only good thing I can say is Airbnb support was awesome-fast, responsive and it was obvious they wanted to resolve my problem. I'll never know what was happening on Julia's end or why but despite not trying to take...

Not recommended for a long-term stay! It is okay for a couple days, but the smell of the place and location will make you regret your decision by day 3. It is also not worth the price. There are way cooler places in more hip neighborhoods in this price range.

THE GOOD:
Had all the amenities you could need. Internet works great. The A/C unit works well. The bed is comfy. Robert was cool enough to leave water, coffee and beer.

THE BAD:
The location is not the greatest. It is about 1.5mil from the Meuller development which has a Starbucks and a grocery store. However it is at least a 15 min drive to anywhere cool. It is very 'suburban' and does not have that Austin feel. You cannot walk to any cool restaurants/coffee shops. You will need a car (or Uber everywhere). The neighborhood was kind of sketchy. I got hit up for change a few times by people on the corner.
The neighbors also play Tejano music and sing really loudly at night.

THE UGLY:
1. There are a lot of mosquitos in Austin right now (from all the rain from the TX hurricanes). They fly down the chimney at night- you can't kill them fast enough! (I had literally 100 bites from head to toe. 25 bites on just one foot/ankle!!) Robert suggested I "wear bug spray at all times" and that I buy a citronella candle. Didn't realize I was 'camping out'.

2. The house is old. It has a "damp basement" smell to it that lingers in your clothes. (Smelled like moldy basement to me). There are no windows to open in the living area to air it out, so you are trapped with that smell. (I had to wash all my clothes 2-3 times to get the smell out).

3. Mostly lit by skylights, so when the sun isn't out during the day, it's dark and depressing in the home.

4. I counted 6 dead roaches. Better than live ones-- but that just means that the home had been sprayed with toxic pest control chemicals. Maybe this is why I had respiratory problems and headaches the entire time I stayed there.

Robert seemed like a good host initially; however as soon as I had some issues, he quickly became uncooperative. I spent $1750 for a 1 month rental. I was not comfortable there and he would not issue any refund. He acted "offended" that I did not like the home's scent or the mosquito problem. He told me to "just sweep the bugs up and move on". He did offer a cleaning service to come-- however this was not the proper solution for the issues I was having.

I had to involve Airbnb for a partial refund since the owner was not willing to work with me.
I highly suggest choosing another location in Austin if there are any available.
üî•

Michael was prompt with getting me directions into his home. We did not meet initially but ran into each other during my stay. The home was exactly as described. Not the best experience I have had on Airbnb.
Five-star stay in the Lone Star State!

The place was in a good location. Coffee shops and restaurants are in walkable distance. That said, it was dirty when we arrived. It was my girlfriends Birthday and we had plans that evening. We messaged Michael who said his cleaners had been there and offered to refund the cleaning fee. When I communicated to him that it was not what we expected and now I was going to have to go buy cleaning supplies, he responded that there may be some there but offered no other suggestions. His response came off as uncaring and unhelpful. There were no cleaning supplies and spending the first couple hours of our stay cleaning the place, which wasn‚Äôt cleaned recently, was not expected after an 11hour drive. There was hair in the silverware drawer, a dirty counter, stains on the couch/cushions, and the stove had cobwebs & grime. It completely ruined that night‚Äôs plans and her birthday. In addition the internet was also inconsistent. Our other Airbnb stays have always been clean and comfortable.
Jennifer is an exceptional host. Looking for another stay in Austin is a waste of time. This will exceed all of your expectations in an affordable AirBnB.

I left here after 5 days due to the number of maintenance needs and pitch black property. Jennifer was nice and responsive but at a certain point responsiveness is less important to the constant need for response. I arrived 2 days after scheduled and had to ask for access code, it was in 40s at night, heater made loud bang first turn on and smelled like burning so had to turn it off and freeze due to late night arrival. Next day she came promptly but decided it was fine. Change filter light was on, filter had not been changed for 5 years. Smelled, no visible carbon monoxide detector did not feel safe using, was COLD every night. Internet issues from day one (there to WFH), lightbulb out day two (had been flickering since arrival) cannot wash clothes in hot/warm water, handmade soaps- no sterilization, property was pitch black, an issue anytime but near winter sun sets around 6. No paved path in rain. Abandoned lot w cars, trash etc right behind. set to stay for month.expensive switch.

The Good: Tara made the check in/check out process very convenient, and was responsive to messages during the stay. The neighborhood was great, and very convenient to highways and S. Congress. The rate was very affordable.

The Bad: I specifically look for "no smoking" accommodations because I can't stand the smell. While the house rules specify no smoking in the apt, the smell of cigarette smoke is immediately noticeable as soon as you open the front door. The apt was also very dirty. I cleaned the toilet and the floor surrounding it but was still unable to get rid of the smell of urine in the bathroom. There were nasty-looking stains on the carpet in the bedroom. Some of the pots and pans in the cupboard were dirty. Two of the burners on the stove immediately began smoking when turned on. There were moldy coffee grounds in the coffee pot. The inside of the fridge was dirty. There was a cigarette butt in the hall closet. Etc.

For me, the bad outweighed the good and I would never consider staying here again.

Joe is a great host! Not only did he welcome us with fresh flowers and a bottle of wine chilling in the fridge, but brought over new hairdryers when he heard that one was on the fritz. He offered us suggestions of what to see and do in Austin; and his location is convenient but off the beaten path enough not be noisy. Outstanding. I would stay there again anytime.
I don't want to comment make your own experience

Listing information was inaccurate to was was provided throughout our stay.
There was no internet TV or u-verse as described, and it took them a week to have us move the TV from their main home to the rental unit so we could use any entertainment, other than 3-4 non-English channels.

Internet was not high-speed, and payment/data moderation was displayed when we were apparently using too much bandwidth during our stay. Our personal research showed we used about 1/2 the amount they‚Äôve shown to us (400GB) again, we are a digitally-based working couple.

Things we‚Äôre broken and non-working, and host had disrespectful attitude when we provided this feedback on check-in.

Value was not worth what we paid and we ended up vacating the stay early.

This is a great deal for Austin.  Very close to the Domain, and if you are heading downtown on loop 1, a generally fast drive down there too.  The place has great new appliances and is really low price for Austin.  It is a bit dark, and the beds were a bit uncomfortable, but it makes sense given the low cost of the unit.

Pros: 1. Great location, 10 minutes away from domain. 2. Very safe, Austin police station is just at another side of street so no need to worry about public safety. 3. Fair price. 4. Air conditioner is very powerful.

Cons: 1. Not clean as expected, has occasional bug problems. 2. Communications with owners might causing some unhappiness sometimes.

What's more Austin TX than a red-and-white Shasta AirFlyte? It was as charming as the photo and parked behind a cute cottage on a shady street just a block from groceries, a great wine shop and stellar Tex-Mex at Maudie‚Äôs. (Plus a cheap, 10-minute Uber to downtown.) The host, Sarah, was friendly and informative and greeted us with an offer to share her lovely back yard and garden, even welcoming the guitar! Add in wildflower season and it made for a cool road trip on the back roads from Dallas.

Couple cautions: although we are comfortable with close quarters and pretty familiar with RV quirks and limitations‚Ä¶this was something of a challenge. Pay close attention to the floor plan provided on Airbnb. The bed is ample and as is the refrigerator, but be aware that nobody over 5‚Äô8‚Äù can stand up in the combination commode/shower area. My partner is 6‚Äô2‚Äù. Ouch. He was a good sport about it though.

Also be aware that the host has multiple signs posted that shoes are not allowed inside the Shasta, even though the floors are covered with mats. (?) I can maybe understand banning high heels or cowboy boots‚Ä¶but rubber soles? And there are no chairs outside the RV to sit on and take off shoes. We simply couldn‚Äôt figure this one out. By the time we crouched on the concrete back steps of the host‚Äôs house and walked to the Shasta, dirt and grass and gravel were stuck to our bare feet as opposed to much cleaner rubber soles. It was dirty and painful and what exactly was the point?

A more serious glitch: the waste tank filled before our minimum 5-night stay was up. We were only in the Shasta mornings and late at night, took our showers at our friend‚Äôs nearby condo, knew to simply evacuate the commode (first-time RV users sometimes hold down the water pedal too much). I can‚Äôt imagine how people who are going to be there all day and night wouldn‚Äôt fill up the tank in at least half the time. The end result was that on our last night, we got back late in the evening after my birthday dinner to no usable toilet. Our text to the host was answered by a flat "No, I'm not home!" and she didn't text us further about what to do or even when she would return‚Ä¶so we had to pack up and check into La Quinta at 1 a.m. Not a great or cost-effective ending to our stay but maybe it‚Äôs all part of keeping Austin funky. No doubt it‚Äôll be a funny story in time.

We wanted a early check in which wasn't possible which we totally understood however the rude response we received from her friend.colleague speaking for her was beyond unprofessional.  Countless times she acted annoyed, spoke to use rudely and sighed while on the phone.  Not appreciated at all.  Additionally why are you paying for a cleaning fee when you are require to wash all dishes and clean up before you leave?  Dont really understand the fee side of it.
Great spot only a short walk from downtown and southern Congress. It rained during our stay but had it not, we certainly would have made use of the pool outside. Would stay again.

As an AirBnb host myself, I was extremely disappointed with this stay!  And I have also stayed at many Vacasa hosted places around the country but this was not like the other experiences. Firstly, I asked to check in early and could not be accommodated. Then when we arrived, the lockbox code was incorrect and getting the correct code was a huge hassle. Overall, for the price,  I was very unsatisfied with our stay.

Pros: Location, free onsite parking, surrounding houses, clean interior to appartment.

Cons: Complex was dirty: overflowing trash cans in outdoor common areas, cigarette butts and empty alcohol bottles on tables, outside of most apartments. The air in the appartment complex smelled of used cigarette butts / tobacco that were decomposing. The apartment complex is dated (and not the cool kind of dated). Stairs were challenging, different rise runs on each set, not to code, poorly lit so guessing the size of a step or drop step was difficult at night. To get to the booked room you have to go up a set of stairs, then down a set of stairs, then up again. Railing was lower than 36" , creating a hazard given the other named issues with the stairs. The pool water is murky and cloudy, and the area surrounding the pool was filled with old trashy sun baked furniture and floaties. I booked with the intent of spending some time in the pool area, but was disappointed with the space and the condition. Interior was clean, but very dated, and smelled of weed when we arrived. Bedding and bed were average, bad pillows (not the decorative ones, those were cute, but the ones you put your head on), the bed was cheap/ rickety. The shower head didn't function - struggled to get water through the head with enough flow to shower. The booking was overpriced, relative to the apartment complex environment and apartment amenities. Would not recommend or book again, unless the price was significantly lowered.

Hi,
It was a nice stay for us. The location is walking distance to S. Congress so lots to see, do and eat. The stairs can be rough with luggage but we are middle aged and it was fine. It was a challenge checking in mostly because it was late night and pouring rain with thunder. However, the information about lock box was a little misleading. There is indeed a lock box which had the wrong code but they quickly answered the phone and reset the code so I could get the key. Actually, there was no need for a lock box or key since there was a numeric lock right on the door which worked fine with the original code and then the updated code. This was a little confusing but they were helpful and really for our room on the 3rd floor there was no need for a lock box anyway. Wireless was a little slow at times but they did have a second wireless network which my wife used with instructions in the room (different SSID and password).

I would stay again and rate them a solid 4+

Dave and Cindy

I recommend staying at this condo because it is very centrally located for many Austin and south-Austin activities. It comes with free parking and check-in/check-out is a breeze. The condo is kept clean and the A/C works well, but does not remove humidity. The bed is not very comfortable and is noisy when you or your partner moves. The kitchen is ready for meal prep. Note that this condo is on the third floor and you must navigate several staircases in order to reach it. The host does not allow Amazon packages to be delivered to the condo.

1. The shower is so loud we wondered what was wrong with it. It bellowed.

2. When it got hot and steamy, out came ants from the cracks in the grout.

3. The pictures do not accurately portray the building you are staying in. Very old.

4. It reaked of the chickens next door as soon as you opened the door, making using the shared porch completely unappealing.

5. When asked for a partial refund because of the above, it was declined.

Not a bad place overall. Great location and has several places to visit within walking distance. Space was clean and bed was comfy. I'd say it's just a little overpriced IMO. but again that's my opinion.

Pros:
Clean space
Close to restaurants/grocery w/ 5 min walk
Cute little house, perfect for two people

Cons:
Need to replace rug in living area (curled up about 3 inches in path where you walk to bedroom, you have to watch it every time you pass through there)
Little to no sound proofing - wouldn't have been an issue but the neighbor right behind the bedroom decided to have a rave Saturday night
Need to replace toilet handle before it falls off
Wi-fi was too weak. Used phone as hot spot to work on my laptop and use tablet

Overall it wasn't a bad experience, but it wasn't stellar either. If it was prices a little lower it wouldn't have been so bad. It's a really nice place but just needs a little attention. Maybe I'm too harsh in my cons, but those things just nagged at me. Basically if it was my personal house I would have rectified those issues immediately - but I hate having stuff that does not function 100%.

I want to be positive but I need to be truthful too. The hosts were very friendly and accommodating. The tiny house is very cute and cozy. It‚Äôs only two blocks to a fantastic breakfast and coffee shop Try Hard. Also a few other places to eat and drink.

The negatives. The bed was extremely small I think a twin, and squeaky and uncomfortable. It had a plastic mattress pad, the cheapest sheets that you can buy, probably 97 thread count, the pillows were flimsy. The house needs a really good deep cleaning and a freshening up. The yard was unkept and the porch was dirty and the furniture was unusable. My girlfriend went to sit on a chair and the legs wobbled so badly she almost fell off the porch. From the street the main house looks abandoned. I am sad to write these negative comments but I feel it‚Äôs necessary to my fellow travelers to know what they are really getting.

The posting advertised a queen bed. It is not. It is a full (53‚Äù). One of us had to sleep in the loft twin bed.
The house is dated and in need of some attention. The outdoor space looks nothing like the posting. Pots are empty or filled with weeds.
Be aware the main house is very close. The space in between is messy. There are a lot of cats hanging out here.
The location is great and walking distance to many things.
Good for the money. Wasn‚Äôt as roomie or as modern as I assumed it would be from the pictures, but all I needed was a place to crash for the night!

Our trip to Austin could have been a disaster. Due to the recent flooding, our flights were cancelled, rental cars sold out, and we arrived in DFW instead of Austin. The last thing you want to worry is a place to stay and Jonathan and Emily ensured that was one thing off our minds.

Definitely recommend both of them as your hosts while in Austin
If/when I come back this is the spot I will book! Great location but not loud. Nice house with space and backyard!

We had a wonderful stay. Jonathan left a list of local recommendations. There was a Keurig machine, fully stocked coffee bar and a beer in the fridge at check in. We felt very safe with a gated driveway that could fit two cars. The house itself was perfect size. We even had enough space to have grandma over for breakfast one day. I had read in previous reviews about road noise. If you are a light sleeper this could definitely be an annoyance but it was never so bad I needed to use the earplugs I brought just in case.

Host was very pleasant until the day I arrived in town. Apparently neighbors were alarmed that I'd visited prior to my stay and parked in the (wrong) parking spot. When I arrived at the airport in Austin, I received a message admonishing me to " During your stay, restrict yourself to only my condo unit while conducting yourself with modesty and quiet." Since I'd explained my reason for the stay was post-surgery recovery, I'm not sure why Rita thought I'd be entering other homes in a loud and immodest fashion. When I visited, I wore cargo shorts and a Hawaiian-style shirt, which I thought would be consistent with Austin-area sartorial standards. If she had Rita had not waited until the day I arrived at the airport to let me know her concerns, I might have worked something out (or canceled in time to get a full refund). This last-minute change in her tone led me to cancel, and cost me around $400.

The amenities list was somewhat misleading - there is no TV *in the private room.=,* and I'm not clear that the bathroom was private - i.e. exclusively for the guest's use. Prospective visitors would be wise to clarify any concerns well in advance.

The location is on the suburban west-side of Austin and mostly residential, however if you just need a place to sleep, the price is quite low, and may be suitable for someone on a budget.

Dawn‚Äôs place was clean and quaint. It rained a lot while we were in town so it was difficult with the mud outside. We never met Dawn but the place was quiet and we were unbothered by neighbors and noise.
No fuss, no muss. Very convenient, immaculate, quiet. What more could you ask for?

Die Unterkunft bietet bequem Platz f√ºr 5-6 Leute. Die K√ºche ist super ausgestattet.
Kim antwortet sehr schnell.
Gerne wieder.
Beds were not as comfortable as expected. Online pictures did not reflect the quality of the house.

You won‚Äôt be disappointed staying here. Well appointed with attention to detail.
Would book again.
I think it's asking me for 2 reviews because my booking was broken into two pieces.  Ditto all the things in the earlier review!! Stay here. You wont' regret it!

L‚Äôendroit est tr√®s mignon, agr√©able et calme. Le bus est tr√®s bien pens√© il y a tout le n√©cessaire et c‚Äôest tr√®s propre ! Tr√®s bien plac√© pour visiter Austin et Benjamin est tr√®s agr√©able !

We were hopeful that this would be an unique dwelling to stay in, and we were very disappointed at the conclusion of our stay. The toilet connects to a septic tank which leaks a horrible odor to the whole bus all night long. After a few days of sneezing, coughing, and watery eyes we realized there was an exorbitant amount of mold growing on the rear AC which was exposing us to mold spores. We cancelled the last night of our stay and immediately go in contact with Customer support, as I had been greatly affected by this mold and AC is necessary during the summer in TX. The host refused to refund the last night despite the condition of the AC unit which is incredibly disappointing. I would avoid this place even if you are trying to save some money.
SO DAMN COMFY.
If you want a unique stay...look no further! Great hospitality and truly  a hidden gem!!

the place was nice, clean and accurate - but we didn't vibe with Ruby for some reason, and I felt a bit stressed trying to follow all her rules.  Communication felt passive aggressive. it might have just been me - my fault for not bringing it up with her directly.

I paid $153.00 on a Satusday night  no where near the domain, atleast not close enough to advertise and charge for living in the areA.  There was one roll of toilet paPper IN THE WHOLE APARTMENT ,615-730pm

The place is small but sufficient for our stay. The furniture in living area and bedroom different than pictures and we were not provided with pool access. The hosts did not inform us prior to arrival nor at booking that the pool keys were lost.

Not as described. This is an not a gorgeous condo it is an efficiency apartment at best.  The furniture pictured is not what you get.  The living room had a broke down futon and stained love seat that also wasn‚Äôt comfortable.  The mattress on the bed is very low to the ground unlike what is pictured and lumpy.
