The top sheet was stained on the top right.  The bathroom has a disgusting bathtub that was dirty and stained.  I took pictures and wish I could load them.  The whole place just seemed dirty and grimy.  There is a washing machine but it is a front loader and the seal was gross and black around the edges.  The apartment complex seems shady I seen a person on the property smoking marijuana and one was on a balcony close to me as I could smell it in the one I rented.  They had the nerve to ask me to pay an extra $75 dollars for cleaning as they stated the apartment smelled like marijuana.  I was offended and quite upset as the the apartment wasn‚Äôt clean to begin with and not as pictured or described.  I was there as little as possible due to the conditions.

This Airbnb is located in North Austin, very close to downtown and other restaurants and shopping areas. Great location!

On the down side, the bed and sofas were SO uncomfortable that my back was hurting after a weekend stay.
Make sure you bring water/snacks/food! The fridge was empty, which I expect of course, but there was no water and I think every hotel or Airbnb should at least have water to drink.

Just my thoughts!
Quiet condo! No traffic noise! Slept well!

Ivan and Christina‚Äôs place was great! Check in and out was easy and the spot was ideally located. My only complaint was that the bed was slightly uncomfortable but that didn‚Äôt ruin my overall experience.
Cool apartment close to downtown & domain , the ac is bomb specially in this  heat !!!

It‚Äôs my own fault. Went for inexpensive and got cheap instead. A tired little apartment, would never had called it a condo. Keurig and coffee would have helped   A decent extra blanket would too, not a $5 Walmart throw. Place was clean. Bed okay.

Place was immaculate when we checked in. The linens, toiletries and kitchenware were all high quality. When a problem arose (which was not of David's doing), his response was quick and appropriate. With family who moved to Austin, wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

Dave hat ein super schoenes Haus, in dem wir uns total wohl gefuehlt haben. Die Garten ist eine gruene Oase, und wir haben auf der Veranda trotz Regenschauer die Natur genossen. Dave ist sehr entspannt und ein aufmerksamer Gastgeber, der uns auch mit vielen Informationen versorgt hat. Die beiden Schlafzimmer sind grosszuegig, sauber und sehr huebsch eingerichtet. Wir haetten es nicht besser treffen koennen!
Had the cancel my stay but Jinny was very understanding.
Very inconvenient and canceled because I didn't have reviews after confirming

Although this is a very nice neighborhood, this property did not meet any kind of our expectations and pictures are misleading. We arrived without receiving our check in instructions and wondered around until a family member was able to pry open the side gate for us. The guest house door would only lock from the inside and the ‚Äúpersonalized code‚Äù never worked.
From the 2nd day onwards, we weren‚Äôt able to enjoy the pool or hot tub due to lack of cleanliness (green algae) and poor operation of both pool and spa. My husband even had to pick up shot glasses around and IN pool.
The host was not home our entire trip. And when I had finally had enough and complained I got some money back but no apology until a few days after our trip.

Cute space. My wife and I loved the location. Kinda close to the heart of the city but just far enough away to be less congested.

One warning: on Sunday night there were two long and loud trains that passed by that lasted over five minutes. It‚Äôs was seriously loud and disrupted my sleep before a very important job interview in the morning. If you don‚Äôt mind loud trains waking you up, then this place is dope. Probably not the best choice for business.

Pros: quiet, fairly large space, comfortable bed, about 10 min drive (w/o traffic) to downtown, very cheap for 2 bed/ 2 bath place

Cons: on the older side, was clean but not perfectly clean when I arrived, you'll get charged city hotel tax (this is completely legit but no other airbnb I stayed at in Austin did this).

Bottom Line: the place is not new and fancy, but it has parking (carport), was quiet and more than enough for all my needs.

This place was fine for a few days however I was pretty disappointed in a few things. First of all, I stayed here during the coronavirus pandemic to visit family that needed help. The owners assured me they were going to clean the place extremely thoroughly and made me wait over 1.5 hours past the agreed upon check in time in order to ‚Äúdeep clean‚Äù. However, when I got there there were parts of the house that had not even been touched (I took photos to prove), the owner was there cleaning without a mask and gloves, so I had to disinfect the whole place myself. The shower was full of bugs before I used it. Plus there were knives in the drawer that were supposed to be clean and were covered in a sticky mess. The sponge was moldy and there wasn‚Äôt even a new one to replace it with. Yuck! Second, there is no mention in this listing that there is not a TV. Would be fine otherwise but during stay at home order, pretty inconvenient. Third, they do say that the oven does not work, however they claim to have a toaster oven. This is NOT true either. They have a regular toaster and zero oven capabilities. Finally, I gave the owners a chance to redeem themselves before I wrote a negative review. Followed up again before writing this and I got zero response from them. No apologies. No compensation for my troubles. Just completely ignored. This place is probably fine during a regular time, but I do not recommend while coronavirus is an issue. I will say they have a beautiful backyard.
No comment.
The only negative thing I would say would be no access to a washer/dryer. If i was staying longer, I would have definitely needed that washer and dryer.

L'emplacement est juste parfait! Nous sommes venu de France, c'est l'endroit id√©al pour d√©couvrir Austin sans se prendre la t√™te. La plupart des activit√©s son possible √† pied (m√™me si les am√©ricains vous diront de prendre la voiture:), le capitole, les mus√©es, la vie nocturne, les restaurants... tout est disponible autour du loft.

Great place with plenty of room for 5-6 people. The location is great, walking distance to all of the local spots and right by a bicycle rental stand for those further trips. I would recommend this place to others and would stay here again on another trip to Austin! Two minor things, but not things that would keep me from coming back, if you are having more than say 3 people, the lack of a second bathroom or at least a half bath can cause a minor inconvenience. Also, for light sleepers, you are right on 6th street so it is loud at night but you expect that staying in this location.

If you want to stay in the middle of downtown Austin it‚Äôs hard to beat the location of these apartments. It is important to note that these are not luxury apartments. Inside there are a lot of funky damaged walls and floorboards and overall you can tell it‚Äôs an old building that has had layers of paint added. Top Trip Rentals did a great job but for anyone used to staying at a luxury rental this might be a shocking experience given the motel-like quality of the interior.

If you want to sleep while you are in Austin do NOT book here. We stayed during an off season weekend in Austin. There were no music festivals or special events going on, which makes me believe it would be even worse during a big event weekend.

Music blasts from the street through the night until early hours of the morning. Sirens go off frequently and can be clearly heard in the apartment. From the interior of the building, drunk parties run, yell, scream and cheer in the hallways at all hours of the night. Because of all the hallway noise, the lower level of this apartment is an unacceptable space to sell as a sleeping area. The noise from other guests was so disturbing we had to move two mattresses out of the front room to the living room floor to sleep, which only helped slightly with hallway noise and was worse for hearing loud music blasting from the street. We wore earplugs the entire time and it was still extremely loud.

In addition to the noise, there was an AC pipe dripping into the kitchen the entire stay. We called about it and were told it would be serviced. It was not. The AC unit is very loud throughout the entire apartment. With the other noise, this is low on the negatives list, but worth mentioning.

I have never had to submit a bad review to Airbnb, but unfortunately this one is warranted. If you want to party all weekend, loud drunk 20-somethings don‚Äôt bother you and sleeping is not on the agenda, this rental could work for you. Unfortunately for me and my guests, this was not the case. This apartment should not be wrongfully marketed as a nice place to stay in Austin, but as the drunken party rental that it is.

We made a very late (as in, the same day) booking into this AirB&B apartment, as the one we had booked into had an AC supply failure and we were stuck. This is an apartment block right downtown, and I mean RIGHT DOWNTOWN, Austin on 6th Street. Some of the apartments are privately owned, some rented on a long term basis, and some for sort term lets. Out unit, 508, was the last unit on the corridor next to the laundry room. I can highly recommend it as it is the furthest away from 6th Street noise that one can get.
The "host", Chereen, was great in all matters, the apartment was as advertised. Everything provided as stated in the description. So no complaints at all.
The only issue with the apartment is that there is only one bathroom, which can become inconvenient for 4+ people. Also, only the one bedroom is private, the other two sleeping areas are open - one immediately when you walk in, the other on the second floor outside the bathroom. If there are 2 couples, you have to know each other rather well...
The noise from 6th Street can be disturbing, and earplugs are provided!
Austin isn't a cheap place to visit, and this apartment was over $200/night. For a couple there are cheaper hotels, but you don't have the convenience of a kitchen and a large living room.
I would stay here again.
Convenient location!  Host mentions the possibility of noise due to proximity of 6th street nightlife but it didn‚Äôt bother me at all.

Stephanie was very friendly, communicated well, and was forgiving on our misunderstanding regarding the check out time. I wish the reviews would have been more accurate or descriptive mainly on the bedroom and bathroom, with an emphasis on the bathroom. There were mildew stains on the Silicon around the tub, dirty Grout lines (had to purchase shower slippers to feel ok with using the shower), a makeshift bamboo stick acting as a lock for the door, the window frame was dirty.   The reviews were accurate with regards to the extra toiletries and the window a/c unit working well in the bedroom. My boyfriend didn't mind the powerful insense type of smell throughout the house but it did overwhelm me.  The entrance to the shared driveway had a steep entry point, wasn't an issue luckily as we had driven our truck versus our car.  I guess what left the worst taste in our mouths was the following night we stayed in a 3 out of 4 stars Red Roof Inn about 4 miles away for the same price we paid for our Air B&B experience... we kind of kicked ourselves for not going there to begin with.

Great location but very disappointed we didn't have a key to lock the door, bathroom was never cleaned, couldn't work the TV.  But the biggest was the fact the alarm in the main house went off most of the day and the police showed up asking us to get out of the house with our hands up.  We ended up getting out of the house because of the sound of the alarm.  Was unable to reach the owners to get these things resolved.

Sleeping in this place is like participating in that show fear factor. You will arise in a sea of cockroaches biting you and crawling on your face. Your complaint will yield a response such as "we know we have roaches but we use spray to keep them at bay." I didn't know air bnb allowed people to host with roach infestations? There was definitely mold in the house but air bnb refused to inspect it, instead they claimed it was dirt without using any sort of official tool that can capture metrics about mold spore density. I am sensitive to mold, I could see it growing out of the vents, I don't think the support guy at air bnb knew what mold looks like. That being said I should have looked at the place in person before I rented it because it was clearly a dump. There was an unemployed alcoholic that lived there who would always be hiccuping and complaining about his DUI. I could not stand to stay in the place for more than 3-4 days. I would not recommend staying here unless you are very poor and need a long term hotel room sort of thing,  just remember there is no toilet paper or water, so you will have to bring your own. This was the worst experience I have had with Air BnB and I don't think I will be using it again. Watch out!

UNSAFE AIRB&B!

I literally had to kill a scorpion and multiple large cockroaches by my bed downstairs!! The pictures are misleading and are uploaded from loooong ago. The house is packed with the families items and is unclean. This leads to the cockroaches. The hottub is also broken but is advertised as an extra amenity. The host and his family are very nice people, but it‚Äôs infuriating to think my dog could have been killed by a scorpion in my room. This house could be a great airb&b if it was cleaned and decluttered. This is an extremely honest review because I don‚Äôt want people to drive across the country like I did only to have their trip ruined.

The place was like described, the check-in and check out easygoing.
Everything was prepared and the welcome tag with our names on it was very nice.
The only issues were, that the small bed in the second sleeping room was kind of uncomfortable (seemed crooked when I was lying in it) and somebody was snoring next room, which was really annoying.

This is a no-frills stay in a location that is perfect for just crashing and saving money. There is no room in the space to eat a meal or really hang out; not a lot of natural light or air, so hanging out indoors is not pleasant. The neighborhood is not picture-eque or walkable except to Family Dollar/Taco truck - and I felt a little on edge doing so. However, if you just need a place to crash that's convenient to downtown, great hikes, and the airport - this is a great choice. The hosts couldn't be nicer. They went out of their way to make us feel welcome, but also left us completely alone. The place is very private. It has all the essentials - full bathroom + kitchenette with coffee and fridge (just note there's no where to eat).
This was just as described on the Airbnb site, not hidden fees, clean and centrally located to a lot of stuff. Would stay again no questions asked.

Die Unterkunft liegt in der N√§he des Flughafens. Es ist sehr ruhig. Man ist in einer halben Stunde beim Capitol. Dort finden gratis F√ºhrungen statt.
Der Check in hat sehr gut funktioniert und wir waren unabh√§ngig.
Todo genial, la anfitriona es muy atenta y las instalaciones son inmejorables. Repetir√≠amos sin dudarlo

Estuve Con una familia de 4 en la casa de Priscilla. La casa tiene todo lo que se necesita para pasar un tiempo agradable. No necesitamos nada extra en ese tiempo.

Ich war mit einer 4-k√∂pfigen Familie bei Priscilla zu Hause. Das Haus hat alles, was man braucht, um eine angenehme Zeit zu verbringen.

Hostess did not greet us upon arrival.  Home was as advertised and neighborhood was ok.  There was an emergency situation and hostess was unable to be contacted.  I would suggest an emergency contact phone number be given to future guest.
The location cannot be better for an authentic Austin experience!!!!
A must stay in Austin! Just a block away from South Congress Street, where there is plenty to do. The place was spotless and much bigger than expected! Would stay here again in a heartbeat!

We stayed here for a family wedding celebration happening at a venue on South Congress. We did run into some troubles with a water leak in the kitchen, which I cleaned up upon arrival - the hosts were responsive and accommodating to the challenges.

PROS:
Location, location, location - this bungalow is easily walkable to all South Congress and First ave eateries
Responsiveness - The team was very communicative through some hiccups we had upon arrival (aforementioned water leak) and accommodating to our needs from shutting off the kitchen water like bringing in bottled water for us to drink.

CONS:
Access - We arrived after dark, and the pathway in from the street was incredibly dark with several plants/toys in the walkway; and we had to move trash cans from in front of the access gate.
Cleanliness - Due to covid, we wipe down surfaces and high-touch areas when we arrive anywhere we stay. Upon arrival, my husband wiped up about a months worth of dust off the plantation shutters on the main door. When I sat on the loveseat, I saw cobwebs and a dead cockroach under a chair in the sitting area.
Bed/pillows - If you like a really soft bed, and non-fluffy pillows, then this place is for you. We ended up going home a day early just to sleep in our own bed again.
Clean and quiet. No elevator to get to the second floor. 4 blocks from Congress so plenty of food choices

Wir waren beim SXSW im German Haus als Aussteller f√ºr innovative Industrie vertreten. BigRep ist Hersteller des weltweit gr√∂√üten 3D Druckers mit Hauptsitz in Berlin. Da wir mit 4 Personen unterwegs waren, h√§tte ein Hotelaufenthalt unser Budget gesprengt und somit haben wir uns f√ºr eine Airbnb Unterkunft entschieden.
Ich muss gestehen, dass ich anf√§nglich, auf Grund der Lage etwas skeptisch war, da sich das Festival in Downtown befand. Aber bereits bei der Buchungsanfrage wurde ich von der Freundlichkeit und Hilfsbereitschaft der Texaner und im speziellen von Kurt, unseren Vermieter, in den Bann gezogen. Die gesamte Vorabkommunikation verlief problemlos und sehr gastfreundlich. Kurt hat uns alle Informationen, wie Zugangspincode, Wifi Zugang, Hausordnung etc. vorab zukommen lassen. Somit mussten wir nicht einmal eine pers√∂nliche √úbergabe vereinbaren, sondern konnten das Haus zum vereinbarten Termin einfach beziehen. Trotzdem stand Kurt jederzeit zur Verf√ºgung und erkundigte sich, ob wir gut gelandet sind und alles unseren Vorstellungen entspricht. Als ich dann vor dem Haus stand und nach 14 Stunden Flug das Haus betrat, f√ºhlte ich mich gleich total zu Hause.
Das Haus ist mit 3 Schlafzimmern, 2 B√§dern, einer gro√üen K√ºche mit Insel und Wohnzimmer ausgestattet. Es ist sehr liebevoll eingerichtet und macht einen hochwertigen Eindruck. Die K√ºche war mit allem ausgestattet und somit bat sich die M√∂glichkeit selbst zu kochen. Nach einem vollen Arbeitstag "nach Hause" zukommen und sich frei bewegen zu k√∂nnen, mal mit den Kollegen im Garten zu sitzen und das gemeinsame Abendessen zu genie√üen, macht einen dienstlichen Auslandsaufenthalt so viel angenehmer. Das Haus liegt zwar ca. 15min. Autofahrt von Downtown, aber die Atmosph√§re, Wohnqualit√§t sowie das Preis-Leistungsverh√§ltnis entsch√§digen daf√ºr.
Wer also in Austin eine Bleibe sucht, dem sei das Rosedale House von Kurt w√§rmsten empfohlen. Sie werden es genie√üen und es lieben lernen.

Not a terrible place to stay, but most definitely not a luxury either. There is almost no furniture. If you plan on cooking meals be aware that you will be eating on a gold out table and wobbly folding chairs. We opted to go out. The bed in the smaller bedroom is very uncomfortable and if you are planning on four people to stay, one should be prepared for a couch. The TV has no cable box or antenna, so that makes the TV useless. The shower has a large moldy hole above it, so that was gross. Otherwise decent location, good amenities in the complex.
Adam has a really cool place. Its clean and even has a rack for bech press and squat (I didn't happen to use). But thats hella ill

We really deliberated over writing this review. Because we do not have a lot of experience with Airbnb's, we sought the opinions of friends and family to see if our expectations were unrealistic or whether we were on target about our issues.

There were some good points about the house. A yard as well as a small park across the street for our dog, a washer and dryer in the garage. Because our stay was lengthy, these were important factors for us. We stayed a total of 9 weeks. The location was good and the neighborhood was quiet.

I will not go into every single detail about what was wrong with the house. But there are general and specific points that need to be made. It was old and not well taken care of, furniture was very dated, and it looked like everything had been around for awhile. Amenities were at a minimum; NO garage door opener (What!?) which is a huge hassle when you are coming and going all day long. They stored some of their personal belongings in the ONE car garage (bike, wood, etc.) which made it difficult for us to store our own stuff and park our car. Internet was 3 mb/s which made it pretty hard for my husband to work from the house. In our minds, although not exactly impressed by these factors and somewhat inconvenienced, we COMPLETELY understand that these are not issues that warrant a terrible review but certainly bring it down a couple of notches. HOWEVER, that said, there were other things that, in our opinion, were not acceptable.

Our first morning at the house, we found small dead bugs in the non dairy creamer. We brought it to their attention, in person. Obviously they were unaware of this and were very apologetic. We assumed this was just a fluke and things like this can happen. No worries.

Upon getting settled in, however, these are some of the big issues we had:

The master bed was a mattress and box spring that sat directly on the floor with no bed frame. The noise the bed made when you sat on it or moved around on it was unbearably loud and made sleeping extremely difficult. For 9 weeks!

The kitchen had major problems: We had FOUR spoons, ONE pan with the bottom scraped off (we do not have a picture because mid stay the handle broke off so we threw it away and bought a new one), no mixing bowls (we made and served salads in a cooking pot), one metal strainer that had RUST on it. A few mixmatched glasses, a few mixmatched bowls (the dishes were a full set) and a couple of disposable storage containers, one of which was an empty DOG TREAT container. A few pots, 2 with loose handles. There were many other kitchen items missing. When we mentioned this to the owners and asked for kitchen towels and oven mitts, they brought them over but said it was not their responsibility to provide us with everything. Based on the conversations we've had with others, actually, it is. We should have what we need to run a household day to day, especially for a 9 week stay. And everything should be in working condition and sanitary. Well, I guess we were on our own. We bought some pans, strainer, cutting board, and many other kitchen items we needed. Some were items she did supply but we were not comfortable using hers in the condition they were in.

The bottom of the bathtub was completely rubbed off and looked old and unsanitary.

Obviously, we were unhappy with our accommodations. It was clear to us as guests that our comfort and convenience were not not a priority. We wanted to shorten our stay but were unable to. We just made due.
Great place to stay in a quiet neighborhood. A grocery store and tons of food options are within walking distance. The internet is good, but it's not the most comfortable place to work remotely from.

This lovely studio is jut as described and pictured. It is a small space that is well apportioned and works beautifully for 1 or 2 travelers. The closet is spacious with plenty of hangers and plenty of drawers to unpack your stuff. The mattress is a bit softer than I‚Äôm used to, but I had no trouble sleeping and the sheets and quilts were so cozy! No noises from neighbors or cars or people on the streets. It‚Äôs a quiet residential neighborhood but very near restaurants and shopping, as described.
We had almost no communication with Michele and Alex because everything was as expected and we had no need to bother them!

Hosted friends in town for the weekend and decent space for 4-5 people easily. Close proximity to downtown and coffee shops near by and only 15 mins to Barton/Zilker. The place is neat and well priced. Few odd things that aren‚Äôt bad, but worth noting if it matters to your experience: 1) there were a few coffee machines with no coffee pods/beans to make any coffee and 2) lots of chores/cleaning have to be done prior to checking out despite the huge cleaning fee.

Nice house and pool + lake area. Quiet area but still short distanse to Town. A bit more tricky then what we are used to for getting a cab due to UBER is banned, but thats Austin and has nothing to do with the apartment.
We‚Äôll look to stay here again, no doubt! Great location.
If you like to avoid busy, noisy places to stay, this bungalow is for you. Crista is there if you need her, but isn't invasive at all. I could have stayed here for weeks.

Rocky is a great host. He did everything possible to make me feel at home. The place was really cool with every possible convenience. The neighborhood is in transition but was safe. The stairs are a killer so if you're a senior or have bad knees, you met be challenged. All in all, it was a good experience.

Great location but very expensive and I would not recommend as a "work from home" office. There is a tiny table and old chair you could use as a makeshift desk (that won't fit if you are also using the futon as a bed). There is very little natural lighting able to get into this room, so only book this place for the location....not to work from (very depressing! also my coworkers constantly complained about my wifi signal).  Small note: it is a futon and a bed, not two beds (the pictures and listing are a bit misleading showing the same bed with two different covers). Also the laundry is just a washing machine that is outdoors and quite rusty...

Unfortunately Jessica‚Äôs place was not what we expected. For one, the place has likely not been deep cleaned in years. The baseboards, windows, floors, rugs, walls, etc. are filthy. The backyard is basically all dirt. The couch is broken‚Äîwhen you sit down on it, it falls to the ground in the middle. Not to mention the pictures make the place look much larger than it actually is. When we showed up to check in I wiped the counter down with a paper towel and it was brown. We had to have the cleaners come back and leave for three hours so that they could actually do a thorough cleaning. A lot of the lightbulbs were burnt out and we had to replace them ourselves. While Jessica did drop off a few lightbulbs there were many others throughout the house and outside that we had to replace including the string lights out back. If they‚Äôre burnt out, either take them down or replace them...The backyard needs some landscaping and cleaning- ashtray and random stuff just laying around that we had to move to the side. Sink in the kitchen is broken, the pots and pans are grimy and need to be replaced. As with the silverware.

We rented here for 5 weeks and wish it had been a better experience. Really unfortunate as this could be a great property if there was more upkeep.

Excelente casa, las fotos no le hacen justicia, es realmente linda y espaciosa. David fue excelente anfitri√≥n; dej√≥ todo listo para nosotros, estuvo al pendiente de todo y no hubo problemas para llegar y entrar a la casa. La cocina tiene todo, hay lavander√≠a, mesa de billar, un peque√±o jard√≠n y las camas son c√≥modas. Excelente casa.

Un lugar muy acogedor, ordenado, limpio, con una ubicaci√≥n incre√≠ble.
Jon nos brind√≥ todas las facilidades, nos hizo sentir como en casa. Totalmente, sin pensarlo, volver√≠a a su sitio una y otra vez mas.

This is a pretty centrally located Airbnb, particularly given the price. All transactions were smooth and prompt. The neighborhood struck me as a college neighborhood but was very quiet despite that. I'd stay again if I was coming alone and wanted to be close to South Congress.
Jon is really nice and helped me when I had a emergency! I highly recommend but note no cable. Good stay regardless.

Check in was easy and communication fast.
However the house was quite filthy upon settling in. I spent our first night cleaning the walls, floors windows and shelves all covered in grime and dust. I didn‚Äôt want to sleep in other peoples dirt, but apparently that‚Äôs too high maintenance...? Our sheets had a white flaky stain on them.
The pics make it seem like a bright and clean space but our experience was not that! The house is dark and although decorated well with a new kitchen, it‚Äôs falling apart from foundation problems and doesn‚Äôt get the attention it needs. When we first booked we contemplated trying to extend for a month while we wait for our new house. But once we arrived we couldn‚Äôt get out fast enough. Amanda offered to clean the house after I let her know I was unhappy with the cleanliness, but I had already done it so that was moot. But that‚Äôs all I got on the subject. And upon checkout when I expressed to Amanda how crappy it was to have to clean when we got there, she turned it around on me and said it was also crappy for her to have to sweep my dogs hair off the floor upon checkout. Sorry, but I pay a cleaning fee for that. We left the place tidy but I guess we should‚Äôve cleaned fully before leaving AND upon check in.
She came to clean up after us before I confirmed that we had checked out as asked, an hour before checkout time. And that seemed to be my fault that our dog was still there, even though I never confirmed we were gone.
We did accidentally melt a spot on her toilet seat without realizing it was us. Which I apologized for and agreed to pay for, begrudgingly after we had such a bad experience here. Apparently when you have enough high reviews you don‚Äôt have to try to win everyone over? Sadly we had such a poor experience here and nothing close to what others have mentioned.
Be aware that train tracks are running right behind this house.  You will hear them day and night.  Very annoying.  Ruined my stay at this place.  Couldn't wait to get out of there.
This place was conveniently located. Close to the grocery store, restaurants and The Moody Center.

Unserer Aufenthalt war einfach perfekt. Rechelle war der perfekte Gastgeber, sie war immer f√ºr uns erreichbar und hat sogar Hilfe √ºber das notwendige heraus angeboten.
Das Haus ist super gem√ºtlich, gut gelegen und sauber. Alles was man braucht befindet sich in der N√§he, Einkaufsm√∂glichkeiten, Restaurants und √∂ffentliche Verkehrsmittel.

We didn't have clean linens and towels when we checked in as the maid did not change things out. Instead of having them fix the problem he just dumped fresh linens and towels in front of the apartment and expected us to change them. Was not very close to SoCo either

This palce is a real South Austin Sleeper!  Quiet, yet only blocks from SoCo, Curra's and Con Madre are seconds away, for breakfast tacis, Avocado Margaritas, etc. You will be comfy inside as Charles has thougt of everything.

I got food poisoning, from food products left in the apt dated expiration in 2017.  I never dreamed that the host would not throw away things for over 2 years.  Under the couch was filthy. There was no place to put luggage other than common areas making it hard to walk. There was was minimal storage in the apartment. The storage available was filled with items.  The bed and all the furniture consisted of old and damaged IKEA items.  No black out curtains and the blinds didn‚Äôt function.   If you turn on the AC, it makes a gurgling sound in the bathroom sink that was disruptive during sleep.  The neighbors TV/stereo blares through the wall at random hours of the day and night.  The dishwasher was full of water.  In the bathroom there was 2 burnt out light bulbs making it difficult to see. I don‚Äôt know how any of the other guests missed  these things. Moved to another Air Bnb and I currently love it.
Just exactly what we needed for our short stay at ACL. Don‚Äôt really have any complaints. Would book again.

Prefacing this with I have never once left a bad review on any site in my 29 years. Avoid this at all costs. Charles was hands down the most rude, inconsiderate, and condescending host I‚Äôve ever had. There was an ant infestation in his bathroom that he tried to say I attracted (after less than 24 hours at the property, as if I sat on his very dirty bathroom floor to eat my pizza on). He was not helpful and extremely rude when I politely requested him to help handle the situation & asked if a cleaner could come by bc insect poison was all over. He offered me $25 to clean myself or get out by 5 (I.e. find a new place in less than 3 hours, pack, and go.. when all of Austin lost power so no avail homes..)
-I also cleaned the bathroom with Lysol wipes when I got there bc it was not cleaned well which I have never done.
-if you want to be talked to like an idiot and feel worthless and like you‚Äôre the problem, this place is for you. If not, avoid. The physical location isn‚Äôt worth the grief

We notified the host within minutes of check in that the studio was dirty and the wifi (and tv) were not working.  We did not have wifi or other internet (or tv) for the majority of our stay.  We stayed for several weeks.  The host kept saying he would fix it but it was never fixed.  He has one wifi account for 3 properties on the lot and the studio is the furthest away from the router.  Most of the days we didn't even have enough wifi to open an email.  A few days we had enough that we could see a spinning wheel on our browser.  We never had enough wifi to make the tv work and it only works through wifi.  The place was not clean and was dirty.  The studio floor was covered in dog hair from a prior guest.  The shower wall was covered in human hair from a prior guest.  We told the host but he didn't offer to send anyone out to re-clean.  We dropped something under the bed and when we lifted the corner of the mattress to get between the slats of the frame it was horribly gross under there and looked like it hadn't ever been cleaned.  The sink pipe leaked dirty water and the host put the bathroom trash can underneath the sink to catch it.  It was open and visible (not in a cabinet) and full of gross brown water that got higher and higher our entire stay.  We asked the host if we could have a different bathroom trash can and he never responded.  Sheets and towels were stained.  There were also cobwebs and various bugs and insects including an earwig.

I reserved this place in good faith when my electricity went out at the beginning of the terrible winter storm in Texas.  I communicated with Nick that my electricity had gone out and he responded that I could check in early.  When I got to the place it was freezing with the only heat source a tiny space heater on the bedside table.  Completely uninhabitable.  I reached out to Nick letting him know that I am over 65 with health issues and could not safely stay there and requested a refund.  He has never responded and gave no refund at all.  So rude, inconsiderate, and bad faith.  I would never recommend anyone stay at this or any other property owned by this person.
Very convenient location near groceries, coffee, and bus stops.
I was insulted, kicked out and left with no place to go.
Lugar c√©ntrico, muy limpio y espacioso. Solo el WiFi no funciono m√°s que en la TV y las puertas del ba√±o que no cubren al 100%. El patio muy c√≥modo para convivir.

The cottage is on a corner lot and there is only street parking, not on premises so this is misleading. The bathrooms are not private as the sliding doors do not cover the opening. The yard is unkempt and not as depicted. The fence was leaning and fell down so it was not a fully fenced in yard as listed in description.
Great host and great location, but a bit dirty, and we had a lot of bug problems while visiting.

I have several pictures I hope to post to corroborate my statements; per the websites ability and permission. EXPIRED RENTAL LICENSE The Operating License (by code must be visible and up to date) for a rental had been expired since OCT2016 (over a year from our visit). HEALTH RISKS This rental would not pass any standard of healthcare inspection. Once we settled in my friend began to develop (what we now know to be) a severe lymphatic infection with inflammation in his respiratory system. His condition became worse and became a fever. We had to cancel plans for the Holiday and was unable to see his family as planned since he was bedridden. The illness persisted after leaving the rental but once we got home he required medical treatment and days off work for both him and I. Medical Professionals were confident it was from recent exposure to airborne toxins including dust and several types of mold. The air quality poor, including broken flooring and ceiling, all types of visible mold on the ceiling and in the crevices of the kitchen and bathroom tile. The dust was easily seen as large dust balls and debris underneath each of the beds. There were long hairs in multiple areas (upon arrival; see picture); and the bed sheets had hair, appeared used and insufficiently washed. SAFETY There was a Yellow Jacket nest very close to face height, near the sitting area in the back yard. This poses a significant risk if you have a severe allergy (as one of us does). The first aid box there did not include anything useful to prevent anaphylaxis shock. RISK OF DOG ATTACK BY NEIGHBOR PITBULL The backyard was fenced but the next door neighbor (in close proximity) owned a Pitbull that would not settle down. He was displaying territorial behavior and the owner had a cigarette and walked inside, clearly unperturbed. Unfortunately, this prevented us from letting the dogs outside without fervent supervision to ensure the safety of my dogs. I had to stand with my back to the Pitbull to attempt and block his view of my dogs . I even I tried to use tiki torches to create a barrier if the case he were to jump over the fence (well within his ability to do so). NOISE We were woken at early hours by incessant dog barking from the dog next-door. There were several other dogs in the neighborhood area that barked intermittently. PRIVACY There was no privacy inside the home; if the window had blinds they were broken. I had to stand up magazines along the window sill to cover the exposed areas and the ‚Äòfree wireless‚Äô sign propped in the window facing out ensures the neighbors know your connection is not at all secure. I did not feel comfortable leaving any belongings of worth in the home while we left for the day. The keyless entry for the front door is convenient but did not have any latch lock or other...
A/C situation was horrible. Had to buy our own fan. Ants everywhere in the kitchen. Worst Airbnb experience ever.

Place was superrrrrr dusty and it smelled like smoke so bad!!!! The a/c was not working properly so we were hot the entire time!!! I had to spend money buying things to clean the whole place myself because I couldn‚Äôt take it!! And tables and floors and everything had dust everywhere! The restroom smelled urine  sooooo bad!!! I do not recommend!

I would never recommend anyone stay at this place. I had a bed bug crawl on me. My sister had to kill one and it left blood all over one of the beds. I had to rush out at 1 am extremely worried about having been bitten and taking bugs back home or somewhere else. I am extremely disappointed in this house. I had photo proof of the bugs so I was able to cancel and get a full refund but because of the bed bug situation, I could not book another air bnb. I am appalled that this woman is still able to rent out the home. DO NOT STAY HERE!
Kristine is very accommodating in the way that she will do whatever it takes to have her customers not run into any troubles in regards to the stay.
Can‚Äôt go wrong with location and spacious backyard.

The location of this place is nice, 10 mins to pretty much anything in Austin. Also walking distance to a park which was nice for our two year old. The place itself was old, rundown, and unkept. Lots of damage all around the house. I found that at first glance it looked somewhat clean, but it was not. I understand an older house will not look as clean as a new house, but this was just plain dirty. The bottoms of my feet were dark with dirt after walking around for a few minutes. I saw a large puddle on the kitchen counter and wiped it with a paper towel and the paper towel was almost brown with grime. There were dust bunnies everywhere not the nice kind, even a few clumps of hair. If a bed is more than 3 inches off the ground, 6-7 in this case, the floor underneath should be clean. I don‚Äôt think under the bed had been cleaned in months. I found some questionable things on the floor I honestly couldn‚Äôt even examine. There‚Äôs a few seats in the living room, no couch. And a tiny tv, about 12-18 inches? Looks like a computer monitor. No cable, just antenna and a DVD player that works I think? But the remote for the tv didn‚Äôt work so we couldn‚Äôt switch input to it and try. Not a big deal as there was ONE dvd present. Outside was a nice yard however very unkept and dirty. Sweeping the concrete patio would have been a nice touch but it hadn‚Äôt been swept in months. Also dog poo out in the yard. I‚Äôm sorry to have to write a bad review I actually have never had to write one but I think people need to know what they are getting. This would be fine as a party house when you are young and looking for a place to crash for a few hours after a wild night out, otherwise don‚Äôt waste your time.

Writing review based on our cancellation from this place. Please see the other reviews of me in the event I am left a bad review.
- Arrived at the place and the pictures were different from what we actually saw.
- no WiFi was available. We spent the whole afternoon trying to contact them.
- the first person on the phone was rude and suggested we got away with coming early. We didn‚Äôt think that WiFi would be turned on at the checkin time only.
- Kristine didn‚Äôt care about what was going on. She said she would have to ‚Äúwait for her other apartment guests‚Äù to try and sort out the problem for her. She refused to sort it out herself.
- Even the Airbnb support team could not get in touch with them for hours at a time.
- very relieved we were able to cancel with full refund and move to a more hospitable place.
Location was nice. Backyard was perfect. Cozy place to stay, but as a heads up the beds were a tad uncomfortable.

We came from Houston to a Wedding and stayed at this place. Great location and hospitality from the host. Very good communication and responsiveness. However. this is not family friendly place, maybe if you are just looking for a place to crash and just spend the night being super tired or drunk. We bought some Dave's Killer bread from the Randalls nearby and found it with wholes the next morning so we discovered a mouse was also staying with us there. Don't expect much from the beds as they make noises when you move and be prepared for a funky smell but if you are going there just to sleep, go for it.

Vania es una excelente anfitriona. Trata siempre de ayudarte en lo que necesites. Necesitas un traje de neoprene porque trabajas en piscinas y hace fr√≠o? Vania te da! Necesitas un bolso porque en tu valija no entra todo? Vania tiene! Te gusta andar en bicicleta en tus ratos libres? Vania te presta la suya! y as√≠ podr√≠a seguir y seguir y seguir. Y adem√°s cuanto puede te invita a comer sus exquisiteces.
La casa es muy luminosa y amplia. En mi cuarto me sent√≠ s√∫per c√≥moda y a gusto y la din√°mica de la casa me result√≥ perfecta.
Lugar para no dejar pasar si debes hospedarte en Austin ;)

I don‚Äôt believe the reviews. The place was very basic and in a location that did not feel safe. I could not arrive as expected because of car problems but received no response to the msg I sent. Had to cancel because I couldn‚Äôt get there when expected but never heard from anyone. Checked the place out when I finally arrived and would not have stayed there.

Jon was a nice host and that‚Äôs about the only positive thing I can say. The apartment does not have adequate AC and the pictures don‚Äôt show how many plug in fans are required to circulate. There was hair on the floors, shower, and sink and it stuck to my feet whenever I walked barefoot. the neighborhood it‚Äôs located in is disgusting. There is trash EVERYWHERE. Not worth it at all for me but if you‚Äôre looking for somewhere to just drop your stuff and keep going I guess it alright.
2nd time staying at Jon‚Äôs place. Location and price are just so tough to beat. It‚Äôs close to virtually everything you could want and then some!
Good location to freeways‚Ä¶neighborhood not so great.

Simple, clean, and great location, but it‚Äôs an old unit in a run-down neighborhood. Description of ‚Äúluxurious‚Äù is misleading and made for a way overpriced experience.

Also, note that there is no A/C in the bedroom ‚Äî just an A/C box in the living room and fans in the bedroom, which we were not told until day of check-in. Not cool enough for the Texas heat.

Pros- loved the layout, a/c units did more than enough to cool the place down, very well equipped/stocked up, pet friendly, cute little yard, great location

Cons- there‚Äôs only one and it was this weird/rude experience I randomly had on what ended up being my last day there: I wasn‚Äôt sure when exactly my trip was going to end so I initially booked for 3 days and after that I extended by a day, and then another day, and then another (shouldn‚Äôt have been a problem as long as I paid the money- I did, and it was available- it was). The morning of the last day I submitted a request to extend again around 6/7am. I got no response at all however, and when I went outside around 10 to pick up my Uber eats there was a man sitting in a truck in the parking lot who immediately began to gripe at me about how many guests I had over the course of my stay even tho he himself admitted that it never exceeded the allowed limit. He then followed it up by saying that I needed to hurry up and get out which confused me because I had extended and I knew it was available. He told me that the owner had told him that no I had to leave. I checked my app but I still hadn‚Äôt received any reply. Then at <10 min before check out I finally got a notification that me request to extend was being denied. The man from the parking lot then began knocking on the door every 5 or 10 minutes telling me to get out when I had ZERO time to pack my things up or prepare to check out. This resulted in a panic striken frenzy in which I tried to pack up all my things, clean up after myself, do everything on their checklist, and deal with this random dude banging on the door telling me to hurry faster. It was just mishandled in a really unfortunate way. I found out later that the same man had also bombarded two of my guests as they were leaving the night prior and started going on about the all the people I had over (two). So just know that your privacy isn‚Äôt exactly going to be respected here considering how intensely this dude had been watching and taking note of any comings or goings, round the clock, for my entire stay. üëé

The location and price is good for central Austin. However the cleanliness and especially the horribly musty smell are deal breakers. It is an older small apartment complex which is close to major roads and in a quaint neighborhood.

Studio was smaller than expected and is listed as 'quiet' but is on a main road and you can hear the traffic, especially during rush hour in the morning and afternoon. You can also hear upstairs neighbors banging and walking around. We asked for a plug for the kitchen sink on the first day so we could do the dishes but never heard back from the owner. Ended up using a coffee cup to keep the water in. I found the bed to be very uncomfortable (too hard) but my husband didn't mind. May be better suited for short stays but did not meet our needs for a 5 day visit to Austin.

Location and WiFi were solid. Cleaning ladies were still there when we had arrived 30min after check-in. The bathroom had a couple of problems. For one, the bathroom door was so warped it jammed if you tried to close it. Some of the towels had stains on them and the ones under the sink were wet. We also had roaches visit us at night.
Decent place to stay. The Airbnb is off a busy road, so it does get noisy.
Decent stay for a decent price. Cleanliness could have been better- the throw pillows on the couch stunk of B.O. and the bed was slightly broken.

The most horrendous experience I have ever had on Airbnb. Host gave two different pass codes for door and both did not work. When trying to con at host after calling and texting about 60 times altogether, no response. Called Airbnb they had me waiting for an hour which they give the most to answer. Mind you I‚Äôve been at the Airbnb since 10PM gave the host until 11PM before calling Airbnb and they say I have to give them an hour from the moment that Airbnb sends them an email LOL. No response. Had to get a hotel. Host never answered.

This place is a good stay for the price just a little stupid they had Netflix access in the tv already so that‚Äôs nice.
Everything worked as it was supposed to

This place is really only good for short term (3-4 days). The shower curtain was dirty, as was the air vents. No dishwasher is inconvenient. Screws were loose on the curtain rack and actually fell off once. The screw on the kitchen cabinet was loose too. The location is great though.
Great! Just confused on exit directions because it says to put dishes in the dishwasher but there is no dishwasher

It was a couple of things we didnt like. One, the apartment is a lot smaller than it looks online. Two, it had a very nasty mildew smell, we went and bought scented candles and spray but no matter what we did the smell wasnt leaving, we also had to buy our own towels, the towels and bed lining were very dingy and had spots on them from multiple use, so did the pillow cases/ sheets. We informed the owners about the horrific smell. They did nothing to accommodate us. We also told them that we were purchasing smell goods for the apartment. Still they said nothing and no accommodation. Honestly i wouldn't recommend this spot. I wanted to leave but my boyfriend felt it would be to much at that point. We didnt know about the areas.

Nice place, but accommodations could have been better.. There was not enough bedding to accommodate the 3 guests that stayed. Property liaison had to be contacted to enter unit as we were given the wrong access code. A ‚Äúthrow blanket‚Äù was the extra bedding we had to accommodate the 3rd guest.. the blanket was adequate a kindergarten sized napper . Area was convenient to our destinations. There was also a creepy crawler in the closet. Tub slow to drain made showering kind of gross..
After a brief snafu with checking (promptly resolved), all was as advertised, Clean, convenient , and well stocked. Early morning traffic noise might bother light sleepers.

I was given the wrong door code. I called and texted for over an hour with no response. when someone FINALLY answered my call, she gave me a couple door codes before one worked. this isn‚Äôt the first review ab an issue with a door code, so it‚Äôs absolutely ridiculous that they still don‚Äôt have their shit together. location was great, it was clean, looked exactly like the pictures, just couldn‚Äôt get into our room after 11 hours of driving. disappointing.
Shannon was able to easily add a day to our stay with no complication!  Thanks!
The door was a little hard to find at first because I arrived at night. It's the one in the middle.

The best thing about this place is definitely the location. It‚Äôs walking distance to plenty of bars, restaurants and shops. Although, I wouldn‚Äôt recommend staying here if you are not familiar with city living since some might find the neighborhood a bit intimidating. I had no concerns walking at any time of the day or night, but I would understand if others would feel uneasy about it. Overall, I think the place is priced right for what it offers.
I needed to cancel my reservation due to covid. While I can‚Äôt speak to the quality of the unit, the host was very responsive and very accommodating of my need to cancel.
No frills, clean and convenient -- just what I needed for a quick trip into town for a conference.

Awesome place! The hot tub wasn‚Äôt working the first day, but the host was able to get it working after that. We also had to keep it quiet outside because the host said that the neighbors had been complaining lately but it wasn‚Äôt too much of a problem. The host does stay next door in the garage.

We only have one complain and that was some of the beds we slept in had crumbs on it the first night.

We also had a hard time with turning on the some lights. Also, some lights were automatic so that took a day or two to get used to.
The weather was our only disappointment as it limited the amount of space where we could all gather together.  We could have spent the weekend exploring the owner‚Äôs eclectic collections.
If you‚Äôre contemplating staying here, simply do it. You won‚Äôt regret it.
Crazy cool collections!

There are many repairs that need to be done throughout the house. There is damage in the master ceiling and it‚Äôs cover by plastic. Wall paper it‚Äôs coming off.
Beautiful decor.
House has a lot of potential.
No privacy in the pool as it faces the golf court, and the tennis court it‚Äôs next to the property.
Thank you.

The studio is stylish and livable with a very comfortable king Bed, which made for a relaxing stay. Place is a little hard to find but Sue was attentive and helped me navigate to the parking spot to get checked in. Only disappointment was the place not having the free bikes that were mentioned in the listing, and even so I‚Äôd stay here again.

heel behulpzame en vriendelijke gastheer. wij waren zijn eerste gasten, en dat was er op enkele vlakken aan te merken, maar hij was bereid om dingen bij te schaven. zo had hij bijvoorbeeld aanvankelijk eerst een fout adres gegeven en er was geen sleutel voor de voordeur. dit had hij niet aangegeven. ook niet dat er nog vier andere gasten in hetzelfde kleine appartement zouden zitten. maar de prijs viel goed mee en we hadden voor de rest alles wat we wilden. het was er ondanks het aantal mensen ook gewoon stil die nacht. fijne ervaring, ondanks enkele onaangename verrassingen.

We ended up not staying at this place. It was really dirty and unkept. On arriving we found the bathroom had not been cleaned, hair and muck was in the tub and toothpaste spittle dried in the sink. The floor and carpets had not been cleaned or vacuumed and the bed looked as if the bedding had not been changed. The table provided was sticky.Johnny was hard to get ahold of when we arrived and would not return our calls after we arrived. His on sight boarder was unfriendly and not helpful. There was absolutely no way we were staying in those conditions. Even at the low cost of $35 one would expect the place to be clean.

Michael was very responsive during pre-booking, and during our stay.

However, his attitude changes with us once the pressures of the upcoming SXSW. We had booked with him an approx. 3 week stay, to leave just before another booking for SXSW. Apparently, he booked our check-out on the same day as they were checking-in, which caused stress towards the end of our stay (below). In preparations, and probably to deal with some differed maintenance on the house, he had painters, general contractors, electricians, etc, come close to a dozen times during our stay, often without notice.

The house itself was really great, but furniture and finishes are not as shown. Blinds were cheap Home Depot paper that didn't retract without the use of plastic hair-type clips. Kitchen was poorly stocked. Mostly it seemed to be showing the wear of lots of booking and little re-furbishing as things were used or abused. Maybe that has changed with all the work done during and perhaps after our stay. All this was easily looked over because it was a great modern house, until Michael became a dictator, and threatened to kick us out early if we didn't comply with his demands, no questions asked.

He had, prior to booking, also scheduled a cleaner to come once per week, which turned out to be more of a method of checking up on us rather than cleaning. We had pre-approved 5 guests - two couples, and one single. We were accused of having more. We had pre-approved a small well-behaved well-traveled blue healer to stay with us. Towards the end of our stay, when Michael was needing more time to prepare the house for the next guest, he informed us that the dog was making too big of mess (you can read our prior reviews, of which almost all them had this same dog stay), and that we needed to leave a day early and pay an extra $150 cleaning fee. This house has all hard wood or concrete floors, so a quick sweep and vacuum would clean up dog hair quickly. Dog was not on the furniture. I questioned the "mess" the dog was making, and he went into a tirade about how it was HIS HOUSE and we were going to do what he told us to, "thanked" me, and hung up on me.

I employ nearly 100 people, and work with 100s of clients and business partners annually, and his negotiation style is simply to demand. Perhaps Michael was under some stress, and he is normally a great guy, however, I wont stay with him again. Its not worth the risk to stay with a host that threatens to kick its guests out because they wont accept his demands unquestioned. We respected the house, we had the exact number and type of guests as booked, we received permission for the dog, we allowed him to continually invade our privacy with contractors and "cleaners", yet he made unreasonable demands and threats.
No TVs in the bedrooms

Very accurate pictures and description. Plenty of towels, blankets, pillows, and towels! Trash bags, paper towels, toilet paper, dish soap, laundry soap, shampoo, conditioner etc all supplied! Slept 9 of us very comfortably! Quick Uber to everywhere, but not much within walking distance. Very quick responses from owner! No issues during stay.
The stay was amazing and everything was very easy. We did however think there were more rooms and beds but that was our fault. I think the pictures confused us a bit.

You will have picked the right place...beautiful home....clean....well stocked...even fresh eggs and orange juice for first morning, along with bread...furnished as shown in pics...fresh flowers...candy...comfortable beds...beautiful horses to pet and feed carrots....and last but not least..a great hostess that ties everything together to make you want to go back!!! Thank you!!!  Ladies from Spring

Our experience with Karen was disappointing. While we enjoyed our stay in Austin, we encountered problems with the accommodations.  Karen sent detailed information before the stay, but was not very responsive on the day of the stay. We arrived to a dirty unit, despite being told that a cleaning service would be there from 2-4pm the day of our arrival. It took a while to get a response call from Karen when we reached out about the issue, but me and my guests were concerned with sleeping in previous guests dirty linens and there were not enough towels for our party to shower with.  After being assured by Karen that we would receive a refund for the cleaning fee when she did respond, 5 days later she replied to my resolution request with accusations of me lying when I provided documentation of the mess as well as threats that a lawyer would be in contact with me regarding my party's behavior. I defended that my party arrived to a dirty unit and had to do laundry on our vacation, but was still met with accusations. Finally, AirBNB stepped in upon my request and helped resolve to be compensated for the issues. Only after AirBNB got involved did Karen finally admit that she was in error and no cleaning service had been scheduled to clean after the previous guests. While she apologized and I understand that we all get busy sometimes, I feel that the situation was handled very poorly and was very undeserving of any guests.

Perfect for our needs - 8 days of intensive SXSW. The place is very spacious, located in a quiet and safe neighborhood. 30 minutes walking through residential streets or a $7-8 Lyft ride gets you into downtown Austin. The kitchen is very well equipped, but there isn't a lot of lounging furniture, so maybe not the best place if you plan to use it a lot during the daytime.

The owners attitude was horrific. We had a seven night stay and out of the seven nights, five of those the hot water heater was not working at all. The second that we realize that this was an issue we communicated with the host, and simply asked that we be reimbursed for the inconvenience of not being able to take a comfortable shower. The host then threatened to call the police on us and kick us out of the Airbnb, saying that ‚Äúpeople like you are the reason why we are getting out of the Airbnb business‚Äú.  The house was poorly put together, although the pictures were representative of what the house had in it, the place looked like it had been put together from spare parts. Tiles from the floor were loose, curtains to the bathroom would fall off from the slightest touch, and everything just appeared to have been poorly thought out. Also The host told us that we had to keep the air conditioning above 73¬∞ at all times. When the host manual stated that the temperature should be simply kept at a reasonable temperature. It is a very hot summer and sleeping with the apartment at 73¬∞ or higher caused us to sweat. One morning we even woke up and the owner had change the thermostat from what we had set when sleeping, to 76¬∞ And so we woke up in a sweat. I do want to mention that they were only in the house to perform repairs on the hot water heater and did not enter it while we slept without permission. But changing the thermostat on us while we were sleeping without her permission was not acceptable. We travel a lot for work, and have stayed in A ton of Airbnb‚Äôs, and we have never had any issues with any host ever. I always give a five star reviews and we always go out of her way to make sure that the cleanup for the house is as painless as possible. I hate that we had such a bad experience, and hope that if anyone read this, that they do not have the same issues that we had with this host.

Ty fue un excelente anfitri√≥n nos ayudo en todo desde que reservamos fue muy atento. Para el check-in tuvimos que llegar antes y nos pudo recibir sin problemas.
La ubicaci√≥n es buena si vas a l centro de la ciudad aunque necesitas coche o uber para moverte no esta a mas de 10 minutos en auto.
La casa es muy acogedora y tiene todo para estar bien.
It a great place , close to everything , but no late check out , 11am your expected to be out of the room.

The Airbnb is in a great location and is well equipped, but service is poor. I called and messaged Ryan and the on-site property manager in order to complete maintenance requests, but received no responses until after my stay ended.

Place and location is very nice. Finding the room and checkin is a little difficult. Expect to walk for 20 minutes to find the room and if there is a problem don‚Äôt expect an immediate response from hosts.

This place is in a very convenient location just across the street from the convention center and from the Marriott which has a Starbucks. It's also an easy walk to all the usual touristy spots- 6th Street, the Capital, the river, Congress Street, etc. The beds were very comfortable. The bathroom could use a touch up with fresher caulking but was clean. There's also an additional sink and mirror in the lower level bedroom. The spiral staircase to the upper bedroom would be tricky with a large suitcase but our carry on bags made it up with not too much trouble. The unit is on the third floor and there's no elevator so be prepared! A free parking spot came with the rental. The living room had two couches in a very sad condition and we're very uncomfortable (low to the ground and hard to get out of and very deep so if you're short your legs stick out if you sit with your back against the low back. The fabric was slightly stained.) That's too bad because they are the first thing you see upon entering. A better couch and a couple of single chairs would be a big improvement. We were there 4 nights, Wed-Sat. There was not much noise from other people coming and going the first two nights but the weekend nights were noisy. I guess it was also Mardi Gras weekend. I'd probably stay again but would also search out other options to compare and probably not over a weekend.
Would not stay here again. The unit was not clean when we arrived and check in was delayed two hours because of this.
I am sorry to say I thought it was overpriced for what it was. I would not stay here again

Thomas was a very communicative host and quite proactive in dealing with checkin, checkout, and issues that came up. The room is quite small, so I wouldn't recommend more than 1 person. There are a couple of places to eat within walking distance, but not much else.

We were about a 15 min/$12 Uber ride from downtown.

If small, affordable, and just off the edge of the downtown SXSW chaos is your speed, then this place is ideal.
Beautiful space and plenty of room, BUT only 2 bathrooms. No half-baths.

We found bugs both alive and dead in the bed sheets when we first arrived. Also, all of the air-vents throughout the house were full of dust, some even black. There was tons of dust on all of the decorations throughout the house. Upon arrival we found dirty dishes in the cabinets. We Found a live scorpion in the living room and a dead Rat in the front yard. The pool was full of dirt and the lights in the actual pool did not work our entire stay. In addition, the place smells of old linens. The odor was so potent it smelled like urine. Overall, the house looked like it was just quickly vacuumed or swept. Not actually cleaned. The yard was full of stickers and overgrown. Huge disappointment for charging $1,000 a night.
Your family will have a blast. The views of Hill Country are unmatched!

The view is priceless!  It is spectacular.  But the house was really dirty, a lot of dust, a dirty refrigerator and some kitchen utensils like pans were with food scraps!  If they fix the cleaning the house out of 10!  But right now, with the whole issue of covid, cleaning is a MUST.  The attention of the host was good.

First I would like to say the host was great and my family loved the pool, but the house requires a lot of tlc. It was not very clean. I had to wash every pan, pot or dish before i used it. The house has a lot of odd decor, but i guess we were just not into it. My family kept talking about how creepy it was. One of my family members found a noose right outside of the pool area which was very odd. The pictures are not very accurate at all. Overall the house requires a lot of attention.

The pool at this place is INCREDIBLE!!!

Amy can be hard to get in touch with until closer to your stay. I asked questions a few times regarding the sleep availability when I was making plans (months before our stay) and did not receive a response until about a few days before checkin.

I cannot recommend this host or property.  It may have been lovely at one time, but the entire property feels as though it has been neglected for awhile.  We contacted Amy the day of our arrival to let her know that the pool was green and cloudy, the dishwasher was broken, that laundry had been left unfinished in the machines, and that we were generally unhappy with the state of things.  She told me we could leave that night if we wanted a refund - that was at 7 pm.  We did not take her up on that as three families with kids had all driven hours to get there and we had no alternative accommodation.  She did not seem particularly interested in taking any other steps and I was told I could take my complaints to Airbnb (which I have now done).  FWIW, I have never left a bad review for a host ever (nor have I needed to).  But this was way outside my experience and expectations.

Our extended family of 7 stayed in this house for 3 days. I had reached out previous to our stay a few times about some issues in other reviews regarding cleanliness and maintenance. Amy assured me that she had been to the house prior to our check in. The house did smell very strong of cleaning products but there were deeper issues in the house.
1) A soiled diaper was found under a bed as we were packing up.
2) 2 beds / sheets were not clean. Ours had hair and what seemed like drool stains on our pillows, so we ended up washing them again after the first night.
3) the Dishwasher had a weird smell and upon inspection, the liquid detergent never dissolved in the previous wash, which led us to believe unwashed dishes were put away before we arrived. We didn‚Äôt trust anything in the kitchen so we had to rewash everything prior to use.
4) lots of dust everywhere and doors were caked with grime.
5) not confident the bathroom counters were sanitized. We found fake eyelashes sitting on the counter behind the sink- found on the last day as I was packing up my toiletries (I don‚Äôt wear fake eyelashes). The other eyelashes were stuck to my husband‚Äôs sock.
6) the downstairs toilet clogged often. So eventually all 7 people had to use the same toilet in the master bedroom. Amy offered to send someone to fix it, I provided times, and no response.

We really hate leaving bad reviews, but I want to verify what the other guests have written. The house is not well maintained. The closet door is still broken, for example. Or the master bedroom shower was literally disintegrating around us (gravel/grout). The railing on the balcony was wobbly and did not feel safe (we have a 5 year old).

The pool was great and we spent as much time as we could outdoors. The new grill worked fine and we used it for 2 out of 3 dinners.

I do not recommend this house.

I dont know why a cleaning fee is charged, the place was not clean. Also it needs major updates. As much as we paid for this house , you can at least and I say least , buy ceiling fans that work and that arent about to fall. The beds are a joke.  The pictures do not show how dingy and dirty this place is.  I cant believe its rented out.  We will not be coming back. I hope the owner takes some pride in the place and fixes it up.  The old cabinets in the kitchen are falling off the hinges.  I cant believe we paid money to stay there.  I will not be referring anyone to this place.

The property has a great view, pool and hot tub. The decor is somewhat eclectic and is fitting with the property. I did not stay here personally, but the groom party (including my three adult sons) stayed here along with their significant others. We had 12 Adults stay there. The fact that it was advertised to sleep 14 was, at best, a stretch. We had brought along 2 queen size airbeds in anticipation of this possibility, so there were enough beds. The guests ran into a few problems though. The beds were old and worn down and "indented" in the middle. The pillows were also old and worn down and some smelled of mildew. The bed sheets don't fit, and the converted garage did not cool down properly. It was much hotter in the "garage" than in the rest of the rooms. The decking outside needs to be refinished as well. The most immediate problem was that there was broken glass by the pool and some of the lighting was out and there was a terrible roach problem. We communicated these things to the host. She apologized and offered to let the guests use the hot tub for free. This was appreciated but did not solve the roach problem. We were here for my son's wedding so didn't have time to look for somewhere else to stay otherwise we would have looked elsewhere to stay. Once we got back home, we looked back at some reviews in Jue and found that the roach problem was a reoccurring problem. The property has great potential and could be a five star property if corrections and upgrades suggested were adopted.

We were very disappointed with the cleanliness and state of the house and were frustrated that when we brought it to the attention of the owner she disregarded our concerns and was unresponsive. We paid a lot of money for a quality stay that did not live up to the price, pictures and description on the listing. The house is in a great area up in the hills with a nice pool but I wouldn't recommend staying here until much needed house repairs are made. Make sure to complete a full inspection of the house upon check-in and document all the issues with photos in order to report any concerns within 72 hours of check-in to cover your stay otherwise your case will be disregarded too.

amy was comunicative.the views are amazing but the place needs lots of work. lots of outdoor  lights are broken dont work making it very dark. we also found hair in the bathtub when we arrived and all the vents were moldy. the masters room had water damage in the ceiling. furniture is old and falling apart
The neighborhood was very quiet and safe. The only negative is we were about a 10-15 minute drive to downtown and it was difficult getting taxis with no Uber in Austin.

I booked this for a business trip to Austin and although communication was great and the location was nice, it was overall a bit underwhelming and I did not have a great stay.

I arrived an hour after the posted check-in time and a repair man was there repairing the shower and asked me to give him 30 minutes, which I did, but it was kind of frustrating after a long day. The owner did not communicate this delay with me until after I had arrived. If they had it would have been less frustrating.

There are a few dogs in nearby yards that barked regularly, especially early in the morning. There's also some sort of train that you can hear blowing a whistle or something every few hours.

I had work I needed to complete early each morning, and the internet was quite slow. I did several speed tests and saw download speeds of 1 mbps and upload speed of .1 mbps, which was frustrating and did not seem reliable.

Despite the visit by the repairman, the shower was not fixed and the handle on the cold water was not working. So, after a bad night of sleep I didn't even get a good shower, but instead had to quickly rinse without scalding myself.

Overall I'd say the aesthetic and comfort of the unit is quite lacking, especially for the price-point. I thought the bed was super comfortable, but overall I was not happy to have paid $125 per night. I'd say it's more in the $60 per night range for what you're getting.
This location could not be beat!! Recommend to anyone trying to stay in the downtown austin area.

Check in was easy and It's in great neighborhood-and i am all for character of older buildings but this place is more run-down than it appears in photos.  The big 2 issues for me however are sleep and safety.  The mattress on the queen bed was awful for 2 people-you sink into the middle of the bed-it's like sleeping in a hammock. The sheets and pillows were older, the extra blankets were very old. Worst part however it be aware that you are above a garage and there was no smoke detector.  I brought this attention to the owner and AirBnB complete with photo on missing detector on the smoke detector bracket on the ceiling and he responded to Air BNB and us that it was there-it was not.  On principle, i would not recommend.

You‚Äôll love this place if cockroaches and roasting in the TX heat are your thing. If not, I‚Äôd suggest looking elsewhere.

We showed up at the Airbnb to find cockroaches in every room (3 total but we didn‚Äôt stay around to find the rest). When I asked about the cockroaches, Ames said flippantly, ‚Äúsorry a few must have scurried in when we sprayed for them.‚Äù No offer to check for more or to clean them up. Gross!!

We booked in the middle of TX summer and the house was HOT! We turned on the A/C and left the house for several hours. The small Airbnb was still an uncomfortable temperature when we returned and I broke a sweat just sitting on the couch.

Then, the TV wouldn‚Äôt work. My kids, wife and I had to go get a hotel. And, to top it off, I wasn‚Äôt able to get a full refund. I had to pay fees for Airbnb and Ames decided to cut down the amount of my refund. So, for this terrible experience I ended up paying $50!!

I‚Äôm sure under other circumstances, Ames‚Äô place could be good but, for me, it was a stress-filled nightmare with a poor resolution.

We had a terrible stay at this place. We were there for two cold days & nights. This apartment is not at all equipped to stay at if it's below 60 degrees outside. There's no heat and the space heaters didn't work. Only one outlet in the whole apartment worked. When I messaged the host about this their response was "can you try flipping the breakers" which I would never do in an Airbnb. That's the host's responsibility not mine. The wifi was also out when we got there. The bed is weirdly concave and the couch has stains on it. This was one of the worst Airbnbs I've ever stayed at.

This small bnb is near a park in Clarksville. It's a nice, safe neighborhood not too far from the center and about 15 minutes walking distance to whole foods. This airbnb is on the top floor of a separate guest house with the downstairs neighbors sometimes very noisy, but they tend to quiet down around 23h. Airbnb could use some upgrades - it takes a while for the shower to drain, same for the sink in the bathroom. Aircon works but it only cools down one part of the bnb where you will not be sleeping. One night I was woken up in 94 degree heat with no way to cool off that part of the room without jerry-rigging 2 large noisy fans to push air to that area. I explained everything to host, however he decided to ignore what I was saying and said that he will try to find someone to fix the A/C even though the aircon unit was working. The backyard is off-limits and it's used by the house owner.

I couldn't have enjoyed my stay more in Sharon's tent. It has everything you need and is no less convenient to stay in than any room that will cost you twice as much. Sharon was an extremely welcoming host and was informative about Austin.
This tent is the place to be.

We very much regret choosing this home for our stay in Austin. Although we appreciated Jennifer's communication, the photos of the house are outdated + misleading. The home was dirty, tired, & in need of an exterminator. The bathroom was crawling with ants, & on our last night, a large insect descended from the ceiling vent & began crawling toward our children in bed-- they were horrified! We immediately cleaned much of the home the first night, left our shoes on at all times, & ultimately decided to check out early.
