We appreciated that the linens appeared to be clean, but the rest of the home has just been used & abused by visitors.

The home is about a 40 min drive to downtown with traffic (from Brushy Creek/Round Rock area), & you must pay a toll both ways. It is situated near several parks, one directly across the street, which was a saving grace for us. There are also many restaurants, a Starbucks, & grocery nearby.
There were cockroaches in the house. I do not recommend this rental.
Our stay there was just OK, in the photos the house looked great but it wasn¬¥t. The bathrooms were old, and the house in general was not as clean as we expected.
I would Not recommend this place due to roaches. Sleeping there was not cozy at all.

House had plenty of space but seems to be in need of a deep cleaning / renovations. The house is conveniently located in the suburbs of Round Rock with several dining and shopping options nearby.  During our stay there was construction going on behind the unit which started as early as 7am and cause the house to shake. I would verify that this is no longer happening before booking your stay.
There was a dead mouse in the garage and at night I can hear loud noises from the mouses inside the walls!!

The location of the place was great. Check in and out was very easy, with everything done via codes including early check in luggage storage. The place does have a bit of wear and tear with some items needing replacement (light bulbs, bedroom lamp, bedroom door). There were also ants in the bathroom and a wasp nest out the front. Also worth noting that there is a full kitchen but no pots and pans so it would be difficult to cook in.
Moderately noisy location with dumpster trucks and restaurant delivery trucks in mornings.
The house did not meet our expectations. We expected to find a beatiful house in a tree and was not well. The best of the house was the bathrooom wich was very well decorated.
She was very kind. But the AirBNB system is rigged against the consumer and I won't be using them again.
No need to overthink, just book it!
No thanks.
Anthony & Hayley's was exactly as advertised, couldn't recommend it more highly.

We stayed at Brent‚Äôs place for a month while we searched for a place to live in Austin. It was the perfect size for my husband, myself, and our pup! It was nice to have our pup have his own yard to play in. Check in was easy and the home was very clean upon arrival. The location is spot on! Only about 10 min to downtown. The ONLY downside that we found is the bed was a bit uncomfortable and the AirBNB gate locked from the inside so with only one key my husband and I had to strategize every morning how we were going to leave. One morning I was actually locked inside the AirBNB. But if you aren‚Äôt on opposite schedules it wouldn‚Äôt be too bad. However, it is also probably on us too because we should have asked for a second key!

Le cottage d'Anita est tr√®s bien situ√©, pr√®s de tous les restaurants et boutiques de south Austin, on peut m√™me s'y rendre √† pied et en m√™me temps, sa rue est tr√®s calme et reposante, un must! Le cottage est bien meubl√© et tout est √† disposition, la seule chose qui m'a manqu√©e c'est un s√®che-cheveux!...
Due to a hotel snafu we needed last minute accommodations, and Anita‚Äôs place fit the bill. Cozy and private in her backyard, on a quiet residential street. Absolutely adorbs, and comfy!
You will not be disappointed! Amazing place and close to the falls and hikes that we were looking for
Excelente opci√≥n, hermosa cada, con todo lo que puedes necesitar, limpia y bien decorada. Sin duda volver√≠a!!!
Lieu atypique, l'accueil est chaleureux, tout est fait pour passer une bonne nuit!

Justin was very nice and accommodating.  But the "bed" was not even a mattress.  It was thin padding on a sheet of plywood and the bedding material consisted of a sheet and 2 blankets.   I'm not where others had laid their heads before but the type of pillows  available were not launder-able.   Did I miss something?  Not sure.

Decent little spot, but I had trouble getting the heater to give me exactly the temperature that I needed to sleep well, and woke up when it got too hot. I recommend you figure this out before leaving for a night out, so you can set it and crash.
A Great place to crash and chill at night.  Justin is Polite and I Had No Issues.  I would stay again.  Can not beat price.  THANKS EDWARD
Cozy and calm crash pad minutes from south Austin‚Äôs hub.
Low cost place to crash for a quick trip.
No disappointment‚Äôs with the property, location and service from Bruce

The location is excellent. We really enjoyed being close (walking distance) to the river, lady bird lake and all kinds of cool restaurants and bars.

We struggled, however, to get a decent night's sleep because of how hard and awful the beds were. I think if you're getting a cost effective nightly rate at this airbnb then a terrible bed isn't a huge deal. You get what you pay for... but my nightly rate (with taxes, fees and the cleaning fee) was not cost effective, so I expected at least an average quality bed. That was not the case. The bed was literally the worst bed I've ever tried to sleep in.

The bed aside (and the fact that we were tired) we enjoyed our stay. Everything was clean and as described in the listing and communication with the host was excellent. If it weren't for such a terrible bed ... I'd consider coming back.
Its a beautiful old farm house with animals and view ... but the conditions are very bad and the whole place was so dirty I never seen such an unclean house on airbnb!

The apartment looked great, just not what the picture says. we were on a couple's trip with another couple, when we booked this place we saw it was a 2 bedroom apartment, unfortunately when we got in it was just a one bedroom apt with one bed on the hallway. it was  very disappointing and we felt deceived. There was no way 2 couples couples stay there as there no privacy at all. we had to get another place the night we arrived, a actual 2 bedroom suite in an hotel and had to pay again without getting a refund for this place even though we dint stay 30 mins in the apartment. i just want everyone to please take note, not all pictures on Airbnb is accurate as the Host Mark had mentioned to me that Airbnb posts the pictures not the host. I believe things should be done better. This messed up our trip.
The place is exactly as described don‚Äôt hesitate to book a night at this place.

Read the description carefully!  This is not a place to stay during cold or rainy weather.  Fortunately, the weather was fairly mild for my stay so the outhouse was ok but kind of creepy in the middle of the night - I am normally up twice during the night.  I did not use the shower - weather too chilly for showering outdoors.  My granddaughter lives nearby so I showered there.  I had intended to book a different bnb and did not realize I had booked the wrong one until I got there.
It is an old house that feels creaky -  beds, linens and bathrooms need renovation. Does not feel fresh. Overpriced.
Can‚Äôt go wrong staying here. Good location, Quick answers, and trendy.!
I never had a chance to see house.

The location is nice but the plumbing in the main restroom was poor making the shower and toilet not usable. Also the toiletries were hidden behind a door that was very difficult to open. We had to supply our own. Overall it was a very poor experience I would of rather stayed in a hotel.

Pros: Great location. Many restaurants, bars, shops are all walkable. There is a nice dog park a block away. The bathrooms look like they had been redone recently and were very nice. Parking was very easy on the street. It‚Äôs a quiet neighborhood. No issues with any neighbors. The hosts always responded quickly when we contacted them.

Cons: Older house. Very creaky. Description said sleeps 4, but all they had was a one double bed, one single bed and one air mattress. So the sleeps 4 was a little misleading. Their sofa was small, no chance anyone can stretch out and sleep there. Internet was horrible. Tried to work from there and zoom meetings were always dropping. We also found some roaches under the kitchen sink, and told the owner. They have netflix on the TVs but wasn‚Äôt able to add any app that would give you live tv.
The location of this house is amazing! My only concern is the furniture is extremely uncomfortable. The bed was unbearable to sleep in and the desk chair reignited a previous injury.

Nuestra estancia en casa de Lois fue fant√°stica. Estuvimos muy c√≥modos; Lois nos permiti√≥ sentirnos como en casa. La casa est√° en una colonia muy tranquila y agradable. No hubieramos podido haber escogido un mejor lugar para quedarnos.
It does not get any better!

The place and neighborhood is very nice, but the host lack in communication and readiness made my check-in a nightmare. Host never responded to any of my messages to confirm address and check-in time. Upon arrival my room wasn't ready as it still had prior tenant stuff.

Well I was like 2 hours on the cold waiting for the lady to provide information of how to get in the house. Lady was kind and attentive but it doesn‚Äôt change the fact that I was pretty much forced to stay at the house because she will not allow you in and out access and she will not give you a key üîë or any form of way to get in and out the house unless she open the door for you , strange ! Room was freezing cold ! She put some tape in the door and made it better  and gave me a blanket. You are forced to be upstairs in your room ! No tv or nothing ! You can‚Äôt use anything that is on the house for except a bathroom you share with a stranger .
Cozy place that makes you feel at home! Definitely a steal if you can book this place!

I did not end up staying at Jean-Paul's rental because despite the fact that he was very nice upon my arrival, I simply did not feel comfortable with the circumstances. I arrived at the rental hours after the official check-in time (7:45pm) and he was still there cleaning the space. He explained that this is his personal living space. There was quite a lot of his stuff around the place and I could see that indeed there was more cleaning to do. He also explained that he would be staying in the downstairs studio over night until he left town in the morning. I then left and ended up staying at my sister's house since I did not feel comfortable with Jean-Paul still at the place. He then messaged me saying that he had gone upstairs to grab his computer around 10pm and that the place was all ready for me. Unfortunately this rental had a no-cancellation policy and the cost was quite high given the circumstances. Again, while Jean-Pierre was extremely nice and helpful, I am quite disappointed with this situation and felt this was a violation of privacy as well as a misleading listing.

ATTENTION: Do not book!!! This place was AWFUL. The place does not look like how it does in the images. There are spider webs all over the place, gnats flying in every room, and there was a bandana tied over a light in the hallways that already had burned spots (FIRE HAZARD)! This place needs to be taken off Air BnB and he needs to never be able to list with them again.
100 outta 100 would rent again. All very well with zero problems.
The stay was one a minimalist would expect. If you need luxury and pampering, it wont satisfy. Neat experience overall.

Leyla and her husband are very nice! However, when I checked in, they informed me the radiator heat was broken, and they had provided a space heater. This would have sufficed, had the heater been safe to use. When I went to plug it in, I noticed it had burn marks on the plug. Luckily it wasn't too cold the first night so I went without heat. The next day however, was only in the 40s. I took the heater to the fire department for inspection, and they said it was not safe for use. They also could not guarantee safety with a new space heater because they could not determine what electrical outlet caused the burns. There was no way know if it was the wiring in the Airbnb or a different source. Given the 30 degree weather, this obviously made the Airstream uninhabitable. On top of that, the WiFi was not strong enough to hold a connection so watching any sort of TV was impossible. I was also not informed of the small AMPs usage limit until I had arrived (flushing the toilet, and showering count towards the allotted amount). For a quick weekend stay in beautiful weather conditions this would be fine, but I do not recommend for longer stays, or when it is cold.
You will not be disappointed!! Greatest little getaway. Very stylish airstream and so cozy.
Tout √©tait parfait. Passer quelques nuits dans un airstream est une tr√®s bonne exp√©rience, et celui ci est tr√®s propre et bien √©quip√©. Je recommande
Very "funky" place with lots of potential but needs more maintenance and repair and TLC.
Nice little place‚Äô it got Hot in the room but the host let us borrow a fan so it wasn‚Äôt that bad after that
One of a kind experience! Nothing like having a late night food truck snack by the fire.
Cozy space with everything you could possibly need right at hand. Might be tight for two people if the weather was bad for days.
If I could never leave, I wouldn't! Amazing place, amazing host. Can't wait to come back again. There are seriously no words except for YOU HAVE TO STAY. You just have too. Such an experience.

This is a great little place in north Austin close to everything! It‚Äôs on a quiet street and the parking is really easy right in front of the place. The apartment came with all the supplies I needed for a month long stay in Austin. You can hear a little bit of noise from the apartment above but by no means is it a problem.

Perfect location, there are so many restaurants around the area, and its a 5 minute walk from 6th! It only comes with one parking spot, but there are parking lots/garages around the area.  Didn't get a chance to meet Melissa and Neal since we did a self-check in, but their instructions via message were very spot-on and accurate, we had no issues checking in! And they were quick to respond to messages!

Alice was there waiting for us when we arrived to show us around and answer questions. During our entire stay she was responsive and accommodating and even drove us to the great HEB supermarket (about 1 1/2) miles away.

The cottage is a separate building in the back of Alice's house. She is apparently making an entire compound in the back yard and along with the cottage there are now two small trailer campers she will be renting out.

The entire scene could be described as "funky" and could well be appealing to many people. But there were several drawbacks which we feel should be pointed out: there is no proper door between the bathroom and the bedroom and this could be an issue of privacy for some. If there were more than two people, an additional person would have to walk through the bedroom and into the bathroom without the door. Also there is no table or chairs on which to eat or to be able to work or write. There are chairs and a table on a deck, but we're not sure how this would work if it rained. There are lots of mosquitos back there and there is a notable roar from the nearby interstate when you leave the cottage.

We were able to negotiate our visit to Austin using public transportation and by walking; however, a car is really an absolute necessity given the location.
Chet realizes that Austin is hot and supplied us with 8 water bottles upon arrival that were a life saver. The neighborhood is just off of Lamar yet there's no noise.
1st place finish. phenomenal location and a really cute apartment. the bed sheets, by the way, are to die for.

Not a spot for group trips. There are strict rules and the stay was disappointing due to that. The host lives downstairs and has a rude communication style. If you‚Äôre looking for a spot for you and your friends, this isn‚Äôt it.
I don't want to write a public review.
She was really rude

Est√° en un vecindario tranquilo, con supermercados y buenas vias de acceso. Sus mascotas son muy amistosas y se vuelven tus anfitriones cuando Samantha no est√° presente. Ella muy amable y tiene todo ajustado para que tengas todo lo que necesitas. Muy recomendado.
Having dogs barking all the time may be avoided.
Construction noise, dirty bathroom with a rude host.

My boyfriend and I were disappointed in this stay. The guesthouse wasn't cleaned before we got there. The floors felt dirty and so did most of the things in the house. The bed was extremely uncomfortable and the sheets didn't seem washed. In order to make the bed bearable, we found some pillows in a chest in the living room that seemed dirty and didn't have covers on them. The blankets in the chest also haven't been washed recently. The window unit in the guesthouse was dated and had a hard time keeping the place cool.
Incredible place! No issues. Just a scoot or Uber away from everything! We were so sad to leave and will for sure be back! Thank you again James!
James was a great host. He communicated quickly, and the place was a gem. Killer breakfast tacos right across the street!
Bad communication, not accommodating , rooms are much dirtier then they appear.

My guess and I have NEVER experienced so much racism!! Where do I start?  Granted I paid in FULL for an event (Baby-Shower) to host, we had a check in time @ 2 pm. First thing I noticed was the trash bins filled to the top with trash. (Which the Host is trying to charge me for) When setting up we also noticed that someone else down the street was having an event as well, which we heard loud music from the backyard and the front of the house. Proceeded to enter into the property to set up for my event. Noticed a camera in the back yard but didn't pay it to much attention as I would also want to watch my property.  This issue started when I received a call from the host. 1hr after the event started at 5 pm. We had children playing in the pool ranging from 7-13. Having a blast, while the adults were at a table enjoying themselves with conversations. We had music playing at a REASONABLE volume for the respect of her neighbors.  I also walked towards the front of the property to ensure the music wasn't loud. (NOT A SOUND) However, the host called with a very RUDE and disrespectful attitude and told me the children were making to much noise. The CHILDREN playing in the pool??!! The noise ordinance did not start until 10:30 pm,(which is stated in her description) it was 5 pm. She then proceeded to call me and threaten me with the cops for the noise. I CALLED THE COPS MYSELF and had an officer come and check our noise to ensure we did not exceed. Officer stated he could not even hear the music from the front when he arrived. The officers that arrived when the host called never even stepped foot out of there patrol cars. If we had the music up SO HIGH why didn't APD ask us to lower it or even ticket us???  Had a few guesses out front saying goodbyes around 9:30-45  when they notice a very RUDE individual on the phone saying" Yeah there are a lot of BLACKS here and they look like DRUG DEALERS" He then went to the back to and speak with a group of elderly sitting at the table. Music was low enough for everyone to hear what he had to say as he was very rude and yelling. The farther to be intervened and ask him he needed to leave as "WE" paid for an event and paid to be here. The host stated only 6 guesses. NEVER was I made aware that I was only to have 6 guesses ?? Why would I have 6 guesses when I'm throwing an event?? By this time my phone was dead and did not bring a charged to charge.  She also mentioned our event lasted until 4 am. THIS IS A FLAT OUT LIE!! Only to try to get more money from me. My guesses included children and elderly, staying until 4 am?? NO, I DO NOT THINK SO!! She noticed that this was an Afro-American event and straight up judge us!! Having her "Friend" from 3 blocks away come and try to end my event is uncalled for. Him calling my friends and family " BLACKS & DRUG DEALS" uncalled for. We were ALL respectful! Just because my phone died she assumed I was ignoring her. She also stated we left trash all over her property, which is yet another lie. I have pictures to prove we left her property the same. We paid for a cleaning fee, however, we did ALL the cleaning. No package/ instruction book was left for me to read.  If you are a minority I WOULD NOT recommend this HOST AT ALL!!!

My issues with the home are below & I have pictures which were submitted to Airbnb. I did not stay in this home & found other accommodations. I was refunded my money back. I also realize that the host lives here but expected a cleaner place due to the obligation to provide a clean stay.

1. The house smelled disgusting.

2. The bathroom curtains were moldy.
-The shower curtain desperately need to be changed out. It was gross. There was a dirty towel left in the shower & used personal hygiene products left is a disarray in the shower caddy.

3. Dirty sock tied around the bed post

4. The pool was dirty.
-While it had been raining, my expectation was that it would have been cleaned or some sort of arrangement would have been made to have it cleaned prior to me reaching out. I had to text to request it, which was odd to me because I specifically asked about the pool prior to booking.

I felt the interactions between me & the host were super defensive & I was being gaslighted. The responses were always, no one else has had an issue or we always receive compliments on our home. Not sure how that addressed the pictures and issues I was having but that was the response they provided. I do not recommend.
Great location. Host was nice. Poor quality furnishings, very poor upkeep on the property. Much of the furniture was damaged or broken.  Shower was a nightmare to get hot water.

Great location, but the home had several missing and broken amenities.  Updates are needed to most of the furniture and the kitchen needs to be stocked with staples.  It was fine given the price, but would not stay again.

The home was nice but some of the fixtures were broken or in poor condition. The overhead vent felt like it could fall at any time because it wasn‚Äôt fastened down properly and some of the door knobs were barely hanging on.

Property was as advertised: very pleasant, well-kept, well-equipped. Host lives adjacent and greeted us when we arrived, asked if we needed anything or if there were any problems.
Short but steep hill at entry: may be problematic for people with mobility problems.

The first thing to say is that the numerical ratings I have assigned are meaningless. Our visit to Texas took place under unusual circumstances (a sudden plunge in the temperature). The problems we encountered may be completely atypical.

To provide more details is impossible in the space provided. I have written a detailed review, which I would be prepared to share. Here's a brief synopsis:
There was virtually no hot water in the bathroom throughout our stay.
Internet was out for 48 hours.
The "duplicate key" didn't fit the lock.
The cooking implements in the kitchen are inadequate.
The entryway is uneven, steep, and pitch black at night. Would not be suitable for people who are unsteady on their legs.

Jonathan's responsiveness varied. He was great at check-in, slow initially in responding to our problems (he was out of town, and had provided no back-up host), and, once he appreciated the situation, both concerned and fair-minded. We received a partial refund.

There is a back house that is very close to the house, although it's fenced off. There is a dog there that barked at us upon arrival and at other random times during our stay. We did not know there would be someone so close in the back house until after we booked it. There was no key hand-off like advertised, the front door was unlocked and the keys were sitting on the table. It was a nice, cozy cottage but pretty old; not worth $250 a night in my opinion. As we were walking through the house, we saw a huge waterbug (roach) in the back room which was very off putting. We saw several smaller bugs in other rooms also. There were 5 of us and one of the main reasons we booked this house was because it advertised 2 showers. We were disappointed to find out that the back shower's water pressure was so low we couldn't even use it. I tried and my shower literally took an hour. Both showers had pink mildew on them. That back bathroom did not have a door on it, just a curtain. The front bathroom's door did not close all the way. Not very private. We were asked to move our car and park in the dirt to the right of the driveway so that a car could access the back of the driveway for the back house. Several inconveniences. We got a noise complaint when we got back from 6th street from the owner of the house (who was staying literally just feet away in the back house). We quieted down right away. A few days after our stay, I get an e-mail about damaged property. A stool with water damage, trash pile too big in kitchen (the house rules specifically said we didn't have to take the trash out and that it was ok leave it all in one area), stains on the couch (which literally just looked like wet spots in the pictures he posted), and a "ruined" plant (it just looked like the plant had naturally wilted and dropped a few petals) on a side table that had water spilled on it. He wanted us to pay $100 for this which we all agreed was just ridiculous. We cleaned that place up before we left. We pretty much did the cleaning person's job for them when we really didn't have to. So the owner and I go back and forth about the damages. He realizes how crazy $100 for these minor "damages" is after I explain to him that nothing is really in need of repair except the stool. He lowers it to $80. Then to $65. The picture he posted of the replacement stool from Ikea costs $40. This is the only thing my friends and I agree needs to be replaced because we left a cold jug of water on it and the condensation caused water damage. We agree that the replacement looks a...

Matthew is a nice, communicative, and considerate host. Communication with him was great. The property location is good, very close to downtown, town lake, Zilker park, and dinning places.

The best part of this place is it has three bedrooms and three real beds, not couch/sofa beds or floor mattresses. This is a definitely a plus!

But.... a few things I can't help point them out, and you can call me picky. The house is a very old building with single layer glasses windows with nearly no sound insulation. I could hear the neighbor guys talking 1:30am in the yard even he was using his normal voice. Because the window air conditioners being installed so most of the windows could not be opened to circulate the air. The house has the old building smell and there's no way to refresh the air. One of the bathrooms toilet was falling off and one of our guests almost lost balance while using it. The other bathroom doesn't have power outlet so if you want to blow dry and style your hair, you'll need to plug the hair dryer in the bedroom and hope the cord is long enough to reach the mirror in the bathroom. I know everyone's definition of clean is different, but having "visitors" in the kitchen and the bathroom threw me off. One of the dinning chairs was dangerously falling apart and can cause accident. There was also broken beer bottle glass chips on the floor so make sure do not walk around with bear feet.

If your not comfortable with BUGS do not stay here. When I first got there I seen a few here and there but after 4 hours of running into bugs I called Airbnb. Airbnb wasn‚Äôt very concerned even sent several videos and pics of the different bugs all over the home to try to check out And find another host but they wouldn‚Äôt honor it. My problem is not with Matthew it‚Äôs with Airbnb for even allowing the home to be listed if there‚Äôs a bug issue. There‚Äôs bug traps everywhere in the home but obviously that hasn‚Äôt resolved the bug problem. The issued a 20% refund once I checked out.

Not HISTORIC AND ECLECTIC, but OLD AND TIRED!
This house was not as represented in website photos. The bathrooms were the worst. They had mold on the shower tiles and curtains. The refrigerator was not even wiped out from the previous occupant.
The heat was inadequate for the conditions of the weekend we rented. He had space heaters but when we used them, they tripped the breakers and left the house not only cold but dark. He refunded only $100 and did not acknowledge the uninhabitability of the house.
THE WORST EXPERIENCE we‚Äôve ever had with AIRBNB!
The space was large enough for a group of 6 and Matt was flexible with us. The location is killer.

In a great spot and definitely a throw-back to old Austin. Really not clean though; built-up grime and dingy - inside and out. It was disappointing. We checked in at night; too late to change anything but we did some of our own cleaning.
Dont expect the pretty room with girly bed. Was completely different when we got there. This was a main reason we chose this place. My daughter was disappointed, therefore I was too.
The price isn‚Äôt worth the stay. Bed was uncomfortable.
No thank you.
Dirty dingy and not what I payed for !

Pros:
The beds and pillows were comfortable.
Location is good.
There is very convenient and plentiful parking.
The neighborhood is quiet.

However, some constructive feedback is necessary and we are taking into account that Austin is experiencing unusually high heat and the house is in the woods near a creek.

Cons:
The air conditioning units in the two rooms with the bathrooms do not function correctly.
The house is in need of regular exterminator treatments. We found a cockroach in the shower and earwigs in several rooms.
The rugs and couches need to be deep cleaned, the living room was musty and smelled of weed. The front door frame is not sealed, you can see daylight through the crack.
The sponge in the kitchen was dirty and needs to be replaced.
One bathroom has a curtain in place of a door.
The bathroom with the door did not have hot shower water.
The outlet near the front door had scorch marks.

After reading some of the host responses to previous posts, it's worth mentioning we were only in town for one night and the host was difficult to reach during this time as he was out of town. It's also worth mentioning that we checked out early and went to a hotel to shower.
logement fonctionnel id√©alement situ√© √† Austin, √† proximit√© des lieux qui comptent. L'h√¥te est tr√®s r√©actif et fait tout pour simplifier la vie. Je recommande !

Place as described. Says it sleeps 8 people but will charge more per head after 5 people just so y‚Äôall are aware.

Freezer door handle is broken, not sure if they are aware of this or just haven‚Äôt fixed it.

The condo and host were excellent. The location however was horrible. There is a homeless camp right across the street. There was constant yelling and fighting throughout the night. The last night at the location we were woken up 4 different times from gunshots. We were warned by neighbors to not go outside after dark. Pretty scary for 2 single mothers and their daughters.
Worst trip with Airbnb so far.  Wouldn‚Äôt recommend this even to college kids traveling to Austin for a night.  Awful smell, bad communication, and bad experience.  Only positive is the location.

AWFULLLLL!!!
WELL I HAVE A LOT TO SAY ABOUT THIS RESERVATION I KNOW ITS LONG BUT WORTH THE READ! .. Lets start with at first he was ok, responded with in 24/48 hours of my messages and even let us adjust our dates due to our flights being canceled.. SO fast forward to the day before out check in.. I flew in from California and had to spend the night int he air port and would arrive in Austin at 7am.. I had messaged Jonathan 10:30 PM Texas time and had said i was arriving early, and if early check in (around 1/2) but if not could i at least drop off my bags so i didn't have to carry them around all day, but i didnt hear from him which is fine because it was late so i was excepting a reply in the am...In the morning i check and there was NO reply, around noon i emailed again asking what i needed to do further to get checked in... lock box, key pad, ect. Again no response.. by this time it is now 2pm so i had call him.. left a message hoping he would get it before 3pm due to that being our check in time, and again no response back.. at this point im exhausted and getting worried because there has been no communication from him. We arrive at 3pm to check in, due to it being an apartment complex we had no idea which unit we were in, we called and messaged AGAIN! But once again no response.. i had taken a look around the place and saw a girl out side, i thought it was worth a shot to ask her if she knew Jonathan, and she did! I was so relived, so hes a real person but just not responding. I told her we are supposed to stay in his place this weekend but cant get a hold of him, she says typical hes kind of flaky, but she gives his friends number to us. Apparently they both rent out their apartments and then stay in each others apartments when someone is renting it... seem strange to me but anyway we called this gal, i cant remember her name... And of course no answer.. By this time it is 4pm an hour after our check in and i call AIR BNB customer service, they we extremely helpful....So they tired contacting him ( in the mean time we still had our luggage and were just walking around the town with it). AT 6pm i received a call from air bnb and they said they couldn't get into contact with him either! they asked if i wanted to wait and see if he responded and i said NO! it seem so sketchy and unsafe to be staying with someone that isn't even responding to airbnb !! So we had to find a new place to stay, lucky air bnb had helped us with this... Later that night around 7:45pm i get a call from Jonathan.. I answer "hello who is this?" J-'this is your airbnb host, did you want to check in? sorry feel asleep" ARE YOU KIDDING ME SO FOR ALMOST 24 HOURS YOUR WERE ASLEEP WHEN YOU KNEW YOU HAD PEOPLE ARRIVING! EVEN AIRBNB COULDN'T REACH HIM! And honestly he didn't actually sound sorry at all as he giggled after he said he feel asleep, i responded with a "nope" and hung up the phone. Needless to say I WOULD NOT STAY HERE! seem like this isn't the first time something of this sort has happened!

I wouldn't trust this dude.  It was cleaned but there was a profound smell of dog in the apartment.  It didn't smell as if the dog took a crap or peed everywhere but it smelled kind of like wet dog all over the apartment.  It was obnoxious to the senses.  Also, didn't know this dude had a dog.  I was pissed.  Worked late the night before, took an early flight hoping to nap when i got in and while i'm trying to fall asleep, the dog is crying cause it has to go to the bathroom.  I was annoyed.

If I could give no stars I would I had surgery the morning of and I asked to check in at 11 it was approved I got there I walked in tried to open the room door and there was people in there they didn‚Äôt open door they said They were previous tenants I checked the next room door locked mind u I just had major surgery and walked up all those stairs I called the host texted many times no response at this point I‚Äôm in pain I walked to my car called n texted still no response I went and got a room at the Omni I lost 276.00$ and it‚Äôs been days I didn‚Äôt stay not one night and I‚Äôve gotten no response from host and the customer service still hasent fixed the issue I need a refund this was the work experience ever especially after havin major surgery !!
It really wasn't what I expected. Very disappointed and don't think it was worth it.

First, Ingrid‚Äôs place itself is modern, spacious, neat, clean. The front-facing street is also charming. However our 8pm arrival was a nightmare. It‚Äôs hard to discern where the house is at night. The emailed instructions were inaccurate: the ‚Äúlong front driveway‚Äù has a big closed front wood gate facing the street. Ingrid asked us to unload/meet her in the back alley which is ANYTHING but convenient: narrow, uneven dirt drive, a dead end, and pitch black. You have to back out of the narrow lane flanked by neighbors‚Äô cars. My driver declined Ingrid‚Äôs insistence to unload there (so dark she had to meet us with a flashlight); we used the gated gravel path in front instead. The house backs onto woods and the back gate has no lock. It‚Äôs pitch black. After attempting to sleep, I checked the windows and found all 6 downstairs windows unlocked. SOLO WOMEN TRAVELERS SHOULD NOT STAY HERE unless lights and a gate lock are added. An aggressive dog made it worse. Ingrid was helpful with my moveout.
No hassle, as advertised, quite neighborhood, we would book again.
The pictures don't do it justice!!! It's look so much bigger in person. Will stay here again!
You are a damn fool if you come to Austin and DON‚ÄôT stay here...so book a stay already!!!
Could not go on trip due to Covid 19 so I have no feelings toward this place.
Stayed here with 2 friends and it was nothing short of perfection. The location is very close to downtown but you'll have a hard time wanting to leave the inside of this comfy home.
Do not stay at bottom floor of hacienda as it is extremely disruptive if someone is staying on 2nd floor.
My mistake in booking and Daniel gave us a full refund even though he didn‚Äôt have to. Highly recommended
Unique little place.  Cool  atmosphere. Too bad our stay was so short.

The room was very stylish. However, something we did not expect was for the pullout mattress to be covered in dirt when we pulled it out, and for the room to feature a bathroom with walls that did not go up to the ceiling, so everyone could audibly hear every last drop of pee and other things very easily which was off-putting for the women in our group. Everyone seemed to agree that we didn't expect what we got. I ended up staying with a friend in town because I didn't think I'd get much sleep. Additionally, the host asked us to leave them an additional $25 cash or venmo them for "city tax". I contacted Airbnb about it, and they said there should be no such thing, so I think they were trying to scam us for additional money

We did appreciate that the host allowed us to check in early (1 1/2 hours) and she was very communicative.  The inside space was very clean.  However, the AC unit (window) turned on and off every few minutes until we turned it down to 65 degrees and then it would stay on longer than a few minutes.  Every time it turned off, the ceiling lights would get bright and when it turned back on, they would dim - VERY ANNOYING!  The outside space was definitely lacking and looked nothing like the pictures on Airbnb - it was very messy!  The rock stairs out back are dangerous (the pictures don't show that) - definitely would not recommend this place for older people or people w/ young children.  That is noted in the description, but as I said, the pictures don't accurately depict what is there.  For the money we spent, we were disappointed - we've stayed in other places for the same money and they were pristine.

Anna and Chad were exceptional hosts. The room is exactly as described. They are also extremely quick to respond. Chad offered us many recommendations about places to go and things to do. They also graciously allowed us to keep our bags at their house while we explored the city before our flight back home. I have nothing but positive things to say about my experience and would stay there again.
The property was exactly as described, and the proximity to 6th street cannot be beat. Gaining access to the apartment was a breeze, and all codes provided worked without any problems.

Wir hatten eine tolle Zeit in Austin! Das Appartment ist super zentral gelegen, direkt an der historischen 6th Street. Da dies das Vergn√ºgungsviertel von Austin ist, konnten wir abends auch im Zimmer die Live-Musik genie√üen. Nach Mitternacht war es dann ruhig, sodass wir gut schlafen konnten. Das Appartment war sehr sauber, modern eingerichtet mit bequemen Betten und alles Wichtige war vorhanden. Kleine Grocery-Stores, sowie M√∂glichkeiten f√ºr Fr√ºhs√ºck, Mittag, Abendessen waren direkt vor der T√ºr, sehr zu empfehlen ist das 1886, direkt gegen√ºber :) Zutritt zu Geb√§ude und Wohnung erh√§lt man schl√ºssel-frei √ºber Zahlencodes (Eingangst√ºr wechselt regelm√§√üig, Wohnung individuell f√ºr jeden Aufenthalt), was wir als sehr angenehm empfanden, da wir nicht st√§ndig irgendwelche Schl√ºssel verteilen mussten, wenn wir zu unseren jeweiligen Konferenzveranstaltungen gegangen sind. Anfragen wurden prompt beantwortet.
Parking sucks.

the TV was broke on arrival and even though they said they would have it fixed it never happened, many lights do not work... this is only a 1 bedroom with 3 beds in it... it has a very used and worn feel. Be prepared for bar music till late every night... after many Airbnb stays this is one of the worst...
Elevator was broken and apartment is on 7th floor
This is one of those Airbnb‚Äôs that ruins your next Airbnb that just doesn‚Äôt compare. A clean, simple space. Would stay again
No comment
We we‚Äôre standing outside for 20mins with no response from the host. Had to cancel due to the inconvenience.
I did not actually stay because I got confused.
great place! convenient location (close to downtown, but the neighborhood isn't super busy).

As other reviews stated, it's not that this home and location aren't good, it's just not great and up to standards offerered by many superhosts.  If you are looking for great airbnb experience, you will be disappointed.

The room was beautiful and very comfortable. The three problems I had were it said in the description this was the guest house, it's not really a guest house in my opinion. It's connected by a door to the owners part of the house. Not exactly the private guest house I was expecting. The pool was not off the guest house as appeared in the picture but off the owners part of the house. This wasn't the romantic getaway I was expecting. Not to mention the three sets of gates, steps and stone pavers I had to drag my luggage through. Very disappointed and not worth the $200 a night.

The issue I have here is that I reached out to the host after booking stating that I felt that they were not clear on the description that this place was shared with another unit. In all fairness they did respond and state that this was disclosed in the house rules description which it was. They offered a full refund, which I stated I would still stay since it was the day of check in and would be difficult to rebook something else. After a while I was notified that they cancelled on us leaving us without a place which I thought was petty. This is the only reason I am posting a bad review.
Un hogar muy limpio, amplio, luminoso y acogedor, sin duda volver√≠amos!! Gracias john!!!

The listing was accurate as far as location and communication with Robert was good along with ease of entering the apartment.  However, upon arriving, we found rotten food in the fridge, no clean dishes and a dishwasher with mold/mildew, heavy mildew that was red in color all up the shower walls and on the floor, dirty sheets, and food/liquid spills on the floor.  Felt like a party/frat room.  I immediately notified Robert that we would we leaving to stay in a hotel and Robert refunded our money.  Robert stated that a new cleaning company was the issue, however I find it hard to believe the amount and type of mildew would grown in a week.  The next day I notified Robert that the refund was $64 short of a full refund.  Two weeks has gone by and no resolution and this is the last day I could post a review as per AIRBNB.

Location is phenomenal, but whole airbnb arrangement is illegal. The building management forbids it and all residents are tenants including the host here. You have to stay hushed about your stay. Host provides one fob and the fob provides the only access to the entrance, the elevator and all the amenities. If you come as a family or group then that can be inconvenient. There is no free parking, on-site parking is a multilevel structure and is $24 per night, City parking overnight was $3 and freely available on Electric Drive. Host offered no such information to us. The apartment could use a serious cleaning as it had a bad odor, probably from a dishwasher loaded with dirty dishes from before. There is an old small TV but no remote, no cable, no DVD player. NO cooking utensils in kitchen either. There was no clean silverware or dinnerware when we stayed- bought disposable stuff from HEB. Once again, Location is superb and probably the apartment would work well for a group of singles who would eat out or party outside.

El apartamento era muy acogedor, todo estaba muy limpio y ordenado.
El barrio era muy tranquilo, y a unos 5-10 minutos de la universidad caminando y a una media hora del centro de la ciudad.
Como posibles mejoras:
el aire acondicionado es bastante ruidoso y la nevera tambi√©n.

En general, si volvi√©semos a Austin volver√≠amos a coger el mismo apartamento sin dudarlo.

We initially loved the space, but saw a few cockroaches and the ventilation system spewed pollen. We ended up leaving a day early. I let the host know, but she denied it had anything to do with the house. I wasn't looking for any refunds, just a simple acknowledgement that something was wrong with our stay, but they were not having it. So for that reason I can't recommend this property. Too many hotels and other places you can stay that will at least listen to your concerns.

Great location! Very cool design. The bedrooms only have beds, no dresser or nightstands to set anything down. I ended up using the ironing board in my bedroom as a makeshift vanity. Also, we had large cockroaches in the house which was gross and freaked us (two girls) out big time. If you are light sensitive, bring an eye mask to sleep, the shades in the bedrooms provide no help.

Beautiful place, but watch out for scamming!  As of today Nov 6, 2018 the farm house listed for only $113/night. For the price we paid $164/night, we didn't feel we got what we paid for as far as space & service.   We couldn't use the 1st floor space as it was dark at night (we were out during daytime), some lights don't work as their light bulbs were removed or made dim, we were asked to do some cleaning although we paid additional cleaning fee, and we were accused of breaking and stealing some property items.  No value gained from staying here and we will never return to this place or recommend it to anyone.  We feel the host was scamming us for more money.  We paid $100 in advance as cleaning service charge, yet the host messaged us a day before the check out asking that we clean after ourselves (such as dishes and carry the trash out to the corner of the street) else there will be extra charges!!!  The host indicated "these instructions are in the house description before you booked the house".  We looked for these instructions everywhere in Airbnb and we couldn't find them and the host was not able to point them out to us.  At night, we also noticed all the lights in the kitchen and living room were extremely dim that we couldn't use the space.  We couldn't see where cups and dishes are stored, we couldn't sit at the breakfast bar and read, and we were watching our feet trying not to fall over furniture. Some ceiling lights throughout the house don't work as their light bulbs were removed.  After check-out, we messaged the host to confirm we cleaned the dishes, thrown out trash, and left.  10 hrs later we received a request from the host asking us to pay extra $70 for missing bath towel and broken Apple remote!! Really!!!!  We were shocked and upset by these false accusations and rejected them as we never used the TV and we never took any bath towel.  We sent a response to the host rejecting these claims and never heard back from her, not even an apology.  We don‚Äôt recommend this place, stay away.

Ein sch√∂nes kleines haus. Sehr modern und sauber. Die Einrichtung ist funktionell aber auch sehr einfach (Ikea). Die R√§ume aber auch  Bad und Bett k√∂nnten etwas gr√∂√üer sein,  aber wir haben uns rech wohl gef√ºhlt. Die Lage ist sehr gut, ruhige Wohngegend in der n√§he von SoCo und man ist schnell im Zentrum. Whitney war sehr zuvorkommend, immer erreichbar und hat sich schnell zur√ºck gemeldet. Alles in allem k√∂nnen wir das Haus nur weiterempfehlen.

This was the worst airbnb stay I have ever had. The host is a huge problem. She will harass you at every turn the moment something goes wrong. Unfortunately, a few things went wrong during my 44 night stay. Please do not stay here.  Example, the host has surveillance everywhere and she has no tolerance for food deliveries left at the wrong door. You will receive a message from her every time your food order is dropped off incorrectly at her house, even when she is not home while you stay there. She will also go out of her way to charge you outside of airbnb for anything that goes wrong that may represent a monetary expense for her. Airbnb has a system set up for extra charges when something goes wrong. She will not use it. I felt very unsafe, paranoid, and overall uncomfortable. The house is great, good location, but in this price range, $4,500 mo, I would expect full amenities, no baby roaches on my toothbrush, and a more professional experience.

I cannot recommend this host or this property. Upon completing our 3-week stay (some of which we had no power), our host accused us of stealing all her linens, pillowcases and towels from the property. The evidence of our crime? Her cleaners had called her and told her they "couldn't find any towels" and she had "seen them all a month ago." Obviously, they must all have been stolen by us ‚Äî two clients on a road trip who paid her $3,000.00 and got our kicks dabbling in the underground soiled towel market.

Before we knew it, she had turned around and billed us for all her towels, saying that "AirBnb could help if needed." We were so angry. Were we being scammed?? We engaged AirBnb first, who reached out to the host to verify goods were actually stolen. She had not even visited the property herself and instead relied on the word of a new, completely untested vendor who simply didn't know where things were.

An unfortunate, ridiculous end to an otherwise nice stay. Do better.
Killer location, Austin hospitality at its finest.
Brad‚Äôs place was exactly as listed, no TV in the bedroom, though one wasn‚Äôt listed either, so if you want to wind down at night plan appropriately with a laptop or phone for tv in private.

Le logement propos√© par Josua √©tait tout simplement parfait!
Notre chambre et la salle de bains priv√©e √©taient tr√®s propres. Nous avions √©galement acc√®s au salon et la cuisine.
Il se situe √† quelques minutes de marche de plusieurs endroits √† faire (et √† refaire) : Zilker park, Barton Springs, etc. De plus, la rue est tr√®s anim√©e et s√©curis√©e!

Josua est un h√¥te tr√®s accueillant et tout √† fait sympathique : n'√©tant pas v√©hicul√©s, il est venu nous chercher en voiture √† un point strat√©gique. Il nous √©galement partag√© les meilleures choses √† faire dans cette ville!

Cette maison √©tait tr√®s chaleureuse et convient tout √† fait aux couples ou aventuriers solitaires! Je vous le recommande vivement!
It was difficult to specify an arrival time.  Host was extremely flexible.

100% recomendable. El departamento es muy c√≥modo, limpio y luminoso. Sarah es una perfecta anfitriona, responde muy r√°pido, siempre atenta a lo que pudieras necesitar pero sin invadir. Y adem√°s el barrio es precioso!!!
Solo observar√≠a que hab√≠a pocas ollas y bandejas para cocinar.
Great place. Very quiet. Only problem we had was the porch light coming thru the bedroom window made it seem that it was daytime all the time. It really messed with my sleeping.

Our stay here was pretty disappointing. We managed to be in Austin during the blizzard in February 2021 when the whole city lost power ‚Äî to be clear, that was in no way our host's fault nor was there anything he could have done about it. However, he was uncommunicative with us as we tried to sort out what to do in a house he was hosting us in that had freezing temperatures, no power, and no hot water. It's not like he could have turned the power on himself, but at no point did he offer to help, ask how we were doing, let us know if/where there were any flashlights or candles, or anything else to be helpful.

As for the apartment itself ‚Äî there was hair on the furniture in both bedrooms when we checked in as well as dirty dishes that we had to clean ourselves, and when we notified our host he just said that 'sometimes the cleaners go too quick', without offering to help rectify the situation. The couch was pretty beat up, the WiFi was unreliable, there was very little natural light, the towels and bathroom amenities were cheap, and the bed creaked so badly that any movement in the night would wake you up. None of those are egregious on their own, but it added up to an overall very disappointing experience. I would not classify this as an AirBnB Plus.

Tobin‚Äôs place was in a good location- walking distance or even electric scooter-Ing distance from main areas in Austin.

The place itself was spacious for 4 of us, and all bedding and amenities were provided, however when we arrived we saw cockroaches in the kitchen and were a little worried. Additionally, the beds are extremely noisy and not the most comfortable.

This apartment is one of those outdoor entrances so you can really hear everyone and everything outside the surrounding area. And there were birds that had a nest right outside our door so we were a little scared going in and out of the apartment since the birds would aggressively fly in the hallways and get stuck haha.

Overall, I would recommend others to stay here for the price and location!

This is one of those places where you get exactly what you paid for.
Pros:
The location was amazing- literally 10 minutes to downtown using side streets.

There‚Äôs plenty of local food spots about 5 min away from the location.

Spacious bedrooms

Cons:
The walls are very thin it‚Äôs hard to tip toe around if you‚Äôre a heavier person. I‚Äôm sure the downstairs neighbors thought that we were jumping but, the floors are just very squeaky.

The keypad is close to being worn out. It always took us a few times to unlock the door due to the buttons sticking. When trying to check in- it took us about 20 minutes because of the keypad. I did call the host but he did not return my call at all. We finally figured it out on our own.

I don‚Äôt think I would stay here again how we, if you do need somewhere close to downtown, and only plan to use this Airbnb for sleeping and showering- this place is for you !

Tobin's place was clean and pleasant. He was responsive to our communication/needs. The beds were comfortable. The kitchen had everything we needed and more. We moved the coffee pot to a little table next to the kitchen due to lack of outlets. There isn't much natural day light but it was ok because we were gone most of the time or resting. We were able to enter easily and had no problems with keyless entry. Very convenient location!
*My biggest concern was that there is no hand/safety bar of any kind in the shower, no safety strips on the floor of tub, no bath mat/rug for ceramic tile floor* The tub felt slippery and wet feet on tile is slippery. It's an accident waiting to happen! My 80 yr old mom was with me and did ok, but we both felt that was a big safety concern! Bare minimum on towels. Only paper towels in kitchen-host provided 1 roll. Both couches are terribly uncomfortable! That surprised me and was disappointing. No outside space. Overall we enjoyed the space.

The Daniel Drive house was spectacular. Even better than expected. Staying there was one of the highlights of our trip, it was perfect for our needs.

However, dealing with WLVR was needlessly difficult. Myself and several members of my group were repeatedly pestered and condescended towards by the WLVR staff. This was unnecessary, unprofessional, and stressful.

The AC was on the fritz when I arrived but Genevieve made a call, the tech came right out and the problem was fixed asap. This is our second time staying here and we;ll probably do it again next year!

This was a clean spacious place to rent for the  weekend. It had everything we needed to make it our own Thanksgiving at home. The back porch was an extra space my family loved to use. The traffic on the side road was a little crazy but the house has a fence to help block it. The only complaint is you don‚Äôt have full control over the thermostat. We would stay here again.

While Renee's place had most of what my family and I needed for our 5 night holiday stay, we felt it was very bare-bones for an airbnb and not great value for the money we paid. Several things in the house were in need of repair or replacement such as the dishwasher (which did not work at all), the blinds in all of the rooms, and the screen door. The blinds also provided no privacy in a busy neighborhood area as they were virtually see-through. The beds were all pretty uncomfortable.

The neighborhood itself is not a great part of Austin -- it's loud and there's lots of noise from the street. The place could have also been much better equipped considering it is for hosting larger groups. There were no cooking basics like oil, nothing to bake with such as baking sheets or dishes, and overall not many amenities or supplies were provided in comparison to other airbnbs I have stayed in. It felt like the owners were trying to cut costs anywhere they could which rubbed us the wrong way. For example, they had the air conditioning system pre-set so that it would get very warm in the house in the middle of the night even when we would manually set it before going to bed, causing the house to get uncomfortably warm. Overall, I would not stay here again.
Cool space with lots of privacy.  We didn't get a chance to meet the host regrettably.
The showroom is not warm

The place was nicely decorated and had a cute record player with a great slection of vinyls to play. Unfortunately for us and our stay, we encountered two negatives. One, was a lack of parking close to the home. We had a loaded truck bed with suitcases, fishing poles and bikes that we had to park in front of someone else's home, a few houses over which was not ideal. I think if it had been explained that their's a lack of parking in front of the home, it'd have been helpful in our descison to stay here, initially. Second, there was a strong musty clothes or mildew sort of odor that just did not go away. We opened the front door to try and air it out thinking maybe it had been closed up for a while, but it never faded.
After asking if we could park in the driveway, even if it meant being blocked in, which unfortunately we couldn't, we didn't want to seem more of a bother.
Well-located studio. Has microwave, no stove/oven. We did have some mosquito trouble, so be quick with the door!

La Casita Bonita es un tesoro! Por mucho el mejor Airbnb que hemos rentado. Desde la limpieza y el estilo minimalista del cuarto, el area y la ubicaci√≥n, es sin duda una excelente opci√≥n para alquilar en Austin. Caro y Emiliano son unos excelente hosts, siempre bien atentos y r√°pidos en contestar cualquier pregunta o recomendaci√≥n. Cabe mencionar que en la habitaci√≥n incluyen un mini fridge con refrescos, agua y Red Bull, tambi√©n una consola de Nintendo y TV por si deciden quedarse en el cuarto a descansar. En general una excelente experiencia, sin duda pensamos regresar muy pronto a La Casita Bonita, muy recomendable!

Simon should not be renting this apartment. He required us to call him for building entry and didn't tell us about a Thursday evening flight he had scheduled where he wouldn't be available to answer the phone. He mentioned another way into the building but we found that locked when we tried it. We had late night plans but unreliable building access contributed to our decision to skip them and not stay out late in general.

This could have been avoided if we were allowed to take the key with us but Simon instructed us to lock the key in a lockbox every time we left the apartment and told us that if the key was lost we would have no recourse to get back into the apartment. To access the lockbox you have to lean into his private balcony from the very exposed public building space. We were uncomfortable the whole time navigating the building and wondering whether or not to risk a bad review by further pressing the point of being allowed to take the key with us. If you don't mind waiting for access to the building in the middle of the night, hoping security doesn't find your presence suspicious, sneaking around the building and looking like a burglar trying to unlock a lockbox on someone's private property from the public area every time you need access to the apartment, then you might enjoy Simon's spacious bathtub and clean kitchen.
Quite spot in a nice neighborhood. I didn't like that the lock on the room door was broken. And the pot where I boiled coffee in the morning was dirty. Other then that you couldn't beat it

Great central Austin location. If you're looking for more of a private experience, this is a good place. I however enjoy connecting a bit more with my hosts, rather over a cup of coffee or tea, and that just wasn't something that my fiance and I experienced at this particular Air BnB.

I will say the hosts were very responsive to our request for items we were in need of (ice, can opener, and bottled waters), but there wasn't any communication or "getting to know you" outside of that. Is the fact that we didn't feel much of a connection on this point the end of the world? No. But I will say I've traveled and stayed in many Air BnB's (in and out of the country) and the personal connection is one of the primary reasons I've continued to choose this particular option over others. If that's not there, then you might as well just get a hotel right?

Again, this isn't a knock on the location or amenities per say, but more of just a disappointment in not really feeling like the experience met all of my expectations based on the description and price, as compared to other places in the near vicinity.
Excelente son personas incre√≠bles amables sin afectar la intimidad de verdad esperamos regresar. Lo m√°ximo!!
If you're looking for an authentic Austin experience... Look no further

Amazing location! Tons of cool places around and 10-minute scooter ride from downtown.

Was bummed that there was a leak in the ceiling and from a window (we had to put bowls on the floor and when I mentioned it to Nathan he said he‚Äôd probably go to Home Depot as he expected there‚Äôd be a leak..). Also I do wonder if there has been a cat and a litter box maybe at some point as there was a persistent smell. Make sure that you understand that there are NO toilet or shower in the trailer, you will have to get dressed and go out the trailer and in the house in the middle of the night if you need to go...

We loved the location, the trailer was well decorated, but at the end I don‚Äôt understand why 5 stars were given so often to this place :(

In keeping with Austin's motto to "Keep It Weird" there are few stays to better this that Nathan's Air Stream! The bed was also incredibly comfortable. Unfortunately had issues connecting to Wi-Fi, which neither Nathan nor myself could seem to fix despite our best efforts, so I had to resort to using a nearby coffee shop to get work done. (First World problems).

UH-MAZE-ING. I didn‚Äôt want to leave! Backyard is a little smaller than expected but didn‚Äôt ruin anything! I almost wanted to cancel plans just to stay in the AirBnB! Definitely will be renting again next time I‚Äôm in town!

Super cute place to stay but doesn‚Äôt quite live up to the photos. Bathroom is not attached and it‚Äôs across the backyard and up about 10 stairs. Everything seemed a little dirty (inside there was a weird film on everything, dishes were dirty, backyard was a bit of a mess). The hot tub was cool, decor was cool. It got veryyyy cold at night and the space heater was quite loud. Not maintained enough for the price we paid.

Nathan hat mir sehr freundlich empfangen. Er hat mir Tipps f√ºr Aktivit√§ten gegeben, diese waren sehr hilfreich!
Ich habe mir √§ussert wohl in der Unterkunft gef√ºhlt. Sie ist sehr sauber und wirklich gem√ºtlich - es hat mir an nichts gefehlt. F√ºr die Umgebung Austin habe ich die Lage der Unterkunft gut gefunden.

Unfortunately, we had to check-out of Tobin's place after the first couple of nights (we should have stayed for six). The bed frame was broken and unfortunately, he did not come fix it, despite us giving him an entire day to do so.
For an Airbnb Plus stay, we'd expect better hospitality. Not to mention, Tobin's space was lacking amenities - there was only one washrag in the bathroom, only one hand towel, no body wash in the shower, the smoke detector had been removed from the kitchen, there was no dresser or drawers for us to unpack and only a handful of hangers for us to hang up clothes.
Overall, it was a horrible experience, compounded by the fact that we went two nights with little-to-no sleep because of how noisy the broken bed was.
Thankfully, Airbnb supported us and allowed us to check-out early.

Dog hair on sofa and no linens for additional bed. NOT CLEAN! Kitchen knife chewed up by dog(?). Lights in living room did not work. Wi-Fi did not work. Bathroom towel rack and vent falling off wall, toilet wouldn‚Äôt flush properly.
Host did not respond in a timely manner.

Unfortunately, this is my first non-5 star review of a stay. I want to be fair and give credit where credit is due: the place is clean, affordable and would probably work for a short weekend stay. I have been on the road working from home and normally book Airbnb Pluses because there are generally no issues, and if there are the hosts are generally awesome and fix them in a timely manner. My main issue was the wifi, contacted the host shortly after arrival and he said he would be by ‚Äúwhenever he‚Äôs at the property next‚Äù to fix the issue. I responded asking for an ETA because I had some important meetings coming up and never heard back during my month stay. The only time I heard from him was at the end with him asking me to give him 5 stars in every category. Normally with a bad experience I don‚Äôt even write a review, but this just rubbed me the wrong way. If you look at the reviews of his other units on the property you can see that this is a known issue which hasn‚Äôt been fixed for months. The other issue was that the electricity in the living room would go out for 30mins-1 hour every couple of hours to the point I had to sleep on a friends couch for the last week of the trip because the AC would go out as well. I hate to write a poor review, but I do want to warn others that are in a similar situation as me to be aware and read other reviews of all his units on the property to get a clear idea of what to expect.

I don't think this can be classified as an Airbnb Plus property. The plusses: the location, and the comfy bed. The negatives: the lack of items and amenities to make this place acceptable. The condo is also very dark during the day, and the wifi was very spotty, so difficult when trying to work from home. The kitchen was lacking many cooking items, (proper knives, a cutting board etc) the bathroom amenities also weren't on par with what I would expect from a Plus property. I think small changes would make this place more comfortable. In addition, the host was not as responsive as we would expect. We stayed a full week, so if you don't intend to spend a lot of time in the condo it could be fine, just don't expect the special 'extras' that a Plus promises.

I don't typically leave reviews of any kind, but felt the need to do so for this particular stay.

The back deck was really lovely, and the place was well stocked. Unfortunately, we didnt have a great experience otherwise.

When we arrived, a very strong mold/mildew smell hit us at the door. The floor/ rug in front of the sink was saturated with water but we couldn't tell where it came from. We cleaned up the water and let Rachel know so that she was aware and could check out the issue before it caused any long-term damage. She responded quickly and seemed grateful that we let her know.

We realized the smell was coming from AC, which sits directly above the head of the bed. We opted to turn it off and open windows to try and air it out as the other vents didn't work. After leaving them open for a day while we spent the entire day out, the smell dissipated a bit to tolerable level.

The place wasn't the cleanest. There were dust balls on the windowsills, the AC appeared and smelled dirty, and the silverware drawer countained dirty utensils. There were dishes in the sink upon our arrival.

Two days in, we found cockroaches hanging out around the broom closet. We decided to find another place to stay two days before the end of our visit.
it was a disaster.. AC blows dust on the pillows and the mattress was broken

Coming from Dallas, my boyfriend and I were looking forward to a weekend getaway in Austin and our stay at Sean & Sarah's place all week as it appeared to be a great value for the private suite in a favorable location for what we had planned. Unfortunately, due to the catastrophic Category 3 Hurricane Harvey that was forming in southeast Texas that same weekend, we regretted to cancel our trip to avoid any risks and impact of Harvey reaching the location of the airbnb, which would of course ruin a romantic weekend getaway, to say the least.
We did much research on the hurricane and weather conditions in the area prior to cancelling the trip as we had both already taken off work and made other investments for the trip outside of our airbnb reservation. After much debate, we decided to formally cancel the trip about an hour after check-in since the developing hurricane's path looked to be close enough to pose an unsafe journey with nearby areas being evacuated, including my boyfriend's family who strongly advised not to venture anywhere near the Austin area that weekend.
We thank Sean & Sarah for partially refunding the trip under their moderate cancellation policy. However, we were quite disappointed that due to such an unexpected and devastating natural disaster such as Hurricane Harvey, they were unwilling to make an exception and provide us a full refund. Based on our back and forth communication and their raving reviews, my impression is that Sean & Sarah are a very nice and decent family. However, in this case, there seemed to be a lack of compassion in their decision not to issue a full refund on account of the nearby Category 3 Hurricane Harvey. We do wish them well and hope they were not directly impacted by the devastation and regret that we couldn't keep our reservation we so looked forward to.
You will not be disappointed! Beautiful property -- way more space than I imagined, and the house was in immaculate condition.

This house has potential, but due to mismanagement and lack of productive communication, I cannot rate it any higher. At check in we weren‚Äôt even able to access the property initially due to a second deadbolt being locked with a different key. I contacted the owner and she started frantically swearing. Not necessarily AT me but still very unprofessional to say the least. After a hidden key was located we were able to access the house.

Upon entering and looking around the property, we found it to be very much in disarray. Dishes left all over the counter, sticky substance on kitchen counter, messy dog bowls with food all over the floor in the dining room, the trash was not taken out from previous renter or owner, bathroom had toothpaste all over counter and their personal toothbrushes still there. A cabinet in the kitchen had both over the counter and prescription drugs within a child‚Äôs reach. This made me extremely uncomfortable as I have two children that I didn‚Äôt think should have access to that if they go to the kitchen for a drink. The refrigerator had the owners food and leftovers inside. I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôm leaving more out, but that will give you an idea.

When we contacted the owner regarding the condition of the property she stated that she had to leave in a rush because of an emergency with her dog, but that the house was still clean. She sent us pictures of what she said was just before she left the house, but they were clearly from another time because they did NOT match the current conditions.

We did not ask for a refund or even a discount on the nightly rate. We merely asked for the cleaning fee to be refunded since the property wasn‚Äôt left clean for us. The owner said no and was honestly extremely rude about it. She said because we had already received a 10% discount for booking as ‚Äúnon-refundable‚Äù (but that has nothing to do with the cleaning fee or cleanliness) she would only refund 40 dollars, period. Luckily AirBNB took care of the cleaning fee for us once we sent them the photos we took of the property. Airbnb made it right for us and we will continue to use this service but I would never, ever suggest this home to anyone visiting the Austin area.

I will start with the good things- the location of this place is great in Austin. I think this is a prime location to stay at to have access to a bunch of different areas. Check-in was easy.

My main problem was the house cleanliness. This is a full time home which I didn‚Äôt believe I read when originally booking the non-refundable stay. I may have missed it but I don‚Äôt believe this information was included. When we arrived there were crumbs and some sticky spots on the counters. When I communicated this I was told it was from the cleaning solution which is just not true. There were snacks left out and the floors had crumbs and dust and did not appear at the minimum vacuumed. The bathroom had children‚Äôs toys in the tub and overall there were just a very large amount of personal items left out. Again, for a lived in home this makes sense, but this was not the expectation I had from the pictures which do not show these items. I will credit that the cleaning fee was returned after some discussion.

My other problem is the bed situation. This booking says 5 beds. One is the bed in the guest room which was fine. One is a twin bunk bed which cannot have adults which I didn‚Äôt initially know. One is the child‚Äôs bed which was depicted in pictures. But the second double bed is the trundle underneath the kids bed, which you do not have access too. It is really difficult to pull it out and use on the carpet. And the last bed is the ‚Äúluxury air mattress‚Äù I was told. We only had 4 people and we were able to make this all work, but I think all of the ‚Äúbeds‚Äù need to be shown in the pictures and usable to count as beds listed on the booking.
Our stay at Adrianne's couldn't have been better!
The hosts were so accommodating when my flight was missed and let me stay longer (later check out) . We also locked ourselves out one day and they came and let us in and bought local cookies
the house is dirty and smell Bad
No pude aprovechar el espacio; cambi√© de planes.
You should stay here! The place was even more stylish than the photos portrayed; girls trip with no car = 10 to 15 minute Uber to everything you could want to do in Austin‚ù§Ô∏è
Hermosa decoraci√≥n,el departamento cuenta con todo lo necesario tanto para cocinar como para dormir todo todo no le falta nada hasta el √∫ltimo detalle est√° cubierto.

It is a tiny space, and right in the back of the house where a family lives, and so it feels a bit raw and exposed.   I needed to put paper towel over the drapes so that I'll have privacy when exiting the bathroom / shower.     TV works only through one's computer.     I needed to ask for more tp which was a bit odd, rather than having enough for my stay it felt like I was rationed.    It's a decent place for a night or two, def need a car or uber, not walkable to anything, and plenty of parking right outside.

The Airbnb was as pictured, though a bit older in real life than we expected. The one thing to note is that (as is common in Texas), there were always a ton of bugs outside the door every night so every night we had to be careful to make sure bugs didn't come in. We also found a few spiders around the place.

However, the biggest issue we had with the place (and the reason we checked out early) was that in our last night we saw several cockroaches in the place, around the size of my palm. And also a few dead cockroaches. The cockroaches flew around the place and since it's a tiny home they were crawling on our bed as well. Lisa, the host, mentioned that this was normal since there's a hole in the place that cockroaches come through (apparently the hole is being fixed) so I would caution any future guests... stay at your own risk.

The pics advertised are not at all close to what it looks like in reality. There are multiple units separated from each other and the pool is towards the last unit. We stayed at unit 1 and the pool was close to unit 18 . The dishes at the unit were dirty, so I was not at all comfortable using them. I put all the dishes in dishwasher again. Upon arriving at the pool, the heated pool was very dirty and was not working, took pics. We even asked if we could be places close to pool,but we were told it was not possible until next week. But after looking at the pool, that wouldn't have helped since it was dirty.
I would not go there again.
Didn‚Äôt have any real problems

A good sized unit (3 bedrooms + open kitchen/living room). Nancy was very quick to respond. Parking was easy and the neighborhood was mostly quiet. There was some construction across the street, but nothing too loud. My only negative was that I think the place could have been cleaned more thoroughly (some ants in the kitchen, food crumps on the counter, etc).
the airbnb was just as offered. location for a nurse working at saint David's south is incredible. host was quick to respond with any problems and very polite.

Overall nice place within walking distance to boat rentals. Pull out couch was very comfortable plenty of extra blankets, pillows and towels. Wasn't too thrilled that the pool was under going maintenance during the entire stay. TV didn't work and WIFI had very weak signal. Called the office who reset the router but still didn't help.
Great quick getaway before school got started for my daughter. Was kind of a bummer that the lake level was so low this year but still lots to do around the lake .

This is a very outdated place and dirty. The back door is broke.
Hot tub was cold.
Ash from a used and dirty fireplace was all over (not used by us).
The shower is made for someone under 5 foot tall.

For what we paid, we expected a more 5 star experience. We got a 5 star view and location with a 1 star house.

The villa is very nicely located overlooking the marina.
Nevertheless there were many problems with this unit:
- Cleanliness: the sheets on one of the beds were dirty and full of hairs. There were no extra sheets in the villa that we could use.
