- Broken/ not working properly: the door screen was completely broken, the microwave and the hair dryer were not working. The showers are very old and not working properly, it was impossible to fix them at a right temperature
- There were no shampoos, kitchen sponge (i.e. essentials).

An additional note: the building is old and not updated at all: there are all the switches on the walls for plugs but not for the ceiling lights. In order to turn the lights on/off you have to use the chain below them (which is annoying, especially if you are not tall).

This Airbnb was a good choice for a little getaway to Lake Travis for the weekend. The hut was cozy, the staff was accommodating, there were plenty of amenities (linens, soap, kitchen utensils, a coffee maker, an iron, TV, Internet, firewood to burn). The second bed is a full-size, so not quite ideal for adults.
It was a great place. Great area. But a little misleading according to the photos. Not directly on the water. And no accessible fishing area.

Hot tub was filthy, brownish water (pics to show) room equipped with a fire place and no ready kit to utilize the fire place, therefore, we had to settle in and leave into town to buy a $20 ready kit to use it. That should be avail for quest on site to purchase it as complimentary. No lake view due to trees blocking 90% of the view, blankets where hard like sand paper, restrooms extremely tiny (RV size) couldn‚Äôt find our way down to the lake to view the water it was all blocked. So we had to drive out of the area to see the water, at check  in we where asked the same questions as the App so frustrating after driving 5 hrs. Not happy, this was an Anniversary trip and it was not pleasant. We had a better tome away from the site

It's very clean and it was within 10 miles of everything we wanted to do. There were a few dishes in the kitchen area and a small fridge. The bed was firm, but I like that. The shower pressure was a little weak but nothing unbearable.

The room/apt was fine. My only issues are with the separate set of rules not clearly posted (including threats of fines up to $250) at the time of booking. No early check in, even though they advertised a flexible check in time...AND they expect you to stand on someone else's property or out in the street to smoke (or $250 fine). Finding the place after midnight in the dark wasn't the easiest thing to do in a city I don't live in.
Not as nice as pictures make it out to be. Very low water pressure for the shower. Otherwise the location is close to DT and 6th, as advertised.

Very nice place and relatively close to downtown Austin. We didn‚Äôt have any issues with noise as the area is very quiet. The only thing we noticed was the very weak water pressure for the shower. This could be due to the water issue that the city of Austin is experiencing, we are unsure. It took double amount of time to shower because very little water was coming out of the shower. Other than that, we enjoyed our stay.

The photos on Mireille's listing is a huge exaggeration of what the place actually looks like. The photos make the place look a lot bigger than it actually. This place is simply not designed for 6 people. She says there are 4 beds, really there are 2 beds, and she stuck 1 cot on the floor and 1 black leather couch that's extremely uncomfortable to sleep on (with no bedding provided) in the living room. Additionally, I'm shocked that she did not even offer essentials like SOAP, but offered 4 small hotel sample bottles of 'shampooing conditioner' that is clearly insufficient for 6 people. Additionally, her listing states that it's located in downtown Austin, but that's also not true (see map, it's in Clarksville).

Finally, I would not list below issues if the overall experience has not been completely subpar (beds and soap). The water pressure in the shower was so low that none of us have even washed our hair because the water pressure is so weak that we are afraid that shampoo couldn't get washed out. The cleaning crew came to our unit the morning after we checked in as they thought we were checking out. The wifi was not working and I had messaged the host at 10:30 the evening we checked in and it wasn‚Äôt fixed until 9am Friday morning. One of my friends works in Finance and had calls starting at 8am East Coast time, which is 7am Central Time, so she had to wake up early and go to a cafe to access Wifi. Again, none of these issues independently are a big deal, but overall do add to our already poor experience and leaves a further poor impression.

Our group actually split up the last evening and half the group ended up getting a hotel. I would strongly strongly recommend not staying here. It's outrageous that we paid $300 a night for 3 nights in this small, cramped unit.

Good stay, but not quite as described. This is a second floor unit in an older house. Great location and accommodating for several people, but nothing glamorous. Broken front door screen and little living room space with bed directly beside front door was not great. Fine stay overall in terms of cleanliness, but not as grand as description.

This place was disgusting and disappointing. Host waited 27 days into my reservation to give me a key to my room, the internet didn‚Äôt work for 10% of my trip, the room was covered in cigarette ashes I had to clean myself, and he offered no refund or communication. He should be ashamed, acts more like a slum lord than an airbnb host.

It was a magical land..oh wait, wrong world..It was a hipster land in the city of Austin where you can find this quant Inn ideally located neither too far nor too close from any coffee shop or place to eat.
Nate's place is great with a great shared bathroom and a wonderful room but Nate himself as a host was quite negative sometimes and that came off in a bad manner to me in the beginning of the trip.
Nate is a very nice person! The only major problem we had was the dogs waking us up howling both mornings. The actual room we stayed in was very clean but nothing special.

My new home away from home! This place was better than expected! Pamela gets a gold star for her attention to detail. This home has everything you need. It's close to the university and downtown as well as local restaurants. I hated to leave!
First air bnb I‚Äôve stayed in and it did not disappoint! Loved everything about it!

This house is much bigger than it seems when you first pull up. Well furnished, has everything you need for your stay. We only stayed 2 nights unfortunately, but would stay here again when we visit Austin.
The host canceled this reservation 182 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Overall it's a good place. It's close to some night life and restaurants, and the price is good. Sleeper sofa is very uncomfortable though and the wifi/cable is terrible.
Too bad the nearby bakery is under reconstruction.
The neighbors can be a bit noisy. One runs a shipping company for cakes.

This apartment is great.  Location cannot be beat.  However, I did not have hot water for a shower for my stay - 2 nights.  Although some minor attempts were made to rectify the situation, the bottom line is that a new hot water heater was needed and not installed timely.  I offered the manager several opportunities to right this wrong, but he did not respond.  The extent of it was, "sorry for the inconvenience."  I consider showering more than a convenience.
You can‚Äôt go wrong with this stay. Not far from 6th street at all.

Very good place for a family or a group of travelers.
The house is nice and is exactly as described.
The location is close to downtown.
The only problem is that the neighborhood is very dark at night and does not feel safe enough. I think it is perfectly safe, but the feeling is a bit unpleasant. Would not recommend for a single traveler.
The house is spacious and generally pretty, but there were some unusual bugs inside when we were there. You should rent a car as public transportation isn't so great in Austin or near that area...

Jennifer's house is situated on a quiet street in a great neighbourhood. Communication and check-in were impeccable and very pleasant. The hostess reacted immediately if we had a problem, for example when one of the bikes had a damage. The bikes are very convenient, but I wouldn't recommend them for a longer tour.
Not recommended. Dirty floor and lost of mosquitoes and bugs. Very tight for three people.
Comfiest bed and softest sheets ever. This place is small and just right if you need a place to crash a few nights while in Austin and don't want to stay in a hotel.
Very small bathroom. Had a musty smell which bothered my wife who is sensitive to mold.

Matt was extremely communicative, and check-in was a breeze! The space is cozy, and has everything you could need. It's too bad we had grey/rainy weather, otherwise we would have made use of the porch and yard. Next time!

A good small stay for anyone needing to find a spot near downtown Austin. The location has many various restaurants within short driving distance. The only upside is the parking was a little difficult without our backup camera we would have had some difficulty leaving the driveway and that‚Äôs about it!

El contacto previo con Matthew fue muy amoroso, durante la estad√≠a no tanto. El √∫ltimo d√≠a llov√≠a, estaba construyendo algo atr√°s por lo que era todo barro, tuvimos que llevar alzando 4 maletas y no recibimos ayuda

William was polite in our interactions prior to the visit, but the house was extremely unacceptable from a cleanliness perspective. There were roaches in the master shower, cobwebs with dead insects, the place was very dusty, the floors were not clean, and there was dog fur in the sheets. The most ridiculous thing of all was that there was UNDERWEAR ON THE FIREPLACE MANTEL! The Airbnb Cleaning Checklist was clearly not followed!

Also, note that he lives here. All of his belongings are in the house. This includes the fridge, freezer, and closets. The office in the picture did not have any desk space cleared for use. It was very cluttered.

If you just need a place to sleep this might be the place for you.  The place lacked in cleanliness, and essentials. We were there for a cross fit event and didn‚Äôt need to ‚Äúhang out‚Äù at the house much, but it would have been nice to have had the essentials to cook breakfast at least. There were no dish rags, hand nor dish soap, only a few paper towels, 1 pan and a few pieces of silverware but plenty of bowls and plates. Kitchen floors were sticky, cabinet knobs were gummy, fridge was dirty inside and out, baseboards were dirty, several spiders and webs throughout, rotten potatoes in the cupboard. Carpets were badly stained and walls are bare and scuffed. The least homey place we have ever stayed at!! Walking barefoot in this house was not even a thought. We had an issue with the shower not turning off so that made us miss the first of my sons event, the owner finally called back and came over to fix it while we were gone which was kinda weird but necessary.    He seemed very nice and communicated promptly. Really needs to consider a new cleaning crew!!

This place was terrible in terms of cleanliness. The refrigerator was filthy and had mold, there were large spider webs on the ceiling, the bed looked slept on, the carpet was dirty, we found a dirty sock on the floor, the walls had scuff marks, the dishwasher didn‚Äôt work, there was a live roach in the kitchen....etc. My family had to live in this dirty place for a week. And the host thought $100 was a sufficient refund, when this place cost over $700. Stay anywhere but here!!!

Overall a nice listing‚Ä¶ up until our stay was rudely disturbed by our so called ‚Äòhosts‚Äô over miscommunication.
If you‚Äôre looking for a quaint, somewhat spacious place in Austin this might be the one for you. Note they stay right by the listing.

This host does not care. We booked his property for SXSW...the event was cancelled due to corona virus. I was told by him to contact airbnb, I did so and never heard back since everyone needed help in doing so. He will now not refund us the money, this is a time of complete and utter chaos and we need to be there for one another. Please refund us ASAP!

No surprises.
We enjoyed the space on the first floor with family and friends.

Evwn though Roland was very responsive and the communication was really fast and troubleless I have to be assertive about the place itself. The neighbor hidden was bad, there were truck houses just next to the house, also the house was small and only has one bathroom for the entire place so if more than 3 people go to the house you'll have some issues with this. Overall it was an OK, but still the price and the house are totally overrated for what it offers as a whole.

Erin's place was quiet and private. We were able to rent bikes and bike all around the city.
Check in was easy! The condo was furnished with everything you would need. We had issues with water pressure and ac but Erin is looking into the problems.

We wouldn‚Äôt stay here again if we have known all their personal pictures and belongings was everywhere. It was a bit uncomfortable, we didn‚Äôt even stay in the master room because of all of the pictures.. we had to go buy a blow up mattress and stayed in the living room.

Lata was really communicative and the location itself is really nice. There‚Äôs a beautiful patio and lots of deer in the area. However, the house itself was not super clean. There were big cobwebs in the living room and the bathroom, rooms and sheets were dusty. Also the blinds above the bed just fell off and we had to make a trip to Home Depot to fix them ourselves which took up time from our shoot. The outdoors were nice, and we‚Äôd planned to stay the night. But the bed was very small for 2 people, so we just ended up leaving after the shoot and getting another hotel room.

Bryan‚Äôs place did the trick for us. It was clean and accurately described. A few odd things did happen:
- did not receive a reply from Bryan for a request we had
- the cleaning crew was still working 45 minutes after our check in time
- there were no check out instructions
Nicely decorated but the shower is terrible and location to main areas is a bit farther than described

A few large dead cockroaches and one dying on our arrival, lack of kitchen supplies, ripped sofa bed that is unusable for sleeping, limited cleanliness. Good response time when we had trouble entering  lots of parking at the fourplex.
Great place, but it was a bit smaller than we were expecting. The only downside was the acoustics. Everything was very loud and echo-y, so downstairs noise affected upstairs ppl trying to sleep.

We had a terrible stay at this home. We were told it would be suitable for 4 people. The place is extremely small and barely suitable for 1. If your looking for value for money definitely do not stay here. Host also tried to request extra money off us for an extra cleaning fee when we left the home in good condition. Extremely disappointed with my stay here and felt I was cheated with my money for such a small and basic place.
Not sure why Airbnb is forcing me to write a review..
Nothing but compliments.

the space was exactly as described. I checked out after the first night Bc I could not deal with sharing a bathroom with another guest . This was my fault and no fault of the host. Josie  was hospitable:
Great location and stay! Water pressure is low as stated from other reviews but wasn‚Äôt a bother. Would stay again !:)
The room was exactly as stated. Josue was a great host. Only complaint is the low water pressure in the shower as others have noted which wasn‚Äôt a big deal to me. I would stay again.

Do not, for any reason, book this place.
It is his apartment he sublets out via air b&b in violation of his lease. But let‚Äôs be real, you probably don‚Äôt really care, nor should you, assuming the place is up to par. It isn‚Äôt. Will smell bad, not be cleaned, you‚Äôre lucky if he made his bed. I refused to stay here, cancelled, and made other arrangements.

The host is kind and thoughtful with providing books and homemade gifts, but we were very disappointed with our stay. We had this place booked for two weeks, and ended up leaving and finding a new Airbnb after 3 days.

Though the place appears clean, tidy, and comfortable in the pictures, it was far from that. The grill area between the carport and the house that looks to be a good place to hangout and grill, was cluttered and had about 20 huge pieces of spare wood leaned up against the house near the chairs and table.

As we were walking through the house, our feet turned grey/brown from the dirty floors. While looking though the kitchen, there was dust, dirt and grime in the draws and on the dishes, and worst of all, there was mouse fences under the kitchen sink.

Among other things, there were piles of hair in the bathroom drawers, soap scum on the shower curtains, and dust/dirt on the extra cloth chairs that were in the living room.

Most importantly, the lack of insulation in the doors and windows makes this place unbearable to stay in during the winter. We had the heat turned up to 85 degrees during our entire stay, and we were still freezing! Unless the host plans on properly insulating the doors and windows, I‚Äôd recommend not staying here in the winter time.

We were very excited to stay here, but were incredibly disappointed with our stay.
It was sold as two beds it was one and a broken air mattress.

Something about various things that I won't get into here for good reasons for them. I basically left early etc to deal with this Airbnb. I didn't think that there would be a problem when I checked in but there were on multiple levels for reasons that are beyond my ability to comprehend. I will leave it up to someone else to figure it out. There was also another female guest earlier in the stay who may have contributed to majority of the issues but they don't confront her or something else is going on. I empathize with noise sensitivity issues but Patty was beyond reason on this issue. She thinks that you are slamming the door unless it makes zero noise. She thought her door glass will break and so on!!! In my opinion, I never slammed the door. I know how to slam a door and this woman has not heard nor seen the evidence of anything of that sort. Just too much idiotic nonsense here and zero chill.

We were still ok with the place but there were a couple of things that bothered us. The upstairs shower facet came right off and had trouble turning off. The kitchen chairs were very shaky and about to break. The outside pool furniture was old and worn out with holes. We could not get to the washer closet.
This is a cool house but the toilet ran loudly all night and I couldn‚Äôt get any sleep.  Was exited to hangout in the hot tub and make s‚Äômores but the fire pit was not hooked up.

My expectations were high for the price per night, however, the home was so dirty and dog hair was everywhere.  The two couches were filthy. I had to change the sheets in all beds and clean tubs and floors.  Bulbs were out and light fixtures broken.  The pool/spa furniture was in terrible shape.  I was extremely disappointed.  The home is/was listed for sale and a family and realtor arrived unexpectedly to show the house.
The landlord is very good. Everything is fine. But unfortunately I was bitten by ants in the swimming pool.

The house's plumbing was a problem for the trip. There was a leak in the living room that we had to continuously clean with a shop vac, also one of the kitchen sinks was clogged so it made it a bit difficult to clean dishes up.

There were also a lot of spiders in the house throughout the stay, pest control needs to come out and spray to keep them out.
This place is very close to the city but wrapped in nature. You do not feel like you're in town.

Estuvimos una semana, la respuesta es r√°pida, en auto a SoCo hicimos 12 minutos, esta hermoso es para ir a desconectarte y estar en contacto con naturaleza, a pesar de que ah√≠ mismo vive Ruthy y su esposo, tuvimos total privacidad, volveremos sin duda y mi perrito feliz con el cesped. Recomendable

Me & my mom stopped here last night on a cross country road trip. We were so excited about staying here, since the pictures on the listing were so cute. As soon as we opened the door we both cringed because it smelled so poorly of ‚Äúarmpit‚Äù. We sprayed some perfume to try and dissipate the smell. After settling in I wanted to take a shower. I have been in plenty of campers before and expected the shower to be smaller than at home, but this shower is TINY! I am 5‚Äô8‚Äù size 12 and did not fit. I ended up standing in the bathroom and attempting to wash by sticking one limb in at a time. The shower was also extremely painful because the water only has one temperature which is almost scalding. I take very hot showers generally but this was next level. Additionally the bed was extremely thin and hard. We didn‚Äôt get any comfort or sleep here and left the next morning to continue on stinky, exhausted, and overwhelmed. Next time I will just book at a hotel.
We would not recommend a stay here.

Kevin rents out his personal home for Air Bnb in which he makes you check in late with no self check in just a key under the mat. He leaves his dirty shoes under the bed his guest sleeps on and dirty clothes around the house . The apartment smelled like marijuana and he even had drug paraphernalia in plain sight. Kevin also accused me of stealing his charger when I told him I didn‚Äôt have the charger but was still willing to pay him for it he got an attitude and threatened to contact Air Bnb and make sure my deposit was taken from me even though I left his home In the exact same condition it was in when I got there. Kevin was an extremely terrible host he even contacted me during my stay and tried to come pickup clothes and a razor so he can get ready for a party while I was staying there like we were roommates.Extremely unprofessional and I would rate it ZERO stars if I could. This was my worst air bnb experience.
Very cozy space, the location is very close to the convention center and a block away to jogging trails on town lake.
betty was nice there were some issues thqt she resolved and the cottage was quite nice but this neighborhood isnt very safe, lots of homeless camps, saw police a lot, etc.

Pros:
- excellent location
- flexible when we had to change our dates
- very convenient check in/check out process

Cons:
- bikes were in quite bad condition (one broke down on us while we were 4 miles away. It got dark while we were trying to fix it ourselves and was a long walk back)
- bit dirty (red stains - maybe wine or maybe blood?? On the duvet), dead cockroach in the bathroom, dead ant in the bed)

Overall good location, but if the bikes are your deciding factor know that they are not reliable!

Perfect location. The bicycles are killer. I borrowed a bike every day and it made my trip 1000x better than it would have been otherwise. The bed was very comfy and the Airbnb is private and secluded. Lots of thought put into their space. Only negatives are that the AC is noisy/ineffective. And the kitchen has poor ventilation for cooking. It felt muggy inside and I felt sticky after showering. It would be difficult to stay in the summer.
Well located, isolated unit and had our own entrance!

Shawn's place is small and if all you need is a place to sleep it is a great spot. There is a fridge but no silverware or microwave, so beware if you bring back leftovers or get food for breakfasts. The place is close to public transit and about a $4 Uber ride from downtown.
My family was disappointed with the property.  The home is in a state of renovation, and should not be rented until improvements are made.

We were excited to stay here because of the convenient location, the check-in was easy and the communication with Roderick was quick.

Unfortunately the cleanliness of this place was very deficient and we had serious roach issues during our stay. We found two big dead roaches when we arrived, but what made our stay very uncomfortable was that more roaches kept showing up. We saw medium sized roaches crawling on the kitchen counter top on multiple occasions while preparing meals, one crawling on the dining table, another crawling inside the dishwasher, one on the fridge door, on our clean clothes that we left on the desk, and several small roaches crawling on the floor. It was a very unpleasant situation for us and our guests.

Based on our experience, I wouldn't recommend to stay in this place until the roach issue is properly addressed. Additionally, the "enhanced clean" attribute shown in the description of this place is not accurate, the floors were not clean and we also found dirty pots and pans on the kitchen shelves.
A horrible unclean unsanitary dump that is falsely advertised.

The couple was very nice. But the little room was just not that comfortable. She forgot to tell me there was a heating blanket under my sheets so all I felt was uncomfortable wires on the bed. I thought they were coil springs! Which was horrible. First night was freezing. Hot air escapes the room very easily when you open the door. Main house is warm but my room needed a portable heater -cold. Dust everywhere. I hated the shower.. did not seem that clean.

Toilet was very clean tho. For the price, it's alright.
Private bath, very clean. Unfortunately, no TV.
Kicked me out on the street after screaming at me. Infested with cockroaches, lizards, snakes. No cleaning done whatsoever. Very rude behaviour. I felt unsafe in the presence of the owners.
Cute place, well located. Only complaint is that the windows were all painted shut and could not be opened so it was very stuffy and not ideal temperature wise.
Very old house, house was dirty, things were strewn in the back yard including an old truck.

Lydia es una host incre√≠ble, siempre estuvo pendiente de nosotros y nos brind√≥ excelentes recomendaciones locales.

Un saludo y recuerdos a ambos!!
Alles Erforderliche wurde bereitgestellt. Kommunikation war mangelhaft.
My stay at Baylor'a apartment was... dirty. The sheets were not fresh, the bathroom had urine at the toilet area, there were no clean towels, and the kitchen was disgusting:

Fabulosa experiencia. Ryan no puede ser mejor anfitri√≥n, pendiente de nosotros en todo momento, esperando para recibirnos, d√°ndonos mil recomendaciones... un 10! La habitaci√≥n es completamente nueva, decorada con mucha gracia e impecable. Bebidas, secador de pelo, plancha... de todo. Excelente lugar, buena host. No duden en reservar con ella.

The place was fine, was in a great location and had all your basic needs. For a Airbnb plus I was a little underwhelmed. The furniture seemed cheap and basic. The biggest issue was a snowstorm rolled through during our stay and knocked out the power. It was unprecedented for Austin and happened the day we checked out, so I don‚Äôt put this on the host at all.

However, in times like these I wished the host was a little more understanding and supportive. After we left, we had to leave our rental car in their parking spot as we got stuck in the snow with the roads being so bad. We scheduled to have the car picked up when weather permits. But this was the least of our problems.

We were stranded and there was no power in that part of town for almost a week. We spent the week hopping from hotel to the next searching for any food we could find. It was dire. I found it extremely insensitive for the host nag me about the car in the parking spot, saying they had guests staying there, which would have been impossible. The whole neighborhood had no power for almost 5 days. No one was coming in or out. How about checking with how someone is doing? The car eventually got picked up before a someone else ever checked in.

I think this speaks to a larger issue with Airbnb. Hosts are often very disconnected with what‚Äôs happening on the ground. They‚Äôre often not in town and they can‚Äôt help you when something really goes wrong. As for Airbnb itself, they don‚Äôt own any assets so they are limited in what they can do to help. That‚Äôs why there‚Äôs such a huge variance on their platform. This experience has made me appreciate the consistency and hospitality of hotels.
If you have never been to Austin, this condo complex is located in a lower income are. However it's decently located BnB for down town and surrounding areas........

Overall, it was fine. The description is accurate. The apartment isn‚Äôt in a neighborhood that we cared to explore but was easy to get an Uber to the spots we wanted to go. The gate code was wrong when we first arrived, but the host was quick to respond and no issues. I understand that staying in a air bnb is a different experience than staying in a hotel but there were things that were much missed. We ran out of toilet paper after night one- there were only the two roles that were already in the bathrooms and there was no soap in the showers. There was only 2 towels when we arrived which certainly isn‚Äôt enough if the space holds 8 (there was only 4 of us and one got there before the rest so warned us to bring towels). If I go to Austin again, I would stay downtown within walking distance to the action but overall it was fine - suited our quick stay and for a good price
No comment

This place is a SHIT HOLE!

Not a condo, crappy old apt. Beds are horrible and not thoroughly cleaned. Zero hospitality. We had to leave one day early due to a homeless man being passed out on our front door step. We contacted host and she passed it off on apt manager. She took no responsibility offered nothing.

We will report to AirBNB

Pros: quick to respond host, easy check in , not far from downtown
Cons: encountered quite a few bugs in the apartment & the area was not safe for young females; we had more than 1 situation that left us a bit unsettled.
Great place to stay! The neighborhood may seem in a slump, but this place is not. Felt super comfortable the whole time and had easy in and out access.

The inside was fine and clean- the location was good as far as proximity goes to other places in Austin BUT the location was extremely ghetto, the complex was gross and run down and the pool was not a place to hang out - overall for a group of girls we felt very unsafe in the neighborhood- I was extremely disappointed and felt deceived by the description of the whole property- the number of beds was deceiving as well- as choose that place because based on the description we thought we would have a bed for each person however 4 of us had to share beds which isn‚Äôt a big deal but definitely was not what we thought we paid for- I wouldn‚Äôt stay again and wouldn‚Äôt recommend- sorry

Die Wohnung ist sehr sauber, gut ausgestattet und die Kommunikation mit Melanie unkompliziert, freundlich und schnell. Die Lage der Wohnung ist gut- alles in Austin ist schnell erreichbar.

Allerdings sind die Matrazen sehr weich (nichts f√ºr Leute mir R√ºckenproblemen), in einem Schlafzimmer ist der Boden absch√ºssig daher schl√§ft man mit dem Kopf nach unten. Warmes Wasser ist leider selten vorhanden. Die Anlage wirkt von au√üen heruntergekommen und die Gegend ist be√§ngstigend vorallem bei Nacht. Nicht f√ºr Familien geeignet.
Der Pool auf dem Bild hat wenig mit dem Pool in der Anlage zu tun- wir haben ihn aufgrund der Nachbarschaft nicht genutzt.

Es tut mir leid, dass zu sagen aber ich w√ºrde es als Frau mit Kindern nicht nochmal buchen. Die Wohnung ist super aber die Gegend und der Zustand au√üerhalb der Wohnung ist wirklich nicht gut.
The mattress was a bit rough to sleep on, not great for back sleepers. Otherwise, no problems

This Airbnb is dressed up nice and is accommodating until you go to bed.  Beds and pillows were uncomfortable and single pane windows in the bedrooms along a noisy street i.e. trash trucks at 3am every night made sleeping difficult.  If the bedrooms were better this would be a 5star place.

The apartment was super clean, modern and had everything we needed. The location could not be better, right downtown but also not super loud at night. I would definitely recommend staying here.
My only disappointment was that we asked if we could store our bags for a couple hours upon check out but didn't get a response, and had to pay $43 to keep our bags at the Visitor's center.
Pillows are hard as a rock. If you‚Äôre going to stay here bring your own
The Host John is a mess tries to take advantage of the situation and asks of extra money after checkout and comes up with all the lame reasons.

Quaint and clean studio space with modern feel. Fairly small area with plenty of natural lighting but sufficient for 1-2 people. Drawdown blinds provided privacy from the main house but otherwise, we didn't feel secluded. Great location in proximity to the UT campus and approximatively 15 minute drive to Downtown/Rainey Street.
Everything was fine. Short commute to downtown. No issues at all. Bus only a block away !
Clean, Daiwoo microwave matches the fridge but has trouble popping microwave popcorn.
Quiet cozy place to crash while touring the city of Austin. I would stay here again.

Photos look better than actual studio. Entrance is not impressive, be ready to walk around a pickup truck and pile of construction trash to reach studio. Lots of Do Nots in House manual. No closet or even space with shelves or hooks for hanging clothes. Drawers were filled with cleaning supplies and refill bottles.

The house is in a great location. The hosts are not responsive and not helpful with the issues that we had. When I went to the door the key was in the keyhole. A red flag for me. Upon entering the property, it looked dirty. The blinds were dirt stained and the walls were dirty also. The towels we found were frayed and nasty looking. Looking at the sheets there were makeup stains and hair on the bedding. I tried contacting the host, but the voicemail box was full and I could not leave a message. Cannot recommend staying here.

The stay was great! It was very central to everything and all of the shops and nightlife on South Congress was walking distance, but it was tucked back far enough that it wasn't loud. My only gripe would be that there are no blinds on the front of the house, so you have to change in the bathroom for full privacy.
Die Unterkunft war sehr sch√∂n. Wir haben uns bei Olivia sehr wohl gef√ºhlt. Es war sehr sauber. Check-In war problemlos √ºber Code m√∂glich. Das Bett war sehr bequem!

Everything went very well, the wifi was a bit on the slower side but my family and I managed. We were even planning on returning in a few weeks as my Cousin is leaving for the marines and really wanted to spend time with the family in Austin again but unfortunately we will just have to search for another home. I would strongly advise everyone to take pictures of everything before they leave. My family and I swept and mopped the entire house, took all trash out, cleaned out the fridge of smelly left behind condiments from previous renters and left things very clean and even did not wear shoes in the house as the host asked of us but was contacted by the host saying that we owed $20 for dirty towels left in the rooms? we cleaned the whole house, checked all rooms and restrooms and no towels were left behind. I spent over $1000 so $20 is not an issue but it is an issue when you're being charged for someone else's mess and also paid a $200 cleaning fee and still the host is asking for more even when you left their home spotless. I have never heard of a host charging for towels, I have always assumed that was a wear and tear item but I guess I was mistaken. I have rented Airbnb's countless times and have never had an issue but now I have learned to always take pictures of absolutely everything upon check-in and check-out.
No tv

Need more towels, no wash clothes, update pictures to reflect how the place actually looks, need air refresher, house smells musty and like there a horse inside. need bathmat, need trash cans. main picture where living room looks decorated and clean and a nice couch, not true. The couch was a terrible cheap and small futon and the "brown ottoman that turns into a twin bed" was not there. Not in a good area. Very cheap and close to downtown (20$ uber ride) , but you get what you pay for.

Un appartement confortable tr√®s bien situ√© dans un quartier tr√®s agr√©able et anim√©. Tout est faisable √† pied (20 √† 30 mn de la 6√®me rue). Nous n'avons pas vu Sam ni son colocataire et nous avons donc b√©n√©fici√© d'un appartement entier. Sam a r√©pondu √† toutes nos questions et s'est montr√© tr√®s r√©actif. Merci Sam !

The place is quite good but the host would never respond to any of the calls when there was no water from any of the tap from the day 1. The Air conditioning wasnt working and to my surprise there was water leaking from the Ac at middle of the night. I reserved this place for a birthday party and that turned out to be a disaster after these things. I was highly disappointed by the house
Could be a great getaway but amenities are less than advertised and misleading.  Do not expect a cool AC.  It is HOT inside in summer.

I would not recommend this airbnb as the quality of the boat is not worth $207/night (with all the fees included). It was an interesting and eccentric experience but not worth the money. There was no hot water, and the toilet clogged itself overnight with the rocking of the boat. We did not use the toilet in fear of the $200 cleaning fee, yet old urine and feces came up from the toilet. Additionally, there was used toilet paper in the waste basket since you are not allowed to flush any toilet paper down the toilet. With a $75 cleaning fee, this was honestly disgusting and unacceptable.

The accommodation was nice enough but the stay was unmemorable.  The air conditioner worked very well.  The kitchen was adequate.  It was a very quiet marina with almost no signs of life.  There was not much to do.  We couldn't use the kayak (there was only one, not two as listed) because there was no paddle.  It could be a nice getaway if you're looking to get away from everything.  The price was reasonable considering we booked kind of last minute but overall not the best bang for our buck.

This guy has no sense of conflict resolution, compassion for others, nor concern about his renters.
I was woken up to two male police presence with the door wide open screaming and yelling for me to wake up. I walked out the room half naked as it was 1 in the morning. They gave me 15 minutes ‚Äúto pack my shit and leave because I was in violation of Airbnb fire Marshall code for pets‚Äù officers words. I was not contacted by the host prior to having my privacy completely violated, and enduring emotional and physical stress that I had never experienced before over a puppy.

Here‚Äôs the factual story.

I wasn‚Äôt impressed with the area/location of this air bnb but the inside has been remodeled/ upgraded by ikea to make up for the atrocious outer appearance and location (known drug area).

1. The inside of the home is as reflected in photos and the bed was comfortable for the one night. (You can tell the place is old as the floors creak when you walk.)
2. The hot water did not work during my stay and I informed host and he stated his was working fine (as he live in the community as well) and we were on the same boiler so that was his way of resolving that issue.
3. The second day there I had to have my puppy brought to me (due to other reasons.) He is a 8 week old potty trained puppy. That did not urine nor Poo anywhere in the place. As the house was as I found, when it left aside for me not having time to wash dishes from dinner I made that evening.
4. When I first arrived I noticed the odor of pets and feces filling the air where the apartment is located, as the neighbor across from this place keeps there animals on a covered patio and doesn‚Äôt apparently clean after them.
5. I was woken up to a nightmare of stress because my puppy was on the premises which is a violation (I take responsibility for). However I‚Äôve never experienced such a lack of human compassion or decency for another persons life/situation. I had to sleep in my car from 1 in the am until 7 am when I drove 3 hours back to Houston and couldn‚Äôt work because of the emotional stress that was caused. The host did not try to contact me nor resolve this simple issue before it escalated and I was violated in a way I‚Äôve never in my life experience. I spent over 200 bucks for 2 nights in which I only stayed one. If all you care for is somewhere to stay with no personal customer service or compassion from who you‚Äôre giving your money too then this is the spot. The way this situation was handled still weighs on me and I think will for a little bit as I was violated.
Rude person

We were in a rush to find an alternative Airbnb due to a bad experience and we booked last minute. We could not be more thrilled with our stay. Quick responses and quality service. Everything definitely lives up to the posting hype! 6/5 stars.

The place is clean just like the pictures on here, but to us the location was horrible. I guess we weren't used to that side of town in Austin. The apartments are not in a good location but everyone has their own opinion. The Host is good at responding.

Nice for price and inside is great but dont expect that outside as he states. We were very hot when arrived and with the locked thermostat I had to contact to get turned up....but host adjusted to what they wanted and due to 100 plus temps all day the 84 degrees apartment we arrived at barely cooled off by morning!!! I finally got host to reply and change around 2am in morning  but sucked he didn'tlower to temp I asked 69 or 68....he did 71! But you get what you pay for.

I don‚Äôt understand how this place has good reviews. I booked it based on the good reviews. The fridge had cockroaches, and the sofa-bed when pulled out had hair and dirt.  This place is a health hazard. I typically don‚Äôt give bad reviews but am compelled to do so here; that‚Äôs how bad this place was.  Renter beware.

Read the fine print before booking. I wanted to reschedule my booking with this host due to a family member having COVID and family disputes at home. I contacted this host about 5-6 days prior to the booked event and I was denied rescheduling. ***The host did not want to miss out on profit by having me reschedule and leaving the original booked date be empty*** I explained that he had plenty of time to find another guest to book due to memorial weekend but I was still denied. I asked for a bigger refund instead and I was also DENIED. The refund that I was eligible for was $60 out of $450. I contacted Airbnb hotline and it was completely useless. POOR customer service and host is money motivated. The original purpose of Airbnb is to be cheaper than Hotels and to provide better customer service. Don‚Äôt forget that!

We initially based our stay upon the condition of this place as shown in photos the host posted. We had hoped that the host's description of their place and the overall environment was an honest and candid evaluation, taking the highly rated reviews into consideration as well, we placed our trust into this host and reserved the spot. Upon arrival, the first thing we noticed were the handful of prostitutes waiting not even 10 feet from the entrance, being picked up and dropped off by shady characters in shady vehicles right back at the same spot in front of the property (this was around 3pm mind you, but apparently they work right outside the complex at all hours of the day from our observation) The tenants in the building also pickup the prostitutes from outside the building and bring them into the property. Due to this unsafe activity I‚Äôm very suspicious of these ‚Äúhighly rated‚Äù reviews and it makes me question a lot about this host and property. We also discovered not only that this was NOT an isolated condo (as the photos and description of the property led us to believe) but an apartment on the second story of an apartment complex unit. It looks like it‚Äôs the projects. The property itself was run down and there was a constant smell of cigerette smoke permeating the air around our unit. Soon as we walked up to our door we noticed hornets crawling into the top casting around the door. We quickly entered into our unit and found that the inside indeed did not match the exterior of this property, so we applaud the host for attempting to ugrade the quality of their unit somewhat. Like putting lipstick on a pig as a previous review mentioned... We found things to be relatively clean the first hour or so, until we began to comb through the bedsheets and towels and found an assortment of stains, noticing that the white sheets and towels had a rather unsettling off white color, not to mention how starchy and stiff the towels were as if they'd sustained every type of mess possible. We shrugged these things off, even the prostitutes outside initially, as well as the strange men around the complex who would sit in their vehicles for hours sometimes at night. We tried to overlook the complete dishonest description and just enjoy our stay but not even within several hours of our check in we began to find ROACHES in every single room in this place. We stood from the 4th until the 9th of september and EACH DAY here we found more and more roaches, in the bedroom, in the living room on the wall behind our heads as we watched tv, in the refrigerator and microwave ?!!!! Now we are no stranger to unruly environments, we are familiar with the hood and the circumstances of the ghetto but we did NOT pay to go stay in one during our birthday vacation. Disgusting and terribly dishonest on the host's part to not disclose neither the dynamics of the area. Bugs are a normal part of Texas living and hot weather, but this many ROACHES in a house is not healthy nor is it safe or comfortable. We tried our best to tough out the stay, it was unfortunately too last minute and expensive to stay in another airbnb in the area or at a hotel for the remainder of our stay but because of the non stop bugs we kept ourselves outside and about most of the day to avoid them. The roaches inside the fridge were absolutely disgusting and prevented us from keeping any leftovers or food inside the fridge during our stay, which was not only annoying but also expensive. This place is not safe for women alone, I would have not completed my stay if my boyfriend wasn‚Äôt with me. You may wonder why I did not communicate anything to the host right?! Just read his lack of accountability or lack empathy and aggressive responses on his previous reviews. I personally don‚Äôt like aggressive confrontation and I didn‚Äôt need anything or anyone else to ruin our vacation trip even more. I also normally don‚Äôt leave bad reviews so
PLEASE DO NOT BOOK WITH THIS HOST IF YOU CAN HELP IT.
Was very fast to contact and quickly made the room available. No problems! Great stay and is near the 35 to travel the city.

NO!
Really, no. no. no. no.
Seriously, NO, NO, NO, NO. Don't do it to yourself.

I booked the place based on Valdete's good reviews on the site, but I had to flee as soon as I could.
There were 3 major issues (plus, a very expensive cancellation policy you must be aware of) :

1. THE HOST BLATANTLY LIED TO ME.
When querying about Valdete's place, the very first thing I wrote, literally in the first line, was a simple question: Is your place within a walking distance of dining places? She quickly replied that it was!!
In reality, the house is in a suburban residential neighborhood, and not within a walking distance of ANYTHING.
When I communicated the deception to her, she replied "YOU CAN RENT A CAR."

2. WORST INTERNET CONNECTION.
The internet connection was REALLY BAD, the worst I've experienced in the last decade!! anywhere in the world!!
The connection was weak (2 bars) AND it constantly got disconnected! It was so bad that it took me forever to search for an alternative place, finally, I gave up and woke up my husband in the middle of the night and asked him to make a reservation for me from overseas!

3. NOISE, COOKING ODOR, YELLING, COMMOTION, AND NO MASKS
The room has a joint thin wall with the family living room, which is an open space with the family kitchen.
Yes, it is as BAD as it sounds.

Last but not least, when I canceled the reservation due to Valdete misrepresentation, false advertising, and lies she had the audacity to charge me $249 for that one night I HAD to stay at this miserable place! I arrived at Valdete's place in the afternoon, after a 20hrs transatlantic flight, with 3 suitcases. I had no car and no internet connection to book an alternative place therefore, therefore I HAD to stay the night. I checked out the next morning and left the room intact and spotless!
AND WAS CHARGED $249 FOR THAT ONE NIGHT!!!
There is a saying that goes, "Marry the person you will want to divorce." My advice, don't tie the knot with Valdete! Of any kind.
She is a terrible host and a cheat .
The host canceled this reservation 86 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

The epitome of a no frills stay. If you're looking for a cheap place to crash after a long night of drinking, this will handle that. Just don't expect anything more. Also see if you can find an alternate place to shower. It's a bit difficult to get it to where water starts coming out and even then it's not much. Luckily there is a cup you can fill up to dump water on yourself.
Had a killer time, within walking distance of Stubbs, Empire, etc. Highly recommended!

The apartment is located in an area that is not safe at night. Be extremely careful if you walk home from 6th St. There is a homeless shelter 2 blocks from the apartment which means that there are a number of people loitering in the area. Your closest walking distance shops are a liquor store, record store and a dodgy gas station. We saw a man fall down a set of steps right outside the apartment building because he was so drunk/stoned that he couldn't walk. The apartment is exterior entry, though in a gated area. There are many AirBnB units in the building and several people were wandering around trying to figure out how to check in. It was an odd situation, so we opted not to stay in the unit because we had women in our group who didn't feel safe in the area. The unit itself is as advertised-- clean and modern.

The apartment overall was nice however the toilet and shower was a bit dirty. Also be weary that there is construction happening next door so it can get loud.

Host was very strict with check out times, which is understandable. However, he did say it was $40/hour just to hold luggage or extend check out in the room, which is fair to extend check out, but as for just holding luggage, this seems a little bit exorbitant.

The area that the apartment is based in is close to the city centre, however, there are plenty of homeless people there, so be aware of that when choosing to stay here, I even saw a fight between them near the apartment.

Would never stay here again the place looks relatively clean at a glance, upon closer inspection it's filthy from the pillows on the couch to the dirty windows to dirty sheets with stains. This place was basically put together in no time and you can tell as the hallway light flickered and didn't work also trying to use the bathroom in peace no way! None of the locks work one of the bathrooms has a hole in the door where the lock should be so you can see right through. The notes left behind are just horrible and unprofessional such as the note left on the dishwasher on a napkin. Basically can't do anything even changing the temperature because it's a 500 dollar charge for almost anything. Oh and trying to get in push the handle up or it won't work we tried for 20 minutes to get in with no luck. Right in down town so that's the only upside. Did not enjoy our stay and felt uncomfortable due to cameras apparently watching you. Save your money and stay somewhere in east Cesar chavez. 1 star.

These hosts asked us specifically why we were booking with them ( to explore the live music & bars on  6th street) when the second wave of COVID shut 6th street down before our stay they would not refund us nor reschedule with out a higher rate. When we got to the place the dishwasher was broken. There was only one spoon and one fork. One of the floor to ceiling windows blinds were stuck shut. The master sink would not drain. We also were stuck in the parking lot due to the complex gate not working... we were stuck there for 30 min before we got a response back & an hour before we were able to leave. This threw off a whole day of plans.

Unfortunately, we were very disappointed once we arrived. This place looks nothing like the pictures. The pictures must have been taken when the place was new because the actual place does not look like this. When we arrived, it clearly had not been cleaned. There were smears on windows, sugar rings from previous drinks, sticky residue in the fridge and freezer. The bathroom doors didn‚Äôt have knobs so there were just holes in the middle of the door where a handle and lock should be. The showers (both) were not clean and had hair scattered throughout. There were also someone‚Äôs dirty clothes found under one of the beds. In addition, the big windows in the living area had floor to ceiling blinds that didn‚Äôt work so our view was obstructed.

I‚Äôm certainly one that rarely complains or writes a review. However, we traveled a few hours to get here and had other friends from out of town that met us there as well. We were both embarrassed of the condition we welcomed them into. All of us spent the first part of our stay cleaning just so we could try to enjoy ourselves.


I‚Äôm only writing our experience because I feel as though I would have had a second thought about booking this place if I read an honest review about the cleanliness and accuracy of photos. We were charged for every single person who even entered the condo whether they were hanging for a few minutes or sleeping there. Anyway, it was a waste of money, and certainly a disappointment.

Was conveniently located by 6th Street. Downside was that there were so many homeless people and crackheads walking around that we felt unsafe at times to walk towards 6th Street. Got harassed by someone asking us if we could buy them alcohol and then they got super aggressive when we said no. The condo itself would be very nice if owners would do upkeep/maintenance on it. One of the sinks in the bathroom is clogged and needs the drain to be cleaned out. The living room blind on the  right side won‚Äôt raise at all the chain is broke and not seated in the detent. The floors are so dirty that when we walked with white socks on around the condo it turned them completely black. There was a roach in one of the bedrooms the first night and we had to kill it. The bathroom lights in the guest bath flicker like a strobe light and hum super loud. The door handle to the condo is either busted or incorrectly installed. It will only open the door if you raise the handle up backwards. Led to us standing outside for 30 minutes in 100 degree heat trying to contact the owner about it. The metal coffee table in the living room was so wobbly we couldn‚Äôt even put drinks on it. Views from balcony were super nice. Would say it was mainly priced so high due to its location to 6th Street. If it was anywhere else it would be WAY overpriced due to all the things wrong with the condo.
Checkin was simple. There were a few items missing but they were quickly delivered to me.

The location is great but the stay is overpriced due to the amenities NOT WORKING. The sink was clogged, shower handle broken, lights in the room not working, heater not working, etc. There was zero communication on how to fix any of these issues.
not really like the photos
Poor location. Unclean apartment. Next to a gas station and surrounded by homeless people.
It was a nice place but hard to find at night. The area was a little scary as a woman to have to get out the car to enter the code to get in the gate located in a alley.

Mattress was absolutely awful. By the third night I could barely walk. Major back and hip pain. Already scheduled chiropractor visits for when I get home. Don‚Äôt know how this could be called ‚ÄúLUXURY‚Äù. Also, the walls are super thin. All road noise from trains, motorcycles, and neighbors coming in at all hours of the night.

Noisy with above neighbors having a dog and walking heavily with shoes.  Intermittently very loud noise from heater or whatever turning on.  No dresser but at least she ordered much more hangers for our stay so we could hang most of our clothes instead of pulling from our luggage daily.

As a fair review, I will give Nancy & Vin's place a solid 2/5 stars. The hosts were always available to be communicated with quickly and easily and the location of the property is absolutely prime with so many things easily within a walk's distance, this is where the overall hospitality stops.

My girlfriend and I booked this place for 4 days due to the immaculate reviews and location; sad to say we cut our stay short and checked out the next morning due to a multitude of issues in the property.
-Smelly dumpster directly in front of the property from another business
-Paper-thin walls, could hear all aspects from all directions, left-right, outside, upstairs. Found it hard to sleep with all the noise
-Broken furniture, mirror, and toilet seat; broken decor (Vases specifically)
-Overall unclean near window sills w/ dead bugs and dirt; messy washer area with tools scattered.
-Back patio is unclean and unswept; did not bother to go out there with all the foliage that has fallen.
-Dirty/Smelly sheets that were clearly overbleached and extra blankets with hair and dander from previous renters.
-Random source of fruit flies/mosquitos (potentially from the drain, not really sure)

Nancy and Vin were easily within reach and understood the situation and responded quickly, this however is not the experience I wanted to sustain on my first day of vacation in Austin. Until a new cleaning crew is hired I would not recommend this place as the awesome reviews do not reflect at all the experience I had. As one of the more expensive properties in the area, I was very unimpressed.
Nancy was beyond helpful with schedule changes and last minute adjustments due to my error not hers.  Great place to stay!

I hate to give this place a not-so-great review but I feel an obligation to provide candid review.

First the good

- host was very responsive
- general location is very convenient
- spacious enough for a couple

Now the not so good

- everything inside is really really cheap and pretty uncomfortable, notably the sofa.

- there is a TV but it‚Äôs really ghetto and has only Sling channels you‚Äôd never want to watch (‚ÄúDance moms‚Äù seriously that‚Äôs a channel) but no standard broadcast or cable channels. You‚Äôll only be able to watch your own streaming subscriptions.

- it‚Äôs at the back of a restaurant parking lot and so very high traffic and loud, with very little privacy.

- there was trash pickup going all morning on Friday (for hours), I think because of the restaurants there and even on Saturday. This really is the backbreaker here imo.

Anyway, so long as you‚Äôre aware of these drawbacks, it‚Äôs pretty reasonably priced and you could certainly do worse for a few night but not longer.

We enjoyed our visit to Austin‚Äîthe weather was perfect! The home was clean and provided almost everything we needed except uninterrupted sleep and we wanted to make sure to pass along the details.
In your ‚ÄúHouse Rules‚Äù notes, you remind guests to be mindful of the apartment neighbors below the house. Unfortunately, it was the other way around. Three of our four nights, we were awoken in the middle of the night or very early morning. There were loud voices and the smell of marijuana was intense. Even as we checked in, we noticed the smell but didn‚Äôt figure out where it was coming from until later that evening. After a 5:30 am wake up from the lower apartment on Saturday 11/25, the landscapers arrived at 8 am and began leaf blowing all around the house. We did not want to call you during our stay in case they got mad at us and made matters worse!! We had concerns when we initially booked about sharing a house with unknown tenants on the first floor, unfortunately those concerns turned out to be valid.
The alley is also so loud with trash trucks operating late night and early morning. You may want to consider a noise machine for your guests.
A couple of recommendations we have for future guests would be to replace many of the blinds since they do not give guests their full privacy and place a small television in the living room.

Le quartier est tr√®s calme, tout pr√®s de downtown, la terrasse agr√©able. Les chambres et la literie tr√®s confortables. Petit b√©mol sur Le wifi qui fonctionnait mal et  les ustensiles de cuisine, trop vieux et de mauvaise qualit√©, qui m√©riteraient d‚Äô√™tre renouvel√©s.sinon tout est parfait!
Almost don't want to share about this place because I want it to be available every time I come back. Can't recommend enough. Great for any conference.
Can‚Äôt go wrong. Book this place now.

El ba√±o estaba muy sucio, parec√≠a que ten√≠an mucho tiempo sin limpiarlo, de verdad no quisieras ni entrar all√° por todo el pelo y suciedad en el piso y ducha, la habitaci√≥n  estaba todo lo contrario, muy limpia y comfortable, la cama es lo mejor adem√°s que hay Netflix gratis y la entrada y recibimiento es muy accesible.
Looking for a place to crash this is the place .

This was one of my worst air b&b experiences I walked into a trashed house with some tweaker girls lounging around like they owned the place and after staying there I assume they were the ones who actually owned the place not this Caleb person cuz after I complained that I had to clean human feces off the toilet before I was able to use it one of them started cleaning the place and it seemed like they had been there for a long time the place was just disgusting other than the room that seemed relatively clean other than the sheets and stuff could have been cleaner but it looked nice I‚Äôm hard to upset and I‚Äôve slept in some shit places but this one was absolutely terrible how do you even get shit on a toilet seat where your leg is supposed to go and to top it off one of these tweaker girls stole my lighter after asking to borrow it

I am a local resident who needed a place to stay immediately because of some house issues. I arrived 3 hrs after the earliest check in time, I was standing on the sidewalk of the house for more than 35 min with 3 suitcases and 2 bags of perishable food in a 101 degree temp. I tried to reach the owner 4 or 5 times,no answer or instructions. During that time my phone died,and I had to bother the neighbors just to plug in my phone to call an uber to try and find another place to stay before my food spoiled,they were less than polite/helpful,which is understanable. I had to cancel my stay,never even walked onto the property, I received no apology, no refund, or understanding of a situation when people are in a bad spot,and refused my refund because it is the cancellation policy for them. Do not stay here if u want anyone to look out for u or have the slightest understanding and empathy so someone doesnt have 50 dollars taken from them for no service. Hope nobody stays here!

Caleb had great communication but the place wasn‚Äôt what I was expecting. It‚Äôs obvious that it was not professionally cleaned because the toilet was incredibly dirty (I did not feel comfortable using it at all), the floor needed to be swept in both the bedroom and bathroom, and the ceiling fan in the bedroom was covered in dust. There was no keypad lock on the bedroom door so when I left the house, I had to leave the bedroom unlocked. I didn‚Äôt feel very comfortable with that because there was another person staying at the house as well. The only upside is that the bed was very comfortable. I hate to write a bad review but I was just very disappointed.
Racist
Room was perfect, clean. Bathroom was HORRIBLE. Mildew in shower, no toilet paper.

I was extremely disappointed with this stay for many reasons. One of reasons I booked this property was because the listing stated that the host had followed and implemented enhanced cleaning protocols. I found the property to be the exact opposite it was not clean in many areas at all.  There were no efforts to clean during the 4 day stay that I could note. I would not book this property again. People are paying to stay at this property, and they deserve to enjoy a high level of cleanliness on the property and in the areas that they can use. I expect a LOT more from Airbnb, and when it comes to cleanliness this should be a top priority for every approved Airbnb host. This was unfortunately an epic failure in the category of cleanliness.

Place was absolutely disgusting upon entering. Rotting food in 3 different trash bins. Dirty dishes piled up in the sink. Dirty dishes on stove. House smelled of rotting trash. Dirty bed linens in my assigned room. Huge rip in the felt of the pool table rendering it useless. Working with air bnb to get a full refund.

A scam. This is the first bad review I‚Äôve ever wrote. I‚Äôm pretty easy going but this guy is a scammed me. The communication sucks. Every message I got from them was just instructions but never answered my questions. The code to the door did not work so I couldn‚Äôt get in. I canceled my whole stay with him which I paid 175$ and only got back 75 dollar back. Dude made 100$ dollars and I was never able to step foot into the Airbnb.

First , you gotta answer the messages , Poor extremely poor communication‚Ä¶

secondly , your advertising of the property was piss poor , your post had my friend who booked the place thinking it was a whole place to myself , while having the private room , no where in the advertising it says more than 2 guest will be using the space , we walked in with a house full of 5 and that‚Äôs not what I was expecting nor my friend who booked the room .. Just Terrible

This was a terrible experience do not book this place nor anything Caleb has to offer because this was a bunch of bull shit!!!

had a good stay, on time responses from host and convenient location. The place was a bit dirty though (counters and no clean dishes)

It was a decent room for $65 a night with all the fees. Don't expect to play pool becuase the table is VERY damaged. Its almost impossible to get a hold of the host but you will get plenty of automated messages. I lost my keys here and had to call corpoarte to get my keys back. The stay was Okay for the pay. You will have to share this with OTHER PEOPLE. the location was close to alot of places and 20 minutes from downtown. The bathroom and kitchen are cleaned daily.
Not responsive enough

I never got a response to any of my text messages I sent a pictures on arrival. my door was open the light was on and the bed was not made there were dirty white towels on the floor and behind the door.  it was obvious my room was not clean. Not to mention trash overflowing in the kitchen and the noise of. door slamming TVs and people talking.

Worth for your money. But had hard time sleeping - noisy roommate ( I belong she live there permanently or long term). Had issues with sleep than wake up loud talking outside my room. Room is clean and good. Bathroom is little broken and not properly cleaned. Sink was dirty with dishes.

I was a bit disturbed by the care and cleanliness of the home. Additionally I was charged a cleaning fee, and not sure what that goes towards as the shower had visible mold and holes in the wall that had apparent water damage. The tiles around the faucet looked to be caving in as well. In addition to the bathroom being beyond unsatisfactory the hardwood floors were in disrepair and created trip hazards. The refrigerator was not clean and had a foul Odor as well.

The place was great. Modern and good location. However, I am very displeased for various reasons. Additionally, the listing states that there are 2 bedrooms and accommodates 6 people. There were NOT 2 bedrooms. There was 1 bedroom. The second "bedroom" is a cramped office with a pull-out couch. And one couch to in the living room. There were 6 of us total and we did not fit comfortably. One of us had to sleep on the hardwood floor. No air mattress or anything. Also, there was dirty underwear within the sheets & pillow cases that were supposed to be used for the pull-out couch bed. Lastly, the owner did not state that there is LOUD MUSIC playing all day and all night at a bar right across the street. There should have at least been a note in the listing that states that. My grandmother did not get one ounce of sleep all weekend due to this. Very disappointed.

Bathroom was cluttered with owners items, including loofa and sponges, tubes, bottles, and numerous other items. Tub did not drain properly; sink in bathroom did not drain at all. Rug in half bath was dirty. The kitchen was disorganized with pots and chopping block on the oven top, haphazardly placed items on top of fridge, a fridge full of owners' items without any space for us. Fridge smelled of foul food; Penises drawn on blackboard -- disgusting and inappropriate; dust on coffee table. Washer and dryer are blocked by clutter of buckets and other obstacle course items. And the site claims that it has been cleaned up to Covid standards! Really? Don't be deceived by pictures which show a place that is clean, tidy, organized and without owners' items. It is anything but.
OBSESSED with this space. couldn't have been better. and on top of everything, Adam has a speaker and great books. i have never loved an Airbnb more !!!!!!!

Owner accused us of stealing towels and was incredibly aggressive about it. He contacted me via text and phone in an extremely unprofessional manner, even after we told him we did not take any towels. There was a major leak in the bathroom, from the toilet and wall, yet we just left it alone. We used one towel, which we left on the sink.
Needless to say, we would absolutely not feel comfortable coming into contact with this host again or conversing with him. Please assist us with him.
This was my second stay with Adam at this same location. If I could live here and pay rent I would. I will be recommending everyone who comes to visit me in Austin stay here!

The house is in need of repairs.  Both of the living room windows leaked water, enough to form puddles on the living room floor the night it rained. The back door was being held together by duct tape that had been painted over causing the door to not fully close. The communication response time declined as soon as there was a problem. I spent the last day and of a half of my vacation  emailing her back and forth about the problems with our stay.  The host refunded a portion of our money but not willingly.

The process from beginning to end extremely surpassed my expectations. Before booking the place, Nathan was quick to respond my questions regarding his house. During our stay, we had full access to everything. (I especially appreciated that no drawers were locked for personal use, compared to other rentals). Nathan provided all the basic necessities (and more!) from lotion, bath towels, coffee, and basic spices needed for cooking. We did experience a minor plumbing issue, but Nathan immediately sent a plumber within the hour to get it fixed. This goes to show how far he'll go for his tenants, and it goes unnoticed. Thank you again for allowing us into your house, Nathan.

Also, this is just a general tip for future tenants. Austin is a no plastic bag use city. Bring reusable bags for grocery to avoid paying for paper bags.
could not reach host once i left (forgot my keys in house and was locked out of my own subsequently after sending money)

***Not as Advertised - Active Construction Site***

The listing stated the backyard is not available until late March as work is being finished up on a pool and back house. The day before our stay in May the hosts advised they were still "wrapping things up" didn't expect any excessive noise . We arrived to find an active partially completed work site at the rear of the property with excessive noise from construction and power tools.

The photos on the posting showed a paved entryway- we arrived to find the entryway to the property consisted of an unfinished dirt path which ended up flooding during our stay. At times we weren't able leave the property without walking through mud.

The condition of the front of the property was not included in the description nor was it communicated to us by the hosts.

This property was an unfinished, noisy construction site during our stay and a bad experience.

Not as advertised, terrible value.
Place was in a great location but the house was not clean at all
Mattresses were awful, towels were not clean, parking very collocated.

such an incredible spot! i can‚Äôt stress enough how close you are to the most happening area.

i will absolutely be staying here again next time i‚Äôm in austin!
It was a clean, nice house, but some extenuating circumstances caused some difficulty with the reservation and communication.

Decent house in need of some bathroom repairs and a recarpeting upstairs.

Owners should not list the house as being blocks from the convention center.

Bad location. This place is within 1/2 block of 20-30 homeless people. The house across the street is boarded up with a car in front that has had its tire stolen.
Felt super unsafe and didn‚Äôt end up staying here.
I let the owner know i didn‚Äôt feel safe and they took almost 2 hours to respond letting me know I could park in back. I had already left and had gotten a hotel room by then and even though i was in the house maybe 15 mins max, they wouldn‚Äôt refund my cleaning fee.. disappointing.

It's a nice place and the location is great, yet there are an obscene amount of rules (more than most airbnbs and some that are just obvious)  and the fact that the place is actually two separate airbnbs in one is not prominently addressed in the listing (especially with COVID). The place gets the job done but is not worth the trouble of dealing with poorly organized hosts (three) and the fear of breaking any number of the endless rules that the hosts threaten to fine you with if broken.

I would pick this place if you need a central location and want to be near downtown. We expected more amenities and cleanliness due to the price we paid but not a deal breaker. No body wash while we were there so we had to go buy some. Washing machine had a moldy smell so we did not use it while we were there. Knobs on the stove were not working correctly but the host was quick to send someone over and get it fixed right away. If you have any issues, host is very quick to respond.

I recommend that the house and pool are cleaned before arrival. The house itself is great comfy beds, wonderful location, responsive owners, and great pool. Also this house was advertised under a private pool section of Airbnb but it was shared with the guests of the back house. I‚Äôm not sure if it stated that in the info about the house but I don‚Äôt believe it did. However, I could be wrong. The people the night before us absolutely trashed the house and there was only one cleaning person there and she looked like she‚Äôd been cleaning all day we all felt horrible for her. Lastly, the fact that someone was cleaning the pool after we all had arrived was odd considering I reached out a day or more before to tell the owners that we would be arriving at 3pm was disheartening.

This house is very close to downtown Austin, which makes for a very convenient location.

Be warned though, that the location itself is a little bit sketchy. Neighborhood full of broken windows, abandoned houses, people walking the streets late at night, etc. Would not recommend this place for a single traveler or a family.

Many rules that were not in the original listing were sent to us after check-in, and they ask for a list of everyone's names and ages after you book. People are often in the backyard and a maintenance person appears randomly to clean the pool and enter the outside of the property without any notification beforehand.
Good location to Rainey St. Noisy from street noise at night, house was a bit dirty, and pool was really dirty. Even conversed with other guests in back house and they agreed.

The overall stay was nice. They were very accommodating with our animals! The only thing we found odd was 1-ply toilet paper. We have stayed at a lot of BnBs and this has been the first encounter wth the 1-ply...we were not fans and ended up buying some 2-ply to get by. We think for the price, 2-ply should be made available! Overall, the house worked and Shelby was extremely quick with responses to questions!
Thad's place is well-located and inviting. Our only complaint was a bug problem. He did come over to spray, but the problem never got better.

If you have a big group of people looking for a place to stay in Austin look no further. This place has it all from the location to all the amenities that come with the house I doubt there are many comparable places. Thad was also great and extremely responsive to and questions I had. If you get this place you won‚Äôt leave disappointed.

We booked this property for the pool and hot tub for our children to enjoy. The water was so freezing cold in both, we couldn‚Äôt go in either one.
The house is not great for little ones, no doors have safely locks and the kids can escape from the front or back door at any moment.
Also, the driveway is atrocious! So steep and dangerous. The house has a musty old smell I couldn‚Äôt mask with candles or room spray. There was no broom or vacuum, so if your kids make a mess- you are stuck living with it your whole trip. Location was good, nice neighborhood.. but next time we visit Austin, we‚Äôll choose another house.

Was very clean space, but was missing a tv for the unit.
Unfortunately, we had an ant infestation after the first night which set the tone for our whole trip and I had guests seek other accommodations.
The host canceled this reservation 86 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Overall we were disappointed with this house. The house was too warm upon our arrival  and it took 2 hours  to cool the house to a comfortable temperature. The house had an unpleasant smell upon arrival. The kitchen faucet was loose and appeared broken, although it worked. There was a large water stain and bulging area on the ceiling above the kitchen table with flaking paint from the area falling on the table and floor. The towels were old and musty smelling and there was no soap in any of the bathrooms. Although the house is situated in a nice neighborhood, some of the furniture is a bit worn and could use replacing.

Location and Vema keep this place at 3 stars, the rest is 1 star level. The towels, per an earlier review, are still old, torn, and musty. Overall cleanliness is below average. Amenities are limited and everything appears to be purchased at the lowest possible price to maintain this as an AirBnB. If you're looking for a large place, with nothing that can be really damaged, this is the place for you.
