Beware of the location of this place. This is a quaint loft, but the location is not in a safe or convenient area of town.
Nice place, but the host made some problems with the checkout, that could be avoided very easily.

Un lugar con excelente ubicaci√≥n, se llega a muchos puntos de inter√©s en la ciudad f√°cilmente.
Al igual, las amenidades adicionales te hacen sentir muy c√≥modo y tener la sensaci√≥n de que no te hace falta nada.

We evacuated from Houston and booked Kristen's place on our way. When we arrived, she had no idea we were coming and said her cousin was staying in the place. While we did book it last minute through Instabook, it was a pretty big inconvenience to drive all the way there and be turned away (even after paying).

Good location as the downtown/SoCo area was a 10 min drive to and from. I would only recommend if you need to stay nearby on a budget.

The building has small walkways and stairways are old and steep making it difficult to move luggage.

The entire place was dirty and I really do not think there was any "Enhanced Cleaning" from the pandemic - there were stained bedsheets which we didn't use, used wet towels next to the washer likely from the previous stay, leftover open toothpaste in the bathroom, and unclean utensiles. The room itself is directly outside of the terrence which can be convenient but neighbors will be walking by all the time.

During our stay, our rental car was egged which is not fun to deal with during vacation.

This stay listing is not worth your money and safety.
Thin walls, horrible neighborhood, and uncommunicative hosts.
The address given isnt acorrect. It sends you to a house not a condo.
I had a difficult time finding the address and when I messaged Paul he answered 2 to 5 hours later.
That wasnt helpful.
Thin walls: neighbors were arguing and fighting and the condo is right in front of terrace where you have hear people talking.
Do not stay here if you want to relax and sleep.
Dust, sticky floors and smelly sheets.
I had to clean everything the day I got there and didnt even bother to text the host because he didnt respond fast the first time and I was not able to find another booking anywhere else.
Second night I was supposed to stay I finally got feed up with the noise and unsafe environment, I canceled the second night, told the host and Maya said it was my fault!
So unprofessional and inconsiderate.
I wouldnt recommend this stay.
Dont waste your time.
Dint waste your money.
Close to the main drag. 3 rd floor small apartment for two. Lots of pets in apartment complex.

Did not end up staying in this AirBnb.  I originally had reserved this location for one night in Austin. Upon arrival the pool was completely drained. There was cigarettes all over the outside of all the units and trash bags overflowing outside of all the units. The overwhelming amount of trash and cigarettes mixed with the Austin heat made for an unpleasant smell to say the least. In the days leading up to my stay I received several messages instructing me on how to keep the unit clean but, once inside the unit,  the Air ducts were covered in dark brown dust and the bed was just one large white sheet with two pillows underneath.

In a great neighborhood, close to south Congress.

The place had a few missing items I feel are good-to-haves in a trip rental but did not really factor in my rating: there was no facial tissues (Kleenex) which is big for me due to allergies, no dedicated small desk instead I worked on the dining table, no conditioner in the shower, and the sofa was positioned oddly requiring me to move it so I can watch the TV comfortably.

However, my visit was completely put off track due to the ice storm halfway through which caused the electricity to go out for the last two days of my visit. I cannot fault the owner for this but what I do fault them for is the lack of communication and understanding. I was not given proper updates when she had that information available to her (I would not have known of a couple of updates had I not asked). Additionally, I was not provided any discount as a courtesy; not $1. Your experience may be similar should you have other similar issues during your visit.
I was only disappointed I didn't get to see the puppies!
Was no hassle!
This place was not very nice.
The bomb!
The place suited my needs as a place to crash while prepping for my wedding. Nothing glamorous, but good for the price!

The house was cute, the inside was clean, but the self contained toilet ruined the whole stay. The smell would waft out when you opened the lid and got even worse when you flushed. Would‚Äôve been a 5 star stay without the toilet!
This was nothing like host described. Would have been better off stay at a motel 6! Very disappointed. Definitely not worth the cost!
I went into this guest house not expecting much.  Just a place to sleep.  And it didn't deliver.  The inflatable mattress was not fully inflated, which caused back pain and kept me awake all night.

We paid over $230 for the night and unfortunately we‚Äôre so uncomfortable that we left at 9:30 and had to pay for another accommodation. I didn‚Äôt mind that the space is small and the vibe is rustic‚Äî that was accurately described. However, the bed is sunken in and was uncomfortable. The ac unit also blows right onto your face which was giving me a runny nose and the bathroom smells from the toilet. The water in the shower is hot and the location is convenient for getting downtown. Maybe the price reflected the busy weekend but was in my opinion is too high for what‚Äôs being offered.

I booked this right before Memorial Day weekend and booked it because it was the cheapest place to stay on a whim- $330 dollars for myself. I contacted Nate after booking and said that my bf might tag along, and since there‚Äôs a mention of cameras and a rule blatantly saying you cannot bring anybody back with you whatsoever even if they ubered (one car per reservation rule as well) and he was quick to respond. That‚Äôs good.
He invoiced me for an additional $55 to add my guy to the reso.

This is not a tiny house. This is a storage shed in a backyard of a home with a porta potty/airplane style toilet, not an ‚Äúeco toilet.‚Äù If you poop, the room will smell.

I don‚Äôt vape but if you do, this man threatens to charge $500 for doing so if there‚Äôs traces of it happening.

Upon changing reservation for 2 instead of 1, only 2 towels were provided for our 4 day stay. This weekend was hot, y‚Äôall. The water pressure in the shower was minimal.

He provides the essentials, even tampons for ladies. There‚Äôs a first aid kit. There is wifi. There is no cable, no streaming. There are basic channels listed that work but we could not get the TV to work.

It‚Äôs a little overpriced for what I got, honestly. Not impressed.

Overall the Airbnb was as pictured and the stay was okay, but did not meet expectations.

There were a group of 10 ladies staying with me and we were concerned about wasps around the property. The property manager brought us some Raid spray, but was not very friendly about coming out to the property. When we couldn‚Äôt find the comforters (since they weren‚Äôt with the rest of the sheets/blankets), one of the girls called the property manager and she wasn‚Äôt friendly again, she had attitude so we didn‚Äôt call her again. The bathroom outlets stopped working our second night, and we tried to reset them, but they still didn‚Äôt work. The string lights in the backyard worked upon arrival, but didn‚Äôt work on the last night. We didn‚Äôt call based on the other two interactions we had when asking for help.

The bathtub was not clean as expected, there was hair clogging the drain when we turned on the water, so we used the master shower only.

My main issue was with the front doorknob, it should be tightened/replaced as it was a pain to unlock the door. You had to lift the doorknob to unlock it. The lock didn‚Äôt feel secure overall. We had to rely on the deadbolt, which was also difficult to lock.

The house was in a nice location if you are planning to go downtown. There was a pest and cleanliness problem in the home. The host was notified and no compensation offered. The pool was very nice but, wasps were still not taken care of from previous compliant. That was addressed prior to staying but not taken care of. Overall it was okay.

House not ready @ time of check-in.  Cleaning lady was still cleaning for about 45 mins Past check-in time and her kids were in pool when we arrived. Dishwasher was not unloaded, had dishes in it. Lot of insects/bugs inside. Freezer ice maker was not working. Had to purchase lots of ice.

The house and amenities were nice and as listed. I thought the house itself was a good value.
The issues were more with the cleanliness and the host's professionalism. A chair broke and the garbage disposal didn't work. These were addressed quickly.
The house looked like it hadn't been vacuumed or dusted in quite some time. When I brought this to the host's attention, she stated it had been vacant for awhile and offered to have the cleaners come out to address it. I gave her a time of the day that we would be out of the house as having cleaners there while we are also there is awkward and inconvenient. We returned to the house after the time I had given and the house was still not cleaned. One of our guests was not feeling well and was going to try to nap, so I asked her not to have the cleaners come so she could rest. I received no reply after this, no attempt to reschedule and no offer for a refund. When I asked for a refund the day we checked out and she acted surprised and refused.

We were in Austin for the spartan race located in Burnett,TX. We need a place to sleep before the race day. The dominion was not far away at all quick drive we had our own transportation. House was very neat and organized . Our room was very clean and organized. Only complaint is my boyfriend is one of those people that is always warm and he couldn't sleep well cause house wasn't cool enough. The room had a ceiling fan but just wasn't enough he likes it ice cold.
Unfortunately, we didn‚Äôt stay with Caleb due to the uncleanliness of the room and the bathroom. However, Caleb did give us a full refund and was apologetic for the inconvenience.
Nice place but not responsive at all

Everything is exactly how it looks in the pictures. Overall, I enjoyed my stay in room #1 for the few nights I was there. But as a word of caution, there is no smart lock on the bedroom doors and the refrigerator doesn‚Äôt work.
It was a nice house, but the bed linens were not clean. I reached out to the host and never gotten a response back from him.

This has been my worst experience. Very unprofessional, we had agreed on checking in early in the morning. he sent me the door code the night before and when I arrived to his place it turns out he gave me a wrong door code. Tried contacting Caleb for about 1 hour and he never responded. Waited for 3 more hours and he never replied or called me back. Could not stay at his place and i had to book an expensive hotel room last minute. awful experience.
Buena comunicaci√≥n y buena ubicaci√≥n, le suger√≠ cambiar el colch√≥n porque no era muy c√≥modo, pero en general todo bien , volver√©.
Horrible experience. The room was disgusting upon check-in. Stayed 3 min and left.

Die Unterkunft war nett und hatte alles was man braucht. Der Preis war ok. Das Zimmer, K√ºche und Bad war sauber, aber Wohnzimmerboden war mit Dreck bedeckt. Leider haben wir zu zweit nur einen Satz Handt√ºcher bekommen. Auf meine Anfrage nach einem zweiten gro√üen Handtuch wurde zuerst rasch reagiert aber das Problem konnte nicht behoben werden. Auf erneute Nachfrage bekam ich dann einfach keine Antwort mehr. 5 Tage, 2 Personen mit nur einem Dusch Handtuch war dann f√ºr den Preis dann doch nicht angemessen. Eine Bewohnerin h√∂rte morgens um 07:30Uhr laut Musik direkt neben meinem Zimmer. F√ºr eine Arbeitswoche bestimmt normal aber ich war dort zu Urlaub. Da w√§re ausschlafen ganz nett gewesen. Ich bin mir nicht sicher ob ich durch diese Umst√§nde dort noch einmal buchen w√ºrde, obwohl die Unterkunft ganz gut war.
The stairs up to the apartment were the only obstacle- the stairs were difficult to get luggage up and down.

Just as shown.  Great stay with great host! Plently of towels...most host only give you one or two to keep reusing but not this one! Only downfall was the HDMI port on the TV was still broken.  Another guest several months ago mentioned it and I assumed it was fixed bc the host said he would address it but I was sad to see it was unusable.  The channels are very limited so don't plan on any low key time watching TV.

The place was what was expected from pictures. The location is really great if being close to SOCO and easy drive to everywhere else that is Austin. It has the basics, not fancy but that is reflected in the price. We had a small problem with TV that could have been user error and they came right over to fix. Would recommend.

Let's start with the good:

Location (close to everything by car)
Working kitchen - great stove with oven and a working refrigerator
Ryan communicates pretty well
He worked with us to fix the situation below

Let's move on to the disaster that we experienced at this place
Upon arrival we found the living room rug wet, a soaked bathroom rug and an unpleasant smell throughout the living room
We weren't sure if the house had been cleaned prior to our arrival because we found an empty plastic bottle of iced tea and a bowl of salad in the refrigerator; hair at random places on the floor; crumbs on the stove; several hair bands and somebody's pants left under the bed.
The towels seemed clean however.
The real issue began when we tried to take a shower the next day. I had been in the shower for about 5 minutes washing my kids when I realized the water wasn't going anywhere. In fact, it started overflowing the shallow shower rim. I turned off the water and had to decide whether to try to come out or wait until the water subsided, but it wasn't going anywhere. I got a pot from the kitchen and began to empty out the water into the toilet. After that I was able to shower.
I had informed Ryan of the issue and his housekeeper came in and treated the shower with Drano, supposedly.
The following day I was washing the dishes in the kitchen when I heard a strange gurgling sound coming from the bathroom. I came in to find the shower dirty with about an inch of water and brown substance and what resembled a square of toilet paper swimming in it. How did it float up, you might ask? I am wondering the same thing.
I informed Ryan of the issue and he said his housekeeper was going to take care of it.
At this point, however, it had become clear that this was not going to work because I had no more interest in going into the shower with obvious plumbing problems and we asked to leave one night early to stay in a hotel.
After some back and forth with Ryan, he did apologize and offered some reimbursement, which we accepted.
However, overall the place left me with quite an unpleasant feeling. Aside from the issue at hand, the place is not well maintained. The glass is falling off one section of the back door (leaving a gap for insects, etc). The hooks in the bathroom are barely hanging on by a thread. The doorknob in one of the bedrooms is falling off. The other bedroom has exposed electric sockets. Not sure what the issue was - perhaps something had been overlooked or miscommunicated, but, yeah, not a pleasant experience at all.

The house was as pictured and described for the most part. It‚Äôs the back unit of another house, and is located right next to a local wine bar. The house in general is conveniently close to downtown and South Congress area. We appreciated the location since we had so little time in Austin and wanted to make sure we were staying within the vicinity of places we wanted to visit west of the lake. However, our actual experience wasn't so great. We booked here for 2 nights for 4 people, which would have been perfect since there are two bedrooms. Upon arrival at the unit, everything for the most part was fine, just minor things like not having enough towels. We were given 2 to use for 4 people. We contacted Ryan, and he let us know that we would get additional towels the following day. We were already exhausted from traveling, so we figured it was okay and would just make it work for the night. We rested at the apartment for about an hour before heading out to dinner. When we came home for the night, we couldn‚Äôt rest like we had hoped. While settling in, we discovered tiny bugs crawling all over the dresser tops. This prompted us to check the rest of the house, and noticed the bugs were also crawling along both bedposts, the mattresses, and on the floor. We were unsure what types of bugs they were but were uncomfortable sleeping under those conditions. Some of us also noticed bug bites on our bodies, so we contacted Ryan right away to let him know about our discomfort and to see how we could resolve it. At this point it was already 11:30 PM, and since we couldn‚Äôt get a response from him we decided it was best to leave the unit for the night. We didn‚Äôt stay there for the rest of the weekend because we were unsure whether it was an infestation. Ryan did not return our message until almost a day later (21 hours), and instead of working with us on a solution, his response was unsympathetic, hostile, and accusatory. He basically started by claiming he gave us enough towels, even though in his previous note he apologized for not giving us enough, then said that his housekeeper cleans the unit every time and that there were absolutely no bugs whatsoever (even though we had pictures and a video to prove they were there). He also immediately referred to us as guests who made him not want to host Airbnb. I was so confused by the tone and I‚Äôm extremely disappointed by this experience overall. I'm even more appalled by Ryan‚Äôs way of handling the situation. I understand that at the end of the day, it‚Äôs Ryan‚Äôs home, but having been a long standing member and supporter of the Airbnb community, I find this situation unacceptable. We were not rude or demanding, simply asked for a solution and tried to resolve the...

The bungalow is in a great location. Close to a the main areas and helps avoid the traffic on I-35.

It was uncomfortable overall. Parking is in front of a boarded up house that people lived in (scared to leave our car in front of it). The dark walk to the back yard. The outside light switch is in the kitchen, which would have been nice to know since we had dogs and it was creepy outside at night. One bed is a mat. It's not a foam bed or a spring bed. All the bars in the couch can be felt, which makes it uncomfortable to sleep on. The shower is skinny and short people friendly only. There were some spiders in the bathroom and bedroom. Trash outside the bungalow. No grass for dogs around the bungalow or closed in fence. You have to walk all the way to the street in the dark and next to the boarded up house people lived in. Maybe a light on the side of the main house would make visitors feel safer.

There were no instructions on entering the bungalow or leaving. We washed dishes and none of my messages were answered on Airbnb.

Overall, I wouldn't stay here again. I've used Airbnb 6 times, and this was the only uncomfortable one. If I were alone, or just a couple - it would of been scary. But we were a small group, so it was manageable - no one was alone.

Pros:
-Comfortable 2 bedroom bungalow
-Located close to downtown
-Lots of room in refrigerator for cold storage

Cons:
-Small shower
-Bathroom needed restocking (no trash can liners available, less than 1/4 full of watered down hand soap)
-Limited privacy at night

Didn't read any info on posting/house manual about the unit being located in the back. I was having trouble finding the actual unit, and tried texting the host, but no reply. I did not feel comfortable snooping around the property, especially since there were several cars parked on all sides. Unfortunately, I had to knock on the main house to get info. We ended up having to just pack a grocery bag of just what we needed because it was too hard to carry all our bags all the way to the back of the property, on the gravel path, through the overgrown bamboo, in the dark. We used our cell phones to light the way. I didn't hear from host Ryan at all, but Tif ended up responding to me when I had a question about the parking. The actual bungalow was pretty cute. The glass front door did not have a curtain, and I wished there was a way to have a little privacy at night. We watched a movie before going to bed, which was fun. The beds were on the smaller end, and I ended up sleeping on the couch. The kitchen had all the basics. But the bathroom needed some work. The shower was incredibly small, even for myself at 4'10" and 100lbs. I can't imagine a full sized adult showering in there. A shower door would be much better than the plastic curtain in there. The curtain did a poor job containing the shower water. Also, there was not a liner in the bathroom waste bin, and I could not find any in the supplies.

Endroit tr√®s proche de la ville
La maison √©tait tr√®s propre
Rien √† redire tout √©tait parfait
Je recommande cet endroit

This place is decent. Close to downtown. The neighboring businesses- cosmic coffee, the wine bar and food trucks were all nice to be able to walk to. It‚Äôs a bit unsettling though to arrive to a block with a number of boarded up houses on it. The bungalow itself while cute is a bit worn- missing tile in bathroom. The shower stall is very small.

Checking in was a breeze and the location was very close to downtown Austin. However I did not spend one night in the apartment due to the mildew smell, which was stressful trying to find a place to stay with such short notice. If you don't mind the "basementy" odor and if you intend to just relax at the apartment, there are few things you should know. They do have a TV in the apartment but no Cable or Wifi, so you may want to bring a few DVDs (they had a couple there) or a radio. You also have to park on the street, which is in an okay neighborhood. The driveway and pathway are gravel which may be an issue with your luggage or for an older person.

Mayra was quick to respond when we first booked, but slower to respond after that. The place was cute and as described, but we started to realize upon arrival that there were a few mosquitoes inside. We didn't think much of it, but once we tried going to bed, we realized the bedroom was swarming with them. We killed at least 20 just in the bedroom. We got a horrible nights sleep. We tried to make the best of it the next day, but we were getting bitten while eating breakfast the next morning in the living room. I think they were either getting in somewhere or someone left the door open before we arrived while cleaning. We decided to leave the trip a night early and let Mayra know what was going on, but we never heard back from her. It was overall a disappointing trip.

My mattress was COVERED in stains. Several looked liked blood, others looked like urine. Many others besides those.

Also, the AC didn't keep the room cool. It was about 85degrees. Sure there are little fans you can use, but I shouldn't have to use them.

I was not able to get much sleep because of the noise from the road. There is a raod that runs right in front of the house. The windows in the room let all the road noise in. Maybe invest in some double pain windows or something to get rid of the noise from the traffic.
No complaints great place to stay...

The sinks and tub gurgled and smelled terrible. Likely due to lack of plumbing vents.
The bathroom fan clicks loudly constantly unless it is turned on.
It‚Äôs one house turned into 3 ‚Äúapartments‚Äù and the walls are too thin. We heard other guests through the walls quite a bit. Kitchenette has no dish soap and the checkout list required that our dishes be done.

The cleaning and pet fees were a bit outrageous for what was provided and there was a note saying ‚Äúdon‚Äôt forget the house keeper‚Äù (does that mean the cleaning person doesn‚Äôt get that $70 cleaning fee? Or any of the $70 pet deposit?)

Anyway.

The bed was very comfortable.
The docks next to the marina were kinda cool.
Coffee was great.
The yard was fantastic with hammocks and rocking chairs and a fire pit and a grill.

It is one of a few houses in a cul-da-sac type area. The house is attached to others so you can hear most everything going on from house to house. The house was oddly shaped and had only a mini fridge, no kitchen or place to cook inside.
The very worst part about it was they are on a septic system and every time we or someone else next door flushed a toilet, the entire house smelled like waste. A couple times we would come back from eating out of something and the whole house stunk like sewage.
The common area was very nice. Lots of trees and areas to lounge and hang out. They did have a fire pit with wood provided which was great. Plus, a couple bbq pits if you want to cook on them.
All in all, it wasn‚Äôt terrible but it wasn‚Äôt what we expected.

I have to be honest, the location was in the middle of nowhere, the beach is a short walk, but its got a sign saying no trespassing so you cant take advantage of it. Heating wasn't working first night, was given a portable heater the following morning, a bit too late really. Once one thing goes wrong, everything that is not perfect irritates you, if someone next door has a shower the same time as you, the water pressure drops to nothing ! It was clean, and the bathroom is the furthest room away from the bedroom.

This airbnb was just big enough for my family of 5.
My parents in one bedroom my 2 sisters in another and I took the couch which turns into a bed.
I really like that this place has other Air bnbs neighboring it and there is a public shared area with with many hammocks and a nice outside fire pit.
The inside of this place was very nice and very simple we really loved it the only thing that was lacking was a proper kitchen but we made it work.
The only other slight drawback was that the lake has a very low water level at the moment so we couldn't really enjoy the part of the lake that was near us we had to drive 15 minutes to another part where we could actually swim.

Do bring some bug spray or some kind of Bug r
epellent when you're gonna hagngout outside cause the mosquitoes will get you.

communication was awful in getting checked in. this was a very stressful experience and had to contact air b n b support to finally get a response. this place was not that clean and it was sort of gross how there was a "just sanitized" paper on the toilet yet there was hair and residue all over it. There is nothing to cook with so if you want to even make something small don't bother. The outside could of been pretty if it wasn't so dirty and the lights didn't go on at night which made it an awkward and less scenic place to hangout. All in all, I wouldn't recommend staying here. It's more of a beach  shack rather than a house.

This property is not what it seems. We were forced to leave after one night after finding cockroaches everywhere throughout the kitchen and bathrooms. When trying to communicate this with the host, we were told to ‚Äúdeal with it‚Äù, and that ‚Äúroaches are a normal thing in Texas‚Äù.

The house looked like a fraternity abandoned it years ago - I strongly warn others to avoid any properties from this host.

I do, however, thank Airbnb for their persistence in resolving the reservation so that we could receive our money back and go elsewhere.

Alex‚Äôs place worked well as a home base for our group of friends and had enough sleeping spots for all of us. Proximity to downtown, Rainey St, and Target was great. However, the neighborhood did not feel very safe. The front door did not have a deadbolt and the garage door did not lock shut. We had a man try to enter through the back door late one night and saw him walking the street again the next morning. We also had a cockroach in the bunk room. The third queen bed is a pullout couch in an open space. Overall, the house served our needs but would not recommend for groups looking for more than a place to crash.

Had only 2 towels for three guest. Light fixture in living room did not work. After we notified them they NEVER fixed it. Back yard patio was NOT inviting. There were lots of Spider webs in front n back yard.  Only received sheets for second bed upon request n NO BLANKETS! SHOWER CLOGGED UP N MADE US ONE HOUR AND HALF TO PARTY. Mattress and bed spreads in bedroom were GROSS to say the least. They were BADLY stained!!!!!!!!!!!!
We unfortunately had to cancel our trip due to the COVID pandemic but Katya and Bobby were incredibly understanding and their communication was unmatchable throughout the process.
Very accurate photos and description of the home. Small but has everything you need. Some water damage areas on the ceiling but had no issues. Very clean overall. Would be willing to book again.
Very noisy traffic sounds

Very small room at a noisy intersection. Lot of traffic

Nice host
This place is a bit awkward in size and location. If you‚Äôre looking for something in the immediate area it‚Äôs okay. I would not recommend this place to many people though.

The room it's fine, have a lot of amenities and the location it's very accurate because you have a lot of places near and a lot of bus stops near, it's very private and the instructions for everything are very clear.

The only thing that was a problem for me is that the place is over a busy street and there's a lot of noise and on weekends it's the worst it's very stress full and the internet was very slow.

The stay was ok. The room has a small window unit, which in the day time is very hot in the room unless you're close by it. Room was clean. It's located on a busy street and you hear everything and everyone passing by. I did see a small dead roach in the tub. Other than that everything else was fine.

Everything was 100% accurate and as advertised on the Airbnb site. The only thing that keeps me from making this a 5 star stay is the location simply being right next to a busy street. This isn‚Äôt much of a problem though because there are disposable earplugs and a white noise machine provided! Can‚Äôt recommend this listing more!

Lovely simple room, as advertised. Very clean and with easy check-in/out.

Only concern is the road noise, it's VERY loud. I was unable to sleep for the entirety of my stay, which made my trip much less enjoyable. Also the fridge is loud, so the combo of the two make it unbearable.
And this is probably just me, but i felt very scared at night because there is no security screen on the door and i could hear every pedestrian walk by a few feet from where i was sleeping.

Lynda went above and beyond for out stay during the F1 race in austin this weekend. There was a problem with the water in austin that made it undrinkable and forced everyone to buy water bottles for everything besides bathing. She ordered a surplus of water to drink and rinse with that lasted us the whole stay!
0 complaints whatsoever!. Exactly as described and pictured and would absolutely stay again when I'm back in Austin.
What a great stay! I cannot believe how great the location of the aparment was!! Any concerns I had were quickly alleviated I would have no issue staying here again!

Our stay was perfect.
Close to our son's home.
Hillary's home was as described, though pictures didn't do it justice. It was even larger than expected.
The home had everything anyone would need to stay for a short or long period of tme. I should say, it was provided with what was described AND SO MUCH MORE!
Highly recommended üëç
Great place a bit off the beaten path. Close enough to downtown but far enough to escape the madness.
No thank you.

The bed was comfy and the pool was nice especially during the heat wave going on while we were there.  Location can't be beat.  What was not clear to me from the listing's pictures and possibly of interest to someone else, is that the unit looks onto the host's house.  If we could see into their house, they could likely see into the unit.  Therefore, we kept the shade down because it didn't feel private.  If the motorized garage door-like shade is down, it blocks your view of outside and your entrance/exit to the unit.  It  made me feel uneasy and uncomfortable in there.  Also, told the host I accidentally broke a wine glass while doing dishes, left $5 to cover the cost but did not hear back.  Communication was... eh.  I also had to ask for the instructions to get in because it was less than 24 hours prior to arrival and I hadn't received anything.
It's a very cozy place and the people were friendly. Unfortunately the neighbors argued a lot late at night and it was quite loud.

When we walked in to Breezy everything looked neat and beautifully decorated but there was an open condom wrapper in plain sight on the bookshelf. It was gross but we just threw it away. We came back to sleep pretty late and it was cold that night but not below freezing. We turned on the heater and when i pulled the covers over me i could smell that they were dirty. They smelled like private parts, STINKY. There were no extra blankets or sheets anywhere. Although the heater works it never adequately warmed the space and we were still cold in the morning. I'm still horrified at that stay. I messaged Barrett about it and received no response. Complete ignore.

The tiny house itself is spectacular! The village was a neat community. I was disappointed there were dirty coffee cups in the home, and there was a sewage smell in the morning (there is a community of tiny homes and rvs so not completely surprising). Also, at night it was noisy and people were constantly walking thru our tiny home area. It was very convienent having a washer and dryer on site though and the bathrooms/showers were clean and very close. Check in was hard, I couldn't find a space to park and no one really seem to know what I was talking about. Some of this was my fault, we couldn't make it in before late check in, it was a Friday night and there is a community movie night so there was a lot of cars. Overall though, the stay was fine.
This place does not provide a change of sheets.  You cannot adjust the AC. There will be walking and stairs in your stay. And my car was stolen from designated parking.

Our first ever really bad Airbnb experience with Paddy. The rental period was relatively non eventful to start other than the dryer gas line leaking causing a strong nat gas smell whenever we had the dryer on which is a hazard (which was never fixed). Toward the end of the rental period the nagging SMS messages began from Paddy "turn off your lights I dont like them on" "make sure your dog poop is picked up hourly" "your recycled plastic has food on it" "dont place a trash bag outside prior to throwing it in the bin" "Dont steal my things past Airbnb folks have stolen things" "I have to come into the yard / I have to come into the house". I have never experienced an Airbnb host who has acted like a warden of a prison but thats how we felt. To cap it off after checking out Paddy sent a final climatic SMS which accused us of stealing bed sheets and a 2nd set of keys which were never there & threatened to charge us a surcharge for not separating our recycling again + a $40 fee for some dog droppings we missed under a plant in the yard. If you enjoy being under a constant sadomachochist analysis of what you are doing in your Airbnb book some time with Paddy and she will show you what its like living on Rikers Island.

I have lived in this house for about one month. The location and furniture is good.

However, I have some problems.

First, the air conditioner had the insect eggs.I observed them when I arrived.
After about 10 days, the host said that I should confirm whether they are eggs or not‚Ä¶.
I told her to enter in the house for confirmation. But, she refused‚Ä¶
And, the company visited to deal with the this issue. But they left it‚Ä¶ So, some eggs dropped. It‚Äôs very frustrating. She might know this issue and should deal with before I arrived.

Second, the lights on the second floor and rest room were out. I told her to replace. But they didn‚Äôt fix it‚Ä¶

Third, I asked her print out some documents for my flight. But she didn‚Äôt.

Last is garbage. How to throw away the garbage is different between Japan and US. But her explanation is not kind. And, she doubted me to have thrown away the inappropriate things. But, it is respond to neighbor‚Ä¶. I was very irritated her attitude.

Eine sehr sch√∂ne kleine Unterkunft! Wir waren sehr zufrieden. Es ist sauber und alles da was man braucht. Parken war auf dem Grundst√ºck m√∂glich. Ein separater Eingang ist auch da. Das Bett ist gem√ºtlich! Nur wenige Fahrminuten mit dem Auto um zum einkaufen, Restaurant oder √Ñhnliches.
Wir kommen gerne wieder!

Our stay was okay.  The place was clean and the bed is comfortable.  For the price, we were surprised there were no frills--like a bathmat or washcloths.  Due to a dead battery in the keyless door lock, we were locked out of the apartment.  Mark handled the situation with an hour, but it was not pleasant to have to wait outside for a locksmith at 10:30 pm in 95 degree heat.

This is a 1980's college area apartment that is very close to UT campus and has dedicated, shaded parking underneath.  It is roomy for a couple, has a fully equipped kitchen, with plenty of toiletry amenities.  However, this apartment needs to be taken out of service for a month or so for some major maintenance (bathroom, kitchen, doors, deck) and deep cleaning.  It is in a fairly quiet location.  Unfortunately, after notifying the host of several safety issues the morning after arrival (uncovered switch plates with exposed hot wiring and broken glass in the stove top) and possible code violation (removed, disabled smoke detector), nothing was done.  Therefore we didn't take the time to expand on the mold, black/pink faucet slime, inop disposal, breaking oven door frame, loose shower curtain, etc that also were bothersome.  Overall, the apartment was clean (at first glance and on the surface) and nicely appointed (albeit, a bit eclectic..but this IS Austin).  For the past several years we have stayed at a nearby modern, hotel ... but were looking for a change of venue.  This Airbnb apartment, after all various fees, was within a few dollars of the hotel ... but has a fully equipped kitchen (keeping us from searching for restaurants) and a bit more elbow-room. We're not saying that we don't recommend this apartment, but will likely do more searching for our next stay in Austin.

Pros-
Location
Separate living and bedroom space
Parking is easy
Extra toiletries if you forget any

Cons-
Could have been a lot cleaner
Very noisy (construction work happening all night long on the next street over)
AC wouldn‚Äôt stay on the temperature we selected so we were up multiple times throughout the night adjusting it.

Overall, the place was very dirty which was unexpected based on the listing description.

There was a hole in the backdoor, deck was covered in splinters along with the makeshift pallet chair.
The couch's pull out bed was VERY uncomfortable, the floor was used instead of the bed.
There was dust covering the AC intake, on the bathroom shelves, under the bed, even in the basket for the parking pass.
The dishwasher had dirty dishes from the previous person covered with food.
There was dirt / oils caked on the walls and light switches.
There was mold on the inner shower curtain along with the hair on the bottles and walls.

Overall a really nice home to stay at but there‚Äôs a few issues that must be know before booking this. The main issue being that the hot water would run out quickly leaving 3-4 more guests without hot water to shower with. The other issues have to deal with strict rules like 10pm curfew, no extra ‚Äúguests‚Äù even if they‚Äôre just staying for an hour, no real privacy in the backyard, cameras all around the house, and the shower curtain rod in the community restroom CONSTANTLY falling down. Would recommend for a couple and maybe one or two other guests but if you‚Äôre planning on having more than 3-4 people, I would not recommend this house.

This property was as described. However, the check in process,  long list of rules and regulations was a bit oppressive. You shouldn‚Äôt have to stress so much about sleeping somewhere. We were satisfied with our stay, however this is not a place to stay if you are on vacation.

The study is more or less pleasant and has something charming, but the layout of the furniture is not the best nor is it the most practical. We do not find sheets for the sofa, and this mattress is old and bad. It is the only Airbnb in which the host has not put enough coffee in the kitchen, not even enough paper napkins. The bathroom is very spacious. The decoration is warm and pretty. The lock at entrance door is about to fall, which makes the site unsafe. The host's pics are nice, but far from reality. This is the first time that I write such a negative evaluation. I'm very sorry, but I do not recommend this site at all!! AE

This was the perfect place to stay while I worked remotely for a few days and visited with friend in Austin. East Street is a emerging neighborhood and this was in a quite little spot close to the action, but not in it. Loved the bed and treats in the frig.
Nice room. Not the best location.

Sehr privates Zimmer mit eigenem Bad (etwas missverst√§ndlich in der Beschreibung) und eigenem Eingang (unabh√§ngig vom Rest des Hauses. Neal hat sich sehr gut gek√ºmmert und die Kommunikation lief schnell und klar. Drei Buslinien in fu√ül√§ufiger Entfernung, ansonsten Uber oder Roller in Massen in der N√§he. Sehr gute Ausstattung mit Handt√ºchern, Pflegemitteln (Shampoo, Zahnpasta etc.) oder Kaffeekapseln.
Sehr ruhige Lage, obwohl nicht so weit von der Innenstadt entfernt. Komme gerne wieder, wenn ich in Austin bin.

We had trouble getting out of bed when the temperatures where below freezing point but the radiator heating did the job. Very quite neighborhood and you can walk to the cherrywood coffeehouse in less than 15 minutes.

This home was in a very sketchy neighborhood and the furniture was not new as they advertised. Parking was in the rear of the home that was not advertised. It also smelled really bad. There was one tv in the entire Airbnb. The refrigator was rusting. The host only lets you cancel before entering the home because they know once you see the property and neighborhood you would not want to stay there. I reached out for a refund and they refused to give me one.I watched the cleaning personnel  leave and the home still had a stinch. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this property.
Well this place was a bit tricky, kind of had trouble getting in was a little confused on the directions to the entrance. Very short stay, although a very nice place .

you get what you pay for
there are bedbugs in the beds
Unique DIY tiny house with scented candles and comfy vibes. Only complaint was slow and unstable WiFi.
joel has the coolest place to stay - def a place that you‚Äôd never except to be kick ass

The pictures posted are not what the house looks like. I was extremely upset on the amount I paid for and what we got in return. It would of been better at a hotel instead. Nothing in the house was clean prior to us getting there. It was very disgusting. We chose not to even use one of the restrooms because it was so dirty. It was pretty unreal on how gross everything was and the lack of effort  that was put in for preparing for us to stay. The location was good but it was very horribly dirty in the restrooms, fridge and just around the house. Would not recommend this place or go back.

Rashaka is a great guy. Answered all questions to me promptly and had the place ready for a really early check in.

The only thing I missed in Rashaka's place was a microwave, but we managed to heat our food on the stove without issues.

I would definitely come back to this AirBnB, specially because of the location.
Couldn't be better!

To start I would absolutely consider staying here again for a short stay. It has everything you could need and it is in an amazing location! The price is very reasonable for the location. It isn‚Äôt the nicest or well kept AirBNB I‚Äôve been in but as mentioned location and everything you need is there. I stayed there for a month which was a little too much for me cause there is NO sunlight and the broken items started to become frustrating on a daily basis.

The place was perfect for our quick weekend trip to Austin. It was about 20-25 minutes from everything we wanted to do and was nice and quiet when we came back at night. The house was very hot when we arrived, as the air was turned off, but other than that, it wasn't great experience! Thanks Molly!
No comment

La casa es c√≥moda, tiene un amplio jardin, 3 ba√±os completos, la cocina es grande y Molly encantadora. La llave la puedes recoger directamente en la casa en un buz√≥n protegido lo que hace s√∫per f√°cil la llegada a cualquier hora. El vecindario es my tranquilo pero no hay tiendas cerca ya que es una zona exclusivamente residencial. La cidad est√° a unos 20 minutos.
Overall good spot, but location is a little misleading and the active renovation project is a little inconvenient.
The worst experience.  Home is unclean, room smelled like dogs, the location is not safe.  We paid for the stay, but did not feel safe and did not spend our two nights there.

The house would not accommodate 10 people. We had 7 and it was tight. Only had one closest and a tiny storage space for hanging garments in the master bedroom. The beds a hard as a rock. The refrigerator was filthy and ice maker didn't work. There was leftover food in the refrigerator. The kitchen cabnets were broken. Worst of all the Air conditioner was off when we arrived. And 90 deg in the house. The house was not worth what we paid for the weekend.

The home is conveniently located proximate to the Local HEB grocery store and the highway is less than a quarter mile from the nearest exit to the driveway. If you are looking for a place proximate to the domain area it doesn't get much better.
This is not only a few short blocks from South Congress.  I walked there every morning.

Es war ein toller Aufenthalt in Austin, leider etwas zu kurz. Das Cottage ist wunderbar, am liebsten h√§tte ich es eingepackt und mit genommen. Die Gegend ist einmalig. Sehr ruhig gelegen, aber trotzdem nah zum South Congress. Angela und Ian sind super nett!!
Sollte ich wieder einmal Austin besuchen, dann werde ich auf jeden Fall versuchen "mein" Cottage zu buchen.
10/10 recommended ! Only regret is not staying longer.

Eddie's home is cute and cozy, with a lot of attention to modern decor as he renovates this house.  The neighborhood is quiet but very close to the Austin scene.  We ate at Uchi's just down south lamar street....i cannot recommend this place enough for sushi aficionados...TOP NOTCH...we visited on a Tuesday night, and had to wait over an hour because we did not make reservations...HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.
Not as clean as I would like.  No tv, second story that I wasn't aware of.  it wasn't my favorite Airbnb.  wouldn't stay here again.

Cute house with a lot of food and drinks left for us! Great for a group of girls.

Issue: House was close to downtown and other places we visited but not on a good street. In between a metal yard and an abandoned house. A lot of noise from metal yard and construction.

The walls are very thin. You can hear everything going on in the home, no matter what room you are in. This place is not well stocked with common items like towels, toilet paper, and napkins. Many of the outlets in the kitchen are broken. 2/3 bathroom doors do not offer any sort of privacy. The hosts are awful at communicating with the guests. I would not stay here again.
Good location, not the most comfortable beds. For as much as it costs, I would expect a bit more.

The location was perfect because we needed to walk to the JW a few times a day. The unit was very clean, the space was great. However, the beds were super stiff, and combined with LOTS of night life noise, sirens and traffic, don‚Äôt expect to sleep very well. BRING EAR PLUGS! The wifi was absolute garbage. We came to TX for work, but we could hardly do any work because the WiFi was so bad. Other than hard beds and crappy wifi, the unit met our needs and expectations.

I would not recommend until they fix all issues with units. Unit was not fully clean, specially the bathroom: shower did not work and had old hair and stains. Dishwasher also did not work and had clogged water making it smell disgusting. Air filter was not change in a long while as our allergies were out of this world during our stay. Plus, we had two days with no water. We never complain, you can see our profile, but this time we had no choice.

Nice location for downtown, but had kitchen ceiling water damage, and random decorations and stuff stored in closets andc closets with doors missing. Host was Communicative and check in and out were simple

The condo was okay but the parking situation was not very clear on the house manual. I texted the owner and called no response until next day. And the amount of money that was spent was too much for a couch that was ripped and not enough silverware that was provided. Overpriced in my opinion!!!!!!

Very disappointed.  The only good thing was the location.  The photos are misleading.  He advertised a sofa bed and it was only a corner chaise....only had back rest for one person to sit.  It is also missing a huge piece of the faux leather.  Definitely not what is in the photos.  There are reviews going back to 2019 about the condition of the couch. No chair as shown in the family room.  Master bedroom shower has a crack in it, so you had to be careful of where you stood.  Master bedroom sheets and comforter had holes in them.  There was an ironing board but no iron. Several holes in the walls.  The rug in the other bedroom had been screwed into the floor and was stripped and screw was pointing up.  Floors were filthy!  I made the mistake of going barefoot and my feet were black.  We were in town for a wedding and had three other of Ryans properties in the same complex and we were all disappointed.

In brief: Terrible experience. Dirty unit. Poor host customer service. DO NOT STAY HERE!

I usually don't write reviews, but I truly wish to advise people against renting from this host! As a long time AirBnB patron, I have never experienced as much upset as I did with this experience. A few of my colleagues and I were town for a busy professional conference and needed accommodations close to the convention center. This AirBnB was in a prime location (the only plus), but on arrival it was clear that the unit was incompletely cleaned and DIRTY. There was hair on the bathroom floor and in the drain, and visible dust everywhere. After communicating my concerns to the host, he supposedly sent a cleaning service over to the unit to address issues, but I cannot confirm this because I was not in the unit at the time and when I returned the same hair and dust were strewn about. After reaching out another time, providing pictures, and requesting a partial refund, he did not respond so I escalated my complaints to AirBnB. Absolutely terrible. Do not stay here.

The place is good for lone travellers or couples, lots of room to open suitcases on the floor.  Large dressing with hangers. Hair dryer. Comfy bed.  Not the best neighbourhood to walk through alone at night though, so get your supplies in the daytime or take an uber/lyft to the CVS a few blocks away.  Also had some annoyance from the dogs in the area barking at each other for long periods of time at night.  The place in itself was good, it was just further away from public transport than I expected so ended up taking a lot of uber/lyft which made my overall budget higher in the end. Lots of room to park a car though so maybe a rental is the answer here.

Location near S Congress was awesome. Tons of great restaurants and things to do, also very close to downtown. Condo complex had a pool and a grill too, and neighbors were incredibly friendly. Wifi was also reliable and strong.

This condo does have a roach problem. When I first checked in, I found three dead roaches in the bathroom/bedroom in plain sight. Not sure how a cleaning crew could have missed them if the place was actually cleaned prior to my arrival. Then proceeded to find new roaches weekly throughout my stay (most live, some dead, I‚Äôd say 12-20 in total). Sarah offered to call an exterminator after a few complaints from me, but since I was working from the condo I couldn‚Äôt really relocate while the condo was treated so I ended up buying roach traps and setting them up myself.
The host canceled this reservation 86 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Stayed at Shelly‚Äôs with my gf for a last minute 4th of July trip, and it didn‚Äôt disappoint. The space is very open and eclectically decorated; and the view of the sunset is nothing short of spectacular.
Would not recommend.  Dirty and small bathrooms. Light was out in the bedroom bathroom. One bed had a weak and messed up wooden frame.
My stay at StudioSoCo could not have been better! The amenities and location are exceptional. Everything is well thought out and organized.

This place is a great value and very stylish. The area is amazingly close to downtown & anything on the East side, but its the east side...which means turn 1 block the wrong way, and its not safe. The host and home were fantastic. The home was extremely clean and even though the owners live there, there wasn't too terribly many personal belongs around the home. My only advice is to be aware that if you are alone, you may not feel comfortable given the neighborhood. I would have felt fine with my husband, but as a single female in that area, I did not feel safe.

Flew into town for some meetings and they all were canceled because of severe weather. Me and a coworker decided to make a trip out of it instead. Couldn't have been happier with the location, the house, or Deanna's communication. We had a great time and I plan on using this house as often as I can while in Austin.
Small bed room Mattress was not in a good conditions towel were not clean and had holes

What an incredible location! Just a couple minutes from everything and you don't even need to rent a car. Hop on a rental scooter and you're just minutes from everything that Austin has to offer. Deanna was an incredible host and even let us keep our bags there after we checked out since we had a late flight. Can't recommend this stay enough!

The home served its purpose. However, just as another person stated, location is close to places if going by CAR not walking.
The neighborhood feels very sketch and the fact that you can't park your vehicle inside the driveway because there are tenants in the back of the rental doesn't help either. The pictures are very deceiving. If you just need a place to sleep it'll do.
You shouldn‚Äôt stay here if you hate ROMANCE because this place is romantic as fuck
Unfortunately we were not able to make our reservation due to travel delays. However Melody was very understanding and responded quickly. Looking forward to staying in the future!

Wir haben 2 N√§chte dort verbracht, es war genau wie beschrieben, super Busanbindung in die Stadt, mega Ausstattung in der K√ºche, die anderen Mitbewohner hat man kaum wahrgenommen, alles war supersauber. Wir waren sehr zufrieden.
Jon-Marc + Gigi‚Äôs stylish hill country cottage is an absolute dream. We stay there as often as we can. You won‚Äôt regret staying here... book it ASAP!
Photos do it no justice
Although never met Russell in person everything was as written if not than better. Super information about Austin and immediate text response to any questions.
My main problem with this place was that it was so hot outside and she did not have the room cooled off before we arrived.  It took all night to cool off.

This was difficult to review. I loved the place, it was decorated well, the bed was comfy and had everything we needed. But the parking was impossible, we had to park in the street with very few options, our host was late for our check-in and the AC didn‚Äôt work. So with a 100+ degree day we dealt as long as we could but we had to cancel and go to a hotel.  Not that easy to do with a baby.

Great place to stay near the university and downtown Austin. Humble and minimalist studio apartment. Kimberly was quick to respond to any questions and provided detailed information about the space. One traveler‚Äôs note (has nothing to do with the studio or the host):  parking in this area is tricky. I got 2 parking tickets in places that I thought would be ok, but wasn‚Äôt. There‚Äôs strictly no parking allowed on one side of the street next to the apartment.
If you're looking for a bed to crash 15 minutes cycle or scooter from downtown then this will do. Don't expect to want to spend time there.

We stayed here for 11 days. Lots of maintenance issues that could not be fixed because the host was not in town. He texted to ask how we were doing, and I messaged back about plumbing problems. I got no response. There was a lot of dust under the bed. There were dirty dishes in the dishwasher when we arrived. No kitchen utensils, just two pans. We bought some groceries and realized there was no way to cook anything. I would say that if if you're looking for a place to stay for more than just a couple of days, stay somewhere else. If you're just looking for a place to crash for a couple of nights, it's fine.

It was a conveninent location for me, but the amenities were not correctly described. It provides a 3-in-1 shampoo/body wash/bubble bath product instead of separate shampoo and body wash. I managed to find a leftover sample shampoo bottle with a very small amount of product left, but there was no hair conditioner. Mike later told me he does not provide hair conditioner unlike the amenities description. Also I was not able to find a hair drier in the places Mike told me to look to find one. It was impossible to hang any clothes because the closet was full of stuff. The HVAC unit was so loud that I woke up every time it started running. Somehow the set temperature went back to 60 something degrees in the middle of night, so I woke up every morning because it was so chilly. Not worth the price.
He didn‚Äôt answer any messages and his number was non existent. We had to cancel day of because we had no way to get in or communicate. He should not be allowed to host on here

I would not stay here. This airbnb was notified of my sister staying with me, and they towed her car! It took 3 hrs and $215 to get it back. Barrett was not remorseful whatsoever and did not offer a reimbursement. I also had to call him more than once to actually get him to give my sister her own parking pass! Ridiculous!

Barrett was very attentive and extremely cordial.  The community is quaint and you can‚Äôt leave without appreciating the mission of Community First.   We had a nice, quiet stay there in the Aerostream. Our only negative is that we were there for New Year‚Äôs Eve and hoped to find some community activities.  Unfortunately there was nothing.
do not check in late. difficult to find.

This place was so small.
I was playing music at a low level and was told that ‚Äòquiet time‚Äô starts at 10 PM.
The neighbors above me complained to the host on both nights I stayed, then I was contacted by Air BNB and told that there was a dispute filed.
Now I could understand this if it was done when the problem happened, but no. It was done after the check out time so I wouldn‚Äôt be eligible for a refund...

Ich habe drei Monate in der Wohnung von Lawrence verbracht. Die obere Unit ist wesentlich ruhiger als die untere, wenngleich beide Wohnungen hellh√∂rig sind. Das Appartement ist sehr zentral gelegen und es gibt ausreichend Platz zum parken. Wirklich ideal. Die K√ºche ist f√ºr einfache T√§tigkeiten ausgestattet. Das Bad ist super und sehr sauber. Waschmaschine und Trocker sind sehr einwandfrei.
Great place to stay! All pros no cons; great host.

Very good place except for one thing.  As a country,  short of war, we are going through the most serious matter we can experience as a nation which is the possible removal of the President. While staying  at this place, it was impossible to access any timely news channel to keep up with this matter because they don't have simple cable TV.  I also live in California and was very concerned about the fires out here.  Again, no timely news.

The place was absolutely disgusting. If you long for your fraternity days walking into a trashed house after a massive party to find the place wrecked maybe it would be for you. There wasn't a clean dish in the house, people sleeping on the couch, music blasting at all hours of the night, an inch of thick dust, stickiness and god knows what else all over surface in the house. I really don't know how anyone sleep there, the bed was filthy and the linens obviously haven't been washed in months. Don't get me started on the bathroom either, but apparently Will and his roommates don't believe in toilet paper. If this was going to be the speed of the place, the description couldve been forthcoming that the place was a dump. I literally wouldve walked right out as soon as I got there if I had felt like dealing with the hassle of getting a refund. Bottom line, don't stay here.
See previous review. This place was a disgusting dump. Do not stay here.

I would not stay at the black onyx hotel, the rooms are smaller that shown, the bed was very uncomfortable and really made me sweat, the room balcony door was thin and you could hear people‚Äôs casual conversation though it in the living room with the tv on, speaking of the of the Tv, the YeH didn‚Äôt get louder that just about casual conversation like if I whispered I was talking louder than the tv, there were dirty dishes in the cabinet with the clean dishes and there was a coffee maker in there with keurig cups but no sugar ü§∑üèæ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èLike what‚Äôs the point, over all it wasn‚Äôt a good stay and uncomfortable
Comfy and convenient! Just make sure you put the address without the apartment number into Google maps or the app takes you to the wrong place.

Pleasant experience overall. Kitchen was not well equipped (no cutting knives, very little cookware) - that was a problem for us because we visited on Thanksgiving and planned to cook. However, it's not a deal-breaker overall.
Secure parking on site, great location, I have nothing but praise for this Airbnb and I‚Äôve stayed at quite a few.

super awesome place! about 30 minutes from downtown. place was clean and organized, although smaller than i thought. didn‚Äôt see the animals outside which was a little disappointing, but not the host‚Äôs fault. only complaint was that the door is very hard to lock and the dead bolt does not work

This house has plumbing issues! The sink did not drain for ~20 minutes, and when it did, it leaked underneath the sink, into a Tupperware container. The container holding the dirty dish water actually overflowed on our first night and spilled all over the kitchen floor. Right after that, the dishwasher we did not start, began leaking as well. I wish I would have known about these specific problems beforehand, especially since they knew of, at the very least, the sink's issues. It made it extremely difficult to do any dishes. I would definitely recommend using paper plates and plastic cups if you choose to stay here.
No hospitality, absent host, felt isolated to a room. Perhaps that's what I should have expected.
Nice clean place to stay over but no meet and greet in person. üòï
Host could not have been lovelier. Unfortunately we weren‚Äôt able to finish our stay,  but she refunded us fairly.

Felicity was a great host that was responsive and very accommodating (even let us store our luggage early as we explored nearby) but I can‚Äôt help but feel disappointed with the space.

My cons:

- The shower-head that was initially provided barely poured out above a trickle, but she quickly replaced it when we brought it to her attention. I couldn‚Äôt help but wonder why the good shower-head wasn‚Äôt installed in the first place.

- The room had an odd smell that emanates from the closet area/old installed heater. It was reminiscent of stale smoke and made it hard to breathe. She able to do something about it that it wasn‚Äôt noticeable when we returned (she handled this and the shower-head while we went out for lunch).

- Though we were able to drop off luggage early, we weren‚Äôt able to ‚Äúcheck-in‚Äù until half hour our scheduled time because the cleaning staff was behind schedule.

- The place is advertised as entire apartment when it‚Äôs really just a room with a small private bath. It felt more like a hostel space than anything else.

I couldn‚Äôt but feel let down as the previous bnb in Austin I stayed in days prior (in the same price range) offered a much larger space, a full kitchen, and no need to bother with quick fixes to problems that shouldn‚Äôt have been problems.

Pro: Felicity is very accommodating and responsive. Great location only about a 7 minute drive to the Driskill Hotel.

Cons: not very clean. There was hair in the shower and over the sink. Very noisy, right next to a fraternity or sorority house that partied until 2 in the morning. Someone downstairs kept slamming the door open and close so it was very noisy. The heat and internet didn't work the first day but Felicity totally fix the problem the very next day.

This place is next to a frat house. I found roaches as soon as I walked into the room. The place was defiantly for a college student that doesn‚Äôt care about where they are staying. The shower was terrible!! My bf is 6‚Äô3 there was no way we can use this shower at all! We wanted a cute getaway like the pictures showed! This was the opposite! It was a disaster!
Super cute and quiet with a comfortable bed. But it's in a college neighborhood and no TV lol so heads up on that.

This place is very old. Creaking wood floors, bathroom that doesn't latch or lock closed, lots of dust and a cockroach in the hallway area. worst of all, the entire place smelled extremely strongly of mold and I have pictures of the window air conditioner filled with mold. Might have lead, but it definitely has mold so your health and mind will be seriously affected if you stay here. I had a 2 day stay but had to cancel after the first night because I couldn't sleep all night because it was so bad. Also the walls are so thin I heard a lot of noise during the night from outside, also since the window ac plastic window cover lets in a lot of noise. I am very surprised the host gets away with hosting a place that is so old and in such bad shape.

The place was clean and beautiful. I was concerned about cockroaches, but I only had one during my two weeks there (maybe because it was a room on the second floor). One thing I would say is that the WiFi was very unstable during the last few days, which was inconvenient.
the place was as advertised and described by others.  when we were there the water was unfortunately low.  we were comfortable and it was quiet.
We had difficulties with cooking. The cooktop was not working and the barbecue run out of propane gas. There is no lake view the lake was drained.
Not worth the high price compared to what I normally get on Airbnb
No

Cute little unit- only complain I can say is the AC barley blows in the bedroom and it‚Äôs always hot in there and also the place smelt like cigarettes REALLY bad. Had to get a candle to get the smell out while I was there.
Cute spot in a quiet East Austin neighborhood. No TV like listed, just a projector.
Very clean, spacious and nice place. The right thing when you want to avoid the crowd. But there are no shops in walking distances

The pictures need to be updated to reflect the current condition of the home. I booked this rental in early March for a very special occasion in late July. My family flew in from all over the country to stay here, and it was a disaster to say the least. There were construction projects upstairs that the owner did not inform me were incomplete until the day of the reservation. Additionally, the cleaning crew missed many areas in the house, including black mold in the downstairs bathroom, undergarments and hair left in rooms and bathroom drawers, and a layer of filth on the playground equipment that made them unusable. There is also no play set outside. It‚Äôs been replaced by a trampoline that‚Äôs full of leaves and mud. The owner has a side business that she runs out of a small house behind the rental property, so be prepared for her workers to open the front gate and walk through the part of the yard that‚Äôs advertised in the renal photos to get back there. We were given no prior warning that they would come through the rental property, and one worker in particular got very hostile and refused to tell me why he was walking through the yard even after I explained  that I rented the Airbnb for the weekend. There were many other issues with this property as well, and the amount charged to stay here was outrageous for what it actually is, so I have an open case with Airbnb that includes photo evidence of my claims to receive a full refund. I would highly suggest renting elsewhere for any occasion.
excellent location and value, but couple features a little odd.  No running water in kitchen area & no toaster.   Hard to find entrance--no path from parking area.
No comments

This is a single room only , not entire apt/studio . It‚Äôs older but clean. It‚Äôs in a building behind the main. House , parking is limited . You need your own blow dryer and soap , shampoo etc . No TV .

Photos are very misleading. The picture of the house is not where you stay. You stay in a run downed building begging the house. There is no ceiling fan. The foundation is so bad that the bath room door doesn‚Äôt close. The door overlaps the door frame. Super small bathroom. The toilet has a wall behind, to the left, and in front. So, if you‚Äôre over six feet you won‚Äôt be able to use it. In order to sit on it, I had my left knee shoved in a corner with my head resting on the wall in front of me. I had to stand up in order to wipe my a**. This place would be worth it if it was a flat rate of like $30 a night. There are some pros to this place however. The location is good and there is a smoke detector.

El lugar es c√©ntrico, sin embargo cre√≠mos que era una casa por las fotos, el lugar es peque√±o m√°s c√≥mo una rec√°mara con ba√±o independiente, es bueno si no estar√°s mucho ah√≠, solo para dormir.
not what I expected, water drainage problem and lots noises

Simple, straight-forward place to stay at.
Location is awesome - fairly central location to get around Austin.
Check-in was very easy.
Didn't have problems with parking, but I can foresee how it can get difficult to go in and out due to shortage or small spaces.
It was quiet at night time, unless you count the hum of the AC unit.
Shower water pressure is low.

Thanks. I gave 5 star to Felicity. She is very prompt in her responses and also with the anticipation of the following are taken care immediately so that the next customer will not have the same issues.

1). The bathroom door is stuck and hard to close and open. Once I was scared that I am stuck in the bath room as I was not able to open it.

2). toilet is not flushing good. Needs to change the toilet system.

Thank you

Read ad carefully. Pictures can be misleading. You will be staying in a small studio apartment BEHIND the pictured house posted. White patio furniture was not available during my stay. Apartment had quite a few bugs that kept biting us during our stay. We saw a Texas sized roach in the bathroom. Ceiling light did not work, and the other 1 out of 2 sources of light was borderline broken (lamp kept flickering. Had to position it a certain way to keep it on.)
Zimmer okay, mehr aber auch nicht. Relativ benutzt, nicht wirklich sauber, durchgelegenes Bett und sehr kleines Bad, vor allem die Toilette.
I liked the location to downtown, it just was a bit dirty.

This place rules. If you're after good barbecue, there's two insane spots within a block and a half. If you're after good bars, there's three insane spots within a block. If you're after a nice chill spot for a homebase in Austin with quick access to cool stuff and a killer host, book this spot now and thank me later.

Sehr sch√∂nes, stylisches Appartement an guter Lage, nahe Bird Lake und guten Restaurants in Gehdistanz. Wir sind am Fluss entlang nach Downtown gelaufen und hatten rund 30 Minuten.
Das Appartement ist super eingerichtet - l√§sst keine W√ºmsche offen!! Wir kochen selber und waren absolut happy mit der K√ºche. Auch das Bett war sehr bequem. Kleiner ‚ÄûKritikpunkt‚Äú: Wir sind uns einiges gewohnt, da wir viel reisen, doch hier habe ich die Klimaanlage als √ºberdurchschnittlich laut empfunden.
Great location! Noise detector felt a little bit brother but wasn‚Äôt horrible. Would come back

two different air bnb in the same house with thin walls in between. BACKYARD/POOL IS A SHARED AREA but it's always running so you're good.  so beware if you have anxiety with making noise. Bed is low to the ground but really comfy. there's Hulu with Rickand Morty! you have to go out the front door then to the side of the house for pool. there's a camera in the tree so don't try to sunbathe.. quite embarrassing üò≥.  AC unit works slowly so sleep with a towel under the door the trap the cool air.

this was a terrible place to stay at, pictures are deceiving, the place is super small, one small kitchen, small bathroom, and small bedroom. it's a house that has been split into two separate airbnbs. the bed was broken and on the ground, could not sleep and had back pain because of it. There were literal roses and random trash under the bed. there was no central AC but a cooling unit hooked to the window. the address provided on airbnb is close but not the correct one, the host sent us a different address shortly before our check in. Adding to all of that this place was on the pricier side and we paid the price expecting high quality, instead this was a broken down, small, and dirty place that you'd expect to be one of the cheapest options. Even location wise this was far away from everything.

Just the day before this I was staying at a different airbnb that was in the middle of downtown, much better in every aspect, and lower price.

Decent place for what we needed, but has some house flipper construction concerns. Wall in kitchen leaked from baseboards, likely from the shower stall on the other side in the other unit. The shower has flooring instead of tile on the shower wall in our unit, so I‚Äôm thinking that‚Äôs the cause. Unfinished rough edges on the quartz slab counters. Dangerous broken board on a step on the deck in the backyard.
Exactly as described.  No better value in South Austin.

The place was clean and had good cooking tools, but there were issues. A bathroom door was broken and unusable. One bed was uncomfortably high and would be unusable for some people. It‚Äôs advertised with a Flexible cancellation/change policy but Christopher refused to accept a change made 7 days in advance. Quite unprofessional.

When you get to the building you have to find the apartment number and walk up a lot of stairs and go through dark halls. I suggest getting there in the day time cause it feels creepy at night. The apartments are numbered weird, so it took me a while to find it. They are pretty old, they have elevators that are permanently shut down. When you first walk in the apartment you notice how it‚Äôs very Texas theme which is cute, everything looks alright, till you sit on the edge of the bed and it breaks, then you go to rest room and the door comes off. Then you want to cool the place down and the AC does not get cold. They do have pots and pans and a few condiments you can use. So that was nice. This place would be perfect if they would let you know ahead of time that a few things are messed up. When I left i let them know everything that was wrong, They told me I was gonna have to pay for damages, till I told them it was not fair, and it made me wonder if they knew it was already broken. I felt that I was being set up. Then they went and took a look and noticed they were small damages caused by all the use prior to my arrival, and that the door just needed to be screwed back in properly. If I didn‚Äôt speak up they probably would have charged me unfairly. I don‚Äôt think this place is in the right conditions to be out for rent on air bnb.

I get the concept of you get what you pay for. In fact, I'm an advocate for it as that's what I signed up for with air bnb. But we didn't even get that. Let me tell you what we paid for: a clean private bedroom for me, my friend and our 2 dogs to sleep in. (With an increased cleaning fee which was agreed upon between Melvin and me) which I was totally fine with and happy that he was open to negotiation as he normally doesn't house dogs, which was nice of him to accommodate. So let me tell you what we actually got for our money: a place for our dogs to sleep. Let me tell you what we didn't get: A clean place to stay. It was a pig sty. There were cardboard boxes littered throughout, open and unopened. The kitchen had a stacked sink and dirty dishes scattered across The countertops and was completely unpresentable. And not to mention when we walked in we were hit with an overpowering stench of weed (to which our host said part of his cleaning was to keep the window open and now we know why...fresh air couldn't rid the place of that stench of weed) To his defense, the bedroom we were supposed to stay in was neat and tidy. When we first arrived we knocked several times before he answered. When he opened the door we weren't sure we were in the right place as he didn't invite us in or welcome us. Not a friendly greeting. I understand people being introverted and this by no means is an attack on his personality but, coming from someone who has hosted people frequently via air bnb, part of your being a host is to be just that (definition of host: a person who receives or entertains other people as guests) we did not feel received, entertained or welcomed as guests. It was just uncomfortable. So remember, we paid to sleep at a place, so tell me why we ended up sleeping in my truck? Our host had locked us out via the deadbolt so we couldn't get in. We tried for hours in the middle of the night to call, text and bang on the door to get his attention. And by banged I mean BANGED. I would say I'm surprised he couldn't hear us but the stench of weed lends itself to providing an explanation for his lack of appearance. So with no assistance by our host, we 'slept' in our truck in the parking lot of the complex. I'm only thankful we Drive a truck as this could have been even worse. Worrying about our animals that we couldn't get to preoccupied most of our thoughts. Approximately 2 hours later my friend decided to try his phone again. We are now at 7am.
