She sent him a text, no reply and she called him again. He hung up after we said hello so we called back...

Unfortunately this place wasn‚Äôt for me. The pictures are somewhat deceiving. Melvin is a polite man. But my concerns were safety and security. If you don‚Äôt mind the smell of constant cigarettes being smoked on the ground floor and if you don‚Äôt mind marijuana aroma and if you don‚Äôt mind the smell of B,O And the disgusting carpet. Then this place is for you.

I wanna start by saying that Melvin was very communicative and considerate during my stay! I wasn't finding my copy of the key and had to leave without it. I came back at 1 AM and Melvin waited for me to come back so that he could open the door. I really appreciated him doing that.

The room and bathroom were well put and decent. People tend to complain about the smell of smoke or weed in the place, and it is a real thing in the apartment, but it doesn't get into the airbnb room and I didn't really care about the smell when I got out of the room.

The location wasn't the best and the price could be better for what is offered.

The apartment smelled like urine. We couldn‚Äôt stay and left after two hours.
After trying to receive our full refund as we did not stay in the apartment, the host tried to blame the smell on us. Terrible place and sneaky host who lied.
There was hair in the left sink, used condiments, trash half full & no face towels paper towels or soap
Overall the stay was good. There was an issue with the door not working and we were unable to use the stove as it was also broken. Megan was open about these issues and we worked around them.

This place was nothing but perfect for our needs. It was clean, spacious, and had everything we needed. The communication between the host and us was nothing but amazing!  They even provided us with a mini bose speaker to use. You will not regret your decision.

This is a good place to get away from the city for a little bit. Great distance from a lot of wineries, breweries, and distilleries. Necessities are a short drive as well.  My only complaints were that it wasn't sparkling clean like I thought it would be. Sitting outside you can also smell the septic tank, which wasn't ideal.

It‚Äôs was 100 outside and they didn‚Äôt Even turn the ac on before we got there so it was horrible. The other bed in this airstream was broken it‚Äôs was moldy and melded and it was 275$ for two night s

You pay for location and size of the house. Make sure you bring hand towels and wash cloths because they don't have any in the bathrooms. The kitchen was also not as clean as it should have been and that was disappointing. And the art work on the walls was not appropriate either.

The host refused to refund my cancelation after the winter storm in Texas. There was a boil water notice in Austin until a day or two before our check in. Texas was declared to be in a disaster. Members from our group live in Austin and in Dallas and witnessed everything going on there first hand. We communicated with the host and Airbnb customer service early on but received no resolution from them. So here we are. The host without a heart. Airbnb without any real customer support.
The communication and organization was exactly what they described.  No surprises at all and everything worked out smoothly.

The house is located in a very nice neighboorhood and near downtown. However there are some issues. The house needs to be repaired in order to be rented.

-Heating/AC does not cover a part of the house and we needed to purchase 3 additional heaters, once when turned on the heaters the electricity went off (the outside temperature was 14¬∞F). We needed to repair the breaker many times, we even had to purchase a screwdriver.

On December 24th, there was no water because the pipes we broken, but not precisely for the bad weather, we went to look and the instalation was terrible. We had to call a plumber that night by our own beceause the renter told us all the plumbers were not availanle until 4 days.

The food waste disposal machine also did not work and every time the sink was full we needed to pump the water out.

The instruction book mentioned that cable tv was available and it did not work at all.

Always had response by our renter, but never solid solutions.
Rented this for a bachelorette , just as described no issue

We booked this property for a family wedding. It‚Äôs much more suitable for a bachelor or bachelorette weekend as a place to crash.

Common area is small, couch is IKEA and saggy/uncomfortable. Bathrooms had mold and dirt.

We asked several times for an early check in and kept getting ‚Äúpolicy‚Äù
Answers that it would not be decided until day of. Then, day-of, Renters Club management would not grant it. There was one roll of TP for 11 guests for a 3 day rental.

Mostly though, this rental experience wasn‚Äôt typical of Airbnb where the hosts are gracious and accommodating and my siblings and nieces/nephews also felt that way.

Long story short, I would not stay here again unless I had no better options.

Pros: location is great, there is ample parking, and the house has a layout that is suitable for large groups. There were 9 of us and we slept comfortably.

Cons: the house was dirty and infested with roaches. Both showers were absolutely filthy. They were full of dirt, hair, and mildew when we arrived. The couch, though comfortable, is covered in large, brown stains. Worst of all, however, the house is completely infested with roaches. The owners clearly know there is a roach problem, as all of the sink drains were plugged when we arrived. As soon as we unplugged the sinks, we started to notice roaches in the house. We were pretty good about plugging the sinks when they weren't being used, but forgot to plug them on the last night and woke up to half a dozen roaches in the house and in our suitcases. Disgusting.
Bonito lugar lo mejor de la casa fue sus camas muy c√≥modas lo que no me gust√≥ fue que no tiene tv, en las anotaciones-  pero todo lo de m√°s perfecto,,,gracias....

Excellent location and very attractive home. Perfect for a large group to mix leisure time at home with venturing out. We enjoyed the big dining space and wonderful backyard. We recommend to others, but given the price, I was a bit disappointed at a few things-
The WiFi was not working for our full 3 day stay, and a few basic kitchen amenities were missing that made cooking difficult. Beds sleep 12, not 13.

I ended up leaving shortly after arriving because I felt unsafe. The apartment complex itself is very rundown and I would not have felt safe entering or exiting at nighttime (which I needed to do because I was there for work). I wrote the host to let him know I had found another place (I didn‚Äôt cancel because I didn‚Äôt want to not pay last minute) and I never got a response.
Very colorful place. I couldn‚Äôt stop reading all the writing on the doors.
Stylish pad, that‚Äôs a hop, skip, and jump from the city. Just leave 10 minutes early for everything... traffic.

Place was okay. Main areas were clean, but linens need a major upgrade. Towels had stickers that scratched several family members before they realized they were there, and it wasn‚Äôt just one towel. If you are traveling  with several people, you may not find comfortable seating for everyone in the living room. Disappointing overall.

We chose this home because it was in a good location and allowed pets for our one dog. Understandably there was dirt and dog hair on the floor, but we were disappointed to find pet and human hair on the bed linens. It would have been helpful to have a house manual available as we were not familiar with special features of the home like needing to turn on a switch to use the dishwasher, where to find extra linens, etc. Our host always responded in a timely manner, even when we had issues with water leakage in the bathroom. There were  also some missing essentials and the oven was unusable due to dirt and what appeared to be melted plastic.

Upon checking in it took Ames an hour to respond to my call after calling a couple of times to receive the code to access the apartment. When I settled in I still had not received the email as clearly stated in the description that I would state all I need to know about the unit. There were no guest manual in the apartment so I was not clear about parking, which I had to keep am eye on it throughout my stay. The next day while packing up an hour before check out I hear someone trying to get in which thru would have if I did not have the top lock looked. Now again, I was a there alone not listing who it could be since I had no guest. When I opened the door it was a cleaning crew of four. I stated I was still packing and they stayed at the front door until I left. but only did I have a hard time checking in but was rushed out by the cleaning crew. I stay in Austin very frequently and have yet to come across this many issues before. I did send Ames a messages about my stay and asked for 1/2 , not even the full amount refunded and got a decline. I would not recommend booking listing.

Noted that there is no washer and dryer in the apartment unit, you need to pay $1,50 for washer and the same for dryer for each use in the community laundry. Neighborhood is quite noisy, not a restful place.  Building is old and run down.

We stayed here for one night, and everything went as expected. My only complaints are that we paid a $70.00 cleaning fee, yet we were expected to load/run the dishwasher if any dishes were used, and the dishwasher wound up not working anyway.
Once we checked out we received a message from Ames requesting $60.00 for bedding that was stained beyond repair. I was told that there were two separate stains, and upon receiving the photos we discovered that only one was ours, and had to briefly dispute the second stain, which appeared to be washed and dried blood. We ended up agreeing on a $20.00 fee for the the pizza stain, but I really do doubt that a very small pizza sauce stain is beyond the repair of oxyclean and a washer. The stay itself for a single night in Austin was great and the location was ideal, however, my experience with the host was disappointing. From now on I'll be sure to check my bedding prior to staying in it to avoid another accusation.

While we enjoyed the location of this airbnb, it's clear that the apartment is not intended for a long term stay (we were there for 30 days). The beds & furniture are very uncomfortable and there was hardly any cleaning supplies provided for us other than some crusty dishwasher pods that were so old they didn't work. As a result, we had to order cleaning supplies and were told by the hosts we shouldn't have packages shipped to the airbnb. One of our packages ended up getting lost as the main office refused to accept them for us.

Aside from the actual apartment, we did not have the most pleasant experience with the hosts themselves. We stayed at this airbnb during the terrible snowstorm in Austin this February. While most of Austin was losing power, heat, and running water (so did we), our hosts never checked in on us once. We were forced to evacuate this airbnb and book another across town so we could have working showers and toilets again. When I messaged the hosts to see if they could ask the building when the water was expected to turn back on, they were extremely rude and unhelpful. All in all, a very poor experience.

If this is your only option in Austin, it's fine but I wouldn't choose to stay here again.

I notified they host about finding feces in a drawer, and a broken towel rack, which i have pictures of. They sent $70 refund with no note or apology, or explanation. I sent a message back stating $70 was not efficient and requested at least $200.
I never heard back from anyone. You have to imagine, when finding feces, toward the end of stay, thinking what rodent was in apartment when we were during our stay! I was horrified and completely grossed out!!
$70 and NO EXPLANATION< AND NO RESPONSE TO ME REQUESTING $200 refund! No good business practices!!!

This apartment is in bad shape. we arrived to find water dripping out of the air conditioning filter area in the master bathroom. it was dripping heavily and obviously had been for some time. There was so much water damage on the upper cabinet that it was swollen and cracking, the flooring in the master bathroom was swollen and some pieces had actually lifted up entirely. The door frame was swollen with water damage at the bottom so much that the paint had peeled off. The vent in the hall bath was also leaking water and you could tell this was also a regular problem by the way the popcorn coating had peeled off in places. Bother the floor in the kitchen and the hall bath were also swollen with retained water and the bases of the counters in both bathrooms and the kitchen were literally crumbling apart. The carpets were grungy and not pleasant to walk on and they were also lifting up in the area between the kitchen and bathroom. With all that water damage there is most likely a lot of mold hiding under the floors and the bathrooms just smelled damp and musty. When I contacted Ames about the dripping unit he said he would contact maintenance and then didn't communicate until I asked what was happening, he said they would come the following morning which they never did. The place was mostly cleaned except some pubic hair on the bathroom floor and the inside of the trash can lid having something on it. The pool was fun to swim in, and the location was nice but we will not stay there again.

nice location and an okay stay if you just need somewhere to crash (ACL vibes), but the place has some major issues. There was a massive leak in one bathroom the entire time we were there that wasn‚Äôt fixed. When I emailed the hosts they said they‚Äôd call maintenance and that was the last we heard. One of the bedroom doors would not close at all. There also were a few aesthetic things around the apartment that left little to be desired. If you‚Äôre staying for more than a weekend I‚Äôd maybe reconsider.
Tout s‚Äôest bien pass√©, l‚Äôappartement est propre, bien agenc√© et bien situ√©, les demandes sont rapidement trait√©es.

Molly's house is only 5 mins away from restaurants and HEB (great grocery store). Since she lives upstairs, she is very easy to communicate and her response is very quick. Her bathroom sink did not drain well at first, but she came over to fix it with Drano right away, and problem got fixed immediately. Her house is very spacious and a lot of room to spread our suitcases and sit around. We plan to come back next time we are in Austin!

We booked an 11 day stay with Molly and ended up bailing out after a few days. We just weren't comfortable with the place.

There is a nice new refrigerator, gas range, microwave, coffeemaker, and probably the biggest TV I have ever seen outside of Costco. The home is reasonably spacious with a large front and back yard, but it was not inviting enough for us to want to spend any time there.

The house is old. Old walls, very slanting floors, sticking doors and doorjambs, layers of paint and caulking, funky bathtub, and most of the furniture is really old, too. The living room upholstery is stained and one chair has a rip. All of the dining room chairs are old straight back chairs with sunken-in rush seats, not a comfortable seat in the house. The beds and linens were old and well used. The kitchen wasn't too bad, enough dishes and glassware, but the cookware is ancient thrift shop. Wet towels in the washer, unwatered house plants and lots of old books, movies and stuff.

Most of the house was reasonably clean, but the floors were filthy. I go barefoot indoors, and my feet turned black immediately, as did a paper towel when I wiped up a small spill.

We had noted the house has window air conditioners, not central A/C. They worked well enough, but of course you have to run them all the time, and they are noisy. There are only sheer flimsy curtains on the windows, so I had to hang sheets and garbage bags on the windows for privacy and to keep out the light at night.

Our experience was that the owners wait until a guest complains before attending to upkeep. Yes, Molly responded quickly enough, but had to be informed that the detergent was almost out, the batteries were dead in the TV remotes, the DVD player couldn't be connected because it was was obsolete, the A/C filter needed to be cleaned, and the kitchen faucet and dishwasher were loose. There was no wifi info in the house and no instructions on how to use the four giant TV remotes. On request Molly provided a Brita faucet filter that should have been there but wasn't and a mattress topper because one of the mattresses is hard as a rock, but we had to set up all these things ourselves.

We are always willing to overlook a problem or two at Airbnb's, because we know homes can have some problems, but this was a bit much.

If you are attracted, as we were, to the spaciousness and the Hyde Park location, be sure the rest of the offering fits your needs.
The apartment suited our group very well. Big open spaces with activities that we sadly didn't have time to use!
The neighborhood is filled with homeless people it‚Äôs really sad. Very noisy neighborhood as well. None of us slept the one night we stayed.

This place is lacking in the details.  It is spacious and has potential, but seems quite outdated and in need of some repairs and upgrades. Also beware that there is not an elevator and you must hall luggage up four flights of stairs. Location is on the "wrong" side of I35 if you want to have easy access to 6th Street by foot without having to walk past homeless area with a lot of tents and panhandlers constantly harassing you.

Overall a great stay. The parking situation was not perfect, and the village of homeless people nearby was a bit scary. Also, few things in the unit were broken. Generally, it was clean and as described.

The location sold me on this. While Austin in general seems to deal with a lot of homelessness and there is a community close by, it never came across as negative. Everywhere I went seemed only 5 minutes away. A quick walk to downtown. I only had myself and one other person and this place was spacious and luxurious. I‚Äôll definitely be booking again in the coming months
This is a place to book if you are younger than 25.  When they sent me a message about having devices inside the unit to measure sound I should have known than I booked the wrong place.

Modern loft east of downtown in a gentrifying area of town. The space is relatively nice. We had some issue with items not working (fan in master, foozball table broken, sound on arcade, towels stained) and were disappointed at the hosts responsiveness (they said maintenance would come but didn‚Äôt fix anything). There are major homeless encampments around the property so Location doesn‚Äôt lend itself to walking to downtown. Their policies (guest doing dishes, taking out trash, etc) also leave something to be desired. Overall, I would not stay here again.

Nice stay 20 min from the airport. close to downtown and almost 10 minutes Uber from everywhere.
the apt is huge, 3-4 couples fit perfectly.
the neighborhood is not premium but alternative. The first impression is not good but then you realize it is safe.
nice details such as shampoo and soap on bathrooms, and overall clean.
I had a bad experience with towels (not provided and not response from the owner).

Very big space with a some major drawbacks. The main door doesn‚Äôt have a deadbolt and is only locked by an old four digit lock. The sheets and beds were clean but most surfaces throughout the apartment were grimy and had fingerprints. We also found a dead bug in one of the  restroom that looked like it had been there for weeks. Although the area is very convenient and walkable in the daytime, at night it‚Äôs a different story. The host‚Äôs phone number sends you straight to a voicemail asking you to send a message via Airbnb. There was also no response from the host after asking him if there was any way to add temporary security to the door.

This house is almost all show and has massive issues including security problems and janky utilities.

Pros:
- Well stocked kitchen with nice gas stove - Comfortable beds - Spacious and pretty- Nice neighborhood

Cons:
- THE BACKDOOR LOCK IS ENTIRELY BROKEN AND WILL NOT LOCK AT ALL- IT IS UNLOCKED AND IT IS UNSAFE ESPECIALLY TO LEAVE ITEMS IN THE HOUSE WHEN OUT SINCE THERE ARE NO CURTAINS MAKING YOUR ABSENCE VERY OBVIOUS. You do not have a key to the house yet only one of the two code locks will open via code and neither will lock via the code pad.
- I saw another review mention the not-curtained upstairs windows but that is actually the only room with any curtains at all. There are absolutely none downstairs, including in the two bedrooms which have large windows. There is nothing separating you and the neighbor‚Äôs windows, giving no privacy or save from the morning sun. In the middle bedroom your room is visible from the house‚Äôs hallway too.
- Old windows let in a draft, large cracks.
- The hot water mostly does not reach upstairs, so it‚Äôs impossible to use the nice big bathroom for a hot shower.
- The downstairs bathroom has a sliding door that is very separated from the wall giving no soundproofing from the kitchen sitting area or bedroom near it. The door has no handle on the inside and isn‚Äôt on a full track so you can‚Äôt open it by pushing against it, so you have to smash your hand between the door and wall to grab the end and pull it open. The cubicle shower has no shower curtain or door and no mat was provided, so you have to shower against the wall to not completely flood the bathroom floor.
- The WiFi does not reach past the kitchen/one half of the house. So no WiFi in the living room or bigger bedroom.
- The bedroom near the side entrance has two lamps, yet one is not even plugged in because they didn‚Äôt bother putting an extension cord.
- The tv has a DVD player yet no cords connecting it. Also with no WiFi or internet connectivity, don‚Äôt expect to use any streaming services.
- Middle hallway has round rocks that are painful to walk on and very difficult for older people. Middle bedroom also has a painful flooring.
- Old food obviously hasn‚Äôt been cleaned out for a long time, rotten things in the fridge.

The property had many pros:
Jaime was an excellent communicator
The home is near beautiful Barton Springs for hiking, etc.
Compared to other similar properties where we have stayed previously, we were surprised at a number of issues we encountered:
The external areas of the home were relatively unkempt, for example, an empty litter box and rolled up rug at the front entrance, as well as similar items in the patio area
The interior was not super clean - for example, the glass inlay of the dining table was surrounded by crumbs and other debris
There was no hot water in the kitchen sink or master bathroom sink/shower - we left the water on for several minutes and it never got warmer than room temperature
There were fruit flies in the kitchen sink drain
Inadequate linens - only one kitchen towel, at least one of the bath towels had a musty smell
Inadequate toiletries - kitchen handsoap was just a little soap which had been filled with plain water, showers had very small amounts of shower gel and already-used soap bars
Inadequate closet space - there was no way to hang our clothes - no hangers, no space in closets
Only one coffee filter was left for a 3 day stay
No iron, no laundry detergent

It really pains me to write this review because I have never had to write a negative review for any other AirBnB properties. But I think Jaime and his property have a lot of potential - these are pretty small things to fix, but there were just too many of them to ignore.

It is a cute little house with a nice, off master balcony and fenced side yard.

The location is close to things if you‚Äôre okay driving and paying to park. We would have used the rental scooters a little more, but the house was far enough out, that scooters could be sparse.

No coffee maker.

The master bath shower is huge and very nice! Though, one day I had trouble getting any hot water and had to take a cold shower. Not sure how, but the next day it gave us hot water.

If you‚Äôre looking to spend a lot of time at the house the couch is fairly small for 3-4 people and not the most comfortable I have sat on. (We spent most of our time out, so it wasn‚Äôt much of an inconvenience for us.)

We would stay here again if some of the small issues (especially the hot water) were fixed.

We stayed in Jaime‚Äôs house for ACL weekend, and it was perfect for that. Communication was excellent, checking in and out was very easy, and the house was clean. Overall, very happy with our stay and would recommend it.

A word of caution to groups with multiple vehicles‚Ä¶ there is only one parking space, so additional cars will have to park in the street. Pay attention to street signs so you don‚Äôt get a parking ticket. Jaime warned me, but I missed that part of the message and parked on the wrong side, so learn from my mistake!

It is a true tiny home. The bed situation is a little bit of a struggle as there is no headroom at all. Pictures show that so nothing major. There is no hot water however. We were not expecting that. They do have hot water in the public showers area so you can get a hot shower if needed, just none inside your room.
As described. Note - tiny houses really are tiny! It was nice, but maybe not a good fit if you're tall.

A nice tiny house experience. It was located in a parking lot so only one view out the front end / hitch window. I like the experience but I won‚Äôt do again. It has 2 bar stools and one chair for seating, no couch. Decent RV fridgerator with freezer. Towels were provided.

I fully support Community First goal to make a debt in Austin‚Äôs homelessness. This village has a great layout: chicken coop, outdoor theater, geodome for growing, kids playground, dog area. You can see a ton of tiny house for ideas (140) and 100 RVs. One or two person smoking within 25 feet of signs saying no smoking. I hate smoke.

There is a laundry facility but I didn‚Äôt have detergent. Plenty of parking for your vehicle. Sound travels here so I could hear a guy 2 RV spaces over. Pillow cases weren‚Äôt the softest, detergent used?

The main issue I had was cleanliness. Floors were dirty, plenty of dust on windows sills.
This was my second time to stay here at the Blue Aggie and it didn't disappoint. Love the country and community feel close to Austin.

I was extremely excited to be staying at a tiny home but this was a really bad experience for my boyfriend and I. At first the Airbnb seemed great, but after dropping off our stuff and leaving for the day, we came back at night to a HOT tiny home. It felt like entering your car after you leave it in the sun for a while. We had a lot of trouble sleeping considering the bed was up top and heat rises and were even sweating throughout the night without a blanket! We cranked the A/C to its maximum but by morning it still wasn‚Äôt working. On top of that there was this light outside the window right next to the bed that was so bright, so if you are the type that has trouble sleeping with a light on or with what seems like shades being open, don‚Äôt go here. We contacted the host about the A/C and trying to get this light off but he never replied! Not during our trip and not after. I even followed up.


Also a note to everyone, there was no hot water during my stay!!! I left the shower on for 10 minutes hoping it would turn hot but it never did.

ALSO, for parking, there are spaces available but they are VERY LIMITED. One night I got home and there were no spots and since the host didn‚Äôt even respond to my initial message about the A/C I didn‚Äôt even bother contacting him about this. I just had to wait there for a spot because I didn‚Äôt know what else to do. There was a gate with more parking but it required a code and we never got a code.

Definitely disappointed in my first tiny home experience and would not return with Barrett.

Pros:
-Chris stayed in contact with us during our stay to ask how everything was.
-The neighborhood seemed safe and quiet, and it was within walking distance of downtown (a 30-45 minute walk).
-The dog and cat were both very friendly and sweet.

Cons:
-Chris was out of town, and his roommates were unprofessional. When we first arrived and asked about the key, one of them told us there was no key and they just left the door unlocked (this made us feel very uneasy because we weren't familiar with the area). When we came back in with our things a few minutes later, he gave us the key and told us it was a joke.
-The place was absolutely filthy: Urine all over the toilet seat, facial hair all over the bathroom sinks, and the entire apartment looked like it hadn't been cleaned in at least a month (visible dirt on the rugs in the bedroom, dust bunnies in the hallway, and dirty countertops in the kitchen). It reminded me of those boys' dorm rooms I occasionally visited in college that were never cleaned.
-The bed we stayed in was a loft bed with a very lumpy mattress. It caused me some significant and lasting lower back pain.
-Although the ad said we could use the kitchen, the refrigerator was so packed that there was barely enough room to keep the few groceries we bought for breakfast and lunch during our three-night stay.
Ok, very generic. No issues with the stay though.
Functional, tough metal ladder to bed. Served it‚Äôs purpose as a place to crash

Desafortunadamente Nadeen no pudo recibirnos porque tuvo que irse de la ciudad a √∫ltima hora, aunque pudimos recoger las llaves en casa de su amiga, que nos esper√≥ amablemente incluso cuando lleg√°bamos a medianoche.
