Buyer Beware

I recently booked this house for 2 nights as my wife and I were visiting Austin. I am a seasoned traveler and willing to overlook a few imperfections.

However, I cut my stay short and left this house after one night. Overall the house is not kept up to standards. You are greeted with cobwebs hanging all over the garage door, followed by a bug infested, worn out fence. I choose this house as I was traveling with dogs and it highlights its backyard. This is where things went from bad to worse. The backyard has several broken and ripped chairs around a table, a grill has its parts strewn all over, weeds are 18 inches high, the grass needs to be cut and watered and candidly by letting your dogs out they will be subjected to ticks and fleas.

The inside of the house is generally suitable but only surface-clean. The downstairs toilet wasn‚Äôt flushed prior to our arrival. A rather rude greeting when I lifted the seat cover.. overall the house needs a serious deep cleaning and basic repairs.

The location of the house is decent and has lots of potential. However, based on my shortened stay, I can not recommend this place to others.

It is a nice place with easy parking and close enough to everything. If you are looking to be in all the action this might not be the best place for you but you will pay a lot more to be right in it all. There was a smell coming from the dishwasher that was standing moldy water and the whole house smelled strongly of faboloso. If you have issues with smells this cleaning product might bother you.

The location is great, I can‚Äôt stress this enough. Also, they provide good tips/suggestions of places to visit and eat at in the area. There is soap, shampoo, and conditioner in the shower which is helpful. The pillows were quite comfortable as well. Check in/out was easy.

The curtains are fairly useless and let sunlight into the sleeping spaces earlier than I‚Äôd prefer. We also saw (and killed) a cockroach in the bedroom area. This wasn‚Äôt too horrible for us because we understand that cockroaches are everywhere in the south, but still something worth noting. The host sent us a message touching base with us on our first day, we mentioned the cockroach in our reply and received no response during our three nights there‚Äînot sure if that‚Äôs common practice for this host. Again, not a big deal to us, but worth noting.

The pullout bed is surprisingly uncomfortable and sinks down drastically‚Äîthis was the worst part of our stay. If you‚Äôre planning to stay here and needing to use the pullout sleeper as an additional sleeping space I‚Äôd suggest looking elsewhere; your sleep will be impacted. There was also an inflatable queen size mattress in the closet which proved equally bad. The mattress lost air after 4-5 hours‚ÄîI was essentially sleeping on the wooden floor after a few hours.

- The house is much much older than the photos depict.
- Nextflix wasn‚Äôt able to be utilized as it was being streamed in 4 other locations
- WiFi kept dropping while watching a movie.
- Bad lightening in the first floor
- Maintenance guy was scheduled & showed up before 10am banging on the door when checkout was at 11am.
- No stopper in the bathroom sink, things can fall down easily
- The entire first floor was sticky and our shoes made a sound each step we took. This made us question the entire cleaning process, therefore, we went and purchased paper goods & plastic utensils in order to eat our takeout.
- I was overwhelmed by unneeded information prior to even arriving at the house. Checkin was listed as after 3pm on the Airbnb website. I was sent a google document link to fill out what time I would be checking in, which I didn‚Äôt realize was congruent with Airbnb rules. I received a message for early check in, another for dog fees, and a 2016 Austin things to do website. The amount of additional messages & info not related to check in, rules during stay & check out was overwhelming.
- Anytime I messaged or replied, I received what appeared to be a generic message.

TOWING ENFORCED 24 HOURS! We stayed at this property for one night as my family and I didn't want to make the early morning drive from CorpusChristi to the AustinAirport. As we are Superhost ourselves and work in Vacation Rentals, this was a worst-case scenario trip. I received an abundance of communication from this property management company of which I did read and respond to most.(4 emails, 3 Airbnb messages, 1 txt messages) The day of our check in I was texted the door code and had the address, this is where the breakdown occurred. We arrived very close to midnight and saw ample parking so we didn't think anything. The following morning to our surprise as we were leaving to the airport to catch our flight we discovered our vehicles had been towed. We called the management company for which we were told, "to bad you should have paid more attention to the instructions, we have bills to pay so no refund." We were forced to catch an $40 Uber to the tow yard and pay $460 to get our vehicles back. Followed by missing our flight, and paying $600 to rebook the next day. Along with $160 to stay in a hotel until our flight the next day. It goes without saying for me, when I'm in Austin I will be staying at a hotel. As for the unit it was "ok" no extras provided.

A good place to stay in Austin and a nice apartment. The main issue was the WiFi didn't work and the host wasn't too helpful with fixing this issue (in fact it never was resolved). Luckily this wasn't a huge deal but it could've been problematic if I needed to e.g. work.

A very nice stay :) I think to keep in mind this is an apartment not a luxury mega fancy place, it‚Äôs clean and neat to their extent. If you‚Äôre looking to cook during your stay their kitchen amenities is right for you. Everything listed is provided.  Big plus they had a brita water pitcher but unfortunately the filter was not changed during my stay. Roku tv was a little slow and would crash if you move too fast so be patient sometimes. As the other reviews, WiFi wasn‚Äôt correct but just contact the host for any problem and they respond right away. Not sure if this applies since I paid extra for early check in but don‚Äôt expect your door code minutes before, you won‚Äôt receive until right on the dot for check in time up to 5 minutes after. In all this wasn‚Äôt too bad and I enjoyed my stay, very comfy :)
No wifi so if you have to work from home, probably not ideal. Very close to all the tourist locations. Very quiet area. Convenience of parking lot right in front of building.
the bathroom fixtures need to be tightened , there is no view to the room ad there is a fence right outside but location is very near to downtown.
Great place to stay if you don't mind using the provided earplugs to block out the noise of dirty 6th at night!

Everything that is in the description is on point. You want the 6th street action you‚Äôre right on it with a view of downtown Austin! Only issue was the 1 bathroom was 4 of us hey but we made it work just fine! Everything is nearby walking distance or just rent a electric scooter you want have a problem finding one believe me.

We enjoyed our stay.

Pros
The apartment had enough space for two of us to work remotely.

Cleaning service available. The staff is incredibly sweet.

Golds gym in the building

Lots to do nearby

Cons
It gets loud and sometimes late into the night. We are used to noisy apartments so didn‚Äôt bother us much. For light sleepers, use the noise machine.

There are some shady individuals who hang around the block. Have your Ubers pick/drop you off on 6th only. The street perpendicular should be avoided.

I‚Äôve been renting from Airbnb for over a year now and this is by far the worst experience I‚Äôve ever had the property is not at all what it‚Äôs made out to be for the price it‚Äôs very old and the doors are very hard to open including the back door me and my husband booked a last minute reservation for new years and we were very disappointed we didn‚Äôt even stay 30 minutes and didn‚Äôt touch anything I immediately contacted Paula with my concerns and didn‚Äôt get a response until 423 in the morning. We got to the property around 730 and was gone by 8:15 we didn‚Äôt have a decent place to park are car because there was a vehicle in front of the house I‚Äôm not sure if it belonged to her or not I let her know that I tripped over the floor leading into the kitchen and she showed no care at all I also contacted her the next day regarding a refund for anything and she didn‚Äôt care to work anything out with me and then sent me $50 for what idk when I paid $800 but this is definitely a lesson learned
I can't recommend Irma's place enough!

The place met our needs. The host is responsive and easy to work with. Not the fanciest place and not the greatest neighborhood but overall the location is close to downtown and has everything you need to crash for a few nights.
Gorgeous place! I was so sad to have to leave!
The host canceled this reservation 86 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Spend a month with Ethan, and had no complains. Awesome host.
Host cancelled less than 20 minutes before check in. DO NOT RECOMMEND STAYING HERE!!!!!
Rocky road with no pavement  to destination
Cleanliness issues but you get what you pay for
I wouldn‚Äôt stay again, House is foul smelling and towels dirty. Sheets felt sticky and doubt cleanliness. Very weird location although close to airport. Can‚Äôt find cabs easily.

I booked the house for my family to stay while in Austin while visiting my son who lives in the area. It was 6 of us total, so the appeal of the number of beds is why we chose this house.

It honestly isn't equipped to have this many people stay at the house. It does sleep 8, but when we checked in there's only a small kitchen table and only 3 chairs available, one was apparently broken with no additional chairs. We had to go to my son's apartment and use a few of his fold out chairs, if we were guests without someone like him in town we would have had to go buy our own as the host wasn't available until after dinner with no communication up front that this would be the case. There's only 1 couch to sit on, so entertaining within the house is difficult. Only 1 lounge chair outside, so don't expect to readily enjoy the back yard, however it does have potential.

We did address this to Ben, he came on our second day and tried to smooth things over, but it honestly felt like he wasn't taking ownership of the lack of amenities. It was either previous guests stealing or breaking things, or that there were folding chairs but were left out in the rain last week and broke (it hadn't rained in weeks, we checked), but overall just left a bad taste in our mouth that he didn't really care. After talking with him, he did say he would bring fold out chairs that day, and did bring them but not until the next day.

The kitchen is ill equipped, for example there are no sharp knives or kitchen utensils typically seen for cooking. Again, if it wasn't for my son being in the city to use his utensils, we wouldn't have been able to cook without going to buy our own.

I don't mean to come across as "nit-picky" as there's several other items (i.e. the washing machine literally took 6 hours), however overall the space just isn't up to the standards that I was hoping to see when renting a house through AirBnB for a stay. As what we experienced, it's equipped to be nothing more than a bunch of beds for people to sleep.

The house was small and lacking any homely feel. The sleepout is included in photos, but host tried to charge us extra to use it. Washing machine and laundry lights were not working when we were stayed. One of the bedrooms is also the exit out of the house to the sleep out. Not enough furniture for 10 guests in the dining area and lounge. No wine glasses and limited cutlery and crockery. I felt it was a good place to sleep, but not a place to use as a "home" for a stay.

This was a bad experience from the start, and probably tops the worst Airbnb experiences I‚Äôve had after 5 years of hosting and traveling.

After booking we were informed that if we wanted to access all of the areas included in the listing we would need to pay a significant amount more to access the ‚Äúshed‚Äù in the back house, which was included as part of the listing description. We weren‚Äôt happy about it, we paid as there weren‚Äôt really any other listings that had the number of beds we needed this close to arrival.

On arrival to the house itself, it was spotless but not really set up for such a large group. The pullout couch was unusable (stained and collapsing) and one of our group slept on the floor instead.

The yard had also had garbage and broken furniture, and we were looking forward to having a coffee outside only to find for a group of 6 there were only two usable chairs.

To top it off the shed that we had paid so much extra money for smelled of mildew/was damp, seemed to have no insulation because it was freezing at night and heated by a tiny space heater. It also had exposed wiring and an unfinished paint job. Had it been included in the first price it wouldn‚Äôt have been a big deal but we could have booked a much nicer listing for the price we ended up paying for something that was only a step above a tent in the backyard.

I felt like this was just a college crash pad we paid way too much money for in the end.
Gorgeous home in a killer location. Everything is new and modern.

I‚Äôve lived in Austin for the past three years and had a relative come visit for a few days. I wanted this to be a positive experience for my aunt given her first time with Airbnb. The address and room was just as described. My only complaint is that the main bed was VERY squeaky and the sofa sleeper was not comfortable at all  & hard to put back up. The walls are thin too so you can hear when a neighbor decides to wash their laundry @2am. I‚Äôm a heavy sleeper so it wasn‚Äôt an issue, however my aunt was different. Overall for the price and location, it wasn‚Äôt horrible, however I would‚Äôve preferred to stay somewhere else had I known the bed would squeak so much.

Shortly upon arriving my husband used the restroom and the toilet wouldn't flush. He noticed that the toilet tank didn't have any water and the water was shut off, so he turned the water on so the toilet would flush. In less than 2-3 min, the toilet tank began leaking water on the bathroom floor and on to the bedroom. We hadn't been informed of any toilet or other issues. Upon reaching out to Ames, they informed us that they were aware of the toilet issues but that maintenance had been there earlier that day "fixing" said issues. (The toilet tank had cracks or holes in it which was repaired with adhesive). We promptly contacted Ames to inform them of the leak and that we would be leaving for a hotel. Ames asked that we cancel the reservation and we have since requested a maximum refund. However, that's not the full amount of the reservation. I'm seeking a FULL refund for this poor experience.
The bed creaks; there are fruit flies all over; the chair is uncomfortably narrow; the shower curtain liner needed changing; the shower barely fits one person; the remote needed new batteries

If you can deal with the toilet, fridge and A/C making disruptive noises throughout the night and day, and a cozy space, then this place may be for you. However this space, they kicked me out after resolving a shorter stay since it was unlivable (couldn't sleep + cockroaches) in 30 minutes, and I was forced to sit in the rain for 3 hours until my next check-in. The entire experience was difficult with hard communication. and I am a guest who has never had to complain against ANY airbnb and I can sleep on a moving taxi (photo evidence can be provided).
Apartment was cute and all necessities were provided. However, bathroom was extremely small and the furniture in living room was broken
Overall not bad stay. Just bad communication about checkin. Gave us wrong passcode to get in and had to call late at night. Waited in a sketchy alley after a long drive.

I told the owner I would not leave a bad review, but then they ghosted me. I was locked out of my unit after being given 3 codes to enter the BNB. Since only one of the codes was right, we were locked out of the unit from "too many attempts". Once entering the unit, the bathroom had so much mold/mildew inside it that I did not feel comfortable taking a shower in the unit. I was in Austin for testing purposes for less than 24 hours and was not going to add to my stress by relocating. You can't just come in and fix mold so I waited less than 24 hours to let them know. They reimbursed me for HALF of the cleaning they promised, and provided no explanation as to how mold/mildew was left in the unit if it was cleaned previously. I was only able to get my full cleaning refunded by sending a complaint to Air BNB. I will also mention that the "available" washer and dryer are located outside of the unit and you have to pay for it. I will never use Air BNB after the experience I had with this location. Steer clear!
Average place to stay, host was super responsive which was nice but we were underwhelmed by the condition of the property. The shower was also broken during our stay which was disappointing.
Couldn't have been happier with this

Apartment was in an amazing location, close to everything that you'd need. The place was easy to get to and nicely decorated, but not so clean. Most drawers in the kitchen and bathrooms were filled with the host's personal belongings, and the fridge in the kitchen was full with half-eaten food. The shower drain was clogged on the 2nd day of our stay, mirrors were dirty, and the kitchen was not properly cleaned.
Nous sommes chanceux d'avoir rencontr√© Cecila, Alex et Natalie, et heureux d'avoir s√©journ√© dans leur paisible maison. Par leur amiti√©, ils ont rendu notre voyage sp√©cial. Merci pour tout!
For the price, was slightly disappointed.

I've been an Airbnb user for many years and this was by far the most disappointing experience I've had. The pictures and reviews completely fooled me into thinking this would be a comfortable home base for the week my family and I visited Austin. While the apartment is furnished, it was filthy (dirty walls, chocolate on the mirror in the master??, ants in the bathroom...) and dishearteningly inhospitable. The king bed in the master was sunken in on both sides. Sterile, nearly blue LED lighting was all we had to illuminate the common areas. Aside from the TV, there was nothing to peruse or check out in the Airbnb. Definitely do not recommend. Even for the price, this apartment was unacceptable and made our trip entirely lackluster.

Place was not reflective of pictures. Chairs are about 5 years older than the picture, extremely dirty and stained. Walls are dirty, pillows as well. Shower curtain stained. Would not recommend staying here unless very cheap.

We were extremely disappointed in the cleanliness of the place. We left after one sleepless night. The sheets had bits of dirt and grit all over them. Both beds. If they find a good cleaning service this Airbnb would be worth going too.

Directions indicate to leave linen on the bed, but leave towels on the ground. Not surprised since our sheets seemed dirty. Also I‚Äôve never stayed at an Airbnb that made us take out our own trash. We saw bugs in one bedroom. And we wanted to stay somewhere with washer and dryer but it wasn‚Äôt clear where those were.

The only reason I would recommend this place is for the location. However, the place needs some TLC - the cabinets, doors, and wall trimming needed to be replaced or repainted properly. The shower curtains also had some mold on the edge of it. One of the two mattresses was sunken in the middle, so it was uncomfortable to sleep on. The front door keypad lock batteries died on the first day we were there. The owner(s) of the condo replied at a reasonable time.

I gave them ample time to refund me for at least 3/4 of a day because the sink stopped up in the kitchen they had to come in replace the garbage disposal I was there to be with my grandson taking him here and there and I had to wait for maintenance people and could not cook because the kitchen sink was stopped up the cabinets are old the floors were dirty the rug in the living room stained. Not a  happy camper.There was no stopper in the bathtub so my grandson was unable to take a bath for the first day there was no stopper in the bathroom sink‚Ä¶ I could go on

Ashley was very accommodating and communicative when the weather in Austin was very bad and disrupted many aspects of the city. She made what could have been a tough situation a very smooth experience!

I highly recommend their properties.

Unfortunately the host did not tell me the apartment number or keypad access in time. So I showed up and had no way to get in. By the time she replied I had already left and made other arrangements for housing.

Good location, host attentive, rooms are comfortable and so are the beds although we were not inform that one of the rooms is in the garage area with a broken door that it seems is has been kicked. Overall our experience was not the best. For starters we had to wait approximately 50 minutes after 3pm for the check-in. If¬†you delayed your check-in hour you get penalized, but what happens when you are on time and have to wait for the cleaning ladies?, which allegedly were professional cleaners as advertised when booking the house, but the house was disgusting.¬† Cleaning of the house is really, really bad, we didn't understand what the cleaning ladies did at all. Cabinets, closets, floor everything was not only filthy but there were also dead bugs, shower curtains were disgusting, also as soon as we get in we realized they left the washer and dryer on, but the bedding and towels that were folded and supposedly for our use were dirty not only yellow spots but dirty. There was dust everywhere. It's really frustrating when you had to clean the dust and wash the bedding and towels on your vacation time which it's what we did.¬† Refrigerator didn't work at all. Also there were broken floor panels and the pool table is tilted. We stay because we were passing through and we were a big group so we thought it will be difficult to relocate in such a short time and also because we were traveling with 4 elders.¬†Not as advertised, not professionally cleaned at all

I host group trips for several different individuals monthly. our stay at this property was one of those trips. We arrived to a cold house, with a non-working refrigerator, and dirty dishes from previous guests left in the dishwasher. I actually had to message the owner twice to get a response, in which I was told that a refund would be issued because the refrigerator stopped working on the last stay, and he had control of the heater. I am still waiting for a response, 7 Days later, as to whether or not I'll receive the refund that was promised for the inconvenience.

The house is in close proximity to some decent places in Austin, but that is about all it has going for it. Don't let the great pictures fool you, this place needs some serious TLC. The guest bathroom has mold on the wall, the floor in the hallway is coming apart, the pool table isn't playable because of it's condition and it's not level. When we arrived the dishwasher was full of dirty dishes, the cabinets and countertops were filthy.

Biggest complaint was the fridge not working. Messaged Caleb about it but didn't receive a response. I did receive what seemed to be automated messages used to "check-in" with guests the next day asking what he could do to ensure he got a 5 star review.

I do give compliments to AirBNB. After messaging Caleb about the fridge not working and not receiving a response I contacted them. They are able to see messages exchanged via the message center and even tried to contact him themselves. I then sent them pictures of the rest of the place. They gave him time to respond and rectify.

DISGUSTING
This is the most disgusting house I have ever stayed at. Every single thing was dirty. There was hair all over the bathrooms and IN the beds, the towels and sheets were stained with reddish brown spots, there were grease splatters in the kitchen, fire ants in the kitchen, paint chipping, the bathtub was so clogged that a quick shower left standing water for hours, everything was covered in a layer of dust, and the smoke detectors were without batteries. There are other things that I could have looked past like the 4th bedroom being in the garage, the tv not working (and the owner not calling us back), the bedding feeling like it is from the dollar store, not having any clean towels upon arrival because they were in the wash, but I could not get past how dirty this house was, which is why we left early.

This house is not clean, there were bugs in the kitchen and on the kitchen table, a broken bed in one of the bedrooms. A bug issue in another bedroom which we were told we should avoid using AFTER we checked in but had 6 people so it was not an option to forgo a room. Sheets and towels are stained, bathrooms are awful and the house needs love. When I brought my concerns to the host I was told he is out of town so he was unable to fix the broken bed, or the bugs in one bedroom and can not hire a bug spray company to come spray the house and kitchen while we were out. He offered a price adjustment but the less than a fourth of our bill he gave us back was not worth three days/ nights in this dirty home.
Host is very nice just not responsive to fixing issues or responding in a timely manner.
If your looking for a frat house this is perfect. If you are a family looking for a clean home this one is not for you, move on.
üî•üî•üî•üî•üî•üî•

This home is an older home but the bed and every little thing that you could possible need they have provided which made up for it big time and no need to run to store for all the things you may have forgotten. Very cozy !

I would not recommend this place. The air vents and refrigerator were disgusting and the bathrooms were not as clean as I would expect. There are also pets that live in this house (could smell urine/saw a crate) and those danders bothered all of our allergies. The house was also full of air fresheners which was too much scent. The only positive I have is that we did have a plumbing issue that the host responded to quickly.
Wouldn‚Äôt recommend this place. Very dirty and dingy. Terrible smells, stains on the furniture. Broken furniture even. Be careful sitting in the toilets
The place is ok but the bedding is woefully substandard.

Don't let the pictures fool you! We did not experience what we thought was going to be something original from the hotel norm. The trailer is much smaller then the pictures perceive it to be and not as clean as we had hoped! Kitchen appliances were covered in more than noticeable dust and hair and that proceeded to follow into the bathroom as well with more hair on counter and in shower area, also the toilet seat is way to high for any normal person to sit on. After staying only 2 out of the 4 days we had issues with ants, roaches and an awful sewer smell coming up from the bathroom that was unbearable to breath. We had enough and this was not relaxing!
Leann did see us taking our bags to our car, came outside in what I would call inappropriate sleeping attire and proceeded to ask us, why we were leaving? We told her about the ants, the trailer being dirty and the bad smell coming from the toilet was just to much and that we thought it would be best if we left. We were then told by Leann that she thought we were to "BIG" for the trailer anyway! I'm 5'2" 135 lbs and my boyfriend is 5'9" 195 lbs. So, not only did we experience some issues & bad smells, we were insulted on top of it all!
I would prefer not to have spent $400 and have to deal with these issues. We came to relax and experience Austin, not have to complain about cleanliness, bugs, bad smells, inappropriate attire and insults! All that should of been addressed prior to our arrival. I would highly not recommend staying here!!

Was sent to unit C instead of unit D (what was listed) without notice. It was no big deal since everything looked the same except the studio layout. Convenient location and the place was clean. Check in was easy. There was a funky smell that possibly came from the AC unit. Already informed Jay and he was open to the feedback. Another  reviewer mentioned the minor cleaning duties that guests are asked to do. I did not mind throwing the garbage all in one bin but it is weird to have to strip the bed linens when everything obviously needs to be cleaned and we were charged with a cleaning fee already.
Location, location, location. Close to SoCo. This place does the trick. Bed ‚úîÔ∏è bathroom ‚úîÔ∏è

host over communicated and called me to complain about me having friends with me at the unit. These people were not spending the night, but the host was upset because they were in the unit. After I got off the phone he sent me a text to say that not another person other than me could be in the space at any time. Will not go back.
Good location near South Congress.  Unit is cozy and fairly comfortable.  Mattress is very firm but was aided by a mattress topper which the host provided.  Shower tile is dirty.

Overall, I cannot recommend this host or any of this company's rental listings.
Pros: this is in a beautiful area, unit is good size, ample street parking.
Cons: where to begin.. host created an unsafe situation, first time in 7 years I've felt the need to file a complaint with AirBnB. Unit itself was not clean, was not ready on time. Host and staff were very unprofessional. Shower in unit leaked all night, flooded the bathroom floor, brought out the roaches and spiders.
Other things to note: the unit is up a steep little hill, not good for anyone with limited mobility.
Simple and clean accommodations.  Not a fabulous location if you do not have a car...a bit out from shopping district.
Stayed here for the second time and did not disappoint! Very clean and quick responses
I could not say enough great things about this location. This was my first time ever staying at an air bnb, and Paul & Erin‚Äôs cottage exceeded my expectations. :)

The mattress was in bad condition, the pulldown ‚Äú bed‚Äù was terrible. To have it become a bed you have to put together a thin foam pad and lay it on top. This was a hassle and once completed still extremely uncomfortable. The hinge where it folds from makes it impossible to lay without having something poke you. I‚Äôve stayed in tons of air BnB‚Äôs and these beds had to be some of the worst. The pull down bed was awful and uncomfortable, I woke up 10 or more times each night. The location was pretty good not too far from the tourist activities and restaurants. The other thing that made this stay a little less then stellar was the intense list of rules. It didn‚Äôt make us feel welcomed to stay here. The parking situation is also not great. There are no lines so you have no idea where you should be parking. The drive way narrows as you go down and there is brick that sticks out and goes the length of the drive on your left side. It makes backing out a perilous endeavor.

One of at least 5 cottages on this property. Our cottage had several maintenance issues that were not addressed before we got there. Good location, but experience was not quite like the raving reviews we read.
I wound up cancelling in the last minute and did not get to stay.

The place is very pretty, quiet and well situated. It has the potential to be a great location to stay, but I would not return because it is missing basic components. Not enough chairs in the dining room ( only 2), not enough towels or coffee cups. There is no hair dryer and no iron. The bathtub was absolutely filthy
Nice quiet spot with all the South Congress happenings in walking distance. Very comfortable beds and plenty of space. Heat was an issue but that shouldn‚Äôt be a problem most of the year!

Die Wohnung ist ganz in Ordnung. Die Lage ist top. Man ist ganz schnell in der Stadt. Aber das Bett muss dringend ausgetauscht werden. Komplett durchgelegen und es knirscht extrem laut. Daf√ºr ein gro√ües Bad.
No issues. Easy check in. Nice-sized space for 2 people.

Small place, clean and tidy. If you have trouble sleeping I would not recommend this place or AirBnB of any kind for that matter. I forgot how uncomfortable and hard the mattress are; it‚Äôs definitely a cheaper type of mattress so if you can sleep on something like so then Airbnb is for you; if not I would not recommend it, as I slept 2 hours and had to drive an hour and a half home; it was scary.
Just what I needed. Took a salt bath in the tub and the bed was comfy. I was so tired from spending my days out and about and this was the perfect little chill, rest spot.

Cute little place ...make sure you follow the rules ... this people have no empathy for bending the rules a little ... no room for empathy if you make a mistakes ... confrontational , harassing and unfriendly !
It was just my experience !

This is the first negative review I have ever posted.  I have never had a bad experience with airbnb until renting this unit. I am not sure who all the good reviews are from????  We were very unhappy and checked out a day early. The bed was REALLY uncomfortable and we had backaches. The property is not "cute" and the advertising is misleading. The towels were VERY used and had stains. The air conditioning was not functioning and it was 104. There are signs for "neighborhood crime watch". We checked out a day early to go to a hotel and were not issued a refund. The  advertising is misleading.  We would not stay here again.

I was suppose to stay for three nights but stayed only one night. The stay was not comfortable, came in and first seems like the wall unit AC wasn't running and there was a portable standalone unit as well turned off. The humid/ moldy smell coming from the bathroom was overpowering the whole "cottage". The bed was so uncomfortable that I woke up with terrible body ache. The noise from the portable ac unit was so loud that when it came on, the electrical noise/feedback woke me up throughout the night. The lights were pretty dim in the living room. The person who was communicating wasn't the hosts but she mentioned being out of country, so delayed communication.

This is not a comfortable place to relax and spend time. It's fine for overnight accommodations but the unit is tiny and drab, the furniture uncomfortable, and the constant barrage of emails and notes warning against urinating on the patio (plus the Ring camera/doorbell) make clear that this is a crash pad for young adults. When we arrived the temp was 86 degrees and the unit had a bad odor. Turning on the A/C helped with the odor. But we would have done much better in a hotel, and for no greater price.

Cute, small place. Great location. Had a weird/old odor, but since it was so hot out we couldn‚Äôt really air it out. The ring doorbell was a little creepy and the multiple messages from the host was a tab annoying. Also, not to the hosts‚Äô fault, there was a dog a few doors down that wouldn‚Äôt stop barking in the morning. Other than those few things, good stay overall.
Place wasn't clean and smelled moldy. Heating is very loud.
The apartment is not nearly as nice as the pictures. We were extremely disappointed!

The place is good in terms of price and location, but some things can be improved: bed is not very comfortable and the curtain is really bad In leaking lights in, which makes me cannot sleep good overnight. And the bathroom is really small

This place was nice, and I hate to leave reviews that aren‚Äôt 5 starts... however, I found several hairs in the sheets as I was laying down. I ended up sleeping on top on the comforter with another blanket. There was also a stain on the pillow case, could have been clean but it just unsettled me.

Apartment has a good location, but needs to be updated all around. Bedroom blinds don‚Äôt work, the HVAC is set to 68 and during the night we would have to get up to change it. Paint is pealing off the doors, bathroom is very small 2‚Äô between cabinet and sink so difficult to move. Also the sink is rusted and has been painted over etc, etc... The entry sidewalk is cracked and it‚Äôs dangerous, particularly if arriving at night.

My partner and I stayed in this ABNB for 10 days. We were in town for a wedding and stayed to see Austin.

PROS:
‚Ä¢ Great communication about property
‚Ä¢ Quick response times
‚Ä¢ Well-stocked kitchen
‚Ä¢ Great location, close to SoCo and it's a lovely, quiet neighborhood

The hosts were wonderfully communicative about who was on the property and when. That was so appreciated! As we were in an unfamiliar city, this was a huge comfort to us. They were also quick to respond to any questions.

About the property, the day we arrived I was praying for coffee and was so happy there was some. It doesn‚Äôt seem like much but when you‚Äôve been traveling it‚Äôs the little things that get you through! The same with the kitchen ‚Äì I was so glad there was a basic spice set, oil, and utensils. It enabled us to cook what we could at the ABNB instead of eating out every night. It's also very close to SoCo (walking distance) which was really nice!

--

NEUTRAL / THINGS TO NOTE ABOUT THE PROPERTY FOR FUTURE GUESTS:
‚Ä¢ Slow internet (We know this isn‚Äôt the host's fault but we‚Äôd like to note it for future guests who may need to work remote)
‚Ä¢ Laundry is not in unit, it‚Äôs coin-operated, and it only takes quarters

My partner had to work several days while we were in Austin and the internet was unreliable. During work meetings, he‚Äôd get disconnected often (this also happened when we were watching Netflix and playing video games ‚Äì but that‚Äôs more annoying than problematic).

Another thing to note: The laundry is in the next building over and you need to bring your own quarters. We also had to have a Lyft driver stop at a gas station so we could get quarters because we were travelling and didn‚Äôt have any change! :O

--

CONS:
‚Ä¢ Lots of rules, not a relaxed vibe
‚Ä¢ You get two rolls of toilet paper and then have to purchase your own

Our personal feelings were that there were so many rules and notes, we ultimately felt unwelcome. We tried to read through everything but I kept rereading them to make sure we weren‚Äôt doing anything wrong or accidentally incurring fines.

My biggest annoyance was that hosts did not provide enough toilet paper for our stay. I think this is really odd. I had to take a Lyft to a gas station to get more. We paid $160 a night to stay here. How much is a pack of 24 toilet paper, $11? I messaged the hosts and they responded that they only provide a "starter kit" of TP. I was unhappy with this response but it felt so bizarre having to "argue" for more. On all of their info it says ‚ÄúLet us know what we can do to make your stay comfortable‚Äù...but then I had to argue to get more TP? After sending my note, the hosts did send more but the whole thing felt so strange to me. We used an additional *one* roll. ¬Ø\_(„ÉÑ)_/¬Ø

In the check-out instructions it said ‚Äúwill not accommodate last check-outs‚Äù. Totally fine! As we were leaving, I really needed to use the restroom. I thought to myself, ‚Äúwith all these rules, if I use the bathroom and we leave 15 minutes after our check-out time, are they going to charge me for a late checkout?‚Äù Especially after the toilet paper thing, I just wasn't sure, so I had to wait until we got to the airport to use the restroom. It just wasn't a relaxed stay for us.
Nathan‚Äôs property smells like mold don‚Äôt book it! Ugly broke down motorcycles outside also!
Stylish place! We did find a roach and killed it. The cleaning team came afterwards, hopefully we don‚Äôt find more during the rest of our stay.

You won't be at all disappointed in this AirB&B.  It's roomy, spotless, and the location is absolutely perfect....within walking distance of all the major parks in the area, and, should you want to go downtown at night, public transportation is only one block away.   Perfect for a stress-free getaway.....

More of a micro house. Could barely move in the shower. Was asked not to flush the toilet very often because it costs her 3 dollars a flush. Toilet didn‚Äôt work when I got there. Had to do my business at the local sandwich shop. Bed was comfortable. Woke up with large ants in it though. Had to cancel my second night because I came home to a major infestation of large carpenter ants. This put me out and was late in the afternoon so I had to spend an additional 200 dollars on a hotel. Host did refund me one night. Just a huge inconvenience and bad experience with the host.

This is one of several stays at this location. This place never fails to impress. We can walk the Mueller path, or walk to dinner or a movie. Brewed coffee, cook something from HEB, you name it. We will be back.

The place met our requirements for the number of bedrooms. However, the beds were not comfortable we could feel springs underneath. The couch had wear and tear. There was a pungent odor and had to buy air freshener. The house is really old and it shows especially in the showers.

Exactly what we needed for the night. Close to the airport, private room with private bathroom. Breakfast was not a given (had to request the day before, which I didn't know until I got there) but we were fine without it. Would recommend to anyone who needs a place to stay the night after arriving in Austin.

Breakfast was A JOKE (6 blueberries, 1 hard boiled egg and mini box of cereal). We did not feel welcomed, we said hi and bye daily with no response from hosts. Hosts weren‚Äôt helpful in what was local to do. Uber rides $30-40 one way, 15-20min ride to downtown. The bed length won‚Äôt fit you if your over 5‚Äô10. We happened to get stuck in the snow storm and once we realized we probably shouldn‚Äôt drive, the hosts wouldn‚Äôt let us stay longer than two extra hours. Our flight was cancelled, we had no where to go or could go, and we felt totally dismissed considering the horrible weather.
What you see is what you get! Location can't be beat for the price if you are flying out of AUS at weird times.
Decent place for a quick stop at Austin

This is a solid place to stay if you're flying out of Austin, but be prepared for curt treatment if you do not follow her EXACT preferences for contact. Dont expect to be able to call, or text. But DO expect to be rebuked for not calling or texting prior to arrival. Confused? Dont worry, she will interrupt you to explain it.

Several times.

We told the hosts that we will arrive late. They said it will be fine. When we arrived at the Airbnb unfortunately nobody opened. We tried to get in contact with the hosts but nobody responded. We had to take an Uber to the next hotel. Next morning Juliet texted me that they fell asleep and didn‚Äôt hear the bell, the knocking on the front door or the phone calls. That was a really disappointing experience.
Trato cercano y estancia estupenda. No soy un gran amigo de los perros, pero los que tienen Alfredo y Juliet son encantadores y educados. Repetir√≠a sin ninguna duda.

This place is like walking in to a home as someone walks out the back & does not clean up before you come in. We initially wanted to leave, but with no response from Airbnb & the hosts strict cancelation policy we would lose our funds. I will say the 2 upstairs bathrooms was clean. we slept on air mattress in the loft are & LR. the red comforter room smelled like B.O. the house was not vacuumed, there crumbs all over the tile & needed to be swept. The stove was disgusting, we didn't feel clean in this home at all. Was charged for a professional cleaning fee & was not even cleaned properly. The trash from the previous tenants trash was cooking in the 100¬∞+ heat in the garage. The house smells like the hot garage trash when you walk in. There was vomit in front of the house & in the downstairs bathroom. Someone wiped it & never proper cleaned it. we found someone's clothes in the washer when we checked in. Also looked as if someone laid on the beds & was never changed. The host asks that you wash the bedding before you leave. SMH, this house is not verified clean before each traveler.
This house is OK if your in a frat or going to party, but not very clean for families.
It was reasonably clean, but things worn out from constant use as a short-term rental, I assume.

The house is in a great location and has a unique set up with wo different, separate levels. This worked for our group- two families with 2 and 3 kids, and the grandparents. The house was fairly clean, not perfect, but nothing too bad. At first glance it was perfect, but after more inspection, it was just so-so. The major issue was the beds. They were SOOO soft that no one slept well. My husband and I could not sleep in the same bed without rolling to the middle, basically on top of each other. The second issue was the internet, which was sporadic. The AC went off a few times because the nest thermostat needed internet. That was awful and we woke up sweating and grouchy one morning. We also tried to watch a movie but couldn't because the internet wasn't working. We emailed GuestSpaces and then called the next day. They did call back a few hours later and helped us get the issue fixed, but that was a day before we were checking out (of a 6 day stay).
The other issue was a minor one. The house just did not have any extras at all. No board games or playing cards, no beach towels, no kids toys, no plastic plates or cups, very limited kitchen supplies, zero pantry items. While none of this was promised, at least some if not all of these items are usually included in places we've stayed in the past.
For the price, I would not recommend this property unless they purchased new beds and did something to improve the internet.

While this Airbnb was in a good location, I would not recommend it as it was very dirty and many ways: dead cockroaches under the bed, the water heating broke and took multiple hours before someone fixed it, duct tape on windows, weird stains on blankets and towels. I would not recommend.

Do yourself a favour and avoid this stay. The description is completely misleading it is only a one room apartment. There is no seperate bedroom and not room for multiple guests. The stay is located in a derelict complex and is completely uninviting. The room is massively overpriced for what you are getting and to top it off the AC didn‚Äôt work making it very hot and uncomfortable. Luckily we only had to stay for 2 nights here..
Location is fantastic, but the bed is very uncomfortable, and ‚Äúbed area‚Äù is extremely warm.  Very uncomfortable stay.

The 808 is one of the most convenient AirB&B in Austin. Right off the highway so everything is less than 10 minutes away. Even with the Austin traffic. 6th street and Rainy St are just a scooter ride away.
Room #4 is a converted garage, if you are a light sleeper then the washer-dryer might be a nuisance. The wifi was slow at night  so no Netflix.

Wir haben in der Garage geschlafen. Der Raum war super renoviert und sauber , die T√ºr zu dem Schlafraum war eingetreten. Ansonsten braucht das gesamte Haus eine Renovierung. Der Preis war f√ºr das Angebot absolut in Ordnung.

The pictures are deceiving. It is not as nice when you get there as it looks in the pictures. The room we were given had a huge dent in the door and did not have its own tv. When we arrived some one was blasting rap music and looked like a scary person. Did not feel safe here with the way the door looked and the location of this place. It was in a scary neighborhood. You have to share the bathroom and it‚Äôs far away from the room. I was just given a code to go in so no interaction with host. Seemed like no one could even enforce house rules because they are not even at that house and give the code to anyone that wants to stay there. So you better pray that you don‚Äôt have a weird person staying the same day as you because you will have to interact with them. My girlfriend and I both felt unsafe as soon as we got there and we left and got a hotel even though we couldn‚Äôt get our money back for the stay here.

I arrived at night with no response from the host and no door code. I had to knock and ring the door bell for about 15 minutes until another guest let me in. The common areas and kitchen were disgusting with old food and empty booze bottles everywhere. The bathroom is less than ideal. I don‚Äôt suspect this is professionally cleaned at all. My room was out in the garage off the laundry room. This would have been nice to know. The common area picture is very deceiving.
Don‚Äôt hesitate to book here
don't stay here. I'm disabled and he discrimination against me. he is not a good person and he should not be a host
lack of communication unlock doors and house dirty shower and fridge.Garbage overflow in kitchen
I had to wash my bedding the day I got there the room was not clean and the host didn‚Äôt respond till my 3rd day there sorry I just put the truth out there

The property is very different in real life than what it looks in the pictures on display. So the pictures definitely are misleading at the first place. The room is a garage room which wasn't mentioned. So no windows which is very depressing. The room itself is fine but because it's built inside the garage, obviously the outside is all a mess and untidy. There is one bathroom shared between 4 rooms, which again is kind of ok. The sink would not drain out the water and it took time to do that. No bath mat outside the shower, which makes the floor too slippery after a shower and can lead to a possible accident. The bathroom definitely needs repair and a makeover. There is a wierd wet smell inside the property, which is not too pleasant.  The property and common areas need repair,  maintainence and upgrades. Also the area outside the house is kind of untidy and messed up. Book this room Or property with not a lot of expectations.
definitely clean, out the way, silent yet accessible to everythingüî•üî•üî•

Terrible! Room #4 is in a garage, smell damp and temperature not the same as in home. Caleb‚Äôs house has three other rooms in the house and #4 you go into the garage and has a wall and door in the garage. It smells and is damp and camping outside would be better bc of fresh air. I immediately called, text that I didn‚Äôt want to stay and pictures and descriptions were misleading. If a room is in a garage it should be disclosed, period. He said he would refund my money and I said it was late and I was tired and that I tried to cancel but system not user friendly after a long day. Next day he said I still needed to pay bc he didn‚Äôt rent the room out bc I didn‚Äôt cancel properly. It was late after 7pm when I started transaction to book and stay, I would not recommend this for anyone. If you want the experience I had, good luck. Room in a garage!

Continuing my review having been a long term guest and tenant for 5 months here...

Before you book Room 3 - DON'T. The bed is broken and is coming off the hinges. It is very uncomfortable to sleep in.

The oven door to the stove is broken and therefore cannot be used properly.

Ice machine on fridge doesn't work and has an old molded filter.

I hope the host reaps what he sows as he is a very ugly, cold hearted, selfish and possibly racist individual. I am a black woman who helped take care of his Airbnb, even replacing some things he needed out of kindness, and came home to all of my belongings on the front porch to be stolen by anyone for 15hrs without my knowledge being legal tenant here that paid him consistently. The man is demonic and is an evil twisted person. He is never on the property as it is automated, but I strongly encourage every Airbnb guest who is considering this property to please look and book elsewhere. He overcharges for the rooms and cleaning fee..

Find somewhere else to stay. I've been living here for the past 5 months and have seen it all.
You're paying a cleaning fee for no reason because the housekeepers never clean properly. There have been weeks where they leave dirty dishes in the sink, kitchen and bathroom floors filthy with pee and liquid stains, don't clean the stove or bother to wipe the counters. I did it all while paying a cleaning fee for a new booking every single time. They will literally come, half ass switch out bed sheets and see the dirty house..and not clean it. I have complained about this to the host and was ignored.

The house is old and abandoned and has a hole in the wall in the main restroom making it unsafe to use. Pool table is molded and old and damage, looks nothing like the photos.

I have witnessed homeless people who don't bathe sleep and rest on the sofa and not once has it been cleaned or shampooed..so the furniture available for guests is filthy and unclean. Do not use or sit on it.

L'appartement est tr√®s bien situ√©, proche du quartier anim√© de South Congress. La communication avec Will a √©t√© tr√®s facile, qui a tout fait pour rendre notre s√©jour le plus agr√©able possible !

The place is great. The location is unbeatable. If your planning to lounge and watch TV this may not be ideal.  The decor is great but the sofa is not comfortable for two adults for any extended period.
Este lugar ha sido de los mejores que me he quedado en EUA, limpieza impecable, buenq ubicaci√≥n y con todos los servicios, es justo como debe ser un Airbnb sin duda me volver√≠a hospedar aqu√≠

Pros:
-Nice neighborhood

Cons:

-there also was a ring security outside but was not listed on the ad(I read this is a violation not to disclose this on your ads)
- no consistent hot water
-ac in upstairs room made sure to NOT work making it hard to sleep in the mornings

I booked the place within a week of staying and ran into some last minute car troubles. I messaged Mohsen and requested a partial refund (at the very least) within 2 days of booking. My request was denied and I had to pay full booking regardless. I am an avid traveler and hence why I book last minute (knowing things pop up). The fact that I had to pay a full week, full price, when 2 days after booking and within a week of staying is crazy. It‚Äôs not like I held this reservation for months and blocked them from others booking this location. If that was the case, I would totally understand. Two days out‚Ä¶. Give me a break.  Ps‚Ä¶ I‚Äôve never in my life left a bad review for anything but this truly just left me very salty.

There was no hot water when we checked it only cold water. The place was dirty upon check-in. It looked like they have not been cleaned in a very long time. Lots of dust everywhere on the baseboards and what not.
cheating and rude

I drove cross country on a moving job and am in pain from a slipped disk in my back/ bone on bone cartilage damage among other injuries which I disclosed to him: Not only was he cold and unresponsive to my situation this guy split his garage into like 20 Sections so he could make as much money as possible with the least amount of customer satisfaction possible. Oh and If you want to be a sardine and treated like a number rather than a human book a reservation with this guy. I doubt the residence is up to code. Not safe. Do not pass go do not collect $200
bomb
I was taught if you can't say anything nice, don't say anything at all.
Convenient location close to the bus center, in a quiet neighborhood. The host checked in with me through the app. Will stay here again if I visit Austin alone.

room is as it looks it looks in the pictures. it's a very small box but worked for me for the one night I couldn't get into the hostel I wanted to stay at. wouldnt recommend for longer stays. quite far from public transport into town
Very understanding. My flight was cancelled due to in le weather in Texas, so I couldn‚Äôt travel after all.

if you need a place to sleep this room will work. i wouldn‚Äôt let my mom to stay there.
great for guys aged 18-30
take a shower . crash and leave..

The photos and the description of this place are accurate.
If you need a place to sleep and leave your bag (under the bed) it works!

The room is super tiny (my linen closet is bigger). But if you are under 5'11, you will survive!
The room is located in a laundry room adjacent to the house garage.
You will need a car to move around, there is no public transport.
You get what you pay for
Just what it says - a room! Exactly what I needed and for the right price when I had some serious schoolwork to do while in the city for a small press expo.

Exactly as advertised! Nate's thought of everything. Can't beat the value. One tiny thing: the hot and cold knobs in the shower are mislabeled, so don't be an idiot and suffer through half a cold shower like me before figuring it out. Hot and cold are where you'd naturally assume they'd be, not how they're labeled.
Place has everything an individual needs.Great place for an eco-conscious person looking  to lower their carbon footprint.
if u just want to shower n sleep that's fine. Otherwise there is no human interaction and lots of rules . no smoking out side was the worst rule.

Nate's place is a cozy little private room in his garage, with a shared bathroom with one other guest. I had two gripes about the place.
1. The wifi gets a bit slow sometimes. Websites and pictures take a long time to load. And you can forget about watching a video.
2. The area isn't the safest area. There is a group of homeless down the street, where the pizza hut is. They would yell and jeer at people walking by. I would not recommend walking down that street at night or alone.
Nice place, cute set-up with the basic amenities in the room. The only issue was WiFi not super strong or will fade in and out
AC unit was making loud noise all the time and it didn't cool the tiny room inspite of running the whole night. It was difficult to sleep.

It‚Äôs good a place to stay, you get your privacy, as someone who travels and stays out late, I always worry about coming in late and disturbing late night peace but with stay I had no anxiety. Also to be able to have a place to store my food and drinks without leaving was amazing

This place is very budget friendly, perfect for a quick stay which is what my stay was.  I personally wouldn't stay here more than 1 night though as the bathroom situation is rough.  Campers/RVers may be aware of what a self-contained eco-friendly toilet is, but I sure was not.  The smell is pretty brutal.  Shower looked more passable but not great as well.  A overnight, quick stay this is one of the cheaper spots, but just know what you are getting into if you plan for this to be a longer stay.

AirBnBs are for sleeping, shitting, showering, and perhaps doing laundry. I don‚Äôt care about anything else..

This Airbnb fails at 3/4. Toilet is disgusting camper porta-potty. Shower is small and uncomfortable with bad water pressure. And no ability to do laundry, even with perfectly operational washer and dryer running next to the rooms while you sleep. Even offered to pay to use them and denied. Had to walk a mile to pay 5$ for coin laundry every night in a bad area of town. Wasted my time and money needlessly. Real pain in the arse.

I had to book this place because I needed to be close to work. If you are just visiting and want to hang out, do yourself a favor and pay for a hostel in the downtown area for the same price. At least in a hostel you can share areas and use the laundry area and have a place to eat. Never in my many years using Airbnb I experienced this feeling of being just an occupant of a room. They made you feel like you were invaders and not guests. Zero friendly and the location is not convenient for someone without a car. I paid 5 more dollars for a room in NYC just a week before and the contrast between this sad place was shocking.

Quick stay for one night, did not use internet or bathroom so no comments on that or other features of the house. Otherwise, no issues with room itself or place. Knocked off one star for unidentified smell.

Would not recommend to anyone, this place is not worth the price at all don‚Äôt waste your time or money. Underlying dirt and an odd odor, compost toilet, and the water pressure in the shower is just awful. Hosts are inhumane.

10/10. Honestly I was mildly skeptical of all the positive reviews because there‚Äôs no way a place could live up to the hype but Ruthy and Roger‚Äôs place absolutely did. Those are not bots, we‚Äôre all telling the truth. Stay here and you won‚Äôt regret it.

This was exactly the quiet getaway I was looking for. The greenhouse was wonderful.

Only downside: the shower head is very low and there isn't much water pressure, which is only a problem if you're tall!

Folks, you have to check out this place. It feels ‚Äúout of the way‚Äù and is nestled in the woods, but it‚Äôs actually only about 7 minutes from commercial areas where you can get any necessities you might have forgotten.

Photos are totally accurate of the place.

Awesome stay.
Decent. Not near anything worth going to though.

The location was about the only thing that was a good experience. Looked a lot like they did the bare minimum as far as amenities. The stove was broken, the water pressure (and temperature) was awful, and the back building looked a little concerning, and dangerous. Overall, I expected more after reading the other reviews, and was disappointed after the actual experience.

Have been traveling using Airbnb for years, and this is the first poor experience I have had. While I want to preference this review by stating outside of the window issue this wasn't the host's fault, but all things listed below are worth noting.

While the apartment was clean and organized, the neighborhood left a bad taste in our mouths. My wife was verbally harassed by a group of guys across the way, from the apartment after attending a work conference. When I got back for the night, she had informed me that the same group of guys were using binoculars to try to see into the window. I instructed my wife to call the police, but by the time I had gotten back to the apartment, the group had left. We closed the blinds and tried to lock the window to only find the window to have a broken lock. We were able to wedge something in between the frame to help it stay secure but was an uncomfortable stay in a bare-bones apartment. The complex was fairly basic and the location was quite far from the majority of the notable activities in Austin. We were both sad that this is how our last day in Austin had to end, and how our experience was after reading good reviews.
Convenient location (about 10-15 min Uber from most destinations). Solid place to stay if you‚Äôre looking for a place to crash in between stops.
Exactly what you see in the pictures. There were issues with the WiFi in the building, so just know that the router is in this unit so the owner may need to stop by.
Does the trick
Not worth it‚Ä¶ smelled dingy‚Ä¶ bnb is not upto the expectation of the price paid
The place had an old smell to it. It looks much newer in the picture than in person. Using the tv is a hassle I wouldn't recommend.
it's a good place.  quiet and the price is not exaggerated.  It could be a little cleaner and more careful, there were many dirty or broken things.  It made the place look bad that it was like this.
Snug garage apartment with lots of charm and a killer treetop private deck. Off street parking.
My 1st choice...but maybe I should not divulge that (haha).

The rooms are great and the host is responsive. However, while I was staying here for an extended time, I would frequently see cockroaches crawling all over the kitchen at night. I don't mind one cockroach every now and then, but when I see multiple ones every night it is a problem.

The house was great because it had so many bedrooms, a pool and a great hangout area but we got locked out of the house for an hour. The keypads did not work well and the host did not answer my many calls and messages until later. Also, the air conditioning unit upstairs was broken. The host said he would send someone to look at the problems but he never did. There were also no instructions on where to put full garbage bags and we had a cockroach the first night we were there. He never answered this question either. Also, I had to go out and spend 30 dollars on toilet paper and garbage bags because the house has none.

AC unit upstairs was not functioning and was not resolved at all during our 4 day stay.

I would strongly suggest taking images of the entire home upon check-in otherwise the host will attempt to bypass providing a refund for the faulty AC by claiming damages that were pre-existing.

Renter beware.

The photos on the listing are accurate. The house is beautiful and large with plenty of beds and bathrooms for a big group. And great location, a very short uber ride away from downtown. Unfortunately, we had many negative experiences with this house so we would not stay here again unless the host fixes these things. The biggest issue was that the keypads to the doors were both smashed (looked like a broken iphone) and therefore, were not easy to use. When leaving the house, we were unable to lock the doors. It felt unsafe. Eventually we were able to leave through the backyard, but it was very inconvenient. The pool was only usable on day 1 as the pool turned very green with algae the next day. Hanging out in the kitchen or in the living room at night was made difficult by the intrusion of cockroaches. We saw over 10 cockroaches during our short stay. Lastly, the host was not good at communicating. In the months leading up to the trip, the host would not answer my messages or questions so I had to call AirBnb to reach out to him. Then during our stay, he rarely responded to my messages and never called back when I left a voicemail on his phone asking about the broken keypads. When he finally did respond, he wrote very few words which made it clear he did not care at all.
David was quick to respond to any questions or problems we had

We booked this house for a bachelorette party. The AC did not work (in June) and our host seemed to make no effort to fix it. We called, messaged, and texted him multiple times from multiple numbers and he wouldn‚Äôt answer. He finally answered and sent someone out to fix it.it worked for an hour and broke again. He once again made no effort to answer our calls. Many things in the house are broken, the doors don‚Äôt close properly, etc. The house itself would be perfect with a new host and a few updates. Would not recommend booking a house through David.

Gross. The place was not cleaned.

This is clearly a party house in a good location. Cash cow property that used for big parties. House was in pretty rough shape. Stains on the walls, ceilings, couches. Tape all I ever the walls. Broken smoke detectors. 2 broken showers. Pool was not cleaned.
Ice machine broken.
We found eggs in the cabinets. This place wasn‚Äôt Austin ‚Äúweird‚Äù it was downright gross.

The host was not helpful in resolving issues.

1-STAR. This airbnb was such a disaster. DO NOT BOOK THIS PLACE, or do so at your own risk of not having somewhere to stay when you get there!!

When we arrived to the house on 6/2/22, there was a CEASE AND DESIST letter from the City of Austin stuck to the front door, dated in permanent marker 6/1/22. It stated that the owner was running an illegal rental operation, and no one was allowed to enter the property until the owner met with the City, or they would be subject to fines something like $2k per night. The letter wasn't exactly clear if just the host/owner would be fined, or anyone they found on the property. We called Airbnb, who called the host, numerous times. No answer. FOR HOURS. It was 100 degrees outside and getting late in the evening, so we waited inside the airbnb while we frantically tried to find a new airbnb that would accommodate our group of 10 on the same day. Airbnb helped us secure a new location, even though the process took 5 HOURS on the phone with Airbnb from when we arrived to when we had a solution, so we wasted a whole night dealing with this issue. The host finally responded to us on Airbnb messenger a few hours after we arrived and just wrote back "Oh no worries, the city's files aren't updated :) " Um, really? We never heard anything else from them again, nor did they ever check in to see what we wanted to do.

Besides the complete lack of concern on the host's part, when we did a walk through of the property, it's clear the house receives little-to-no attention from the host. The pool was green-ish, there was a dead cockroach in the living room, stains on the walls, ceilings, linens. Opened food in the pantry and freezer. We have pictures of everything to back up this post. We ended up at the Governor's Mansion that's 12 minutes away from this one, and we're so thankful the Governor's Mansion saved our trip. This one should be a HARD PASS.
Could not recommend higher. Charming, central, lovely.
Tim and Ellie‚Äôs place will blow your expectations out of the water. Such a different take on a traditional Airbnb, but no less comfortable. We will definitely stay here again!

Alles einfach perfekt!!!
Sauberkeit, Lage, Ausstattung, Kommunikation, Infos √ºber Aktivit√§ten und Restaurants (komplette Mappe mit Infos liegt bereit) und vor allem die Innendekoration des Airstreams haben uns begeistert.

Der Airstream befindet sich in einem mit Zaun abgegrenztem Gartengrundst√ºck welches ebenfalls wundersch√∂n angelegt ist. Privatsph√§re ist zu 100% gegeben.

Ein weiterer Pluspunkt sind die kostenlos zur Verf√ºgung stehenden Fahrr√§der, welche sich in einem Top Zustand befinden. Die beste Art und Weise Austin zu erkunden, ist mit dem Fahrrad.

Obwohl wir die Gastgeber nicht pers√∂nlich kennengelernt haben, h√§tten wir das Gef√ºhl sehr willkommen zu sein. Sogar eine personalisierte Begr√º√üungskarte lag bereit.

The house was as described -- it was very modern, clean and very convenient to walk to local coffee shops, restaurants, shopping etc. The alley was a bit noisy at night, La Mexicana Bakery is right behind the house and open 24 hours, but their breakfast tacos were great.

The host responded to texts and several issues were fixed quickly. However, on one day we had a smoke alarm beeping (to have battery changed) and it was about 6 hours before it was repaired, with no updates from the host during those hours.

Assuming that communication issue was a one-time problem, and not the norm for this host, I would recommend staying here for anyone who wants a clean modern home close to downtown Austin and the trendy Congress Ave. shopping area.
Clean and quiet place in South Austin. Quick response. Can‚Äôt really complain.

With the pandemic going on I would expect a clean environment to live in. Was told I had to wait for home cleaning before the next run. Home was not up to par. The bathroom tub was dirty. Found liquor in the freezer. The flip out couch was unsanitary and broken. When addressed the concern, nothing was done

This place was not clean. There were cobwebs above my mother-in- law‚Äôs bed!!! We didn‚Äôt notice it when we first walked in because we checked in the Airbnb around 1am , so it was late and we were all tired. Later that morning when my mother-in-law showed me the cobwebs above her bed, and small bugs in the kitchen, we left immediately.The backyard fence was leaning over into the unkept grass. The place is dated. There are carpeted stairs.The front yard is unkept as well., absolutely no curb appeal. The location was the only thing good about this Airbnb. It was a TOTAL inconvenience because we had to drive almost two hours away from AUSTIN to my parent‚Äôs house after looking for house all day in Austin with a realtor.

Overall, the condo was fine. Comfy beds, plenty of room for our group of 4, extremely convenient location for anything you would want to do in Austin and a quiet neighborhood. Could use some tlc- cobwebs in corners, hair in shower, bathroom faucet loose.

The house was very clean and spacious but I was very disappointed with the location and "lake view". The location was next to a trailer park community which wasn't ideal and the photos posted are very outdated as it seems the lake has been dried up for a very long time. I understand the lake being low is out of the host's control, but I definitely would have chosen another place to stay if I knew prior that the house was facing dirt and an old abandoned boat. Also, the host messaged me a few days before our trip asking how many people were staying because the 5th bedroom is only open for groups of 8 or more. Since we had a smaller group, we would've been charged with an additional fee for access to the 5th bedroom even though the description says 5 bedrooms.

One of the few places in and around Austin that can accommodate 10 people in beds without counting couches as a sleeping location. Unfortunately, Lake Travis is low due to drought conditions so no water access currently from the house's dock. Dock is a good location for stargazing after dark though. The only issue everyone mentioned was low water pressure at the house, not sure if this was related to drought conditions as well. Overall we enjoyed our stay.
Spacious home. Unfortunately, the water by the dock is now dried up..
No issues
El encargado no revisa el alojamiento antes de rentarlo, por lo que si hay un problema te van avisar despu√©s de que hayas viajado y hagas el checking.
todo estuvo muy f√°cil y maravilloso, sin duda me volver√≠a a hospedar

The unit is spacious and in a decent location but my biggest complaint is that it is not very clean. The sheets and shower curtains were both stained and the dishes weren‚Äôt fully washed (the dishwasher does not clean dishes completely).

This is an okay place to stay, but not one I would recommend, especially for the price point. Cons:

- Biggest issue is that there aren‚Äôt really beds. They are frames with a mattress on top that squeaked and was uncomfortable, with just one person on each bed. Can‚Äôt think it could take the weight of two people. It was bad enough that I asked if the host would refund if we left after one night, and they didn‚Äôt even reply to my message asking if they could make an exception on the cancellation policy. One of the bed frames was even indented and broken in the middle. Very uncomfortable.
- This isn‚Äôt really someone‚Äôs place, it‚Äôs a rental managed by a company, as demonstrated by the flood of automated emails I received from them with many, many instructions.
- Apartment complex looks like low-income housing.
- Door lock was janky and was not properly installed
- There were fruit flies in the place when we walked in.
- Upstairs noise from neighbors was loud (footsteps etc)
- Decor was put up on 1 nail in a very unprofessional manner. Painting fell, as did towel hanger in main bathroom.
- Ensuite bedroom lamp didn't work
- Ensuite bathroom sink didn't have cold water and hot water only drizzled water.
- Sink drains didn't have a cover/plug and anything small (rings etc) can fall down the sink easily.
- Shower water was so weak, hardly any pressure/flow so couldn't wash my hair.
- Kitchen drawers were dirty.
- The cleaning requirements on checkout were annoying - throw out the trash, put all bedding and towels on floor etc.

Pros:
- Good heating (nest), especially with the cold weather that week in Austin.
- Free safe car parking
- Kitchen was well stocked with appliances and cookware.
- Dining table was big and comfy.
- Check in and out is easy with a lock box code on door.
- Location near S congress st IF you have a car, but not walkable otherwise.

Would not recommend for the price. I wouldn‚Äôt stay here again, but it was doable for the three nights.

Communication excellente de la part de l'agence qui g√®re l'h√©bergement. Peut-√™tre m√™me un peu trop d'infos... √ßa en devient indigeste !

Les photos mettent un peu trop en valeur le logement. Elles ne montrent pas les quelques points d'am√©lioration : lits f√©briles, matelas trop mou, peu de pression dans l'une des douches, porte-serviette cass√©, voisinage bruyant... Points d√©j√† mentionn√©s dans des commentaires pr√©c√©dents mais qui n'ont pas √©t√© rectifi√©s...

Dommage pour nous, lors de notre s√©jour la piscine √©tait hors service. Nous avions sp√©cifiquement choisi ce logement pour pouvoir profiter de quelques baignades !
