Unfortunately the photos make it look much nicer than it is.

Upon arrival we were greeted with cigarette butts at the entrance. As we walked in, the stale smoke smell hit us immediately. It seemed like a mixture of cigarettes and weed.

I specifically chose a place with a tub so my daughter could take a bath, however, the tub looked to worn and gross on the inside (not shown in pics) there‚Äôs no way we would have used it.

We ended up leaving (taking the $ loss) and stayed in a hotel instead. I felt embarrassed because I was the one who chose the place for us and it was a fail.

This place was a great location, perfect stay for our dogs and kids- with the dog park and pool available! The apt had everything we needed and was plenty big enough for our family of 4+ dog.

However, it was not as nice as advertised in the photos. It‚Äôs obvious that this is not a place that people live it, but a full time rental. Which is fine! But, the only people ever in it are previous renters and cleaning people.. which means nothing is ever checked on our used daily to make sure it works. For example, the coffee maker was broken (leaked coffee all over the counter), the trash can lid was broken, the en-suite shower had basically no pressure but had a continuous rusty leak from the ceiling that was quite annoying. Also, there were no tub drains at all!!! Which means I couldn‚Äôt give my kids a bath, but the place advertised as having a tub?

Lastly, I probably would‚Äôve given this place a 5 but by the end of the trip I had reached my limits with the emails! I mean, my god, is there such thing as too much communication???? I received constant messages the few days leading up to our trip, which I was able to mostly ignore, tho it was stressful while we were flying into town and I kept getting notifications- I thought something was wrong with our reservation. But when i had a specific question it was just completely ignored. But then throughout our trip the messages just kept coming, I thought about deleting the app I could hardly enjoy a day in Austin without air bnb blowing me up!

Overall, would recommend and would stay again as most of these issues were only minor inconveniences to us. But I know to some people they could be a deal breaker, so wanted to share! For the price, it was worth it.

We loved the pool, and the location was close to everywhere we needed to be, which was really nice. Check in and check out were easy, and it wasn‚Äôt hard finding the apartment.

Unfortunately, the apartment wasn‚Äôt as clean as we expected. It had definitely been swept and cleaned, but there was a bad smell throughout the apartment. There was a gross leak over the shower, and some of the appliances looked dirty. The front porch/yard area also looked a little bit run down. With a little TLC, I think this could become a very nice spot.

I have stayed at many Airbnb‚Äôs traveling the country and have never seen a place so dirty in my years of travel. There were dishes in the cabinet with mold on them, silverware, pots and pans with food caked to them, vents that looked like they‚Äôd never been cleaned. I reached out to airbnb for a refund of my cleaning fee, which they granted, after the management company said they would send someone out to clean the next day ‚Äî this didn‚Äôt work for me, I was there to work and this place needed more than the counters wiped down. Having someone come clean in the middle of the stay is completely inconvenient. Unfortunately we didn‚Äôt see the previous notes about how dirty this place was before we booked it a few months ago. This place needs a serious deep clean.

Kommunikation mit Vermieter war gut, Check In problemlos. Pool war gut, ebenso der Waschmaschinenraum.W-Lan einwandfrei.
Die Lage entsprach nicht ganz unseren Vorstellungen, die Wohnung ist insgesamt sehr dunkel. Die Ausstattung der K√ºche ist unzureichend, zum Kochen nur eingeschr√§nkt geeignet.
Das Schlafsofa ist unkomfortabel, in unserem Fall war es sogar mit klebriger Masse verschmutzt, der Balkon geht nach hinten raus mit Blick auf Bretterzaun und M√ºllcontainer.
Check if bathroom sink/tub water draining  is okay when you first check-in. If there is a problem let the owner know asap to help with the problem.

All in all it was ok. It was a lot darker in the apartment than the photos made out. It‚Äôs on the bottom floor so no real sunlight comes in.
Everything was a taxi ride away and the local environment was a bit run down.
The host however was really responsive - only issue is the lack of towels and they were damp.

If you‚Äôre looking to stay in an apartment complex then this would be your option. It was not what we expected and we‚Äôre disappointed in our overall experience. We ended up not staying there and going to another place.
This place was a convenient location, but not the best value considering the cleanliness, lack of wash towels, and the noisy neighbors above.

Hip decor, convenient parking, great location for exploring Austin. But the whole place smelled musty and various things were in desperate need of TLC: broken blinds in living room, broken toilet paper dispenser, rusty kitchen sink.

I‚Äôm really not hard to please so my expectations were low.

I‚Äôll keep it short and brief. Tv would go black every 15 minutes. We woke up to a giant roach in the living room. The key to the gym was now where to be found even though the owners notes said it would be somewhere designated.

The location is great.   Besides that, it‚Äôs just ok.   You can tell it‚Äôs a rental property and no one lives there full time.  A blind was missing.  The floors are super dirty, you‚Äôll notice when you walk barefoot.  During our stay, the water pressure was gone all day as if they where working on it.  But no one told us that before or during our stay, so we didn‚Äôt have any water from 10am to 5pm.  Typical in an apartment, if you know about it.  I would stay again because the location is great and the hiccups weren‚Äôt that bad.
Be aware of the stove not being secure to the wall. It can tilt when opening the door and cause an accident. Otherwise, the place is in a good location.

Low key in the cut older apartment for basic travel needs!

Decorated as pictured.

As long as the air filter is changed & is charged up with freon; it should blow fine.

The bed & sofa arent as comfortable (sunken in) but of you dont weigh over 135lbs, you wont notice.

Host is friendly and responsive via text on airbnb but not after late hours.

I‚Äôll start with the bad. The worst thing about the place is the noise, especially during the week. Tuesday and Thursday morning, sometimes before 7, are trash days, and the dumpsters are less than twenty yards from the bedroom window. You will be awoken by their crashing if not by the back-up beeping of the truck. Wednesday morning the leaf blowers start right outside your window around 7:30-8. The sound Insulation is generally pretty poor: if the upstairs neighbor has a conversation on the balcony, you will hear it. Plan to bring ear plugs.

There was a roach spotting (a big fella‚ÄîI named him Phil) in the kitchen cupboard upon arrival. Later while I was watching TV, Phil scurried across the floor and died by the door. Roaches are to be expected in older apartments‚Äîand clearly they do use pesticide...RIP Phil‚Äîso I didn‚Äôt mind that much. That said, the pictures make the place look much, much newer than it is, which is a pet peeve of mine.

The disposal was not working upon arrival, though I did get it going later. I let the owner know and they offered to come take a look at it; they were very communicative and willing to help.

The place is decently stocked with dishes, cleaning supplies, cookware, etc. It is clearly cleaned regularly and upkept as well as it can be. The major problems are moreso due to the complex itself.

The location should be quite good for out of towners. It has good accessibility to decent restaurants, Zilker, the greenbelt, and downtown, which can be reached by bike or scooter if you don‚Äôt have a car; be warned it‚Äôs uphill from most of these things though, so the trek back will be more arduous if you bike.
Expect delayed host responses, I even got a message saying the dishwasher not even working after 5 hours of check-in. Dont expect more, average for a downtown nearby night stay

Good for the location but looks nothing like the pictures, very dark space and the walls are paper thin (your neighbors will hear Everything and vice versa).. the shower only has a scorching hot option and no cool option. I wouldn't stay long term but for a short stay of a single night, it is just ok. Owned by airbnb property managers vs a local owner, have various thoughts about this. Property managers come here from Cali and monopolize the housing stock & raise the rent in Austin.. If youre going to monopolize the city, atleast put some basic supplies in the apartments youre renting out ...

The place isn‚Äôt bad, but not the best. Smells like weed, pull out couch is broken, had some flies, only 4 towels, & didn‚Äôt have blankets for the pull out couch. Although we did message the host the night we arrived about there being no blankets for the couch & she provided one the next morning. Also the blanket for the bed is stained

Apartment looks clean, but smells very strongly of cigarette smoke even though they claim it is non-smoking. Had to check out early because my wife and I could not handle the smell, hurt our heads and our throats.
the place is completely different from the photos, the cleaning is not good, the pool is far from the apartment and the area is not pleasant

Decent location if you wanna spend your trip in Austin with some Cockroaches. Informed the host about it and they seemed not to care as this issue has been going on for a few years, per reviews. Found roaches in kitchen, bathroom, in the bed and in our stuff in the bathroom. I presented multiple photos to the host and they denied any type of compensation or had any worry about the disturbance. We spent hours shaking out our suitcases and had to stay elsewhere and was also not reimbursed for that. Keep looking, there are other host that care more.

This is a good budget rental in terms of spaciousness and location, but the bed was extremely lumpy and uncomfortable. In addition, it is quite dark in the apartment and doesn't have the same feel that the photos lead you to believe. The kitchen and bathroom really need to be updated. However, I have got to say that for the price... it was fine.

Decent stay for the price! Great location for local Austin eats! Mattress does not have a bed spring and is flat on slats. Couch was more comfortable. This is a bottom floor apartment and is very dark! The pictures look light and bright  but that is not accurate. Still a decent stay as long as you‚Äôre okay with that! Coffee machine leaked bad but you‚Äôre right down the road from Coffee Radio Bar so just go there!
Outdated with rust stains. There was no water pressure in the bathroom sink and the kitchen sink looked so used that a layer had been scraped off :(

Do not stay!!!!

There was a number of things about this Air B n B that truly disappointed us and tainted our stay in Austin. Overall, we are deeply saddened about our experience. I think it‚Äôs important to provide an accurate and honest review, so that other guests do not have the same experience. Please read the full review.

** TLDR:
Cons: Terrible communication, dirty, inefficient AC, cockroaches, and RATS!!
Pros: Dog friendly, convenient location**

The pros of this apartment is that the location is convenient if you need to get downtown and close to stores, you have access to laundry (that you will need to pay a few bucks for), and that it is dog friendly. This is where all the pros end.

Firstly, when we checked in we noticed that the unit is run down and much older than the photographs/listing suggest. As other reviews mention, the unit could use a renovation due to chipped kitchen surfaces, rusty kitchen sink, damaged bathroom, stained bathroom tiles, damaged paint, patched up dry wall. Not to mention, it‚Äôs darker and dingier than the photos suggest.

Additionally, we walked in to see the bathroom was still dirty from previous guests, initially thinking this was black mould, we alerted our host. Moreover, we had one fork between the two of us for a 12-day stay. Given this was in the first 24-48 hours, we found that the host at this point was responsive and willing to resolve this issue. They sent out a new cleaner the next day who recleaned the bathroom and we got some new silverware.

A few days later, we noticed our AC was not cooling as we liked, and was cooling inefficiently and to around 76-77 in the day. As we were working from home, and adjusting to the Texan heat, we found this was good enough. Unfortunately, you do not have full control over the Nest system, and can only set between parameters of their choosing. I let the host know, and they assured me they‚Äôd let maintenance know, however we never had anyone come out to resolve the AC, despite the host informing me someone came out to fix it. This was totally inaccurate as we were home ALL day, and no one came by. Again, I let the host know and nothing was resolved. They did not respond to me and we just managed with them AC as is.

At this point, I was sort of annoyed about the stay, but was going to get over it and call it a doozy and that be it. Until our final night where we were awoken at 2:00am by the loud sound of an animal stuck in a sticky trap in the kitchen/hallway. It was flapping around and banging. We contacted the host and there was NO response. We contacted air b n b and they too contacted the host. We noticed that the critter was a large rat. The sound the animal was making from pain as well as trying to escape was horrific, so horrific we could not sleep. Eventually the rat managed to escape which means the rat was running around the apartment with us and our belongings!!! We were totally disgusted & left early in the morning, completely exhausted - we camped out in a parking lot until we could leave, that‚Äôs how bad it was! Not to mention, I‚Äôve been informed by authorities that sticky traps are ILLEGAL due to the sheer cruelty.

The only communication we received back from the host was 1) an automated message asking if we were going to be leaving early so they could clean (ha!!!!) 2) an apology for a slow response and that they‚Äôd alerted maintenance - NO apology about the rat. NO apology about the vile and UNSAFE experience we had.

It‚Äôs totally unacceptable, and we have sent messages to the management and it is now over 48 hours, and we have heard NOTHING in return.

We spent over $2000 - $200 plus of which was for a cleaning fee when honestly the place is so filthy (don‚Äôt look under sofas you‚Äôll see huge dirty dust bunnies, hair, and cockroaches!) Save your money and find another property!!!

We stayed in Austin in April with another host and had an incredible time, while this was the antithesis of that experience!!!! We have only ever had positive air b n b experiences, so we were honestly just so surprised that this was so terrible.

If you‚Äôve made it this far - I hope this informs your decision to NOT stay at this place and do NOT stay at any of their other properties, because if you unfortunately face any issues during your stay, you likely will not have them resolved.

[They will probably claim we are after money, like they responded to some other poor individual that stayed here, but I have all the evidence to back up my review - which I have shared with air b n b, and the host.]

When we arrived the apartment was small, dark, low ceiling, smelled of damp and was in a very poor state of repair. We did not stay at the property and had to find alternative last minute accommodation. The place was dirty, lots of damage, enamel coming off bath, dirty and damaged base boards (damp?), damaged & poor quality kitchen, paintwork damaged and botched attempts to repair, filthy windows and messy/dirty patio area. We shared our photos with Airbnb and Austin Vacay requesting a refund. Unfortunately cannot share photos on this review. Not what you'd expect for $800/night for 2 nights.  The property was completely misrepresented in the photos and description on the Austin Vacay and Airbnb websites. Austin Vacay did not return nor respond to our request for a phone call and communications were occasional and did not respond to either my, nor Airbnb's requests for a refund. Airbnb ultimately gave a 5% refund and nothing from Austin Vacay. All very disappointing with both Austin Vacay and Airbnb - we have lost all confidence in booking accommodation using these sites.  We have never had an issue prior to this booking.

- little water pressure in the bathroom sink
- antiquated plumbing in the shower making it difficult to control pressure and temperature
- a bathtub that is dated, with surfaces exposed that should be replaced
- ceiling paint in the bedroom that's about to fall, as well as paint patchwork on the walls.
- kitchen countertops that are in terrible disrepair. We like to cook in, occasionally, but can't here.
- kitchen space that can't accommodate two people.
- poor lighting throughout. With all the lights on, it's still a very dark space.

The place wasn‚Äôt the best .. the main things were when we walked in , it was dirty.
Some stuff has not been dusted in a long time.
The sofa cushions were old and smelly.
The counters in the kitchen were older with scratches,which in the pictures it looked different.
The wifi was going in and out horribly.
For the first few hours I couldn‚Äôt work since I couldn‚Äôt connect.
The lady upstairs makes a lot of noise most of the nights.
One night she keep banging something on her balcony.
There wasn‚Äôt enough toiletries which they said they can bring but wouldn‚Äôt have it in time before we checked out.
Super inconvenient if we are already paying to staying.

Also our check out was at 11am and the cleaning lady walked in at 10:30.
She almost walked in on me changing which was so inappropriate.
I was mortified!
Good for the price.  Could be a bit more clean, but no major issues.  We just stayed for one night and it was sufficient for our needs.

The house was adequate and the location was great. But we did not like Turn Key Rentals. They're a huge company that has poor communication and no personal touch. After booking thru Airbnb we were contacted by turnkey and we're told that we had to sign a lease. Like a real, proper, multiple page lease that you'd sign to rent an apartment, not a weekend airbnb. We complained to Airbnb and they verified that we shouldn't have to sign. Airbnb should take on the responsibility of being the middle man and streamline the whole process to reduce red tape. We told multiple people at TurnKey this, but they weren't having it. The day before our family trip we decided to just copulate and gave up the fight. But then to make matters worse, to access the lease and information about the property you have to go thru their online portal via another third party: IDology. They've got your birthday, home address and more. I mean they're allegedly a reputable company, but now your personal info is in yet another database for yet another company. AirBNB should be the middle man. That's the whole point of the service! We're still figuring this out with Airbnb, but be warned that if you want to book with turnkey you'll have to go thru their processes.

The house itself was adequate but it didn't seem as nice as in the pictures. There were scuffs on walls, dusty windows, and water from one of the showers never quite got hot. The blinds provide zero privacy during the night when lights are on. Also no basics like coffee in the house. Toiletries did not include lotion. Seems like all possible corners were cut and just the bare minimum is offered. Not a great stay.

While the location of the home is amazing, we found the house very dirty. At first glance it seemed cleaned, but then we noticed the showers were covered in mold and mildew and the linens did not look clean. While we reached out to Turnkey and they responded via text immediately, it took them a day to actually come and change sheets and start to clean the bathroom. It needed much more than they did. For almost $500 / night, this home is simply not worth it. Additionally, the walls are paper thin, it is stocked at the bare minimum, and the amenities are much poorer than even a motel.
The RV and whole property offered the kids and I exactly what we were looking for. Low key, private, close to lake access and very close to our home in Austin.
I had to leave early and Stacy was very accommodating!

Nice play to stay near Austin. Found weird that the ‚Äúowner‚Äù stopped by as I was grilling and tried making me go inside for us being ‚Äúloud‚Äù however there wasn‚Äôt music being played at all or screaming being done.

There was about 4 leaks as well inside the house. Not the kind to complain but I suggest looking into that. It could very much damage the home.

Do recommend if issues with leaks are fixed.

While the house itself was clean, quiet, and large enough to accommodate a big group, the lack of air conditioning was an unfortunate situation that severely impacted our overall enjoyment. While Diana and Micah were responsive to our report of the issue, they unfortunately were unable to get the issue resolved during our stay. They offered a partial refund ($100 of the nearly $1500 it cost to stay) and a 20% discount if we came back in the future. When I asked that we receive the 20% discount now given how uncomfortably hot it was inside (over 80 degrees), I was rebuffed and offered 15%. Although they were quick to send this money, $180 off didn‚Äôt feel like a good value for how uncomfortably hot it was. It was also disappointing to find the lake almost completely dried up, significantly different than the photos of a dock floating on inviting water. And finally it must be acknowledged that one of the neighbors clearly dislikes AirBNB guests - the house rules and additional messages from Diana and Micah made it very clear that even accidentally turning in to the wrong driveway was a problem. (not tough to do considering how close the houses are). Not to mention the death stares my group got from this neighbor as we arrived. We had no issues with her, but we were constantly under stress worrying about upsetting her. In summary, this would have been an almost perfect stay had the AC not been out. As it was, we made the best of it but felt we did not get the value we wanted.
Haven't fully decided yet.... Depends on owner's response to my issues. Some good some very bad.

Avoid the location.
Overpriced and dirty.

My family and I have stayed in many Air BnB properties throughout Texas. This being said, I feel I can give a well rounded opinion on this home.

Pro's-
-We had to alter our original date for our vacation, and the homeowner graciously allowed us to do so
-Great location near grocery stores, local shops, and restaurants
-Gorgeous view from the master bedroom balcony.
-Comfortable bed in master bedroom
-Great bathtub and shower in master bedroom with good water pressure, no issues with lack of hot water which can be an issue in some hill country homes
-Large, private dock in a quiet cove area
-Open floor plan with a large dining table and island
-Owners were very friendly and helpful with local tips.

Cons-
-Many roaches in the home, approximately 5 per day, mostly downstairs near kitchen
-Could smell dog even though the home is listed as a pet free rental.
-Railings outdoors at the back of the home on the second story patio down to the main floor is dangerously loose. if an adult were to have leaned against it, I'm not sure it would've held up, and the drop was about 20 feet down. Also, near the grilling area the railing is very loose. The drop is much further on this side. This could be a huge liability if someone falls and gets seriously injured. We had children with us so safety is a big thing for our family.
-Very poorly stocked kitchen; not even the can opener functioned (it was rusted to the point of being fused). No pizza cutter, strainer for pasta, or adequately sized pots/pans. The two non stick skillets were completely scratched up making them unsafe to use. We weren't expecting a chef's kitchen, but with three kids, eating out every meal was not an option. Making dinner was extremely difficult not having basics available and we ended up having to go out and buy a cooking pan with a lid.
-The property listing does not say that there would be any lake toys, however, it would make the property more appealing for future guests. We have stayed at other lake properties who have kayaks, paddle boards, plenty of lake toys available for our use that we don't own since we don't live on or near a lake. When we asked the homeowners about this, they stated that in the past their things have been stolen. I suggest a shed or storing them with a padlock on the dock like all the other houses in the cove.
-White patio around the house was very dirty due to mud being churned up by sprinkler system at the back of the home.
-Difficult to get to property and park; we were worried about the neighbors during our stay since it was highly emphasized not to go anywhere near their parking areas. It was obvious neighbors don't like having an Air BnB property nearby when they let their large scary dog wander into our yard.
-Cameras outside home on patio were not disclosed in the listing as per Air BnB policy. The camera was functioning because we saw the green light on. This made us uncomfortable being that the camera was pointed at the back patio where we hung out most of the time. I thought it was strange to have a camera here in an area that's more private, yet there wasn't one at the front door.

There should really be updated pics shown for this house and it needs to be maintained on the outside as well as the inside. There was a lot of minor things wrong with the house, the door knob was a main issue that made us feel unsafe especially with the nosy neighbor who's dog would be on the porch at night. Even after we reported the door knob and it was said that they were going to send someone to fix it,no one ever came. There was enough minor issues that are unnoticeable until you're actually staying there to realize (but in Diana's instructions she's detailed about giving only a few minutes to contact her with any issues.)  I was enough to make our experience not so well. We will not be back!
Overall really clean house and a nice place to stay. Finding the house is very difficult and parking is not great.

We enjoyed our stay here. It is not a far drive to get into Austin, to shopping, to restaurants etc. The House was really nice. There was no water access while we were there (levels were very low) but even if there had been water it would have been quite difficult to access. It is a very steep and overgrown path down to the dock.

This place should be offered below 50 dls since nothing about it stands out. it had a pest problem that needs to addressed soon. The place is clean regardless of pest. Bed and pillows were uncomfortable for my wife and I. Everything else is OK.

I felt uneasy in the parking lot and my privacy was inadequate .
My host were informative and easy to contact
A decent place to stay for the night. It wasn‚Äôt bad for one night but any longer would‚Äôve been ill advised. The bed was not comfortable at all.

Can‚Äôt get much cheaper than this one, but you get what you pay for. Decent location. Not the safest feeling place. Both nights of our stay we had people screaming at each other late at night which made it hard to sleep.
Booked and into my room within 20 mins! Saved me sleeping in my car with my poor planning.
Nice place, good for two but for three it‚Äôs not the best because of the couch which is not very comfortable. But the bed is very comfy and there is all the amenities you‚Äôll need.
Location was bad. Inside was decent. Felt like I wouldn‚Äôt have booked had I known the surroundings, but they did about the most they could with the space.
Dirty! I had to leave and stay somewhere else and photos are very different than real life

Mark was very prompt about responding to us.  Just a block from a main route with 3 bus lines going downtown. Many reasonable places to eat either within walking distance or a short bus ride. Would definitely stay here again.

House was big and well kept! Very disappointing interactions with the host though. The host was Very aggressive and hostile after our stay when in fact we left the house spotless and took very good care of the house while we were there. Once we left the Airbnb a few hours later I get a message from the host Naomi saying we broke their Polaris (pool vacuum) when in fact we never touched it and it was working the entire time we were there and still working when we left. She was aggressively texting me saying ‚Äúit would never break on it own, it had to be us that broke it and we will have to pay for it.‚Äù And then a few days later she had her pool guy come check it out and he definitely told her it wasn‚Äôt us that broke it or did anything because I received a text saying ‚ÄúPolaris is fixed‚Äù with no apology or anything for accusing us of breaking it. Very sad after having such a good time staying at the house.

Wir k√∂nnen uns den anderen positiven und √ºberschw√§nglichen Bewertungen nur anschlie√üen: Ragan und Kris sind sehr liebensw√ºrdige und hilfsbereite Gastgeber. Die Wohnung ist riesig, super ausgestattet (inklusive Snacks und Getr√§nken) und extrem sauber sowie ruhig und in einer park√§hnlichen Anlage gelegen. Do not book this room with the expectation of having full access to the pool.¬† Two of the three nights we booked the host was entertaining guests in the pool despite the fact that when I booked the room I told Michelle the pool was the main reason we chose this space. The cleanliness of the room was also poor, smelled strongly of smoke, needed to be swept,¬† dead bugs under the bed, A/C filter had obviously not been cleaned in a long while, the toilet didn't work properly and the fridge was a sticky mess. Overall this trip was a huge disappointment and waste of $300. We would have been better off at a motel if we had to share a pool, which with the covid19 situation we did not feel comfortable doing.
Not what we expected from the pictures and ha o g trouble hearing about refund after wanting to leave after one night!

this is a cute little place in a quiet cul-de-sac.  An understated exterior (the entrance looks like a utility room off of a carport) hides a quiet little respite from the chaos of Austin, but like the Room of Requirement, everything you could want is inside.  Google maps tried to steer me to one street over, so if you're not in a cul-de-sac you're on the wrong Street.  there is a big back window looking out over ground level at a pool.  two well-behaved dogs occupy the yard. I don't think I heard a single bark from them.  the only annoyance was the next door neighbor lady calling loudly for her cat at some ridiculous hour.

Our flights got delayed so unfortunately we had to reschedule our journey and could not stay here as planned. Communication however was great at all times and we are sad we did not get to experience this apartment.

The location was exceptional & apt. nice/clean. Whole Foods and bikes nearby. Unfortunately, there was NO toilet paper in either bathroom! A paper towel roll had been placed in the upstairs main BR & small box of Kleenex in 1/2 bath and none available in closet as suggested in house guidelines. We found this to be rather offensive & disappointing considering the price for one night for 4 people: > $300!
Kal‚Äôs condo was very centrally located on 6th street but in a quiet block away from the madness!

This location can‚Äôt be beat if you want a school record store, local ice cream, restaurants and the biggest Whole Foods you‚Äôve likely seen within a block! (Also Lululemon and Lush) It was a $10 Lyft ride to the Moody Theater if you want to do ACL! And that was peak! It‚Äôs about 20min walk. We definitely would stay again should we find ourselves in Austin!
no need to second guess this one

The location of the property is not on the water as one of the listing photos shows; the property is a block away. The thermostat was never in our control-very overheated at night. The mattress was in serious need of replacement, it was literally sunken in on one side, could not get a good nights sleep as I kept rolling into the middle of the bed and bumping into and disturbing my husband. Always ask when the mattress was last updated.

The house was nice and easy to get to but the most disappointing part of our stay was that the lakeside backyard area is anything but ‚Äòprivate‚Äô. Our host decided to have a 20-30 person baby shower party in the backyard area by the lake that lasted the entire Saturday we were there. We had no privacy and felt like we were in the way of the host and her family, which included many cigarette smokers ü§¢. The experience was uncomfortable and it felt like we were being treated more as an inconvenience to the host instead of paying customers that wanted to use the facilities in private. Also, the bathroom door is broken and doesn‚Äôt close and the fridge ice-maker doesn‚Äôt work üôÑ. The fact that the host felt like it was appropriate to hold a massive party on the same property that she was renting out to Airbnb guests was strange and frankly rude in my opinion. At least the lake was still beautiful‚Ä¶ üòÅ
The  room is not lockable which is very inconvenience to us
You won‚Äôt be disappointed... this place has everything.
It served our purpose but the outside of the house/patio and back yard was over sold in the pictures. The patio has not as nice as it shows and the backyard is over grown.
Very nice home, but the location was a little uncomfortable

I have never left a negative review, but I sure wish that others would have been more forthcoming, so I will.  This house had not been properly cleaned.  The first thing we saw when we walked in was a sofa that had all of the cushions askew.  The floors in the hallways needed to be swept.  The bed in the back room had a comforter that was not on straight.  When we pulled it back, the sheets were all messed up as if they had been slept in and then the cover was just pulled over.  The back porch had trash that had not been thrown away.  The final straw was the vomit on the side of the toilet and the floor.  I understand that the maid service may have just had a bad day, but it was clearly not ready for guests.  I was also upset to see that several people before us had commented on the HVAC system being out.  The morning we arrived, I got an email saying that the system was out as if it had just happened.  After reading the other reviews, I believe that it had been out for some time.  Though not related to the cleanliness, I will also comment that this neighborhood did not feel safe.  Again, I hate to say anything negative, but it was not a good experience and I do think it is important to leave an honest response.

Very spacious, well stocked, convenient location only a short drive into downtown. Lots of thoughtful touches. It is near train tracks, but the last train we heard was around midnight so didn‚Äôt interrupt our sleep much.

This is a very cool house with a nice layout.

Unfortunately it was very dirty upon our arrival. When I contacted the host he was apologetic and sent someone to clean while we were out having dinner. When we returned some things had been clean but it still remained quite dirty. The rugs were very dirty/had not been vacuumed. The stove remained dirty all of the glass top tables in the living space had rings and dust from previous guests. The host kindly refunded the cleaning fee but it was unfortunate that we felt like we were in a dirty house.

Overall pretty good experience.
Pros:
Great location
Price
Size of the house
Easy check in
Safety

Cons:
Bedding and towels left in the washer and dryer
Roach in the bathroom that scared the mess out of me as it jumped/fell out of the soap dispenser onto my wash cloth
Hair and dirt on the floors
Eating utensils left out on the counter

Pros: Can‚Äôt beat the price for a house that can house so many people comfortably. There‚Äôs a king bed, queen bed, full size top and bottom bunk and lots of couches. The patio is a nice touch. The location is great in terms of being nearby downtown etc. They have a lot of board games available.

Cons: The house is next to a train track and the noisy train seems to run at night. A couple of my grown friends were spooked. The entire house is like that one drawer that‚Äôs filled with those odds and ends that you have no idea where to put them. The layout is odd and the furniture is awkwardly large. All the linens and towels were disheveled in the closet. The cleaning fee is as much as the stay, but they make you take off the bedsheets and towels and set it next to the washer before you leave. We had nearly zero amenities - no toothpaste, razors, etc that was listed on the site. There were not even paper towels or napkins in the kitchen. Many kitchen utensils were burned, dishes, cups, cutting boards were dirty in the cabinets, and the pots and pans were near impossible to reach even for a 6-foot-tall man. The smaller bathroom smelled of urine. The house manual has a gazillion rules and potential charges if you use extra towels/linens, have an accidental spill, or leave 30 min later than the checkout time. I was stressed on my vacation with making sure we didn‚Äôt break any of these rules. The yard appears neglected. And the host never responded to one of my messages.

TLDR; you get what you pay for. Not a terrible stay especially for a large group, but don‚Äôt have high expectations.
Decent location. Hosts were responsive during check-in though the place was not fully ready for us (i.e. beds unmade, bathroom not fully done being cleaned) despite having agreed on early check-in.
Coachroaches upstairs.   Kitchen isn‚Äôt stocked at all beyond a coffee pit and a few pans. Outside was dirty and unusable.
Awful.
Stay was for my daughter, she had nothing but positive things to say. Thank you.

PROS: located in a hip neighborhood; on a quiet street yet still highly walkable; very private & nice if you have a pup traveling with you; nice amenities (extra towels + beach towels, lots of toiletries, bikes that we didn't end up using, a few snacks & treats available; etc.)

CONS: could have been cleaner (we found some used ear plugs on the floor, old coffee grounds in the coffee maker, etc.); and very hot (even with the wall unit and the old window unit for 'extra cooling', it is still no match for the Austin summer, especially when the sleeping arrangement is upstairs in a loft and hot air rises; we were never quite as cool & comfortable as we would have hoped to be)

I didn't interact very much with the hosts, but when I did, I didn't feel super welcome. I asked to send myself a package bc I'd forgotten something, but they made me feel like my asking was a burden and didn't seem interested in helping me out at all. It was a bummer as other Airbnb hosts in the past have often gone above and beyond to make us feel comfortable & like their place is our home away from home. Would have wished they could have been more accommodating.
This place was above & beyond what it‚Äôs advertised as. I‚Äôm a touring musician from NOLA. I will continuously try to book this exact stay with my monthly stops in ATX !

Excellent
Good location
Quiet
only someone working on the first floor around 8 AM. but that is a minor complaint.
Good parking on the street.

This is a nicely furnished home that is well equipped with the basics and a comfortable bed.  It was our first trip to Austin.  It isn't a walkable city but you can walk to the Capitol from the house and it is central to drive to everywhere we wanted to go.  Our only regret was that we didn't meet the resident dog.

We enjoyed our stay in this home.  The house was clean and nicely styled. The location is nice and quiet and it‚Äôs only about $8 in a ride share to downtown.  The shower was really awesome! I never heard from the owner which I‚Äôm used to but that didn‚Äôt really bother me.  A couple of small things‚Ä¶ there was only one coffee filter even though we were there for 3 days.  They do not provide any cream for your coffee and no snacks like most other Airbnb so if you like your coffee light like me, make sure you bring your own creamer.  The water here tasted particularly awful, maybe the worst tap water I‚Äôve ever tasted.  They provide a Brita water filter but it does not help with the bad water taste much.  Highly recommend bringing your own bottled water, I had lots of water elsewhere in Austin and it wasn‚Äôt an issue.  The Roku tv was not working when we arrived even though Wi-Fi signal was strong, after a night of just streaming on our iPad we did a reset of the network through the tv and that fixed the problem.
Not very clean
Disgusting and filthy. Had to stay in a hotel not the air bnb I paid for.

Bret had great and clear communication and guidelines regarding check in. The location is stellar and exactly as described.

Unfortunately, it felt like the apartment was not well cleaned before our arrival. The bed sheets had a big yellow stain and while Bret replied very quickly when I messaged him about it, there were no attempts to rectify the situation by providing a location where clean sheets could be located or anything, which was disappointing and quite frankly, sort of gross. There were also coffee grounds in a bowl sitting on the sink that hadn‚Äôt been disposed of before our arrival, so I‚Äôm not sure what the situation was. We requested a late checkout by message over 24 hours prior to our departure and never received a response either way. There are no ‚Äúfrills‚Äù that you may have seen in other airbnbs - no extra pillows (in case one per person isn‚Äôt ideal), kleenex, or guide booklet with local favorites or recommendations.

Lastly, I can not emphasize exactly how close the toilet is to the bed. It is described in the listing accurately and the other comments mention it, but if you‚Äôre traveling with another person you will hear and smell it all as there is no door to separate the two but just a shower curtain.

Overall, Bret got us in to the location early and promptly and provided a centrally located stay with an accurate description, but I would not choose it again.
Address was hard to find on the street at night.

The house is: well located but rather noisy because it‚Äôs near the railway; clean but rather old and in need of some basic maintenance; convenient but not the most comfortable for families with children. Despite enjoying our stay, we wouldn‚Äôt go back, especially because of the borderline discriminatory comments that Doug made after our checkout.

The location was great for us to access downtown Austin, and communication Caroline was great-she always responded to emails and messages timely.

The major issue we had, which I knocked off one star, was that the cleaning crew did have to come again while we were there because they did not clean the attached bathroom upstairs, and the result was an ant/fly problem that forced my friends using that room to use another bathroom for the duration of the trip. Caroline did communicate when cleaners could come back, but their lack of attention was a bit frustrating since we were only there for a short trip.

Outside of that and the AC not being as strong as we are used to (but the temperature is 100degrees outside, so I can kind of understand), it was a cool home with a gorgeous view of the backyard.

Location was great. Several restaurants are walking distance and bars are a few blocks away! The host of this air bnb was invasive. She assumed we had more people stay the night than what was listed on the reservation, but that was not the case. The host also tried to come inside the air bnb without knocking because we arrived 20 minutes early than the check in time. The encounter we had was not an experience I want to happen again because it made the rest of the stay uncomfortable.
Ok--There's no better host on the planet.  How's that?  Make that the solar system.
There are no more gracious hosts in Austin, or maybe the world, than Roya and Jerry.  Just don't reserve my weeks :)
Roya and Jerry ALWAYS exceed my expectations.  It doesn't get any better than staying with them, unless I'm home.
this is great location if visiting Austin. plenty of parking if needed but still close enough to walk or take a scooter to downtown. it had the basic toiletries if your missing any. quiet area to

I went in thinking this house would be amazing but was very disappointed. The house itself is great but it needs a little attention. There were ants all over the kitchen when we arrived and were a problem the entire time even though we had no food out. I went to make a pizza in the oven and it was completely disgusting there was old food hanging from the racks. It was so gross we chose not to make food in it. The house was very hot when we arrived and it took a long time to cool off. Considering the fact that the host can control the temperature remotely with the nest thermostat it would have been nice to arrive to a cool place considering it‚Äôs so warm outside. Overall for the price of this home it did not live up to the standards we expect.

Access to the unit via a stepping stone path is somewhat difficult for people with mobility issues. Shower is tiny, bed is not the greatest and no provision for washing dishes in the kitchen. Hosts never checked on me in three days and trash went to overflow. Yet they charge cleaning and service fees.

Thanks for hosting us Joe. Noticed a few things such as the lack of a curtain rod in the upstairs room, lack of a bathroom mat once you exit the shower/tub in the upstairs bathroom, and lack of extra pillows for the bedrooms. Also noticed the vent in the upstairs bedroom came loose when we tried to close the vent (the vent came off from the ceiling and we had to reattach it to the ceiling) one night. Couple of these things made the stay/house feel not as well put together as  we were expecting after viewing the photos and reading the reviews. Good location for walking to the Austin beer garden around the corner, and other west Austin activities.
Cozy 2 bedroom place.  Quick Uber to everything in Austin.  It does get noisy at night but that is to be expected, the apartment is on campus.
Can't recommend this place enough. Plenty of beds and bathrooms, along with keyless entry customized for us. Victoria was overwhelmingly accommodating and I would not hesitate to stay here again!!
House is in a very convenient area. Parking is a bit of a hassle. Bathroom sinks leaked and toilet was broken.
Amazing place! Small yet doesn't feel small at all. Enjoyed the natural sunlight, the location, the feel of the place. Nothing but great things!
The coolest Airbnb I‚Äôve ever stayed in crazy insane space well decorated
Quiet place when you need a break from the crazy city life.  Big enough to have everything you need, but small enough to keep the cozy vibe.
Oh they killed it
Awesome idea and killer digs!

The first disappointment was the intense mildew smell.  Then a rat got caught in the trap in the middle of the first night. It was a pretty loud ordeal and took a minute for us to figure it out. After finding it in the oven warmer the next morning, we felt entitled to some compensation. We were told that if we left immediately then he would refund the second night.  I still had to pay the first night rate, the cleaning fee and the processing fee. I don't think that was a hospitable response to us pointing out a rat infestation. Huge disappointment and inconvenience.

not worth the money, beds very uncomfortable, awful part of town. i was nervous every time we left the house that our items would be gone when we got back, the uber driver also was shocked when we told him that we paid 500 for 2 nights for that place, bathroom and kitchen were nice. the communication with the host was excellent, but just not worth what we paid. no extra blankets or pillows were provided for the ‚Äú3rd sleeping arrangement (couch)‚Äù.

Our experience at this listing was not good. We did not stay there for more than 30 minutes before relocating to a hotel for the weekend. Here are a few of the reasons: The house was not clean - there was a musty smell, expired food in the refrigerator, unvacuumed area rug, and stains on the sofa. The house does not have central air and heating - window air units ‚Äì this was not disclosed and is intentionally hidden in advertised photos. There are some structural issues (i.e. hole in the flood in bedroom). The home is not as it appeared on the advertisement. The description and photos are made to seem much nicer than the actual location. High reported crime area - not disclosed on listing. The value is not worth the price asked for on the listing. The listing is very different in person compared to the online description. We were two females and did not feel safe or comfortable staying in the house for the weekend. Overall, we did not stay even one night, but contacted Airbnb directly, received a full refund, and relocated to a hotel for the weekend. The host was less than accommodating to deal with after we explained that we did not feel comfortable in the home as two females; however, we were able to go through Airbnb directly and receive a full refund.

Exactly what we wanted for ACL weekend! Short, guided walk to two of the entrances from this location. After the show, the path back was never crowded like the others I have experienced. Lots of space in the apartment! Ryan allowed us to check in early and was helpful throughout the weekend with any questions we had. Saved us a lot of money and trouble since we didn‚Äôt have to get Uber‚Äôs all weekend. About a $20 uber ride from the airport which isn‚Äôt bad either!
Good location but overpriced for two bedrooms and one funky bathroom. Not as nice as the pictures appear.

Place is great, house number isn‚Äôt visible at night if you‚Äôre arriving late. Overall the place was VERY clean. Cleanest wood floors! There was a light cigarette smell walking through the door but it wasn‚Äôt noticeable after walking around the house. Beds were awful, didn‚Äôt get any sleep from how uncomfortable the mattresses were.

Space was mostly as described but felt like hosts left the unit just before my arrival. Cleaning service hadn't wiped down the counters, cleaned the floors, she there was dirty silverware in the sink on arrival.
Can't recommend enough!
Cleanliness, friendliness, and very close to downtown! you‚Äôd be CRAZY not to stay here

I have a 3 months baby, and the house doesn't even have a heater,we fond a very small electric heater,the bathroom doesn't have a heater too,we freeze all night.it was a terrible night with airbnb for the first time.
on the picture it shows 2 Quine beds but we fond only 1.and I request it for 3 guests. me and my wife and my mom. terrible
No frills. Clean and comfortable.

This was our second air bnb experience ever. We were slightly wary because the first experience was sub par. Jim & Deb crushed it. If you‚Äôre looking for an affordable place to stay that has an incredible view this is the spot. If we ever come back to Austin we will be sad if their air bnb isn‚Äôt available!
Spacious suite in a Nice neighborhood. Too bad we can‚Äôt access the pool due to COVID.

A cockroach was what greeted us in the living room on our first day in the airbnb. The description included "heating," which was completely inaccurate. There were just 2 small plug in heaters. Do not recommend.

I would strongly discourage you from staying here. The place was a dump with broken locks. It‚Äôs smaller than the photos make it seem with one bed crammed in an entryway room. We had roaches when we were there.
Terrible host,terrible place.

Parking was never specified and the neighbors were rude to the point to tow our vehicle. The host did not answer at all the whole time we were there. The toilet did not work. The wifi and tv did not work as well. If you want to be without service or entertainment inside the home this is the perfect spot other than that it is not worth the time or money.

We were not too happy about this Airbnb. The kitchen did not even have matches to turn the stove on; I would recommend to have the basics in case someone needs to prepare something. The blinds in the room were broken and there was a very strong light glued to the outside window that would not go off. I asked David about a few issues including the outside light and some packages going missing and never got a respond.

This was not a pleasant stay. The bathroom sink was broken and didn‚Äôt drain. The floors leaked when it rained, soaked through the rug and created a horrible smell for the rest of the stay. We contacted Alex about both of these issues, she mentioned someone was coming to take a look, and no one ever came. She then didn‚Äôt respond for a full day. The hot water stopped working in the shower, the bed sheets were dirty, and there weren‚Äôt proper cleaning supplies to do our dishes. The place was not a pleasant stay and Alex‚Äôs communication wasn‚Äôt good either.

If you‚Äôre looking to stay in Austin, this Airbnb is conveniently located near all the action on 6th St in East Austin and only about a 10 minute walk to downtown and Rainey St. The Airbnb is no frills and gets the job done.
No frills, clean, functional.
Prepare to pay for parking.
Location wasnt well described. Host never answered me. Gave 4 of us 6 towels and one roll of toilet paper for the week. A all around horrible experience. Not worth the price we paid
Decent apartment, a bit dingy but killer location for SXSW!

Really convenient spot with tons around to do/visit (lots of great bars and restaurants within walking distance)
It is in an alley and my goodness those garbage trucks make one hell of a wake up alarm!
Also, as of writing this (11/3/2022) I was told that there was no carbon monoxide detector on site and as such, I purchased one at the local target and left it there.

This property would be great for a couple days but wasn't the best for 6+ weeks. The beds were uncomfortable and the master bedroom stayed cooler than the rest of the house.

The kitchen wasn't as stocked with pans as I would have hoped but we made do.

The outlets in the dining room didn't work and the sectional in the living room didn't stay together so weweren't constantly having to move pieces

This was a dirtier studio than expected with a damp smell throughout. The A/C unit fins were caked in grime, and the local contact was able to arrange for cleaning the next day. There was a lack of personal touches unlike other AirBNBs that we‚Äôve been to. Location was great but the street wasn‚Äôt quiet.
Meh? I don't know how much you're paying for this listing, but I was overcharged and had a nonconsensual bed-share with a flying cockroach.

Great location near 6th street bars and other local eateries. Private access is perfect although parking is very limited. Hard pressed to park a truck and get out at the same time. Place is modern and hooked up with anything you may need for a weekend. Only negative was lack of overall cleanliness. Cobwebs on the ceiling and dust on decorative pillows.
The rental was nice. Def did not look like the pictures online sadly, so if you‚Äôre basing it off those photos  like we did you may be disappointed.

We were woken up by the garage early in the morning after choosing this place to have a little sanctuary after a long weekend and was not aware this was the main garage space used for the house.
The outdoor space was very dirty and unorganized, not comfortable or inviting which was a huge selling point based on the pictures.
We have stayed at a few airbnbs over our week stay in Austin, the price is about the same as the other but the amenities are not there. No waters or anything provided by the host.
Location is really convenient, there is a ton to do around the space.

Check in was a nightmare. I did not receive the code to the door until 2 hours after our check in time. Crystal stated in her response message that her code did not send because I booked ‚Äútoo last minute‚Äù making it seem like my fault! So sorry for booking your Airbnb so last minute instead of letting it sit empty for the night! Multiple things in the airbnb itself were not working, broken, etc. the bed/bedframe was broken and squeaky, the closet doors did not open, and the dishwasher smelled like mold. The bed was uncomfortable due to the broken bedframe and the couch was also uncomfortable. The location was good but construction was annoying

Great location.  Minimal decorations, but that is what we wanted with small kids :). One t.v. in main room, nice patio that is fenced in.  Lower end mattresses so if you have back problems I would maybe look elsewhere.
Over all the place was nice didn't like that there was no cover on the patio window covering had to purchase a sheet to cover the window for privacy
No question - if it's available, book it!
bed is a bit hard, bit the location makes up for it as you are close to most things
Victoria and Rick have set up a really cool vibe here.  This is a bucket list item, and I couldn't have been happier with the stay.
There's no second guessing where I'll stay next time
You get what you pay for for the most part. More for those who don‚Äôt plan to be home much.
The place is good located , 8 dollar UBER away from 6th street , the only problem is  there is NO TV in the room

This was my first time booking with airbnb, and I must say I was a little disappointed. While Sunee was great at communicating with me, the problems in the apartment made my experience very frustrating. To start this place was convenient to sleep, but not much more, we spent a lot of time in the apartment because of the weather. Since there was no television and not so great Wi-Fi, it made our stay a bit of  a drag. We stayed for a week and it was really an inconvenience not having a microwave. My major problem was the fact that the tub wouldn't drain/ drained very slowly, and the paint in the tub kept peeling off while we showered. The problem took 2 days to be resolved, at that point I  was over my stay. Sunee was very understanding and tried to help as much as she could.

I couldn't check in until after a whole hour than what was listed because the previous guests left late which was not my issue. I was also told I would be notified when the room would be clean and ready and that message NEVER arrived. You can clearly smell and feel that the bed sheets weren't washed. There was rust all around the bathroom sink. There was a huge dirty brown splatter on the front of the fridge door. There was hole in the fridge. There was pet hair on the sofa bed. It was not "quirky and urban" more like rusty dirty and in a sketchy neighborhood. When the host was asked how to work the TV I got a "just lookup a video of how to work it". It's smaller than expected. It says it hosts 4 guests but in reality can only host two. The sofa bed is only convenient for someone 5 foot or shorter. the only negative experience I had in Austin was booking this place.
No comment
Parking with a truck was a little difficult but everything else was ok.
Stayed there for a couple hours because I missed my flight I can‚Äôt complain about a thing!
Hab die Unterkunft wieder gebucht
The house was very clean and exactly what is described. The location isn‚Äôt bad just not the prettiest surroundings.

Let me first say that we chose this place due to all of the great reviews about cleanliness and communication. When we arrived the trash was piled up coming out of the trash bins and on the ground as if it had not been disposed of in weeks.

We were given an alarm code to use after being advised that the alarm was set. Upon entering the home we found that the alarm was not set and it was still dirty in each and every room and bathroom from the previous guests. There were towels all over the floors as well as the beds were still tossed and unmade with dirty linens from the previous guests. There were dishes in the sink, trash in the trash cans and also personal items still there from the previous occupants. The sectional had a broken frame, stools were missing from the kitchen table, secondary bedroom door was off thr track. master bedroom door hinge was off with screws on the floor....luckily we did not have small children with us. Also, a majority of the lights were out on the patio light strands. We tried to reach Kade several times but he did not reply. Someone (Alex) else finally replied and she tried to help and also advised that this was not her property. She was eventually able to get someone there to clean the house. There were also no wash cloths there and we did not get them until day 2 about 9pm or so. I sent a message saying that we were being ignored and Kade eventually sent 2 messages about towels and I never heard from him again.

Kade never did follow up to see if things were good after all of the issues that we had the first two days. Nor did he ever follow up during or after the trip with an apology.

This location does have a lot of road noise as it is by a overpass/highway, a train runs near a few times a day as well as quite a bit of airplane traffic. Therefore, if you are looking for a quiet stay this is not the place for you.

I did request a refund of part of my money when I returned home and Kade did advise that he would get the refund processed the same day that he replied. After several days went by there was no refund.
I did try to contact him again about the refund and again, no reply. I ended up having to contact the Resolution Center through Airbnb to communicate with Kade on my behalf.

The Resolution Center was very prompt and they did get my refund in a very timely manner.

This was the most horrible home rental that my family and I have ever experienced. It put a bad taste in our mouth from the very beginning of the trip and it was hard to enjoy ourselves for the time there. We were so glad to get back home!

We usually rent homes through VRBO and have had no issues. I will try Airbnb again as I will not let this stay spoil it for this company. The Airbnb staff that assisted me was great.

*** Something to note- if you experience a problem with your property when renting with airbnb please contact airbnb immediately (within 24 hours) as you could be do a full refund. We did not know this so we were constantly trying to make contact with the host (Kade)...thinking that he was our only resort. Not the case!

This home was perfect for us. We were in town for our daughter's wedding, and we traveled with our 2 small dogs. Our biggest complaint is the parking. We had several family members in town and only 3 cars could park. They can't change it, but we had to make alternate plans for a get together, which we hosted. The other complaint is that we froze. We'd adjust air, and it wouldn't last. We didn‚Äôt make complaints to him while staying; so he didn't know.

Overall the stay was ok. Area was 10-15 minutes from everything. The place was not clean though. Garbage was left from previous people. Bedsheets did not smell clean. There was no refill paper towels, no tissues, mirrors only in the bathroom, and dust everywhere.

It wasn‚Äôt a huge problem but there were some roaches in the apartment. It was stated that we had the entire place to ourselves but the owner‚Äôs had an attached apartment inside the home. We were looking for a little more privacy than that. Other than that, the house was very accommodating!

Scherry and Lee‚Äôs house was more than what we expected. It was close to everything we wanted to do. We would have spent more time on the deck (beautiful) but the weather never cooperated. Great hosts.
Aron was very communicative and hospitable. The place is small but stylish. I had no issues with the place or with Aron!
Rob was a friendly host! Bedroom was a little smaller than anticipated and the shower head will be uncomfortable if over the height of 5‚Äô5. Over all it was a nice place to stay in Austin!
Rob was very friendly and the space was just as we expected.

Rob's place was close to the Noris convention center where my conference was being held. I was able to walk there each day in just a few minutes without any hassle. In and out with a door code is easy and no fuss. The room was comfortable and I slept like a log. His dog sometimes woke me up in the morning, but I would totally stay with Rob again if I return to Austin.
Rob is a very experienced host, and he stays near the home for almost everytime so that the guest may ask him about anything you need. Good choice!
Rob was efficient and worked with our check in time !
The value is good, however, you do not have the comfort of a home with limited access to the living room and kitchen.  Very small house.  Parking was also problematic with parking on the street.
I was attending a conference at Norris Center nearby and Rob's place was within walking distance. My flight into Austin was quite late and Rob was nice enough to stay up late and meet me in person.

A pleasant stay and excellent value.
The N. Austin area where Rob's home is was perfect for my trip.
The dog says hello, but is really quite timid. :-)
Thanks Rob.
Very groovy. The dog enforcers a regimen to overcome jet lag.
Quick stay, in and out. Rob made it easy to check in and check out for us.
only saw Rob when I checked in. Nice & quiet
Not worth it. Stay away from Turnkey.

Worst Airbnb stay I've ever had. I've tried to resolve issues before leaving a review but this agency is a joke. They communicate great when asking questions prior to booking (although they keep trying to redirect you off Airbnbs platform) but once you book they won't respond.
*Beds are extremely lumpy, squeeky (barely move and you wake the other person up and overall gross.
*Most TVs (main room greatroom for hanging out and Master bedroom) do not work/have cable and are not smart TVs. This means no ability to have family/hang out /unwind time together while someone cooks and others watch tv like planned.
*Internet day one was so horrible (down then very poor speed) I had to use a wework space at the last minute. We reset the router and got the internet to work upstairs only on day 2. (I guess they consider the plastic folding table in the family room with a monitor (but no cables) the office!!!??? instead of the actual architectural office on the main floor that is secluded and designed for this purpose? this defeats the purpose of having a dedicated work space if in order to use the it people can not watch tv on the only tv in a common space.
*yard not useable, it has an only sink countertop laying against the fence like a junkyard and it's full of weeds so you can't even access the fire pit and it would be a fire hazard if you did.
*broken window in laundry room and door to bedroom by kitchen didn't close (door doesn't fit the jam) made was concerning
* kitchen - beautiful but refrigerator didn't make ice or dispense water and dishes were dirty it was super unorganized, used odwella bottles in the cabinets and multiple jars with mold in them.
THIS PLACE NEEDS TO BE REMOVED FROM AIRBNB'S PLATFORM IT DOES NOT MEET THEIR STANDARDS.
The home was clean and I felt safe with the alarm system. My only complaint is that the bed was very uncomfortable.

This place is okay.  Says pool & hot tub but they weren't clean.  That was why I rated it like I did.  Don't say you have amenities if the guests can't use them.  Grounds overall were messy & this interfered with parking.  Bags of leaves & trash filled parking along curb.  Go to a store & get toiletries.  They say they are provided, but there are empty bottles in the bathroom.  Be aware one bathroom for 4 rooms in same house. Stayed in the Paris  room. Bed is very squeaky & loud.  I won't recommend to anyone I know.
Not good experience

I would have given much higher ratings but for the fact that the owner's little dog Coco was yipping and yapping without a break when I got there at 8 pm until about 10pm and then after the owner left at 6 am for the entire morning until checkout. I was exhausted and really needed to sleep and had even put that in my intro email.
This place was advertised as QUIET (my primary desire) and it was anything but. If Nikki hadn't known the dog would act this way I would still give low marks but I would have perhaps understood how this could happen. The worst part for me was that she told me at 10 pm this was the way it would be in the morning after she left at 6am! She could have told me she would be gone (and the dog would yap) when I booked it, and not when it was too late to get a new place.
I can tell that she is a generally nice person, but false advertisement is a deception that hurts people. I tried putting cotton balls in my ears so I could go back to sleep, and even covering my head with a pillow, and then I tried running the bathroom fan and playing music on my laptop, but the dog's high pitched yapping pierced through everything. I was unable to sleep. It seems that when Nikki is there, the dog is calm and doesn't bark. Unfortunately for me, she had a craft fair for which she was leaving at 6am and was gone until check-out. I really don't want anyone to go through what I went through, so I'm warning if you really want quiet you should look elsewhere.

There are too many rules, bed is more for one person not two..checkout was at 10:00.  Loud dog, unfriendly host. If you arrive late you won‚Äôt be able to unpack, because of sprinkler system, also not lit good.
Nach anf√§nglichen Schwierigkeiten  (keine, bzw. dreckige Bettw√§sche )war Augustine sehr bem√ºht, alles zu unserer Zufriedenheit zu regeln. Hat direkt neue Bettw√§sche gekauft.

We stayed at Augustines place recently, and were very disappointed with the level of cleanliness, and the lack of facilities.  The carpets had clearly not been vacummed and were badly stained.  The bed was exceptionally uncomfortable, with the mattress being a double, and the base being a queen size.  The kitchen has full facilities, but there were barely no utensils, plates or glasses, other than some paper cups.  There was also no tea, coffee, or milk.  The photos did not fairly represent the house at all.  To be fair, we communicated this with Augustine, and he was very quick to reply to us.  He refunded us half our payment.

The pictures were miss leading. Beds were just mattress‚Äô on the floor. The shower head didn‚Äôt work, the tub was dirty and we pulled hair out the drain.
We were in town for a conference and stayed at the house for 2 hours and knew we could not stay. So we left and got a hotel. The host was late for check in. And then didn‚Äôt respond to messages for over an hour. So we had to wait at a gas station until he called back.
Once we let him know that we could not stay at the guest house, he never messaged us back. üòí
This being my first Airbnb experience, I was Very disappointed!
Though the host is a nice man, the mold, the leaking floor, and the odor from the water damage were far too unacceptable
No thank you

The house is beautiful. But the kitchenware was dirty. There was no hot water on the showers in the lower floor.
It DOES NOT take 15 minutes to get to downtown. We did around 45 and it can be kind of a drag and a waste of money when having to ask for Ubers to take you downtown, and the ride was not cheap.

This is not a luxury house to rent. We had 3 pregnant couples and one with a newborn looking for a safe getaway with a pool. This is house was set up for large parties, with tons of beds set up in the bedrooms but clearly no space for that many people in the common areas. The house was older and had issues like wonky shower heads, extremely water damaged floor boards, cracked walls (in the bathrooms). We couldn‚Äôt access the AC at all as all were covered with plastic locks. We had to text a temperature within a provided range to the owner; and the house was kept at that temp the whole time, making it uncomfortably cool in the day and too warm for sleeping. There was a leak of sorts in the garage, so every time you went in/out to the fridge in the garage or to the driveway you were dripped on. One of the fridges in the garage didn‚Äôt stay cool, the fridge in the house froze our eggs, and the freezer handle didn‚Äôt work properly. Some of the mattresses were extremely old and had huge divots making your roll into the ravine in the center. In addition to old mattresses and dirty sheets, there was no hot water in any of the  bathroom sinks. And the fees for using anything that would have been assumed part of the outrageously priced rental were just annoying, everything from $25 per misplaced towel (which had to be sorted and placed in particular spots) to heating the pool to daily pet fees higher than the cost of boarding.

Gizem‚Äôs Place was wonderful to say the least!
Everything was perfect except for the noise at the pool that was constant and went late into the evening hours and after ‚Äúquite time‚Äù. We know this has no reflection in Gizem, just the community. Gizem did provide earplugs.
There was no cable service or local tv, so therefore no way for us to get local news or forecast other than from our cell phones. Gizem did have Apple TV, but we had no knowledge of it and there were no directions.

Dated place that was one of the worst Airbnb‚Äôs I‚Äôve stayed at.

It has an odor, mix of sewage and grandma‚Äôs perfume in various parts of the house.

The mattresses were probably 10 yrs old. The bedding is dated too.

This is the worst Airbnb I've stayed in and I have been using Airbnb for 7 years. It was dirty, it smelled like cigarettes, it had stains in the carpets, and one of two showers were broken. The nice lady involved in the business that owns this house tried to fix things but really couldn't in the middle of our week long stay. I would absolutely never stay here again or book with this company again.
Efficiency townhome in an established neighborhood. Parking on the street is not ideal but not an option. Communicated issues with the bathroom to the owner.

Appreciate Vacasa giving me a refund when this unit was unsafe for our family. The unit was not as stated and had broken tv and fan. We were not comfortable staying here. Ended up with no place to go because they couldn‚Äôt find us an available unit.

Really nice place but got locked out of the place at 12 am and my dog was stuck inside. The code changed and they were very slow to respond, over 30 min on hold and waited outside almost an hour while my dog was whining and freaking out inside stuck.
Central location, we struggled with finding parking and communicating with Abel, but otherwise ok.
Good location and apartment matches description. However, the place was dirty the bed sheets were not changed from the previous occupants and the place was, overall, dirty.

Pros:
Great location - walking distance to S. Congress Street, $5 Uber to downtown
Quiet and secure complex
Ample parking
Strong WiFi

Cons:
The host was in violation of his rental agreement. This apartment was rented as an exclusive AirBNB which he is not allowed to do. He had received several notices to take his post down or face eviction which he ignored. Our first night, the property manager came over to post a 3 day eviction notice on the door. It was unnerving to think we could be thrown out or the locks changed while we were out with no recourse.

In case that doesn‚Äôt both you, here are the other realities. We were 3 people staying for 4 nights and were provided exactly 3 towels, 1 roll of toilet paper, and no pillow cases. This was as bare bones as you can get. I don‚Äôt mind if a listing says you have to bring you own supplies but this one was misleading of what would actually be provided.
a Cut above the rest
Cozy country get away ... scenic Texas Hill Country near Austin ... if you want to get a bit off the beaten path but still be close to amenities, restaurants ... this might be just the spot.

Two words- stay away. Incredibly dirty and disgusting. I could never sleep due to the dozen roommates you will have PLUS the cheap mattress on which you‚Äôll feel every spring and the pilled linens. From the leaking refrigerator to the moldy shower curtains, to the dirty guy sleeping on the couch (cause who knows why he doesn‚Äôt sleep in his own room) these places are filthy. People will also steal your food and take your stuff from your room. Just. Stay. Away.

Kristine was great to work with. She responded to any questions we had promptly and check-in/out was a breeze; however, we were very disappointed with the accommodations. The furnishings were very limited. The small couch in the living room sat only three people comfortably. The bedrooms literally had just a bed with no other furnishings (except a random chair in the master). I had to put my CPAP machine on the floor.  It was advertised that the third bedroom had a double bed, but in fact only had a twin with a broken head board. The second bedroom's bed was very uncomfortable and caved in the middle.  The house needs a really good deep clean (lots of cobwebs, windows were filmy, and shower tiles had mildew). Overall we were very disappointed with the price we paid compared to what we received.

There are multiple great things about this home.  It's in a very quiet neighborhood.  The backyard is amazing.  The hammock, tree house for the kids, the fruit trees, the garden, and the roosters in the next yard added a nice rustic feel to the home.   We did not find any issues with the neighbors.   The pool did require daily skimming  due to the trees, which we did not particularly find problematic.  The pool was surprisingly cool, so we did end up paying the $200/day fee to heat, which did seem very steep.   There were, however, some issues.  The house is a bit worn and in desperate need of a coat of paint on the interior.  The home was clean upon arrival but not spectacularly clean (dust and some dirt on the floors).    There were no Sonos speakers on the inside or outside of the home as descibed.  When I contacted GuestSpaces, they informed us that a prior guest left a speaker in the rain and they were replacing.  They sent a very cheap speaker from Amazon the following day.   The biggest issue is that a sewer pipe was broken in the backyard and shooting "filtered" sewer water into the air and down the yard towards the pool.  It would happen intermittently.  We immediately contacted GuestSpace on Sunday.  They informed us that it was a known issue and that somebody was coming out on Monday.  They ultimately came on a Tuesday.   I explained my frustration that this should have been communicated up front (children playing in a yard with E.coli spraying into the air did not seem ideal).  Overall, communication was not great with GuestSpaces (sewer issue and the speaker) and detracted from our stay.  I think if GuestSpaces could step up their game and the owner addresses some of the issues in the home (paint, leak in ceiling above pool table, built-in seating in master closet is coming off wall, etc.), I would highly recommend.
