Very intrusive neighbor that stalks the property waiting to find a complaint. He definitely watches every door at all times of the day. Nice house but stress of neighbor ruins it quick. I‚Äôm sure that is his intention.

The location was great and it was very easy to get downtown. Unit was small but cute and had everything we needed. Our only complaint was cat hair in the unit (on kitchen plates) and we killed multiple roaches and ants inside the unit.

I'm sorry but I can't recommend going here during cold weather. There are 2 vents that pump in air from the outside into the unit. When the outside temp is below freezing the unit not very very unconformable. The host was unable to turn off these until the 3rd day then everything was perfect.

Otherwise the accommodation was prefect.

I had stayed 1 month, host was very accommodating, answered every question i had as fast as possible. My arrival date/time changed couple of times (due to covid19) and host helped me through it. Quarantined in this location for a month with no issues.

This ranks in the Top 2 Airbnbs I've ever stayed at. Rob is an incredible host, with some of the fastest communication turnaround times I've ever seen. He was so quick to communicate and give us guidance and recommendations, and we cannot thank him enough! His listing is immaculate and very cozy!

The house was rather sparse. If you just need a place to crash, this will be just fine. Although the bed on the floor was a bit odd.

Overall, it was fine.

Location is great, however the 7 foot ceilings make you feel cramped in the bathroom, ceiling fans that don't work and when the AC went out we were blamed for it (even though one of the tenants is actual HVAC engineer) and bad communication made this a place we do not want to go back too.

The location was excellentand the condo layout was excellent,however, there was some noise after 1000pm. The noise was above our condo and lasted after 1200pm. Messages were left for the on-site manager to contact me but he never responded.

Be advised that prior to entering the complex you will need to park on the street and go inside the complex to obtain the garage clicker. It was very difficult to find parking and we did not find parking until after 49 minutes.
If I had known parking was difficult I would have had less anxiety.


I paid 700.00 for two nights and would have been okay with this price but after dealing with the noise after 1000 pm and non responsiveness from the onsite manager I believe it was not worth the rate as the noise ordinance should have been enforced.
Please do not book this condo. It is misleading and a scam.

Ryan's place was what we needed in time of crisis. Although if you come with multiple vehicles, you may want them to either book somewhere else or find out about overnight parking on the streets since you only have one reserved parking. Comfortable stay though for our overall purpose.

The pictures depicted are not accurate. The condo is dirty and poorly maintained.
I would not recommend this location.

La Casita es estupenda. Sin duda repetir√≠a. Tiene la ventaja de que est√°s independiente y a la vez tienes a tu anfitri√≥n al lado.
Christian est√° siempre disponible para cualquier necesidad y responde r√°pido.
Eso si, si te molestan los ruidos hay una v√≠a de tren relativamente cerca. En nuestro caso hemos estado muy contentas y, sin duda repetir√≠amos.
The accommodations are very high quality. I would not hesitate to recommend.
Not the best stay for Austin, given the high price, it does not provide the quality you would want. Personally me and my friends dealt with a broken, pee stained bed, and it ruined my stay.

Colleen is such a doll! She is very communicative and provides amazing service! The only reason I didn't provide 5 stars is because the location isn't ideal. We experienced leaking water inside the studio and there was a vehicle parked illegally in the parking lot, which blocked my car.
decent place, unfortunately not near any bus stops and we didn‚Äôt drive. Lots of handy scooters were just up the road so we could get about

Toilet was broken and wouldn‚Äôt flush. Their wifi was non existent on both tv, laptops and phone. And when I tried to reach out to host I didn‚Äôt hear anything back. Also they have a electronic keypad which doesn‚Äôt work to lock the door so you definitely need to retrieve the keys to lock the door.

Needed maintenance attention. Toilet seat loose. No dispenser attached. ( only part)
Wifi was notvworking so no television.
Super 8 would have been better

Very practical and straightforward process. If you're looking for a temporal low cost place to stay, this location is perfect. It's close to several restaurants, coffee shops and a bus line that takes you downtown. Noise may be an issue but the practicality of this place outweighs this minor problem.
Very Austin at a price that will make you think you‚Äôre not in Austin! Great location and value!

The good news is place was as pictured and nice industrial modern updated feel. The bad news was awkward with owners personal dirty clothes and shoes in the closet as well as clothes in the dresser in the bedrooms. The TV did not get local channels to watch Football games or any live TV. The  walking distance to UT was longer and more challenging than looks on the map. Finally, Owner accused of us putting a hole in the island, which was shocking since no one in our family even sat at the island nor did we eat any meals in the house. We were very respectful of their home and belongings.This was a mature family outing with no alcohol and we did not appreciate being accused of damage or missing utensils that we did not do.

La casa de Michael es muy amplia y muy bonita, adem√°s de limpia.
Michaels es un gran anfitri√≥n y esta al pendiente de sus hu√©spedes.
El barrio es poco iluminado, por lo que no es muy accesible para caminar por la noche sin embargo en auto hay muchos lugares cercanos para cenar rico.
place is sick!

Not much nice to say. Andrew was more combative than hospitable. The room was not warm and relaxing. When I mentioned the room was cold he responded it use to be colder. The bathroom was shared with three men and was not cleaned regularly. The kitchen frequently had a sink full of dishes and not adhering to cleaning up after oneself. The ‚Äúbreakfast‚Äù is stale nuts and packaged oatmeal. Andrew needs to update his listing and improve his hosting game.

Will NOT stay at this place again. For many reason‚Ä¶. I do not like being accused of damaging an item that was not done during our stay. What‚Äôs weird is he asked for me to privately Venmo him for the cost and leave Airbnb out of it. Sketchy.
The place was pretty much what we expected. The accusations of smoking inside, then threatening to charge me an extra $75 was the only downside to an otherwise pleasant trip.
We have stayed in many AirBnB all over. This is at the top. Could not better happier. Enjoy.

Great location, plenty of hot water for 8 people, plenty of sleeping space for 10+ people,  if you bring an extra air mattress. The only downside is that the Air Conditioning is on a set schedule, so even if you try to lower it, it will bring the temperature in the house up again. We even thought the AC was broken at first. This is not a summer friendly home for that reason.
For the location and niceness, the house is a steal!

Great location, good access to scooters so you can ride them downtown. There was some existing minor damage (dents on the fridge, broken TV remote, etc), so I‚Äôd suggest documenting those when you check in to avoid potentially getting pinged for those issues.

I arrived at 7:45 pm (much later than the 4pm check in) and the cleaner was still there. She was rude and told me that Jay informed her that I may not show up until the next morning. She told me the owners had been there painting the walls a few hours before and she couldn't possibly get everything done on time. I went somewhere else for the night, and when I requested a refund, I was told that they were only 10 minutes delayed and would only provide $30.

The house is nice however location is horrible. Lots of trash ran down homes old trailers and campers including parts everywhere. It's like the house is in the middle of a junk yard. Lots of neglect and abandon homes in the neighborhood. In my opinion this should not be an Airbnb.

Nice little spot on the east side. Only complaint I had is the TV is broken and the shower head is terrible. Other than that, you get what you pay for and the host Colleen is nice and responded quickly to our internet issue.

Would stay here again.

It was a very terrifying and unprofessional check in. I got to the Airbnb around 10pm because I was celebrating my birthday. The code to the lock box was correct, grabbed the keys and unlocked the door. I peeped inside and there was a man in the bed and he was about as shocked as I was. At this point I‚Äôm terrified and had to find a hotel for my birthday weekend. Luckily I called Airbnb customer service and they said fixed everything. another thing is that getting ahold of the host was very frustrating. She wouldn‚Äôt  pick up my calls or texts until 2am.

The place is awesome and quiet! The only problem I had with this place is that the floors had not been swept and mopped and there was a not so fresh smell in the place. These are minor fixes, I would stay at Colleen's place again!

We were charged a 45 dollar cleaning fee. However when we arrived the apartment was not clean. Mold in the bathroom, pubic hair, and a kitchen that had dirt on the counter and table. Lastly the main bedroom was on the first floor with no curtains to cover the window so people could not see in.

Pretty decent stay! A little on the expensive side for what the place is, but I stayed for a month and didn't have any major problems. There are bug problems at times (I was greeted by a few dead roachies when I checked in and a few more later on) but for the most part things were okay.
Overall it wasn‚Äôt a bad experience the room was just not as clean as we hoped.

The location is fantastic for UT students and visitors. Amenda is warm and quickly responds to questions. The flat is old but generally well equipped. It is a bit inconvenient that there is no wash machine and cloth rack. The place is very quiet, but the indoor heater/air conditioner will be a little noisy.

upon arrival i was gutted by the state of this tiny house.

unidentifiable smears/stains all over windows, mirror, and icebox. window shade damage and stains.

alexa/iphone controls not functioning.

half-eaten tubs of ice cream in ice box.

cabinetry falling apart. chipped and worn finishes, drawers, and doors. stains and damage along wall.

mouth wash residue left in bathroom sink. calcium and hard-water build-up on sink handles and faucet.

unimaginable stains and stench on the mattress.

after a thirty minute inspection, i decided there wasn't a chance of me staying the night, and i checked out.
Don't stay it's not worth the money for sure at all. Not even to get to stay in a tiny home it was horrible.
A+ accommodation for my weekend trip to Austin. Couldn't have been happier!
Air conditioning works very well. Neighbors are quiet. For what you are paying it's hard to not love the space

Ask for outside pictures before you book. Spray painted ghetto building with drug deals and trash everywhere. They don‚Äôt spray for bugs, I have a picture with a spider, tick, and roach in the same picture on the entrance. No parking anywhere, you can barely drive onto the property. There‚Äôs broke down vehicles with smashed windows taking all the spots, I left, my girlfriend was terrified to stay there.

This is yet another Airbnb for the sake of being an Airbnb...meaning there's nothing special or extra effort taken. The experience might be different if it wasn't in a tourist city.
The WiFi works well and the table functions well as a workspace. Providing snacks is a nice touch.
The worn bed has a thick memory foam layer to compensate. AC works but loud. The shower curtain is moldy. The entire unit, especially the kitchen, is quite dated.
Someone knocked on the door 15min before checkout, which bothered me...pretty obvious the key is not in the lockbox and I'm still there.

As a fellow host, I get frustrated by listings like this and I might be a little tough. Some extra effort and attention to detail go a long way though.

BEWARE !!!

This was the worst experience I‚Äôve ever had with an Airbnb.

When I arrived the room door was completely open, the room was disgusting and no one was to be found.

I finally found someone and was told I would need to wait 30 minutes before the room would be ready.

Please note that it was close to if not 100 degrees outside that day.

After finally getting room, I was able to see just how nasty, grimy, old, and awful smelling the room was.

I tried to make it work but it was too gross, so I canceled the reservation and did not receive a refund.

This is your warning. It‚Äôs not what you expect.
Great house for groups - so much space and seating to relax and spend time together. Wonderful pool / deck space also but the mosquitos were bad during our stay :(

The place was very clean when we arrived! We had 6 people stay and only complaint is that the futon in the living room is not comfortable to sleep on. It is a futon though, so you get what you sign up for. There are places within walking distance for coffee in the morning or quick bites to eat.

It‚Äôs a shame that all of the windows need to be covered otherwise you‚Äôre looking directly at the owners unit. It‚Äôs a nicely layered out home, that‚Äôs clean yet very dark inside,

The coffee maker was broken but there‚Äôs was a one day response to replace. But by that time I had to go out and purchase a cup at the cafe that was nearby.

Everything worked, the neighborhood had lots of walkable places to eat. Late check in. I would say it‚Äôs priced correctly.
Floors aren't clean

I wouldn‚Äôt recommend staying here. Something I‚Äôve always enjoyed about Airbnb is that it feels like a home away from home. This unfortunately felt more like a motel. Colleen was very friendly but the place was dirty and uncomfortable. Although the apartment smelled clean upon arrival we quickly found a moldy shower curtain and a huge dead roach in the kitchen. The bed was extremely uncomfortable since it was only a mattress pad and not actually a mattress. We also had a hard time sleeping due to the very loud AC unit, the planes taking off and landing, and all the trucks driving early in the morning.

Fue un departmento funcional. Lo √∫nico malo fue la LAVANDERIA porque no funcionaba y nos trago el dinero.
Colleen dijo que devolveria 1 d√≥lar y 1/2 que la lavadora nos retuvo.
Finalmente, como nos retraso nuestros planes y la ropa ya estaba con detergente tuvimos que pagar 25 d√≥lares a la tintoreria para que resolviera el problema.

A very simple and accessible space that will get the job done at a semi-affordable price, only problem would be the insects can easily breach and make it there home via lots of  areas of entrance such as access points in the walls or the thin and loose window.

I booked last minute and found this place near the airport but I wouldn‚Äôt stay here again.  It felt dingy, run down and not clean. Nothing was plugged in (not even bedside lamps) and ended up ‚Äúcharging‚Äù my phone on an outlet that didn‚Äôt work all night.
It was ok. You get what you pay for.

Will strongly recommend not staying here. Strong ‚Äúhood‚Äù vibes. Bad location and neighborhood. This old building contains a lot to stay away from. Never stayed in such a bad and unkept property on Airbnb. Very disappointed from this booking. After arriving we asked for our money back without even considering sleeping inside. Pictures weren‚Äôt similar to reality and bad smells coming out from all over. Hair and dirt all over. Lack of parking. Bed is very low end. Located on main road with so much noise. No privacy. Very strong Motel vibe. Definitely not a recommended place to be sleeping in. Owner hasn‚Äôt sent back money for the stay after confirming he will.

Horrible. You‚Äôd do better camping in your car. Shower turns off mid-stream, spiders from the drain, upstairs neighbors can be heard stomping all evening and night, thanks to thin walls. Horrible location‚Äîdriving downtown (or anywhere you‚Äôd want to be) means traversing some of the worst road construction imaginable. $87 is a horrible, thieving price for this place.

Although Colleen is a very responsive host, the apartment itself is disappointing. It is inexpensive, which is good, but it is also old and somewhat rundown. It's decorated nicely, but the bathroom has broken items. Most distressing was the fact that it was listed as having 2 beds, but one of the "beds" was actually about 5 feet long -- much too small for a normal adult -- and not usable. (My son couldn't stay there as planned because of it.)
Parking was also not as good as expected - it had parking, but it was rarely available. It was also listed as near UT, but actually it was a significant distance away. There also was a strange smell in the apartment.

The price and pictures looked to good to be true. Once we arrived, there were only 2 parking spots left, when it says 1 car per unit. If you have a truck or a big car, it is very difficult to park.

Checking in was easy. The worst part was walking into the unit and smelling cigarettes. There was plenty of air freshners around to mask the smell, but it didn't work. All of our stuff stunk (suitcases, playpen, clothes, etc.). Sinks, toilet, and tub looked like they needed replacements. Comforter looked old. TV and internet worked fine.

The smell of cigarettes was so bad, we didn't stay with our baby that night. We cancelled that afternoon and only got a partial refund.

If you have a baby and/or kids, don't stay here. It's unhealthy. The price is great, but not worth it.
We got this place on the quick. Was ok sofa bed is very small and uncomfortable. Main bed is nice but the air con was very noisy. The pace could do with a lick of paint and cooker was dirty.

Was looking forward to a nice stay in Austin and was horribly disappointed. Parking was difficult, the lockbox was sticky, the curtains were stained and the kitchen looked unusable. Very outdated building. Did not feel safe or comfortable in the area at all and would not recommend to others, especially if a solo traveler.
Host went above and beyond to return some belongings I accidentally left.
No comments
You get what you pay for
Wrost place to stay. I found a live roach and a cricket. Gross. The host refused to refund me, after I abruptly left due to the disgusting nature of the place.

Rahul is a nice host, but unfortunately my partner and I were dissatisfied with the standard of the apartment. We decided to find other accommodations for the evening. Poor bedding, a moldy shower and a dark apartment building. I do appreciate Rahul's communication throughout.

Excelente atenci√≥n de parte de Mark, con anticipaci√≥n nos pas√≥ un mapa de ubicaci√≥n para que fuera mas sencilla la llegada. El acceso es muy sencillo porque tiene lock box con la llave dentro por lo que no hay problema con el horario de llegada. La limpieza fue impecable y a zona es muy bonita.
Sin pensarlo volver√≠a a quedarme en casa de Mark
Expect to stop at a supermarket to purchase what you will need in your way in.

The location was pretty central, walking distance to the university. The smart key system was easy to use, but I worried that we wouldn't be able to get in if my phone died. All the amenities were there: washer/dryer (outside), dishwasher, internet and access to netflix/hulu. The patio was much smaller than anticipated and there was only one chair. Bathroom was also very small but it was fine for a few days stay. The hosts responded quickly to messages and were very polite, I would stay again.

Arthur‚Äôs place was ok. We really liked the location very close to downtown. The only problems were that it was dirty, the place had dust and dirt on the floors, including food crumbs in kitchen area. Toilet bowl had mold inside. The top floor neighbors were very loud all night. This place is perfect for younger crowds. Not a relaxing spot!

Location was perfect! Arthur was very responsive when the WiFi wasn‚Äôt working (he changed the password without mentioning it to us). The apartment, though, was very dirty. There were some things in the trash cans before we arrived and there was toilet paper in the toilet (had it not been flushed??). There wasn‚Äôt much attention to detail. No dish towel and the cleaning sponge had been sitting on the bottom of the dirty sink cabinet. Towels were very old. Cabinets, doors and walls were noticeably dirty and grimy. Towels were clearly very old. We found an extra folded sheet in the bedroom cabinet that had old blood stains. Made me think that the bed that we were sleeping in wasn‚Äôt very clean either. Would have much rather spent about the same amount of money staying in a hotel.
Not as clean and maintained as we usually see with airbb. Noisy pipes at night. Only one small blanket for third guest.
You get what you pay for.
Great little spot in Austin! Close to downtown but also away from the craziness of the city.

When we arrived, the check-in procedure had changed, but we were not notified of this change and happened to find the key under the door mat. Additionally, we did not have running hot water in the sink (which I was asked to look under the sink to see if the water was turned off myself), none of the doors close appropriately, additionally the sofa bed was broken and had dirty sheets that were stained. We also found dishes that were not fully cleaned, with coffee stains and a half pot of coffee in the coffee maker.

We were disappointed to find the listing was not as advertised as it no longer had a smart lock, lights weren‚Äôt working, blinds were broken, and it did not feel clean. However, Arthur was very receptive and understanding, issuing a full refund for the inconvenience.
Ein sehr s√º√ües Appartement in guter Lage. Die Kommunikation hat einwandfrei funktioniert, genauso wie der Check-in.
The apartment was not quite what it looked in the photos. several outlets broken and no sheets for pullout bed

The location was convenient and relatively quiet. However the bathroom was not the cleanest and there was only 2 working lightbulbs in the apartment, making it dark and hard to move around.

Further, I arrived late and found the apartment unlocked. As a woman traveling alone, I found myself slightly nervous when entering the apartment.

Expect student accommodation quality. Location is a 20-30 minute walk from the city centre, north of the river.

The apartment desperately needs more lights. The bedroom had one dim lamp, so did the living room. Also, the extent to which the air freshener was used, it was literally suffocating.
This stay was nothing short of fantastic!

Don‚Äôt book here! Tawone notified me that this room I paid for wouldn‚Äôt be available 3 days before my trip after booking weeks in advance. I also had to call airbnb to formally cancel my reservation because Tawone didn‚Äôt take the time to actually cancel the reservation and prevent me from being charged! Book at your own risk, and have a backup plan if you do!

Bath towels had dirty stains on them. We had no idea there would be no TVs in the bedrooms which was a little disappointing and misleading from the photos since they only include shots of the beds. We had an issue with the toilet getting clogged which was resolved very quickly.
Gross!! The entire place smells like body odor. Dirty sheets and towel when I arrived. Was told to ch age the sheets myself. Do not stay here!!!

The check in was a self check-in, but unfortunately the other guest took the room I was supposed to be staying in. I ended up sleeping in the middle room with the twin size bed, which had dirty sheets and blankets. I was not provided a towel when I checked in. The kitchen was also dirty so I did not feel comfortable using it. The only good thing was the communication from the host, but it was quite limited due to language barrier. Luckily, I speak a little bit of Chinese and was able to ask for accommodations.
Can not fault, absolutely perfect.
Look no further pull the trigger if looking for a place in the ATX

The room was clean, and the location was decent. However, the AC unit in the room was disturbingly loud, and the bed was just uncomfortable, and the pillows were basically paper thin‚Äî it will guarantee you a sleepless night.
You can‚Äôt go wrong with Antonio‚Äôs place, it‚Äôs all as described and more.
Nice cozy home. Not too far from city so traffic isn‚Äôt too bad. Neighborhood is quiet.

I stayed Tashara's for 10 days. I was impressed that my room was clean the bathroom was spotless. That being said, Tashara's husband/co-host was a jerk to say it in the nicest way. He seemed to thrive on making every interaction as unnecessarily hostile as possible. I can only imagine how things would've turned out if Tashara did not step in times without number, to diffuse his drama.  I felt very anxious asking for simple things such as toilet tissue -after he took all the ones kept in my bathroom. On my last night, I begged to use their washer and he asked me why I can't walk down to some random laundromat away from their house. I could say more but no space to write. I would suggest he find another hobby bc hosting is not it.
Nice space. Area not too great.

This place is not as described, Peaceful and private. If you book this room make sure its what you want the host has a very bad attitude about rescheduling dates. Even if the circumstances are extenuating. Like the death of your father. The bed is very hard and pillows are old and flat.  You dont have control of the heat of room temperature, it was very hot. Theres a small window unit for ac which i had to use. I was very uncomfortable. The host seemed to walk pass the door when tv was in use or me and my guest talked or laughed. There was a room below with very loud guest and playing music well after the (9pm quiet time) that the host has posted in multiple area's.  Threw the night i heard more ambulances and polices sirens than i usually hear in the city. Overall a horrible nights rest, and not worth the money.
Book this place, you won‚Äôt regret it! Can‚Äôt wait to go back

Das Condo hat prinzipiell eine gute Lage. Das State Capital z. B. ist gut zu erreichen. Zu anderen Highlights wie der 6th street f√§hrt man gut mit dem Scooter in etwa 10 bis 15 Minuten.
Checkin und Kommunikation waren schnell und reibungslos. Der kostenlose Parkplatz ist auch super und sehr ger√§umig. Die Wohnung bietet jetzt keinen gro√üen Luxus, ist aber ausreichend. Ganz sch√∂n war die kleine Kaffeemaschine mit Filtern und Kaffe schon vor Ort.
Eins sollte man vielleicht noch wissen, die Wohnung ist im zweiten Stock und es gibt keinen Fahrstuhl!

Thank you for accommodating us on our trip to Austin. The location was great as was communication, security and check in. We found the fold out couch/bed needs to be replaced. Supplying 3-4 layers of foam indicates there is a problem, but it was not an adequate solution for sleeping, especially for an extended stay. It's not comfortable to sit on either. The Roku/ TV cut out inexplicably over and over, which was frustrating, and we couldn't get the dishwasher to run, even after we slammed it shut. We appreciated the snacks, coffee, bed and pillows, and the full length mirror, the lighting in the sink area, those were all great.
The water took about 3 or 4 minutes of running to get hot in the shower. We run an Airbnb ourselves, so I know that there is a lot to consider and implement. This is intended as constructive criticism, not as complaint.
Thanks again,
Kurt

Overall it was close to downtown and had a private parking spot which we appreciated and a working desk with reliable internet.
The unit was small and the bedroom and living room are essentially in the same space and there is only one set of windows on the wall by the window. The bathroom unfortunately did not have a fan or a window which often made the place smell not so great/feel humid.

Was a nice place, but was very hard to find because there were no pictures of the outside. Had to call Brett, but took a while to reach him. The code to get in was wrong so had to contact him again. Other than that the place was nice and would stay here again. Parking is right in front of the door.

The house itself is 5 stars, I highly recommend it. However, Airbnb had the wrong address! It was an extra 10-15 outside of Austin, making a huge difference in our trips to the city. Furthermore we had ordered things to this address. When I notified the host of this error she was extremely defensive and hostile. I was legitimately shaken following the conversation, she acted as if this wasn‚Äôt a big deal and me asking for compensation was a ‚Äúshake down‚Äù. I decided to back down and accept a lower amount just to get the convo over with and now I‚Äôve only received 1/5 of it.

The house was great myself and a couple guests found it to be comfortable and accommodating. We were a bit worried about the location at first but quickly found it not to be a problem. Would totally stay there again in the future if I was in town again.

Nous avons eu un charmant s√©jour chez Sam. La chambre est conforme aux photos et tr√®s propres. Des serviettes de toilette sont √† disposition et nous avons pu garer la voiture devant la maison. Nous recommandons vivement.

Sam ist ein netter Gastgeber. Wir waren mit dem Auto da und in Austin ist alles super easy mit dem Auto zu machen. Leider war die Unterkunft nicht sehr sauber. Im Bad lagen viele Haare und der Boden h√§tte definitiv eine Reinigung n√∂tig gehabt. Abgesehen davon war alles bestens.
If you want first rate hosts and a first rate Airbnb, look no further. You found it.
Jim y Deb son unos anfitriones increibles y el alojamiento es de lo mejor, no necesitas recorrer grandes distancias para conocer bellos lugarea y encontrar lo que necesitas. 100% recomendable.

Everything was how it was described and every convient for our reason for trip. It was our first time in Texas and we were not aware of big hill so we had a of trip for us. In general, it was really nice. There was a mini fridge, microwave, and a coffee maker, but no toaster.

Was in town for an event at the convention center and I could not have had a better place to stay. Convention center is a quick 3 block walk away, tons of food options on Rainey St.

I never met JT but responses were quick and check in was a breeze. The space itself is spacious and had all the amenities you could need.

Don‚Äôt expect a call communicative host.  We were going to be there for 3 nights and they had TWO towels and that‚Äôs it !! No hand towels or wash cloths so when I asked the host for some and complained he kicked us out of the unit.    Checkout my reviews as a renter - I am an excellent renter
I would stay here again. The location can‚Äôt be beat, but the host lacks in response so much it made me nervous.
Place is perfect but there‚Äôs no TV. But there‚Äôs a lot to do in Austin so you won‚Äôt be home a lot.

Couple of things:
1. The apartment is not on Congress like the listing says or used to say.
2. The apartment is on the third floor and the listing does not say that.
3. The parking is very inconvenient, long walk back to the apartment. Not convenient to unload and load your belongings.
4. I don‚Äôt think the host is allowed to Air B&B this apartment because he told us ‚Äú if someone asks tell them you are my friends‚Äù. So we where worried the whole stay that we might get kicked out.
5. The art work is not family friendly, so I had to take some of it down. This place is more for young single guy to rent.
6. The host wants you to clean even tho you pay a cleaning fee.
7. The extra linens for bed is stained and kinda gross.
This was our second time staying at Laura‚Äôs place and it did not disappoint! We love it there!
From the minute I walked in the door I didn't want to leave. This is my second stay here and I'll never stay anywhere else. If this place is booked I'll just cancel my trip to Austin!

Listing is deceptive. there was a snake on fire pit, pool was filthy, flooring had crackling-type noise and gave us sense of instability; receptacle bins outside were overflowing and unsightly; and not typical quality for Airbnb. Response from host was quick but belittling. She retorted snake was rubber and she could remove it for us. Staycation experience was ruined and embarrassing.

Es una excelente lugar para alojarse, donde puedes relajarte y disfrutar de la naturaleza en compa√±√≠a de tu pareja o familia. El anfitri√≥n siempre est√° al pendiente y listo para resolver tus dudas, sin duda muy recomendable para todos
The bathroom is LUDICROUS. Parking is a bit of a bear but that's not anything Anthony could control.

I want to start by saying‚Ä¶ you are renting someone‚Äôs house. The house were they currently reside. I have stayed in tons of Airbnb‚Äôs over the years and never had an experience as strange as this one. To start- the closets were filled with stuff. In fact, so full there was no space in the closets or drawers to hang or unpack our suitcases. The bathroom cabinet was filled with the owners items so there was no where to place our toilet trees. The only place we might have been able to place anything in the bathroom was behind the mirror but it was very dirty with rust and dead bugs. The frig and freezer were filled with food. Their mail and amazon packages were being delivered while we were staying there. The place had clearly not been cleaned by a professional as there was grim and dirt throughout the house, lightbulbs were burnt out in every room and the kitchen needed painting. For $350 per night, we had basically paid their rent while they went on vacation. On a positive note, the location was convenient although close to the highway so you could hear the traffic if you were sitting in the backyard. If you stay here, you don‚Äôt need to worry about packing a suitcase because you‚Äôll have everything you need from clothes and shoes toothbrush and toothpaste, food and drink, yoga mat and first aid kit, repair tools and kitchen supples. If you‚Äôre looking to travel light, this is the place for you. However, if you‚Äôre looking for something clean, well kept and well lit then I would keep looking‚Ä¶
Nate es un excelente anfitri√≥n, el lugar est√° muy limpio y c√°lido, sin duda volver√≠a a hospedarme aqu√≠
Nate is top notch. Don‚Äôt hesitate if you need a place to stay!
Don't rental this place. the whole place is needed to be clean. smelly pillows and bed. no bed sheet. towers on the floor in the bathroom. bad experience.
It is nothing short of excellent. Enough said

After another host cancelled our reservation 30 mins before check in, I had to quickly find another stay for my family and I. Jesse was quick to respond and allowed us to stay in their home with such short notice. Even offered a small discount for the inconvenience we experienced. This home was close to everything. 10/10

Dan and Lisa went above and beyond to make my boyfriend and I‚Äôs stay a memorable one. Not only did they provide a clean, private space filled with everything you could need, but they also gave us local, nearby spots to check out! This was our first time using Airbnb and we wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to book with Dan & Lisa on our next trip to Austin!

Be careful and check all furniture, because we laid down and a bed and it feel to the grown. Owner then request $550 for a new bed. When we moved the mattress that was beyond over weight for the frame, the frame had a screw that looked like it belong in a toy holding the frame together. And there were more broken bed in the garage showing a history of broken beds. Be very careful

Cleaning service still at the house two hours after check in time, upstairs shower leaked to the downstairs kitchen - Bien just told us not to shower so much. Food crumbs in our bed sheets. Kitchen disposal smelled so bad.
cannot say enough wonderful things about this property. didn‚Äôt want to leave!

Unfortunately my stay was a bad experience. No working air conditioning on the top floor which wasn‚Äôt good for the middle of the summer. The owner lives in a small house in front of the structure, eliminating privacy. As soon as we walked in we were greeted with loose dogs and were told we were early. We were, by 6 minutes. Pippa told us she would move her cars for us so we can park in front of the property, but she never did. Gave a very micromanaging vibe that jaded the sense of hospitality. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this stay nor return.

Tom was super accommodating with early check in & late check out. It‚Äôs a little small but has everything you need.  Information provided is accurate and he has tips for places to go in the neighborhood.  There can be some noise from the street, but it probably won‚Äôt bother you unless you‚Äôre a sensitive sleeper.

Tom was very prompt in his responses to any questions and the stay was hassle free. The room did smell of cigarette smoke even though there is a no smoking policy. This is probably from a past guest who violated the rule and Tom was very understanding when I informed him. We had no issues with parking and it was easy to find.

Be very cautious and carefully read the details when booking this listing. I thought I was booking for a 3B/3B but it turned out that I had to pay additional for the extra bath/living space. Also you will be charged additional fees after booking the place. The description says that you will be charged a 9% additional city fee, and this fee will be charged after you pay for the listing. This was actually very frustrating, since the host sent the request 2 days before my trip/check in. Try to coordinate this whole process sooner if you can, that way you won't be running around trying to sort out accommodations right before you trip. Outside from this, the place was just as described in the listing. The place is recently renovated and comfortably accommodates a large group of people. Centrally located in the city and easy to get around. Plenty of street parking so you don't have worry about parking issues.

Great location. Big space. Minor disappointments all over. Persistent fruit flies from a previous visitor. No blankets for the pullout sofa. No mop. No hand towel holders. Val said she'd meet us for check-in, but didn't. Overall, nothing that significantly detracted from our getaway trip for 10, but for the price paid it feels silly that these things were overlooked.

The location is great but the building and apartment itself is old. Beware that the bathroom may not be the cleanest. There is a spot above the shower head that looks like it could fall in at any moment and has black mold. The nozzles on the shower head are covered in junk making the water have a mold like smell.
The kitchen cabinets were dirty and sticky. There are minimal kitchen supplies. There are only 2 large knives, no cookie sheet, no new sponges, no foil or Saran.
We looked for cleaning supplies to clean some stuff ourselves but there is nothing. No broom, vacuum, disinfectant, tub & tile, not a thing. The only thing for cleaning provided is laundry detergent.
The beds are alright but slightly hard and uncomfortable.
Beware of the garbage dumpsters being emptied early in the morning around 6:30am right outside the bedroom windows and it is extremely loud banging around.
Completely out of the listers control but you will also here sirens all night long.
Overall I wouldn‚Äôt call this the cleanest place I have ever stayed and definitely not the best equipped. It worked for the in and out I did with the convention we were there for.

I typically don‚Äôt write reviews on Airbnb though we stay at them for a good third of the year since we travel so much. On the plus side was there were two bathrooms which have a sink and toilet in each and a shower that is shared. The beds were very comfortable and it was in a walkable location to 6th street and Rainey street.
It was disappointing that the apartment is not bright like it does in the photo. Windows are one side of apt which faces a high rise so there no sunlight that comes in and thus the apt looks really dark, dreary and depressing. The apt is very old and not well maintained at all. We had several issues during our 4 night stay. The morning after we checked in, we noted that the shower curtain and the liner was covered in mold and not just a small patch ‚Äì it was widespread, and the tub being narrow, you couldn‚Äôt help touching it while you are in the shower. I notified the owner and the response was he ordered a new one but it probably wouldn‚Äôt arrive before we left. I guess he hadn‚Äôt heard of amazon prime. Above the shower is a large patch of mold ‚Äì it looks like the upstairs may have had a leak in the past and the mold is bigger than my hand. The tv wouldn‚Äôt connect to cable, and we notified the owner early on day 2 and he responded that he would send someone over ‚Äì nobody showed up for a day and half so I emailed him next day and notified him of that and he stated that he had the cable provider do a remote reset. He had never informed us of it. The communication is a big problem ‚Äì the lack thereof. The tv was finally able to connect to the cable but then you couldn‚Äôt see the full screen or turn the channel ‚Äì we informed the owner and sent screen shots and no response. The bathroom mat was filthy so we had to wear slippers when using the bathroom, and whomever cleaned the apartment left a used kcup in the Keurig, so you can deduce the lack of cleanliness in this apartment. The kitchen cabinets are very old and water damaged and the interior looks really old as well. The toilet tank cover was cracked, and the outlet in the bathroom was moving all over the place and seemed unsafe to use. When you flush the toilet the entire time the tank is filling up you hear the most loud excruciating sound from the pipes so if you do use it when others are asleep its bound to wake them up. The straw that broke the camels back was that the electricity went out on us and their untimely response hastened us to leave a day early for other accommodations since based on previous communications from the owner, they were so untimely we didn‚Äôt want to wait indefinitely in the dark. We were informed the next day from the owner that the meter was tampered with and that energy was restored within 2 hours after I initiated communication with him again. There is such a total lack of urgency to respond on the owners behalf.

1. We didn't know where our garage spot was
2. We had no extra towels
3. The shower was super slippery, with not mats. My husband slipped and hit his head on the wall
4. My sisters car was towed, since we did not know our garage number. She had to pay $250 to get it out.
5. The neighborhood felt very unsafe. We were woken up throughout the night to the loud sounds of police and fire trucks
6. The condo felt dirty and needed some love and care
7. The bedding was awful and pillows were very thin
8. There was no extra blanket for the pull out sofa.

First off, Ryan is a very communicative host. He was quick to answer any questions I had and even sent someone to replace the air filter when I recommended it.

PROS:
1) Best location in Austin. Walking distance to 6th st, Rainey st, all of downtown, and even SoCo.
2) FREE PARKING. This is not common with Airbnb‚Äôs in DT ATX
3) Spacious apartment.
4) Great price for the location too!
5) very well functioning AC
6) Amazing host

CONS:

4) empty beer cans and cigarettes left on the patio, with cigarette butts

8) TV not connectable to Netflix/YouTube

If this apartment was a little more well kept I would bump this up to a 5 star but unfortunately it‚Äôs not very clean.

We have to give them a one-star rating. The place was cute, but the issues and their attitude definitely make it undesirable. Along with one star, please post the following:

"We were very disappointed in this residence. It was not ready for guests. The bedrooms had obviously just been painted, and the furniture had been taken apart and not put back together correctly or was completely out of place. The art work was on the floor, leaning against the wall. There were several broken items, including lamps and switch plates. The smoke detector was on a shelf, in a closet.
The bathroom counter and sink were not clean. The bathroom fan was hanging from the ceiling. The tub faucet was loose.
The sofa bed linens were skimpy - a lap blanket only.
There were cockroaches in both bedrooms and the bathroom.
There was a delay in contacting the property manager, which ultimately allowed them to deny any requested compensation other than a refund of $50 of our $60 cleaning fee.
Be warned!"
I was a bit disappointed to say the least and no response from host. Other places I‚Äôve stayed at take their business serious. This was not one of them.

The duplex is not in the best neighborhood. Driveway and parking is awful. You are sharing with the other duplex next door. Construction going on next door. Beds are awful and falling apart. You will not get any sleep. We ended leaving rental after first night and moving to a hotel room elsewhere. It was also very dirty.

Mattresses are incredibly uncomfortable. Bed was broken upon check in, however we were notified by host an hour before check in. Handyman didn't fix the bed until 7pm and left the bed dirty. We notified the host as soon as we saw the bed dirty. He stated there were clean sheets in the closet and to change them ourselves. I highly would not recommend this airbnb for future stays. Driveway is uneven and not shown on pictures for a reason.

We would not book again. Both of the beds were broken and uncomfortable. The handyman was sent out twice during our stay to fix the bed but were only temporary fixes. When we first arrived the apartment hadn‚Äôt been cleaned from the previous tenant due to a miscommunication with the cleaning crew so we had a 3 hour late start. The host was quick to respond which was nice, but overall was not worth the price.
Due to unforeseen circumstances we did not get a chance to stay.

The stay would‚Äôve been great if there wasn‚Äôt cockroaches!! Scared the crap out of me & my bestfriend at 12am seeing one in the sink & in the kitchen & another run cross the living room floor 40mins later! I messaged the owners & they are aware of the problem. Once the problem is fixed the place will be great!

It was a very bad experience. The house smelled horrible, it was an unbearable smell. Very uncomfortable beds, bad mattresses, they sag in the middle. The sofa bed had blood stains on it, really very unpleasant. We paid 2 nights, I asked for a refund of 1 night because we were no longer going to sleep there, the smell was unbearable, and the owners of the house had no opening. Very ugly that they are like that.

Yes it‚Äôs affordable but few things prevented us from enjoying our stay. First, the smell in the place. Hard to tell what it is. Something unpleasant. As if a cheap perfume has been used to cover up old smells from previous guests.
Second, the dead cockroaches to be found in numerous location in the apartment.
Third, the tub. Very tired.
Fourth, the pantry. Filled with empty stuff. Th√© coffee bag was empty. The cooking oil bottle was empty, etc etc.

Check in was a bit of a hassle. The original code given was incorrect. Reached out via Airbnb messaging and received a response relatively quickly but was given a couple more incorrect codes - one even for the unit next door. Immediately upon entry the unit smelled like cigarettes and continued to smell like it for the duration even after trying to air it out. Cleanliness was below average. A lot of dust and dirty floors. The beds were not comfortable whatsoever. I slept on the king bed and it was essentially a mattress topper on top of a wooden plank. Your back will hurt after sleeping on it. We had turned the AC on. It was a modern AC unit, the one you can control from your phone and it kept being reset to 80. We had planned on leaving by the stated check out time, 11:00 but as we were getting ready to leave the cleaning person came and it was around 9:45‚Ä¶we felt rushed to head out because she was hanging around the property just waiting. All in all, I wouldn‚Äôt stay here again. Was on par to staying at a shady motel 6.
They were great hosts! I did a bad job of communicating because of life and they were still patient with me. The only con was that the picture in the living room was scary when I took my glasses off.

The house was quiet and clean, close to restaurants. It is not close to downtown (about 25 minutes) but it worked for us since we just needed a place to stay for one night and had our at to get us around. The only negative was that we were 3 people and since there was only 1 queen bed, we were asked if we needed an air mattress, to which we said yes. Unfortunately, when we arrived the bed on the floor was not an air mattress but a duvet on the floor... so that was not the best sleep. I would not recommend the stay for more than 2 adults in this case.  We did not get to meet our host in person but communication was good and his parents who were there when we arrived were welcoming.
10/10! Don‚Äôt hesitate.

were in the subject apt.

Just as described. There was plenty of amenities from snacks to pots and pans. Parking is limited to one spot per room but there is plenty of street parking.

I‚Äôll start by saying that Colleen herself was lovely and replied quickly. Check in was easy and she had a welcome basket with snacks and a folder of places to eat and go so that‚Äôs sweet. The location is in a not so great neighborhood but we didn‚Äôt have any problems. I will not stay here again, however, because of the AWFUL ROACH PROBLEM. We killed at least 5 roaches in the ONE night we stayed there. Colleen was quick to apologize but after reading the rest of the reviews I realized that this issue has been going on for months but apparently hasn‚Äôt been solved. Parking was also awful. A few cars had parked in the back and I couldn‚Äôt move my car! There was no room to back out. Maybe if I didn‚Äôt have a van, a compact car would fit. I had to wait until someone left to be able to leave or else I would have hit someone‚Äôs car. Over all I did not have a pleasant experience and would have been happier paying the same amount for a hotel room. I understand that some older places have bugs but this place has a problem.
This place was infested with bugs and roaches. It made the stay very uncomfortable.

Reeked of cigarettes and mold upon walking in. There was also a hole being dug in the ceiling of the bedroom by some kind of rodent, which had a dust pile on the floor below it. Also, very obvious the sheets weren't cleaned when you see several hairs (not yours) upon opening the blanket. The location has literally nothing around it, and due to road construction in the area, a major pain to get around.

We only stayed here because our original AirBnB was canceled due to a tree falling on it.  This place ended up being $25 more a night than the previous one and it was not clean, the stove didn‚Äôt work at all so we couldn‚Äôt cook and there were so many sounds at night to keep us awake. If staying for a while - not worth it as you are taking the risk of not being able to use kitchen appliances.  It was also not relaxing.
Pictures were very misleading

If you require a place for rest and relaxation, you may want to consider another option because the walls in these apartments are very thin. You can hear the neighbors. I checked out early and sought accommodations elsewhere.

Also, I do not suggest parking in the property lot as the space is very tight and my car was involved in a hit and run with considerable damage from another tenant or property maintenance staff. The photos for this place were misleading. They make this apartment seem nicer than it is. When you walk in it looks like an old apartment that someone tried to fix up. All of the cabinets and finishes do not look as nice in person. The apartment smells like someone smoked in there at some point even if it was years ago. We found roaches in several rooms. The beds were not very comfortable and the fitted sheets kept coming off while you slept. I ended up sleeping on the waterproof mattress cover. The biggest issue was the a/c. It was over 100¬∞ outside when we got there and the window units were not turned on. I asked the host if she had issues with it. She answered very quickly. It worked for a little while and then it would not get below 80¬∞. No one even slept in that room because it was so hot. place was not clean, we did not end up staying there. Seller responded quickly but refund is taking a long time.

We had high expectations for this property called a ‚ÄúBeautiful Austin home‚Äù. Unfortunately, it did not live up to the cleanliness standards we have come to expect from Airbnbs. Si deseas realizar una estancia en Austin, en especial cerca de la UT, no encontrar√°s un lugar mejor. su ubicaci√≥n, confort y extraordinaria hospitalidad hacen de la casa de Al√ßir un lugar excepcional. No surprises with this property.  Everything was in order.

First of all, the place is just as charming as described.  There are lots of personal touches in the decoration that show lots of care and thought.  I especially appreciated all the bathroom extras (like hair ties and bobby pins).  Check in and out is very easy.  The area is easily walkable to some restaurants and a quick Uber away from downtown and the airport.  Unfortunately, I had an awful reaction to the sheets.  Any portion on my face that touched the pillowcase broke out in hives after the first night.  While I do have sensitive skin, this has never happened to me before in an Airbnb or a hotel.  I was able to get control the reaction by the third day by loading up on allergy medication, hydrocortisone cream, and covering the pillow with my own clothes, but it made it difficult to sleep because I was anxious about my clothes shifting and exposing the pillowcase.  It was very uncomfortable and itchy. So heads up if you have sensitive skin or are allergy prone! Also, the internet was a little slow to the point where running multiple tabs caused it to run very slowly.  This was hard when trying to compare multiple restaurants and such.

We had a mixed experience staying at this property. While in general we had a good stay, there were a number of issues that would have us question whether we would stay at a Renters Club property in the future.


1) While the listing states that the house sleeps 16, six of the beds are unacceptable, crammed into two tiny rooms in the windowless basement, down a set of stairs that I doubt meet Austin building codes. I also doubt that the rooms themselves are permitted under Austin building codes.

2) The kitchen is poorly equipped for groups of 16. One cutting board, no vegetable peeler, minimal cooking utensils, no cookie sheets, just to name a few. The wine cooler does not work.

3) Much of the furnishings are tired. The outdoor patio furniture should have been retired years ago. The table and chairs on the upper balcony are not outdoor furniture. Several of the mattresses were sagging. Much of the furniture scattered throughout looks like it came out of grandma's attic.

4) During our stay we contacted our concierge at Renter's Club to report that there were no kitchen towels and that the two rolls of paper towels made available to us had been used, and asked if there was a "stash" we could access. The report we got back -- that the company policy was two rolls per rental, and that we should use hand towels from the bathrooms in the kitchen -- was a joke. Seriously, two rolls of paper towels for 16 people for 5 days?

5) The trash was not emptied once during our stay, and was overflowing onto the ground by the time of our departure, providing delicious treats for the property's chipmunks. There was a can of trash (not ours) on the first floor balcony the entire time of our visit.

If you are looking for a luxury rental, this is NOT IT.
1. THIS IS A SHARED SPACE. There is someone living in one half of the property that shares a wall with the living room and had 3 rooms w windows DIRECTLY OVERLOOKING THE POOL. This is NOT a private space. There were cars in and out of the driveway the whole weekend that were not ours.
2. This was probably the most disappointing Airbnb I‚Äôve ever booked. This place is 100% for bach parties and that‚Äôs it. It‚Äôs very outdated and dysfunctional. This is a frat house, not a luxury rental.
3. Everything in this place is dilapidated or does not work.
4. Wine fridge does not work.
5. Blinds dont work in many of the rooms or there just aren‚Äôt blinds at all.
6. Fridge is not cold and for some reason they turn the ice machine off between guests so there is no ice.
7. Patio table on porch is just a metal frame.
8. Upstairs patio furniture is indoor dining chairs.
9. Dishwasher broke during our stay.
10. Kitchen has plates cups bowls but not much for cooking and minimal essentials. For example, hand soap, no dish soap.
11. Living room furniture has broken legs
12. Beds are mattresses w no box springs and therefore sagging.
13. Grill was not working as it appears it set the wall on fire. There was an additional propane grill that was not clean.
14. Check out instructions were very specific about trash however exterior trash cans were completely full.
15. Pool trash can was fill of someone else‚Äôs pizza and beer.
16. Lighting is dingy and horrible.
17. View is nice but would never stay here again and would not recommend.

I had to cancel this reservation!

The place was very uncomfortable and a complete mess upon arrival. With the help of AirBnB, I was able to get a refund. The room is ‚Äúclean‚Äù if you don‚Äôt mind a stained room. The rest of the house was cluttered and sink filled with dirty dishes, walls falling apart and dirty floor. Not recommended.

so, lemme preface this by saying that I get no pleasure from criticizing these people as they were generally... okay... so, first and foremost, you are going to be staying in a 3 bed, 1 bath with an elderly couple. they would bicker like old couples do and you can hear every syllable of it distinctly, though not understand as they speak taiwanese. when I first arrived I asked for a mug to make tea in and was informed they had no mugs. it took them several days to go to the store to get one. the top of the fridge is incredibly dusty. the broiler on the stove is filled with insulation and debris. they keep all their pots and pans in the oven. no toaster. if you want to toast bread you can either take your chances with chemical exposure in the broiler or take all the pots and pans out of the oven then put them back when you're done. also, the sink in the bathroom is infested with ants. for 900 dollars for a month it was acceptable, I suppose, but I wouldn't want to pay more than that...
If your looking to sleep this is the place there kids banging and screaming and blenders going off at 4 am also you might get locked out horrible time

Overall the air Bnb was great. Very clean and check in was easy. Location is close to plenty of things to do. There was really only one issue and I‚Äôm not sure if this is as a freak occurrence or something others need to be wary of, but our car was broken into (windows smashed) while it was parked in the spot designated in the reservation info.
As far as we could tell nothing was stolen, so maybe someone came out and scared the perpetrator away... unfortunately we had to spend the last day of our trip dealing with getting the car windows repaired and it‚Äôs quite difficult to discount this occurrence when thinking about our stay. I guess be careful and don‚Äôt leave valuables in your car overnight no matter where you stay!

I am extremely dissatisfied and upset with this air bnb experience. The shower had no water pressure for hot water, the host's dogs barked off and on for hours at night, the house (I assume the HVAC system) was incredibly loud, and the hosts themselves were very loud just on the other side of the door as well as made stomping sounds in the room above us.

Things went south pretty quickly with this host. My husband was looking for ice for drinks so looked in freezer directly outside our entry door. Host was very upset with his ‚Äúdigging‚Äù through private freezer. How would we know? It was right outside door of our room. She was nice enough to get some ice for us. I thanked her but told her we were unable to use as there were no glasses in the room. She got very upset that they had gotten ice when we had no glasses. I believe she knew there were no glasses in the room as she then told me we should go to store down the street to buy. We had called for a Lyft ride. Driver was down the street waiting and I couldn‚Äôt get door locked. I was notified he was ready to leave so called host to see if she would lock door. She said she would. I walked down driveway so driver wouldn‚Äôt leave. She called to me from top of driveway (room in back of house end of driveway). Wanted me to come back to lock door. Since she was there for that purpose told her we had to leave. She told me to come back so she could show me how to lock. I told her we had to go and would figure it out later. She later texted me upset that I was leaving room unlocked. However, I saw her at top of driveway, she spoke to me and had come to lock the door so I figured all was well. If I was going to leave place unlocked I would not have called her in the first place. As it was she was standing near the doorway as we left and she had said she would lock. When we got back late that evening, I figured out how to lock door and texted that information to her so she wouldn‚Äôt worry about the place being unlocked. I also told her in the text that the room was still cold (near midnight) and she said she turned up the heat around 6. At that time she texted and asked if temp was okay but we left right after that. She was very upset that I texted her late at night. I was not expecting a response at that hour. Was just letting her know that it hadn‚Äôt warmed up so she could kept that in mind for future guests when the weather is chilly. On a minor note, there was no hairdryer in the room as listed but that was promptly remedied. We had to put our suitcases on the floor as there was no place to sit them. Light was very minimal with a dimly lit table lamp and overhead fan light. Certainly not enough light to read. Overall a very unsatisfactory and disappointing stay. I felt I was being yelled at with every text response. I honestly have never had such an experience at an Airbnb.
Stylish and country at the same time. Spacious and clean at the same time. Backyard is to die for!!

The place is just ok. It‚Äôs next to a busy street so very noisy. The place is a little run down and a lot of the furnishing are pretty worn and beat up... didn‚Äôt live up to the pictures or the price. Also there were lots little dirty spots that didn‚Äôt seem to justify the cleaning fee.

If all you want is a flop house to come back and sleep in after getting drunk in Austin, this is for you. If you want a comfortable, clean space to relax in, look elsewhere.  The home looked great in photos, but as soon as we pulled in it was obvious the photos were misleading. The gate leading to the "front" door to check in was rusted out and laying on the ground. We had to step over it every time. Almost every cabinet door in the kitchen was broken and dirty, all of the cabinets were empty and lacked even the most basic supplies. There was a single towel hook in the bathroom, for a home with 7 beds this is bizarre at best. This AirBnB is clearly run by a company that does not care about the guests experience. I've never regretted an experience more that this one. It was truly awful.
Mold in the bathroom, bedroom windows nailed shut, bugs and very dirty on Checkin. Location is not as advertised.
Si viajan en un grupo no mayor de 4 a Austin, les recomiendo este alojamiento, les va a encantar, es muy acogedora, limpia y centricamente ubicada.

Not a pleasant Airbnb experience. As soon as we walked in, the entire unit reeked of smoke. We booked this place because it's listed as an Airbnb Plus, hoping it would have higher standards. When we asked the host, they stated that the previous guest had smoked inside the unit. The host was aware of this but chose not to inform us and didn't do anything to get rid of the smell before our arrival. The host was slow to respond and refused to refund the entire amount we paid even though we could only stay for 15 minutes because the smell was too overwhelming. Had to escalate the case to Airbnb in order to get a refund.

Voor een Airbnb Plus zijn de verwachtingen wat hoger dan normaal. Wij zijn daarom ook teleurgesteld in ons verblijf. De eerste (van twee dagen) dag was er een lekkage waardoor wij geen gebruik konden maken van de douche, was machine of wat dan ook met water te maken had. Er werd een loodgieter gestuurd om het probleem te verhelpen maar die kon niks betekenen dus moesten we maar wachten tot de volgende dag. Uiteindelijk hadden we de ochtend erna pas weer water.

De tweede dag hoorde we een apart geluid in de woonkamer, wat kakkerlakken bleken te zijn, extreem smerig.

De airco werkt erg goed. Echter maakt hij dusdanig veel kabaal dat je niet een fatsoenlijk telefoongesprek kan voeren in de woonkamer.

Een van de omringende huizen heeft een Haan die om 07:00-11:00 dusdanig veel kabaal maakt dat je niet meer kan slapen.

Het bed was redelijk ver doorgezakt en maakte veel geluid als je rustig bewoog. Lag daardoor niet comfortabel.

Al met al zeker geen positieve ervaring dankzij bovengenoemde zaken. Misschien waren onze verwachtingen te hoog maar een Airbnb Plus is niets voor niets een ‚ÄòPlus‚Äô woning.
Great place! Only complaint I really had was WiFi was sketchy and the fire alarm kept going off one night

Although in a tad lower middle class neighborhood and the houses were close together, the Airbnb was in GREAT proximity to downtown (about 4 miles), VERY convenient. Upon entering, it was VERY inviting, updated, clean, and the beds were VERY professional made! However, we soon learned that both beds were VERY noisy and the king bed was the most uncomfortable bed we have ever slept in. In bed, we started rolling towards each other in the middle. We lifted the mattress and found it to be on slats (not box springs) and there was a broken slat in the middle. (We didn't want maintenance to come at that hour, as we were already in bed.) So, we tried 1 across the top/1 across the bottom. Then, the neighbor's dog started barking outside nonstop for 15 minutes. My husband moved to the living room floor with just a sheet from the king bed (no extra bedding). The dog started up again at 4:40am, along with a rooster crowing from another neighbor's.
VERY NOISY, VERY UNCOMFORTABLE! NOT RECOMMENDED

We had really high expectations for this stay after reading all the reviews and the fact that it was an airbnb plus. We have been on a 60 day road trip staying in over 17 hotels / airbnbs and this was by far the worst.

Before we checked in Austin Vacay sent us a long list of instructions and rules and tried to sell us early/late check in. We hadn't seen anything that extensive before, but thought it was something airbnb plus listings may have, this was our first airbnb plus stay.

Overall we had issues with parking, wifi which was unusable, the place smelled like mould which was overcoming by the final day, all the furnishings and the walls needed maintenance as things were scratched and broken, and the rooster crowed day and night. We were so uncomfortable we ended up leaving a day early and found other accommodation.

Would really advise that Austin Vacay do some maintenance on this property and some kind of inspection.

Everything was fine until we came home on our second day and couldn‚Äôt get inside because the entry code had changed without notifying us. We ended up finding a window that opened and were able to climb inside. Overall, it was a major inconvenience.

My friend and I abandoned a filthy air BNB condo near the University and resorted to Colleen's ad. The booking and contacts with Colleen was seamless. I didn't any issue finding the apartment as clear instructions were given. Colleen also has a booklet left on her kitchen table with local tips which helped us because we were tourists. The area isn't the best but it's doable. I would not mind booking there again.
very small spaces. all the dishes were dirty and we had to clean upon arrival.
Really sucks
Stay here at your own risk.  Place is in extremely poor condition with more issues than I can mention.  Not a safe area either.

This place was not what I was expecting when I saw the photos‚Ä¶unfortunately, it had a strange smell and clearly people smoke outside due to the huge amount of cigarette butts outside of the apt. The area didn‚Äôt feel too safe either. The apt itself was much smaller than pictures, very outdated, needs maintenance, sofa had crumbs and our bed had some mysterious stains on it..the AC in our room was incredibly dirty on the inside and when we turned it on it smelled so bad, especially moldy so we had to keep it off. The pulls on the bathroom cabinet drawers were rather loose/broken and the kitchen drawers were hard to open and were old. Kitchen wasn‚Äôt inviting to use . Bathroom didn‚Äôt have the vents working so it was always hot in there. If you need a place to stay for one night maybe you can stay here, but I wouldn‚Äôt do more than one or none...

The apartment does not match the pictures. There was mold on the shower curtain. As soon as we walked in we were surprised by lots of flies all around the apartment. We had to buy cleaning supplies to remove the odd smell that lives in the apartment. Also the tv does not have any channels. I would not recommend it. I personally feel like the apartment overall is overpriced for the quality of the property.

Check in was easy but my family and I stayed for 6 days and we only had 2 towels and 1 roll of TP. I asked for a refill of TP on day 1 or 2 and it never arrived. The place also has a weird musty smell and had small spiders and roaches around the kitchen and bathroom area.

Disappointed in this stay‚ÄîI don‚Äôt like leaving negative reviews, but this place was probably the moldiest / smelliest Airbnb I have stayed at unfortunately.

It reaks of cigarettes, there are flys and little bugs all over the place. There is mold, dust, and dirt on corners walls and appliances. I honestly don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs been fully cleaned in a long time.

Nice host who provides water bottles and snacks, but I do not recommend this place‚Äîit‚Äôs not hygienic.

Her building is too old to live, the paint could not cover the smell and the oldness. I don't want to say bad words about others, but I regret to book her place and prefer to sleep in my car than staying there. I booked 2 weeks at $35/night, but after I unlocked and stepped in, I decided to cancel and left the place untouched. But she charged me $72, so I lost more then $100 just to step into her place. Search Google map for her apartment named The Bolm at Austin, you will find more genuine comments.

I hate leaving bad reviews. The place itself was just ok, but I pretty much walked in and right back out as I knew I would not be able to sleep (very loud argument taking place in an adjacent room where it sounded like something was thrown against a wall) and the patrons hanging out had open containers drinking and smoking as you walked past them. I did not feel safe, so I cancelled my reservation and went elsewhere. I‚Äôm out the money, but learned my lesson to read all reviews.
Sch√∂ne saubere Unterkunft mit einem guten Bett und alles was man braucht. Die Gegend war sch√∂n ruhig. Ich hab mich wohlgef√ºhlt.

I'm sad to say that this was one of my worst experiences. The place has a bad atmosphere, dirty, cockroaches, hair on the bed, the kitchen has several old stains, dirty bathroom, other living and dead bugs. I couldn't stay here. I left and it all became a bad experience to find another better option.

The overall apartment looked much older than pictured. It is as if they used photos from first move in and have owned the place for many years -- the place has much more wear and tear than pictured. The tub is also extremely old and scratched up and the bottom lock does not work on the door (which I was never informed about prior to check in and ended up getting locked out of the apartment). The host did answer my phone call informing how to get back in the house, but the method she described took us about 15 minutes to open the door. Multiple dead bugs were also found around the apartment. The place is not unlivable, but it definitely needs to be listed more accurately and more information needs to be disclosed to guests.

Overall our stay was fine and the host was welcoming and communicative, but I wouldn't recommend staying there unless you are trying to save money. You could tell no one really lives in the apartment, it has only the basics. Beside that it wasn't super clean when we got it and the kitchen was not the most functional. Other than that our stay was fine, but again, not great.
No heat!

The beds were pretty rough, they didn't have support in a lot of spots. When we investigated, we saw that the wood beams had been duck taped in some spots while others were just left broken. Both the spots that were just taped and the ones left broken would sag leaving absolutely no support.

Along the lines of broken things, the TV in the bedroom had the sketchiest base which made us feel nervous that we'd break it if we got too close and it moved the wrong way. additionally, there was absolutely no remote for that TV which was an additional inconvenience.

Aside from the indoor experience, the outdoor stairway up to the apartment was brutal and was extremely dangerous. After it had rained, the material that is deteriorating on the inside of the stairs leaves a dangerously slippery residue on the bottom of your shoes to the point that my girlfriend and I had almost slipped and fell multiple times.

Overall, all this place really has going for it is that it's located in Austin but a fairly meh part of Austin. Definitely would not stay again for the price we had to pay.
This place is very disappointing
Expect an exceptionally clean place with unique decoration but no tv, pots or pans, WiFi, and no microwave

I don't recommend it, canceled with me when I was already inside Uber on the way home, I was totally helpless both by the host and by the Airbnb support which was terrible, made me wait for 6 hours and they didn't help me find another place I had to get a hotel in the booking and pay 3x more because it is in the last minute!  I don't recommend the Host, and I hope that no one needs the support of Airbnb, because they are terrible and besides not being of any use, they make you wait a long time for a solution that never came!  terrible!  I recommend looking for another service!

Tim's place was very dirty and disorganized. It looked as though there was absolutely no attempt to clean up before we arrived. Food crumbs all over the counters, used tupperware, dirty clothes tossed into random corner in closets, chewed gum on the windowsill. It was like a frat house. I really wish he would have hired a cleaning service or done the bare minimum to clean the place before we arrived. Half the lightbulbs were out, broken doors.... I could go on. But the worst part was the lack of WIFI even though it was listed as one of his amenities and then the complete lack of communication for the remainder of our trip after we asked about it. Tim said he'd work on the WIFI but then screened our calls for the next 3 days until it was time to check out. I would have left a moderately negative review if it wasn't for Tim's lack of communication. If you want to check in and spend 2 hours cleaning in order to make this place livable, then rent it. Good location and 2 bedrooms, but that's about it.

Nothing but good vibes and no less than 3 great spots to stoop. My homies and I did nutin but boolin. If your looking for a place to park your ass for the day and down some mickeys and old English look no further.
It is within student living apartments so it's just really hard to find.  I had to wait 15 minutes to find my Uber as there were over 30 apartment buildings.

Looking at other reviews, perhaps we came at a bad time. However, for us, the room was very dirty when we arrived. The floor in both the bathroom and the bedroom wasn't clean there was dirt and some rappers lying around. The sink had hair in it and one of the towels left for us was dirty and damp. Also the bed sheets did not seem like they had been recently clean. Additionally, finding parking was incredibly difficult. Overall, it wasn't terrible but it was not worth what we paid.
Host is great, place is clean, but....heavy smell of cigarette smoke.  Very bad.  Would not recommend if this is an issue for you.  Was so bad my clothes took in the smell in one night stay.
Get the place.. you won‚Äôt regret it!

Julie was prompt in answering texts and fast about providing paper towels and toilet paper.
Close to I-35, restaurants and The Domain.
Older home but nicely remodeled, big back yard, 2 bathrooms but couldn‚Äôt use one of the toilets because of a bad leak.
CONS: visibly accumulated dust on fans and door frames; so much so that my allergies started acting up. The oven had so much grime at the bottom that it started smoking and the whole house smelled terrible so we had to do a quick clean before using it again but it continued to smell bad. Has a garage but is not accessible to guests. Not the best neighborhood, but relatively quiet overall.

The foundation of the house has a lot of cracks in the ceiling and holes in the wall , while cooking the kitchen lost power numerous times the restroom toilet didn‚Äôt flush properly and kept stopping up the oven was missing a knob at first I had trouble starting it and then realized it wasn‚Äôt plugged up cabinets were missing knobs there were no instructions as far as how to work dishwasher /tv no washing amenities available like bathing soap only shampoo and conditioner, there were also only large drying off towels but no small wash towels available I had no access to the backyard and check in response was slow/ delayed communication was poor between host and I with house issues

The stay was ok absolutely nothing special about it. Oh wait yes there was. We found a special bloody surprise on two of the beds. It may not have been huge blood stains but very noticeable stains. We got new sheets but that‚Äôs when we found nasty bugs in the sheets. There was dried up food crumbs on the stove (we didn‚Äôt cook). The second bathroom the knob to turn on the water was broken when we got there. The place may look nice in the pictures but it‚Äôs not clean at all. I got charged $100 for a cleaning service that clearly showed it was never cleaned. Wont be staying here again.
