The house was exactly as described and easy to find.  We decided to book at the last minute to avoid bad winter weather and visit friefs in Austin.  Julie was very accommodating and we were able to get in a little early.
The place gives you a unique experience .... I really enjoyed the disconnect ...  no tv...  perfect..
stay here right now. drop whatever you‚Äôre doing and stay here.
Incredible Stay! Don‚Äôt miss out!

If I could give this place 0 stars I would. First of all, we messaged Tracy the early morning of our trip to confirm our stay and once we landed in Austin, we saw that there was no reply from her. We gave her the benefit of the doubt and went to the Airbnb at 3:10pm (check in was 3pm) and the door to the location was open! Then as we entered the whole place was dirty as if the tenants before us just left and no one cleaned up after them. There were NO bed sheets, dirty laundry piled up and trash bags full with trash in the trash can. We messaged and called Tracy with NO response whatsoever. Then we called Airbnb customer support who ended up helping us find a new stay after 4 hours! We went to a Starbucks with our luggage and stayed there for 4 hours until we got a new place to stay. Mind you we had just flown in from LA and were tired as is and so this just started our whole trip on the wrong foot. Please stay away from this place and this host. She doesn't respond and is unprofessional.

Tracy was initially great with communication until the end of the stay.. I was charged $50 for a 15 minute late departure as she said she didn‚Äôt receive communication about the need to stay a bit late.. the late departure was beyond my control (I was in town for an interview) and she made it impossible to compromise on a departure time anytime past 11am. She completely ignored my request and then said she didn‚Äôt consent.. because she ignored it. She did not allow for ANY flexibility and that was terribly disappointing.

I was also accused for my dog ruining her draft stopper. 1st my dog was in a travel kennel when I wasn‚Äôt there and with me the entire time I was there. My dog didn‚Äôt chew up anything. 2nd, this accusation came after I disputed her late departure charge. These allegations are in retaliation for my dispute and are completely dishonest.

The house appeared clean although when I left on Monday, I had bug bites all over my arm. After a visit to the doctor, I was notified they were bed bug bites. They have since healed so I am 100% sure they are not from my house.. that leaves her home as the culprit for bed bugs.

Overall, I would never stay at Tracy‚Äôs home again. She was impossible to work with and had zero ability to connect and relate on a personal/human level.

This apartment is centrally located and in a nice building, close to many convenient locations. The doormen are very nice. And those are about the only good things about this place.

First of all, the mattress was extremely old and had broken springs. Matt did offer to replace the mattress, but it took 2 weeks, and I had to resort to sleeping on the couch. The pillows and sheets were old and raggedy. The couch was piling, the curtains were very cheap and kept falling off of the curtain holders. Most of the drawers on the dresser were broken and were unusable. The leather chairs were completely torn up. I worked from home during this period, and I had to sit on them daily. Not so comfortable. Matt replaced the chairs with bar stools (!) so I couldn‚Äôt use them either because they were too high for the table. The apt itself was quite dirty‚Äî every time I had a spill or mopped the floor, I found that I was picking up loads of dirt (much more than I could have created in my short stay). Lastly, construction woke me up daily around 6:30am and continued throughout the day until about 4PM, even on weekends.

For the price of this apartment, I felt that all of these things were unacceptable. I initially booked this place because of the glowing reviews, but there was a huge disconnect between the price and the quality. 3 stars for great location and nice doormen.
If you're looking for a comfy loft, fast Wi-Fi, and a brunch style kitchen look no further.

This is a very modern/nice place to stay. It is cozy, somewhat small interior for 2 people. Only complaint was the very small area to park, and issue with the shower backing up extremely fast. The Host did say she had the issue fixed within a few hours and offered us the main house to shower, however we left before our 2nd night (wasn't sure if the issue could be repaired/wasn't comfortable)
Wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to stay here again.
No complaints‚Ä¶
Stylish, cozy appartment. Walking distance to South Congress. Very convenient for using Lyft for lower price than parking in downtown.

They show an outdoor fire and advertise on line and at the house that it‚Äôs lit every night at sunset and even tell you to text a phone number if they forget‚Äî which I did. There was no fire as advertised outside so I texted. Reply was that the guy was not there but had notified his wife who was in the main house and she would take care of it. She didn‚Äôt. I texted her. Is AirBNB and she wrote back but didn‚Äôt say she would turn on the fire. So I asked about logs for indoor fireplace. She told me to drive to town and buy a log at the store if I wanted a fire.

It kept getting colder. In fact, It got so cold inside that I couldn‚Äôt sleep. It was 55 degrees at night and when I tried to sleep it was hard to do so because of the extreme cold . The thermostat was either controlled remotely or not working. Bed cover and sheets were denim and rough knit fabric which was very thin so offered no warmth at all. Therefore, I slept in my complete sweaters and socks and warm parka, basically my cold weather camping gear on the sofa under a throw. Very cold.



The indoor water heater temp was set so low that the water only got warm in the shower never hot. None of the water ever got hot. Think the hosts kept the temp on economy temp.

Very nice view, but all in all not worth the cold. and IMHO not great hosts.

PS. Host Said I didn‚Äôt know how to use thermostat but I do: it‚Äôs same as mine at home so that was NOT the problem.

It was a unique home, great decor and wonderful location. Cool ping pong and neon sign. The commons ranch waterfront was really nice and you should check it out. When we showed up, there were no towels, pillow cases or sheets. We found some towels in the dryer and didn‚Äôt notice the missing bedding until we went to sleep because a blanket was on the mattress. It would‚Äôve been five stars but the lack of the basics made for an uncomfortable stay.

The host was very hard to reach, I stayed at this house for, four days without air condition and the host was no help. The door knobs were all half way placed in the restroom leaving  one of the guest stuck in the restroom. Horrible experience! There was no where to put my clothes, and there were dirty socks found in a lot of places.

Do not let the low price lure you into booking this Airbnb like it ensnared me. The pictures are very misleading. Aside from the Airbnb not being cleaned prior to my arrival, the broken bathroom amenities, and the host‚Äôs uncooperative nature - allow me to express the worst part of my whole trip. I had a security incident where the other guest‚Äôs actions had compromised my belongings. Due to the unwillingness of the host to fix the front door and negligent behavior of the other guests, the front door to the Airbnb was left wide open late at night twice. Not only did this cause a huge influx of insects to flood the property and rooms but also it also gave me a very uncomfortable/unsafe feeling to continue my stay. This event occurred closer to midnight on my first night so I immediately reached out to the host, packed my belongings, and left the premises. Since I had been visiting from out of state, I needed to find other accommodation so I took an Uber to a nearby hotel and booked a stay there. The next day after long, unproductive conversations with the host and AirBnB support, I made the decision that I was not returning to the dingy, unkept Airbnb. In the end, I had not even stayed a single night in the Airbnb out of my 8 night booking, and the host refused to provide me with a full refund nor a partial. This experience ruined my perception of Airbnb‚Äôs and has made me very hesitant to book them moving forward. Please save yourself from a very stressful situation, and do NOT book this Airbnb.

I lost my car on sixth street on Friday night and Robert dropped what he was doing and spent AN HOUR driving me in and out of all the garages near Congress Ave. This is so above and beyond what one could reasonably expect from an Airbnb host! If you want an amazing host who goes above and beyond and charges a reasonable price near downtown Austin, Rob is the guy for you.
There is no bedroom with three single beds. It has one full sized bed. 10 total beds in the house.

This location and sleeping layout would be perfect for a large party that wants to check out downtown Austin, but this house is in rough shape.

Most important to note is the pest problem. We spotted a rat one night and cockroaches the next morning. There were rat droppings on the kitchen counter. The shower drains were plugged up even though there are no bathtubs, so it was probably to keep the roaches from crawling up in between groups.

The kitchen's trash can is the kind you'd find outside a fast-food restaurant and the coffee pot is broken so that if try to make a pot half of it spills all over the counter. The floorboards of room with 2 beds are cracked by the door, someone's foot could easily go through it if they're not careful.

The hosts were unbothered and unapologetic about the rodent problem. When I pressed the issue they said someone had already came while we were out to eat and set traps "under the house."

This is part of town is being built up beyond belief. If these hosts want to capitalize on that, the least they can do is get the house in proper shape.

This is an expensive poorly maintained frat house.  I left detailed notes on issues w pics on 1/7 & requested a response & a small reduction in rent. 7 days later, no response or action.  Rent charged was equal to 3 hotel rooms at 4 star hotel. House has a nonfunctional bathroom, ancient mattresses, house is dirty and not maintained.  A shower that does not drain, counter sink that rocks, toilet seat not attached, 50gal wet garbage can in kitchen, dirt under beds, on walls, on remote, coffee maker filthy & leaks, booze left in drawer in room, cleaning supplies in the bedroom closet, homeless sleeping on the side of the house.  Front door lock blinked red indicating battery change needed, causes door to not always lock upon closing - we were told all was fine.  Feedback also sent to Airbnb -also no response.  Very disappointing stay.  Do not recommend.
Good spot, within walking distance to Rainy Street. The only issue is there are a lot of homeless people in the surrounding area, but they don‚Äôt bother you much.

We had a terrible experience at this home.  Air conditioning did not work from the time we entered the home.  Outdoor temps were in the 90s.  Indoor temperature reached as high as 87 so it was extremely uncomfortable.  The host was not very responsive, taking hours to respond, one time telling me it was because he was on a flight however that wouldn't explain all the other times he did not respond.   When we informed the host about the AC, he did send over an AC repair man as soon as he could, that is when he finally responded to my message.   The host only provided one key even though the house sleeps 7 and we had 7 people.  We asked for an extra key which he said he would provide but never did.  Also there was no lock box for the key.  It was left under the mat on the front porch which felt extremely unsafe especially when he asked us to leave it there for the AC repair man while we were out to dinner and all of our belongings were in the house.  After the AC was deemed to be unfixable, the host did agree to a full refund because we cancelled our trip within the first 24 hours.  However to make matters worse, as we were leaving and taking turns bringing our stuff to a hotel, the key fell in btwn the slats on the front porch but by then the host had stopped responding completely.  Needless to say, he  should utilize a lockbox!  On top of all this, there was no onsite parking as stated in the amenities.  The location is walking distance to the main strip but you have to walk through a highway underpass where there are a lot of homeless people.  They seemed harmless but it's something to consider.

We were disappointed by our stay at Austin's place. The house itself initially looked clean. The location was good. However, we immediately started to see cockroaches. Some were dead and some were running around. The sink was clogged, chairs broken and the dishwasher was not working. If we had not seen the cockroaches, I think our stay would have felt a little different. The place itself looked nice.
Cheap, near Rainey, but a really sketchy area. Lots of open drug use and an aggressive neighborhood. Convenient but not the most secure. House is decent inside.

Highly do NOT recommend this place. BEWARE COCKROACHES throughout the entire house!! Host non-empathetic to that situation and unwilling to give us money back. Not quick to respond or help resolve it.

The house and yard was very dingy and dirty; filled with liquor bottles, cigarette butts, etc. We didn't make it through our first night as the cockroaches started to come out when it was dark - we were forced to find the only nearby hotel that could accommodate our bachelorette party of 16 at 2am!

Host was unconcerned with the cockroaches and said it was NORMAL. She's been unwilling to refund us - we are now fighting for Air BnB to require the refund for us. Not to mention, try to get some of our money back for the hotel which was far more expensive that our Air BnB cost to begin with!
The host is also now trying to charge us for being at the house for the few hours on our first day!!

Outrageous and disgusting.

We rented this house for the US Grand Prix F1 weekend and knew the price was probably inflated because of that. Even so, we felt that it was overpriced for the actual value of the home. Based on how much we spent for the weekend, we felt like the home should‚Äôve been a little more maintained. Scuff marks on walls, broken floor tiles, and spray painted windows on French doors in one of the bedrooms leading to the yard.  It worked for what we needed it to be, but maybe more for bachelors and not necessarily bachelorettes. Great location to downtown, Rainey st, and Whole Foods/target though! Also, lots of homeless in the area, but didn‚Äôt feel unsafe, just a tad skeptical.  Overall a 4/5 - it was a good crash pad for F1 weekend.

Location was great, close to target and chase bank.

Rainy st and 6th st was pretty close to. There were homeless people wondering around but it is because the missionary was close by. No issues.

Alex accommodated well, the remote was missing and she was able to drop one off the next day.

Only issue we had was we had to fix the flush on the master bed room toilet.

Extremely dirty. I wouldn‚Äôt want anyone to stay there. The bathroom was dirty. The shower was moldy. The mirror was dirty. There was hair everywhere. I even found toenails on the floor. The bedroom was terrible too. I found dead bugs in my bed and loose hair everywhere.

We got into Austin at 1130 at night, realized we weren‚Äôt going to be able to crash in the airport (there was a LOT of construction going on) and we put a request through to stay with Stu and he got back to us almost right away, and had a key in a realtors box waiting for us when we arrived a half hour later. The room is only a 10 dollar Lyft ride from the airport, in a quiet neighborhood, and you‚Äôve got your own shower and walk in closet. Thank you Stu for making the night much more bearable. It made a world of difference to us.

A few things I wish I had known before booking at Robbie‚Äôs - nothing in her photos is inaccurate. With that being said, there are no photos of the bathroom, which is in rough shape. The shower is a small dark box with no AC, and the towels/rest of the house smelled overwhelmingly of animal urine. Upon our return home, I had to wash all of my clothes - even the ones I didn‚Äôt wear - because just being in my suitcase caused the odor to cling to them. The house is also slightly imposing from the outside (of which there are no photos), and it requires a trek down an uninviting outdoor path to get to the room.

Overall, I would not recommend this room to a friend. However, if on a budget and don‚Äôt mind the smell and cramped bathroom space, this place is just fine.

For the value it‚Äôs not that bad. However, the bathroom and kitchen trash cans were full of trash. There were ants in the bedroom bathroom‚Äôs sink at all times. The kitchen stove had food all over it. There was leftover expired food in the fridge. And then the oven was gross. There was also no hot water in the showers.

We just finished our stay in Austin with Matt. This occurred during a horrible snow/ice storm. We were snowed/iced into our neighborhood and were having issues getting out of the neighborhood due to snow icing on the streets. We actually got stranded in the home for our whole stay having to walk to a grocery store for food due to the roads being blocked with ice and snow. Matt pressured us into leaving on the day of our supposed check out so that another air bnb visitor could stay. A local who lost power during the storm. We messaged back and forth with Matt that morning and told him our concern about not being able to drive out of the neighborhood safely even at noon and he basically told us that she would be checking in at some point that day so we would either have to leave or let her inside the home. We are in a pandemic and we weren‚Äôt comfortable letting someone we had no clue who she interacted with into the house with our one year old daughter. The new guest drove up at 11 as we were packing our things making the whole situation very uncomfortable as we were still trying to work things out with Matt. We didn‚Äôt even know if we could get out of the neighborhood as the only exit included a steep climb that was iced and people kept sliding down when they attempted to drive up it. The house had not been cleaned or anything and she walked in right after we were able to gather our belongings. The new guest felt horrible because she had no idea she was basically kicking someone else out to be stranded in the middle of winter storm with no place to go and also knew we would have to attempt to exit the neighborhood in a treacherous winter storm. It was very scary and we expressed our concerns with Matt throughout but he never took ownership, avoided our calls only messaging us, and tried to blame us saying we told him we were leaving when I have the message exchange never did we say that. The Only things we discussed was that we would try to leave but that we might not be able to due to the icy roads that had not been cleared yet. I‚Äôm worried about this host because 1. He has no concern for our safety even we I approached him prior to staying about concerns on house preparations for the cold weather he blew it off then messaged me in a frenzy after the fact to prepare his house in the midst of the storm 2. The fact the house was not cleaned in between our stay and the next person in the middle of dangerous pandemic makes me question if he even cleaned it prior to our arrival. 3. The fact that the sink broke during our stay due to his ill preparations prior to the freeze and no apology or concern was raised. And he let the next guest go in to a broke sink.
I understand that this was a crazy storm that Austin has never seen but Matt was not interested at all in our well-being and didn‚Äôt even check with us before letting someone else book the place knowing that the neighborhood was barely even accessible due to the road conditions. He came across as a money hungry person looking to get his next dollar and toss the people he already collected from aside. Just sad because this could have been handled much differently and would be another story.

Great place to stay for a weekend. Very large size and well-appointed. Kind of hard to find for us but with a little instructions you won't have any problem. If you don't like this place you probably won't like any place on Airbnb.
A couple of nice little houses; not in the best location but it served it‚Äôs purpose for our use.

Das Zimmer ist sehr sch√∂n eingerichtet und war sehr sauber. Es hat ein Lavabo mit einem riesen Spiegel sowie eine K√ºhlbox im Zimmer. Uns wurde am ersten Abend ein Besucherparkplatz reserviert, da alles voll war.

Davids Apartment ist circa 10-15 Minuten per Taxi vom Stadtkern entfernt und perfekt f√ºr einen Aufenthalt in Austin. Das Zimmer ist wie auf den Fotos - sehr sauber und mit Liebe eingerichtet. Ich wurde ganz lieb von einer Freundin der beiden begr√º√üt. Die Wohngegend ist sehr ruhig und in der N√§he sind Superm√§rkte und Fast Food Ketten. Ein Auto / Uber braucht man aber auf jeden Fall. Ich w√ºrde wieder dort √ºbernachten :).
Scam

Booked 2 nights here for my daughter and I out of desperation during power outage that occurred during subfreezing temperatures.  Stayed only one night because pipes burst at the house of my neighbors who were watching my pets, so had to leave 1 night earlier than planned to go home to care for my pets and spend another night in my own home with no heat or electricity.  Host was fully aware of circumstances,  but didn‚Äôt even offer a partial refund for the second night.  Also ‚ÄìI was charged a $100 cleaning fee but  dishes on the kitchen  shelf that were supposedly clean had greasy fingerprints on them and had to be thoroughly  washed  before use.  Gross!

Very charming little place but not particularly comfortable - very slow hot water (four to five minutes). The chalet is also located at the back of a lot, with no lighting along the way and several blind corners, which may be jarring for late arrivals.

Clean, but needs updating. Loud window air conditioning units. Portable heaters. Hot water takes 2-4 minutes. Small old coffee maker. Shampoo, soap has been there for months. Double bed, not good for two.

So my friend and I wanted to go to 6th street we wanted somewhere close to stay. We chose this place cause it was close to downtown the price was reasonable.

Bring a speaker to entertain yourself or bring a lap top because there is no TV.

The bed is sturdy don‚Äôt let it fool you it is comfy to sleep in.

However :( the bathroom was the absolute smallest one. The shower head is not adjustable. There is also window in the bathroom and it‚Äôs weird changing in there with no curtain.

Also if you have a fear of bugs I wouldn‚Äôt stay here because while we were sleeping lady bugs began to appear everywhere which is fine if you aren‚Äôt a scared of them. There is no body mirror in the bedroom so bring a mirror and there is no vanity so if you plan on getting ready bring all that.

Overall it did the job for a small weekend...
This place has so much potential, but I unfortunately had a challenging experience with the host. For that reason, I won‚Äôt be back.
It was not clean and was not worth the price paid. We did not have towels to use and there was not hot water.

The home is not desirable. Found it to be dark but suitable for someone needing a place to sleep.  The owner is not respectful. Owner demanded money for a dog and when I stated to her that I did not know what she was talking about and asked for clarification she did not respond.
Don't expect any form of breakfast you will not get what you pay for at all also no T.V any where in the whole house !! Worst BNB that I have ever been to

The pool was green our entire stay which really put a damper on everything for our group. Alan was helpful but I was a little disappointed considering I had asked him days before our arrival to confirm the pool was open and running and he said it was.

Do you want to get catfished? Do you want to excitedly walk into your AirBNB and question you're in the right house? Do you want to have a pool in the backyard but not be able to use it at all? If so, then THIS is the spot for you! From the time we arrived and were given the wrong door code, to the host calling me "Lindsey," it was obvious that the "Superhost" status of Alan means he has a lot of AirBNB's and doesn't remain aware what condition they are all in... And this house is proof. The pool was green our entire stay. Like, highlighter green. Couldn't even see the bottom. You don't have to be Einstein to know that means algae growth. So much for my only search filter being "pool" and planning a whole day around the pool, including packing a suitcase full of floaties on the plane... No one from our group could use the pool the entire time. We had to use the HOSE to mist ourselves in the heat, but eventually had to go inside due to the mosquitoes eating us alive (some of took Benadryl and had to cortisone it was that bad)... A correlation to the gross, stagnant pool? I think so. The house and pool is not a cute spot for bachelorette parties, it's a DUMPING GROUND for bachelorette parties. Like the elephant graveyard on "The Lion King." There is CRAP everywhere. See that cute photo of the "office?" Yeah, it's now full of used/old bachelorette decor. See the pics of the gorgeous, kempt backyard? Yeahhhh well the reality is a BBQ you can't access, tons of broken/old crap peppered about, overgrown grass, bad bad bad. Embarrassingly awful. Take note from the pics of the artwork on the walls and the huge, gorgeous leather couch... We are still wondering where those were during our stay?! Lots of nails on the walls but... No art. A blue, stiff loveseat now is in the living room. CATFISHED. Let me not forget the huge branch dangling over the yard just waiting to fall on your head! BYOHH (bring your own hard hat). Our biggest upset is that we told Alan about the pools condition and branch right away and he kept lying about it. "It will clear up by tonight" then "it will clear up by tomorrow"... Shouldn't it have been clear and ready to use BY our check in time? And he admitted to be aware of it, to boot. Said he was at the house 5 days in a row checking the pool... maybe it was the other recent review that calls out the green pool. Said that getting a landscaper was hard lately. So I filed a complaint with AirBNB during our stay... Alan declined the refund I was fairly requested trying to give me a so story that this "is his livelihood." Like I'm some millionaire? We just wanted the pool in the pics, is that so much to ask! AND THEN he sent men to the house at 8:30am on day 3 of our stay, with NO notice to us, to take down the branch. I thought it was hard to get landscapers? Guess not. Waking up to strange men in the backyard using a chainsaw in a tree outside our master bedroom was terrifying, esp to a group of 9 women. A total invasion of privacy! I've contacted AirBNB about this several times now and they don't seem to care... It's incredibly upsetting. There should be some kind of standard that hosts are held to. Homes should be walked to ensure that the advertised photos are what's being delivered. If that were the case, Alan's home would not be listed OR he would need to remedy the current status of it to make it worth the amount he charges for it. Do not book this AirBNB unless you genuinely don't care about having a pool or are cool jumping into a green pool you can't see the bottom of. One more time, say it with me... CATFISHED. Good work, "Superhost" Alan... Enjoy the money you made off our group. You should be ashamed.
Bobby has put a lot of effort into the Avion Trailer, it was one hell of a cool place to stay. I'd recommend this to anybody looking for something different.

This place is a filthy mess. The dust on the air conditioning duct is a thick, there are cockroaches, and sheets with holes and discolored pillows. I tried to stick it out as I am a pretty tough cookie and I paid my money to be there.

This was the first time I had ever used Air B and B I did not know the policy. I came to Austin to sing but now I must go home as i I have gotten sick from staying at this hosts home.

Want evidence? I‚Äôve got pictures of the sheets, cockroaches, piles of dust and spiderwebs and of the green infected mucus coming from my lungs that breathed in this horrible filth.

I booked a hotel and now I must book a $601 dollar flight to get home so that I may heal and get the care I need in order to move forward.

I will not being using A B and B again since they do not screen their hosts properly. Fool me once shame on you... and ‚ÄúI won‚Äôt be fooled again‚Äù to quote The Who.

Again if you want proof, I have photographic evidence. I hope Karma finds this woman and gives her the business end of the truth.

I could say more, but I have to pack for my $601 flight home.

Thanks for my visit to hell.

Terry‚Äôs place is within the Wyndham in Austin. These were private condos that were bought out by Wyndham. Amazing view from the balcony and private patio/pool area. The Wyndham staff is responsible for cleaning, check in, and any issues within the unit.

Unfortunately their staff brought us towels that had a used needle for injection hidden within one. I almost stepped on this getting out of the shower. Once discovered Wyndham sent up someone to get rid of the needle. Terry was unhelpful with this incident and just said talk to management at Wyndham. I wasn‚Äôt expecting much help from Terry because the situation was already handled, but he took no responsibility for the incident stating ‚Äúmy beef is with Wyndham‚Äù.

I‚Äôm not sure how someone can post an airbnb listing and not be found reasonable for what is coming in and out of their unit.

2/5 stars because your stay will probably be fine, but if an issue emerges just be aware that Terry will not be helpful. If this was a motel 6 I could understand used needles being found in the towels, but not here!

This place is as described ‚Äî not a spa resort, but a resourcefully closed in patio. You don‚Äôt go here for comfort as much as vibe + value, of which it boasts both! The chicken biscuit place just down the block is to DIE for, so after you say goodbye to the backyard bestie duo of the chicken & turkey, go grab yourself some breakfast :)
kind of hard to find, lighting wasn't very good outside of house. Grounds could use some upkeep

The place could be described as "quaint" if you're looking for an unfinished "funky" room. The walls are alternating corrugated aluminum and unfinished wood planking. Only the bedroom is air-conditioned. The place was hard to find. The "steps" up to the place are an unanchored couple of wooden steps that tip over when you step on them if you're not careful.

Chi was a wonderful host, and the location is also wonderful. But if you plan to visit Austin during the hot summer months, this rustic unit might be a disappointment to you.  There is only a window unit in the bedroom, so while we paid for a unit with a living area, kitchen, and bedroom, only the bedroom was livable during the hot days we stayed there.
The accommodation was really well presented, however, there was no water from one of the bathroom sinks. They were also inflexible with early check ins and late check outs which was inconvenient.

Good location & house was nice enough - especially main room & office/tv room. Issues were with broken items/amenities. Washing machine was not available during our visit (we knew ahead of time but still not great), water in main bathroom was turned off due to a persistent leak & the dishwasher leaked when we used the main sink the kitchen.

In my over 50 stays I have never written a poor review but my experience at this stay warrants me sharing with other guests so that their trip isn't ruined like mine was. After I booked this listing, Meshelle shared that she had made changes to the listing and linked to a private website with revised photos. This was a red flag because since I had already booked, I couldn't cancel my booking and had made my booking decision based on the Airbnb Plus listing photos. However, I was even more disappointed when I arrived at the Airbnb and the private website photos didn't even match the actual listing. I would have never booked this listing if I had known what the actual listing was and how it was designed and furnished.  You pay a premium for a Plus listing based on the design, and to have the photos so significantly differ from the actuality was extremely disappointing and I felt unfairly charged a premium for an experience I didn't actually receive. I messaged Airbnb immediately at check-in about the issue, and they agreed that the listing was misrepresented, however, given their unresponsiveness despite multiple follow-ups, I wasn't able to move to a new accommodation until the following afternoon. In addition, I was not refunded the service fee, cleaning fee, or first night's stay given Airbnb saying that the host refused the refund. Some other comments on this listing have mentioned that the photos do not match the actual listing, and I would like to warn other guests that if they do book this listing, they will not be receiving the same interior design and experience as is shown in the photos.
Everything is great but no kitchen table...

There was no absolutely no hot water for two days. The rest of the days the hot water came in and out during showers.

The listing indicated 3 queen beds which was a key criterion for our choice of rental but in reality there were only 2 queen beds. The listing claims the primary/main bedroom to have a memory foam mattress but it does not. The mattress in that room is very, very uncomfortable. My husband and I, who were visiting our daughter at UT, along with her grandparents from the East Coast, slept very poorly because the mattress is dented in the middle and within 2 minutes each of us kept sliding into the middle. The mattress in the primary bedroom was also very dilapidated and worn and it felt as though we could feel the springs. Definitely NOT a memory foam mattress!

We are calm, caring, and reasonable people, most of my family are educators, working at very reputable institutions. We do not like to raise concerns to the level of a bad review and I told Jill I didn‚Äôt want to leave a bad review-that was my response to her when she told me how bad it was for her business when people leave bad reviews. I resisted leaving a negative review until now because in spite of Airbnb‚Äôs Aircover policy the company is offering me, for all of these issues, only 20% off of two of our 4 day stay because of the hot water issues. This, in and of itself is highly problematic. Any reputable business would recognize that hot water is fundamentally an expectation.

It wasn‚Äôt just the hot water which was highly problematic but also, the bed issue, as well as the main bathroom tub being unusable when we wanted to use it to boil water to pour into it to take a warm bath when the hot water was out. There was no way to plug the tub.

In addition, the office that was advertised as part of the rental was not useable because it was full of baby gear and there were personal Items on the desk including a credit card bill. We were counting on having that as a private work space for my spouse. That and the 3 queen beds and of course hot water were expected.

Also the pictures on the listing didn‚Äôt match the decor in the house and there was no dedicated closet space for our clothes at all.

I can provide further detail upon request on all of these items.

Jay responded quickly to our renting the place. And when we needed a coffee maker.
When you walk around the house to the back of the house, you will view an old truck, trash cans, leaves and debris. The back porch is not like what is in the pictures.
Updating pictures of the entire place is essential. The furniture is not in the location of pictures.
I believe with a little upkeep and updating pictures, this would be a viable rental. I personally wouldn't recommend this place.

Jay and his team have put a lot of thought in this studio. He's open to discussing your concerns about the place. I adjusted my stay mainly due to allergies, poor air quality, and was searching for a studio suitable for remote work.
Couldn‚Äôt ask for more in Austin TX. Nothing better than these views and spot on the water.

We had our family vacation at the lake house. I do not recommend this place for anyone. We picked this home for housing our large family, location on the lake and to the city. The biggest complaint is the level of cleanliness throughout the home and lack of safety features on the exterior. The host let us know it was not updated so it wouldn‚Äôt ‚Äúlook clean‚Äù. The home just wasn‚Äôt clean. The fans and vents had thick dust on them so we didn‚Äôt want to turn them on. The kitchen window ledge by the sink was covered crud and dead bugs. The countertops were dirty and the silverware were not clean. The kitchen supplies to cook was subpar and had to buy our supplies to clean the dishes. There was radon junk under the kitchen sink like old bowls of bacon grease and old sponges. There was old food in the pantry so we couldn‚Äôt store our food. Random piles of sheets in the closets on the floor. The bathrooms did not feel clean either and we all wore flip flops in the shower.  If you didn‚Äôt wear shoes in the home your feet would be black. The beginning of the staircase down to the dock lacked handrails. They had recently replaced the staircase and left a ton of nails on the ground on the area you walked out to the dock. He asked us to show up an hour later after our check in time to ensure it was clean after they had a large party. The pool was over chlorinated it made everyone‚Äôs eyes hurt and the hit tub was an inflatable.  Overall this was such a disappointment for our family. Everyone was uncomfortable during the time there. We made the best of it but I would not recommend booking this place for the price they charge.

Okay so where do I begin so honestly I gave it a three stars because the place is nicely decorated but the description of double beds is inaccurate they were single beds, and when we first pulled up to the property a lady came outside to tell my gfs parents (Hispanic) to move from her parking spot when there was no notification there and when asked the first thing she asked was ‚Äúdo y‚Äôall know English‚Äù I speak English fluently I was born here, we finally got everything inside just to find out the beds were singles not doubles and that we had to turn 2 of our guests away to stay in a motel, constantly looked at differently by the other residents and plus it has quiet hours and it‚Äôs on a golf course plus we had to call the host because the address they gave us was not even the address the actual condo was at a different complex but the place was neat overall it was somewhat okay but very misleading and inaccurate on location, beds and especially the people being racist

This place is austin-weird. We‚Äôre Austinite‚Äôs so we kind of knew what we were getting into. However, the pictures set a somewhat unrealistic expectation. It‚Äôs old. It‚Äôs worn down. I think it‚Äôs a double-wide? I‚Äôm not quite sure. Stephanie has thought of a ton of extras to include, but a few items fell short as well.

1. There is no WiFi. Yes, I should have checked. However, when you boast about having a desk/workstation there‚Äôs an expectation that you also have WiFi. She did say the bar next door had WiFi, but the password did not work.

2. The bathroom is creepy, and in need of a renovation.

It did the trick for a place to lay our heads, but I likely wouldn‚Äôt stay again.

Paula‚Äôs place is incredibly convenient. It has all the amenities you need and it is very close to downtown. Our Uber rides were no more than $10 everywhere we went.
Thank you for your hospitality!
If you need an inexpensive place to stay with a big group, this will do the trick.
Unfortunately, not a great area, very small, poor furniture, place is old and needs updating. Host is very good though.

Ideal place for the price. Had a couple unexpected disturbances during the stay. One was the upstairs neighbors were doing some remodeling, so it was loud at times with the sound of power tools, but that's not at any fault of the host! Just bad timing. And then besides  a couple 'bumps in the night' it was a fine stay.

We got dust allergy after checking in, as per our complaint Colleen refunded almost half the cost, however she told us that the apt will cleaned and sheet will be cleaned, unfortunately it didn‚Äôt happen, we had to sleep in the dusty sheets again. It was a disappointment for me and family.

I gave this home a 2 star review. The 2 stars are earned because the host was kind and on-time with communications. However, the home was dirty and not at all safe. Below are what we observed during our stay.

- There was an awful smell throughout the house. I had to purchase an air freshener to clip to the AC (which was really loud) and spray the home down.
- The home was run down and dirty over all (the cabinets were falling apart and the home looked dilapidated)
- The bathroom was dirty (the bathtub was dirty and the mat inside is turning brown)
- The towels that were left for our use were WET :(
- Not sure if there were animals in the home previously, but my friend's allergies started acting up and he is only allergic to animal hairs
- The door did not close properly. There was a light storm overnight and we woke up to the door OPEN even though we made sure it was closed when we went to bed. It was alarming and made us feel unsafe.
- We were watching a movie in the evening and halfway through the night, the wifi just completely shut off (not as big a deal, just an inconvenience)
- We did not find any extra blankets - the ones provided were tiny and thin. It was a bit cold at night due to the way the AC worked.
- The pictures of the home did not show how the interior really was - there were cheaper prices in other areas of Austin for cleaner, safer stays
Hard to find parking some nights

photos are very deceiving... the place isn‚Äôt as clean as it looks in the photos. i also came to stay here with a 1 year old who just started walking so finding a piece of broken glass on the carpet was a real bummer. many of the light fixtures had bugs in it and the kitchen light had a dead roach. some plate bowls were in the cabinet dirty so had to rewash before using them. also found expired hot sauce from 2017 and stove was so outdated and rusted you could barely work the the connections and lastly, the fridge handle was so sticky upon arriving. there should NOT have been a cleaning fee for how dirty it was...
No hot water, very slow internet, dirty yellow sheets, dirt swept under the beds, smudgy dishes.  I cancelled my 30-day stay and had to fight airbnb to get my money back.

I stayed here for one evening. I was asleep in the bedroom when I heard a very large crash. I went to the bathroom to find the entire sink and drawers had fallen off the wall. I submitted a message with a photo immediately to the host. She apologized.
They are now billing me $750 for damages that I DID NOT CAUSE.

I do not recommend Colleen‚Äôs Airbnb.

The location felt unsafe, the building and apartment were dilapidated, broken closet door, dirty fridge, very loud window AC units, trash around the parking lot and patio, Very thin bedding‚Ä¶

There was no communication from the host. We left and stayed at a hotel.
Dirty kitchen,  dirty area

Warning to future Air B and B renters!  This rental is not as it is described, using the word, ‚ÄúThrifty‚Äù is not an honest adjective.  This place is tiny, beat up, dirty, and the craftsmanship is horrible.  Almost all of the kitchen drawers were off track and the handles were barely attached.  There were huge patches of sheet rock, poorly done, on the ceiling as well as the walls including stains.  The floor in the kitchen had stains and cracks all in the tiles.  The rental details also did not mention that it was cooled and heated via window units with cages around them.  $214.07 per night is not worth it at all.

Even though Colleen's communication as a host was great and the check-in process was pretty straightforward, the place did not seem clean enough for children given the number of cockroaches we had to kill, the mold-like smell and the dirty linens.

Stayed here for birthday weekend and regretted it! When arrived  we noticed living room window was open (lock didn‚Äôt work), refrigerator didn‚Äôt work but freezer did, water leakage from toilet in restroom, and a dead roach under the bed and bugs on the ceiling. Already feeling unsafe and unsatisfied the second night we were harassed by a crackhead on way in and later saw flashlights shine in through windows around 3-4 am. Didn‚Äôt feel safe or clean and wouldn‚Äôt stay there again.

Booking Colleen‚Äôs place was the worst experience I‚Äôve ever had on air bnb. The space is literally unlivable. The listing is very dishonest. The pictures of the place are very old (probably taken on the first date of renovation) and look nothing at all like the current state of the space that exists there today. Additionally, the place was disgusting. There were bugs (cockroaches), the stove was damaged and repaired with tin foil, the oven was covered in grime and unusable, paint was falling off the walls, there was clear structural damage throughout and literally a big hole in the wall in one of the bedrooms. Upon arrival for a two month long stay and the realization that the space was in the awful condition it was in, we tried reaching out to Colleen who left us her number on a note. She never responded to the text at all. We had to reach out to air bnb to get a refund as she clearly violated several host policies. I would strongly advise booking anything with this host.

Lindsey‚Äôs Airbnb was very clean and thoughtfully designed; it was perfect for my month long stay in Austin. The kitchen was also well stocked, and it was nice having several cafes and a grocery store within walking distance. However‚Äîand this is not the fault of the Airbnb owner whatsoever‚ÄîI do have to add a warning to any person of color hoping to stay in Clarksville. Several times during my stay I had been harassed, threatened and racially profiled by residents of the neighborhood, even having a man speed towards me (there are no sidewalks), stop dangerously close to me, then harass me in broad daylight. Again, Lindsey and her co-host were very kind, but unfortunately I did not feel very safe during my stay, especially having expected Austin to be a more progressive city. I‚Äôve travelled around the country quite a bit in recent months, and even in other parts of the south, but I had never experienced racial prejudice to such a degree as I did in the neighborhood of Clarksville. I apologize for ending on such a negative note, but it felt necessary to share this‚Äîespecially to other people of color.

There was a cockroach crawling on the ceiling above the bed. This was after check-in being delayed by 3.5 hours. I left and rented a hotel room. Mike refunded me for the second day but not the first. Will not consider any of Mike's properties again.

Also there are multiple units rented on this property. I had 2 somewhat sketchy people knocking on my door around 10pm saying that they rented both units. I'm really not sure what to think. Just a horrible experience after a long day of driving.
Couldn't recommend this place enough.
The host canceled this reservation 86 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
P.E.R.F.E.C.T! No more words to say....
Expect nothing but the best!

Choose this place at your own risk, make sure to take pics of anything weird or damaged before you settle in (something I should have done) or else you will be accused of damaging etc. Besides that overall decent place. AC only worked half the time we were there.

Not the best value. Common area was cluttered and smelled. Multiple dogs in the house, would bark loudly anytime you walked In the front door.

Room itself was okay. Cheap mattress. No Smart TV, only Direct TV with limited channels. Location is okay. 15 minutes to Downtown, close to the airport.

For almost 100 dollars a night, it's ridiculous that this level of laziness and lack of quality control exists. But that's Austin for you, the prices are ridiculously too high for what you're getting.

There are better places, I would not stay here again.
Very quiet place above the garage. Brian is very helpful and will even deliver Doordash when the delivery person goes to the wrong place!

The owner failed to show in his photos, and to state in the description,  that the studio has a window air condition unit, and does not have central air. The window air condition unit did not cool the place. It was very hot. The place sits on top of a garage, and the listing did  not state that. Also, the bed was not that comfortable, you will sink in the middle, and the sheets are synthetic which adds to the discomfort when trying to sleep. I wanted to watch TV, and when I turned it on, I could not get any channels. I texted the owner, and he said he did not no what it could be. I could not sleep and the place was not cooling. There were black ants crawling on the door frame and around the front of the place. The parking is a tiny spot in the back, and the place really does not provide much privacy.  I had checked in on a Tuesday and I decided to check out on Wednesday due to the most uncomfortable place that would not cool, and the discomfort of the bed and bedsheets. I texted the owner and he did not respond to me. I called Airbnb that I had to check out, due to the lack of proper cooling and discomfort that I experienced. Airbnb contacted the owner, and he refused to refund me for Tuesday night even though I did not stay there on Tuesday night. It was quite unfortunate of the owners response to me. I left the place as I found it, clean, I even threw out the garbage. Despite all this, Airbnb treated me with dignity and even though the owner refused to give me back my money, Airbnb refunded me.

My review reflects my own experience. We had a unique experience because Marie‚Äôs daughter and 6 year old grandsons were in town staying with her. They live out of town but came to visit Marie. There was a ridiculous amount of bickering and chasing the grandson around the house during the little time we spend at the house (we aimed to
Leave early and return late). They watched tv at the highest volume and all added their commentary from around 7:30am until 10:30pm. My sister and I found it to be an uncomfortable environment with their consistent family drama.

honestly, I regret reserving this place.  from the first minutes of checking I felt uncomfortable due to the inhospitable way of the host.  I overheard her somewhat loudly complaining while she was on the phone with someone about noise I was making while moving in my bags.  I made an effort not to bother her or make any noise.   in fact I only spent 10minutes max in the house (I had a tire blowout while driving and was forced to spend the night elsewhere).  when I mentioned my experience to host, she was most concerned with getting her key back.  do yourself a favor, spend a little more money to get a different place.

Marie's listing is as described.
Marie's communication is great.
I only stayed one night.
I would stay again once she made a few improvements to spruce up the room. The bed wasn't comfortable to sleep in, and the shower tub was a little dingy.

VERY DISAPPOINTED! Steven forgot we were coming. He offered us clean sheets and we had to make the bed ourselves. The bathroom was dirty and full of hair. There was no trash can in the bathroom or in our room. There was no light bulb in the one light in the room (other than the overhead light). We told Steven that we had to leave very early in the morning (3am) but he hosted a very loud party that didn't end until 2am. Not impressed. Don't waste your money!
It‚Äôs a nice house, not to big not too small perfect for a kickback

My only complaint is the attitude I received from the host come check out time. I was not aware check out time was at noon. I did not read the manual that the host said check out time was but that was my fault. This does not change the fact that that I did send a message to the host in the morning asking what time check out was. I never got a response until she called to basically yell at me and tell me to get out now. That I trashed her place? By the way so not true. If my trashing the place means leaving dirty dishes and towels. Ok then. This is supposed to be a vacation home. I was not aware that the owner wanted all the towels and linen washed and dishes too. That's what I got complaints on? When I thought housekeeping is supposed to handle that. Instead housekeeping called instantly to complain about me for no reason. Yes she told us we had to leave but she only had to tell us one time. After that we got are stuff together instantly and left.

I walked into Britta‚Äôs Airbnb and said ‚Äúthis is one of the nicest Airbnb‚Äôs I‚Äôve been to‚Äù and it stayed that way! Although the couch sleeper bed is slightly uncomfortable, it wasn‚Äôt nearly bad enough to ruin the rest of the positives

This property is in good location about 30 minutes walk to Domain area. in a quiet neighborhood.. The master bedroom is spacious but there were so many things in the room on top of cabinet etc. And the house has bad noise insulation that noises from other room is quite disturbing especially there were often quarrels with shouting during our stay.
Host is committed to offer good service with cleaning, although initially is not as we expected.
But my real complain is the T&C of AirBnB, that for booking of 30 days is considered long term contract of there is no refund, and payment is taken well in advanced during booking by airbnb. when we found there was animal in this property after few weeks of booking and yet we could not cancel as there was no refund.
Fun place close to the airport. The bed space is quite tight. It was fine for one night but would not recommend for an extended period.

Favian did respond to our questions timely. The Only other thing this place had going for it was proximity. Ask for a photo of the building exterior before booking which will say a lot.  Kitchen (stove, dishwasher, refrigerator, garbage) was not acceptable and very dirty. Also don't expect to be able to use the television. Basically a bed  and bathroom.

house not ready for check in despite coming in an hour and a half later than what was posted, have verified w host beforehand. didn't find out through text until the day of check in that theres personal items in the space being rented. a little loud outside on the main road even when all windows / balcony doors are shut, tolerable though.

Liz has a very cool place in the East End of Austin. It is near so much and there is so much to do even a block away. Liz gave us some recommendations for things to check out in the city, and they were spot on. Don‚Äôt hesitate with that booking button!
üî•üî•üî•
Cute place with plenty of space. Communication while renting the space was not great, there were 2 questions we did not have answered until after we had already checked out.
Restrooms toilet did not work well.
It‚Äôs a really nice place close to everything. The only  bad thing was the light roof of the bedroom doesn‚Äôt work.
Walking after dark does not feel safe with large number of homeless individuals in the area.

Do not stay here!! Unchanged linens, hair all over until, stains on walls and floors, sticky floors, ceiling fans above beds covered in black filth, no power to back room so no fan or air conditioning, can‚Äôt see through mirror so dirty in bathroom. About twenty exposed screws sticking out of wall, which used hold something which sectioned off the dining area. This sectioned off dining area is what they call a ‚Äúbedroom‚Äù it‚Äôs not a two bedroom.  It‚Äôs a very beautiful bedroom with a bed in the dining area which has exposed screws sticking out of the walls everywhere. A total dump! Section 8 housing long forgotten about, and not cared for by owner. Just a total mess at entry way also. Just a total mess period. Not safe, not sanitary, not an option.

It‚Äôs definitely affordable. Neighbors are nice, good location. Apparently someone had just checked out after 2 months before me so there were a few problems. The apartments wasnt very clean, there were roaches. I understand it‚Äôs an old building but there were a ton of small ones(not tree roaches) so be prepared for that or book another place. The toilet was broken and leaking, the stove door was broke and the fridge door was broke BUT those 3 things were fixed within 24 hours. I liked the quick communication, location and size of the place. You‚Äôre definitely getting an affordable price for the location.

This was my terrible experience ever with AirBnB.  The apartment is very old and furniture was very bad.  Air conditioners are pretty old and very noisy you can‚Äôt sleep when it works.  We stayed 4 nights out of which 2 days toilet flush was not working.  Host has arranged one day to use toilet in the other home next to ours and next day we have to go out for mile and use the public toilet in 7-ELEVEN.  Kitchen cabinets are terrible the doors are broken you can‚Äôt open and close easily.  And we find lot of misquotes and cockroaches everywhere. And there‚Äôs no ventilation at home.  Among all the host was responding immediately which was the only positive.

The host was okay but seemed like she had a attitude after I kept asking for surveillance of my car as soon as I got to the Airbnb my car was stolen in less than 10 mins should be a warning that it‚Äôs a bad neighborhood then all my belongings werebin the car stolen I had no money to book another Airbnb and she wouldn‚Äôt even let me stay another night

The host was great and easy to get a hold of. Unfortunately the parking situation was difficult, but after 20 minutes of figuring out where we could park, it worked out. The real problem was the upstairs neighbors. On a Thursday night the people were making so much noise we could not sleep. They were Rolling something around on the floor banging down. It was ridiculous. It was 2 am when this noise got worse. I contemplated calling the police, but I was just to tired.  I had to put my ear pods in to sleep. Unfortunately this is out of the owners control, but either way it was a bad night for me. So beware and call police early.

The house was roomy enough for 7 of us. The layout of the rooms was different than described, but we had enough sleeping accommodations for everyone. The house was a little run down, but we weren‚Äôt there much. There was some clutter, which wasn‚Äôt a big problem. There was a used pregnancy test in the back bedroom. The towels in the bathroom were damp. We went wash them in the washer, but the washer and dryer weren‚Äôt hooked up. We ended up washing them by hand and hanging them up to dry. There weren‚Äôt a lot of outlets in the bedrooms, so it made multiple people charging items a little difficult.
The place was great but the fact that it only had one bathroom was an annoyance

The host was amazingly accommodating and the check in was very easy. Unfortunately with how unclean the home was and the ongoing pandemic, our guests weren‚Äôt comfortable staying in the home. The conditions were so off putting we were forced to cancel last minute even though there was no refund and find other accommodations.
No problems good stay
The place was definitely not clean and is in way worse shape than what the photos depict.

pros:
close to downtown, nice restaurants, bars, etc
apartment was clean
bed was comfortable
easy to cook, grill, access to parking, pool & gym
allowed me to stay a couple of hours past my check out time

cons:
host was not communicative and not solution-focused.
the doors to the apartment complex were broken and when I called him to ask for help, he sounded as if I was bothering him
there were claims for amenities that were not available. this included: a hairdryer, a ‚Äúfireplace‚Äù, an iron, and coffee maker
the keurig in the apartment was broken and leaking. Peter said he would ‚Äúbring me a new one today‚Äù and then never responded or brought a new one over
The host also shared that his apartment complex doesn‚Äôt know he rents this space out - and also does not live in austin, so will not really help and you therefore cannot ask the front desk for anything.

another big red flag that I was shocked to see was that the apartment in the photos is NOT the apartment you stay in. he likely photographed another space and recycled the furniture and photos for this listing. incredibly misleading as the one in the photos had two sinks in the bathroom, a bigger kitchen, and more space in the common areas. this is very sneaky because he staged the new space just like the old one and so I am not surprised if it was never noticed in the past.

peter did not have a check out list and so i did not know what my expectations were for checking out/cleaning. I shared with him that I would not be awaiting a response as he hardly would get back to me.

it was not worth the stress.

1. Was an apartment that was not supposed to be listed on Airbnb.
2. Couldn‚Äôt find the unit based on his instructions.
3. Had to ask for WiFi and parking info.
4. Parking garage required permit to park so truck was towed the night before we had to leave. After asking him about it he blamed us for parking in a reserved parking spot, which we didn‚Äôt and told him we didn‚Äôt. He never apologize or offered to reimburse the $230 impound charge.
5. When we requested a reimbursement from Airbnb Peter told them it was our fault for parking in a reserved parking spot. We had to get with the leasing office and the towing company to confirm to Airbnb that it wasn‚Äôt a reserved parking spot and that everybody at this apartment complex needed a permit to park in it. It has taken over over a week and we still don‚Äôt have our money back.
6. The apartment is furnished with extremely cheap furniture and looks nothing like the pictures.

This dude needs to be taken off of Airbnb. It‚Äôs in a good spot so it may seem like a good deal but don‚Äôt do it. You‚Äôre sure to regret it.

This rental was not clean.  It is obviously a party spot, and there are stains and sticky spots to prove it! Upon my stay, there was lots of long, black hair in the shower and on the floor of the bathroom, stains on the rugs, dirty refrigerator, and sticky surfaces.  Additionally, there was loud music from the tenant below that literally vibrated the entire apartment throughout the evening.  The host was not helpful, from start to finish.  It was hard to reach him for check-in and check-out, and no information was provided when you arrived (wi-fi, gym access, parking, etc.)  Overall, it was dirty, loud, and frustrating.  The apartment is in a great location - but I would still say to steer clear from this rental!

There are a bunch of red ants at door knob and door frame when I check in. The entry is not in a building, it is on mud and grass. The ant nest is one foot away from the door.   I do not even dare to be near the door. I texted the host, he first said they are not dangerous as long as they are outside, but when I found ants inside the place, he is blaming me for opening the door.  Seeing him not being helpful, I complained to Airbnb about the ants.  Now here is the shocking part: I never met the host, and this place is a seperate entry on grass. The host is afraid of me reporting more ants with pic( too afraid to take when I see them first time), him/her is making up excuse of me intruding his privacy. There's no common place, and host keeps telling me to ask him for anything whole time without actually helping me, how could I even intrude privacy? The host made such excuse to Airbnb so he can cancel my trip in the middle of my stay. Be sure to take picture of anything of pests, even when you are in shock and possibly in danger is the lesson learned here. And avoid this listing if you can as when the host is cold, the trip can be a disaster.

We decided to book a 6-day stay after reading mostly positive reviews. Unfortunately we had to move to new accommodations early due to the window unit AC. The very first night we noticed the unit would come on/off frequently and was quite loud ‚Äî wasn‚Äôt a big deal until the next morning we woke to allergy-like symptoms out of the blue. (Uncontrollable sneezing, watery eyes, itchy throat, cough).

We knew something wasn‚Äôt right when we began to notice black gunk when we‚Äôd blow our nose. We‚Äôd be out the majority of the day and only return to sleep ‚Äî then the ‚Äúsymptoms‚Äù would begin only when we were there. After further visual inspection of the AC, there seemed to be black gunk built up where air would flow out. We tried to sleep with the AC off one night but with temps in the 90s it was not feasible. After just one night away all ‚Äúsymptoms‚Äù dissipated, including the black gunk coming out of our noses.

Sharing our experience since it is extremely inconvenient and costly to have to unexpectedly switch accommodations last minute.

El √∫ltimo d√≠a tuve un peque√±o inconveniente pero Rachel fue muy buena anfitriona y me hice una compensaci√≥n, el lugar es muy bonito y c√≥modo. El inconveniente a cualquiera puede suceder as√≠ que no considero que sea un mal lugar para hospedarse, sin duda regresar√≠a

The owners are dishonest!!!  The home does NOT have lake access as stated in the ad and they are trying to charge us for damages from a prior renter.  Also the home was dusty and on a busy corner no were near the lake.   You could see the lake on the third floor way In the distance. False advertisement!

Nice spot.  Go in the back, not the front. Things that should be highlighted. There are plates, bowls, cups, wine glasses (and opener), sponge and dish soap, washer and dryer, blow dryer, towels provided, cooking pots pans and utensils, even a cutting board, microwave and a water filter in the fridge. There's a Target nearby so you can shop for anything you need. I feel like a lot of thought was put into hosting and I like it! This is a metro part of Austin, so yeah you're going to deal with homeless or druggies around here and that's not the property owner's fault. I loved the location for everything. My only issue was one of the blinds were broken when we showed up, I brought it up with management and who knows if I'm going to be charged for it but I mentioned it upon arrival so we'll see. Considering how strict their damage rules seem to be, they ought to be on top of what damage is existing before their next guest.
spotless and everything in the place was in new condition. prompt communications from host.   Could not be better. Great location for accessing all parts of Austin.  Nice quiet neighborhood.

Just stop looking in Austin and book this place. You won't fine anything better, cozy living space with literally everything you need and to many great touches.

We found snacks, drinks, tech, tips and you can't beat the location. Quick Uber ride to anywhere downtown.

El lugar de Andrew es sin duda el
Mejor sitio de Airbnb al que he llagado ! Los detalles de cortes√≠a y las amendidades de todo tipo as√≠ como los aparatos tecnol√≥gicos adentro sorprenden. Se Nota que el piensa en todo lo que a un viajero le puede faltar desde un costurero hasta cepillo de dientes y cosas para el cuidado √≠ntimo. Great place and location.

Parking is not the best but you can purchase a parking pass in the garage across the street. If you have a big truck, don‚Äôt waste your money on buying a pass, it won‚Äôt fit in the garage.

Keep in mind if you decide to occupy the apartment with all 6-7 guests, that 4 will be in one room. So perfect for family and kids; not ideal for sharing adults. The AC is either full blast or stuffy because if you raise the temp it doesn‚Äôt feel like anything is actually coming out. Also the water pressure in the restroom sink is extremely low. Other than that it‚Äôs a very decent place to stay and the host is very detailed in what the bnb has.

This is not a safe place to stay, neither the place nor the neighborhood.  Our daughter's brand new car tire got punctured in the parking lot and she ended up in a very dangerous, scary situation with a flat tire on the inside track of highway 290 with cars flying past her both directions at 65 MPH and higher.  This  could have been lethal.  Worst experience we have ever had with any Airbnb place, or for that matter, anywhere we have ever stayed.  Nor was the host's response adequate when we asked her for a refund after we had just paid $150 for a second tire. So terribly disappointing and frightful all of this.  This is the worst review I've ever written for any Airbnb host, but I feel ethically bound.

Colleen was very accommodating, a great communicator, and very understanding.

Unfortunately, the apartment we stayed in had several roaches which lead us to switch apartments and then eventually check-out early and find a new hotel. At one point, one of our friends woke up to a roach crawling on him. At night, we could hear some kind of animal loudly crawling around/scratching. We concluded that whatever it was, the animal was either outside on the wall or inside the wall. It woke us up multiple times. The location was also not the safest and didn‚Äôt have much to do/see around it.

The description of this air B&B is inaccurate. We really wanted to like this place, but were left disappointed and therefore would not recommend staying here.

Colleen was very accommodating and gave us a great suggestion of the local places. The place is super closed to the airport so it's very convenient if you rent a car. However, we are very unsatisfied with cleanness.
1. We saw some roaches at the door, both live and dead.
2. When we checked in, we found there are some bugs and unknown batting on the sheets in the beds.
3. The bath towels have dirty spots.
4. At night, we heard bugs flying in the room.
5. The shelf in the fridge is also dirty.
6. The whole room is super humid and almost everyone felt allergic.
7. Even the packages of the snacks they provided on the table are sticky.
Therefore, unfortunately, we would not recommend staying here as well.

The apartments are a little older but some rooms has been remodeled like the bathrooms and flooring. The kitchen is completely outdated and the stove was dirty for those who plan to cook. The smoke area was dirty and filled with cigarette buds all over the ground. Could have been cleaner.

This unit claims to be sanitized, but smelled terrible when I arrived.  There were dead bugs with the dishes.  The bedding is shabby and stained.   The entire unit is much rougher than depicted.  I left immediately and found other accommodations, but the host has yet to refund any of my money.

Plus: very clean
Cesar is a great host
Everything you need is provided: shampoo, towels etc
Quite neighborhood

Nowhere to hang out in the apt. There is a backyard but it‚Äôs bare ground and a bench.
The bed was not comfortable.
cozy little place in East Austin. from looking on goggle street view was bit nervous at first about area but ended up being quite street and  felt unsafe

Meets basic needs, no kitchen stove/oven, but everything else was there. No tv, which wasn‚Äôt a problem for us, WiFi was good, plenty of hot water.  We stole an idea for our Airbnb... white noise machine.
Todo en perfectas condiciones y en acceso alas calles principales

The place was really nice. Very modern and well designed. The twin beds were really low and small though. The amenities were basic - some coffee, but no cups. Luckily, Alex brought over whatever we needed. In the end, he did express some disappointment that the dirty dishes had not been placed in dishwasher. I thought that was why a cleaning fee was charged. As a host myself, I didn‚Äôt expect renters to do anything that the cleaning person would be paid to do. Still a positive experience.
The alley entrance isn't as challenging as one would imagine - to find initially or for Lyft/Uber drivers.
Nice place but the bathroom was a disappointment.

Me & my family evacuated from Houston Tx do to hurricane Laura, rather be safe than sorry do too the impact of Hurricane Harvey.
Soon as I arrived on the property I felt threaten, she clearly was intoxicated & already using racist term like ‚Äúyou brothers & sisters‚Äù ‚Äúdo y‚Äôall like to be called niggas & bitches‚Äù ‚ÄúBOY & GIRL‚Äù. We had nowhere else to go & out of $903 for 2 nights & decided to stay. The house sleeps up to ten & she charged a extra $80 a person after 4 people and total we had 8.
She was on the property the whole time being very disrespectful her dog peed on our bags. She has bed bugs & a pest problem. The only part I enjoyed was the pool(after I cleaned it). Speaking of the pool while I was in the pool Her & Beast (her dog) came over asking for more money, we refused & she got very disrespectful calling us ‚Äúpieces of shit‚Äù ‚Äúdon‚Äôt fuck with her she‚Äôll fuck us up‚Äù. We explained to her that we was in a difficult situation & we had no more money because we could be losing everything. Mind you she‚Äôs stayed in the master bedroom our entire stay. She asked us to leave early on checkout day, practically rushing us out the house. Once we left she said ‚ÄúI‚Äôll decline the next AFRICA AMERICANS group‚Äù I‚Äôm really hurt and lost because we did everything to accommodate her even sent her extra money($200). Felt like a slap in the face.
I have videos & receipts if anyone would like to see them.

Kevin our representative was excellent and quick to communicate.

The property itself was very disappointing. The toilet in the master bath overflowed. We had to clean up the mess it made. Even after maintenance came it still didn‚Äôt flush well. We couldn‚Äôt use it.

The faucet in the master bath was loose so one sink couldn‚Äôt be used.

The dishwasher didn‚Äôt get dishes clean and the two dish towels were stained and dirty.

Someone had to fix the air conditioner because the thermostat stopped.

The cracked floor left paint chips on our bare feet.

In all fairness we should receive partial payment back because this place was horrible. I don‚Äôt recommend it.
Exactly what the photos and description says, no surprises. Great communication with hosts and very close to airport and  pretty cheap cab rides to bars and downtown.

Good East Austin location 6 minutes from downtown and close to Mueller as well. A comfortable bed, bathroom with linens for one or two days, an apparently unused kitchen which isn't good even preparing oatmeal,  due to all teflon pots/ pans being severely scratched (cancer hazard.) Kitchen faucet was broken and didn't turn off until I manually tightened it.  A beautifully designed ceramic tea pot on the stove. Lots of decorative items on all surfaces. TV in bedroom has a channel with current news.  The light by the front door didn't work. Bedroom is ground level, adjacent to drive in and walk in gates and on a corner and it has blinds but no curtains to keep out the light from street lights on two streets and to make it possible to open windows for fresh air and maintain privacy.

We were excited for our first stay on Lake Austin to celebrate our daughter‚Äôs college graduation.  We paid top dollar for a small house on the water which photographed great.  When we arrived the house was clean however there were no wine glasses in the house, no coffee and the refrigerator ice machine didn‚Äôt work so we had to go out for ice.  The back deck lights did not work so we were not able to enjoy the deck at night.  We had arranged a pontoon boat weeks ahead and a couple of days before our visit Walker contacted us saying our reservation was cancelled and we could book with another group for double the price.  When we complained they honored the original price but turns out the first outfit canceled due to weather and they never mentioned it.  We cut short our boat cruise in half due to miserable rain and wind.  We would not book with this group ever again.
Won't retreat it

The communication with the host was great, but the apartment has several issues:
AC is very noisy. I could not sleep with AC on due to noises.
The flat was not very clean.
Kitchen equipments are sparse.
and the most important:
The wifi is spotty and fails regularly during work hours.

Eight months ago, this booking was a known mistake and we tried to correct it 10 days after booking and you would not let us out of the booking even after Airbnb contacted you and asked you to consider letting us cancel. There would have been no cost on your part, as you would have easily been able to obtain another booking in in 7 1/2 months. We just had to bite the bullet and make the most of it.
The apartment has difficult steps, carrying stuff up and down them during our visit was difficult. But, I was glad we didn't take your offer of a downstairs one, as I would not have felt safe to me. There were frequently men in the parking lot, looking at cars, picking up keys, working on cars, etc.
The door lock system worked beautifully, but was concerned what would happen if the the battery ran out? Would we be able to get in? We assumed the key on the wall behind the door would open it and kept it with us. Does a blinking red light mean it needs a new battery?
Having a bad knee as we stated in trying to cancel, I had to do exercises on the carpet. I could see dark spots - wondered when it had been last cleaned? Didn't have any extra sheets or blankets to possibly place on floor as a cover-that would have helped. The bed very comfortable, but torn comforter and no duvet cover seems a bit unsanitary.
The two sofas in the living room are terribly uncomfortable, springs broken on one, cover cracking apart on the other, need to be replaced. The small kitchen table was that, small . It was the only place we had to work and not large enough. Two of the four chairs had bent legs and one actually couldn't be used.
Staying in a place for a month requires cleaning supplies to be provided. It is unreasonable to think a person is to go out any buy cleaning products for toilet, bath, sinks in kitchen and bathroom, and countertops especially during a pandemic.
The clock on the wall indicated 12:10 the whole time we were there. You need to replace the battery that was missing.
There are dribbles of some kind of dark liquid running down the back of the closet, stains on the bathroom closets and paper and dust behind the chest in the closet , as I found in retrieving a necklace that fell behind it.
In searching for all items in the bedroom as we packed up, I found a strip of crust from an old piece of toast from some previous lodgers.
The trash can in the kitchen had mold on the inside upper lid which I could have cleaned had you provided disinfectant and rubber gloves, which we asked for some and you said you would bring over - it never happened.
