It wouldn't have been quite as nasty if the foot pedal worked, but it didn't We had to lift the lid with our hands each time.
Insufficient cutlery - 3 spoons, 5 forks, 4 steak knives, 4 knives. No strainer. No washing up tub for a few dishes had to run the dishwasher for the few chipped bowls and plates. We borrowed mugs from friends and left them , so you now have 4 instead of the two you provided. No dish towels or hand towels in kitchen. Frying pan needs to be replaced - eggs constantly sticking.
The wall switch runs the wifi - that was frustrating until we figured it out.
If you are looking for a convenient location this is it. If you care about cleanliness and a feeling of comfort, don't even think about staying here. When we originally booked an Airbnb in our old hometown, our thoughts of having people over to visit with us and share meals was not possible in this place. We were not able to change it once we realized our mistake. So CAUTION on a monthly stay- don't push book it because you will not be able to cancel after 48 hours - EVEN WITH OVER 7 MONTHS NOTICE.
We were Superhosts for three years with over 200 guests in our home and never did we ever have as much difficulty and lack of support with Airbnb as we did with Casey and this rental.
We are tying to stay positive that this is a one-off.

Andy had no consideration and a major lack of empathy for the pandemic. After respectfully asking for a refund a month in advance he declined and kept $800 of $1100. DO NOT BOOK WITH HIM, SPEND YOUR MONEY ELSEWHERE

When we checked in, the ac was off and locked
We quickly realized that it wasn‚Äôt going to cool until unlocked or idk what as wrong with it. When I reached out he told me to get a refund and to get a hotel.

I asked if he had another house I could use.
He sent one that was not near the quality as this one not to mention he said if I switch he would credit what I paid to the new house ‚Äúbecause it was more a night‚Äù it was actually disappointing..
We ended up sleeping with no ac and the next day someone came to fix it.

After that everything was fine, we had no problems..ohh and there is only a dryer no washer

1. David did not respond well to multiple requests. We wanted to check in early, but never heard back. Later, we asked about the WIFI access, and got a single (unhelpful) response which failed to provide what we needed. We never got access to the Wifi (the code and title listed in the lone info card was incorrect).
2. (Most importantly) David does not have a permit to run an Air BNB in this area. The cops came and gave us a citation for him while we were there. This apparently has happened more than once according to the cops.
3. There are poorly covered bullet holes (?) in the external wall of the house.

The space was very clean. Parking was okay, but only adequate for a compact car, and we had to open and close a metal gate to enter and depart. This might be difficult for some, and was less than ideal at night.
The only refrigerator was a mini size and it sat on the floor, so packing and retrieval of items entailed trying to see at floor level. There were hardly any dishes...just a few cups, one small bowl, one drinking glass. woefully inadequate dishes. The ones there were mismatched and chipped, which made them unpleasant to use. No coffee pot, just an electric teapot and a 1 cup keurig that had seen better days. All the kitchenware was thrift store quality. We had to tilt the only couple dinner plates to get them into the microwave. Not conducive to even simple meal preparation and NOT a fully equipped kitchen.

The place was clean, but lived in when I got there. The kitchen sink broke second night, was never fix for the remainder for my 8 night stay. The host was very responsive to messages, but was unable to have the landlord come fix the sink. By the end of the stay, the sink/dishwasher had started to smell. The clogged sink significantly impacted my stay. I was not offered a satisfactory refund.
If you don‚Äôt mind the messy front lawn, stove and other stuff on the front porch then this is the place for you.
Adequate but but poor workmanship. Kitchen lacking some basics for anyone who wants to cook. No outdoor space. Complex is kind of an eyesore.

DO NOT STAY AT THIS UNIT!!! It is not cleaned and disinfected according to COVID-19 protocol and it isn‚Äôt the safest environment.  It‚Äôs the 1st time I‚Äôve been totally disappointed with the unit, the owner‚Äôs response and AirBnB‚Äôs customer service.

This place needs help  The lady that meet me was very nice.  First, there are over 50 steppingstones you have to walk on to the back of the home to get to where you enter the room that are very  loose and I almost tripped twice. Secondly, the bed sits directly on the floor. So the bed is very low to the floor.  They sell a bed frame at Walmart for $30. The bed is very old and uncomfortable. Third, there is no way to lock the door to keep residents from entering your room. It was warm in the room when I arrived, they did have a window ac unit but it looked as old as the house. Fourth, this home is so old there is no 3 prong receptacle plugs so no laptop power. This is very unsafe by the way. The homeowner did give me a power strip with an adapter to plug in the wall to allow me to plug in my laptop and other things but once again very unsafe without the grounding plug in the receptacles.  If you just need a place to lay your head then I guess this place will work, but not me again.

I rented the room for my father, who has pretty low expectations and actually currently lives in a modest mobile home, said, ‚Äúthe place was a dump!‚Äù ‚ÄúThere was no tv, the mattress was sitting on the ground with no headboard or even a frame.‚Äù  I responded with, ‚Äúthis is Austin and the California transplants have caused a significant increase in housing costs, so you get much less for the money. I didn‚Äôt expect it to be gorgeous for 50 bucks, but I didn‚Äôt expect that it would be a dump! I‚Äôm sorry, Dad!‚Äù

When booking the host was very nice and agreed to let me check in prior to the actual check in time so I could come to the room and clean up before an appointment I had.
When I arrived the room had a very strong cigarette odor which I understand could have been the fault of a previous guests, however it was bad enough that just being in the room made me/my stuff smell of cigarettes (ppl at my appointment could smell it on me üòí) . The shower was dirty and there was a dirty washcloth hanging in it. I would have found a different room immediately b/c of the odor alone but the appointment I had was extremely important (the entire reason for my trip) and there was no way I could find another place and still make it on time. So I decided I had to deal with it.
When I arrived back from my appointment I planned to lay down, as it had been a long exhausting day but when I pulled the cover back the sheets were dirty/had hair all over them.ü§¢
That was too much for me so I chose to leave the room at that point and had to find another place to stay.
This place is exactly as advertised. Ultimate privacy, clean and quiet. Cannot best the location. Not everything in Austin is downtown.
If a small room with no television is what you're looking for, this is the place.

This place is a scam. Do not book it. This man ruined my boyfriend and it‚Äôs trip to Austin. We went to check in at the end of the night and were met with a dirty yard shed full of junk instead of a refinish guest suite. Unfortunately, I was so freaked out we didn‚Äôt take pictures. But the house was exactly the same as in the photos. We both tried calling the host and messaged him on here and got no response. We spent an hour driving around and calling every hotel in and around Austin to find a place to stay and EVERYTHING was booked! I‚Äôve never had a bad experience like this with Airbnb until now. I‚Äôm very disappointed.
The room is comfortable and nice, but the cat didnt come to say hello. :/
Brian's place was clean and well-located. The biggest drawback was that the wifi was very weak and did not really work while I was there.

Everything needed was provided. A fine space with lots of food options around. Not the most convenient location for someone without a set of wheels, although the rapid bus at the nearest stop makes it manageable. They answer their messages quickly.

This Superhost was not prepared for my arrival, in spite of messaging me that I could come after 3 pm. I understand things can come up, but after letting support know about this trivial matter, this caused Brian to falsely accuse me of smoking in the room and other non-sense. So I have to deal with a Superhost's retaliation from his own lack of preparation.

Yard isn't really kept, and ceiling light didn't come on despite texting the number the owner said to.
AC was a pain to figure out, and a few too many decorations got in the way at times. But if you just need a quick night's rest, this will pass.
No issues. Great stay.

Upon arrival we realized there was no proper way to know there was other guests in the house. Once we entered there was booze and other illicit items across the counter with other peoples stuff all over the place. Our room was laid in from the other guests and left the bathroom extremely messy. To the point where my boyfriend and I did not feel comfortable staying there. After failing to get a hold of the owner after multiple attempts we decided to get a hotel. After the terrible experience with communication and lack of understanding on the owners part we advise your better off spending your money at a hotel. After messaging him our experience and concerns we were ghosted and ARE STILL WAITING FOR OUR REFUND.

While in a good location, the unit is listed as a 1 bedroom, but in fact is a studio apartment with the bed in the living room about 5 feet from the sofa bed.  My colleague and I booked this with the understanding that we would be in separate sleeping spaces, which was not correct.  We also arrived to the unit smelling strongly of smoke and very dusty, with lots of mold in the shower walls, curtain and ceiling.  We're not sure if previous guests had been smoking or if the smoke came from outside the unit as there is a seating area immediately outside the front door with an ashtray, indicating that people have been smoking right outside the door.  When we contacted Priya about these issues, she insisted there was no smoke smell, but did not come check it out.  She also insisted that it was a one bedroom and was described accurately.  To us, a bedroom means a separate room with a door.  Airbnb was not able to relocate us the first evening, so we stayed one night and moved to another place for the remainder of our stay.  The walls are very thin, so we could hear lots of activity from the surrounding apartment units.
Location is dow town, but not close to anywhere you want to go. Very dirty unit and furniture is damaged and uncomfortable.

Great location. Bed was uncomfortable as we kept sinking to the middle. There was glitter on a chair that got on my suit jacket. The complementary snacks offered was a single nature valley granola bar and coffee. We just needed a place to sleep for the evening so none of this really bothered us. If you plan on an extended stay, this may not be the best option.

The only real positive thing about this place is the location in relation to downtown and all the action. Now the negative stuff. The mattress was impossible to sleep on so if you can‚Äôt handle a FIRM mattress, bring your own. Thankfully the couch wasn‚Äôt too uncomfortable but not ideal for a vacation. The owner also parked in our designated parking spot forcing us to pay for street parking that wasn‚Äôt compensated back. Also someone broke into my vehicle in a supposedly ‚Äúsafe‚Äù parking lot with FAKE CAMERAS. Could of had a better experience. Great location tho

During our stay, the shower handle was broken. While it was supposed to be fixed prior to our stay, we were informed when we arrived that it had not been fixed. Then, we were informed it would be fixed by the end of the first day. However, it was not fixed so we did not have a shower for the first night or the next morning. The shower was only partially fixed by the second evening. In partially fixing the shower, the plumber left no handle (since they were missing the part) so we had to turn on the shower with pliers. While it ended up working out, it was frustrating that it took so long for us to get a shower. Additionally, we were initially told there was a futon sofa, as the description said it slept 3 people. However, it was only a normal sofa. Thus, if you have 3 people, beware that only two will be able to sleep on a proper bed. One thing we did appreciate was a discounted rate due to our problems with the shower.

The guest room that has two beds is one of the worst-smelling rooms I have ever been in.  I mean it REEKED of mold/wet socks/grossness. Having guests pay an equal amount for a house and being stuck in that room was embarrassing.

Nice house, with stunning pool area, but would say the house itself was quite basic for the price paid, especially considering one room was outside in a separate pool hut with no bathroom, and the only way in and out to the pool was via the main bedroom.

The management company seem particularly ruthless with little flexibility and additional charges for everything like early check in ($100 if arriving before 4pm), late check out ($100 if leaving later than 11am), not washing pool towels, hot tub and pool heating.

Despite the large cleaning fee, and zero flexibility to leave later than 11am, we still were given a list of chores before check out with threats of additional charges.

Whilst I‚Äôm a long term, frequent Airbnb user, always very conscious not to leave anyones house in a mess, all of this added a point of stress to the weekend that I wouldn‚Äôt have had with a hotel or a more welcoming host.
Only complaint was limited couch space.
Needs new master mattress, it is very uncomfortable

There's actually nothing within walking distance of this apartment.  One of our bed's frame was completely broken so you'd slide onto the floor.  The towel rack fell off the wall so nowhere to hang a towel.  And the worst issue was they had previous guests who smoked and it reeked.  Everything in our suitcases reeked, including the suitcase itself.  And we paid $450.00 a night for this place.  I contacted the hosts and they weren't willing to do anything for our inconveniences.

Not as nice as the photos look online. When we asked if we could stay an extra day because we had a horrible stomach bug and couldn‚Äôt physically move, we were told to go to the hospital. A little human decency would have been nice.

Die Wohnung ist sehr sch√∂n.  Die Lage ist ruhig. Der Pool ist ganz sch√∂n. W√§hrend unseres kurzen Aufenthalts aber geschlossen. Downtown muss man mit Auto oder Bus. Parken ist in Austin nicht teuer.
The interior is old and furniture is not in good condition as pictures provided. We had to go throw all the trash even we paid cleaning fee. For sure not coming back.

Nice place , only thing I noticed negative was dirty tubs, lil different from pictures , roaches in kitchen , and loud neighbors outside past 10 pm until about 4 am.. besides that everything else was ok‚Ä¶
There was a bit of a plumbing issue during our stay, but Kyle was on top of it a rectified it quickly. No issues after that!
El sitio es agradable, bien ubicado, no obstante la falta ventilaci√≥n y mejor aseo.

The host was very nice, the room cosy and arranged with good taste. I did find a live roach ü™≥ in the bathroom. I hate giving bad reviews and every other time I just don‚Äôt leave one. But I decided to treat myself with a place close to lady bird lake. I paid more then what I would regularly pay for an Airbnb plus stay. I wasn‚Äôt going to review this place but I would have wanted to know, I got so paranoid, locking my luggage every time before I left.
Very homey and private. Though not super recommended if you're over 6 feet tall.
Place as described, had no issues. I‚Äôd stay there again.
The kitchen is top of the art, but there are no instructions on how to use the equipment.  There is a bug problem in the kitchen area and tons of mosquitos outside, come prepared.
Never stay here. Fred burst into our wedding reception at 9:45 yelling at the bride to turn down the music. He looked drunk. It was embarrassing and scary.

So I don‚Äôt normally write bad reviews, but this is the exception. The apartment complex was abnormally loud. The walls are paper thin, a dog upstairs barked all night, you can hear the upstairs neighbors walk to the bathroom, do their business and flush. Which the plumbing system shook the walls.
There was a huge party in the courtyard of the complex which lasted well into the night.
The biggest problem was we were intentionally told to park in a specific location. We verified the exact location, with messages to prove we were told to park where we parked.
Our van was towed and the host had to take us himself to the impound from there we paid 193 dollars on top of the 133 dollars to rent the place for one night.
The host didn‚Äôt even offer to pay or make right the problem despite this is solely the negligence of the host.
I do not recommend this host, he was not upfront about the apartment nor parking situation. The host said after the fact, he had a parking pass which he never offered which would have alleviated the problem to begin with.

The area felt incredibly unsafe and the pictures were misleading. The interior - especially the bathroom - was not as nice as it looked on the pictures and the building that was first listed in the pictures is not the building that you stay in. You have to walk down a pitch-black ally to get down to the building you actually stay in and the door lock did not feel secure at all. The lockbox that the key was stored in was also broken, which did not make me or my boyfriend feel okay at all. Me and my boyfriend both felt unsafe in the apartment and we decided to leave to stay in a hotel instead. Felicity at least gave us a refund after we told her that we did not feel unsafe, but this was unfortunately my worst experience with Airbnb.

Pros:
Location is excellent!
AC is cold!
Bed is so comfy!
Felicity is good about responding promptly

Cons:
Lock is not super safe and there is large crack between door and outside so a lot of mosquitos/spiders.
Wifi is weak and not good for streaming
Not a lot of parking

This listing is very misleading unfortunately. The photos do not give you a good feel for the actual space. Upon first look, it seems like the unit is part of a house but the unit itself is actually behind the house pictured. Upon arrival you‚Äôll see the door is in very bad shape. It barely closes which easily allows bugs in & will only slightly close due to the deadlock. We felt very uncomfortable leaving electronics behind in the space due to the fact it would likely be very easy to break into.
The host does provide earplugs due to the fact that it‚Äôs directly next door to a fraternity house which we didn‚Äôt mind too much.
Since the space is old & has hardwood floors throughout the noise from the neighboring apartments is incredibly loud. The walls are thinner than paper per say. It was frustrating that the neighbors, especially those above the unit, had no respect for others in the building. Lots of noise from 7 am on on a Saturday morning. We were looking forward to sleeping in a bit for the weekend & found it was nearly impossible due to hearing lots of conversation & shuffling very early in the morning.
On top of that, the parking was so difficult. Don‚Äôt even attempt to park in the driveway because there‚Äôs almost no space & unless you have a sedan it will be very difficult to get out of once you‚Äôre in. With that, since it‚Äôs located right next to a fraternity house, there‚Äôs almost no parking available on the street. In addition, it‚Äôs very worrisome parking on the street itself due to the drinking & driving that occurred during the night.
Lastly, the only available sink was the bathroom sink. They have cups & mugs available to use to make coffee/tea but no water besides the bathroom faucet to use for such things. With that, we weren‚Äôt certain how to clean anything without any kind of actual sink or dish soap for the dishes. It was very frustrating.
Although the bed was comfortable, the bad certainly outweighed the good. I would not consider this place worth its price, it should really be half that. I would suggest just getting a hotel or a better Airbnb & pass on this place. I hate to leave a bad review but I do want people to be aware of what they‚Äôre getting into. We‚Äôve used Airbnb for many travels over the past few years & this is easily our worst experience. So unfortunate.

Nice home. Unfortunately, it's my opinion that the owner should not be on Airbnb or other home-sharing sites. The owner's anxiety about renting her home transferred on to us and made for an unpleasant Thanksgiving (and now week after).

Not only did the homeowner preemptively cancel our reservation while I was traveling for work, but we received an extensive DO/DO NOT list upon arrival in all caps lock. Labeling this rental as a "Slick Bungalow" begets far worse than a family weekend with half the guests 40+, using the potato ricer to make mashed potatoes, sleeping in until 11am and playing cards in the evening. In the homeowner's words, "Our learning curve with Airbnb has been a sobering one, and we certainly have had our fair share of disasters with some of our guests."

I am certain we are not those people. And yet.

We are currently being charged for having the person, which my family flew from across the country to visit over Thanksgiving, inside the home, therefore increasing our agreed upon 4p count to 5p. Note: we were below this rental's requested maximum (6 guests) and this guest was mentioned several times over Airbnb messaging. At no point did Eli call to check in/inquire about her, or approach us directly, which is her prerogative, but gives you a sense for what she's after here post-stay.

In sum, while a nice home, I would not recommend this rental. A first in my history with Airbnb.

Logan‚Äôs place was very clean for the most part. The handle to the front door broke a couple hours into our stay, and he was out of town and felt he couldn‚Äôt get anyone there to fix it. So no attempt was made.  It was a significant inconvenience to not be able to use the front door with the layout of the house.

The photos didn‚Äôt highlight the level of uncleanliness. The mattress and box springs have yellow stains, the ceiling fan was covered in thick dust, the light fixtures switches were so dirty that when wiped with a cleaner cloth - the cloth turned gray with dirt and the parking lot wasn‚Äôt very well lit while the gate to the property was always left open. There is also a musty odor to the apartment that they tried to cover up with an essential oil diffuser. We opened the windows and balcony door for a while every night but could not get the odor out. The futon in the living room is old and torn up and the mattress pad is so thin that no one could comfortable sleep on it. We have pictures to prove everything. Not very flexible to work with.

Hervorragende Unterkunft - blitzsauber, toll ausgestattet und in sehr guter Lage. Die 6. Stra√üe ist ohne Probleme zu Fu√ü zu erreichen. Ich empfehle Derricks Condo gerne weiter, eine Top Wahl f√ºr einen Aufenthalt im Austin!

I guess we expected more.  Towels were old and scratchy.  No shampoo/conditioner.  Nest thermostat was pre programmed so it got hot at night.  Dishwasher didn‚Äôt work.  Coffee was confusing so we just went out for it.

You get what you pay for, the airbnb host was extremely friendly and accommodating however the room was much much smaller than expected, the room was boiling hot when we arrived and honestly the tiny air conditioner placed in an odd place in front of the bed couldn‚Äôt circulate air the way it needed. The water pressure was odd because it would go back and forth from extremely strong to soft, and you either had scalding hot water or frigid cold, no in between. There were a lot of broken decorations everywhere, I cut my shoulder on an odd broken metal motorcycle wall decoration by the bed, and there were a bunch of things (small trash, liquor bottle, and a dirty towel) left behind by the people who rented the room before us that housekeeping clearly missed. I wasn‚Äôt given instructions on what was expected once I left the room until I‚Äôd already left and was driving home, so the trash and recycling were still left in the room.
For ACL It was worth the money because everything was so expensive, but staying in this room on just a regular trip to Austin is a no go.

Small intimate space, decorated as pictured (with a few things moved around in the kitchen). Location is within about three miles of the main downtown areas, and fairly quick to hop on a main road to get you around. I would suggest either electric transportation (bike/scooter), Uber or a vehicle to avoid a 20-30 minute walk to some of the bars/restaurants in the area.

Please be aware that the complex is in an underdeveloped suburban area and bed is under a set of stairs in the building and can get quite loud throughout the night (also a laundry somewhere nearby).

Otherwise, the spot worked well for a base to get out and explore the city.

Great condo! This was my first Airbnb experience and I was blown away. They thought of everything. Next time I come to town I‚Äôm gonna try to make this my spot but I doubt it‚Äôll have the same availability since I grabbed it when it was brand new. Get it if you can.

This is a spacious home in a good location for Austin. Nice patio area to sit outside and everything you need to cook in the kitchen. The host charges a high cleaning fee and then demands you do a bunch of specific cleaning yourself or they‚Äôll fine you which seems unfair to me, but other than that it‚Äôs okay. Also not good for partying as there is a big note that the neighbors have been instructed to call the cops and have you immediately evicted if you make any noise after 10PM.
Worst experience ever
Terry was very rude throughout the entire process.

Colleen was nice and communicative when we needed it to address a cockroach problem, but the place is really not too nice. It is MUCH darker inside than the pictures lead you to believe, and it's generally really run down. Not especially clean, vinyl flooring over an uneven floor, walls have obviously been painted dozens of times to cover cracks, a loud AC unit that hasn't been cleaned in years, etc. The kitchen does have the bare necessities, but it's certainly not well outfitted. Also, the apartment has people talking, smoking, and drinking outside at all hours. I wouldn't say it's unsafe, but there are better budget stays available.

We were disappointed in our stay. We saw roaches (Tree and House roaches) multiple times both alive and dead. Also, random people kept knocking our door both nights. We were not expecting anyone so we stayed inside very quiet. One knock on the door at 430 am jolted us out of our sleep and was very scary. As a result, we got a poor start heading out.

The apartment is easily accessible to and from downtown. The parking was very easy. Also, the apartment complex has a vending machine that takes cards in case you need a snack.

This place was extremely dirty for our stay even for an economical option. Sticky floors, dead cockroaches, dirt, and stains in bathroom. Bathroom sink barely works and drains very poorly. Kitchen appliances too gross to use. Fortunately the bed and sheets seemed ok or else we would have left upon arrival. In hindsight we should have gone with a better option and paid slightly more. Hopefully the cleaning procedure improves at this place!!

WiFi signal was so bad, so if you need it for work or something, consider other options.

Other than that, the place was just what I expected.
This rental is an old grimy apartment! The online photo fools one into thinking differently. I had zero affinity for my one night stay.

This AirBNB was not cleaned when I arrived in which made me question if the cleaning people are ‚Äúmeticulous‚Äù. Bugs come in and out of the drain. The walls are thin, you will hear the neighbor yelling throughout the day. I personally do not think it is worth the price it is listed at. That being said, it could have been worse.
Awesome place. The only negative thing is the parking .The parking garage is almost a block away from the hotel . Paid $30 for two days .

No towels, soap, shampoo or oven.

Great location fun balcony but over priced for the lack of utility in the unit

Candy‚Äòs place is a short taxi ride from downtown and not too far from the airport either. The shower was all but a spray until I contacted the host and she sent her husband to install a new nozzle. Water took ages to get hot. Place has everything you need for a short budget stay. Bring your own hairdryer as the one at the property is very weak. It‚Äòs a nice little place, however incredibly noisy so was almost impossible to sleep. Stayed somewhere else for the last 2 nights because of that.

Es war toll hier zu sein. Candy hat nicht zu viel versprochen. Wenn ich das n√§chste Mal nach Austin komme, dann m√∂chte ich gerne wieder hier meine Zeit verbringen. Danke f√ºr alles. Viele Gr√º√üe aus K√∂ln!

This unit has unsafe stairs leading to the front door that wobble and are very steep and uneven. The thin walls and proximity to the busy street nearby made it extremely difficult to sleep, as we heard every single car, truck, ambulance, or police car that went by. Unfortunately, we had to cancel our stay after one night due to the experience.
I would NOT recommend staying at the cabin. We came home with bedbugs/ scabies and have had a hard time getting our refund.
Fantastic location, but the bed sinks to one side and was very uncomfortable and was also left with dirt in it.

This was a convenient location with all the standard amenities and more‚Äîwifi, toiletries, towels, bathrobes, etc. Cute space, but we're both not smokers, so we weren't happy with the cigarette smell inside the bedroom. We had trouble getting in touch with the host, but she was friendly upon out arrival.
This place has everything you need, while also being a funky, memorable stay in ATX

The address wasn't correct but i suspect there is an issue with Air BNB about changing it. Lu is very adamant about notifying people of the wrong address, i was messaged immediately so I never showed up at the wrong house. Lu supplies many amenities for the guests, It is very much above and beyond. I did enjoy the atmosphere while I stayed there.  I could not get timely responses from the host. Initial questions where made clear after I read the packets in the room and kitchen about how to do things but I still had questions. The place was very pleasant. It seems the host is selling two bnb from 1 ad. I was very confused when I had shown up to see a completely different house out front. Spent a great deal of time trying to get hosts attention and by the time I solved the problem then they responded. These communication complaints could be due to the quarantine in effect with all this covid19 disaster, but I still took the time to text and call with delayed responses and never an answered phone call. I went through the comment book and there where many good things said. I feel it was probably because of the times right now that made the lack of contact.
Very cute and clean place!! I thought the detached kitchenette/bathroom would be a bit of a pain but it was not at all. Thanks Lu!

No communication whatsoever. Arrived after no response all day and no answer when I knocked. Her phone was turned off so there was no way to contact her. If it wasn't for Airbnb Support I would have had to sleep in my car that night. They luckily found a new place for me. The price may be cheap but not worth it at all. Stay away.
Carrie hosted us on 4th of July with a last-minute booking. The listing was prepared quickly and the stay went with no issues.

Excelente trato y atenci√≥n. Mucho mejor que un hotel, casi como en casa de un viejo amigo. No lo pienses dos veces.
Excelent!! Don‚Äôt think twice is more than right!
Sadly, I was promised $15 by the host but wasn‚Äôt able to get it from her or the app, despite trying a few times.

I‚Äôm still pretty confused about this whole reservation. I reserved this months in advance.I messaged the host 6 days prior. The day of check in, I wasn‚Äôt as communicative but there was no message from her either. We got to the location, I called, texted and also rang the doorbell.There was no response.  I hope the host is alright, since I did see she was a superhost. It was a very weird situation.
short driving distance to most areas, wouldn't want to walk the steep busy streets. Bad cell service and wifi. A/C is locked at 75.

Expect a no frills, simple stay. Worth the money and the location isn‚Äôt bad at all for getting to East Austin or down town. Only disappointing fact was there isn‚Äôt an actual queen sized bed. It‚Äôs actually what I would amount to bench pads fit together to make a sleeping area. Some of various heights. We did not sleep very well at all.
Es una casa muy buena para una visita por la ciudad y no muy lejos de downtown en carro. Estacionen su auto en la cochera es mi sugerencia y no lo dejen en la calle.
The leather seat on the sofa was ripped; the smoke detector went off in the middle of the night even though there was no trigger and there was a minimal amount of towels and toiletries
A steal of a deal!
I would not recommend apf 300

Andrea‚Äôs place is much smaller than the pictures make it out to be. There were 4 of us and it was extremely cramped. It is a small space in a garage with no windows nor ventilation. It was pitch black unless the lights were on and became very stuffy. Because it is a garage there must not be good sound insulation and we could hear the cars on the highway which kept us up. Despite being very clean and looked nice, it was not very comfortable.

Cute place but it was so dirty when I went in. There was trash from the previous guest piled up in the bathroom, kitchen cabinets had brown spills in them, floors had multiple shoe prints on them, bed sheets had human hair that was not mine, pillows had yellow stains. It was really hard to enjoy a place that was really gross. I ended up laying all my close on the bed so I wouldn‚Äôt be touching the pillows or bed sheets. Really cute apartment but gross experience.

This adorable condo is in the primo spot to walk, scooter, or drive to everything.

I gave this three stars due to some issues we had that I feel you shouldn‚Äôt have to when your in an Air BnB.

The bed is semi comfortable however it is almost on the floor. It was not ideal for us. We felt like we were falling into the bed and rolling out of it onto the floor.

We had to finish the laundry that was left when we arrived. We also had to put sheets on the bed. The bathroom and entryway was dirty to the point I swept and cleaned up so we could walk around barefooted (which is required after 10pm). I washed the bathroom rug because it was dirty also.

There were other minor issues to deal with, but Gina helped promptly with those things.

The place is very clean and looks like the pictures posted. Had no problem finding the place, but when you are sent details on checking in make sure you pay attention to the pictures. At first I didn't and could find how to get in.

The dishwasher is not working, not a big deal. Also the bed is like 4 inches off the ground, so if you have problems get up and down that could be an issue. But the mattress is very comfortable.

I only have one complaint and it may seem silly. It had probably the worse toilet paper I have ever used
Gina's place was nothing but perfect and the location is everything.

Communication was great with Gina. Was able to get in and find the apartment easily. Only thing was the overall condition of the apartment. The dishwasher didn‚Äôt work, which she let us know and that‚Äôs fine. But there was also a light hanging from the ceiling and the bathroom was not up to par. The towels had stains on them and the shower was not clean. The location was ok. Not super close to the main downtown area but close enough.
No Comment

Do NOT stay at this place if you value cleanliness and a 5 star experience. This house fits a large number of guests, but the photos do not reflect the current state of the home. There are scratches everywhere, bugs on the window sill, scratchy limited supply of white towels, etc.
Great location and wonderful place for a larger group. Nothing but great experiences all around.

Do NOT stay here unless absolutely forced to! The host tried to cancel on me 10 days prior. The house was extremely dirty including cat throw up in the sheets, blood on the toilet, and just overall dirty home! Not to mention the reeking cigarette smell. A $30 motel would have been a better option.

Canceled on us day of after we drove 8 hours on Labor Day weekend. Everything was sold out so we got a hotel room in town and left the next day. Ruined our entire Labor Day weekend. These people are incredibly rude.
Cool place is crazy Austin Texas

We had a great time in Aj's home. the pics don't do it justice. Very clean, spacious, and lots of funky artwork. The location couldn't be beat for the plans we had in town. We will definitely try to stay here again next time we visit.
*side note- if you have severe cat allergies, definitely heed Aj's advice in her home's profile. I hadn't noticed that and several of us wondered why our allergies had flared up. Wasn't terrible for mild allergies like I have but a severe allergy would have been problematic.

This is a big and beautiful home that had eccentric elements. We were not able to flush any toilet paper and the kitchen is randomly well stocked with some things (three can openers) but then missing some key items (no cutting boards and no coffeemaker).
Enjoyed how close we were to downtown but I didn‚Äôt expect for the beds to be dirty upon arrival

Place was exactly how it was listed and pictures on point. Very modern and had private entrance. Only negative i can think of is the low water pressure and low lighting on bathroom mirror. These were a few things mentioned by other reviewers.
Had no issues with offstreet parking. Easy check in/out.
Close to everything if Uber or driving your own car.
Nice safe hilly neighborhood. Didn‚Äôt walk around due to it being very hot outside.
Would recommend and stay here again when weather is cooler.

Unfortunately this Airbnb is not family friendly. Such a great location and very convenient, near Barton spring pool, botanical garden, nature park and plenty of food/coffee options.   But, the house itself lack in hospitality, not enough pans in the kitchen, grass extremely high (our kiddos were not able to enjoy the outside as planned), no toilet paper, and broken toilet seats. We did contact host and the grass was cut the day before our departure. For the amount of money paid for this Airbnb, we expected so much more. Hopefully the host can take the time to revamp this unit.
You can‚Äôt go wrong with Dorie‚Äôs Treehouse!
it is a small house and There is no tv, but the house gets the job done
Great service, had an issue with internet but they came over right a way to work on the problem and fix the issue with the router.

Check in was a breeze with directions even a jet lagged traveller could follow.
I locked myself out of the apartment on my second day and Anthony sorted a spare key for me, he really went above and beyond what was expected

We ended up having to cancel last minute because of a death in the family so can‚Äôt speak to the space itself. Can speak to the very nice communication from day one of booking. We were actually looking forward to meeting. Will book with them the next time we visit Austin.
Bridget‚Äôs place was exactly as described and exceeded all my expectations. They were very accommodating in all regards even with my emergency, late-night request to book. Would recommend to anyone!
Bridget's place was exactly as described. We were only there for one night, but it did the trick.

My family and I stayed for a week, and the place was just okay. The first night we tried grilling but the grill was in such bad shape it just created a huge fire. The owners had it replaced a couple days later. The hot tub was disappointing- the jets barely worked. Overall I feel like the house didn‚Äôt live up to the pictures, and I probably wouldn‚Äôt stay here again.

Cynthia y su mam√° fueron geniales, mi pap√° se qued√≥ un par de d√≠as por el mal clima en Austin y ellas fueron incre√≠bles, incluso pudieron recogerlo y llevarlo ya que por el mal clima era complicado, el lugar era muy acogedor y ellas unas excelentes personas, no dudes en hospedarte aqu√≠
clean but noisy
The location was excellent, but the apartment was dirty and had bugs!

The condo (apartment) was great! It is close to shopping and restaurants. The condo amenities- pool, arcade and workout room were closed- this was a little disappointing and should have been reported as closed.
Great kitchen space- very limited kitchen items - so if you are planning to cook bring a few items. This space has a washer and dryer- bring pods if you are staying for a few days.
We would likely rent again if needed.
Was a great host but the apartment definitely needs some attention. The cleaning fee is outrageous given it doesn't look like the apartment has been cleaned in months.

After wiping down common things like light switches and faucets it was pretty apparent that they hadn't been wiped ever with a bunch of grime coming off. Pretty disappointing after paying such a large cleaning fee to begin with, especially with covid going on. Firepit and jacuzzi were nice but wouldn't recommend until after the virus dies down unless host takes cleanliness more seriously.
Good location near a lot of downtown options. The complex itself is more shady but all that disappears the second you walk inside

Stay was fine other than the fact that we had no hot water. They came and installed a heated shower head which made the water hot but also looked like some kind of death contraption that we were scared to use. Also, this is in a really run down neighborhood, so don't be surprised. The inside is as nice as the pictures though.

Daryl was really quick to answer questions and gave us an early check in. It‚Äôs a place to lay your head and is convenient to many Austin locations. Issues we had and I have let Daryl know:
There was no hot water except for the shower that has a RV style, on demand heater, on the shower head. It‚Äôs plugged into the wall about 3 feet away and seems sketchy. So 5 of us had to shower in 1 shower instead of 2 as stated. There also was many things that were just poorly cared for such as big pictures randomly falling off the wall and the handle to the balcony coming off. Quiet apartment complex but did not feel comfortable walking around at night. Many electronic issues, missing power cords, tvs not connecting to remotes, outlets not secured into the walls.

Five days was too long to stay here not enough towels, coffee, toilet paper, ect. There‚Äôs a ‚Äúcoin laundry room‚Äù on site, but there‚Äôs no directions on how to get there and no comments on how much it costs.

Beds were comfortable. Couch was comfortable. Good fridge. Has plenty of kitchen supplies but you‚Äôll need to bring cleaning supplies.
Muy acogedora, excelente ubicaci√≥n y casa tal cual como se muestra en las fotos. Sin duda regresar√≠amos a este lugar.

This is a luxurious large contemporary STUDIO apartment with fully equipped kitchen, office area and out of sight open sleeping alcove. Splendid for single occupancy but problematic for two if sleeping, TV, telephone and music listening are out of sync since sleeping alcove has no door. Almost on the U of Texas campus. Note that large SUV owners and inept drivers may have difficulty negotiating the cramped indoor parking space.
This solo traveler was completely satisfied and will certainly stay here again when I return to Austin.

The location is great and my stay was fine. The bathroom was extremely small  and uncomfortable. The check-in process could have been smoother (instructions for entering code weren't super clear). It was a bit of a challenge getting my luggage up the stairs.
Great location! It‚Äôs small, but has everything you need for a short visit. The parking spot is tight. Our Kia Sorento barely fit in the spot, but it was manageable.

Stayed here during the F1 weekend. Place was as described. Amber was always available and prompt to respond. Parking tip for other guests : avoid parking in the driveway if you don‚Äôt want bird droppings on your car.

They were quick to respond and allowed us a last minute early check in after our travel was ahead of schedule. The kitchen/dining and living room are on separate floors of the house which was a bit inconvenient for a large group.
Views to die for. Place was a lot bigger than expected! Fully stocked with kitchen supplies, extra blankets & sheets.

Great space! Unit 3 was way roomier than expected.

The location is up and coming with quick access to all of the Austin staples.

Parking is metered street parking, but for those used to city life, is nothing new.

Would definitely stay here again.

Unfortunately, my stay at Yvette's did not go smoothly. In my history of Airbnb, I have never had to leave a negative review or call Airbnb to complain about a host. Yvette knows I am going to be honest about my experience and in return I'm assuming she will be leaving me a negative review in return. I informed the host I would arrive between 9 am-1 pm because I was traveling from out of town. She was fine with this as her post says check in starts at 8 am. Upon arriving to her home, the front yard area was cluttered with random tools and junk. I called to let her know I arrived but she didn't answer. After knocking, she showed me to the room. The comforter had two big holes on it and the room had a strange smell, but that didn't really bother me. The TV did not have access to Netflix, Hulu,  etc. Be careful with the shower,  the water pressure is very strong. After seeing the common areas, I realized that the host sleeps in the living room with her bf. There was a huge bed in the living room which made it uncomfortable to even attempt to hang out there. The backyard had a private area for the dogs and a trampoline, however, it had clothing hanging all over it. I just didn't feel comfortable leaving the room at all. So I was gone for most of my stay exploring Austin. I believe that is why the host didn't add pictures of the common areas to her post, which should have been a red flag for me. Also, the ad stated it was pet-friendly, but her dogs kept being aggressive towards my dog, barking loudly, trying to bite him, and ganging up  on him. It bothered me that the host did nothing to calm her dogs down. My dog is completely trained AKC certified Canine Good Citizen and emotional support. He was afraid of her dogs. So again, I felt trapped in the room. Any slight movement I or my dog made, Yvette's dogs were barking up a storm. Even to the point that I had to leave at 2:40 am because I couldn't sleep with all the noise. Also, the Host did not mention prior to the booking that 3 people were living there. Her, her boyfriend, and her son. Around midnight, I had to text the host because the walls are paper thin and I could hear a loud conversation between them and that her dogs kept barking. Host did not stop her dogs from barking all night when my dog never barked at them. I felt like I was walking on eggshells in that room. It doesn't help that this room is right next to the kitchen. The next day around noon, two hours before my check out time, the hosts texts me to apologize about her dogs barking all night, stating how she didn't even want the dogs and how they don't have any training. I appreciated the apology but it did nothing to resolve the fact that I was not able to get any rest in the room I paid for. After that,  she became very defensive and cooky on text and was threatening to leave me a bad review. Just unprofessional and I honestly wish I would have called Airbnb at 2:40 in the morning to complain or paid much more for an actual dog-friendly stay. She didn't even offer a discount for the stay. Just be cautious if you decide to book this place. Pros: host leaves you snacks, coffee, and plenty of toiletries in the room. I didn't use them but it was a nice touch.

After walking up and down the block looking for the address, I contacted the host Steven who didn‚Äôt want to hear me pissed off that I couldn‚Äôt find the place. Being a host on AirBnB myself, I make sure everything is very easy for my guest to find the place at the very least. He was apathetic to the fact I could not find the place and if not for Maribel, the other host, I would‚Äôve cancelled and found another spot in the middle of the night.
The place itself was nice & spacious for the most part. Freezer was filthy with old food and drinks so I didn‚Äôt use that and there was no microwave so I couldn‚Äôt heat anything up I had brought back.
A rental car is definitely needed if you are staying here unless you want to Uber & Lyft for $10-20 each time which is all I had used out there. Closest place was Whataburger (24hrs) which was about a mile walk.
You get what you pay for so I blame myself for picking this place.

Volver√≠a sin dudarlo a esta casa preciosa por varias razones: el estilo y la belleza que tiene, la paz y tranquilidad que transmite, la ubicaci√≥n inmejorable para ir al centro de Austin caminando y por el cari√±o y amabilidad que ofrecen los anfitriones.
My only regret is that I didn‚Äôt stay longer.
The Bloomhouse is such a special place. If you‚Äôre on the fence about booking, just book it! You won‚Äôt regret it. ‚ù§Ô∏è

Este lugar es √∫nico y extraordinario, los anfitriones en todo momento contestaron mis dudas muy atentos y agradables, la casa es incre√≠ble adem√°s que tiene una vista espectacular, la limpieza excelente sin duda volvemos pronto!

There were several roaches and spiders in the house as well as dead ants on top of one of the beds.

The light in the en-suite room did not turn on at all and the toilet leaked.

The house was spacious but was not clean. Check in was easy, but the stay was not the most pleasant.

The apartment was very nice. This is a great neighborhood with many beautiful homes and we felt very safe taking long walks in the area. The apartment is well kept, clean upon arrival and the appliance all worked well. The bed was comfortable and there was great water pressure in the shower. Overall, it was a very comfortable place to stay.

There are two issues that need to be addressed to make it a five-star experience:
1) The cooking pans need work or a refresh, see the attached picture. We picked this place to be able to cook our meals here and I spent a good amount of time working on cleaning the largest fry pan with a SOS pad so we could use it. Not a big issue but when you‚Äôre paying over $290 a day (we were in Austin during a peak period), you don‚Äôt expect to scrub the pots and pans when you arrive.

2) The second and bigger issue is the driveway. Many homes in Austin have the two parking pads down the center of their driveways and, if you look at them throughout the neighborhood, you will see they are gravel fill at the same level as the pads. But, the parking pads in this driveway are missing the gravel filling that is supposed to be on both sides of the pads. There is up to a 4-5 inch drop off on each side and the concrete edge has a sharp line at the top. This was a real problem for our sedan‚Äôs tires when making a 90 degree turn at the end of the driveway to turn onto the pads in the area designated for this apartment. The sharp edges of each concrete pads could be heard rubbing loudly on the sides of the tires when turning into this area. You can see this has been a problem for other cars based on the black marks worn into each pad. We stopped using this area as soon as we
discovered this issue. I'm hoping our car tires were not damaged, but have yet to go to the tire store and have them inspected. Dumping a load of gravel to fill in between the pads and bring this area up to the proper grade will solve this problem and prevent damage to other guest's tires in the future.

The owner sent me a message that they intend to fix both issues in the future.

Stayed with my grandson for 5 nts. This is not a "new" townhouse as advertised. The furniture is not "new" as well. Exterior and Interior are both weathered. Was disappointed with the townhouse cleanliness . There was differing degrees of dust from very dusty underneath beds and couches to dusty thruout living area. Lamp shades and lights were dusty with dead bugs. Had to request xtra toilet paper, hand soap and kleenex box that were not available. Owner responded immediately to issues. The kitchen has modern appliances and location is very central.
This is centrally located for all your down town activities. 2 or 3 blocks off of I35 (but not noisie) and 5 or 6 blocks to SoCo.

I really wanted to like this place. It had so much potential. It was cute and had a great style to it, but so many things made the stay uncomfortable. The worst was there was zero wifi (the network didn't even show up). It was kind of the host to have her boyfriend come over to look at it, but by then we were halfway through our work day and even with him there there still was no network showing. The shower curtain was filthy and had brown stains on it, there were  no hand towels, nor anywhere to hang your towel to dry, and the bed was not the most comfortable. The sheets weren't soft and the pillows felt super cheap. I don't think I would stay here again.

Corey's place was perfect for our group of 5. It is a convienent area if you are spending most of your time in the Downtown area, like we were. He was very attentive and quick to respond, which was helpful. We were there during the Austin Marathon, which did make getting around Sunday a bit of a pain but that would have been a problem anywhere!

No WiFi which the host informed us a few days before our arrival. The host was quick to respond when we could not find the key to open the apartment upon arrival. She mentioned it was under the door mat and it was inside the door. Host failed to inform us that she came to the house and moved the key from where she originally stated it would be.

Great location to get to the city attractions just not my area to stay due to the parking and cluttered area.

Be skeptical of the pictures you see as they are outdated. If you are looking for a last minute place, then this home might fit you. I planned a weekend here but left after 15 minutes of arrival. Kristine helped me with my refund as she understood the issues and was polite about it. Great host but unfortunately the home disappointed.

The check in was easy and communication was okay, but other then that I can not give more than 1 star. The house was filthy and in need of maintenance. Mouse droppings in the kitchen, a filthy bathtub, and a dirty floor were just a few of the issues.

Jacob's place was cute and had most of the things we need. The rain shower was really great after a day hike and the kitchen was equipped with dining wares for our takeouts. He also prepared mosquito repellent for us. I also like that Jacob has solar panels on his roof, which made me feel encouraged as an environmental activist.

Here are a few things I wish was communicated though on the listing. The outdoor yard was under construction and we were not informed of it. So we were not able to hang out outside at all. I was really excited about sitting under the trees. We saw a couple roaches, which I understand is somewhat normal in Texas, but I've visited Austin many times in the summer and this is the first time there are several showing on the same day. It added the stress to our stay and I lost some sleep worrying about a flying roach.

Everything was as expected, but the host changed on our checkout date. We rented Tina‚Äôs place, but when I went to message her at checkout, the host‚Äôs name was changed to Ann and a totally different person‚Äôs picture was shown. Seems strange.

I really wanted to give this listing the highest rating. The apartments are beautiful, very well-maintained, and have a great location. Unfortunately, I am giving a horrible review because of the people who manage this property. The first issue we ran into was terrible Internet speed. I had to make a couple of work-related video conferencing calls and wasn't able to do so because of the poor connection. I looked for a modem and couldn't locate it anywhere. I reached out to the listing customer support and was told to check the closets. Well, this wasn't really helpful as I have already spent a ton of time checking their closets before reaching out to their support. This back and forth happened around 8pm and my last message just got ignored. The next day I woke up and discovered that the entire apartment didn't have any water. I called their property manager to report an issue and was told to hold off until they check with the building management. I called them back an hour later and they told me that there was nothing they could as the entire building got affected and that I should "sit tight". I asked them again about the modem location and my message got ignored one more time. I was patient and had to ask them for the third time why they are ignoring my question about the modem. This time they answered back and said it was somewhere in the living room. Given that the apartment is really small, this wasn't helpful at all. I asked them to be more specific and they said that only cleaning people knew about the modem location and that they couldn't get in touch with them because of the bad weather. At the same time, we got a message from them to prepare for a potential power outage without actually telling us what needs to be done. An hour later I called back to check on the water outage status. My call got picked up by Rose who appeared to be extremely rude and unprofessional. She wasn't capable of having a conversation with a frustrated customer. Moreover, she said that THEY were 'patient with US' (her direct quote), and in the end, she advised us to call Airbnb if we weren't happy and HUNG UP on us. They haven't done anything to alleviate our frustration: they could offer a discount or an option of an early check out with a refund for the last day. Instead, they did NOTHING and presented themselves as someone who didn't know how to deal with unhappy customers. Property management is totally incompetent when it comes to handling critical issues. Advice to the owner of this listing: your apartment is gorgeous but you should be careful with who manages your apartment. These people are absolutely clueless about the location of essential devices and can't deal with situations under pressure.

Here is the problem; Austin has a volatile housing market.  A huge part of the problem is companies such as these, buy up available housing that is intended for first time buyers.  They are the problem with the housing market.  Thousands of possible family homes taken off the market

Although the decor inside the unit is cute and the proximity to downtown is nice, that's about as far as the positives go. on this listing. The pool had a sign outside stating that it was closed due to Covid-19 and although the description depicted cookware there were quite a few basic items missing

Additionally, the parking lot is a major health and safety issue, as the assigned spot is on such a steep grade toward 6th street that I was worried about my car or luggage rolling into busy traffic and my leg got smashed by my car door every time I had to prop it open to push my way out of the driver's side of the car.

Finally, the heater was broken and the only thing the host gave me to keep warm during the two days that it took to get the unit repaired during a major cold front was an electric blanket, which isn't really helpful when you're getting out of the shower in a freezing cold apartment. The cold had gotten so bad that I finally had to inconvenience friends and stay with them for a couple of nights until the heater was finally fixed. I'm not sure why the host didn't think to drop off a space heater for me to use in the interim, which is pretty basic, but needless to say I was less than impressed with the service. Terri had also committed to refund me or give some sort of credit for the inconvenience and then never followed through with it during or after my stay.

I'm a fellow host and have stayed at A LOT of hotels and Air BNBs in my time, and this by far has been my most disappointing experience as a guest, and it couldn't have happened at a worse time since I had just started at a new job during my stay.

I'm not sure how Terri made superhost, but I can say that I am not impressed with her skills as a host and frankly do not think that the property itself is safe or fit for use as an Air BNB. I don't like leaving negative comments as a guest, but frankly this stay was a total drag.

Not quite sure how this place has such high reviews.

The location is ok. Parking is horrible... I wish I would have known this... my door was dinged by a scooter... the parking space is literally by the sidewalk in a very uneven position.

There are window unit ACs which are extremely loud... and are on constantly. You can't turn the fan higher than on first setting because it's start clanking... and to top it off, one of the times we came back to place it smelled horrendous and the toilet was running as if seone had used it. I had to use an entire bottle of fabreeze to make.it manageable to be in there.

I was truly not going to mention this and just let it be, I don't have the nor the energy, but, apparently.the maid blamed us for breaking some blinds. Mind you, we were only there to sleep, never even opened the blinds. yet, was sent a picture of the blinds completely open and twisted. I am thinking the maid might have accidently done it and blamed us.
Wasn‚Äôt to bad !

Master bedroom was always warm despite the ceiling fan which is not a good thing in a Texas summer.  Had no access to any of the closets in any of the bedrooms. They were all locked. No dressers either. House was clean, neighborhood quiet.

DO NOT RENT HE HOUSE IF THE OWNER DONT FIX THE A/C OR LET YOU KNOW. OR GO CHECK FIRST BEFORE YOU RENT IT. I HAVE TO LEAVE ONE NIGHT EARLY FOR THE SAFTY OF MY 4 KIDS. IT HIS HOUSE HE SHOULD ALREADY KNOW ABOUT THE A/C. HE DIDNT ATLEAST GIVE SOME REFUND BACK. IT WAS HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE  MY FAMILY HAVE THIS YEAR. I ALWAYS RENT A HOUSE EVERY SUMMER. NOW IT BETTER TO RENT A HOTEL.

This place is fantastic, I cannot even tell you how perfect of a location this is.
Not to mention the view and included parking cannot be beat. I was a bit skeptical about the price but when my husband and I walked in, our jaws dropped. Worth every stinking penny.

The place is nice but in a bad neighborhood. We had a bunch of drunk people across the street both night being loud and a drunk driver hit one of our cars that was parked on the street because the parking situation is not good, the car got totaled. The owners tried charging me 100 dollars claiming that we cut a zip tied cabinet that the property manager forgot to zip tie. They tired charging us another 100 dollars for opening the door to the garage that was never locked or marked as off-limits (every other door that was off limits was either marked as off limits or locked). He ended up not charging us because he saw in the camera that we didn‚Äôt have any malicious intents for going into the garage. He charged me another 200 dollars because the hot tub was cloudy, but when we first arrived to the house the hot tub was already cloudy (the owner claims it wasn‚Äôt even though he never went to check the house before turning it over). This place is really nice but it‚Äôs a trap, they will try to get every dollar they can off of you. We treated his home with respect and took care of it but still tried charging us for everything he possibly could.
Slightly tricky check-in process‚Ä¶!
cozy. quiet neighborhood. listing said washer and dryer included but it was extremely smelly and didn‚Äôt work. a/c was leaking. extremely dirty.
El sofacama ten√≠a basura dentro, el lugar no estaba muy limpio y es muy fr√≠a la parte de abajo de la casa, a un grado inc√≥modo.

Great place to stay, location is perfect. Very quiet, off the beaten path, but still close to everything. Don't forget the bug spray, though! Our pets did a bit of damage by ripping a hole in one of the sheets, hazard of owning Great Danes, but they allowed us to pay to replace the sheet set. I am a bit disgruntled by our dogs tracking in some mud and it getting on some pillow cases we knocked on the floor and being charged an extra cleaning fee when the pillow cases should be washed after guests anyways. My sister's small dog also had an accident (pee) that we missed because it was under a step stool, also charged an extra $100 cleaning fee for them to mop it up, which again they should be sweeping and mopping between guests, anyways. I am a bit frustrated because I don't understand what the original cleaning fee we paid encompassed if it wasn't doing laundry and sweeping and mopping. I would just be weary to stay here if you plan on bringing pets.
No heating is unacceptable.

By far my worst Airbnb stay ever. Firstly, the host fails to take any pictures of the exterior of the property clearly on purpose (because, if they did, nobody would book it). It's an chainlink fence surrounded by uninhabited buildings in an area infested by homeless people. As a group of grown men, we felt uncomfortable.

Next up, prepare for an interior with grease and slime on the walls, broken floorboards, and nothing in the apartment working - we had to fix the toilet, the TV never worked, etc. Also, the backyard is at best a 4" x 12"x porch with just a few chairs (nothing like what is pictured in the photos).

However, most importantly, this home is NOT SAFE. Within 1-HOUR of being on the property, we had two homeless people walk into our backyard, shoot heroine IN FRONT OF US WHILE WE WERE ASKING THEM TO LEAVE, and, after they were does, they confronted us. It was very clear that this is their regular spot where they do drugs (which the host failed to inform us of) and when we informed the host, she provided no security nor lock for the property - we had to purchase one ourselves because we felt so unsafe. Had it not been a weekend where we would not be able to find any alternative accommodations given the race in town, we would have left immediately.

While the host is reasonable at responding, it's very clear she does not want to help in any way to remedy the security of the property and prefers to let guests figure it out themselves after they book. I cannot stress enough how uncomfortable this entire experience was - AVOID THIS PROPERTY AT ALL COSTS.
Great location, but the airbnb was not clean when we arrived. We let the host know about our troubles, hopefully it is fixed for the next guests!

Great location for walkable access. Our biggest issue with the house is the AC unit wasn‚Äôt able to keep up during the day. We‚Äôd set the thermostat to a reasonable temperature of 71 and the house couldn‚Äôt cool lower than 82 during some of the days. During the nights the house was able to cool off some but the days were bad. I‚Äôd suggest messaging the owner about this before your stay and ask for them to have the AC unit running before you arrive‚Ä¶ the AC was off when our group arrived midday and it was brutal.

Pros: house was nice, good layout, newly remodeled, great backyard, short uber ride to most places of interest, shampoo and conditioner provided, washer and dryer worked (but were not plugged in), fairly quick response rate of handymen but a bunch of women did not like handymen showing up disturbing morning coffee.
Cons: bunkbeds hard to adjust to, not walking distance to many things (deceptive in description), sketchy neighborhood, broken sink in bathroom, broken garbage disposal, toilet ran very long in one bathroom, no toilet paper or garbage bags or dish soap or dishwasher soap. needs more comfy seating in living room

The house was big enough for our group and the location was decent.  There was no toilet paper, no hand towels, no wash rags, the oven racks are broken and very few dishes, and only one trash bag.  There was also old food in the sink which caused a pretty bad smell.  The host also didn't respond to anything, other than automated messages.  Overall, it served its purpose for our large group and the home has a lot of potential if there were more time and thought put into the amenities.
Has a big cockroach problem.

No TV, no radio, not even a clock on the wall & no blinds on the windows in the bathroom!!!!  No lighting! The light outside the door does not work, had to use the flashlight on my phone every night just to see, did not feel safe.  Saturday night when I got home at 9:20 I was locked out of the gate! Had to use a small table to stand on to reach over the gate and unlock it!! 2 story, the owner is above you, when walking around above me it was VERY LOUD, woke me up my first morning there
if you're staying in ATX and need to be downtown, this is the place but the catch is, you also find silence when you get tired of the noise

This place is all about the location as you are very close to Congress and downtown. The stay itself is adequate with no frills. The wall and floors are really thin but this is eluded to in the description.
The tiny home was comfortable yet quaint and tight. It is OK for a couple days but no long stays. No laundry facilities

Loved the privacy of this tiny home. It was just enough for two‚Äîsuper cozy. I wish we would‚Äôve had a longer stay so we could‚Äôve enjoyed coffee on the deck! I was worried about parking but the road was a dead end so there was plenty of street parking. The ladder to the loft is very steep‚ÄîMight be a challenge if you‚Äôre planning on drinking a lot.

The tiny shiny was everything expected of a tiny get away spot. Located in a dead end made the place private and quiet. Min away from downtown Austin and perfect for attending an event at the moody center.
He's an absolutely terrible host, and he will for sure treat you horribly!! I recommend that you never get a place from him!
There wasn‚Äôt a pic of the room! The sheets were kinda dirty, and I found a few spider webs around the house

DIDN'T STAY at the airbnb but the last accommodation and quick responses made my experience a smooth one. I wanted to stay with fily n had to cancel last minute and my charges were reimbursed justly. Thank you for your service!
If you come to Austin you need to book here first. Top rate accommodations, I can not say enough positive things about this host or property!

Good location for university visitors to stay but need to upkeep the place my bath room clogged , power tripped , shifted to an other room, that room toiled had no  water , had to go to other room to use toilet one night. Other room I was shifted to was much smaller then the I booked and paid for.

Arrived to the AirBNB, while putting the key into the door, we were told that she‚Äôs ‚Äúpretty sure the room hadn‚Äôt been cleaned‚Äù. Her excuse was Memorial Day weekend. Not one that adds up in my opinion. She said she would have to cancel our reservation if the room hadn‚Äôt been cleaned and proceeded to tell me that my anger towards her was uncalled for. The room had been cleaned decently, only flaw I saw was the long black hair stuck to the shower wall. Neighbors and area is quite noisy, woke up to roofers and heard VERY LOUD almost blood curdling screams during the early night. In order to ensure our safety, we propped a folding chair against the door.

Might be a cheap place but not what you‚Äôre expecting. Look elsewhere! I‚Äôd hate for someone else to be out of an Airbnb after traveling all the way from Indiana or any place for that matter, after paying the fees tacked on .. including the CLEANING fee.

We stayed for 3 nights and got no sleep any of them. Every tiny movement resulted in a cacophony of squeaks from the cheap, metal bedframe. Not to mention the air-conditioning unit made horrible rattling noises the entire night. The sink leaked, wetting the bathroom floor with each use. There was a dead bug smeared on the shower wall. Also, there is no kitchen despite the listing being an "entire apartment." The wifi was very slow and unreliable. To top off the stay, with no warning from the host, at 7:37am on the final morning the electricity was shut off due to maintenance (aka no AC) and we were woken up to workers right outside our window. Save yourself and go somewhere else.
Solid stay. Worth the affordable price, and they even got ramen noodles üî•üî•üî•

Very dirty place!!! I do not recommend staying here!
The place was so dirty, I had to ask him for a vacuum as soon as I stepped into the room. There was dog hair and dirt everywhere.

They have a no shoe inside policy, but I couldn‚Äôt follow it. I felt disgusted to walk barefoot on that floor.

Also, they didn‚Äôt let me know they had a German shepherd living inside until he accepted my request. That was very shady. It wasn‚Äôt in the description, otherwise I wouldn‚Äôt have stayed there. It‚Äôs very uncomfortable to sit and eat and the dog it licking you all over.

Also, the bed had dog hair and stains everywhere, I wonder if they even washed the sheets before we came in. bathroom was also very dirty. The tub in the shower was clogged and the towel handle broken.

Do not stay here unless you‚Äôre fine with staying at a dirty house. Ughh
There was no electricity, wifi, air condiotioner etc during part of my stay and no refund was offered. Stay away from this place.
S√∫per atento contesta r√°pido la habitaci√≥n es muy c√≥moda tiene el ba√±o para uso exclusivo de la habitaci√≥n sin duda volver√≠a sin pensarlo

Very cute space, complete with the owner‚Äôs own artwork!  She was very understanding about our check-out time, as well; my fianc√© ran the marathon, and we were worried about getting back on time because of traffic downtown, but she was very accommodating about the delay.
The space was very nice, but unfortunately the place was not clean. Hopefully the issue will be resolved for future guests.

We had a good stay at Gavin‚Äôs place, despite some minor inconveniences. The interior of the house was clean, newly renovated, and tastefully decorated, as depicted in the pictures. The exterior was much nicer than most of the houses in what seems to be a rapidly gentrifying neighborhood. The kitchen seemed to have a problem with circuit overload, requiring us to reset the breaker box outside several times a day and during the night.

I also found it difficult to walk my dog in the neighborhood because it has no sidewalks and is close to several busy streets.
As advertised. Comfortably space. Close but not too close. Nice and quiet neighborhood. Ample parking.

I booked this AirBnB for two of my colleagues and was very disappointed - first the toilet clogged, and then they were woken up by a very loud neighbor yelling very early in the morning. Both experiences left them sleep-deprived at a time when I really didn't want them to be sleep-deprived. Not Zach's fault, and these are both things that could be remedied fairly easily in the future (get a plunger next to the toilet and have a talk with the neighbor) but our experience here was poor.

Pros:
Location is good
Checkin was a breeze
Communications with Lisa were prompt
Home is mostly as advertised

Cons:
Heat was not working in the house when we arrived. Lisa was prompt in getting someone there to look at it but ultimately decided not fix it during our stay. The first night we were their the home dropped down to fifty one degrees inside. We were given a $60 refund for the issue, <10% of the total price which I considered a low.

Shower head was broken and sprayed water against the walls

No recycling bin.

Coffee maker was rather old and did not work well
Expect nothing but the best! I enjoyed my stay here and plan on renting again when I return to Austin.

Simple guest house with gas stove, rain-type shower, and clean linens. No paper towels on arrival, but host was prompt with communication and provided us a few rolls to get us through the weekend. Off street parking was nice, could pull right up to the door to unload bags, until we woke up in the morning and our car was covered in bird poop. Biggest disappointment and frankly most annoying aspect of our stay was the SWARM of fruit flies upon arrival. Also, several dead pill bugs on the ground underneath the TV stand. The I-35 is literally in the backyard and you will probably hear the cars driving across the overpass seams in the bedroom.  Residential area that is relatively quiet and minimal street activity.

Host was confused how payment worked and tried to charge us the morning before we were supposed to check in. House wasn't very clean and had bare minimum supplies in it. The kitchen table and chairs was extremely sticky. Host expected us to clean dishes before we checked out even though we payed a cleaning fee. I have never left an airbnb before 11 am but host said we needed to be out by 10 am. Electrical outlets stopped working and host had to send someone out to fix them. Multiple doors including one of the shower doors didn't shut fully. Caulking was all over shower floor from it falling off the wall.  Host was responsive.

Terrible property and host. Stay away and rent from another host who takes more pride in property management, safety, honestly and satisfaction of guests. We always use VRBO, never had any problems, but tried Airbnb because a family member suggested it. Dirty house- inside and in surrounding area. Unsafe inside with several improperly finished areas. Railing was falling out of the wall. Peeling paint on walls with water damage and shoddy DIY repairs that would embarrass a slum lord. We see why he didn‚Äôt meet us there. Contacted hosted upon arrival to express disappointment in cleanliness and ask for our $198 cleaning fee back. Host gave us the suggestion of leaving the property and issuing a full refund. We decided to do this because if was unsafe and dirty. We communicated to him on the Airbnb chat when we left, 30 minutes after arriving. We went and stayed in a hotel. At this point he went radio silent. Messaged him again on the Airbnb chat the next morning and he was still unresponsive. Filed a formal resolution request with host to get our money as he promised. He declined the request and stated the house was clean and we did not properly canceled which was not what he instructed us to do. Host is under investigation with Airbnb.

Might I add that my brother is a host and could not believe the condition of the house, how much was being charged, and how we were treated.
