I do not think this host or property should be a part of Airbnb as it definitely tarnishes their reputation. If anyone would like to pictures please let me know.

I have been using Airbnb internationally since 2011. This listing is below average compared to other listings I've stayed at over the years. The unit was formerly an apartment that has been remodelled for Airbnb. The remodelled living room and kitchen are well-done, as the photos suggest. However, the bedrooms and bathrooms were sub-par. The floors needed to be mopped, walls and door needed to be wiped down (dirt stains around door handles). The bathroom needs more work: walls and ceiling were dirty, towels were worn and dirty. 1-star budget motel quality levels.

This Airbnb is also lacking the same amenities many aspiring superhosts provide... welcome book with a listing of sights and recommendations and soap/shampoo in the bathrooms.

The listing reflects the latest trend of "short term/Airbnb property investors" trying to make a quick and easy buck. Quantity over quality. Keep your expectations low and you will not be disappointed.
Be aware the building is brand new and so still incomplete. Fittings still needed for the hallways etc and the complex is mostly empty
A to die for intimate modern space!

This place was in an extremely convenient location! I felt extremely safe here & there were no issues. My only complains would be figuring out the A/C unit & the lack of mirrors (personal women problem!)

El departamento es tal cual las fotos. Muy bien ubicado cerca del centro de Austin.

Mis √∫nicos puntos negativos ser√≠an los mismos que le√≠ en las rese√±as anteriores (y que ignor√©). Faltan art√≠culos b√°sicos en el departamento y la TV se desconecta de internet constantemente. Adicionalmente la puerta del ba√±o que conecta con la rec√°mara estaba atorada y tenias que dar la vuelta al departamento para acceder al ba√±o, no hay acceso directo desde la rec√°mara. Si esos puntos no te molestan, s√≠ recomiendo el lugar.

Gracias Helen!
Place was great but it was hard to tell from the photos and description that there is no door between the living room and bedroom so not great if privacy is of importance.
Hard to sleep the first night, very noisy neighbors.

Carols was nice and the house was accommodating. The beds were uncomfortable,  we could feel the springs in the small bedroom queen mattress.  The sofa was not comfortable either. I wouldnt recommend anyone stay here unless they only plan to use the mattress in the master room. There was also not a lot of kitchen items to cook with.
Tons of character, friendly hostess! Killer chocolate chip cookies üç™

This house has hot pool and jacuzzi. It was the primary reason to choose this house in our winter break. We were there with kids, multiple age groups. We were ready to pay $$$ for our 2 night stay expecting nice stay.

House was clean, has nice view from the living room. However there are few reasons we were not happy in fact frustrated with the host.

On 2nd night, one for the room got locked. We started communicating with host again and she asked us to try many things like use credit card to open door, search for master key in the house( no clue where it is), try random pass code to open, etc etc, non of them worked and host stopped responding. Whole night room got locked. Unfortunately we had kids medicine in there and communicated the same with host. She relay didn‚Äôt care about it. We ended up going out in the middle of the night to get the medicine. Locksmith came next morning and unlocked it. We had really bad experience for 1 day in our 2 days stay.

When We started getting into the pool, it was not hot enough for us. Reached out to Host to adjust the temperature. If guests has control to adjust pool temperature, it brings lot of piece of mind. Guests are in holiday mood and don‚Äôt want to spend lot of time in communicating with host.

Another thing is, jacuzzi. We have no clue how to switch on jacuzzi. Followed instructions provided on little iPad but there was no luck. Again started communicating with host and after lengthy conversation, host revealed that jacuzzi is not good and jets had lot of pressure. We were okay with it and asked host to switch on. Host surprised that jacuzzi was not working. Next day some one came to fix it and it worked for couple of hours and again stopped working. Host simply said issues like this is acceptable in big houses like this. Kids totally missed the fun. Kids were not able to use pool also since it is too deep.

Overall, house is decent but response from the host was very poor and she didn‚Äôt understand the situation we were in. It‚Äôs not worth money we spent.
Great place, not so great neighborhood

Was nice to get away from home with my boyfriend and dog. Unfortunately had to pay extra for our dog to come, tiny dirty areas were made on the comforter and are trying to charge extra for that. With having White everything that should be expected and I think it should be changed so expect to be charged extra if you leave something the slightest bit ‚Äúdirty.‚Äù
Another thing, assuming it‚Äôs because we brought our dog, they accused us of ruining their living room rug which was not touched, our dog stayed within eye sight the whole time and in the bedroom when we left short periods of time.
Sad to say but this ruined our experience with them. Hopefully you don‚Äôt deal with any of this when you book with them. Seem a little money hungry.

Pics make it seem bare bones but immaculate, It‚Äôs more grimy than just bear bones. There are no locks on the bedroom doors and no lock box for the main key, just left in the garbage. Poured rain and water entered my room though window was completely closed, damaging some of my things on the ground. Informed host but he didn‚Äôt apologize and stopped responding after a few texts. Host does not seem to live in town.

Excelente opci√≥n para visitar Austin. Casa nueva, cuidada y bien decorada en barrio moderno, tranquilo y seguro. Roxann es un encanto y est√° pendiente de las necesidades de los hu√©spedes. Yo vivo en Espa√±a y fui a visitar a mis hijos que viven en Houston y nos hicimos una estupenda escapada de fin de semana a Austin. Ellos piensan volver a esta casa, no es para menos. Detalles muy cuidados. Gracias Roxann.
no furniture, minimal space, very cold.
No plug in the bathroom so had to do hair in the bedroom with my phone as a mirror but other than that exactly as expected.

Wir k√∂nnen diese Unterkunft sehr gut empfehlen. Es ist alles wie auf den Fotos abgebildet. Helen und Christopher waren sehr freundlich, nett und hilfsbereit. Jeden Abend bekamen wir Besuch von Rehen die ihr Futter abholten und wir genossen die Ruhe.

Wir hatten wunderbare Tage bei Christopher und haben den Pool mit dem sch√∂nen Landschaftsblick sehr  genossen. Zimmer und Bad sind sehr ger√§umig und gepflegt. Auch Poolt√ºcher wurden gestellt. Das Anwesen liegt ruhig, trotzdem ist Austin in ca. 30 Minuten erreichbar. Christopher ist ein hervorragender Gastgeber, der sich gerne Zeit f√ºr seine G√§ste nimmt.

We arrived and construction was going on in the back yard which was not disclosed. They were using loud power tools including table saws etc until after 11pm. We message owner and had no response for two days. Next two days were uneventful u til on Monday the construction crew show up again staying past 8pm making the back yard completely unusable.
Few insect issues like fire ants but nothing major. Also wear socks or house shoes in house due to the floors leaving your feet dirty.

Upon arrival there were dead flies in the kitchen and food splatter inside the microwave.
There were only bath towels...no hand towels to dry dishes or for face washing in bathroom.
We sent pictures of dirty floors, dead flies, and filthy microwave and he assured us he would have the cleaning service return to take care of these issues. However, they did come, but did NOT take care of these specific things.
When we asked what to do with recycling in the house, he directed us to put them in the large recycle bin in the driveway, but there were large raccoons guarding the outside trash bins, which were already overflowing.
We had trouble locking the front door after us when we left the property. It wouldn't lock according to the basic instructions left and his additional instructions didn't help. We had to figure this out for ourselves.
Hunter insulted us by suggesting we were the problem by complaining too much.
We would not recommend this property to anyone.
Bad ass place for a quick nights stay!
It‚Äôs just nothing bit fantastic! Lovely place

Not great, the sheets, soap and overall management was done very cheaply. The place was not very clean when we arrived. With that said, it
Was the only place in town that would house our large group.

The owner could spend just a little more to make this experience perfect. Too bad they did not.

We had such a bad experience with this placer. Please do your self a favor. With this price, this isn't a glamping. They literally just put up a tent and put bed. For the price you'd think it's real glamping. It's not. First, we got there thinking, hmmm yeah, it's ok. But when we got at the site, no label or number, we didn't know where or which tent we will be staying at. The host responded late, we enjoyed the fire pit, but when it's time to sleep, that's when our frustrations began. You could hear the road and the planes, super loud, worst.. there was a dog barking all night, roaming around our tent and eventually got in the tent, it's zipped all the way but he managed to get in, attacked our dog and scared the heck out of us and the kids, he eventually left BUT continue to bark again. We decided to text the host, after awhile, the dog stopped barking. It was terrible, we booked 2 nights, but we left early next day we couldn't stand it. Listen to me, I do not recommend this place at all.

Our trip was unfortunately cut short due to rain storms, so we didn‚Äôt get to experience everything the Airbnb had to offer. However, the bed was clean, the fan and AC worked fantastic, directions were clear, and the horses were beautiful. My favorite part was the nature. We saw too bunny rabbits, a family of deer, and the view of the river was nice.

We had hot water in the shower as long as we kept the water pressure at its lowest. Having said that, it was not strong enough to wash all of the shampoo out of my hair. But it was enough to wash my body!

My only complaint would be the lack of privacy. I was expecting our tents to be further away from other people but they were very close. I could hear other people talking and hear them slam the doors every time they got in and out of their cars.

Joan fue muy amable desde el principio. La comunicaci√≥n fue fluida y eficaz. Incluso nos ofreci√≥ un upgrade y mejor√≥ sin duda nuestra experiencia! El lugar es muy muy grande y se pueden ver variedad de animales. Lo recomiendo!

I would just add to the other reviews (which I was surprised they didn‚Äôt mention) that the tents are directly under a flight path with the Austin airport close by - so the planes fly quite low and loud. They flew at night and kept me from sleeping (not something I normally have a problem with) and during the day it disrupted what we thought would have been a bit more of a quiet nature getaway. For us, if we had known this in advance we would not have chosen to stay here.
Without question the best place to stay in Austin!  Cass is the most thoughtful host I‚Äôve ever met.

This property is not one I would recommend. The app you have to use to check in is cumbersome and doesn't work properly. Once we got in we discovered roaches and huge water bugs, dead and alive darting about. Unacceptable. Owners must be aware there is a bug problem as we saw bug deterrents plugged into outlets in every room. (Clearly, they don't work).
Property is not well maintained. Light bulbs were out on porches. Back deck is blocked from use due to neglect and rotting wood. (This is not mentioned in description.) No shower in upstairs front bathroom. If you stay in that room you must take a bath or go to another room to shower. The shades in upstairs bedroom and in stairwell do not operate properly. Could not close them.

The management company was responsive when we first called, unable to get in to home and when we called again about the bugs and lamps that were not working properly. They did refund us the cleaning fee, which is extremely high, as well as a portion of the service fee. Our family rented a total of three homes on the lake during this Thanksgiving break. All homes were lakeside. Only ours had issues. The other homes did not have a bug problem and their properties were meticulously kept. This property is way overpriced for what you get. You can find better.

Description of property did not meet expectations, thought it was adjacent to the water but was a block up and shared with other properties. Upstairs guest room ceiling fan could not be used without light so made the room stuffy at night. This room was also lacking window treatments allowing no privacy and light in. Window treatments and new bedding/pillows needed throughout. When told the property supplied the bare minimum they really mean it. Sparse on toilet paper, paper towels, and no tissue was provided.

Space heaters are used, not central heating.  Hosts are willing to work with you for Check in/Out times.  Keurig pictured doesn't work.  Hosts have auto messages and may not check their messages til after check out.  Walls are coming off in the bathroom, Neighborhood isn't exactly the best, and there were electricity issues that didn't get resolved during my stay.

Unfortunately it was not a great experience. The ac wasn't working properly as it's a stand up unit..it only cooled about half of the place. The power went out multiple times during our stay..we were told the breaker box was in the back of the house..we had to walk through a swampy backyard to flip the switches every time we used the blow dryer. The place is about half the size of a hotel room and a lot older looking than the pictures. Also felt unclean..especially the bathroom. I also found it strange that they messaged us at check out asking to wash the dishes (only two cups are provided) and clean/ pile towels when there is a cleaning fee being charged. I wouldn't suggest this place.

Great location  near downtown and great price. You get your own parking spot. The place was nice but not as clean as expected.  It also did not offer great privacy as the bathroom window did not have curtains and you can see through the front door window curtain.

Location can't be beat. I frequent the East Side when I'm in Austin, and this is a quick walk to some great highlights. This was my first stay in an AirBnb since COVID hit, though, and I was underwhelmed with the cleanliness. Perhaps the cleaners were having an off day, but I felt there were some areas that were missed.

Very mediocre place. The communication and location was good, but the place itself was very small and not that great equipped. There were two spoons and a fork but no dish shoap, but we were expexted to do the dishes. The room was next to the kitchen of the bar next door so food fumes kept on coming into the room.
Great location but the ac was faulty.
Crisp and Clean home with Views. You won‚Äôt be disappointed.
This place is clean and comfy. The 10 minute drive to the airport makes it‚Äôs a steal for anyone who needs a place to crash for the night!
Very simple and easy stay with no hassles. Perfect for quick trips with the necessities.
Cheating for booking date

Poor, Unknown persons move in there to get things messed up and thereafter they come after you with bills claiming you have damaged/ misplaced stuffs In the room. Becareful when choosing this apartment.

This is the first time I have ever left a negative review and I don't take doing so lightly.  However, as a guest I would want to know the misrepresentations of this "luxury" listing.  My husband and I chose this location for our 20th wedding anniversary believing the beautiful pictures were accurate.  In summary, this is NOT a luxury home.  The home is unkept and unsanitary, the sofa had stains, debris and cobwebs.  The kitchen counters were dirty and dusty and the cabinets had unwiped stains. Sections of the rug and bedroom bench had large stains on them. The host failed to inform us that the deck has rot and mold growing under the structure and would be unusable.  The deck amenities were a selling point for selecting this property.  We were not notified of this until 30 minutes prior to our check-in.  The deck area is almost one-half of the entire upstairs area. The overall interior of the downstairs and upstairs felt as if the home hasn't been occupied in several months. We left the property within an hour of checking in and were forced to make last minute hotel accommodations.  We immediately informed the host when we arrived of this situation and his remedy was to refund us the $100 cleaning fee, which he did, since it appeared that this home was not cleaned prior to our arrival. Needless to say we were thoroughly disappointed and are seeking a refund for our stay.  This is a very unfortunate situation. In all our previous stays with Airbnb we have never experienced such a gross misrepresentation of the home.

This was once a very nice house, however, you can tell it has been primarily used as a "party" house and has not been very well kept. There were stains on the couches and a few broken amenities that were not repaired well. The biggest draw to this house was the pool, but when we got there, it was extremely dirty and cloudy, we didn't even want to use it. All of the outdoor furniture was gross and dirty as well- we spent a lot of time cleaning outside just to be able to use/enjoy it. With that said, the property served its purpose for our group and Mack's communication and responsiveness was great. We blew a fuse at one point and could not locate the electric box and Mack responded within 30 minutes of messaging him. He was also very accommodating in letting us drop our luggage off early at the airbnb until we were able to check in.

The house looked great in photos but so many things were wrong on the inside and out. A dirty pool
area with broken and bug infested furniture. Broken appliances, faucets, doors, and other things we kept finding throughout our stay. The area was walkable to some good local bars but felt sketchy in some moments. The room and bathroom count and size of the home fit what we needed but other things did not.

The swimming pool was all dirty and full of leaves and debris. I had to spend several hours of my time to clean it . The outside patio furniture is all dirty and moldy. The refrigerator was not working and we had lot of stuff go bad.

Overall I was not pleased with the cleanliness . The picture of the outdoor area is no where close to what was there when we arrived.

This home is beautiful, but needs a little maintenance.

First, the good-- decent size in Austin, good location near Lady Bird lake. Well decorated, easy to communicate with host, and rules were not restrictive.

A few areas for improvement:

The HVAC was not good- with heat set to 65 on each floor, the first floor was 65, the second floor 77, and the third floor a boiling 85 degrees.

Water pressure was fairly low in the showers, had to stand just over the faucet on the second floor to be under the shower.

The fun-looking hanging chairs out by the pool were rusted on the base and would tip over if you sat on them.

There was one dish towel in the whole house, no wash cloths in bathrooms, and no blankets in the living room. There were also no dishwasher tablets for the dishwasher.

Amplification: 1 queen bedroom and the double twins that appear smaller are a single car garage split in half with no space for luggage. There is a front gate requiring manual operation for car access.

I had booked this listing for three nights, as it was very close to a training workshop that I would be attending in Austin. I arrived on a Thursday after dark. There were no exterior lights on in the front of the house except for a dimly lit lamp post in the front yard. The neighborhood is dark and the houses are on larger lots and set back from the street. I  had been instructed to park on the street and enter the property through the rear of the house. I walked up the long driveway and around the back of the house and at no time did a motion sensing light come on. There was no light at the back door but with the flashlight from my phone I managed to find the keys and unlock the back door. When I stepped into the darkened house there did not appear to be anyone else around. I found the bedroom and got settled in, but wondered if the owners would be home later in the evening. Incidentally, the hall light outside the bedroom door was also non-functioning. I felt a bit apprehensive and did not sleep well. The next morning when I left the house to attend my workshop I still had not seen nor heard anyone. That evening, when I returned to the house it was the same scenario - no lights, the house was dark and silent. Finally on Saturday I texted the owner to ask if they were gone for the weekend and should I expect anyone else to be at the house. She texted back and said that they were out of town and that no one would be at the house until Sunday. On Saturday evening I arrived at the house at dusk to find a car parked in the driveway that had NOT been there earlier in the day, after I had been told that no one would be at the house. I was a little freaked out so I texted the owner again to ask about the car in the driveway and she texted that their daughter who attended UT had taken the car to get it serviced and then returned it to the house. Well, that would have been nice to know, especially since she said that NO ONE would be at the house. After that incident I felt completely uncomfortable staying in the home, so I packed up my things and left a night early. I found the entire experience very inhospitable and a lot of my uneasiness could have been alleviated if the hosts had only COMMUNICATED with me and left some lights on!  Other observations: the guest bedroom appeared to be vacated room of aforementioned college-aged daughter. It was pretty bare-bones and, with the exception of the bed (which was very comfortable), it appeared to look pretty much the way it looked after she moved to college - posters on the wall, a dusty bookshelf with AP English books on it, a little desk. etc. The room and the bathroom across the hall were fairly clean - the house appeared to be about 40 years old and hasn't had a lot of updating. All in all, I found the entire experience to be very disconcerting.

I have experienced very poor service with this air bnb listing. I was unable to enter at the time of check in because the door code didn‚Äôt work. I had to wait several hours to check in because the hosts were unavailable to let me and my partner in.

Good thing we were able to wait at a friend‚Äôs house near by to check in or we would have had to wait outside.

The bathroom and kitchen spaces are both unclean. I have photos. There is hair on the counters and toilet in the bathroom. There are smelly dirty dishes in the sink.

The sheets and towels have a foul odor.

The host are not hospitable. There are rude signs around the house that say things like, ‚ÄúKeep the bathroom clean.‚Äù and ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt eat our food.‚Äù

This is the worst air bnb experience I‚Äôve ever had. I‚Äôm 8 months pregnant. Check out is at 11 am. I don‚Äôt feel safe contacting the host until check out.

I will like a full refund.

Thank you.
Decent overall but location was far from everything and no shops nearby, for that reason I'd stay closer to S Austin or downtown next time

We checked in during the recent freeze in Austin. The heat wasn't working for two nights. Two days of back and forth with Sonder to get the issue resolved.. and it wasn't resolved to my satisfaction. The first 2 nights the AC blew only cold air, despite someone coming into fix it (when I asked what they'd done and when they'd come in, no one could tell me which makes me suspect they didn't do anything at all). When I contacted Sonder the 2nd night, they told me about a portable heater in the kitchen which I could use in the interim. When I explained it was a 2 bedroom apartment and we would need 2 heaters, they seemed stumped about that. They offered a code to a "nearby" apartment to go in and retrieve the heater from the "empty" apartment. Even though it was empty we were not able to stay in that apartment for the night, but could go to one 17miles away, but only for one night. We declined the offer to move. Given that it is Texas I also declined the offer to enter a so-called empty apartment and requested they go and bring me a new heater from the store. They did bring a heater that night at almost midnight which was really not fun to wait around in the cold for someone with an unknown ETA. The next day (day 3) I had to prompt them to get someone out to fix the heat... they confirmed at 1pm that the  issue was fixed. We returned home at 9pm to an tropical apartment. The vents were finally blowing hot air, but the system was not recognizing that the temperature was reached and continued to blow hot air (I had the system on "auto" so it should recognize when its at the requested temperature). Despite turning the thermostat down to 65F, it continued to blow 90F + air through the night until I finally gave up and turned it off. The next day (day 4) the outside temperature had risen above 53F (which was also the inside temp of the apartment the first 2 days just FYI) so I gave up with trying to get anything solved. I went to Austin for a scientific conference and spent 2 days trying to sort out a heating issue in the apartment so didn't really learn much. After contacting Airbnb, they made Sonder refund 50% of the first 2 nights fee (inadequate compensation in my opinion). Given that the premise of Airbnb is renting out other people's homes and not corporate entities renting out their numerous apartments, having Sonder on here when you can also book them on booking.com and through Sonder's website goes against the premise of Airbnb and I will never stay in a Sonder again. Also, there was mold on the shower curtain but I didn't take a picture because I was more concerned with getting them to fix the heat. One star.
Worth it if you need a quick place to stay but not as nice as the pictures make it look. The bed situation was in correct, it did not have twin beds

What to expect? Horrible customer service. What to expect? Having your reservation canceled after checking in, being gas lit about your email confirmation, and generally being treated without respect. There isn‚Äôt an option for zero stars.
Horrible customer service. Last minute cancellation without valid reason given. Talked to 3 staffs over phone for check in code/procedures. Ended up rejecting my stay. Stay away from this property!

This was the worst experience I've ever had. First off, our unit's AC was broken. We then had to move to a new unit across the courtyard. There, the tv didn't work. Sonder could not fix this issue, and the customer service was the worst I've ever dealt with. No one could find a solution, then multiple representatives just disconnected my call after spending much time on the phone with them (3 hours total....on vacation). We told the representative that we couldn't stay in an apartment with no TV and wanted a refund. We then left to get a hotel, with AC and TV and excellent customer service. Both Sonder and Airbnb are trying to not refund us the money. WE DIDN'T EVEN STAY IN THE UNIT. For the last several days I've spent countless hours on the phone with the "Resolution Department" speaking with different reps, Lemmard, Rachel, Hannah, Ashley, and Roquel. And every one of them doesn't care about the customer. I know this because they are trying to make me pay $900 and we never even stayed there!!! They don't care about how majorly inconvenient this whole ordeal has been. They lie and say they are going to call back, but never do, then I have to call up there over and over again to try to get in contact with the person working our case. The lack of integrity and customer care is absolutely disgusting and I, moving forward, will no longer use Sonder or Airbnb. Prior, I was a regular customer of Airbnb.

Good riddance forever, Airbnb. You have been an extreme disappointment.

No twin
Basic at best
No home comforts
Uncomfortable
No light fissure over Dining table
No throw pillows
No spare blankets
Caulking round bath needed re-do
Location good
Clean ish

BEFORE YOU BUY

Heres a list of the issues we had with this place:

1. We arrived and were given the wrong door code. We spent the next 20 minutes on hold trying to get in touch with customer service to just get entry into the apartment.

2. The upstairs toilet was clogged and full of urine/toilet paper once we actually got into the Airbnb. After we reported it to Sonder, we were asked if we would try to unplug the toilet. Why on earth would I fix a toilet that I didn't break, for an Airbnb that I'm paying 1400.00 for?

3. We found someone's dirty underwear in the pull out couch. Completely disgusting.

4. We were told there was a noise complaint on the same night that we were gone from 8 pm until 3 am. We werent given a time or any information on what caused the noise complaint. Needless to say this was the last straw for me.

1400.00 for 2 nights is fine if you're Airbnb is squared away, clean, and ready to go once you arrive. I would not recommend staying here as you can find much better deals in the area.

Austin is a beautiful city. Unfortunately, this accommodation does not match the excellent character of the city.
Paying $377/night , we were shocked to find a poorly maintained unit and facility. Building needs serious upkeep, floors uneven, many outlets did not work, bathroom needed total overhaul, beds extremely uncomfortable, and inappropriate art. Sonder could do MUCH better.
No concerns... beautiful accommodations and location!

Space is nice.

Sonder...I don't like the fact that I need to download a separate app, make an account, upload my driver's license and then get the check in info on their app.

I want a smooth experience in the Airbnb app. This is annoying.

We booked a unit with four beds as we were four adult friends, but our unit only had three beds.

Upon reaching out to Sonder after our stay, we were told that we got switched to a different unit due to availability issues. The fact that they wouldn't think to communicate that at all was pretty disappointing, especially considering how communicative they were through automated emails and text messages up to, during and even after our stay (which got kind of annoying). To their credit they acknowledged their error and issued a refund, but not the best service if that's something you need to reach out and fight for.

Worth noting that Sonder is a third party company separate from Airbnb, which was a bit surprising. They make you register and create an account which felt unnecessarily cumbersome (especially when my uploaded ID was flagged as "fake" in their system) and are strict on early check ins or late check outs (there are fees for each).

The unit itself is fine--cleanly, well equipped and in a good location. Besides from the obvious missing bed in our case it was largely as advertised though fairly cookie-cutter overall.
Nice location with good furniture but not cleaned well. Found some trash and dirty silverware from the last guests and the vent was moldy

This was definitely good for a crash pad. We loved the location and were close to everything. We didn‚Äôt stay in this exact location pictured, but it was a similar unit. We did have every Uber complain about the hill of the driveway, as well as a broken dishwasher during our stay.

I did not enjoy having to download a separate app to do everything in.

Other than that, it was fine! Nothing crazy but it worked.

Although the Sonder team was extremely available via the chat app, i had a number of issues during my stay. The worst was the security fail, which was surprising considering all the steps they make you take to verify you before checking in. The doors are operated by keypad and mine was broken the entire stay. I was unable to lock my door when leaving the property every time, having to leave my belongings exposed. There were also no blinds on the glass doors downstairs that left the ground level wide open to neighbors and i felt uncomfortable being down there with lights on at night since there was zero privacy on that floor. Every time i got home i was paranoid someone might have gotten in and so ran through the apt opening every closet door and i locked myself in the bedroom each night, but the windows didn‚Äôt open so i couldn‚Äôt get any fresh air. The apartment itself was fine, but clearly one of those Airbnb rentals that feels like it‚Äôs been left to fall apart and no one cares - all the fixtures on the tub/ sink etc were  loose and dirty, there was a mild case of black mold forming on the tiles near the bathtub upstairs, there was a coffee maker but no tea kettle‚Ä¶The bed was okay, not the most comfortable but also not the worst. Pillows were bad though but honestly that was the least of my concerns and that‚Äôs sort of subjective anyway. The Sonder team sent me 25$ for my troubles, but that‚Äôs about the price this place should have been per night considering how unsafe and stressed out it made me. Hopefully they value this feedback and will refund me for this extremely stressful stay.

Sonder was a miserable company to work with. They failed to respond to messages leading up to the reservation, and then cancelled our 5 day reservation moments before check-in due to issues with their unit. Accidents happen ‚Äî but when they do, I expect companies to work hard to fix their mistake. Sonder did nothing to help remedy the poor situation they left our group in on a holiday weekend. I will never consider working with Sonder again.

This airbnb is owned by a large company, which I failed to realize at the beginning. In spite of that, the location was walkable to downtown, and nice overall.

The one thing that kept it from five stars was the lack of transparency or forthrightness, or honesty? Weeks before check in I had inquired possibility of early check in since our flight would arrive two hours early. We were told that that was an option to review near actual check in, and sounded reasonable. However, two days prior to check in, when I asked about checking in earlier, I was told of course that is an option - for a fee of $25! I have stayed at many airbnbs and never had to pay for early check in when available. Had I known this earlier, I would have chosen a different airbnb.

Would not recommend!!! The location is decent because you‚Äôre near Barton Springs and right off S. 1st. However, the actual place had a lot of cons. When we entered the condo it was VERY warm and muggy. Tried to change the air and make it cooler but the system wouldn‚Äôt let us go above 76 when outside it was in the high 80s/low 90s. It was miserable. Especially at night. The one room that had a bed where two people could sleep in it had a fan BUT it was broken. The string that would allow you to turn off the light but still keep the fan on was broken, so the only way to keep the fan on was to keep the light on. This wouldn‚Äôt have been a problem had it not been 76 degrees in the house, probably even warmer upstairs. Because of this, my husband and I had to sleep in the other room which was composed of two twin size beds. There was a working fan in that room however it was still horribly warm. Overall, not worth what they charged per night and would not recommend!!!
The room was very clean but the AC was not enough to cool the room. Thw bathrrom has a weird smell and you could hear the neighbors they were very loud.

This is a decent place to stay if you are on a budget and wanting to visit either UT or downtown Austin.  My biggest complaint is the AC.  While it was abnormally hot (100 degrees for our 3 day visit), it could not keep up with heat.  It did not get below 80 degrees in the room until midnight or later.  The window unit is too small for a room on the 2nd floor in the Austin summer heat.  To be fair, Felicity warned us about the previous visitor possibly turning the unit off when they left and she brought additional fans to compensate for the lack of AC.  She was a good host and responded very quickly to any questions we had.   I would not stay here again in the heat of summer without replacing the window unit.  I would likely consider staying again in either the fall or spring.   Overall, decent place to say on a budget but AC upgrades are needed.
Accuracy between on line descriptions and reality was missing.

I think it was okay overall, obviously for the location, but nothing more. Not very clean, at all, dirty floors and dusty. AC unit MUST be cleaned or replaced (dusty, dirty & moldy). Bed is unstable and creaky. Wifi was unreliable and/or didn‚Äôt have signal at all.

Great location. Cozy and clean. Unfortunately, we found two roaches, one in the hallway and one in the room. There were also a lot of bugs and we got serveral bug bites.
The floors were creaky and uneven. It didn‚Äôt bother us too much but we felt bad for the people below us. We didn‚Äôt have any problems with the frat house next door.

Great location. Close to downtown & UT campus. Plenty of food choices within walking distance. The room was small but has a private bath and a mini fridge. You'll find spiders and some other bugs that sneaked into the room. I wasn't so surprised/bothered by them after spending 4 yrs living in TX. The major concern to me was that the room or maybe the sheets weren't very clean. I got mild skin irritation during my stay. It went away shortly after I left.
Nice place, comfortable and clean. Parking can be a little tough being so close to UT but was always able to find something close. Can‚Äôt go wrong staying here.
The small window AC unit was working hard - but was unable to adequately cook the upstairs room with 109 degrees outside.

I was looking forward to my stay at Felicity's place but was ultimately disappointed by the experience. The shower was the worst part for me. The water would barely dribble out of the fossit and the temperature was either cold or very hot. The minifrige was also a disappointment because there was so much ice that had built up that the door didn't close fully, so it was basically unusable. The brita filter that they provided with water was a nice touch but there seemed to be mold growing in the basin. Additionally the place just has cheap furniture. Chairs that don't sit flat, a dresser with the bottom of one drawer missing, the bed was comfortable enough but I had a few bug bites after waking up. The AC worked well and was always refreshing when I would return to the place, so that is a positive. This place is just cheap, and for the $127/night that I paid (including taxes/fees) it was not worth it. I wouldnt recommended paying more than $50/night here. (Also the place is in a student housing type building next to a frat, I don't remember if that was mentioned when I booked the place but just keep that in mind).

This stay was overall a 2.5/5.

The pictures do not accurately depict the quality of the actual residence. During our stay we found many items that were broken or just in bad shape. All of which was told to Jason. On a good note Jason did offer to come out and fix these items but it was not worth the time to do so since we were not utilizing all of the items.

Bring extra paper towel and toilet paper with you, there was not enough for the 6 of us. There was about half a roll of paper towel for the 3 nights and 4 toilet paper rolls. There was also no all purpose cleaning spray. All of which we did purchase ourselves and left for future guests.

The cleanliness I would say is a 2/5. There was a roach in the master bedroom that we did kill. There was also a sock and water bottle under one of the broken beds and a random t-shirt left in the bathroom. We heavily suggest wearing shoes at all times. We are a asian group and normally take our shoes off but our socks quickly turned brown/black due to the floors.

The location is not the best spot. It is on 6th Street but not centrally in a area that you would go to 6th Street for. There were many many homeless people on our street and on most corners. We were about a block away from where most of the homeless slept.
Convenient location one block away from 6th St and a short walk to Rainey St.   Space was tight, but we had 11 guests and it was doable.

The place is nicely decorated and functional. The walls are very thin though and you can hear other tenants constantly. The location was a quick scooter ride to 6th street and Rainey street but dot not suggest traveling from the condo to these locations alone.

Dirty sheets. Dirty floors. Couch is stained. Restrooms are dirty. One restroom has a clean sink but dirty shower and the other restroom sink is dirty with a clean shower... but pictures are photoshopped or took from 5 years ago.

Be wary this could be an Airbnb night as far as the booking processthe place states that it accommodates six although they try to nickel and dim you for every person they almost scare you in the beginning after you've already booked into cancelling with all their rules and restrictions apparently you're not allowed to have visitors there during your stay other than that the place is great sandthe space is convenient to most thingswe enjoyed our stay but we're a little stressed during our stay wondering if we were going to be kicked out or not

Most of the towels smelled like cigarettes, as well as the master bathroom for the duration of the stay. There was also a homeless individual asleep less than 2 feet from the back gate entrance 1 morning, we had to step over him to even leave the property. Finally, the couch in the living room was broken and couldn't be leaned on properly. The location is close to lots of things by car, but going out on foot did not feel particularly safe due to the location directly next to a serious highway / homeless encampment.

Check-in was pretty bad, I showed up early and asked to drop bags off - I was denied and told to wait for the agreed upon time- once the agreed upon time came- there was still maintenance people working on the place- cleaning services hadn‚Äôt even started- a couple hours after we were supposed to be able to check in- I asked the cleaning people to leave- I told them I would finish (it was just dishes left).

After that, the oven broke- I didn‚Äôt use it at all, but it started beeping throughout the night. - I googled the error code which said there was an electrical short in it- I let the host know who sent someone to check it out. I was told it was checked and shouldn‚Äôt be a problem. The next night it started beeping again- and didn‚Äôt stop till about 9 am. I had trouble sleeping two of the three nights there because of the broken oven and found the host Jason to be unhelpful and somewhat rude.

I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this place to stay.
killer location

The overall conditions of the condo was not at all shown in the pictures. The home had dust caked on the grates on the ceiling, roaches found running across the kitchen, showers covered in mold, shower curtains stained and molded, drains were not properly draining, beds were not good quality, walls were dirty, and hair balls on the ground. Definitely not what we expected for the price and ‚Äúsuperhost‚Äù experience.
Good location and comfy home. Limited Parking on site but wasn‚Äôt a big deal since you could park on the next block.
The house is nice but kinda dark. Not too much natural light and one shower didn‚Äôt work.

Michelle's place is in a great location and she was quick to respond to all my messages. Unfortunately, our group had some issues with dog hair all over the apartment including the bedding which was not a pleasant experience.

The absolute worse experience I have ever had. I work in hospitality/Sales/Customer Service, and this was by far the worse experience I have ever had, and Gina was the absolute worst host as well. There is simply not enough room here to convey all that I experienced, so I will say the least.

The first week of our stay was fine. Unfortunately, the hot water heater went out half way through our stay. The hosts weren‚Äôt able to get it fixed prior to the big Texas snow storm (one day before the storm) and verbally told my husband (since they live next door) that they would refund the days the hot water was out. We left the space with three days remaining when the roads were safe, as there was still no power and no fix for the hot water heater scheduled. Unfortunately, since this was said verbally and not written in a message in the AirBnB app, the hosts were able to go back on their word and only gave a refund for the days we not there. We figured since they were so nice they would honor their word, but they didn‚Äôt. It‚Äôs sad that this is our first poor AirBnB experience and to have a host that was less than amenable in a terrible situation. He didn‚Äôt respond to messages quickly to have a discussion and accidentally called my husband thinking he was a plumber 6 days after the last message we sent. After he realized his mistake, he hung up on him, and then didn‚Äôt answer when he called him back. Due to all this, I will in the future make sure I stay with messaging hosts only in the app and we will also never stay with this host in the future as we will be traveling often back to Austin.

Horrible communication. Me and 4 other guys were stranded for 7 1/2 hours with nowhere to go. The host needs to post the accurate address instead of the neighborhood the house is located in I wouldn't suggest this host to noone. We were going door to door knocking on doors trying to find the right house to the point we had no choice, but to leave with embarrassment. Thanks to Airbnb customer service finding a hotel for us and providing other hosts nearby to book a new stay.

the worst Airbnb ever,
I took this room which is not part of the house and doesn't have centralized AC/heater.
very rude host, keeps telling you to switch of lights and when I was literally using them to do my day job (wfh) and she says we should use natural sunlight and threatened to increase the rent. kept nagging me for using heater and also keeps telling you to leave the place if you want to. had a horrible time.
she kicked out one other guy for leaving the toilet seat open and talks bad about other guests constantly.
above all she one night came to my room when I sleeping without knocking just to turn of the light.

I kind of don't want anyone else to find out about this secret gem.
Travelers, stop by. If you‚Äôre looking to get outdoors this is the spot for you. It has all that you need and is conveniently located.
Absolutely not worth a penny, dirty and no communication. This host wasted so much of our time and Airbnb wasn‚Äôt helpful!
I can‚Äôt wait to stay here again! Funky, spacious, convenient - it was everything we wanted and more.
I was not found of the locks on the bedroom door and needing a code to get in the  rooms. I believe he also had motion sensor in every room. It was a little weird.
Cute place but attached to the side of the house if you‚Äôre worried about smoking or any noise problems

Pretty disappointed in this place. There was bugs in the room. The host walked right inside without knocking luckily we were clothed. They didnt allow you to bring your own alcohol and insisted you bought theirs. Its a $300 hotel just stay at a hotel. We actually left to go stay in a hotel.

Before I begin, my thoughts are primarily about the value and difficulty in finding the apartment. We spent over 10 minutes looking for the actual unit in the apartments. We wanted to cook until we saw the cookware on top of the refrigerator. My expectations would not have been nearly as high if this were a $40 or even $50 stay but $100 Absolutely not! Stellar communication and flexibility; the only negative was that she didn't leave her ADORABLE  dog Bella with us. :)

Mucho muy recomendable!

sorry I don't have one
These host are liars and thieves. Extort Airbnb. Lie about damages so Airbnb can pay them them.

I would expect over-priced mediocrity at BEST!  Expect poor service, fraudulent extra charges she claims are taxes that she double-charges for and expect to be lied to about the amenities. This place should rent for $200/night MAX
Yes-Hands down the best place to stay bar none! Super clean and designed to do nothing but relax. This place made me want to send for my stuff back home because I didn‚Äôt want to leave.

There is likely no better location in Austin. If you are traveling alone or with a person you don‚Äôt mind sharing a space with THIS IS YOUR PLACE!

So much walkability. & the host was incredibly knowledgeable with local eats/drinks/to-do‚Äôs.

Overall we loved this house however there is a few things I wish I had known before booking. The location is not ideal, while only about 15 minutes from downtown, the neighborhood was in no way safely walkable for three young women. Also major heads up, do not lean on the coffee table as it will topple over & be extremely careful with the oven warmer, there was no clear indication it was on so one of us grabbed a pan underneath burning herself. Very simply appointed and clean apartment. Nothing spectacular but good for a short trip.

Place was fine. Not very tidy. At all. Only real complaint, the rest was completely fine. blatant lack of cleaning is unsettling to say the least. Other than that price point right on par with what I‚Äôd think

The condo  was absolutely  beautiful and a great location!  All the more reason for our overwhelming disappointment with our stay. Our check-in time was 3 p.m. and  when  we arrived the condo was  not  cleaned.  we informed our host, Kevin and he was sincerely apologetic and said that he was going to get someone there right away to clean it. He even called us back on our cell phone rather than email to let us know that he was going to be in constant contact to let us know when we can get into a place. We initially thought it would take maybe an hour or two. We I have two small children and had just arrived after  a very long drive. We were exhausted and we're hoping to be able clean up, rest up and then enjoy the city. Unfortunately, 4 hours later we hadn't heard from him  even after we called him several times without a response. We then attempted to contact him by email. We had expected a phone call to let us know when we can go back but then around 9 we noticed he finally emailed us. To our dismay, he informed us that his phone had been off and he just put it back on and that our room was now verified clean. To his credit he did refund us for the 1 night stay  but undeniably a disappointing situation and over 6 hours waiting with two young children... we were in Austin for only one night during our travels  we were  extremely tired  and didn't have time to freshen up and rest after are long drive... our expectation is that he would have called us immediately knowing he already had our phone number. And to make matters worse the next morning while my husband was in the shower the water was shut off and when we try to contact Kevin he was not answering his cell phone. It took him about over 15 minutes to get back to us. When he finally did contact us  he let us know  that he was going to send a maintenance man . Then sometime later  he finally contacted us again to let us know the services was going to be cut off until about noon... check out time was 11.  We ended up having to call Airbnb customer services  explain the situation and then we left without  showering or feeding our children any breakfast.
Host did not respond the entire time we were there. We had no toilet paper when we checked in. And there was not enough blankets/sheets for couch & air mattress.

Great location and place very close to downtown with plenty of space for groups, however, we ran into several unmet expectations from the host during our stay. This was actually my worst air bnb experience thus far. Kevin was very slow to respond to me and as a guest, it was weird to feel like a burden after simply asking for things that should have been readily available already. This was especially difficult when we realized the extra sheets and pillows Kevin promised us for the air mattresses were not accessible but instead inside of a locked closet. Although I first inquired about these around 3 pm, he did not message me back until 1:30 am with where the keys for the closet were, when we were already asleep. We ended up having to take blankets off of the beds and use those for the air mattresses. In addition, the machine that blew up the mattress had dead batteries inside of it. Therefore, we had to drive to a store and use our personal money to purchase more batteries. Not only was this an inconvenience but when I asked Kevin to reimburse for the batteries (two times) he completely ignored me and I still have not heard back from him. Unsure why I had to pay for batteries that I used once and were his responsibility to buy. Overall, it was a frustrating and disappointing experience for myself and my friends.
The place was clean, convenient, and priced right. The parking can be a bit of a pain if you roll in late at night - spots were always available, you just had to find them.

The seller texted me the day before check out stating how great the guests were and asking if we needed for another week. He stated that AirBnB charges me 20% more than what you pay him. He asked how much I was charged, and insinuated that we could work out a deal outside of AirBnB. After this was refused, he messaged me after checkout saying that we left the house a mess for his cleaning crew.  He was the one that came in to clean after check out, not a cleaning crew, and his accusations were false. He said he would provide photo evidence so that we could work it out without him filling a claim, and those photos were never received. I believe he is just trying to get extra money out of these tactics.

Sandy was an attentive host and quick to respond to our questions and requests. The kitchen was missing a couple of items,  but she got them to us just a few hours after asking. The place suited our needs to visit nearby Austin, Lake Travis and Perdenales Falls State Park.

When we arrived, everything appeared fine but as we settled in we found a few concerns.

First, the house had not been properly clean. There were piles of crumbs on the furniture, the trash can was caked with food and smelled horribly, and no one had thoroughly cleaned the floors as there was piles of someone else's dog's hair in multiple locations.

Then we took a step into the side yard and things took a turn for the worse. There is a sign on the door that reads, "RODENTS WILL COME IN NEVER LEAVE OPEN." Then we went outside to find trash and dog poop all over. There was what appeared to be a broken hot tub covered in random construction materials and trash.

The dirtiness inside and outside plus the risk for rodents was enough for us to contact the host and Airbnb for a refund.

I spoke with the owner of the duplex and he was very kind and apologetic. I assume this was just a case of out sourced cleaning people not doing a great job and overtime things built up.

Frances happened to be out of town when I stayed at her place, but she was very thoughtful about keeping in touch and her location cannot be beat. Love the decorations in her home and the invaluable guide to Austin she provided!
I didn't have a good experience. The place could have been cleaner.
Excelente estad√≠a, muy amables V√≠ctor y to√±ita excelentes anfitriones muy limpio y muy c√≥moda la casa. Yo fui al motoGP y sin dudarlo el pr√≥ximo a√±o regreso.
I cannot recommend this place enough, the pictures do not do it justice. We were blown away by the outdoor space and size of the pool. Howard provided everything you would need.

The house is beautiful.  Please be careful when booking a stay that the Renters Club manages. I was having a staycation with my 12yr old and 15yr old daughters. They came upstairs from the pool and said, ‚Äútwo men are swimming in the pool‚Äù. The renters club host was not responsive. I got two different stories from them on why two older men were in the pool. I did get a full refund. However, what is something terrible had happened to my girls. Unacceptable.
It‚Äôs our 4th time staying here and every time we leave we can‚Äôt wait to book our next trip!
Good location and great dog park though the complex is a bit too questionable. Unfortunately there was no hot water when I was there and that made for a disappointing stay.

When we arrived the place was much smaller then we thought. The a/c didn‚Äôt seem to work. We arrived after the available check in time and the house was not ready for us. We were told to wait outside until the cleaning crew was done.
Be prepared to be left stranded. She will be missing and you will not be able to get in her Airbnb. You'll pay and won't get to stay. Avoid at all costs.

Checkin instructions were long and hard to understand. We had to park on side to road and walk
Across the street to walk down stairs to get to the key. Very inconvenient. We finally figured that part out then parked in garage and the link given to unlock the elevator was not working. I called the host and it took them 2 hours to call me back. Toilet would not flush and the ceiling fan was making noise all night. Was not worth the money I paid .
Stay here, you won‚Äôt regret it
A truly magical place.  I make a habit of not going to the same place twice, but I can‚Äôt wait to go back to Lost Parrot Cabins again.

Make sure to read the listing information. I didn‚Äôt know I may possibly be asked to change our own sheets and do much of the cleaning. This put a big damper on our trip. Though it didn‚Äôt take much time, it was still inconvenient.

The house looks good, mattress was very cozy and bathroom shower area looks great too but the path walking to the backside would require some nice cleaning as it has some bushes sticking out which can hurt in the night when you can‚Äôt see the view, and the bathroom including the drawers next to the bathroom was bit dirty which put a damper on the stay.

If you are looking for a fancy hotel room in a suburban neighborhood, then you must stay here! It‚Äôs got everything you need and nothing you don‚Äôt. It‚Äôs worth every dollar for that bathtub alone. 10 out of 10.
Very basic and no frills, but the information is accurate and location is close to the Domain. Every single thing is labeled so no guessing and check in was easy.

I stayed here a couple nights while visiting Austin. It‚Äôs a spacious studio with a king bed and large bathroom.

It‚Äôs perfect for one person, but weird if you have two guests. The door on the bathroom is broken and there are only thin curtains separating the toilet and bedroom. It‚Äôs very awkward and no privacy if someone needs to go. The kitchen area is also within the large bathroom area which was strange.

The host was very responsive when we had trouble with the lock. Overall a good stay.

This was our first experience with Airbnb so we did not know quite what to expect. Overall, we were pleased with the location. It afforded our family a ground floor, quiet place to stay with more room and more convenience than we could have gotten by booking two adjoining rooms in a hotel. However, we encountered several problems that were inconvenient to say the least. A family that is tired from a day of traveling across country should not have to drive to a Walmart to buy blankets for their beds before they can bed down for the night. An elderly couple should not feel that their bathroom commode might just fall over as they sit down or alight from it. Six guests that wish to freshen up after a long travel day should have six sets of linens at their disposal. Guests should not expect maintenance to have to spend several hours the morning after their arrival fixing items that should have been attended to ahead of their stay. Guests should not be awoken after they are in bed by a man claiming to be the "cleaner" who then gets angry and slams the door as he is leaving when he had the combination to the locked linen closet and could have at the very least kept the elderly guest whose blanket was not on his bed from spending his first night cold.

This was my first experience with AirBNB, and the corporate customer service was outstanding, so kudos to AirBNB. I can‚Äôt say the same for my experience with the rental or the host. The pictures in the posting are accurate, but unless you see things up close you don‚Äôt see everything. The kitchen was dirty, there was leftover food from the last renters, crumbs and splatter marks in the drawers and cabinets. So, we washed the dishes we used prior to using them. The stove was rusty and spattered and there was only a 4-cup coffee maker. There was only half a role of paper towel and half a roll of toilet paper when we arrived, but the owner did have someone drop off more. A day or so into our stay the power in half the kitchen went out so we had to move the microwave and coffee maker to different outlets, but the most unsettling was the animal the got into the roof.  The animal climbed through a hole in screen just under the eaves at the end of the house. We heard a boom and scratching and running around during the night.  This is not a ‚Äòwelcome to my home‚Äô rental, it is owned by out of state owners. If you can find a different option, I would suggest you book elsewhere.

Casey was a horrible host. Her apartment was crawling with roaches and my children and I were absolutely horrified. She knew her apartment had roaches and failed to mention this upon booking, leaving me and my children with no choice but to suffer through our stay. My children were restless and wet the bed due to them being frightened of the roaches that crawled about her apartment. Casey attempted to charge me an additional $120 cleaning fee to cover the bed, on top of the $59 cleaning fee I paid in full without incident, alleging that her maintenance staff charged her an additional $120. Casey‚Äôs leaky fridge also ruined my son‚Äôs birthday cake which was the icing on the cake, no pun intended. If you are considering Casey‚Äôs place for your stay in Austin, I beg you to reconsider. I have never been treated so poorly.

I do not recommend staying here . Plenty of roaches, the appliances were broken , tub leaks , and the location is really bad . It‚Äôs like staying at a motel 6 .
Be prepared to wear shoes the entire time to avoid stepping on roaches . Only plus is the bed is really soft. The entire place needs to be revamped . It is very poorly taken care of. Wi-Fi barely works. Cabinets don‚Äôt close. Shower rods are rusty. Please don‚Äôt waste your time or money .

This should be call cockroach lane. The place is infested with cockroaches, we were doing coffe and coackroaches were getting out from the toaster , we were cooking and cockroaches were getting out from the kitchen , we were washing dishes and cockroaches getting out from the sink.  Like a horror movie . The first day we arrived and notice a smell . The kitchen was so dirty , the oven had pieces of food , we should have left as soon as we arrived , but we didn‚Äôt want the hassle  to pack and do a search and waist one or two days from our vacation, so we stay. So the next morning we didn‚Äôt eat or bath . We went to HEB and bought cleaning supplies , towels , Clorox , desinfectant and we get back and clean .  We left Clorox in the sink at night , in the bath , we fumigate with raid and next day clean the floors and we found several dead. We did this all our stay . Soo run away from this place. Not recommended . The only thing we like is the location it is in the middle of Austin . But from that and the cost and cockroaches not worth it.

The location was okay for a weekend trip but I wouldn‚Äôt recommend it long term. The bathroom and kitchen needs some much needed updating . Rusty shower rods and the cabinets in the kitchen were nasty. We ran out of towels but Casey was able to provide more. The bed in the master room was two twins put together so you will be falling in the middle all night . The location is quiet and was close to most things we needed to go. Unfortunately we discovered roaches one night while going into the kitchen and the lights were off. Completely blindsided about this fact and would never stay there again. Upon further inspection we noticed other reviews about the roaches but they weren‚Äôt there till after booking. Not sure if this is Casey‚Äôs doing or Airbnb but it‚Äôs suspicious. Hopefully she renovates the place and exterminator there soon.

STAY AWAY!!! ROACHES!!!This place is gross bed sheets have stains white towels have stains and even the shower curtain have stains l. Not to mention there is in fact still a roach problem that the host has yet to put a permanent fix to
For the location and price, you can‚Äôt go wrong.

Although Casey was very friendly via the app, the actual airbnb was disgusting and I wouldn‚Äôt recommend to anybody. The bedroom light didn‚Äôt turn on. The apartment smelled of smoke when we arrived. The comforters were dirty and had a brown stain on it which did not smell good obviously. We found a roach crawling on the toilet seat, the kitchen table, and one in the bedroom. Overall I was disappointed and not happy about the situation.

Place was about 10 minutes outside of downtown, and was conveniently located; however, the place was surrounded by a neighborhood that felt slightly unsafe and insecure, considering we were three young girls. Stay went smoothly, though.

We arrived after checking in online. Host did not provide a passcode to the door so we couldn‚Äôt get in. We messaged and tried to call the host several times to no avail. Finally contacted Airbnb; they also could not get in touch with the host.
Bottom line, we paid in full for a place to stay and couldn‚Äôt get in. We were forced to find other accommodations late at night.
The host finally responded at 3:04am via Airbnb message ‚Äúapologizing‚Äù. No reason was given for the terrible service.
We have had nothing but great experiences and great hosts with all other Airbnb reservations in the past. This was NOT one of them.
This place is a bargain, but you get what you pay for!

BEWARE!!! Place IS INFESTED WITH BUGS. Entire first floor is filled with ants. I am a physician who uses Airbnb weekly as I travel for my work. Never have I ever been so uncomfortable in the 1 week I spent here. Worst mistake of my life. Landlord  blatantly ignored my request to spray the house for bugs as it‚Äôs infested with ants and instead requested I go and buy bug spray to spray the house. How ridiculous. Then they claim they never had this issue until I came as if I brought the ants with me. They gave me 75 dollars saying this is too much and I don‚Äôt deserve anything more. What a joke. After a week of hell and 100 ant bites I do NOT recommend this place.

It was not clean, we had several issues. Linens were not clean, flys everywhere, dead bug in sheets, hair in sheets that were not ours, and ants were all over the place downstairs. It didn‚Äôt seem like they cleaned before we got there.

The price you pay for this listing is all for location location. Yes it's very clean inside, but the fridge was half full of food that was not ours, there was no where to put our clothes as the closests where locked and no places in the bedroom. The bedroom does not have a fan or blinds. The pool was disgusting, it had water bugs that bite, and leaves floating everywhere, the grass was over grown and half dead. The host did communicate well but loved to keep reminding us not to have shoes in the house which is fine but tell us once only. We did not feel able to relax. For the price we paid we felt we did not get value for money.
The house itself was ok, but out side the house, driveway and backyard was very dirty, not possible to use the furniture due to shit. Door from kitchen area to backyard very dirty. Too expensive.

The communication started okay, but it became more and more delayed. The login was incorrect when my family got there so we had to wait to get a new door code.  The house is clean inside but the surrounding area is a little sketchy. Our car got broken into on the last night even with the gate on the driveway. There was also a weird noise coming from the attic. I texted the owner about it but was never addressed.

Cristin was an amazing host and we had a great stay! Not only was she very easy to communicate with but she had everything setup for us prior to arrival and the house was spotless, not to mention excellently decorated. There are a ton of amenities at this home and checkin/checkout was a breeze. It is also close enough to downtown that we had no issues getting anywhere. Looking forward to staying here again next time we are in Austin!
Bed felt old and not that confortable. The paper shades let too much light in the Room and that is not ideal for resting.

Although the location was ideal, there were two things that made this stay very uncomfortable. One, we were only left with less than half a toilet paper roll. Ran out the first day which did not make for a happy morning when both of us had to go. Literally had to use a napkin and the last two squares on the roll since it was an emergency. Went and bought our own after. Second, the towels left for us were disgusting. They smelled of urine and rotten milk. I felt dirty the whole time after using them. Not just that but I was left with dog hairs all over my body after using one of the towels. Had these two things been remedied, it wouldn‚Äôt have been that bad but overall, the place just left us feeling dirty.

accurate description, clean, close enough to everything cool on the east side. it's tiny but exactly as described and has everything you would need for a place to crash. would stay again, especially if I were alone, but enough room for a couple.

The place was beautiful but there were a lot of mosquitoes and the dog kept barking next door. Late evenings all the crickets and huge cockroaches started coming out from under the fridge and the washroom and it was quite scary and creepy at the same time.

This place looks super nice in the photos, but we were unpleasantly surprised when we got there. The host is super nice, but the apartment complex is VERY run down. There were roaches outside by our door and windows and the shower was dirty. The shower also had horrible water pressure and the water wouldn‚Äôt drain properly. The pool looks nice but was dirty and there are no chairs to lounge. Also, we had men constantly coming to stare us down while we were swimming that were residents of the apartments. The house was constantly hot, and per the hosts instructions we couldn‚Äôt turn the thermostat down past 70 because she told us it would freeze. It was miserably hot the entire time. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend anyone staying here.
Just not a nice place.... very disappointing

This was a nice, clean place to stay. Host was very communicative, kind and helpful. Unfortunately, the Uber rides to/from downtown (6th street) added up a bit. We were also a little disappointed when our Uber dropped us off from the airport and warned us that the area was not safe. The complex and home felt safe overall, but a venture out on foot after dark was intimidating for us.

This was our very first time in Austin! We were ecstatic to visit and to try out our sophisticated Airbnb. Upon arrival we were all greatly disappointed and heartbroken to see that the all the pictures were deceiving. While it didn‚Äôt live up to our expectations, it was an okay stay.
Nice place, area is scary

Good for larger groups - location was a bit weird and sleep was not the best (AC wasnt working well / some of the air mattresses deflated) but gets the job done for a night  if you‚Äôre looking for something on the low
The water pressure in the shower sucked , other than that everything was great .
Unfortunately Jerry was out of town, so the place was not ready for me.

Do not stay here. The pictures are incredibly misleading; the space is tiny and cramped, there aren‚Äôt multiple rooms and it doesn‚Äôt feel private at all. The room was dirty with stains on the floor and walls.

The room is quite small. It wasn‚Äôt especially clean. The rest of the house smelled quite strongly and was very very cluttered. And you are renting a room in a busy house with other people, so be prepared to hear people talking, even later at night. The neighborhood is fairly quiet, but not especially well cared for. The room was rather dusty, and the toilet seat is broken. I would simply confirm with the host before arriving that it has what you need.

There wasn‚Äôt enough toilet paper, host didn‚Äôt respond, TV didn‚Äôt work, the bunk bed room is a garage that‚Äôs remodeled so a little bit weird and you can see directly in from the alley. The location was decent though if you‚Äôre looking for a place just to sleep basically this would do
Pictures are misleading, second bedroom is a garage. Linen had red and yellow stains on it, carpets and sofas are dirty. Apartment is clearly not cleaned after each stay.

Can't say much about this place because I never got in. The host was unresponsive and never communicated with me until after I had to call Airbnb to get a refund and book a last minute hotel after I arrived in Austin.
Only after the refund process went through did she pop up to message me on the platform to say she had lost her phone and other excuses. I'm not sure what the deal actually was but very shady. Be warned. Do not recommend in the slightest.

AVOID!!! So many issues, and not pleasant at all to work with. First, they had these crazy rules that was made it sound like it was the Taj Mahal. However, when I got in there, most things were broken and dirty and it was honestly disgusting. And they were very nonresponsive. The garbage had not been taken out, there were bugs, the door on the bathroom vanity was literally hanging off, the bathtub was constantly running, the hand towels in the bathroom were grotesquely stained, all the cabinets were beat up, counters are stained and dirty, TV didn‚Äôt work well, place smelled bad, and the kitchen table had some gooey substance on it. This from a place that demanded you take your shoes off before you went inside.  I honestly did not even shower there and got a refund for canceling even though host refused any credit. Pictures don‚Äôt lie. wI‚Äôve stayed at. It‚Äôs also high up on a third floor, so could be difficult for somebody to carry all their stuff up to even in the best circumstances.

The place was beautiful and it was a great location but there was some issues: There was a bit of miscommunication with the host, problems with the gate, and the amenities.

1. Although the listing said to check-in at 3 PM, I contacted the host for an early check-in and he agreed for me to arrive at 12 PM instead. Upon arriving at the AirBnB at 12 PM, the house was not ready due to cleaning services and delayed to an hour; So I had to kill time and go somewhere else.

2. The gate upon arrival was a struggle. I was able to get my keys from the lockbox but moving and pushing the gate was hard to do. Multiple times, my boyfriend and I had to fix the gate for us to enter.

3. The bedroom and living room was exactly like the pictures but other things were not shown. The shower was messy and felt as if someone lived there and left; empty and full bottles on the caddy, unorganized. I had plans to go to the lake and come back to wash my bathing suit, but the washer was overflowing with dirty sheets and towels. I don‚Äôt know what cleaning services the host uses but he needs a new one.
Cancelled stay due to poor check-in instructions and communication.

My friend and I did not feel safe or comfortable and did not end up staying the night at this reservation. The incorrect address was listed on the reservation. The location was not as expected. We were not told this through prior communications, but instead informed when we arrived and called the host as requested. This seemed like a red flag, but we meet with the host as we were excited to be in Austin for SXSW. When we entered the apartment it was unclean and we noticed uncomfortable adult magazines throughout the apartment. Our host stated he was in the middle of resetting so we said we would leave and come back. The toilet also was broken and the makeshift hanger did not fix it. We were asked to lie if someone asked who we were. Ultimately we decided not to stay the night and due to the high traffic in Austin for SXSW were unable to stay in town so we headed back to the DFW area. We told our host we could not stay the night. When he responded the next day, he agreed to refund us about 1/3 of our reservation. Kokayi seemed like a polite guy, but all these other factors made us uncomfortable enough to cancel our reservation.
Owner I talked to was a male and he was very rude. He said he was going to call me back and I‚Äôm still waiting on that call back.

Pros:
Great location
Porch was cute/nice
Perfect for a weekend trip

Cons:
Pull out bed was very uncomfortable
Great Spot, Great Location. I issues with The Internet but nothing major. Overall great experience, would book again
I had locked my keys in my car and Shawn extended my check out time with no hassle. great hospitality.

This place was a fair price for a north Austin, dog-friendly, no frills, free-standing home in a very transitional neighborhood, but was missing some basic amenities like coffee and added towels which we communicated to the owner. The place was clean but showed some wear and tear. It had fenced back yard for our mutt but was muddy due to the rain so we didn't use it. This wasn't the best place we've stayed but it got the job done, and we were able to drive anywhere we wanted to go quickly.

Great facility! Descriptions of the house where misleading. Photos where not clear and accurate. There was a gentleman with a crutch that was acting strange and startled one of us making us all feel uncomfortable. He was hovering around the door making us feel not safe. The listing didn‚Äôt state that this was a split house with a family living down stairs. Amazing setup with the house and yard just really expensive for a split house that a family is living in.
house was very clean, A/C worked great,  wifi was a little slow but that might have been an isolated problem.
I want to steal the couch!

The space and location were fine, but the check-in process was awful. There was way too much information shared up front via AirBnB messages and over text message (a true AirBnB novel of instructions), especially for my one-night stay, and this not only wasted my time but also made it difficult to find the key info I needed to actually find this very hard-to-find location.
