Went to one wrong location that my Google Maps directed me to before navigating myself to what I was sure was the right location, with my building (#11) listed on the front gate. When I finally got to the door, the app I was supposed to use to unlock it didn't work so I called the host but got his voicemail, which made me anxious that I would have no way of getting in if he didn't call me back. Fortunately he called me back a minute later but it turned out I was at the wrong building in the wrong complex, even though it was the same exact door number at the same address as the apartment I was supposed to be in (one was the A side and one was the B side, apparently). I finally made it there but it took about 45-60 minutes longer than almost any other AirBnB I've stayed in and was a very frustrating process to go through right after flying in.

Maybe fine for a longer trip, but for those planning on staying for one or two nights I'd say the check-in process makes booking this location not worth it.

All in all a beautiful and quiet space. Loved the trees in the views.  My only really minor disappointment was the lack of available closet in the bedroom with king bed. In an already small/tight room, it was a pain to have to navigate around open suitcases of clothes and not be able to hang clothes.
Trailer was nice. The location was not great.

We were unfortunate to get caught in the rare winter storm in Texas . We first stayed in Dallas then Waco and our last stop Austin . We were blessed to have great communication with our others hosts before arriving to Dallas and Waco in making sure we would be presented with no problems from the storm upon arrival to our airbnbs . However we had major problems upon arriving to Austin . Days prior to our arrival we contacted the host to make sure everything would be ok . Communication was poor . But eventually the host responded and mentioned he had some water issues due to the storm but that everything was resolved and that we were good to go . Upon arrival we opened the door to a musty order that was masked by febreze and cologne. While trying to settle in we stepped into the first bedroom and our socks got drenched. We then realized  the whole carpet was wet . We automatically called the host and I do have to give him credit that he did respond to our late call and quickly agreed  to cancel our reservation so we could get relocated somewhere else. He also agreed we could stay the night until Airbnb relocated us in the morning . However the place was in such a bad manner I.e room rugs were wet , bathroom rugs dirty and sofa bed and room bed sheets were filthy . We wished communication was done correctly before arrival to avoid the 24 hours of hell which we did not have a ‚Äúhome‚Äù. This lack of communication could have been avoided and we didn‚Äôt and  shouldn‚Äôt have endured all of this.

Disappointed, after reading the reviews I was okay with the cost. However, the ‚Äúremodel‚Äù is poorly done. Pieces of the top bar are coming off.
The space was anything but clean. Bed linings had not been changed from previous stay or were stained when changed out. Shower lining was extremely disgusting. The cleaning fee is a rip off for the quality of cleanliness the place offers.
Location was the only part accurate.

After checking to make sure we would have access to the hot tub at 11:30 it was not hot, had to wait 25 minutes for it to heat up. The ac went out our second night and it was 81 all night. Reached out to both owners with no response from either. Roaches came out of the oven when we turned it on. Worst AirB&B experience ever.

I booked an overnight stay at this airbnb in Austin in the middle of the week. All i needed was a place for me and my dog to sleep. The host left some complementary dog bowls and a dog biscuit and some water bottles and beer and snacks in the fridge, which was a very nice touch. However, i soon realized that the a/c was not working and that the unit was too warm to stay in without it. After several attempts trying to adjust the thermostat to no avail, I messaged the host and waited for a response. Called the host and left a voicemail and waited for a response. Messaged and called several more times without a response. I waited around in the uncomfortable warm unit for an hour before i decided to give up and find other accommodations. I message the host saying that i was leaving and that i will need a full refund, and the host then finally replied back that he would. When he sent a refund, it was only partial. It turns out that airbnb policy was for the guest to assume the airbnb costs. It was an unpleasant time and the kicker was that i still had to pay a fee for it.

My original reservation for this unit was for 3 nights during a vacation in Austin, TX. Unfortunately, I only stayed in it for 30 minutes before setting up other living arrangements. From what I gathered during my short stay was that there is a significant amount of false advertisement. For example, the sleeping space was very tight and the foot of the bed was right up against the wall so the soles of my feet touched the wall. Also, above the foot of the bed was a block window that connected to the interior of the house, not the exterior. There was no covering on this window so I could see when another unit's light was on and vice versa. No blackout curtains were available in my unit, unlike the post mentions. There was another block window near the kitchen area as well. Another issue with the unit was the bathroom area. There was a curtain to draw instead of a door or wall. There were two steps to walk up to be at the toilet. My head touched the ceiling as I stood at the toilet. Across from the toilet was the shower but I had to step down into the shower area. Also, there were blinds/curtains missing on some of the windows across the back of the unit. An exterior issue was that half the walk way behind the house was missing concrete walking stones so I was forced to walk in the dirt/mud to get to the entrance. Also, plastic edging was placed to separate the walkway from the grass and I tripped on this one night because there was no exterior light on that side of the house. Square footage is listed, but no mention of ceiling height to objectively measure just how "tiny" this house really is. I attempted to communicate my disappointment with the owner, who did nothing to remedy the unpleasant experience. She was more concerned about how I was going to review her unit on the platform. When I did request a refund of some of the amount, she stated the issue was completely my own and attempted to intimidate me by stating, "I think it best neither of us leave a review." Obviously this made me want to leave a review even more. All in all, a terrible first Airbnb experience, and probably the last.

I would like to add that the customer service at AirBnb has been exemplary for addressing and remedying my situation. Also, the owner's dog, Mo, was very friendly.

COCKROACHES. Crawling out of small holes in the wall, cabinets had not been cleaned out in years. Cockroaches also present on kitchen wall/counter/floor as well as the bathtub and shower area, the more we explored the more disappointed we were to pay 303 dollars for 2 days. Host offered to spray for bugs, but it was still a disappointing experience.


great location

Very interactive cohost

Flexible check in

Walkable to anything you would want to do!

not at all retro, just run down and in need of serious repairs. There is a basket of crackers and granola bars but no actual breakfast.

Accommodating and down to earth host.

Some cleanliness issues which lowered our rating. House seems as if someone is currently living there but rents it out from time to time, including storing of personal items in drawers and such. Made the say a bit uncomfortable.

I hate to be negative, but this is a negative review. It needs a professional clean, at a minimum, including inside the grimy fridge. Cobwebs all over. One ceiling vent and ceiling around it torn up. Just general disrepair. Fridge was almost completely full of other people's partially used condiments, beer, liquor and was extremely dirty. No note to explain for guest's use, so we thought it was owners stuff. For a 13 day stay for a family, needed and expected an empty and clean fridge. It would look much cleaner if painted inside. Showers were full of half used bottles of stuff, just kinda gross. We didn't even take showers because so yucky. Poison oak in back yard. Cobwebs everywhere. No toaster. Not enough plates, bowls or utensils for advertised max guests. We had to buy a pot because only a 4" pot in kitchen. No strainer, serving bowls or common kitchen dishware. We used paper and plastic and washed everything before we used it because it didn't seem clean. No dishwasher soap and a drying rack left out, so we were unclear whether dishwasher even worked.
Great for a party crowd or college kids that wouldn't care about cleanliness or cooking, because there is a ping pong table on back patio, but not good for a family. We left after 2 days because we were just grossed out by the place.
Justin and Amy‚Äôs place was reasonably priced and in a nice neighbourhood. The cleanliness in the unit however was not great.

Great place. Didn't have plates or forks but there are several stores close by that I was able to go to in no time. The pathway to the room was overgrown by tree branches when I first got there, but they were trimmed the next day.

The house gives me frat house vibes, but in a bad way. If you get Bedroom B you get to hear everyone poop and pee since the bathroom is connected to your room but it's not your private bathroom. It's so annoying. And Abi doesn't implement any quiet hours so some of the guests shower and wake me up at 11 or midnight. It's hard to find parking because the neighbors are sensitive about cars parking in front of their house and there's like 4 other people living with you and they all have cars. Otherwise the house and room are clean. You have everything you need. Abi responds quickly and is a genial guy. There's nothing wrong with the Airbnb , but I didn't enjoy my stay.
i could have not found a better location
Nice location but it has cockroach problem during in the kitchen even we didn't use it at all.

Nice house with 4 available rooms. It‚Äôs 10 minutes drive from house location to any where in Austin. The neighborhoods looks security, but few blocks away looks not.
Every room is clean, the only thing need to notice is there are cockroaches in the house, we kill 4 ones during a week.
Condo is clean, convenient and cozy, but the cleaning charges are exorbitant

Believe the other reviews - we had major issues around hygiene and cleanliness. when we got there, the bed linens had been changed and the kitchen and bathroom surfaces were clean. Unfortunately, it was obvious that the cleaners had done only those things and left. The sofa cushions were in disarray and there were food crumbs visible all over the cushions. The side tables also had food crumbs all over. There were chunks of dried dirt, hair, and other debris all over the rug and floor. I opened a dresser drawer and there was a strange, fist-sized ball of hair in it. There were cobwebs along the baseboards and food particles and hair everywhere. The refrigerator smelled extremely fishy although the baking soda container in there was helping a bit. We had nowhere to sit and didn't want to touch anything.

Ames responded quickly and offered to let us cancel and give us a full refund without working with us on how to make the stay work out. We spent a couple of hours trying to find alternatives and couldn't find anything less than almost 2x the price on such short notice - so we asked him to refund us the first night stay and get us a hotel room for the first night, as we would be happy to keep the rental once cleaned. He refused and said he wouldn't pay for a hotel, and that we'd only get a refund for the first night if we didn't stay there. We couldn't afford to go anywhere else, so we just laid towels on the sofa and went to bed early. I pointed out that he was basically telling us that by not giving any sort of refund or compensation, he was demanding that we pay full price to stay in an uncleaned apartment with no internet service - no response.

Next day, the property manager came by to fix the internet (which was down - but this happens). The cleaner didn't show up by 2pm, nearly 24 hours after check in, so we left and came back late evening before dinner.

The cleaners had stopped by... but other than brushing the crumbs off the sofa and table, it didn't appear they had done anything. The sofa was still messy with loose feathers in the exact same places they'd been before. The ball of hair was still in the drawer. The floor was just as dirty as when we'd left.

At this point, Ames issued a refund for the first night and the cleaning fee - the right thing to do. It was a pity it took him so long to handle it appropriately.

Otherwise, the sofa and rug are as permanently filthy as other guests have mentioned. I mean huge dark stains that just look unsanitary. The bathroom tile is as yellowed and uncleaned looking as described by others (nothing that can't be deep cleaned - the cleaners just aren't doing it). Nothing like photos and no one would rent the place in the condition it's actually in. It's a shame as the apartment is small but comfortable, freshly renovated, and in a good location.

One other thing - there is a frat house of sorts near by and they have backyard parties from around 11pm to 3am. If you are sensitive to noise you will want to avoid this place.

Wouldn't stay again.

The apartment itself is ok, but unfortunately it is managed by completely inept people.

We had a previously-agreed upon checkin time of 5pm, we arrive at 530pm, and not 10 minutes after the cleaning lady lets herself in and kicks us out so that we don‚Äôt get in her way while cleaning. After messaging the ‚Äúhost‚Äù, all they have to say is ‚Äúsorry about that, you can leave your luggage in the apartment while you‚Äôre out‚Äù.

The alarm system is completely bonkers, it‚Äôll go off on you if you open the door from the inside. You have to type in the code manually to disarm it, but that didn‚Äôt stop the police from showing up guns out! After messaging the ‚Äúhost‚Äù, again all they had to say was ‚Äúsorry about that‚Äù.

Would not recommend this place to anyone who appreciates a stress-free experience.

This location is close to downtown which makes it easy to go back and forth to restaurants and clubs.  The home was okay but needed more cleaning for our stay.  The air conditioned had trouble keeping it the house cool and needed more details on the alarm as it wasn't in the home guide provided.
There was no hot water

We were excited to stay here from seeing all the great reviews and pictures of the place.
Unfortunately, from the start, it was not so smooth.
1. There were constant reminders of our stay (before the trip)
2. I received a text saying what the door code was however when we got there it was incorrect. So we looked into the Airbnb app and found the correct pin.
3. When we opened the door, we were hit with a strong whiff of cigarettes. The owner was quick to respond. But I had to ask for her to bring an air freshener. Fortunately the weather was warm enough to open the windows.
4. While waiting for the air fresheners we found a used towel in the bathroom and when we told the cleaning lady,she said they always forget to get that‚Ä¶.
5. There was hair and dust bunnies all around the home.
6. The water in the fridge tasted like rotten fish
7. The window screen in one of the rooms was broken (popped out onto the backyard)
8. The cleaning lady came in an hour earlier than our check out time.
The house itself was great, but the neighborhood wasn't ideal.
Alberto communicated well, no issues

We booked this to visit my two sisters that live in Austin w my 3 & 5 yr old. The reviews were good, so we thought it would be fine. Our flight was 3.5 hours delayed & the PM said the owner insisted we meet him so I had one of my sisters go meet him. Not super convenient & a little annoying, especially when my sister showed up & there was a keypad. The house wasn‚Äôt spotless, old & dirty bathrooms, but we weren‚Äôt that worried about it. We ordered pizza, bathed the kids, went to put them in bed & found badly stained sheets on my sons bed. We then checked the other beds & found stains on the master bed as well. We were so grossed out. We messaged the property manager & while she offered to have it replaced, we were grossed out & decided to book another place. She offered to reimburse us for the rest of our stay, we pay the first night & we agreed. I followed up after a week and a half and they are now accusing us of staining the sheets and fighting us. Do not book this place, shady owner!
Convienant location. House was lacking in kitchen amenities. No dishwasher or baking pans.

The host was very responsive and extremely accommodating about early check in. However, the place was not clean and just not pleasant to be in. For example, my bedroom had for light only a bare bulb dangling by an exposed wire from the ceiling fan, and there were no drawers in which to put my clothes. There was no WiFi info provided, and the host was not able to provide us with workable info. Given the COVID-19 situation, my travelling partner absolutely needed to have WiFi for work purposes. That, along with the disappointing state of the apartment, led us to leave after one night and pay for other accommodations.

It‚Äôs not in the greatest location. It‚Äôs very small no t.v. If u want just a room for one person it may be ok and if u don‚Äôt mind being next to frat house. It Was not good experience for us and we immediately checked out and notified Airbnb customer service.

We stayed at this property for a football game weekend in Austin. Because it was a game weekend, hotels and other airbnbs were really expensive. We chose this property and while the value was ok for the money, we would not stay here again. The fraternity house next door had extremely loud parties both nights and the building was pretty scary to pull up to and stay at. It‚Äôs a back house with fully open doors full time except for your room, which needs to stay locked even though the lock seemed easily breakable with one hard push. There was mold in the shower and we felt a little iffy sleeping in the bed on the sheets. We could hear every word that the people in the unit across from us said. They dropped their phone in the middle of the night and we heard it and them scrambling around to find it. There wasn‚Äôt much privacy. &‚Ä¶ There was blood on the sheets!! I understand that this was one of the most economical properties we could‚Äôve chosen for the location, but we did not love our stay.

The lack of outlets and maze of extension cords was very concerning. The entryway, gardens, and back were in disarray.  The cafe set was small and not comfortable. It felt like a college student was kicked out for our stay-all the random shower items. Expected a small kitchenette, not washing dishes in the bathroom sink. AC barely kept up with the heat.  There were no maps, bus schedules, Austin info nor recommendations for nearby restaurants. Next door to a frat house. Might be fine for a 20 something but no older.

I have stayed in several places through Air Bnb throughout the years and this place was in the worst condition: leaking and unsafe shower handles, decrepit wall below the shower handles, missing light fixture, broken frame on a unnecessary mirror leaning against a wall, molding coming off the fireplace mantle, broken window blinds, poor and unsightly wood and paper towel sealing the window for the air conditioner. I missed the fact there was no TV or kitchen sink, and those were not deal breakers, although those additions would make this a better place. The 12+ bottles of used shampoo and body wash in the shower along with a used bar of soap shows a lack of attention to detail. The redeeming aspects of this rental were proximity to UT and the Capitol and the bed was surprisingly comfortable.
I have experienced and expected more out of previous rentals and this unit was disappointing.

A small studio that suited us well for our weekend stay. We did have issues parking on the first day as the next door frat house had a party and there was also a game on, so we had to circle the block for a good while until someone left. But no issues parking any other time of our stay. It has everything we needed and was cheap to get into town by taxi when needed too.

Pool is not the selling point of this house. The heater is broken and it's somewhat neglected. The outside area is great, but do not come here if you plan to swim.

Not enough basic living necessities, dish soap, plain (non beach) towels, wifi was broken until we fixed it.

Pros: Location was great in the East side of town, short walk to restaurants/bars in that area and short walk to Rainey Street. The beds and the couch were comfortable and provided enough room for all guests.

Cons: I had concerns about this place after I booked as the reviews subsequently were poor. I messaged David in regards to these concerns (specifically people complained about the broken internet, lack of hot water, not enough bath towels, dirty pool) and he assured me (after two days of waiting for a response) these issues would be fixed upon my arrival -- of which, half were fixed... the water was hot, but could scald someone if you weren't careful; the internet didn't work; the pool was dirty; there were, however, enough bath towels. I messaged him on our arrival notifying him of the internet and didn't receive a response from him all weekend. I've NEVER had a host just not respond during my stay if I had a concern/question.

In addition to these issues, there was a kitchen chair laying in the dining room -- completely broken. One of the bathroom windows was broken/wouldn't shut/lock. I found this to be somewhat of a safety concern. The front window panes outside of the living room had been broken in multiple places. The shower head in the bathroom that with the broken window was utterly terrible, poor flow/sprayed in random directions. The house holds up to 16 people, yet does not have enough kitchenware to serve that amount of people (I think it might have had 8 glasses and 1 coffee mug); luckily, we didn't need to cook.

Minus the few pros, this place is pricey and not worth the bang for the buck -- I wouldn't book here again.

Where to begin? It‚Äôs apparent no one cares for this house. The pool was filthy and unusable. I wanted to clean it but the strainer was destroyed. The hot tub wasn‚Äôt hot. There was garbage everywhere and the picnic table was broken. The owner asked for photos when I sent them to him and I never heard back. The couch in the living room was dirty, almost cringe worthy. The beds had garbage in them to include braces rubber bands. I don‚Äôt know if it was from the cleaning staff or the previous renters. The area is not great. Empty houses. Graffiti. Homeless encampments.

The house got the job done for a bachelor party but if the photos were updated you would not stay here.

If you‚Äôre bringing a family here I would seriously reconsider. Maybe we just got a bad cleaning crew but the house (for almost 5000 dollars) was not clean. A chair that I read about in a previous review that was broken was still in the house in the closet... Definitely not worth it for the money.

Thankfully the only good thing was it is located about 5 minutes to downtown Austin. We tried to be out of this house as much as possible.

Not within safe walking distance to downtown area. Would want a car to get around. Pictures are old, older house with very minimal work to get it ready for the next renter. Pool was filled with dirt, sticks, and leaves. Sheets had stains and showers did not work. Needed to use a bowl to rinse off our hair. Very underwhelming for the description and pictures.

We were disappointed in our stay.  The communication with the host was poor.    When we arrived at 3 to check in and the house had not been cleaned!  To make matters worse we could not get ahold of the host.   We had a big group of nine so obviously disappointed.  We decided to make the best of a bad situation. We ended up taking all the towels and sheets to the laundromat and my wife cleaned the kitchen and bathrooms.   The maids showed up the following day.  Also the pool was very dirty and water cold.  The pool equipment was not turned on or didn‚Äôt work?  On a positive note the house really is a nice house and the yard is bigger than expected.   The host did apologize and compensated us for the situation.

The location was good for our party and was central and within walking/scootering distance from downtown.

The reason we booked this house was because of the swimming pool, as it provided our party of 14 something to do during the day for fun. To say the pool was in poor condition is a complete understatement. We showed up and the pool was completely green, covered in leaves and dead bugs and clearly not cleaned anytime of recent, and not circulating at all. It was disgusting. We immediately placed a call to the owner and they said a pool guy would be over soon. It took 1 1/2 days for anyone to show up at which time he informed us the filters had not been cleaned for over a year. We then had to wait for the cleaning to take place, and were told to stay out of the pool for 24 hours before using. When booking a 3 day trip and to not have access to the very thing we booked the house for, for 2 of those 3 days, is beyond frustrating.

The owner said he would make things right and reimburse us a portion of our stay given the inconvenience, but since leaving the property he has completely ignored us and is non-responsive.

If you are booking this house because of the swimming pool, I would recommend looking elsewhere based on our experience.

The house was disgusting - very dirty and grimy. Cockroaches, ants in the sinks, spiders in beds. It‚Äôs obvious that the sheets have never been washed. Pool was a green swamp when we arrived but was eventually fixed on the last day after several complaints to the owner and a hard working pool company. No hot water in the house.

We had reached out to Alex prior to our stay with concerns about previous reviews we had seen regarding cockroaches, dirty pool, etc. She ensured us that all issues had been resolved. Therefore, we were disappointed when we arrived to a green pool full of algae and leaves, dirty sheets, and bugs throughout our stay.

Wouldn‚Äôt recommend staying here at all. Stay somewhere else for the price.

This Airbnb did the job for a bachelorette weekend stay in Austin.

Pros:
‚Äî Pool was great!
‚Äî Flexible check-in/out with many of us coming and going at different times
‚Äî Enough sleeping space for everyone

Cons:
‚Äî Kitchen supplies are lacking (even after I confirmed with Alex that we would all be eating breakfast at the house). There are only plates / utensils enough for 4 (not as many as the house sleeps)
‚Äî There were 2-4 bath towels in the whole home. The remaining towels were all beach/pool towels. These towels smelled (likely from the laundry machine being overloaded)
‚Äî One of the toilets began leaking water, so there was only 1 working toilet for the 13 girls for a portion of the weekend. This was not fixed after we alerted Alex
‚Äî The slats on the queen bed are broken / missing. This means the mattress sank when sleeping
‚Äî The floors did not appear to be mopped before we arrived. We took off our shoes and had dirty feet after walking through the house so we needed to wear shoes the entire time

Please be aware before booking this Airbnb. The house reminds me of a college frat house. Alex was responsive to address initial questions and concerns about towels and hot water, but it is incorrect to say this house was¬†recently remodeled.¬†

Pros
Great location to local restaurants¬†and bars (6th st,¬†Reiney St, bbq, food trucks)
Enough space to fit a bigger group
Pool and outdoor area are very relaxing

Issues
Black mold in both showers ceilings
Mouse poop/droppings in kitchen cabinets
Bugs/moths in the house
Broken shower handle in the common bathroom (identified by previous guests in May 2022, not fixed before arrival).
Had to use pliers to use the in the shower (pictures sent to Airbnb)
Master shower temperature handle knob installed incorrectly. Turning all the way left only has cold water.¬†
Sink facets¬†are not secured to counter tops
Toilets are angled incorrectly, representative that there¬†isn't any attention to detail in the house
Must walk through the queen bedroom to get to the back bunk bed room.
The front door latch assembly needs replacement (identified in previous reviews) -¬† unable to use the keypad lock mechanism on the front door.¬†
Only provided 3 bath towels for 10+ beds. Remaining towels were pool towels
Hot tub isn't functional
No dishwasher, but it says it in the listing
Must use plastic utensils¬†as kitchenware is lacking (no can opener)
No additional trash bags in the closet.¬†
House is was not well maintained

I would not recommend this house again
If you want a place in the country with chickens and quiet...this is your place.  Kitchen is lovely but the ceilings are a bit low.

For the price it is a good value. Location is good but it is amongst industrial buildings in a heavily industrial area. The bungalow is divided into 2 units but the construction of the dividing wall is so poor you hear everything the other unit says. The mattresses are not comfortable.
The view alone is worth the price.

The Airbnb was burglarized while we were gone the first night. Bad neighborhood! Not safe. The cameras don‚Äôt work and the fence was easily bypassed. The host was negligent by leaving a back window unlocked and Airbnb has been unresponsive.‚Äù

Pros:
--Bedroom is clean and practically furnished with sufficient space.
--Bed is comfortable (though the pillows need updating).

--Very quiet--though there is an occasional jet landing at close-by airport; also heard my roommate snoring one night. Host does provide earplugs.

--Close 10-minute walk to 2 buses (easy access to most places). But you will need a car otherwise.

--Thoughtfully labeled spaces allow you plenty of space for your things separate from your roommate.

Cons:
--Upon check-in when I requested a washcloth, host told me it didn't "make good business sense" for him to provide (ditto for kleenex). So I had to use paper towels and toilet paper--which of course is $$ and not good for the environment. This set the tone for the visit. :(

--Cleanliness is below par--even by pre-COVID standards--especially in kitchen/dining area.

--I was disappointed this host wasn't more personable or interactive as this was the reason I didn't stay in a hotel.
Don't consider here, you may be disappointed! He cancelled a day before arrival and was very rude while communicating his cancellation.
would not consider it again. Bad first experience for me and my family!!
Don't stay here unless you are ready for a huge hit to your pocket book for unfair accusations. Dogs barking all night and day. No real privacy.
Not large! But clean, warm, and just eleven or twelve minutes drive to downtown Austin. And Paula is a quick communicator.

Excelente experiencia, fu√© como viajar en el tiempo, es un sue√±o, est√° casi intacta, como si el tiempo no hubiera pasado por ella, Carl fu√© muy amable, estuvo al pendiente y nos di√≥ recomendaciones, es uno de los sitios con m√°s estilo donde me he alojado.
Est√° muy bien equipada con todo lo que necesitas.
Gracias Carl por darnos la oportunidad de vivir esa experiencia de ‚Äúglamping‚Äù

I booked this apartment for my wife's birthday celebration given the proximity to the lake and based on the online pictures.

The condition of the carpet in every bedroom and the living room are in deplorable condition, including what appears to be blood in the living room and master bedroom. Further, one the walls by the kitchen bar area looks like food was thrown against it and never cleaned. I contacted the host within 5 mins of arrival and was assured that a cleaning team would be dispatched the next day to perform a deep cleaning. Well, that cleaning crew never arrived.

This apartment is marketed as being able to accommodate up to 6 guests, however when 1 person was taking a shower (with no washer or dishwasher being used) all of the water to the apartment completely shut off for over 30 mins. The first contact told me that there must have been utility work being done in the area and asked me to go outside and walk around to see if I could locate a work truck (really??). Well, the water shutoff was due to the host's water sensors being set to a low level and it automatically turned off the water. How do you market a place for 6 guests, yet have the water shut off for 30 mins when 1 guest takes a shower.

Lastly, the parking in this community is has some very stringent rules. Every car requires a parking placard (provided by the host) to be placed on the dashboard or our car could have been towed. The host blamed the HOA and encouraged us to place a note in the window. If the host is going to take a reservation (knowing how stringest the security at this place can be), they should arrange for the parking passes in advance .

The location of the apartment is excellent - a short walk down to the marina where you can dock your boat and be on the water in minutes. It's also a 10-12 min drive to a ton of nice restaurants, cafes, etc. but the cleanliness of the apartment and failure of the host to do what they say will do does not provide value for the money.

Great location and a nice place. However, we had a poor experience due to an annoying electrical noise that we had to deal with for an entire week, including technicians attempting  a repair. The property also has quite stains and bleach marks on carpets and furniture. The kitchen has very limited eating and cooking supplies, and we found dirty pots and pans in the drawers/cupboards.

The bed was hard as a rock and there was an extremely weird odor. We cancelled within 1 hour of check in since the host didn‚Äôt respond and he didn‚Äôt even offer a refund. I paid for two nights when I only stayed an hour.

We were a group of 6 (3 couples) staying at Tony's place for a couple of days. The check in was smooth and the place totally lived up to our expectations. On the first night of our stay, at 3 am, the fire alarm started screeching all over the house. Six of us, extremely tired guests jumped out of bed wondering what had 'hit' us. We were not sure if we should run out or call the fire department. Anyway, after 2 minutes of wandering around the house and trying to figure out what to do, the alarm stopped. We went back to bed and in 10 minute intervals for the next 30 minutes the alarm kept going off. By then all our dreams of a good nights sleep had evaporated. We left a voice message for Tony, our host, to help.

At 8 am the next morning Tony arrives with a case of beers, a bottle of wine and batteries for the fire alarm. Tony, what we needed was loads of Aspirin, not alcohol. He changes one set of batteries for one alarm and tells us to do the rest. Seriously. I did not know we had jobs in the maintenance department.

Other than this problem, it was a nice stay.
Impeccable! Every detail, every touch mad us feel right at home.
way too much expansive, this place does not worth this much price

Apartment was in a good location, however I‚Äôve never had a more difficult check in - about 10 slides of  pictures with outdated instructions to read through and messages with different instructions. It was very confusing. There are also strange fees you‚Äôre made aware of after you book like a $500 fee for any ‚Äúaltercation with neighbors or leasing office‚Äù which was really odd.

This place was okay.. Not really a place that you can just chill at because the TVs don‚Äôt work except on a few crappy channels. No hand towels which was frustrating in terms of exfoliating and washing your face. Bedroom light didn‚Äôt work. Besides that it was doable just not what I expected. If you just need a place to sleep then it‚Äôs fine!

DIRTY‚Ä¶. beer cans lined the hallway of this complex, smells like overwhelming wet dog, dirty dishes in the sink, full trash can in unit, dirty sheets, dirty towels, pee in the elevator. Super gross. Host knew the maid wasn‚Äôt able to clean in between guests and didn‚Äôt inform me. I had to call about it when I arrived and they made me leave so they could have someone else come in and clean. Unfortunately booked my stay during the southwest cancellation fest and this host was unwilling to adjust my stay or help me even though it was all out of my control. Hard pass for my next trip to Austin.

We were excited to find a home in this location which is quiet and handy.  There are plenty of beds and the home was clean.  But it needs an upgrade, aesthetically and also for convenience.  Not enough flatware, only one kitchen towel, lots of burned out light bulbs, no chairs in bedrooms, no hangers, in some cases, no lamps....just not up to par for the price!

Was pretty upset with how this stay went. Checked in at 4 to find that the house had not been cleaned, literally left from the last guests. After a long time trying to contact someone, we spoke to the manager brandon and he basically said there was nothing he could do. It took a while to reach the host and she did not seem to care either. I understand things happen, but was very frustrated with the cleaning situation and how things were handled. It seemed like it was not an issue at all that our first night of our trip was ruined and everything was pushed back. All of our plans and reservations were ruined and we lost a good chunk of money. The cleaning crew was great though whenever they came to do a cleaning. Will say that the house was precious and great location. The water pressure was pretty low, hard to take a shower or bath. Overall not a great experience, terrible communication, and management. I pray that no one else has this experience.

We messaged to ask if we could have an early check in, and were told this wasn‚Äôt possible. An hour before we were supposed to arrive, we were told that check in would be delayed an hour. This completely stuffed our Mother‚Äôs Day plans. When we eventually checked in, a doorknob broke when trying to close the bathroom door, and there was a blockage in one of the bathroom sinks. When we informed the host about the blockage, we didn‚Äôt get an update for 2 days. I saw a cockroach on the kitchen floor on our last day. Overall I would not recommend.

The hot tub did not work. The porch light were out. The TV didn‚Äôt get the Cowboy game. Dirty. Trash, empty beer cans left behind. I was told I would receive compensation for the lack of amenities, still haven‚Äôt seen that. I should have taken my Board of Directors to a hotel.

We booked this house weeks in advance of our trip, we chose it because of the location and the fact that Sarah is listed as a super-host/good communicator‚Ä¶ unfortunately this wasn‚Äôt true.

At check in we ran into an issue with the keypad and couldn‚Äôt get into the house. We spent from about 6 PM- 10 PM trying to get in touch with the host, it was freezing cold and we had to miss dinner plans to try to figure it out. We ended up actually getting a hotel which was very expensive, Airbnb refunded us for the stay and Sarah was apologetic.

I feel like we are super lucky we could afford to get a hotel, traveling somewhere and not knowing if you have a bed at the end of the night is very stressful. Plus the refund takes a while to process.

Overall, worst experience I‚Äôve had with Airbnb and though support came through in the end they were not responsive or helpful at all until about 9 AM the next day.

This could have been avoided or fixed with minimal communication but we couldn‚Äôt even get that.

Where to begin. Let's just say the pictures advertised are not quite what you get in person.

I gave this listing 2 starts because I appreciated the sheer space of the house and room to live in (with 18 woman), but we had trouble from the beginning. Upon arrival, the front gate was broken, yard look disheveled...yard equipment, kids toys/bikes, and trash were strewn about the yard as if someone had just rushed out before we walked in.

We had significant issues with the lighting and electricity throughout the house. And while the manager was quick to call an electrician, the electrician even commented that the current set-up was not suitable for a house that size, and that it was likely we would continue to have issues with the lights. Which we did, as I had to go in the attic to flip the breaker multiple times.

Additionally, none of the TVs worked in any of the guest rooms, no towels or wash cloths in bathrooms - had to search around the house for common items. There was mold growing in one of the dishwashers, food left in the fridge, crumbs and dirt in the kitchen and "clean" dishes put up in the cabinet.

The pool is a whole other story. While it was large and the water clean, it was hard to relax looking around at the disgusting mess around the pool...every chair was either cracked/broken, molded, or thrown about in the grass. Not to mention the crumbling tile at the end of the pool with the heap of old, dirty, deflated pool rafts everywhere.

The unfortunate thing is that our entire group kept commenting how much potential the house had, but it just seemed so poorly taken care of. If you are hosting an Air BnB and charging that much for a night, it should be at least clean, neat, and presentable to guests, but instead, we got dirty, disheveled and uninviting.
Perfect hidden spot off the beaten trail! We couldn't have been happier with the stay and close proximity to all the distilleries and breweries!

Gate keypad difficult to work. When leaving, it is hard to see how to open the gate when the keypad is outside the perimeter fence. The concrete stepping stones need to be buried in the ground to help guests carry luggage into the cabin. Currently they are just laid on the ground. The two provided lounge chairs in the living area are very uncomfortable.

Comfortable bed, bath worked fine expected kitchen items provided.

Great value but further off the beaten path than expected.
Great location... First time in Austin and will be back to this place on my next visit. üî•üî•üî•
Derek and Tammy were so fast with communications and even called to make sure we didn‚Äôt have problems checking in or out.

Be aware‚Ä¶.. They do charge an additional pet deposit is nonrefundable, which I did not see disclosed. When I realized there was an additional fee, I immediately asked for a refund probably within five minutes of booking, which they denied. They are also not flexible on check-in or checkout times like previous other places I have. It was also very loud with road noise. If you are a light sleeper, I do not recommend.

Overall, we enjoyed our stay. Location was about 10-12 minutes from downtown. The bathroom was not very clean which was disappointing but the bed was comfy!
Nothing to share...
the house was everything we expected and more. from upfront communication to check-in to assisting us while there, I have nothing but good things to say!

The room looks clean but it was not.

The floors were dirty. The beds had hair and bugs in the sheets

There were spiders and ants in the room.
Their customer service was extremely slow in rectifying the issue. Took them 10 hours to provide a resolution.

Worst experience ever. Wasted an entire day in Austin.

Will never recommend Sonders to anyone.

I found roaches in my dogs food as well as roaches crawling around the facility at night. Also, there was a situation whereas urine, stool, and toilet paper flooded the bathroom shower. The smell was absolutely horrid. This company was not helpful at all !!! The owner did not have the shower cleaned until 12 hours later and he only had the shower cleaned, so the toilet remained unsanitary. He‚Äôs disgusting and does not care about anyone else‚Äôs well being. Do NOT stay here!!!

This could be a nice house but it really needs some basic maintenance.. We could not use the kitchen chairs because the legs were loose and unsafe to sit on. One of the chairs fell apart when my 11 year old granddaughter sat on it. We informed Peter but he said he could not find the tools to fix the chairs and told us to use the chairs in the dining room instead. We found dirty cookware in the kitchen, and the stove and oven were dirty. Peter did have the stove cleaned, but we ended up washing the dishes and silverware ourselves before we felt comfortable using them. There is a coffee pot but it is a keureg, so if you want more than one cup of coffee, bring a coffee pot.  You should also bring basic kitchen cooking utensils because many of what‚Äôs there are broken and unusable. You should also bring your own pillow. The house has plenty but they are not very nice.

The place does not look like what is listed, it was very dirty. There was a lot of dust, bugs, cobwebs, dirt etc despite the fact the host said a cleaning crew was there two hours prior to our arrival. It looks like a wild animal of some kind was in the kitchen area at one point, there‚Äôs imprints on the ground everywhere to suggest so, not sure what else that could be. Blinds downstairs have holes so if someone was around they could see inside the kitchen area. Bathroom had some mold. I can‚Äôt complain about the location or size, but this place is not at all like what the listing (pictures) suggests and after cleaning he place and trying to rid of the seemingly never ending list of bugs I did not feel comfortable staying and ended up getting a hotel the first night and staying there instead.

Place was very hot all day and night. Shower never warmed up. Was very dusty and not clean when we arrived. A light fixture fell on us while we were in the kitchen. We were overall uncomfortable during our stay.

Location is unbeatable. If you don't plan to hangout much, this is an excellent location. We were also able to do some laundry, which was extremely convenient!

However, this home is old and has some challenges associated with that. The bathroom door was too warped to shut properly and the 2bd bedroom's "door" is just a shower curtain, so privacy isnt easily attained. We blew a fuse for trying to turn on the living room light while watching TV. Cali got us moved to the unit next door for the evening, but the wifi signal was too weak in that unit for us to use it. She claimed it was fine when we tried to report it, which was a little frustrating. We also noticed the AC doesn't keep up, it runs 24/7 and the place stays fairly balmy.

Ultimately, it's an okay place if you just need somewhere to sleep, but not the best place to hang out and relax.

you do not have access to the house until you ring her. I was locked out all night on a night that was below freezing temperatures in Austin. it wouldn't have been so bad if all my things were not in her place. so I froze most of the night until finally deciding to check into a hotel room. mind you I had no change of clothes or anything to get cleaned up into. I was very unhappy.
It was a fine stay, though be warned when getting into (and out of) parking at the complex, you‚Äôll have to call the host every time.

The apartment was fine I guess. She keeps it clean. Check-in is a little confusing. There‚Äôs definitely a lack of communication. No info - in writing or in person - about where everything is or how to make myself at home. Most importantly, it wasn‚Äôt cool that Ketty and her boyfriend were both sick with hacking coughs during a covid pandemic (number 1 symptom being cough), and she neglected to notify me before my visit or even acknowledge it while I was there. I would not recommend staying here.
The unit I stayed in had the bedroom windows right next to 35 (highway). It was so loud at all points of the day and night that it was very hard to sleep.
Everything was great‚Ä¶no complaints!

Prior to booking, we messaged the host confirming there were two bedrooms, one with a king bed and another with a queen. When we arrived to the Airbnb after having a HORRIBLE check in experience, we realized we were in a totally different unit than we booked and DID NOT even have the Queen and king beds. Instead we were in two doubles. On top of this, on their profile they say they have a 1 hour response time but when we were struggling to check in and standing outside for hours, it took them over 12 hours to reply.
This was the worst stay I‚Äôve had ever and all because of the host. It‚Äôs a joke that we still even paid for renting this space when it wasn‚Äôt even the same unit we requested.
A good host but, the place was not to our liking.  Too dark, needs brightened up and the dead palm removed.

First of all, the apartment was great, nice location and nice beds. Some things were not up to standards. When we arrived at 10pm, the code to open the door was not working. Had a long travel, so needed to go inside asap. The fridge was completely empty. No beers/drinks which they advertise with. And last but not least, all the towels where dirty and covered in stains. The more I think about it, the more I think this experience was not worth all the money they charge per night. David solved it by  letting us check out late. Could not give 5 stars, so 3 for the location and the apartment itself

Stayed here with my family and friends for one night. We have 5 people in total which makes the house a good size for us. Location is not too far away from downtown. Host is lack of communication; responded promptly to requests for more blankets but responded with no apologies for the giant foot print stain on one of the sheets in the guest bedroom and defended that it was cleaned. Even when we sent her a picture through Airbnb message to show her the situation, host still questioned if that‚Äôs the bedsheet she provided. We did not expect stained bedsheets and it made us question general cleanliness.
Couldn't have been happier with my stay.  Felt like home.
No

As advertised, the apartment was in a great location, had plenty of room for six women, and our hosts were very communicative. The place is cute and has some great outdoor space, which we did not get to use because it was too cold out. We did, however, have some issues with the indoor common area. The living room was much darker than it appears in photographs, the lights were very dim, and one of the couches was broken, which made the room difficult to use, especially at night. This was disappointing, since we‚Äôd chosen the apartment specifically for the living space. The upstairs toilet clogs easily and there was no working plunger while we were there, which was frustrating. Also, we were charged for a few towels because of makeup stains, which was surprising, since we‚Äôve all stayed in many Airbnbs and never had that issue before. Of course, every host varies, and we don‚Äôt want to leave behind damages, but it seemed odd to us that we were charged for the towels without the host attempting to wash them first.

La casa de Jon esta muy bien ubicada, tienes cerca mucho para hacer y es b√°sicamente una zona tipo estudiantil. La ropa de cama y las toallas todo bien, dormimos bien. Pero, la casa me pareci√≥ que no estaba limpia como deber√≠a.

We were unhappy with the place because it was 1) unsafe for our kids. We couldn't use the upper balcony at all because the railing was broken in several places; 2) generally unclean. Stuff was sticky and there were bugs, including a dead roach in the carpet which was old; 3) generally not nice. The stocked cookware and anything else like the barely functioning universal TV remote were not good quality. The bathtub was old with blemishes. The beds were uncomfortable.

I would not recomend staying here. This is one of my worst Airbnb experiences. I read the previous bad reviews and hoped it would be better but it wasn‚Äôt. Upon entering, there is a musty smell. The entire place shows signs of wear and tear. The pictures on Airbnb are not the true state of the place. The beds are horrible and make squeaky noises when you sit on them. The bed dips down and you wake up with your back in pain in the morning . The worst part is the critters that run around in the walls/ vents at night. The critters woke us up at 3am with their scurrying.  On the positive side, the location is great since the house is near Zilker. In conclusion, this place either needs to be updated and an exterminator brought in or marketed for budget travelers who are willing to forgo basic comforts for a good location.

Communication with the host was our biggest issue - poor communication from their end resulted in check-in confusion, and overall unpleasant experience.
You get what you pay for.
Looks nothing like the pictures, but is a quiet place.

Unfortunately, this Airbnb does not match the photos that are depicted on their listing. Our outreach to the owner of the property turned out to be a no-response until we continued messaging them, hence we are providing the most honest review possible that every single member of our family agrees upon.
The place was filthy to begin with. We walked into the place with malodor (musty smell) from the first to the second floor. Throughout our stay, we discovered filthy carpets which made us reluctant to take off our shoes. Our family usually wipes down everything upon entry to any Airbnb property due to covid. We ended up with dark wipes after wiping the stair handles. It was evident that this property was not fully cared for from prior guest departure. We found soda cans under the bed. The bathroom seat on the bottom floor was broken. The water pressure on that bathroom was excruciating slow. There was filth around soap dispenser, which was quite disgusting. The place was advertised for 5+ guests, but the amenities were certainly not designed for 5. There was one single mirror only in the upstairs bathroom & a small thin mirror in one of the rooms for 5 of us to use! Imagine the scene in the mornings.
We were charged over $200 per night. With the experience of 7-8 Airbnbs during the past year, we would entirely agree, this should not be worth more than $50 per night. We encountered broken drapes, not covering the entire windows for night sleep. We encountered broken beds! Bathroom drapes torn apart. Broken jagged electric outlet, unclean nightstand with dirt all over the small pantry. We sent over 10+ photos of the property at the end of our stay to get explanations with no answer until we continually texted the next morning. In one sentence: ‚ÄúThis is a health hazard that should be reported to health officials. I would not recommend this place to anyone.‚Äù
Unsatisfied customer :(
The chairs were broken, back door barely opened, and water pressure was low.

I would be wary of booking this rental. When I arrived the upstairs outside door was left unlocked. The downstairs bathroom sink didn‚Äôt work beyond a messily dribble. The place overall felt dingy and unsafe. The TV was broken and didn‚Äôt work unless you wiggled every plug coming in and out of it and when it did come on it was only  briefly and randomly. Beyond that the TV volume was stuck at a volume so loud that it was actually too painful to watch. When I attempted to get solutions for these problems I was told to ‚Äúchange the batteries‚Äù. Lol when does changing batteries fix a broken TV? There was no volume control on the remote which was patched together with duck tape or anywhere on the TV. It looks like the host lives far away in another time zone. Beware.  I wouldn‚Äôt recommend staying here unless you‚Äôre ok with a really sub par experience.

There was no WIFI - although it was advertised.  Paid a high cleaning fee but the carpet was dirty & overall not completely clean.  We could not find our access information for check in & when reaching out to the hosts, there was no answer & never a return phone call or text.   Location was great!

The downstairs toilet wasn't working properly, the kitchen  sink was clogged, and there were ants in the place during our stay.   There is only one shower in the entire place.  This is not comfortable for a group of  7 people.

Had issue with the general cleanliness (or lack thereof) with this unit. (Dust, grime, removable stains, and mouse droppings). Tried to work out with the host (very amicably) requesting a refund of the cleaning fee - which was vehemently denied.

The host instead encouraged me to leave an accurate review, so here we are.

There are tons of airbnb options in Austin- you should find a better one.

The place is a good deal and a good location but there was room for improvement:
‚Ä¢The apartment smells musty, like there might be mold.
‚Ä¢The drawers in the kitchen are very old and fall out/collapse when you pull on them - they need to be replaced.
‚Ä¢Brown water came out of the faucet in the bathtub each time I turned the water on.
‚Ä¢The host didn‚Äôt send check in instructions ahead of time.
‚Ä¢They ask you to not tell people at the apartment that you are staying in an Airbnb which is odd.
‚Ä¢The batteries in the Netflix remote were dead.

I think if these issues were fixed, it would be a 5 star review.

Pictures are either old or filtered. This place was not clean at all, the bathroom had black mold, the ceiling fan was caked in dust, the couch was COVERED in visible stains that would make you cringe. I couldn't spend the night there, I ended up driving home.
The hosts claimed the housekeeper had just left the property before I checked and theat they were new. Bottom line, this felt like a raunchy place thats been partied and God knows what else for years. Highly disturbed and disappointed.

This listing was as advertised with just one exception. Weeks After I registered and paid for two guest and 1 pet, the day before our arrival, I was asked to pay an extra $85 for a pet cleaning fee. I took the host at his word and paid but I‚Äôm not sure why I wasn‚Äôt charged initially? This could have been my mistake for not reading the fine print or an Airbnb website mistake so I‚Äôm still giving the house and Jon a five star‚Ä¶but just be aware that the pet fee might not be included in the initial price.

Wish I could say everything was great but I had to wait on the door for 40min before being able to unlock the door as the code door I was given didn‚Äôt work. I wouldn‚Äôt say this is a bad place to stay because I don‚Äôt think so but is not good value for money and the extra fees for early check in/out are way too much. No flexibility whatsoever these days I don‚Äôt think is a great experience.

*Smoke-smelling House, Poor Customer Service*
The house smelled like smoke despite advertised as a non-smoking airbnb. Worse, it smelled like it had been attempted to cover it with chemical air freshener. When brought to their attention, it was told to me that the housekeeper didn't say anything when cleaned earlier and to turn on the fan feature of the Nest and that was it. No other assistance. No offer of reimbursement. No help when asked about different accommodations.
Moreover, when additional messages were sent, I received messages focused on getting a 5 star review and checkout. They failed to affirm a concerned customer with health issues exacerbated by cigarette smoke.

Location was great for ACL. Door code comes right at check in time, however our code was wrong. I called the number on the email with no response. Luckily we got a response through the app within a few minutes because waiting outside was hot. The toilet started acting up and wouldn‚Äôt flush correctly. Like it was clogged, but it  would eventually drain. There was no plunger. The provided Wi-Fi information was not correct and we couldn‚Äôt find the modem so we had no TV during our stay. Shower knobs are wonky. Hot water knob comes off wall when turning it on. Too many issues for such a short stay and high price.
Place was fine, but I left an expensive vacuum flask behind and it took them more than a week to find it and let me know. No care at all

**SEWAGE LEAKING FROM TOILET** Do Not Stay!

We had a few issues with the listing. At first it appeared to be someone renting out their place which is always great to find, but unfortunately it was run tightly by a management company. We asked for some wiggle room with checkin and were told everything has an upcharge. Not really a great start but it's ok. We were in Austin for my little brothers wedding and just needed the place for the night. We spent 7 or 8 hours at the apartment total. In that time we discovered an unpleasent smell in the apartment (we opened all the windows to let it airout), dirty linings with dog hair and actual granuals of dirty in them, broken counter edges that were a bit too sharp to make one comfortable (glad my kids were at my in-laws), and worst of all the toilet was unsealed at the base and wiggled around with you sat on it. There was an obviously leak of sewage around the base and back of the toilet that was disgusting and quite disturbing. Now I am not saying it looked like Amber Hurd had stayed there before we did, just that there was discolored water and obvious watermarks where it has leaked previously as well as what seemed to be a very poor attempt to fix the toilet using caulk.

So we reached out to the host a day or two after our stay to complain about the issues and asked for a modest partial refund for the issues. They were not please and said we should have let us know earlier so they could have fixed it. I let them know I was there one night and circumstances were such that I was not able to contact them while in the apartment. They let me know in no uncertain terms that they were unwilling to give me a refund. I let them know that I would be leaving this review. I also don't think it's fair to future customers to have to stay in that kind of filth so I am working with Airbnb and with the City of Austin to make sure the issue with the toilet is addressed at the very least.

Shoddy & Shabby. Unit needs attention. The toilet is loose and bangs against the wall. Pillows feel heavy and worn. Kitchen dishes are sparse, cups are chipped. Mold along tub lining, shower faucet not firmly fixed in place. Picture frames broken, random broken hook in wall. Pieces of cabinet missing. Kitchen drawer barely opens.
The location is good.
I was disappointed & frustrated to find the unit dirty, not cleaned & with a strong odor of marijuana. A lousy way to start a trip considering the five emails sent repeatedly asking when I was arriving and if I wanted an early check-in for an additional charge.
I contacted the host who had a cleaner out allowing me to get in the unit by 9 pm. When I asked the host for compensation for my inconvenience, I received no response, none.
I reached out to Airbnb who offered 20% off and no cleaning fee which I thought was fair.

The place needs a maintenance. Tub shower stain and sink stain and dirty.
Hair blow dryer broke on us
The outside pool is pretty dirty.
We didn‚Äôt get the code to check in until we reached out to the host.

Terrible experience. We arrived and there was no power, and no hot water. They were inconsiderate and only cared about their money. They weren‚Äôt helpful at all we were literally stranded and they couldn‚Äôt even answer my calls. We had to pay another expense for a hotel, so we didn‚Äôt stay at the air bnb at all and they couldn‚Äôt even give us a full refund.
Just a couple blocks from everything downtown.
No response from the host. Very disappointed and frustrated by the experience
Just know what you‚Äôre getting yourself into. You get what you pay for

Yo comet√≠ el error de pensar que el departamento era completo, y al llegar me di cuenta que √∫nicamente se rentaba una habitaci√≥n privada y lo dem√°s era compartido. Eric fue muy amable a pesar de este mal entendido. Para ser honesta, el lugar no luc√≠a tal cual las fotos, pero no estaba mal. Lo recomiendo para viajeros j√≥venes (no familias) y que √∫nicamente usen el hospedaje para dormir y ba√±arse durante pocos d√≠as. La ubicaci√≥n es estupenda. Queda a solo un par de cuadras de los paraderos de Metro Bus en Riverside. Cerca tiene un Supermercado HEB. El departamento se encuentra en un complejo privado, por lo que hace seguro el rumbo.
Naked man sleeping on the couch and moldy coffee in filter with gnats were unacceptable.  Checked out immediately and he refunded me.
This place was very dirty, not like the photos at all. Biggest waste of money. I showed up and immediately had to book a hotel room

PSA I saw (and killed) lots of baby cockroaches in the kitchen, plus when I turned on the fan in the room a bunch of dead insects fell to the floor. The main dialpad to the neighborhood was broken (physically torn out) and the pedestrian gate did not open. Otherwise, the bed felt comfortable and I was able to work on the wifi with no interruptions. Pressure in the shower was fine, toiletries supplied. Definitely a cheap accommodation in Austin near the airport. Would prefer a cleaner place next time.

Unfortunately we were very disappointed with our stay. We got in around 1am after traveling and hoping for a great place to clean up and crash. There were no pillows on the bed and the ones in the closet didn‚Äôt have cases/sheets on them. The apartment isn‚Äôt in a great neighborhood, seems to be all college apartments which isn‚Äôt disclosed. The pedestrian gate has the locks ripped out so the bus stop is right outside. The complex smells terrible of a certain smell and that can be smelled within the unit. Eric was good with communication and you can tell that he tried to clean the place up but overall my husband and I were not comfortable or happy and we ended up booking a hotel room for the remainder of our trip after that first night. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend or book again.

The view is incredible. We had something come up and Paul was very understanding when we had to leave early.

The photos are misleading. Some of the furniture isn‚Äôt the same and there is furniture that isn‚Äôt shown in photos. Felt like someone lived there and had been asked to leave so we could stay (don‚Äôt think that‚Äôs the case just how it felt).

Great location in South Austin! Located on a quiet street but very close to a ton of restaurants. Short drive to the airport, downtown, COTA, etc. No issues checking in, would absolutely stay here again when visiting in the future.

Josiah was a friendly host and the place is a short uber ride into town. The room was fine and comfortable bed. But the entire house smelled really bad. The shared living space was messy, dirty and the kitchen was unusable.
Great place to stay! So much room and killer location!
I was accused of stealing stuff. Please book at your own risk.
Tiny home was very nice and comfortable! Location was a bit far from downtown Austin in our opinion but we had a rental that took about a 15-20 minute drive which wasn‚Äôt so bad.
You won‚Äôt be disappointed!

Me gust√≥ mucho la ubicaci√≥n, la limpieza y la discreci√≥n de Mary y su pareja, puedes entrar o salir a cualquier hora, y est√° muy limpio, pero si no te gustan los perros o gatos o eres al√©rgica no debes ir

While Slava was quick to reply and the studio was in great condition, I felt I was nickel and dimed for things that resulted in a not so great customer service experience. I stayed at the studio alone all 4 days and accidentally had another day booked. While this was my fault, I asked my girlfriend to give me a ride since the last night was accidental and I just moved to the area, Slava charged me extra for 1 guest who also had narcolepsy and cannot drive home at night. I will not be staying with this host again as I felt the customer service wasn‚Äôt amazing.

This studio was great for the short stay. It‚Äôs small but cozy! Mind you, there is no kitchen so plan on eating out or getting pickup. Overall, it was exactly the place we needed for our time in Austin! The host was very detailed in all the information you‚Äôll need for your stay.
Had no issues, would book any day!

El lugar muy comodo!! Sin duda lo mejor es el colch√≥n es una maravilla.
La casa es algo vieja pero la remodelaci√≥n es buena. Muy al estilo Austin. La ubicaci√≥n es media, un Uber te cobra 10 dls hacia el centro. Nos pareci√≥ bien el lugar
I had to cancel last minute due to a family emergency and Steph and Meshelle were more then understanding even though it was last minute. Look forward to booking again!

Pay attention to the fact that it is on a busy street. That is not an understatement. The house is very small and very close to the curb. There is no noise absorption. I thought I was getting a relaxing home with a tub that, yes, was on a busy street, but not.. like... THAT busy. I don't know what to say other than I was unpleasantly surprised upon my arrival and left. Staying there alone as a woman, made me that uncomfortable.

There were mosquitos as soon as we entered.  My girlfriend and I were bitten repeatedly through the first night.  We vacated the location by the second day.  This was totally unacceptable.  It was a horrible experience and I am seeking a refund or partial refund.  The rental was extremely unpleasant.  The floor was very dirty, and the futon has mysterious stains on them.  The backdoor was unlocked as well.  I do not recommend this rental at all.
Overall, this is a great place to stay! The street noise is a little bit loud, but the host provides earplugs, so it didn‚Äôt bother us while we slept.

Cute place interior wise. The location leaves much to be desired and is somewhere I would not want to stay again due to the sketchiness / the bus stopping right in front of the house. The street is incredibly loud even into the middle of the night. The host was really great and the place is cute, but sadly, the location is what killed it for us.

Would never recommend anyone stay here for longer than one night.  Almost everything in the property felt like the graveyard of cheap, run-into-the ground, unwanted furnishings that previously belonged to host, now to be charged to the AirBnB guest (instead of being sold off at a flea market or rummage sale).  Rusty shower bar with rust fluid dripping down shower curtain, blown out kitchen appliances that look like stuff from  Antique Road Show, which when used, emit burning rubber smell, dust mites all over bedding (if allergic at all, DO NOT STAY HERE), filthy tub and rugs covered with hair on arrival.  The owner is happy to deflect blame to the following: "I'll let housekeeping know".  But it seems to me to be an owner's problem, not that of an hourly wage cleaning service.  I would not recommend this place to anyone except for Goodwill looking for inventory.

Christians place is spotless and has it so own entrance and is a great little space for a couple of days!
The two things I didn't see in the other reviews that I wish I had known before booking are that it is located at a noisy traffic intersection and it is noisy throughout the night. I live in a big city myself and am no stranger to noise at night but found the noise very disruptive, which made for being very tired the next day. The other thing to note is that if you don't have a car, the location is a bit isolating. You can walk to one v cool cafe (flitch) but otherwise, the area is not well suited to walking and we relied on Uber to get to further located places.

The place was very cute but not worth the expense. The towels and dishes had a unpleasant odor. The host was also unresponsive. For having so many restrictions on the place, I expected the place to be better.
Creative Spot Killer Location Can‚Äôt Wait To Come Back ! Thanx again Jason

I wasn't 100% happy with the rental, as I had to address some cleanliness and safety issues with owner. It was a little noisy as unit above appears to have a pool table and I could hear balls clicking all night. If you're allergic to smoke, I wouldn't recommend unit  as I could smell smoke coming through vents from the adjacent unit.

Jason communicates information and expectations clearly and timely, but he does not deliver on guest expectations.
Upon our arrival the exterior area was filthy, the unit was not clean and basic amenities were lacking. Additionally the unit was not well maintained with closet doors off the tracks, drapes not hung properly, TV remote missing. And most importantly there is not a security deadbolt or bar for the front door. I shared other issues privately with the host, hopefully he will address them. But this was such a disappointing experience I will not stay at any of his properties again. The feeling I had was that he is an absentee owner that never inspects the property and quite frankly just doesn‚Äôt care. I am comparing this stay to stays I have had all over the world. This is the first poor review I have written. Be mindful before booking.

I would not stay here again simply because the place was so dirty despite paying a $100 cleaning fee.
After walking in the apartment with bare feet the soles of my feet were black with dirt. The rugs and couch were covered in stains and were dirty. The master bath shower was covered in mildew/mold. The kitchen sink had a foul smell. The sheets were dirty and had hair on them.

I chose this place because the pictures looked beautiful and I assumed that the $100 cleaning fee meant the place would be..clean. We walked in to find dust balls on the floor, dirty smudges on all main area walls, none of the kitchen or living area surfaces had been wiped down (my damp paper towel was dark brown after wiping a section of the coffee table), debris on the area rugs, stains on the couch, and massive fingerprints on all the acrylic dining chairs. I didn‚Äôt have the will to even check the bedrooms and bathroom. We picked up our things and left the place...it was that bad.

For someone else this space might work better.  I was looking for a short reprive from locking down with my family during the Covid pandemic.  But two things made this space an unexpectedly poor choice for me: 1.  It wasn't as clean as I expected, which made me skeptical about the claims of having been disinfected.  2. The window treatments don't provide privacy - basically none in the living area, but even the bedroom drapes didn't cover the windows well.  It's privacy that I miss, so this was really disappointing.

The Airbnb is beautiful and in a wonderful location. Unfortunately, I will have to give Jason a horrible review. My friend checked in the first night at Jason‚Äôs Airbnb and woke up to a power outage. Multiple times she tried to contact Jason to no answer. I was unable to check in since my flight was cancelled. Instead I drove 24 hours from Las Vegas to Austin to try and meet up with my friend. I messaged Jason to please respond to my friend to which he replied that all communication must be via the messaging app. I can‚Äôt believe he said this because at that time, the state of Austin was in crisis. There was no heat, no hot water, no electricity and my poor friend was in complete distress and isolation with no updates from Jason. When I finally reached the Airbnb, it was 10 degrees (F). We asked if we could have some extra blankets, candles to which he replied that he had no additional supplies and that he could possibly drop off blankets tomorrow without any reason he couldn‚Äôt today. We lied awake at night unable to sleep in 5 degree weather completely unprepared for this disaster. In the morning, we saw that the silverware in the cabinets were dirty. We were disgusted because we used silverware the prior night but could not see due to no electricity. I can‚Äôt believe we used dirty utensils in the middle of the COVID pandemic. We decided to leave the Airbnb for safety reasons. I asked Jason if we could please leave our 2WD sedan rental car in the snowed in parking lot. It was unsafe to drive as we saw multiple car accidents due to unplowed roads and non functioning traffic lights. Jason replied that we must immediately vacate the premises at exactly 11AM when we checked out with our car gone.

This review would have been very different if Jason had shown an ounce of empathy, communication, and understanding for the situation. We understand that Austin was in a state of crisis and that every resident was going through hell. However, we were two people in a new city completely unprepared and unaware of the impending disaster. If Jason could have simply updated us, maybe give a reason why we couldn‚Äôt leave our car, we would have appreciated it. From the beginning, Jason was curt and this whole ordeal shows that all he cares of Airbnb guests is that it is part of his business.

This place is smaller than expected and too much money for the value. We arrived to a broken bed, wet towels, shower knob that came off in your hand, a washer that leaked down to the ceiling of the people below us, black scuff marks everywhere on the white walls, staining/food marks on the ceilings, only 3 wash cloths for 6 people (sleeps 9), broken/rigged up bedroom curtains, and broken wall outlet.

I spoke with the owners/property managers about some of the issues we had and they did give me a $105 discount after we checked out. But for 6 people for 3 nights we spend $2,632 total to stay there. So $438/ person. Not worth it one bit. Will not be going back. Do not recommend for the price. If it was $200/person then maybe. But we paid high dollar for a low place. Also do your research on the location. You can see ‚Äútent city‚Äù from the balcony under the overpass.

The condo looks as pictured and the location is right off the freeway which is very convenient. However as soon as we checked in, there were several things we noticed and brought it up to Corrie. The oven was not working when we were trying to bake a cake for the celebration, the towel rack in the guest bath was broken, the washer out of order, the place did not look like cleaning service came when we checked in. (Corrie did have them come in to tidy up while we were gone) water was dripping from the roof near the sink and the worst part was most of the guest could not sleep due to the noise from upstairs until the last night. The unit definitely needs some repairs.

Jason would not communicate after my booking was complete which should have alarmed me. The property is unsafe and I would not advise anyone to book this unit. There were groups of people hanging out in the parking lot and on their balconies when I arrived and that went on under the next day. The noise in the building made it important for me to sleep. The condo is more like a motel. The noise was beyond ridiculous and I am not talking about the traffic. The unit was not clean, the sofa was filthy and the refrigerator was dirty as well. The towel bar was broken, the dryer did not work and the master bathroom has not been cleaned in a while. Beware of booking this place if you want a clean and quiet place to sleep. The only thing that was offered from someone other than Jason was $35 which is a partial refund of the cleaning. I took pictures of the items I complained about and never heard anything from Jason.
