The last straw was loud arguing early in the morning, I gathered my belongings and told my group we were leaving. If I paid for cleaning, why did I have to take the trash out? I have never experienced anything like this before.

The place was in a good location close to downtown. It was clean but the noise level from apartment above was so high that we did not sleep for two nights. I emailed the host multiple times and he said they will remind those upstairs of the rules but the noise level got even worse the night after. They screamed and moved furniture from 12 am to 7 am and was so annoying. When I asked the host to extend our stay for only one hour because we were not able to sleep at all due to noise, he refused and said they can‚Äôt.
I would not stay there due to noise level and host not taking responsibility.

Do not stay here. Upon arrival the condo was not prepared and it was disgusting. After leaving for several hours and poor communication it had been ‚Äúcleaned‚Äù but it was extremely obvious from arriving before the sheets had not been changed and it was still gross around. Cookware was disgusting and we were never really sure if the front door Locked from the inside. Seek elsewhere at all costs.

Cleanliness was an issue. Bathrooms did not look like they had a cleaning before, dirty shoe prints all over master bath and master bed. Lights wouldn‚Äôt work and we couldn‚Äôt sleep in the master room the first night due to the lights staying on all night with switches not working.

Horrible experience - ended up leaving at 10:30pm to stay at the Hilton. Stained beds and couches, lights didn‚Äôt work, slats under the bed were broken, mold on the shower head, dirty footprints on the WALL - all things that should have been addressed prior to arrival.

I have stayed in a lot of Airbnbs and all were fairly decent to all out great. This one was very much sub par. It needs a deep cleaning and a complete overhaul. The shower looked moldy, the tile grout looked dingy. The walls were smudged and the cabinets all banged up. The ceiling tiles were stained. The drapery was inadequate. They were thin and didn't cover the windows. There were no hangers and only one, half, hanging rod in one of the bedrooms. I went to Target and bought hangers for the place, but one of the bedrooms had no closet at all. It was locked. Several light bulbs were burnt out. there was no lighting on the exterior stairs that lead to the street.
Pros were that is was a short walk to Target (to get hangers), Wholefoods and Brew & Brew coffee and bar. There were little wrapped soaps and shampoo and conditioner in the shower. The sofa was comfy. It was nice to have the deck.

Disappointing listing. While the listing is large and beautiful, these hosts are not interested in your overall comfort. Before our stay, the host sent several messages reminding us of the house rules. This set a tone that made us feel unwelcome and uncomfortable. We booked our stay last minute to visit some family traveling to Austin. We were unclear if the host would allow our family to come up to the room before dinner, but when we reached out to check, the host was very vague and unclear, ultimately leading us to change our plans because we were concerned they would charge us.

The rooms are well staged but not functional. Sheets are cheap. Pillows were uncomfortable. No extra pillows or blankets. And outlets were hidden under the rug in the bedroom, making them difficult to access. The host even told us not to take anything additional off the other beds, even though we paid for the entire condo.

This was also the first listing I‚Äôve ever stayed in that didn‚Äôt have a deadbolt or interior lock, which means anyone with the keypad code could enter the condo when guests are sleeping.

The host‚Äôs contact number isn‚Äôt a real number that reaches anyone. It‚Äôs a voice message that directs to the app without the ability to leave a message. So in the case of an emergency, this host won‚Äôt be answering the phone.

All in all, I‚Äôm glad we didn‚Äôt pay the full rate for this listing due to our lack tribute booking. The price is much too high for the low quality of the experience. Our experience was inhospitable, and we found these hosts to be unhelpful. We‚Äôve stayed in many places around Austin with hosts who care about your comfort and experience. Find another listing.

Hands down the worst AirBB experience to date. This place was filthy and falling apart. Hair and filth on every bed and surface. Definitely do not recommend.  This place is literally disgusting. Hosts are overly communicative which indicates that the place is well taken care of. Not the case at all.

We encountered a major issue and the host responded quickly to try to make it right.

Pros:
Nice apartment. Good location. Lots of space. Target and Whole Foods just a block away

Cons:
Needs some TLC. Many light bulbs out. Cabinets in kitchen and bathroom are beat up. Toilet seat in master is loose.
great place overall. Didn't love the many messages warning about not partying or having extra guests.

Poor communication, no wi-fi and the host argued over the alteration policy and then became non-responsive after trying to make me cancel my reservation mid-stay (so they could avoid processing a refund).
The place is not very clean. Towels smelled of mildew.

The bed was so hard it felt like we were sleeping on the floor. I had to try and sleep on the small couch which was no better. I had back pains the rest of my trip and hardly slept. We have to go out and buy a pillow foam topper for the bed which was not cheap and hardly helped. HORRIBLE !!!!!

The shower is on a slope and the water runs down rather than down the center very slippery. You could easily fall. Be careful.

Lastly this location is close to fun things and restaurants but NOT walking distance to most things . it‚Äôs right off a main road and before the exits to a main high way.

Neat and tidy little unit. Good location, close to South Congress.
Is quite noisy - can hear the traffic from the highway and the owners upstairs but they observed quiet hours overnight and we didn't hear them at all. If you're sensitive to noise and don't like sleeping with ear plugs I wouldn't recommend.

Honestly, the stay was 3 stars out of 5. The location was hidden away & has a very narrow, steep driveway making it hard to be picked up by Ubers. Also there was not much privacy. Though it‚Äôs a suite with our own entrance, the people upstairs were pretty loud and especially the dogs. There is a door that separates the suite & the house & at times we were able to hear the dog right on the other side of that door or people walking by. The walls are thin so it was a bit uncomfortable to converse with my husband or get intimate with out worrying if we were being heard.
The Wifi was terrible, I kept dropping zoom meeting with my clients & the streaming services provided did not load sufficiently. The shower is definitely a slipping hazard since it has no door, all the water splatters out onto the bathroom floor. Also there wasnt any hooks to hang jackets or anything besides the two hooks in the bathroom. Also obviously used nail & first aid kits were provided.

Very disappointed... the photos did not show how many stairs there were and we had alot of luggage and heavy. I wouldn't have booked it had I know.

I was't happy at all when I found a dead roach on the dinning room floor and the bedroom had cob webs :(

Unfortunately we found this house to be much worse than expected. There are very basic things that a guest would normally expect for a whole home rental (especially when paying very exorbitant 'holiday prices') that this place simply didn‚Äôt provide:

1) Lacking the courtesy to heat the home prior to our arrival ‚Äì My elderly parents (one with dementia) arrived to a very cold home and were overall pretty horrified with the initial experience.

2) Price gouging ‚Äì I get that during a holiday period that prices will be significantly higher than normal, what I don‚Äôt appreciate are places that triple their normal rate (we paid $300+ a night, it was absolutely not worth that, nor worth half that).

3) Sparse and barren ‚Äì This house has none of the charms and comforts that many Airbnb hosts put into their places, very little thought given by the host a guest‚Äôs comfort. In fact, there isn‚Äôt a single flat surface in ANY of the bedrooms to place anything. No dresser. No desk. Nothing. My elderly parents and myself literally had our luggage splayed out on the floor. It was appalling.

4) Lack of essentials ‚Äì With a whole home rental you expect things like dishes, pots and pans, etc. While this place had a number of these, we couldn‚Äôt find any bowls whatsoever, as well as other kitchen tools that one would expect. Coffee maker is provided without any coffee (honestly at $300/night I‚Äôm surprised this host isn‚Äôt providing K-cups or similar!).

5) Poor quality of furnishings and surroundings ‚Äì In addition to a lack of basic things like a dresser or desk (literally the only place in this large 4-bedroom home where one can sit and do work on a laptop is on a single dining room table), the quality of what is there is poor. The dining room table chairs feel cheap and represent a bad tripping hazard. There are literally 2 cheap and dirty plastic chairs in the garden to sit on (one with a broken lightbulb on it).

6) Poor maintenance ‚Äì The house overall seems a bit run down and old. A couple bulbs were out, including a large one in one of the bathrooms. Little thought was given to the back garden, it‚Äôs basically unusable as it is, no chairs, no ambiance, etc. The garage feels like a construction zone, with debris and tripping hazards. Poor maintenance when it comes to painting and structural repairs. And the fireplace didn't work (very disappointing especially at Christmas time)

All in all this was by far my most disappointing Airbnb experience ever (and most expensive), and I wholeheartedly would not recommend this home or this host to anyone. Avoid.
Basic accommodations in a central location. Air mattress, no windows. Kind host.

We should have checked the drive time not just the distance (miles) things were from here. Was given the wrong information for the unit # and the code.  Needs a good cleaning and a little updating.  Was very disappointed üòî
The place was not clean when we arrived due to that reason we didn‚Äôt stay.
I do not recommend staying here. It was not as described.

TLDR: This is a great property for college kids or people looking for 1 to 2 night near the lake.
We stayed for a month while a home remodel project was taking place within the same area but would not return.
Pros:
- The owner of the property is extremely nice and will communicate and try his best to make things better ASAP.
- The house is in a nice, quiet location with the ability to walk down to the water or just around the nice neighborhoods
- Allows pets
- The WiFi even for 2 adults WFH worked great (until it completely stopped working 3 days before we left.)
- The house did not have any issues during the Feb '21 snowpocalapse - a very good thing

Cons:
-- The oven knob is broken so you can't use the oven to any specific temp and then it's hard to know if it's really off (as someone who has lived through a house fire, once we got it off and cooled, we never used it again)
-- The beds are uncomfortable, really uncomfortable. One is SO SOFT you fall to the center and sink, one is soft on top but can feel the springs under the mattress topper
-- The TV lost connectivity, so wouldn't work more than a few minutes sometimes. We'd try to reconnect to WiFi but it was frustrating so we gave up and used our laptop
-- The couches are not comfortable, again with the soft, sinking thing
-- The kitchen lights have a wiring issue and would flicker, turn on-and-off randomly... we ended up using the hood light more than recessed lights.
-- There is 1 key between 2 people and that can be challenging when there are multiple schedules
-- Tools were lacking (esp for a longer stay) so we went to our house and brought back comforters, pans, pots, grill tools, etc.
-- Unfortunately the heater completely broke our first night, it took 2 days to do a complete replace. The owner did jump on this right away, but we were also trying to avoid construction so this was upsetting and distracting us from work while dealing with it.
-- Unfortunately the septic tank had issues in our first week so the house smelled like... septic tank. We went to our house and got smelly candles and tried to mask it but again, why are we dealing with these major issues as Airbnb renters? Just unfortunate timing.

Overall, the house did its job. Our infant daughter didn't seem to notice anything. Our dog could run around. We had a place to go during a remodel. The owner did act quickly and was apologetic. But we were stressed out over the property and looking back, we shouldn't have rented and just dealt with our own house.

the hosts were very bad at communication. they did not reply for multiple of questions immediately. I should've cancelled right then, but was sold for the location. the location is very nice, calm and serene. but the house itself was not clean, bath room curtains were very dirty, the bed was broken and in a very bad shape. all the supplies were rationed. in the end, it was a bad choice for a stay at Austin.

I have stayed in Airbnb's all over the world never have I had so many problems with a site.  The first thing is this listing does not sleep 6 adults.  I would say 4.  They do not have off street parking.  They do not stock the place fully for guests.  Only 3 rolls of toilet paper for 5 women, really.  The cleaning crew needs to be fired.  Dirty sheets and pillows for 3rd bed.- if you could call it that.  Blinds are broken and the "3rd" bed is out in main room so very bright.  Across from a bar- it is very loud until late at night.  Overall the space is very nicely decorated and a good location if you are going to 6th street or convention center but I would not stay here again.
Good location but a bit noisy!
Expect Wendy to go missing when needed.

Place at the rate location and very comfortable
However not very kid friendly : Upstairs has a very low railing risky for small kids for falls
no microwave
no heating beyond 68 F so Families with young kids will have a problem

The bungalow was such a neat and tidy place. My only suggestion is to have less rules. We were charged a cleaning fee but still had to wash our own dishes, sweep, and throw our trash out. That should be mentioned in the description before we were charged.
Extremely dirty upon arrival‚Ä¶food left on counter, bedding left in washer/dryer, hot, trash stinky, etc.

The location is good and close to downtown, but the neighborhood is old and does not feel safe. Room was not clean when we checked in and we need to flush the toilet by ourselves. Stove is not fully working. We had to ask the owner for more trash bags but none was in stock in the house and the owner did not give any help. The hot air conditioner of the house is uncofortable and noisy, and we kept waking up to drink more water during the night. Water pressure is very low. Overall, given this price and quality, staying at nearby hotels is a much better choice.

Wendy‚Äôs place was very clean and cute, however the refrigerator was broken, and had been broken for a while, which we were not made aware of before our visit. They did have a very tiny mini fridge but we weren‚Äôt able to fit much in at all. We had planned to cook/ eat in and the broken refrigerator made that impossible. We also had some technical difficulties with the keypad.

Overall I would recommend, but double check everything is in working order before you book

This facility is a hidden gem in the middle of Austin. You won‚Äôt regret booking with Shelby. The house has everything you need for either a few days stay or a month trip. Things are organized and prepared with lot of thoughts for the customers.
The place was very clean and eclectic. It was as advertised and we enjoyed our stay. It is close enough to downtown and may neat places but also far enough away that it isn't a super busy area.

If you‚Äôre looking for a cheap place in a good location and don‚Äôt mind a filthy bathroom sink, a weird musty smell, dusty ceiling fans, no sheets on one of the beds, and no curtains in the bedroom this is the place for you. For a three night stay we managed to make it one night (if you count leaving at three am the next morning a night). Also, I asked the host for an earlier check in and she never responded. I get not being able to check in early, but I feel like when you‚Äôre staying in someone‚Äôs listing you should at least respond. This place is a dump.

It pains me to leave a negative review. Raj seems like a very kind and nice person, but our experience at his place was not good. He has a lot of good reviews, so we were really shocked  at our experience. After having stayed in over 30 airbnbs this isn't new to us. The few pros are that the bed is comfortable, there is free parking, and the location is decent. The cons for us are a long list, but the biggest issue we had was that the place had not been cleaned prior to us checking-in. But the apartment was presented to us as having been cleaned. The bed had been made with the sheets of the prior guest, there was animal and human hair everywhere, food splatter all over the kitchen, a dirty toilet/tub, floors not been swept or mopped, and I could go on. The place looked like it hadn't been cleaned in 4 months or more. When we alerted him of this were told that his cleaning lady had an emergency. This was after he told us that they had spent 2 days cleaning it. Basically the cleaning person did not inform Raj that the place couldn't be cleaned due to a personal issue, so the person just never informed him and we checked-in to a nightmare.  In his defense, he did try his best to make it right as much as one could at that point. But in all truth it ruined a few days our of stay and we felt completely uncomfortable the entire time we stayed there knowing how dirty the place was. The biggest issue we had is that there is no excuse that can be given for this to have happened. It is not our problem as the guest that his cleaning person had an emergency. While I have compassion for people having emergencies it is not okay to make the bed with dirty sheets or not clean a toilet seat and act like all is well.  I admit we did end up cleaning the place and getting somewhat of a discount/refund. We did this versus canceling for a full refund because at that point moving to a new location would have meant losing money due to the fact that so last minute there were no airbnbs to pick from in our budget. We felt why should be we forced to pay even more and lose money when we didn't do anything wrong. So we did have to suck it up and deal. Either way had we have moved to a new location or stayed like we did the whole experience really ruined more than a few days of our trip. Aside from the place not being cleaned, most of the furniture in the place is either falling apart, stained, or badly worn. The kitchen really lacked enough utensils to cook a meal. The TV works but is in poor condition as well. I later found out that Raj doesn't take a profit from this airbnb, and gives the money to charity, which is commendable. But that being said, the place sort of has the feel that someone went to goodwill bought a bunch of furniture and threw the place together.
I only had a brief stay here for one night (arrived late and left early).  Everything was fine for the price paid.  No real coffee in the morning, though, only instant coffee (yuck!).

Was disappointed in the rental- first the positive: location was great, beds were very comfortable.

The negative: this place needs a lot of attention. 7 light bulbs out, including the front porch. Bathroom door sticks so bad my wife and mother in law could not even open it. There is no exhaust fan in bathroom resulting in very high condensation from showers (hence door stick) also a great deal of black mold in bathroom and foul smell throughout house. Also had to pull battery in smoke detector do to it going off every time you showered. Only 1 roll of toilet paper and 1/2 roll of paper towels, 2 washcloths for 4 adults and 3 bath towels, kitchen is poorly equipped for any cooking( no sharp knives, 3 glasses, limited pots and pans. Back porch is really bad, mold and mud everywhere. The gates don‚Äôt lock and there are gaps in the fence.

I hate writing bad reviews but I felt necessary considering the cost for such a disappointing stay.
Don't trust this host. He tried to have us pay for what was a defective bed that was missing a bracket.

We rented this house for 2 nights to celebrate our daughter's graduation from UT Austin nearby. One positive thing about this place is that the kitchen and the adjacent living room are in open space, which is good for a big group to gather. However, this house is just too small to accommodate up to 20 people and with only 2 bathrooms- only one of the two bathrooms provide complete privacy, the other one has a barn-type of doors and can't be locked.
There are plenty of towels, toilet papers, and paper towels available. One thing we were surprised to find is this house has NO microwave oven. Though this was our fault because the host never advertise that it has a microwave. We just assume that it has because we have been at many Airbnb rentals and this is the first place that doesn't have a microwave. We just thought that this must be an essential appliance to have. Also during our stay the water heater broke down on the second day of our stay and the host could not repair it in time for us to take showers, which was a bummer. The host did try very hard to resolve the issue while we were there but was unable to because it's was a holiday weekend and it's difficult to find repairman. However the host did compensate us $200 for the loss of use of the water heater for that evening.
10 out of 10 recommend booking here, you won‚Äôt regret it

Great location and cute decor and home theme. Booked this house for a bachelorette party for 16 people and there was plenty of space for us to lounge, sleep and socialize. 2 bathrooms is a bit of a struggle with that many guests but not a deal breaker.

However, there were a few deal breakers‚Ä¶About an hour after check-in the entire plumbing system gave out (not our fault) and we were unable to use the toilet and shower. This was extremely inconvenient seeing as how we had just traveled all morning and had dinner reservations that night. Called and spoke with our host, Valerie and she said she‚Äôd send someone over immediately. That person showed up 1.5 hours later. After assessing the situation, he said he needed to call a plumber. We told both him and Valerie that we had dinner reservations and would be out of the house when plumber arrived (we thought someone would tell him the code or meet him there) One of our guests had a later flight and arrived at the house to find the plumber standing outside waiting to be let in. After letting him in, my guest was told she could not leave the house until he was working due to company policy (She was trying to leave the house to meet us out) we called our host, Valerie to explain the situation and see if she or someone else could go to the house to deal with the situation since we felt it was not our responsibility. Valerie ended up hanging up on us after repeatedly asking us what it was we wanted her to do??? As a host, we felt she should‚Äôve been at the house to handle this situation or send a property manager- not make her guests handle it.
End result- plumbing lines were completely clogged from past guests and had to be completely emptied. Even after the plumber fixed the problem the toilets and showers were still a bit iffy. I understand that Valerie did not cause this issue but it was extremely inconvenient to deal with on our first night. Also, upon our arrival both city garbage cans were completely full and we reached out to the host who said she would send someone over the next day to remove the garbage and no one ever showed.

And I know cockroaches are considered ‚Äúnormal‚Äù in Texas but there was a cockroach found in the main bathroom on Sunday which rubbed a lot of the guests the wrong way seeing as how we are not from Texas. Also- lots of flies in backyard near patio table even after we cleaned it upon arrival. Had to run to Walmart and buy a fly trap which caught over 30 flies in just a few hours. Pool vacuum was also very full and there were no directions on how to clean it or any directions on how to remove it. We had to swim around it all weekend and the pool became pretty dirty with leaves.

All in all, this Airbnb served its purpose for a large group and there was plenty of space and we all loved the initial vibe of the house but we were very turned off by the problems we encountered and the lack of communication and assistance. If you book with Valerie, I sincerely hope you do not run into ANY of the problems that we encountered.

Terrible.  We really wanted to be able to stay here because it was near downtown and looked really cute from the pics‚Ä¶ but we started sneezing and coughing as soon as we walked in.  There is an obvious mold/mildew problem.  If you are sensitive or have asthma, don‚Äôt book.  We couldn‚Äôt possibly stay here and they didn‚Äôt refund anything.  Had to book a hotel instead.  I hate to leave a bad review (my first ever), but I feel like I needed to warn others and feel like our money (at least part of it) should be refunded since we immediately notified them and cancelled within minutes of arrival.  Beware!

Brett‚Äôs house was good. We were very disappointed when we had to check in and received the wrong check in code. We ended up having to wait over half an hour to respond sitting outside the house. With a group of 6 we were disappointed.

The location was perfect! The house was clean and as pictured.

Pros: Cute style. Very quiet. Affordable. Private. Cons: No kitchen and I wasn't able to use the coffee maker, which was advertised as an amenity. Had to drive to a Starbucks a few miles away both mornings to get my morning coffee. Not a big deal but was looking forward to morning coffee in my Air BNB. There is a small microwave and fridge. I ended up picking up some pre-cooked SNAP Kitchen meals and heating them up for my meals. There are other comments people made about the neighborhood - I disagree with any negative comments. The neighbors and neighborhood are lovely, low key, and very quiet.
Place was cute close to the city but not as clean as I would of wanted.

The house was very nice! There were dogs in the backyard most of the time but they didn‚Äôt bother us; just very loud and could come across scary when walking past. Other than that, our stay was very pleasant!
You cannot find a better spot for one or two people to explore Austin.

Do not stay here.  There was no air conditioning and it was not cleaned between people like we were told it would be.  Owner doesn‚Äôt answer the phone calls or texts. Parking is street spots no garage spots like told. Would not recommend this place to anyone.  We went for a bachelorette and it was highly disappointing.

Great clean, stylish place. It‚Äôs a home specifically built for short term rentals but styled comfortably and cannot highlight enough-very clean! My only criticism is the beds are way too soft for my personal preference.

The place was clean, but felt cold like a concrete box. It‚Äôs not a private condo building. It‚Äôs a ‚Äútime share hotel‚Äù without the services that come along with a hotel, like a bar, or a restaurant. The pool was full of screaming kids, yelling ‚ÄúMarco Polo.‚Äù Not relaxing at all. I didn‚Äôt use any amenities because there were too many people. The worst part was how rude the host was  about it. I saved the screenshots of her accusing me of ‚Äúextortion‚Äù because I wanted to leave and go someplace private and quiet. Worst experience I‚Äôve ever had with a host. EVER!
I do not want to post a public review
The door to get in is at back of the house on a small dirt road

The house was exactly as pictured and very spacious.  The kitchen and bathrooms were stocked well, including a new toothbrush which came in handy since my husband forgot his!  The only downside was the sectional.  It was really low, not very comfortable and hard to get out of.  We really enjoyed our stay and would stay here again!
The house is very clean, but a bit spare. The kitchen is not all that well stocked. When we stayed, the towels were thin and old, there were no washcloths and no bathmats.

You are basically renting two bedrooms and a bathroom that are upstairs in Tracey‚Äôs home. The bedrooms appear to belong to the children and the only privacy is with the door being shut. It is clean but no privacy!

Wir waren f√ºr zwei N√§chte bei Esther & Istral. Die Beiden haben uns sehr nett empfangen. Die Unterkunft ist sehr sauber und gepflegt. Die Gegend ist ruhig und wir haben uns sehr wohl gef√ºhlt! Die Innenstadt ist mit dem Bus gut zu erreichen.

F√ºr uns war das der perfekte Ort um gem√ºtlich in Amerika anzukommen, es war sehr sauber und wir f√ºhlten uns sicher!
Es gibt alles um die Ecke was man so braucht, Supermarkt, Tankstelle, Restaurants,...

Die K√ºche war leider nicht so gut ausgestattet wie erwartet, aber auch das kann man √ºberbr√ºcken. Wir wurden mit allerlei leckeren Snacks √ºberrascht und auch Flyer f√ºr verschiedene Trips wurden zur Verf√ºgung gestellt.
Die Unterkunft ist klein aber fein und im Gro√üen und Ganzen war alles in Ordnung.
Eine sch√∂ne Unterkunft in einer ruhigen Gegend!
Good spot bad management

Difficult to find the particular unit in this property, as the directions were inaccurate. However, owner was quick to respond when we called and left a message. Also, no lighting to allow us to navigate through the yard to our car parked on the other side of the fence. Otherwise, the unit appeared as described. Needs more air flow from the A/C to the bedroom

Don't walk, run away from this scam, fraudulent listing. If you enjoy breathing black mold, leaking ceilings, broken plumbing, filth, insects of all varieties, bed bugs, bed bug bites, vermin (mice and one plump, rotting dead racoon), hairy linens in fact hair of every nation and pet everywhere, falsified description and pictures, lack of internet wifi, broken tv, unresponsible unkind unresponsive and discriminatory host as well as the dirt and grime of the lowliest bug shack on the planet. Very much smeared lipstick on a slaughtered pig. Then this is your place! But honestly this experience was worse than covid itself. Save yourself the deceit and aggravation and check into a Model 6 (compared to listing it would be like the Four Seasons). Oh and definitely a fire hazard that should condemned anyday now.

There were bugs in the bathroom. A huge cockroach in the tub with flies swarming all about. Also, the floors need to be repaired! There are tons of cracks and scuffs.  The place is dark and dreary. Nothing like the photos online.  Also, it‚Äôs a nightmare bringing luggage to the back house. And there‚Äôs no maintenance in the side yard or backyard. Very dirty and the air conditioning is leaking onto the porch. I have been in TONS of Airbnbs throughout the country and this was one of the worst. It was practicallyI$250/night after all the fees and NOT worth it.
Not a legal Airbnb, made our stay difficult.

No words to describe, its a 5 stars place to stay.
Thanks for everything. Will come back again .

Decent place. Close to walking for food and fun..Kind of a drag with the gate fob for parking...have to go out and come back in. The sliding door to the patio is giant and does not slide well at all. Its very heavy..The outside of the complex is pretty dirty and doesn't look maintained.

Location was great, but a very dated Airbnb. Needs quiet a few updates and more attention to detail. The bathrooms were dirty when arriving, ie hair in the shower and soap on the bathroom walls.  Unfortunately when we arrived for checkin we had to wait 30 min due to the cleaning crew still being there.

Do NOT stay here if you are bringing a vehicle. I followed Paul‚Äôs instructions for parking and my vehicle was towed. I messaged Paul to figure out what happened and have yet to receive any kind of response. He was helpful when checking in but as soon as there was an issue, he disappeared. Very unhappy with my stay here.

This was one of the most disappointing experiences I have had in an Airbnb. The issues are so many I‚Äôve decided to list them.

* When we arrived we discovered it is not a full residential home but part of a home totalling maybe 500 square feet. Double the price of a hotel for a far worse experience.
* The couch is terrible and uncomfortable, the throw pillows had stains and obviously never been washed.
* The insane cleaning fee apparently did not cover cleaning out trash, washing dishes, vacuuming, or cleaning sheets before our arrival.
* The Apartment has no hot water and the shower does not drain!
* We arrived to a list of rules not posted on the listing that informed us to fees we could incur but we‚Äôre unaware of.
* They have a rule that if anyone comes to the home you are renting other than you, you will be asked to leave immediately with no refund. Something great to know before you rent a place to relax for a weekend.
* I paid far more than a hotel for two nights in a dirty, tiny apartment with no amenities and a television that doesn‚Äôt reliably work.

This apartment is not worth your time and do not fall prey to the false advertising on this page!

Overall was ok.  There were a number of strange items - Host requested $20/hr for early check-in, which I've never heard of before.  Terms sent stated "no visitors" which was bizarre.  There is a window at the front top of the space, that has no shade and when lying in the bed - can be directly viewed from the next door neighbor's second floor windows. Water pressure was pretty low.  Not bad, not great overall.

BEWARE. Sonder's policies are incredibly restrictive and their team will NOT help you if you need to change your reservation.

When our travel plans changed the unit we had booked was available for our new travel dates so I requested a change to our reservation. I received confusing messages that said "we can help you with your alteration" but they never accepted the change. When I followed up I was told "space isn‚Äôt available for your new dates" despite those dates appearing as available on Airbnb as of now.

After all of that they had the nerve to try and sell me on a different property and a new booking. I responded that I was even open to staying in this other unit if they would transfer my reservation but was ignored.

Overall incredibly disappointed as the unit appeared to be nice but they were more interested in taking my money than providing reasonable customer service.

Make sure to lock your door with a chair or something and come with your own security camera, because you might find some guy in the middle of your living room after 2 days randomly. When asked what he was doing there he said ‚Äúhe was making sure we checked in?!‚Äù, which is a bit ridiculous since I was in contact with the company while I was checking in, also who the hell comes after a day or 2 and walks in without my consent and invades my privacy just to make sure we check in on a property I already paid for.

- Getting in was the worst, codes to the door didn‚Äôt work. No phone number to actually call anyone, we had to message someone multiple times in the app and try multiple codes. We then had to wait for someone to come in person.
- The electronic deadbolt was very difficult to use, you had to hit it in the right spot to use it
- The deadbolt to the balcony door is off, you have to pull up hard on the door for the deadbolt to catch
- The gate to the parking lot worked sometimes
- They kept telling me they were emailing me but the emails never came through email or spam
- Bed is plywood, it‚Äôs so hard and uncomfortable, we barely slept
- Garbage trucks come at 3:45am right outside the room and are very loud, the windows are old and you hear everything, bring ear plugs
- Shower pressure in the primary bathroom is so strong it hurt, had to use other shower
- Code to the pool doesn‚Äôt work
- The room is definitely not what is pictured, quality of materials are very poor
- Our rental car got towed our last day
-This place was the worst airbnb I have ever rented

Ants galore in our apartment, from the moment we walked in; in the kitchen, living room, and dining room. They literally were there the entire time of our stay even when we didn't keep food or drinks out in the open. It was disgusting. There were two closet doors just off of the hinges when we walked in. The door to get into the apartment barely worked and we were stuck outside trying for sometimes up to ten minutes to get into the unit. The location and parking garage are the only two things keeping this listing going.

We had the absolute worst AirBnB experience at Sonder Austin. The one redeeming aspect was that the location was fabulous and walkable to many shops & restaurants. The unit itself was not as advertised, was poorly constructed, and had an active dirty leak from the ceiling for the first two days of our trip.

Upon arriving at the unit, we noticed two things:
1. The unit, which was listed as a two-king bed unit, only had one king-sized bed.
2. There was an active flowing leak from the hall bathroom ceiling, which continually splashed dirty water all over the tub.

I immediately contacted Sonder about both issues and was met with indifference, empty promises, and (not kidding here) gaslighting & lies from the customer service staff about both issues. I spent the first 30 hours of our trip consistently in contact with the Sonder team, asking when I could expect the leak to be fixed, and asking why we were placed in a unit that did not have the king beds that we paid for. The Sonder team tried to convince me that ‚Äúthe ceiling leaking into the tub is normal for Austin‚Äù, and ‚Äúthe second king bed is actually the pull-out sofa‚Äù (which was a double bed, outside of the obvious fact that a king bed listed does not mean a pull-out sofa anyway).

We were never given any expected time period to expect a maintenance person to inspect our unit, so I had to just keep checking back in with the team repeatedly. Even after someone finally showed up to fix the leak at the end of our second day (with no notice), the dirty water was never addressed from the leak, and we were simply never given an answer about the misrepresentation in the listing re: the beds.

I will never stay in a Sonder unit again in my life. The fact that this multi-million dollar corporation chose to gaslight and lie to its customers instead of just addressing two simple issues immediately is mind blowing. We paid a lot of money for the unit, and could‚Äôve gotten better service in a motel.

Having a third party company manage a BnB dissolves the purpose of the app and makes solving issues cumbersome, instead of the advertised assurance of ‚Äúbetter service, better experience‚Äù. As a superhost in our own city, we recommend finding an actual owner-host or just use a hotel.
Drab, noisy with beds that are best described a torture devices.  The directions for locating the apartment are incoherent.
worst experience I've had on AirBnB so far. The place did not matched the photos and the beds had stains and hair left behind.

We were lied to about COVID cleaning. No COVID cleaning was done. The housekeeper showed up at 3:45 to clean this large home. We were told at that time it was just to bring extra towels. Well, we could see beds being made and more work than just towels. We left the housekeeper alone and went to the lake to give her time to clean. We expected a clean home at the listed price. She left at 4:30. We walked into the home to find dirty floors, carpets, kitchen surfaces, and bathrooms. We found old chip bags in the drawers. My 5 year old son climbed out of the bathtub with a black hair on him. We found black hairs in the shower. We found dirty forks and knives in the utensil  drawer. I pressed as to why the house was dirty and finally pulled out of the Host at 7:00 that the housekeeper didn‚Äôt fully clean the home. I asked why and the Host said because we pressured her into leaving. A second lie. I‚Äôm not a neat freak. But in this COVID age I expected cleaning to be crucial. So, we cleaned the place with the Clorox wipes and cleaning products that we bought. No communication on this issue. We would have given the cleaning woman the time she needed if we had none. And we should have been told the house was not clean.

Una estancia normal sin m√°s! Buena ubicaci√≥n, gente en el lobby fue grosera, solo hay dos elevadores para los 20 pisos y c√≥mo te sacan a las 10:000 se hace un caos estuve 30 min esperando elevador por qu√© todos iban llenos

The unit presents well in pictures and was recently renovated.  It was clean and neat upon arrival.  The downside to the unit is that, even though everything looks nice, it is cheaply furnished and minimally equipped.  The mattresses seemed pretty new, but were uncomfortable (we double-stacked two for additional cushion) and covered with a vinyl sleeve that made us sweat on whatever side was in contact with the bed.  Kitchen supplies were very basic and not sufficient for much in the way of home cooking, especially beyond two people (we had 4).  There was no soap for the dishwasher, only a small travel size bottle of dish soap for handwashing, and no drying rack. The requirements and expectations of guests, while not all unreasonable, are quite extensive and much more than any other Airbnb I‚Äôve stayed in, so prospective guests should make sure they understand them fully.  Finally, I‚Äôm disappointed to report that interactions with the host were unexpectedly harsh after we checked out.  She took an aggressive approach to issues she had with our stay (the first ever for our family as guests), falsely accused me of being a liar regarding garbage duties, and tried to charge us $765 for damages and other frivolous items (minor, cleanable couch stains; excessive repair estimates with no basis; surprise charges for garbage; repair for an already broken table).  I volunteered to pay $75 for a little extra cleaning and trash pickup for accidentally putting out the wrong bins on garbage day.  The rest I felt was a money grab and had to write a detailed page and half to Airbnb in my defense.  Airbnb promptly decided in my favor and thanked me for ‚Äúmy kindness and being a great guest in the Airbnb community‚Äù.

This was my first and last experience with Airbnb. My stay could have been so much better if the host would‚Äôve taken responsibility for issues that occurred instead of blaming the guest and threatening to falsely charge guests frivolously if she gets offended by guests feedback.
Basically, she allowed me to book a property that was listed as newly renovated over a month prior to my 2 week visit to Austin for surgery. The day of arrival, I had an issue with the keyless lock. After waiting for hours, Shelli notified me that the neighbor had access to a key, to use that key and return it. She accused me of breaking the keypad that just went blank after trying to enter enter the code. She even suggested that we use the spare key in case there are keypad issues but the keypad should be fully charged but will reset. On my day of arrival, Shelli notified me of maintenance that the property needed that she had known about weeks before my arrival that couldn‚Äôt be completed. Shelli took offense to me stating that it would have been fair if I had been forewarned to allow me to find another place weeks ago instead of my finding out the day of arrival, the day before my major surgery. Also, if it was imperative for the work to be done, I should get some sort of discount for my inconvenience during my recovery. Shelli said that she would reschedule the work and then took the approach to continuing insisting that I take the night to find another place to stay. That was impossible since I had surgery at 6am the next morning. She even continued to message me about the lock and vacating the day of my surgery. I told Shelli that since I was in already in Austin and was recovering from surgery, the place was adorable, I will be staying. Things started to look up until a heavy rain on 5/28/21. It rained no more than 20 minutes before water started to enter the home from the garage. I contacted Shelli and she said she couldn‚Äôt call me but to send pictures. Shelli proceeded to blame me for booking the place and not allowing her to perform the maintenance on the garage. She decided to canceled the maintenance instead of proceeding with it to avoid giving me a discount. My guest and I were rudely asked to vacate the next day while I was still recovering from my surgery. We cleaned up the water and left the place how we found it and were out before the 10am check out time. I informed Shelli that we were gone and that I expected a refund for the 3 days that I had paid for. My guest and I had to finish our stay at a more expensive hotel. Shelli sent me a message hours later that the security cameras showed that the Lyft driver who picked me up accidentally ran over a strip of the grass and that is considered abuse of property. I have yet to receive my money back for the 3 days after I vacated the property.
Airbnb is stating that they haven‚Äôt received a response regarding my refund either.
This same property host has had the same type of poor review in which it turns into a money grab from different guests. It has to be the host. This is ridiculously bad business!

The place had no hot water at all, and the towels in the bathrooms had curls of hair on them. Pretty disgusting. I checked in at 2 AM in the morning...so when I messaged Fred, I didn't expect a response right away. Nonetheless, I think having hot water in an airbnb is an obvious thing to expect? Not to mention the hairs I saw on the towel after I attempted to take the cold shower. Furthermore, there was no soap, and no shampoo. I'm not sure if this was specified somewhere, but this was the first airbnb without them. I'm sure this kind of situation is rare, given that Fred has decent review. BUT...it still happened. Your whole visit is ruined knowing that you don't even have hot water. I wish Fred did something to make up for the experience...but he didn't.

I chose this place based on the reviews, which no longer seem valid. As soon as I walked in, I felt a bad vibe. The place was disgusting. Dead bugs, dust-covered lighting, mold infested shower that was coming apart from the wall, cracks in the ceiling, just a general feeling of grossness. I only ended up staying in this room for less than 30 minutes. Slept on the couch at a family member's house because of how unclean I felt being here. Even though the nightly price is not high, there is an extreme "cleaning fee" that is added on and given the state of this place, the fee is clearly not used for cleaning purposes. I ended up getting back a small portion of what I paid, and that was after long wait times with customer support. The host never responded. Avoid staying here if you value cleanliness and integrity.
Was a great little room. But the location and parking was not ideal.

My boyfriend and I stayed here for 7-8 days and I think it's a good space to occupy that amount of time in. We didn't spend too much time in the suite during the day, but it was always cool and refreshing coming in from the heat. And overall a steal for the price!

A bit disappointed. Malaika communicates well, but the room was a bit gross. There were cobwebs and spiders, the toilet is falling off the wall and tilts when you sit on it, and the room in general was just not clean at all. All of this wouldn‚Äôt be a deal breaker, except that when we went to get in bed, the sheets looked like they hadn‚Äôt been washed at all. (There was hair and dirt and what looked like dandruff) Everything else is livable, because I understand the price is a bargain, but the sheets are where I draw the line. We went and stayed at a hotel instead. It has potential, just a bit grossed out especially considering a $70 cleaning fee.

We checked in on Friday evening. When we pulled to your the house we were glad to see a garage. However, that excitement was short lived when we were informed we were not allowed to access it and this information is not provided in the listing. Additionally it is a four bedroom house but three rooms are available. The master bedroom is not one. The one bathroom needs work. The shower head is unstable and shoots water wildly. The towels are extremely hard and rough so bring your own. The decor and furnishings is quite outdated. There is an unidentifiable odor in the home as well. When we went to place our bags in the bedrooms we found a dead cockroach in the hall and a smaller one was seen on the side of the dresser.  There were a few crumbs on the counter and stove. There is food, condiments, and alcohol in the refrigerator and cabinets. There were other personal effects throughout the house. We stayed for two nights and paid a little over $600. It definitely was not worth it and we would not do it again, nor recommend it. The hammock was unavailable and the outdoor furniture was thrown about. There is a Directv receiver in the living room but no remote for the Directv. You can only watch tv via apps on the Vizio tv. The tv in the bedroom only shows snow no matter the channel or source you choose. Lake Travis is a nice little town and the location of the house is good but I do not recommend it.

Place was nice but it was dirty, hair in the shower and floors were not cleaned you expect a bit more with a 60$ cleaning fee, and still was expected to remove bedding before you check out. The air conditioner did not work very hot it was 92 degrees outside and almost 79 degrees inside. Personally would not recommend.

We were disappointed with our stay. I encourage any potential visitors to carefully look at the other reviews and to look at the location before assuming it is a cool Austin spot. We're not the picky types, but here were some of our discouraging experiences.

- The AirBnb was notably dirty. The rug had not been vacuumed, the shower curtain had a foot of mildew stains, the master bedroom had an odd smell, and the bed covers had dark splotches. We could tell the owner had cleaned before we arrived, but there was a lot that was left to be desired.
- The location is NOT good. The pictures may suggest that it is in a hip area or modern construction. It is a much older building behind a Jack in the Box and across the street from a cornerstore/bus station where people tend to loiter.
- We arrived at night and saw some of the windows in the complex were boarded up. It is a unit that has been carefully re-purposed to look like a cool downtown condo, but it is actually an older, downtrodden complex.
- We saw nothing crime related, but the crime statistics while we were there were high and people do tend to loiter or drink in the parking lot. If that is something that concerns you, look elsewhere.
- We believe that the air conditioning was programmed so that we could not make it cooler, despite warm weather. We ended up having difficulty sleeping due to the heat and left the windows open for much of our stay.
- A representative from the City knocked on the door to drop off a notice of violation regarding the water temperature. It did not impact us and may have been a building-wide issue, but a pretty funny representation of our stay.
- The owner did not send us the door code prior to arrival. (Thankfully, he was very responsive and responded to a call when we arrived.)

We have stayed in four Austin AirBnBs over the last year and are frequent visitors to the city. This is the first bad experience I've had, especially considering the oddly high price.

The place was nice looking, unfortunately, the place was not clean. The refrigerator and the floors were dirty. As soon as you walked in there is a weird smell. There were also small cockroaches. The hosts were quick in responding to my messages.

This is a fantastic until and super clean.  Comfortable.  Modern.  The second full bathroom is a huge plus, too, and the hosts are very attentive and on their game.  The complex is dated but this is reflected in the pricing and I would give 5 stars for the value.  There is, however, one major drawback and that is the lack of hot water.  A hot shower is a crap shoot and we missed out on three of four days during our stay.  If the hosts will install their own hot water heater instead of relying on the community "boiler system," they would have a 5-star rating every time.
Upon arrival we were a little hesitant about the location, but we had absolutely no issues during our stay. Location is convenient as it‚Äôs close to basically everything.

The bedrooms, bathrooms, dining room, and kitchen were all great and seemed to match the photos on the airbnb site. The living room furniture did not match the photo on the airbnb site... and the two couches had rips and stains (on both side of the cushions) on them... not pleasant to sit on. The living room stunk terribly of smoke which was odd considering how adamant the host was that we could not smoke in the unit. We didn't feel incredibly safe in the area. Two policemen were on the property chasing a man around the units on our first day in Austin.

A place not too far away from SOCO and the rest of downtown that‚Äôs fine to crash in at night. The bed was very hard and somethings like the WiFi information or extra toilet paper were not readily available in the room unlike other Airbnb‚Äôs I‚Äôve stayed in.

Cute place. A few things should be noted. There are chickens and you must walk through chicken poop with your luggage to get to the door of your rental.  The shower isn't the best. Finally there are mouse droppings on the  counters in the kitchen.
Pool was not as nice, kinda dirty. Not a lot of sun due to trees.
Asides the mistake in advertising it was ok
What you see is what you get. Nice place, 5 stars. Host responds when needed. We had no issues. Thanks Stephen

The place had no paper towels, so bring your own paper towels. Address on Airbnb was incorrect. Host did not provide checkin instructions until after the listed the checkin time. Kitchen was dirty even though there was a listed cleaning fee. Cleaning fee goes towards city taxes not actual cleaning so expect to clean yourself.

If you do not care about safety or location, you can stay here.

DO NOT BE FOOLED, as the internals look great, but as soon as you pull into the neighborhood, you can see you are in a bad part of town. Cars broken into and crashed on the street, run down buildings, etc. We definitely felt unsafe and contacted Air BnB immediately, but the seller refused to offer even a partial refund.

I booked this air bnb mainly because of the kitchenette which on pictures and in the description stated that we had access to a stove, unfortunately when we got there we were told that the stove didnt work because it failed code compliance. I explained this to the host and requested a partial refund and she goes and changes the description now it says ‚Äústove under repair‚Äù I‚Äôm really disappointed because it was a nice suite however they should have posted in the description that the stove didn‚Äôt work.

Also the bathroom is very small and it was a struggle to get through the bathroom door.

We didn‚Äôt end up staying here as we were kind of terrified by the area. This is NOT the East Domain. It‚Äôs in an area with a fairly high crime rate, and we passed some cars with broken windows and men hanging out outside late at night as we were on our way in. May be ok for some, but we had some nice stuff in our car and didn‚Äôt want to take the chance of it being stolen. Check Google Maps and Street View before booking to see if you‚Äôre ok with it!

I payed almost 350$ for 4 nights and I texted her the dates were wrong and I was trying to get if fixed. she said shed help me so I wouldn‚Äôt loose my money and then ghosted me the date of check in to this very day mind you I never went to the location never checked In nothing and she only gave me half of my money back when I explained it was the only money I had to my name . Don‚Äôt base judgement from pics cause we know in this life the internet is a hell of a place . In support of a 22 year old trying to get her feet on the ground and now only 100$ to her name because of this app pls don‚Äôt book here or support this scam they only wanted to give me 15$ back from the 300$ . One love guys I know the universe has my back

Just know you are going into an old apartment complex, and will be sleeping in the living room on a couch (shown in the picture).  There is no privacy and no warning when someone walks out or into the space.
Had a few hiccups with check-in but once I was there had no issues. Great location and I did not feel uncomfortable coming and going as needed.
No

The apartment was lovely, great lay out and had everything you needed.
Good facilities such as the gym.
My only negative part of the resort was the sales people at reception, didn‚Äôt know that it was a timeshare sort of place as the sales person kept pestering us every time we entered of left the building.
Upon many times saying no he still asked me on check out if I‚Äôd come back and do this apartment viewing.
No means no and it put a bitter taste to the end of our stay.
I probably wouldn‚Äôt come back unless the sales people weren‚Äôt there or left you alone.
Terrible experience would never book from this person ever

BUYERS BEWARE. Don‚Äôt book this Airbnb. Regardless of the past positive Reviews since that is what influenced my decision on this nightmare Airbnb. Unless you want to stay in a dirty unkempt home during the pandemic nonetheless, with dog hair and dirt all over the floor, spiderwebs above the beds, Dog urine smells where your head should rest on the bed, Un wiped tables with greasy fingerprints, dirty toilets, sinks and showers, a used pan with food in the oven, roach traps in the bedroom and even previous guests DIRTY socks in the ‚Äúcleaned‚Äù beds which is just completely horrid and unacceptable. And to be frank, those bed sheets were not washed they just remade the beds with the same used linens DURING COVID and I know the host will make excuses if she responds to this because she did the same when I messaged her,  but if you‚Äôve ever actually cleaned before you would know that there‚Äôs no way socks can be caught in between your linens once the bed is already made and plus those socks were as grimey as her floor. There‚Äôs no privacy in the kitchen and living room because there are no blinds whatsoever so forget turning the lights on at night unless you want to be completely seen from the outside. The closets that were ‚Äúopen‚Äù for guest use were filled with clutter up to my waist height so that was unusable as well if you‚Äôre planning a longer stay here. I felt like they were playing a joke on me I‚Äôve never stayed in such a disorganized Airbnb. They also mentioned the garage was usable but no remote was ever found as noted in the check in procedure and the garage door was locked from the inside. This was a nightmare from the start to finish and hopefully the host takes this constructive criticism since she took all night to even message me back even though I noted in the booking process I would be checking in between 10pm-12am and she couldn‚Äôt even apologize for her dirty home just made poor excuses and offered to send her cleaner out at 8am when I was already going to be checking out in 3 hours. What a joke, talk about no accountability. My family was subjected to this disgusting home after two days of traveling and if I can persuade you to look for a different listing for your healths sake that‚Äôs all I need. I would have never let anyone experience what I did. She will blame her cleaner as she did with me but the house should be her responsibility as a whole when she is hosting for other people. She really dropped the ball and I‚Äôm sure she‚Äôs done it before and will do it again to other unsuspecting guests. I don‚Äôt know why they‚Äôre on Airbnb if they can‚Äôt keep up with the bare minimum in the Airbnb rules such as cleanliness. Don‚Äôt book here. Period.

Lots of issues with maintenance and cleanliness of this property. There are actually 3 airbnbs on the property, plus the owner‚Äôs residence. Loud partiers in one of the other airbnbs woke us up at 2am. One of the hvac units was broken so we had to keep all of the interior doors open in the airbnb in order for the temperature to be maintained. The toilet did not flush on its own - we had to take the top of the toilet tank off and manually activate the float every time we wanted to flush. Despite a ridiculously high $200 cleaning fee, some parts of the kitchen were super dirty. The shower caulking was failing and there were screws sticking out of the living room floor. There was a huge palmetto bug roach in the bedroom.

The owner said she would drop by to look at the hvac and toilet but never showed.
Overall the location and place were great, but poor communication. Glitches between Airbnb and Sonders caused confusion that was eventually resolved but disappointing.

It‚Äôs corporate housing through and through. Happy we had laundry available in our unit, but disappointed that the whole experience felt so impersonal.

The biggest issue was our checkin experience. We arrived after the main lobby of the apartment complex had closed and no one was onsite. The keypad we were instructed to use to access the building was broken, literally missing keys. We tried to reach anyone to assist with getting us in, but didn‚Äôt get a response until much later. (I don‚Äôt believe a phone number was ever provided.) In the meantime, we had to short the contacts of the missing keys with a bobby pin to get in.

So the place is fine once you make it in, but hedge your expectations and don‚Äôt look for personal touches.

Worst exp ever! Horrible check in experience, got locked in garage, host never replies ans when they did they sent me inappropriate memes?? Wasn‚Äôt clean, took me 3 minutes to walk to my unit from parking garage.. was such a maze. Had to check out and eat 5 days as I was too ill to make it to food deliveryto walk 3 mins each way...

I gave Sonder a 2/5 only because their customer service was accommodating and able to switch us to another unit that they owned.

Otherwise, I would say that Sonder was a pretty bad experience. The worst Airbnb experience I‚Äôve had and I‚Äôve stayed in a lot of Airbnbs.

While the photos of the place are technically accurate, they have very-carefully photographed only the best-looking parts of the apartment and, for example, not shown photos of rusted metal in the bathroom.

I think this is a company that buys cheap apartments in shady buildings, puts up a cool wallpaper, and then calls it a day. Basically, lipstick on a pig.

The first unit we stayed in was rundown, and the car next to ours in the building‚Äôs parking lot was broken into. The second unit that they moved us to was better, but the hallway had dog feces in it.

Definitely not worth the premium price they charge for their premium wallpaper.

A
Check in was easy, pictures are a little deceiving since the actual place has horrible lighting, no natural lighting. There is no light bulb in living room either just in kitchen. Stay was okay.

Premium location, older home. The window units did not adequately cool the unit which made it uncomfortable for our summer stay. The second night of heat I reached out and the host promptly responded in the morning. Unfortunately I was ready to check out by the time we came to a solution.

Photos were deceptive. Carpet in living area was worn out.
Bannister on stars heading up to apartment was detached and rotting.
Water was leading from shower head.
Windows were filthy unlike the photos.
The small space heaters did not adequately heat the apartment.
The space has personal touch in the decor. However, it is not adequate for 5 people. The powder bathroom on the first floor is difficult to use. Not many eateries within walking distance.

If you‚Äôre looking for just a place to sleep a lot of people & be close to the university, this place is it. Other than that, the apartment was dirty upon arrival, dishes still in dishwasher, hair in the shower and dust everywhere. Many of the features in the apartment were broken & not fixed properly so we were constantly putting the place back together. The garage clicker that we were given also did not work. There were not many amenities to this apartment so it was simply just to sleep. Would not stay again.

I wouldn't trust the listings Renters Club posts. They had waited until after confirming our reservation and after we had checked in to tell us that the gas bill was not paid and that we won't be able to use their gas-burning kitchen appliances nor will we have warm water - basic amenities for living. They suggested, a day into our stay, that our 10-person group find a new Airbnb to stay in or stick it out. I feel scammed out of my money. Try to reserve with other renters to avoid getting affected by them cutting corners to make money.

Space itself was large and lovely. Unfortunately, was not very clean. Floor had pieces a garbage lying around and the bathroom sink and counter was messy and had what appeared to be leftover beard trimmings lying around.

If you have a problem with these guys, your crazy and should probably go stay in a low budget motel 6!! Lisa and David‚Äôs place was everything we needed and more !! I travel all over the state of Texas and there place is top notch !

The house was nice, clean and spacious. Host was quick to reply to any questions we had. Access to the river was within walking distance for adults but not recommended for younger kids due to the steep route. We did not have access to the community boat ramp which was unfortunate but we were able to launch at a public boat ramp about 25minutes away.

My family and had no where to stay when we got to Austin. Airbnb & Terry left us when no bed. Terry never responded. His number doesn‚Äôt even work. It‚Äôs the fault of Airbnb for not checking their host. I have to upload a selfie to reserve a spot but you don‚Äôt update phone numbers for strangers that rent their houses out?!? They gave me a refund that I‚Äôm still waiting on. Didn‚Äôt help me during my trip. Had to find a last minute hotel at 9pm. At the time Airbnb said they would refund that but didn‚Äôt. Worst service.

There was a bit of a hiccup with the entry code not working initially, so it would probably be sensible to double check details ahead of arrival if you are coming in late as I was. Besides that though, the place was funky and fun, with possibly the only points of concern that I had being the lack of a high based table - it's a bit tricky to eat off the coffee table! Great neighbourhood but unfortunately I wasn't able to explore due to COVID concerns.

Thanks Cori for a great stay! We stayed 2 weeks to explore Austin while working remote.
(+) wifi was great
(+) Loved the location and nearby restaurants
(-) kitchen was fine, but not ideal for a longer term stay - a tad dirty and no kitchen table
A lot of little thing got annoying like no garbage in a bathroom, broken sink handle, not enough seating in the living room - what's chairs are their are uncomfortable.

Overall, a good location and experience. Place is as described. We really liked the security of the gated parking lot.

The amenities are a little basic, but we spent little time in the Airbnb with the exception of showering, restroom, and sleep.

Our only complaints are the paper-thin walls, fruit flies, and WiFi.

The WiFi speed is terrible. Probably not the best place if you need a reliable connection.

We could easily hear the people above us engaging in adult activities at 2-3am. Come prepared with an app on your phone for white noise or a good set of earplugs to drown out the neighbors or risk several nights of interrupted sleep. 6th street also gets very loud early in the morning if you are trying to sleep in.

The kitchen had a lot of small gnats/fruit flies flying around. Not sure if this was specific to our Airbnb or if this is commonplace for Texas.
It is NOT Elite. Misleading. Clogged bath tub. Flying from 1500 miles away very disappointing.

Stayed here one night during the holiday season, to see family with my mom. Collectively we may have gotten 4h of sleep total due to the toddler screaming every 30mins;1 followed by the adults screaming well into the night. It was a very uncomfortable room, with an uncomfortable mattress and lack of airflow. The bathroom was adequate at best and the hospitality was non-existent. I do not know if it was bad timing or just bad communication, but we will not be staying again.

My colleague and I stayed for SXSW 2022, and the place could not be more perfect. Everything in the apartment is brand new and high quality. The kitchen is fully equipped and furnished. The location is quiet and less than 10mns bike ride from downtown. Looking forward to next year!
Nice little place not the best location for walking

Do not expect the pictures to be accurate, the place looked like it had been deserted for a few years and the pool was completely green. They canceled 10 minutes before our arrival after driving 4 hours to our location. We were given a BS story about a fire being in the AC unit, the fire may have been several years ago, like I said it looked deserted.
Do not expect the host to answer your call, our called went direct to a voicemail and never received a call back to date. Very unprofessional.

Awesome space. Close to everything. Very clean and modern.

I'm always worried about how quiet the stay will be and there were no noise issues. The bed is also a huge concern for me since I've had a bad experience with a spot on airbnb before but this bed was great!

The only downsides would have to be the parking area is really tight and limited. There were also no TVs in the upstairs bedrooms but we had a laptop anyways.

I'd definitely stay here again though!
Kristin was an incredible host and would respond immediately to any questions. The location couldn't have been better, walking distance to anything you could possible want.

Don't go!! I traveled with my carpenter and an senior Client. I was looking forward to a great stay but instead a didn't get anything. First the email 24hrs prior never arrived it took several messages during the trip down there (from Sheboygan Wisconsin to Austin Texas) to get the code for entering the apartment 5hrs prior to arrival. Then finally there at 17:05, as the description when i booked was looking amazing the neighborhood was not really inviting as described, as it was getting dark some junkies came asking for money, that was clearly not what i was looking for. After 3 very slow turns around the building searching for the room - an apartment complex of about 200 rooms, by now 17:49 i contacted the owner, but didn't get an immediate reaction, i decided to knock on someones door to show me the way after a minute i finally found it. With the given code i tried to open it 3 times a dog started barking people started looking at me as if i was a burglar. I contacted the owner as it was officiously the wrong address, send pictures with it, and my group didn't feel safe and was tired by 17:54 i told the owner i was going to a hotel (Best Western). At 18:00pm the owner responded to me saying he was to check out what went wrong, as i found the hotel within just 3 min, i checked in, paid and on the way to my room i got an answer at 18:08 - " I found out the problem. If you‚Äôre still there, the unit 151 is the one you can check in. Our automatic system sent the wrong email to the guest that was supposed to stay at 151" problem solved and we could go back, i just entered my room to crush down on the bed. To tired to go back we stayed in the hotel! Then all communication with the owner stopped. No response anymore. At 18:13 i responded with another $220 for the room. No reaction. At 20:57 i responded "My client doesn‚Äôt want to go back to the place it look better on the pictures, there where several junkies in front of the parking, my client is not used to be in a lesser neighborhood, I cancel the further stay
at that place. A barking dog next door is not what I‚Äôm looking at after a 20 hour day. That we had to search for it so long and then still not getting in was to much for the day. We will stay elsewhere till Monday." Again no response. Next day i send another mail at 06:49am "I know the rules but it would be respectful if I would be paid back my money for a place I never got in the first place. Everything what had to go wrong went wrong and after 20 hours of traveling I just expected a good rest and that wasn‚Äôt there. As this is a business trip with my client the trust in my company got a big dent. No matter how good we are in our work this ruined the trip. For future projects I lost the trust that we can handle any job as we can not even book a good place to stay. It started on the wrong foot and will hurt my business in future deals in this area." No response again and officiously a dum question to ask for money back. Till today 12/17/2019 back in Wisconsin no response of the owner about the place or about recuperating my money. $472 for nothing including $220 for a hotel. Another $381 for air mattresses sleeping bags and towels to stay with friends in the neighborhood and the worst first impression to a huge client for my company. Others might had more luck to stay with Ames - the owner, i certainly had the worst experience and the most expensive for getting literally nothing!

Even though the unit is a little older, it was clean, comfortable, and close to a lot of things. The on;y negative put of the whole trip was the road construction all over town that made getting around difficult.
Had a strange smell.

I would not recommend staying here. The check in instructions were not easy to find, the place had not been properly cleaned (even though the host told me I would have to check in late because it was being cleaned), and it seems the host has  management company acting as the middle man who is not responsive. This is not my first Airbnb experience and I am generally a pretty relaxed person but the place was so bad that I could not stay here.

We got stranded in west Texas during a highly unusual snowstorm, with the National Weather Service recommending NO TRAVEL. We communicated with the host asking to move the dates of our reservation so he can keep the money and open the listing for other guests, he said NO, he said NO to cancelation, he was closed to any options. If you have a normal life with family and normal issues I DO NOT recommend making a reservation with this host he is completely intransigent with his costumers.

Non-functional Internet/WiFi, plumbing and electrical issues, with no resolution during our stay. Plumbing issue appears to be known as non-draining tub/shower is missing drain cover as an attempt to correct. In the end, this was merely a clean bed to sleep in as we couldn‚Äôt play the board games we brought without dining room lighting, couldn‚Äôt watch movies or the NYE ball drop without Internet/TV, and couldn‚Äôt get out the door in a timely manner the following day as 5/6 guests were forced to use one shower when we discovered the Master shower to be non-draining, so morning #2 plans ruined, as well.

This was simply a clean bed to sleep in as the main features we needed ‚Äî Internet/TV, lighting, and plumbing ‚Äî weren‚Äôt what we expected. If we‚Äôd known it was that ‚Äî just a clean bed ‚Äî my attitude might‚Äôve been better, but we needed Internet/TV, lighting, and two fully-functional bathrooms for our plans, and for the number of reserved guests, and I communicated this both on the phone and though app messages.

Hosts had no resolution for problems outside of saying they would message other guests in an entirely different unit to reset router, though Nest thermostat indicated the Internet had been off for four days at that point. Female host indicated she‚Äôd never been in the unit when attempting to help us correct internet and electrical issues by phone, so outside of telling us to stream movies on our phones, or via our phone hotspots, there was no solution they‚Äôd offer. (We tapped out data on two phones attempting to watch one movie before giving up.) Messages about plumbing problem never addressed, neither during stay, nor after. No follow-up communication, no actual attempt at resolution or repair during stay or after. Frustrating and disappointing, to say the least.

I am disgusted by this host's behavior and lack of empathy during a natural disaster in Texas.

I reserved 3 nights in this accommodation starting on Friday 12 February through Monday 15 February. Once the extreme arctic freeze hit Texas, the roads became non drive-able and covered in ice so, in the interest of personal and public safety, we made the decision to cancel our reservation. Public authorities were asking Texans to stay home and off the roads and the Governor of Texas issued a disaster declaration that same day so we cancelled due to the natural disaster that was occurring.

We had already paid for the booking in full several weeks before so we reached out to the host and asked, given the circumstances, if we could change the dates and not lose our money. They said no. I politely asked them to reconsider given the disaster that was occurring in Texas and they abruptly said no again. I then had to escalate the issue to Airbnb just to get my pet cleaning fee returned. Airbnb asked this host to consider refunding our payment due to the natural disaster extenuating circumstances clause in airbnb's cancellation policy, and they still said no. This is unacceptable.

Where you spend your money matters. There are many airbnb hosts who showed up for their community during this natural disaster, this host did not. This host capitalized financially on the disaster and left us no other option but to lose our full payment. I would not recommend staying here or supporting a host with such little empathy.
Although short, had nothing but a great stay here!

While the unit is priced at a value and in a good location, we were disappointed with our stay. Each bedroom is connected to it's own bathroom, which is great, but one of the bathrooms had a very disturbing and overwhelming stench, and the floor in that bathroom had visible water damage. I think there was probably water leaking in that bathroom during or after a previous stay, and I suspect ongoing plumbing issues in the building (also based off earlier reviews). The smell was so bad that neither of us could stand to use that bathroom or it's adjoining closet and kept it completely shut - so we had to share the one bathroom (the bath in the other bathroom also smelled a bit, but not so significantly). I did notify the host and they apologized for the inconvenience.
