On a smaller note, the listing says: "There is also a combo washer/dryer in the apartment!" - this is false. There is a coin operated laundry room outside of the unit in a shared space. Just want to make sure folks are aware.

Location was great but apartment was not as expected. Apartment smelled like cigarettes. The bed sheets all had yellow stains in them.  Once u open the door besides the cigarette smell, you also have the smell of dog poop right in front of your door. Neighbors do not clean up after dogs and pool area was horrible as well no one could go swim when their is dogs in their.  I don‚Äôt think will ever use Airbnb again.  Place is to run down.

This property was not what we expected. Proximity is the only decent thing. The beds were comfortable. The kitchen is crap. The stove burner is leaning so we had to cook our food leaning. All the chairs were falling apart dining area. The house had a weird smell. There is no dresser to put your clothes in.

This unit was exactly what we were looking for on our weekend getaway to Austin.  Beds were comfortable, host sent lots of detailed information and instructions beforehand and even messaged to check on us throughout our stay.  There were the exact amount of towels (4) and wash cloths for guest showers, host also provided extra toilet paper, trash bags, dish washer pods, dish soap and laundry pods for guest use.  There's a set of sheets for the pull out couch, but no extra blanket to bundle up on the couch (which was no biggie for us)
It‚Äôs nasty
There‚Äôs a Covid 19 exception air b&b and hosts are supposed to stand by currently-based on actual policy- if the guest has Covid 19, hosts refused to comply, and am disputing this amount paid.

Had this set up for 2 days but took my family out after the first day, it started when my wife noticed sheets where stained after that the mattress is stained with urine, carpet very bad shape toilet I'm 1 of the restroom is falling apart from the bottom. Is says to be quiet after 10 pm but it's very noisy with dogs outside, and also it's right beside a dog park they have so it stinks really bad. sofas are dirty everything needs to upgrades. the only part I can say that it was ok was the kitchen but we never used.

Do not stay here. The place was a good location, but nothing was clean except for the bedsheets. The stove was off balance and was difficult to cook on. The drawers, counters, shelves baseboards, a/c all had visible dust, hair and grime.  The couch & carpet had visible stains and chunks of the flooring were missing throughout the apartment.  The cabinets and drawers did not close properly either throughout the place. The toilet in the 2nd bedroom was not screwed down to the floor and emitted a consistent foul odor. The wifi consistently did not work and the place was in overall disrepair. The dog park was just outside the front entry and other residents were consistently smoking and routinely left dog excrement right outside the entry. This was a very disappointing stay, and not as advertised at all. In any other circumstance I would have requested/expected a full refund

I want to start this review by saying despite all the issues that came up, the hosts were very accommodating, responsive, and understanding.

After arriving, we quickly realized the photos were strategically taken to avoid the rundown state of the airbnb. There were minor inconveniences to start and we became more uncomfortable the longer we stayed and found more and more issues. The windows in the bedroom didn‚Äôt fully close, so we could hear the noises outside. The carpet was not clean and the couch smelled. The shower head in one of the bathrooms was broken so After the first night, those of us who ‚Äúslept‚Äù on the king bed ended up sleeping on the ground after 2 hours on the bed. Their backs were hurting because the bed frame was actually broken and the mattress was lumpy.

Despite our uncomfortable stay, the hosts made arrangements to get the handyman to come fix the broken bed frame and shower head. However, the last straw was the cockroaches that we found in the bathroom the night before he was supposed to come. When we checked the reviews again, we saw that roaches have been a problem in the last month, so it was unfortunate that this had not been resolved before our stay. We decided to cut our trip short and thankfully, the hosts were extremely understanding.

This place just needs a deep clean and some detailing and maintenance for each room. We hope that these issues will be addressed for the next guests so that no one would have to experience what we did.

Pros:
- location: ~15 min away from the city
- price
- amenities: kitchen and washer/dryer onsite, and toiletries all included
- Cleanliness: depsite the age of the apartment everything was as clean as it could be

Cons:
- Immediate area: area isn't great and the neighborhood dog run outside the front door is always stanky. doesn't get in the house though üëç
- Apartment age: Everything (appliances, floors, carpets) are rundown/cracked/stained etc

Overall a decent place to stay if you're just tryna get out and see the city
House is not like accurately described or shown in pictures. The host is accommodating and communicates, but just not worth stay here.

Unfortunately my experience at this air bnb was not as hoped or expected. While the location is great,  the apartment itself is not. The king size bed was wet with brownish stains all the way down to the mattress protector so it was not sleep-able. There were roaches (the small infestation ones) in the bathroom sink and the showers had little to no water pressure. I had to call customer service to assist in finding me a new place to stay as this one was not habitable. The pictures are deceptive, the apartment is extremely old and falling apart. The bedrooms also face an extremely busy street and we heard traffic all night.

Our stay was just okay, there was a constant smokey smell, cigarettes and weed, not a big deal if you're in a Vegas hotel, but we were traveling with children, so not pleasant for us. Owner reached back and offered air freshener, but we could already smell the air freshener that was there just mixed with smoke. Also got some burnt toast smells, probably neighbors. I Saw a couple of small roaches crawling around, but there was a can raid in the bathroom.

Good location, but somehow we missed in the description that there's a dog park steps from the front the door, we thought there was supposed to be a pool there, but important to note, the pool is actually in the adjacent building.

There was a strong cigarette smoke odor when we checked in. In the morning, after waking up and realizing the smell was permanent & seeing a large cockroach on the wall, I contacted the host about both issues. They offered an air freshener and baking soda, which didn‚Äôt arrive until the next day. They also sent someone to repair the door to prevent more pests. I asked if they had other units available, and they only had 1 pricier unit. In hindsight, this is when I should‚Äôve contacted air bnb directly. They sent pest control but didn‚Äôt clarify when/if they would, so my brother turned them away when he was checking in  (I hadn‚Äôt disclosed the roach situation to him out of embarrassment). There were rains one night and we woke up to the bathroom sink flooded and toiletries soaked. There were 2 leaks in the ceiling.  Other issues - dirty silverware, crumbs, chunks of pet hair, and early power tool noise upstairs from renovations (same owners so they knew but didn‚Äôt mention it prior).

The wifi is in & out and the beds are not comfortable, but for 2 nights I got what I paid for. Expectations weren‚Äôt high but still a rough place. The lights do flicker so anyone with light sensitivity should be cautious. There were a lot of emails to keep track of- pushing to pay for upgrades and tasks to do before ‚Äúcheck out‚Äù.
If you just need a cheap place to drop your bags, it‚Äôs good. But I wouldn‚Äôt suggest it for a vacation or hang out spot.

We stayed here for about a week.
Pros:
1. It is in a good and safe neighborhood
2. It is quite big, has separate space for wfh.
3. There is a full-size kitchen for you to use.
4. Plenty of space for parking on the property or on the street.

5. The hosts are quite responsive and also allowed us an early checkin.

Cons:
1. Cleanliness is not taken care off.
Eg: The refrigerator had a rotten banana in the freezer, we encountered a few roaches, the house has that old furniture smell to it‚Ä¶ because of lack of sun/ use

2. There is no microwave but two dishwashers

3. The dryer doesn‚Äôt work very well. we had to use the Austin summer sun for drying our clothes‚Ä¶ there was also no laundry detergent which is usually not the case.

4. The owners had their own stuff in the property which limits your use of space. ex: clothes in the closet.

5. The handwash in the bathrooms were diluted with water‚Ä¶no idea why..?

overall, not bad‚Ä¶ but could be better.

it will work just fine for a short stay, but not ideal for longer stays or staycation.

Apartment full of roaches and absolutely miserable communication from Sonder. Twice we packed everything to move to a different apartment and twice they stopped responding (had to unpack and spend another night!). Then the new unit wouldn‚Äôt open and our existing one locked us out at 11 am sharp.
We got the cleaning fee reimbursed ($80 off a $2500 bill), thanks I guess. Unacceptable in every regard.

(Not to mention the code to enter the building never worked and we had to ask ppl to let us in every time we came back to the apartment)
Apartment was nice and had everything we needed. Only negative is you have to park 2 blocks away and walk with tons of homeless people around
Sonder double booked me and cancelled my reservation the morning I was meant to arrive. Ridiculous.
Very disappointing communication with multiple agents - no real help. Pactage lost and no help from Sonder.

I spent 10 days here -- both work and fun.
Locations is awesome. You don't even need a car.
The unit was great. Spacious and clean. I moved the tv into the bedroom to watch tv in bed. The could was extremely uncomfortable and not clean.

Once settled it was very comfortable -- it was very difficult however to checkin, starting with needing to download an app 24-hrs prior to arrival, requiring me to take several photos of my face with their app (which is too far into a violation of my privacy). They say it's for security purposes, but we all know companies who do this are full of s*** and there's more too it. If I had known this was required before it was too late to cancel I would have -- but that's me. But I am in tech and versed in how privacy/data collection... It's just not necessary in this case.

Also, the instructions getting to the unit (it's a large building) were not clear. At that point, I absolutely hated my decision and Sonder... Once in though, as I mentioned above, there were many positive aspects and was happy with my stay, despite still feeling slightly violated now that they have photos of my face sitting on their servers for no good reason -- after all this is why we have an Airbnb profile with good ratings!
Nice place but communication is bad and have to use the Sonder app.
reserving the airbnb was a pain and felt invasive. I've never been asked to submit personal information like that before

Sonder Review
NOTHING is mentioned about having to enter the property from an entirely different street.
NOTHING is mentioned about having to pay $35 per day for parking
NOTHING is mentioned about the fact that a room numbered 1453 is actually on the 4th floor. Hmmm I would think it would be the 1st or 14th floor
No tv - had to download Chromecast on a free trial basis (which means I have to remember to cancel it). Then you are limited to certain steaming options. No local channels or news. After downloading and setting up everything, I find that we still don‚Äôt have anything to watch.
We are furious and asked to check out a day early with a full refund of our second night so we can go elsewhere. Of course, that was denied as well.
Horrible instructions. Wifi password info was incorrect and not explained. I had to figure it out on my own. Needless to say I WILL NEVER stay at a Sonder property again!!!!!!

The only trouble I had was finding the entrance to the building.  Part of that was my fault for arriving in the middle of the night.  Even at that, however, I called and his staff answered immediately and stayed on the line until I found my destination.  Everything was great and the staff was extremely accommodating!

This location could not be better. There are a bunch of restaurants, bars, and shops within walking distance as well as many others within a 5-minute Uber ride. The apartment is super clean and check-in instructions were simple and easy. They were also very responsive when I had a question about check-in.

It is smaller than I anticipated - a studio but with no sitting area. Instead, there's a queen-size bed with a 4-top dining room table. Full-size kitchen though and a washer/dryer in the unit (with detergent) as well as a large closet.

The only complaint is the neighbor above us was extremely noisy. I don't believe that's Sonder's fault - they appear to rent out the entire 4th floor of this complex and I imagine it's full-time residents of the apartment complex that live above us. Regardless, you could hear every single stomping footstep. Which was all day/every day and happened late into the evening (past midnight) and early morning (7am). Including what I believe to be them running their vacuum for 30 minutes at 6am on a Friday morning. I've lived in this area before and know that these types of apartments are not the most sound-proof, but I wasn't expecting it to be this bad. That could be largely based on what tenant lives above you (which could vary depending on which unit you stay in). It might be worth the risk, depending on how heavy of a sleeper you are, but we likely wouldn't stay here again because of that.
A little bit difficult to find where to go in but Sonder apartments are my favourite to stay in when travelling as it always has everything you need
It was a nice place but someone came into our space while we were away to fix a cabinet handle - without any notice and left us a note. Just found this a bit uncomfortable.

As described, the room is located in walking distance to many great restaurants and bars. It's not far from the river either. A few things however that had I known, I would have stayed elsewhere: the "free parking" is not available on site as listed. AFTER booking, I was told the garage on site is $25/day or street parking on site is pay by the hour 8 am to midnight. The free parking is first come first serve, at minimum 2-3 blocks away, but likely 8-12 blocks away which is a long walk in the summer heat. I understand it's not uncommon to pay for parking in a city, but felt this was false advertising. Bigger issue though, there's a block wide construction project going on immediately behind the building and they would start work every day at 6:30 am, jackhammering, trucks going, you name it, and not finish til 6:30/7 pm. Saturday morning they started 7 am. Even with ear plugs it was very loud.

This space was super clean and tidy which was what we ultimately cared about while traveling during COVID! As an FYI, the photos of the Airbnb we booked was NOT the actual apartment we got but it was stylish and clean so it didn‚Äôt really matter to us. The only bummer was that there was no balcony like the photo showed. Also, beware that this company has extensive rules and fees! For instance, the $400 security deposit was threatened because of noise levels one night (we were literally watching a movie) and then on the check out email they said we would be charged $100 dollars for each rubber pool bracelet that wasn‚Äôt there. Just seems excessive.

Our stay was amazing.
The place was great!
Small restaurants below were a plus.
Target and Whole Foods were walking distance.
Only downfall, no free parking.
But YOU are in DOWNTOWN AUSTIN. You must pay parking everywhere.
Will definitely stay with Sonder again in the future.

Everything was just okay.

The communication was very difficult response times were awful
And often times I had to call even though I was told someone should respond in under 24 hours.

Unfortunately the apartment wasn‚Äôt cleaned before we arrived, which was rather unpleasant especially as I was with my wife and 3 children. The building site opposite is very noisy from 7am to 7pm 6 days per week so we couldn‚Äôt use the Juliet balcony or open any of the windows due to the noise. Parking is tricky if you have a hire car as the car park is small. Washing machine and drier were of good quality.

Tolle Unterkunft !
Super nette Gastgeber, mit einem s√º√üen Hund !
Gute Tipps f√ºr die Umgebung!
Sauber, gepflegt tolle Ausstattung!
Und gut zentral gelegen!

Alles in allem eine Empfehlung wert !!!

Whilst the location is great and the space for 10 in the house is convenient, a few items in this accommodation were really disappointing. The pool was extremely dirty, kids couldn‚Äôt go in, lights outside were broken making it unsafe and some furniture was really in bad shape (all table chairs were almost falling apart). In combination with the extremely high price for this place, the value you get for what you pay is really poor.

Good location. But we were shocked that this home has such good reviews. When we arrived which was later in the evening sheets were clearly soiled with body fluids. We sent photos to Anna who quickly defended her cleaning staff and offered to bring clean sheets the next day we would not sleep I. Those sheets so we found new sheets to change ourselves the dishwasher was broken dirty pool with dirt and papers not just leaves. Broken and extremely dirty bbq the deck around the pool had warped boards that if you step on o e side the other side would pop up  In the shower we‚Äôre old bars of soap and about 9 small various soaps from previous guests  we asked for a partial refund only to be told we broke the dishwasher and would be billed for it and we were dishonest  people and next time we should get a hotel. We have owned several vacation rentals and stayed I. Several as well. Have never had this experience or been treated this way. Will not return

BEWARE!!! I'm not one to write a bad review, but this one is a must. *clears throat* If you have any type of living standard, this is not the place for you to reside.

I was locked into this hell hole for 30 days because for this reservation, it's NON-refundable once you book it. At least that was the requirement when I booked this Unit.

The issues I had with this place are, INSIDE the Unit - everything in it looked as if it came from a thrift store, and nothing matched. There isn‚Äôt much natural lighting in the main living area as there is only 1 window for the entire area, minus the bedrooms. The bedrooms only have 1 window each. Also, there were numerous spiderwebs throughout the house as though the house isn‚Äôt cleaned routinely. I had to change the air filter for the A/C and upon removing it, it was absolutely filthy, filthy, so filthy! The beds and bedding are very mediocre, and the floors were very gritty.

The house just doesn‚Äôt have a clean feeling, and it appears as if the owner never comes to it, and here is why.

OUTSIDE the Unit ‚Äì The grounds around the Unit aren‚Äôt kept, and there are several funky garbage cans near the walkway into the Unit. Also, near the property, there are hundreds of garbage cans that sit on the street for days/weeks; its obvious there isn‚Äôt an HOA. There are multiple Wasp and Yellow Jacket nests all over the property and near the Unit. The outside walls are covered with webs, leaves, and dead bugs. Noting, this is a duplex, and there is a tenant in Unit A, and Unit C. Unit C is actually the garage that‚Äôs been remade, and yes, a family lives there. The Airbnb is Unit B. There is a backyard connected to Unit B, but it‚Äôs not maintained, there isn‚Äôt any seating, and there is a non-functioning BBQ grill that sits near the back door.

I'll end on this note, just because a person/owner/host is able to have an AirBnB doesn't mean they should, if they aren't going to reinvest back into the property.

Again, BEWARE.
Worst experience ever.

Booked a vacation here due to the pool shown in 10% of photos and listed as an amenity. Pool was drained and under construction but host never informed us so we could make other plans. House is very small with no amenities. Listed as 2 beds + pullout couch. No blankets for the pullout so we had to buy some. Washer/Dryer combo doesn't dry clothes. Sent through 3 cycles and then had to go to the coin operated machines without change machine. Uses a Nest thermostat to force the space temperatures to 78* multiple times a day and it takes hours to pull down to a comfortable level. Worst Air BnB experience of mine so far.

The communication was excellent, we had no troubles finding the place and getting in. Everything was clean and it had everything we needed. The location is ok, 15min drive to downtown. The only bad thing I can say is that the room is in front of a space designated for pets so the smell was horrible, it didn‚Äôt smell inside though but every time we go out or enter was not pleasant.

We went to Austin because of niece and goddaughter's wedding at the Austin Line on Sat, 9/3/22. We booked this place because of the slightly cheaper rate and the pictures looked good. But please read my comments below:
PROS:
1) Slightly cheaper rate than most.
2) Had clean linens to use.
CONS:
1) There was an unpleasant odor, a musty, old, damp furniture smell, when we opened the door and walked into the unit.
2) When we went to the bedroom with the queen-sized bed, I headed to the bathroom only to be greeted by 3 flies, one was a huge horsefly. I had to lock the bathroom door and I used a magazine to swat the flies. There was no fly swatter to use. I understand Texas is a desert, but it felt dirty/unhealthy to have flies inside the bathroom when you just walked into the unit.
3) The next morning, we found a dead cockroach inside the unit, behind the front entrance door.
4) Also, the same morning, after I got rid of the dead cockroach with a plastic bag, I went to wash my hands in the kitchen, I saw a live cockroach! It scared me. It scurried away. This was our 2nd day out of 6 days. We all couldn‚Äôt wait for our stay in this place to end.
5) The unkept Dog Playground was literally next to the unit entrance door. There were dog feces all over that playground even close to the fence approx. 4 feet away from the entrance door of the rental unit. It was disgusting.
5) Dogs barked at night and in the morning from the unit either next to us or above us.
6) The toilet seat in each bathroom was loose and slid to the sides. It was unsafe to do your business.
7) The plates and bowls available for use in the kitchen were old, scratched up and made of cheap plastic. They are overdue for replacements.
8) There were only 3 hangers in the entire unit. We were attending a wedding on Sat. and I had to iron or press shirts and skirts and had to drape the pressed clothes on the chairs in the kitchen/eat-in area.
9) There was no Wine cork screw opener. I bought wine bottles and had to go to the wine store again. Thank goodness they were giving away free ones which I left at the drawer in the kitchen.

Don'tbook here owner doesn't take accountability for running a dirty and smoky home. It wreaked of cigarette smoke we informed the owner she took no accountability the matter. The whole place is filthy and covered in dust. I have medical condition this place made me very sick. The host tried to gaslight me in saying she didn't have this complaint before I screen shot previous review about same matter she stated that none complained it was persistent smell of smoke. The home smells like they been smoking in it for years stained in the walls and furniture so I don't know what she means by that. Also we saw piece of gum in the center piece lost my appetite. Food and drinks trash around the home that wasn't left by us. There was so much dust that I had to shower after leaving her place disgusting it's violation of health and safety and she should be fined. Also must have roaches we saw evidence of roach droppings in the kitchen.

Nice small space for a quick stay. Extremely short drive to many good spots in Austin. Family neighborhood, so felt very safe. Friendly hosts. (Just an FYI, we had trouble with Waze and Google maps finding the place, but Apple Maps found it and that‚Äôs in no way the hosts‚Äô fault.)

Die Unterkunft war super und sauber.
üëçüèΩ
While the listing had a wrong apartment number listed host was quick to respond and provide correct information.  Apartment was clean!

Very disappointed with service given to me, Wifi was not working at all we reach out the Host for help we really needed Wifi to do my  remote work and my friend needed submit some assignment for her school we're doing a short  workcation Austin for some new scenery . The Host reply to us only twice and that was it no more communication from the host BUT the wifi still was not fix. My group and I did not feel comfortable being out all day and getting exposing to Covid so we end up stay at the Airbnb with no Wifi which means no TV and no access to our laptops (to work) end up losing two work days. The lack of urgency and communication is unprofessional and unfair basic on previous review and star rate other renters receive I had high expectation on the service the host would provide us ............. Smh
Good north location. Has everything you need but had poor water pressure in shower and slow draining sinks.

The apartment is very clean and in a very convenient location! The only issue we had was that the shower pressure was awful and the tub did not drain quickly. We were standing in water while we showered.

Unfortunately my experience here wasnt great. The place was pretty dirty when we got there, especially the bathroom, and the entire place stunk of heavy cigarette smoke. As of typing this, the clothes I brought with me still have a faint cigarette smell to them, so if you are sensitive to cigarette smoke, look elsewhere. Decent location, laundromat close by, if you have a car or willing to bike a while, its a good spot.
It was very dirty. I appreciate the fast response and refund of 1/2 of the cleaning fee.

It was a bare basic. It felt like a college dorm room. All the furnitures had scratches, some damages and stains. Couch had stained sad-looking flat pillows. Shower curtain had a discolored orange bottom. If you are looking to cook your own food, you will be disappointed. All the pans and pots were scratched up, the coating was coming off.

The house is dark and has a really bad odor which was a bit concerning, wondered if it was safe to breathe in. And there was a cockroach repellent, so I was worried about dealing with that. Thankfully I didn‚Äôt see one.

Communicating with the host was the only thing that I could say it was good. She was accommodating to my request and responded quickly. If you are looking for a budget travel, maybe this place is for you.

So for the price it is completely adequate. I had a bed and basic amenities. My biggest gripe was that it did not specify that it was or had previously been a smoke friendly space. As non-smokers we did not appreciate it and honestly struggled with it the entire time. There was also a general mustiness and moldiness of the space that wasn‚Äôt great but again for the price it wasn‚Äôt the worst I guess.

The cleaning crew didn't do their job very well. The minute we walked in, something was smelling nasty. We messaged first thing but didn't get a response until about 5 days later (I think the day before we left but nothing was done). The water from the sink was absolutely disgusting. You would turn it on and want to vomit. We found out just before leaving that it was the dishwasher which was backed up and there were still dishes inside. We washed our dishes in the bathroom. The pillows on the couch have food stains on them and the office table is also broken with the chair having some marks on it. Some of the lights also didn't work. The lights weren't a huge deal, but still annoying when you'd go to flip on the light and only the fan comes on. I think we left it cleaner than when we arrived. As for the area, that was fine. Regular code pad to get in. The AC worked, so when it's 100 each day, that was nice.

Nice apartment, but the host doesn't care enough to maintain it. We had some of the same problems from other reviews (cigarette smell, missing light bulbs, empty soaps etc) so clearly it's been this way for months.

Pros:
Easy check in. The apartment looked very clean when we arrived. Comfy furniture. Nice place in a good location.

The main con:
The dishwasher had several inches of gross stinky water in it when we arrived, which you'd think the cleaning crew would have noticed. Casey asked me to run it to see if it would drain, and it flooded the kitchen. I cleaned it up, and he sent the maintenance guy over to replace it with a different one. I ran the new dishwasher and it flooded the kitchen again so I cleaned it up again. This time I got no response from Casey when I told him. I reached out again after a week of no response because at that point the kitchen stunk pretty bad. After all that, he offered to reimburse me for the $2 laundromat cost from cleaning.

I‚Äôll write a list of things you should know:
- house half the size than pictured
- barely any utensils
- pots and pans were dirty
- heater didn‚Äôt work
- EXTREMELY thin blankets
- uncomfortable hard beds
- tv didn‚Äôt work
- wifi did not work as well
- neighbors dogs continuously bark
- homeless close to location as well!!

I‚Äôd give it a 6/10. Not terrible but won‚Äôt come back..

The houses are really lovely but very disappointed at treatment and lack of communication by property manager. Dishes were dirty upon arrival and bathrooms and kitchen were not fully stocked for a 5 day stay for 10 people. We found out dishwasher was not working from cleaning people, but never a courtesy message about that from property manager. When we finally sent a message his reply was very rude.

Houses are really nice in the inside, spacious, warm and comfortable, when you drive up house looks abandoned due to lack of maintenance in the loan and dead plant all around fence.

The washer and dryer did work but we had to hold them by a few people since they shake so much, they literally moved around the house when on.
It was okay neighbors a little bothersome

Didn't know 16 beds are in 2 separate buildings. There was no Microwave in neither of the buildings. received no response when pointed out, dont know why. Expected a barbeque Grill in the building. Though there is a phone number listed, Phone calls are not picked up .
Overall upkeep and furnishings are good.

host denied reservation due to nieces coming over to visit
beware no kids or friends or family allowed over

Locale description somewhat lacking. Thankfully my elderly Father was unable to come because we had no idea from description or pictures that there were 3 flights of stairs. We arrived after dark, & when the sun rose we found the patio couch had muddy foot prints & dog crap on it. We didn't go out there at all obviously.  The kitchen was the draw for us as we planned to make Thanksgiving dinner. It was pretty dirty & greasy, & the oven was very bad & smoked the whole time we used it. There were no dishwasher pods or dishtowels. Overall we enjoyed our stay, despite leaving it probably a little cleaner than we found it. The location is close & convenient.

I originally booked this rental via Airbnb Luxe. I was contacted by Airbnb in August that they had removed the rental from Luxe due to consistently poor reviews and feedback. I was then contacted by Heirloom Travel, who manages this rental, promising that the concerns of past stays would be addressed before our stay in November. Heirloom noted 'wear and tear of the house' and 'poor housekeeping' as the reasons of why this rental was removed from Luxe, and that they are taking a full week of no reservations to work on the house (deep clean, new paint, etc.) before our stay. I believed the management company and rebooked with a small discount.

After staying in that rental, I can confirm that NONE of those promised updates were done to the house. This house is in terrible condition. 1) The photos were taken when the house was first listed, everything has seen years of wear and tear without being taken care of (the walls and floors are gray from stains). 2) Everything was dirty - Cockroaches in BOTH units - rugs, linens, couches smelled horrible. 3) Bedroom doors were off the hinges and could not even close properly for privacy and lights in many rooms and bathrooms were burned out. 4) There is construction all around this unit in the neighborhood - no sleeping in possible. 5) The patio cushions to the outdoor patio furniture were stuck in the surrounding trees? Some previous renter obviously had too much fun with those and they have yet to bother to either retrieve the cushions or replace them with new ones. 6) The wooden deck on Unit B is very obviously rotting and is a huge safety concern for large groups of people sitting outside on the balcony.

In short, I highly recommend not staying here and that Heirloom Travel finally considers fixing this unit before any other renter has this experience.

Good and bad, good location, walking distances to food and bars. The condo was clean. The bad, the furniture was very uncomfortable. They need to purchase beds and a new couch. The kids beds were in the master bedroom closet.

The room you see is the room you will get at Richard's apartment. The place was clean. It is not a Hyatt or Hilton but you are not paying anything close to what those rooms would cost you.
Richard is an easy guy to work with. I arrive from out of county when I come to the US. my cellphone carrier failed to switch me to a plan with wifi so I was lost with no ability to get past my mobile service email. I thought my sim card had failed. Richard hung in there with me trying to communicate so all worked out in the end.

I hate to give any place less than 5 stars, but I would not re-book here. The entire apartment reeked of dog, and the smell permeated my clothes. The floors were pretty dirty, I couldn't step out of the shower without getting dirt/dog hair on my feet. The bathroom also isn't the best, the sink doesn't really drain, and the shower is basically a trickle of water. The apartment complex isn't the safest, I was actually cat called by another tenant on the day I checked out (NOT Richard's fault, but it didn't foster the most "friendly" environment overall). Pros: it's close enough to downtown to not get caught in traffic if you're commuting there, it's 5 minutes away from the river trail, you are able to use the fridge to store food, and the room itself locks.
Nice place! I understand cleaning fees but not sure why so high. I get due to COVID but my home is cleaned the same COVID or not.
Not recommended given several issues we had during our 2+ week stay
no public review
Nice place but parking is weird

Very poor response from host. You have no access to any amenities. The Muse ( neighboring property) will not allow any Lola residents on the premises.  Which is why i booked this property.  When I reached out for support I never received a response from Lola or Sonder . I won't not book this again.

The experience in general was good as the location is great.
The apartment looks very bright in the photos but in reality is really dark, even with the lights on, which is definitely a negative for us as we where looking to stay mainly inside working remotely but had to look for cafes and other places as the place wasnt nice enough for staying in all day.
It wasnt very clean either, but Im sure that it was bad luck.

This was the worst experience with an Airbnb property / host i have ever experienced.  The Host (Sonders) did not send check in instructions 3 days prior as communicated in the listing.  As a guest I had to contact the Host 3 times each with a 30+ min wait time to get check in instructions.  The last time was while standing in the hallway with luggage outside the appartment, while on hold, waiting to get check in instructions.  Sonders initially forgot send, and when they did share check in codes and instructions, they provided the wrong door codes.  As there were no check in instructions, there was no notification of parking rules, not in House Rules section of AirBnb for the listing, or provided on check in.  There was a parking pass, but it was buried in a pile of papers among menus and coupons on the counter.  As a result car was towed, had to arrange transport, get cash to get car out of impound for a total of $300 and a lost day of travel.  The Host (Sonder) offered a full refund, provided email for a copy of receipt and then ignored the offer to refund.  If you stay with this Host (Sonder), do everything through the AirBnB app and Report everything immediately, as it happens, they offered full support and reimbursement and then turned around and stalled to answer until after Airbnbs policy allows them to go after the Host.  The host has microphones mounted throughout the apartment to listen to guests.   When AirBnb investigated reported issues, the Host (Sonder) ignored all communication with AirBnb.  AirBnb indicated the Host ignored all attempts of communication by AirBnB and the Guest, AirBNB refunded the guest 60% of the incurred cost as a "courtesy".

This is advertised as a 9-BR stunning estate. However, 4 small rooms were garage converted rooms. Sound proofing is so bad, you can hear snores and small movements. Dirty head boards, old couches (outdoor/indoor furnitures), loose faucets, and unfinished floorings. Promised to fix a non working fridge but no one came. Pool was dirty too. Someone came to test the water but did not perform cleaning. Property sits in a slum area- a mix of good and old homes. Paid 11K+ for a week ( 12/27-1/3), not worth it!

The place is not bad. A bit of an older house. Pretty big and spacious for a 2 bedroom. Front door is very hard to open. You have to pull on it really hard. I thought I had been given the wrong code at first. There‚Äôs a small guest house in the back yard. Not sure if anyone lives in there but it made me a bit uncomfortable to show up at night and see it‚Äôs door wide open. The area of town is not the best. The garage was blocked off by a blanket. I peeked in there and saw a huge hole in the ceiling.

Myself and two other women stayed at Terri's home for two nights. I will go over the pros and cons for us

Pros:
15 to 20 minutes to 6th street (without traffic)
- Close to gas station, food trucks and grocery store

Cons:
-Had to go over some steep heels to get there
- The house is on a noisy street
-Front door can be difficult to open and close (make sure to read the instructions on how to open and close).
-Window in kitchen wasn't covered and anyone could see in
-No Icemaker (a small soldier ice tray was in the freezer)
- Some of the dishes seemed dirty
-Curtain in bedroom closet to front door did cover the full window. If anyone walked up the would be able to see into the room
-Private room in the house that we could not access (Just made us a little nervous)
-Smaller home in the backyard (which also made us nervous because we were unsure if someone was living there
-Trash cans outside were full and we could barely get our trash in
Owner was rude

Would not recommend! This place had zero ambiance, characteristic of a motel room! Why bother displaying two clocks that do not work? There was  no TV in the bedroom, no spoons to be found and very little cutlery. Chipped coffee cup, no welcome basket (no coffee, tea, etc)! No extra throws or blankets, pillows. So dissapointing . I could have stayed in a motel for half of the price.
Solid place to crash for a night

When we arrived at the residence we found that it had not been cleaned from the prior stay. We contacted the host and waited the necessary hour to give them a chance to resolve the problem. We did not hear back from the host and had to find another residence for our stay at a late hour after a full day meeting f travel. We understand hosts don‚Äôt clean, but no response was very unprofessional.
Was a decent place for the price, but I would really recommend against having 4 people there. The couch bed was very uncomfortable

Host and neighbors ruined what could have been a great weekend. The place looked good, accurate to the pictures and was decently clean except for the refrigerator that was full of old food condiments and had left over beer and spiked seltzers from previous guests and the coffee maker had not been cleaned and had the dirty filter and coffee still in it which was was unpleasant and made the kitchen full of fruit flies.
The property is listed as being able to accommodate 10+ guests. What the host does not tell you is that they do not, nor anyone else for that matter, live there. It is obvious that the neighbors are 100% fed-up with living next to a 24/7 AirBnB. The neighbors called the cops on us multiple times for no justifiable reason. Form the moment I arrived, one of her neighbors pointed at me and shook her head disapprovingly. I was barely getting out of the car. The host specified ‚Äúno parties‚Äù but did not accurately explain the situation. I don‚Äôt consider the 10 allowed guests having some drinks and listening to music at a moderate volume on a Friday or Saturday afternoon to be a ‚Äúparty‚Äù. If you have a problem with all 10 guests using the backyard simultaneously then
that should of been specified. When the cop came on Saturday afternoon to (very politely) tell us about Friday‚Äôs complaints, he knew which gate to come into, he knew the property was an Airbnb, he had already called the host, and he told us it didn‚Äôt look like we were doing anything wrong but that these calls happened all the time with this property. In other words, we were taking the burden of previous guests‚Äô actions. The Host tried to contact me while I was in the pool so I did not answer my phone and then showed up with her husband. Walked in to the back yard of the property and basically tried to kick us out. Acted belligerent. Told us that they had been watching us through a previously undisclosed camera which we considered to be an invasion of privacy and did not proceed to calm down until her husband started making inappropriate racial comments about how he thought we ‚Äú...were obviously Mexican, aren‚Äôt you?‚Äù And about how this might be the last straw for them to loose their AirBnB host license. It is a nice property and it could have been a nice weekend but the actions of the host and her husband really put a damper on our experience and I had personally never felt so disregarded and offended. Bottom line, If the backyard amenities aren‚Äôt to be enjoyed by the amount of guests that the host states in the listing then she should lower the amount of people allowed in the house, state that more clearly, or possibly not rent out the property so often so that the neighbors don‚Äôt feel they live next to a hotel. If she and her husband have a problem with Mexicans staying at their property they should state that as well. I am an AirBnB host myself and have worked in Hospitality for 12+ years, there is NOTHING hospitable about this host or this property.

Pros:
Pool
Backyard area
Comfortable beds
Cons:
Pool floats were broken
Fire pit did not have any wood to use
Kitchen was hard to use (bad pots and pans, dishwasher not bolted in so it moved on you)

We had a bad experience for multiple reasons. Do not want to disparage the host or the place, but left a low review that reflected our experience. Our experience could be a one off, but we would NEVER stay here again, especially with all the options in Austin.

The location of the house is not in a great location. We have stayed in many Airbnb's and this one did not live up to our standards. Due to being spring break we were unable to find anything else on short notice. We would not book this house again.

We stayed at May‚Äôs for a girls weekend. The house was as described inside and the backyard was decent. The neighborhood was not the best. There were homeless people up and down the street and the house was on a busy street. Parking wasn‚Äôt an issue for us but if you have large vehicles or more than 4 it could be an issue. It‚Äôs around a 10 min drive to downtown area. The gas stations and stores that are close are not the safest so be sure to stop ahead of time.

The place is pretty cute but quiet small. We thought it would be bigger by looking at the pictures. The sad thing was the electricity in 2 bedrooms went out at night so there was no lights in those rooms. I texted the host around 10pm at night. She answered in the morning and that wouldn‚Äôt help much

We were very disappointed about the hot tubs cleanliness, as that was one of the main reasons we booked the house and couldnt even ise it. We paid a very high premium for a house on the main road in a not great area  and were hoping to enjoy the backyard which wasnt like the pictures depicted. I appreciate the owners quick responses to my emails but we are very disappointed in the amount of money that we spent just to get a‚ÄùIm sorry‚Äù

Cleanliness = fail.

1. Crusted food in kitchen
2. Hair (lots of hair) in the shower
3. Linens - ew. Odd smell.
4. Baseboards and vents - uncleaned like ever.
Annnnnd‚Ä¶
5. COCKROACHES - kitchen and bathroom. 2+ inches in size ü§Æ

Location of this place is amazing. Being directly on Congress Avenue you have so much to do all in walking distance and if you want to visit downtown it is just a 5 min drive up the road. Other than location this place lacks MAJOR maintenance. The worst being a terrible smell that lingers from the guest bath, my guess being due to the extremely loose toilet probably leading to sewer pipe fumes leaking through the non existent seal. To add to the bathroom issues, both showers had terrible drainage, if you like your showers turning into baths for your legs, then this is your place. You could not shower without the tubs beginning to fill with water. The simple lack of home maintenance is endless, does hiring a handy man to clean drains, tighten toilets, swap filters (HVAC filter was disgusting), etc. really break the bank that much for you guys? Please do your guests a favor and hire routine maintenance.
Cool place...little over priced :/
cool, hip, spot in a killer location

Great location and communication from the hosts was good. However, here are some of the issues we had with the place:
‚Ä¢ Dead cockroach in the first floor closet where the bed was stored
‚Ä¢ Lack of sheets for the downstairs and dirty pillows
‚Ä¢ Insufficient bath towels

Austin is a great town and the location could not have been better, but our group left a little disappointed by the quality of the Air BnB.

False advertising.  Couch bed was broken in half and unusable the first night. The blow up air mattress was a twin sized mattress pad.  Front door key pad password only worked for one day, then the password was changed and I received a notification. We had to use the back door the entire weekend.  No pillow cases were provided when we arrived.

Urban Stay as a company is disorganized and unprofessional. The team at Urban Stay, the impact you have on others when you double book spaces is careless and thoughtless. Your inability to manage your calendar creates problems, stress,  frustration and disappointment for your clients.
‚Äò‚ÄòTwas perfect for us four dudes on my buddy‚Äôs bday. Unfortunately we had to leave unexpectedly via a family emergency.
If you wanna use the fire pit, bring some Duraflame wood and maybe some firewood from your nearest store.
Clean place shame on you for leavg it dirty

The home is located in a poor neighborhood and smelled like weed, and gave everyone a bad headache. There was a visitor delivering packages. A second visitor that was a previous resident that was attempting to retrieve belongings. When notifying the owner of the Airbnb, she stated she spoke with the previous resident and that they denied coming by the home.

This place was very convenient for a downtown wedding and the decor is on point with the Austin vibe.

Only complaints are the walls are thin so we could hear walking around upstairs and kids but it wasn‚Äôt tooooo bad.

Overall we enjoyed our stay and would book again!

Excellent location, centrally located in Austin. Hosts were very friendly. Cool, funky lodging. The space is slightly rustic (i.e. low ceilings and unusual shower/bath), but nothing super surprising based on the pictures and description.
Good communication but a lot of unexpected problems occurred during our stay, also not the greatest part of town either.

No Hot Water our entire stay even though we called to have it fixed. Not even a call back or offer to discount our stay for the chilly inconvenience. 2 thumbs down from each of us that stayed and had to take cold showers. There was 4 of us, so 8 thumbs downüëéüëéüëéüëéüëéüëéüëéüëé
Condo was very clean and owner was an A+ on communication. Little further from town than we had expected, but that‚Äôs our own fault. Price was a little high for what you got, given the location.

Daryl was an exceptional host, quick response, smooth check in and check out. Airbnb was clean and updated. However the location was not ideal. The community was very run down. The street outside the community gate did not feel safe. Even some Uber drivers picking us up/drop off made comments about the area being sketchy.

Good location depending on your needs, but it is a very busy street and difficult to get out of the driveway (due to considerable traffic) unless you back in. Not our best Airbnb experience, but the house was fine for a quick stay.

I appreciated the fast communication, easy check-in, flexibility with early/late check-out, and reliable/fast WiFi.

The things I did not love: House was very dusty and not as clean as I would expect (found hairs in both bathrooms, kitchen drawers messy), Felt very old/cold (some lightbulbs burned out/flickering), Not fully equipped like most Airbnbs with common kitchen and bathroom items (wouldn't recommend cooking here), Noisy (on a busy road/bring headphones or earplugs to sleep, toilet water runs for awhile after flushing which is loud enough to hear on a conference call, heater is loud/clunky, just all around lots of noises).
Were not thrilled with the place. Not a lot of prep work going into it.

The place is mostly fine, but a lot of small details that made the stay disappointing.
1) the lights flicker aggressively whenever the water is running (this includes both sinks and the shower).
2) house manual is VERY specific and foreboding, hard to feel welcome when every other sentence says "PLEASE be careful with x y z as they are new!!"
3) sink placement makes it impossible to use without dripping water onto the floor, which we had to wipe up after every use so as to not damage the wood flooring, as per the house manual.
4) We tried to use the downstairs AC primarily as it said in the house manual, but when it got cold during the night, I did not want to go down the ladders to turn up the heat so just used the upstairs one--then woke up to a message stating to use the downstairs one. It felt as if we were being monitored.
5) Tried to use the futon but couldn't pull it out for fear of scruffing anything--floors, couch, walls.
6) lots of flies and small bugs--normally would be a non-issue but these small offenses add up!

If you just need a place to crash for the night I guess none of these things matter, but then there are much cheaper options for that. I was looking forward to my stay here as the place looked adorable in the photos but sadly could not enjoy it.

Clumps of hair on the floor and in the shower. Ants all over the place. Bed wasn‚Äôt made and looked like it had been slept in. Fridge was dirty and had someone else‚Äôs alcohol left behind. Cute place to stay but a bit disappointed.
You won‚Äôt regret staying here!!

Great for one (maybe two people) for a weekend. Loved how unconventional the space was but still had the necessities. Only con is that the location of the Airbnb is not in the best part of town but if you‚Äôre out and about all day/at work/etc. it‚Äôs manageable.
Sketchy neighborhood, place had a smell, floor was dirty. Did not have central heating or than an electric plug in. Would have rather stayed in a hotel room for same price or cheaper.
I did not end up staying here, having to cancel due to COVID-19 advisory. Refund request remains unaddressed by AirBnb.

The house has potential and Erick is nice and responds quickly to messages or gives you a call. Unfortunately, the house was not clean when we got there. The floors were dirty, the pull out bed had a lot of food crumbs on it. The bathtubs were dirty. There were also ants in the living room and dining area. Erick did offer to come by and clean but i expected the home to be clean prior to us arriving. The AC upstairs was not working and was extremely hot. Again, Erick did offer to send someone out but I rented this house because i was getting married and having to deal with all these extra things on the day of my wedding was not ideal.

Location was good, the house was spacious but had a lot of trash from empty shampoo and body wash bottles. Left over toothbrush‚Äôs which was a bit gross. Got questioned about a key that was left completely alone and I know for a fact it was left alone because of a previous review already written so I made myself awake that I was carful and still got questioned.... seemed a little suspicious. Anyways it accommodated the people i had with me and that‚Äôs good enough i guess!

I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this property, they don‚Äôt communicate about the conditions of the home or try to make it right with me. The house wasn‚Äôt cleaned properly, the AC upstairs was not working, the pullout couch was broken and there weren‚Äôt any sheets, covers or towels.

Decent place if you are looking for a cheaper place to crash for a night in Austin. The host is not very good at communication, I had to reach out a few times and even call to get the code to get into the house. When we arrived the cleansing lady was still in the house, one of the bedroom doors was locked shut, the door to the attic was broken causing the house to be very hot in the home. Other than that, hope was not as clean or in good condition (stains on carpet, scratches on walls & doors, old furniture) as other airbnbs I‚Äôve stayed in but it served its purpose as a place to crash for one night.

This is 5 minutes from where I needed to be for several days. The house is clean and uncluttered. The host is super responsive. The mattress could be better and the bathroom exhaust fan is unusually noisy. I wasn‚Äôt bothered by the street noise since I use earplugs anyway but I didn‚Äôt think it was that bad. Bring your own washcloth as the bath didn‚Äôt include one.
DONT TO TO THIS GUY!!! HE WILL SCAM YOU AND DONT GIVE YOU YOUR MONEY BACK !!!

The worst service and experience ever!! He was overly aggressive, impatient, and disrespectful! He came in the house unannounced during late hours without notice. Did not include in detail or the description that we were going to be sharing the house with other people. I feel completely disgusted and I‚Äôm disappointed with how unresponsive Air BNB corporate is at this time.
Clean place with plenty of room to sleep number of people listed. There was no fob left for the pool which was disappointing but another resident let us in.

I rarely write reviews and when I do I always try and leave something positive.  This is a cute duplex for a quick over nite stay, if you don't have more than 1 vehicle or have to stay longer than a day, this will work just fine. I have stayed at many airbnb's, all over the country and this airbnb by far was the most uncomfortable.  The front door has see through glass where the owner who lives in the attached unit constantly passed by and looked in, no privacy. The parking situation was not a good one, there was only space for one vehicle on a long and narrow drive way no other place to park but the street which was not safe given the neighborhood. The toilet seat was two sizes too small for the toilet, girls sit to pee, that was a huge issue for me.  We left a day early because this was not a friendly or comfortable situation for us.   I was clear that we had fury babies,  medium size husky and a 3 month puppy.   For all pet owners, choosing an airbnb that allows pets is ALWAYS a concern, there were some paint chips by the door knob that very well could of been there but she billed me $75.00.  Pet owners beware.  If you need a place to stay near the airport with no more than 2 people and 1 vehicle this will work fine.  The place lists for 6 people, but there are 2 beds and a small 'click clack' type sofa that really only fits 2 small children.

Was switched to different unit last minute. No king bed :/ definitely not quiet or peaceful, loud neighbors, dogs barking and sirens. Woke up to construction sounds and power tools. Not my greatest Airbnb experience.
Keyless self check in was convenient, location is within a 15-20 minute drive to everything. Sadly, there was a slow drain in the bathroom and no barbecue grill as advertised.

Overpriced for what it was. Basically just half a house. Beds uncomfortable, single ply toilet paper, poor handiwork around the house, walls super thin (you can hear neighbors talking outside). There is also a rooster next door and a neighbor working on a car or something waking you up first thing in the morning.
Near airport and COTA nyt there's no supermarkets near
Muy buen anfitri√≥n siempre al pendiente y atendiendo cualquier duda. Es 100% recomendable, no hay una sola queja. Limpio, ordenado y te hacen sentir en casa
Price is low and convenient for limited people

This was a terrible Air BnB. First, the bathroom was pretty gross. There was urine and hair on the toilet and all over the shower when I arrived. The host very noisy late at night. Talking loudly on his phone and tossing around pots and pans close to midnight. The second night wasn't any better. Again with the loud pots and pans and this time it was at 2am. Woke me up and the racket continued for over an hour though this time I think it may have been another guest. Never got back to sleep and ended up making the 12 hour drive home on just 4 hours of sleep. I've had better nights of sleep in a fox hole.

Nice quiet stay.

Room and bedsheets had a bad odour.

Good for short term stays.
The thermostat is locked. The room was uncomfortably hot to a point where it was difficult to sleep, and there were no fans in the room.

As soon as I arrived, the issues started. The door code that I was given didn‚Äôt work, so I had to contact the host. When we finally got inside, it looked basically nothing like the pictures. When we got into our room, it smelled SO bad. We tried to air it out while we were gone by opening the window and turning the fan on high, but it didn‚Äôt work at all. We figured out that it was the covers that smelled so bad. We almost didn‚Äôt even stay the night here.

While Leo was responsive and communicative, I would not stay here again.
If you have any sensitivity to fragrance do not stay here. They wash their bedding in heavily fragranced detergents. I was not able to stay due to an allergic reaction.

It‚Äôs a very basic room with a full bed and you are upstairs with three other rooms. They do offer a key to lock your room but are very strict with their no shoes policy. Also, if you have bad allergies I do not suggest staying here. We cut our trip short because staying in this house made me sick.
This place is a gem. Right near the airport and easy to get to. No frills, clean and simple.
no

parking is bad , I heard noises from roommates all the time .
bath is not clean . there's some trees branches at the entrance and scratches my face the first day ok the darkness . also I don like to remove my shoes all the time come in and out . sorry but I didn'tfeel very comfortable. it's just good for a desperate situation not good for every days . also the share kitchen is little nasty . definitely property needs attention . I got a problem to open the my room door the first day and the attention was quick replacing the lock code . also mattress is comfortable and lingerie smell good .

es un lugar muy limpio, est√° todo muy ordenado, creo q no es un lugar para viajeros, creo a es m√°s para personas que est√°n trabajando por algunos d√≠as en la ciudad, no es un lugar donde quieras pasar tu tiempo, solo es para dormir, no hay nada para hacer en su alrededor, no es tan centrado como dice la descripci√≥n, no hay paradas de bus cerca, solo puedes salir en Uber!
It's a fine place if you don't mind shared accommodations.
Cheap and affordable. No frills or extra effort taken on behalf of the host but good place to crash for the money.
It's one night place. I will not recommend it for longer because its not clean, not comfortably and cozy. Doesn't feel like something I will go back to.
Second time staying here. A few blocks from family member‚Äôs home.  We will be back.
It‚Äôs a duplex and not very attractive, but does serve its purpose.

Perfect location. The homeless people inside the gates is a safety issue. The gate to get into the doomed was broken 3 out of the 4 days we were there so homeless people would walk in and urinate on the stairs and on the building. The stench of urine was unbearable. We opened our door on one morning to have a homeless man literally sleeping on our doorstep. The second we would walk out of our condo homeless men would harass us for money. The dryer was broken and 2 separate people came to ‚Äúfix it‚Äù and couldn‚Äôt so we couldn‚Äôt wash towels the entire stay. I feel like having the security gate working when you all know there is a ton of homeless people in the area should be a top priority. We did not feel safe. I would not feel comfortable having my wife and her friends staying at this place.
Could not have been happier with our stay!

Terrible experience all around, inaccurate listing with house filled with someone else's stuff including clothes, used expired food, sexy toys, and prescription pills. Won't offer refund due to them leaving and booking another place to rent when they didn't bother to clean out the house prior to leaving. NOT meant to host anyone for a long term stay let alone a weekend stay. WOULD NEVER RECOMMEND BOOKING HERE. It's a scam.

Neal is very quick to respond to any and all queries. Location is great and always enough parking available. Neighbourhood is quiet but construction on building just behind the house was disruptive as it started at 7am.

We will not recommend this Airbnb to anyone.
House is not as bright and clean as the 40 pictures advertised.
We get very bad bug bites all over bodies.
Place is small even though it says 3 bed room. No dinning table, only 2 chairs in the house as we have 5 people. Ceiling lights are not working, rooms are dark. Host did not help out at all. He even told us to eat in the back yard where condition is bad, overgrown weeds, fallen leaves, sandy and pebbles in the ground, rusty outdoor furnitures.
Moldy shower curtain.
Vent Hole on floor by the bed side in mater bed room. The metal floor vent guard is not screwed in.
House looks like situated in a building site where work is unfinished, you walk through rocks and sand to get to the front door. The neighborhood doesn‚Äôt look appealing, garbage and recycle bins all over.
You don‚Äôt want to have vacation there.

The place was really nice and charming. Was also in a great location. the amenities were there for the most part but we were missing trash bags and couldn't use the washer or dryer. detergent was not provided, which is a little disappointing bc they don't sell travel sized laundry detergent.

Such a disappointing experience. The pool was very dirty as well as the hot tub. We were told that the Polaris was on and running but it never moved during our entire stay which was 5 nights. We also had to message the host EVERYTIME we wanted the hot tub turned on and it took them 2-3 hours to respond. Once it was on then it would turn off in about 30 minutes. What's the point in getting in the hot tub if you have to wait 3 hours because you can get in.

Also there are CAMERAS everywhere!!! Even in the pool area which is private and in the backyard. that is super CREEPY!!! They were actively watching us in the pool and the hot tub that took them 2-3 hours to turn on.

The host was just down right rude and when she knew we were not happy (6 people in our party) she said she had complaints from the neighbors that we were in the pool and being loud.!! There is no way I would have stepped foot in that DIRTY pool. I happen to even know the owner of the house across the street and she never complained. In fact the night in question we were in bed early due to obligations the next morning. VERY SAD that the host resorted to these tactics just so she did not have to refund us money because of all the issues we were having.

If you want to have cameras on your every move around the pool area, side of the house, front of the home, entryway and doorbell, then this is the house for you!! If you want your privacy protected then run as fast as you can!
No issues. Everything as expected.

Location is very close to the airport, so that was a plus since our stay was short. This is an apartment so there are some downsides obviously - on our second night the fire alarm went off in one of the other buildings around 10 at night and it was very loud. Obviously the owner can‚Äôt help this, but it took a while to go to sleep after that. Despite all of this, our expectations were met and we would stay again.
Parking is not so easy to come by.

lovely place to stay in. easy access to the pool.
the bed was comfortable but very noisy. I could not move freely on the bed.

We booked a month in advance. We traveled down from Ohio. We were tired and ready to relax and got to our place and someone was living in apartment. Somehow it was double-booked by mistake. We had just traveled all day and had no where to stay. Had to call Airbnb and find another place and pay more for same day booking and for weekend rates. Very stressful and was a HUGE inconvenience our first night in Austin.

The incorrect listing,  unconnected wifi network due to very weak signal despite the amenities list said "Continuous access in the listing". I've never encountered such kind of trouble in Airbnb stay. The wifi signal is really weak and our device caught the signal only "outside" of the house, which was totally useless.

I have stayed at air bnbs all over the world and this unfortunately was the worst one I‚Äôve stayed at.

We thought we were getting away to the countryside- however be prepared, you are right next to the airport and the planes get super low and are loud. Not Joans fault but just something to know.

When we arrived at night time, it was so dark and no signage for the ranch or the keypad‚Ä¶ the keypad is 30 feet away from the gate and is the size of a credit card reader‚Ä¶ we called Joan for some help and she did not tell us she was on a plane and there was no one there to help or answer our calls‚Ä¶ thankfully we figured it out but what if we hadn‚Äôt? No signage for the cottage either. We weren‚Äôt sure if we were at the right place?

Also I did not realize that there was a dog on the property and the first time we heard some loud scratching at the door freaked us out? Wasn‚Äôt sure if it was the owners dog or some random lost dog? Also dog woke us up another night because he was non stop barking at midnight. We messaged Joan about it and she took care of it but never messaged us back or even apologized. Lack of hospitality‚Ä¶.

But the worst part was the cleanliness. This space needs a major deep cleaning. The tub and the shower curtain is so dirty. There‚Äôs cobwebs and spiders everywhere. Fridge was hard to open‚Ä¶ dirty appliances and 1 mug? Didn‚Äôt really feel like we got what we paid for or what we were expecting.

We did not end up staying at the cottage due to the lack of cleanliness. There were several spiders and other bugs, both alive and dead, throughout the building. Additionally, the bath tub had mold and mildew and was not safe to step in shoeless. There was a loud concert taking place on the property which we had been warned about, but were not supposed to be able to hear indoors and we definitely could. Joan did refund us when we expressed our concerns, but it was frustrating to have to find a different place to stay when it was already late at night. The cottage was not safe or clean and while we hope that it was a one-time fluke, I can‚Äôt recommend this location.

I appreciate the lodging. The host is really comunicative and nice. But, we expected something else for the price we paid. The smell of the bathroom was horrible, the inner side of the toilet bowl was really dirty and smelly, we had to clean it ourselves;  all the mats were full of dirt, the bath mat tub was slimy, the sheets smell like they had never been cleaned. Which its weird, because for an early check in they wanted to charge us 18$ more so the cleaners finish on time for us. One of the mattresses was really uncomfortable, it feelt like it was a really old mattress. The patio was full of boxes,  again, full of dirt and dust, we were wondering where was the pretty table and the chairs  from the pics.

So‚Ä¶ I had no experience. I am sure this place is nothing but lovely. As I was displaced and finding refuge in Texas after hurricane Ida hit Louisiana, i could not make to peter‚Äôs due to more weather reasons and was not safe to drive at the time I could head there.
I tried getting a partial refund back, as I am spending more money than planned finding a place to be while Louisiana recovers. Peter denied, and has solid booking all around and the lack of humanness for profit was just a horrible experience.

Great location and comfy bed. The coffee shop was great and a necessity because there was no coffee available at the house. Otherwise it was not a great stay. Most of the electrical outlets were missing the faceplates. The floors were dirty so definitely had to were shoes in the house. The bathroom was dirty. There were loose screws and random items laying around the place. Closets were filled with junk. Pictures were sitting in the floor instead of hanging on the walls. The cohost walked in on us while we were in the backyard hanging out. The biggest issue was that there was cat pee smell in the kitchen.  The kitchen was unusable. The cohost came and cleaned it. The next day the smell was back. We saw a cat trying to get in the house. Overall I would not stay here again unless it is cleaned up to actually look like it is advertised.

My wife and I stayed here to be able to go out and celebrate our anniversary. Unfortunately, the location was not clean at all. There was such dust in many areas of the home, which my wife is highly allergic to. Also, the bathroom had soap scum, there were crumbs on the couch, and a used razor in the disposable toothbrush area. We were lucky we did not cut ourselves with the used razor, which had hair on it and the floors were so dirty that my black socks were covered in dirt from walking on the floor. The whole house did not look like it does in the pictures and especially with a random half empty champagne bottle in the fridge.
Worst of all they double booked and someone walked in with luggage stating they reserved the location for 4 days, yet we were still staying there.

Overall, I would not recommend this Airbnb to anyone, we felt unsafe, and we will never try to stay here again, especially with my wife having breathing problems from the dust.
Stellar spot! Close to the dirty 6.
Such a cozy place to stay!! They literally thought of everything we might need. I was so sad to leave! Can‚Äôt wait to come back again!!
10/10 recommend! You won‚Äôt regret it!

Check-in is a nightmare, convoluted and arduous. You had to register your car in an app (which was not user friendly) and without proper information to get it done. Owner gave wrong information on how to get car registered.
The master bedroom did not have a dresser or any type of unit with drawers to put clothes!
The bathroom did not have a place to hang hand towels!
The thermostat was in another language and was not easy to figure out!
A huge cockroach was in the dishwasher on the day we were leaving!
Dog owners walked their dogs through the hallway (where unit was located) to the dog area but left their poop in the hallway!

This place is a lot bigger than the pictures make it seem. Plenty of room for everyone to spread out. Pool area was a nice place to hangout. Hosts were always readily available for any questions. Only negative thing I could say is that the term "sofa beds" is a little misleading. Essentially every room has a futon that collapses into a bed that sleeps one, they are not like pullout couches.

I stayed here and at their other listing for my bachelorette party. The units overall are great and are next door to each other, which was very convenient for our group. My challenge was that after I booked, they called me that the price was actually going to be $500 more. I understood and kept the reservation, but it was a bit frustrating. When I followed up with them a few weeks later to ask for a reminder of how much the extra fee was, I didn't hear back, so I had to ask again the week before the trip. Apparently this was due to a glitch with AirBnb that was out of their control, but frustrating none the less. I'd still recommend staying here, it was just an unfortunate situation in addition to a few hiccups we had with their other unit (included in the review for that page separately).
We stayed for ACL and there were shops and restaurants on the same block.  Very convenient!
I Had reservations for over a month, the host cancelled the morning of the reservation. Was unable to find other accommodations due to the late notice. Completely unacceptable.

Place was as advertised.
Owner has dogs, but the place was well cleaned and I had no issues with my dog allergies at all.
Will never be staying in this hosts homes again. Bugs all over kitchen sink, AC/Heat didn‚Äôt work, the toilets were clogged. So unhappy.
Cute place centrally located on the East side of town. Quick drive to everything. Only downside was bathroom water pressure.

So for this Airbnb let‚Äôs start with the positives. Close to downtown, it was $10 Uber ride to 6th street. If you come during college football is close to UT stadium (we didn‚Äôt but drove by the stadium).

Now for why this place is a two star. This house is on the smaller size just be prepared that you can hear almost everything going on in the house. Night one there we noticed a dead bird in the front yard and then in the back was a dead possum. Start to day one we started notice more and more ants around the house. We had a person fall asleep on the couch and said she had seen bedbugs in the night and had been bitten. Over the days of our trip we noticed more and more bugs through out the house. ants, spiders and cockroaches. There was night when I was watching the tv and felt crawling on my leg to look down to see a spider making his way up my leg. We contacted the host on day 3 of the our 6 day trip and she said that she would send some one to take care of the bird and possum. I asked for a partial refund on the house due having deal with this and she just never responded to that part of the message. The housekeeper did come out for the possum and bird but nothing for the bugs that we could tell. Until the insects are dealt with well. I wouldn‚Äôt suggest staying here.

Overall the property was similar to the pictures and the location is close to downtown.

I was informed the morning of my check-in that the window was broken and they didn't have time to fix it yet so they gave me a free late check-out. I appreciated the offer and I understood it was an accident but definitely not ideal. There were a lot of construction going on early in the morning so it was a bit loud. Also the cleaning could've been better as I found some popcorn kernels on my bed frame and the filters were quite dirty.

For the price in the area, it was ok.
They communicate to the point it makes you feel uncomfortable. Ton of hidden and added fees inlayed

This part of town was very convenient to get into town. Parking was easy. There were lots of restaurants really close by. Check in went very smoothly and communication with the owner was very easy. However, there were dried boogers on the inside of the shower curtain and I found a whole fake nail on the floor of one of the bedrooms. Right at the foot of the bed. So all in all it was fine for a night, but the lack of attention to detail in cleanliness was not ideal.

The place was clean and the price was cheap, but the neighborhood was questionable and it‚Äôs really a garage that‚Äôs connected to a house that‚Äôs been converted. There were also dogs on the premises and we had issues 2 nights in a row with dogs barking.

Not a trustworthy individual. Double booked on the day I was supposed to check in. Asked me to get a hotel that he would compensate me for the night (up to $100) since he messed up. He said the place would be clean and ready to go the next day. The following day, he texted me early morning and said the place is ready to be checked into. When I got there, there were wet towels in the washer (with someone's hair tie), stains on the faux leather couch that I wiped off myself, and the comforter/sheets on the bed were not washed. After I informed Martin of these issues and asked for a refund, he still had the cleaning lady come knock on the airbnb door to "fix the issues." I told her we were packing our things to leave and she threw her hands up and walked away. Martin then refused to pay me back for the hotel and demanded that I call airbnb for the refund because he wasn't going to cancel the reservation. I was left stranded twice with an underage child. Absolutely ridiculous.

We came, we saw, we left. This place is not as advertised. It's a converted garage, and not at all "luxury," but I guess at the price we weren't expecting top-of-the-line.

if you are a couple sharing a bed, it might be fine for you. The bathroom was dingy and the grout stained, we didn't want to shower there.

The biggest problem was with the advertised second bed. It was an ottoman, not a pull out couch, and it was a cot, not a bed. The place was laid out in a way that made it impossible to pull out the bed without blocking the bathroom. I had to move some things around to find a way to have the bed open.

The photographs on the listing are done with a fisheye lens that does not show where the bed is in relation to the bathroom. If the bed is advertised, it should be clear where it is. Also, there was no bedding and pillows for that bed, only for the queen size bed in the bedroom.
