This was not comfortable, and hotels in the area are priced at only about $10/day more, so we decided to move to one of those. The host would not cancel the reservation, so now we have to fight with AirBnB for a full refund for the listing not being as advertised.

Save yourself the trouble!
If you are looking for a house in Austin for a weekend trip or even a few days, look no more! Beautiful home, great location only 10min drive to downtown.

The Host was very professional and communicative when needed.  Restaurants and shopping centers nearby.  The home was adequately described and reflected in the photos and description.  The cleaning crew prior to our arrival did a poor job.  two of the four beds didn't have sheets.  Wet towels in the washing machine.  Used coffee grounds in the coffee machine.  No paper towels or trash bags which we had to go buy.  Ben did tell me that this is the first (and last) time he would use that cleaning crew, and did offer to pick up and drop off the bags and paper towels the following day.  maybe just some bad luck and timing on my part.

The Austin Oasis was an incredible place to stay. The house and location could not be better. The home is walking distance to incredible restaurants, and the backyard space is unbeatable. 5 stars all around!

Our hosts kindly let us visit the townhouse several weeks before our rental. We knew that the main living quarters were on the second floor, but we failed to anticipate difficulty that the stairs would present. At our age, carrying groceries and other heavy items up to the living quarters was challenging.

I was unable to complete my stay at Gary‚Äôs. The guests before me had animals and the place was covered in animal fur (which I‚Äôm severely allergic to) I made it about 3 hours before breaking out in hives and swelling up from all the coughing and sneezing. It was so bad the fur was getting in our mouths. My boyfriend popped open the vent to see why the air circulation sucked to see the filter CAKED in dust and pet dander. It was disgusting. It appears the place was not thoroughly cleaned if even cleaned at all. Considering the fact that there‚Äôs a pandemic and the place wasn‚Äôt properly sanitized is deeply disturbing. I‚Äôve never had an experience like this before and would not recommend this place until they make some serious changes.
Unfortunately, I wasn‚Äôt able to stay and had to cancel last minute. I worked everything out with Gary and had no issues!

The condo was lovely and I enjoyed my stay. However a PSA... I let Gary know I was traveling with a pet and did not hear back from him as to what the additional cost would be, additional cleaning fee or deposit. I sent him a text the day before my trip. I received a message via Airbnb that to approve an additional cleaning fee of $120.12. At that point I had no option but to pay.
I feel that $120.12 in addition to the $80.00 cleaning fee for 2 nights in a 630 sq ft condo with my 20 lb dog is excessive. That is $200.12 to cleaning charges.
If you are traveling with a pet please ask in advance about additional charges. I paid for my mistake I don't want anyone else to.

I did not actually end up being able to stay at this place because when my friend and I arrived, at around 11:30 pm, we discovered that the keys were nowhere to be found. The check in instructions indicated that they would be in a lockbox. A few hours before checking in, the host sent a message saying that they might actually be under the front door mat. This struck me as pretty insecure and unsafe. When we arrived they weren‚Äôt there either. Upon coming into the very poorly lit apartment complex, which has the feel of a kind of dingy motel, we were harassed by other residents and even followed by one as we tried to find the right place. Being unable to find the keys after all this was really uncomfortable and a bit scary. While the host was reachable and trying to locate the keys for us we felt pretty unsafe with the whole experience and instead decided to book a room in a hotel that night. The host was barely apologetic and did not offer to reimburse us despite the fact that we couldn‚Äôt get into the apartment. Definitely would avoid this property.

There was no hot water on arrival , the ac was off and house was crazy hot and we couldn‚Äôt even stay and had to leave while house cooled off ,  the outside house door doesn‚Äôt close all the way the walls are dirty the fridge is covered in dust and had cigarettes on it , spider webs all In The inside chairs , it‚Äôs smells , the toilet was dirty and it isn‚Äôt what was expected from posted pictures and because of ACL it‚Äôs virtually impossible for us to go anywhere else
The place is not represented accurately by the photos. Broken bed, window unit ac that wasn't working, hole in wall, and busted blinds. Overall grimy feeling and smelled of mold.

The information read that the AirBNB sleeps 10, but some of the bunk beds that were in the rooms were extremely unsafe. One of the beds was not secure and if any person over 100lbs that would have slept on it would have fallen and injured themselves and the person on the bottom bunk. Other bunk beds were missing wood frames and made it very uncomfortable. The AC did not work properly and there were nights of being extremely hot. During our stay we found random long hair throughout the main residence‚Äôs shower. The house was in a decent location and could walk to some of the nightlife. The bathrooms in the houses were very nice and can tell they have been redone.

Excellent location, probably could not get any better. Bathroom is a bit smaller than I would have thought from the pictures.

My only real issue was that the air was not on when we got there and the house thermostat literally said the house was 98 degrees inside. It took about 4 hours to cool down and just started off the trip in a bad mood because our baby could not nap in the heat.

Also saw 4 cockroaches around the house (2 of them already dead).

Pretty bad. A variety of issues:
1. Major street noise problem. Morning garbage pickup starts at 6am and lasts for hours. There are restaurant workers in the alley making loud noise all night. At times sounds like there's a Demolition Derby going on outside the bedrooms. Seems pretty bad that this isn't disclosed
2. Unresponsive. We'd made arrangements for arrival that fell through. Then we made a request day of, that wasn't responded to for 48 hours. 2 days later, when the request was no longer relevant, we got an "oops, missed this" reply
3. There's a rodent burrowing in the walls
4. Inflexible with check-in and check-out (just wanted to drop a bag slightly before 4p. Hard no)

Outside of those complaints, the house was fine. Wouldn't stay here again, though. Many other listings look more promising

No communication for months, no responses to the booker or the the company which is assisting the booking.


I booked in April and I was not told it was double booked u til nov 12 after I attempted to get my info to check in. The process sucked tremendously

Everything are ok except we did not aware that Raquel would be inside during our stay...
We thought it was fully rented house, not any sharing...
No recomendado
A cute little converted garage space. A little noise bleed through from the main house but no different than a duplex or apartment.

Great place for quick stay. The hosts are incredibly thoughtful and has furnished the studio with everything you need and more- shower essentials, feminine hygiene products, skincare, coffee, snacks, basic kitchen items, and even a filled Brita water filter in fridge. Not the best place for light sleepers with passing trains and the fridge making loud noises however was not a huge issue for us as we would be tired by the end of the day and just pass out sleeping.

The place was not clean and we had to leave. The furniture was also not accurate in the pictures - the couch and table were different and stained and there was a third full bed upstairs and desk downstairs which is not shown in the pictures. The street is also very busy with cars zooming by.

Tolle, gr√ºne Neighborhood, die Wohnung ist gross, hell und cool eingerichtet. Sonne auf dem Fr√ºhst√ºckstisch ! Das Deck geht auf den Creek und ist ebenfalls gro√ü. Man ist mit eigenem Eingang v√∂llig autark.
Kurze Wege zu allen Attraktionen.
This is an illegal Airbnb, the management of this establishment refused us entry

The house wasn‚Äôt what my family expected. The first thing we noticed was a camera in the main living space. That made us feel very uncomfortable. The house was also not cleaned well which is not good especially during Covid. The master bed was unusable. We both sank into the middle of the bed due to a huge dip-sag. Blinds in the master are broken and missing slats, privacy concerns. A really bad musky smell upon entry and lasting about 24 hours into our stay. Location is very bad. One house off a major road and across the street from a rough gas station. I would not recommend staying here with a family.

The good: the host was great with communication. The washer and dryer were nice.

+ : very good location, parking, good neighborhood

- : been very dirty (have cleaned on arrival 2 hours the apartment), heating very very noisy, The beds are uncomfortable, kitchen is poorly equipped and also very dirty (have nothing cooked there), the shower head can not be adjusted, the blinds are partially broken and you can not adjust them, there was no blanket (unfortunately only a 'comforter cover' what was very thin and cold)

Location and communication is decent. But this place is not clean, who ever is cleaning this place is basically robbing the owner. The walls and ceiling fans have a layer of dust on them, the cabinets in the restroom have a layer of dust as well. ( I took photos as proof) There was small pieces of trash and dust on the floor throughout the place. The sofa bed has no blanket or pillow, they expect you to use the accent pillows that you have no idea who sat on. There are no washcloths or mid size towels. The shower will only get hot for one shower, then you have to take cold showers. If you go out at night expect to use your phone as a light because there is no exterior lighting outside of this unit.

My friends and I had to Lysol and bleach the common areas, and go to Target to buy bedding for 2/3 of us.

Place was super dirty and disgusting. Sticky floor, stains on furniture, table wobbly, not enough towels or plates/silverware for number of guests. He worked with us and told us we could check out early and he would refund us the $ for the rest of the trip but then only refunded us half of what we paid for 3 nights when we only stayed one night, because we had to, there was nothing else available. Luckily Airbnb made it right and refunded us the rest of the $ we were owed. Would NEVER book with him again.
You won‚Äôtbe disappointed!

My stay was just ok. It was very hard to get ahold of Hunter with any concerns or questions I had. When my family and I first checked in, the apartment was warm, it didn‚Äôt feel like the ac was working so I reached out in regards to this and never received a reply. The ac seemed to be working better throughout the night but again in the day it didn‚Äôt feel cool. The apartments across the street look a little sketchy but we had no issues. Overall I don‚Äôt think I would stay here again, my experience was not great with the lack of communication and the ac issues.
I wouldn't recommend this place, it's dirty and the wifi disconnects every 5 minutes.
Just Okay.  Good location for us. Not well stocked.  No forks, three spoons, several knives, and one glass ;-(. Not great for a family stay for four nights.  Cleaning company should be fired...

Hunter started alright at first. We asked for a few hours extra so long as there were no reservations and he said sure. Day before checkout I asked about it and he acted like it never happened. When I mentioned it again he ignored my message entirely. When I mentioned missing things, he ignored that as well.  I will say, it's a whole apartment for fairly cheap. And the internet is amazing. But as for the negative, if you're like me and only traveling for necessity so you need to cook to save money, bring your own pots and pans. He has tiny beaten up pots and pans and we couldn't even make macaroni boxed. There were no lids for skillet and no pot holders and no oil despite it being promised. We relied on that and didn't bring any so had to get some. There is no washer or dryer and no designated work space. Those were blatant lies. Two lights were out. The pictures also dont match the post for the apartment. The shower is not for anyone taller than 5' 5" just a heads up too!
Did not disappoint, great experience and very cozy!

The Airbnb is updated, modern, cute, and has everything you would need to stay there comfortably for a day or a month. The only problem that we had was that there were quite a few roaches we had to kill inside the Airbnb.

Also, just as a side note to whoever‚Äôs staying here: there are a few levels of steps that you need to take to get to the Airbnb itself (for accessibility considerations).

Very messy and unorganized. He was taking apart furniture for other people staying and putting them in different rooms. He wouldn‚Äôt give me money back when I canceled my reservation because it was very bad.
Didn‚Äôt even stay there. Dirty and in terrible condition. Not worth the money. Still waiting on my $500 refund.

This home was disgusting! We found a dead mouse in the middle of the kitchen floor along with roaches and various dead insects throughout the home! The house smelled like if the creatures had been dead for a good while! Did not even step into the home only to take photos! Definitely do not recommend!
Great place, not so great neighbors

First thing room and whole house was dirty. Second on in her all bathroom they were putting a bucket to store water because her bathroom were already broken and now she is blaming that i broke it. Two unknown person came and knock the door and said that they live in the place and wanted to get in the house. I was about to call the police and they finally left. I would highly recommend to take picture of everything at this house, since everything looks like its about to break.

Don‚Äôt be fooled! If I could leave ZERO stars, I would.

The place was nothing like the listing. We DID NOT stay, and left after seeing how gross it was. It was absolutely deceiving. The whole place smelled like chemicals from cleaning supplies, the the extent of barely being able to breath inside. Two others that arrived with me and myself got headaches from it.

The place was extremely dirty inside and out‚Äî broken blinds, stains ALL over the sofa, 10 garbage bags piled in the yard, etc. The neighborhood was unsafe as well, and just up the street were dozens of tents and homeless people. It looked nothing like the brightened, photoshopped photos AT ALL.

I had to find another place last minute for 12 guests, and it was such a hassle. There was NO WAY we would stay in this place with the chemical smell from cleaning supplies and how deceiving it was.

It was completely falsely advertised. I contacted the host and they refused to give a refund‚Ä¶. Not even partial, which is absolutely ridiculous. I‚Äôve been in contact with Airbnb for this issue which still has yet to be resolved. I have several photos taken that day that I‚Äôll post here if it‚Äôll let me.

On top of the horrible experience walking into this place, and not being able to stay bc literally couldn‚Äôt breath‚Äî it took 3 hours to find another place last minute for myself and 11 guests. It shouldn‚Äôt be allowed for hosts to deceive people in such a way like this. The place was Disgraceful.

If we could give it zero stars, we would. The place was nothing like described. We got there and left. Very dirty and in poor condition. There was broken glass outside, We have kids!! The table chairs were dirty and wobbly, broken door near kitchen, couch stained and looked broken right in the middle, carpet was completely stained. Now We can‚Äôt even get a refund. We payed $945 and They only want to refund us the cleaning fee??? Ridiculous! We‚Äôre still trying to get a full refund. Thank God we found another place immediately. Don‚Äôt waste your time in this place. Fooled us for sure.
The place was dirty and had a weird smell. House is older than it appears in pictures.

I have stayed in about 6 airbnbs in the last few years and this was a horrible experience. We were able to check into the airbnb at 3PM. We showed up at 3 and there was a cleaning woman and her 2 children there. She stated to us that it would not be clean for another hour and a half to two hours. Gunner did not inform us this was going to happen. I messaged him and he sent me a screenshot from the cleaning lady who was originally supposed to clean the property along with photos with how the previous guests left the place and stated this wasn't an excuse but just wanted to make me aware. The text messages showed he knew the property would not be ready at 3PM but he did not inform me.

Then once we did go into the airbnb it was not as described. There were ants in the kitchen, ants and roaches in the laundry room, black mold on all the shower curtains, significant amount of dust on all the air vents, stains on the couches and ottoman, a raincoat found in the couch cushions. We had the air set to 62 and it never got below 75 while we were in the home. The vanity sink upstairs was wobbly and barely attached to the ground. Several of the outlets were not on well and 1 of them was taped on which seemed like a hazard.

I would not recommend this airbnb and to make matters worse, 2 of the girls who were on the trip are now reporting that they have bites on their legs. They may have bug bites. Working with airbnb now to get a refund.

Unfortunately, the experience and stay at this property was extremely disappointing and unacceptable. The home conditions and safety inside and outside of the home were beyond concerning. The furniture was broken and stained, the kitchen cabinets were covered in grime and dust, the air vents were filthy with piled up dust, the showers contained black mold, the blinds were broken/missing, yard filled with trashed and the list goes on. The most disgusting issue was ants on the kitchen counters and cockroaches in the kitchen and bathroom. The home is located on a very busy and noisy street and did not feel safe. We arrived and I let the host, Gunner know our concerns. He did offer to visit the property, but the caliber of the issues were way beyond being fixed in the less than 48 hour window that we were at his property. We were also not comfortable having any individuals come to the home with our belongings while we were not there and did not want to take time away from our vacation. We tried to stick it out, but the ant and cockroach issue became too much and we left the property to seek alternative accommodations for the remainder of our trip. I let Gunner know that we left and followed up by sending him 35 photos that we took to document the conditions of the home and never heard from him again. I finally contacted AirBnb once I returned home and they were able to assist us with a partial refund and classified the experience as ‚Äúhigh severity‚Äù for cleanliness issues. When AirBnb was working with Gunner on our behalf, they told me that Gunner tried to give ‚Äúphoto proof‚Äù that we were still at the property after we had already left. I was able to prove his fabrication wrong as we were already on an airplane leaving Texas at the time he had ‚Äúphoto proof.‚Äù I was polite to Gunner in all communications. I am not one to complain or cause confrontation, but it needs to be shared that this property is not providing the experience that is marketed in their listing, is vastly overcharging guests and the host is not to be trusted to resolve situations in the right way for guests.
Don‚Äôt stay here. Location is not great and pictures are not accurate to what the actual form of the house is

This property really had a lot of maintenance issues. The property is located in a nice gated area! We had issues with the master bathroom toilet not flushing, dirty area rug in master bedroom, loud squeaky bed in master bedroom, sliding glass door was broken and had sharp edges, Kitchen faucet was loose, remote controls had dead batteries. The oven was dirty, No common bathrooms as you have to go through either the Master Bedroom or guest bedroom to use the bathroom. Could use nice linen, towels and new mattress in Master Bedroom. Needs a lot of updating....

Worst airbnb experience ever. I do not recommend this place to anyone. Firstly the ceiling of the bedrooms is very dirty. Then the bathtub clogged water immediately and the water started leaking into the rest of the house from under the bathtub due to a sealant leak. I had to use all the towels so the house doesn‚Äôt get flooded. Host told me she will fix it by the next morning and refund the cleaning fee. However she never refunded the amount. I patiently waited till 5pm next day to get this fixed  and the plumber never showed up. So I cancelled the rest of the stay for which I got a partial refund for the remaining stays worth. Host claims that since I didn‚Äôt stay in the Airbnb for whole period of time, obviously with no basic amenity of a shower. She won‚Äôt refund me the cleaning fee she promised. I was in Austin for a long long weekend and this experience totally ruined it for me.

I had to cancel my reservation at Edwin's place the night before my trip to Austin due to a death in the family. I was sad that I wasn't actually able to stay at his place so my review can't speak to the actual listing but I am disappointed by my interactions with the host. I understand the strict cancellation policy in place and respect that, however I would think that during extenuating circumstances that I would at least be able to get half of my payment back for the length of my stay.

I messaged Edwin directly before cancelling apologizing and letting him know what was going on to which I received no response. I then escalated the situation with Airbnb and they tried to reach out to him twice to which he gave no response. I'm sure the place would have been lovely had I gotten a chance to stay there and didn't have to cancel my trip but the lack of empathy and cold responses from the host leading up to our stay was off putting. When I asked genuine questions about our stay prior to knowing I would have to cancel, I was met with automated responses that didn't answer any of my questions. Although I understand the strict cancellation policy in place, I just expected more empathy and warmth compared to the lack of communication I received from the host after messaging saying I had to cancel due to a death in the family and the automated responses leading up to my stay in response to questions I had.
Dope ass place

It was not the good adresse and no wifi.

All was super clean just bad informatique
The restroom is less than 2 square meters. The worst Airbnb I have ever met!
Honestly stop looking and book!  The place is perfect....plus Le BBQ is just a short 5 min walk.  Can not get any better.
Expect to be charged extra for anyone who steps foot onto the property. Even if they aren‚Äôt sleeping over.

Very nice but not what I was expecting!
I feel as if the description is misleading. It makes it sound like it's a 2 block walk to 6th St.(where you can get your drink on and walk back v without an Uber) You have to take a 6 min uber($20) and it's a 30min walk through the rough side of town. Parking is terrible, it says you can fit 2 vehicles and that's if you have 2 smart cars. You have to park outside the gate and I was worried my car was going to get broken into.
This location says it'll fit 15, which it can. When I bumped my reservation up from 6 to 10, it doubled in price. I don't see how that's okay when it's the same place I'm paying for with 6 people. I can see the cleaning price double but not the actual reservation price.
Be prepared!

Place was not at all as expected. I took plenty of photos and videos. Dust ALL over along with beds that had hair from previous guests some beds seems like the sheets were not changed in ages. Toilet did not work along with a broken door. Chair was broken that stabbed me to the point that I bled.

Be mindful that the house is close to downtown, so it is in a bad part of town. There is many homeless people around. Other than that, the home was just as the pictures showed. It also has plenty of room and beds which is a plus. Everything was clean and freshly mopped! Although, only one car fits inside of the gate.

Considering the extensive  rules and the cost of the stay, it was disappointing to find the state of the house was not up to the same standards upon our arrival. With that being said, the owner was quick to respond when we alerted them to the issues and rectified the problems in a timely manner.
Can't get a better location. You can walk everywhere in the Domain. Very spacious

Plenty of things to do,  the view from the balcony is nice as well. The apartment complex was quiet as far as neighbors go. You will hear people outside yelling some times. The bed was not that comfortable, that was my only complaint

The place is nice and just what you need if you have a big group. The only problem was the garbage disposal did not work so there were a few nats and the outdoor area was not well kept for the price of the cleaning fee charged. Deacon was very quick when we had questions.

If you are wanting a party type atmosphere this is the place for you. Loud area at night..appears to be a party rental spot. Be prepared to potentially buy your own toilet paper and paper towels. Roaches were an issue...alive and dead. Baby roaches dont come from outside..aesthetically doesn't look like the pictures and the patio was unusable due to weeds, broken chairs and dirty hammock

This place was so disappointing. It looks cute in the photos, but it very dirty and not well maintained. The couch in the living room has multiple rips in the leather, and is held up by small pieces of wood. One of the showers has a nail sticking out of the wall which seems particularly unsafe. The Airbnb is not stocked with toilet paper or paper towels, we had to go out and buy our own. Also, the towels provided are disgusting and just old rags. If you are a clean freak, this place is NOT for you. All in all, we made the best of our weekend, but if you book this place bring your own TP and bath towels.
Didn‚Äôt meet expectations. Dirty dishes, dirty laundry and coffee in the pot, to start.  Communication was good but too many issues during my week long stay.
Okay overall just smells bad

The place is in a great location for downtown Austin. We experienced someone named Ben, unsure if a resident or employee. Ben watched us throughout the weekend, sat outside our door, and spoke to us a few times rather rudely.  When I messaged the host of this concern there was no response. There was also someone who came in our room and took linens and a key card out. During a pandemic it would have been nice to know people would be coming into our room and taking things out. We were also accused by Ben of smoking when none of us smoke. This was very frustrating and people should know about Ben before booking here.
Location 5 star.  Accuracy of property was spot on. Water pressure in shower not so good.
poor communication
This place was fire.

dont expect free parking since ot is dareinthe City Center.
sometimes it is a bit noisy again, it is in the City center. there is a wall with things to do. if possible visit the mckinney state park.

in walking distance you have congress, 6th street wirh bars and live music as well as the congress bridge with its bats. avoid tacodeli and one taco if possible.
Warning: please beware of beware infestation. It‚Äôs bad
Decently clean, quiet, convenient location, and friendly service. Front desk open 24/7. Nothing fancy but good for the price.
Not very accommodating. Almost was rejected from staying because of my Texas ID.
I've stayed in better hostels in 3rd world countries. Wheeling my suitcase through the streets of Austin from the parking garage several blocks away was a pain.

People walking around without masks, no parking at all. Had to park on street which is unsafe for my car because this is TENT CITY!!! Homeless people are reckless here and tried to get into my gas tank!! Why?!! I don‚Äôt even know!! I guess they wanted to drink my gas. It is true what they say about Austin, KEEP IT WEIRD

You get what you pay for. It was cheaper than a hotel, but as is the way of the world. Didn‚Äôt have any issues with the place, but one of the gentlemen that worked their was rude and seemed irritated that anyone was there at all. Other than that, everything down town is nearby, and there is a parking lot nearby that is currently free due to COVID I imagine.
Literally the worst Airbnb or hostel experience I‚Äôve ever had to deal with, and I‚Äôve done a lot of traveling.
They did not tell me they did not accept Austin residents and would not let me spend the night I was supposed to stay ,bad communication . And had to find a place last minute
Cool place to crash for a couple of days! The speakeasy is firee!!!
pretty on the outside but not clean or well managed when you really look
Nothing fun

tolle location zum Leute kennenlernen. Die Bar unten ist wunderbar. Allerdings habe ich herausgefunden, dass ich absolut kein Hostelmensch bin und nicht schlafen kann, wenn 4 leute im Raum derbe schnarchen und die anderen 3 ihr handy laut gestellt haben. Bin daher ein Tag eher rausgegangen

Location is good, the conditions are much worse than on the pictures. Stay there if you don‚Äôt have any other options.
Also there is a bar downstairs and can‚Äôt sleep because of the noise.
horrible

The house rules stated a quiet time from 12am to 8am. I had no issue with that, so I booked my stay. When I arrived, I found out that the downstairs bar would be open until 2am. I didn‚Äôt think anything of it until I arrived back at the hostel later in the evening and the music from the lounge was BLASTING, until 2AM. This music was SO LOUD that upstairs, laying in my bunk, I could still hear the music through earplugs, and feel the VIBRATION of the music. This was the worst night‚Äôs sleep I have ever experienced in a hostel, of the 30+ hostels I have stayed in over the years.

My complaint isn‚Äôt about the hours‚Äîit was a Saturday night in Austin, I get it‚Äîif I had known this in advance, if the information in the listing was correct, I simply would not have booked a stay here. I recommend updating this information so that it is crystal clear that anyone not partaking in the downstairs activities should plan to not be able to sleep until 2AM.

Location was great but the air conditioning does not work adequately enough for the Texas heat. Having 8 people to a room & tiny personal fans doesn‚Äôt cut it. It was literally cooler to sit outside at night than to try to sleep.
Also, not much room for bags in rooms.
Badly organised and unclean.
I was not happy with the conditions of the room offered to me..it was dirty,hot and not at all like the picture...I would not recommend..nor would I want my famly/relative to stay there
Very good location if u want to see the night life. Parking may be a bit problem (in the night) as they block off 6th street .

Buen ambiente tanto con el personal como con el resto de las personas alojadas. Una localizaci√≥n inmejorable para visitar Austin a pie y con conexiones sencillas a las estaciones de transporte. Repetir√≠a sin dudar, recomiendo!
war nun zum 2. Mal hier! Einfach ne klasse Lage!
The history alone in this place combined with the lounge and amenities makes this place in my top 10 hostels of all time!

Upside: people in the reception are helpful.
Downside: fills up quickly, 6th street nearby is just filthy,
unfortunately some junkies in the area near-by the hostel and in bus stations it's just so unpleasant for those on foot.

Une des meilleures auberges de jeunesse que j'ai pu trouver. Tr√®s bien situ√©, a proximit√© des tous les lieux de restauration et bars. A part le bruit lourd du bar d'en dessous qui se situe en dessous, √ßa reste bien. Pensez ainsi √† prendre les bouchons d'oreille √† l'accueil, sinon la nuit risque d'√™tre tr√®s longue.

Il manquerait √©ventuellement un billard/baby-foot et des remises sur les loisirs/tourisme aux alentours comme dans d'autres auberges.

One of the best hostel i found. Good localisation, near to all restaurants and bars. the noise from the bar just below is very loud, but it's ok. remember to take your earplugs or you'll pass a very ling night.

it's missing a pool/babyfoot, and discounts on activities/tourism as in others hostels

It was pretty dirty. I‚Äôm no germaphobe, but I found it very dingy. I dropped my phone in the crack between my bunk bed and the wall, and the floor and wall were black with grime and I don‚Äôt really know what.

I stayed in one of the coed dorms, and I was surprised that there wasn‚Äôt a curtain for my bunk bed. It was also very loud. In my room, I could hear every creak and sound.

All in all, it‚Äôs very cheap and centrally located, but I think it was just a little too gross for me personally.

My only complaints about the hostel are how loud it was and that its bar is too expensive.  I think it‚Äôs great that they have a bar, and it is really nice, but you can hear it from the second floor.  Also, the drinks are too expensive.  This is a hostel.  The drinks should be less expensive, not more expensive than the bars around it.  If you‚Äôre more expensive than 6th street, then there is something wrong.

I was very disappointed with this rental and the experience with the host. It all started when I tried to check in an hour early, as I had been traveling for 10 hours. I called the number I had been given for the management company in charge of the unit and was never able to speak to a person. I left several messages on the 2 extension numbers that were provided and never received a response. I reached out via the AirBnB thread and only received a response a few hours later. This was not our only problem. The unit was falsely advertised. There was no cable, which we had specifically requested as the weather was going to be bad and one of our guests was in late pregnancy; therefore, we were going to be spending a lot of time indoors. The sofa, love seat, and chairs were all ripped and any time you sat on them, white particles hung on to your clothing. We had to place sheets over the couch and chairs so that we could sit on them without ruining our clothing. There were also cracks in the floor throughout the unit. The worst part was that the shower handle was not working and when we reached out to the management company via phone, again we received no answer. By that time, we had been traveling for over 15 hours and were in dire need of the amenities. I reached out to Ryan via the AirBnB app and asked for someone to call us directly so we could explain the situation and no one ever did. Ryan attempted to troubleshoot through the AirBnB thread, which was not helpful. There was no way to send pictures or videos through the AirBnB thread, which Ryan had asked for, so I asked for a direct number to send them, and one was never provided. Finally, after a back and forth of over 2 hours, Ryan said AirBnB would be contacting us to resolve the issue. They never did. We called AirBnB and asked for a refund as we had been trying to resolve this issue for over 3 hours without any resolution and would be leaving in the morning. AirBnB refunded us about 65% of what we paid. This is an extremely disappointing rental, I caution anyone who is looking to stay in Austin; do not stay here. Although the location is great, the management and amenities are extremely poor.

Great location for those who want to be in the center of the hustle and bustle for a good price! I was a little weary of being a woman walking alone in the area at night but the Fay wasn‚Äôt too bad so maybe just be cautious and aware of your surroundings anyways in the Austin Area.

The photos of this property must have been taken 10 years ago. The property is in terrible shape. To give you a mental picture... imagine a cheaply decorated fraternity flat after 4 years of college partying, in a run down building. Just gross.
One of the beds was broken and if you were to lay down on the mattress it fell to the floor on one side. The AC didn't work. There was an inch of dust on the air return. The host said he couldn't get anyone out to "approve" the air not working and completely ignored the fact that one of the beds was unusable and we wouldn't have anywhere to sleep. I'm still fighting for a refund which is INSANE. I've never had a bad experience with Air bnb but this situation will make me extra cautious in the future.

Ideal location.  Don‚Äôt count on the pool.  It was locked even though 100+ our entire stay.  I understand it is one of the original apartment buildings in the downtown area.  So the whole building looks to need TLC.  I felt that the apartment is not well cleaned between stays.  They may disinfect but that does not a clean apartment make.

Location is excellent.....only a few blocks away from food and bars. Cold A/C and amenities were all present and working. Had a leak, but someone came out quickly after I messaged the owner. Would stay again.
The apartment numbering was confusing. It took me a little wandering around to figure out where it was.

We were disappointed because the decoration was tired with many marks and dirty walls. There were also only 2 mugs and 2 knives in apartment advertised for four. There were four of us. We would not stay again.

Based on location alone, i don't feel like i got ripped off. The flat was also clean, with clean towels and linen. However, the host explained before the trip that they had moved the ‚Äòaria suite‚Äô to a different apartment number within the same building. This would have been totally fine, if the new aria suite wasn't so under stocked, and broken.  I wonder if we were the guinea pigs to stay in this new flat since the switch?  Who knows. The heater didn't work the 1st night - which is out of their control, and they fixed it as fast as possible. Which would have been great, except they entered the flat without our permission, ignoring and / or not seeing my request that we be there to let them in. From there, everything else was fairly minor, but mainly just annoying / inconsiderate. When you're paying over $2k for 4 nights, one could expect a certain mix of miscellaneous amenities that go a long way. For instance - ice trays, and dishwasher soap. There's more but cant recollect.  Ad says microwave - there's no microwave. Things that were broken - light in bedroom, shower head / shower valve, etc. The host sends automated messages prior to, and throughout the trip, and responds to messages when not busy. Nearly absent was the AIRBNB style feel were used to - and it shows.

The apartment was not what was pictured in the listing. It's an entirely different unit but just has the same art on the wall. Very misleading. There isn't an island in the kitchen and the fridge is not a side by side with a water and ice dispenser. Also the place is very dirty and dusty. I had to clean all the surfaces and sweep the floor before the rest of our guest got there.
Apartment was dirty. Seems like others staying in the same complex had the same issue. Other than that it was as advertised

CAT FISHED! This air bnb is NOT what you see in the photos so BEWARE. We booked in January and stayed in October and yet this air bnb listing has yet to be updated. The unit looks like it has not been dusted since it was built, all the baseboards and fans are lined with thick black layers of dust. Don‚Äôt even bother to check under the beds. We had two bathrooms and booked for 5 nights with only 4 rolls of toilet paper. When we asked for more our messages were ignored. However we were asked to strip all beds and start the dishwasher even though we‚Äôre charged a cleaning fee. The nearby streets are filled with homeless people and the smell of piss. Wouldn‚Äôt recommend to my biggest enemy.

I don't write bad reviews but in this case I decided to publish one.
We are two scientists from San Francisco who were visiting Austin for business. We needed a decent place near our meeting point to crash for two nights.
While Ryan's place looked really good, the absence of any type of sound insulation made this stay a torture for both of us! The studio is on the street level on the corner with two walls and two windows along these streets. With absolutely no soundproof, we could not sleep at all since we were listening to people chatting, laughing, vomiting and urinating just couple of feet from our pillows and beds!
This is terrible experience! And this should be communicated in the property description!
When I contacted Ryan to complain, Ryan told me that he cannot be responsible for the natural city noise and that this building was build in 1980-ies.

I was living in 14-16 century homes in many loudest cities around the globe and never experience anything like this! And this is correct, Ryan cannot be responsible for the natural city noise but he MUST fix the noise proof in his property! Or give people know that they need to prepare for some "city experience"!

Great stay! Can‚Äôt beat the location. Stayed Friday-Tuesday and not sure if it was a dud weekend, but did not experience the noise others spoke on. A few times people walking around the street were loud but nothing ongoing or enough to feel unsafe or annoyed.
Ryan gave very clear instructions! Place was very clean and had everything you needed. The unit was was the closest to the street so you could hear people walking by. But wasn‚Äôt a problem at night

The unit itself was nice (except for the ants in the kitchen). The neighborhood is not very walker friendly if you‚Äôre out walking alone and the response from the on-site manager was NONE. I called them twice and left messages and she never called me back. Finally, the directions on where to park were not very clear and even though there were at least 40 open spaces there, our rental car was towed from inside the locked garage and it cost us $250 to get back with NO sympathy from the host. I would not stay there again!
great location but cleanliness of the place was horrible

Tl;dr RUN. Do not stay at this listing or any of Ryan's Austin listings. Poor communication so I couldn't check in after a long drive. Dirty and broken appliances. AC breaking and pouring water into the unit at 2 AM. Host unpleasant to deal with. Was moved to two different units Ryan owned due to broken AC and experienced a lot of the same issues in each one. For all my trouble I was refunded less than a single night's stay for a stay of nearly three weeks. DO NOT STAY AT ANY OF RYAN'S PROPERTIES!

Units are not in numerical order (they appear to be random order, going from the low teens to the 40s to the 30s within a few units of each other and no consistency between different floors) so I struggled to find my unit when I arrived. Tried contacting host with Airbnb message and phone call. No response. I went to get some food. No response. Three hours later and I had no assistance or help. I had to wander all over the building complex one floor at a time with people staring at me to find my unit. After that, the parking information was inaccurate. I was told to park in a specific spot in my welcome instructions (G2 I believe?) But there was no G2. I contacted the host again and waited. No response until I found what appeared to be a private number and called that. Host tried to tell me to call back later! I told him that was unacceptable and finally got help. Host claimed that the HOA had repainted the parking lines without telling them and to just park in "Onyx Hotels Guest". A completely stressful and miserable experience checking in. I should have known my entire stay was going to be a big issue here but I was so tired from my drive that I reasoned the hard part was done and the rest would be okay. (It was not.)

When I entered I noticed a foul smell. I tracked it to the washing machine and found it absolutely full of black mold. There was no bleach in the unit to just run a cleaning cycle. The host told me I'd have to just go buy my own and scrub out the machine myself.

I also noticed the AC was making a weird noise (located in the ceiling above the closet). I told them I was concerned the condensate was not draining appropriately. I got no response to this.

The unit was missing small things I'd expect in an Airbnb. No hand soap in kitchen. No rinse aid for dish washer. Non stick pans were all scratched up (which is dangerous). There were no cleaning supplies to wipe up spills which I'd think would be especially nice to provide during a respiratory pandemic. I was told if I wanted any cleaning supplies I'd have to buy them myself. There was also no washing machine detergent which I had to buy myself again.

Several days into my stay, I was awoken at 2 AM to water pouring through my ceiling from the AC unit (after they had ignored my request to have someone check it out). I put down towels and pots to catch the water and turned the AC off. I tried the phone number and the message system but there was no response. So I texted Ryan's personal number. I do not recommend this. He was unpleasant when we exchanged texts, telling me how he had "over 150 units" and he's still there 24/7 for his guests and that he was "sorry you're so upset". Never once made an actual apology for how abysmal my experience was, left that up to his property manager.

AC tech got sent out the next day. They did what they thought was a temporary fix. But within a few hours water was pouring from the ceiling again. This would result in me being moved to a different unit of Ryan's in the same complex. This unit, as it turns out, also had broken AC (which I found out after I'd already scrubbed the mold in this washing machine with bleach I'd been forced to purchase and discovered the dish washer was broken). So I was moved to a third unit in the same complex. The AC worked fine here throughout the rest of my stay. However, the garbage disposal broke, the dish washer broke (had to wash all my dishes by hand), I couldn't get hot water to the master bathroom shower (even though a repair person came out multiple times, I just gave up and used a different shower with hot water), and the kitchen was gross (dirty cups with lip stains and dried drinks at the bottom, a spoon with rancid butter on it shoved in a drawer, spiders spilling out of the knife block when I pulled a knife out).

What did I get to compensate such a bad time over the course of three weeks? I was refunded less than a single night's stay.

As I found out, Ryan (the host) is not the one you're speaking with over the Airbnb account even though it says you're speaking with Ryan. To speak to Ryan, you need to use his personal cell number. Ryan will get irritated if you suggest he let guests know they aren't speaking to Ryan over the Airbnb messages that say you're speaking to Ryan. But so much was lost in communication using texts and Airbnb messages because I was talking to two different people and never knew. Once I had a direct line to the property manager for all future problems (and there were many) communication was prompt and polite.

The only nice thing of my stay was the location and the support staff. The staff was always timely and polite. It's clear to me that they're understaffed and overworked.

Miserable experience. Could not recommend this unit or any of Ryan's 150+ units

I dont typically write reviews for stays but just thought I should post a buyers beware. This building is old. Expect maintenance issues. In the first 10 days I spent here the water was shut off twice for maintenance without any warning. The ceiling leaked once. The location is convenient if you want to stay in the downtown, but consider the risk and compare it to the price.

I would not stay here again. At nearly $1000 for four nights, I could‚Äôve stayed somewhere that didn‚Äôt have only two nasty shower towels and washcloths that looked like they should have been replaced years ago. The sheets were not clean, nor was the bedding for the pull out sofa couch. There was a pool on site, but no beach towels. The coffee maker pre-set option was broken. The TV in the bedroom offered one channel that was worthless. No laundry detergent. Uncomfortable furniture. Just no.

The unit was okay, except there were no extra blankets, sheets or pillow covers for the pullout bed. The refrigerator was broken and the circuit breakers kept going out. We had to turn off all the lights and run one thing at a time, be it the washer or the hair dryer, etc. There were no hangers for some reason so the closet was kind of useless. We contacted the host about these things and he didn't deliver extra sheets or blankets until our last day. We asked for a partial refund for the multiple inconveniences, especially since the fridge waS broken and we had to eat out every night. He offered $100, which didn't really cover much. I attempted to have a conversation about it and he told us that we could "submit a change date request and check out early" if we didn't like his offer. I attempted to call him to have a conversation and he did not respond. If you're looking for a responsive and hospitable host, Ryan is not for you.

Unfortunately, we did not have the best experience with Ryan. We arrived at 2am and the code for our door did not work and after trying to contact them for 20 minutes with no answer, ended up going to a hotel across the street where the concierge said that this was a common occurence. Luckily, Airbnb was nothing but wonderful and negotiated a full refund for us. Thank you Airbnb!

We enjoyed our stay, the accomodations are nice.  We had an early morning flight and during our departure we were trapped in the parking area.  We tried to use the gate remote that we had been using all week and nothing we could do would open either gate.  We called to contact number and explained our situation and that if we couldn't get out we would miss our flight.  To this day, we have received no response from the management.  We called again begging to get us any info on how to get out.  We were trapped.  The gates wouldn't open.  We had to make other arrangements to get out and just barely made our flight after over an hour and a half of trying to get out.  We never received a call or anything.  As far as the management is concerned we are still trapped in the parking area.

Unfortunately my experience was bad. Really bad.
All, absolutely all the houses in the world have a table. Well, this place does NOT have a table. Not a very basic one. They also do not say in the ad that there is a dog and cat loose on the property; those of us who are allergic and phobic should know this in advance.
Communication with the hostess VERY bad.
In short: a very bad experience. I do not recommend this site at all.
If Airbnb is honest, they will post this review without makeup. AE

The inside property is great, but I I had a very bad experience with their management company (Turnkey). If you are used to dealing directly with the apartment owner or a small hosting company that cares, you may be disappointed with them. Three main issues: (1) Initially their key code didn't work and they refused to speak to my guest (who was the first to arrive at the house) on the phone to help her.  (2) Upstairs deck, backyard and furniture was covered in dirt/dry leaves. They said it was due to it raining after they had cleaned it and not their fault, and refused to even credit the cleaning fee. When I first reported the incident, they made me jump through hoops to even agree to send a cleaner (did 3 phone calls, different people asking for photo evidence and more details, scheduled a cleaning but didn't show up). They finally cleaned it, but had no empathy that they handed us a dirty house and then made it really hard to get it remedied as if I wanted to spend so much time on my vacation talking to their team. (3) They have a 10am check out and wouldn't let us check out even 30mins later. The cleaning lady even showed up 10 mins earlier than check out. I have never been in an Airbnb that didn't allow me to stay at least until 11am since 10am is so early/unusual.
My vehicle was vandalized while staying here. I did not have a good experience at all.
The landing is dangerous - do not stay here if you have a hard time climbing or sleepwalk. You have to wear shoes to climb the loft because it is bare pipe screwed to a wall. It was very clean.

There were a lot of problems with the fridge; One of the first things we did when we got there was get groceries and were very disappointed when everything we bought spoiled in 36 hours or less due to the fridge not being cold AT ALL. This then forced us to eat out almost every single meal(definitely not what we planned financially for). We even googled how to work it just incase the last people who stayed had messed with the temperature setting (still didn‚Äôt work).

Other than that, we didn‚Äôt have very many other major problems and truly enjoyed our stay!

This house was in a great location in Austin. Unfortunately, the place had quite a few bugs, the AC would not cool the space below 75 and the bed was extremely uncomfortable. My partner and I left in the middle of the night to stay somewhere else due to the bed causing severe back pain. Overall I wouldn‚Äôt recommend staying here for the price.

Overall place did not seem thoroughly cleaned after last use. The front bathroom toilet seat was broken and both sinks would not drain properly. There was a broken bar stool seat in the kitchen. One of the light fixtures was broken. Sheets didn‚Äôt seem clean  there was left over residue on some of the bunk beds. Miscellaneous junk stored in all the cabinets, missing essential utensils. I thought it was a bit overpriced for the quality. The pictures were misleading. Overall the Airbnb sufficed for our group since our other Airbnb canceled. But would not stay here again.

The entire place looked like it had not been cleaned in months. The sheets were dirty, and we had to re-wash them. The floors needed to be both swept and mopped. There were numerous stains on the carpet and couch. We had to cover the couches with sheets to sit on them. The back yard was full of trash (cigarettes, beer cans). Also, there was a dead bird in the backyard. Lastly, the sliding door that leads to the backyard does not lock.

Where do I even begin. I booked this place for location + prior reviews for my bachelorette party.. all I can say now is DO NOT BOOK HERE! First it all began Friday morning. We were told at the end of September that we could check in early on Friday or even the night before which I thought was wonderful. My sister drove 3 hours to only arrive to the place and have the code not work. I message the owner and he replied with another working code. Once she walked in she noticed someone was SLEEPING IN THE HOUSE! It was totally unsafe for her to do this not know what she was walking into. I immediately called him and he had no idea why someone was there and I was never informed either. This already ticked me off considering she needed to get in their and decorate plus the situation was unsafe. His communication through this was shit. I would send multiple texts to his phone and I would get a 3-5 worded response an hour later. After a response was given and he talked to I guess his ‚Äòproperty manager‚Äô he said that the person sleeping there would be out by 11 and maids would come then. I didn‚Äôt think this was fair at all considering we booked this place and they get the joy of just sleeping in while she waiting in her car. The maids didn‚Äôt arrive till 11:45 and did a terrible job cleaning. The maids told my sister she would have to put the bedding in the dryer and back on the beds if needed and just left. We were also suppost to be given parking passes for the garage which were no where to be found on the counter. When I texted him about this issue it took an hour to respond and all I got was ‚ÄòI suspended towing‚Äô. Okay didn‚Äôt know you could do that but at this point I was over it. The weekend went on and when i arrived Friday evening the pictures on Airbnb and what is in person do not match. The whole house looks terrible things are broken, the couch was totally different, no rugs, no bathroom towels at all, barley any toilet paper, no trash bags .. I could go on and on it basically wasn‚Äôt anywhere near ready for people to stay for the price we paid for this weekend. Come Sunday morning for check out we did what we needed to do than came down to the parking garage and realize my friends care was TOWED!! She was pissed and thank goodness her car has a tracker because we were never notified by ANYONE where her car was even taken or when. We would of had no way to find it. I ended up texting him this and all he replied was ‚ÄòI can Venmo her $100‚Äô like we don‚Äôt want your money we want this shitty place to be fixed or a refund. She thankfully didn‚Äôt have to pay the towing fee because I had the text messages between the owner and I stating he suspended towing but the situation still happened when I didn‚Äôt need to. All in all I would never recommend you stay here please just go look somewhere else and avoid the headache that I had to go through.
If you think this property looks like the one in the web. you will be sadly mistaken and feel like you've been punked. Horrible Horrible.... not a lot of amenities available for guest to use.

This Air bnb needs a THOROUGH cleaning and updated maintenance. When my group first arrived, there was a dog poop stain on the carpet, a broken cabinet, beds were unmade (sheets folded and laid on each bed), a broken towel holder, ripped couch, and leftover bachelorette party d√©cor from the previous group. While the location of the Air BNB is a great,  the apartment complex itself is not. There was constant noise from the upstairs neighbors, especially from 12-4 AM and the complex reeked of weed.
Do not plan on cooking anything in the kitchen - not equipped.   Location great
Unfortunately had to cancel our trip due to covid restrictions. I was disappointed that there was no refund.
You won‚Äôt be disappointed with the cute bungalow.
Be sure that the windows have been fixed before booking. At least 3 ground floor windows were not able to be locked. Very insecure.
No thank you.

I have been staying at airbnbs for a very long time and have had almost entirely positive experiences with hosts and properties. Some of my hosts have even become friends. However, this was one of the more frustrating airbnb experiences I have had. When I arrived (at night), there were three lights out in the house, including the only lamp in the living room and the main kitchen light out. The first lamp I tried to move into the living room from the bedroom was also out. They said to look for light bulbs but I couldn't find them anywhere (turns out they were in a locked closet). We had a cold front come in and it was cold in the house. When I tried to turn on the heat, the system was blasting cold air. I reached out to the host and I was told "just give it time to warm up." I then explained it had been on for 30 minutes. I sent pictures of the temperature dropping from 64 to 59 in the house. After a frustrating back and forth via the messenger app (no one called me) which basically involved the host assuming I was just using the thermostat wrong  I was then told to call the number on the thermostat to trouble shoot it, which of course was a business line and it was after hours so I just got a voicemail. Someone finally called me around 9pm (not the person I had been communicating with) to say they were sending someone out by 11pm to look at it. I told them that I wasn't comfortable being there alone with a repair person that late at night and asked if one of them was coming to meet them. Nobody involved in the property was planning to be there, so I told them they could either send someone the next day or one of them could come that night to meet the repair person. They didn't want to come that night so they asked when would work the next day. I told them I was working from the airbnb and I needed quiet and privacy and would be done by 1:30pm so they could come in the afternoon. I tried to just turn the system off and it wouldn't turn off and I couldn't find a breaker box, so the a/c ran all night.  By the time I finally got to bed on that night after trying myself to fix and trouble shoot the heater, when I opened the bed, there was hair in the sheets.  I took pictures but was so frustrated with everything else and it was so late I just didn't even mention it to them. I assume someone slept there and the sheets didn't get changed. The next morning, even though I had explained that I needed to work from the airbnb in the morning I was told that someone would be coming at 9am which was when I needed to be getting ready for work. I had to insist that someone managing the property come and meet that person so I could get ready for my day instead of managing repairs. They sent someone over thank goodness. Turns out the thermostat was broken. The person who came on Saturday was very nice and apologetic and offered to change the lightbulbs later that day, but by that point I was so frustrated, I just wanted to get out of the place. All in all, staying at this airbnb was entirely too much coordinating with people who were not communicating with each other and have unrealistic expectations that their airbnb guests should be troubleshooting the issues in their property. Someone involved in managing the property should have offered to come look at the thermostat and make a plan when it wasn't working that night.  I liked the space, but would not stay there again, as it doesn't seem they are proactive about making sure the space is ready for guests or that the guest has a positive experience in the property.

Nicely appointed studio, clean, but the upstairs neighbor was ridiculously loud, kids running, yelling, gates slamming...thin walls/ceiling, you hear everything. I realize this is not in Roberto‚Äôs control, but it was an issue.

The listing is very misleading. The ‚Äòfree onsite parking‚Äô is actually street parking and none of it is onsite. There are very few street spots available where the host indicates parking can be found. The number of beds in this listing is actually one double bed. There is a couch but it is not a pullout or sleeper-sofa. There are no other beds even though the listing says 1 Queen, 1 Double, and 2 sleeper-sofas. The max occupancy for comfort is 2 adults and 1-2 children (if they will sleep on a couch). The upstairs neighbors, as other reviews have already pointed out, are up and moving around very early and they wear cement blocks for shoes.

This BnB felt like an unkept bachelor pad. Dirty towels were left on the floor, shower was dirty, dirty dishes left in the sink, and trash was not taken out.
Owner was easy to reach out to, however when asked about the towels was left with no response.
Parking instructions were very unclear and getting through the gate was a huge headache.
Unlikely I will stay here again.
The house was amazing during sxsw. Very close to coffee shops and taco spots. Also close Enuff but far Enuff to stay out of the messy traffic!!

First of all, Colleen was a great host, she was very responsive to all my inquiries and helped me out. I stayed for an entire month and I have no complains about the room itself. For what I paid for, is a small studio apartment but it had everything I need for the day to day. This is not a good place if you plan to work from home because the Internet connection is unstable and it doesn't have a table that you can use as a desk. But other than that, if you'll mostly use it for sleeping there and spending a few hours during the day, this is more that enough. Keep in mind that the complex needs some maintenance, but the room itself was exactly a showed in the pictures.

Pictures portray upscale accommodations, but there were two broken sofas, crumbs under the cushions and hair in the kitchen drawers. Broken sofas counted as sleeping accommodations. The bunk beds upstairs were unsteady. Most of the kitchen drawers were broken. The bathtub could not be used. We left and requested refund for two nights, which was declined.

Cosmic was a very accommodating and gracious host. They were very responsive and attentive to our needs throughout our stay in Austin. Overall, I'd say that the pictures depicted the inside space quite well. This is a two bedroom  unit and 1.5 baths (note that the 1/2 bath is a jack & jill style where it attaches to the main full bathroom and one of the guest bedrooms - so you will not be able to freely access it without going through one of those. My only takeaway for future guests, is I would not necessarily advise you to stay here alone as the neighborhood is not in the safest of neighborhoods. We did not feel comfortable walking from the Airbnb and decided best to take Ubers instead. The plus side is the unit is tucked back off the street behind another set of bungalows, so we did feel safe inside. Overall, a clean space, hospitable host, but unfortunately just not in a great area.
Host was slow to respond. Description didn't mention an in-law suite which is shared with other guests and parking was very inconvenient.

This place was very cute and overall, a great place to stay at! My one big downside is that the water pressure in the shower was really bad. I had read reviews beforehand and they are very true; the water pressure is very slow in the shower. Also parking was not always fun with the other cars that made it very difficult to back out. It‚Äôs close to the city but not super close to where we could walk so the location was eh but we should‚Äôve done more research on our part.
Close place to most things, parking can get tight. The shower head barely works(no pressure at all), the tv doesn‚Äôt work unless you have a Roku or fire stick. Cute place.
The place was good, we didn‚Äôt have that much trouble with parking luckily. The shower pressure is bad, but it does the job for a couple days.
Smells of mold and Bugs, don‚Äôt waste your time. And cancellation policy makes it impossible to get your money back once you see how dingy it is.

Had a cockroach crawl on my face while i was sleep! Look around and saw 3 others next to the bed. Spiders and spider webs under the bed, in the corners of the walls, and everywhere u could think of. Nasty!
Don‚Äôt stay hear. Horrible service.

Microwave was broken and overall description had many inaccuracies - i.e the descriptions says single level without stairs, which is not accurate - we had 3 kids with us one of which is a crawling 9 month old, so that was an important detail

we paid Valerie an additional $350 to have the pool heated and it was not heated despite the fact that we let her know and paid ahead of time. We reached out to Valerie, but no resolution was provided and she actually stopped responding.

the dishwasher had a constant pool of dirty water in that wouldn‚Äôt drain - the dishwasher was still running when we got there from the previous guests when we unloaded it the dishes were all gritty and had old food particles still stuck to it. tried rewashing them, but still gross so I just had to hand wash everything.

To be completely honest, if you are looking for a pool-hang getaway, I would look elsewhere. The interior of the house is wonderful. But the backyard was disappointing. The grill was not the same as advertised, the yard was dirty, there were untrimmed dead bushes surrounding the pool, and the pool itself was quite dirty too. We also couldn't turn the hot tub on and the contact we were given for any pool / hot tub needs never responded to us. Overall we had a lovely time, it's just that the price is a little too high for what you actually get.
Didn't offer anythingfor the rat I had to kill that ate some bananas,  the house should be rat free for now.

This review will be a PRO and CON review. So the pros.. location is so good! Just blocks from so many restaurants, walking paths, and 6th Street. The space was quaint. The back patio was nice to have when we wanted to sit outside. The washer, dryer, fridge, dishwasher, and stove were very convenient.

Now the cons... I‚Äôve never stayed in an Airbnb that was so dirty and scarce on basic things. The first thing I noticed was that there was no doormat, and we were constantly tracking in dirt from how sandy it was outside. Then there were dead bugs everywhere. We had to sweep immediately upon arrival and had to continue sweeping up dead bugs.

There is also Packing tape around the doors, maybe as a way to keep bugs out or the AC in. Then we noticed the flooring in the kitchen was coming up by just walking on it.

There is not adequate parking and though we were told we could park in the alley, neighbors who also use the alley would honk at us as they passed. There is one window unit and it is not adequate for cooling the whole place. We understand heat, we are from south Mississippi. So this isn‚Äôt a review from someone who just doesn‚Äôt know how to deal with heat. The kitchen would be so hot that we could not really enjoy cooking, or even just having a meal when we got take out.

The bed was comfy, but the pillows were all yellowed with stains. The bathroom floor needed cleaning. Roach poo on the sink was not so appealing.

There is a pull out sofa as the listing indicates, but it‚Äôs in the bedroom and if it was folded out, it blocks the bathroom. Not ideal.

We have stayed on lots of Airbnb‚Äôs and this is the dirtiest one we have ever been to. For a $175 cleaning fee, I expected much more.

Beautiful spacious property and a great location but there is no parking and no gym access for saunders guests.
I would stay here again but probably bring my own paper towels and toilet paper as they are using the cheap stuff for both!

My group was excited to stay at this Airbnb in Austin, but a horrible ice storm hit the area.  The governor declared a state of emergency as there were widespread power outages and dangerous road conditions.  Because of this, we were unable to make it to Austin.  Sonder refused to work with us at all to reschedule or refund our trip...they even kept the cleaning fee even though nobody ever used the rental.  Sonder had no compassion for a situation that was out of our control... I would not recommend staying in a Sonder rental anywhere.
Worst experience, dryer didn‚Äôt work, water in toilet running. And dirty.

My boyfriend and I really enjoyed our stay at The Sonder. Often times, vacation implies relaxation and letting your guard down from the throws of daily stress, to the detriment of your mental agility. During our stay here, we didn't have to worry about our minds getting rusty when it came down to crunch time decisions, such if you should roll the dice (who says you can't gamble in Austin?) with ambiguous parking suggestions or pay $34 dollars to park overnight at the Hyatt to remove any doubt of towing. For us, the answer was clear. What's $136 dollars to leave your car in a space for 4 nights, when you really think about it. Or if you just kind of think about it, which is the modus operandi we followed and recommend to find a semblance of tranquility while staying here. As we approached the building we saw the beautifully decorated lobby. We got a very very good look from the outside because the code to the lobby didn't work the entire time we were there. We aired this grievance to The Sonder, but "no one else had a problem so it should work." It's fine, it finally gave us an opportunity to yell HOLD THE DOOR to the elite guests who were granted access. Once inside the unit, you can walk towards the large window and take in the views of surrounding buildings you could've stayed at. As you're overlooking and absorbing the echoes of the volleyball court below, you'll feel a slight breeze. As if the living room invites nature in for tea, or because the backdoor isn't capable of closing. The back door does not close. The good news is, once the grievance was aired, there was a resolution within 48 hours. Instructions were provided on how to close a door. They didn't work, but you'd be remiss to not appreciate instructions on how to close a patio door.
I'd also like to comment on the name Sonder. you're realizing everyone has a life as complicated as your own, more so if they decided to book through the same avenue and invite worry with regards to a gate code, parking space and back door insulation.
I was expecting something a little newer and more polished. Somewhat disappointed.

Worst  Airbnb experience. Upon my arrival, I received an email from Sonder that the digital code to enter condo was not working and to request a key fob from the front desk. I arrived at The Catherine, and the front desk had no idea what I was talking about. Several calls to Sonder, they called and instructed the front desk  to give me the key fob which ended up not working (front desk personnel even tried to help me gain access) Sonder had no onsite property management available that evening so I had to find another place to stay (it was already late Saturday evening).  While Sonder did offer another place to stay; it was not in the same location and a part of Austin that one would not feel safe in. I requested Sonder Management to call back to discuss the event (I wanted to ensure this would not happen to another guest) but I still have heard nothing.

Spectacular space and views.   2 balconies, private rooftop bar, pool, etc.  All 1st class.  But, there is no parking.  NONE.  It isn't available in the garage, and it costs $50/night (more if you come and go) at the hotel next door.  It's Texas, so that is a big deal.
Very lowly maintained. Would not recommend.

Pros: Well equipped, clean place, located at a quiet neighbourhood. Friendly host.
Cons: To get public transportation you need to walk 15min (30min after 11PM) with buses every half an hour. Water pressure is not the best and you have to wait several minutes to get hot water. Noisy floor and doors could be annoying specially if you come back at night and don't wanna wake up anybody. Room gets colder through the night.
No comments
Not what we expected, unfortunately. The bathroom and kitchen were not cleaned very well and the art in the bedroom was a bit off-putting. The double shower was nice though.

This spot has everything. Location, hip decor, kitchen well equipped and hosts were at the ready for all requests at the drop of a hat. We stay in air b and b's consistently year to year and on our next visit to Austin, this will be our choice if it is available. Walking distance from anything you could ask for! Killer stay

The house is beautiful inside and out, but its right behind a bar so late at night you will have drunk people yelling and fighting right in front of the house while they walk back to their cars.  There is an alley that runs along side of the house which is very unsafe. The alley area is not well lit and with the combination of the large homeless population and drunk people, you have a recipe for disaster.  During our stay we had somebody throw a rock through the window that faced the alley.  Luckily no one got hurt.  Also the way the host handled the situation was not very efficient.  After I contacted her, she sent a person to fix the window.  This guy didn‚Äôt even knocked on the door.  He just punched in the code and walked in with me being in the property.  The way he fixed the window was with tape and a piece of cardboard. I then tried to contact the host but it was like she dropped from the face of the earth. She never replied to any of my messages.  I guess she thought she had done enough to keep us and the property safe by sending a guy to tape cardboard to the window.
This place is so close to bars, restaurants and Austin attractions. You won‚Äôt be disappointed!

The host team must have suffered the consequence from a  prior guest stay and their cleaning crew.  The TV was cracked.  And the coverings for the beds were stained and the pillows and sheets had hair in multiple places.   Then there was the cockroach in the kitchen and an orphaned slipper on the bedroom floor.   It did not give us confidence of a good unit turn.   Most disappointing was that there were no apologies or acknowledgement of the issues.  I was offered $104 cleaning back out of $302 with no additional communications even after I filed for dispute resolution.   We had to spend $200+ additionally for a hotel stay because there was no way one can stay in a place where there was ample doubt whether the unit even got cleaned.   Disappointed at the lack of communication and ownership of the issues.
Good space for a work retreat and videoshoot. Location offers a killer view of downtown.

The toilet was broken, the garbage disposal was clogged, the floors in the kitchen were super sticky, the living room rug was wet, the bed sheets smelled of mildew, some bath towels were stained, and there was dust everywhere. The place looks nice, but the amenities were lacking. They are no closets and the master bedroom curtains does not close. No blinds in the living room so there is no privacy at night from the publics view. To be honest, this was one of the worst airbnb i have ever stayed in.

Minimal sound insulation between floors so if you're unlucky enough to have loud, roller-skate wearing party animals staying in the apartment upstairs, you might struggle to get shut-eye at night.

Location is convenient - loved having a Whole Foods nearby, but the area does not feel super safe at night. Gentrifying neighborhood.

CONS: Lack of towels and washcloths. No area rugs in the bedrooms or living space, if you do not have slippers or socks your feet will be very very cold. No window treatments in the living room so daytime TV watching is a no go because of the glare. If you have to arrive early you are unable to store your luggage onsite which makes it extremely difficult to roam the city if you arrive earlier in the day. Cooking was also a challenge due to there being very few utensils, no foil, no cling wrap, or even ziplock bags. Lastly, the bedroom attached to the balcony gets serious HWY noise! It was very hard to get any sleep in that room. One of the bedrooms had a broken picture frame and the bed was also broken.

PROS: Good location, great views of the city lights, and the beds were pretty comfortable and we all did enjoy the day beds in the living room.

The photos led us to believe that the stay would be quite luxurious when in reality it was all underwhelming and not tended to.
