Dust on furniture, odd smell from cabinets, no ice or water from fridge and no ice trays to make up for it, no control over A/C so it was blazing hot indoors (something most Texas rentals have figured out),  misleading photos regarding size of the space (can‚Äôt pull chairs out to use dining table or breakfast bar), hand soap in lieu of body wash, empty conditioner bottles and all around an odd stay.

Beautiful view of the city from the living room but the space it‚Äôs self was dirty. You couldn‚Äôt walk on the floors barefoot without them turning black. The living room rug needed to be thrown out! It was awful. Living room bed was broken. Only 4 towels for a listing that sleeps over 10 people. No ice, the management did end up bringing ice trays and a few more towels half way through our stay. They also repaired the bed during our stay. Their communication was great.
But the space was not what we expected. Would not stay in the space again but would check out other places they host because the communication was great. Overall, the place needs to be cleaned and touched up. Broken art, dented up fridge and dirty walls just made the space seem over used and kinda beat up. There was also no added value or little charming things about the space. Kinda had the bare minimum when it came to things.

I could see this place working for college age students but for a group of mature 50 plus women it was disappointing. The place itself was very 'tired" : needs to be painted, ceiling tiles in kitchen visibly dirty, chunks of painted spray insulation from pipes missing, bedroom rugs dirty.The rules are quite strict yet the amenities are few: cheap bedding, no bathroom mats outside of showers, limited kitchen supplies, no dish towels or pot holders, no iron (I purchased 1 & left in unit) but ironing board. The location is convenient but very loud as it sits next to highway with a group of homeless who approached & harassed us while waiting for Uber. It should be noted that one has to walk/carry bags up 2 flights of stairs so for people with young kids or heavy bags it could pose an additional inconvenience.

*be forewarned* this place will send you a laundry list of items that they WILL charge you extra fee‚Äôs for. this is a corporation of thieves. we stayed here for one nite and when we checked in there was a leak that started in the living room. i messaged jason immediately and he said ‚Äúoh it must be from a mop bucket or someone spilled‚Äù. he didn‚Äôt send anyone to check on it. this kept leaking thru the nite and we had to use our limited bath towels to keep it at bay. additionally, the wifi wasn‚Äôt working. they charge for everything including per person, if you don‚Äôt take the trash out, or if you mess up a bed etc. but god forbid the place is flooding or there‚Äôs no internet. they won‚Äôt address it until after you leave!!! DO NOT RECOMMEND. Jason was a terrible communicator. DO NOT STAY HERE. NOT AS ADVERTISED ###

We were very disappointed in our stay at our air bnb. One of the beds was broken in our air bnb. The toilet in the bathroom also would not flush and did not work our entire stay. Our entire bathroom flooded and the water went into the bedroom and ruined some of our items. The bathrooms smelled of urine and was very unclean. Both showers were also very dirty with mold.
The refrigerator was not working when we first arrived.
Our host was prompt with his responses and sent the maintenance man over to look at the issues however the bathroom and bed were not working our entire stay.
Nothing short of perfect!

I was happy with the location. Sadly, that‚Äôs about it.
I do not believe it is worth the value in its current state. Michael was pleasant enough during check in however, I stayed there a month and not once was there any further communication, even just to reach out and ask if there was anything I needed or simply how my stay is going. I would not say that I‚Äôm a clean freak but I was dissatisfied with the cleanliness of it. Every rug, big and small, was really dirty. On check in there were still dirty dishes in the washer. A light fixture hanging loosely broken from the ceiling. Not enough hangers. Not enough utensils. A bathroom tub that is peeling so severely I had to buy bath mats. Yikes!
Ceiling fan in the bedroom makes an odd loud sound which was hard to ignore. Patches of spackle paste on walls. Unfortunately, it did not meet my expectations. The place has potential though, just needs some attention:)
Wonderful space! Had everything we needed and more. Pillows on the bed not super comfy so maybe bring your own if that bothers you.

I had an extended stay here. I would say that this apartment would be great for a short trip as it has everything you need for your basic accommodations. But I would not recommend for extended stays. The kitchen just isn't stocked for someone to live there longer than a weekend. There are no oven-safe items, no ways to store food in the fridge, and a tiny collection of cutlery (seriously, there were 3 forks). The bathroom sink didn't have hot water, and the bed was without a doubt the worst mattress I've ever slept on. I had to buy a cheap mattress pad just to have any chance of waking up without some part of my body aching. I've stayed in hostels that had better accommodations. Again, for a short trip, I wouldn't mind any of what I just listed. But if you're looking at places for an extended stay, I would honestly avoid this one.

Please be aware of the rats that‚Äôs located inside of this home. I called the renters club which are the people that are hosting this home on air bnb and was told that they apologize for this situation and they believe me  because I wasn‚Äôt the first rental that called in about this place having this kind of  issues. I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôm not because of this location! It‚Äôs surrounded by a lot of trees/woods with a lot on old wooded home! For the price I paid for this location and couldn‚Äôt sleep at night knowing it was a rat in the home is very unexpected. When I called them all they did was apologize send a pest control out and offer me a  bottle of cheap ass wine! As of today 07/22/2010  I am still fighting with these damn people  trying to get at least half my money back after I cleaned up their  dead ass rats!  Please booked wisely

Overall the house was great, clean and nicely kept. A negative points though. It says it can sleep up to 12 but that is only if you bunk up multiple people and have someone sleep on the floor. It actually only has 6 beds and 2 of those are kings. If you have 2 people sleep in each king that still leaves a gap of 4 people to sleep on the floor or in the living room. Very misleading from a guest count number. Last negative was the amount of homeless population around the place in all directions. Going for a morning walk is a little uncomfortable because you need to keep your guard up. We actually had the YMCA right next to the place get broken into and the front glass door was shattered in the morning. However one positive is how close it is to Rainey street. Only about a 5 minute walk.

The AirBnB is exactly as pictured--full of really nice features, technology, and upgrades. Home was very clean upon arrival. We did receive a tour from Frank on how to use the technology which is a bit complicated to use so we appreciated the instruction.

The rooftop deck is incredible and we really enjoyed it. The bed is also one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept on for an AirBnb.

While we enjoyed our stay overall, we were disappointed with the AirBnb and would probably not book again at this price tag. Over $500 a night is expensive for a 1 bedroom and we expected the AirBnb to reflect that price. Instead, several features of the home weren't working properly. The hot tub is high tech, but only 2/8 of the jets are working. This was deeply disappointing as the hot tub was one of the main draws. The shower is fantastic, but you can only use half of it to avoid leaking into the bottom floor. Although not a big deal, the dryer was also broken. We weren't planning on using that anyways but it's emblematic of a lack of maintenance at the house. Frank was aware of all these issues, as he told them to us when he gave the tour, but has not rectified them. (On the dryer, he said it had been broken the previous weekend and he was waiting for parts).

We also notified Frank that the shower had no shampoo, conditioner, or soap. He said the previous guests had probably stolen them and offered to replace them. I personally expect hosts to inspect the home after each stay to see if things are missing before the next guests arrive. Frank did offer to replace these items, which we appreciated. He gave us 3-in-1 that day, which as a woman I really can't use on my hair. 2 days later he gave us shampoo and soap (but not conditioner).

This is not a trustworthy place to stay, I would hate anyone to experience what Iwent through,  this place is run by 5 people and Gaberiella was never introduced to us. Had to find a different place for my stay and still have not been referred a penny please don't risk this.

This house was a true gem. It was so close to downtown, the airport, and anywhere we wanted to go! It was lovely and quiet at night. The only thing we ran into were bugs, but that's just Texas for you! Jackie also let us know they had sprayed recently so the only bugs we really did run into were dead.
Never received a response from host after both calling and sending message. Couldn‚Äôt check in. No one answered door after knocking and ringing bell. House looked completely vacant.
Does the trick if you need a place to stay close to the airport.
New to Austin, so this was my go to when I needed a place to crash while I worked and searched for an apartment, this place got me out of some tough moments.

Very good service and communication from the host!
The place was nice and clean.
Simple and not fancy, but nice.

We had to cancel due to the covid virus and the host was very unresponsive when it came to refunding us. The location was much further than advertised and had strange neighbors. This spot was strange and had cameras inside without any notice that there were cameras inside.
Not only that he only gave us a portion of the refund very much after the fact claiming he couldn't cancel it which is very not true. Very dissappointing and messed up during these times.
Super weird, bad host, awful place, definitely do not reccomend.
This is an affordable waypoint for anyone who is camping out or passing through.  Don't expect a good night of sleep though; the walls are thin.
The house is shared with another people and it is uncomfortable to wait for the bathroom.

This stay was comfortable, Leo is very good at communication when it comes to all the details about the stay. The area is generally clean. That being said, you get what you pay for. You are not allowed to use the fridge, wear shoes in the house, watch the TV past 9:00pm or touch the thermostat. We shared the house for the night with two other parties, who liked watching loud movies, but we went into the stay expecting other humans, so it wasn't that surprising. I will say, it was difficult to find parking- we had to park on a different street and carry all our stuff to the house, which wasn't ideal. Overall, easy place to stay for a quick trip to Austin, and close to many of the places we wanted to go! So despite the little things, it was worth the price.
Very comfortable. Very accommodating. Wicked fast internet.

Ubicaci√≥n excelente , muy limpios y organizados, tambi√©n muy atentos ya que no sab√≠a c√≥mo usar airbnb y est√° fue mi primera experiencia se comunicaron conmigo y me ayudaron volver√≠a a quedarme definitivamente con ellos si regreso a Austin much√≠simas gracias !

after reading reviews that the place was very clean, we were looking forward to the experience of a shared airbnb. however, we were greatly disappointed. The floors were disgusting, making your feet black. the towels and sheets reeked of mildew. we did not use the towels because the smell was so strong. i would not recommend it for the price we paid.
Low frills here. I actually did not shower as it just didn‚Äôt seem clean to me. My bad had someone else‚Äôs hair on it. This is a last resort need to stay by the airport type of Airbnb.
Not a good time. Rushed out the door. Left a personal bag m, and items, behind for 1-2 hours and all my stuff got thrown into garbage bags. When I asked them why they said it was the cleaning team.
Due to weather conditions I was unable to work. I had to leave town and Leo didn‚Äôt offer any refund. I booked 7 nights only stayed 2 nights. Left at 6am on the third day.

Krista has a great spot, away from the crowd but still a scooter ride away. We had a car and were able to get to the supermarket, but if you don't its a great option because she offers all sort of stuff at the place directly.
Everything was great and Jason was very communicative. Only complaint is that mattresses are very cheap and unbelievably uncomfortable.

UNIT NOT  CLEAN. Dirty linen, comforters, kitchen cabinets and walls. Upstairs bathroom toilet, handle broken and seat loose. With that being said, didn't trust prior "cleaning" we cleaned and sanitized.  Be warned, more than two vehicles, parking is major issue.

Buyer beware. This is not a "whole residential home" as listed. This is a second floor apartment. The first floor was used as their office. The lock on the front door didn't work. The "porch" beds were disgusting, which made the "porch" unusable. The loft had mold on the a/c grille and what looked like a dead bat laying on the grille. Plates and utensils were dirty. Apartment was dingy, dusty, and moldy. Wouldn't stay there for $50 a night. Pictures are misleading.

Very convenient location for this roomy spot. We had everything we needed. It‚Äôs fairly quiet, we never heard neighbors, and the hosts communicated quickly. The parking spot is hard to back out of because it‚Äôs on a busy road, so we just ended up parking on the street around the corner, which had plenty of parking. The location is a very short drive to Central Market, where you can stock up on provisions!

THIS is an incredibly disappointing place to stay. From the dirty front porch with random trash and a dead plant along with fake plants on the brick wall with leaves and dirt and mold on them, and the dead flowers on the dining room counter sitting in dirty stinky water, and the crappy shower pressure, and the incredibly off putting musty, old, dirty smell we bought air freshener to try and control, to the neglected , dirty grouted tile floors throughout and the rickety front gate and old wobbly sliding glass door and it's almost non effective door lock, we contemplated leaving.
The outlets are so loose in the kitchen, dining and bedroom, that plugging in our phone chargers and jockeying them while holding our breath, often resulted in the our chords coming loose when we weren't looking and having to charge our phones in our car instead. This was true for the toaster and the microwave oven as well.
We work paycheck to paycheck, and if we were richer, we surely would have left within 15 minutes of arriving. Easy as heck fixes here ‚Äì first, get a safer lock system. A new sliding glass door would be fabulous with an updated, effective lock on it (since it‚Äôs the main entrance) to me is a no-brainer in a city with crime. The sliding glass door that is currently installed is from the day the apt complex was built which is many decades ago. Get rid of the dead plant, the dead flowers, clean the doggone floors, tighten up the outlets and get some air freshener plug-ins at the very least. Jeez!
Getting out into the traffic from the parking space is taking your life into your hands if you're doing so between 7am and 10pm.
There were several other disappointing things but you all get my drift! I don't write bad reviews of even mediocre places I've stayed. But this place is owned by a corporation and they do not care about any of the obvious details, or about safety. If they did, the lock situation would be updated and there would not have been a vase of dead flowers on the counter to greet us as soon as we came in! Consider yourselves forewarned.
host was very difficult to communicate with

Looking back, the name Austin - Austin Vacay was a clue to the tone of our stay. It didn't feel like we were guests at a host's home. It was a lot like a motel stay. Communication was by form letter and received  in duplicate from both Austin- Austin Vacay and AirBnB.  Other emails asked: Did we want to check in early? Did we want to check out late? Did we want to check out early ( so the cleaners could plan their day )? For $55, I say, the cleaners can hold their breath. We thought $63 / night was a fair price for the space, but $55 was added to that for the cleaning fee. Adding insult to injury, we were expected to carry our trash and recycling to the bins out behind the building. Speaking of spaces, the parking spaces are narrow. With a full size sedan, we could open the doors only about a foot without hitting the cars on either side. The original tub drain stopper was missing and the handle for it was falling off. The description says that downtown, etc. is "nearby". It also says that it's 4.9 miles away. Those statements are contradictory. To me, nearby means within walking distance. The sliding glass door into the place was difficult to open and close. The tracks are grinding together. My able-bodied wife couldn't move it. The makeshift handle looked like it would pop off the door on the next try. Security was a hasp and a padlock. The front gate had a nice lock on it, but the gate itself was like an old barn door, leaving me to wonder if most anyone could kick it in.

We booked the week before SXSW and Spring Break and for the price it was a steal. The location/space had everything we needed for our short visit. The only flaws would be the parking space from the main street which makes it tricky to get in/out, the closing glass door (hard to close/open), and the lack of working outlets (many were either not working or very loose). We realize it is an older building so many of these flaws we could understand. Overall, we got what we paid for during our visit. The hosts were also very communicative and responsive the entire time.

Such a gross rental- our feet were black from all the grime on the floor, smelled of mold and smoke and none of the outlets worked/lights flickered. Extra blankets were dirty and the pillows had old make up on them. There‚Äôs no lock for the door and there were mold stains on the ceiling from water damage. We paid almost $200 and we‚Äôre still awaiting some sort of response from the owner (they have employees that respond to messages). We‚Äôre very flexible people and travel often but this was just nasty- DO NOT STAY HERE.
To be honest there is room for a lot of improvement. The way my situation (dirty room upon arrival) was handled was horrible. Not using this particular business again.

If you are looking for quality then avoid this place at all costs! Upon walking in, there was a horrible odor. There was mold on the ceiling and every corner had a heavy amount of dirt in it. The entrance door was hanging on by a thread and even with the lock I was afraid anyone could just push it down. The curtains does not cover the patio window which is the only entrance. I felt very disgusted and unsafe the 1hour I spent there.

Property owner didn't even know what appliances were in the property. Nothing to clean dishes with (that were disgusting when we got there, by the way). We were told to use dishwasher pods when there was no dishwasher, ended up having to purchase our own cleaning products.
This property doesn't lock from the inside, the only "lock" is a piece of plastic that prevents the screen door from sliding open. Very unsafe.
Property owner sent me multiple "forms" to fill out through a third party website, away from Airbnb.
Sketch place, I don't recommend.
Parking tight n hard to back onto very busy st. not made clear there is a 2nd key box. Possible dampness in the air . You get your $ worth
Host is racist and so are neighbors.

Did not state full list of house rules on the Airbnb app and added a whole another list of rules a few hours right before check in. Invaded our privacy with having surveillance on the property and not mentioning it on the Airbnb app. Terrible experience.
Our stay was comfortable and the house well located. Although the house didn't meet our expectations because the bbq was dirty, the main shower and the outside furniture were in poor conditions.
Perfect for large group, but not super close to the night life.

Location was really close to downtown. Neighborhood was also peaceful.
However beds/mattress was not very comfortable for adult but it was okay for young kids. Quality of utensils in kitchen was also not very good.

This property is in a nice quiet neighborhood conveniently located near Circuit of the Americas and plenty of restaurants and stores.
Maintenance could definitely be improved. A major leak was addressed but could‚Äôve been caught before our stay if someone had turned on the faucet. Pest control was an issue that was not addressed during our stay. I was assured by the owners before our arrival that it would be addressed before hand. Several dead bugs were found around the house suggesting it was sprayed recently, however, the front door doesn‚Äôt seal and the outside areas are not treated and covered with ants and spiders.
I didn‚Äôt message them about everything that was wrong because I wasn‚Äôt there for that reason, but there were other inconvenient issues with cleanliness, maintenance, and missing items.
I won‚Äôt stay here again, sadly.
Great stay for me and my family one day trip to Austin! Very cozy space with killer evening and morning views

The pictures of Hummingbird House (called Ruby House on the website but not when you get your confirmation email) are completely misleading).  It does not look like that in reality!!!  The decorations are sad for any comparable rentals in the Hill Country.  They have added a couch and chair with ottoman in the living area which is nice.  There are no dish towels or dish rags in the kitchen only a sad little scrubber sponge to try and clean the counter tops with.  The linens and pillows on all the beds should be thrown away immediately because they are horrible.  My grown daughter slept in the top bunkbed one night, and bugs were crawling on her.  All of the towels are sad and should also be thrown out for a rental like this.  We were given 6 towels for a rental that listed 7 guests.  We found 2 towels in what we thought might be our laundry room off of our patio.  Soon, we realized that housekeeping was doing the property's laundry in our cabin which was probably why we never had any hot water.  The floors were not clean.  They were maybe only spot cleaned.  The shower door had slimy black stuff on the bottom corner of it.  There is a nasty, dirty curtain over the bathtub.  The curtains over the dining room table and sofa are torn and dirty.  The fence was falling down in the back yard.  The living room door and window let in so much wind that it was impossible to keep the cabin warm.  We were expecting a much nicer property when we rented the biggest cabin on the property for our daughter's wedding at the Brewery.  Also, expected some signage to be able to know not to turn into the Brewery to find the cabins!  There's no signage.  After our daughter got married at the Brewery, a hot water pipe busted in the outdoor shower due to cold weather.   I also appreciated them sending an engineer over so quickly when the pipe broke.  Having the water shut off to our cabins was such a bad ordeal.  There was no water in the Bunting Cabin where my mom was and was too tiny for us to go over there anyways.  The Coyote Cabin was full of other wedding guests.   I felt like we were literally left out in the cold with the 7 guests in our cabin that night without water, one of those being our 2-year-old grandson.  I have MS and walk with a cane and/or walker so the outdoor bathrooms in the middle of the night in freezing weather were not an option but was suggested to us by mgmt.  The closest hotel only had 2 rooms at $149 per night plus taxes which is not nearly enough for 7 guests plus a dog.  We were tired, angry, and cold.  We all ended up driving 3 to 4 hours home that night because of the whole fiasco!  We had a terrible time trying to pack up after having a day of wedding stuff coming back to the cabin was what we were looking forward to in order to relax.  We were told we would be refunded for the cabin for one night plus the cost of hotel rooms but were only refunded $500.  That was not fair.  We were left "out in the cold".  I am extremely unhappy with that aspect of the service.  I understand it was no one's fault the freezing weather broke a pipe in the outdoor shower, but it is someone's fault that we were told we were going to be provided hotel rooms and were not.  After all the money I spent at Jester King that weekend, I expected better treatment.  I can't get over the conversation we had not matching what was given to me.  As I told them during our phone conversation that night, I wasn't looking for a hand-out, I was just looking for somewhere for my family to stay.  We were tired, cold, and frustrated.  We needed a place to stay.  Seven people cannot stay in a cabin without water or in one hotel room!  We stay in rentals in Texas with our large family, but this was by far the worst for the money.  The cleanliness, the quality of linens, decor, furniture, and lack of care that we were without a place to go after our wedding is, at least to me, in poor taste.  We also never got a call in to order food.  We only ever go their voicemail.

Not really worth the price; half the total cost was taxes and fees. They charge $100 cleaning fee to wash bed sheets and a few towels; our bed linens were dirty and we had to take the trash out ourselves. There was an animal in the rafters of the roof that kept us up both nights. The coffee maker did not work, so we had to drive to town to buy coffee. There were some campers next to us that had 3 dogs, all unleashed. They did not care about keeping their dogs in their space; we had to fend off the dogs and ensure they did not enter our cabin or jump in our vehicle.

While the pictures match perfectly, its hard to imagine 10 people actually staying in this small cabin. The beds are tiny (my husband is 6'3 and could not fit) and are quite uncomfortable. There's only 1 sink in the entire cabin, it's in the bathroom. There were only 7 towels. Luckily, there were only 4 of us so it sufficed. Overall, it was expensive for the quality of beds, somewhat uncomfortable. There's no curtains or blinds in the front of the house which is ok, but I really didn't like that there was not a curtain or blinds in the bathroom - very uncomfortable.  There are also no cabinets, so we had be vigilant about hiding the dog's treats and food. We attended a wedding on site, so it was very convenient location.

Decent location but few things to know before you book:
Listing is bit mislead, Place is not private as you may think, there are multiple other cabin/camping place next to you.
While we where there, wifi mostly didn‚Äôt work. It was Maybe up next morning for an hour or two. Imagine a kids without wifi.

There is no sink beside on one at restroom.

While we booked the place it was listed as kitchen being available , but there was no kitchen. There is a table with toaster oven which didn‚Äôt work, nor coffee machine worked when we tried to use it.
Bunk bed is of no use, both of them makes a loud squeaky noise.

Location is ok, but it‚Äôs not worth the service.
You will have no regrets...book it
The location could not be better with just a short walk to jester king brewing. Check out the nature trail as well.
Do not reserve before you see the internal photos of the facilities, This place has communal shower and bathroom  about 100 feet away from the cabin. Undesirable location. not for families.

Great space for 1 or2 at most.  Be aware no bathroom inside unit.  Lack of kitchen amenities could also be a problem.  Although there was a hot and cold water dispenser in the Dillo, there was no dish pan or dish soap provided.

Home is nice, and the pool is nice. Well appointed. Lots of towels.

Beware though: if you plan on having any visitors ‚Äî even within the house rules and City of Austin guidelines ‚Äî Karen will harass and threaten you with eviction. She will watch your every move (literally, with cameras), and comment on your comings and goings. For example, immediately upon arrival, we were threatened when my wife's sister and her 3-year-old dropped us off from the airport, and came in for a while.

Ultimately, she is very uncomfortable with having a home on AirBnb; she will make that clear with constant pestering, and will make your trip unpleasant.

Avoid this one if you have friends or family in Austin and have even a single visitor.

Everything was exactly as described. The house was located far enough to be away from things...but close enough to get around with a car. Kids didn't want to go anywhere as they were too busy swimming multiple times a day during the 100+ degree summer days.

Karen was very clear in expressing her concerns around restriction / concerns from the home owner association. To me, they were very reasonable / common sense that I felt compliance wasn't an issue (e.g. no parking on streets, quiet period overnight).
Awesome places ‚Äî We wanted to stay longer but sadly someone already booked it
Dark at night, no streetlights. Gravel driveway and dirt road but not too hard to find.
No complaints. :)

This humble tiny house was just what we needed for our needs. We needed quick and comfortable accommodations and this provided. Wanted to build a fire and the host provided all the fire essentials, down to the wood.

Was planning on staying at Kristen's place, unfortunately due to Airline delays and cancellations our flight never made it to Austin. We communicated our situation with Kristen - based on the fact that airlines faced a devastating hit during the nationwide storm and unable to rebook, Kristen was unwilling to even compromise and help us out that were unable to even show up. She stood behind her cancellation policy, which while I can understand this was an extremely exterminating circumstance, even a reduced fair would have been appreciated.

1 couple out of the 3 actually made it. Homeless shelter setup right next door under the highway and viewable from the location. Uncomfortable was the words described to me. Walking downtown is basically impossible, and taking Ubers to go 2 blocks was deemed necessary to avoid the camp.

HVAC needs addressed. System is not balanced, basement is extremely cold while upstairs is too hot. For the money spent, it was deemed not a good value.

When we got to our airbnb in Austin, the place did not have any power. GuestSpace relocated us to another airbnb that was further away than what we wanted. They were not flexible in negotiating price or compensating for ubers. This was especially disappointing to us because we chose their airbnb due to the location.

There were two primary issues we encountered 1) lizards in the home that were apparently entering through a malfunctioning patio door and 2) cleanliness (grimy floors and furniture, unwashed bedding).

WiFi issues that other people mention are still an issue. There was also a smoke/cigarette smell in the apartment we weren‚Äôt expecting. Overall pretty accurate listing, but was a bit frustrated at the smoke smell.

This is not worth your time. He‚Äôs a very unresponsive host and will take your money for no discernible reason. I booked the wrong date by mistake and he would not assist in giving me my money back after I told him an hour out that I booked it mistakenly. I didn‚Äôt even stay at his reservation and he still took my money.

I'll start with the pros - the location of the apartment is really convenient, lots of parking available and the apartment is a decent size. Unfortunately the cons far outweighed the pros and we did not have a good experience.

My partner and I needed to work during our stay, which was completely impossible as the WiFi is really poor. The router is kept in another apartment so the signal is very weak and drops constantly and is just unusable. Our phones didn't have signal in the building so we couldn't use our hotspots too in the meantime. We notified Hunter about this issue on the first night but communication was really slow and it took 2 days to get a response. The issue was never fixed during our stay and we were forced to work at coffee shops and come home to no WiFi for streaming anything too.

Overall the place feels very unclean and dusty (my partner had an allergic reaction from all the dust and developed a terrible cough while we were there that kept him up all night). We had to clean all the surfaces, crockery and cutlery ourselves before using it. The dishwasher is broken, the fridge is falling apart and the stovetop smokes like crazy when you turn it on. Plus there were only 2 light bulbs that were working in the entire place so we were mostly in the dark.

I hate to complain and don't usually do so, but on this occasion I felt I really did need to highlight these issues as they were detrimental to our stay :( Wouldn't recommend.

Pros-

-The sunrise from the balcony is beautiful.
-It‚Äôs in a central location that is easy to access other parts of Austin.
-The space was clean and comfortable

Cons-
- Although I received an initial welcome message letting me know I could message with questions, I did not receive an response to the questions I asked before, during, or after my stay. Zero communication. I wonder if something came up for the host, but I saw other reviews saying communication was limited.
- I could not find a way to turn on a porch light to illuminate the front door. For coming up the steps alone at night and finding the keys etc, it was very hard to see in the pitch dark with no lights.
-I would not suggest this place if you intend to work from home. The internet cut out badly and the road noise is loud during the day (however it was quiet at night).
Quiet neighborhood,  no issues at Hunter's place. Had everything we needed to accommodate us while visiting.

I don't like leaving bad reviews, but I do not recommend reserving stays with Hunter for one reason, he does not care about his guests. We arrived and were immediately not satisfied with the cleanliness of the apartment. We made it aware to Hunter and sent him photos. After that we got no response nor any attempt to make it right. For the price of the apartment it is definitely not worth it, keep looking somewhere else or go to a hotel.

It was a little hard to get in touch with the host then he sent us info for the wrong apt, then the tv did not work. And then on top of that in the middle of the night there were two men who tried getting into the apt had the code for the lock box saying they booked this place as well. Not very happy about any of that
he was fast replying, only thing really was next door neighbor dogs barking. No laundry unit. Wi-Fi didn‚Äôt work as well.
No tv control had odors my stuff when placed in my car took said odor
Not a family vacation home, it was dirty, many things were displeasing!

When we checked in we were super excited to be in a house after being in an apartment. We were house hunting and airbnb'ing in the meantime.

The first thing that we noticed was that the AC wasn't working properly. We notified Airbnb and Ivette. It took 2 separate occasions for a technician to come and fix it. This was very concerning to us because Austin gets incredibly hot in the summer and is in the middle of a heat wave where if the AC isn't working it becomes unlivable. After being "fixed" by the technician who confirmed that cold air was indeed blowing into the house, the temperature in the upstairs would not go below 77/78 degrees F during the day. So for those who can't tolerate the heat, this would not be a good place to stay.

During the communication with Ivette in regards to the AC Airbnb requested that a refund for the days that we didn't have AC working, be given. When that exchange happened, Ivette continued to ask me how I'm going to compensate her for bringing my service dog. Now it's important to note that before staying at her place I had informed her that I have a service dog and she said that it was okay. But when negotiations were happening asking for a refund she repeatedly asked me how I was going to compensate her for bringing my dog. I responded each and every time that my dog is a service animal but she seemed to gloss over it. It finally reached a point where I asked her, is there a reason why you keep asking me?? Because at that point it feels like discrimination. I then told Airbnb that my host is not being understanding of the fact that I have a service animal even though I mentioned it to her prior to staying at her place.

Now this is where it gets even worse, the fire alarm was blaring for 3 days straight during our stay. It was the blare that you get when the fire alarm is running out of batteries. The fire alarm is situated on high vaulted ceilings that you would need a ladder to access. It was a beep every few minutes the whole night. It was absolute torture. The second day the security system kept beeping. The third day the fire alarm would beep/blare. It was a nightmare and psychological, mental, and emotional torture because the beeps were so loud that it disturbs your overall being. And I would liken the beeping to Chinese water torture except, perhaps worse, because on some days you didn't know when it would malfunction. Turns out the fire alarm was out of batteries like we told Ivette. And the security system was going off because it was connected to the fire alarm. When she did get assistance to help us with the fire alarm it would take hours because her house manager lives an hour away in Round Rock. And when she had people show up, she didn't notify us. There was once a lawn mower maintenance guy who showed up in the backyard when the glass door to the backyard is completely transparent which is an invasion of privacy.

The helpfulness and communication with Ivette was awful. It felt like she blamed us for the problems rather than trying to work with us to solve them.

Overall, I would say the listing itself was fine. The location was great. The towels and linens were all bleach stained. But the hospitality of the host was abysmal.

Overall had a decent stay. The place is very simple and is most suited for a stay in which guests don‚Äôt spend much time in the home and are only needing a bed to sleep in at night. The biggest downside was the blinds in the bedroom, as they did not keep light out. Expect to be woken up as soon as the sun rises.

Excellent location if that‚Äôs your priority, but very sparsely furnished. We didn‚Äôt have noise issues but the bedroom is in need of curtains to block out street lights. Was disappointed to learn the pool was 2 blocks away. Very clean. Response time was good, but had to call too many times for wrong codes, clarifications, lost remote, etc. Functional, but not especially welcoming‚Äîand that may be just fine for some people.
Pillows are awful!   Very flat

Check in directions were not clear and left out basic instructions on how to find apartment. Apt is very basic with cheap ikea furniture. No cable. Bed is uncomfortable and linens and pillows are old  and awful. I woke up with a stiff neck due to crappy pillows. The apt has moldy vents too. I don‚Äôt recommend if you‚Äôre looking for a quiet place to stay. There are bars downstairs and it gets pretty loud.

Apartment was fine, very loud restaurants and bars in the area that had music going late into the night.. the owner would not provide a refund for my first night which I was unable to make it to Austin due to all flights being cancelled and Texas experiencing a freeze for 2 days. Not a great way of doing business and understanding circumstances which were out of my control.

This is a good location, as far as walkability and proximity to restaurants and shopping.  Not much is provided as far as toiletries goes, we only had one roll of toilet paper and there were no more in the unit, a couple bars of soap, and the tiniest shampoo/conditioner bottles we‚Äôve ever seen.  Most of the furniture is broken, the toilet paper holder is broken and the toilet paper kept falling in the bathroom garbage can.  There is a washer and dryer, but no laundry or dishwasher detergent. Dirty dishes were in the dishwasher when we arrived.  Due to the location, it is very loud in the evenings on the weekend, as expected.
Thank you again for the info and the casita. It was a bit away from all of the busyness, but that‚Äôs what I was looking for. The only negative thing was the weather.

This place was central, but I have negative points to the room, all the time the owner had the A / C going on,  the motor was behind the wall where the bed is, and it was a constant noise, I couldn‚Äôt sleep, this place was a garage that was converted into a room for rent, there were two doors one in the bathroom and the other in the room there were noises and I thought that at any minute one of the doors will be open, I didn‚Äôt feel comfortable. The bed was very uncomfortable, very thin mattress.  Also do not forget that this (room) was converted from a garage to a rental room, the parking was just there you open the door and the car is there, for me this was hazardous, and the truth is I felt very unsafe in this place and I don't think it's convenient to rent this place. I DO NOT RECOMEND!!

The unit was fine but very used and there were cleanliness issues. Also, the car port was full due to neighbors parking in it which required me to knock on doors to get one vehicle relocated. This wouldn't have been a big deal but the lighting at night is not good so it took extra time to figure out where to stop and unload the vehicle so overall the check-in process took a while.

In the kitchen, the refrigerator had fruit flies inside and they flew out when the door opened and the blinds on the glass door to the patio of the unit were missing so light was shining through into the living room.

Overall, the location worked well for us however the condition and parking situation would be a concern for future stays.

The pictures are accurate and the place is cute.  It looks recently remodeled although the bathtub is peeling and needs repair.  There is no where to store your clothes.  No drawers.  The master closet is locked.  There is a coat closet but it has no rod. The place is much smaller than it looks online.  There are no room darkening shades.  I had to park about a block away in a neighborhood that you don't want to be roaming around in, at night. There is noise from the road at all times,  and the upstairs neighbor never sleeps so the noise from his pacing made it impossible to get a good night's sleep.  I cut the trip two days short because the neighbors were having a noisy and very ugly fight in the common area outside.  When I called to mention to the owner that the area was an issue, she did not respond until the next day and did not ask why or what happened.  She only said she'd not had any complaints before. I checked into a hotel those last two nights and ended up paying for the AirBNB AND the hotel.  I was not offered a concession or a refund for the two nights that were unused.   I was in Texas taking the Bar Exam and the stay made the all day testing a nightmare.  I would try and find something else.
Tidy but **not** clean; there is a bug problem here. Loud neighbors. Strange smell. Cute aesthetic. A bit tight.

Don‚Äôt book here unless you plan on being treated like crap and deal with a bad attitude host ewww not satisfied at all and will never work or book with these people again. Place is not great and the area is just not it. 0 STARS IF YOU ASK ME

I shouldve went with my gut instinct when i drove up to this place
I saw someone smoking crack in the parking lot and when i told then they told me to call air n b they could refund me
It was 10 at night and i was awake for 40 hours if i wasnt for that and me not thinking i would find somehwere else i wouldnt have stayed
I ended up staying here and the 2nd night the sink in the kitchen flooded as well as the dish washer
As i was trying to inspect it all the water in the sink shoot out and hit me in the face
I was trying to clean up the area and noticed small bugs coming out
I told the owner she said she would have someone come out and look
Next day as she said she had someone come look
(Me being on vacation slept till noon)
And i woke up to a message of her saying she could just let him in remotely
This comment scared me being a female staying alone for her to think that it would be okay to let some random person into the apartment was so odd to me
I waited maybe 1-2 for the sink to be fixed because u didnt want to leave my things alone with a stranger
Last thing that happened and probably the worst i got bite by some kind of bugs and had huge itches bumbs on my back legs and arms

I wouldnt recommend this place if ur not from the area i would recommend a hotel theres hotels that r cheaper or around the same price and easier to work with and closer to austin
Having to pay 200 penalty for having people over or moving things around or leaving the house dirty or not washing the laundry is ridiculous to me

The actual apartment inside is neat and has a nice set up. overall it was great, however the actual neighborhood this apartment is located in is the ONLY reason I would not stay here again. We chose this place because it was centralized to most things we wanted to in Austin but to be truthful the neighborhood is rough. The entire time my girlfriend did not feel safe. one night we came back and couldn't find parking and were forced to park our car on the street that was very busy. what really did it was our last day, we just got done exercising and wanted to try the food truck across the street after returning. While waiting for our order, a road rage altercation escalated right in front of us and we were fearing for our lives not knowing if at any moment someone would have a weapon. Terrifying experience for my girlfriend.
Bonnie, the situation with the work being done at the apartment was unfortunate.

This location is not worth the money spent. The location to start is not in a very safe feeling neighborhood and very rundown. Then upon arrival there was a massive infestation of both fruit flies and mosquitos everywhere. Then after we told Bonnie about it she sent a ‚Äúcompany‚Äù to come clean it but even after there was still a massive infestation and nothing had changed except there was now a very apparent smell of pesticide in the air for the rest of our trip that made my girlfriend sick. The location it‚Äôs self felt safe once you got inside, and Bonnie was very fast to answer us anytime we had a question or concern. However there are an excessive amount of fees that come with just about any problem for the house that included even a $50 fee just to send something you forgot, and a $100 fee for broken objects, or unauthorized people and more. It just felt like there were more rules and I could never enjoy my time at the condo cause everything was going to cost me money if I messed something up. Finally there is a $90 cleaning fee but they require you to remove the linen and take out the trash and sweep and make sure the house is as clean as when you left it, even though you‚Äôre forced to pay $90. Feels like that $90 should just be paid to me by the end of the trip. Either way, by the end of the trip I felt cheated and controlled and did not enjoy my time there and highly recommend to keep looking at other options.

I feel like the listing was advertised as something completely different than what it actually was. The neighborhood looked unsafe on the way in. The sliding glass door was left unlocked upon arrival. There were three bath towels, one hand towel, and one wash cloth for two adults staying a total of four nights. The towels were very hard and scratchy. There were no dish towels in the kitchen to dry your hands on. The couch and ceiling fans in the unit were completely different than the ones in the listing photos. The living room ceiling fan did not work at all and there was exposed wiring. I went to bed in the bedroom on the final night and woke up early to the ceiling fan being off and the ceiling fan light turned on when I went to bed with the fan on and the light off. The unit didn't appear very clean, there was noticeable dirt and hair on the bathroom tile including a long single red hair stuck to the shower wall. The hand soap dispensers are filled with dish soap which didn't pump properly which leaked onto the counters in globs. The shower curtain rod and hooks were rusted, there was an odd exposed pipe coming out of the ceiling above the shower, and the utility flap in the bathroom ceiling appeared to be rusted and have slight water damage. I tried to run a towel load before departure but couldn't get the machine to work. There was weather stripping hanging down from the front doorway. The flooring was bubbling and coming up (stick on laminate). The bed in the bedroom was advertised as a king but it was more like a queen. I'm upset that this unit was not accurately described and failed to meet my expectations. The pictures were very deceiving, the couch was completely different, other decor items. I felt very lied to about this unit and I'm very upset. Definitely not worth the money,  you'd be better off paying the same for a hotel.
Horrible experience. We called the host many times for an hour on our check-in day & never received a call back. WiFi didn't work either with terrible cell connection in the area.

The apartment community was good and located close to domain. But there is no sound insulation and can hear music and cars passing through even late at night. The bed is of bad quality, about to fall apart and needs repair. Bathroom and towels were not clean. It was not worth the money.

our stay was from Monday to Thursday (Aug.24-27). Place was not ready by 3PM as per schedule. Have to wait for an hour for cleaning people to finish their JOB.
Internet was out from Tuesday around 4:30PM and did not come back at all. We checked out at 11am on Thursday as per schedule and still no internet. Not a pleasant stay

So what should have been the perfect 4 day get away turned out to be a disappointment. The place was as described super cute but unfortunately the smell of mold is overwhelming. They were notified of the mold in a portable ice maker that the owner came and removed but that was not the origin of the smell. Then we started reading older reviews of this property and found other complaints that stated the same complaint. This can be a huge health issue for someone sensitive to mold. The people running this rental just completely brushed the concern to the side with no intentions of investigating. Airbnb has been notified we will see what kind of company they are.

Don‚Äôt waste your money on this place! We arrived late and the gate was difficult to get open. The cute walkway you see in the photos looks more like a junk yard in real life. The coffee shop and food truck were never open while we were there. The worst part was that the entire place smelled like an ash tray. It was clean other than the smell and cobwebs and rat droppings in the cutout above the closet. We booked 2 nights but only stayed 1 because of the smell. When I notified the owner, he accused me of lying about when we left and the smell. He was extremely rude and unprofessional. His communication and the way he treated me for his place smelling horrible was absolutely terrible! I never even asked for any money back. I just wanted to give him feedback and let him know we weren‚Äôt staying the 2nd night and he was so terribly rude to me.
Amidst the chaos that is Austin, this space is a magical sanctuary.
Close to downtown , AC units are a bit noisy.

DO NOT STAY HERE TITLE IS VERY MISLEADING VERY BAD PART OR TOWN NOT EVEN CLOSE TO DOWN TOWN ITS A 15 mins DRIVE AND YOU‚ÄôLL PROBABLY COME OUT TO NO RIMS and BOTH the host didn‚Äôt even answer when we told them we couldn‚Äôt find the place so we couldn‚Äôt even find it!! DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!!!

Beautiful place, but be ware the shower really doesn't get you clean because the water pressure is really weak. I showered every day while I was there and scrubbed and scrubbed yet still for some reason I have sunscreen stuck on me from the first day when we went swimming. So bring a harsh scrubber to get that grime off you. Also the bathroom sink pretty much doesn't work but it's okay because the kitchen is only a few steps away. The bed is very comfy and the decoration is pretty, the biggest plus is definently how close the loft is to all the popular tourist places and things to do.

Grown men love the drink and hang out by the only stairs available to access the apartment.
During my short stay I observed, the men start at about 4-5 pm on weekdays and any time weekends.
So I had to cancel on day 5 of my booked 44 night stay because these men made me feel completely unsafe and I was alone.
They stared at me, tried to pet my dog, and tried to talk to me 2xs. I could feel their stares as I walked up the steps, as I walked to my car, and as I walked my dog.
They sit, stare, and drink late into the night. There are also a lot of random men who hangout in front of the apartment, on the sidewalk.
The home is decent & the host replies fast. But it was difficult to get my money back, but eventually I did after a long process.

The home is spacious and nice. Please note that there is a train track that runs close to the home which can be noisy at times.

We had an unfortunate incident where a wall mounted TV fell off the wall when we went to adjust the tilt. We uncovered the TV was not installed properly (lacked safety screws and had missing parts). Owner was insistent for us to pay for the TV even after we had repeatedly explained to them the install issues and even spoke with the wall mount manufacturer who indicated not putting safety screws is a serious safety issue. Finally, Airbnb had to step in and told us we are not responsible for the damage. A bit disappointed the owner treated us in this manner when the issue was a poor, dangerous installation for guests. Would recommend to ask the owner to ensure all TVs in this home are installed per the wall mount manufacturers instruction as this can cause serious damage or injury.

Bernard‚Äôs place was nice but I was disappointed to find no washer and dryer as I was planning a long term stay. As I understand it this is a limitation in AirBnb‚Äôs system which doesn‚Äôt allow hosts to differentiate between coin laundry in building vs laundry in unit. I appreciated his willingness to work with me on refunding the majority of my reservation.

Very nice, quaint place to stay with proximity to almost everything in Austin. Restaurants, bars, and nightlife were just a short Uber or Lyft away. Everything inside of the unit was as advertised by the hosts. The one negative thing that I will note is that the bathroom in the unit was not very clean.

Great location and very cute place. Unfortunately we were unable to shower during our stay because the knob on top of the faucet would not stay up so the water was not diverted to the shower head. We reported the problem at 4:00 in the afternoon of the first day of our stay and were told that maintenance was called to repair but no one ever came. Inconvenient to have no shower. The responses to our messages gave us the feeling that they didn‚Äôt believe us‚Ä¶that we didn‚Äôt know how to operate the knob on the faucet.

It‚Äôs hit or miss on the smoke smell. I‚Äôve had times it didn‚Äôt smell like smoke and other times it was terrible even though they are non smoking places. Well- smoke is invasive even if it‚Äôs done outside or the neighbors smoke.
The couch pull out was hard to sleep on. A lot of communication. Decent stay for a quick one night trip.

Great location, close to everything we wanted to see and do. This Air bnb rental is not sanctioned through the complex so it felt weird being there like we were doing something wrong, had I known in advance I would have booked somewhere else. We did not receive parking instructions in advance and host was not responsive when we reached out multiple times. He eventually got back to us and straightened it out but it could of been avoided.

This place is not clean at all. As soon as we arrived and walked around in the apartment our feet turned black from how dirty the floors were. The bathrooms were not clean (clumps of hair stuck in the door hinges) and the showers were moldy and gross. The host was responsive, however be aware that the breaker will flip and the air conditioning will go out. I would not refer a friend.

This was a great AirBnB for groups and extremely close to the city life. Overall, we had a great experience, however, we did a have a few issues that we let the hosts know about. Besides those issues, the house was great, but seeing how much we paid, it was a little disappointing to have broken amenities in the home.
No frills. Exactly what we needed. Branden is very communicative and accommodating.

This property did not have a working toilet and they knew about it as they left pliers to flush the toilet. I asked them to make the repair as I was staying 4 days and no one came to repair it. I left a day early and they just apologized, no compensation at all. Horrible experience. Do not stay here! They don‚Äôt care about your needs or experience.

Not the best. Smelled like vomit and stale cigarettes. Was barely cleaned definitely not Covid cleaned. All the outdoor amenities are pretty weathered. I wear a lot of black... it‚Äôs now covered in white animal hairs. Was told an amazon box would show up with the trash bags I needed... it didn‚Äôt. After my husband showered, I searched everywhere for another clean towel, but couldn‚Äôt find any in the cupboards. I used his wet towel and then went searching through the rest of the place. They were all in the dryer. The kitchen sink was brown around the drain from lack of deep cleaning. There are zero personal touches. It‚Äôs a bare minimum effort Airbnb in a fancy neighborhood. But, you watch tv on a hard IKEA couch smelling stale cigarettes. Not the best.

Completely underrated place.  It was fantastic and better than we could have imagined!! The view was spectacular.  It was perfect for what we needed it for. The upstairs bedroom gets HOT though.  The location couldn‚Äôt have been better.  It says no lake access and there is a path that goes all the way down but It‚Äôs no lake access for a reason, the neighbors do not want people on their dock and will call and complain.
Nothing better than waking up, heading onto the deck with a hot cup of coffee, and soaking in the serenity (and feeding the swans!) for a weekend away!
Couldnt be better!

This place has a unique style which is very authentic to Austin. From the record player, hammocks, fire pit, quilted pillows, decor, and overall vibe you really get to separate yourself from civilization in an well-designed stainless steel oasis.
This was an absolutely magical place to stay. Every detail was given the utmost consideration. The only downside was that we only stayed one night!
Cute, quiet studio. Loved the big picture window, but had some trouble getting the tv to work.

Very poor communication on traveling to, name of actual apartment complex, parking etc. Apartment (room and restroom) was extremely bare and under prepared. The host did not leave bathing towels or wash clothes, but did offer to allow my guest and I to use ‚Äúas many paper towels as we needed‚Äù. Such a bad experience with Airbnb. I‚Äôve been using Airbnb for severa years, staying in several states and cities. This is my last Airbnb stay. Not worth the headache of being jerked around and misled by an unfit and unprepared host.
Expect dead bugs and unclean floors.
I got the check out date wrong. But Koffi was very understanding and helped us get a smooth last-minute move out
Great proximity to downtown, but lots of traffic noise at night being next to the highway. I did not sleep well because of the poor quality mattress.

I have read great reviews about this place. Hence, I booked it.
Unfortunately, my experience was not good.
1. we arrived after midnight and there was no coffee/water
2. one bed frame pillar was broken and another one is tilted. not in good condition
3. There were cob webs at the corner under the bed. cleaning wasn't done properly.
4. AC even when put to minimum temperature wasn't effective.
If you‚Äôre in Austin something close to downtown I would 100% recommend this place. Can‚Äôt go wrong with it.
No thanks

Nice place with eclectic style and original art. Will stay again if returning to the Austin area.

Pros:
-Nice beds
-good water pressure
-mostly well stocked kitchen & pantry (no sugar)
-soft towels
-fast WiFi
-easy check in/out; minimal requirements
-nice safe hilly walking around neighborhood
-clean floors, we don‚Äôt wear shoes in the house.

Cons:
-master shower is open without curtain or door. May be a ‚Äúpro‚Äù for some but I don‚Äôt like drafty showers.
-one of the bedrooms has 2 small single (dorm room sized) beds.
-directions don‚Äôt spell out what can or can‚Äôt be used in the pantry - don‚Äôt assume, ask first.
-half dead cockroach discovered on day two. Not sure if it‚Äôs a resident or immigrated inside when we were loading/unloading suitcases. It‚Äôs Texas so I expect bugs, but extermination schedule may need updating.
-must drive to restaurants/grocery


Not used/reviewed:
-back raised deck
-minimal front yard (looks bigger in the photo)
-tv and video options.

Close to an HEB which is super convenient. The property is very cute and clean, and the host was very accommodating when I ended up arriving sooner than expected. My only issue was very loud construction going on during the weekdays, both in the garage (right next to the bedroom) and in the duplex unit attached to the back. Probably isn't something that will be going on forever, but the lack of communication of that happening was a disappointment.
When we arrived there was a damp, dank odor in the home. Within 15 minutes my wife‚Äôs lungs were irritated. Colleen was very responsive and issued us a full refund right away.

Unfortunately we had to cancel our stay after checking in. The unit smelled of cat urine and we found two dead cockroaches within 15 min of getting inside. Colleen was very nice about the situation and offered a full refund, which was great, but we were left in a tight situation trying to find a new place to stay at 4 pm on a Friday.

We came for the pool and that‚Äôs what mattered to us the most. The home is surrounded by trees so naturally the pool had leaves in it which wasn‚Äôt much of a problem just a bit of a nuisance.

When we arrived the cleaning lady was there so I left for over an hour to give her time to finish up. The house could‚Äôve been cleaner. There were dead bugs on the floor here and there and trash still in the trash can. It didn‚Äôt appear as though anyone had stayed in the home for a while. No hand soap or towels in the downstairs restroom.

Priscila was very responsive and quick to accommodate us and the cleanliness I feel is more of an issue with the cleaning lady rather than the host.

We also couldn‚Äôt figure out how to turn any of the TVs on so we just listened to music on our phones.

Good morning,

The house & property is beautiful, but is in desperate need of some maintenance.

-The grass is severely overgrown & accumulation of leaves are causing a nasty mosquito infestation

-Upon arrival, the trash bin was empty at the curb, however, someone left 5 bags of trash inside the garage with the door closed. It smelled something awful (and lingered throughout the house) so we opened the garage door, placed the bags inside the bin, and brought bin to the road for pickup. We had to purchase some air fresheners just to get the odor out

-The air conditioning unit would not kick on. The thermostat showed an error stating ‚ÄúCheck AC unit‚Äù. My brother in law found the electrical fuse, removed it, cleaned around it & reinserted it and that did the trick. Next morning it happened again, so he repeated the steps and it worked. Apparently it may need servicing soon.

-The kitchen sink faucet was very loose. And we had to figure out that you must flip a light switch to run dishwasher.

-The pool guy stopped by to change out the filters, which caught us off guard

-While he was here, someone from the city pulled up (with light sirens on). The lady introduced herself as being with the Code Compliance Department. She started taking pictures of the house and yard. She questioned us pretty heavily about renting. She told us that we were not supposed to renting this home because it was against code. We apologized & told her we were evacuating from the storm and would leave if we had to. She told us we didn‚Äôt have to leave, and that she would be contacting the homeowner to address it.
It was a very uncomfortable situation to be in & felt like it was a gross invasion of privacy

-There were many personal items through out the house that I felt caused us to be extra attentive to so that we didn‚Äôt mess them up.

-The pool is in desperate need of vacuuming and the only net I found to fish out leaves had a huge hole in it.

-The patio has numerous loose boards that need to use caution with small kids

-Finally, on our last day, we smelled a terrible odor downstairs. It intensified as we approached the laundry room. After opening the door from laundry room to garage, it smelled as if something died inside (maybe a rodent). It was so awful we could not stomach it anymore so we quickly loaded up our remaining items and left.

I notified the owner about all areas.

The place is overall very nice IF some TLC can be done.

While the location was convenient to downtown, when we arrived there was hair in the bathroom and on the couch, which made us question how throughly the house was cleaned before we arrived. I reached out to the host, who apologized, but nothing else was done. When paying a $210 cleaning fee and being required to clean before checkout, this was very disappointing.

Long story short: I ended up cancelling my stay and moving to a hotel due to a safety issue.

There were two major problems with this stay
1) the host contacted me hours before they stay saying that the hot water was not working, but offered a credit for each day the hot water was not working. I agreed to this and understood that if a hot water heater fails, there‚Äôs not much you can do about that except wait. You‚Äôll notice that a recent review before mine mentions the hot water issue as well.
2) on my first morning, I kept noticing this mildew type smell, and I woke up this strong headache. I almost never get a headache, so this was odd. I eventually found the smell was coming from the AC unit in the wall. I pulled off the lid to find that the entire unit was covered in black mold. This was especially dangerous because the unit fan is over the bed frame, so you‚Äôre directly under the fan, and, there is no circulation in this enclosed, less than 300 square foot space. I arrived on an 85 degree hot Texas day, so that unit runs constantly. I don‚Äôt have to explain why breathing in black mold is dangerous, but I was pretty shocked to see this level of negligence.

I ended up contacting AirBNB directly, knowing that between the hot water issue+mold issue, I had no plans to stay in this space. I requested AirBNB to cancel my stay, and issue a refund, which they did.

There are, however, some positives:
1) the hosts communicate fast! That‚Äôs really nice.
2) the location is awesome. Less than a block or so away from everything. This was my primary reason for booking this location.
3) it‚Äôs a great space for one, maybe two people. It does have everything you would need for an extended stay.

I‚Äôm both an AirBNB user and host, so I‚Äôm writing this note with the understanding that it‚Äôs not always easy to be a host, and things sometimes go wrong. When you stay with AirBNB, you accept that you‚Äôll find a hair, or something will not be perfect. It‚Äôs not a hotel. But, there are certain standards that have to be met. This location failed to meet those standards multiple times. I think this could be a great future stay for guests, if some improvements were made.

After reading other reviews I was extremely disappointed that there was no blanket provided, despite three requests. It went down to 30 degrees a few nights. I ended up getting sick which ruined the end of my vacation. It's really a shame because the location is great and it is clean.  It was a trip that I was really looking forward to.

As advertised, the location is great, close to good restaurants and cafes. Additionally, it is close enough to the downtown area, but not too close to where traffic will become an issue.

The host responds quickly and resolves problems promptly when requested. I had to have the key code changed due to an error of my own, and the host had maintenance come over to the property the same morning.

If I‚Äôm ever in Austin soloing or with one other person, I would try and stay at this Airbnb, and you should too.

I stayed at this location while I was in town from work.
- the path leading up to the house is dirt and constantly tracks dirt in. With hard surface floors I had to wear socks or shoes the whole time to avoid tracking dirt into the bed
- the road parking is limited and not great. I ended up having to park kind of far and still had luggage to tote back and forth.
- the space is much more cramped than it looks like it is in the photos. Definitely could not imagine staying here with another person as you'd have trouble walking past one another just to get to the bathroom
- the faucet in the bathroom is not properly installed so it feels like simply turning it on, you're going to snap the faucet off the sink.
- same issue with the toilet. I plopped down a little too hard and it didn't feel like it was properly installed
- had to leave early for a family emergency and the hosts were not kind or understanding and would not refund my final day

I would not recommend this space.

The atmosphere is very cool. Made a little fire outside the RV as the string lights on a timer came on at dawn. Icing on the cake.

I ended up having to call the host because my app wasnt working properly to get in (issue on my end) and he responded right away. Can't thank you enough.

My only gripe was that the toilet paper was the worst I've ever used.

It's the weirdest complaint I've ever made, however, I'm still perplexed by the fact that something could be so thin and so uncomfortable at the same time.

Anyways, everything else was as expected -- no complaints here. I wish I could give 4.5/5 stars.

Quick heads up: my wife and I could hear the person living above the apartment playing video games and walking around in the morning.

Honestly, we were only hyper aware of it because my wife had an important business call that morning and we didn't want shooting going on in the background.

This isn't something that Tobin can control though so not a critique. And had the noise became an issue, then I would have walked upstairs and talked to the guy.

So if you can't take calls in a car, then you may find yourself having to meet the dude upstairs.

House was as described however the master bedroom bed is quite hard, felt like sleeping on a board.  The listing says that the house can have up to 10 guests however, the host messaged me the day of the reservation that any guest above the 4 I had listed would be $16 per guest per day.  If found this to be very frustrating.  I was in town for family reunion and family was coming in from all over. I did not have a final head count as people were coming and going and I did not feel like it was his business to monitor as long as I never had over 10.  The rate should be based on the size of the house not how many guests you have in it.

Edvin and Sezy were very accommodating with easy directions and many welcoming gifts. The upstairs was very comfortable, a lovely bed, large closet and spacious bathroom. Unfortunately it was quite cold during our stay and the downstairs was uncomfortably chilly as the heating system is upstairs. The hosts offered to buy a space heater but we were able to borrow one form our daughter, but it did not heat the space.
Our only other complaint was no TV with local stations.

For my complaint I will let you know about the trip just as I have in my review. This trip was an awful experience. Not because of the people I was with (my best friends) but because of my host's inability and unwillingness to help on multiple problems as well as his inability to provide a safe space to stay in. I will explain chronologically. When I showed up to the house we walked through the home‚Äôs front gate which was easily opened but lacked the piece needed to keep the gate closed (we found it on the floor and had to rig it to close) to avoid leaving the gate wide open inviting everyone on the street to come on in. This was minorly concerning until we got to the door. Me, my wife, and our friends, (3 other couples') stood in the frigid Texas cold which was the start of a cold front moving in for the weekend trying to find the check-in instructions. After finding them, they read "door code ####" which puzzled us when we looked up because there was no combination lock on the door, just a key hole. after spending about 15 minutes trying to find an unlockable gate or door of some sort, we got a message back from our host saying "Under the mat." It was not under the mat. My friend, fed up with the cold, twisted the knob and pushed and BOOM the door was open! My 7 friends and I stood in the empty door looking into the dark room afraid to go in because anyone could have easily walked on in ahead of us. After checking all the cabinets and closets we assumed no one was in the house. With his short responses we knew he wouldn't be much help so we continued to look for keys to lock the door. after looking in every possible place, under every possible matt, we could never find the keys to the house. Because we were all hungry, we decided to go out but soon remembered the fact that we had no keys to lock the house. Long story short we knew that we would either have to leave someone home to guard our stuff, pack our stuff into the cars every time we leave, or take our chances. We took our chances. when one couple entered their bedroom, they complained that their door could not close all the way. They weren't too offended by the idea except for the fact that the whole house was freezing and their room was the only one with heat. They ended up sacrificing their heat and privacy and left the door open. Throughout the trip we struggled to keep the heat in the house above 65 degrees which was a worsening issue as the outside temperature continued to drop below 20 degrees. When we woke up the first morning the temperature inside the house was 60 degrees and dropping after we told our host about this we asked for instructions on how to fix the heating situation. His reply was short, apathetic, and not sweet, "still not heating up?" to which I replied "62" "62" he replied "OK on the nest set it to 75 and shoot me a picture I called an HVAC guy but I'm afraid it‚Äôs impossible they aren't available and too busy because of the road conditions." We told him we would trouble shoot. We did and nothing worked. We thought it was suspicious that he asked to send a picture of the thermostat at 75 because it looked almost like the house was 75 so we took pictures of the actual temperatures which during the trip dropped to 51 degrees inside of the house. It was almost better outside in the sunlight than in the house. We also tried our hand at contacting HVAC which SUPRISINGLY offered to come out and help. Because I wasn't about to pay for our bad hosts heater, I declined but noted the fact that he must not have tried too hard to get an HVAC guy out. Not great. Because it was so cold, we continued to go out into town in search of heat which we somewhat found but all the while, ran the risk of all of our stuff getting stolen because we couldn't lock the door. That night, two of the couple's had experienced enough and decided to go to a hotel. One payed 140$ the other payed 150$ both in fear that they would wake up to a frozen significant other next to them if they stayed. Since I payed, I gave them their money back for the night. In the morning on the last day of the trip, I messaged our uninterested host. "Hey Andy the heat never got above 64 last night and began to fall to 60 later on and was 51 this morning. the first night in the low 60's was tough but bad enough for half our guests who have to get hotels. Not sure what your refund policy is for stuff like this and its obvious it wasn't purposeful but I would urge you to refund some of the money especially with it getting to 51 and lower last night..." for days I never got a reply or a refund. I tried to wait and give him a chance before writing a review. Then finally I was messaged by him through Air BnB! It was a Damage claim saying that WE broke the door which wouldn't close! Half laughing at this ridiculous notion, I declined the damage request and am now writing this review. Do not rent from Andy unless you wish to be unsafe, uncomfortable, un-helped, and squeezed for damages that you did not commit!

PLEASE BEWARE!!! The host is absolutely HORRIBLE!

The place itself is very nice, and the location is very close to downtown Austin... but there is NO KEY FOR THE DOOR AND THE DOOR KEYPAD DOES NOT WORK!

When we arrived he gave us a password for the front door key pad, we entered it exactly as described perfectly probably ten times. Nothing. He then asked us to look under the mat for a key... not only was there no key, there wasn‚Äôt even a mat!

We walked around to the back and found the back door WIDE OPEN. Unacceptable. We contacted him and he told us he would send someone out to check the keypad, but he never did. He claimed that he did and that ‚Äúthe keypad worked fine‚Äù but that was clearly a lie since we never left the place and no one ever showed up.

Please please please, only stay here if you don‚Äôt value your safety as it is impossible to lock the door if you ever decide to leave. Our vacation was essentially ruined. We had to rent a car just to use as a locker for when we would leave the place.

Absolutely terrible. Zero stars for the lying loser. Oh, and the hot water lasts for about 45 seconds.
It was amazing! Nothing but excellent!

I have to say that unfortunately, we had an issue with the A/C in on the of the bedrooms and I texted the host to let him know about it, he replied back later saying that he could not get the technician to go check it out that we could sleep on one of the sofas in the living room (not the answer that I was expecting).
