On Sunday he said that he was going to meet with his management team and that he will let me know ASAP what they said. I waited 2 days for his response and I did not get any. I am still waiting and it's been almost a week. We love the place, however, we were very disappointed with the service and I cannot recommend it.

We had a great experience here. I did see a dead cockroach when I arrived - but hey, at least it was dead! There were a couple of other bugs around the house that we saw as well, and a few of the towels seemed to be stained with makeup when we arrived. Other than that, everything was clean. Someone in a previous review mentioned having temperature regulation problems, but we had no issues there. Overall, I definitely would recommend this house, although I do think it is slightly overpriced.

It is a beautiful place BUT we had issues with cleanliness. Upon arrival we noticed dog hair on couches and rugs and strong pet odor. We also found our sheets were dirty on both beds - fortunately there was a washer and dryer for us to wash the sheets ourselves so we could sleep. We pay a cleaning fee, but it was evident the place was not well cleaned prior to arrival. Not happy about that, especially during a pandemic.
such a cute place and a short uber to town. we were sad to leave!

Disappointing stay in a very expensive, unclean home. Trash and recycling were full and smelly when we arrived; dishwasher also full and smelled badly.  Three large roaches in just the one night we spent there. Toilets, mirrors, faucet knobs not properly cleaned. We felt pretty uncomfortable staying there during COVID times, so we went and bought disinfectant spray to spray around the whole house. No clean towels in master bath. Laundry and dryer were full of damp clothes when we got there even though they are listed as available amenities; I had to finish the host's laundry so I could do my family's laundry. The host did respond to my concerns by refunding the sanitation fee, but it was still a very costly stay for a not clean home. The host relayed that it was hard to get the home prepped in time since I booked last minute; however, I feel that if a home isn't ready to go and sanitized properly then you shouldn't have it actively listed as available. Just take the listing off if you can't prep it!  There were also very few notes or directions for anything - i.e. how to use the tv, where to find clean amenities, etc.
Horrible communication and stalling.
Only regret we have is that we didn‚Äôt stay long enough!

Maison tr√®s agr√©able, spacieuse, dans un lotissement calme avec acc√®s piscine. Nous avons pu nous garer sans soucis devant la maison. La chambre √©tait agr√©able (nous avons loger √† l‚Äô√©tage). Notre arriv√©e a √©t√© un peu confuse, la chambre qui nous avait √©t√© indiqu√©e √©tait occup√©e par quelqu‚Äôun d‚Äôautre. La communication avec l‚Äôh√¥te n‚Äô√©tait pas parfaite. Apr√®s avoir quitt√© les lieux nous avons re√ßu plusieurs messages de la part de l‚Äôh√¥te (de mani√®re insistante) nous demandant o√π √©taient pass√©es les cl√©s de la chambre et de la piscine alors que tout √©taient bien dans la maison.
My first time renting an AirBnB and could not have been happier with this place!
The house was super good, I got more than expected but the location is a bit scary, The neighborhood was not good.

I was under the impression that we were renting just 1/2 of the duplex that shares a pool. In fact, this is 2 duplexes, so 4 units, which hold 14+ people each sharing a common area that is meant for a much smaller group. The location is in a run down neighborhood and I would not recommend people return home alone late at night. Overall for the price point, I would not recommend staying here as accommodations (pool, grill, patio) are shared and not usable after 1030PM and the poor location.

Initially when we first checked in there was wasps at multiple entryways, which isn‚Äôt a big deal it‚Äôs Texas and summer time.  They sent a maintenance guy out to drop off some spray and we took care of it, crisis diverted.  The downstairs living space was dirty at checkin, it could've used a sweeping or mopping and a vacuum on the rugs.  There  were water bottles left under the couch and the microwave was filthy.  They sent housekeeping out the next day when we were out of the house and upon returning, there was no noticeable difference in the spaces we complained about.  The trash cans were full and they reeked of seafood/shrimp and it stunk up the whole property at checkin.  You could literally smell the trash from the entry door of the property we stayed at, which is probably 50-60ft from each other.  The maintenance guys we‚Äôre supposed to dump the trash cans out when we made a complaint but they failed to do that.  I feel bad for the people that checked in behind us, there was trash overflowing and it‚Äôs a real eyesore at checkin.  As other people stated, the property is in a questionable neighborhood but we did feel safe on the property.  On the upside, the house is vary spacious and can accommodate a lot of guests and it‚Äôs very reasonably priced.

Top floor has 3 bedrooms that 2 of them would normally be closets in a master suite. 1 bedroom has to be accessed thru the bathroom!
Kitchen pots and pans were in bad shape and not good for cooking.
Good house if your looking to sleep a lot of people.

Undoubtedly, this place has a very beautiful view.  But the chairs and sofas were very dirty and stained.  I did not want to sit on them at all. The beds and sheets were not good at all and the cabin equipment was very chip.  It is written in the Dining section that " space where guests can cook their own food!!"but there is no space and stove there.  It is good to stay there for 1 day because of the view.  I do not recommend this to anyone
No frills but close to the highway.
Lou Anne‚Äôs Casita is everything you see in the photos and more. And Lou Anne is a consummate host, sparing no detail.

this was awful. the toilet did not work, we had to manually reach in to flush it. the Wi-Fi did not work as there were too many people on it. i understand it being a shared space, but if that's the case, up your Wi-Fi speed; because paying the exorbitant amount of money for a single room to not have simple amenities is ridiculous. we also heard, through the paper thin walls, the other people in the space complaining of not being able to get the hot water to work. all of these things are basic requirements for a space to rent out, especially for the price. we expressed these concerns to the host, didn't hear a single word back. no communication whatsoever. so we reached to Airbnb who ALSO couldn't get a response from this host which is completely unacceptable and unprofessional. thank god Airbnb refunded us, because the host had no interest in trying to remedy anything. one good thing I'll say, is it's decorated beautifully. but not beautifully enough to forego basic amenities.

She was supposed to come 3 times a week to clean. Sje rven has a room on the house. There was no TP hslf the time amd she would literally walk by a fraxh can in the house and not clean it. No one puts dishes away. Things are left on the table forever and no one cleans up. There is ALWAYS a mess in the laundry area which was right acrops from my room. Sne washed stuff and then dries, then leaves it all on top of machine. Tjete is ONE bathroom for 4 bedrooms , 5 including hers. Then, thete is the hostel attavhed to the hoise with a lot if vsry young people. After you book sje says they will be in theor 3ps annd 4ps. No, thry wete all under 24. I bad to use the reztroom and waited the konest i had waited in a week. It was her in tne shower. Very odd. She lives down the. Street and that was the bathroom for 9 people. I arrived to one of the most uncomfortable Airbnb‚Äôs I have ever stayed in. There were 3 rooms and I didn‚Äôt know which one I had to sleep in so I picked one. Upon leaving I received a notice that the host is charging me $240!!!! $180 for accidentally sleeping in a room I wasn‚Äôt supposed to!!! I had no idea which room was mine! $10 for the beer? No frills. No Hassle.
I just left a show at midnight and picked up another day for the load out, needed to crash for a few hours on a 7 hour turnaround at the last minute.  Adam was more than accommodating.

Craig and Taylor are the ultimate hosts! Their hospitality is second to none. From little Valentine‚Äôs Day treats to saving us from the worst winter storm Austin has ever seen (probably), Craig and Taylor do all they can to make you feel a part of their family. Thank you for everything!

I would just say maybe to install a water heater for the shower. Also, all the cameras were a bit much, especially when they‚Äôre facing the hot tub I can see that it‚Äôd make some guests uncomfortable. The camera at the gate entrance is understandable but the ones facing the deck, front door, and hot tub area are all a bit much. Also the hours for the hot tub are a bit restrictive. The property was dirty, with fungus in the fridge, the house is not well fumigated, we found two scorpions inside. The pool was not clean when we arrived as well.

I requested only 1 hour of late checkout, and the property manager was inflexible and rude when I asked for it.

I have pictures and evidence supporting this comment.

The price is high in comparison with the experience outcome.

Dawn was a great host; she responded quickly to my messages; however, It wasn't the right place for me. It was difficult getting into the bed, and the mattress wasn't comfortable. I also didn't like the building entrance, the hill is steep, and it's not enough light. It's was also very cold even when she adjusted the temperature.

This was a tough one to review. The apt. is really cute. Very clean upon arrival. Dawn was very responsive and very nice. Upon initial inspection, it was very clean and very well maintained. Loading and unloading bags is difficult due to location. Not an issue for me but Sis has bad knees and it was a struggle for her. As we were settling in for the evening, roaches began to emerge. Dawn was quick to respond and came down to help. Unfortunately, 2 roaches turned to 5 just running around. It was too much for us. We bailed. It was very late, we were very tired from traveling and lugging bags in the middle of the night was not how we envisioned our evening. Finding a hotel last minute was difficult and we ended up paying way more than we had budgeted. This was not just an inconvenience, it was very stressful and disappointing. Dawn was quick to issue a cancellation refund and she was great overall but it did not compensate for the incredible inconvenience or extra expenses we incurred due to this unfortunate experience.

It was a very disappointing unit.
No chairs, no lamps, no table to eat at..... the most cheaply furnished unit I have ever stayed in.
Absolutely no amenities!
Amit was accessible but I would never recommend this unit.
Had to cancel my res early. The place was dirty when I arrived, covered in dust. Rude, obnoxious, loud neighbor. Smelled like weed the entire time. Strange outlets, hanging wires scattered all over.
You won‚Äôt be disappointed.

Uniquely styled casita hits all the marks - close to "hot" spots in Austin off South Congress, super-clean, well-appointed amenities with thoughtful touches and very responsive host. Check in and check out was a breeze, and though we didn't bring our pets on this trip, they were welcomed and they even had CBD for pets to try! Be sure to try one (or all three) of the Elixirs. They cost a little extra but are a worthy added touch. Our only regret is that it rained so we didn't get to enjoy the fire pit. Next time!
Amazingly cute place. Cbd samples, wallpaper made me jealous. Fire pit
Perfect. Everything about this Airbnb is to die for.

Absolutely a steal. Right off south congress right in the middle so you are within walking distance to everything. The place was even cooler than it looks In the photos. Has zero issues and will be where I stay when I go down to Austin in the future!!

Absolutely terrible,first of all couldn't get in contact with host to find out how to get into the house. Then when my son and i showed up at the residence there was someone in the residence that we were aware of but after knocking on the door that individual came downstairs yelling peaked out the window and said we were at the wrong house. I identified myself and explained to him we had booked the room he then turned off the front porch lights and the rest of the lights in the house. I tried to contact the host but again no response. I contacted Airbnb about the situation and left it with them to take care of. Would never recommend this host not even to stay in a dog house nevertheless awful experience. Contemplated not leaving any review but figured other people needed to be aware of this situation

Wir waren zum zweiten Mal zu Besuch und wir hatten wieder eine tolle Zeit! Die Wohnung ist sehr sch√∂n eingerichtet und man f√ºhlt sich direkt wohl. Der Kontakt zu den Gastgebern ist sehr freundlich und die Lage ist auch sehr gut, in einer netten Wohngegend. Wir k√∂nnen dieses Airbnb sehr empfehlen und kommen gerne wieder!

The house was very clean. We did see a big spider the first night that we killed and then there was a baby spider the next day. Checking in was very quick. The rooms are very small. One thing I didn‚Äôt like was the surrounding area. It was a very old suspect neighborhood surrounding  the place

If you book this place, expect stained furniture, towels, and bedsheets. Also expect to be shivering in the property while wearing heavy sweats in the middle of winter because you will not have control over the AC. They keep all thermostats locked, and some of us were forced to sleep in concrete rooms (what used to be a garage) that were 61 degrees. There were no extra linens throughout the property to help keep us warm. The trash in the kitchen was already full upon arrival, and multiple light bulbs were either broken or not present throughout the property, leaving some rooms completely dark. Also expect only automated messages from the property owners and feeling ignored if you've messaged them with a question.

The place was big and spacious. Great location. Unfortunately, it seemed as if it was a rushed cleaning job for our stay. There were eyelashes left on the nightstand, dirty towels left on the shower rod, and the floor to the common areas were filthy. (Which our 10 month old discovered by crawling around and having dirty hands/knees to show for it.

Also, that area rug and couch need to be removed from the space immediately. We put comforters on the couch so we wouldnt have to sit on the stained couch, and completely removed the rug during our stay there. They were both disgusting.

It was alright , needs a deep clean and they complain about any little noises after 10pm it was really annoying bc we weren‚Äôt even loud , the house overall isn‚Äôt bad tho , def need some kind of pest control tho .

Pros:
- hosts are very friendly and responsive
- Beds and pillows are comfortable
- AC is cold

Cons:
- The neighborhood is really hit or miss. It‚Äôs clearly in the process of regentrifying. We felt safe within the walls of the property‚Äôs compound but would not walk around the neighborhood.
- Because of the neighborhood, the four units are behind a gate. Which is super annoying if you brought a car. You have to get out of your car, enter a code into a pedestrian gate, manually open the car gate, drive into the property, then manually shut the car gate behind you. It‚Äôs just a lot of work and again we did not feel safe doing this late at night.
- The house is dirty. Everywhere. The showers have mold in them. The walls have dirt and poorly patched holes everywhere. There‚Äôs cobwebs in the corners in nearly every room. There‚Äôs dust bunnies under the beds that are visible from just standing in the bedroom. All the light fixtures are dusty. The furniture has stains and the rugs are frayed. One bedroom had an obvious leak repair in the ceiling that they used popcorn texture on that was not properly done and was just falling off the ceiling and floating around the room. The entire place needs a deep clean, repaint and update.
- The listing is not clear that the ‚ÄúA‚Äù units do not have direct access to the pool. You have to walk through large river rock walk way through the property to access the backyard. Why they haven‚Äôt added pavers is beyond me because it really is an injury hazard.
- The trash and recycle bins were overflowing the entire duration of our stay. We had no where to put our trash and recycling.

The house is large and there are plenty of beds and room for people to sleep. There are only two parking spots and the house was not super clean- the showers were especially gross. Otherwise a decent Airbnb.

Very clean. But was in a neighborhood that I did not felt comfortable in. It did have high security fencing. The day we were supposed to leave someone parked right behind us the night before in our reserved parking. I asked for the person to be asked to move since we had a early departure and was told they would reach out to all the guest. In the AM the car was still there and I had to message the tenant again. They ordered a tow truck. But after an hour of waiting we eventually squeeze my car out. Was still frustrating that it was not taken care of the night before. It was fine but would not do again.

The house needs some maintenance. There was a water leak in the bedroom, and issue with the sink in the bathroom‚Ä¶ location is not ideal, and the whole 4 units parking in the parking spot, was hectic during checkin as everyone got there at 3pm. Backyard was not taken care of or the backyard. Very dirty. Not worth the price, pictures make it a lot better then it is.
Clean and very accommodating not to mention comfortable beds!
No issues, comfortable , clean

I am never one to complain and I always try to make the best of a bad situation, but renting this Airbnb was a horrible situation that I could not make the best of. I had rented this unit for 5 weeks due to the holidays and my daughter having a new baby, and spent a lot of money, expecting to have what was listed in the Airbnb listing. When I arrived to the property the apartment was disgustingly dirty! I had to clean myself, and when I mopped the floor I realized how dirty because the floor was filthy. The listing was advertised to have two king sized beds (which has been changed on the listing now because I complained, I have a screenshot of the original listing). When going through the kitchen I saw there was only 3 forks, 4 spoons, and 1 knife in the drawer. How is anyone expected to eat with the "complete kitchen" that was advertised. Also in the kitchen, a 5 pot coffee maker. If you have 6 people there, (as advertised you can sleep), you constantly have to make coffee. There were no instructions on how to use the TV; most Airbnb's we have rented always have instructions. There were no dressers to put your clothes in and we had to put everything on the shelves in the closet, which by the way, did not contain any robes that are shown in the pictures and was also dirty. When I further cleaned the next day I saw that the sliding glass door was open and the lock was broken. We slept the first night with an unlocked door!!! This was completely unsafe and dangerous!!! I sent the "hosts" three different messages on three different days to fix the lock to which I got the response "we will let our maintenance people know." They never showed to fix the problem. The "patio" was disgusting and dirty and not what was shown in the pictures. Upon further observation, I found mold in the shower, the walls were dirty and also contained mold, the "pullout couch" was not a pullout, just slept one person. The molding around the floor was dirty and broken. The vertical blinds at the sliding glass door had 6 panels. When I tried to use the dishwasher, it did not work, only to get a response from the host "we will let maintenance know." But the final straw was when I was using the kitchen sink I started to feel my feet getting wet and looked down and in the cabinet and there was water filling the cabinet. I messaged the host and got the same response, "we will let maintenance know." That is when I called Airbnb directly and sent them pictures. The Airbnb representative was incredible and so helpful with our problem! I can't thank them enough. I have pictures and videos of everything. This was a horrible experience and this host should not be able to list properties on Airbnb. After calling Airbnb and them investigating, I received a full refund within 15 minutes, which tells me this is not the first time they have dealt with this property. As soon as this happened we were out the door within the hour. I am also convinced that the comments listed under the listing are completely made up. I can't believe this host would advertise what what they do and get away with it. I have documented everything, and I would NEVER rent anything that this host is associated with!!!!! This host ruined what was suppose to be a wonderful holiday week!!! Also, according to the amenities listed on the listing page, these are the things that are NOT true according to the listing. There are NO:
No city skyline view - I have no idea where this would have come from and why it would be listed
No cleaning products - I had to buy my own, which I left there
No body soap or shower gel - I bought my own
Hangers consisted of 5 in total
No drying rack - no idea where this would have been
No clothing storage - the only place to put clothes was on the shelf in the closet - no dressers
No first aid kit - never saw one
No wine glasses - absolutely nothing
No dedicated workspace with a room with a door - there was a table in the living room but no workspace with a door.
Dopest place first time getting an air B&B meet all expectations had a killer cook out 20/10 would recommend this place

DON‚ÄôT BOOK!
This was the worst experience of my life, I was NEVER treated this way. The agency handling booking fail to notice that I had 2 toddlers in my group (listed) and seems the hosts don‚Äôt allow children. Talking to one of the hosts (the polite one) the day before, we both noticed the mistake, but agree ldto keep the booking. When we got to the place, the another host was waiting for us and treated us very rudely from the start, in less than 10 minutes he told us we were not welcomed and had ONE HOUR to leave (two mothers, with two toddlers, my elder parents, luggage, and no place to go).
I won‚Äôt go into details of how he treated us, but what is relevant to other travelers, in the pictures it looks big and spacious, but the living/kitchen combo is tight. estos lo que dise  el anfitri√≥n y m√°s es un lugar muy agradable  lo recomiendo mucho no dudar√≠a en regresar

Great location - just 2 minutes from The Triangle - convenient to so much.
Disappointed in the condition of the living room sofa and chairs - they are so dirty. So much so my young adult children didn't want to sit on them - so we used some linens to cover them to be able to sit on them.

We appreciated the hospitality from the hosts as well as the location, but felt the home was dirty and could have used a decoration or two.

It was mixed.  Some very nice things - kitchen, deck and bath areas - but some not so nice things - no ice available, no operable windows, too much outside lighting and lots of construction/tree removal noise.  I don‚Äôt think I would stay here again, even though there were some nice features.

The house is clean. However, it is clear that the owner is attempting DIY projects and is still learning. During our stay, the kitchen drawer broke as we were opening it to get silverware. Additionally, the mattresses, pillows and linens are very low quality. Bring extra paper good as there was only a couple of rolls per bathroom and one roll of paper towels for the kitchen.

The location is "okay". Be weary if you are driving a big vehicle or towing a trailer. We had to store our boat and trailer at a near buy storage facility, incurring additional fees. The house is on a single lane road that makes it difficult to turn around. The driveway is very steep and is basically unusable.

The biggest disappointment of our trip was the fact that the dock was basically out of the water. We had towed our boat for four hours for our Spring Break trip with our children under the guise that we could dock our boat. This was the main reason that we had chosen this home. When we arrived, there a boat parked in the dock. I immediately called Bhishma and was advised that the boat was inoperable, he was out of town and unable to move it. Additionally, I was advised that we could "tie our boat next to the dock". This would have been a hazard to us and would have potentially damaged our boat.

When I attempted to resolve the issue with Bhishma he was courteous but claimed that the dock issue was listed in the description. Unfortunately, this is not the case.

So, if you are wanting to rent a property to have a private dock... look elsewhere.

There was no swimming area, and didn‚Äôt feel there was a safe location to launch the kayak. There was also no paddle or life jacket.  Several bugs and large cockroaches that we had to kill.   Sleeping at night wondering if you will wake up to cockroaches on the floor is not pleasant.

We were not happy with this stay as the place was not clean and the value was not worth it.
We kept finding cockroaches and it seemed like an infestation.
2 of the throw blankets in the closet were dirty and I could tell bc I smelled them, they smelled used.
The host was quick to reply but we felt this property for which we paid $996 total for 3 nights was not up to par.
I believe there were hidden fees I didn‚Äôt see. The property was advertised as $114 a night, how do you get to $pay $996 for 3 nights. This isn‚Äôt right plus property was not clean to standards.
La Cabana has an odd set up. Not much common areas - just the kitchen. No real place to hang out, but otherwise fine.

Terrible Airbnb and terrible customer service! We checked in and realized there wasn‚Äôt any hot water. We reported this and nothing was done until the next day even though they responded to us the first day. Nor did we have any gas for the stove, soon to find out the gas was shut off the week prior and nothing was ever done. We wasted a couple hundred dollars on food that we couldn‚Äôt even cook. For our 3 night stay we had no gas to cook or for hot water. The couch leg was broken, all of the furniture was cheep and uncomfortable. All of the dishes were in the dishwasher and dirty. Upon checkout, we were making sure we didn‚Äôt forget anything and found dirty underwear under one of the beds, which wasn‚Äôt ours. Lastly, there was on roll of toilet paper in each bathroom, and no extra. Same with paper towels; they supply minimal supplies for you stay.

Do not book this property with Turnkey. I warn everyone about this property and Turnkey. This was the worst experience I have ever had booking a vacation rental. They do not run their business with integrity. They want your money and they don‚Äôt care that they do not provide what they advertise. We gave Turnkey the opportunity to make this right and they did not. We booked this until based on the pictures and description and after speaking to their representative. Turnkey did not disclose that the unit‚Äôs driveway and the property surrounding it were under construction which caused us to not be able to enter the property. The driveway was 2 thin strips of concrete with deep trenches on either side. The road leading up to the property was also under construction. I describe it as gravel mogul pits. The parking space for the unit was already taken by the homeowner of the other unit. The other homeowner advised us to park in a business across the street. We decided we didn‚Äôt want to risk being towed for parking on someone else‚Äôs property. We called Turnkey and asked for assistance and said we were willing to accept another property. Turnkey did not provide us with any assistance. We did not check in to the unit at all as the driveway and perimeter was not safe to drive on and should we have driven on it, we would have had to back out of the long driveway on raised concrete strips risking going in a trench if we made a mistake. It was dark when we checked in. We had to go to a hotel for the night. We had to cut short our trip and drive home early. I cannot believe Turnkey was so greedy for our payment they would risk putting a family with a child and a dog in a hazardous property without disclosing the information. If it had been an oversight on their part, we gave them ample opportunity to make this right. They chose not to. They did not refund any of our rental fees, pet fees, cleaning fees, etc and we did not check-in or enter the property. This company is greedy and does not conduct business with honesty or integrity. After calling the company several times, I finally received an email from Margaret in their corporate office that I should have purchased travel insurance. I‚Äôm quoting her email ‚ÄúWe are not moving forward with any refund amounts at this time. In accordance with our cancellation policy as shown below, no refund will be issued for any non-refundable payments or Weather and Other Unforeseen Events: TurnKey does not accept liability for any inconveniences, delays, or your inability to booking in a Unit arising from any temporary or permanent defects or stoppage in supply of water, gas, electricity, or plumbing, damage caused by weather, road closures, or conditions, construction, natural disasters, disruption or cancellation of your travel, events, conferences or reason for your booking, government orders, pandemics, viruses, illnesses, infestations, water conditions, closings, pollution, acts of God or other reasons beyond TurnKey's control. No refunds will be given for any delays or cancellations due to such conditions. Accordingly, travel insurance with ‚Äúcancel for any reason‚Äù terms is highly recommended for all bookings and may purchase online at https://turnkeyvr.com/insurance.
We are sorry for any frustrations and we understand this is not the solution you were looking for, but hope you understand our position at this time. Please let us know if there is anything else we can assist you with.‚Äù

Dear Margaret,
This booking was not eligible for the cancel for any reason travel insurance. You and Turnkey should be ashamed of running a business where you treat customers so poorly that you advise them to have insurance for your false advertising and inaccurate listings. Your company did not provide any support or assistance in finding another property.

Not what we expected, it seems to be a house cut up into sections. You share the amenities with the other guests, and like a hotel, you wait your turn to use them. The pictures are misleading, we did not have a relaxing time..

The apartment was as described in the listing, however I believe we are being scammed. Hours after we checked out we received a request for $350 for ‚Äúdamages caused to the oven,‚Äù however during our stay we did not use or touch the oven. This claim for $350 came with no pictures of the broken oven or an understanding of how that amount was calculated. The claim is currently being disputed, but there is no way this oven was broken during our stay, so it feels very much like a scam. Be wary if you choose to stay here - survey the apartment and take pictures of any damages when you arrive.

I never leave bad reviews (check my review history if you don‚Äôt believe me!) but I feel compelled to after my experience here.

Overall the place is very clean and close to downtown, so that was nice. Now for the bad.

This place advertises having two beds, but pull-out bed turned out to be a disaster. First of all, it has a significant slant, which makes the springs pushing into your back worse. Then, we discovered there were no blankets for it. I messaged the host and was told that they were out of town and the housekeeper couldn‚Äôt bring one, so I try and purchase one myself. In a city I don‚Äôt live in, when I don‚Äôt have a car. I guess the owner doesn‚Äôt know anyone else in Austin who could do it? Red Flag.

The second issue was being awaken at 8am the morning of check-out by someone entering the unit. In my sleepiness I didn‚Äôt see who it was before they left, but it was very alarming. I contacted the host and they said it was the housekeeper. I am not sure why the housekeeper would be entering the unit at 8am without knocking when they should know people are staying there.

Overall, this air bnb felt like it was being run by a big, out of touch cooperation from afar. That is exactly the opposite experience people staying in Air BnBs want.

Alessandra wanted some unusual things, not listed under the house rules.  One was to leave my room door partly open when I was not in my room.  The other was to not allow any water to go down her kitchen sink drain.  She seemed to believe that the city has a guage on her sewer pipe and that is how she is charged for waste water.  A sewer guage?  Other things (not only water) go down  sewer pipes. ( The waste water charge on Austin bills  says it is averaged from regular water use.) So she wants the kitchen  water collected in tubs which she wants people to take outside. These can be heavy.  The 1st afternoon I was there she said "You don't slam doors."  Referring to a review.   The next day she claimed to be super sensitive to the sound of doors closing. So I made a big effort to close  doors quieter. The next morning  she started really slamming doors herself, all over the house.  Very loud and scary.  There was a faulty electric light switch in her L. Room. Took  it several tries .
The room is a converted garage. Very hot and the fan is very loud. Kept waking us up. Bathroom was not as clean as the rest of the house. Shower and toilet being the problem.

Our 4 night stay was ok, but could have been more comfortable.

The room is a small garage conversion with a window ac unit, small closet, table, chair, and full bed. I would have appreciated an extra throw blanket for coziness.

The bathroom is on the other side of the house. No supplies (new soaps, travel sized shampoo, etc) were provided, except for 2 bath towels. There was no hand towel or bath mat.

The living room and kitchen areas were cluttered, not very inviting. We felt bad about being in those areas, so we stayed in our room most of the time.

The owner's dog is cute, but barks a lot at you. Not good if you're scared of dogs.

Check in and access to the house is ok, just have to download an app and have Bluetooth connected.
Self check in was a breeze, room is perfect for a weekend excursion to Austin. Convenient location that avoided much of the traffic problems getting to downtown.
THIS IS A SCAM! Host is unresponsive, the listing is not real and the ‚ÄúAirBnB‚Äù has permanent residents. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY.

They have a serious roach problem. They come out at night and they are everywhere. I spent too much money to stay with roaches. Had to recheck and unpack all my luggage to make sure I didn‚Äôt bring any with me home... a serious problem.

I hate to leave negative reviews but this place did not meet our expectations. The place smells like dog urine and pet odor spray, has a roach problem, and the dishwasher is broken. All these things are fixable but for now I unfortunately would not recommend!
Centrally located. All the amenities you need when staying away from home. No cable, but does have WI-FI , local ,Netflix,  Hulu is avail also.
Really different from the pictures, the lighting was really bad, we found a lot of cockroaches, and we had no hot water.
