We did communicate this to the host. We were told that pest control may come out but probably not since it was the weekend. The host knew of the roach issue prior to the booking and our arrival.

Had a terrible odor the moment we walked in - some kind of moldy/musky/wet scent throughout. Sheets were so dirty - had human hair and colored stains throughout. The hosts weren't able to do anything about the situation until the following day. When we asked to have a reimbursement for bed sheets so we at least had a clean place to sleep, they denied. so unhelpful, never booking again.

Unfortunately, our overall experience at the property was poor. The location was great, the communication with property management was good, and the neighbors were nice. But, the apartment was dirty and infested with roaches.

We found used bottles of water and socks that did not belong to us under the bed, which did not give us confidence that the apartment had been cleaned thoroughly. The dishwasher was inoperable and had water/soap still sitting in it from the previous guest. The sheets in both beds were stained with what looked like blood and all the guest were itchy during our stay (unsure if the beds were the cause). The apartment overall was not in great shape; discoloration/dirty walls, the toilet not being bolted down, dirty floors just to give a few examples. In addition, we encountered at least 10 roaches during our stay in various areas of the apartment, including one in the bed.

Water was shut off suddenly for a few hours during one of the days as well. We contacted management who informed us that emergency maintenance was the cause. We know this was out of managements control, but a heads up could have been provide (if the maintenance was known in advance) or a follow up to see if the issue was resolved at the very least.

As much as we wanted to like this property because of the location, we cannot recommend this property to anyone and will not be staying here again. The issues were just too numerous to forgive.

I don't really like to give bad reviews,,,,,,but the unit I stayed in had roaches......plural. I got there late so when I discovered them it was to late to cancel so I actually slept in my vehicle. I booked the room for 3 nights and was charged $384.93. The property refunded me $205.92 and charged me $179.01 for the one night, which I'm guessing included the Cleaning fee and service which is ridiculous considering the place looked like it needed to be cleaned when I entered it not to mention the pest problem.

So if I could rate my overall experience with this property lower than 1 star I definitely would.

Overall, my stay here wasn‚Äôt bad. However, the pictures are taken well so you don‚Äôt see some of the worse parts of the room (open pipes and cables along the walls, pieces of the walls missing, mold on the ceiling).

Host had very good communication and the check in process was a breeze. The area was very sketchy and the photos on the listing were extremely misleading. In the photos, the home looked MUCH cleaner, newer, and nicer. The listing disclosed that there were exterior cameras at all entrances for safety, which were not the case. And in that area would have made me feel much safer. In the home, there were many holes cut out in the wall, exposed pipe and wire, underneath the beds were not clean (orange juice bottle and other trash left NOT from our party), bathroom had maybe some mold on the ceiling? No bugs visible in any part of the location.

Definitely got the job done but nothing luxurious and the photos were misleading. Just not as nice as expected.
Decent place to stay, not the best location
No complaintsü§å
Charged a ridiculous amount of money charges for stains that were already their

We used this space for a photoshoot and it was awesome for having space to shoot in however their guest policy made it very difficult to accommodate models - there were never more than 4 people in the house at 1 time, only 1 person stayed the night, but we had to pay for 6 people.

Overall, the stay was okay but the location was great. It had a beautiful view, however, we were not informed by the owner that the lake had a drought which made docking our boat pointless as it was very unsafe for us to even walk up and down the ramp. The cleanliness of the entire place was disappointing. Restrooms were not hygiene friendly, entertainment area upstairs was filthy, broken down furniture, too many bugs were inside of the house right as we checked in. The house itself was in bad shape. The place could have been much more better for the price we had paid. If the owner renovated the whole place, we could possibly return!

So the best part is you have your own boat dock to keep your boat in the water if you are bringing a boat. There is also a boat ramp on the property to use so you don‚Äôt have to go to a public boat ramp. However the bot ramp is not very safe and has broken rock on the sides and has uneven concrete that is old and broken in some areas so just be careful.

The worst part was how unsafe the chairs and seating areas are. One of the chairs broke while my mom (on her 60th bday weekend) was sitting in it by the pool broke and she hit her head on the fence and almost hit it on a rock that she barely missed. There was no concession offered or anything offered from the owner except for an apology. That is unacceptable and I honestly think should have resulted in a full refund since it could have been a law suit.

Also the houses were all dirty with bugs and leaves. The ground keepers were actually blowing leaves into the bedroom under the door when we arrived for check in and we had to sweep them out ourselves! There were gaps under all the doors so every morning you had dozens of rolly pollys and spiders all over the floor you have to clean up. Also be aware the photos have not been updated online and it will look different and not in a good way from what you see in the photos. It‚Äôs not terrible but looks way nicer in the photos.

Overall we still had a good time, but for over $1200/day for the stay was way over priced for what you get and very disappointed the owner did nothing to offer a refund or even come out to fix and check the equipment after the chair broke and hurt my mom bad. We will not be staying here again and for the price you can find better.
I would have preferred higher water pressure but was sufficient for needs.

The ceiling was cut out in the kitchen that seemed to be to fix a mold issue. The place smelled like mold. The windows were all dirty and the yard was not kept up. The pictures made the place look so much better than it ended up being and we were very disappointed.

Dustin was quick to respond to questions and followed up with us on our stay as needed. Plenty of space to sit and hang out between activities. Showers were able get hot water easily.

At the time of our stay, the backyard patio area was a little rough looking. There was some damage from a previous guest but Dustin did give us a heads up just before our stay and someone had come by just before us to begin fixing that area up. It did not affect our stay at all.

Upon check out the host asked if I could leave a good review and leave any issues in the private feedback. I suspect this was the same message sent to other guests which may explain all the 5 star reviews for this listing. I think because of that I was mislead when booking. I was expecting a 5 star stay but this listing was 3 stars at best. I‚Äôm leaving an honest review so others don‚Äôt get mislead.

Cleanliness - Upon check-in we had to strip the sheets off the bed because they were dirty. We picked up a couple big clumps of hair. There was mold in the shower caulking. The windowsills were loaded with dead bugs. When I opened a window the wind blew a dead spider onto me. Nasty! At check out the host wanted me to tell her when we were leaving because the cleaners were on a tight schedule. I have to imagine the cleaners were rushed before we checked in.

Comfort - There is an old couch but really not enough space to comfortably sit more than 2 people. Footrests or a coffee table would go a long way for relaxation. There was a big backyard but no furniture to relax outside.

Wifi - the wifi was brutal. When there‚Äôs more than 1 device connected the wifi is laggy and very spotty. My partner and I were working remotely during our long term stay and had a lot of issues. More than a few times I had calls drop which is a bad look for me with my clients. Online gaming was impossible with the lag. The listing advertised high speed wifi but that‚Äôs just not the case when more than 1 device is connected.

There were so many things that just didn‚Äôt work. The cold water in the bedroom sink did not work (hot water was fine), the overhead stove light was broken, the dishwasher did not dry the dishes (and there was no drying rack for dishes so you have to hand dry everything), the bedroom window just barely doesn‚Äôt close which made it unnecessarily loud at night. The list goes on.

Overall this listing is just average at best so I‚Äôm giving it 3/5 stars. The only features above average were the TV (large smart tv), the large kitchen sink w/ garbage disposal, and location which includes two food trucks and a convenience store just steps away. Every other feature was average or far below average. It seems that not a lot of effort went into this place.

This listing is probably okay if you just need a place to sleep for a weekend but would not recommend for long term stays especially if you‚Äôre planning to work remotely.

What seemed to be a solid monthly rental turned out to be a ton of issues. No information provided at checkin despite a month-long stay. Backyard grass was very unkempt upon checkin.. to the point where you couldn‚Äôt even walk through backyard because there was so much grass. The shower handle came off a few days after checkin and the solution from the owner was to use a wrench to operate the shower until it was fixed which was about a week . No communication during the issue, they just showed up randomly to fix without warning. Then after these issues the host simply stopped responding to my messages and flat out ignoring me. Very unfortunate experience that I ultimately thought warranted a refund but no such luck as host is no longer responding. Be careful with this rental everyone.
I messaged, called, & even knocked on the door over the course of 5 hours but I was never able to get ahold of the host to check-in. I had to cancel & find somewhere to stay at 9pm.

Place is in a really convenient location. We found it quick to get to all the sites we wanted to see in Austin. We also loved the creek with a walking path just down the street.

The apartment is well thought out and designed.

The amenities were fantastic, e.g. we were thankful for laundry soap.

Check in/out was easy.

We only had two issues but they were a bit major:

- The shared laundry room was quite dirty. The floor was covered in dirt and half the machines were broken. Also, needs coins ‚Äî no cards.

- We asked if there were any problems before coming, due to the weather disaster. We were assured there were no issues. When we arrived we found the shower could not hold a stable water temperature (undulating between freezing and boiling). It seemed like no one knew, and this was not fixed in the week we were there. This made showering very unpleasant, moreover the water pressure was pitiful.

Thank you for providing a place to stay during my trip. While I‚Äôm grateful to have a roof over my head, for the price I paid for one night, I was extremely disappointed by the quality of the building, unit, and stay. By the way the unit was marketed, my expectations were very high, anticipating a more luxurious stay at a ‚Äúprofessionally designed, sparkling clean‚Äù apartment unit.  Upon arriving, the apartment building was under construction, which caught me off guard as there was no prior warning. The work being done on the building obstructed the parking details I was instructed to followed which again, was unexpected and frustrating. Lastly, I was surprised, and again frustrated, by the list of check out instructions that included taking out the trash, removing the sheets, and running the dishwasher while I paid a $65 cleaning fee in my total cost. The overall quality of stay for the amount I paid did not meet my expectations and left me quite frustrated and disappointed. However, the location is very central to a lot of great things Austin has to offer as long as you have a car.

This location was extremely convenient when my daughter and I visited the area. Very easy access to whereever we needed to go.

The parking was located right under the unit but be warned not to go up the ramp too fast in a lower car. Parking was never a problem for us.

The unit was clean. Unfortunately, the battery died on the keyless entry when we were there and it took about 45 minutes of us waiting outside until the owner came to fix it. Then it took about another half an hour until it was fixed but they were very pleasant and we understand it was not their fault. Batteries die. When we tried to watch the tv we discovered that someone had taken the batteries from the remote control. With no other way to turn on the television we had no access to that feature. The host offered to drop batteries the next day but we were not going to be around and did not want anyone to go into the unit without us there.

All in all, the rental was absolutely fine, but we would stay in a different place next time we visit.

Was a pretty good spot that had everything one might need and was nice looking. My major complaint is that the toilet paper was ultra low quality - thin, breakable, and scratchy. Easy thing to fix, but sad kind of thing to try to cut costs on.
Great value spot! We were 10 minutes from everywhere. You can hear the upstairs neighbors, but it wasn‚Äôt bad.

I wanted to really like Cannon‚Äôs place from pictures and description but was disappointed upon arrival - I expected more and not a college apartment complex. Walls are thin - it was noisy and could hear ‚Äúeverything‚Äù from other units. Apartment was clean overall - there was an odd odor and towels had stained and recommend replacement.

Clean rental and well located to campus. Furnishings sparse but adequate.

AC didn‚Äôt kick on/off regularly at night.

Be aware of cleaning charge and also additional request for you to do part of cleaning yourself.

Was accused of having pet and request for additional payment (I had no pet). Make sure you ask for support if accused of this and let them know ahead of time if you are planning on a pet.

Most providers provide at least some coffee for coffee makers. This provider did not.

Also, accidentally left with plastic parking pass. Offered to mail back, with owner wanting me to overnight it. An inappropriate request imo.
Overall good apartment, but there is a smell of animal urine. Also, the assigned parking space is a little difficult to find.

Overall great. Good location. Helpful guides for Austin. However it was kind of dirty, water smelled weird, not enough towels (only 2), and air mattress was only a twin (thought it‚Äôd be a queen but that could be my mistake). Also they wanted to charge us $30/hour to drop our bags off (a little unheard of) but then ultimately let us check in 1 hour   early since the cleaning people were done.

Great location. Easy check in and check out   We had a few problems during our stay, we had no hot water for the first night. We let the hosts know and they responded quickly and let us know a plumber would be there the following morning to fix the issue. The plumber arrived at 8am and got the hot water back on. The remote for the tv was also not working the first night of the stay, the hosts ordered a new one which arrived the following morning. We appreciate the responsiveness from the hosts, but not having hot water and waking up to a plumber is not ideal for a vacation. We requested a partial refund which was ignored.

This house is disgusting.  There were 3 - 64 gallon trash bins at the front overflowing with trash as soon as we pulled up.  The grass was super tall - trash in the backyard - and so many bugs could not really be out there.   As soon as you open the door the house smells like dog.  (We had to buy candles it smelled so bad) Half of the lights/ceiling fans do not work - especially the lights over the stairs (unsafe).  The house has a keypad that would not lock at all - we would have to leave through the back door to lock the front door.  The majority of smoke alarms were missing/disconnected.  (This is probably due to the stove having no exhaust) The stove has not been cleaned had nasty food and crust all over it.   The house is so dirty - the linens smell like mildew super unclean and unsanitary.  There were roaches in the pantry.  And then to top it all off - the host had the audacity to try to charge us a fee for dog crap?! -  We had no dogs or pets.  I believe the cleaning crew is taking him for a fool. We had to open up a case with Airbnb because he just kept insisting we pay an extra fee for his horrid, disgusting, nasty dirty house. Honestly worst stay ever through Airbnb.  He did try to escalate with Airbnb which sided with us as we provided pictures and had notes between us and the host.  We did not want to open up a case with Airbnb for refund - (since you have to do it within 24 hours and we were only there for 2 days - however had we know the host was going to be so rude and disrespectful on top of his nasty house we would have!) We lost out on a lot of money for a miserable house in Austin.  STAY AWAY!
The house was great. The only issue we had is the keypad was a little finicky and took multiple tries to unlock/lock usually (but this seriously could‚Äôve been user error)!

The home when I arrived is nice on the outside from the front. Upon entering it looks clean but it was not clean nor sanitized. Due to covid you would think the owner would make sure their cleaning team would take all Per cautions and keeping the home clean and safe for the next renter. The floors were dirty stuff spilled on them and you can tell they have not been cleaned in a good while. The home is left the way the people prior that stayed there leave it. The lights in the hallway as in the stair case do not work none of them as my mother Inlaw fell and hurt her self due to no lighting. The light in the loft does not work as well yes there is a lamp to connect but the plugs do not work they even have burn marks so we were kinda scared to try to plug more stuff not knowing if there would be a shortage or a burn out from that plug. Locking the door was a hassle and I tried to get ahold of the owner yet no response till the next day which was very inconvenient knowing we could leave our stuff there and the door not being able to lock and if anything went missing in their home we would be accountable for. So number one rule in renting out an Airbnb you should always be able to get in contact with the owner at any time for any reason if something is not right or goes wrong with the home. In this case not being able to lock the door so we could leave is one main thing. I spent over an hr trying to make sure the door would lock and no answer from owner cuz he said he was out of town. Also walking into the room they look clean yet again the floors were dirty the beds well the covers were not washed and they smelled. They had over people hair and dirt on them. So I had to take all the covers off from all the beds and put them to wash which is unfair knowing we are being charged a cleaning fee. The master closet omg that carpet is disgusting you can feel the nasty from it. So when renting this home please make sure to wear shoes or sandals at all times cuz your socks if white will be dirty from just a few seconds walking in them even your feet. Please check the bed covers if they were even washed or cleaned at all. The backyard in the pictures was one reason we wanted to stay but when we went to the backyard it was dirty and not a space you could hang out. The chairs had not been cleaned in god knows how long and there is a family of mice that scared us while walking out there. There are big roaches in the home so check your bags before leaving so you don‚Äôt take none back home with you. Before leaving I did take all the bed covers off my self to make sure they get washed and put them in the washer and upon throwing the trash outside, well there was no room for that. The trash was over filled he has 2 bins and both were over filled to the point they don‚Äôt close and trash was on the side as well. You can tell that trash has been there for over 2wks. Going to the side of the house to throw trash a rat came out and scared me. After the cleaning and washing of Mr Alecs home my family and I were able to relax. The home in my point of view was dirty not sanitized due to covid, nor clean for the next renter. The beds were okay to sleep in, the kitchen was useful the couches comfy but we did have to spray them down with febreze because they do have a dirty smell. Before leaving the home I did take pictures on how my family and I left it cleaned. Also in master bath the tub sounds like it about to break and the plugs did jump as we were using the bathroom ones and could not turn them on since the breaker is in the garage and it‚Äôs locked. So if you need to use the plugs in the restrooms they don‚Äôt work or if they do, not at the same time. Be safe the plugs have burn marks. On a good note area is nice and safe good neighborhood.  There is also a store close by and it is close to alot of shopping centers. FYI the walls are paper thin as you can hear everything. The traffic around 5 is very busy and takes a while to get to the home.
The check out process was a bit too much. Having to pay a cleaning fee is frustrating when you have to run the dishes and the washer/dryer on your own.
P terrys go crazy
Place was okay, little dirtier than I thought and ended up seeing some bugs that was unpleasant. Overall an okay house.

The owners sent me a different address than what I booked on the day I was flying into Texas. The booking still showed the correct address; however, in the check in instructions they told me to drive to a different address and stay there. They didn‚Äôt respond to messages or calls from myself or Airbnb. I didn‚Äôt feel comfortable being moved to a different unknown apartment away from the conference I was attending. The worst part was this all was happening after I landed in Texas and it was 8:00 pm. I ended up booking a hotel nearby.

The location of this apartment is perfect for shopping and restaurants (it is in the Domain Northside section (right in the heart of high-end shopping and restaurants); however, the hosts put the incorrect apartment complex initially and address in the Airbnb application. They did not edit the address on the Airbnb, but only messaged me a few hours before check in the correct apartment complex location/address. This did not help with the planning as I already had an Uber scheduled to the original location ahead of time. A recommendation for Henry and Kate to put the correct address from the beginning.

Additionally, the apartment unfortunately was VERY dirty and was definitely not cleaned before I arrived. The vents and fan had piled up dust (which looks like it has been there and not cleaned for months - it is that sticky kind of dust) and the entire apartment is not clean. The kitchen had coffee stains and spots of various residue (from oil) when I arrived.

On the flip side, Henry was very communicative via the Airbnb application. They offered to order any appliances or toiletries that may have been running low or missing (as not all appliances were available or low in toiletries).

I gave this place a 1 rating, even tho' Gavin told us in a text to give him a 5. I never met Gavin or got a message  explaining why he wasn't there to explain things to us. The fridges had leftovers from previous guests in them & we needed to leave our perishables in our ice chest. There was a pair of dirty socks on the living room couch, the bbq grill was filthy, and when I complained about these things, I was called a bad guest! The 2 day stay came to $1,968.53 NOT worth it, especially when guests are expected to clean up inside & out, wash the dishes & towels and strip the beds. I suggest looking into alternate places to stay.
The views are insane!!
Overall they stay was fine.  A few unfortunate things we discovered that the host was notified of.  Not sure if I‚Äôll be booking again.

We didn‚Äôt have a good experience, the apartment was extremely dirty and there were several things that needed fixing.

There were roaches around the apartment and there was lots of activity in the building.
Place is close to town. Apartment complex not what you would expect; noisy; not enough parking spots.

I would not stay here again; towels were dirty, bedding was unchanged, the cabin was dirty, the grounds were unkept with junk yard attire everywhere. Felt a little in between Sanford and Sons and Deliverance. I booked because of the tub that ended up visually being covered in mold and possibly urine. I‚Äôve never written a bad review, this was my first.
Overall not a great experience. Poor communication from the host, less than clean upon arrival and the patio was unusable because it smelled like urine. Avoid unless you need something on the cheap.

Our stay here was ruined by filthy floors, kitchen, and bathrooms, and poor communication from the host. We arrived to a stinky airbnb with sticky floors, greasy/dirty glass and doors, a used q-tip, wet laundry, dried beer, and broken glass (not even covering all the things). In the end we were refunded only some of the cleaning fee and one night stay. The host (politely, but inevitably) undermined us when we told her the place was really dirty, even after the second cleaning. She offered us a cancellation around 8 or 9pm on the first night of our stay, but at that point it was so late and we were exhausted from having partially cleaned the place ourselves. We ended up being kind of stuck for the week and continued to find things that were covered in a layer of grease and dust. Location was good though.
Not super clean - fridge was dirty, tape on the walls from a party, dust on windows. Neighborhood was ok - a little rough a block away. Air conditioning super loud and fridge woke me up every hour

The house is very nice but the rules are really strict. They charge you extra money per HOUR if you want to use the jacuzzi (heated) which is absurd. For the amount of money that you pay to stay here that should definitely be thrown in if it‚Äôs being advertised in photos as an amenity. Also costs extra to heat the pool (which is fine but just a heads up.) Also very strict about noise and being outside past 10pm. There are cameras in the back watching you which made some of the guests feel very uncomfortable as they were in bathing suits. The pool was also filthy with leaves, build up, and dead bugs everywhere. Aside from those things the house was very nice, modern and spacious. Just wish I knew the information about the jacuzzi before booking. Photos were misleading.

This is a typical "Vacation Rental."  It is very photogenic. Be aware that a Master Bathroom shower stall has direct access to outdoors through a clear glass door rendering that shower virtually useless.

My family and I stayed here for 5 days while our house was painted. The house itself was clean but I would not stay again after my experience with the host. The most inconvenient part of the trip was that Kels waited to tell us the freezer wasn‚Äôt working until after we checked in. We also found out later that evening when I was going to make my daughter some milk, that the refrigerator wasn‚Äôt working either. Since our house has been under construction I was really looking forward to cooking but that was impossible without a refrigerator. The refrigerator was fixed 2 days later after to visits from the repairman. After the repair we asked for compensation for spoiled groceries, takeout while we waited for repair, and a refund for the 2 nights. Kels didn‚Äôt agree but did end up refunding for the groceries and takeout.
We later asked to book an extra night since painting at our home was running behind. Kels said he needed to charge an extra $100 on top of our current rate since it was Memorial Sunday. We didn‚Äôt think this was fair and that he was trying to make up for money already refunded to us so we said no.
During our stay we also found a gas leak outside while playing with our daughter. I immediately let Kels know. After no response called the gas company for him. I also stayed at the home to be present for the gas company since that was required by them. After Kels messaged me back he said his Dad would show to take care of it but he never did.
This is the most disturbing interaction - 1 day after checking out of the Airbnb I receive a photo of a knob on a gas stove that is slightly turned. Kels then asks if I intentionally left the gas on at the stove in the Airbnb. I was shocked when I saw the message. He was asking me if I intentionally left the gas on to hurt someone. I was immediately offended by the ridiculous question and obviously said no.

Took my 14 year old son to Austin booked this apartment for our trip. Our little vacation was going to be for six nights in Austin but left after only two nights. The first night was fine but on our second day here two men unlocked our door and walked in to the apartment asking us what we where doing here. I was freaking out and scared for my life and for my son how did they have the code to come into my room. Property manager said oh it was a mix up laughed it off and said they sent them the wrong room information. I was told not to call the police they would fix this but my thoughts were to call 911 two unknown men are in my room. property manager said he would come and update my door code so no one would have it. Terrified and scared I agreed to let him come change the code after this I could not sleep or even felt safe in this small apartment I reached out to the property owners just for them to give me an apology. I left the next day I did not feel safe at all and what was was supposed to be a fun week with my son in Austin turned into a horrible experience. How can such a mix up happen ? I am still very shook by the whole experience and never plan on using this Airbnb again. I was in tears the whole night that I was there. This was very traumatizing for me and my son , save yourself from having any mixups happening to you on your vacation and having your plans ruined!!! beware of their mixups
Photos are deceptive. This unit was not properly cleaned and smelled of mildew that visible on the shower curtain liner. Do not recommend.

They do NOT clean the place. There is just no way. The dishes weren't washed and they were kept in the cabinets. The worst part was having insects EVERYWHERE: on the bed, on the couch, IN THE DISHWASHER, in the bathroom, everywhere!

The couch bed has a plastic around it which makes it extremely uncomfortable. You can't sleep on it because of how noisy it is. I don't understand why they would wrap it like that.

I also never heard of an Airbnb that demands to throw out the trash. I wouldn't know where that is and this sounds absurd.

Usually, Airbnbs have at least coffee, there was none.

We couldn't do the dishes because of the insects we found in the dishwasher and let's just say we weren't sleeping very well at night since we knew bugs were probably on the sheets.

Lastly, the walls are super thin. Like the other person said, just don't do it.
The apartment had a very bad odor so I could not stay however the host was willing to ease the problem. I got my money back but was not a great experience!!
Floor was extremely dirty, AC unit makes so much noise.

Smelled horribly
Dirty linens
Never again
One bedroom Apartment right off the drag not too far from the university.

Our recent family stay at this property was not what we expected.  When we arrived the door code would not work.  Luckily the owner lives next door so they came over and helped us get in.  Then the television would not work.  We checked in Friday afternoon and it didn't come on until Saturday afternoon.  Thirdly, the exterior door to the back yard would not lock so the first night we had to sleep with it unlocked which was very unsettling given this property is only a few blocks from a homeless community. Finally, and the most disturbing to us was the fact that this property was advertised as "Backyard Oasis".  this is why we booked it because we had small children. Turns out the owner has built a fence 8 ft. from the back of the house so there was no backyard.  The owners were very nice and tried to help us with these matters but the false advertising should be fixed.  I will not be using Airbnb in the future.
Communication is fast. The room is the same as described. The complaint is that it‚Äôs not very clean. Also, the noise from upstair keeps us awake.
Nice house. Futon not great. Could use bed in third bedroom.
Not sure this view can be beat in Austin.  You won't even want to leave the house.

Absolute top-notch place to stay in Austin. Tom is a very communicative and hospitable host. Everything is brand new and the location is in the most hip part of town! If you are looking for a place on the east side, look no further.
We were robbed while staying at this Kasa. Kasa was responsive, but there was no reimbursement for all my stolen belongings.

The host indicated they would send checkin instructions 24 hours in advance of checkin. They did not. I ended up having to find another place to stay after several messages to the host went unanswered. This was a really disappointing experience - the kind that scares people off from AirBnB. To the host‚Äôs credit, they did refund my money in full, however having to find last minute accommodations at 8pm on a Friday night in Austin because the host never sent checkin instructions was a real bummer.

Beautiful house with amazing views. Darlene had mentioned it prior to our stay, but we had some issues with the refrigerator. It does not cool down as fast as you would expect a refrigerator to cool down. Were primarily concerned with our grill meat going bad.

Semi-okay place to stay, definitely worth it if you‚Äôre on a budget. Not as dog friendly as they say.. (back yard was full of fleas) if I‚Äôm paying $150 for a dog deposit, I expect there to not be fleas or any harmful bugs that make me anymore out of pocket. Location had a dead animal rotting in the back yard. Notified owner the day of and nothing was accomplished until almost my last day there. And not a full house either. The house was split in half with you staying in the garage half of the house. When check in instructions came, owner stated parking spots were designated to 1 per unit. Upon arrival the ‚Äúneighbors‚Äù were parked in 2 spots in driveway. If you‚Äôre okay with bending over and being run over after paying for a place this is the spot for you. Not a great location either, spend your money else where.

Nos encant√≥! Es justo lo necesario, solo para descansar no estuvimos durante el d√≠a pero lleg√°bamos s√∫per cansados en la noche y es maravillosamente tranquilo, silencio mucha paz. Me encanta el blanco inmediato te das cuenta que todo est√° limpio como debe de ser. Me hubiera gustado quedarme dormida m√°s tiempo jaja. Definitivamente regresar√≠a

Stay was okay.

Room and location were good.

Entry was confusing and they didn't reply until 2 am.

Room also started leaking from who knows where, tried calling, no response. Just mopped it up when it started, may have just been from the rain.

Didn't answer question on key placement which had a 200 dollar fine attached to it.

So again, it was just fine. Be prepared to just figure it out on your own. Which you will. But still more stressful than it should be.

Never staying at a Kasa Airbnb again. Photos were inaccuarte. The walls, couch, rug was dirty. None of the key fobs to get in and out worked and they never replaced it for us. My wife and I were stuck in the apt unit on her bday bc it was difficult to get in and out without the key fob. When I called Kasa I spoke to 3 different employees and they promised to call me back but not a single one of them did. The customer service was the biggest frustration bc they didn't care about our stay at all.

The sight was great!
When it came to the room, check in was at 3pm and the room wasn‚Äôt even cleaned or ready. Cleaning team said ‚ÄúSorry didn‚Äôt know anyone was going to be checking in today.‚Äù Not sure if it was a communication issue? The room was just dirty has dog hair on floor, the carpet was stained, room has a weird smell, and nothing really felt comfortable. My expectations weren‚Äôt high with this place when I booked, just wish I was proven wrong but I wasn‚Äôt.
Good location but host was not responsive.   Our access did not work.

Convenient to have an apartment in a high-rise building in downtown Austin. Kasa is excellent at providing a "full-service" experience. Full disclosure, two negative events happened on my stay:

(1) I saw and got rid of two silverfish in the closet during my stay, and unfortunately found that one of my sweaters ended up with a hole that the silverfish ate through;
(2) I had someone enter my apartment on the second-to-last day of my stay -- Kasa had a technical glitch and had given instructions and keycode access to my unit to a new resident starting their stay. Startling and bizarre experience, but Kasa ultimately helped get it all sorted out after we called them.
Management team was not easy to work with in changing the dates of our stay

Space and location are great. Check in is a little complicated, but nothing to worry about. The AC was broken in my unit on check in... took more than 24 hours to get the host to get a repair man out, and I had to repeatedly ask for updates from the host and responses were slow and Unhelpful. It was unbearably hot in the apartment. Ruined my stay. Will not stay here again. For the amount I paid to stay here I would expect everything to be in order.

First, I want to mention that I have great resistance to leaving any negative reviews if my experiences.

You can tell that these guys tried to brand a great experience but failed miserably on the follow thru.

My unit didn‚Äôt have WiFi for the 7 days I spent in the apartment. After reaching out to support I was asked to wait and offered solutions that I had already tried only for more days to go by.

After the stay they offered a discount on my stay, which of course I appreciated, however these places are making significant margin on these places.

The apartment itself was bare minimum and quite cold from a design perspective. The bed mattress was soft and uncomfortable.

The quality was just enough to say there were things.

Then hospitality was poor all around and I will acknowledge attempts have been made.

Overpriced. Unit is not what's in photos. sticky floors, in general wasn't a fan of this place. Way to many keys and codes to get into the building. In general not a good value. bedroom is too bright, bad for sleeping. not a lot of privacy.

It's was a great apartment, yet the check in process is unnecessarily complex.   The most frustrating is that I forgot a necklace there, sent them a text right away, and then had to fill a form and that did not help as it was not returned, not an ethical operation.

The Kasa apartment was spacious and in a good location, however we unfortunately had multiple problems during our stay. The most concerning of which was not having any communication from Kasa when there was an emergency situation in the building we were staying in (possible bomb threat). Other Kasa residents in the building were notified of the situation by Kasa, but we never received any communication. I reached out to Kasa to try to understand why we were not notified and figure out how to ensure this doesn't happen again (there was another bomb threat the following day). We received a small refund for the issue and was told the Kasa team would escalate this issue and get back to me, but there was no follow up.

On a separate occasion, Kasa notified me they were sending a maintenance person to fix a light the previous renter had alerted them of, but I asked Kasa to not send a maintenance person while we were staying there for (1) COVID-related safety reasons, and (2) disruption during the work day. Kasa told me they cancelled the maintenance request, but the maintenance person showed up anyways a few days later during the workday, disrupting a work meeting I was in.

These may be one-off issues, but they didn't instill enough confidence in the company for me to stay at a Kasa again.
There is no better location!

The property is beautiful and the location gives you full access to downtown Austin. This was a great place to stay. And the amenities (I used the pool and fitness center) were awesome.

My one complaint is the check-in process. They make you put your personal information in their own outside website rather than using Airbnb‚Äôs authentication. And they ask for it in an Airbnb message that says right at the top never to communicate with owners outside of AirBnB. I think they are violating AirBnB policies, but they threatened to cancel my stay at the last minute if I didn‚Äôt comply.

The location and view is amazing. But the Kasa experience was not.  The check in and if parking a car requires careful attention to the checkin instructions as does the elevator key pad and the location of of where to put the key pad to enter the main building from parking.  I had to ask the assistance of other residents to figure initial coming and going out. Frustrating! Then the door key pad did not open after several attempts.  Frustrating again. The apartment really needs a fresh coat of paint as there were markings and looked dirty on many walls.  Its a bit dated cabinets and doors.  The couch had some stains.  There was a funky odor in the closet and bathroom area.  This was not my favorite airbnb as I feel many homeowners take more pride and offer a better experience.  I do not think I will use a kasa from airbnb again.

I am not a person that likes to give bad reviews but this was by far the worst air B&B experience I‚Äôve ever had.
After arriving from a long flight and following the check in directions to a T we discovered the code to the door of our unit was not available. After contacting customer service trying several codes, waiting for them to get in touch with the ‚Äútech team‚Äù they could never get us into the apartment. There is no one on site that has a key. They even asked us if we would want to stay in another unit down the hall that had not been cleaned. Trash was everywhere and the bed had obviously been slept in.
They told us to find a hotel (at 11pm by that point) so they could fix the door. After checking out at 11am, they still could not get the door fixed or have the alternative room cleaned. I then spoke to a manager who told me that they would refund me for the stay but not for the hotel room that we were forced to book that night. But offered $100 credit to a future Kasa stay.
I found the company totally unprofessional, rude, and uncaring of our situation. It might be a beautiful apartment but be aware if issues arise they are extremely unhelpful
Kasa was responsive but they failed miserably at making sure the access badges worked. Nice place in a good location but room and parking access was very inconvenient.
The room has a great view- don‚Äôt plan on sleeping in though, the curtains, or lack there of, made it so that the morning light shown in with no way to avoid.

Pros:
- Great location
- Spacious apartment stocked with household essentials
- Smooth check in /checkout process through Kasa

Cons:
- My dog found an old carrot under the couch on the first day
- The elevator callbox was broken the whole stay
- The shower head in the bathroom has a leak, which causes it to spray out of the tub when the shower is running

We have stayed at several Airbnbs and have had no issues previously; certainly have never given a bad review before. However, Kasa‚Äôs listing was not found to be accurate upon arrival to our unit. We were unable to even enter the elevator due to the virtual check-in being broken. Had we been one hour later, the gracious staff at the building (not owned by Kasa) let us up, only to discover that our parking pass didn‚Äôt work so we had to pay $48 to park for one night despite the listing indicating free parking was included with our stay. Kasa did say the would refund this money, but due to below issues and us leaving we did not get refunded. Upon further inspection of our unit, we discovered several cleanliness concerns including dirt, hair, rust, and leftover food on some utensils from prior guests. Furniture was also broken (TV stand, vanity, couch). We reached out to Kasa with our concerns and they were willing to move us to another unit, though we requested to leave due to overall cleanliness issues of the building air vents were very dusty. Additionally, we had booked a stay for a full week and were granted one roll of toilet paper, 2 towels which were stained, and had no soap in the bathroom. I can understand and was willing to overlook a few of these issues all of them together we felt it was best to leave. We asked Kasa to refund the nights remaining on our stay so we could go somewhere, and they refused resulting in us having to dispute the stay with Air bnb who provided us a full refund for the remaining nights in order to allow us to finally enjoy our vacation. We will unfortunately not be staying with Kasa again. I would also urge others staying with Kasa to look at prior reviews as it appears we have not been the only ones with these type of concerns.

This place is listed as 2 beds, but that‚Äôs my fault for not looking further into that. I requested early check in and was denied, but furthermore my check in was delayed by over an hour. I wasn‚Äôt able to check in until 5pm. The place was not very clean, the bathroom was dirty (hair in the shower, and a few tiny bugs - but I get that). Bathroom lighting was atrocious. The bedroom is too bright to sleep in. I ended up sleeping on the concrete floor in the back closet. Hardly any amenities to cook with. Coffee was provided. There were extra sheets and pillows offered. Towels didn‚Äôt smell clean. Honestly, I‚Äôve stayed at so many Airbnb‚Äôs and this was by far one of the worst experiences. Elevators broke, and had to take service elevators. The whole experience was just awful. I didn‚Äôt feel like the pictures really represented the space, nor did I feel like the description matched the space. To be fair, I did not complain to the host so they did not have an opportunity to make it right. But from the moment of an hour+ delayed check in (and nowhere to store your bags! So had to wait with them), it was not a pleasant experience.

Directions are incredibly long and still manage to be unclear.
Worn down and needs to be cleaned.

For a longer downtown atx stay this place would be okay. For shorter, go to a hoti.
Owner confirmed a check-in time and delayed check-in the following day. Had to seek other accommodations and thus they're getting a 1 star.

This is the worst Airbnb I have ever rented. The day I was supposed to check in I received a message threatening to cancel my reservation if I didn‚Äôt make a profile on their own site. I also received a text telling me that the main entrance checkin box was broken. No info on how to actually get in the door. When we finally did get in because someone saw us waiting outside, the room when checking in was very dirty, everything was incredibly cheap and uncomfortable. I checked out that day and cancelled my two night reservation immediately

Very expensive and terrible check in experience. There were so many instructions, had to park in an out. Elevators and doors weren't working with the card. We didn't understand how to get back to the apartment from the parking and there was nobody we could ask. Apartment was a bit raw and there were insects in the shower. Construction site right in front of the apartment made everything a bit noisy and view wasn't the best. Overall value for money wasn't great. Nothing exceptional.

The space itself was spotless and lovely. Unfortunately, a massive construction is happening right across the way and so the noise started at 7am and went into the night. Then, when it was time to check out the elevator wasn‚Äôt working and the apartment is on the 15th floor! With luggage, you can imagine it was a pain.

They don‚Äôt tell you check is at 4pm until after rsvp is made. I submitted an early check in request 10 days in advance as I was waiting around from 1030am on with bags. They won‚Äôt tell you until 1pm that day. But you can‚Äôt leave your bags anywhere. I check in and a maintenance man shows up 10 mins after I walk in to fix a sink which I told him that I he would not be allowed in. The walls were extremely dirty. Black scuff marks on almost every wall. An old razor was left in the shower. Lastly, it is next to a major construction site. They worked late Friday evening after 8pm and started working before 6am. It was not restful at all. Really disappointed in this stay.

We had a terrible experience. Before booking, we asked about issues with construction noise - many of the reviews for this property noted this. Kasa assured us that construction was only an issue during business hours. Turns out this was horribly wrong. Construction started consistently at 6am, and one morning even a lovely 3:45am start. We had to purchase eye masks and ear plugs, which only got us so far. The blinds in the bedroom were also inadequate, and light from the construction site was beaming into our room in the middle of the night. Kasa did offer to move us to a sister property, but it was too little too late in our stay.

On an unrelated note, after check-out, we received a notice from Kasa that a mirror was damaged and we owed $250. We left at 4am to catch an early flight and did not cause this damage. Kasa continues to place the blame on us, and cares not to listen at all. This was simply the cherry on top of an awful experience all around.

First of all, pay attention to instructions and you will be alright, that‚Äôs if your given the right keys!! I have never had so much trouble with a Airbnb!!!! Place was clean and very nice but the mix up on their part was ridiculous!!!!
Not good

Nice building and good location but the check-in process was terrible. I arrived at the location not knowing how to access the building. A person from the leasing office eventually came out to assist and told me to call Kasa directly. I was then told on the phone that I had to complete a questionnaire and identity verification before they could send me check-in instructions (this had not been advised at any point earlier).

When I eventually got up to the room, the instructions did not include a code for the door so I had to call Kasa again. The process was very clunky and inconvenient.

I could also not access the building after hours as the callbox was turned off or had malfunctioned. The phone rep could not assist. I had to wait about 30 minutes until the door was opened by somebody who was leaving the building. Had this not occurred, I would've had to sleep in my car.

The Location and the space was great. The experience was one of the worst I have ever had. IT's no a home, it's basically a hotel- and not even a 4-star. there is no direct communication with anyone, when arrived the keypad didn't work and I had to be moved to another room in the middle of the night. They tried, honestly to make things better, but in the end their attempt only made me more upset and my stay uncomfortable. I traveled over the holiday driving from NYC to Texas- there was essentially NOTHING in the kitchen to eat or cook with, I wasted a money doing so. we left 3 days early. if you want a hotel stay- book a hotel- if you want a house, home or condo that feels like a home- this is not that. do not let the pictures deceive you.

This unit was a little neglected (old towels, old rugs, old furniture) and it does not look like the pictures. Unfortunately that was the least of our problems because we had so many issues with this unit. There was no hand soap, no dish drainer, no skillet just some old rusty pots in the kitchen. The stove was so old and rusty that started smoking when we first used it. The smoke detectors went off non stop on Christmas morning. Before we even stepped into the unit they called us and made us sign agreements that we would not smoke or talk loud after 10 pm. They said that they have noise decibel meters and very sensitive smoking detectors. All that is fine, but if you know that you have very sensitive smoke detectors the least you can do is have a decent stove? At first they told us they would move us to a different unit, next thing they sent some soap and a couple of scrubbing pads (I guess they expected us to clean the stove?) I called them, they apologized and then said that they would send someone the next day (which still left the stove rusty so we did not use the stove again). The bathtub in the master  backed up with water and after reporting it they said they could only come the Monday after we would have already left. We also had issues with the parking lot... but this post is already too long to tell you that story. In summary I will not stay at any of the Kasa properties again.
Spacious, beautiful, minimalist apartment. There were no issues. Great stay.
Host unresponsive to problems with unit.
The confirmation process is terrible.  Avoid any property managed by Kasa!

We chose this Kasa apartment for a work trip and were very disappointed.   The room is cold and uncomfortable.  Cement floors with only one small rug.  Walls are bare.  Couch is hard, small and not comfortable to sit on.  They definitely took the cheap route for everything.  The sinks in the bathrooms are tiny, stainless steal bar sinks that did not drain properly.   This place has no personality, charm or coziness.   It was pretty depressing really.  Would not take much to improve.  A comfy sectional couch, some soft rugs on the floors,  some generic art on the walls to give it some color.   Also, the key cards did not work on the elevator and the keypad on the first floor to give you access to the elevator was Out of Service, so we had to wait for someone else to get on the elevator with their card to let us up.  Luckily most people in Austin are nice.  Anyway, I would not recommend this place.

Our car was broken into while in the garage and clothing was stolen along with petty cash. Access keys were not always successful and we needed to use the code. Location was awesome but felt unsafe after the theft of our items from our car on the first evening there.

The location is nice. The cleanliness of the unit was subpar. Upon arrival, there was a roach in the bathroom. After showering and attempting to dry myself off, I noticed black dirt stains on my towel. What was pictured wasn‚Äôt provided.... the check in and check out process was very strenuous. When contacting via text I got responses 5-6 hours later when I was SLEEPING! The staff member who answered the phone upon check out, had a horrible attitude and didn‚Äôt seem knowledgeable. Directions aren‚Äôt very clear upon check out. The unit REEKED of sewer the entire time. To top everything off, the tv wasn‚Äôt working. Once I notified a Kasa member, at 4 p.m, I then got a response at 10 pm! By that time I wasn‚Äôt watching the tv! I had to figure it out myself. This was my first time booking with Kasa, and most likely my last.
Too many rules. Noise regulated. No smoking. A/C limit

Location was perfect. Check-in/out was very clear and easy. KASA claimed the washer in the unit was full of grey water for just 1 day. But the water started smelling after day 2. They should have fixed the issue immediately. Not being from Austin - I did not know the heat would make the water smell so bad after just 1 day

Be aware that Kasa has placed generalized pictures for each of their Airbnb listings. Our place didn‚Äôt look like the provided pictures at all. The apartment is in one of the best spots in Austin which is nice. Upon arriving the place was a little dirty. Didn‚Äôt clean well especially for our stay being during Covid. Coffee maker had mold in it, couch was dirty and smelled and there were old towels left in the washer that started to smell. Hair on the sinks in the bathroom and kitchen was not great. Kasa is very good at communicating but not great at prepping the place. Would stay somewhere else if going back to Austin.
Not as shown in the photos and not well kept... good location but wouldn't stay there again.
Not enough towels for 4 people to stay. No condiments to use. Not enough pillows/blankets for the 4 to stay. TV did not work. Great location but I had higher expectations for what was presented.

You‚Äôre paying for the location with this place. The pictures are somewhat deceiving. In reality the walls were scratched, the furniture was different, the back door wouldn‚Äôt seal, the bed wasn‚Äôt made, we had to buy drano to unclog the bathtub, there were broken picture frames, I had to reset the internet everyday, and the bedroom TV had no channels (it‚Äôs not a smart TV). I did voice my complaints when Kasa reached out to us on our trip. They sent me a $50 visa gift card, which was really kind...but we won‚Äôt be staying anywhere with Kasa again.
But the location couldn‚Äôt be better. We were a short walk to anywhere.

A very spacious and conveniently located apartment. The places was actually way worse than what it looks in the pictures. All the appliances are insanely loud. You can literally not be in the apartment if the dishwasher or dryer is on. Shades in the bedroom did not work. The unit was kinda dirty when we got there. The water pressure in the bathroom sink is very low. It's very hard to wash your hands.  The door code changes every few days and it's kinda annoying. Hot water runs out very quickly.
The place was everything we expected from looking at the photos. Only complaint would be the address is on Lavaca but you really enter on 2nd street.

The location and apartment was ok, but we were assigned to an apartment that someone else already had, the worse thing is that they gave us a code and we were able to access it!! Fortunately the other renter was not there when we entered it! This was not safe for both parties and very unsettling for me! I will not rent a Kasa Air BnB ever again!!

The original listing I booked was not properly maintained and was very dirty. The Kasa team was quick to correct the multiple cleanliness and maintenance issues by offering to move me to another location, which was of much higher standard, but could not completely erase the extremely poor condition of the first apartments condition.
If you stay here, view is not good. Floor is very dirty. Expect feet to be brown. Not worth 551.00. Only issues.

Our apartment was quite dirty - the rug was stained and the blinds were very dusty. In addition, many things were dilapidated, such as the coffee table that was severely chipped. More than anything though, it was completely unprofessional to give us the codes to a different Airbnb where someone was already residing. I inadvertantly broke into their rental and those renters will probably never be informed that this happened. Afterwards, we had to wait quite a while to get access to a new, shabbier place which is hard considering we arrived late at night. I appreciated the customer service agent on the phone though, her name was Angela.

First off we had a great time staying at the place. The only reason I didn't give a 5 out of 5 is there needs to be some changes made to the check in instructions and repairs done to the apartment/furniture. The screen at the elevator no longer shows the same options as in the written instructions. We were able to figure it out on our own but it did take some time and was frustrating. The futon couch was broken upon arrival and was being propped up by an end table but it was still usable and I slept well on it. The toilet constantly runs and is probably racking up a large water bill. This was annoying because we kept having to turn the water off and on to the toilet so it wouldn't run all the time. Otherwise, things were great and we had a blast. I would 100% recommend staying here. These critiques are mainly to document the problems I experienced and so other members can let people know if they haven't changed.
Nice place but WiFi connection sucked !!!

You cannot ask for a better location!! Great view! Sadly that is all you will be getting. The communication is great. What is upsetting, is when I asked for an early check in they told me it was not possible due to the fact the cleaning crew was there. When I checked in i was not as impressed as I had hoped. The area rugs were very dirty and stained. The couch was stained with ink and so were the window shades. One of the chairs were really dirty and stained. I had also stepped on glass twice! My daughter found a piece of glass in the bed as well. We ordered dinner I pulled out some dishes, they were dirty!! With crusty food on them, the glasses, dishes and silverware! I had to wash everything by hand, because the dishwasher does not do anything but wet the dishes. I grabbed the only dish towel they provide and that was dirty! We ran out of toilet paper we started with half a roll. When I told them they did give me a $30 gift card to get some and told me when the cleaning crew arrived on property they would have them drop some off. That never happened. One sink was clogged. I did call with a few of these complaints, after you reach a point you do not want to be ‚Äúthat person‚Äù.  The place needs some repairs. Trim is hanging off, random nails and screws in the walls, the dining table is all scratched up. The door to the bedroom squeaks really loud!!! The front door lock is very crooked. I would not stay here again. Nor would I recommend it. Unless they improve their cleanliness!!!
The location is great but we had no A/C all our stay, and the unit is not as clean as it looks.

Their parking validation card would randomly stop working throughout my stay. I had to pay $72 each time (x4) for a lost ticket. plus another (48 + 36) when I just stopped using the card and pulled a ticket instead. The scenario was unavoidable because it would only happen at the exit swipe with no attendant at the gate.

I tried everything from getting out the car and swiping the entrance gate to trying to pull a ticket at the entrance gate to try to ‚Äúreset‚Äù it. Nothing worked and i was waiting at the exit gate with a line of cars for 10 mins. Rather embarrassing tbh so I paid the fee to not hold up people‚Äôs nights.

I honestly didn‚Äôt mind putting these charges on my card but KASA only offered me a partial refund.

I‚Äôm not sure what person they have running their customer service but they‚Äôre extra lazy with this trivial matter.

Great location, clean. Only problems were running out of hot water, ice maker did not work, bedroom ceiling fan would not turn off, a TV with no network or cable stations. Worst problem was dog poop in the halls and on the stars from building tenants.
After sustaining an injury falling off a broken stool, Kasa is refusing to refund my stay. Unfortunately it looks like I‚Äôll be taking them to court.

Dumpy and depressing apartment. Technically it was clean, but it lacked any character or personality and simply *felt* dirty. The apartment could use a new coat of paint and a few more decorations. It's basically an empty apartment with a sofa and a painting on the wall.

Worst experience ever in 23 years of traveling. Bed without a base to support, sagged up to a feet when you sit. Noisy ceiling fan even in medium speed, windows not covered you can see the street lighting all night. Had to sleep in the car first night and booked hotel the following night.
kasa was accommodating in moving me to another location, but the cold water was crazy.
Good location but it does get noisy at night, every thing as described.

The first apartment in which we stayed was terrible. The shower leaked, the tv was inadequate; and the hot water tank was so small, we barely could take a shower without running out of hot water. Kasa DID agree to move us to a much improved location, though, which we did appreciate. It was an inconvenience to move, but better than staying where we were. In general, was a frustrating stay.

I will be short. The apartment is HUGE and amazing, I really loved it. Not a fan of the industrial design, but this apartment was impressive and spacious. BUT the important thing is, the reason why I score it LOW, is because if you are relocating to Austin and arrive in this apartment as a temporary place, it will be extremely DIFFICULT to get things done because they DONT provide an address and they DONT allow to receive mail or packages. This made our stay extremely annoying and difficult, and it's such a shame.

Great location but a bit hard
To get in. Didn‚Äôt have bedding for the pull out couch and when I called they said they would provide it but then didn‚Äôt. At 9pm they suggested I could buy a quilt
And they would reimburse me. Not an ideal experience

Good:
Great location, great price! My main reason for choosing this property was the location plus the included parking. I wasn‚Äôt disappointed by either.

Not so good:
-Shower curtain was dirty‚Ä¶I had to wash it after the first shower because of the mildew and or mold all along the bottom of the curtain. Bathroom just felt dirty because of the poor paint job and dirty shower curtain‚Ä¶otherwise the unit was clean.
-Decor was lacking/minimal furniture‚Ä¶felt like a dorm room.
-Either the Wi-Fi was poor or the Living Room TV had a connection issue. We had to unplug the TV several times to get it to reconnect.
-Bedroom TV was local channels onlyü§∑üèº‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è‚Ä¶smart tv‚Äôs are really cheap, If you don‚Äôt at least have cable you better have a smart tv. We spent more time in the unit than planned because of unseasonably cold weather‚Ä¶we normally wouldn‚Äôt care.

Bad:
Total lack of responsiveness from Kasa. No email with check-in instructions, no reply to several questions asked through Airbnb app.
Not clear that parking is only available for 1 car. This is a 2 bedroom apartment That holds 6 people. it seems reasonable that at least 2 cars should be able to park.

The location and condo were both really good for the most part. Although it is 2 bedrooms (& sleeps 6) you only get one elevator and parking fob. The kitchen was not stocked well with dishes..it had 3 spoons, and only 2 coffee mugs..maybe 4 water glasses and the ice tasted very bad. The bathrooms were well stocked but there was no top sheet on the beds.
Someone entered my rental to repair a washing machine that I was unaware was broken, while I was naked, so that was interesting. Overall, it was a really large space for the price and the location was great...management could use some upgrades.

I requested an iron and never received it. The master bed was not comfortable. The TV in the living room needed to be rebooted several times to work. There was a broken glass bottle of sauce left in the hallway overnight.
The place is very convenient to everything. With scooters everywhere, its is easy to get around. The only negative was we left a headset behind, filed a claim and never received a response.

Hard to get in the elevator with out key that was in the room for check in. The shower curtain was moldy and dirty. The spare blanket had hair on it. No pillows on the couch like pictures. No facecloths . They did deliver 1. Yes one for 4 people after requested. They also entered the place With out permission. Very very noisy. The house had a lot of issues and seemed more like a party rental. Doorknobs not attached, sink crooked, no hot water to tub, cracks in doors, poorly renovated and beat up. What appears as a fireplace or mantle is a poorly made facade to hide a closet.

regretted booking it BEFORE the cockroaches. Things happen but the experience with the host after made it worse.

Airbnb resolution struggled to communicate with the host until a week after I left.
