Great location with killer views.

House was a bit more beat up than described (paint falling off walls, locks that didn‚Äôt work, towels with stains on them). There is also a mold or mildew issue in the backhouse. I sent the below message to the Vacasa management team and never got a reply. Posting it here for transparency.

‚ÄúHey Priya - we had a great weekend at the house but wanted to let you know that the back casita has something wrong with it. The person who was staying in there said the smell was unbearable and there is something toxic in the air (mold or something similar). She had a massive allergic reaction. Wanted to just let you know and also suggest you not rent out the casita until the issue is resolved.‚Äù

The house is beautiful and in an amazing area. I would give the house itself 5 stars but TurnKey who oversees the house was horrible. They made me sign a rental agreement and when they sent it to me again the day of my stay it had the names of every person who booked the property in tbe month of November. Needless to say I didn't feel comfortable staying in a place where strangers know who I am and where to find me.

This AirBnB is one half of a duplex, the other half occupied by the owner and family. We found it to one the cleanest and well equipped of the vacation rentals we‚Äôve ever stayed. We have a dog and he liked the private yard. There were TVs in the living room and each of two bedroom. The house is on a quiet residential street that is down the block from a large park with walking trails. Cesar was a very accommodating host. Our son lives in Austin with no spare bedrooms so we‚Äôll probably be back to this place!

Air conditioning kept turning off‚Äî host was not responsive when trying to get this situation fixed. It was very hot and uncomfortable, only stay here in the fall/winter when you don‚Äôt have to rely on a thermostat.
our keys üîë failed on second day. we were locked üîí out. and check out at 10am suckes.

The listing description is accurate but I will say in all my experiences with airbnb, I never had more awkward/unwelcoming experience. We arrived after the checkin time listed and the cleaning service said that the owner made the mistake and booked them that time so we had to wait in our car for a few hours for them to clean. After a long day of traveling this was slightly annoying. I let Lauren know and she refunded me $30. during our stay we had both pest control person come and packages from the owner delivered. The place had an overall weird smell the entire stay that we couldn't figure out what it was. 11am was checkout and we were running a few minutes behind (Ended up leaving by 11:26am). The owner walked into our apartment while i was in my underwear at 10:59am even though you would notice our packed bags in the living room and didn't knock. I told her i needed a few minutes to change and then a few minutes later she came back into the house with an electrician and her partner to start working on things while i was still finishing up packing. I understand that i was a few minutes late to checkout but honestly felt a little violating that they were not giving me even a few minutes to just wrap up checking out before inviting men in the place that I don't know?! Book only if you don't mind waiting to check-in and if you know you will check out VERY early before checkout time to avoid this owner walking in on you.

The pictures make the condo look newer/nicer than it really is, which was a first disappointment. I was also put off by the weird persistent smell in the condo: if you‚Äôre sensitive to strong odours avoid staying here. Was surprised to receive a message from the host asking me to leave the condo for a few hours for the pest control expert to do an inspection so I asked for a discount but the host chose to delay the visit (why bother me in the first place if you could do that from the start?). The washing machine was disgusting with plenty of hair and my clothes came out dirtier (I wish I had known about it before because I only used it once right before leaving for the airport at the end of my stay). The neighbors were very friendly though.
book it for the bed alone..

Good location and cute styling as seen in photos but there's hidden issues.

Listing isn't transparent about major issues.
RV does not lock, and yard isn't very secure backing up to alley.
Bathroom has major rot damage not addressed by Adam when I sent a photo.
Pool also was unable to be used because of a film/rust in the bottom, despite the pool crew "checking the pH".

Just be aware before booking. we might stay again if issues were addressed.

It‚Äôs a nice house but was left in disgusting condition. The kitchen was left with grime and food caked on. We deep cleaned the kitchen before using is. TV remotes didn‚Äôt have batteries. Patio furniture lacked the padding that was shown in photos. Would not stay here again and would not recommend it.
No Thank You!
Except for nothing but the best!
I just sent you a separate message about not getting your messages üò´üò´ I‚Äôm so sorry about that !! Thank you ! ü§©ü§©

Poorly appointed. The location is great!

Building and neighbors are nice. Unit is fine. Amenities and appointment were terrible.

Missing amenities include: no coffee maker, minimal dish-ware and utensils, no dish or hand soap, terribly uncomfortable furniture, no side tables or lamps by beds, no dish towels.

Broken amenities include: broken dryer, broken garbage disposal, burnt out light bulbs, futon was uncomfortable to the point that it was unusable. Owner had to be contacted to turn on heating.

WiFi worked fine. Access was easy. Beds and pillows were comfortable.

A dingy place that is not well maintained. A general look of neglect about the entire place. Carpet in the bedroom is old, rippling and gross brown. Living room area rug needs a good cleaning. The dead bolt on the front door is barely hanging on to the door frame. I guess the best example is the rusty trash can in the bathroom. It does not take much effort to purchase an inexpensive trash can from Walmart to replace the rusty trash bin. This place is like before pictures on a home fixer upper show.

Pictures need a refresh as does the property to be fair to future customers.  The immaculate clean pictures to not represent the reality that‚Äôs in need of a full commercial clean.  Perfect location but the property has become tired, stained and dirty since initially listed
No issues, great place to stay!
Generally a nice small place near downtown. The host lives in the same house as the rented apartment. Rules were communicated clearly, but I didn't feel welcome in the house.
Rob was accommodating and provided a unique experience. I would definitely come back when in Austin.
No comment

First, I did not feel safe at this location. When I arrived I thought I was lost bc the front yard did not look like picture on Airbnb.  There is a toilet in the front yard and it‚Äôs very unkept. The area for me didn‚Äôt look to safe. I did ask Lucy about my car, if it was safe overnight. There were only specific spaces on the street I could park bc of neighbors.  The other Airbnb guests were not friendly. Lucy was no where to be found that night and in the morning during my stay.  This was the first time I felt uneasy and not safe in an Airbnb.

DO NOT STAY HERE!! No hot water, mold on the windows, and if there‚Äôs an accident, host will insist you pay for it.

1. POOR HOSTING: Host had a standing mirror in the room - literally right next to the bedside (where a side table should be). There was no sign it wasn‚Äôt fixed to the wall, but when it tipped over and broke, host insisted I pay for it (even after I offered to pick up a new one, she asked me to buy one from her preferred retailer).
2. NO HOT WATER: There is no hot water. Shower takes 10 mins to warm up and it‚Äôs barely temperate. If you like a hot shower, this is not the place for you.
3. MOLD: When I took picture of the mold on the window, the host accused me of photoshopping the pictures. Lol.

Lastly - I only slept there one night and host thinks it‚Äôs fair I pay the full $450+ since she has to purchase a $129 mirror.

All to say, this is my first BAD AirBnB experience and it‚Äôs really disheartening. I‚Äôve always had great experiences but this one‚Ä¶well. It‚Äôs for the books.

There were dirty floors, carpet when I moved in and constant noises throughout the night (dumpsters being taken out right outside the window).  This is on top of non working elevators the majority of time I stayed there, constant parking changes/requirements based on apts request and weird smells throughout the apt complex.

When we arrived, our uber could not find the house due to the location (up a hill on a highway). When we walked in we found 3 dead cockroaches on the living room floor. There was 1 hand soap in the whole house, 1 roll of toilet paper, and no paper towels. There was also no remote for the TV. The Turnkey team did respond quickly about the toilet paper and paper towels. they even came to drop some off. They also offered to have someone come spray the living room for the cockroaches, but the damage was already done since we had to clean them up. When we were leaving, we found 2 live cockroaches in one of the bedrooms upstairs. The whole house was just dingier and a little dirtier than the photos showed. The location was close to everything by car, but ubers and lyfts had an incredibly hard time finding it. We had to get out in the parking lot next door and then walk along the highway to the house. I do not recommend staying here.

Went for a bachelorette trip which called for multiple ubers and every single driver was unable to find the house and we had to walk down the very steep driveway and stand on a busy sidewalk. Only rent this place if you have a rental car! It‚Äôs hell without it. Came in with wet towels and had to do the laundry myself. There was a leak from the upstairs toilet so we weren‚Äôt allowed to use it. Little stains on duvets/sheets/towels. Lots of space though! And the water filter in the fridge is expired so bring your own water!
William went above and beyond to host! Add some kitchen equipment I asked for and cut the grass one extra time we were there! He was quick to respond and wanted to make his guest feel at home!

We booked this place to spend 2 days in Austin for Christmas time and we were so excited about it based on photos seen on Airbnb ...but the house was not cleaned as expected.. the restrooms were not cleaned at all and dust and dirts everywhere.. I‚Äôm not sure if the house was cleaned before we get there.. we sent the photos to owners and they sent someone for cleaning but still not cleaned.. the location is just fine closed to downtown but not in very good neighborhood..

Overall it was an ok place to stay if you are not super concerned about cleanliness. Also heater wasn't working in 2 of the bedrooms and we didn't have extra linens so it made the stay feel uncomfortable. I would say this was my first time ever booking with Airbnb and it made me second guess and want to stick to hotels going forward.

Similar to the other reviews, we had issues with tons of black ants in both bathrooms during our weeklong stay. Issue was unresolved by the end of the trip, so fair warning - we did receive a partial refund from Airbnb. Please note that this is not your traditional Airbnb experience - this house is managed by a business that just copy-pastes fear-mongering messages and contracts to you prior to your arrival. Lots of all caps, lots of unenforceable contract agreements that you don't have to respond to - they oddly don't seem to care. Finally, we tried to get a refund prior to arriving as the house was under a boil water notice, and the area was under a state of emergency, but as soon as we requested this from the host they became unresponsive and stopped communicating to us. Our check-in was late due to housekeeping trying to kill the ants and the location is in an alley off the highway exit near a bunch of homeless camps. It's otherwise as described in the photos, has a camera facing directly into the unit, not much common area but good for sleeping many guests. It's one of the cheaper options, so I guess you get what you pay for!

The location was great, right next to the city. The house itself has so much potential. All the things I am listing can be fixed VERY easily. I am not sure if they have a cleaning company in between each stay but they are not doing their job at all. The floors were absolutely filthy. If you walked around the house in bare feet or socks, they were black within minutes. The living room curtain has a massive stain in it. The walls, doors and door handles were filthy. There was only two extra rolls of toilet paper for 8 people for three nights and no laundry detergent. We had to go buy our own toilet paper and laundry detergent. The fridge was not working when we arrived. The downstairs sink kept leaking even after a person came to fix it. The temperature could not be turned down and was locked the first day. It was over 90 degrees so the house was a sauna. This was spring time in Austin, I can not imagine what it will be like in the summer. There were not enough towels when we arrived and they were very dirty and stained. This was by far and away the worst airbnb I have ever stayed at and it could all be fixed with simple cleaning and maintenance.

Here is a list of all the problems we had while staying here:
-We arrived for check in at 4pm to find three people still cleaning inside, they had their truck parked to where it took up all three of the available spaces (keep in mind this is after I had already told the owner that we‚Äôd be arriving at 3pm)
-There was a MAJOR fruit fly and house fly problem. I‚Äôm talking literally dozens of fruit flies all within the kitchen area and upstairs bathroom
-There were a number of cleaning problems: there were used contact lenses on the bedside table, lightbulbs were out in the upstairs bathroom, dirty dishes still in the dishwasher
-The people staying at the house across from us had a dozen guests who played loud music and took up the pool and drank outside the entire day
-They had people come and mow the lawn at 8am (with no warning that this was gonna happen)
Other than that the place is aesthetic looking, pretty close to what the pictures depict except the backyard is much smaller than expected. Still a cute place.

Pictures are extremely misleading, it‚Äôs not a walk to 6th street unless you want to cross a busy street. Poor communication, you need something? Gotta wait couple hours for a host to reply. No sorts of privacy because of the sheer curtains (the only thing blocking you from the other house that‚Äôs 50 feet away). Pool is disgusting and dirty. Overall 5/10 cute house but maybe be truthful with people. Also charge too much for a nasty looking toilet seat.

Close to down town but not worth the money spent at all. Property is not maintained well and the neighborhood is pretty run down. The space is also tiny for the amount of people it states it sleeps, photos are exaggerated. Overall disappointed with our stay

Place was great for me and my boyfriend. Apartment was in a convenient location. We wish one of the rooms had a king sized bed, but can‚Äôt really complain because two bedroom was advertised.

I would not recommend staying here. It looked nothing like the pictures and was dated, not very clean either. The exterior of the building is not nice at all. There was also an extremely strong oder in the unit the entire weekend that smelled like something burning, were cockroaches, and the back/slider door lock was completely broken and could not lock. The unit was missing some basic amenities like clothes hangers, a bath mat and a decent frying pan. We messaged and they immediately responded and delivered what we needed.
The apartment is in a quiet residential neighborhood but close to the city and Barton Springs.
The unit has been renovated and is fresh and clean with nice appliances. The only downside was the bathroom. The tub and shower surround were not updated. The tub surface is peeling off and gross. The grout and caulking in the shower is moldy and gross. It's unfortunate that they updated everything but the tub.

Unfortunately we were unable to make it to our rental in Austin due to unsafe traveling conditions from a winter storm. The host was responsive but failed to be flexible when we could not get to the location due to unsafe roads and road closures from ice and snow. After messaging the host with my concerns she failed to respond whether she was local or not to know information firsthand but only responded with ‚Äúroads are safe, weather is cold.‚Äù After calling many local businesses, local police, and Austin DOT, whom all said many roads are closed and to not travel to the area because conditions would only be worse over the weekend, she still was adamant that the roads were safe. I asked if there was any way we could reschedule dates, refund, or if she had a rental in Houston since we needed somewhere to stay for the night but she refused. Yes I know you cannot predict weather and everyone wants to make their money but I feel as though the host could have tried to somewhat help us in some way to have us rearrange dates and possible pay difference if the rates were higher.

Would stay here again. Host was very quick with responses and made accommodations to our travel times. Only bad thing was that the bed was not on a box spring but the mattress was directly on the floor in the frame. Was not like how it was in the picture, but everything else was phenomenal!
No thanks
Tod is easy to communicate with if needed, but probably won‚Äôt be necessary. I had a very long stay and experienced no issues.

It was a quaint little home! We enjoyed the home and space. The hosts were great throughout the whole process from check in, accommodating with extra towels, and detailed instructions. Unfortunately, we did have some issues with the cleanliness of the place. We understand this may not have been the owners fault but the cleaning service. We normally don't nitpick but this place had mildew growing on the shower curtain, dirty bathroom trash can lid, dirty rug, dirt on the sofa bed and few other things. This is the only reason we gave it this rating.

I was unable to stay at this Airbnb because it was not fit for the 2 year old child I was traveling with (we booked and canceled within the SAME hour and communicated immediately) the host charged me for a night and cleaning free for the Airbnb I NEVER stayed at. They then stopped communicating.

Meshelle's place was, as described, funky and
great.
Located in a quiet area. I did not like the bed, it was too soft. You literally sink into the bed and it's very difficult to move. Overall a decent place for the price.

Due to damage due to a severe storm the night prior, we were unable to stay at the property. There was a downed tree and no electricity. Paula was in constant contact with me letting me know the status. She was trying hard to get the tree removed and working to getting the power restored before the check-in time. I made the decision to cancel the reservation and Paula was very  quick to get the cancellation approved to refund the money. This rating is for the customer service I received. I can‚Äôt wait to stay at this home on our next trip.

1. The WiFi was temperamental & sporadic.

2. The remotes for the TV‚Äôs didn‚Äôt work 90% of the time.

3. The master suites shower only had cold water.

4. The gate could use some WD40, or a lubricant that‚Äôs designed for exterior applications. Had it just been my wife and daughter, they would have not been able to open the gate.

5. Acorns and sap will be falling on your car, an issues that I assume is relegated to autumn.

the upstairs shower was already leaking when we got there. the frame from the upstairs bathroom was also broken when we got there but forgot to take a picture. I cleaned it up and threw away so no one would step on anything and get her. the curtain is not broken, the rod kept popping out everytime we opened the curtain. the confetti is our fault and so is the paint coming off on the door. we picked most of the confetti and only have 10 to 15-ish left. Also, who keeps a whole shelf right where a door can continuesly hit it.


NOTE: anyone who rents this place, take pictures and video of everything when you first get there. put all the frames by the backyard door in a safe place, that door will keep hitting that shelf and drop them.

check under sofas and beds because there is dust gathered everywhere. take pictures of that too for when you get charged extra $150 cleaning fee

take bug spray with you because you will see a lot of roaches and spiders
Cancelled last minute. Terrible experience.

The stay wasn‚Äôt horrible, but definitely not worth the money. The actual apartment is a nice setup in a convenient spot, however the furniture and cleanliness were not great. We had to kill multiple bugs during our stay and the furniture was constantly falling apart. By checkout we were afraid of what could break next. We tried to communicate with the host that manages the Austin property, but she never called back. We did not hear from her our entire stay.

The big draw for us was the seemingly outdoor atmosphere to hang out with family and our dogs but unfortunately that was misleading.  The small was overgrown and there were ants in the patio area and just in the lawn itself.  We could not hang out there at all! The grass was so tall that the dogs had a hard time doing their business.  I was also surprised the area wasn‚Äôt very appealing since the reviews hadn‚Äôt mentioned that.  There was little privacy as the windows in the bedroom were completely exposed.  So much so that I put all the pillows I could find to cover them.  When packing I even I accidentally took 2 of those pillows that matched exactly to mine.  When she told me a couple hours after I left she agreed for me to mail them and I promptly did first thing in the morning with no issues!

my partner bled on the sheets due to a natural feminine occurance and the host is harassing us for money and requesting photos along with air bnb of the stains. super  embarrassing that they are this cold and unfeeling. I'm not sure if it's a kink or fetish but it should be reprehensible to request a photo of blood marked sheets from your guest. zero out of five for the whole experience. Really icky.

I had some issues with the Wyndham, but it was mostly outside of the host‚Äôs control.

The room itself was nice. Good location, with a gym, big rooms.

I had a series of bad luck with it though - the water pipe burst several floors up, and I woke up in a flooded room. The response was terribly slow - it took an entire day for any action to be taken. More frustratingly, I had my phone blown up by a sales person trying to get me to purchase a timeshare the entire time. The guy even stopped me in person (I had never met him before prior) when I was headed downstairs to get help from the front desk. Eventually, a day or so later, I was moved to a different room.

Separately, a few days later the elevator broke down while I was in it, trapping me in there for about 45 minutes. The firefighter eventually came and got me out.

The host never responded when I alerted him of the issue. As the person with the relationship with the resort, I would have expected some communication to the resort on my behalf, or at least saying something back.

All in all, the location was central, and the resort was nice, and I was largely just unlucky. But if things go wrong, don‚Äôt expect much support

This location is conveniently located to all DT ATXs has to offer. Yet detached just far enough to be quiet.

For the price, this Airbnb makes for a good crash pad for your next ATX outing.
This place was everything and more. It had everything that we needed. It was missing nothing. Exactly what you want from a place, especially if you're going to be there for a while.

The house is not in the best of neighborhoods; however, when you arrive on the premises it‚Äôs quite clean/well kept and very quite. Not an ideal location though if you don‚Äôt have a car. Not much is within walking distance.
The home is absolutely stunning - the design and layout is perfect. When we first drove up to the house we were a bit nervous not knowing the area but we had no issues and it was very quiet!

Pros:
- Prime location

Cons:

This is one of my worst Airbnb experience so far. The unit is in a very good location and close to every tourist spots. And the host respond is pretty fast. However the unit is not fully clean when we arrived, the air conditioning is dripping water, the floor is dirty and bed sheets from pervious guest are stacking on the floor. There are few missing items from the amenity list. On top of that, I got bug bite during my stay and I am sure they are not from mosquitoes. The unit itself have a thick wall and close to the exit route to the parking garage, which you can hear your neighbor playing bass in the morning and everyone in and out. Overall, this is not an pleasant experience I ever expect from Airbnb.

I booked a room with basically only 24 hours notice, and Jay was extremely accommodating. Chose this pace largely because of all of the reviews touting the location, and they weren‚Äôt lying. You can walk or scooter to most anything; I only needed a Lyft a couple of times. Jay (and her cats) are also very personable, too, which was an added bonus. Would stay here again!

There is several cats Isnideand outside tge in which host doesn‚Äôt list in her showing!! I‚Äôm highly allergic to cats anda fear of cats!!!!

This home is cute in pics but make sure the toilet seat is fully situated/connected before you use it so you don‚Äôt fall inside. My car was broken into on my very first night at the Airbnb and while the hosts were quick to respond, they were overall useless in the effort since they have no real cameras installed at the front of the house, only motion detectors which happened to only catch my final motions coming into the house and not the burglar tossing my car inside out smack in front of the property. There‚Äôs no way to turn off the inside living room light which made it  a bother for me to sleep at night. If the light is a security feature it only confirms my stance that this location is NOT safe for an Airbnb. If it‚Äôs not a security feature, I still do not recommend staying here if safety is your priority. Noticed a bug crawling around my room. And to top it off, they refused to accommodate a 30min-1hr delayed checkout.

This place does NOT LOOK like the photos, it is on the bottom floor by the parking lot, very DARK, it smells MUSTY and MOLDY, the bathroom has NO VENT, we had NO HOT WATER for the first 2 days, followed by no water at all in the bathroom, the next day! The management told us it was a city issue and offered no compensation for this major inconvenience!

Almost all the DISHES and GLASSWARE were stained and DIRTY, neatly placed inside cupboards for some reason? The only one wine glass provided had LIPSTICK STAINS, which we left for them to see and took photos! The management offered to send a cleaning crew for a touch-up after, but upon arrival we had no choice, but to clean all the glasses, mugs, dishes, etc. we needed to use. All of the cooking pots and pans had an unhealthy coating or were completely scratched. The "silverware" was super cheap and flimsy, felt like plastic coated in cheap silver paint.

We payed a full price for 7 nights for what is listed as "enhanced clean" and private experience, none of which was delivered! One of us had to work remotely the entire time inside the apartment and having anyone come to touch up on cleaning, would have been very disturbing.

From the moment we entered, there was a HORRIBLE SMELL OF MILDEW throughout the apartment, which was not masked at all by the cheap, chemical air-freshener plugged into the wall. We all got terrible headaches from this awful smell of that permeated everything inside the apartment.

The photos posted are very DECEIVING, they show a bright and light place tastefully decorated. However, the entire apartment has virtually NO NATURAL LIGHT at all. All the lights had to be on in order to "see" at any moment of the day inside this apt.

Several of the porch blinds were missing and people walking into the building could see us sitting on the living room couch at all times of day or night, again NOT PRIVATE. The porch was barricaded by two dark and old walls on two out of three sides. The only, small porch opening faced the narrow parking lot and the street. Everyone walking into the bldg. and/or the pool passed by this porch. In fact, it felt totally unsafe because at any moment anyone from the outside could walk onto this porch uninvited! NOT SAFE for single travelers. We never got out to sit on the porch, it was dirty on top of it.

The bathroom window above the tub is not functional, it is completely barricaded with tacky dark paint/paper?! The toilet was not flushing for an entire day, the bathroom sink drained super slowly and there were 2 toilet paper rolls provided for an entire week, one was half used and the other one was under the sink, so cheap! This place lists as ready for 4 people, yet only 3 sets of towels are provided and the second bed, the sofa was not made for us upon arrival.

This was a LOUD unit, with noises from people walking by the front door and people directly upstairs, as well as behind the bedroom. The bed was positioned directly under a narrow window that faces the communal pool, which is super close to the window. It was very hard to sleep because there are bright, neon lights around the pool shining through the completely closed blinds above the bed, all night long!

Couple of nights in a row, there was loud music and party noises well passed 11:30 p.m. On top of this, the bed sheets smelled dirty, were wrinkled, and the bed comforter had obvious stains on it. It was simply placed two loose sheets, not tucked inside a cover. We could not help but wonder if any of these linens were even changed/washed!

Overall, this was our worst Airbnb experience we have ever had. It is really embarrassing how FALSELY it is ADVERTISED and presented for a substantial amount of money! It definitely made us feel as if the owners only care about PROFIT OVER QUALITY and HONESTY!

Location becomes completely irrelevant if you are staying in a DIRTY, MOLDY, NO VENTILATION, NO PRIVACY, DARK, OLD place that is "made up" with cheap "make-up" into something that is far from reality. We would absolutely NOT RECOMMEND this place!

Great location close to downtown and the lake. Cant go wrong with this one. A bit much light in the bedroom at night/mornings may make it hard to sleep if that bothers you, but nothing an eyemask cant solve. Great all around experience, would stay again.
Needs repair and noisy neighbors upstairs late night and all through the early morning hours.  Difficult to stay asleep.
Nice place and location but NO PARKING SPACE. Don‚Äôt go with your vehicle

I typically never leave negative reviews but I think it‚Äôs important anyone staying here know about our incident. The air conditioner broke during our last night of stay at this residence. We barely slept  due to the home being around 80 degrees F. I reported the issue to the owner who wasn‚Äôt able to get service out to the house at that time. I can understand this as it wasn‚Äôt truly in their control but initially they were amenable to offering a partial refund. The owner was unresponsive after and wouldn‚Äôt communicate about the incident. It‚Äôs a negative experience and I would truly just stay away given if it happened earlier in our stay, I‚Äôm not sure they would take the matter seriously.

We arrived to the place being not clean and had to wait for someone to finish cleaning and washing the comforters. The power went out within 12 hours of us being there. The host would not communicate back with us. The host would not answer the phone. We had to sleep in my car, yet we were still charged. The host refused to give us a full refund. We spent over $500 to have power for only 12 hours. They were aware that the power had just came back on but did not tell us any of this prior to booking. The WORST Airbnb host ever. The host and Co-host are money hungry individuals. They are not truthful nor fair. They just want their money and will get it by any means necessary. They are no more than scammers in my eyes. I do not recommend. If I could put no stars, I would.

I was charged a cleaning fee of $60 and was also told that if I left any dishes or trashed that I would be charged an additional $60. Which I'm not sure what the first cleaning fee is for. Other than that the place was at the time

The location shown on the posting is nowhere near the actual location of the apartment. The map shows where the apartment complex's office is located. We wouldn't have booked if it showed the accurate location. The apartment was nothing fancy and a little dirty. We were only given one bath towel even though we booked for two adults.

We were disappointed with the apartment, very bare bones and dirty apartment complex. The couch was stained and the chairs were broken, super low quality towels and no amenities really. I think if you‚Äôre a college student and you get a cheap rate it‚Äôs a fine place but I was disappointed with the place

The Airbnb is exactly as pictured - it has everything you need! Unfortunately, we stayed due to a cancelled flight right before the power outages / water problems of February 2021. For that reason, we were not able to actually stay at the location due to no power at the Airbnb. However, those are purely external circumstances and the hosts are incredibly communicative and helpful. I would definitely recommend this Airbnb (just not during an ice storm that shuts off the power of half of the city!).

Other then it not being an entire place and having wide open windows so the whole town can see and having code enforcement show up informing me that the owner didn‚Äôt have a license to even have an Airbnb oh and did I mention the first night hearing the next door neighbors asking for toilet paper at 5 am when the music finally stopped the stay was fine

We were disappointed with this stay. It is not as shown in the photos. The table in the kitchen is different and unusable bc it is broken. We were unable to use the fire pit and when it was brought to the owners attention, we were given instructions on how to change the propane ourselves, which we were not comfortable doing. There are no curtains on the windows in the main areas or upstairs  except in the bedrooms (one of the areas is a sleeping area-and there‚Äôs no curtain-so no one could actually sleep there) There were also a crazy amount of large ants in the master bedroom. Our first night there I woke up to ants crawling on me in the bed-This happened the second night as well. There were also Japanese lady beetles (they look like ladybugs) EVERYWHERE. I brought this to their attention as well, and they said they would take care of the ants and the beetles when we left, which didn‚Äôt help us while we were there. I would not stay here again.

The pros:
The house was in a good location, and right next to an HEB grocery store.
There were plenty of beds and sitting areas for all of our guests to sleep comfortably.
we got early check in (50$ an hour which was pricey in my opinion but still was nice to be able to check in early)
the outdoor area had cornhole and a small putt putt area which was a nice addition

The cons:
the house was not cleaned well (dirt piles in closets, stains on sheets/ bedding) and it did not look as done up as the pictures suggested. when we arrived i had to move pretty much all of the backyard furniture into where it should‚Äôve been. i know over time property gets damaged and furniture needs to be replaced and it was all still nice, just not as nice as pictured.
surround sound never worked, and the fire stick was missing and we couldn‚Äôt figure out how to make the TV work without it.
the neighbors are not nice, and there‚Äôs signs throughout the house that warn you that they will call cops with noise complaints. we never got complaints but whenever they saw us they made it a point to act as though they did not like that an air bnb was located next to them.

I travel to Austin, Texas often with work.

This time however, since I was to be there a while decided to book a few weeks and bring the family.

Unfortunately, only a few days after booking the home, flights, car rentals all 4 of us came down with the worst flu I've had in years and basically made us all bedridden for two weeks!

Despite not being able to travel and past the ability to cancel the home with any credit, we really appreciate that Dallas provided us a partial refund even though he wasn't obligated to do so.

We'll be back for a visit soon!

First, of all, my wife loved the decor, and felt the place was very warm and comfy. Me, I'm more function over form person. So here are some function issues: 1) King bed is not in the master bedroom (it has two doubles); 2) No door in master bath; 3) The blinds in the bedroom with the king bed do not cover the window all the way and they face the street and sidewalk. If you walk out in the bedroom at night, you can be seen from outside; 4) There is NO network television service, therefore we could not watch network news, live football games, etc. Only a couple of apps are available. 5) In the bedroom with the king bed, the bathroom is a little small and the placement of the toilet paper holder in is "in your personal space" and is put on backwards (when you hit it because it is too close to commode, it falls behind rather than in front of you).

Not a terrible place, but probably would not stay here again.

The property was not clean at all. Random hair in all the beds, dirty fridge, dirty bathrooms. We basically had to clean the unit ourselves.
The upstairs master isn‚Äôt really a master bedroom. It has two doubles in it. There is also no door to the en suite master bath. It would not take much to put doors up.
The unit was decorated nicely.
Can‚Äôt recommend staying there. Property was disappointing.
no door on the upstairs bathroom I immediately thought some dirty shit kinda sexy

We were very disappointed by our stay at this house due to the unsanitary conditions along with the unprofessional and inconsiderate response from the hosts to mend our problem.

Upon immediate arrival to the house, we noticed 3 cockroaches in the common living areas. We were hoping that was just a fluke and would not be an issue, but we continued to notice more and by the end of the weekend, counted almost 20 COCKRAOCHES total. And these were not small cockroaches. They were big disgusting roaches and we found them alive, dead, and half dead in the common areas, bedrooms, downstairs bathroom, and 1 unfortunate member of our party woke up with them IN HIS BED 2 nights in a row. Absolutely disgusting.


But maybe worse was our host‚Äôs response. Now you would think as disgusting and completely unsanitary as this situation is, that we would get an apologetic and urgent response to resolve this issue but this was not our experience. As soon as we realized this cockroach issue was as serious as it was, we contacted the host and they sent someone out the first day to spray the bugs. That night we noticed there were still roaches but most of them were dead or mostly dead. However the next day the problem continued with even more roaches and so we contacted our host again, and this time they did not send anyone but instead made several excuses that did not make any sense as to why they didn‚Äôt send maintenance to remedy this issue. We continued to try to reach out and quickly realized they were not really trying to help solve this urgent issue for us. Instead they consistently were gaslighting us on the phone. The host told us on the phone that ‚Äúthey couldn‚Äôt send someone in the unit when we were there‚Äù after we told them we would be gone most of the day and they already sent someone the day prior. The host also said that they couldn‚Äôt spray bug spray since we had our own stuff in there, but that was literally what they did the day prior so again it made no sense it all. It was very clear that excuses were just being made and they were not really interested in solving this situation and kept talking in circles. This really put a huge damper on our whole weekend where most of us travelled from all corners of the country to try to enjoy a vacation together. And much of the entire weekend was spent worrying about cockroaches in all the rooms and in some beds, and then worrying about trying to remedy the issue ourselves since the hosts did not remedy it for us. Furthermore we have to worry about possibly taking these nasty bugs home with us and causing further infestation.



Because of our negative experience with their poor communication and response to our problem, we were forced to finally take up the problem with AirBnb and got a partial refund (though we arguably should have had a full refund due to how bad the situation was). How can you charge someone to stay in a house completely overrun by giant cockroaches sleeping in your bed?!?!



While the house itself is pretty nice and has a nice backyard, an INFESTATION OF ROACHES BEING UNADDRESSED is a serious dealbreaker. Also, the game room with 4 beds in it is a converted garage, NOT a bedroom, which is where the cockroaches appeared most frequently. They really need to fully and seriously resolve this issue before letting anyone back into that house.
Julie's cabins was the perfect weekend get-a-away. Close to the fun things of south Austin, but tucked into the woods where the quiet will melt your stress away.

The A/C system was not working both days and nights. It was unfortunate in the Texas heat, especially with a baby. It hit about 80 degrees the last night we were there. Our car was broken into. Since we are from out of town, we were not aware this area had homeless people.
You get what you pay for .
Unfortunately, it was not the cleanest (sheets, restroom & shower). I‚Äôve had worse but I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôll stay here again.

I would describe this place as ‚Äúfine‚Äù. It is clean and in a good neighborhood. Everything is bare bones. You get two towels and one wash cloth, 1/2 role of paper towels, 4 forks and four knives, no throw blanket for the couch, no tissues in the place, the lowest quality ‚Äúamenities‚Äù (hairdryer, appliances, TP) on the market. You are given a set of chores to do upon leaving (take out all trash and recycling yourself, run the dishwasher, etc) before you leave. If you accidentally leave a personal belonging behind, you are fined! Hospitality? Not this guy‚Äôs thing I guess. There are a ton of little places within a few blocks of this that make this feel like a bad youth hostel.

The apartment is on the 2nd floor, building #1 directly on the busy expressway, which you can hear well inside. the older property is tidy with direct access to Ladybird Broadwalk. nice relaxed people, nice pool. the apartment is spacious and well laid out, the bathroom is old dated and in need of a refurbishment. the kitchen lacks some essentials for cooking.
there is no sofa bed as advertised just an air mattress, fine for kids for a few days but questionable for adults. the apartment was very dirty when we arrived. Jacob came in the evening with his partner and changed the bed and cleaned the bathroom. We cleaned the apartment ourselves the next day. Jacob was very communicative at the beginning and easy to reach by email, the cleaning fee should be refunded. still no receipt, emails are no longer answered

Just my honest review. The AC unit is extremely loud and will keep you up at night. The shower drains extremely slow and you will be standing in a 5 inch pool of dirty water the whole time. The bathroom is very outdated the tub is falling apart. No shower stuff provided bring your own. Towels look dirty. Liked the access to the river walk and the fact it was gated. Bedroom and rest of apartment is clean. Check in is not safe at all did not like it and felt unsafe during my stay because of it. If you need a cheaper option to stay in Austin this is it. However Ubers will be between 15-20 to get to downtown from this location.

The location is great!
However, we had an intruder walk In while we were in the home. It frightened us and we felt extremely unsafe after, knowing that someone else knew the code to get in.

The house did not feel
Like a super host. Beds and pillows not comfortable, towels were dirty and old, and items were left in the washer from previous guests.
Stayed here for my bachelorette party and could not be happier with our stay!

The pictures do not completely reflect on the place you are walking into. We stayed here and had to leave the next day due to finding fleas. The host was quick to respond and is going to reimburse us. The host found out the guest before us had a unapproved dog staying - probably where the fleas came from.

Disappointed, because I have never had this happen with staying in Airbnb homes.

I would not book with michael and gabriela again. The price was good and INSIDE  the actual condo was cute. However the area wasnt the best, the tub, kitchen table, microwave and stove was dirty. The Roku did not work and we were stuck with basic cable. We stayed 4 days 3 nights and notified them of all issues day 1 and we were told they would either come the next day or send their cleaning person. No one never came. We ended up cleaning things ourselves (even though we paid a cleaning fee) and also had to purchase a new roku for the remainder of our stay. Customer service was beyond poor. Never again.

Never came to fix the shower that wouldn‚Äôt drain even thought i texted and called about it. Know what location this place is in before you book this place. There was a lot of bugs, and there‚Äôs only a few fans but the AC doesn‚Äôt work well so it‚Äôs very hot inside. Things look very nice until you take a closer look, dishes were dirty, paper peeling on tables, dead bugs in the carpet.

If I could give ZERO stars I would! This place was NOT clean and hosts very unhelpful. It had bugs everywhere, hairs from past people on the pull out bed, and trash on the ground. The kitchen sink didn‚Äôt drain work and we didn‚Äôt realize till we tried to throw some soup out and it STUNK! The host did nothing to help. They also didn‚Äôt provide any blankets for the pull out bed (only linens) even though in my initial message I asked for blankets. The AC doesn‚Äôt work in the room so it gets hot in there but it‚Äôs freezing in the living room space. The wifi sucks - can‚Äôt even load a low res YouTube video. We got locked out of the apartment and the host didn‚Äôt know how to override their own lock. I figured it out after 30 minutes - with no help from them.

There were basically non-stop issues since the moment we checked into the Airbnb. When I brought this up to them, they basically ignored my message and just said thanks for staying with us. So I had to reiterate what I wrote. It‚Äôs frustrating that they just chose to ignore the message. Clearly they don‚Äôt care about the people staying at their Airbnb.

I‚Äôm currently working with Airbnb to get my money back. I suggest you pay extra money to stay at a different Airbnb or just get a hotel cuz this place is DISGUSTING and the host is AWFUL.
just okay. linens were cheap and not comfortable. charged a cleaning fee then threatened if we didn‚Äôt leave it tidy and take out the trash we‚Äôd be charged extra. better off staying at a hotel.

Gets the job done, nice place however no linens were provided for pullout couch, the blanket for the pullout couch was filthy and smelt horrible. Only 3 towels provided for a place that sleeps 4 and they were very low quality and pilled cotton as you dried yourself.

The location of the apartment is very good, the room is generally clean, but found that there is a piece of dirt on the bed linen, the next day I sent feedback to the landlord, the landlord did not reply to the message at all!  Maybe it was bad luck, and two bad experiences happened: 1. On the third day I was ready to wash clothes. When I opened the door of the storage room of the washerÔºåthe slide rail button on it fell out, and the door fell out almost under pressure to me; 2. By 12 o'clock in the evening of the fifth night, when I was preparing to wash, I found that there was no hot water. When I woke up the next day, there was still no hot water; I tried to cook eggs and found that the gas stove could not ignite, so there should be no gas!  A few problems occurred, and the landlord sent a message, and the landlord either did not reply, or the reply was very slow!  The Airbnb experience this time was not good anyway.  Hope the subsequent landlord can do better!

I‚Äôm giving a two star review because of some cleaning issues. The place itself is nice and is in a good area. The directions provided were good and we had no problems getting in.

The cleaning issues were due to the sheets being dirty on the bedroom mattress. We had to take them off and wash new ones and put them on ourselves. Upon taking off the sheets, we also noticed there is a large pee stain on urine mattress.
The shower wouldn‚Äôt drain properly and would pool up with water full of black hair. Those were the things we ran into issues with.
I requested a refund on the cleaning fee but was declined because the host said we didn‚Äôt take pictures of the sheets and the drain was a maintenance issue. They also said that we didn‚Äôt inform them of the drain until after the stay was a reason for the decline. I figured I would let them know once we left so they could take care of it when no one is there. We did take pictures of the drain. We left the dirty sheets in the closet for them to take a look at but didn‚Äôt take pictures of them.

As I wrote in a note to them, it‚Äôs disappointing and unfortunate because the two main things someone would expect to have during a stay are clean sleeping and a properly working shower. The money isn‚Äôt the issue. It‚Äôs being charged for a service that isn‚Äôt fully provided.
Good location.  Comfy bed.  Bed sits low to floor which some may find problematic.  Would stay here again!

The place was as pictured, the neighbor seemed super sketch but we didn‚Äôt have any issues with the area. The host didn‚Äôt respond to any of our messages upon responding. There was a pile of linens and someone‚Äôs dirty pants by the front door when we arrived and the bathroom floor was wet as if someone had just left? The place had a million air fresheners and after it being a big much we started to unplug them which revealed a moth ball and mouse pee smell. The vents had giant, and I mean huge pieces of mouse poop visible in them above the shower and in the laundry room. There was also scratching coming from a locked closet by the front door. The bottle brush by the sink was moldy and orange. Overall not huge inconveniences just not great. The place was as pictured.

This place is a health hazard, poorly managed, and I highly recommend you book elsewhere. This is my first time leaving a non 5-star review but I feel the need to share my experience with you so that you can avoid this place at all costs! My check-in time was 3pm, and upon arriving close to 4pm there were maintenance employees inside the building. The employees then continued to work and even informed my GF and I that they would need to come back later that evening to finish what they started. On top of them running around the house long after check in, there was no shower curtain or liner in the only bathroom. The staff told me the shower curtain had been washed and to remove it out of the dryer... when I took it out of the dryer I found it was covered and I mean SOAKED in urine. Absolutely horrific experience. It had never been washed. I messaged the host informing him of this, and he blamed the previous guest and said he would have someone bring me a new shower curtain the next day. Well, THEY NEVER DID. After following up, they then told me to "just use the liner." There was NO LINER. Anyway, long story short, neither my girlfriend or I could shower all weekend. He never resolved the issue, and by the time checkout came, the entire upstairs started to smell like pee. When I told him I would be leaving a review he tried to offer me pathetic hush money "after the 14-day review period ends" which I already informed Air BnB about and found hilarious. Although they respond to messages, management is a joke and the place is absolutely a health hazard. Stay at your own risk.

Place was damaged and bed unfurnished, bathroom lacked toilet paper, soap and sanitizer dispensers were damaged, place smelled strongly of cannabis.

Found puddles forming on the floor in the kitchen, informed host immediately and they asked us to wait for a plumber, until 10am. Plumber did not arrive at 10:40 and host said they'd make arrangements.

Plumbers were there all day using power tools.

Host informed me that I did not need to leave a review and would be compensated cleaning costs of 85$USD if I did not leave a review for 14 days.

I took issue with the idea of being paid for my silence. Though I understand the importance of ratings, this is really beyond the pale.

I stayed here for three weeks while waiting for my house. Couldn‚Äôt find another place like this at the price point.

Pro‚Äôs:
Price
Plenty of space
Location is very convenient!
Has all the basics to cook
Pretty cool balcony

Con‚Äôs:
Sketchy corner of the area. No incidents while I was here though
Weird smell. It was uncomfortably musty.
Pillows and bed have crinkly waterproof covers. Understand why, but not very comfortable.
Internet would drop out a couple times a day. Not great when trying to work.

Location:
Overall this was a good spot for us. It was conveniently located North of downtown but only 2 blocks from freeway so only about 5-7 minute drive downtown and only 10-15 minutes from the Domain. The neighborhood is decent, right off the highway are a couple taco food trucks that are delicious and a good number of homeless, but they were never seen on our road. There is a small school so traffic can be busy during the beginning and ending times for school. Plenty of parking provided, and a small area for pets to use bathroom.
Inside:
When we arrived we did feel like it had a rushed cleaning job. We ended up sweeping the entire apartment and moving furniture to clean under prior to unpacking our things. The water lines for the shower were hooked backwards so we thought we didn‚Äôt have hot water at first. The water pressure for downstairs is poor, and even worse when the temp drops. The internet is spotty, so if you have business meeting plans or game, be very weary. The mattresses need to be replaced, they are both very bad on your back, the bed is the smaller room is significantly worse. For the prices they are asking the beds 100% need to be replaced! It was nice having washer and dryer available, never any issues with those or any other appliances. They do have monthly pest control, in 3 months I saw only 4 bugs total in the kitchen, but with having 3 sliding doors that we left open often I was not surprised or did not think this was an issue. No roaches were ever found by us.
Hosts:
Hosts were responsive when we reached out. The only issue they were unable to fix was the spotty internet, but they did offer to reset for us since we did not have access to router. The hosts are unable to provide a key for mailbox, so plan on not having access unless you talk with mail person when they are delivering then they will open box to check for your mail.
Pricing:
I think this place is priced on the higher end for what is offered, but with Austin housing is going up everywhere. Towards the end of our stay we asked about extending our stay and were notified they are no longer doing extended/monthly rates. The rate for 1 month would have been higher for the entire 3 months we stayed. I definitely don‚Äôt think they cost should have went up, but based on time of year/seasonal events in the area, this is what happened.

The apt. was fine, but the communication and help from the host was horrible esp. when needed most.
The apt. has 2 rooms and the door knob on the second room door was missing (don't know how that happened) , but the door still had its lock installed. My brother got locked in the second room as none of us could figure out how to open it without the door knob. I texted and called Joseph (from sdta) to explain what was going on, but after the initial call there was no follow up from him. I texted and called him multiple times but no answer. He just left us to figure a way out! This happened on the first night out of a 2 night stay and there was no follow up for the rest of the stay except for checkout messages.
Def. one of the worst exp. ever!!

The host gave us the wrong key code yo enter the house and was not responsive for half an hour when we messaged the code was not working and needed help.

While waiting for the code, we noticed the neighborhood and we did not feel safe. The neighborhood was not clean and there were dumpsters nearby. So we did not even enter the house and went back and booked a hotel as we had to attend something urgently.

The host did not even respond and offer any refund when we messaged about our concern. Overall a rare bad experience as we stay in Airbnbs pretty often.

Location is fantastic and the yard / porches are great.  House worked well enough for our needs.  However we arrived to a not clean house though...our infant crawling around was immediately obviously picking up up a lot of dog hair off of the rug...in a  "no pets" listing.  found dog hair on other  items, the door mat , etc. and a turd in the back yard. So i had to vacuum the rug, etc.  Also a lot of essentials were missing when we arrived and we requested them one-by-one as we needed them and realized they weren't there. (vacuum, broom, dust pan, multipurpose cleaner, dish towels, toilet brush, ...)  They supplied everything we asked for, but it was frustrating and eventually i got tired of asking.  maybe this is resolved now but there should be better management of essential supplies - esp for our almost 5 week stay - and better cleaning.  We don't have pet allergies but if we did it would have been bad.

This was definitely the worst AirBnB property I had ever walked into. Upon arrival the property/area was very dark and there were police investigating a suspicious car out front.
Once inside, the owner‚Äôs belongings were everywhere. About 20 pairs of shoes sitting in the living room entrance, personal bathroom supplies inside the shower, entire closets and dressers overflowing with clothing.
Definitely felt like we were invading someone‚Äôs personal living space and not staying at a rental property.
Above all, I think the worst part was that the whole front living/dining space gives no privacy as the large windows don‚Äôt have curtains or blinds and you‚Äôre very exposed to the street.
The entire experience was not how I wanted to start my first Austin trip but AirBnB customer care really helped us find somewhere else to stay after not feeling comfortable here. Definitely not worth paying this much money for what the host is offering.
Parking was a little strange with the incline and tons of cars on the street, but the location was ok.  We only stayed 1 night.

The location is all this place had going for it. However, based on my other Airbnb stay experiences, this one was sub par. Usually the host provides all instructions the day of check in, but there were no instructions provided until I asked for them at 9pm the day of. The bathroom had broken towel rod and toilet paper rod. The kitchen utensils were dirty and not washed so we couldn't use most items.

Arrived to find a toilet seat covered with urine; also experienced one live cockroach and five live spiders, on kitchen floor. Dishwasher comes lose from kitchen counter when you open it. Main shower knob broken and unreliable. Neighborhood was sufficiently "uncertain," such that our daughter would not let us take the grandchildren for a walk during the day. Vince was responsive by text but never stopped by, and the exterminator arrived five days after we reported the cockroach and spiders.

Pictures are deceiving. This is place is not luxurious whatsoever. Sofa bed did not have sheets supplied, we had to wait until the next day to get some, even though we told him how many people were checking in. Hand soap and basic things were also missing. Unit smelled when we first arrived because the AC is kept high. It was difficult to get the right temperature in one of the showers because the knob is broken. The place is very plain and looks like it was put together on a budget.
Overall disappointed

It is in a quiet area. The traffic to the downtown area was horrific at times. It was F1 race weekend, so possibly attributing to the heavy traffic. The accommodations were good for two couples, as we each had a king room and own bathroom.
Great place , pictures do not show how great the house is , best for staying away from the city hustle , but not far from good places and things to do .

good air conditioned, fresh day and night

no coffee for guests

no communication with the host, he is not very friendly

noisy bed but clean

house is not very clean

Nice location.  Great communication with the management??  Cleaning crew could do a better job, inside and out.  Broken furniture on the patio, on a gourgeous day, we‚Äôre a disappointment.  Broken dishes and old pots were also a disappointment.  For the price, we were expecting more.  It was my birthday, so the company and touring Austin made up for it.

Pros: Close to downtown on quiet street with ample parking.

Cons: Thin walls with units above and around you. Airbnb only as quiet as your neighbors. Not ideal conditions if working remotely. Contacting mint house about noise yielded no results. First level studio had a lot of spider activity. Webs everywhere and multiple spiders.

Maybe with a weekend stay the nuisances would have been minimal vs monthly stay. Ultimately monthly price was not worth value imo.

Outdoor areas were not clean. If you stay in the rooms close to the access door, you will be listening to the in and out sounds. Very annoying. The quality of the mattress is terrible. The location, cleanness inside the room is okay. It is pricey, but I am taking into account that Austin is getting very expensive.

Where can I start,
This place was an absolute treat.
The coziest!!
You won‚Äôt regret booking a stay here.

Location is in the quiet part of east side, and a close uber ride to wherever you'd need to go in Austin. The company was fast in response time, but they kept getting important details with the booking and checking out process that I can't give 5 stars for my stay- they almost didn't have a room for me. The room isn't big but clean and well-laid-out and has everything you need.
No
Small room with no ventilation, not a great area and poorly equipped.
The bathroom smells very bad and the AC kept cutting off.

Our room was extremely dirty, the dishes, the shower curtain was too gross to touch, the bed absolutely sucked it makes noise every time you toss and turn and kept us up. Overall a very unpleasant stay.

I had the worst Airbnb experience at this listing. After our first night, I had a terrible fright in the kitchen when I noticed that the bananas I left on the kitchen counter had huge human-size bite marks. Realizing it can only be a rodent, I messaged the host who said she would send over her cleaning unit to look into it. After speaking with my husband we decided to leave the place. We have a three-year old, and we just couldn‚Äôt stay at a place where rats may be around at night. When I told the host this, she said I can‚Äôt get a refund due to her cancellation policy. And that previous guests have not complained about this. This is after I sent her pictures of food eaten by the rodent/s. My husband also discovered the plastic container of croissants we left out on the kitchen counter had been gnawed into. The plastic in one corner was clearly cut through and one of the croissants was pulled out and bitten into. I sent these pinto the host too and called Airbnb customer service. I spoke to agent, sent the pictures and we checked out as soon as we could. AirBnB decided the issue was covered by AirCover and issued a refund. The cleaning fee is quite high for this listing, and this is not included in AirCover so I lost more than $200 in cleaning fee and taxes. We checked into a hotel instead.

I wasn‚Äôt judicious in choosing a place in an apartment complex with a young child. I‚Äôve lived in an apartment complex in the South before. The thing with apartment complexes is that if your complex has a rodent issue then it doesn‚Äôt matter how much you clean your individual unit. All crevices and cracks need to be sealed completely for your unit to be free of rodents, and this is really hard.

I don‚Äôt like leaving negative reviews, but I wanted to let others with children or those who are sensitive to rodents know of this issue with this listing so they don‚Äôt go through the same experience as me. I should have just booked a hotel even if it‚Äôs a bit more expensive.

Terrible experience. Way way way over priced. Construction ongoing across the street constant. Smelly condos. Dirty. Will never do business with them ever again. Booked for one month and left early because it was unbearable.

Kasa instructions and responses are quick and well-described. That said, I had some issues with needing to get out of a 2.5 month reservation due to major life changes and they would not change their 30-day penalty even with a 30-day notification which seemed egregious. They also lied initially and said they could not change it, but after about 3 phone calls with both airbnb and Kasa it was confirmed that they just didn't want to. Again this was with 30-day notice on my part.

The cost they charged was also comically bad, I now am renting a nicer place on a 3 month lease with rental furniture and paying less than half what I was charged to stay with them.

If you need a corporate rental, there are at least 4 options in Austin which will not charge you 30-day penalty if you need to change the move out date, and hopefully also not lie to you about their business decisions.

Dishonest host, kasa tried to collect my credit card information several times after the booking was already confirmed. Then due to an apparent ‚Äútech glitch‚Äù on their part, I couldn‚Äôt check into my unit until 6 hours after  my confirmed check-in time, kasa rep on phone said there was no way to let me cancel, basically they took zero accountability for any of their errors so I spent many hours on the phone today to finally get refunded.
OMG !! Incredible place downtown and the view is to die for !!! Definitely would book again !!!!!

Overall this was a terrible stay and we will never come back to this property. I‚Äôll just start with the worst stuff in case people want the abridged version: 1) there was no hot water, 2) the apartment next door was going through renovations and it was insanely loud starting at 9am in the morning. Not the best way to wake up on vacation. I think I‚Äôve left maybe two negative reviews out of the crazy number I‚Äôve written, this place is bad.

Check in was fine, they send over a webpage where you can review the steps ahead of time and the front desk was friendly and helpful. Communication overall is pretty good, the host is responsive.

When I entered the apartment, there was bunch of equipment inside because maintenance was fixing a stove. Eventually the guy came back and I explained to them that I‚Äôd be there for a few days and wasn‚Äôt going to need it, asking them to return after we leave.

Most of the apartment is fine but there are just some really weird issues. The baseboards in the bedroom are terribly discolored and I can‚Äôt tell why, looks incredibly dirty. I don‚Äôt really know how to describe everything but it just feels like everything was built the cheapest way possible.

I get the impression that this management company does things as lean as possible, they are fully hands off and rely entirely on others to report issues to them. This is great when it works, but this apartment just feels like everyone who manages it has a ‚Äúnot my problem‚Äù attitude. Not a fan, will avoid this host in the future.
Pull out her was not acceptable for an adult male. We had to get a hotel also for the week.

TLDR: apartment was not cleaned properly (dirty sheets, someone else's soap stuck to the shelf in the shower, stained kitchen towel) and there were a lot of basic things missing from this apartment. Would not recommend. Side note: the bed is quite raised with the top of the bed being ~3 ft off the floor. It wasn't a problem for us but I wouldn't recommend for anyone with limited mobility.

Long version:
Overall, the cleaning and preparation of the apartment were lacking. I feel bad leaving a bad review but there were a lot of basic things that were missing during my stay.

Issues with cleanliness
- the fitted sheet had fresh food stains on it. I contacted Alexander about this, he ordered new sheets but we never got new sheets in our 5 day stay. (Note: there was also no top sheet between the comforter and the fitted sheet. I would hope that the comforter cover is changed between guests but there were some stains on the it as well.)
- In the bathroom, someone else's someone soap was stuck to the shelf in the shower
- In the kitchen, one of the towels by the sink had stains

Additionally, there were things missing from the apartment that are pretty standard in other AirBnBs that I've stayed in and the apartment just didn't seem prepared.
- no box of tissues
- only a partial roll of toilet paper in the apartment. Usually, there is at least 1 extra roll
- both the washer and dryer had clothes in them. (Wet clothes in the washer.)
- only 1 folded towel in the bathroom despite there being 2 guests (found some others in the dryer)
- no hand towel in the bathroom (couldn't find one in the dryer or anywhere else in the apartment)
- no garbage bag lining the trash can in the kitchen
- silverware and dishes in the dishwasher

I also think that the apartment could use some general maintenance:
- the knob of the cabinet under the sink fell off
- rust around the drain in the tub
- The bottom glass in the refrigerator doesn't really fit. The crisper drawers are open to the rest of the fridge because there is a big gap between the front of the drawer and the end of the glass.

As the other reviews state, place was obviously not clean.  Got blamed for half broken stuff that was already in the residence.  Overall.  Be careful they will try to charge you extra to clean their already dirty property

Melissa is a very responsive Host.
Beautifully upgraded Home.
Good location, towels and blankets.
Extremely Squeaky Doors (the entrance door, the bedroom door and the bathroom door). It definitely wakes up the other person sleeping.
Everything that wasn‚Äôt right in the home was conveniently blamed on the previous guests and the term used to describe them was ‚Äúhorrible guests‚Äù. The broken sofa was their fault, leaking pot must be their fault, missing hair dryers was their fault (which were delivered when asked).
The home does not accommodate 12 people as mentioned in the listing. It accommodates 6 adults in the 3 bedrooms and there were two single beds in the closet of the master bedroom which can only be used by young kids of the parents otherwise it‚Äôs awkward. If they expect others to sleep on the sofa then those weren‚Äôt sofa beds. Just regular sofas.

The house is much smaller than it appears in the photos!
We almost left, very disappointed!!
The yard was terrible! Cheap plastic tables and chairs!

Matt‚Äôs place is as described. Well located close to downtown. The area was quite because we visited during the summer when UT Austin was not in session. Great place to stay for a few days to explore Austin!

Great location. Can walk to Moody Center, football stadium.  Several places to eat nearby.  I'm not sure if the listing says so, but  there is no elevator.  May want to consider that if you have any travelers with limited mobility. The apartment building itself is in bad shape, but Matt's place is clean.

Hi All.
This condo is very nice. It is supplied with everything you ever need. But I suggest they hire a new cleaning service . This place was somewhat dirty. There was hair on the toilet and a used q tip on the floor. Being highly allergic to dust and pollen. The vents in the bedroom and bedroom were soooooo dirty. They did give me a credit of 50. But I don't agree this was adequate. Also 25 yards down the street there are about 39 homeless sleepingunder the bridge. I would pass on this place

Was really disappointed that we didn‚Äôt have a clean apt as we entered. The bathroom mats were wet and so was the floor beneath it, there was no toilet paper and kitchen towels. On contacting the host we did receive these supplies, but given the price of listing my expectations were let down

Prior to our stay I was very impressed with responsiveness to my questions. Check in process was easy with good instructions. The space in the apartment was very good, especially the 4 bedrooms plus loft, difficult to find that so close to downtown.  Location is right on campus so their are loud frat houses across the street. Easy spot for getting ubers. Secure garage for car. But we were very disappointed in the upkeep and quality of the apartment. Right when you walk in you notice a very pungent smell, which I believe to be mold. In the bottom drawer of one of the bathrooms, their is mold growing in the drawer. The walls are very dirty and paint is chipping, cupboards in bathrooms are also damaged. The one sink in bathroom was plugged from the moment it was first used and never did drain that water for our entire stay. Over 3/4 of the vanity light bulbs did not work, nor did the bedroom lamps have functioning light bulbs. Grout in the other bathroom shower and floor is disintegrating and very dirty. Carpet in bedrooms isn‚Äôt tacked down and would come up every time you tried to shut the door.  Yes, I could have reported some of these issues to be resolved during our stay but when I‚Äôm on vacation I don‚Äôt want to have to deal with conversing/organizing a maintenance person‚Äôs arrival since we had plans to be gone during the day and we were not comfortable with a stranger being in the apartment when we weren‚Äôt there. These are all maintenance issues that are very visible and should‚Äôve been addressed PRIOR to our arrival.  This isn‚Äôt something you have a lot of control over but the apartment halls are also terrible- the floor is covered in pigeon poop and right above your door a pair of pigeons sat the entire time we were there so you have fresh poop on the floor in front of door along with feathers all over your entrance rug and door.

Our stay here was adequate, but we were quite disappointed with the condition of the building and the finishing touches of the home.

The building is run down and dirty. The closer building elevators did not work with a printed sign with directions to the other building elevator indicating it may have been like that for awhile, and this home is on the 5th story. The stairs and hallways outside the room were run down with missing sections of the ceiling in places. In addition, during the first night of our stay the building fire alarm went off for 20 minutes at 11:30pm, and the other residents seemed unconcerned leading one to believe that may be a common occurrence.

Overall the home worked well for our stay, but the finishing touches of the home were not great. The home was mostly clean, but feels like a college dorm. The refrigerator worked well but was missing shelves with tubing for the water dispenser coiled inside and the light had no cover. The bedding was ok, but some beds lacked warm blankets and one had to search for the better pillows to sleep with (there were many pillows).

If you get a good deal this place will work for your stay in Austin, but I would recommend looking elsewhere.

The location of the apartment was great! West campus, near UT and near downtown. The apartment decor is new and very pretty. The host was great at communicating and responding promptly, although most of our issues were not resolved during our stay. That being said, the apartment building is a little bit older and it needs maintenance (hole in the hallway ceiling). The elevator was out of service and the apartment was on the fifth floor so we had to carry our suitcases up and down five flights of stairs, and one of the guests in my group is pregnant so it was difficult for her to walk up and down the five flights every time we left the apartment. The apartment itself seems to have been out of use for a while before our arrival. The bathrooms were generally clean but the tub and shower were very dusty (probably due to lack of use and not being cleaned for some time before our arrival). There was no coffee pot, even though the host had provided complimentary coffee. The parking passes that had been mentioned were not provided. We notified the host and he could not get us new ones during our weekend stay, although he did offer to pay for our pay to park costs, but it was very inconvenient to find street parking in west campus.

The location was very central to where we needed to be which was great. There‚Äôs a 24 hour convenience store just a 5 minute walk. But unfortunately the Airbnb was extremely dirty when we arrived. As if it hadn‚Äôt been cleaned. That was our biggest issue. Otherwise the Airbnb looks pretty much as advertised!
Excelente estancia que cumple con los descrito y anunciado en su departamento.  Nos volver√≠amos a hospedar aqu√≠ sin problema

The host was absent. The host didn't respond fast at all, took hours to respond. The place was dirty and the instructions were very unclear how to get into the house. Once we got into the house we couldn't find what room was ours. Every room in the house was dirty and trashed.
This hoe was nad ass I‚Äôll be coming back

The apartment was clean and in a good location. The host was very responsive.

The entrance to the apartment was made through the parking place and sometimes it was noisy as it was on the ground floor and we could hear engine motors.

We had problems with the heating system, and the host provided 2 heaters until the maintenance team managed to fix it after almost 1 week.

I would have appreciated more flexibility in check-out hours, but unfortunately, I had to pay for one more night to do a late check-out.

The host mentioned that they will offer a discount for our next booking.

really nice place in east austin. unfortunately my place was filled with mosquitos and I killed 20 within the first two hours I was there. while that was irritating what got me was seeing the wasp/hornet in the window. i was offered another room in the complex which had less mosquitos but there was a dead roach in the corner.
