I feel bad for leaving a review like this but I am not an insect person at all. I left after a 2 hour stay.

The place has everything that is needed for long/short stays.
However, it might be not really comfortable to work from there if planned.

- the walls are really thin
+- space for 1 person (2 if it‚Äôs a short stay)
+ close to airport and not too far away from downtown
+ has all essentials

The house was clean and can accommodate 8 adults comfortably. The house is located in a nice neighborhood and is close to the city where the restaurants and bars are. We ubered for the most part, but can also rent scooters/bikes and walk via the river walk to access different parts of the city.

The pool was broken and unkept when we arrived. The water level was extremely low and it had not been cleaned. Additionally, the water filter attached to the fridge did not work.

Lastly, ensure your listing on Airbnb matches the listing you receive in the confirmation email from Vacasa Texas. We thought we were staying in a different house with a different location due to a glitch between Airbnb and Vacasa Texas‚Äôs systems.

Apartment was like description and the complex is conveniently located. Host was responsive but not accountable.

We had some plumbing problems at the apartment and while the response was quick, no remediate was offered after 4 hours with no water and loud pipes in the bathroom. Being in town for just 36 hours for a wedding and having no water was highly anxiety provoking. We were never told that the water was back on and the hosts never offered to help with anything. I assume it is because they have over 60 rentals in the area and so their management is spread thin (which is not the customers problem). The instructions said they lived next door so it was weird that no one stopped by‚Ä¶

Things happen but how a ‚Äúfamily business‚Äù addresses a crisis like no water & pipes gurgling 24/7 their property says a lot. I reached out to them before leaving this review to see if they would acknowledge my concerns and they were not for me, but hopefully they will for the next guests.
The place has potential but kitchen smelled like pee left dirty towel on the floor pillows were on the floor 3 bedroom with only one bed and the pullout mattress was lumpy and thin

The loft is in a good location.
The loft was fine.
In that regard I had no issues.
The big negative was how the host responded to the power grid failure and our concerns.
While Texas was going through a massive power grid failure, we asked to move our dates, not for a refund.
The host denied our request.
Considering the magnitude of the crisis, we felt our concerns were ignored simply for not wanting to lose out on their money. FYI all hotels were offering full refunds.
Also there‚Äôs one entrance to come into the complex which just happens to be next to the garbage area which was overflowing with massive amounts of garbage. Not the best way to enter into the property.

Stayed with my mom to explore Austin.

Pros
-location is close to everything
-large space several beds and spacious
-easy access
-good views

Cons
-space was not cleaned well. the carpet had confetti likely from last visitor, random clothes in the drawers, hair in the shower and on one of our pillows
-floors had our socks dirty & black
-every night between 12-2 am people (likely homeless) were screaming bloody murder.
-first floor unit and tenants above are very loud
-I didn‚Äôt think to post this but after reading other reviews cleanliness has been a recurring issue. Overall the place wasn‚Äôt bad just something to know.

To add I felt like the fees for not complying with the rules like not taking out the trash and the fee involved is extreme if the place isn‚Äôt up to standard with basic vacuuming and cleaning sheets/showers.
the location for this place is unmatched!

We found the property to be acceptable, but disagree with other reviewers that it is in a quiet neighborhood. A divided, 4 lane highway is less than 100‚Äô from the house. We like dogs, but not when they bark randomly at all hours. The location is somewhat convenient to Austin and the airport, but the neighborhood is located in mostly open industrial property with limited local stores and restaurants. Mostly those around the airport.
Dylan was a terrific host who accommodated us with every request that we had. The house is nice and near the end of a quiet street which has a dead end with no through traffic which was a plus.
Quite dead-end street with no thru traffic; beds were comfy and the water was hot. Communication was stellar with the hosts.
Our stay was ok. The host wouldn't respond to our texts. There were cobwebs everywhere with spiders hanging down, and it was very noisy.
Everything you need for a short term rental. The kitchen was fully stocked. Only issue was that the area is not the greatest but the property is gated.
Think hard about this location in an industrial park, the proximity of homeless, and the new management getting the kinks out.  Finally, to some of us, appears over priced.
Nice place in the country. Very clean. It did feel a little weird not to have any blinds or curtains. There is a TV with Roku but no wifi so it was unusable for us.

Super disappointed with the cleanliness of the location.  Unclean towels (white towels that were actually grey), washcloths (looked someone had used it but it had been folded up - lots of dirt and make up on it), food debris on the side of the refrigerator, long, black, wavy hair all over the apartment and someone else's blood on the bed comforter - gross!  The overwhelming smell of the glade plug-in gave us headaches.

The only good I have to say about my stay at this Airbnb is that there was a bed and the water was hot. I honestly didn't enjoy my stay due to the foul smell and damp condition of the room.   Upon walking into the room I was hit with such a foul stench that smelled of dog piss, humid basement, mold and a mixture of some freshener trying to cover up the smell. I stayed for 5 nights and my clothes felt damp as did the bed sheets. My clothes also absorbed this foul smell. I tried leaving the bathroom fan on as well as keeping the fan and AC on in the room. This place needs a dehumidifier, badly! The towels did not smell very fresh and smelled like wet dirty mop. I was so disappointed because the studio looks simple and clean per the pictures. Also, for the cleaning fee that they are charging, I would expect the host to at the very least, take out the trash. I had to walk all the way to the opposite end of the building and take out my own trash. I honestly hated coming back at the end of the night due to that foul moldy smell and damp bedsheets. I tried to leave the door open for a few minutes a day in order to air out the foul smell and get rid of some of the moisture in the air.  I suppose it's true. You get what you pay for. After this experience, I will honestly think twice about booking another Airbnb in the future.

For the couple positive things, whoever did decor and selected the beds did a great job. Awesome beds and decor was adorable even though whoever did their photos should be paid double cause it made the place look twice the size it actually was.

This is far from a 5 star stay for a few reasons, but mainly lack of communication overall. Especially with no phone to call or text when there are issues. The gate codes did not work when we arrived (only the car code which we had to use all weekend since there was never a response to that issue or wasn‚Äôt even acknowledged that I asked the question). Then one of our doors the keypad didn‚Äôt work so we were locked out until a cleaning lady helped us get into the lock box for the spare physical key. Wasn‚Äôt till 4 hours later they responded through the app saying ‚Äúthat happens sometimes, use this key‚Ä¶‚Äù.

Then we had a terrible ceiling leak from something flooding above us that ruined our bathroom I also received a late response with little info, no apology, and no resolution. It took all of our towels to clean up with no replacement or response about this issue.

These, along with some other misleading notes about how this is walking (CAN NOT walk to 6th or Rainey, is it very sketchy with a homeless camp you have to pass that is under the highway) - makes this place too much for its high cost. Cute and adorable, but management/communication needs to be fixed.

I guess we were the first long-term stay guests in this place so few things make this place not the best place for a long-term stay. There is a rule about "not accepting mail" so that guests cannot accept any mail including online shopping packages(amazon,eBay, etc.). This is really inconvenient if you considering a long-term stay just be aware of that.  We had learned this rule just before check-in. Also, as listed there is no washer/dryer and the closest laundromat is not in good condition. House is close to Target and HEB  and located in a residential quiet neighborhood, approx 25 mins (without traffic) to the downtown area.  The pictures are very representative of the place. Hosts are responsive.
Location couldn't be better! Great unit, everything we needed!
The location was perfect. Everything worked out as expected and the listing was accurate. Just know it is in a large apartment complex but there were no issues with that

The unit is located right on South Congress Avenue.  Be careful pulling in and out of the entrance or your bumper will scrape. The unit is a decent space but as others have commented it's pretty empty.  Unfortunately the unit wasn't cleaned very well - the shower curtain was moldy and upon entering had an overpowering bleach smell.
Nothing fancy but good location and listing was as described

PRIVACY VIOLATION. The host had someone enter the unit without our knowledge/permission/consent while we were out of the place. All of our belongings and electronics were open and lying around the unit because we thought it was a private unit. Whoever came in could have tampered with our items or copied our hard drives and we'd have no way of knowing. This is a major privacy issue and the host did nothing other than "Sorry for the inconvenience."

And to top things off, the HEATING WAS BROKEN IN THE WINTER until the host provided us a space heater.

Made the mistake of being way too nice about some really terrible things that went wrong during our stay. Toilet was broken upon arrival, Alex was very responsive about getting it fixed the next day, which I appreciated. However, the fix didnt work, and based on a previous review i can see that this is an ongoing problem that isnt a clog but is being neglected. Much like the rest of the apartment. No bedding on one of the beds and no extras anywhere. I told them i would be okay until the next day as it was a little warm in Austin that day but it would have been great if they remedied this right away. Again, i was too nice. Other things to note - general cleanliness is bad, couch is broken, fixtures falling off the walls, very dusty and standing water in the shower. And in regards to the shower - hot water did not exist in this home. It got luke warm at best. Again, i was too nice. I didnt want to spend my vacation complaining about the air bnb so chose to address it as soon as I got home, which was a mistake. Dont be like me! Take pictures and document!

Upon requesting a partial refund for no bedding, no working toilet and no hot water, i was accused of being threatening and blackmailing. Use caution when booking. It doesnt bring me joy writing this review but this has been a nightmare.

Really good location though‚Ä¶ and i hope this encourages them to actually follow the standards of all of the amazing air bnbs ive stayed at in the past and take the complaints seriously.

Immaculate house nestled 25 minutes from downtown Austin. The amenities of this vacation home make it hard to leave the backyard with a full pool and spa combo. Not to mention the Traeger grill/smoker and outdoor TV on the patio.

The hosts were extremely quick to respond to any questions we had and made the whole trip very smooth. 10 out of 10 would stay here again.

We arrived to a dirty house and that really got our vacation off on the wrong foot. They sent out a house cleaner within two hours, but that really messed with our itinerary. The house is really far from Austin proper. The host was very communicative and nice.

Correspondence with hosts was a highlight. The pool table was virtually unusable due to sticks being broken by previous tenants. It was also a little frustrating not having directions to amenities on hand

Good location but still need to Uber most places. The washer and dryer do not work well, also no detergent was supplied. Low stock of toilet paper and cleaning products, needed to buy our own. Otherwise, it was a good place to stay if you‚Äôre not looking for anything fancy.

There are numerous things that made this airbnb feel unsafe. We only stayed there four hours. The owner who lives in a portion of the lower level of the house could gain access any time he wanted to the airbnb side of the house through two deadbolt locks which he controlled the key side of. He had also installed deadbolt locks on the outside of the bedroom doors. The entry to the airbnb was not through the front door, you had to walk along an uneven dirt path along the side of the house. The dirt path was not well lit. The key to the airbnb was not in a lock box but behind some bushes on top of a electric panel. There were dead cockroaches underneath the kitchen floor trim. Other notes. Three is no living room in the airbnb, only a kitchen and dining area on the first floor and three bedrooms upstairs with a wood deck. The only place to sit downstairs was on some stools around a hightop dining table. The floors and sink in the kitchen were dirty. After we left we explained some concerns with the owner and requested a refund but he refused. We sent the information to airbnb. They agreed it that it seemed unsafe and they refunded our two week stay payment.

Great location if you need to be in this area, and plenty of room for a family of four. Unfortunately the place was not cleaned well for our stay, and had a very offensive odor that was present for our entire stay. Not sure if this is typical for this property, but something to keep in mind before you book a stay.
Kinda dirty and the area is a bit ghetto.
NEEDS TO UPDATE DECOR OLD LAKE HOUSE AND NEEDS TO ADD CLEANING SUPPLY TO HOUSE. THE MASTERROOM HAD A BAD SMELL LIKE SEWER. AND MY REFRIGERTOR LEAK BROWN WATER. OTHER THAT THE LOCATION WAS PEACEFUL.

Overall the place is exactly as described in the listing. It is a no frills place. Small, and not well maintained. The shower is exactly as listed. There is dust on the majority of the furnishings, baseboards, hanging picture. The bathroom mirror was water spotted so much so you couldn't see yourself. The toilet seat was very loose and the light in the shower would turn on and off on its own. Also, plan to bring a wash clothe or some other item of your preference as one is not provided. There are plenty of towels which was great.
Absolute scam. Safety concern ladies. Arrived to the property and the lockbox was open, key exposed, door locked and unable to enter. Was not able to enter or stay.

It was okay just weird that it was obviously a hotel type place but we couldn‚Äôt check in we just had to get the key that was hanging on the door. It was also really small for the price range and there was way too much noise outside with construction that was not mentioned. Not really worth the price to me

Very nicely decorated. Beautiful kitchen.

We had 5 guests, but we were originally only provided 4 towels. I texted the host to get more delivered. The second day there 2 more were delivered (6 total). The day we were checking out, they finally delivered the rest. 6 towels for 5 guests is not ideal for a 4 day stay, especially when guests could potentially be doing activities and need to take multiple showers.

Master bedroom bed dips in the middle, very uncomfortable sleep.

Also, misleading to say you had a stationary bike.

Don't just show a picture at the end of several photos showing the damage to your house.   Put information in text explaining the situation so people will look for the photo and see what you mean.  You also were unfriendly on the call and should have considered that someone might still be uncomfortably when at the house no matter how nice the bedroom looked inside.  I still felt the damage on the outside of house could make it unsafe.  You should fix the house damage completely before you start hosting again.  I felt like you slighted me be keeping  all the money.  A half way point would have increased my rating of you.

Don‚Äôt let the cat photo fool you. I been staying at Airbnb‚Äòs for over 5 years and never experienced a place like this. You can NOT get a refund a minute after you check in because I tried. The unfriendly host Adams said Id be refunded for the last 2 nights, which did not happen. Good luck to anyone that gets stuck here.

Curb appeal very low. Room and bathroom were clean and adequate - but unfortunately bed only had sheets and no towels were supplied. After booking i was informed i needed to supply my own towel and blanket. So i slept very little and left without a shower. I would suggest owner spend a few bucks on a blanket and towel before posting this again. Also might want to get rid of the junk car in front and consider revising the curb appeal.
If blanket and towel provided would give 3 stars.

We were disappointed in this home
Three girls traveling together for over 20 years. Visiting Austin for 3 nights. We usually have a fourth but she had something come up at last minute. The listing shows a room with twin beds. This was one of the reasons we selected the property. The room had one bed. If our fourth was able to make the trip this would have been an issue. One bedroom had no nightstand or lamp. Other reviews said super clean. This was another reason we selected this property. There was a dead roach in master bedroom. The backyard was not awesome. The chairs were very dirty so we could not enjoy the yard. The towels were old and thin. Both bathrooms had one washcloth and no hand towel. There wasn‚Äôt a hair dryer as listed but as soon as I contacted Pam she brought one over.
We did not find this home warm and welcoming as we have with other Airbnbs.

Positive:
- The place is clean
- Priscilla allowed me to check in the luggage early before the check in time at 3pm.

Negative:
- No microwave
- Dining table is not for share, remember to check "Guest Access" section of the listing. I wasn't allowed to use the dining table to work on my laptop when no one is using it and was told "It's not a desk; it's my dining room table. As I mentioned, it is not included in the listing, and therefore a house rule. I'd appreciate you respecting the house rules." I found it strange her response very cold. I am also a host (in California). My guest is working remotely so he is using the dining table to work every day to have a change of scenery, sometimes leaving his monitor on it. I never felt it was a problem.

I chose this place due to the proximity to work and because the complex had a pool. Unfortunately due to my schedule I wasn‚Äôt able to enjoy the pool. The kitchen was also a selling point since I was planning to be there for several days. The bed itself was comfortable but the bed frame was very rickety. The kitchen was fully stocked. The room location was unfortunate due to a noisy neighbor and the a/c was loud when trying to watch TV. The only person I ever saw/heard was the noisy neighbor. The complex was gated and parking was always available near the unit.

Airbnb review

BEWARE; These studio rooms are in rougher neighborhood along the I -35 corridor. When we arrived the bed was only a double, not a queen as advertised. The bed frame was so bent and broken that we were unable to sleep. Cockroach‚Äôs were found in the morning and we left without returning. Airbnb canceled our remaining nights and gave us a full refund.

SDO! NOT! STAY! HERE! INFESTED WITH BUGS! This was the ABSOLUTE worst airbnb experience I've ever had. To start it off our stay was originally scheduled for February of 21 when the large ice storm that affected much of the southern US hit. We reached out asking to reschedule after our area had received so much snowfall that we physically couldn't get our cars out of our homes. The host informed us that this was not an option and there was nothing he could do. Then just a few days before our stay he reached out saying that the plumbing at the stay was out due to the storm so we would need to reschedule. So, we were expected to be flexible and understanding of his situation after he was neither in our situation. We rescheduled and initially upon showing up things seemed to be okay... for the first five minutes. The pictures you see on the website are extremely misleading. Upon arriving the house is tucked behind a shack...literally ready to fall down. The whole thing is dirty and run down, one of the bathroom doors is only secured with a rubber band, and there was a lamp on the wall hanging by a thread that fell off the moment we touched it to make sure it was secure. There is a dog out back that barks all night every night and multiple nights in a row we heard gunshots just down the street. Then on our second morning shortly after waking up we walked into one of the bathrooms to find a SWARM of TERMITES flying around and a huge dead roach under the bed. We immediately tried to message and call the host several times with no response. We then received a call from someone else saying they were with a realty company so we explained to them the issue and they said that someone would be coming right out. We had plans for the day and no longer felt comfortable being in the home so we went about our day. We got back hours later to find that no one had in fact been out and the termites were still in the home. We then called the host back with still no direct answer. The same realty company called back saying that since it was a Sunday no one would be able to come until the next day. They genuinely had no issue allowing their guests to stay in a termite infested home for a full day. We then reached out to airbnb themselves to hopefully get some help which didn't go any better. After a phone call with an airbnb representative explaining the situation they said to give them 15 minutes and they would set up hotel accommodations. 30 minutes later I still hadn't heard anything so I called back and all I was told was that I would get a call back soon. Well a few hours and another call to airbnb later with the same " We're so sorry to hear about your experience, a " SUPPORT AMBASSADOR" will be reaching out to you shortly". What a joke!
No one reached out whatsoever, least of a SUPPORT AMBASSADOR! Apparently, airbnb also deemed it acceptable to leave us in the bug infested home for the night. It's shocking that a company the size of airbnb has no contingency plan for true emergencies. So, you're on your own folks if you are ever in need. We ended our trip a day early, but the whole experience made us miserable and completely destroyed our trip. We did get a full refund, which was the least they could do after the fact. I can not stress enough how strongly I would advise someone against staying here, it was an absolute waste of a trip.

This property mis-represented, old and smelly.  It is no oasis that was portrayed in the ad.  I opened the door from an ALLEY entrance walked through with the agent on the phone and immediately cancelled.  This was not the   property for my family.
Good place all around but beware of gnat and mosquito problem. If that doesn‚Äôt bother you then this is an A+

It‚Äôs okay. The house is down some alley you have to find. Not a big deal but then you walk into the house and it‚Äôs like one of those bad flipped homes. The bathroom had ants. We found a roach in the kitchen that got away. They‚Äôre growing bamboo in the back yard so there are water troughs of standing water with the bamboo. That‚Äôs why you‚Äôll see people complain about the mosquitoes. We couldn‚Äôt even be in the hot tub because the mosquitoes were so bad. The location was good. The house is very hot and I‚Äôm from actual south Texas. They have a nest so they can control your ac from their phone. Every time we turned the ac colder, they would turn it back up. This isn‚Äôt the worst house ever but I have no idea how they justify charging this much. Check is was quick and easy.

We‚Äôve had several problems with this Airbnb and feel that the pictures and description didn‚Äôt portray what this Airbnb actually is like.

Here are the issues:
The address wasn‚Äôt clear. Finally went down an alley way. On the way saw a homeless man right outside our house sleeping in an abandoned house right outside. The front door locks but is very wiggly and does not feel safe. The door frame looks like it‚Äôs been broken into and the the door doesn‚Äôt quite fit in the frame.

The blinds are all busted in the main bedroom.
The smell outside and inside smells musty and old.

One of the ‚Äúbedrooms‚Äù and the toilet is literally right by the front door. The main bedroom does not have easy access to a bathroom. And it‚Äôs right in front of a dryer. You barely are able to put your legs in front of you and I‚Äôm fairly small. If I were bigger I‚Äôd have to sit on the toilet from the side. Was never shown in pictures.

Bed is like sleeping on a hard wood slat and makes noise every time you move. The person in the opposite room can hear everything.

When you flush the toilet it sounds like a freight ship the size of titanic is coming into port. The house shakes and there‚Äôs a very loud horn.

Dogs barking kept us up all night.

Shower is freezing cold and has hair all over the shampoo bottle.

Mainly do not feel safe due to the front door/area.

DO NOT STAY HERE! DIRTY AND VERY MISLEADING PHOTOS!

The entrance to the 'property' is down an alley behind a abandoned falling down home. The property itself is a garage converted into a janky property.

The overall conditions of the property were horrible, falling apart and dirty.

We refused to stay here because of the conditions of the property. Owner refused to refund money and we had to go through Airbnb support to receive a refund.
Decent value, but very small and shower water pressure is awful. Good location in east Austin and seamless check in.
Shower dripped, table in living room was unstable, smelt bad, awkward location.

Location was perfect!

Otherwise, horrible communication with host. They reply very late and appear to be frustrated communicating. I have called the number listed to ask how to get into the property. The address listed isn‚Äôt the exact location. Instead, you have to turn right on the next street and enter through an alley. Host never picked up my phone call and that delayed my entrance with the family into the property for about 35 minutes.

Place was not clean at all and I have pictures proving that. There were also cockroaches inside the property.

The backyard lights were not functioning and floor and patio furniture were dirty and old.

I have communicated this to the host and when they replied they did not want to call me back and gave instructions to use one of the houses lamps and put outside.

Very disappointing for a business that is well located near downtown Austin.

The location was great and was within walking distance to excellent restaurants. The photos of the home, however were misleading. The house is not well maintained (the skylight leaked considerably while it rained). The bathroom and kitchen sink both had unpleasant odors. The door to one of the bathrooms doesn‚Äôt close properly and the toilet is so close to the washing machine that there is no room to sit down. One of the king size beds is right next to the front door, which is not well sealed. There is a considerable gap between the door and the molding, which made us feel like the house wasn‚Äôt very secure. The outside of the house is also not well maintained. There were so many mosquitoes in the back that we couldn‚Äôt sit outside for more than a few minutes. Overall, we did not feel like the price of the house accurately reflected the quality and we would not stay here again.

Duplex is at the end of a very congested street, it was quiet on a weekday. Kitchen window had no curtains and the glass double door  looking at the street had no curtains. Beds where very thin hard mattress and even harder pillows. Thankfully they had extra sheets to cover the windows! Bring your own tv/ entertainment, the tv does not have anything except a blue screen! It was supposed to be able to chrome cast with no directions! Over priced for the area and no entertainment!

Pretty awful experience. Arrived early evening on Christmas eve. We planned on cooking because everything would be closed/ limited hours Christmas eve/day. After going grocery shopping we unloaded everything. I bought some cooking supplies because Mark‚Äôs kitchen is limited. The bed had no blanket or comforter. I mentioned this to Mark, he immediately became combative. He told me to use a space heater if we got cold. We went back and forth, and he finally told me that if I went to buy one, he would reimburse me. Later he told me his cleaning people took the blanket home with them for cleaning and would bring it on Christmas. The next day a man brought us a very used, thin blanket. The apartment has a washer and dryer, why did the cleaner take it home? In addition to the blanket incident, we only had one small towel to share and the place was very dusty. I don‚Äôt think it has a ventilation system. We were unable to watch anything on the TV‚Äôs because its controlled by an alexia app.
Nice location in the nature, not to far from the city. The apartment was not super clean, but it was very specious. No self check in, so if you get in late that might be a problem.

We booked four days at this location to hopefully spend some much-needed, relaxing and quiet family time. First, I will say the property was beautiful and well-equipped at first glance. The beds were comfortable and house was clean.

That said, we did experience a lack of hot water during our stay, which was uncomfortable for all guests, including our 2-year-old. We were four adults and a toddler.

One of the adults in our party travels with a service animal and though the property description says pets are not allowed, we reached out to the owner before arrival and he was very accommodating in permitting us to bring the dog with us after providing him with the reason for the service animal's support.

On the second day of our stay though, we experienced very poor customer service and behavior from the property manager and owner that we are still very much confused about as we were having a pleasant stay up until that point.

As we were getting ready to leave for lunch, the fire alarm went off due to vapor from a hair dryer. The property manager texted and asked if everything was okay, and we said yes and shared the reason for the alarm. Furthermore, the service animal‚Äôs owner decided he felt well enough that day to leave the dog at home while we stepped out for a quick lunch (took medical precautions) and he left the dog in the bathroom in order to ensure the dog did not jump on the furniture while alone, as requested by the property owner, though the dog is well trainer and does not not show that type of behavior.

We assume the property owner stepped by to check on the house (his house‚Äôs guest house) as we received a text that the dog was barking, but the dog is trained to only alert when someone is at the door. In addition, the front door was unlocked, which we very clearly made sure to lock before heading out. He asked that we come get the dog and we immediately did so to ensure the owner was not uncomfortable with the situation.

We later arrived and noticed there was still no hot water. We asked for help and were met with false accusations of breaking many house rules and a lack of support with utilities from the property manager saying she ‚Äúcould call a plumber but it would take a week.‚Äù She mentioned the owner ‚Äúknew‚Äù we were smoking in the home, which was entirely false, and that he could ‚Äúsee‚Äù we had many people with us, which again, we were 4 adults and a toddler (house accommodates 6). She said they were confused because we never told them how many people were staying nor who each person was, which in past experience with Airbnb‚Äôs those details have never been needed as long as our group is within the number of people allowed. The property manager would not answer our calls and instead texted us not to contact the owner as she was ‚Äútrying to calm him down and help us‚Äù when we are not exactly sure what the concern was nor needed any help outside of getting hot water.

We asked if she could tell us which house rules the owner thought we broke, but to this day have not received a clear answer. We did not appreciate being falsely accused of smoking in the home, breaking numerous house rules nor lying to the owner, as we did no such thing. To make matters worse, when asking for help with the water heater, the response received was much along the lines of ‚Äúyou have broken many house rules. I can call a plumber but it will take a week. If you have other suggestions, let me know‚Äù. This atrocity of a response and lack of willingness to help, on top of the false accusations and overall harassment we felt, ultimately pushed us to leave Austin early and cancel our last night at the property.

I would not recommend this location to anyone due to the poor management, lack of customer service and uncomfortable situation we were pushed into by the owner without any explanation or willingness to discuss with us directly.

Host genuinely tried to charge me $5,000 for paint that was chipping, as if I chipped the paint, and as if white primer cost $5,000 to "repair". So be careful, take photos before and after if you decide to risk coming here.

This place is pretty small. It's tiny honestly. You won't be able to stand up in most places, and be careful with your head going through doors. This place is a "no more than 3-day visit" place.

Amenities are not available to any guest. The staircase is also dangerous. It's very narrow, and they literally built a staircase that they had to put warning signs on. There are actual warning signs on the stairs. The mattress is a thin foam mattress on a wooden pallet a couple inches off the ground.

Also, you share the bathroom. It's impossible to keep it dry. And the walls are thin, so you hear everything. Everything. You'll have zero privacy.

I didn't want leave too terrible of a review with the 3 stars. We'll see if/how the host rates me now.

I really hate leaving bad reviews. it's bad for Airbnb overall. With this in mind, I felt leaving this review is in everyone's benefit. I definitely like Airbnb. I've only taken a few trips now and this was my first "bad" and scary experience. It's not pleasant when you see a message that a host is essentially trying to scam me. Case in point, they also attempted to charge me $25 for clothes hangers. If i accidentally took one or two, I'm very sorry, however, it's not a $25 expense... Let alone something to chase down a guest?

The bathroom is absolutely covered in hair. I don't know if the person on the other side of the very thin dividing wall was another guest or a resident, but he/she left the already disgusting bathroom with puddles of water on the ground and sink. The room had several spiders and is more of a large closet as opposed to a guest room. A note for people unfamiliar with the area is that there are train tracks running between the bnb and South Lamar, so it is a long walk south to get to a crossing (Alamo Drafthouse takes 25 mins to walk to). Still less expensive than some other bnbs around, but owner will not give refunds for any reason as I found out during the pandemic when she kept my deposit despite state mandates shutting down my travel event weeks before my check-in date. Use caution and expect an unkempt living space with noisy neighbors that stay up late and wake up early.

The townhouse looked great in the photos, plus the reviews were good, but it's not actually that nice. There were a number of problems, and we ended up canceling our stay.  To begin with, it's not well maintained. The front door is slightly dirty, the entry light was not working, the closet door off one of the bedrooms was unhinged, the thermostat was falling off  the wall, one of the stairs was broken, and there were holes in one of the walls and doors. As a guest, this is annoying and time consuming because you have to document it and message the host to make sure you don't take the blame for it when you leave. In addition, the townhome is sparsely furnished and the appliances are incredibly cheap. The bedside lamps, for example, have a USB plug, but there is no USB port - I don't know how we were supposed to use them. The towels were made out of some weird microfiber material that I use to clean the kitchen, and there were no hand towels. There are no chairs besides the 2 barstools, pillows were pretty old and dirty. The host was very responsive and nice, but he couldn't attend to any of those items until the next day, so we canceled our stay as we did not feel it was worth the bother.  If you are not fussy, and just need a place to pass out, it's fine. But if you like comfort and a place where you can hang out, this is probably not the best place for you.

Stayed here for 2 months and didn't have any major issues. The Airbnb was extremely spacious, had very comfortable beds, and the host was quick to respond to any messages. Wifi is very fast and was able to support 2 people working from home with simultaneous video conference calling. The garage was a bit snug for our chevy suburban (and had an awkward lip you have to drive over) but there was plenty of street parking that we just opted not to use the garage.

Some smaller things to note: Google maps takes you to the wrong address one street over, which was confusing during check-in. Stove can be a bit finicky to turn on, and like most other Airbnbs, pots and pans were quite scratched so if you plan to cook a lot during your stay, consider bringing your own. We couldn't receive mail here as the host wasn't able to provide a mail key.

Overall would stay again.

Unfortunately, this airbnb was not what we expected at all. Firstly, when we arrived to check in (which was already about 30 minutes later than the check in time) we opened the door to the airbnb to find someone still cleaning the house and he let us know that the people before us had trashed it so much that not even the maid would clean it, and that the sheets were oily. We just waited around until he was eventually done cleaning, so we had a late check in and the host hadn‚Äôt ever let us know he was done cleaning. We just had to hope he was gone. Then the next day a maid unlocked our door and walked into the house. Very odd situation, especially since the host wasn‚Äôt keeping us updated on any of this. Also we were woken up Friday and Saturday nights because the neighbors were all outside until at least 3 AM and one of the nights there was a fight right outside of our window. Our uber driver even told us ‚ÄúOh y‚Äôall are staying in those crazy apartments‚Äù. So just beware when staying here that weekend nights may get rowdy. Garage and location were a plus but I would not book here in the future.
Amazing service but no washer & dryer was a bummer.
Make sure to tell Uber Driver's to use google maps or give specific instructions to use Hudson Bend.  We had some trouble with uber finding the house.
Very uncomfortable bed - seems worn out.

My husband and I thought that this residence was very disappointing. We arrived to find pee on the carpet, garbage left under the bed, and a bad odor within the casita. We were not provided any sheets on the bed either, just one blanket. The door handle to enter the casita broke off after 2 trips of bringing bags in from the car and there were lots of spiders inside. I cleaned the pee on the carpet with a carpet cleaner I had with me (we had a puppy with us, so I brought it just in case she had an accident). Because we were so uncomfortable here, we left the next day (way before our check-out date). Dominic messaged me asking why we left early and so I explained everything to him. He proceeded by blaming me for staining the carpet (I kept our puppy in the bathroom where there was tile floor) and sent me a $150 fee! VERY UNHAPPY WITH THE CASITA AND VERY UPSET WITH DOMINIC!

We stayed here for my bachelorette (16 people) and I feel like we had absolutely everything we needed!

-The living room/dining room is a little tight for 16 people to all move in comfortably, but all the bedrooms and other areas of the house were spacious.

-Greta was extremely communicative!

-There is a liquor store, gas station, juice bar, and restaurant/coffee right on the block.

The house is not located in the safest neighborhood and its on a very busy street. Would not walk alone ever in this location. In description of home it said there would be free/accessible street parking near the house (not in front of house). When we got to the home, there were signs that said we could not park there or we would get towed- not comforting so had to park in neighborhood across and walk across an extremely busy street. When we told property management team, they said they had never seen these signs before and would recommend we just park there and if we get a ticket to let them know.

When we got into the home, the AC was broken and registered at 81 degrees which it was 99 degrees outside. I contacted the property management team and they sent someone out to take a look. They told us the AC was broken and that we needed to call the property management team again which we did. After only being in the house 3 hours we were told we could get $1000 back and stay at another one of their properties. We paid about 6 times that for the house for 2 nights. I didn't feel comfortable staying at any of their other properties given the parking and AC situation therefore did not stay with them further. They refused to give us a full refund and instead just said we needed to contact Airbnb.

Airbnb handled the situation well and we did get a full refund, however I would not book with this property management company again - stay heirloom.
The AC broke for the second and third floors halfway through our stay, the sheets were filthy, the WiFi stopped working and the TV didn‚Äôt work.

The house was spacious with bedrooms and bathrooms on three levels. The water heater wasn‚Äôt sufficient for the number of people in our party so there was a complaint about cold showers. Everyone enjoyed the hot tub. For the cost of our accommodations the lack of hot water was disappointing.
Spacious place but the host has poor communication skills and messages at inappropriate times

As of the beginning August 2021, the pics are not accurate as shown on the listing. The cute bright red porch, is not cute anymore. Be aware that the drawers and closet are still stuffed full with the families belongings, so you can not "unpack" for your stay.

Dusty cobwebs line the ceilings.

3 windows were unlocked, if you are not from Austin, this can be unsettling for your family's safety. The host told me that none of the windows are capable of opening, which is not true. 2 of the 3 unlocked windows slid up with ease.

I booked this place for 3 days, we stayed the first night only because it was super late. We immediately left the next day and went to a hotel.

I contacted the host, and she did not understand what my problem was. quote

Freezer is full of food, unclean and a lot of crumbs.
Fridge still had food in it, however, there was room if we wanted to utilize it, but it was also dirty...so I wouldn't have used it anyways.

A container was left on counter that reeked of weed and had ashes in it.
Also many weed particles were found around the place.

Please DO NOT let the pics or description fool you. This place is terrible. I took many pictures of this place to compare to the pictures on the listing, I am more than happy to share.

Host refused any type of refund.
So I got screwed! Lesson learned.
"Superhost" ? not even close

The day of our booking, Elizabeth refused to host us because of the presence of a service animal in our party, regardless of the fact that Airbnb has an anti-discrimination policy requiring hosts to accommodate people with service animals. Elizabeth was also very rude and difficult to deal with. I do not recommend booking a stay with her, at any of her properties. You may very well be turned away at the last minute.

My stay was canceled when I was 5 minutes from arrival. I‚Äôd confirmed and been given the door code, so was completely blindsided. Then the cancelation was blamed on me. Don‚Äôt stay here, the host is unreliable.
The furniture is moved around upstairs so there is only one couch not two. There is no lake access in the area, because it is all private property.

The location of the Airbnb is a great location. The Airbnb itself needs lots of improvements both inside and outside. The Airbnb was not clean (trash from previous guests), very dusty, broken door knobs, broken shower, 1bed had no sheets or comforter. This was all very disappointing, especially since we booked the Airbnb for 4nights/5days. I was told by Mayra she would refund me the cleaning fee, but have not received it yet.
Not the best beds

Should've read reviews! House is very dated.. doesn't look anything like photos.
Mayra did respond to a few messages in a timely manor. Other message just went unanswered.
As for being clean, I was very disappointed. The walls have stains of food or spillage. A few dirty dishes in the cabinets.
Disappointing.
the house is not as it looks in photos pay extra for the pool and it was very dirty it is not worth the cost there are better places for the same or lesser price

I usually never have bad things or negative things to say about people at all but taking someone‚Äôs money is something crazy to do. First off my son was coming to Austin for a trip to begin his clothing career and network with people while with family and paid for this out of his pocket, didn‚Äôt think I needed to tell the host considering they would be understanding and refund the money. The host have a policy which I completely understand which is you have to cancel within 48 hours ( which i did ) and 14 days ahead but I booked the bnb 12 days before. So instead of taking all of HIS money why not work out a deal ? Have a cancellation fee rather than taking all of his money ???? What if it was your money or your child and someone refused to give them their money back ? I won‚Äôt sit here and bash and tell anyone else not to book or anything negative like that but don‚Äôt take peoples money.

Overall: Nice place, good location but really bad check-in experience

Pros: Clean and comfortable place, around 15-20 from downtown. Nice neighborhood with grocery stores nearby.
Cons: Check-in at 4pm... In our case, we asked to leave our luggage in the house (Not checking in, just leave the luggage) and the owner didn't accept. At the beginning he told us we can pay for an early check-in. Then, he changed of mind and told us that the check-in will be at 6pm because of cleaning reasons... We had to carry our suit-case all around Austin... It's unacceptable to do a check-in at 6pm... is losing the whole day!

I would not recommend staying here if you are wanting to be close to downtown. The neighborhood did not feel very safe and there are not many restaurants/attractions nearby. The house was also not cleaned well and some of the sheets/towels had not been washed upon our arrival. The kitchen has old utensils and cooking supplies.  The outside carport does not have much seating and was also run down. I did not find this house to be as advertised.

Would not recommend this house. The pictures are a lot better than the actual place. Work looks incomplete (mismatched paint). See through curtains in the bedroom (bedroom located in the front).
Some safety concerns- Did not feel safe with a see through front door. The courtyard doors do not lock, anyone can walk through the garage.
Lots of wasted space everywhere and small bedrooms. The master suite is set up very oddly with a small bedroom around the corner.
Also, not sure if they actually clean the sheets, I found a couple of toe nails in the sheets the first night I slept in the bed.

upon arrival the back house hadn‚Äôt been cleaned. It was dirty and the bed was soaking wet from previous tenants. Upon reaching out to Juno and the rest of the team they didn‚Äôt give me a solution or reason for this happening. I was met by the cleaning crew who stated no way would it be cleaned for our stay. I eventually got response from Juno & Micah where we cancelled our stay and we‚Äôre told we would receive a refund, we did eventually receive the refund over a week after chasing them up.
Micah the home owner was no help whatsoever and very rude when reached out to him. We then had to look for alternative accommodation for our stay and ended up costing us way more.

Unfortunately, I only stayed 1 of my 3 nights booked. When I arrived, there was a very strong musty smell and dead bugs were on the floor, couch and bed. The host agreed to take a look and clean this the next day when I would be away for meetings, however later the same night of my arrival I found the trash can under the sink still full from the previous guest snd hairs on the shower wall. The space was cute but dirty in my eyes. The host was  apologetic and refunded my last 2 nights.

We incurred a few problems during our stay there that we believe are worth informing other guests of:

1. The bathrooms don't get hot water for about 7-8 minutes as some of the previous reviews stated. If you shower you will not get hot water unless you waste 7-8 minutes of water.

2. The apartment has a bad smell that you can smell upon entering. Its likely due to the age of the building and that it hasn't been maintained.

3. the cleaning was not done. Our feet turned grey if we walked on the floor without shoes.

4. two out of 4 stoves were not working. They were missing tops and therefore not working.

5. At check in we couldn't open the door because the knob was broken
After trying for a good 10 minutes we got in but then we couldn't leave the apartment because we were afraid that we'd be locked out. The owner addressed and fixed the issue quickly but it was an unpleasant check-in experience not to be able to enter the place.

6. the queen bed in the guest bedroom had a broken frame. Each time we sat on the bed it made an odd sound. We informed the owner about these issues during our stay but nothing was done for the bed issue, lack of cleanliness and stove.

7. the apartment is much smaller than it appears in the photos and poorly maintained.

8. there were dead cockroaches outside the apartment door.

Overall, most of these issues were latent and couldn't be seen in the photos or listing. It is our opinion that this place should not be listed on Airbnb because of the poor condition and issues. Guests who check in at hotels are able to move to other rooms if they encounter problems but that is not the case with Airbnbs therefore this place shouldn't be listed.

-poor quality and highly priced.
- dirty fitted sheets for sofa bed.
No blanket and pillows for sofa bed.
- too much noise from other units and hallway and entrance gate.
- Everything old and low quality.
We don‚Äôt recommend it to anyone. Waste of money.

The pictures are a little misleading we were very underwhelmed by the size, the floors were dirty and the location is a little dodgy. The owners were wonderful though and were quick to get back with any issues

Nightmare. We had to cancel our dinner plans the first night because we could not get the door to lock for the first night, and the host was not helpful and gave us a bunch of false info. one of our guests was on crutches, and there were so many stairs even though the place says no stairs! They don't actually give you the gate number for the parking lot but instead a gate out back. Next to our front door was right where the entire apartment complex dumped their trash on the sidewalk outside our door. Terrible experience, and the pictures make it look a lot better than it is. there is a pool, but you don't get a pool pass with this stay.

I wish I could upload the pictures and video I took.  We had no hot water, the toilet seat was wabbly, they had missing tiles on the floor in the bathroom.  The side table was on its last legs it was also wabbly.  The apartment complex smelled of marijuana, and the parking lot on the side of the building literally had trash thrown around.  It felt very unsafe.  There were bars across the street.  Ames said I would get a small refund, untrue never did.

- Dirty: There‚Äôs hair all over the bed sheet, blanket, and even under the bed sheet (mattress cover). Since we checked in late, they had the cleaning crew change it up the next day when we were out. Same thing. Seems like they just put back the sheet that we took off (we replaced the bed sheet with something else that we borrowed our friend). One more thing: after the cleaning crew came, there were trash all over the front door area.
- No hot water: they only apologized and ignored our next message. We still had to take a cold shower the next day.
- Bad communication: unlike a bunch of emails we received before the trip, they would just apologize (both times as mentioned above) and when we asked further, they would just ignore our message and still send some more unnecessary message about a completely different topic.
Will not return and do not recommend.

Nuestra estancia fue una decepci√≥n!
Cosas buenas del alojamiento:
*Limpieza
*Amplia variedad de utensilios de cocina
*La ubicaci√≥n del departamento es buena, es accesible a varios lugares tur√≠sticos
Cosas malas del alojamiento
*Si buscas descansar, este no es el lugar indicado, los vecinos son extremadamente ruidosos durante la noche y madrugada, una de las camas hace demasiado ruido por lo que evitas moverte para no provocar el mismo, mientras la otra cama se sum√≠a mucho al dormir provocando una posici√≥n inc√≥moda.
*Si buscas ba√±arte con agua caliente, este no es el lugar indicado, batallamos mucho con el agua y para que saliera tenias que dejarla corriendo por mucho tiempo para que saliera.
*Como es un departamento pet friendly el olor que tiene el departamento no es agradable, parece que ni cuidan ese aspecto.
*El condominio es muy viejo y est√° descuidado
Very nice place few bugs rarely seen only thing I didn‚Äôt like is that hot water wasn‚Äôt working I tried to talk about it but got no response
We had a lovely weeklong stay here - peaceful cozy neighborhood, close to everything but far enough away from the chaos of central Austin!

After staying at tons of airbnbs, this is the first that really wasn't for me. I was on the road for several days and reached out mentioning i arrived early and wondering if i could drop a few things off and shower a bit before check-in. She said no and was fairly dismissive, which is totally reasonable as there are clear check-in times, however when I arrived there was no towel.. anywhere. There was no towel to shower and no hand towel that one would use after washing their hands. It wouldn't typically be a big deal but i did specifically mention I wanted to shower. There are also reviews saying they were made to use the outdoor shower, but her check-in instructions only mentioned where the bathroom was, not which shower to use. Given these shortcomings i had to go shower in a gym.
There were also incredibly strict instructions for mask wearing, hand sanitization, etc.. which I would be endorsing of (I'm a doctor that works exclusively with high risk patients) except her mandatory hand sanitizer is a tiny highly fragrant alcohol based spritz which would require about half the bottle to appropriately sterilize one's hands.
Lastly, her dog barked a good deal of the night which made sleeping challenging. None of these things alone would be huge deals but put together it made for a bad stay.
Between the dismissive communication, missing supplies, strict yet ineffective recommendations, barking dog, and unclear showering instructions I would just pay a little extra and go somewhere else.

A reasonable budget stay if you need to be in East Austin. It is recommended to bring earplugs if you're a light sleeper due to the loud street at night and the host getting up early. No white sheets if that bothers you. I recommended this to the host but no reply.

Es ist eine Unterkunft die alle Besorgnisse die man haben kann erf√ºllt. Man ist in kurzer Zeit fu√ül√§ufig am Fluss und mit dem Uber auch schnell in der Innenstadt. Ich kann die Wohnung nur empfehlen.

Both bathrooms had mold on shower curtain liners and a stain on the outside curtain.  One bathroom the door knob was falling off.  The shower heads are too low. ( unless you are 5ft 4 inches...! ) There was a throw blanket with crusty debris.  The neighboring patio, that you must walk by to get to unit, was FILLED with dog feces.  The cold water did not want to shut off in the first bathroom. There is not enough "amenities" for a group of two let alone if there were 4, i.e. silverware and plates. The garbage disposal had a spectacular water "display" when used.  Transient people were trying to get into cars and lurking around doorways at night.  The couch is in front of the patio door but that doesn't matter because the patio is overgrown with tall weeds.  There were no dishwasher pods to use as instructed and the garbage bag removal was impossible, no sure why. Oh, and the refrigerator door "bracket" was clearly broken completely in half.  I will say the bed was comfortable.

We planned to stay 3 nights but left early.  The furniture and bed were very comfortable but  the place needs serious maintenance before it should be rented out. Windows are very old and have not been cleaned in years, yard is overgrown with weeds, doors and bathroom curtains are stained, patio area is messy, neighbors patio is filled with dog poop that smells as you pass by, refrigerator door is broken, ceiling is strangely low in kitchen and bathrooms.  Unit has potential but needs to be fixed first - currently not worth the price relative to other offerings.

Not the best place if you want a quiet night sleep.  Fridge turns off and on for long periods of time and was louder than the AC.  Pretty disruptive for sleep.  Was not fixed even though host alerted , so no cooking for my stay

really unhappy with the unit. smelled awful, made me gag. I immediately asked to cancel upon arriving and was told it was too bad. very misleading images. I was not refunded and am very unhappy with how it was handled.

Inaccurate listing. NO laundry machine. It is in the motel complex, so bring your own laundry detergent and change.. and plan on waiting on your laundry instead of going to go fun things in town. Nitpicky owner will charge you if you don't clean, but will still charge you for the cleaning fee. You can get more for your money elsewhere.

Do not rent this unit. It smelled heavily of smoke upon arrival. We booked a hotel and immediately left. I sent several messages to the host letting them know we were leaving and wouldn't be staying in the apartment and what the issues were and heard nothing back from them. I have never had an issue with any Airbnb's before but this was quite a terrible one.
Quaint place. A/C unit needed the filter cleaned and was very loud but that's my only complaint.
This is a hotel with none of the benefits of a hotel and extra steps for check-out.

The apartment complex was definitely dingy. Apartment smelled like a faint cigarette smoke and REEKED of plug in air fresheners. We unplugged them and then the cigarette smoke become stronger. This was caused by the resident above we were pretty sure. Gross.

Lots of comments about the air conditioning being loud, valid but not my biggest concern. Kitchen had drawers that were damaged, handles were hanging off and broken.

The weirdest thing about this complex building was the stray cats. They'd try and come into the unit. I had my hands full one day bringing things in and left the door ajar and a cat ran inside and wouldn't come out. Definitely skeeved me out. Theres multiple of them at all times lingering.

I rarely leave reviews, but what truly compelled me to do so was the fact that our car got towed even with the parking pass inside the vehicle. The host was ZERO help and blamed the towing company (?). I am well aware the host wasnt onsite to call the towing company but he didnt even want to work with the building management to see who called the towing company to remove the vehicle. He said "we always take photos for proof" - but then wouldn't provide me photos to prove anything... We had the landyard in the vehicle and STILL had to drive to a tow yard 40 minutes away at 11:30 at night. Quick $300 fee that we had to eat.

I'd never stay here again based solely on that and wouldn't recommend it due to how unhelpful the host was. You may not have a towing issue - but it may be something else. Beware.


Like stray cats everywhere dingy.

When we came back from being out at 2am, Jon and his girlfriend were waiting outside our room. And when we walked in they left. It was do weird. Also, they way over communicate. It's very annoying. And the pet fee was not clear. I take my dogs everywhere and have never paid a pet fee with Airbnb.

THIS PLACE IS ABSOLUTELY FILTHY! I don't think it has ever been cleaned. Sleep 6 is a joke - there is one queen bed, one double bed, and a "sleeper" futon on that disgusting floor that is less than 5 feet long. Two smaller children can't even sleep there, so sleep 6 is a stretch. Army of homeless people nearby makes it difficult to walk anywhere.

This was my first time using Airbnb, from the pictures this place looks AWESOME and like a good value. Upon arrival we noticed the neighborhood was HORRIBLE! We walked in and it smelled like mold. The sofa (ACTUALLY A FUTON) was BROKEN on one side. We went upstairs and as soon as you get upstairs it goes from cool air to straight humidity! At the top of the stairs is a disgusting wet spot that never dried and was covered up by a cheap rug! We got into the rooms and they were very dirty, the entire place was dirty! There was dead bugs on the walls AND on the windows AND on the blinds. Everything was very cheap from the beds to the dining room table to the linens used! On our first night my sister found cups underneath her bed and a dead roach to the side of it! Nothing looks like it had been deep cleaned which is quite disappointing considering that we are still in a global pandemic! The bathrooms were also dirty, it was like the person before us left and all she did was make the bed! The room I personally stayed in was soooo squeaky I couldn‚Äôt even sleep, and that‚Äôs not me being dramatic! This place has a bug problem, it‚Äôs dirty I‚Äôm sure there‚Äôs black mold growing in the townhome, and the neighborhood is sooo ghetto! If I could give this place a negative review I would but I guess one star is going to have to suffice! I tried to cancel and the only thing I would get back would be $100 OUT OF ALMOST $500! Worst experience of my life and worst experience for my first time using AIRBNB. Someone should really make sure these places are at least CLEAN before allowing just anyone to rent their homes out.

Upfront communication was good BUT We cancelled our stay shortly after we walked in the door.  We were already skeptical of the neighborhood as it was rundown but pockets of well kept homes. Though it is in a older neighborhood the building was rundown and inside was dingy.  Difficult to figure out which unit to go into as all of the units look the same and the building numbers are hard to read and/or covered up with overgrown bushes.  In the parking area, there were what seemed to be an excessive amount of garbage cans randomly placed where there could have been more parking spaces. The beds were so squeaky just to sit.  We were debating if the couch would have been better to sleep on. There was very limited furniture and TVs were only in bedrooms.  Wish we would have taken pictures or video in hind-sight.

One of the amenities listed under 'Outdoor' are: Backyard- An open space on the property usually covered in grass and Outdoor furniture, but there is no backyard access and the outdoor furniture is one chair outside of the front door. Being a rental that is pet-friendly and advertises a backyard space, that was a big deciding factor in choosing this airbnb, so it was a let down. There was little to no hot water. We attempted to use the dryer to dry a t-shirt and even with the heat setting on high, the shirt was still damp after hours later. There was hair on the clean/put away towels, one of the bed comforters had some mildew on it, and one live roach was found in a bedroom.
It was VERY dirty. Hadn't been cleaned at all. Toilet was used and wouldn't flush. Bugs filled the light fixtures. We checked in and left 10 minutes later
No frills stay. Apartment had basic necessities.

The only reason I would stay in this place again is the area. Near a lot of things to do in downtown Austin. Shows a picture of Alamo drafthouse but that‚Äôs still a 10 min walk away. Bathroom door was broken so it wouldn‚Äôt close properly and since it was a barn door, it was heavy to move. The lamps were also broken and some lightbulbs were out. There was free parking but it did fill up at night.

Spent one night in the tent.  I think the only thing I would call out was that there was a shared bbq area and would have liked the tent to have its own?  But that didn‚Äôt really cause any problems for us.

They made it very uncomfortable they made one of my guests take a rapid covid test they did not allow music unless it was really really low in the house or in the backyard and there were no TVs not in the living room or in any of the two rooms. also if you do plan on staying there for three or more days and you take food you will not have any cabinet space so you would have to put everything on the counters and you only get one pan to cook with.
Amazing place!! Had a short trip with my family and it was nothing but wonderful! I am going to stay here again if I am ever in Austin!!

I was locked out of the Airbnb for 30+ minutes before I was let in because they gave me the wrong password. Sink in the bathroom doesn‚Äôt drain properly. Smoke detector is running out battery and beeps nonstop.

House rules: Take trash out, do dishes, leave place as clean as we can? I believe the cleaning fee we paid covers that? Place was ok. Needs more seating furniture in living room since there is only one couch, maybe a chair or table in bedroom since there is anything we can leave our backpacks or luggage  on but the floor. Apartment complex appearance is not the best but it was quite, neighbors upstairs, though were kind of loud so we couldn‚Äôt get a good night of sleep.

Before we even got there the information given was for 2 different apartments that they where subletting. We where sent to the wrong apartment only to be told to get out and go across to the other side inconveniencing the other guest staying in their own air bnb. The air condition barely worked and the floors where sinking in. When asked about parking they gave me little to no information before hand about visitor parking and where I was able to park, she sent me photos of 2 areas and I parked in both only to wake up on the third day with my car towed and wondering why it was towed when I parked in the area I was told to park in. I had to pay $228 to get my car back and now she is refusing to pay me back even though she didn‚Äôt give me accurate information.  I am completely dissatisfied and have never had a bad experience with air bnb like I did this weekend.

The place was clean and very organized. However the apartment is in a sketchy area and the roads and buildings seem to be falling apart. Beware of the animals in the walls that will wake you up between 3 to 6 AM. Would not recommend for the price. Keep in mind that the Wi-Fi username and password are not the same as the ones listed on the listing. Some parts of the floors are sinking and the check-in was kind of confusing.

Overall the apartment is alright, but totally over priced. The AC didn‚Äôt work for the first week and required multiple messages to get fixed. Offsite (paid) parking is a pain. The units are very loud all day and night as neighbors are similar transient Airbnb‚Äôs and short term rentals. The WiFi cuts in and out. It looks nice in the pictures, but starts to have issues as soon as you show up.

For a variety of reasons, I would not recommend staying in this house. First and foremost, you are not getting what you pay for, and having to pay for parking is a major inconvenience given what you are already paying for this location. My friends and I decided to come down to Austin from Dallas to celebrate and have a good time, but the fact that this house had so many problems didn't help. We didn't have a working toilet the entire time we were here, so imagine 6 different people sharing one toilet, and to top it off, one of the showers was broken. It was a major inconvenience for each and every one of us. As we arrived Friday evening, I emailed about the problem early Saturday morning and was told that someone would be out to fix it as soon as possible, but no one showed up all day Saturday. I then called to make sure they were aware of the urgency of the situation and was told that someone would be dispatched as soon as possible, but this was not the case. We went out for dinner around 10:30 p.m., and we still didn't have a working toilet. When I returned a little after midnight, they had finally arrived to fix it. About time, right? Unfortunately, we checked out early on Sunday morning, so we struggled with only one restroom for 6 people Friday night and all day Saturday. Finally, one of the showers was broken, and the sheets on the beds smelled and did not feel clean. So, after all of this, we would not advise you to stay here, but we do hope you have better luck than us if you decide to take your chances.

Don't stay here. This was perhaps the worst hotel / Airbnb I can remember.

Mint House has purchased a few units in a rental apartment building. We arrived at 11 PM and waited over half an hour to get into our unit. There was nobody on-site to help, and no instructions/directions either.

Looking lost at 11 PM in a parking garage, we asked other people, who said they had the same experience with Mint House.

The upstairs neighbours made tonnes of noise at 1 and 2 AM, and Mint House's only response was "those aren't our tenants" and that they could/would do nothing.

The heat in the unit didn't work. Neither did one of the showers. A note to the CEO went unanswered. It took more than 48 hours to have this resolved.

The kitchen stunk (plumbing problem). Mint House initially offered to charge us >$100 for a cleaning company to come and fix this (!?).

Mint House seems like a terrible experiment : "Hey, maybe we can compete with hotels by buying apartments and renting them out via Airbnb." Unfortunately, they have no sense of what is required to actually run a hotel/hospitality business.

Will never stay at a Mint House property again.

First, customer service was great! You guys responded in a very timely manner and were always helpful. The apartment was pretty confusing to find. Also, because we used Ubers for transportation, it was often difficult for our drivers to get in and out of the area. As far as cleanliness goes, upon arriving the floor was really sticky. Soon we realized the floor was SO dirty it was turning our feet and socks pitch black. We felt uncomfortable walking around without shoes on. There were also many things in the apartment that had a layer of dust on it. In addition, there weren't very many towels. There was only about one per person which typically people use two to shower. In the master bedroom, the bed frame was ridiculously squeaky you couldn't sit on the bed without making tons of noise. People staying in the other bedrooms complained that they could hear every time someone shifted in the night. With this, we could hear every single sound of the people outside and above us. The walls were so thin that we could hear clear conversations of the people next door.  Lastly, one of the beds broke on us. Two people were simply laying in the bed and all of a sudden, the boards below broke. The bed seemed to have plywood boards going the wrong way. They also didn't match the bed frame (they were black and the frame was very light brown) so we assumed it wasn't the proper set up which is why the bed broke. Overall, with the thin walls none of us slept well and with cleanliness and safety issues it was a disappointing stay for the price we paid.

Had a group of 6 friends visiting Austin for a much needed girls weekend. We booked the 3 bedroom unit in late November and had been excited to all be able to stay together.

2 weeks before our trip, I get a call from Mint House saying that they no longer have the 3 bedroom unit available and could offer us two 2 bedroom units that were next door to each other with a 15% discount, or we could cancel. They said the unit never should have been available on Airbnb to rent, and had no explanation for why I wasn‚Äôt notified sooner.

Upon check in, we found ourselves in one 2 bedroom unit and one 1 bedroom unit that were not next door. We had not been notified of this change prior to checkin and were not happy. They were able to switch us to two 2 bedroom units (in different parts of the property) and offer 25% discount, but ultimately our weekend was not the trip we had imagined as the group was separated.

The units were also very loud with thin walls & not as updated as the pics show.

This is a downright depressing place to stay. Avoid at all costs! In addition to the absolutely abysmal parking situation, which was disclosed, our assigned unit (#314) had the following awful features:

- The most basic, sparse furnishings with a dimly-lit cavernous feel.
- Really terrible water pressure.
- Heater didn't heat in the middle of a cold front.
- No coffee.
- No access to shared facilities until we had to request a keyfob which was not initially provided.
- The "toiletries galore" in the description consisted of shower gel and shampoo bottles that weren't full and ran out halfway through our two-person stay.
- The adjacent buildings (in the same complex) were deserted, boarded and overrun with trash and debris that makes the whole complex seem like a post-apocalyptic landscape. There is evidence of decay in the bricks and foundation of the building. The whole place feels deserted and unsafe. Utilities panels are broken, open and one was beeping for two days straight.
- There was a discarded bandage in our exterior entryway for our entire stay and it's probably still sitting there.

Buyer beware. Consider the many other options available in Austin and even in the SoCo area.

The apartment looked clean at first but the floors were so filthy that the bottoms of our feet turned black from walking around the rooms barefoot. There were old food wrappers and a blanket of dust under the beds. No extra blanket or pillows were provided for the pull out sofa. The bedrooms faced the parking garage so there was a lot of noise throughout the night.

Mint house was a nice place to stay for our family. You can‚Äôt beat the location, just steps to South Congress restaurants, bars and shops. Instructions were very confusing to find the unit. The unit itself was clean, but you can tell it‚Äôs poorly and cheaply constructed. There is a ton of noise from neighboring units and the entrance areas. Also the lights from outside are painfully bright even with the shades drawn. The complex itself was kind of crappy, with trash strewn about. Gym was fine.
Great stay, location, and neighborhood. The place was spotless and fit all of our needs. Highly recommend and have nothing but great things to say about our experience!

We were very much looking forward to our stay in this beautiful house, but our first impression was soured when we were greeted by a City of Austin Land Use Code Violation posted on the front door, stating that this property was being rented without a license to operate a short-term rental, and was promoted/advertised as such without a license.

We entered anyway, because hey, we had already paid! We found the cupboards bare. Seriously bare. The kitchen is appointed with a set of stainless steel cookware, a set of plates, bowls, cups, flatware, and exactly 4 knives. Seriously, nothing else. If you plan to cook, forget about. There's a grill out back, but no grilling tools. Got things to hang up in the closet? Bring your own hangers! Forget about ironing the wrinkles out of your folded clothing... there's no iron or ironing board. If you have more than 2-3 people joining you, perhaps consider bringing your own toilet paper, too. There were exactly 3 small rolls supplied to a group of 6 guests for 4 days.

Renter beware! Hopefully Airbnb shuts them down. Perhaps after they read this review, they will!

Generally house was as described, however it was the WORST experience we‚Äôve ever had with an Airbnb host.
After booking, I realized the property was pet friendly (I‚Äôm allergic to dogs). I reached out to management, who assured me that while the last people to stay at the home did have a dog, there‚Äôs an extensive cleaning process and we shouldn‚Äôt have a problem.

However the property was the exact opposite of clean‚Ä¶it was absolutely filthy.
Pet hair everywhere, stained couches and what looked/smelled like dog shit smeared on the baseboard.
The kitchen island was covered in crumbs and sticky. The home also had broken blinds and a large cracked window.
When I contacted the host, they admitted they didn‚Äôt have time to ‚Äúfully clean‚Äù because they were busy cleaning another property.
After multiple conversations, they finally refunded the cleaning fee, however refused to take responsibility for anything and chose to blame Airbnb.
If you can‚Äôt handle a turnaround, DO NOT OFFER IT FOR RENT.
Comfy place to crash.

This is definitely a pure wanderlust lodge experience. House is shared but the travelers who also stop in are very reasonable hard workers making their way. I would suggest for people to rent the WHOLE HOUSE especially if they travel in large packs!

No hot water in the bathroom. Host doesn't care.
Washing machine doesn't work. Dryer doesn't work.
Beds smell like piss.
Nothing is cleaned between guests.
Spiders.
A guy sleeps on the couch of the living therefore we can never watch TV.
Most people are immigrant workers. No real travellers.
Absolutely nothing to do around the hostel.
