Host wouldnt refund me depsite me having emergency medical issues that required me to go back to my country before the check out date, she pretended she couldnt do anything without her "boss"s agreement. Sure. Lol.
People snore like hell. Only expect old immigrant men in their 40s. No actual travellers.
It is always very cold or very hot. We are like so many people in the room. It is impossible to get a full night of sleep.

AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS.
I lost a $5 dollar rfid tag to get into the parking garage ad they are trying to charge me $100 to replace it lol. Don‚Äôt stay here they will rob you
Obtaining the key was difficult because instructions were not that clear to me.
Confusing check in emails.

Sentral East Austin is a cozy crash pad in a prime East Austin spot! A++ for the communication, check-in/check-out, and cleanliness of the place. We had one minor thing come up (VERY minor and did not detract from our stay) and what was pictured in the posting did not 100% match where we stayed. Again, no biggie. No need to say more about the fun of the neighborhood (the other reviews cover that well) but I will warn you that if you have a unit facing the street, it can be VERY noisy. I guess you can expect that in a bustling little bar neighborhood like that, but some of that noise was coming from the halls/building itself.
Sentral East Austin 1630 cancelled my booking whilst I was in transit, only for me to discover they had done so the evening of the day of my arrival. This caused great distress and inconvenience.
The bed was super uncomfortable, when I went to shower the smell was horrible from sink shower and bathroom sink, elevator was out of order which isn‚Äôt the biggest deal .
The elevator was broken. We were put in a different room that had a bad odor. The staff tried to help but couldn't get rid of the smell.
Place is üî• near a lot of things all you need is a scooter

In general, a great place to stay in a fairly busy area in Austin. Walkable distance to many restaurants, bars, stores and breweries.
A few nights during the stay we had heard some people arguing next to the balcony after 2:00 AM, so it was a little concerning.
Also, if you‚Äôre 6‚Äô+ height, the bed might be uncomfortable for your needs.

We were a little disappointed with this apt. The location was great, very central and the building was nice and new. The apt had just a few amenities, but we were able to make do. The bed and pillows were uncomfortable and sunk down in the middle to the point where it hurt our backs. There was a weird smell in the apt during the weekend and we also found a pair of dirty underwear under the bed. It was fine but the place was not cheap and we overall felt underwhelmed by our stay at Sentral.

Do not stay here.  They had me pay for parking in their ‚Äúgated garage‚Äù and in 1 day my car had been broken into via a smashed window, my car was robbed and they did nothing about it.  Not safe to stay here
Really nice spot, a tiny bit of ambient noise at night, but that didn‚Äôt bother me much. Would come back

The apartment was fine, but beware that they provide you a different apartment from what is in the photos. The bed also seemed to be smaller than a queen. The apartment I ended up in was on the ground floor adjacent to the food truck park which was very noisy at night and on weekends.

After we arrived to the correct building and room, the stay was very pleasant. However, the check-in process was awful and I know that many people had problems with it as well. ( I befriended another poor girl in the lobby that was also looking for her Air Bnb late night having the same issues as me and was lost, confused and scared).

I suggest a different code to get into 1614 building versus the 1630 building and more clear check in instructions. For example, "IF YOU ARE IN THE BUILDING NEEDING A KEY FOB AND CEMENT FLOORS, IT'S THE WRONG BUILDING, PROCEED NEXT DOOR" (of course this would never be necessary to even state if the other building just had a different code)... as it should already.....

When you are unfamiliar with the area and dropped off in an Uber during the night, it makes it difficult to know where you are or to identity a building number etc.

Since the code I was given granted me access to the building, I had no reason to believe I was in the wrong building.

When I entered the building I quickly realized there was a key fob box and that it was necessary to obtain a key fob to grant access anywhere in the building. I was very confused about the key fob situation since that was never mentioned in the email. I proceeded to type in the same code they gave me for the door, it did not work, I had to sneak a ride up on the elevator with another guest.

Once I arrived to my door, exhausted after a 14 hour day of travel, I quickly realized the code that was given to me did not open the door. I tried repeatedly before calling maintenance. He said he would come within 30 min, however after about 5 min of waiting, the door randomly unlocked itself and opened...

When I needed support, I felt I had no-one to actually speak to. I felt stranded and scared. Instead I was told they could not call me and gave me the, "on-site" maintenance man's number and he was actually 30 min away. He was very un-aware of what was happening. He first mentioned that I was in the wrong building, the next question was, "what are the floors? Cement or carpet?" when I responded, "cement" he confirmed I was in the correct building....

After the door randomly unlocked, I called the maintenance man back to tell him I no longer needed him to come as I was able to get in, he informed me that he was able to unlock the door from the app on his phone.

After entering the apartment, I quickly realized it looked nothing like the pictures and was highly disappointed. additionally, the wifi code didn't work.

I still had no reason to believe at this point that I was in the wrong room since the room was set-up and ready for guests, water bottles, welcome letters, clean etc .

My friend arrived later than me and was stuck waiting in the lobby until 5am since she was waiting for someone to use the elevator so she could also sneak a ride up. She was exhausted! we ended up having to waste half of our day to just sleep since we were up all night trying to figure out this disaster!

Such a shame as we only had the weekend in Austin and almost a full day was wasted since the check-in process was less than ideal.

When we awoke the next day, I had received a bunch of messages from Air Bnb stating that we were in fact in the wrong building and room.... SCARY!.... Like how does that happen!

We packed up our belongings and proceeded next door.. The building was much nicer, the room was clean and as pictured and the wifi worked!

Had we not had worst check-in process possible and a nights stay in the wrong and vacant random apartment room, I would've given this place 5 stars...

I demanded a refund however, they only refunded us for the the first night.

Overall, I would recommend the place but only if the check-in process was completely changed. A more detailed email is needed, a different code per building is needed, on-site help is needed etc.

While the location is great geographically, the units are very loud -- the windows and walls do not create much of a barrier between you and the outdoor bar below with people yelling until at least 2am. Generally, we had an awful time sleeping here. Besides the noise from outside, the bed was horribly uncomfortable. The comforter was egregiously hot and unbreathable, the pillows were stiff, the mattress sagged to one side, and the A/C was not strong in the room even though we set the temperate to 66 degrees fahrenheit! I have never slept so poorly - and, with 4 nights in a row of horrendous sleep, it really impacted our time and enjoyment of Austin. A pretty big bummer.

Also note: pictures on Airbnb are for multiple units and may not showcase the particular unit you are allocated.

Everything was 10/10 for us! Location was prime. There is a bar under so on weekends you can hear them til 2am but it stops immediately then. And I didn‚Äôt mind it at all. If you close the bedroom door you can‚Äôt hear anything. Lots of escooters and bikes are parked on the corner and in front making taking a Uber non existent. Def will be the place I book every time I come to Austin

Carpet was awful, I felt uncomfortable at the idea of being barefoot and didn‚Äôt dare taking my socks off. The photos don‚Äôt completely match the advertised room, the bed is tiny and 2 feet off the ground. $1,000 for the weekend we should have been in luxury instead the apartment was worn out and fit for a college student.
The balcony of the unit was right next to a food truck park which made it extremely noisy at all hours (all walls are extremely thin) and meant no privacy, other than that the stay was alright

Right next to bar that was very loud until after 2am.  Dog started barking in unit above at 6am until after 9am.  Complained and someone must have finally took care of dog.  Loud unit above, probably the dog again.  Multiple gun shots after 11pm.  If your young and a partier might be a fun place.....not for a family or quiet place.  No flexibility in arrival or departure.  Cleaning shows up right at 11am.  Have to pay for parking, in which i would suggest as not alot of safe street parking.

Great location, just a little noisy at night because unit faces one of the food truck areas (noise does stop ~1-2am and does drown out/not too bad for average sleepers). Definitely get parking pass! Everything you would need (restaurants, brewery, etc) are in walking distance :)

Sehr sch√∂ne und gro√üz√ºgige Unterkunft in einer sch√∂nen Anlage. Restaurants und Bars sind fu√ül√§ufig erreichbar und die Stra√üe ist sehr sch√∂n.
Betten bequem (allerdings f√ºr 2 Erwachsene etwas eng).
Parkhaus gegen Geb√ºhr (20 Dollar pro Tag) kann man dazu buchen.

Gute Kommunikation.

Kann die Wohnung auf jeden Fall weiter empfehlen.
Great location, easy check in, huge apartments- really nothing but great things to say about this air bnb!
Be aware that this neighborhood is so new there may be confusing construction about.
Loved the place! No issues and the fiber internet is a killer. 100% recommend

Due to the extensive and detailed information needed by the hosts when booking the apartment and the beautiful pictures, our expectation were pretty high for this airbnb.  I'll start with the positives, the beds were comfortable, the airbnb is in a good location.  It was really nice to have 2 bathrooms. The couch was comfortable.  Issues we encountered during our stay....the most glaring negative was the odor of pot as we initially entered the apartment.  We didn't know if it was pot or just a musty smell from lack of air circulation in the apartment, but when we returned later that evening after going out to dinner the smell was even stronger.  I did let the host know, but we both felt it was more than likely a neighbor. No action was taken on the hosts part due to it more than likely being from a neighbor.  This greatly affected our stay.  We made a point to be in the apartment as little as possible since the smell bothered our entire family.  We even considered finding other accommodations, but since our stay was so short we decided to just stay.  The apartment also wasn't up to our standards as far as cleanliness.   We can't speak to the quality of the kitchen, we did not use the kitchen or any of the appliances.  I hate to write poor reviews, but we feel other travelers need to know our experience.  We feel the odor we experienced when we were there was not of any fault of the owner, but it still affected our experience in a negative way.  Our first airbnb during our trip to Texas was in San Antonio, we paid a lower price and it was heads and shoulders above this rental.

Stay was pretty good overall, but be warned that both showers are extremely short. The shower head is approximately 4.5' off the ground, so you'll have to bend and contour your body to wash your hair.

The listing also advertises a gym in the complex, but is is tiny and in very poor condition. Some machines don't work at all and those that do are grimey and sticky.

The kitchen has all the essentials and the living room is nice to hang out in. Beds were comfy, desk and kitchen chairs not so much.

Overall a good but not amazing experience.
Could not recommend more!

Way overpriced for what it is. Not as clean and new looking as the pictures. Upon arrival the place had a legitimate indoor mosquito problem. Hosts initially refused to believe, saying mosquitos don‚Äôt live indoors. Then they went on to insinuate that the only reason for the mosquitos must be that we left a door open, which was not at all the case. They never offered any kind of refund. I don‚Äôt recommend.
Matt was attentive and communicative. The location couldn't be better and the property was even lovelier in person!

I WOULD NEVER STAY WITH UrbanStay again!!! Seriously. It started from walking into the house (or two separate houses‚Ä¶ that was listed as one house) it smelt like mildew, the bathrooms were unclean, there was white fur all over the couches, when we called UrbanStay to let them know, they didn‚Äôt show up until the next day with a ‚Äúsorry the housekeeper quit yesterday.‚Äù There were no pans/plates/cups stocked, no cleaning supplies to pick up uncleared place, no toilet paper, 4 towels in the whole place and one washcloth‚Äîthis place is listed for 16 people. 4 of the 16 ‚Äúspots to sleep‚Äù for people were two couches‚Ä¶ the door was messed up, when told to staff, they reported ‚Äúoh it‚Äôs fine you just have to mess with it a little bit to open it‚Äù we‚Äôll when my bachelorette party got home at 2AM‚Ä¶ the door was stuck and we could not get in‚Ä¶ when asked if UrbanStay would call me, they didn‚Äôt. When demanding they came open the door because I had already tried everything but break into the house (and possibly break the door) they came an hour earlier and broke into the house and reported they would come the next day and fix it (they did) but after all that we were DONE with the situation. After all of this, we felt come compensation was needed due to the fact that we paid a pretty penny for this place, they stated they‚Äôd give us $300 back from $5,500‚Ä¶. Which still hasn‚Äôt seemed to reach our account. This was by far a terrible‚Ä¶. Experience. Customer service was absolutely terrible and they did not even close to compensate and try to make the situation better after witnessing all of that happened (bc they were notified through the entire stay).

This place is in a terrible neighborhood, he‚Äôs watching your every move, the washer and dryer aren‚Äôt working, the showers smelled musty, the beds were stained, and overall just not accurate. We were only the one hour before we couldn‚Äôt possibly stay there and although I have aircover, the host gave me $50 of my over $1000 back‚Ä¶.

Pros: good parking
Close to the river walk
Had a pool
Cons. Bad neighborhood
Uncomfortable bed
No blinds in the bedroom to keep moonlight or morning sun out.
Uncomfortable couch!
Wired decor, nothing matched
No TV or decent cooking accessories

This place was disgusting, I would highly recommend avoiding.

When I checked in the place was infested with ants and crickets. The bed had bedbugs, the desk keyboard and mouse didn‚Äôt work. It is also located in one of the sketchiest parts of Austin, next to a gas station where workers are drinking, passing out, and fighting.

Fortunately, I was on the road for most of the stay and just needed somewhere cheap to leave my things while at work.

A week after the stay, the host called me up and accused me of letting all the insects into her apartment (hilarious) and other crude accusations because the person after me had asked for a refund.

I typically leave no reviews at all unless positive but the hosts behaviour after was far too much for me. I know it‚Äôs cheap but it‚Äôs not worth it.
üî•
would not recommend

I've never written a bad review.  This place is bad.   Really.  Bugs, Hot as heck w/ one small ac unit w/ blinking "change filter" light.. (I had to go buy fan).  Stove top didn't work, bugs were plentiful, Shower STILL leaking, plumbing in terrible condition, backyard overgrown w/ weeds and not inviting AT ALL>.  (Old broken dryer sitting out in the middle of it). There could not have been less effort put in to making this place inviting or pleasant.   Magdiel was quick to respond to specific emergencies, but overall this place is not well taken care of.  I'd rather camp under the underpass than pay to sleep here in Dollar Store Sheets.
Great location and the backyard is a must have if you're traveling with your dog. The space could use some minor updates, but nothing major. Great find for Austin travel!

We would be giving a higher rating because it was good for our dog with the big yard and the dog door, however, the strong smell of cat urine that hits you as soon as you walk in was not pleasant. It smelled as if there was a littlerbox in need of cleaning in the house but we looked everywhere and there was none. There was pet hair on the couch and bed, even in the sheets under the cover but I guess it was to be expected being that it is a dog friendly place. Also, we were going to use the tea kettle to boil some water for our tea but there was already some water in the kettle from the last guests, if not before that, which was kind of gross and made us wonder if the rest of the house had been cleaned properly prior to us checking in. Another inconvenience is that within the first 30 min of arriving, we came out to our car to see that someone left a baggie of dog poo right in the middle of the car‚Äôs hood. We felt unwelcomed and sketched out. Would not come back, especially for price.
Everything met our expectations. The unit is only two blocks from our daughters home, so we will book it again the next time we travel to Austin

Es un departamento peque√±o pero muy c√≥modo y acogedor. Tiene una decoraci√≥n sencilla pero de muy buen gusto. Se descansa pl√°cidamente en la sala y en la habitaci√≥n (solo recomiendo reemplazar las almohadas y cojines, ya est√°n muy vencidos).  En la cocina hay todos los utensilios,  as√≠ como aceite y especias para prepararse los alimentos. El edificio es muy silencioso y el barrio es seguro y muy bonito. El tema de la limpieza es algo que se puede mejorar, pero no impide que la estancia sea placentera. Solo la llegada fue un poco inc√≥moda porque las instrucciones que la anfitriona nos brind√≥ fueron un tanto confusas.

Well, the picture on the Airbnb was good but the outside of the house was not clean, even inside had cat hairs on the couch, we were allergic to cats so we had to leave this place within an hour and pay more money to rent a hotel. There was a camera installed in the common area which I wasn‚Äôt aware of as it was not mentioned on the front instruction page, not even in the house‚Äô physical instructions copy (I have a copy of it just in case). Not value for money, neighborhood is not clean, I saw trash thrown even on the porch.

the room pictured is not what we got. It was very similar in the layout and size, but don't be surprised if it's a different room than the pictures. The check in was OK- no one is there and there is no lobby area, it's just en elevator in a parking garage that goes up to the rooms- Sonder sent pictures as part of the check-in info, it would have been very confusing otherwise. The key pad was not super quick and took a few tries to get it to work but we never got locked out. Very clean. I thought the bar scene on 6th near the hotel was not what we had in mind and was very divey.

The heater is set at a fixed temp that you can‚Äôt go above, and I was cold. Granted, Austin is usually warm and I just happened to go during a winter storm. They should give flexibility for those situations. There was a prompt to download the app to control the heat, and there was no way to once I did that, which made me think that maybe it‚Äôs just a marketing technique to have people download their app. I work in tech so it‚Äôs not like I missed an obvious option in the app.
The walls are also incredibly thin and I received a noise complaint from watching tv, so that was bizarre. Finally, the main elevator broke and I had a tough time figuring out how to get upstairs at 1am one night. Not ideal. It took a couple of days for them to get it fixed. All that aside, it was a beautiful and comfortable stay.

Clean and spacious apartment, however, not worth the price. We ended having to pay about $25 a day just for street parking outside, there are no free parking spots and it's not worth it unless you do not have a car. There are plenty of food spots and bars within walking distance though. The building pool is right between a parking garage and the metro rail, so not exactly a relaxing spot. They also did NOT accommodate early check-in or luggage storage when we needed it upon our arrival. Overall, I was disappointed but it was a decent place to stay for a weekend.

The location is convenient to the east side, but they are not accepting early check in even with weeks advance on the request. Submitting an early request is a guessing game because you have to specify a time and then wait to see if it‚Äôs accepted or not

Rentar√≠a de nuevo este Airbnb sin dudarlo. La cama es king size y est√° s√∫per c√≥moda. Para el proceso de llegada recomiendo utilizar el estacionamiento de paga que tiene el propio edificio (5 d√≥lares la hora). Se puede encontrar estacionamiento gratuito en la calle Waller, muy cerca del edificio, la calle parece muy segura.
No free parking. Sleeps 2. Very late check-in.
The check-process is clumsy and not user friendly.

We rented this air bnb Sunday-Friday 7-12 while we were gone a Chinese lady was seen entering our air bnb and looking around we must of made it back shortly after she left because we was in there no time and we had 4 police officers knocking at the door wanting to do a welfare check because the unit we rented was not supposed to be booked according to her from what the police officers said so we had to show the officers the confirmation on the phone once they seen we was valid to be there that‚Äôs when they apologized and left. I then reported this incident and she the Chinese lady contact Sonder And she said she felt disprected as a employee because of how we referred to her as such any who this wouldn‚Äôt of been a problem had she not off went in to an occupied unit she wouldn‚Äôt have been mentioned period we wouldn‚Äôt of even known she existed

The location is really nice but we were really disappointed that the house did not feel clean. When we walked in there was a really foul smell coming from the sink, dishes/pans were still dirty but put away, towels had stains on them, a very dirty used pan was in the oven and tea kettle was super gross. The washing machine was broken during our stay, the host informed us in a way that felt rude - very matter of fact instead of offering an apology or discount to cover the laundromat. Disappointing all around, we picked the place because of all the nice reviews. We rarely give reviews that are not positive but in this case the quality of cleaning did not at all meet the price. I think all of these issues can be fixed by being more careful cleaning because it is really a nice space in a great part of Austin.

While the place was decent unfortunately we couldn‚Äôt get over the horrible cigarette smoke smell. While I imagine it‚Äôs from the neighbors, the smell got into all of our stuff and has been strong enough to affect us even after we left.
I would like to know there is no bedroom. It is just an apartment with no division at all.

I'm not someone who relishes leaving poor reviews, but there were so many unpleasant experiences wrapped up in this tiny studio apartment that I couldn't wait to get home. Upon arrival we noticed two things. One was the soaking wet floors from a cleaner who must have left literally minutes before we arrived and didn't attempt to dry them and two the pervasive stench of cigarette smoke that was attempted to be concealed by multiple air fresheners in the unit (unsuccessfully). It's a first floor unit and I was also struck by the fact that the blinds covered no more than 1/4 of the sliding glass doors, many of them were crumpled up in a corner, a few were precariously hanging from red masking tape. The first 15 minutes of our stay there my boyfriend and I spent using my athletic tape to put sheets up for a semblance of privacy. From there it was death by a thousand cuts.

- If you didn't wear shoes, your feet or socks turned black from the grime on the floor
- found trash from previous guest under the bed
- probably 2 inch period blood stain on the comforter that while washed should have been thrown out (they did send us a new one when asked, but ignored the complaint about the blinds which they had to have known about previously)
- blood on the hairdryer (I'm a woman and a nurse I promise you I know what dried blood looks like)
- they had advertised a TV with streaming services, aside from a jenky remote, every time we tried to play something the Roku would crash so we gave up.
- dishes were put away wet.
- when we went to use the clothes drier for their advertised on site laundry, it was so ineffectual it required being run twice to get our clothing par dried after 1.5 hours of dry time.
- woke up to a cockroach in the shower.

Any one or even 2-3 of these things wouldn't make me leave a 1 star review, but the composite of finding some new gross thing every day of our trip made us seriously consider finding somewhere else to stay by the time the last night. Overall I had zero trust in anything being cleaned to even a reasonable standard which made me, someone who doesn't require impeccable cleanliness in general, extremely uncomfortable. It was all the details of someone managing a property who either doesn't know what they are doing or doesn't give a F#$%. If you do not have money to maintain a unit properly, don't bother.

Very disappointed in the condition of this rental. There was a very foul pipe/sewer smell in the room along with cigarette/Marijuana that was very overbearing. Roaches were everywhere in the kitchen and bathroom as soon as the lights were turned off. Several messages were sent in regard to this and there was no effort to compensate us or anything for the issues. We have rented several times from these individuals and did not feel as if that even came into consideration with addressing our concerns. I also feel that they knew that there were issues because there were roach traps/bait all over the rental as well as candles/air freshners. I do have pictures as well.

Little bugs everywhere, bathroom sink doesn't drain, tub/shower has huge chunks of enamel missing and the drain is rusted like crazy, couch was broken. I booked this airbnb for an emergency situation at my complex, and this was its own stress nightmare. I didn't even stay the second night.

I highly recommend looking for another Airbnb.
The hosts are here to get as much money out of you as possible, I will explain why, the Airbnb says that the room is 100% smoke-free, yet, the whole unit, sheets, and place smell like a complete nightclub. The scent from the entire unit was so disgusting we had to open both the front and back doors. When I reached out to the hosts, they replied a DAY after. The front door, also used as a window, is SO unsafe. It‚Äôs a BROKEN stick that you put to ‚Äúlock‚Äù the door. However, this can easily be broken, and we are on the first floor, so, If you‚Äôre traveling with family or want to feel safe. DO NOT BOOK THIS. The shower is DISGUSTING. It‚Äôs old (which is fine), but there are pieces of paint missing and dirty edges, the sink water doesn‚Äôt always go down, the sink is disgusting as well, the body washes, shampoo, and conditioner are all mixed up, and I can tell they‚Äôve never washed any of that.
It had a really strong tobacco smell the moment you would step into the door. Parking was very small and the area was not good. Could not stay due to smell. Asked for a refund, and they denied it.
Small hippie home. You pay for what you get
Cute little place perfect for 2. However, the mattress was very worn down that we could not sleep comfortably and it hurt our backs.

Great location, walking distance to a bunch of things but not in the middle of the action. Place was a little less clean than I would have liked including a totally mold filled coffee pot and a not totally clean shower. The neighbors were also very nosy and rude. We left our dogs for 3 hours on Friday night until 10pm and the neighbors complained they were barking the whole time and they ‚Äúcalled the police several times‚Äù. After that we kept the dogs with us the rest of the trip to avoid any noise and yet still got many comments from the neighbors every time we saw them. Place was good, but if you have dogs who may bark beware of booking, the neighbors will harass you and never let you live it down.

We had four people in our party and we asked for more towels and blankets for us which we never got. Communication was incredibly bad, never picked up phone or answered messages. We asked for a few little things which were never accommodated for. Tiny house is only good for a two night stay no longer. Also there were cockroaches and ants everywhere on the counters and in the house!

Uno de los mejores airbnb en los que hemos estado. La casa tiene todo el equipo para hacer tu estad√≠a placentera. La cocina est√° bien equipada, el internet es excelente, la limpieza 5 estrellas, las camas son muy c√≥modas y el barrio muy tranquilo. La terraza es un lugar para disfrutar. Thuy es muy amable y sencilla con sus indicaciones. Sin duda volveremos.

Our stay was good because of the location and free parking. Apartment suite A is on ground floor next to lobby/mail room & lobby bathrooms. We heard all the noise from these areas. Also, no patio or balcony, but I was told every apartment had one!

Only window in apt was not private as people were walking by. The privacy screening on window was peeling off which required us to keep drapes closed all time. No view.

The staff at front desk were very helpful and professional. I would not return to this location because of lack of privacy, lack of view, and noise.
Se ve m√°s lindo de lo que muestra la Foto, ideal para pasar el tiempo en la casa, todo muy limpio y nuevo, sin problemas de parqueo y muy seguro, me encanto

Good location for us (close to Zilker to see the tree at Xmas time). Communication with the owner was prompt.  There are not a lot of dishes, so this is probably better for a couple (versus a family). The sofa bed is not a great option for adults (not comfortable).

Lots of positives with the place as you will read in the other reviews. Unfortunately, we ran into a few issues during our stay, with these being the main ones:

1. Main light did not work from day 1. We had to wait on different people coming over to inspect/fix the light over several days, causing a disturbance to our stay. I understand that electricians often provide long time frames, and this is out of our control. But, the lights should have been tested and fixed before our stay. The light remote had no battery in it when we first arrived, so the light was not working or tested properly before our stay.

2. Septic tank. We were asked to let maintenance folks in to turn the water on and off. We were in the apartment at the time, taking private meetings, so this was a disturbance and we were not expecting it with no advance notice.

3. There was a noticeable number of ants coming from the air conditioner and coming onto the couch, and even a bug in the apartment before we entered.

The location and the house are good, but this does not make up for the problems and lack of communication. We were not told that there would be people working on the house until we arrived at the house, despite multiple conversations with the host the week before our stay. A highly intoxicated neighbor started a fight with a man working on the house, saying he didn't belong there and demanding to speak with the owner of the home. She tried to enter the house multiple times and threatened to call "311" on the three of us. The man working on the house was unable to contact the host and I only received a reply after the incident had ended. There are plenty of nice places to stay in good locations, this one isn't worth the headache it brings.

The place was in a good location and it was clean. That‚Äôs it.
However, it was old and all door handles were rusted. It was more like a CABIN than a house.
They failed to put any pictures of the bathrooms. Had we known that one bathroom had a rusted old tub we wouldn‚Äôt have rented the place.
They sent us a long list of house rules and DON‚ÄôTs after we paid.
Made a huge deal out of no noise policy but failed to mention that from early morning there‚Äôs a lot of noise outside (restaurant deliveries at dawn) that prevents us from sleeping in/resting.
The most ridiculous one was no entry through the front door. Never been to an Airbnb with these rules.
Wasn‚Äôt worth it, will not comeback and I don‚Äôt recommend it.
The ac broke during our short 2 night stay but Jason got it sorted it for us

Eine tolle sehr komfortable Unterkunft. Modern und schick eingerichtet. Alles war sehr sauber. Der dritte Stock ohne Aufzug ist mit schweren Koffern etwas m√ºhsam, daf√ºr hat man aber eine sch√∂ne Dachterrasse und einen privaten Parkplatz. Wir hatten vom kleinen Balkon die Aussicht auf eine freie Fl√§che als Brachland und Baustelle, auf der aber Gottseidank nicht gearbeitet wurde. Es ist eine gute Gegend aber nicht so optimal, wenn man nur Ruhe sucht.
OBSESSED with this place! This was my first Tiny House experience and I already can‚Äôt wait to go back.
Extremely poor communications. We had an issue with the place and they did not respond to me for two days and then never resolved the issue.

This place has a noise issue and it seems this is disclosed somewhere that you wouldn‚Äôt be able to find. However, when you contact and complain to Airbnb on this they can point you to this disclosure. We were planning to stay at this place for 3 nights but ended up leaving the place after the first night. There was a continuous annoying noise from outside that was disturbing us and we couldn‚Äôt sleep the night that we spent there. We complained to the Airbnb and could get our money for the two nights that we didn‚Äôt spend there. We got charged for the full cleaning fee for the one night stay. I don‚Äôt recommend this place due to noise issue, otherwise it was clean.

Stay at your own risk! There was no power on one bedroom. I stayed there Monday to Friday, I tried to get the issue resolved on Tuesday, they had me try some stuff that obviously didn‚Äôt fix the problem. I was then told they would send someone from maintenance. I followed up again on Wednesday evening and was told again they would bring it up to maintenance. Thursday evening it hadn‚Äôt been fixed and at that point I didn‚Äôt even bother to contact them again since I was checking out Friday morning.

Host cancelled 1 hour before a 5pm check in. AirBnB support was minimal and left me in a new city with a child and dog and no place to stay. I was told by the host ‚Äúwe‚Äôre not a hotel‚Äù when insisting upon new accommodations after they refused to answer the phone and would only offer text communication. So unprofessional. Very disappointing experience.

Great centralized location for Austin. Easy check in and check out process. The furniture is not the same as pictured, but the apartment layout is the same. Floors were very dirty and the towels were stained. Low rate so we got what we paid for, overall was just fine for a quick trip.
The bathroom alone is worth the stay, it's stellar!

The Kasa apartment was clean with a nice view overlooking the pool. Some things I will note‚Äîthere is a daily fee for your pet rather than a one time fee and you can not leave your pet unattended in the Kasa rental, which makes it difficult to do things all together as one person has to stay back with the pet. Kasa also has a noise sensor in the apartment which was a little weird. We are not the party type of people so it was fine, just seemed like an invasion of privacy. Additionally, the location of the Kasa is not ideal. The street over (Vargas St.), was extremely sketchy and while driving to get coffee we witnessed a few drug deals. Overall, Kasa is nice, but I would avoid Vargas St. at night or even at all times.
Apartamento muito bem equipado, exatamente como no an√∫ncio, recomendo com certeza

Terrible,

Overbooked and Cancelled on me and my family the day of the stay while we were already on the way to Austin, TX.

DO NOT BOOK

The location of this place was pretty decent. Still had to drive to get anywhere but that‚Äôs expected there. When you walked in there was a pretty bad musty smell that never went away. The couch was completely useless is was so uncomfortable. The mattress was too big for the bed frame so I found myself waking up on the edge of the bed from rolling. The water pressure and temp was lack luster. The last night the ac was barely working and it took hours for Alex to reply and at that point we were already asleep. On a positive the place was decently decorated, had anything we needed, and was clean. Probably would find somewhere different to stay next time but for the price it was fine.

The place is spacious and clean, but it is quite dated - especially the furniture and decor.  Pros include the covered outdoor spaces, covered parking, lots of dishes to use. It‚Äôs really more of a 3 bedroom house with the 4th bedroom being an anteroom off one of the bedrooms. The host was not very responsive- I had to repeatedly make multiple attempts at contact before hearing back.  This was a little frustrating. Overall, the place is more of a 3.5 given the cost. I would still stay here again.

There was a terrible stench and dozens of gnats in the kitchen, apparently the previous guests per the owner "had a catered party" and left food rotting in the sink.The toilet overflowed the first night (after 1 of us used minimal toilet paper). The doorknobs to the bathroom fell off nearly every time we shut the door. For nearly $600/night, this is a ripoff.  We would not stay again, good location isn't worth the headache of too many issues with the house. You can get a suite downtown for the same price.

We absolutely loved our stay at the Stained Glass House! The house is spacious and tasteful, and could not be a better location‚Äîjust a two block walk from a very trendy stretch of coffee shops, breweries, and stores. We lounged on the porch a lot and overall spent way more time hanging at the house than we expected!

One of the worst experiences I‚Äôve had with Airbnb. I showed up to a completely empty apartment that didn‚Äôt even have a lock on the door. You could literally see through the holes into the apartment. After being placed on hold for 45 minutes one of ‚ÄúKasa‚Äôs‚Äù employees let me know that they would be transferring me to a different unit but that they did not have the access code to get into the new unit. After waiting another hour I was finally given the code to get into the apartment. When I got into THAT unit nothing had been cleaned, the bed was completely stripped with no bedding on it, towels were dirty and on the floor in the bathroom and there was no shower curtain at all. After all of this they refunded me a total of $168 out of $1008 that I had paid for the booking. I hate leaving any sort of negative feeback publicly and usually just leave it in the private message section here but this was pretty wild on all fronts. I would highly reccomend NOT booking through Kasa.

Bad experience with checkin.  Access cards didn‚Äôt work to access building the whole stay.  Parking situation is complicated.  Have to retrieve key from room then go back and park car.  Then check out have to exit parking garage then go back and drop off key especially when elevators are not working. Very frustrating. Waiting on elevator was 10 to 15 minutes each time.  On Sunday neither elevator worked.  Had to use freight elevator.  There were some ceiling fans in room but no remotes or switch to turn on.  Suggestion‚Ä¶. Maybe some waters in fridge for ur guests.
Great stay. No ironing board and when delivered it was one of those crappy mini ironing boards.
Exactly as listed. Brad was a communicative host and we had no issues during our visit.
Brad‚Äôs place did not disappoint! I enjoyed my stay.

Brads apartment was very cute. It was very walkable to downtown and Rainey street. We also walked south towards some breweries.

The bed was comfy! Which is a plus because normally airbnbs would have crappy beds.
Book you won‚Äôt be disappointed, pays attention to detail!!! Everything was provided that we may have needed and communication was clear!
This place lacks cleanliness. I‚Äôd be weary of staying here, especially during the pandemic.
One thing to note- pay for street parking or $30/night garage parking.
üôÄ

Stayed for 3 nights. Great location, price, hot continental breakfasts and the pool was refreshing after a day exploring Austin! Our room was not ready at the stated check-in time resulting in us having to wait an hour. The staff offered free parking which we didn‚Äôt need but they provided snacks and drinks from their mini store for the inconvenience.

Nos gust√≥ mucho el hotel. Todo bien limpio los empleados bien carism√°ticos y servicial. El parqueo del hotel cuesta $30 por d√≠a pero nosotros decidimos parquear al lado (en un parqueo abierto) y pagamos $20 por cada 24/horas. La piscina no es muy profunda creo q solo llega 3 pies si no me equivocado, pero el agua estaba bien limpia. Si regreso a Austin  me quedar√≠a en este mismo hotel.

Overall I did not have a great experience. No early check in permitted, you need to park on the street to just check in so you can then get garage access to park your car. Poor process in my opinion. The location isn‚Äôt far from 6th street but be careful - it‚Äôs right near a homeless center and some people bothered me walking home one night. I would not recommend it if you are walking by yourself. Additionally, some maintenance/room service people decided to swipe in and try to enter my room without even knocking as I was changing. The walls are paper thin by the way i could hear the couples conversation next to me.  Otherwise the room was clean and there‚Äôs a breakfast included. I won‚Äôt be staying here again.

1st of all thr post says whole apartment to yourself, so you have false advertising and you then have to pay $30 for parking, which is nowhere on the post and is non refundable. THIS IS A HOTEL ROOM NOT APARTMENT, THEY SHOULDN'T BE ON AIRBNB. IF I WANTED TO BOOK A HOTEL I WOULD NOT HAVE USED AIRBNB!!! VERY DISSAPOINTED

I hate to give an okay review. The hotel was nice, we liked the fact that you needed a hotel room key to ride the elevator up. BUT, we had problems with the homeless in the area. We made sure we only walked the streets during the day, but that didn't stop one homeless man from coming up to us. We were even in a group. Don't adventure out of the hotel by yourself. If you do leave, take a vehicle, don't walk.

We booked for a 2 queen bed room but when we arrived to check in receptionist informed us that there were no rooms available providing us with a king and twin size bed blaming us for booking via 3rd party ‚Äúairbnb‚Äù - 4 of us were listed under reservation each one of us with our significant other making our stay very uncomfortable.

Great location, great value for money.

There is a cheaper uncovered parking lot RIGHT NEXT to the building so you don‚Äôt need to pay $30 a day to park in the hotel garage. We asked the receptionist and she pretended she did not know of any other parking which we felt was deceitful but we checked in late and were tired.
Poor location, misleading advertising

Bad homeless problem in Austin. Similar to San Francisco. Just a couple of blocks from the hotel are tent cities beneath I35. Hotel is also next to other ho.eless shelters. At night while walking to 6th Street it made my daughter nervous. We walked in a way to avoid them once we figured out a safer path.

Otherwise hotel pool was great and its just a few blocks from the Capital and UT. I'd stay there again.

One of the front desk is rude, and shouldn‚Äôt be allowed to speak to customers, the person was un-professional, as if she was doing a favor for us. It gave us a very wrong impression of the hotel. And they dont have free parking, have to pay $32.73 extra for parking. Wont stay here again.
A bit noisy on the weekend, you‚Äôll be listening to the venues‚Äô music surrounding the hotel until 2am on weekends.
Everything was great just didn't realize it was right by the homeless shelter and as a solo traveller it was more worrisome walking around. If I was with someone else thought would have no issues.
reservation wasnt honored. room that i had booked for 2 male adults was not available and we were displaced to a single room. host didnt help to accomodate us.
Salimos el d√≠a 8 de enero del hotel y al 19 de enero no hemos recibido nuestro dep√≥sito por $100 d√≥lares, lo seguimos esperando
We needed a late check in and the front desk was kind of rude about it even though we called in a 24 hour advance and paid for both nights still.
If you like dirty streets and sleeping homeless all over the downtown during the day, Austin is the place to go.
Being a single female didn‚Äôt feel safe walking by Salvation Army. Could do a detour around the block that felt better but not well lit after dark.

Our experience at the hotel was wonderful other than the front desk assistant, Sonya. She was horribly rude to my and my daughter. She refused to make eye contact, interrupted us when we asked questions, and did not listen. She acted like she was better than us and was unwilling to assist us at all. Very, very disappointing.

We were not given a room until 2 hours after the allotted time. Many other customers checked in and were given a room while we were waiting. Hotel had two homeless shelters next door. I would not feel safe walking by myself in that area. Suficiente bueno para el precio, si llevas auto deber√°s pagar $32usd por noche extra y debes pedir que hagan el cuarto todos los d√≠as temprano porque si lo no lo hacen. En general bien. La alberca est√° s√∫per linda
Note: Have to pay $30 per day per car for parking.

As an Airbnb Superhost and a longtime IHG member I was beside myself at the miscommunication and lack of customer service we experienced this trip. 1) we booked a 2 Queen room and booked for 4 adults but, when we checked in we were assigned a 1 King room.  I was told by the front desk and the host that providing enough sleeping space for the number of guests is a ‚Äúspecial request‚Äù and isn‚Äôt guaranteed.  With Airbnb‚Äôs assistance we were moved to a king suite with a sofa bed.  2) The toilet was filthy.  But, housekeeping was very embarrassed and cleaned it quickly.  3) There is a club with live music on the patio.  We were on the top floor and the music was very loud until very late.  Pack your ear plugs!

Check in was a disaster because the hotel‚Äôs system was down. This kind of thing happens, so I do understand, and we wanted to be understanding. However ‚Ä¶. Hotel staff totally FAILED to handle the situation with any semblance of customer service. They could have saved the situation so easily but they chose not to. Systems go down, but management totally failed.

The place was clean, and it was very close to the capital, however, there was a very, very very loud bar on the opposite corner from the hotel. I tried to get a room on the opposite of the hotel, but was told there was none available and offered earplugs. The hostess said, you are in the party district area. The room we got was not the room that was advertise. We had 2 beds instead of the 1 king we booked. When you checkin you have to pay taxes & fees along with a $75 hold and $35 for parking to the hotel.
No microwave or kitchen. $30 a night parking
Good, parking was not included nor cheap. We got stuck in the lot and ended up being late for our reservation. Front desk was not helpful in this matter at all!

We got there and were given a faulty keycard to enter the garage. On the second day of our stay we asked for more shampoo and conditioner. The oranges were rotten during the breakfast, and we never received towels that we had asked for. The cleaning crew was exceptionally nice, however.

Some amenities were still limited due to COVID-19 (hotel bar was only open on the weekend and we had to walk over to the attached Holiday Inn for very limited breakfast options), bed was ok but not great. Basically the same as the Holiday Inn.

El lugar cumple lo que vende. La primer noche el aire acondicionado estaba haciendo ruidos raros y no nos dejaba dormir, as√≠ que como a la 1pm pedimos ayuda y nos cambiaron de cuarto. Recuerdo que al rentar el lugar dec√≠a que deb√≠as dejar un deposito de 75USD pero en realidad te cobran 100 USD, fuera de eso todo es como se menciona en el anuncio.

First of all, parking confusion: there's is no clear sign of parking garage entrance or indication where you need to park. Then, I was told that I needed to check in before parking. Prior to the trip I was on the phone with a hotel staff and they told me I can park there before I check in. After check in there's no clear instructions for how this parking garage works, because I have to go back and ask the front receptionist again before she handed me a blue parking card. the parking card doesn't even work half of the time.

overall cleanliness is ok. shower and toilet seat were kind of broken but still usable.

everything was good except for parking. there wasn't a single time we didn't have to hassle with something from the card not working to the gate not going up. for such an expensive cost it was really frustrating.
Indigo is a Holiday Inn Express-caliber hotel. It is situated adjacent to several outdoor music venues. Consequently, on some nights, the noise from the shows was tough to ignore.
Employees were nice and we loved the restaurant. But the hotel had an unfortunate week that really wasn‚Äôt their fault but led to an unpleasant stay.
I usually don‚Äôt give out all 5 stars but there were really no issues. Great spot, fair price.

DO NOT STAY HERE
They overbooked the hotel and cancelled on me at the last minute, and then tried to force me to get to cancel and sent lying emails claiming I wanted to cancel. All I wanted was a hotel room and this was a terrible and stressful experience. Better to spend your time and money elsewhere!

Beware of any errors making a reservation, as they may not correct in your favor. The host Jason, is refusing to respond to Air BnB regarding my accidental butt dial reservation, to make any exception to their cancellation policy to refund any or all of the one night reservation of $221.
It was a complete mistake and I immediately contacted the host to explain that there was only one icon to hit that fully confirms a reservation, after hitting ‚Äúreserve‚Äù- the only way to see all included costs.
He is ignoring me- he will not be honest or mature, even refusing to give me his bosses contact info. This was New Year‚Äôs Day at noon.

Overall, my experience with Hotel Indigo has been one of narcissistic abuse, hijacking my time and money, and just writing this review is making me feel sick.

I get it that it‚Äôs the owners decision not the hosts, and it‚Äôs a process, yet he‚Äôs communicating one thing and air bnb another, finally responding to them but not me, saying he‚Äôs declining me the refund.

People at Indigo Hotel publish their rooms as 'including a pet' but when you get in, they charge you $87.75 on top of the fee on AirBnB. SCAM ALERT:  This is not the hotel. It‚Äôs a scammer in Miami taking the reservation then canceling it last minute if he can‚Äôt undercut the room rate. He‚Äôll leave you stranded, make you fight to get your money back, and you won‚Äôt see a dime for 2 weeks assuming you ever get it back.

Was very happy with the cleanliness, ambience, and location of the hotel itself. Do not use! I‚Äôm not sure if I was scammed or not‚Ä¶ I flew in from Ohio for a business trip. Paid in full for a reservation and upon attempting to check-in was told they have no such reservations and sorry they would not be accommodating me for a room.

I called Airbnb, I was super upset and in a very uncomfortable situation - no one offering any real help and the rep just left me on hold for a very long time w no follow up. I had to scramble and luckily after a few hours found another place to stay with no help from Airbnb
Very disappointing all around!!
No comment just upset

The room was exceptionally clean. However the images of the hotel are a bit misleading. The pool is shared with the Holiday Inn. The bar area is very small. I did a ton of Ubering.
It was good. Regular hotel. The valet guys were kinda rude, the check-in were also a bit arrogant. Nothing impressive

Right across the street from Stubbs. This could be good or bad. Our room faced Red River St. so our room was quite noisy until the concert at Stubbs was over. Parking should be included. Room was clean, but there wasn't anything special about it for the price.

Beautiful hotel in a convenient location. No issues with the hotel staff, or the hotel itself. I was unaware the pool would be shutdown this month. That was one of the main selling points of staying there, so that was a complete bummer!
All you need for a quiet weekend in Austin. unit is above a garage that is opened before 9am, so not the best option if you'll be staying out past midnight.

Kind of far from Austin, uber rides were a little pricey from this location. Rooms are small, beds are hard. Overall seemed clean but had an ant problem in kitchen. AC didn't function properly. Yard was a dirt mound and not very usable, but they have cameras on it and monitored them so we didn't feel comfortable outside with them watching.
For the price it was good location and would work for someone on a strict budget. We will spend the money and be closer to Austin next time.

This was the most complicated check in process I‚Äôve ever gone through. Even after checking in, the key card they gave us didn‚Äôt match with the unit. We had message them right away and it took a while for them to get back to us. They said someone would bring by the correct key card but no one ever came. The apartment was nice and is in a great location but there is a building being built directly across 3rd St.  the street.  This wouldn‚Äôt be a problem except they worked 24/7 while we were there.üò¢

The communication from the host in their standard instructions was very aggressive; ‚ÄúI‚Äôll call the cops for trespassing if you arrive a minute early or check out late.‚Äù Clearly this is not someone who wants to host. The bathroom walls are covered in grime & need to be cleaned + painted & the toilet screams whenever you flush. I wouldn‚Äôt have been so bothered by the state of the bathroom if the host was welcoming & kind. Unfortunately that is not Honey‚Äôs style.
Just as described.  Very quiet area too.   I walked to and from the Moody Center alone and felt very safe.

It just needs to build a little cleaner and the doors to the bathroom need to be fixed because I got locked in the ice maker does not work frigerator was not clean enough didn't feel comfortable put put my food in there other than that the okay place when you ain't got nowhere to go you need lots of space so I can't say I wouldn't stay there again

The place is nice enough, my only issue would be with how dirty the apartment was when we checked-in. This is very upsetting due to the fact that they charge a pretty hefty cleaning fee. This was one of the worst Airbnb stays that I have had, from checking in I had issues,we couldn‚Äôt use the water they were still fixing stuff in the apartment when we arrived.The house was nasty and especially the bathroom the shower curtains was brown and it was hair and dirt on the floor,we never got a dryer to dry our clothes so we didn‚Äôt get to wash! The apartment its so nice and very cozy.

Clean place and safe area, but no parking in the complex after 7pm I had to park far away from the unit. Charged a cleaning fee, but asked to strip the beds, wash the towels and take out the trash. I‚Äôve never done that at other BNB‚Äôs out of the country or any other state. Maybe I‚Äôm being bougie, but i don‚Äôt wanna think about cleaning while vacationing .

Instructions were not clear, gate codes were wrong for both the gate and door. Difficult check in process. After all of that - the cleaner was there even after check in, said she didn‚Äôt know I was checking in that day. Still didn‚Äôt finish the job. Pillow cases weren‚Äôt on pillows, guest closet was a mess, microwave plate was missing, living room tv wasn‚Äôt working properly, wifi was very slow. Just wasn‚Äôt a great experience.

The house looks amazing in picture but sadly it has the feel of a motel on the inside. Moldy cabinets above the microwave which is not only unsanitary but dangerous, white stains on all of the comforters and couch, broken stair noses and missing flooring pieces, air conditioning that struggles to get the house to a comfortable level, expired fridge filter for water, and a front door that wouldn‚Äôt stay closed unless it was locked. I expected luxury especially with the price I had paid but it really was a let down if being honest.

Check in didn't go as planned. Got to the hotel and the reservation wasn't prepared unfortunately. Had to call Trevor and ended up having to figure out accommodations for our first night myself. Trevor referred us to Airbnb, but we made the decision to book direct with the hotel at that point. Now having to figure out the difference in cost between the direct booking and airbnb rates, so definitely a pain. Trevor answered the phone and thanked us for being patient, unfortunately doesn't take away from the massive headache and stress of the check in process.

Great location, down town walking distance. Very clean as well , bed was nice but definitely need new pillow options. The pressure to listen to a timeshare was unpleasant upon arriving (after traveling all day) and they were very pushy and actually said we way overpaid:/. Had a hotel feel for sure.But that said it was spring and in break high demand so I‚Äôll give it a 4 star.
Nice place. Sucked it lost power for two days cus of storm.
The host was very nice; however the bedroom did smell and I slept with a mask on to avoid smelling the smoke. Not sure if it was the sheets or the general smell in the room.

I wanted so badly to love this place as others reported, but the central AC was broken prior to my check in and no one communicated it to me. When I entered the apartment a portable unit was set up and running in the living room and vented out of the front window with a hose so it could not be moved. I inquired immediately about the central ac since the bedroom was quite warm and Jon said that the condenser was being repaired and things should be cooling off shortly. Needless to say, things did not cool off, the bedroom was too uncomfortably warm to sleep, and Jon refused to give me any kind of refund when I expressed my disappointment.
Be careful if you decide to rent this apartment. The management lacks concern for the comfort of the renter.

It was all good, but unfortunately the host would not read nor respond through the app (just text message or calls I found out later). We filled up the form they asked us to before moving in (we were supposed to be able to since 3pm and we did that) and there was a lady there that called out on my boyfriend when he went to check in at 3 as if he had not done the form and found a mess in the place, but he was nice and just told her we would come back. The sink was clogged when we moved in so we had to call maintenance for that. And my least favorite part was when we got stuck outside for 2 hrs at night because the door got stuck by an old lock that should be removed from the door.

If it was not for those things everything else was fine and comfortable.
I would still recommend the place regardless of the incidents.
