I‚Äôve visited Austin about 2-3 times a year in the past few years and I can honestly say this space was one of my favorite places to stay in. It‚Äôs a small and cozy space that is equally perfect for those who are traveling solo or traveling with a plus one. There are some strings of light bulbs outside the patio that can be turned on at night. And it looks really nice!

The only ‚Äúdownside‚Äù was the blind cover above the front door from the inside of the space. I‚Äôm on the shorter side in the height department and struggled a bit to pull down the blind. But that‚Äôs just a personal issue. And it wasn‚Äôt bothersome enough to say anything negative about the place. I would definitely want to stay in this space again.

Everything was great in the beginning. The host was very responsive and sent lots of helpful information about the austin area. However, the night we arrived we were informed that pest control would be coming in to spray the apartment. There was already visible cockroach killer along the baseboards of the apartment and after pest control came there were also roach traps put out. The pest control people honestly didn‚Äôt even seem like they were a legit company. They arrived in a honda wearing basic clothes with what seemed like store bought cockroach killer. During the entire 2 week stay we had to of seen at least 80 cockroaches, dead or alive. I found a dead cockroach in the blender and in our clothes. When I first texted the host about this problem they informed me that they would be sending pest control to spray AGAIN, but to my knowledge never came by. Not that I‚Äôm sure more store bought killer really would have solved the problem. When I messaged them about the problem for a second time, 4 days before our checkout day, they never even replied and all I got was an automated message explaining what to do for checkout. I sent them over 10 pictures of some cockroaches that I had come across, but still never got a reply. The apartments are also not in the safest feeling area. Cops were called to these apartments at least 4 times while we were there, once being because someone punched another persons apartment window out. I also mentioned that to the host, but never got a response. The outlet in the bathroom also does not work. Overall such a disappointing experience and I would not recommend anyone to stay here.

The unit is located in a sketchy apartment complex.. we heard someone getting threatened with stabbing right outside of my window and to top it off, we couldn't take a shower because "it was being repaired.."
According to the host, the water situation was being repaired before we even checked in , but he thought it would be fixed by the time we arrived...well it wasn't.
After several attempts in trying to communicate & resolve everything with the host..they were reluctant to make things right. I spend the rest of the first night on the phone with Airbnb customer service for hours & they helped me cancel the reservation and relocated us the next morning.
Also, $85 for a pet fee is a bit much. It's not mentioned under "house rules"...so you have to read their entire listing to know about it. If you're booking last minute, you have to be mindful of this if you're traveling with your pups. Otherwise, you'll be locked into this reservation and forced to pay $85.

The host was great and communicated very well with me! Unfortunately when we arrived the apartment wasn‚Äôt cleaned but I got a refund for that night. The neighbors were very loud/ fighting constantly, dogs barking throughout the day and night along with very loud music until 4am (paper thin walls extremely loud got no sleep) Obvious drug activity in the complex and random homeless addicts knocking on my door. If you‚Äôre looking for something a decent price and you‚Äôre not gonna be home all day this might be fine for you. If you have family/kids with you I would 100% not stay here!

I have to be completely honest, I had a horrible stay. I‚Äôm a female nurse and it was my first time traveling alone on a assignment and it was the most scariest most stressful stay! The inside of the apartment was great nothing about the inside was bad at all. It was what went on outside or next door even. I hardly got any sleep at the sounds of cries and yelling from a young woman being beaten from an older man. There was always something going on outside that was sketchy and quite frankly I didn‚Äôt even want to come home from work. To make matters worst, I brought my dog with me and I had to send him home the very next day because he ingested drugs from either the grass or underneath the bed. I had to take him to the vet, where they told me he was expressing symptoms of drug ingestion . It was horrible. He was so disoriented and wobbly. ‚òπÔ∏è there is no way ever I would ever stay there again. I‚Äôm sorry

I guess for the price, you get what you pay for. The hosts were nice, the location, not so much. The location itself wasn‚Äôt too bothersome, it was mostly the loud neighbors on the top floor that were really noisy from 8pm - 3am, and while they say no smoking in the room - cigarette and weed run through the vents and filled the room. Cleanliness wise, the pull out couch had stains on the sheets, alongside with feeling the springs hitting every part of your body. The bed itself was clean, but rock hard, along with the pillows. :/ And unfortunately on all of our nights we stayed there (5), we found at least 2-3 cockroaches :( every day - which I feel is just due to the location. The blinds on the windows need to be fixed and are missing a few panels.. so the neighbors can see through the front and the back (where the bed is). I can honestly only say the only good things were the hosts checked in on us throughout the trip (granted I never really spoke to them or about any of my concerns) and not too far from Austin.
No

DO NOT STAY HERE!!!  THEY HAVE BUGS. I did not enjoy my stay here because there was bugs. Also the communication was awful. It will take the host hour to respond back and I was responding to them right away. They came off very rude and wasn‚Äôt really friendly at all. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend.

The kitchen was well stocked, and the art on the walls was beautiful. Unfortunately, this place had some issues: roaches, an uncomfortable bed, filthy laundry area, and the host.
The bed: Mattress is made out of a stiff foam, not springs. I found it difficult to get a good rest on the bed which felt quite hard to me.
Roaches: They are coming in through an outlet in the bathroom. I told the host and even sent a photo explaining the problem but it has been a week and nothing has been done.
Laundry: The laundry area, (shared by the apartment complex) is the worst I have ever encountered and needs to be cleaned up.
The host: I noticed issues the first day I spent there (non-working TV, broken blinds) but it took 5 days, several messages, and more photos for the host to come and do some work, and even then not all of the issues were addressed.
This location is improving, and has the potential to be a really nice little place, but more work needs to be done and to be finished in a reasonable amount of time.

Communication was not polite. I called when we were staying there. They did not call me back. The response came via text and it was not polite. I told them about issues in the apartment but they did not care to apologies for that. Actually they totally ignored it.
The floor under the bed was not clean.

There are random people outside wandering around with alcohol trying to talk to me. Telling me they got kicked out if the building because they turned them into air bnb‚Äôs. Clearly they are on drugs and this is alarming. I am paying a decent rate to stay here and now I am concerned about my personal property and my Lexus. If the drug dealer remains on the property today,  I will be calling the police. I came here to be safe and secure and this is not what I expected for $100 a night. Unfortunately now its hard for me to find another Air BNB close or I would just leave. I‚Äôve just had a major surgery and need to be near my doctor. The drug dealer drives a motorcycle and sits on the side under the covered parking and sells to the people in the neighborhood. I have a Photo of him and will be taking other photos when they are near my car and exchanging money for drugs which I witnessed last night. He is not trying to be low key it‚Äôs very obvious. Im really beyond upset I have to deal with any of this type of behavior, not to mention them approaching me and complaining about being kicked out due to air bnb. I am just a guest here and shouldn‚Äôt have strangers mad at me bc I‚Äôve decided to book here.

Very rough experience with this stay. Although the apartment appeared to be in order, there were many issues. The water pressure was non-existent when turning it to hot. The whole stay we had to take lukewarm showers and had to wash my hair in the sink due to there being no water pressure. There were crumbs all over the pull out couch and a roach crawling on top of the stove. There was a roach trap in the bathroom that we would not have seen had we not taken the trash out. I feel as though I paid for more than what I received.
Host was communicative and responsive. But there are maintenance problems in the house that need to be solved

The place was fine but check in and check out were both pretty painful. Contradictory instructions and had to spend time waiting to get in. At check out the parking fob didn‚Äôt work and we were told two different codes for the lockbox.

The host never answered messages. I had to contact the support several times to get basic answers. We waited for check in instructions but they never came. Even on the day of our stay - still nothing. Eventually support just refunded me for the stay but we had to find alternative place last minute and very late and this was extremely inconvenient.

Good location and communication.  Not a great value for how small the space is.  Old school blinds in the bedroom are missing some slats and slats will fall down when you close them.  We were constantly trying to fix them. This lets in extreme morning sun from the East.

Very sketchy location, would not suggest. Place is extremely misleading from  the pictures! Cancelled on the date that I would be refunded the cleaning fee and now owner is saying she will not refund it, even though I stepped inside for maybe 10 mins and left immediately.

It had been awhile since I'd booked an AirBnb and the amount of chores/cleaning that is expected on top of the cleaning fee is egregious. We checked out the nearby boutique hotel (South Congress Hotel - def pricey!) after checking in to this place and it would have been less expensive to stay there with a check in time prior to 4p and a check out time later than 11a. Plus, I wouldn't have had to run all trash into the alleyway before I left and make sure the dishes were all clean in the dishwasher, along with towels all collected in the "right" spots. I'm fine doing that if I'm also not paying a cleaning fee or paying less overall, but this wasn't worth the $ spent. The house is obviously just used for AirBnb and while all cleaned up, we obviously got the second hand uncomfortable furniture, musty towels, they advertised being able to listen to records (the record player has no needle), and the kitchen didn't have adequate supplies/utensils to cook in for 5 people.

The apartment was very nice and cleaned. Lot of space everywhere. Nice view and many places to go around.  What we didn't like is that the apartments were very noisy; dogs barking all night, people running,  and being so loud. The swimming pool was a lied. It Was so dirty , lot of trash everywhere. we didn't get to enjoy it ,so sad. we had planned to be home and bbq for a weekend day but didn't happen. The pool was under construction and we were not told anything before our stay.

Very clean and updated inside. We arrived late a night so it was a little difficult to find. Only negative was the drive way is shared which we didn‚Äôt know so it was a bit shocking to come back late a night and see another vehicle in the drive. Other than that it was about 20 minutes from downtown.

Absolutely incredible hosts sometimes you really don‚Äôt get a feel for one‚Äôs personality when it is a self checking but these two are something else. I have never felt more safe and accommodated in my entire time using this app.
Drew was nothing but great! He was very accommodating and quick to answers all of questions and asks throughout our stay.

Nice location and big house with lots of rooms to accommodate a large group.  The only drawback is it‚Äôs located right off a busy street so tons of noise and tough to sleep at night. Lots of homeless folks floating around the block so that was annoying getting confronted multiple times by individuals.
Not as good as it‚Äôs described

The only bathroom sink didn't work so if you like brushing your teeth and doing your personal hygiene in the kitchen in front of everyone.. this place is for you! Also I am terrified that the sheets weren't clean and washed when we arrived. There were crumbs and dirt in the bed. The host messaged me the day before my check in saying the place wouldn't be ready until 6 pm because they had no one to clean it and I said that's not possible because we have a dog and dinner reservations. They said they found someone to clean it but looking at the bed sheets and floors I don't think it was ever cleaned. Also, the neighborhood is nice but two blocks over is a really sketchy gas station and businesses I didn't feel safe at in broad daylight.

Parking is not included on premises. It is street parking, therefore not on premises. Parked on parking lot and had my vehicle towed, host refused to reimburse. Bathtub walls were dirty and had hair. Bathroom mirror was filthy. Bed had hair in it and AC in bedroom does not work.. do not recommend. Terrible experience, mattress and pillows not god either.

This was beyond my worst experience. I understand things happen and people make mistakes but this was a series of careless mistakes. First I was told I couldn‚Äôt stay at the property because of a maintenance issue (which is understandable). But I was told this the day of the reservation. I was sent to a different property which turned out to be occupied. A scared couple opened the door and when I tried to communicate with the host they didn‚Äôt believe me and I didn‚Äôt hear back from them until hours later. They offered a refund but  I didn‚Äôt want to look for another place to stay since it was late and I was tired because I go to Austin for work. Finally I was sent to the third property and the place was unsafe. The location was not great and the door didn‚Äôt even lock. Instead of being apologetic they were rude and argumentative.  Their initial messages led me to believe they had an understanding about good customer service but that is not true.
No hot water for entire 2 days we stayed there and the host never mentioned that the hot water won‚Äôt be there. And it‚Äôs an apartment you will be renting, if you are not aware.

Our stay was scheduled during a bad ice storm in Texas, Winter Storm Landon. I got into an accident myself the morning of our trip due to such terrible road conditions and was hoping to cancel, however our host was not willing to provide a partial or full refund or allow us to rebook for another weekend, so we had to make it down in unsafe weather conditions. Check-in and check-out was easy and the place was clean, had adequate amenities and had an OK stay. However, the quality of the apartment and complex was very underwhelming,  and in a not very safe area of Austin.

The washer and dryer are not within the unit; they are in the public laundry room. I have to say that that is the dirtiest laundry room I have used. I think the facility is an apartment complex, not a condo, so the renters don't take care of the complex as well as condo owners. The common area outside the pool is covered with dog poops.  The place is conveniently located.

Airbnb version of a motel, good if you just need a place to sleep, thoroughly unpleasant if you plan to spend time there :) best part: very comfy bed. Worst part: exposed electric wires and struggling a/c
We couldn‚Äôt take a single shower because there was not any hot water while our staying. Floor was bit dirty our new slippers soles all dirty enough. Second bedroom‚Äôs pan was dusty.

We stayed just one night at this apartment. It would have been a nice stay if the light in the bathroom was working. We did not notice the problem until the evening. So showering and using the facilities was not an easy task. We waited until morning to contact the owner to inform them of the problem and ask could any kind of compensation be made for this major inconvenience, but was told that because we had just checked out, there was nothing that that they could nor would do.
My advice for acquiring this rental, walk the entire building, turning on all lights and check everything because if you do not immediately report it, the owner will do nothing to compensate.

Overall I can see why this would be a great place to stay, but our stay wasn't great.

- The toilet would smell terrible any time it was flushed, and that smell would leak out into the boat. It's also very close to the bed to so we had to agree to wait until morning to go. I suspect something needed cleaning?
- When we stayed there was a tarp with a flag in front of the sunset-facing side of the boat that isn't reflected in the images, so sitting on the roof wasn't really what we had expected.
Idk
Cute !! very clean but if u are picky about ur bed n pillows i would bring ur own, veryyy soft , my partner & I had trouble sleeping.
Nice cozy space, not great location, but it‚Äôs Austin so you get what you pay for.

Great communication from host, clear and easy instructions were provided to check in. The place was clean and quiet. It is a remodeled econo lodge and there are people that actually live there. The property was gated, but the gate was open every time I entered the property. There did seem to be a decent number of people loitering and there seemed to be a lot of dog waste on the property which was disappointing when I walked my pup  we were having to avoid lots of land mines.

I never got to use the code to unlock the gate, despite having expressed my issue multiple times, the host didn‚Äôt do anything to solve my problem. She inly suggested I spoke with the people at the office in the building which didn‚Äôt work because as I said when I booked the airbnb I came for work and would leave too early and come back too late.

Shirliene was very welcoming and checked in to make sure our stay was going well several times! The check-in and check-out process was a breeze. We didn‚Äôt have any issues with the apartment itself at all. The reason for the four star review is that the complex was very unkept and smelled pretty badly. There were numerous amounts of trash outside, near the parking, the walkways and elsewhere but I‚Äôd say that is due to poor management of the property.

The apartment complex has several buildings with the same apartment numbers. It was late when I got there (I was there because my mom was admitted to the hospital while we were on vacation ). I went to the wrong building trying to get in. When I called the communication wasn‚Äôt great. Nice but not great.

There was no microwave (which may have been in the description but I was surprised). The shower curtain fell down. There was no way of tightening the bar. The place looked clean, but when I moved the couch (to get closer to a plug that didn‚Äôt work) it was filthy underneath.

When I went to leave to go to the hospital the next morning, I couldn‚Äôt lock the door. I sent videos showing what I was doing. I ended up leaving it unlocked. Luckily no one came in.

The place was just ok. I would not go back.

The place is nice with a good view. The only thing that bothered me is the $100 cleaning fee which is not to clean up after your stay, but to clean up after the people before you, so you basically have to clean before you leave. $100 for such a small place is already outrageous as most small apartments are around $50 for a cleaning fee but then the fact that it‚Äôs not even to clean up after you leave is ridiculous. There‚Äôs also an ant problem which got a little annoying.

Overpriced for what you get, absolute bare minimum involved on every level. Thin walls, lacking water pressure, genius engineering with the hanging shelves just waiting for the lamps to fall off of (most likely they‚Äôd charge you a fee if this happened), noticeably dirty utensils and kitchenware. The most red tape and fee threatening I‚Äôve experienced on here. If it was 40% cheaper I would put up with everything.

Check in process was seamless and directions were easy to get to. The home is decorated nicely with great design elements. We‚Äôre not familiar with Austin area and the location of the home came at a surprise. Maybe they had a rough day with stocking up and cleaning, but this Airbnb didn‚Äôt meet our expectations and was quite underwhelming. This is our first negative review on Airbnb. I don‚Äôt like writing negative reviews, but just be aware.

the place was not very clean, it had dust on the backs of the beds,
the pillows in the main room stank,
the livingroom was dirty and they write you to come out early even you know the time of leaving

During my stay someone entered my air bnb at 2:42 am to be exact i heard the door open & advised the host clearly it is an automatic message because they responded with an number for the host when i advised them someone came inside i text/call the host no response LOL now it gets better .... i had to sleep w a chair infront of the door and the table by the sliding door thats how paranoid i was after someone came inside, i knew someone had entered because i locked the door and when i put the chair infront of the door it closed shut meaning someone still had the code to the door to enter to house PLEASE DO NOT STAY HERE IT IS NOT SAFE i called air bnb they refunded me and sent me to somewhere safer... the crazy thing is the host NEVER responded to air bnb until TWO days after this happened meaning it is an automatic message responding this is not a safe place at all .
It was a good house, not the best location, next time will be doing a little more of a thorough research into locations.

the place is it great and the location it's very good the neighborhood the quiet but the internet is very sucks if you care about the internet I'm not ready to command this place everything was good except the Internet it was a relay trouble and the host was not helpful when you listen to my message you reply to you after 2 days when you called the management nobody answer even when you email them there never reply to you
Place looked exactly as pictured and there were no issues during the stay. One of the cleanest places with plenty of linen for the stay.

We had several issues with our stay. We had a pretty large group of people and it was not sufficient for the occupancy advertised. The pull out bed was extremely uncomfortable. The springs were poking us throughout the night. Insufficient bed linens were provided for the air mattress and pull out bed. The air mattress was not at the Airbnb when we arrived. Also, the AC circulation was not great. The upstairs was much warmer than upstairs, and in the heat of an Austin summer this was uncomfortable.

Additionally, there was only one shower. The water in the shower was cold to lukewarm, and the sink in the bathroom was clogged.

On the plus side, the host was very responsive, but this did not outweigh the many issues.

The apartment is right off 71 and I-35 in a quiet neighborhood. We are working at Circuits of America for a couple of days and this is a short drive over to downtown.
We got in early and walked over to Vic‚Äôs BBQ and it is a hidden Gem! Note, the apartment is on the 2nd floor. House was clean and had all the amenities we needed.
The furniture was comfortable and the google fiber internet was plenty fast, but we didn't get to enjoy it much as we spent most of our waking time exploring Austin.
Nice place for the price. The neighborhood was a bit of a concern, but we had no issues.

Everything was good except the parking. Nowhere in the checkin instructions it is mentioned that you have to pay separately for parking and no instructions on where to park. We had to pay $40 per night üôÜ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
Not smooth check in. About a dozen things broken. Moist bathroom. Would not book again.
Top notch, very modern with executive yet hip feeling. For better or worse, very corporate, luxurious and clean but in my opinion a bit impersonal.

I stayed here in January 2022.  The condo is super cute and the hosts have clearly put a lot of work into renovating and decorating.  And the host Meg is lovely and was always very quick to respond my questions.  Unfortunately, I would not stay here again unless the central air HVAC system has been replaced.  It does not function well and it simply cannot maintain a comfortable temperature inside the condo.  If you read the previous reviews you will see that a few guests mentioned that they had problems with the AC, but that the host was able to quickly "resolve" or "mitigate" the problems.  When I checked in, upon first walking through the condo I noticed that there are two very large free-standing AC units, which are not shown in the pictures.  Immediately I realized this was the "resolution" or "mitigation" to previous guests' AC complaints.  (When I bookd the reservation, based on the photos I assumed the condo had a central air HVAC system.  If I had known the condo requires additional "free-standing AC units" or a "window unit AC" or anything similar, then I would have never booked.)  There is one free-standing AC unit in each bedroom.  The unit in the first floor bedroom interferes with the ability to walk around the bed because of the small size of the bedroom relative to the large size of the AC unit.  Upon seeing that in the bedroom, my boyfriend was immediately shocked and suggested we complain to the host, leave the condo, and book a nearby hotel.  I suggested we simply move it off to the side out of the way since it has wheels and we wouldn't be needing AC in the cold January weather anyway.   So we did and we stayed.  Overnight the first night we found out that it was terribly uncomfortable inside the condo because the heat from the central air HVAC system was unable to warm the condo.  The next day during the day was fine, but in the evening the condo was again extremely cold and very uncomfortable despite running the heat from the central air HVAC all day.  So I notified the host it was too cold inside the condo.  The host asked if I had tried using the "heat mode" on the free-standing AC units.  I was not aware that those free-standing units had a heat mode.  So we immediately turned on the heat mode on those free-standing units.  This successfully warms the bedrooms, but the kitchen, living room, and bathrooms are still too cold. Additionally, any future guests should also be aware that the free-standing units are very noisy. So being a light sleeper, I did not get a good night rest for the next two nights.  Based on my experience during the winter, I have to assume that the summer months would result in the condo being too hot without using the large and very noisy free-standing AC units.  So despite the host's lovely personality and the nicely decorated condo, I would not stay here again unless the central air HVAC system has been fully replaced and the free-standing AC units have been removed.

The location isn‚Äôt bad. However, there was an issue with the cleanliness and the property management didn‚Äôt handle the problem well at all. Poor communication/misinformation.

First off, the cleaning staff was late. We were informed this an hour prior to arrival. We went into the airbnb to drop off our things as we had a dinner reservation to attend. The cleaning lady was still there and didn‚Äôt speak any English. The property management didn‚Äôt offer any additional accommodations. Our things could‚Äôve been stolen or lost.

The cleaning staff didn‚Äôt replace the toilet paper, left the dryer running with towels inside, none of the trash bins had bags on them, etc. This just made us think what else was not cleaned/handled. We understand that they were late due to their car breaking down but this wasn‚Äôt acceptable.

Lastly, the pool was closed due to construction. This should‚Äôve been informed to us early on. We went to the pool to find out yellow construction tape stopping us from going in.
good place but the stairs for me is the only negative

This area is not cleanly, there was garbage and a horrible stench throughout the duration of my stay. You definitely get the bare minimum for what you pay for. Pay the extra money and get something nicer. Apartment was not clean when I arrived and the A/C unit made very loud sounds throughout the night which kept me up.
Not a safe place to stay, lots of gun violence, happening in the complex
Good value, lots of amenities. Fast communication from Beth..I mostly spent my trip in North Austin but it is a little difficult to get downtown.

Cozy studio layout in a two story complex. The room doesn't get much natural light since there's only one window. The entrance is right off the highway feeder that's currently under construction so it can be slow getting in and out. There's nothing in the neighborhood and I wouldn't recommend walking about.

Very tiny space. Not the greatest neighborhood. It is gated when the gate is actually closed.  Pool and gym close after 9 unfortunately working nights couldn‚Äôt utilize them much. Overall good for shorter term stays gets to be very cramped for long term

This has been my worst Airbnb experience so far. BUT...it's important to note that the team at The Bindel was extraordinary. The communication was always fast and polite. They solved every problem they could.

It's also important that this review is for an apartment at the Corazon, not Soco based on a slight mix up.

Pros about the apartment: covered secure parking, great location.

First, the only complaint about the host is that the apartment isn't as well-equipped as I'm used to. I was there for a couple months. There were like 8 hangers, no toilet brush, no cleaning supplies, no outdoor furniture, and minimal kitchen utensils. For some people that might not matter but if you like to cook in, you should know.

Other things of note: the bedroom has large slat blinds so light comes in and it's hard to make the bedroom dark. The apartment was infested with bugs...even in the fridge which I've never seen before. The host tried to get it taken care of but there's only so much you can do. So i couldn't have any food in the apartment that wasn't sealed. And no produce.

This apartment (420) was right next to the trashroom. So there is a ton of noise and even more bugs than other apartments, I imagine. It's also right at the stairs and the freight elevator. Next time I use a serviced apartment I would ask about the exact location, assuming the apartments available are the hardest ones to rent. I would also always google the building for reviews before I confirmed a reservation. This one had a lot of complaints about safety and homeless people. I didn't experience any of this during my stay.

The other guests/residents are so messy it's shocking. There was trash in the halls every day, and dog poop in the hall and on the stairs. I've lived in many apartment buildings and have never seen anything like it.

So in a nutshell, I might rent another Bindel apartment but I'd ask a lot more questions about the location first and would know I needed to bring more of my own stuff. But, I would not spend another night in this actual apartment. In fact, I left 8 days early as I was just over it.
They are terrible. Nobody communicates.
Good place for four people. Not recommended for six as only two beds and the couch isn't comfortable.
We had a decent stay here.  It was in a great location but the apartment was not very clean when we arrived.

Proximity to downtown and other major highways/interstates was convenient. Hosts were responsive, kind and understanding.

Beware, there is a new apartment complex being constructed next door. If you‚Äôre sensitive to jack hammering, beeping, loud banging‚Ä¶.you‚Äôll not enjoy. If you‚Äôll be working remotely this is a distraction that doesn‚Äôt let up. If you‚Äôll be out of the unit early morning and out for most of the day it won‚Äôt bother you at all.
Good, quiet house. Not much traffic. Great access to and from I-35. Fast internet. Cozy house.

Lydia's place is a great choice for a dog-friendly, budget stay near downtown. Ignore other reviews that state it is not in a "good area". As a former Austin resident, you will be hard pressed to find a bad area of Austin in general. The kitchen is well stocked. The queen bed is a smidge uncomfortable, but that would not prevent me from booking again.
El alojamiento es tal cual lo describe la publicaci√≥n. Lydia estuvo en constante comunicaci√≥n y no hubo ning√∫n detalle durante nuestra estancia. Muy recomendable.

Lydia's house me was small and clean. However, not a very good experience. There were a lot of ants in the kitchen and a large cockroaches flew at me when I opened up a door. When I sent a message I did get a nice response from the hosts but it also seemed it was an educational message on what type of roach it was and where they like to be? I really don't care what type of roach it was, it's gross and flew at me! When I asked about the ants they responded with they have been trying to get rid of them and would try something stronger. That wasn‚Äôt very helpful for my situation. We ended up not making our breakfast in the morning because they kitchen was infested with ants. We ended up going to a restaurant, which we didn‚Äôt want to do since we like to make our own meals.

The back bedroom was freezing cold as the front bedroom was hot as hell. I had my wife and sons sleep in the warmer room while I froze my ass off with my dogs.
Worst Airbnb experience!

Do not stay here... it is a wonderful location. So close to everything but you can get your car towed because the apartment is not supposed to be on Airbnb. The manager came to the door to let us know that it is a violation for us to have stayed there. Trash was built up by the apartment the whole time we stayed and there were flies/gnats constantly.

Not as good as I expected! Location is great but definitely is not the best air b&b I have stayed in. The carpet and coach in the living room where full of crisps bites, the beds are not really comfy, there is only one key to access the place, the closets are full of stuff like dirty clothes and old tv screens.

*^Terrible Experience;
not only did it take our taxi an extra 20min to find the development, we still couldn‚Äôt find the exact apartment. We called the ‚Äúhost‚Äù Christian 5-6x, there was no answer. Just texts that he‚Äôs busy.
He then finally had Sarah call us. She was nice enough to spend time directing us.
Christian was still unreachable, we called him many many times.
Upon finally reaching apartment building 923 in the Taxi, we went upstairs and saw the apartment wasn‚Äôt clean, beds were unmade. We took many photos. Christian texted that cleaning lady was coming in 2min, but no one showed up. Extremely frustrated, and very tired we booked a nearby Hotel.

The following needs to be made aware for future bookings ;
1. map directions were terrible, very unclear
3. development name wasn‚Äôt provided
2. the place is up a very steep hill
3. no combo was given for the gate
4. NO elevator at the building
5. Note; apartment is up a flight of stairs on 2nd Floor

We were very disappointed because our group got Covid before our trip and we tried to message and call Christian multiple times to move our trip to a later date or cancel due to the unfortunate circumstances, and Christian did not respond.

WARNING: DO NOT BOOK THIS AIR BNB!

I had booked this Airbnb months before our expected arrival date and had been in communication with the co-hosts of this property, all the way up until the DAY before check in with no issues. The day we arrived to Austin, I reached out several times without any response from any of the three hosts of this Airbnb. Our check-in time was supposed to be 4 PM and I ended up having to call Airbnb customer service in order to get ahold of the owners and they cancelled at 4:45PM, 45 minutes AFTER we were supposed to have already checked in. There were seven of us stranded in a thunderstorm, with luggage, and cancelled dinner reservations due to the lack of communication on their end. (ALSO one of the girls in our group is 6 months pregnant and she had to wait around with us).

I can‚Äôt believe how unprofessional this host was. When guests cancel days even months before, we pay for the booking, but hosts can cancel day off and they have no consequences or system in place - they should have a clear policy for hosts - like if you cancel day of - you give a full refund and $500 to guests to offset the inconvenience and price of finding a new spot day of at the very least.

We never heard from the host himself either, Airbnb had to get ahold of him and tell us as the middle man that our host cancelled last minute. It made it feel like we were completely scammed.

- the pull out couch is broke
- the listing says two beds but there is not
- the heat was on in the summer and wouldn‚Äôt turn off
- No AC
- shower gel was empty
- the check in process was a lot of extra steps and annoying for what it was

Why can I not give 6stars for the communication with me?
Airbnb was as described so no reason to argue or less stars..
Will only stay here when in austin

Spa didn‚Äôt work and kids were not happy about it. After asking the host and waiting few hours, a handyman showed up to fix the spa and not a spa technician. Not work 2,000 for a nights stay. Total waste of my bucks!

Stay itself was great but we did have a few things come up. Multiple roaches were roaming around the property, which was concerning. One of the sleeping bunkers downstairs had loose bolts and was very unstable, we were unable to sleep even the baby on it as it would sway quite a bit. Hardly any hot water throughout the property. Couldn't get a hold of anyone to update as we saw it later in the evening after check in.

Looks like this is in a old motel converted to a apartment, very very old, AC didn‚Äôt work, no views from widows only a parking lot, neighbors staring at you when you arrive not a hello or smile.  Slept awful beds uncomfortable and hot.  Bathroom tiny and poor quality shower bath. Again looks like a 1960s era motel not updated.  Same cost could have stayed in a 5 star hotel with amenities and AC that works.
Sehr sch√∂ne Lage mitten in der Natur. Crystal Creek ist wirklich spektakul√§r und vor allem die Kinder liebten es.

Not somewhere I would stay again.  Not the best of neighborhoods.  Commercial jets flying over house. Neighbor has a dog that barks early a.m. And ... the house has a faint, unpleasant odor coming from bathroom (sewer). Also, the host asks you to text him directly when you check out. The reason being that he will contact you outside of airbnb and offer you a $50 discount at any of his other properties if you leave a five star review ... which means you can't trust the reviews on this property (or any of the properties he manages).
The place was great! Stocked kitchen and most things you would need are there. The only thing we didnt love was the bathroom sliding doors that are very difficult to close and lock.

The location and the home itself is nice. The neighborhood is quiet and calm. The issues we (6 adults) had was that upon our arrival that Friday evening, we noticed that the toilet/chain was broken. We informed the owner by 10AM the Saturday morning and basically, the toilet wouldn‚Äôt be fixed until Sunday at 2PM yet check out is 11AM. We spent our whole stay sticking our hands in the toilet to manually flush it. Additionally, the shower curtain liner was filthy. It had red/orange stains on it. We couldn‚Äôt tell if it was hair dye or rust but it wasn‚Äôt something any of us wanted to look at while showering. Some of the towels were also dirty.

The location is not in the greatest area unfortunately. I did message about the toilet not working properly and never heard anything back the whole trip, it was a huge Inconvenience to not have a properly working toilet (it wouldn‚Äôt flush unless you did it upwards of 4 times). The biggest kicker was we saw a total of 5 cockroaches during our stay which is the reasoning for my 3 star.. probably time to spray again

Die Wohnung ist mit liebe eingerichtet und hat alles was man braucht.
Die lage ist sch√∂n und in der n√§he von vielen guten Restaurant. Sehr empfehlenswert!

The location Peter sent for check-in was different than what is under his listing. What was more concerning than a change in address was the way he handled it. He insisted on having communication outside of the Airbnb app and called me 10 times in less than an hour when I clearly told him I could not take phone calls at the time. Small space suitable for solo or couple travelers. We did bring our one year old and it does get difficult now and then especially during meal time cuz there no dedicated eating space. Overall still a good experience

I would not recommend this place. It was a cute place but the bed that was given was not comfortable at all. Bugs were everywhere. And the floor made the bottom of my feet black when I FIRST got there. The dishes they provided were not clean and just thrown back in the cabinets. And it‚Äôs supposed to be fenced in complex but the gates were always broken. Definitely spend your money elsewhere. Your body will thank you.

Pros:
Good location, pool and gym were nice, onsite laundry, AC worked well.

Cons:
Dirty apartment (shower curtain liner was gross, bedding didn't appear to be clean, live roaches everywhere), cheap bed (you could feel the springs), stove didn't work super well (couldn't boil water), exit gate was constantly open, bathroom vaguely smelled like weed.

The room is very accurate, small, beat, everything you need if you dont mind it being small. The toilet did not produce enough water to flush, i had to use a pot to fill up w sink water to flush the toilet.  Very annoying.  Maybe they fixed it by now who knows.

Overall, the house was fine & matched the description of the listing. The house is located just 10 min. drive to downtown which was nice. However, we were quite disappointed with the lack of communication when we encountered issues. Within a few hours of arriving & sitting on the couch to relax, two of its legs broke. I wrote GuestSpace to let them know & they responded promptly asking if maintenance could come look at it the next day to which I responded "Sure! I will say it is quite stained and appears that it has tried to be repaired before. The living room chairs are quite stained too." However, they never responded! Then the following morning, we woke up to loud/unexpected drilling on the roof. When I wrote GuestSpace to ask if someone was supposed to be working on the roof (because we were never told), they apologized & said they were just informed but would check with the owner to see how long the roof would be getting fixed BUT then no one followed up!

Be careful of this house. The pool was full of algae and wasn‚Äôt usable. Communication to solve issues was good but a lot of wasted time and effort since we had to leave house since the pool wasn‚Äôt usable.

This house was dirty from the time we arrived. The outside table has sticky marks, there were dead bugs in upstairs shower, the fridge crevice was full of old crumbs and the futons upstairs also had crumbs as well (I attached a pic of everything mentioned above from when we checked in. )
We immediately noticed spiders and bugs and a lack of cleanliness. When we went outside the pool was beautiful however all the walkways around it were full of debris metal rubber leaves and sticks . The back fence is falling down , the outdoor area was over grown, the grass nor greenery seemed to have had recently been tended too. Steps were full of dirt in every corner . See pictures. And Spiders were dropping down everywhere from the upstairs porch .
Near the pool as we were taking a tour One of my kids immediately stepped on something sharp. From that point on everyone had to keep shoes on as the grounds were unsafe . How is that fun or acceptable?
Needless to say, We spent our first evening killing spiders and cleaning spider webs only for the sun to go down and the roaches come out !!!!
They were parading across the ceiling floors and coming out of the walls . It was a disaster! I wanted to leave so bad however my husband and kids had this planned for Mother‚Äôs Day and we had other plans in the city and vehicles rented as well that had already been paid for . So I sucked it up and cleaned so that I would be able to somewhat feel comfortable laying my kids down for bed . While in the process of killing roaches at about 11:20 pm we found the live scorpion in the upstairs bathroom. I called the 24 hour emergency line Renters Club-as Felton our direct rep was not responding, and no one even answered. What an emergency line!!

We checked in at approximately 430pm Friday and we killed bugs and cleaned all evening and I have texts to Renters Club-Felton as proof . The next day we were promised the cleaners would come at 10-1030. Which was a delay in our fun as who wants cleaners they don‚Äôt know in the home with all their belongings. However 10 or 1030 wasn‚Äôt the case . They showed up at 11 . So from 430 the day before until 11 the next day we had to wait for them to arrive and 11-12 morning wasted wasted watching after the cleaning crew , And then after that Renters Club-Kim showed up with her blower to clean a filthy outdoor area when I made it clear that a pressure washer would really be necessary! She was only there approximately 35 minutes . When she left the outdoor area was still so bad ,we needed a broom. I had to request that they send her back with a broom .And y‚Äôall did send her back with a broom to leave me how unacceptable .The filth and bugs may be suitable for a group looking to party but it definitely was not suitable for a family with kids . However even a party would be mad to see the outdoor area filthy and inoperable.
Kim got done with her cleaning at 1236 as that‚Äôs when I texted Renters Club asking for a broom . And then pest control came about 1 and said we couldn‚Äôt have the kids outside until the stuff dried and said it takes 30 minutes to dry. they left around 130pm. So from 2pm Saturday until 11 am Sunday is all we had in a somewhat maintained property. Renters club and this disgusting house wasted half my weekend . Oh and they have cameras facing the pool that were not mentioned in the listing . They deserve to have this listing pulled from Air bnb. The home is a safety hazard , infested with roaches and ran by a sub par rental company . In addition to illegally recording me! One plus is I didn‚Äôt get bit with any bed bugs! Yuck! Buyer definitely beware of this one !
good location. pool area was not very clean. easy on and off to anywhere.

When I first entered the room, the smells is sticky there. My body started inching when I get to the sofa and bed. How can I go to the hospital to say I‚Äôm so itch by the room I rent. How can I afford the hospital fee? The room broke my trip. Airbnb doesn‚Äôt work well too. Never use it again
No hot water Fri to Sun! Everything else great - location, cleanliness, furnishings. But cold showers were a problem

Was very excited to book a place so close to downtown Austin for an upcoming weekend trip. However, the host cancelled my reservations at 3 AM the day I was supposed to arrive. I had to find another place to stay extremely last minute (had to stay 30 miles outside if Austin.) Finally got my refund over 10 days later, after already being out $500 and having to pay another $700 for the last minute reservation. Very upsetting on my end. Do not recommend.

Die Unterkunft war in Ordnung. Nach der Buchung wurde man gebeten eine Selfie mit seinem Reisepass zu machen, was ich ziemlich √ºbertrieben fand.

I‚Äôve never written a bad review on here but our experience at this property was so bad we had to leave and seek housing elsewhere. I tried to get in touch with Evonify through VM, text, and Air BnB and only received one response from a women named Jean who offered no help. Here goes: When we pulled back the sheets in the second bedroom there was hair on the sheets, I thought maybe it was a fluke but an hour later when I pulled mine back there was hair on mine too. My daughter found a crusty dried up booger stuck on her pillow case so obviously I don‚Äôt the sheets were changed between renters. The vents in this unit are obviously connected to other units because there was marijuana smoke coming into our bathroom vent, we had to run the bathroom air extractor all day. The washer and dryer don‚Äôt work. There are exposed nails from a broken shelf in the second bedroom closet where my daughters slept. good location. listing photos don't match reality altough they are similar.
place has a funky smell. one bed was broken therefore one side would sink. would not stay again in this place.

This spot is just as pictured. Not a great value, but served our need for a weekend trip. If you plan to spend a lot of time in your Air BnB instead of just sleeping, I wouldn't recommend this one.  The unit gets very little light. The couch is painfully uncomfortable - although its very cute. If you can get cozy, the TV is already hooked up to a number of streaming services, which was nice. Good place for a quicktrip. It can get a bit noisy if you are in lower floor. Lots of young people. But aside from that no issue.

Place was mostly as advertised, although we noticed a few issues:

Other than that, it was a place to stay so we were grateful.

Let me just say that the photos don‚Äôt match the apartment. It was missing the washer and dryer in unit. There was water damage on the walls in the living room (I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôs moldy behind there). I could tell that the apartment wasn‚Äôt thoroughly cleaned because of the mud left on the floors. La casa est√° bien, todo limpio, las camas son personales (para dos personas son peque√±as) hay lugar para estacionarse, la casa no est√° tan lejos del centro pero tampoco tan cerca, a la anfitriona le doy 5 ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

The tiny house was cute, but I regret staying here. The location wasn't that convenient and it was a pain to get in and out of the two gates and gravel path, especially with luggage. There were several things in disrepair and it took hours to get to a comfortable temperature because the A/C is turned off between guests. My main complaint is that there was no coffee maker, just instant packets. The furniture was all uncomfortable and the tub took 45 minutes to fill due to the small water heater. This felt like a total scam. Good communication until we got there. When we arrived it was the wrong listing and I did not hear from Evonify for quite some time. They never fixed the problem. Lindo departamento, es igual a las fotos. La cocina es muy completa, el ba√±o limpio y hab√≠a lavadora. Solo la luz del pasadizo no funcionaba, pero era un detalle m√≠nimo. Pasamos unos lindos d√≠as ah√≠

There was mold growing around the air conditioning vent and the bath towels were stained and dirty. If I could have left and gone somewhere else for the night I would have. I have allergies and asthma and the conditions in this Airbnb were unsanitary and unsafe.

The description fails to mention that the property is located right next to a large frat house, right in the middle of what is apparently called "Greek Row". On the first night of our stay -- a Thursday -- there was a massive party that raged until 2am. The second night there was an even bigger, louder party that actually spilled onto the lawn of our rental. Police showed up, there were accounts of an assault, people screaming right outside our window...

It got so out of hand that we didn't feel safe and left to get a hotel in the middle of the night.

The rental is OK apart from that, though a little pricey for what you get. But you should be aware that the same thing might happen during your stay.

Es hat alles pefekt gepasst und ich habe mich ausgesprochen wohl gef√ºhlt!
Meena ist eine wunderbare und freundliche Gastgeberin, die dir mit ihrer Unterkunft das Gef√ºhl gibt, ein St√ºck weit, in deinem eigenen Zuhause zu sein.

My stay was a negative experience due to another guest staying in the house at the same time. That said, if you‚Äôre looking for someplace affordable and within a short drive of most landmarks in Austin, this is a good option. The host was very communicative!

Do not recommend at all, the apartment smelled like smoke heavily and the bed was so bad we actually chose to sleep on the air mattress the 2nd night. We also saw roaches multiple times in the apartment. Way over priced for what we got, we couldn‚Äôt wait to go back home.
Overall nice place to stay. I would come back. It might need some fixtures around the house but I didn‚Äôt bother me.

Place was overall spacious and clean. Some red flags to watch out for: 1) bad communication. Airbnb was switched to a different address last minute and host did not update the photos or listing details. 2) After we checked out, host charged us for ADDITIONAL cleaning fee (cleaning stove, microwave, pots). These services should be covered by the cleaning fee guests pay during booking. 3) Kitchen was missing a lot of basic utensils such as spatula, cutting board, and knives.

Ivana ist eine wundervolle Gastgeberin, zuvorkommend, hilfsbereit und mehr als freundlich. Die Lage ist optimal (sehr ruhig) und man kann trotzdem alles gut erreichen. Wenn wir je wieder nach Austin kommen, dann w√§r e dies wieder unsere Unterkunft der Wahl.
Not clean and too far from the city to walk.
Good place, but note that there is no stove nor washer dryer available.

While the unit was clean and accurately represented on the interior, the exterior left much to be desired. As a solo female traveler arriving late at night, I felt extremely unsafe upon arrival. Your parking spot is located directly outside of the unit - down a dirt alley way. I feel that this information should have been stated prior to booking, not when the check-in instructions were provided 24 hours before my stay. If I had known this, I would not have stayed here. The dirt alley way is unlit, deserted, and unmarked. I was surprised I was even able to find it and immediately regretted booking this unit as I began to drive down it.

Again, the interior of the unit was nice but I would not recommend for a fellow solo female traveler.

When we got there the gate code did not work and we spent 15 minutes trying to get in. I messaged Sydney and she responded saying someone had taken a bat to it earlier and it was waiting to be fixed. I wasn‚Äôt sure why we hadn‚Äôt been informed of that ahead of time since she knew about it. And she suggested walking in the person gate and then getting the sensor to open it from the inside. But that didn‚Äôt work and when I let her know I was offered no alternative. We ended up waiting another 20 mins until someone left the complex in their car and opened the gate for us. and then we didn‚Äôt get to check in for over an hour after our check in time because the unit hadn‚Äôt been cleaned yet. And we weren‚Äôt informed of it until we were there walking up to unload our things and the cleaner told us we were not allowed to come in bc she hadn‚Äôt finished yet and was so rude. So we had to leave and come back after an hour and had to deal with the same gate fiasco.
House was decent. Check-in was easy but it‚Äôs difficult to find the place

Excelente lugar, confortable, limpio y bien ubicado. Cuenta con todas las amenidades, art√≠culos de limpieza, aseo personal, electrodom√©sticos y utensilios de cocina, no necesitas llevar nada m√°s que tu ropa.

El departamento verdaderamente es muy bueno, la ubicaci√≥n excelente sin embargo hay cuestiones que hasta que no te hospedas en notas y b√°sicamente son el exterior del inmueble est√° descuidado y sucio, el aire acondicionado es completamente ruidoso es imposible de usar para dormir, el tema m√°s preocupante fue el del ruido Del apartamento de arriba, entendiendo que son edificios de una construcci√≥n hecha con madera se alcanza escuchar todo lo que hace el vecino de arriba (mover sillas, usar ba√±os, ronquidos, televisi√≥n, hasta la vibraci√≥n de su celular, es decir se convierte en un tema muy molesto) esto no est√° en manos de Shawn pero verdaderamente afecta y por lo mismo no me volver√≠a a quedar en ese lugar.

Way too pricey for the place and the location. There‚Äôs no closet and a very small kitchenette. The dog park has barbed wire on one side and the fence is unleveled not providing proper fencing in. The place is okay but definitely not worth the price. If you‚Äôre looking for a longer stay,  just call the place and rent it from there. The gates were stuck open or not working majority of the time either.
No

Would not recommend staying at this location. The worst rental I‚Äôve ever used. Found multiple cockroaches and bugs throughout the house, dirty bed pillowcases, mold in cupboards, and did not have gas the entire stay, which meant no hot water to bathe my infant or ability to use the oven or stove. Their management company promised to fix the gas, as a top priority, and did not fix it the entire stay. I asked for a reimbursement for the days without gas and for any day following that did not have gas, to which they agreed, then went back on their promise after the stay. I will never do business with another Austin vacay property and would not recommend this location for anything more than a camping site would cost.

Our stay could of been a 5 star review, Nice central location, clean, covered carport, just as the ad says.
But Here's why it could of been a 4 star review. When we arrived after our check-in time, house keeping was still there. when we came back later, we noticed several items not working including the clothes washer. We messaged Ames-Austin reporting the problems any never hearded back from them. Ames-Austin did as we found out on the last day as we took pictures of the problems, fixed the washer and a ceiling fan without telling us they were coming in, nor did they, leave a note or message us, tell us they fixed two of three problems noted to them.
Here's why they get 3 stars.
A cold streak hit Austin during Thanksgiving 2021, we turned on the heater and ran it that evening. It warmed a few degrees, but it remained cold thru the evening. when we came back the second day I opened the heater closet and notice the gas was turned off and a letter from the gas company saying the gas company turned off and taped the valve off due to vent issues, on July 27 2021.
We messaged then called the message number listed. His first response was Hello not even saying Ames-Austin. After confirming I was talking to Ames-Austin, he reported knowing about it but thought it was fixed. I asked why the repair person, if there was one, didn't turn the gas back on. He said he would get back to us.
We got a message 24 hours later saying because it was a holiday weekend, he could not get a repair person their. He offered for to pay for us to go get a space heater, max $40. We declined his offer due the fact it was our vacation and we were not going to waste it shopping, plus it was slightly warmer.
Also, there was no bath/shower mat, it's very slippery there and a accident waiting to happen.
If they fixed all this stuff, we are not ecstatic about the communication with Ames, but would rate them higher.

The good:

The location was great located close to south Lamar and zilker and not far from downtown.

Unit looked as advertised.

The bad:

The apartment had a bit of a roach problem. When we arrived we had to sweep up and throw away 8 dead cockroaches (not exaggerating by any means) located in various corners of the kitchen, living room, and bathroom.

The garage key pad was dead and was not working during our stay so we were unable to utilize the garage parking. There was however a few open spots in the back parking lot so this was not that big of a deal.

I‚Äôve never had to leave a bad review on Airbnb, but would not recommend staying here. The home smelled of mold/mildew and then was covered up by a plug in air fresher. Within 10 mins of being there we got headaches and felt nauseous. We left for our own safety and found a hotel nearby and the host refused to give a refund.

Do not recommend this AirBnB at all. This was by far the worst AirBnB experience I've ever had. First, the place leaves a lot to be desired with cleanliness. They claim to have a cleaning crew come between guests, but I'm not sure what sort of cleaner would stand by the work done at this place. The floors were dusty and dirt/dust piled up in the corners of the rooms, (particularly in the master bedroom), the baseboards looked like they had never been dusted or scrubbed down, and the bathroom mirror had water drops and streaks all over it when I arrived. The place is also very dated and the updates were clearly just aesthetic choices for photos, because the place definitely isn't as nice as the photos would make it seem. Next, the back door was completely unlocked when I arrived, which was a major safety concern as I was traveling alone for work. Finally, my car got trapped in the garage for an entire day, which was an extreme inconvenience and led to hefty ride share charges that could have been avoided had I had access to my vehicle. I understand the garage door failing was not a direct issue of the host, but I discovered the door to be broken at 7am and it was not resolved until 10pm that night. Luckily, it was just me traveling for work so ride shares solved the issue, but I could not imagine if I had been a family relying on using a personal vehicle for car seat purposes or if I had accidentally left something I needed in my car. I did eventually get in contact with the host and they ended up sawing the garage door open so I could get my car out. However, it took longer than I would have liked to solve the issue and there were multiple times I got copy/paste messages from them (messages reminding me about taking our the trash before I left and to fill out a survey if I was leaving earlier than the 11:00AM travel time) that were clearly boiler plate language they send all their guests at certain times during their stay, but wasn't getting any updates about my vehicle being trapped in the garage. If I was the host, communicating with my guest about their trapped vehicle would have been my top priority before I even dared ask them if they were leaving early or reminding them to take out the trash. Overall, this whole stay left a very sour taste in my mouth and I completely regret booking at this property. I won't every book an AirBnB with this management company again and will instead either stay in hotels or AirBnB properties that are owned by individuals.

Can't complain too much since it was cheap and we just needed a place to stay for the night. The king size bed was extremely uncomfortable - it was too firm. It felt like sleeping on a brick. The pillows also offered no support and my partner and I both woke up with neck and back pain. The couch was more comfortable... should have just slept there.

Also at check-in, we tried to park my compact SUV in the garage as it was stated that a midsize SUV would fit but my car's roof got caught on the garage door as it did not go all the way up. That crunching noise that my car made when it made contact was a nightmare to hear. Then when we walked up at the unit door a couple of minutes after 3, the cleaner was still there hauling stuff away. He ignored us and so we just awkwardly waited for him to finish.

I would not stay here again especially since we also felt put off about the fact that they had a list of tasks for us to do at the end of our stay which while not super unreasonable, adds unneeded stress during the check-out process. This is one of those instances where I wish I just booked a hotel.

We were on vacation and expected to have all the appliances working when we arrive the garage door was broken and dented. We notified the owner. He just said thank you. We tried to wash a load of clothes in the washer dryer combo. The wash machine broke. We notified many times called airbnb because we couldn‚Äôt contact him and told him my sons clothes were trapped in the washing machine full of soap they were all new clothes that we had bought at Cavender‚Äòs. His response was I‚Äôll give you $15 and go to some wash laundromat down the road we were on vacation which I rarely take this route our whole day. We had to return back without clothes. Finally got the washer unlocked get our clothes out and recover them dripping wet, soapy clothes I asked for a refund still haven‚Äôt heard back is very unresponsive. The only through this app can you talk team we gave him your phone number ask you to please call rectify this to this day. Three days later still no call the place was cool very accessible

Airbnb was nice. Little workout room and a great pool but the location to downtown was not the best. There is nothing in walking distance and you will need to take an Uber everywhere or rent a car when visiting.

Was difficult to get back to the lobby, the building could use some serious signs inside.
Also no store close by, no vending machines, no ice no water no nothing.
So if you don't have a car that could be a problem.

The unit is as described and the amenities at the complex are great. Host was very responsive. Cleaning seemed to be hurried and unfinished. Some of the plates and utensils in the cabinets were still dirty. Sheets and towels were left in the dryer.

We also had two luggages stolen while we were moving into the unit. This is obviously not Saint Nicks Suites' fault. We made a mistake and forgot to take in two bags from right outside of the unit door (inside the building on the 4th floor) for 10 minutes. We were absolutely shocked as the building seemed so secure (it requires a fob to get in, and a fob to get up the elevator). We later learned there were actually quite a bit of transient foot traffic coming and going. Again, it's not the host's fault. We just hope you don't make the same mistake and remember to take your stuff inside the unit and shut the door.

The ‚Äúsuite‚Äù was not ready by 3pm as promised for check-in. The cleaning lady, Crystal, was there for another hour after check-in.
Late check-out wasn‚Äôt allowed.
The microwave did not work.
The shower door makes a loud noise when trying to close it.
The place had a weird smell.
No TV in the bedroom.

Very disappointing.
I stay at Leo‚Äôs when I‚Äôm in Austin, like, every time. the vibes of his place(s) are bomb.

I was only at the house for less than 10 hours. Just needed a place for the night. The private room was clean. The bathroom was not clean at all. There was hair and dirt all over the floor and bathroom. I contacted Airbnb to report the problem and the host responded that because it is a shared bathroom they didn't have anything else to say about this. Unacceptable. If you book with this host just know the bathroom is not going to be clean. I don't agree with charging a fee but it only applies to the bedroom and not the bathroom. This was unacceptable.

We were pretty disappointed with our stay. The water in the hot tub was very dirty, not just leaves in the water, but actually brownish water. There was no chlorine in it and no chlorine tablets to add to it. The back porch had a lot of junky looking items in the corner. We killed several spiders throughout the house and two very large scorpions in the pink room (my daughter refused to sleep in that room the second night). We also paid over 150.00 more each night than what was advertised in the app. When I contacted Autumn about it, she said she would check into it but never got back with me. My daughter was so excited about her 21st birthday trip to the dome house but it was quite disappointing!

The room was unclean with large amounts of dirt & hair left from the previous guests. Holes in the walls from which I witnessed a roach crawling. Large light fixtures hanging from wires in the ceiling. Overall terrible stay, I would not recommend it without serious changes.
Really bad communication and was unable to check on day of booking.  Not the cleanest
grunds√§tzlich in ordnung. hatten Bauarbeiter in der Wohnung und immer wieder Zettel an der T√ºre, bez√ºglich abfall welcher nicht von uns war.

I stayed here for 5 days, shower did not work for 4 days. I had to go to one of my friends place who stayed 30mins away to take a bath. Apart from that, basic amenities like soap, paper towel and tooth paste were not provided. This has been a huge inconvenience, this was my first terrible Airbnb experience. The worst part being, the host did not provide any sort of compensation or refund.

Shower wall had rust stains all over, shower curtain was filthy. Aprartment has awful smell. Carpet had stains and my allergies were terrible while inside. Kitchen table chairs are unusable because the are actually bar stools. The work space cut out had no chair. The Bed needs to be replaced. The springs were broken and had no support. The bath towels were gross, stained, and someone else‚Äôs hair was on it.

The positives were the location, the amount of space, it was baffordable, and I was not murdered.
False advertising no pool fitness room ect. Not an loft just a well put together garage

My experience was awful. Seems to believe he is currently living there. No storage for  clothes. Items were just shove in corner to appear clean. In one room there was poop and stains on floor like resent pee. Couldn‚Äôt connect to Wi-Fi it mention unavailable. There was no iron, so we wore wrinkling shirts out. My son had dirty his sweater, planned washing to find all his clothes in washer and dryer. Over all felt gross out being there

Overall we had a decent stay! Unfortunately, their neighbors have noisy dogs that when let out, bark for hours on end. This went on from 6AM throughout the late morning both days we were there. Bring ear plugs if you need to get any sleep.

I hastily booked this location since the high school team booked hotel stays down the street.   The good news: host + amenities are very good as advertised!  Bad news:  (1) cleanliness of the home was suspect with a foul smelling odor from the primary toilet and freezer, main fridge was not properly wiped clean of particles found in every shelf/storage, overpowering chemical cleaning agent odor in main room/kitchen, kitchenware stored away with either heavy water stains and/or residual oil, and bedroom white comforter w/ numerous stains; (2) located on a street with loud cars rumbling/roaring through day/night, 3 transients loitering during the day on the street or at street light, and neighborhood with multiple cars parked on their lawns; (3) central heat with a furnace in the hallway that roars loudly day/night as it heats the home; and (4) throw blankets available on the couch to hide the wear/tear and accidentally realized, the couch had silver buttons for position adjustments.

The location of this home to downtown is great. Communication with the host was also good. She also allowed us an extra hour for check out, which we really appreciated. The downstairs bed and bathroom were nice. W&D unit are new and worked well.

Unfortunately we did have a slew of concerns regarding our experience in the home itself. Upon entering, the smell of marijuana was pungent. The stench was extremely strong, which was disconcerting in general, but also in light of my three young children, ages 6, 4 and my newborn who is 3 months old. The ad boasts a ‚ÄúWOW‚Äù factor, though I don‚Äôt believe that is the ‚ÄúWOW‚Äù most are seeking.

Additionally, we were highly disappointed in the availability of basic items one would expect in a rental advertised for 8 guests. There were only 3 forks, less than half a paper towel roll with no extra supply, no hand soap in the kitchen or downstairs 1/2 bath, and only one hand towel in a house with 2 1/2 baths. One extra roll of toilet paper is also unacceptable.

The carpet felt grimy and dirty, and the downstairs floors also felt as they had not been thoroughly cleaned.

Upstairs in the two bedrooms, the beds were made up of thin sheets only. Your pictures indicate beds that are made up with actual bed spreads/comforters. The double bed upstairs is EXTREMELY uncomfortable; completely lopsided, lumpy and cannot be good for anyone‚Äôs back. The shelving unit is falling apart and the desk drawer meant to house items is missing the actual drawer. Your ad says ‚Äúall appliances and furniture are new and well maintained,‚Äù and what we observed significantly contradicts that.

While the closets are huge and spacious, there was not one single hanger to be found. The tiny coffee pot making 2-3 cups of coffee at a time is insufficient for a home for 8 guests.

After booking the home, we were then told that this home rents rooms individually and mentions cameras that need to be unplugged and food not to be touched in the fridge/freezer. This is information that should be disclosed to people prior to booking. The 1/2 eaten container of Kim Chi, packed freezer and Bachelorette penis straw in the utensil drawer, left me feeling as though we unknowingly rented the home of college aged individuals who left the home unprepared for a family visiting from out of town.

Guests deserve to be fully informed of all of the above prior to booking.

This place did not come with WiFi, toilet paper, a shower curtain (so water was everywhere) or a TV. When I contacted the owner, they took 24-48 hours to get back to me and still never resolved any problems. Very loud neighbors, and the whole place reeked of weed. Great location, and the place has a lot of potential, but poor ownership makes me never want to go here again

I gave 5 stars ‚≠êÔ∏è because I wanted to do my best to make sure this review is shown.
Please, draw your own conclusions based on my review. I will NOT stay there again.

Pros:

Cons:
1)?No dishes (but things to cook with)
