3) Infestation of Silkworms on the tree outside the balcony which leads to the balcony being covered in worms
4) Filthy floors
5)Questionable/shady neighborhood and soundings
6) When going down to ‚Äútry‚Äù to wash clothes, got into an altercation with workers who kept unplugging the modem (that you ‚Äúpay‚Äù to wash/dry the clothes) who then surrounded my husband and used threatening profanity)‚Ä¶‚Ä¶
‚Ä¶. When we notified the company of what took place, they did offer to have our clothes washed/dried/folded by the Washateria you‚Äôre near the apartment complex)‚Ä¶.. which we did not take them up on their offer because we left early and just went home
‚Ä¶.. They ‚Äúdid‚Äù refund one night due to all of the complications and left early

When I arrived with my dog and belongings, there were no instructions as to how to get into the complex, nor how to get to the unit once in. There were constructions crews working on other apartments throughout the complex, and when I got in touch with the management company, they told me that one of the security gates (the front one, and as it turned out, also the back one) was ALWAYS unlocked, so I didn‚Äôt need a code to get into the complex‚Ä¶ This compromised the security of the entire complex.

When I first entered the apartment, everything seemed alright. The furniture was as advertised, it seemed as though it was recently updated, etc. However, when I looked closer, a lot of things were not as advertised. The air conditioning was INCREDIBLY loud (I received a notification within a week of my start day via text message that said we should avoid setting our air conditioning below a certain because apparently several units were having AC issues because of it‚Ä¶), there were no bowls or plates, and the dishwasher did not work. I asked Evonify to correct the errors, they said they would get back to me. Nothing was resolved that day.

The next morning, I went to the back door to the balcony, and I realized it was unlocked. As it turned out, the locking mechanism did not line up with the door frame, and as a result, the door was unable to lock. I immediately informed Evonify, telling them of the security issue, and they said they would get back to me. In addition to that, the water was turned off to the unit (I assume the complex) for some reason when I went to take my shower, so I was unable to get ready for the day.

All throughout the day, I kept asking for updates on there pair of the back door‚Äôs lock, and I kept getting responses asking for patience and that they were working on it. I did not feel safe leaving my belongings and dog in the apartment when the door couldn‚Äôt lock, so I had to cancel my work and stay in the apartment all day waiting for someone to come fix it. At 6pm, after 8 hours of waiting with no solution and no timeline as to when the issue would be resolved, I moved my belongings and my dog out of the apartment and stayed at a friend‚Äôs house. I filed a complaint trying to get my money back with Airbnb corporate, and only AFTER this did they begin to resolve the security issues.

I would highly advise AGAINST staying here. There are places of similar price with better accommodation in other parts of Austin. Not only did I not feel safe being in the apartment and complex, the apartment itself was not fit to be lived in and should have never been listed in the first place.

As I contractor who needs last minute stays, Evonify never fails. Every time I book I'm able to check-in almost immediately. I reserved at 11:00 PM and I received the instructions within 15 minutes. I locked myself outside the apartment by accident and had to call and Jean assisted me at 2:00 AM. I will always return.

First, this host / place combo forces you to pay a nonrefundable ‚Äúsecurity deposit‚Äù of an additional $100 outside of Airbnb before you‚Äôre able to get key codes and check in info. It‚Äôs that or lose your nonrefundable stay, and seems a very unethical move.

Poor sound insulation plus abutting both a busy high traffic road (with one of those noisy metal plates from construction) and a major construction site, meant loud noises and no peace in the bedroom from 7am to midnight every day.

The kitchen sink leaked. The bathroom sink leaked. The *bathtub* leaked. The bathroom floor was wet all the time as a result, and the bathroom cabinet where towels and toilet paper lived was wet and moldy (and all the towels and backup toilet paper were located there and soaked / moldy as a result).

Toilet paper and paper towels were grade F quality. So were sheets and towels. There were no Kleenex / tissues whatsoever in the whole place. Several light fixtures were broken. There was no tv in the bedroom. The couches and chairs had rips and were bargain bin quality. So were the towels.

Despite all this, and despite requesting a refund to leave and get *real * accommodations that weren‚Äôt leaking, moldy, and noisy, the host repeatedly tried to run out the clock, not responding for a day, then taking another day to reply to our response forcing us to stay in the moldy, wet, noisy, grade F quality place for 2 more days than we‚Äôd have liked, until we could complain and get a response from Airbnb directly (who were good and did get us our ability to leave and refund).

Then after explaining and sending pictures to Airbnb, as we were eating a meal, Evonify made it a condition of our refund to literally pack and leave right then within half an hour, or not be able to leave / refund.

Basically, we paid 3-4 star hotel prices for a bargain basement, leaking, moldy, and noisy place with an unresponsive host who tried forcing a maintenance person on us instead of eventually being persuaded by Airbnb to do the decent thing and refund us so we could find a decent place to sleep and enjoy our vacation. If you‚Äôd like the same experience, I highly recommend this host, Evonify.

This was the worst airbnb experience I could have ever imagined! My partner and I were staying here for accommodations after a surgery which we had mentioned to them, yet when we arrived, the airbnb was incredibly dirty. Upon entering, the suite smelled clean but we quickly realized that was because of a car air freshener shoved into the air vent. We found a fake nail (like the kind from a humans hand) on the floor, water damaged toilet paper, clumps of hair throughout, insanely dirty vents, lipstick on a glass, and blood splatters on the pillow case. When we mentioned it to evonify saying this was a health hazard, especially having open wounds post-surgery they refused to refund us and let us leave. We could not sleep in dirty and bloody sheets so we ended up contacting airbnb directly, who then contacted evonify. Evonify ignored all calls and messages for 7 hours until eventually airbnb went ahead and issued a full refund because the host was unreponsive. At this point it was 9pm and we were past all airbnb check-ins and without anywhere to sleep. Luckily we found another host who was incredibly kind and accommodating who allowed us to check-in in well past her check-in time so we had somewhere safe and clean to sleep.
In addition to the disgusting state of this suite and the terrible customer service from evonify, we compared the pictures from the posting and noticed that it was an entirely different suite from the ad that was just decorated with the same furniture. Evonify had also asked us to not mention that we are from airbnb should we encounter any staff. This felt incredibly sketchy and I was very uncomfortable with the situation. Additionally, the only way into the complex was by wandering around until we found a door that had been propped open so if someone had closed all the doors we could have been locked outside.
The floor was dirty when we got there, but other than that it was as described.

I had never had bad experiences with Airbnb until now. We stayed in this place from Sat-Tue (on a long weekend holiday beginning of January). Once we arrived at the location we were very shocked and disappointed. Nothing was the same as high-quality pictures and the modern look in the profile description of this place. We arrived around 3:30 PM at the place and found the garbage and some other cleaning items in front of the door.  we tried to ignore this welcoming scene and entered the door code and got scared, the cleaning lady was still cleaning the floor and we had to stay outside for about 1/2 hour. The neighbors were looking skeptical and awkward. We, on the other hand, were very uncomfortable and tired staying outside with our luggage. Pasamos unos d√≠as en Austin y nos quedamos en este lugar. En cuanto la checking y personal de asistencia fue excelente. Llegar al lugar es sencillo. Excellent host, but the location was not up to par. Floor seemed dirty upon arrival. Restroom had a small hole in the ceiling above the shower head and the water pressure was very low. Had ants in the nightstand that would get on our belongings and on us when sleeping. Also found hairs that were not ours on the bedding and felt unsanitary. If you choose to stay here, be prepared to get spammed with emails. I got 18 emails over the last 3 days. Information on the posting doesn‚Äôt match the emails they send.

I ended up spending $257 for a place that reeked of smoke covered by so much air freshener that I was coughing from it. There was mold in the shower and the apartment complex felt like a motel. They also have rules and additional fees so read it all before choosing to book here.

I had Covid and so did my partner but they refused to let us cancel with 2 days notice.

Not an ideal location if you‚Äôre looking to go out in Austin or be close to downtown. DO NOT STAY HERE! The location does not feel safe and the entire apartment smelled like smoke and they had 5 mousetraps out in the open!! :( We immediately checked out and got a hotel.

The stay was good the only things is when we walked in it had a strong smell of smoke and the following day someone came to put in rat traps felt unpleasant knowing we could possibly hear a trap go off in the middle of the night also made it feel not so clean knowing the place could have rats . I stayed at this hotel over the weekend, 11/12/2021-11/14/2021. They have been made aware by a visit to the front desk during our stay, by a phone call and by an email about a charge of $668 on my bank account. Not a pending fee- a charge. They were alarmed when it was first brought to their attention, and now that I am back home in Houston, they have made no effort, that I am aware of, to correct this problem. $668 is not a small amount, and could put a real financial strain on an individual. There has been no comps, I even paid the additional parking fee still even after they were aware of this issue. I have never had a hotel do so little to correct or make up their mistake. I travel often and would have been given comp nights by this point at any other upscale establishment. Very disappointed at this time.
They do have a beautifully decorated establishment.

For people who have relatives staying in Mueller, this place is ideal.  It's on the first floor, centrally located, very clean, and simple to get in/out.  I'd use this place again for sure!  Meshelle was available but not overwhelming.  Perfect!

Unit is as described. Spacious enough for 2 people. Host is quick to respond. Location provided for quick access to everything we wanted to do, Barton Springs, S. Congress, etc.  I'm a lite sleeper, and there is a fire station down the street which made for noisy weekend nights. Washer & dryer were convenient.

I was assaulted by the cleaning lady for checking out late due to a medical/cardiac event. Then she and her husband waited for me outside the 108‚Äôs door and later outside my vehicle in the parking lot and I consequently had to wait for police to escort me out. Hosts (S & C) were informed in real time and did not help. They kept reminding me that I was trespassing for checking out late and that I would he charged $1,000.00 USD.
No blacks allowed

These hosts went above and beyond with helping us during a very crazy visit. I was in town for the most insane event of my life and my family came down with a stomach bug that was quite messy. This place is really cool and the hosts were incredibly accommodating and quick to respond. Thanks so much for making a crazy weekend a little more sane.

Within an hour of check in, contacted host to notify of issues: toilet seat missing bolt-slid around, ceiling fan/light in bedroom did not work, kitchen light did not work, bacon grease filled pan in oven, one bathroom sink did not drain, light in the closet couldn't turn off, no pull chain or switch.  Contacted phone number listed in check in instructions and never received a response. Switched to communication through the Airbnb App. Christine responded that she would send a toilet seat (never received) and contact maintenance to address other issues. This was Thursday evening. Friday evening, issues still not addressed. Christine stated she will contact maintenance again and stated a courier would deliver a frying pan (never happened). Saturday evening, same scenario. Sunday morning I contacted them again. That afternoon the toilet seat and light/fan were fixed, the sink drained. Kitchen light still out, closet light on- I gave up. We were there until Wednesday. Floors filthy.
Pictures aren't accurate, more like a 2 star hotel and smells strongly like mold, potentially not safe.

Ok, but you get what you pay for. The property was not clean in the outdoor areas. The door locks were all loose. The washing machine made a horrible, louse noise. We had some cockroaches. Wouldn‚Äôt stay here again.

Stylish place with new appliances and hot, high-pressure shower water. Things went well. My only complaint is that this listing shows photos of a balcony and there was no balcony. Evonify says they manage multiple listings in the same building and the exact unit could be different in small ways from the one pictured. However, a balcony is not a small difference. It's not just a different floor plan. It's not just different furniture. A balcony is an amenity in itself. The pictures should not show a balcony if there is no balcony in the listing.
We had no air the whole time we talk to them till we were blue in the face and they was suppose to refunded us one night and we haven't seen nothing and they want return emails or anything.

They were ok. I was disappointed that the washer and dryer did not work and this was not stated in the description. There was also a HUGE cockroach lurking around the unit. We tried to get it out but it kept running underneath the stove and refrigerator. Other than that it was ok. They did require a deposit of $150 that they make you pay through their website. They are trying to keep my deposit because we checked out late but the deposit is supposed to be for damage only. We will see if they resolve it and send it back to me.

Pest control was a huge problem, had to kill 3 spiders during my stay. The pictures posted on Airbnb were no where close to accurate. The place was a dark, small,and old. It was dirty and the walls had chipped paint and scuff marks all over. Not to mention the most uncomfortable beds I‚Äôve ever slept on. Wouldn‚Äôt stay here again.

De todo el tiempo que llevo usando la aplicaci√≥n, no me hab√≠a tocado pagar dep√≥sito o garant√≠a, es un gasto que deber√≠a asumir quien est√° arrendando con alg√∫n tipo de seguro propio, no a costa del arrendador, y ahora el tiempo de devoluci√≥n es demasiado, cuando uno les paga lo hace en el momento, no esperas 10 d√≠as para hacerlo

PROs : convenient location to downtown, plenty of parking & seemed safe enough, nicely furnished and decorated, decent price, easy check-in/out. Full kitchen and washer and dryer (which we didn't use, we barely spent any time in the apartment. Really just used it for sleeping, showering and changing. Not hanging out, cooking or doing laundry.)

CONs: The floor in the bathroom has some water damage and the vinyl flooring is coming up. It looks bad as the first impression.
It was almost 80* in Austin all week while we were there. Our AC was not working. After the first night, I texted about the problem and they asked for a picture of the thermostat, but then never replied again, and never offered a solution for the problem. The 2nd night still no AC - it was cooler outside than it was in the apartment, so we opened all of the windows. It was still quite muggy (in the 70's). Also that night when I went to take a shower there was no hot water. I didn't want to text anyone that late so I sent an email through the Airbnb site. The next day I texted again about the AC. (I never got a response from the email or subsequent texts)
The 3rd day I saw a maintenance man repairing the AC unit across the hall, so I went and talked to him myself. He explained that the whole building was on a very old AC and hot water system and they were in the process of converting each unit to have their own. But there was no easy fix for the AC until the whole unit was replaced with individual units (which obviously would not be done in the next two days that we were there.) He also told me the no hot water last night was his fault that he didn't reconnect something after working on the AC the day before. (So that morning we did have hot water again). He offered us a solution even though the short-term rental units were not his responsibility; he brought us a single portable window unit. That cooled the living room well, but we each had to sleep with our bedroom doors open to have some of the cool air get to that end of the apartment. So the last two nights there were not as unbearable, but still it was not the same as having a fully functioning home air conditioning unit.
I understand the AC and hot water were a bit out of the Airbnb's manager's control, and there might not have been an immediate resolution, but the lack of communication after my complaint is what left me very frustrated. I would have been much more upset if I hadn't gotten the temporary fix that I did for the last two nights.
Very disappointed
Floors were dirty when we entered. We asked for someone to clean but never received a response. Would not recommend

I cannot recommend this place. Several things were missing or broken, and though communication was there, most things took several days to make it right. Listed amenities were not accurate and took several days to provide or repair. Missing and broken things were communicated within an hour of arrival, but ‚Äúescalating‚Äù the communication took days to get results.
There is no vacuum and the rug is very hairy with both human and pet hair and when I asked for a vacuum, they wanted me to prove my claim with pictures. I immediately sent a picture of a wad of hair I took out of my infant‚Äôs hand. After our stay was over in four days, the rug was still dirty. There was never a promise of cleaning it.
The unit was kid friendly, but not infant friendly. It was too dirty for an infant. The tv and connecting cords were all within reach for a crawler, and the small decorative tables topple easily and have broken/ disconnected legs.
The pool was also dirty so our swim stuff went unused. There was broken glass directly outside our unit door and on the complex‚Äôs pavement and stairs leading to the unit.
We will not be returning and in the future, we will avoid any agency that has some kind of communication system outside of AirBnB. We communicated within AirBnB. They wanted us to use their system and create an account. In the future, this will be a red flag for us.

AVOID. The apartment was not as described. Very dirty -- there were dirty shoes in the apartment, a dirty towel hanging in the showers, and sticky brown stains all over the floor and toilet. The table was also completely broken when we arrived. I considered this unacceptable for my family to stay in so I requested a refund, which they denied. The agent was very rude, saying I was "pushing it" by asking for a refund. I had to go through airbnb to get a full refund, which I eventually did. We didn't stay there at all -- ended up booking a hotel instead.

There is a lot to like about this place and location, but this was not acceptable to me:
1.) The place had an awful cat food type smell that was eminating from one of the closets. It was really gross and took a few days to air out the place. We are pet owners so it's not like we are overly sensitive to this.
2.) I don't appreciate them sending somebody INTO the apartment to check on our smell complaint when we weren't there. They could have given me notice to be there to meet them. This led to them denying there was a smell.
3.) I tried every setting and their washer used hot water despite cold/cool water settings on delicate cycle.

Die T√ºr hat ziemlich geklemmt, was den Check-In erschwert hat. Allerdings war der Vermieter sofort erreichbar. Die Lage ist ok, es war trotz der N√§he der Hauptstra√üe nicht zu laut. Restaurants sind zu Fu√ü gut erreichbar. Der Pool war nicht verf√ºgbar, obwohl dies angepriesen wird. Internet hat funktioniert. Netflix Account ist verf√ºgbar. Die Zimmer waren sauber. The AC won‚Äôt work for apt# 218. The thermostat would not go below 78 degrees even when set to 70 degrees. Had to sleep on the floor in the living area to escape heat. The host did say, multiple times, that they are contacting emergency repairs to help but no one showed up. It was pretty inconvenient as far as sleep is concerned.
Excelente estad√≠a, ning√∫n problema, totalmente recomendado, volveremos sin dudarlo.

Our family needed to completely relocate while construction was underway at our home. David made the transition and stay as painless as possible. The home is conveniently located between MOPAC and I35. The host met us at check-in and was very responsive when we had a couple of issues pop up such as the HVAC popping on/off. David immediately dispatched a tech and the problem was solved right away. Thanks for making a stressful time less stressful for our family.

We enjoyed our stay overall. Location is pretty central, but wouldn't recommend it for a family. There was a fight at 2am outside of our window, people shouting at each other. That was a bit scary. But the space itself was very comfortable.

The place was fair for the price, it was a little gross though. The dishes had food residue on them from the previous travelers and the house overall was just lacking a proper cleaning, especially the bathrooms and kitchen. Overall the location was close to downtown and convenient.

Very budget and functional stay. Beds were comfy and we appreciated the AC and ceiling fans. Sadly, the pool was extremely dirty and not useable during our stay. Ubers to downtown generally cost around $12 before tip.

Overall an awful experience at this AirBnb and I will continue to fight for every penny back. This home should NOT be allowed to be an Airbnb. It is unsafe and also UNCLEANLY.

A neighbor on the property did not like that we were staying there because it is a private community. Twice when we were going to leave he tried hitting us with his car.

Outside of the front gate to the community was a couch where about 10 homeless people hung out daily. They would scream at us and cat call us every time we had to leave and get an uber. We felt extremely unsafe not only inside the community but outside as well.

On the last day we were walking to the front to get our uber and a man (who does not belong to the community) ran right past us with a gun in his hand. A police officer was chasing him with his gun pointed screaming ‚Äúget on the ground!‚Äù About 5 more cops cars sped down the street to get this man as we were all standing right there. We then crossed the street and waited for our uber when they tried to get the armed man out of the property.

The apartment needs a lot of maintenance and major upkeep done. My group stays at the jersey shore every summer and this was no cleaner than a shore house that college students rented out.
Place was poorly cleaned. Location was close to our event venue. Not the worst but not the best.

It was an okay stay only problem we had was there was no place to throw the trash the dumpster was packed and had about 50 bags piled up outside. We left bags of trash inside and were charged for leaving the trash bags behind. Location was not the best.

Cozy spot, it's a nice 1 bedroom apartment and the location is central to many other places in Austin. There were a handful of discrepancies when I visited: The listing says a, "Fully stocked kitchen," - Which was misleading to say the least. There were no pans available, just a single pot for cooking in (not sure it even had a lid) and a baking sheet for the oven, which severely limits cooking options, also, just a single spatula. And a single hunting knife for cutting your food. There were other random utensils but no other spatulas or cutting utensils. The record player didn't work/play anything regardless of what we attempted - though there were records in the apartment. The T.V streaming services advertised were also misleading, the services are only available on the patio T.V; not the bigscreen inside, which you'll only be able to use if you sign into your own accounts or if you hook it up to your computer thru an hdmi. FYI, the patio/outside will likely be uncomfortably hot if you're not used to Texas heat. The sound for the inside T.V was connected to a BOSE sound system that both my friend and I couldn't for the life of us figure out how to turn on, messaged the host and they sent a simple instruction but it didn't actually clear up how to get it activated and rather than choosing to continue asking the same question to our host we simply accepted no sound on the inside T.V. There was a dead roach on the floor near the entrance when we arrived but other than that the spot was clean. One of the drawers on the desk had no bottom panel, and the T.V stand looked like it had been kicked in on the back side. I also inquired whether the outside T.V could be connected to the inside to use the Netflix and streaming services without having to sit out in the heat on the patio and the host messaged that the T.Vs did not connect. All things to consider if you plan on staying here. I commend the host on responding quickly when I messaged them. I suggest bringing all the kitchen utensils you'll need other than silverware. This listing needs to be updated to avoid a misleading experience.

Moldy towels, dirty floor, old stained pillows, not enough towels if guests were staying for more than a couple days and wanted clean towels.

However, it‚Äôs an easy check in, decent location and if you‚Äôre not looking for a long stay, can certainly be worth a price tag that‚Äôs less than another pricier hotel or Airbnb. The balcony is cute and the bed was nominally comfortable.

We stayed one night in this room. We checked in to leave our bags and then immediately ventured out for the day and didn‚Äôt return until late, so we didn‚Äôt notice most of the issues until the next day and decided to bring them up when we checked out. We were offered a refund of the cleaning fee by the host initially but then told the actual owner didn‚Äôt want to give the refund because we didn‚Äôt address the issues when we first checked in. We understand that the hosts are representing an owner and don‚Äôt have full autonomy over refund decisions but it‚Äôs a worse experience to offer a refund and then not be able to give it than to never be offered it at all followed by a canned response saying that ‚Äúwe strive to earn a 5 star review, a 4 star review is considered negative‚Äù. Left an even worse taste in our mouths. Make sure to throughly check your room when you check in for any issues because if you try to complain later, you won‚Äôt be refunded.

Not a good place to take your family. Place still under construction and not suitable to host a family but they‚Äôre still making it available. Also way overpriced. Pictures on website does not show the reality of this place don‚Äôt be fool from the pictures. Do not recommend for family with kids.
all pros, no cons
Don‚Äôt expect nice furnitures or bedding.  It is worst than the furniture from IKEA.

The only trouble we had while we were there was the elevator that takes us to the overnight Parking area did not work properly and was difficult to work. Other than that, it was a wonderful location and we cannot wait to come visit Austin again!

Unit was clean and easy to find. Unit needs more chairs and the bar stools are not good for the island. No table to eat on. Only seating for 2 on a lumpy uncomfortable futon. No water pressure in second bath and water stayed cool. No mirrors in bedroom

Stayed for 8 days.  Very busy work trip during my stay.  Not hot water for any of the days.   Host moved me after 2 days from a 2 bedroom to a studio in the same building, and offered to ‚Äúcompensate‚Äù me for the inconvenience.  Still no hot water. Ended up being a boiler problem in the building, which I only found out from speaking to onsite maintenance.   My Corporate Housing insisted there was hot water in the apartment, which is a lie and is insulting.  They ultimately reduced my rate by the exact amount of the difference between a 2 bedroom and a studio - so the did not honor their offer to compensate for any of the inconvenience.  They have absolutely been dismissive since.  There are plenty of hosts in the Domain that are great.  My advice -  do not stay with My Corporate Housing - they are not worthy of your business.

this place is exactly as described. the only downside, which is a huge one, is the dumpsters for the restaurant next door get dumped nearly everyday at 3am‚Ä¶ you will be woken up. it is very loud!‚Ä¶. scare you out of bed loud. the dumpsters were emptied 3 out of the 4 nights i stayed here.

the couch sucks!

Nice quiet place in good location. Another guest had a dog that left lots of hair around. The bed was hard and very uncomfortable. A couple of the other guests were having thermostat wars upstairs so the temp was inconsistent. Standards risks of staying in a place with multiple rooms filled.
Room looked exactly how it was pictured although the bathroom was dirty and there was trash under the bed
It can be really hard to find a parking spot close to the apartment.
Worst host ever!!!!!!!!
We were a large group and didn't want to stay and overpay at a hotel.  The place was what we expected.

This is a guest apartment at the Travis at the Lake apartment complex.  The apartment was on the top floor, modern, and very clean.  Nice for a weekend getaway near Lake Travis.  The apartment faces 620 but the road noise wasn‚Äôt too bad, I did use a white noise app on my phone to sleep.  The balcony has views of morning sunrises and is shady in the afternoon.  I couldn‚Äôt hear anyone in the other apartments.  The pool isn‚Äôt too busy, it‚Äôs in full sun and opens at 10 except on Sundays it opened at 1 after checkout time.

If you‚Äôre just looking for a place to crash this will work. Doesn‚Äôt work for long stays as the single AC wall unit in the bedroom isn‚Äôt enough to cool down the apartment during a semi hot day. We were required to sit with blinds and curtains closed to keep apartment from overheating.

Clothes dryer was broken when we were there. We communicated this to PM but it was not fixed. We were there for a month.

Lastly, bring your own cleaning products. The place was not exactly the cleanest when we arrived. We were required to mop our own floors and wipe down counters.

Again, if needing a convenient place to sleep for a couple days this works. Anything longer I would not recommend.

I‚Äôve  stayed at many Airbnbs and hotels but this was one of the worst. The place itself is simple and nothing special. No big deal. The bathroom is tiny but so what. But after finding a hair in the bathtub, I didn‚Äôt think it could get worst. The hot water in the shower is hot/cold mess as hot water temp turns cold and hot sometimes during the shower.  But the unpleasant shower was almost trivia. Finally the worst part of the stay is the annoying host. I never met her but in the early morning of my check in date, she asked what time I was arriving. Why? I informed her I will arrive at the designated check in time of the listing. ( What is this? School?) Access to the place is by self checkin with keypad. Like ground hog day - again,  the day before my check out day, she again texted and asked what time I will check out. Annoying! Rude. Unprofessional. (Texts saved ) It doesn‚Äôt matter when I leave as long as I check out before the designated time. And I did. Regardless of the reason for asking, it‚Äôs irrelevant to a guest. Never have I been asked by any Airbnb host or hotel - what time I will leave. It‚Äôs like when you are trying to enjoy your dinner at restaurant and the waitress is waiting and trying to take your plate away before you‚Äôre finished. (Whats the rush? Chicken fingers take time). But I felt no pressure to hurry and leave early so she can clean or do whatever. I‚Äôm the paying guest. It‚Äôs called hospitality.

I had cleaned out my vehicle which had pet residue inside a garage bag. Then they falsely accused me of bringing a pet and took pictures of the bag I brought from vehicle. After explaining that I did not bring a pet and that I was moving out of a residence that did, they declined to reason charging me unreasonable cleaning fees for a place I left clean. The host is greedy and seeks ways to  charge additional fees erroneously.
Gaylen was nothing but helpful and has a gem of a place to stay! We‚Äôre looking forward to staying with her again in the future.
Nothing but good home vibes.
Nice and clean duplex unit B but the neighborhood is not the best location. Very low income neighborhood. This unit is the nicest house in the neighborhood by far.

Be aware this is a student housing building on the west side of the university campus, some luxury touches in the common area with a good gym and convenient campus location with easy access to the University and parking

Overall I was disappointed because the unit had no windows, the blinds were broken, the washing machine made a lot of noise (likely broken tub parts), the unit was ground floor with odd layout and had exposed sewage and water pipes at the ceiling that you could hear all the drain from top floors.

The pics were misleading, made it look better than it was, for me this was a below par experience and will not be booking again.

Close to campus and Congress. The loft is a cool concept. Unfortunately the loft was not a clean as I expected. The living room is not a sleeping option since the blinds do not close and the street noise is loud.

The location was great. The unit however was dirty. The floors hadn‚Äôt been cleaned, there was mold in the primary guest bath, bugs in the bedroom, Cheetos and old French fries on the floor, etc. The blinds were broken and the beds were so uncomfortable and obviously cheap. The communication was good and response times were timely. Be advised that they will charge for more than 3 guests in a stay.
Parking is a lil inconvenience but overall ok.

I wasn‚Äôt crazy about this stay. Some things were outside of the hosts control, but some were not.

First, the positives. It was clean and spacious, with easy private parking and within walking distance to coffee, a convenience store, food chains, and campus.

The negatives. Very loud neighbors that were partying all night, and you could hear them through the very thin walls. The blinds were broken, so we didn‚Äôt have any privacy from a very busy street. The trash can wasn‚Äôt covered and sat in the middle of the kitchen. Coffee machine and water filter weren‚Äôt working, and there was no kettle for tea.

The noise is out of the host‚Äôs control, but they really need to make sure everything else is in good working order in between guests. The lack of privacy from the street and disappointing amenities are a problem.

A few things to note that were negative and positive-
Positive:
If you‚Äôre looking for a bare minimum place to basically just sleep and go do activities this was a great location. This was my first time staying in Austin before a work conference. Not everything was totally walking distance but that‚Äôs where there‚Äôs Uber! The place was well kept and it‚Äôs very organized I will say from check in to check out.
We asked our host for a later check out and we‚Äôre able to get out by 11 instead of 10. How nice.
Negatives-
The water didn‚Äôt work from the fridge and at this time you couldn‚Äôt drink the tap (austin Texas water released a statement earlier in the week). And when I told the hosts they told me I should probably just get water bottles. (Lol what)
One of the bathrooms didn‚Äôt flush.
Blinds were broken so on the bottom level of the units, everyone could see in.

Luckily no one was sleeping in the main area but I see now looking at reviews they‚Äôve been broken for awhile. 6/10
Good, but apparently got a noise complaint after we‚Äôve already been checked out for hours

Location was perfect! Upstairs neighbors walked around their apartment like a stampede of elephants; SO LOUD! A major woft of chemicals over took your senses when you first arrive. Cleanliness is clearly important for this host, but it was disappointing to find 2 cockroaches on the wall the very first day.  Only small flaws, but the place has a lot more potential than a single bed stay normally has to offer.

I don‚Äôt usually review but this place was dirty. The carpet was very dirty and we documented multiple roaches.

Also, it‚Äôs a very noisy complex for student housing.

Host communicated well and I would say that if they cleaned better and replaced carpets/furniture a little, it would be better
Tout s‚Äôest bien pass√© - r√©sidence √©tudiante proche de l‚Äôuniversit√© et pratique pour explorer Austin.

The location is great but the logistics of getting in, getting the parking slip, fob and keys is a little complicated.   The room is basic and generally clean but the bed is not super comfortable and our two biggest issues were that the facility didn't seem particularly clean (outside our room) as the trash shoot had food and other garbage around it, the pool was full of debris and grit so it wasn't fun to swim in and another unit started deep base music at 10:30 p.m.  I did call Frontdesk and they contacted the security but we weren't able to sleep until close to midnight waiting for the folks to turn off the music.  I would not recommend this place because it wasn't particularly comfortable or relaxing and I was hoping it would be.

Bedsheets were plagued with human hair, food crumbs and actual dirt. Also, it smelled like body odor. After acknowledging this, someone from the property came to replace the sheets and all 3 replacement sets had dirt on them. In addition, all of the bathroom towels had pubic hair and stains. Repulsed, we therefore requested replacement towels, and after acknowledging the subpar quality of the services we received, the Airbnb staff replaced the towels as well. Disgustingly, we inspected 4 replacement towel sets, and every single one also had pubic hair and stains. Embarrassed, the cleaning lady actually told us that the laundromat where they were washing their sheets and towels was subpar, and yet the property continued using them. Absolutely disgusting and unbelievable for a place that is $630 per night. This is the bare minimum to pay to stay anywhere. Here are other miscellaneous grievances that severely disrupted our ability to enjoy the place we paid for in Austin: no soap (we actually went to CVS to buy our own), no lotion, no bathmats, stains on the bathroom sink and bathtub.

HEATER WAS NOT WORKING, They didn‚Äôt fix it.
the water get stock in the shower.
Noisy, and bed was really bad quality I don‚Äôt recommend it.
Walls were dirty. Shower had a lot of mildew. Water did not get hot. Blinds were missing. Stayed bright through out the night.

Nice space overall. Has a parking garage. The elevators were broken the first day or so we arrived so we had to carry our luggage up 6 floors. The bnb was not clean when we arrived so we had to leave and come back. When asking for more towels after the property manager said he would drop more off we were told to use to washer and dryer in the unit. The bnb did the job for the few days we stayed.
Nice location, small simple apartment. But the building is filled with students and is noisy.
This is 5-star hotel experiences with an airbnb price.   Too bad I was only staying 1 night.
the price range isn't worth it it wasn't that clean laundry wasn't working I ended up having to spend more extra money out of my pocket just to go do laundry . the value was not worth the room
A lot of mixed up communications made the checkin process rather painful. Apartment is as advertised and served the purpose of a bed for the night.
Washer/Dryer were broken during the extended stay

Not at all quiet.  I left a hostel because I hadn‚Äôt gotten sleep the previous two nights. The complex is all concrete, students yell at all hours from their balconies. They let doors slam in the hallway. Ugh such a disappointment.

Such a terrible experience. Do not stay here. It‚Äôs basically like living in a dorm. We stayed there one night and there were college students partying and yelling all night long until 2am. I was 5 floors up and it was still terrible. The walls are paper thin and you can hear everything. They leave you ear plugs because of how bad it is. However, it‚Äôs so loud you can still hear everything.
Ac did not work and there was nobody to help us. A representative told us she would get back with us but she never did. We had to leave and go home because there were no other hotels available.

Great location. about 1 mile from downtown. we were very excited about the amenities but had some issues with them which the host rectified as much as they could. As a result we could only use the hot tub for 2 out of the 5 nights we stayed which was a bummer. The back club house is very nice and brand new. The ladder going up their can be annoying and the spikes on the bottom rungs hurt our feet.

The main house is a little "run down". The living room is certainly updated but the bedrooms and bathroom in the main house are older which I wasn't expecting. our favorite part was the nespresso machine and the arancino milk frother!
Place was horrible and house smelled like dog . She was very discriminating towards me . Also accused me of things I did not do . I will never book here again .
Main bedroom mattress was uncomfortable, seems off balance. Unit above were noisy throughout the night.

La casa de Jenny es hermosa, mucho mejor que lo que se ve en las fotos. Tiene muchos detalles lindos, no nos falt√≥ absolutamente nada. Est√° muy bien ubicada, y estuvo atenta a cada pregunta que hicimos para responderla de inmediato. Sin duda regresar√≠amos!
This has been our favorite Airbnb out of the several we've stayed at over the years. It's a 5/5 for sure. We have nothing but positive things to say!

This place wasn‚Äôt worth the cost. The bed was super uncomfortable. It is all sunken in on one side so you‚Äôre constantly rolling into the other person and they‚Äôre just kind of stuck there. The dryer was broken and the host didn‚Äôt bother to mention this to us before we stayed. When we alerted her to it, she acknowledged she knew it had been broken and that it wouldn‚Äôt be fixed until the next week. Would‚Äôve been nice to know beforehand so we could‚Äôve cancelled the reservation. We walked in to wet, mildewy linens in there it was disgusting. She did offer us a $100 refund so we can launder our clothes elsewhere, which was a nice gesture, but an inconvenience regardless. Would stay elsewhere next time we visit Austin.
Such a cute place! Not too far from the city but not smack in the middle of chaos! Location feels very private.

The place was okay. It was just fine, nothing more. It was clean enough and felt safe enough. Not remarkable, and the general quality of the apartment complex and rooms is pretty low like a cheap hotel. Ex: Weird smells emanating from certain rooms when you walk around.

There is a pool, but it is not as described. There are two squares of buildings, and this location is NOT facing the pool. All gates are automated which is annoying (you gotta get another app), and don‚Äôt loose your phone or you‚Äôd be screwed and never be able to get in! Still, it did the job and it was an effective place to stay. 3 or 3.5 stars!

Total catfish. There were roaches and literally a homeless person digging in the trash right out side the front door. I did not feel safe there with my toddler. The pictures looked nice but the outside is a whole different story. Would not recommend to anybody and won‚Äôt be back
The furnishings were a little damaged but overall ok.
Not in the best area I heard police sirens like clock work! It was‚Ä¶.okay

We liked the neighborhood and the quiet area. I think for the price it was a small cozy place to stay, however during our stay there were some issues we experienced that did make our stay not so pleasant. First was the availability of basic toiletries. Also, we experienced a lot of problems with the faucets in the bathrooms. Plumbing and drainage issues in bathroom shower, the water didn‚Äôt drain.

The rooms that advertise ‚Äúking‚Äù bed are just two twins pushed together. Makes it rather uncomfortable if you‚Äôre a person who like to sleep in the middle as are laying right on the seem of where the two beds are joined. The mattress or held together with ratchet straps

Location is great but the overall space feels very neglected. There is no door knob on the room downstairs and there are stickers all over the walls. There is no closet space downstairs that is not locked so there is no spot to hang any clothes if you are downstairs. There were underwear on the floor in the upstairs closet as well as a dirty cup. There was also only 1 key (not a keyless entry) for the loft, FYI if traveling with another person and leaving the loft at different times.

Este espacio est√° a pocos minutos del centro ,tenemos un restaurante el 888 est√° muy rico adem√°s muchos otros de comida r√°pida .
J fue muy bueno respondiendo todas las dudas que ten√≠a .
Lo mejor es que te puedes parquear donde t√∫ quieras y no se van a llevar tu carro el acceso s√∫per r√°pido y el internet muy bien .

Fairly clean, basic AirBnB apartment in a fairly sketchy area. It was an expensive last option in order to present at SXSW for my university. I would never book such a place for this price if I had to pay for it. If you're driving a car, it's probably fine, but expect people to harass you as soon as you step outside the apartment complex if on foot, groups of people doing drugs right near the entrance, and seems like fights constantly breaking out at the sketchy convenience store right across from entrance. Again, probably fine if you're in a car.

This place's location was fairly decent to get to attractions around town but we also had a car. The surrounding area is in process of gentrification but this place is in an older neighborhood that looks sketchy and I would not recommend walking around.

The place is alright! It‚Äôs very nice from the outside, and I was very appreciative of the garage space out front. The couch and first floor was nice and spacious, though personally it seemed a little smaller in person than what the photos suggests! It can fit 8 people if you plan to have everyone share a bed/room together (which was not a whole lot of space admittedly), but realistically it fits 5 comfortably.
We found ourselves buying a lot of things *for* the house rather than supplied, but something leads me to believe a lot of those items are stolen from other guests that would stay there previously, (given there was parts of a grill set but not everything).
We were surprised by the amount of roaches there were during our stay, given it was in the middle of winter, however the previous stayers left quite a mess when we got there so that might be the source (Opened food bags, lots of stuff underneath the stove, etc left.) We ended up throwing out a lot and cleaning up after the previous guests.
The front door seems to have warped with the season as it doesn‚Äôt fit the frame, so the only way to close it was by locking the door, which unfortunately let in a draft.

Otherwise, a lot of issues we‚Äôve experienced are at the fault of other stayers it seemed, but the rating was based off on an average between the 7 of us. I‚Äôd say it‚Äôs still worth a shot if you‚Äôre looking for a place to stay!

This was like being at home while away from home.   Nothing fancy, just down to earth hospitality.  Kathy‚Äôs home was very secure and comfortable.  Also, there is a cat on the premises, but you‚Äôd never know it.  Absolutely, no odors.  Best Airbnb bargain in Austin!

Kathys Unterkunft ist wunderbar. Ein sch√∂nes ruhiges Zimmer mit einem sehr bequemen Schaukelstuhl, das Bad liegt direkt gegen√ºber.
Alles sehr sauber und Kathy ist eine ganz liebe Person.

I was a little disappointed with the condo when we arrived. was not that clean ( was tidy) but not clean like I like. kitchen was not equipped well as far as to cook anything. appliancs we're all newer but ice maker was broken and the oven was dirty. did not have much to cook with. I book air b and B's because we are on the road and like to eat our own food not at restaurants ( hotels). location was not close to city center but we are walkers so we walked into downtown every day. transit is close though. I do not expect the world for the price of some rentals but when you are paying over $150 a night with fees I don't think I am being unreasonable.
I hate to write negative anything on these but I wish people were honest in writing reviews that is what they are for.

Thank you for the great communication during our stay Dave. We had some issues during our stay that caused us to talk a lot. Some suggestions for the future are to fix the countertop in the kitchen; the multiple structural cracks in the counter were kinda sharp and slanted different directions; so we had to keep them in mind to not set glasses on them. Also, it would be nice to provide a users guide to the house. Finding drinkable water, figuring out how to operate the TV, and the thermostat, and having to YouTube how to use the upstairs bath/shower combo for 15 min was not fun.

The ‚Äúhouse‚Äù and how to use it or not use it was a constant discussion among the family . Our showers had to be limited due to an unforeseen leak that we were warned about upon arriving, only 2 face cloths for the house, we almost ran out of toilet paper, and we watched cartoons one of our nights and half of another day because that was the only thing the tv parental controls would allow us to watch. It was nice to get Dave on the phone but the issues kept happening to us during our stay here and it made the house as stressful as getting to know your way around the city rather than a refuge from it.

Great location though and if these items are addressed I think it could be worth the cost.

Neighborhood was crowded with cars and not what we expected. It was convenient to the airport and COTA.  The kitchen was not as clean as we expected.  Carpet on stairs was dirty and there were limited towels.

This was the worst Airbnb experience I‚Äôve ever had. I‚Äôd highly discourage anyone from staying here because of unsanitary conditions and a very rude host/property manager.

They were uncommunicative prior to arrival. I showed up at the home at check in and found that it quite obviously hadn‚Äôt been cleaned from the previous guest. When I called the property manager to let him know, he informed me my check in wasn‚Äôt for another 15 minutes (instead of any sort of apology or expression of regret). What then transpired was just unacceptable. It involved a 2+ hour delay from checkin, waiting for cleaners to show up. At one point, the PM tried to convince me that a 20-30 minute cleaning for an apartment could be considered an adequate job (when I communicated I had a schedule to stick to). This cavalier attitude towards hygiene and cleanliness during a pandemic is very alarming.

I saw the host had another listing in the same unit and asked if I could go there. They said no. However, it was available to instant book on the app. Presumably, they didn‚Äôt want to offer it to me because it was a more expensive unit. Instead, they told me there was a Starbucks up the street where I could hang out while they cleaned the apartment hours after checkin. By the way, check in was at 4 - which is already a late check in. When I finally got to check in, I came back to find the front door unsecured even though I had communicated that I left my
bags there. The property manager then tried to lie and say there were still cleaners on the premise and that‚Äôs why the door was unlocked. There was no one in sight.

Then, the host refused to refund me anything for my terrible experience (which included wifi not working the entire time i was there) and instead tried to pressure me to leave early (although, he did use smiley faces when he reminded me I was welcome to leave). I had to go through Airbnb to get a refund. By the way, Airbnb saw me evidence and sided with me.

Cleaning miscommunication is one thing. The lack of empathy or remorse from the host is just unacceptable. Don‚Äôt stay here. The neighborhood has nothing to offer as well. I would give it 0 stars if i could.
cute and cozy but not super comfortable. great location and fast communication. bed was uncomfortable,  wifi was spotty, and parking was inconvenient.
Only issue is drive way( garage) . Hard to park.

We live in Austin and were showing our house over the weekend to buyers. Garage was so disgusting, dirty and moldy, trash everywhere, old mattress, nasty frig. We had one bath towel and one hand towel for two. They never brought any more towels. When parking  with more than one person, passenger has to get out and open garage door, open door to  stair access to have room for car to park. Only the driver door can get out and the stair access door has to stay open while car is in garage.  We ended up not staying there except for a few hours. They even had the gall to try to upsell us (multiple emails) for early check in and asked us to let them know if we leave early so they can clean earlier. Terrible experience. What a waste of money.

Overall the unit was new, clean, and in a good location.  What was frustrating was check in was supposed to be at 4pm, we arrived around 4:15pm.  the gate was locked an inaccessible, so we entered through the garage.  As we opened the garage, construction materials and tools fell all over because numerous workers were in the garage.  As we step back from the tools falling towards us, the cleaning person comes from behind and says it‚Äôd be at least another hour until we could access the unit, which disrupted our plans for a business meeting.  So we had limited access to the unit as workers were there 2/3 days and no garage access as advertised and the owner offered no substantial recompense.

Cute stay if you‚Äôre just staying for one night but it was very confusing for us to find. We had to ask the neighbors. When my sister n I arrived there was a guy parked in a truck in the driveway, not sure if he was maintenance. The garage is also very dangerous if you‚Äôre not paying attention you can crash into the house as it is extremely steep.

Pros-
-Decent area of Austin
-Decent communication
-Very clean
-Found street parking pretty easily
- Relatively inexpensive price

Cons-
-Garage too narrow to park in
-No sheets were there for sofa bed and asked to buy own (and would be reimbursed). They said the cleaning lady forgot to leave them and they weren‚Äôt in Austin.
-Sofa is very low. There isn‚Äôt a bed in it. Think more of a kids couch that is foamy that just turns into a bed.
-Air conditioner in bedroom leaked onto the dresser onto my clothes and computer and nobody could come out until the next day. (It was 7pm when I noticed it and notified them.) It leaked into a pan all night.
-Apartment is upstairs. The only door to the apartment goes into the bedroom (that doesn‚Äôt have a closet). When you walk through the bedroom, there is short hallway with the bathroom on the left and then the room with kitchen/living room. (In fact, if you locked the bedroom door, people in the living room/kitchen couldn‚Äôt get out.

The driveway is a steep slope. I would highly suggest parking on the street. The entrance location is in a back alley, then through a garage then up stairs. The door knob between the garage and the stairs sticks. I thought I was locked in and had to hop the fence. Make sure you close the bathroom door when taking a shower. The steam will set the alarm off. If you order food, they won‚Äôt be able to find the address.

Do not stay here ! Lindsey place was infested with bugs, spiders and roaches, additional It smelled like a trash can. Lindsey was quick to respond however she tried to argue the room didn‚Äôt smell. Which was very odd putting.

I immediately called Airbnb and informed them of how dangerous it was to stay in a dirty, spider infested room. They refunded me and I immediately left.

It was awful and disgusting. I have stayed at a motel 8 that was nicer
Unit was dirty, cancelled on the first night of a 30 plus day stay.

La habitaci√≥n cumple, aunque deber√≠an de poner mas atenci√≥n a la limpieza del piso y de la ropa de cama que ol√≠a muy mal. El extractor del ba√±o se ve que no lo limpian hace MUCHO tiempo. Los horarios para podar el c√©sped los tienen MUY temprano y no puedes descansar. La comunicaci√≥n con Lindsey fue muy buena y r√°pida. Acceso/salida muy f√°cil una vez que tienes la app que piden. Cerca del centro.

This is a simple place that does the job for an affordable stay in an expensive town. My wife and two kids stayed here for a wedding weekend. Our experience was overall really good. Location, layout and cleanliness of the place were spectacular. The apartment appears a little sketchy (but we never felt unsafe) and its a little bit of a walk from where you park to the unit. However, these deterrents would stop us from staying here again.

The internet didn‚Äôt work, the back yard was not very tidy, but we enjoyed the space. The host told Airbnb that we tampered with there cameras, that was a bit strange ? The beds were comfortable, I enjoyed the coffee and chicken pot pies. It would‚Äôve been incredibly frustrating to have someone come and fix the Internet but it was also very frustrating not to have it. The TV didn‚Äôt work because there was no Internet. However I did not want to deal with fixing the Internet so it was more of a crash pad when we were there.
Great place from the interior. But the outside of the area is in a not so good place part of town. Very close to the airport and downtown.

I would suggest finding another location. Ultimately you will not be satisfied with the host especially, as well as the property it‚Äôs self.
Very old with bad maintenance upkeep. Pics do not offer a realistic perspective of property. Keep looking for a better property and avoid a negative experience.

Pros
Great location close to everything on SoCo

Cons
No check in instructions. By the time Christian responded, we had let our Uber driver go and had to walk to the very back of the complex carrying luggage instead of being driven there, then up 3 flights of stairs

WRONG photos - Smaller apartment which was not as nice

Dishwasher full of dirty dishes

Dryer had towels in it

Coffee pod machine with option to fill your own pod. A bag of opened Starbucks was out of date 9 months and the other was flavored. The prefilled pods were just not good. A coffee pot would be nice
