El acceso a transporte ya sea Uber, bus, tren, etc es sencillo en caso no dispongas de auto.

Luc‚Äôs place is perfect for a quick getaway. We came in from Dallas to visit friends and it was just close enough to local breweries etc. The house was clean, well equipped and most importantly quiet!

Only two minor things but height would prevent us from coming back: the shower water pressure is quite low. Also, the small couch desperately needs to be replaced/stuffed, it‚Äôs uncomfortable to sit on.

Would recommend!
Place was as advertised. Had some trouble checking in and with the dishwasher, but the host was quick to fix both issues.

Publicidad enga√±osa. Se publicita de 4.Pero en realidad solo es de 2. Pagamos un extra, por 2 personas. No queremos dormir en la misma cama, por lo que tuve que dormir 2 semanas en el suelo. Edificio sin ning√∫n tipo de seguridad en el acceso del portal ni del garage.
Misleading advertising. It is advertised for 4. But in reality it is only for 2. We pay an extra, for 2 people. We don't want to sleep in the same bed, so I had to sleep on the floor for 2 weeks. Building without any type of security in the access of the portal or the garage.

We enjoyed the home, however there were a couple things that the home was missing. There was no wash clothes to wash with, only 2 pillows on a king bed, the sofas were dirty, and the ice machine had mold in it.  But it served its purpose.

We got to the ‚Äúloft‚Äù (aka ground-level apartment) on Tuesday evening and found that quite a few amenities were not available to us that were mentioned in the listing. They talked like it was a brand new listing (when I messaged them on July 29th) that would be all sorted out by the end of the week, but two and a half weeks had gone by at this point, and the listing was still not accurate. Besides the items specifically listed as amenities that were not there, other misleading information included their claim to have a ‚Äúfully equipped‚Äù kitchen, when there wasn‚Äôt even a microwave. They had a TV, but no way to watch anything on it. The couch smelled disgusting and was covered in pet hair, when they claim in their listing, ‚Äúno pets.‚Äù We did not have hot showers, although the water would get hot at the sinks. They list a bath tub as an amenity, but then tell you in the welcome binder when you get there that the tub is unusable. I could keep going with the list, but this wasn‚Äôt even the worst part‚Ä¶

The hosts left a note in the binder that said to contact them first about any issues before leaving a bad review. So I did just that, only to be met first with excuses, which escalated quickly into disdain, and continued into mockery, as if it was completely absurd to them that we would be upset to not get what we paid for. They told me if I didn‚Äôt check back to see updates on the listing, even AFTER they‚Äôve taken your money, that‚Äôs on you. ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Now sure, I had the option to cancel if I didn‚Äôt like the changes, but how is it realistic to expect anyone to re-read their entire listing to hunt for changes EVERY DAY leading up to my trip?? Even so, the only update they had even made was regarding the newly unavailable WiFi.

I could easily get past a few small listing inaccuracies, but to have our ‚Äúhosts‚Äù react so dismissively and immaturely toward our concerns (which we shared at THEIR request) and to never even receive so much as an apology, let alone any attempt to actually resolve our issues‚Ä¶ THAT I have a problem with.

I'd stay here again - the only downside was the upstairs neighbor that I could hear at all hours of the night. Seemed like they were on a scavenger hunt every couple hours, which was obnoxious, but I bring a white house machine when I travel and that helped. The whole floor seems to be Sonder rentals, so a couple coworkers and I ended up being nearby each other and it was convenient. Much quieter overall than Arrive, where I stayed last time I was in town.

We did not enjoy our stay. First off, the host never sent us the passcode for the keyless entry. After calling the host, we were finally sent the information. Once inside, we thought the unit looked nice but there was a strange odor. There were half used food items in the kitchen cabinets including an open sauce packet in one of the kitchen drawers. We threw the open sauce away to avoid having any critters. The fridge shelves were dirty! There was a used towel in the bedroom basket that we ended up washing because there was only 1 towel left. Then we find out that the dryer isn‚Äôt working. There was hair in the bed, on the pillows and covers as well as on the tub floor. The closet light also doesn‚Äôt work which makes it useless since it‚Äôs so dark. As another review stated, the bed frame is not very stable and feels like it‚Äôll break if both guest weigh more than 350lbs combined. The photos in the listing are not up to date with how the apartment looks now.

We reached out to the host with all our concerns and he replied that his cleaning lady was there the day prior, and that he would send the photos and videos we sent over to her. He never offered a solution to us for the lack of cleanliness. We ended up going to Walmart to buy our own disinfecting wipes, towels, wash clothes, and bedding!! We asked for a refund for the $150 cleaning fee since the apartment was not cleaned upon our arrival. We ended up getting Airbnb involved when the host stopped responding. We are so disappointed that our first time in Austin was tainted by our stay here. Save yourself the headache and find somewhere else to stay.

poor outside lighting, unclear instructions, given wrong passcode, 20 mins to provide new code, place reeked of cigarette smoke and chemicals. Can't believe how I don't get a total refund! I had to find another place at 11.30pm at night due to no fault of my own. Terrible experience!
Hosts were extremely communicative, during our stay, but too many issues demanding time/frustration during a vacation, dampened our time in Austin.

Pros: This place was a great stay for my large family. 2 living rooms and multiple bedrooms with plenty of blankets and sheets and also a desk for working situation. Huge backyard and a private garage to park your car.

Cons: although this is minor there were no trash bags provided so we had to make a trip to go buy some. The upstairs can get really hot but that is not the hosts fault that is normal. The bunk bed rail for the top bunk was broken the kids noticed it but they are older so we‚Äôre still able to use the bed. Lastly the appliances were the worst part of the stay. The refrigerator seemed to stop working overnight so my sisters breast milk was ruined in the freezer as we were leaving which caused her to be upset. The washer froze when attempting to wash but when it was unplugged and reset it began working fine. The dishwasher did not start at all. Although we didn‚Äôt need it throughout our stay when we were leaving we wanted to run it with the dishes left but it did not work.
Walking up the ladder was a tad scary, otherwise place is so cozy & quaint.

This is a cute tiny home nestled in a quiet neighborhood, comfortable for one person. The bathroom space is quite tight and the sink is awkwardly small, with its large spigot, and the ladder is: dangerous. The library shelf ladder is a nice touch, at first, but is not made to be topped, meaning to take one to an upstairs level, and has no rails to hold onto, especially when getting onto the loft or beginning to climb down. Wear slippers or shoes when climbing, as the step edges are a bit sharp on bare feet. It's an accident waiting to happen.

There are pros and cons.
Pros
The location is near downtown area which was great.
The apartment is clean, with cookware and some basic cooking spices and oil.
Didn‚Äôt use appliances but they seem to be up to date appliances.
Supplies with shampoo, conditioner and body wash.
The bed is confortable, but this is not a one bedroom it is a studio apartment.
Large closet with iron and heaters.
An extra fold out bed was included.
Extra bedding and pillow were provided for fold out bed.
Easy check in.
Unit has AC and a small tv as well.


Cons
There was no coffee even though pictures depicted the Keurig with coffee.
No wash cloths and only two dry towels provided even though the booking was for four guest.
The futon bed was not comfortable to sleep in.
The toilet clogged and there was no plunger and no cleaning supplies were included. I like to sweep because a lot of hair falls on floor and I couldn‚Äôt find a broom.
Overall the apartment complex is quiet but the neighbors upstairs are not, we were woken up at 3am on the first night because they were stomping around.

I arrived at the AirBnb at 1AM without check in instructions. After 30 minutes of trying to call the management company,  we gave up. Fortunately AirBnb reimbursed us for a hotel for the night and helped us in booking a new place. However this was a multi-hour process and very inconvenient with lots of negotiating involved. If you really need to book this AirBnb, message the host way before your stay as this management company believes it's your job to ask for check in details...
although this place was on a busy road, we were able to block out the noise with the shades.  it was very convenient to our daughter's family and we were able to walk over everyday

Horrible experience.  I‚Äôll preface by saying the aesthetics of the Airbnb were nice and there being plenty of room.  We had a late check in (1am) and I gave the host a heads up about this.  Day of arrival, I realized we never received the information on getting into the Airbnb.   We were told to use the link they sent, but there was no way to actually connect to the lock from the link.   After a couple phone calls they finally agreed to give me a door code.   We get to the Airbnb that night and neither the code or link work.  We called many, many times for assistance but no one ever answered. We finally gave up after about an hour and found a hotel down the street.   The next day, they finally reach back out (8:30am) to help us get into the Airbnb.  They give us a completely different code and it works (shocking‚Ä¶you need a working door code in order to sync the link they send you or the link won‚Äôt work). We get into the Airbnb and the air conditioning isn‚Äôt working.  We follow all the instructions on resetting them and still no cold air.   Later we find out all the Airbnbs there were having the same issue.  We gave up and got hotel rooms for the weekend. I do not recommend unless you like lack of communication, being locked out and stranded, and being unbelievably sweaty.

Gnats in the house.

I understand the camera covering the entrance to confirm the number of guests, but, the camera covering the pool area is just weird and honestly a violation of privacy.

I received 8 messages from the seller in a 3 day stay, way too much communication, and was even asked to fork over more data on myself and my guests through their third party software, as asked to confirm the number of guests again via direct email communication outside of AirBnB. Just way too much.

Existing water damage in the property invoked anxiety about getting stuck with the charges of pre-existing damage.

Claims whole home audio, yet speakers only exist in two rooms. Additionally, this was entirely unavailable due to the Sonos being outdated and requiring the master account to be updated.

Pool & Hut tub have hidden fees and the fact that some of it functions on a timer left me feeling like I was going to be forced to pay for something I had no control over.

A complete lack of curtains in the master bedroom for half the windows means you're getting up whenever the sun is, no two ways about it.

I'll never understand "Luxury" listings that still offer only single-ply TP. There's nothing luxurious about a bloody anus.

Will avoid all Black Opal listings in the future.

Fiji tire from IKEA and junk. Walls all
Had stains on them and were dirty overall not a great place

Good afternoon. I just finalized the reservation, but upon arrival for checking in the lodging was unacceptable. The house was not clean and the agreed upon time was 12pm for checking in. Towels were left in the bathroom on the floor and in the shower area on the first floor. Trash was not emptied and the upstairs bedroom was not made either. Counter tops had crumbs all over it. I did not arrive until 1235pm and had to call to get codes to get in because I didn‚Äôt have them. My guest and I had to leave and be displaced until they cleaned the entire place. I am very disgusted as this is unsatisfactory. Something needs to be done about this matter, whether there‚Äôs a compensation, incentive etc.  but I shouldn‚Äôt have to leave because the lack of cleaning that was needed.

I usually do not write bad reviews, but my experience with Black Opal was so awful I thought my info would be helpful to others. I‚Äôd like to start off by saying that I did not stay at the rental since I refused to give this individual anymore of my money due to his unprofessional communication and his dishonest / thieving rental practices. Let me lay it out for you:
1. Extra charges for dog (any size) - $75 DAILY & explained to me that this was for the extra cleaning fee, when he already charges you (the client) $200-$250 for cleaning fee on top of rent when booking the place. I happen to have family that owns a cleaning company and I can tell you already $200-250 is already pretty hefty price for a deep cleaning of an apartment of that size - so, the EXTRA incremental DAILY charge of $75 for dog hair is ridiculous and downright thieving! Also, even if you pay for the dog at the the beginning while reserving your stay, he still expects you to pay this charge again before you can check in and claims that there is an error within the airBNB system‚Ä¶
2. Extra charges for early check in and late checkout. $100 each or $175 for both. This includes just leaving your bags at the rental early! What a joke! And the cleaning team may still be there‚Ä¶ even though you have paid for early check in?! Hmmm downright robbery!
3. Extra charges for ANY guest that may step into the residence, even if just for a couple hours (not including spending the night). $25 per person per day! It was explained to me that this was to cover the toiletries, toilet paper, soap, and trash removal that EACH individual person uses. I was very specific in that guests would only be visiting for a few hours at most for ONE day during my stay, but it was still $25/day. Also, Black Opal can not figure out how to charge you for just one day of guest entry out of your multiple day stay, so they expect you to pay for an additional guest for each day of your stay even if you are only requesting to have guests come visit for one day only. This is when I decided to cancel my stay, because now this was beyond ridiculous and a HUGE waste of my time and money. He refused to fix the calculation/price issue and I refused to pay for multiple guests for multiple days, so I canceled and EASILY & QUICKLY booked a king suite at the Fairmont hotel for CHEAPER with better customer service, in a better part of Austin, and without surprise ridiculous extra charges.
4. The place is in east Austin BTW! If you are from Austin, you know what that means‚Ä¶
5. Austin is a dog friendly city (as are MANY cities in the US now) and most hotels and AirBnBs and VRBOs and whatever else you might use is very accommodating to animals. Fairmont Hotel had NO extra pet charges!
6. Out of principle there are MUCH better places in Austin for you to stay that will not try to rob you of your hard earned money. Good luck if you end up booking with Black Opal, this person is a crook!

Worst check in I‚Äôve ever had on ABNB and I was treated like it was my fault that they did not put the gate code on their app.
Thank God the next door neighbor who also rented from them and had the same exact issue was there to open the gate.
Oh, but their lousy attitude and harassment was as though it was my fault.
Save yourself the aggravation

its ok for only 2 guess. if you are planing to go with 4 forget. there is no way. we had 2 air bed and noone work. it was a nightmare to sleep. also we found several small cockroach.
it has a lot of extra amenities. the cafe and the Coffee machine excelent.

The description of this place is not accurate.
People in the complex are attempting to enter your unit at all hours of the night. There are constant disturbances from the the unit above.
It would appear that many of the occupants of the complex have an addiction issue.
This is not a safe or comfortable place to stay.
Book with caution ‚Äî due to the state of the apartment upon arrival, and unprofessional communication from the host, we received a partial refund on the reservation from AirBNB.
Weird
Kind of a pain to get into this place, that being said I would stay here again now that I know how to get in.

We loved the great communication, the location, the security of the gated community, covered reserve parking and the cleanliness of the unit. However, it was far from comfortable. The unit has multiple settlement cracks (we counted over ten throughout the unit). It‚Äôs so bad in the master bathroom that the door does not properly close.
The biggest downfall for us was the king bed. It is incredibly uncomfortable. I know some people enjoy a hard stiff bed but we could not enjoy a full nights sleep this weekend, we even tried to sleep on the couch but that didn‚Äôt work out either. We also noticed that the sheets do not stay on the bed which add to the uncomfortably.
This was a groovy stay. It‚Äôs close enough to everything downtown but far enough away to escape the noise and chaos of the more busy streets.
Really well done decorations. Close distance to the Domain and the Hideout. Nothing at all to complain about.

The place is amazing and has everything you would want.   Our only issue is the garage opener was supposed to be on the kitchen counter and was not so we could not park in the garage, which we really had planned to do.    We did call the cleaning lady listed on the check in information and she said she had received something from the owners and had that somewhere but was not sure where.   She was going to find that and text me but never did.   All in all it was just that one issue and does not impact the wonderful things about the house and we would stay there again and highly recommend it.

The location was good .closer to Capitol building.Check in process was not smooth.
The building access code was not shared and front door access code was wrong..We had hard time to enter the apartment.We had 3 cars and could get 2 passes to park the car in complex.
Was really looking forward to our stay.But little disappointed.
Great location for a Saturday night downtown with friends.  For others who are reading this and plan to stay here: there is a coffee maker but no coffee ‚òïÔ∏è so don‚Äôt forget to pack your own!

The unit was solid for what I needed - It was centrally located and was furnished with the essentials. How to locate/access complex amenities could have been laid out ahead of time but that‚Äôs minor. Cleaning of the unit was subpar - there were stained washcloths and long dark hair on several towels and bed linens - nasty. The closet has a foul smell and I caught a roach on the counter one night during my stay.

I do not believe this was well worth the cost.

Stay away at all costs.


They are trying to charge me for a ‚Äúburn mark‚Äù on a rug found by their cleaning team which is frankly laughable. I had no flammable substances nor lighters or matches inside. They say that they will send me a bill for this. I will be disputing via the app and if I see a charge though my bank I‚Äôll report it as fraudulent. This was there prior to check in. I‚Äôll repeat: STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOST AND LOCATION.

I had a terrible experience at this Airbnb. The place was dirty, smelly, there were spiders and spider webs around. There was no soap in the kitchen or in the bathroom sink. I was really trying to make it work but when I lied in the living room bed, the pillowcase smelled of saliva. I turned it around and it smelled like urine. I had to leave immediately. Thankfully, the host was communicative and agreed to a full refund. On the outside of the property there were two overflowing dumpsters that were very unsightly. I can not honestly recommend this space. It was particularly difficult for me because it was the day before thanksgiving and I didn‚Äôt have another place to stay.

You get your moneys worth but it‚Äôs not suitable for more than two people. Especially if traveling with suitcases. It‚Äôs very cramped but livable for a weekend.
The Airbnb host was very sweet! He reimbursed us for the laundry mat since the washing machine was broken.
Also note the main bed broke in the first night.
Modest, clean place. My only complaint is that there‚Äôs no A/C in the bedroom.

This house was very disappointing. It wasn't clean when we arrived (floors were dirty, hair and something yellow in the shower, dirt on the sheets). As others have shared, the house is very dark, not at all like the pictures make it appear. (We did find the lamps in the main bedroom closet that another renter said they bought and left.) It is very "80s," complete with popcorn ceilings, and gold bugle bead peacock art. The door between the main bedroom and bathroom has oddly been removed so there is no privacy. The neighborhood feels run down -- covered boat parked on the street, soft sided dumpster filled with junk on a front lawn the entire time we were there, unkept yards. Didn't feel dangerous however.

Relatively newer studio with nice finishes and a convenient location to cafes, restaurants, Whole Foods, Target and more. Unfortunately, the bathroom lights didn't work at all and based on the doors of a small closest within the bathroom being open and the light on there as well as just outside the bathroom, it was obvious management knew about it. After informing management about it, I was told maintenance would be coming the next day, but no one showed nor was I contacted by management to inform me of the same nor did he follow up until two days later when I asked if they would be working on my last morning so I could see what I'm doing when shaving.  Other than that, I don't know if the neighbor opposite the bed wall a permanent resident or another vacationer is or not but the second night, he through a 6 - 7-hour tantrum screaming/ yelling something about his papers and knocking things around as well as throwing things at the wall in between his unit and this one. So, there's that.

If you want to be in the heart of downtown, this is the place to be. Located right on 6th St you‚Äôll be able to walk or bike to restaurants and bars close by. However - If you‚Äôre sensitive to noise, do not stay here. The walls are very thin. The common door to get in and out of the apartment complex is extremely noisy and located right outside the room. You‚Äôll hear a loud bang every time it is open and closed. We could hear conversations, music, and people walking nearby during the day and night. The toilet did not work during our weekend long stay, which was very inconvenient. No one came to fix it and we had to use public restrooms nearby.

The floors were really dirty and a lot of dead bugs were found in random corners of the home. Sheets in the largest room also had bugs. It was cute and the communication was good, but I would only recommend if you‚Äôre not a neat freak but when I contacted the host about the floors she said she would talk to the cleaning people about it. Also; the pool is very nasty. No umbrellas, only 3 chairs, 7ft deep.

This property could be pretty dang nice if it was kept up. It has several maintenance issues that should be addressed.

To start off, we got to the unit at 3:10pm after check-in started at 3pm. We walked up to 3 guys actively spray painting the front door red. They told us we couldn't close the door because the paint was wet. The company managing this property was responsive to my messages asking about when we could get in and actually close the door and they said they were told the door was painted at 1pm and should be dry by 3pm. Clearly not accurate as there was literally paint being sprayed before our eyes after 3pm. Anyways we go off and waste an hour and come back. Get into the unit and try to relax. About 30 min after we were back, someone was clearly back at the front door working, pulling tape off the handle or whatever and such. But they never announced themselves to us, knocked, nor did I receive any messages warning me. Quite disconcerting and a shitty start to our stay.

Now on to the maintenance issues.
1. the toilet valve is cracked and leaks water, the bowl barely fills with any water and struggles to flush and refill any water at all. It should be replaced.
2. The faucet spout in the bathtub is not accurately secured. It should be properly mounted so it does not rattle loosely in the wall during use.
3. Several kitchen cabinet handles are missing a screw so they just loosely hang and spin when pulled.
4. Bedroom closet pull light is only secured with a single screw, making it lilt to the side and feel as if you're going to pull the light down onto yourself. Needs the second screw that the mount is designed for.
5. The floors are disgusting. The damn glue from the vinyl planks is oviously leaking out everywhere. We had to wear shoes the entire time.
6. There's no weatherstripping on the front door so you can easily see daylight and feel air coming through several gap areas. It also makes it hella loud since it is right next to the metal gate which everyone uses and slams closed.
7. The unit smells like smoke. Seems like at a minimum, the air filters need to changed. It's quite gross.

Also, this unit is in an apartment complex with loads of bright LED security lamps. That's great until you get to the bedrooms whose wood blinds do not cover the entire window and they don't have blackout curtains in the room. We woke up at 3am every dang night with our bodies telling us it was daytime due to it being so stupid bright in there. Could have read a book with everything as closed and blocked off as possible. Desperately needs blackout curtains.


TLDR;
Pros: Central-ish location to North Austin. Clean surfaces and areas (excluding the floors). Off-street parking.

Cons : Clearly maintenance issues. Toilet may or may not flush depending on how recently it was previously flushed. Disgusting sticky floors. Desperately needs blackout curtains.
The apartment was in a terrible location that they don‚Äôt tell you about until you book it. The house smelled like cigarettes and there was only 1 blanket for 6 guests. I would not stay here again.
Mostly clean. The blankets had stains and the beds were very uncomfortable.
Hot Water didn‚Äôt work at all, faced so much trouble. Others aspect were pretty below expectations. Cheap ass apartment in a shit hole apartment complex
Would not recommend
Es un lugar muy bonito, limpio y agradable sin duda lo recomiendo
Place was clean but the sofa was broken no extra blankets. Neighborhood was scary but it was a clean apartment.
Experience was ok. Location not great.

Was very disappointed when arriving to the air bnb. The outside of the air bnb is an older apartment complex with the French broken and run down and was not expecting that from the pictures posted in the listing. The laundry area is a shed however wood inside is all broken needless to say I did not use it. In comparison of the photos inside and seeing it in person I can say the photos looked better. As I mentioned it‚Äôs an older apartment and the bathroom to shower is very small no room between the door and toilet which makes it hard when getting out of the tub. There is also no rug so you step on the floor if you don‚Äôt mind that then it‚Äôs not a big deal however I don‚Äôt like stepping barefoot on a dirty floor after showering. The restroom downstairs gets no ac/heating in it so it was very cold as temperature outside was in 40-50s. You could also hear everything from the next door neighbor them opening and closing doors, talking etc. The living room also has French doors however there is no blinds or curtains on it which made me feel uncomfortable with privacy. Lastly, the couch was extremely hard however since the tv is only downstairs and there‚Äôs not one in the bedroom I had to watch tv on my phone upstairs or put pillows and blankets on the living room floor as that was more comfortable than the couch. I would not re-book this bnb or even one in this area.
It was perfect. It was cozy but not too small. Perfect for a quick visit.

Tiny house was not clean upon arrival - we cleaned and sanitized the restroom vacuumed the creases of the couch ect. The kitchen stove was greasy from the last guest - we tried to warm the kettle for tea and the smoke alarms went off. You get about 15 minutes of hot water, be prepared to shower the night before if multiple people are staying.

The smoke alarms went off at 4am and continued to sound out of nowhere multiple times. The house was very dusty as well. I messaged the host with questions about the hot water - no response.

Pretty disappointed and disgusting that the cups were full of lip prints. The door to the restroom was dirty, and the lid to the top of the toilet definitely needs to be changed out because it has gotten yellow. Also wifi in here was terrible. The four of us definitely had trouble sending and receiving.

We were pretty much done after the cups because like, what else hasn‚Äôt been cleaned. Ridiculous for charging a $60 cleaning fee. They didn‚Äôt even offer to refund that amount.

It was a really bad stay for us from bloody sheets to no internet to our 3 year old son‚Äôs toy rolling under the couch leading to the unveiling of filth and condoms. Not to mention the photos are deceiving. We messaged Urban Stay to tell them about all of the happenings and still do not have a response from them.

Dirty towels in tub, sheets were dirty, beds were not made, and some girl‚Äôs long hair everywhere. Didn‚Äôt know I was signing up for housekeeping but I guess you get what you pay for. It is cheap and there‚Äôs a nice pool but other than that, I was disappointed.

Dimly lit stairwells made it feel scary but nothing bad happened.
Fabulous communication and quick problem resolution.

This is basically a low-end motel. Do not expect anything better than a Motel 6 or Econo Lodge. The quality of furniture is terrible, and the unit looks like a jail cell - no decor, no wall art, no windows, just 1 bed, 1 coffee table, and appliances. The TV didn‚Äôt work and the water pressure was the lowest I‚Äôve ever seen.

Parking, check-in, and location were positives. I also appreciated the host company‚Äôs quick responses to my messages.

Although the home is in a convenient location, it is not worth the price.
EVERYTHING was dirty - mold in both bathrooms, greasy feel to all kitchen items, dust accumulated on surfaces and vent covers, and a bad odor throughout.
Multiple things didn't work - oven wouldn't turn on, no hot water in kitchen sink, both showers were either all the way hot or all the way cold, hall bath sink clogged, back door handle fell off, and not enough lighting.
Also, there is a freight train that runs adjacent to the back yard in the middle of the night, every night, which was not mentioned in the listing.
Host was responsive but that doesn't forgive the condition of the home.

It is a shared place, where only eight people stay in one room (the room is part of the backyard which is covered.
The window AC is freezing one of the beds (directly blowing to a bed). It was not a pleasant stay for me since the other people were awake almost all night, and I could not sleep.
10 people living in one big space  with bunk beds  like prison

This hotel is very clean and the customer service is amazing 10/10. However, for $30 private parking a night I was pretty dumbfounded seeing that the car next to me had their car broken into and stuff stolen. Usually wouldn‚Äôt be a big deal, but I‚Äôm a girl and traveled alone, parking in a garage 3 floors down.
Beware that parking on premises is not free.
Neighborhood was unsafe. My boyfriend and I were uncomfortable walking outside of the hotel, especially at night.
Nice king size bed, view of the pool, walk to 6th street.  Had everything that was needed.  Water pressure in the shower was a little low.

Only reason we went with this place was because it said it had a tub. I asked about it TWICE and if the pool was heated but they said it wasn‚Äôt. Kinda sucked but at least i was getting a tub, since the listing said it had one. We get to the place and first of all, the receptionist had a pokerface throughout the whole check-in process. it was upsetting to find out that my room did NOT have a tub and the pool IS heated to 80¬∞ or so, which was even more upsetting because i didn‚Äôt pack swimming trunks, since they told me otherwise. I packed a few bath bombs for this trip and ended up not using any thanks to the poor communication from the host. The couch in the room had a few stains on it, the AC unit was LOUD, so if we wanted to stay warm, we had to deal with the noisy unit when it was running. We had breakfast at the hotel before checking out and got there just before they ‚Äúclosed‚Äù it. An employee comes into the area, starts telling everybody that he‚Äôs closing down while he encloses the area with sliding doors and locks them so nobody else comes in. Better get everything you need before being rushed out, because if you forgot the butter or anything else, tough luck. the food was good, though. I won‚Äôt be staying here again for sure.
Bad pricing

Hotel is to be as expected. Nothing special, clean, for the most part quiet. The $30 charge for parking a night is ridiculous though, plenty of garage parking nearby that‚Äôs half the cost. If you‚Äôre there for the dirty 6th street, you‚Äôre totally in the right spot. If not, pick somewhere else. It does get a little rough at night in the surrounding area but when we stayed it was the last weekend of SXSW, might‚Äôve been more drank and substance than usual lol‚Ä¶

The hotel was fine and well kept.  The room could have been a bit cleaner but nothing that would keep me from staying here again.  What will stop me from staying here again was the customer service.  I booked a king room and was given a double queen room.  I know, things could have been worse, but it was not so much the wrong room but the sorry customer service and attitude of the hotel manager that will keep me from going here again.  I was simply told they would not do anything to help me and I would have to contact Airbnb.  I did contact Airbnb but still have not gotten any answers from anyone.  Just so you understand, even though Airbnb may say they have a certain room up for reservation, the hotel will not honor that choice and will put you in whatever room they want.  Better to book directly from the hotel so that if there is an issue they will be able to handle it.

I did not stay at this location. I experienced an emergency on the date of travel, offered to send verification of this emergency, which prevented me from reaching the hotel. The hotel declined to give a refund, or even a credit, for this unforeseen event. Despite a cancellation policy that clearly says it is up to management to give refunds for emergencies, they declined to consider this. It's upsetting that a large hotel will not be willing to consider emergencies and would not credit/refund the $275.
Shitty service. Host doesn‚Äôt even respond or answer phone. Scam

Unfortunately, it was not as advertised with the amenities. Host and co-host were not willing to help reconcile the situation either. We had to get AirBNB customer service involved who sided with us. We ultimately cut our stay short after 1 night and went elsewhere. Would not recommend staying here.
If your facing 8th street it‚Äôs very noisy cause there‚Äôs a bar. Also if your planning to walk to 6th street you walk past several homeless people sleeping on the side of the road/sidewalk.

Horrible location, in the hood, did not feel safe, did not stay here to the very poor location. I would not feel safe sleeping or leaving my belongings in this place. Could not get door open to check in.

This is a very nice home to stay in. The bed was the comfiest bed we have ever slept on. However, there were a few issues. First, this apartment is on the first floor and it makes it so you cannot open the blinds without being completely exposed. Second, someone was always parked in the parking spot so we were never able to access it which was an inconvenience. Third, the apartment smelled like cat pee. You could smell it immediately when you walked in and it never went away. The bathrooms were especially bad. We stayed there for an entire week and the smell continued to linger. This smell alone is why we would not stay at this apartment again. All of these issues were told to the owners but nothing was done about them.

Rent at your own risk!
This property seems nice and was easy to access. However when we arrived there was a terrible sewage smell from one of the restrooms. We contacted the host, and he said that their property manager didn‚Äôt notice anything the previous day. No assistance was given and no refund was offered!
We moved out asap and had to dispute thru Airbnb. These guys should be delisted.
Not the best

The apartment did look like the pictures, but usually when reading reviews I give a place the benefit of the doubt. This one though I should have listened. The entire apartment smells of cat litter and stale urine. The smell was unbearable and every day we had to try and air the place out, bought air fresheners and the smell kept returning. We found dead bugs/roaches and there was hair in all of our ‚Äúclean‚Äù beds. The apartment was exceptionally noisy from the apartment above and people around. Some noise is to be expected but several times we thought people were actually inside the rooms. The beds were also very uncomfortable which would normally be ok but with everything added together it lead to a sleepless vacation. We didn‚Äôt mention these things to the host because we saw how they just pushed them to the side in other reviews.

Very spacious backyard, easy parking, and good kitchen. Host was responsive and sleeping arrangements were good, but the Airbnb was lacking in a few areas: weak AC, wasps nearby, and no body soap or dish soap.

When we first got there we opened the fridge and there was literally leftover old pizza and soda from the last guest, there was an almost full trash can with 2 dead cockroaches inside that we immediately took pictures of and sent to air bnb. the place was disgusting as was the shower. and keep in mind we paid 2700 for a 30 day stay and this was how kept the place was. luckily air bnb refunded us almost the full amt and helped us move into a different temporary place. wouldn't recommend this to anyone, it's a weird place with rickety old steps behind a house in a bad neighborhood, stay away.

The apartment was serviceable, but needs maintenance and more regular care. The bathroom sink had a leak underneath it and was also severely clogged. FYI for travelers with young children or pets: many ant poison traps were all over the apartment.
Overall the place is ok. Toilet wasn‚Äôt working and shower handle is falling off in one of the bathrooms. Host doesn‚Äôt reply right away.
74 isn't a good temperature to keep da house when its a 103 outside....
Awesome spot. The neighborhood was questionable but when you get inside it is peaceful and quiet. Trash day is Thursday. We missed it and felt horrible.

Ok so I wanted to just give a clear description of my experience. I rented this place for the location but actually never slept here. When I got to this place I immediately noticed the smell. Its a pungent kind of older musty smell. Not my favorite.
Then the bed wasnt made. And linens were no where to be found. Strange.
Then i tried using the bathroom and the door jammed and I couldnt get out.
It was apparent to me that I didnt want to stay. So I left and asked for my money back.
I was credited the room cost but Airbnb kept a $45 room fee even though i didnt stay.
The whole experience was bad.
I hope this host makes serious improvements and Airbnb stops charging such high fees and keeping them when you are deceived about a stay :(
No comment
Very uncomfortable. When messaging host about an emergency there was no response again

Es gab beim Check-in ein paar Probleme, da wohl vergessen wurde mir die Informatione zuzusenden. Es k√∂nnte f√ºr den Preis auch definitiv √∂fter geputzt werden. Es war nicht extrem dreckig, aber bei dem Preis w√ºrde ich einfach mehr Leistung erwarten. Trotzdem war es im gro√üen und ganzen ein netter Aufenthalt und es ist alles vorhanden, was man ben√∂tigt.

Nice, clean place located just off the Texas campus. As such, we weren't too surprised to have an unbelievably loud party raging on the rooftop of the building right next to this unit for most of the night. This is just a warning to others guests who may want to sleep at night.  Lots of food trucks and dining establishments right around the corner and down the block.
Good apartment, but the building, elevators and parking garage are very dirty

So this spot is definitely not where you want to stay for a girls weekend or weekend away. It‚Äôs more of a place for if you need cheap housing temporarily and have no where else to go.

The living room- strong cigarette smoke smell. We kept our baby in the bedroom for the majority of time because of this (there was still a smoke smell in the bedrooms, but faint).

The bathroom- not super cute or remodeled but did the job UNTIL the toilet blocked up- we sent a message to the owner but they weren‚Äôt able to get anyone in during our stay- we literally had to #1/#2 in a toilet already filled with such‚Ä¶it was disgusting.

The laundry- no detergent. We asked for detergent, they took forever to supposedly deliver it, but we never saw the detergent they delivered. Bought our own.

The bedroom- hair in the sheets. Thankfully we had our own bedsheets on hand and I just used those.

The main vent was covered in dust.

Overall- clean enough. Livable enough. We paid $75/night and I‚Äôd say it was worth around that, maybe a little less. We were between homes for a couple days so this did the trick for us.

While we were aware of the Spartan conditions of the space, location was a huge priority for us during our stay as we needed to be close to a family member who lives in the area. If it were not for that, we would have left immediately. While the space has new furnishings and decor, it has underlying issues with cleanliness. The air vent in the hallway has not been cleaned in months as pointed out in another review. New laminate flooring is coming up in the bathroom due to a leak in the plumbing. Upon closer inspection, there is black mold underneath the the laminate. The AC did not work. The lamps in the bedroom were missing lightbulbs, and there was a large empty box in the living room which we couldn‚Äôt figure out why it was there. All in all, we spent as little time there as we could and have no plans to return in the future.

The place was conveniently located and enough space for eight people. However there were signs reminding about quiet hours which were confusing because we would get automatic text messages regarding noise level outside of the hours.

Worst air bnb I have ever been too.  Same with the owners of this property. 100/10 do not recommend. We stood here for my bachelorette party and there was problem after problem. This house was called the hot tub royale and we were excited to be able to drink and relax in the hot tub. Before we got there they said that the people before us left the hot tub dirty so they would come by the next day and fix it. We called them and said we wanted it fixed as that‚Äôs what we payed for. They knew the hot tub problem wasn‚Äôt that it was dirty but rather it was broke which we found out after they ‚Äúfixed it‚Äù. Instead of telling us it was broken they never said a word and left cold water in it knowing it would never heat up because it being dirty wasn‚Äôt the only problem. When they came and ‚Äúfixed it‚Äù (refill the water) they also left the sliding door open and there were bugs in the house. The dishwasher was broken, the refrigerator and freezer were broken and our food went bad, the dryer which was under amenities was locked. The floors were dirty and our feet were black after walking on it. There were also poor response times. It was constantly we are sorry we will get back to you asap and it never happened. They said first thing in the morning it would be fixed (we were there for two nights) that next morning we heard nothing and once it rolled around to after 3pm we texted them again after many calls and texts the previous night. They finally answered after our attempt and not their own to make it right and said they wouldn‚Äôt be fixing it. DO NOT STAY HERE. This property sucked and you will waste your money. The property isn‚Äôt worth more than $100 a night and it was in a terrible area. Our Uber driver said you do not want to stay in this area and if you do you better not walk around at night. We had these guys in the next house cwt calling us and we were very uncomfortable the whole time not to mention our countless problems in this home and with these owners.

A very poor experience - this spot is not in the best area and this was highlighted when a woman off the street entered the AirBnB at 9pm one night, attempting to film the group of girls staying there. We had to leave the property and move to a hotel, and UrbanStay is still not responding to us about a refund. Would not recommend.

UrbanStay was responsive throughout our trip and made check-in and check-out a breeze. The house was stocked with enough paper products, coffee, and cleaning products for our large group. The d√©cor was funky and matched the vibe of the bachelorette weekend. There was more than enough room for our entire group of sixteen.

Although we had a good time, there were many things that our group were unhappy with:

1.) The location of the house (although close to the airport, 6th street, and Rainey Street) is not in a safe area ESPECIALLY for a group of women. We were told by ALL of our Uber drivers that the house was located in an unsafe neighborhood and NOT to go outside by ourselves. Feeling like you can't walk outside alone was not a great feeling during our vacation. There were many sketchy people outside of the house. In fact, a man in a hospital gown was lingering by the house on Saturday night.

2.) The outside area was disgusting. The green turf around the pool smelled of mildew and old beer. The pool was dirty and the pool net was just thrown to the side. This outdoor area could be a great spot for large groups if it was cleaned up.

3.) The comforters on the beds and the couches in the living rooms had many stains on them. For being a newer listing, this is unacceptable.

The advertisement is misleading.

The location is far from accurate. It‚Äôs not 5 minutes from 6th street. It‚Äôs 15 minutes. It‚Äôs not in the greatest area.

The house itself is actually two separate units. Not connected. While the beds were comfy and it slept 13 of us comfortably , it would‚Äôve been nice to know we were actually kept separate.

It was clean and a neat space however some things weren‚Äôt functioning properly.

Dishwasher was broken, the backyard was not maintained. Pool pump was broke and unusable. The hot tub was dirty and unusable. Limited lighting in the backyard. Was told it‚Äôs cold out so nothing was fixed.

Noise sensors are in the house, kept getting texts even though no one was even there.

For the $7k We expected way more. It‚Äôs not privately owned so the company doesn‚Äôt really care. It‚Äôs just money for them. Compensation was discussed but it‚Äôs impossible to contact them after check out is complete.

I wouldn‚Äôt pay more than $1,000 per night‚Ä¶
Poor place
This was a very last minute trip for me and I found the place not only adorable but very convenient.

This stay quickly ended up going from slightly disappointing to a horrible, dangerous disaster. The hosts made a huge error on the smart lock app (August) and ended my login 2 days early on our 4 day stay. I was locked out of the house and stranded at 5 am with my girlfriend on valentines. We tried to reach the hosts but had no responses. We felt very unsafe there in the middle of the night, in an area  of Austin where crime is known to be higher than average. Unable to access our stuff, and with no where to go on a vacation, we had to contact Airbnb support and go through a horribly stressful and long cancellation process. Besides this massive and dangerous error, the house has an ant issue, a upstairs toilet that doesn‚Äôt consistently flush, poor A/C & heat, and very loud rooster neighbors that caw beginning around 5 am.  The price does not match the value, not even close.  Overall, a terrible experience. The worst ever.  Reading past reviews, you can see these hosts have had similar negative experiences, and there doesn‚Äôt seem to have been any care to improve.

Place was nice to stay at for two nights as a group of 6 but there was a dead cockroach on the carpet when we arrived but for the most part the place was clean. Bathroom is small with one shower so rethink this place if you‚Äôre a big group. The neighborhood was decent compared to the south side of SA. You can hear the roosters at night/morning so take earphones.
Todo bien, solo tuvimos problemas con el internet no funciono
Anytime I have to stay in Austin for work, I look for this host. I've had nothing but wonderful experiences.

El departamento es tal cual est√° en las fotos, pero algo que no puedes percibir en fotos es la comodidad del colch√≥n y almohadas ¬°es como dormir en las nubes! Maravilloso.

El internet es muy muy r√°pido, la tv se ve muy bien, el AC es perfecto, llegar y ver tv fue nuestro hobbie. El departamento tiene un peque√±o balc√≥n que imagino que en oto√±o es maravilloso sentarse a ver el atardecer.
El barrio es tranquilo y los vecinos son respetuosos.

Te proporcionan shampoo y jab√≥n, caf√© y t√©. Si te gusta mantener limpio hay escoba y aspiradora :)
Tiene 2 closet enormes! Puedes desempacar todo y no se llenar√°.

Definitivamente, si necesito volver a Austin, volver√© a elegir a Shirley.

A decent place to stay at. A lot of rules and you have to take out your own trash. House looked clean but the hand wash basin in the master bathroom was dirty (not the owner's fault, the cleaners didn't do a good job).  The Cup holder area in the fridge was also dirty, an the tap of the kitchen was lose and dripping water. The apartment otherwise was clean. however the paint on the walls made the house look duller in real life than in the pictures.

La ubicaci√≥n es muy buena si buscas estar cerca de South Congress. Sin embargo mi estancia no fue como esperaba empezando por la falta de ciertos servicios como wifi, luces en el cuarto principal, ba√±o, vestidores, cocina y televisi√≥n; esto se le inform√≥ al anfitri√≥n, quedaron de enviar a mantenimiento y nunca lleg√≥ nadie ni nos volvieron a preguntar por el problema. Pero si llegaban a entregar paquetes y los dejaban afuera del departamento.
No me sent√≠ como en casa ya que hab√≠a muchas reglas, como no utilizar zapatos dentro de la casa. Tambi√©n faltaban amenidades, no hab√≠a ni caf√© complementario.
Las camas no nos parecieron c√≥modas, ya que el colch√≥n se sume, en especial el colch√≥n del cuarto principal, y las almohadas son muy grandes.
El departamento est√° en un edifico departamental y se escuchan las pisadas del piso de arriba y hasta el timbre del departamento de enfrente.
Si buscas una experiencia acogedora y sentirte como en casa este no es el lugar para ti.

we entered the place by moving a lot of large boxed deliveries away from the front door.  There was no electricity.  We had purchased groceries for a 10 day stay but no refrigerator, no lights, no fan or air system, no internet - messaged host who was oddly asking for me to screen shot the list of networks I could access - but the problem was larger than that!  She finally agreed to call building maintenance.  There is a clear sign on the refrigerator asking NOT to call Leasing office.  We waited and after several calls, messages left for her, texts etc, no clear answer if maintenance would come.  After it got dark, our supplies and food warming up and no indication this would be repaired anytime soon, we requested a refund and left for a hotel.  The refund was refused saying she offered to get us another place temporarily.  I think they are not supposed to be air b n b at this apartment complex and this is why maintenance was not coming to fix things.

apartment is just as described. perfect for singles or a couple but was not the best for families with small children (very loud, lots of construction around the location and also construction underneath the apt in the buildings below,  trash trucks came 2 days in a row at 530/6am and were very loud, you can hear everything happening in the other apt so we were constantly worried about our children being too loud), also smoke detectors were missing. it was within walking distance to Rainey st for food (15 mins and downtown (15-30 min walk) but with all the construction and traffic it was difficult to navigate with kids in a stroller just fyi. guests staying in the apt beside ours constantly smoked right outside of their front door so our entire apt smelled of cigarettes throughout our visit. Pam was always very fast to respond to our messages and we really appreciated that

Nice location. Host was generally responsive. The bedrooms are spacious. The apartment was clean.

The bathroom is tiny however and there is no lid on the toilet seat and the toilet is right next to the bathtub. You have to jig the shower tap just right to get hot water and this wasn‚Äôt explained in the house instructions. The fire alarm goes off every time someone has a shower from the steam.

No full length mirror and no mirror at all in one of the bedrooms.

Also could hear people talking constantly from outside/adjacent apartments. Overall not worth the price in my opinion.
Not good for more than 2 people, location fine, bathroom sink in bedroom, bathroom very, very small, Roku TV,

No amenities at all, not even garbage can in kitchen. NO HOT WATER. sime faucets did not even work. Saw 2 cockroaches. Was charged total $310, not worth half that.  Not at all like any other AirBNB experience....just not up to par.
Overall good experience but the parking situation isnt the greatest

Great location in the domain but very basic. Smoke alarms stopped working half way through visit and continuously beeped to the point we had to unplug them to get any sleep and no one ended up coming to fix them after host said they would. Very unsafe. Microwave was broken as well.
Great location, but the roads to get to the parking garage were blocked off so it was a bit frustrating.

I was in a hurry when I booked this Air B&B and didn‚Äôt read the reviews, which are very mixed for good reason. This is the list of the things we experienced:

1. We paid for 4 guests and there were no linens for the pull out couch bed. Host didn‚Äôt offer to get them to us until the following day so we had to drive to family‚Äôs house at 10pm to get some.
2. Only 3 towels were provided and no hand towels. Host did have those delivered the next day.
3. Blinds were missing on the sliding glass door which limited privacy. Host did actually repair them our second day.
4. Floors were not clean, cheerio on the bathroom floor, half a fake finger nail in one of the drawers.
5. There is a very strong, musty, mildew smell that we can still smell on our clothes now that we‚Äôre home. This was very noticeable.
6. Active wasps nest right outside the front door; host did nothing despite our requests.
7. Missing lightbulbs throughout the house.
8. The smoke alarms were not installed nor did they have working batteries. Host did remedy this on the second day.
9. Porch light was burned out which made for a dark entry. I would not have felt comfortable had I been there alone.
10. Tub has a slow drain so you‚Äôre showering in dirty water.
11. Host only responded one time when he said the cleaners must have forgotten to leave the linens and that he‚Äôd have them delivered the next day. He never addressed or responded to any other questions or concerns.
12. Refrigerator door was broken.

We paid $189 a night for this place & it just isn‚Äôt acceptable to have so many things wrong. I hope that he can make changes and be more thoughtful to better improve the stay for future guests.

Check in was horrible. I‚Äôm pregnant and the lockbox had a problem and I even hurt my finger trying to open it. Besides that, the apartment was dirty and not smelling good, (and I had to wait until 4 pm for that) and no delivery person could find the place because it‚Äôs super hard to find. Neighborhood also not safe.
I don‚Äôt like writing bad reviews but I wouldn‚Äôt suggest this place. It was the cheapest one I found on Airbnb and I would have paid more if I could do it again.

Used this rental while our house was having some work done with the water shut off, so only to use it to sleep and for the bathroom and shower, and that was enough. It was pretty dirty inside and had a funky smell. For the price, I wasn‚Äôt expecting much, but the smallest of added attention could make this place a lot better. It was also very hard to find with no pics of the outside.

It‚Äôs a nice apartment in a reasonably convenient location.
But the hosts keep it in a poor shape, it‚Äôs dirty, the floors extremely sticky, blanket and couch were stained, and wifi was rather poor. They also expect you to take out the trash and strip all the bedding and clean the kitchen, treating you like a maid service.
Place was ok for the price, but had it not been discounted it would not have been ok for the price

Let me start by stating, I have never given a bad review on Airbnb.
Right before check in (Sunday/3pm), Hunter informs me that there are no keys to the unit. The previous guest took them & he was trying to recover them. The unit was unlocked, so that I could enter while they resolve it.
At 430pm, I inform him "I need keys. I need to run errands & I don't want to leave my items unlocked."
At 930pm, he finally responds, "I will have a new key early in the morning."
Monday at 9am, I still had no keys. My 9am business meeting canceled-"Business Trip".
I reached out to Mr. Hunter, told him of my meeting & asked why wasn't a locksmith called on Sunday? He sent me a web pic of locksmith that didn't operate on Sundays. As if that was the only locksmith in town thus justifying his horrible management skills. He was rude, unprofessional, unapologetic, arrogant, & had the nerve to tell me that "my escalation was completely uncalled for & he reported me to support.". What a JERK!

Nice to place but god awful host. She spied on guests, disregarded service animals, make vast assumptions that are not true, posted on social media about her guests, then had the audacity to request $600

Beautiful large ranch style house appropriate for large families.  Fully equipped kitchen. Nice bedrooms. Plenty of thoughtful touches. The backyard was the only disappointment. We had hoped to eat meals in the back porch area, but the biting insects (mosquitos and no-see-ums) were relentless. We fought a good fight for a couple of days, but retreated indoors in the end.  Yes, they were worse at twilight, but they made things unpleasant regardless of the time of day.

Trash left in fridge of left over Mexican food and opened can of jalape√±os which made the rooms smell rotten. Host didn‚Äôt assist with it, made me and the other guests clean it. Black mold in bathroom. Empty toilet rolls left in bathroom. Additional left over trash in sink. Parking was confusing and is tight spaced with trailers and cars making it impossible to drive out of spot. Absolutely horrible. Host didn‚Äôt return my call and took hour/next day to respond.
Worth it for the low cost, room is cold so bring layers.

Lage und Preis-Leistung der Unterkunft sind wirklich super! Es war sauber und die 4 Betten und zwei R√§ume eignen sich perfekt auch f√ºr Gruppen.

ABER es war uns leider nicht m√∂glich die Klimaanlage einzustellen, sodass es eiskalt und laut war - den gesamten Aufenthalt lang und vor allem auch nachts.
Au√üerdem hatten wir beim buchen einen fr√ºheren Checkin angefragt, was uns best√§tigt wurde. Dieser wurde leider nicht eingehalten und wir kamen erst ab 16 Uhr rein.

Bei beiden Problemen war uns Hunter leider keine Hilfe und hat gar nicht oder nur verz√∂gert geantwortet.

The place was okay to stay but there was hardly utensils in the kitchen. The thermostat control was not adequate. Some rooms had excess heat and other rooms were cold at the same time. Hunter won't pick up your call or have the courtesy to call you back to check what's wrong with the place. Ready for a refund only if  the place is rebooked by some one. so ultimately you are forced to stay since you booked and find the place not up to the mark.
Pictures were deceiving and the home was not clean upon arrival, the host was prompt to work out a resolution but ultimately we could not stay due to the state of the home.

The space is clean and comfortable. However, there were a few problems.

1. The Kitchen is ill-equipped. The cookware is really small and poor quality, and so is the cutlery, making one of the big advantages of an AirBNB (the kitchen) not so useful. There were also some already opened containers of food, such as an opened bag of tostitos in the freezer, and cashews in the pantry. Not sure if they were left there on purpose, but regardless, I don't trust like that.

2. The unit is on the first floor, right against the loud street, while the listing boasts otherwise: "balcony looks out into an unforgettable view of Downtown Austin". What we really got was a patio (not a balcony) with a very forgettable view of an IHOP.

3. Wifi is extremely slow. The listing talks about 1Gb/s Google Fiber - multiple speed tests showed we were getting around 8-10Mbps, making it difficult to work remotely or stream anything. Party like it's 2002, I guess.

4. Location. For some people this might be a plus, but for us it wasn't. We aren't living the "Greek Life", so all the loud noise and partying and clogged streets (making it hard to get to the apartment at night) were just a headache, not to mention the drunk idiots being loud in the hallway in the middle of the night. In the morning you get to discover the random crap they leave on the floors of the apartment hallway and lobby, such as tree branches, beer bottles, and spilled food. If you are looking to party, this spot is great, just be aware of the potential downsides.

5. The host took (fairly minor) constructive criticism very poorly. For context, instead of purely written instructions to get into the unit, there are pictures of where to go with text on them with details - sounds great. However, these embedded pictures (not the ones for the listing) could not be expanded on the mobile app, so a lot of the text was cut off. I was unable to read the code because it was cut off. The host gave me the code and I notified them of the cutoff, but instead of acknowledging the obvious deficiency, they insisted (even after some back and forth) I should have used the desktop website and even "printed out the [images]". What is this, MapQuest? I don't know anyone my age who even owns a printer. They also said that it was hard to update the instructions because they have over 10 properties to manage. I guess it must be so difficult to manage so many properties :((((. Firstly, it doesn't make sense for me to use the desktop website in this way when I'm traveling, with 15+ images for getting into the unit, most people are going to be following along in the app. Secondly, I had notified the host that I was displaced from my apartment after it had been out of power for weeks, so I didn't even have a place where I could easily print out jack ****. I really hate people who can't take constructive criticism; it was a sucky way to start off the stay.

The place was okay.  Awkward to get to the place because we had to park in the only non gated lot so walked around the building not even in a walkway. The mattress was terrible with a gigantic sag in the middle, and things were taped together such as the broken toilet paper holder. Signs with so many house rules are all over the place such as ‚Äúno shoes inside‚Äù and $25 per item you don‚Äôt wash.‚Äù The ceiling fan and light in the living room didn‚Äôt work and there were several remotes for it but none worked it.  Overall it felt as if the place was pieced together just to make it a rental.  They did have coffee and water and all the toiletries needed there.

Pros:
-Good location
-Cheap price
-Nice neighborhood
-Clean bed (but not comfy, I would recommend bringing your own pillow and blankets)
-Great amenities


Cons:
-Thin walls
-loud AirBnB roommates (they invited about 6 extra people and a crying baby over for a party/get-together one night and took over the kitchen and living room)

That was the most terrible experience with Airbnb. Rooms don‚Äôt match with the pictures at all. So I didn‚Äôt stay there and just booked a hotel and went away from that place. No reason to lie through the fake pictures. So disappointed. Not clean, so cold and nasty, not safe to stay, no refund. The worst.

I would not recommend booking with Adam. The day of our check in we messaged for the check in information and did not hear back. About 2 hours away from arriving (which was after the appointed check in time) we called and there was no answer. 30 minutes away we called again and he answered stating ‚ÄúOh  Sh!t I forgot.‚Äù He said he would send it right away. 10 minutes away we still didn‚Äôt have the check in information and called again. He answered and started to tell us about the relationship problems he was having with his girlfriend and how he was on the couch. We repeatedly asked for the check in information and eventually he told us the code over the phone. The actual place was fine, and maybe he was just having a bad day but our experience was not good and I wouldn‚Äôt recommend it to anyone else.

I was set to arrive for a two week stay at the exact time a freak icy rain storm hit Austin, but was delayed a day in arriving because the roads were unsafe and piling up with accidents. Unfortunately, an iced over tree fell, taking out the power transformer at Adam‚Äôs AirBnB, as well as a vehicle, making the repair unlikely to be a quick fix for the utility company. Much of the city remained without power for days, including Adam‚Äôs own home.

Yet he took the effort to set me up at an alternate location that his friend happened to have available, a couple blocks away, which I enjoyed. Saved me the hassle of trying to find a hotel at the last minute, at jacked up rates, given so many people in the same area were without power. Good, honest host. I‚Äôm glad he went above and beyond to come through, in difficult circumstances.

The apartment is not as pictured. It is quite rustic. I knew the neighborhood so that was expected but the tub is peeling, the flooring is in rough shape and I was surprised to find a dirty coffee pot and haphazard beverage amenities. As in sugar but in its bag and no creamer options and I had to dig in cabinets to find things. As a crash pad near to UT this was fine but I couldn‚Äôt even eat dinner with my son at the breakfast bar as there was only a single stool.

Pros: Adam is very responsive, and exceptionally quick to address any needs of visitors. The wifi was very fast. The property is centrally located - an easy drive to all of the great local Austin spots. Parking is very convenient.

Cons: This property is a first floor apartment in a noisy building, located two doors down from a fraternity house. We had frequent issues with loud noise, both during the day and at night. Additionally, we had some issues with pre-arrival maintenance of the property. We arrived to a flooded toilet (which then broke a second time after the initial repair) and partially broken blinds. Both issues were resolved within ~48 hours, but should have been addressed prior to arrival. Finally, this property lacks some basics (dresser, cooking utensils, etc), which make for difficulty with longer stays.

Adam completely ghosted my group starting the day before our check in and even after check in time passed. I had to get Airbnb support to help get a refund and book a new place last minute. He informed me 2 days before that the Airbnb had power issues, but after that I never heard from him again. Too many airbnbs in Austin to risk booking a place that may cancel last minute.
Ficamos 2 dias no apartamento da Pam e tudo foi muito bem. O apartamento √© muito bem localizado e bem organizado/limpo

Lupe knew our situation about our kid with autism. She and her husband made discrimination about us and never was flexible about our situation.  we find a long term rental earlier, which was satisfying for an autistic kid that doesn't like change.  Lupe didn't want exceptionnaly to change our dates despite I find for her a client that would book on Airbnb in my place and even for an extra month. we lose more than $2000. the clients I find booked and Lupe had a double pay because of me. she never changed her mind and let us this way. completely unaxczptzble and pure discrimination about person with disabilities. she even tried to ask us more because we had our emotional support dog with us. both have no emotion and if you have an issuer during the stay, know that they will take your money whatever happen, despite we should be protected by the ADA. Even Airbnb did nothing to help us. they said they tried but they said on the host side. be aware !

The reason for the low score is that there were several bugs throughout the home on beds and spider webs in corners. The shower has very low water pressure and the handle even broke on us and required immediate maintenance. The door would not lock although we followed the directions set forth with all codes. Host was not understanding at all.

Enough space for you and your friends. Felt a bit uncomfortable about their initial message. This stay was for my boyfriends birthday. We were somewhat nervous to be outside/be too loud. I tried to do an early check in to set up a surprise for my boyfriend, but it wasn‚Äôt possible unless I booked/paid for an entire additional night, which was unfortunate. Communication was good and location wasn‚Äôt terrible.

Nuestra estad√≠a fue muy buena. La casa es tal cual muestran las fotos, y todo estaba muy limpio. Jillian nos comparti√≥ indicaciones claras, no tuvimos problemas para llegar ni para retirarnos. Volver√≠amos.

Enjoyed our weekend stay at Jillian‚Äôs. Very clean and cozy. It was only us 3 girls but space was big enough for a group of 10 people. The only negative thing was that the downstairs shower was broken so it didn‚Äôt work so was bummed about that.
La casa estaba genial, sin duda si tenemos que volver por la zona repetiremos

We enjoyed our visit to the Austin area. The house interior adequately met our needs. It was small but well laid out and tastefully updated. Fully stocked with essential items (kitchen appliances, table and cookware, paper/plastic goods, tea, coffee, olive oil, laundry/dishwasher/hand soap, shampoo/conditioner/body wash). Dijo was very responsive to our requests although we could have used the dining chair he indicated would be repaired and returned the following day.

The main negative is the neighborhood. Although Dijo assured us he‚Äôd never had any issues, the area is a bit run down. We wouldn‚Äôt be surprised if this is one of the first houses on this street as part of transitioning the area. Cars parked on lawns. Homes in disrepair. Cars and motorcycles racing up and down the street with extremely loud exhausts at all hours of the day and night. Some loud neighbors‚Äô cars made sleeping sometimes difficult as they would come and go at odd hours. Expect road noise regardless of the time of day or night. The street appears to be a pass through or shortcut to enter the freeway. After our visit, we felt the rental price was too high for the location and would not stay here again.
horrible communication. place was really nice tho!

I was asked to be discrete and avoid the leasing office, and that was a little much for me. I didn't use any of the amenities because I wasn't sure if I'd get in trouble or be seen, and I didn't know how well the leasing office knew everyone, and Idk I was just super uncomfortable. I didn't know this was the vibe before checking in so that was disappointing, but I was only there for 4 days so maybe it's ok to be there longer idk

House was nice. The bathrooms especially. However the '5th bed' is just a trundle bed so two of you will be sleeping in the same room. Water was hot, living room was nice. Basic things like glasses and plates are provided which is nice. Only complaints were that the listing does a great job of selling the location, it's actually in a residential neighborhood so it's clearly a property that shouldn't be listed as an AirBnB and someone's just trying to make some money. And it's about 20 minutes outside of Austin, the pictures and description don't do a good job of portraying that reality. They had a wasp problem which wasn't that big of a deal but you don't want to be killing bugs while you're on vacation. And lastly the cleaning requests were ridiculous when compared to the cleaning fee. 150 dollars and we were still asked to strip and collect all linens, take out the trash, and load and start the dishwasher. What does the cleaning fee go towards? Should we have just trashed everything else in order to get our money's worth? Overall it was the ok experience we thought it would be, was a last minute booking because our other booking fell through.
Easy accessible spot. No fuss no frill. House rules are a bit much, not a fan of wanting to charge a fee for minor mistakes.

We had a few bumps, but its really hard to complain about the price. The first night was super rowdy, both the washer and dryer were dysfunctional, and there was a shortage of toilet paper. But again, very economical.

El anfitri√≥n es muy atento, Las habitaciones son limpias y muy c√≥modas, pero la experiencia que tuve con los otros hu√©spedes, no fue agradable, me sent√≠a insegura e inc√≥moda por la cantidad de ruido y fiestas de los  otros hu√©spedes dentro de la misma, sin respetar las reglas del hostal y la permanencia las personas que  realmente vamos descansar y a dormir tranquilos.
