La ubicaci√≥n es muy buena. En general, las habitaciones est√°n bien. Falta un poco de limpieza porque el piso esta muy pegajoso. Le escribi un par de veces a Hunter para resolver algunas dudas, pero no respondi√≥.

Booked this place for two nights for six people. The AC didn't work in either of our two rooms. First night was extremely uncomfortable. Day two there was a heat advisory in Austin as temperatures were as high as 108 degrees, and the rooms were unbearable. Host was condescending and ultimately unresponsive. We ended up finding additional accommodations for the second night. When we returned the next morning to grab the rest of our things and our second vehicle, someone had shot one of our tires. Would highly recommend against staying here.
Great location and very cool place but didn‚Äôt have AC in the rooms and ended up being very uncomfortable at night.
The location was very nice and central but our rooms had no working AC or hot water, even after contacting the host about the fact.

When we checked in, we walked into the rooms and the AC in our rooms was either broken or is just a terrible unit. It had to be somewhere around 85-90 degrees inside. It was a miserable night of sleep. We reached out for support the host didn‚Äôt respond until much later the following morning.

Don‚Äôt book here unless you can confirm the AC in the rooms is working or it‚Äôs winter.

El lugar tiene muy buena ubicaci√≥n! Pero la comunicaci√≥n fue mala y a mi llegada todo estaba muy sucio y desarreglado, definitivamente no lo arreglaron despu√©s de la ultima visita que hab√≠an tenido

If you book this stay, make sure to have a plan b!

When I landed and made my way to the property, I realized the check in instructions did not have the smart key code. I figure no problem, I contact the host and get no answer. I give them an hour then try again. Come two hours into me being locked out, and I‚Äôm unable to get a hold of them and have to stay on the phone with airbnb support for over an hour. Ended up having to cancel my booking and look for a hotel at 10 pm. Easily the worst experience I‚Äôve ever had with airbnb.
No comment

*AVOID at all costs* This may be reasonably priced for Austin, but if you have any issues don't expect the host to be responsive. I happened to get locked out of the apartment on a Saturday evening and all my calls, texts and Airbnb messages were ignored until Monday morning, which was when I was checking out anyway. Had to stay in a hotel and spent the weekend calling a locksmith, following up with the host and Airbnb support while all my stuff was in the apartment. I eventually resolved the issue myself and was given a bad excuse on Monday morning.
Other than that, the apartment didn't feel clean, the filters for water on the fridge needed replacement so the water had a horrible plastic taste, the shampoo dispenser in the bathroom was broken, and it was generally a dark and low ceiling studio. Location was good if you want to be in East Austin, but it's not worth saving the extra $50 or so per night for staying somewhere decent.

L‚Äôappartement de Bryan est avantageusement situ√© pour d√©couvrir le quartier South Congress, m√™me si vous aurez besoin d‚Äôune voiture pour vos d√©placements. Propre et confortable, il n‚Äôy a que la salle de bain et la douche qui nous a d√©√ßu. Bryan est un h√¥te sympathique et disponible.
No surprises, the stay was exactly as expected!

Cozy little cabin spot in a great south austin location! could still use some TLC for the price charged per night. but no big deal. No wifi provided and bad cell service so bring a hotspot! thanks Ronaldo for your quick responses and kindness!

This host canceled the stay the morning I arrived in Austin for a week with my wife and baby. Had to scramble to find other accommodations. Very bad experience and poor communication from the host.

AirBnB support handled the situation very well and was very helpful (thank you AirBnB), but would not recommend booking with Hunter / this house.
Overall, a nice place, spacious and close to a lot of the bars and restaurants. A little confusion with the stay upfront during check in, but no issues past that.

The location is great, but house was just average. When we arrived on a Friday the outside trash was overfilling, and over the weekend animals got into it and trash was spread in the backyard. The pool floats are in poor condition - I wouldn‚Äôt touch. The lights inside the house flicker very often. I understand it‚Äôs an older home but a little work would go a long way. Kitchen didn‚Äôt have  napkins which I thought was odd. Early check out at 10 am (even hotels do at least 11 am now). The instructions say to ask for more towels if needed, and apparently this includes wash clothes for the shower and hand towels because those were not provided. The wallpaper was coming off the wall in the downstairs RR. The toilet paper holder was missing in the master RR. A lot of odd things that doesn‚Äôt match how much you pay for this house, regardless of location.
Wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to stay here again!

Nice, clean space. Nice neighborhood.
Only 1 towel per person + 1 hand towel in each bathroom. No extras.
No towel in powder room on main level.
No hotel sized shampoo or shower soap.
No hair blow dryer.
Coffee maker, but no filters.
You must strip beds and bathrooms and run the washer.
You must take all trash and recycling outside. Recycling was full outside.
Heat was hard to regulate. Too warm on the main level and too cold on the lower level where the bedrooms are located.
A hotel would be a lot more convenient for the price.
House smelled like cat urine communication was terrible and the place is way smaller than the pictures. Neighbors were loud and beds were uncomfortable.. would not recommend

Had people still in the unit cleaning after check in, wasn‚Äôt clean at all even after that. Host had someone come back during our stay to clean again after I asked he wait until I return and not enter without me present- he entered anyways, even after ‚Äúcleaning still very dirty after that and Bryan continually blamed ‚Äúprevious guests‚Äù but I‚Äôm confused how they would‚Äôve caked dust under the beds and on every surface in the home on top of the fact the AC filters were disgusting and don‚Äôt look like they‚Äôve ever been cleaned as to which bryan called this ‚Äúlight dust. Not once did Bryan take responsibility for his property he just made excuses and was extremely rude and made me feel unsafe entering the property against my wishes to clean *again* which shouldn‚Äôt have even been necessary. Hopefully host takes this as a learning experience because much of what was unclean was not from previous guests it was dusty and dirty from extended time without cleaning areas that weren‚Äôt right in the open - under beds, back of tv, inside microwave etc. overall very unhappy with my stay and would not recommend ever. On top of that this is a REHAB property at best. Cabinets scratched to hell, countertop broke in a few places, drywall mudding near AC vents needing to be sanded and painted but clearly the host has zero care for his properties as the state of this place shows. When I noticed Bryan ignored my request to stay out of the property until I was present I chose to stay with a friend for the remainder of my time and Bryan stated ‚Äúyou couldn‚Äôt have stayed with a friend you‚Äôre from chicago‚Äù and was again extremely rude - I‚Äôm an Aggie so unaware to him I have tons of friends in Texas and I DID stay with someone else after my privacy was completely disregarded and another 5% effort cleaning took place. Overall 0/5 stars, waste of money, rehab dirty property at best and extremely rude confrontational host who refused to take any responsibility or even give a partial refund. Wish they‚Äôd show pictures of my experience - he‚Äôd never get it booked again- so disgusting.

NOT worth it !! Having to walk up 4 flights of stairs thru a FILTHY  stairwell to get to an oversized apartment is not worth the deal ..  NOT even close to a ‚ÄúPENTHOUSE ‚Äú as advertised.. entry doors are dirty , walls inside are dirty , just very misleading! Definitely wouldn‚Äôt book again . I‚Äôd rather pay extra & drive tu Buda nxt time ..
Parking is an issue. More than 1 person is issued the same parking spot.  Parking is tight, a black car scratched and dented my work truck. No notification or nothing.

The place isn‚Äôt very pleasing to the eye. The door handle is broken, there are holes in the walls, the floor is dirty and leaves dust on your feet. The sheets are dirty, there are bugs crawling around. Overall not a great stay.

Honestly the place is a beautiful new build that is still currently getting a bit of work done. The front entrance is still gravel which can be a bit hard to navigate with luggage. Overall the stay was not horrible even though there are a lot of rules on the house our party had a good time making the most of things. Since it is a new build there were some problems with the Ac and the lack of tv but things ended up working out. In the end our main problem was that Lucas decided to charge us over $100 of damages that we did not cause. We left the house in an amazing state with video proof yet we now have to pay $65 for a towel rack that was broken when we got there. Along with that he let us know that his last guest had broken the tv and that‚Äôs why we didn‚Äôt have one, which is understandable however now I have to wonder if this is a game to get things paid for in this new build. Overall the stay wasn‚Äôt worth the headache afterwards as I am still dealing with Airbnb to clear things up. I won‚Äôt say Lucas‚Äôs place was horrible but I will say the customer service and overall experience wasn‚Äôt worth it. Beautiful home but not worth your energy.
Was a bit confusing parking but wasn‚Äôt too far from downtown.

Sadly, the power went out all over town after only one night in the condo. Rocio was very understanding and responsive all the way through sorting out cancellation.
We hope to be back when there isn‚Äôt a terrible winter storm!

Big issues:
- If you don‚Äôt want to sleep in, book this spot. Construction right across the street starts at 8am and is so loud due to the thin walls, even some ear plugs won‚Äôt help that much.
- The house has uneven temperature and it‚Äôs impossible to be comfortable in the back area due to the Texas heat.
- They also have a bad couch which broke from normally sitting on it. Cheap furniture in general so if you have heavier guests, beware

Minor issues:
- No ice maker in the fridge
- The kitchen sink faucet is so unhinged and it makes a mess if you don‚Äôt lightly open it

Before we booked this place we were comparing between two different spots and I really wish we had booked the other spot.

The location is great if you want to be across the street from the Fraternity houses at UT. We encountered many problems with the apartment. I had reserved the space for 5 guests and there were only 4 bath towels and 1 hand towel. There was no extra blankets for the pull-out futon bed as well. We ran out of toilet paper on the first day since there was only 1 roll. We had to replenish the supply on our own. The floors were VERY dirty. Bare feet on the floors would turn black after walking around for only a few minutes. The dishes in the cabinet were dirty. Check in went smoothly and the host was very quick with replying in the beginning but communication was lacking after these problems were brought up. The only problem that was resolved was getting a new coffee pot hours after telling the host about how the previous one burned my finger and sparks flew around my face. I am disappointed with the experience as were my friends.

Check in and communication was smooth but when we arrived at the airbnb it didn‚Äôt look the same as the pictures or as described. The rug was not same and very dirty, the couch in the bedroom was not white, the fridge was dented and dirty, things weren‚Äôt hanging on the wall like the pictures. It seems like it was replaced with used furniture found on campus. The apartment floors were dirty and there was half a toilet paper roll when we arrived for a stay of three people. How is the host utilizing the cleaning fee? That should be refunded. The power went out in the restroom and we didn‚Äôt know how to fix it the whole night. The same alarm kept going off every few minutes for the four days of our stay, the walls are definitely very thin. We were staying here because we had artists performing at ACL, so when we get back to the airbnb, we just wanted to sleep after working 16 hour days, and the repeated noise and thin walls made it impossible and an insomniac nightmare. The front door‚Äôs handle was janky and could‚Äôve easily been broken into. We didn‚Äôt feel safe and secured staying here. Because of that, we only flagged the toilet paper and restroom light to the host, because we were scared to cause any issues during our stay and heighten our unsafety. Definitely would not recommend. We deserve reimbursement especially for a cleaning fee that‚Äôs not utilized.

The first impression when walking in: Stinks (literally) and paint on the walls is coming off. Terrible cleaning job: Found a used flosser on the ground, fridge wasn't even wiped down, etc. Also, the neighborhood isn't good... We ended our 7 night stay after the first night.
Not great!

Unfortunately this was not an ideal stay for us. We have been AirBnBing for years, and this was definitely the worst experience we have had with a house. We booked this reservation months in advance. Several weeks after making the reservation, the hosts tried to get us to cancel the reservation saying the city was increasing regulations on short term rentals. They tried to get me to cancel the reservation so they would be off the hook when I had no intention of cancelling. When I responded with a no, they suddenly were able to make it work. In addition to this, This house is full of botched DIY repairs that are safety issues. There are outlets not secured correctly and are hanging out of the walls, ceiling fans that are not installed correctly (we couldn't even turn on the one in the master it was shaking so badly), and lots of sloppy paint and finish work. We even had a shower head fall off while in use. In addition to this, the house is furnished with what seems like the cheapest possible furnishings, bedding and kitchenware. Our stay was very uncomfortable. These hosts seem to have cut every corner possible to save a buck.

This home was pretty but had several issues from a functionality standpoint point. First- the audio on the tv in the living room didn‚Äôt work and we had to fix that. Second- and most importantly- we were locked out two nights by the door code being changed during our stay. One of these nights was in the rain and we were unable to get in. We ended up having to jump the fence (sustaining injury) to get in the back door. For the high price point I would expect to not be repeatedly locked out. Lastly, the owners kept increasing the temperature of the air conditioning remotely during the day to 78 making the house very hot and uncomfortable.

It was okay; the area looked scary but the air bnb was okay. It did not have things a hotel would for the price such as sugar, creamer, etc. and there is no way to get in if you lock bottom lock. You will just be asked if you are in the right unit when they know the bottom lock does not let u in and there is no spare key. I could not shower as the shower did not work; you can probably try a bath. The dryer would not dry my items although I tried two days over and over.

quand nous sommes arriv√©s un dimanche, nous avions re√ßu l'adresse et le code d'un autre appartement.

Location was not actually in the Mueller district like described, but rather a good 20 minute walk to shops and the HEB nearby. In a car, this is no problem, but on foot with children it was problematic. The amenities (e.g. toilet paper, paper towels, kitchen towels, etc.) were poorly stocked and we had to go to the gas station for tp 2 days into our stay. The backyard was littered with garbage and there was a pretty bad wasp infestation with several nests and swarms under the porch covering. Less of an issue but something to be aware of is that the mailbox for all units is located right next to the front door and people were regularly stopping by that area so we just kept the blinds closed. The furniture quality is very poor - the couch had issues laying down into a bed and once it was in position, the middle collapsed while a normal-sized adult was simply lying on it; a corner of the king bed also collapsed the first night and we were unable to fix it without extra tools and materials. The renovated place looked very nice upon arrival, but it ended up being a stressful and very low-quality stay. Hopefully these issues can be addressed for future stays because it otherwise would have been an average Austin vacation.

Holes in the flooring
Broken chairs, couch, & bed
Kitchen pans were caked with dirty burnt food
Trash in the backyard

House obviously wasn‚Äôt cleaned and inspected correctly in between guests.

Also no toaster when it said toaster.

Host was helpful though sending toaster and handyman to fix furniture.

Host also asked if there was anything in particular we‚Äôd like since the ‚Äúbroken-in feel‚Äù was uncomfortable for us.
I don‚Äôt think host understood furniture was literally broken. It was as if last guest had a fight club in the house and the cleaning people somehow didn‚Äôt notice. Handyman arrived and was like ‚Äúyeah this furniture is broken, it just needs to be thrown away‚Äù

The house was designed well and would‚Äôve been a good stay if there was usable furniture and clean cookware.

The place looked nice and was accessible to down town Austin. Area is not the best but not bad. Awesome food trucks down the street.
We found roaches in kitchen our last night when we were going to cook. Sent to host.
Probably wouldn‚Äôt stay in area or apartment again

Unfortunately I did have a bad experience at my stay.  The apt was not an ‚Äúentire place‚Äù as advertised because the host has their private items in the home which is not disclosed in the listing. The closet in both bedrooms were locked and the 1 dresser was half full so there was nowhere to unpack. The refrigerator was half full with half eaten groceries and the freezer was completely full with groceries. There were many personal items in the bathrooms such as someone‚Äôs toothbrush. There are actually 2 bedrooms with doors in the home and then one small room with only a privacy curtain in front of it incase privacy is a priority for you. My check in was delayed by several hours and the apt was grotesquely dirty when we arrived with unidentifiable goo and dried spills on the bedroom night stands, floor, in the refrigerator, and on multiple dining room chairs. There was mold in both of the showers and the master bath smells like mildew. The communication with my host was unfortunate and was only excuses rather than anything constructive to rectify the situation during our stay. A cleaning service could have easily been sent out during our stay while we were out of the Airbnb exploring Austin, but that level of care did not occur. I understand accidents can happen, but this was the most poorly handled air bnb experience I have ever had.

Won‚Äôt choose it again.
Check in was messy with a code not working at 1 am, tv and lights were on inside and back door open. It was really awkward. House can definitely use some repairs and maintenance. Beware the picture showing backyard is not updated. There is a new construction at the back of the garden where host‚Äôs mother lives. She is a very sweet and quiet lady, willing to help. But she babysits for children so you will see them through the windows and glass doors if you open the blinds to let light come in since it is dark inside. Communication with the host was poor.
Sin duda regresaremos, Kj siempre estuvo pendiente!! Nos sentimos como en casa!
Plenty of room for four adults, clean and kitchen had everything we needed. Close to downtown and quiet outside - floors are very creaky but otherwise no noise from neighbors.
Only issue was one of the pictures showed two beds downstairs near the tv. There is only a small couch. No bed there.
was ripped off and responce was call air b n b. no trust
My room wasn't ready because the maid didn't show up. This ended up being bad luck and timing. The hosts also weren't there to resolve the situation.
Couldnt have been better

Pros:
Great location! Near restaurants, bars, amenities close to the convention center as I was there for SXSW .

Cons:
Wasn‚Äôt very clean, had fruit flies, flying around in the rooms, but no food anywhere so that was weird, the garbage disposal had rocks or something in it, and the dryer door had a sharp edge which I cut myself on and there was no first aid kit.

Wonderful area, walkable distance from lots of restaurants, target, and Whole Foods. Very cozy studio, I felt right at home. The noise level wasn‚Äôt bad for me, I see a lot of people complained about the nearby train but I hardly noticed it was there!

don't rent in the Summer - the AC doesn't work to cool the house below 84. their fix was to send his in-laws with portable units from San Antonio - two hours. the problem with all this he knew it didn't work

The apartment is on the 3rd floor. You will need to carry your luggage up flights of stairs. No coffee maker or tea kettle in the kitchen. The beds are confortable.  Could not find the wifi password anywhere.
Bugs infestation made our stay memorable in a negative way. Location not desirable for the price paid to stay. üëéüèºüëéüèºü™≥üëéüèºüëéüèº
was a nice place to stay but the listing listed a grill and fire pit. was very disappointed to learn otherwise

The location is in the middle of an OK neighborhood, it's not bad but not good either. There were ants issue which Dijo was quick to address in providing the ants spray and baits. There were also an issue with the bathroom door lock and odor on the sofa in the family room. I understand it being a pet-friendly place accident is inevitable, however, it should have been dealt with for future guest. Overall, it could be a decent place to stay at once these few minor issues have been resolved.

Host messaged me after booking was paid and confirmed saying that the booking was unavailable even though it was listed for the night on AirBnB. He was unable to cancel the booking himself, so I had to call AirBnB support to cancel it in a way that avoided the fees. This issue made it difficult and more expensive to rebook elsewhere at the last minute. The host needs to be more organized at managing his listing.

Not the best value for what you get- this is an apartment in an actual apartment complex, sort of odd for an Airbnb..also, no condiments to cook,  no coffee, & pans are not great. Very plain Jain place, doesn‚Äôt have a comfy homey vibe. Only plus is GOOD location! But you must have car or use Uber.
meh
This property is conveniently located and spacious. Unfortunately, the cleanliness was an issue, which was addressed by the owner.
Cozy place to crash in a central location! Jean was quick to respond to messages
The general area is not safe and would not recommend walking around alone or after dark.

I really want to rate this place a 5 because the house is beautiful but there was a lot of stuff broken.
We arrive after 4pm and the house cleaner was still there which was weird. He let us in, brought our bags in, showed us the broken dishwasher handle and cool ice machine and then left.
Upstairs the toilet seat literally falls off the toilet.
They couldn‚Äôt tell me how to work garbage disposal.
The large mirror was broken.
The yurt that I paid an extra $600 to be set up was very dirty inside and had lots of spiders.
Not only was the handle to the dishwasher broken but the drawer doesn‚Äôt pull out so we weren‚Äôt able to wash dishes the whole time.
The beautiful outdoor shower/bath is broken and unusable.
There were fire ants everywhere even inside the house.
There was a stray cat in the back yard that kept running into the house because of the giant back doors and was literally attacking the guests legs while chasing them onto table tops aggressively. Looked like someone was feeding it in the backyard on a plate. One of the guests was allergic to cats and had asthma issues by the time we left.
The pool house bedroom had someone‚Äôs dirty panties on the bed when we arrived so obviously those bedsheets weren‚Äôt cleaned prior to us arriving.
Now they are trying to charge me $150 for the broken dishwasher handle even though the cleaning company was well aware it was broken prior to us coming and literally showed half the group it was broken. ANXIETY!

The location was so great! SoCo is right there, so my group was able to walk around easily and found a lot of places to eat just walking out of the airbnb. The host was very responsive, but my only complaint is the apartment complex towed my car. I followed the directions from the host for parking, but it wasn‚Äôt working properly so my car wasn‚Äôt registered. It got towed in the middle of the night, and I noticed it missing when I went to look for it. It really killed the mood for my group, and we had to cut activities short the next day to make time to find my car.

The apartment is in a great location, however I was disappointed with a few things during my stay. Miscommunication regarding parking and not having the code to access the pool caused unnecessary stress and inconvenience. The pool was clean at the beginning of the stay, but got progressively dirtier by day 4 with all the walls turning green with algae.  The pool is also a bit of a walk from the apartment (about 5 min) and there is no bathroom to use, so you have to walk back to the apartment. Highlights of the apartment: the beds are comfy and the AC works VERY well!

Jen & Steven were very nice and easy to communicate with. Unfortunately, the apartment flooded because someone on a floor above nodded off and let the toilet run, which made its way down into the apartment I was staying in. Not Jen & Steven‚Äôs fault but can‚Äôt recommend anyone would stay here based on my experience and the likely water damage the apartment is going to have.

The AC didn‚Äôt work the whole time. I messaged the owner and they said someone would come out but they never did. We opened a window at night to sleep in a bit more comfort but there were no screens on the window so we got bit by mosquitoes. Not worth the experience

Worst stay I‚Äôve had with Airbnb. There is too much to go into detail so I will list bullet points below:
Issues Reported upon arrival:
- No hot water
- Bugs on the floor throughout the apartment
Issues through out our stay:
- Never fixed hot water: maintenance did come eventually and reported it as a larger issue. But there was never a fix or timeline provided.
- Water throughout the apartment was turned off twice during our stay without warning. (Once while I was in the shower‚Ä¶)
- AC was not working: maintenance came by to address this and in their second visit after our multiple notices said the unit was ultimately too old and needed to be replaced. Thankfully the staff at the apartment complex was kind enough to provide AC units too cool us down.
- Dryer would shut off and did not proper dry clothes.
- kitchen utensils were bought and did not work. (Ex. Dull knives, peeler did not peel)

Both of us have worked in property management and can sympathise with all that goes into managing properties. There was clearly no proper walk through done of this apartment. We did everything in our power to communicate these issues and received little communication or response until we protested. The only solution provided to us was to cancel our reservation and vacate the property. Unfortunately there were no options for us to go to and this would forfeit any possible refund. So now we‚Äôre uncomfortable and insulted.

Please, please, PLEASE don't stay here! Terrible host experience. The keycode lock was faulty and I had many videos to prove it yet the host gaslit me and my friend and said we were inputting the code wrong. We were locked outside in 48 degree weather for an hour at midnight trying to get a hold of the host. In the late morning, the host dropped off a key that we were able to use for the rest of the stay even though the lock remained broken. (NO APOLOGY). There were roaches and mold in the unit. Host response time was also very delayed. Just shocking how the host continues to deny the lock was broken and to gaslight us. Two WOMEN outside in the cold for one hour at midnight ... meant nothing to this host. Great to know Air Bnb works with hosts who don't care about the safety of women. Shame on them and shame on this host.
Mold in the bathroom, air vent was caked with dust, floors were gross. Door alarm went off every time we locked it. Don‚Äôt stay here.

I ignored some of the previous reviews and ended up booking this place. Bad idea. The location was in a super weird spot and the apartment complex was very run down and dirty. The unit itself was also not very clean. The hot water didn‚Äôt work and we ended up only staying here for about 30 minutes before we decided to book and stay somewhere else. Overall the hosts were responsive and I don‚Äôt hold it against them but I would advise against staying here.
La clave de acceso no era la correcta y la comunicaci√≥n no fue buena!!

Lipstick on a Pig. Make sure to read all the negative reviews. We experienced most of them during our stay.

We brought some minor things to their attention. Some things were fixed and some were never followed up on. We smelled something in the king sized bedroom and didn't realize what it was. After investigating, we realized the smell was from the bed. The smell was in the comforter and sheet which we took off the bed to find there was no mattress pad on the bed. The cleaning staff had to see the huge urine stain on the bed when changing the bedding. It was gross! We sent a message and a text message; both were ignored by owner.

Some things we experienced while we were there was a lack of hot water, pool code didn't work, pool needed attention (that was one thing they took care of), the dry didn't dry towels, not the greatest neighborhood, people smoking marijuana at the pool, floors were dirty, and the had a huge urine stain on the king size bed. Would not recommend staying here.
I had a few minor issues with the place during my stay but in all it wasn‚Äôt too bad.

The apartment is a little run down but the worst part was the dog area. Covered with poop. No place for me to stand or my dog to go the bathroom. Also, they requested we take the trash out to the dumpster but didn't leave instructions for where it was. The extra dog cleaning fee made this place way too pricey for what it is.

The house was big and beautiful, the pool was great, tons of beds and a separate fridge for beverages was convenient. But the house needs a ton of updates/work. Toilets were inconsistent. The dryer vent hadnt been emptied in years - could easily cause a house fire. The outside lightbulbs needed to be replaced so we had to change the bulbs ourselves and didn't have enough bulbs for the lights by the fireplace, so we sat there in the dark. Upstairs was brutally hot for sleeping - everyone woke up covered in sweat. Ceiling fan was broken in one of the rooms. Asking to turn the pool and hot tub on constantly was a nightmare, although they responded fast. We paid $1000 to heat the pool for 3 days and they kept turning it off remotely so it would get cold on us. It costs $75 to heat a 50x25 pool in New York for 4 days, for reference. It had all the amenities we could ask for - stove, BBQ grill, fireplace outside, hot tub, several bathrooms. Overall great house but the shortcuts were infuriating and we felt it wasn't worth the money we spent.

The Good: location is great. lots of stuff around the area. house is newer and looks nice.
The Bad: there are no curtains on any windows so no real privacy and people could look inside easily. there is no door knob on the bathroom door so you can't close it fully. we had a few cockroaches which was not pleasant.
The place is nice and quiet. my only concern is that the restroom has no door, it has some kind of blinds for closing it so there is no privacy when going to the restroom
The neighborhood may not seem the best as you are driving through, but this home is a gem!
Todo excelente, Mariana es excelente como anfitri√≥n, sin duda regresamos
Although there were a couple questionable confetti pieces left behind, this place rules. Host rules. Location rules. It rules

Great location. Here are some concerns: no fitted sheet on the bed so we slept on the actual mattress for part of the night. The dishwasher had other people‚Äôs dishes in them. Trash can was broken in the kitchen. Hair on the sheet when we arrived.

House was spacious, but the extended list of added fees and rules were just too much (fail to start dishwasher: $40, late checkout? $45, the list goes on‚Ä¶). Private gate was broken, parking is extremely cramped. Host seemed inconsiderate upon departure. Over all, stay was more expensive than it was worth. Not a good deal.

P.S. extremely sparse on ‚Äúwelcome snacks‚Äù ‚Ä¶ did not feel very warm and welcoming at all, more like cold and calculated. $$$

Not for the light sleeper; significant road noise from nearby highway. The unit itself is tucked behind a home on a low traffic street.  House was super-clean, though some of the furnishings a bit tired; I'm sure the host will address.

Great location on the East side near all the bars, easy access to convention center and 6th St via Uber (good luck getting them to accept the short ride tho) or taking a scooter along the convenient walkways between 3rd and 4th, just watch out for freeway feeder traffic. Checkin was easy and host even let me check in early (thank you). A few thoughtful touches included a list of places to go, cooking gear for the kitchen, soap and dryer sheets for the W/D, and even a few drinks. Parking was easy-ish since I didn't make use of the private parking space.

A couple of notes: 1) it's a big anonyplex so it's not easy to navigate, you just wander around until you find stuff. 2) there's minimal or missing window coverings in the unit so you're both awake at daybreak and super exposed to the whole complex particularly at night. 3) the wi-fi is a bit hiccup-y even after a reboot but should suffice if you're not doing stuff that needs a ton of bandwidth.

I worked around the window issue by swapping the curtains from the W/D to the window and covering the exposed patio door. When I mentioned these to the host she was snippy and dismissive ("your complaint is duly noted") so I avoided communicating with her for the rest of the trip üò¨ ‚òπÔ∏è

There were only a few complaints about Hannah's place. One, the TV in the main room didn't have any sound and no instructions were left on how to use the TV in any way not only to get sound but to choose channels as well. I didn't know if she only had Ruko or if she had Hulu as well. TV usage instructions should have been left. Also, the entrance door had a terrible squeaking sound.
W-D40 would take care of that noise.
And general instructions were not left on site. The board said to take garbage to the other end of the 3rd floor. I walked the 3rd floor twice and did not see any place to take the garbage. I messaged Hannah the day before leaving and never heard from her (at least not by the time I went to bed the night before leaving).
Also, before I came I had asked about towels and sheets and I was told there are plenty of towels and sheets. There were 4 wash cloths and 3 towels no hand towels. And they were very difficult to find. They were not in the bathroom.

Sadly, I would not recommend this space to folks. While the apartment is described accurately, the actual space is less than spectacular and dissatisfying.
Specifically, we arrived and it was clear the floors hadn‚Äôt been cleaned. We even found leftover items from whoever stayed prior to us and furniture moved around (not representative of the place they appeared to be depicted in on the listing itself). In addition to the lack of cleanliness, the toilet seat was loose and almost falling off, the kitchen sink frequently flooded, the garbage disposal is broken, and there is clearly a cockroach infestation because we found more than 5 during our stay.
As if these things weren‚Äôt bad enough, one morning during our stay, we were informed 41 minutes prior that our water would be shut off for 5 hours due to an emergency. While emergencies happen, it was another example of the fact that this space is just not fit for guests.
If I had to describe this space with one label, I‚Äôd call it ‚ÄúAn Aesthetically Pleasing Motel.‚Äù Emphasis on the motel. That being said, if you feel comfortable dealing with everything I listed above‚Äî it‚Äôs very affordable and centrally located.

The apartment is clean and cute on the inside. But it is in a neighborhood I did not feel safe outside at night. I feel it was priced too high for where it was located. I do not know anything about Austin so I was not aware of the neighborhood beforehand or I would not have stayed her
No issues, good location.

There were not enough towels for our party and they did bring more the second day of our stay.

Overall, the place was disappointing. It is quite dirty and run down.
-candy/food in couch
-rug is dirty/gross/sticky
- extra blankets for sofa bed were very dirty- like a huge ketchup/food stain that had been there a while. Clearly had not been washed.
-Pool is dirty- cigarette buts and trash in it

- bedroom door will not stay shut
- strong smell of spray/deodorizer trying to cover up another smell (smoke)

The space is great. The beds are comfy. But overall I would not recommend this place or stay again.

The place itself is really nice and has everything you need. All communication with the host was timely and professional. But unfortunately, the area and the apartment complex felt unsafe. We did not have any incidents happen, but I wouldn't stay in that area again.

The host incorrectly set the pin code to get in the room so we could not get in upon arrival and could not get a response from either host our property manager so we were forced to find a new hotel which was an extreme inconvenience given that we drove 12 hours
Airbnb was a bit dirty when we arrived, we had to clean it ourselves which was not ideal hence the cleaning fee we are charged and the location was a bit sketchy but close to where we had to go.

If you like hanging out with roaches, the smell of glade plug-ins entering your soul and like to be harassed by your host at seven in the morning about when you‚Äôre going to leave then this is the place for you. The irony of them bugging me at 7 I‚Äôm the morning to get out so that they can clean earlier when their next check-in is at 6 PM is hysterical for the amount of roaches that were in this apartment. I think we killed a colony. I have pics to prove it. Stay away
Not the hosts fault, but neighbors are noisy and mentally unstable. Apartment complex grounds are filthy, trash and cigarettes everywhere.

The house was exactly as listed so no surprises. It was recently remolded, so the entire house and the appliances are brand new. The hosts kept in constant communication and provided all the details you need and also provided local spots to visit.
The floor plan is open and spacious. All the rooms have a tv's and ceiling fans. The neighborhood is working class and quiet at night. I would stay here again.

El apartamento de Ben es precioso y est√° muy limpio y ordenado.
Se puede disfrutar de la tranquilidad y quietud de una casa de campo sin estar muy lejos de la ciudad.
El lugar y el anfitri√≥n son 100% recomendables. Ya habr√° tiempo de repetir la visita‚Ä¶
¬°Muchas gracias por tu hospitalidad, Ben!

Most horrible experience I‚Äôve ever had booking an Airbnb! Holly, the host was absolutely terrible. She was so unresponsive. Took her forever to respond to my messages. Check in was horrible and there is no code to get in so she has to be available for entry, yet she doesn‚Äôt answer her phone. The day of check out she knocked on our door at 8 AM and asked us when we were going to get out. Our checkout was not till 12 PM so she sat in the kitchen banging pans trying to annoy us. There is also a train two steps away from the unit that goes by every hour. It is the loudest train I have ever heard in my life. There was a note saying the train stopped at 12 AM but that was a lie. It goes on all night all day, and you will not get any sleep whatsoever. I would never book this Airbnb. Beware!

Es una casa que est√° nueva y es espectacular! Estaba muy limpia, el trato agradable y es muy comfortable.
La zona no est√° mal, pero no hay supermercado o bares para llegar a pie.

En coche todo es fant√°stico, lo recomiendo!

The Internet was not there and here is power outage in 2 rooms and my guests slept outside and for entire night we have no power in 2 rooms and no Internet working and ruined our Sunday evening.

Better they have better service for their guests and overall its not a good experience.

Thank You

It‚Äôs a wonderful place to stay it as everything you‚Äôll need for your vacation. We booked it a specially  because of the fire place and the jacuzzi that did not work the first couple of days of our stay . The jacuzzi was nasty and gross and the fire place missed the key to start . We wish the host cared for it prior to our arrival and we wish we didn‚Äôt have to deal with it.
Great location with space but had some bug problems.
We had a few bumps in the road with this stay. But we kept messaging the owner and they did make every effort in solving the problems we had.

The place was OK, but some details, like a leaking shower floor and wet clothes in the washer could be overlooked. Nevertheless, the electronic lock stopped working on my 3rd day. I could not leave the apartment, because it wouldn't lock. It took 3 and a half hours of waiting to have the lock fixed!! Needless to say, this killed my morning schedule. There seems to be a serious communication issue between the host and maintenance. It seems, that as a superhost,  they have too much on their plate. Communication with the host had a 1 and a half hour gap, when my messages went unanswered. This is what really forced me to downgrade my rating with them.

It really feels like your own space. I was a bit weary of an apartment attached to a house, but you don‚Äôt notice it and forget it‚Äôs there.

Great hosts. They even left a binder of recommendations to go.

Host was great but very disappointed in the rental place. There was gnats flying around everywhere and I found more than a handful of cockroaches in the unit. I eventually had to stay in a hotel. Next time I will spend a little more and rent a place that‚Äôs quiet, private, and clean. This was a waste of money.
Luis‚Äôs space is exactly as advertised! Luis worked my reservation out with when had work cancelled! Very accommodating!

Pros: outlets had usb plugs, not cluttered, nice spacious living room, open shelves in the kid rooms, came with an air mattress, master bedroom had a desk, wifi pw was easy to find, had labels, master bed was comfortable, there was 1 toy for my son to play with, nice black-out curtains

Cons: Home was not very well stocked. Not enough dishes, coffee mugs, silverware, hand towels, soap, or wash cloths. It says it sleeps 6 guests, but the home only provided 4 coffee cups. Home only came with 9 spoons, so we had to keep hand-washing them to have enough. Master bath had 2 sinks but they only provided 1 hand towel. House had no wash cloths at all. House had no bar soap at all. They only provided head and shoulders 2 in 1 shampoo, so you have to take a shower with no conditioner, no bar soap, and no wash cloth. House had no hangers, so I had to drape my clothes over the closet rod, but when I pulled them down, they were covered in dust from the closet rod. House had no pen and paper, nothing to write on. House had 2 nightstands in master bedroom, but only 1 had a lamp, so the 1 person has to use their phone flashlight to go to bed. Kitchen was not stocked as well as other air bnbs we‚Äôve stayed in. Most of the kitchen cabinets were empty. The home shows a garage in the picture, so we were expecting to be able to park in the garage, but the garage was locked, so we had to park in the driveway, but there was no working light over the driveway, so you have to use your phone flashlight to go to and from your car at night, and you have to leave your car outside in the dark overnight. The porch light was not activated by light or motion, so unless someone turned it on before leaving the house, it‚Äôs dark when you come back, and you have to use your phone flashlight to see the key pad. There was no working light in laundry room (overhead light was not working and lamp was not working), so we had to use our phone flashlight to use the laundry room. As of right now, while I‚Äôm writing this review, the home description does not reveal that the garage will be locked and not usable. Overall, it was a good house. It just needs sensor lights on the driveway and porch, interior lights fixed, to disclose that the garage is not part of the rental, and to be a little more stocked.

This is absolutely NOT a lakefront property! Don‚Äôt bother ‚Äúinquiring about water level for dock usage‚Äù because there is no water. The fact that Kim still advertises this place as lakefront is completely fraudulent. She defended her listing by telling us that if we wanted to use the dock we should have asked (as clearly stated in her description), but we did not need use of the dock - We wanted to be near and see the water, which based on her EXTREMELY misleading photos looks to have been present at some point in time but no longer is.

Instead of putting the responsibility on your guests to inquire about water level ‚Äúfor dock use‚Äù, perhaps it would be more forthcoming to not market the home in all caps as lakefront, take down the outlandishly old photos of the dock, and let Airbnb users know that if they would like to host their family at a lakefront property for their wedding weekend, this is not the place to do so.

As if that wasn‚Äôt disappointing enough, the home was 91 degrees when we checked in, and it took a full 24 hours to get the thermostat down to a comfortable temperature. To top it all off, each of the first level bedrooms (including the guest house) were covered in ants, and we found several cockroaches in the master bathroom. This was by far the worst experience we have ever had at a home booked through Airbnb.

Was not a good location don‚Äôt leave your key upstairs you will not be able to get back in and will be locked outside for a hour or so. Bed sheets were still dirty and the smell of apartment made my allergies act up bad
Decent place for my 2 month stay. Would not return though. Place is not comfortable enough for long term stays.

Melinda‚Äôs home is walkable to E 6th. Very cute decor but old fridge (1930s) with limited freezer space. A few cockroaches but they responded quickly with an exterminator. Provided prompt replies when messaged. Limited dining area in the home.

- a little dirtier than expected
- location was fairly accurate (not a 5 min drive from 6th st)
- everything else met expectations

My stay was easy and smooth. Little bit loud outside on the weekends but there‚Äôs a sound machine to drown it out.
Would come back!

This is a bit long, but wanted to be accurate. If we could post pictures, I would.

When we walked in, we really wanted to like the location. Yes it was super clean and well organized. Up until check in, Dream communicated well.

The first night the full size bed frame, which is were I was sleeping (alone), broke in the middle of the night while I slept. The mattress literally fell to the floor.

I contacted Dream first thing in the morning, about 7am, they replied about 2 hours later stating that they would go and repair it that day. We would not be back until after 5pm and we let them know. Dream said not to worry. If this was done, I would not be writing this or giving negative feedback, as mistakes happen.

When we arrived back at 7:45pm, the bed had not been fixed. I messaged Dream, got a reply 2 hours later stating that their worker could not make it. So basically they had the entire day to follow up with their "worker" and they did not.

The resolution, another night sleeping on the floor. The room was barely big enough to set the mattress next to the broken frame.

The next morning we checked out and messaged Dream to let them know and asked if there was anything they would do to make the situation right, you know customer service. The answer "just leave the key on the counter".

We paid full price and one of us slept on the floor 1.5 nights, with the owner seeming to not care, just wanting to collect the money. We use Air BnB a lot, this is the worst experience we have had.

Regarding to the surrounding area, two blocks away another apartment complex was boarded up and tagged up with graffiti. 2-3 blocks in the other direction a lot of homeless people. The neighbors were very loud all night, which did not help when sleeping on the floor.
Our stay was okay. Second bedroom had a broken bed and cockroaches in the kitchen.

Sadly, this was overall not the best experience. The initial communication and self check in was great. Having a place to park and only being 10 minutes outside of the city was ideal. The surrounding area of the place wasn‚Äôt the best and would not feel safe to walk around. When we arrived, we got a message stating the AC was no longer working and it was a 100 degree weekend. Luckily, by the second day of our trip this was fixed. But also on the second day, the full size bed frame broke and half the mattress was on the floor‚Ä¶ for the rest of the trip as we never got a response regarding this breaking. Come to find out via the reviews, the same thing has happened to all the guests in the last 2 months. Also, there were small cockroaches that were in the kitchen and living space which made the rest of the stay there very uneasy and uncleanly. Lastly, there was zero communication about the check out process.

When I arrived I began to follow the check-in instructions and they were incorrect. It told me to go to a lock box to get the key but they lock box was open and empty. I called the customer service and they told me to just use the keypad on the door which I did. Upon entering, it smelled terrible and I quickly realized they did not clean the place at all. The sheets were stained with what looked like menstrual blood, the kitchen was a mess, the bathroom was a mess. This was at 3am. I called again and they made me spend the night at a different Air bnb 20 minutes away. They told me that I could stay there for the night and they would try to have someone clean the original Airbnb first thing in the morning, but if they couldn't that I had to leave the second Airbnb by 11am because it was booked for that day. Needless to say, I stayed at the second Airbnb until the first was cleaned. When I went back, I inspected the Airbnb and the sheets were still stained. I sent them pictures of this. They later interrupted my stay to have someone come change the sheets. This inconvenience ruined my stay. I was very unhappy with my experience. They even agreed to provide me with financial compensation to make up for the inconvenience but then never did so. I would not stay with this company ever again nor would I recommend anybody else do the same!!!
It was very comfy! And Shirley was so fast at responding. I had trouble with the gate code and she helped me immediately.

The place wasn‚Äôt dirty but it didn‚Äôt feel clean either. There was no WiFi which did surprise us.
Also a lot of the fixtures in the bathroom are installed backwards. You need to twist the opposite way for the bathroom to open, the bathroom cabinet opens the wrong way, and the toilet paper roll holder was installed wrong so it faces downwards if you try to put it on.

Not terrible or anything. But definitely has its flaws.

El espacio es tal cual se ve en fotos, es limpio, se encuentra bien dotado y est√° cerca de una gran plaza comercial y del aeropuerto de Austin. La comunicaci√≥n con el host y la ayuda recibida para acceder al alojamiento no fueron las mejores
Fake room waste of money ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶don‚Äôt book this room ‚Ä¶..
Conveniently located off the i-35. Well written instructions on directions and check in. No communication with host was needed.

The bed set and bathroom smelt sour. The bathroom was dirty. The mirror had water marks and the sink had hair on it. The bathtub was also pretty dirty. There was a bar of soap with an unreasonable amount of hair on it. Towels were provided but no washcloth. Besides that it was alright.

DO NOT STAY HERE! By far the worst lodging experience I‚Äôve ever had. When we entered the home it was riddled with mosquitos. We all left the Airbnb with a minimum of 20 mosquito bites each after our first night. Mosquitos covered the inside of the house (in the shower, bedrooms, living room) and any exposed skin while sleeping would be full of bites. We chose this place due to the close proximity to my sisters wedding venue (the Arlo), but this was a massive mistake. Ashton has been a huge pain to deal with. We asked a few weeks out from our booking if we could be refunded for the last night of our stay (due to a dilemma we had to fly home early) and Ashton denied. He eventually offered a partial refund but has still not paid it and is non-responsive. The house itself is okay, but the property is not as nice as the pictures make it look. In addition, the beds were extremely uncomfortable. Please do yourself a favor and look elsewhere for an Airbnb.

Great location, but more of a "dorm room" feel to the apartment. The platform bed is only a few inches off the floor which makes it uncomfortable getting in/out of the bed. The slates also slipped off the frame when you roll over. There were also no metal utensils to use for grilling.

After paying 15$ to park the first night set the mood
Tv and cable didn‚Äôt work (junk)
Shower didn‚Äôt work, showered in a mist it was horrible and zero wash cloths
Horrible experience

Check in was a nightmare. Thought our host was ignoring us, had to message another host who shares the same listing. This is an old listing!!!! Please message the host BEFOREHAND. Although it was beautiful inside, bugs were a problem due to a window being left open for who knows how long. Towels were missing and parking is a bit annoying with other guests right next door. Speaking of guests, if the other side is occupied, you will almost hear everything they say or do. The wall is paper thin and was incredibly disturbing. Also, there is no thermostat in the home, you have to contact a different host to get things fixed. Good location though right next to highway but parking is limited as stated in their comments. Overall our stay was definitely below average.

The location of Air BnB was stellar. The check in instructions on where to park/ how to get to the place was not clear. My experience trying to message and contact them was quite horrible. Throughout the process i was contacting them prior to coming and on the date i stayed. They never responded before when I had questions and during the duration I stayed they responded a day later‚Ä¶.. I understand that circumstances do arise but customer service is what is key in this profession and it was not good. As far as the Air BnB there was a blanket on top of the sofa with branches! As if it came from outside. I was going to let my daughter use that one until I saw how dirty it was. There was also trash bag with trash inside of the laundry room. Lastly, it was cold during the time I stayed, I tried to turn on the heater for my parents and the alarm went on when I had the heater on. Just horrible. Other than that the location is spectacular if you want to stay in the Domain. That‚Äôs about it.
a+ host, a+ place. would stay there again with zero hesitation.
The place was clean and not far from downtown or the airport. However, lots of noise in and around the apartment complex at night coupled with an  uncomfortable bed makes sleep difficult.

We wanted to love this Airbnb and we were very excited to stay here but we left a little bit disappointed due to the reasons listed below. The location is great because it is close to everything! The location is surrounded by homeless people but they didn‚Äôt bother us. The instructions left from the owners were easy to follow. It is a nice Airbnb but it‚Äôs expensive for what you actually get.

- Both the balcony and backyard were dirty (especially the balcony) and the outdoor furniture were covered. The listing for the Airbnb advertises these spaces like they‚Äôre readily available but during our stay, that was not the case.

- In the master bedroom, upon removing flat sheet and comforter, we found a dead insect on the bed.

- Both sinks in the master bedroom drained very slowly- the right sink was worse compared to the left sink. We mostly used the other bathroom upstairs (the guest bedroom‚Äôs bathroom).

- The refrigerator was dirty with old food grime.

- Only one set of towels. We would‚Äôve preferred another set for each room.

Although We Didn't Get To Stay Due To The Outage, The House Looked Really Nice From The Outside. Communication With The Host Was A Hassle, To Say The Least. Unanswered Messages After The Outage Had My Group Of 7 In Shambles...Wasting Time And Money. I Got My Second Nights Refund After Contacting Airbnb Because It Wasn't Immediate Like The First Night. Unfortunate.

We booked a very last minute stay for the long weekend - Nico was very responsive and accommodating and even offered a slightly lower rate so we ended up not picking the hotel so the family could stay together. When we got there, the location we knew was a bit away from the stuff you want to do in Austin (that's why it's cheaper) but we weren't expecting it to be walking distance to both a high school and a strip club... that was a weird combo!

House was not clean - dead bugs everywhere (at least they were dead!) and the sheets, although they may have been washed, had lots of stains of who knows what. We vacuumed ourselves, rewashed the dishes and asked Nico for new sheets which he did provide. Washer is tiny and dryer doesn't work. Also note - bedroom 5 is standalone outside in the backyard.

Bottom line, Nico was a good host and did refund the cleaning fee (I had to request it myself), although I wouldn't consider this a "luxury" home and in hindsight should have done a hotel.
Lack of communication from the host.

TL:DR - check-in delayed, room reeked of smoke, found a used cocaine/heroin pipe in the room, offered a new room but management threatened to take the room when we weren't able to move when they wanted us to. told the manager would call, never did. they gave us $100 off which feels insulting for all the chaos we dealt with.

long story: we requested an early check-in as we were traveling with children. never heard back from the contact. once we arrived we were told several different stories about when we would be able to check-in (prior guest didn't leave, prior guest left his stuff, room had been destroyed). after waiting 4 hours, we were given room reeking of cigarette smoke (though it was suppose to be non-smoking) and the floor was so sticky your shoes stuck to it. people in charge told us we would have to wait until the next day to move rooms. we did our best to settle in. next morning we were told housekeeping would start cleaning our new room right at 11am. by 1pm we still hadn't heard anything so we went site-seeing. got a call at 3pm telling us we needed to return as soon as possible to move rooms. when we said we weren't able to get back right away, management said we would lose the room if we weren't back by 4pm. we rushed back and the management team basically ignored us as we struggled to relocate our stuff and our kids. new room wouldn't unlock because despite being told we needed to hurry, they hadn't set up the new lock. found a used cocaine pipe under the couch and empty whippets when we left the first room. new room was clean but the first two days of stress ruined the overall experience. we were told the manager would call to address the experience but they never did. the property doesn't seem well managed as the cleaning team missed a straight pipe and other drug items in the room and several guests were smoking around the property. also in the room they only give you one tide pod and one dishwasher pod so you can't really use the washer/dryer and dishwasher. they offered us $100 off but that hardly feels worth the stress. management just didn't seem to care. rooms are beautiful and location is nice but the people in charge leave a sour taste. not a bad option, just hope nothing goes wrong.

The location is everything! Convenient, but check in a lil‚Äô disappointing. Understandably we had issues at 10pm at night but disappointed that we couldn‚Äôt get into our place until nearly 1:30am because the batteries on our door were dying. (So we finally figured out)

They came the next morning to change the batteries and made it right which we were appreciative of.

Upfront - the situation was resolved by Airbnb and they did a great job dealing with the problem. My girlfriend was there alone for few days and I was about to join later on, so she‚Äôs the one writing what happened -
It was hands down my worst experience with Airbnb rental. Place wasn‚Äôt like on the photos, way smaller and was just dirty and not sanitary. I found a towel with a blood stain, floor was just dirty with some sand(?)

Though I like to refrain from leaving negative reviews, I‚Äôd hate for another family to experience what we just did. My family of 5 (including 2 toddlers) booked a last minute weekend stay but had to book another hotel for the second night.

My son and I felt itchy as soon as we walked into the house, but ignored it. Then I was woken up at 1:30am from the itching again and noticed a spider directly on the ceiling above me, bugs in our blankets/sheets, and bugs crawling over the walls and ceilings. He was nice and said he‚Äôd try to send a pest control company that night, but I told him we booked another hotel and asked for a full or partial refund. Unfortunately I did not hear back until after Airbnb customer service investigated our case and offered a refund. Besides the pest issue, the accommodations were uncomfortable and seemed to be the bare minimum requirements. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this stay for a family.
This home was not very clean & I‚Äôve never stayed at an Airbnb that was not super clean.

It‚Äôs an RV that‚Äôs best days are long past. It smelled bad and wasn‚Äôt cleaned well upon arrival, which isn‚Äôt the end of the world but considering a $50 cleaning fee in included with the charges it irked me.

Disappointing + unsafe for solo female traveler. Couldn‚Äôt get refund for being locked out multiple times.  At least only book less than what you need so if you have to run out you have saved some money.

This townhome is in a quiet, secluded location, but its one of my husband & I‚Äôs least favorite airbnbs unfortunately. Amazing location and a nice, clean apartment. Read the listing carefully - you do not get the whole apartment to yourself. The host (not an individual person but rather a corporation) isn't very responsive over the weekends. Things got stressful as I booked the Airbnb last minute on a weekend day.

This was a less than pleasant experience for me. It started when I got there & rang the doorbell & no answer. I messaged the host :20 before i ever arrived. I got no reply by the time i arrived. I had time constraints & needed to shower & change. He finally called with the door lock code.
The condo is clean & nice inside. The outside area all through the complex is trashy with fall leaves blown in every corner or catch area with trash & boxes. There‚Äôs zero parking in the condo for the guest. I messaged the host & he said have to park on the street. There was zero space on the street. He suggested another street a block & half away at 10:30pm. So i found one that was edgy at it‚Äôs best but I didn‚Äôt get a ticket son that‚Äôs a plus.
In the condo, 2 double beds, both had one sheet & a blanket, with no more available. There were 2 towels but no wash/face cloth for the shower.
Condo is equipped with a roku tv but host messaged me i had to download the roku app & use my phone as a remote. Had to be signed onto the wifi network. I received the wifi & password from the host. So if you plan on booking, best bring your own double bed sheets, a wash cloth & bottle water. Don‚Äôt expect anything but a bed & a shower unless the host addresses the things I‚Äôve listed in my feedback. Thank you !! Everything was great! The apartment was large and comfy with all the basics in the bathroom and kitchen including laundry. We had no issues with the stairs and narrow hall ways but they might be difficult for people with limited mobility.

We stayed here for 2 weeks and likely would not return. The home is  quite old and unfortunately wasn‚Äôt as nice as the pictures and didn‚Äôt appear well maintained. The address was not correct and Nataliya never responded with the correct address after I informed her via email, text, and voicemail of the address problem. When I arrived to the address listed by the requested check-in time, I immediately knew something was off, the porch light was off and the driveway was full, so I double-checked the address listed and looked for any messages that provided an updated address. I was at the only address provided. After knocking a few times, a young, annoyed woman answered and informed me that it wasn't the right place but that this had happened before. After waiting for a couple hours for a response from Nataliya and contacting Airbnb, Airbnb offered me a refund. It was a Saturday night, so I wasn't able to find any last-minute rooms available within my budget but fortunately a friend of a friend was able to provide a couch I could crash on. The place was dirty and people were coming in and out, so I only got 3 hours of sleep before the big race I had to run at 8am. After all of that, Nataliya had the gall to message me and say that the "door was open" and that her mother had been waiting up for me. She never once acknowledged the fact that there was never an actual, real location provided to me. Nataliya, you can apologize to your mother on your own behalf. I don't know exactly what you were trying to pull but you really screwed me over. Thanks for absolutely nothing.

This place is really nice inside, don‚Äôt judge it when you first see the front of it and the neighborhood it‚Äôs in. I have only one complaint. This is a very nice two story house with lots of sitting room in a quite well kept neighborhood. The house is located just off Ben White (71). There are two big closets, one by the front door and the other in the upstairs bedroom. The master bedroom closet is locked off, but the bedroom has no lock.  Great place.

This was the only reason we booked this property. When we arrived at the house, the water level in the pool and hot tub was extremely low. Also, the heat in the hot did not work so it was freezing cold. While we were able to fill up the pool with a hose overnight, the heater for the hot tub never worked and the company that rents this property said that they could not get a technician out to the property in time.

The thing that was especially frustrating was that when I spoke with someone from the rental company on the phone about the spa, he said he knew about all the issues from when he previously inspected the property. So they knew about these issues and didn‚Äôt bother to tell us prior to our trip. We would have absolutely canceled the trip if given the chance.

A few other annoying things: the keypad lock didn‚Äôt work so we had to use a key from a lockbox. This was fine except that we were never notified and I had to call the company and wait outside in the rain while they explained how to get in. Also, on the house page online, it kept referring to the house manual, which I could never find. Eventually I learned that someone from the rental company had taken the manual to make edits.

To address these issues, we got offered a small discount but we still spent thousands of dollars on this staycation for a property that we never would have booked if we had known what state it was actually in. There were plenty of other properties we could have booked. I really feel like we got scammed.

The view and house are great! I would not recommend this property for the hot tub, however. We visited in the winter and specifically chose this place in order to utilize the hot tub since the cold would prevent us from many outdoor activities. Be aware there is an extra fee to heat the hot tub (they agreed to waive the fee for us). Even though we were assured the hot tub worked, the heat did not work properly and they were unable to get it fixed during our weekend stay. We received a partial refund of our stay but were quite disappointed.

This property was a disappointment. Along with the lack of overall maintenance and low level of cleanliness, the management company seemed not to care about the issues we encountered and were in no hurry to respond to or rectify them.
The house was not very clean; linens, baths and kitchen surfaces were acceptable but once we started to unpack and use the house we notice a significant lack of upkeep. First off: a pair of children's slippers partially sticking out from under bed in master bedroom. Secondly, a necklace found in the ( original?) shag carpeting in guest room, right in the middle of the room, so it was obvious it hadn't been vacuumed. The examples continue: toothpaste splatter on side of cabinet in bathroom, dust I could write in inside tv cabinet, dirty cabinet fronts, dirty baseboards, and bedroom carpeting that we were afraid to walk on with bare feet. As far as upkeep, the wall behind bed in guest house wasn't completely painted, curtains stained in guest bedroom, the refrigerator was set to warmest temp yet still froze all our food including a glass milk bottle which shattered. There was also no laundry soap for the washer, though there was supposed to be.
The pool itself was quite nice, but the outdoor area around it was not cared for; piles of decaying leaves on pool deck, old pool equipment and debris behind pool, overgrown trees and shrubs that stuck out over the staircase to get to pool and lighting that was only accessible from an obscure light switch on the very dark lower deck. The string lights on the upper deck were mostly burned out (after we finally found an outdoor extension cord under the bed in guest house).
We had an issue with the entry door keypad and could not get it to stop beeping incessantly, or to lock/unlock. I notified Avantstay immediately that night and did not get a response until the next morning saying someone would be contacting us directly. Though we had plans to be gone for the day, we waited several hours for someone to contact us, as we did not want to leave door unlocked. No one did, so we finally left only to return in the pouring rain that evening and not be able to get in the front door.
For the amount of money we paid for this rental, we could have stayed in much nicer lodging...and not been afraid to walk barefoot

We stayed here because of the pool and hot tub as adversities on Airbnb. Turns out we couldn‚Äôt even get in the pool because water heater was not working and we were not notified. Had we known we would have stayed at a different house. Additionally, there was animal dropping on kitchen counters and we had to throw away some of our groceries. The view is fantastic but not worth the cost.

They advertise the property with a hot tub they knew I wanted to use it two months in advance they told me it was out of commission the night before I was supposed to come. There are big spiders all over this property. Trash every. Broken chairs, sewer lines, just random garbage littered all over the property. The pictures and what it is in real life are two completely different things look elsewhere

The views were wonderful and the common areas were a great gathering spot for our family. However, the pool and hot tub were not working and when renting this property that was a huge selling point for us.
We enjoyed the living space, location, and views but parts of the property, specifically the separate bedroom/bath were neglected with dead bugs and cobwebs in every corner, soap dishes ripped from walls, blinds that didn‚Äôt open to allow for the views, and trash/clutter on the property.

There were pros and cons, but candidly if we were booking today we would have chosen one of the other options available. The Avant Team was responsive but at the end of the day, I would not book this property again.

It was an okay stay. There were dirty sheets in the master bedroom, cockroaches in the kitchen, wasp nest in the patio, no propane, beds were uncomfortable and just dirty place in general. Only positive thing was it was close to downtown/food.

Inexpensive, but there‚Äôs a reason. One toilet leaks, the other had a broken handle where you had to open the tank to flush. Hot water for the shower. lasted about 3-4 minutes. Upon arrival, there was piled food garbage spilled in the front yard. Inside was clean.

I am very displeased with the way my trip went with this host. When I arrived to the city I was told that the listing was ‚Äúcondemned‚Äù I was supposed to go a listening in the domain. I then got moved to this different location in the Arboretum after being offered an $800 discount. However on the same day the original location was still up on AirBnB and if I recall correctly at a higher price, and when I called the representatives at AirBnB they told me that the host had told them it was because he was not allowed to actually host a guest over 7 days in the apartment complex, he was essentially doing a rental arbitrage and from my guess he wasn‚Äôt actually allowed to do that. I was quite disappointed as the host had a long time to figure this out as I booked weeks in advance and I got the short end of the stick on the day of arrival. They gave me the first half of the $800 discount in the first month (I booked for ~61 days) and gave me the second half of the discount the week prior to checkout. It was difficult to have the host provide the full $800 from my experience I do not understand why it took such a long time to provide the full discount/refund the moment I paid the entire AirBnB cost. In fact I asked whether he could confirm or deny if he was going to send me the other half of the $800 and his reply was just a thank you, a non-answer. I filed a claim for him to send over the money and the host told me that I shouldn‚Äôt have done that as it was messing up the system for him to pay me back but the AirBnB reps literally told me I should file a resolution claim to which he could respond to. He sent me a screenshot of the BnB website which literally had a banner on the top of the screen saying he needed to resolve my claim before he can send me money but host insisted that I screwed up and he didn‚Äôt know how to send me my money; there was clear instructions literally on screenshot of the website. His reluctance to provide the agreed discount at a reasonable time made things very tricky. Also the host was condescending and treated me as if I were unintelligent and i felt that the host insinuated that I was dumb. The apartment itself has a 2 in one washer-dryer that took 3 hours to dry my clothes and the microwave was missing the dish. The adjacent laundry room outside of the apartment itself but inside of the complex had cockroaches inside of the washing machine drums.
Not a place I would considered staying again. No hot water and lights in the kitchen wasn‚Äôt working.

Just watch booking her if you plan on extending. You will hear a loud dog bark all hours of the night. She will call air bnb and say she‚Äôs calling the cops when all she had to was communicate her place was booked for the next day. Her bed isn‚Äôt comfortable it‚Äôs very hard. She was rude when she didn‚Äôt respond and had a attitude. She don‚Äôt want you to contact the office bc they don‚Äôt know she using it for Airbnb. Home did a small mildew smell. Could use some air like plug ins. The floors don‚Äôt walk around barefoot bc your feet will be dirty. Just don‚Äôt upset this host bc she will lie just to get someone in trouble and get they account take for her communication issues.
Location is on point with local restaurants and site seeing not far away. Comfort was a big must after 19 hour drive and we couldn't have been happier with that. I would recommend.

Check-in was horrible, was sent the wrong door code and had to find a place to stay for the first night because the on call person never answered the phone. Had to request to speak with someone the next day after calling an absurd amount of times trying to get a door code. Shower was super moldy and the bathroom sink struggled to drain. Outside of the shower and the bathroom sink the place was clean and had good location. Plus the shower had CRAZY water pressure. I would stay again, but you must know that there is no dedicated parking.

On a plus side a ton of stuff is walking distance!

El departamento muy limpio y ordenado, las toallas necesitan remplazo, el lugar es m√°s peque√±o de lo que aparenta en las fotos, las areas comunes del condominio y el estacionamiento les falta limpieza.

Worst Airbnb stay I have ever experienced! The host puts minimal effort into the place, the communication as well as in providing necessary information. I feel scammed and am very disappointed. We were very disappointed and inconvenienced due to lack of free parking which was advertised and NO toilet paper upon arrival. Terrible stay! The smell was horrible (really, really bad dirty rag smell). And, a bug ran over the bed as I got into it. Homewide acted shocked that I had these complaints. This can‚Äôt be the first complaint they‚Äôve had. The place was very worn (even the closets didn‚Äôt open properly).

They would not consider a refund, but this just confirmed their reluctance to take responsibility for providing a quality place.
Excelente ubicaci√≥n , muy limpio , tiene lo b√°sico , y la atenci√≥n de las anfitrionas muy buena , te responden s√∫per r√°pido y eso es muy agradable sin duda regresaremos

The entrance gate to the community wasn‚Äôt working so it was open the whole time and it could be dangerous, and the instruction of the address are confusing, other than that it was clean there where enough dishes for the family and there were towels provided.

I recently stayed here with some significant issues that detracted from my experience. The host had strict rules , including a noise alarm within the unit that would trigger a $1,000 fee if set off. This made me feel like I had to tip toe around the entire time, which was unsettling.
