1.The air mattress provided was leaking and the guest using it was not able to sleep on it the first day , the host was informed and the air mattress was replaced

We enjoyed our stay here. A few things to note for future guests. The pool had to be shocked the day of our arrival so could not use it for 1 of our 3 day stay. That was disappointing. Owner was helpful in talking us through the AV system in theater room.

We couldn't get into the place because there was no key in the lockbox. The code on the other box wouldn't work either and there was a fedex note on the door saying they had missed someone. And the host didn't answer my messages.

When we arrived, there was confusion as to which was our unit because the address and the check in information had differing information. This place was also really dirty. We found bugs in the shower, sink, on the ceiling, on the couch. There was no clothes iron or hair dryer although listed on the amenities. The wifi was very unstable. There was a TV with no remote in sight. Dishwasher didn‚Äôt work.  Host wasn‚Äôt very responsive or helpful. Heating/ac units sprayed black debris all over our bedding and luggage. Entrance is very confusing, and incredibly dark and hard to see at night. Property is next to a house that‚Äôs being gutted and there is loud construction noise starting at 7:00am.

The team running these were responsive, but unfortunately I wouldn‚Äôt stay here again. I slept in a black shirt and awoke with a ton of white dog hair on me. That was not a good feeling

And there were long strands of hair on the wall of the shower. So it wasn‚Äôt well cleaned. Top that off with some neighbors with loud barky dogs and it just made the time here not good.

This cabin was very clean. It had ample parking, check-in was easy, and there were towels and most accommodations we needed.

The toilet worked maybe half of the time, because the handle‚Äôs flapper was poorly connected. I‚Äôve repaired toilets before so I opened the tank to see what was wrong and I was met with a litany of leaks, loose chains, and things I couldn‚Äôt begin to fix without a plumbing van.

The faucet on the main sink sprayed every which way when you turned it on, and is not suitable for almost anything.

The space itself was okay, but the place is more like a studio than a ‚Äúfull house.‚Äù There is no mirror above any sink, so shaving is not really an option. Brushing your teeth is even a chore because you can‚Äôt lean over the sink to rinse your mouth out since there‚Äôs a cabinet mounted directly above it.

I paid $650 for two nights of this, and I really regret not just buying a hotel instead. This Airbnb is a trend of people in Austin taking homes away from people who want to live in them so they can rent them out at exorbitant prices.

I do not feel this is worth your time on both principle and on livability. Sorry.

We were dissapointed with our stay in this studio, especially with the value for money. No real bathroom or kitchen (only one sink), only one set of towels for two weeks,  AC not strong enough for the room, some broken things, very noisy due to the highway, impossible to stay a minute in the garden due to the moskitoes, etc‚Ä¶

Good space; however, bathroom needs to be cleaner and it does not have a sink; it‚Äôs very difficult to shave and get ready. Kitchen had no supplies like coffee, sugar, milk/cream for the coffee maker; I see other airbnbs cover these especially if you provide a coffee maker. Not having tea supplies or water in the fridge when someone arrives is a bummer. There are no basic kitchen supplies at all. Finally, this unit is built on top of a garage with that garage converted into another rental unit. With downstairs tenants the place can be noisy. You can hear conversations and their dog through the floor.

Inside was nice on the inside. Renovations were going on in the surrounding condos, which made it very noisy. We were not made aware that renovations would be going on in the building. I decided to get a hotel instead 2 hours later due to renovation noise and shifting of structure. When I notified them of us moving to a hotel, no one cared to respond. I was a little disappointed by that.

I hate writing reviews. Stay here if you like being out in the open. Big windows no curtains.

What you don‚Äôt see is what made me disappointed. No issues. Enjoyed our stay.

The house itself was very nice - clean and most importantly, the AC was working well.

But the statements from the company were misleading. They said that we could request an early checkin/late check out but then when I followed up, they said that it was not permitted at this location. Not very flexible!

We were missing a set of blanket for the living room and they dropped them off the next day.

#1 - Vacasa apparently owns hundreds of AirBnB's so you are dealing with a corporate owner, not very responsive. Tried to access the property and was given a lock box code with 5 digits, the lock box only had 4. Tried every variation of the one given nothing worked, had to wait for over an hour for a reply that finally allowed me to access the property. #2 - this place smelled. Not stinky, musty. I didn't spend a single night in it. #3 - it is VERY SMALL, really no place to put the  3rd bed (roll away). Directions were unclear. Gate code was not made available.
Hard to get a hold of.

The unit itself is nice and well-maintained, and in a convenient location. However, the host's communication was the worst of any Airbnb I've stayed in. The directions for finding the entrance and getting into the unit were vague and confusing, and there was no reply to my message asking for guidance about how to get in.  We requested an additional hour for checkout, and the host was again slow to respond and then offered no flexibility, even though no other guests were arriving for days. The host's rare and slow communications each were signed by a different individual and seemed to be copied and pasted from a template. It seems like this unit is run by a corporation that lacks any desire to offer a more personal touch to its interactions with guests.

I would like to start by saying I never leave reviews and am usually pretty happy with whatever house I rent. Since I picked this place based off of reviews I feel obligated to leave my experience for other people. We arrived and were not able to get into the gated driveway. Finally the next day we were given a code to get in. This was after the neighbor warned us about getting a ticket if we were parked on the mini driveway sidewalk. At the time we had nowhere else to go since we couldn‚Äôt get through the gate. Aside from the parking frustration we found 2 live small German roaches in our bathroom, hair all over the floor of bathroom and somebody‚Äôs dried contacts. The ice machine on fridge was locked. There was a mini freezer in living room for ice, but it had black slimy mold on all of the corners on the inside. The A/C was locked at 72 and it was 107 degrees outside. We were sweating in our sleep. The ‚Äúwaterfall‚Äù on the pool was only on for a super short amount of time so if you were out for the 2 or 3 hrs it‚Äôs on in the early afternoon then you missed it. Instead there was a giant purple, yellow and green stain to look at. The pool was way smaller in person and had tree roaches crawling everywhere at night. Now I understand it‚Äôs Texas and hot outside so big roaches are inevitable sometimes. The small ones are preventable though. Those are from the house being disgusting. Our feet were black from walking inside the house after 30 mins. Vacasa was nice enough to give us $105 back due to it be so dirty. Still not much compared to the nearly $2K I paid.

Made a mistake and had the wrong checkout day. Host was very accommodating and easy to communicate with. My mom had some things left some jewelry in the room and the cleaners packed it all up. Everything was there. Can‚Äôt ask for anymore. 10/10 would use them again.
This was NOT a luxury house as advertised.  Service was poor.  Amenities were poor.  NOT close to Austin (>40m away).  Would NOT recommend.
Pictures inside are accurate. Neighborhood is quite noisy. Also lots of noise from the connected garage and other apartment. Close to town
dishes were not cleaned properly and dryer handle was broke .

Muy buena ubicaci√≥n si te gusta salir fuera a caminar y hacer ejercicio, el √∫nico contra fue que el aire acondicionado del apartamento no funcionaba y fueron d√≠as especialmente calurosos para ser oto√±o.

Cockroaches everywhere, living room, bathroom and the bedroom, found them on the bed. Had to wash the sheets multiple times and yes they will crawl on you at night. Noisy neighbors, late at night you will hear them cooking and make loud noises. Asked for Christine to work me with me about the pay since I left 10 days early but she said she can‚Äôt do a refund for those days. Also have to pay $50 a day for any guest.
Bon emplacement, bel et spacieux appartement, parfait rien √† dire! Je recommande sans h√©sitation!
Avoid if possible. Cheap hosts, bad communication, nothing works.

I was very disappointed in the place. It was nice overall. The Christmas tree was still up and we went in April. The floors were so dirty, we bought our own swifter mop to wash floors. There was a stain on the comforter in master bedroom and it was gross. The extra comforter smelled that I had to wash it before I could use it because I was so disgusted. There was suppose to be a key to get to the pool area, it was in the check in description but there was only the garage opener with the gym button access. The reason I choose this place was because of the pool. My kids were looking forward to going swimming and never ended up going. First of all we couldn‚Äôt get in pool area and it looked like the pool was closed too. The company should have all the accurate information regarding pool too, like if it was not open, they should disclose that information. Again big reason we choose this place was because of the pool and were very disappointed. I also called the company about this issue twice and wrote an email in customer service. AllI was told first time was the key should be there even if I told the guy it isn‚Äôt and hasn‚Äôt been. I went to the office where pool was and guy working there said the company needs to contact them and they would give me a key and when I told the guy on the phone from evonify, he said he would call me back. When he called me back all he said was the key should be there. No help at all. After that I emailed but got no response. Just very disappointed. Overall townhouse was nice looking and in a good location.  My husband and I and 4 kids stayed there and there wasn‚Äôt enough towels but when I did call they did bring more towels so that was good, but when you know you have 6 guest they should properly stock the place with towels without us having to call. Overall we were all disappointed and wouldn‚Äôt  go with this company again.
Looking for the house was a little tricky, but if you take the little sidewalk next the garage it will take you to the back and boom there‚Äôs the house.

First off, this is a lovely home. The beds are wonderful and we really enjoyed the decor. We were very disappointed, however, in the lack of consideration when a problem arose. I notified Jean that a smoke detector was beeping about every minute or so on a Saturday at 3:44pm. The annoying, loud chirping they make when the battery is low. Jean said someone in the department would be notified to look into it asap. I gave approval for someone to look at it while we were out of the home as we had plans. When we arrived back to the home it was late and the smoke detector was still beeping. I did not contact Jean at that time as it was 1:00am. We had to listen to the smoke detector all night which made for a restless night for everyone. Jean was contacted the next day and was I told it was being forwarded to the appropriate department right away. This should have been addressed the day before. We paid good money to stay somewhere that was so nice and comfortable only to have it ruined by a stupid smoke detector. It was something so simple but so annoying. We were unable to fix it ourselves as the ceilings were too high and there were specific instructions not to touch them. Really disappointed in the lack of consideration. It really is a nice place but be aware your needs or concerns may not be addressed appropriately.

Der Grund meines Besuchs war ein Familientreffen in Austin. Aufgrund der gro√üz√ºgigen Ausstattung war diese Unterbringung einfach genial!
Immer wieder gerne!lll

Pros: place was as pictured and beds were comfy. Checkin and check out was easy.

Cons: we booked this place for spring break and the pool. However the pool was not heated at all and it was filthy. Even if we had wanted to take a 60 degree plunge we couldn‚Äôt - there were grocery sacks, debris and a film on top of the water for our entire 3 day stay. Very disappointed that our kids could not swim as it was the sole reason we booked the apartment. Would not have spent $350 a night on this place if we had known.

In addition to the pool the place had bare essentials for cooking. We also had the worst luck with the hot water. Showers for adults were not great, baths were okay for the kids.
Beautiful place. Unfortunately, there were ants and roaches and the host failed to communicate about an issue (unrelated to the ants and roaches) which made the overall experience sub par.

The address that was given online was not the right address. There was no communication at all about what room was mine, what was available to use in the kitchen , who the other renters were, etc...
There was an odd smell in the house that I couldn't tell where it was coming from or what it was, I did use Febreze to mask the smell, but it did not last long. You had said it was clean and you expected the renter to be clean, I am, but the smell was not comforting.
It was not close to any eating establishments, or grocery stores. There was no cable TV access so no able to watch sports or anything except on my phone. If the other renter hadn't been there I would have not known what room I rented or anything else about the house. I guess I expected that there might be a coffee maker or Keurig to use in the morning since the only coffee place was a mile or more walk.
I saved money by not renting a car, but having to have a Lyft driver come to take me 2 miles would have cost as much as a rental car.
I will not be using Airbnb again. Not a pleasant experience.

Overall experience was Great
friendly neighbors(Oscar)
Beds were comfy
Plush towels


There were a few complaints
-Even after paying a cleaning service fee I was still expected to take off the sheets on all of the beds.
-there was no outside lighting so I was limited and not able to utilize all amenities
-Grill was dirty and nothing to clean with
I would never recommend this business to ANYONE.

Decent stay for what was available at the time. Central to the city. Listing was accurate. Couch was not comfy and complex was very noisy. Residents would be blasting music in their cars and yelling for hours on end most nights.
Instant response to all questions, zero problems with check-in/out, and looked just like the pictures.

This is an interesting place, the area is going through a gentrification and so is this place. You can tell they are trying but not quite there. Bed was broken, dirty vents, garbage outside needed cleaning and the place was recently exterminated hours before I arrived so the smell was there for days. I find with Airbnbs that are owned by corporations, there is a lack of personal touch. All I can say is stay at your own risk!
It was a nice little apartment.  Everything was good except for the smell and the dirty area rug.   The rug was really awful!
La atenci√≥n de Mary fue espectacular!!  El alojamiento es inferior a la atenci√≥n de Mary !! La ubicaci√≥n muy buena !!
Simple and clean, but the area itself "street" is questionable, but never felt unsafe. Very close to downtown Austin, and within 30 minutes of Lake Travis. I would stay here again.

overall the stay was ok. not exactly how the pictures showed it as. Had a plumbing issue which was not resolved till the next day so i had to go somewhere else when i needed to use the restroom. also There is STILL a roach issue.

This apartment is just as it looks in the pictures. The location is perfect because you have all groceries stores just down the block. We slept all through the night because there was no noice from the upstairs tenant nor the tenant that live next door on either side. Host responded every single time with in a second of asking any questions. You won‚Äôt be disappointed if you stay at this Airbnb.

I was without hot water for a good portion of my stay. I had to contact them everyday and was initially told to let the water manager in for 15min which is ridiculous. This is a basic necessity. I would NEVER stay here had I known of this issue and how poorly it was just flipped to use as a rental. The couch was very uncomfortable and bad for your back. Worst Airbnb I have stayed at to date.

This listing is run by a large company that buys/flips apartments into rentals all over the US. If you are like me and enjoy Airbnb because it avoids the hotel and rental companies this place is not for you. We had wanted an earlier check in since our flight arrived at 8 but they couldn‚Äôt accommodate or take bags so we made it work and then weren‚Äôt going to be ready by 5pm check in and when I relayed my scenario, they sped up their cleaning process to get in at 530. Tub was visibly dirty and with just my finger I could rub off grime. Next day woke there were cockroaches all around. They asked for pictures but I had left for the day so they asked me to take pictures of the smushed bugs from the trash when I returned. At this point I was livid and they moved me to a diff apartment in the complex which was clean and good. They admitted in speeding up the cleaning process of the first place they failed to do the roach inspection and prevention. I had to argue for refund on $80 cleaning fee
Sin duda alguna regresar√≠a, excelente lugar para estar, muy tranquilo

DISCOMFORT was so bad that half our group left after the 1st night.
Must summarize, so here‚Äôs a list:
Heater set to 62 = Upstairs too hot + Downstairs cold

EXTREMELY HOT UPSTAIRS
Opened windows to cool but it let in evening smoke stench from neighbors - Uncomfortable bed - smoke alarm random beeps overnight
House Rules = bring own toiletries/don‚Äôt use ours; tub corners were full of items & no caddie was provided for ours

DOWNSTAIRS
1st night we layered up in the low-lit common areas and stayed wrapped in blankets.
Shower felt like a drafty cabin where the water is hot & the air is very cold
2nd night I asked our host about a space heater; she said to go buy wood to start a fire. Instead we turned the heater up to 73, stayed downstairs & slept on the couch.

BED ROOMS
2 night minimum = Needed a spot to hold luggage ~ a bench &/or another chair to sit on while putting on socks. Beds are too high up for sitting.

The view was nice, house seemed classy & clean but we will NOT RETURN

Pictures look clean bright and new, reality is old worn out and musty.  If there's not mold in the walls it would be a miracle.  Bathroom ceiling is collapsing, no faceplate on the old crumbling receptacle, and linens looked like something from grannys garage sale.  Big screen tv is nice if you don't mind watching from 5 feet away.  Washer dryer access is nice until you see the pile of dirty clothes on top.  We had to open all the windows regardless of cold just to get breathable air.  We decided to leave after one night and this was before the toilet backed up.  Not sure what kind of quality control airbnb has but in this case it appears to be none.  We are asking for a full refund for this one.  I cannot believe the positive reviews on this place,  reality is that it is a total fisaster.

Host was very nice & responsive. House did look smaller than expected, we had to wash every dish because it was all very dirty & had lipstick marks on them. The rug in the living room should be thrown out, it smelt horrible in the house. We had to walk around and spray. Lastly, the doors upstairs was broken & when I went to flush the toilet, water came out of the back. Was not satisfied at all with my stay!
no thank you

Rude and in cooperative host.
Bad smell
Dirty AC and overall poor condition of the unit itself .

Quaint unit with ample street parking. Assigned parking space is angled and all the way at the front of the driveway so difficult to get in and out of, even with a small car. Linens were fine but did not seem custom or luxurious as advertised. The only TV in the unit was glitchy and basically not functional. Host was contacted about the issue and never responded. Overall a mediocre stay.
No comfortable table to eat at-just a skinny high table with two uncomfortable bar stools facing the wall.
No issues, met our expectations completely
Cozy home! Just a tad frustrating with a code on every door, but Leo helped get the job done!

I was disappointed so checked out early.
The place was not cheap, around usd140 a night. I arrived expecting a washing machine (as advertised) and there was an old note on it saying it's broken. Jacob suggested I wash at a public laundromat. For this price I think it's fair to say he should replace the hand wash instead of just refilling with water. I feel everyone on Airbnb should make more effort especially for this price, not take advantage of people.
Killer spot in austin and check in was easy.

Would not recommend this Air bnb . This apartment is corporate owned, not privately owned; and the host was rude. We did check in 2 hours early, and the A/C was not working. When I contacted the host, I was told to vacate the property or I would be charged with trespassing. OR we could remain but would be charged by the hour for checking in early. We have stayed in numerous places, but have never been treated like this. Very upsetting. And we went 24 hours with no A/C

This house was very cute, although there were some issues with a smoke detector running out of batteries and not super helpful responses (although the host was apologetic, they said they would come to fix it and I don't think they did). The dishwasher was broken, and we found that the previous guests did not wash the dishes well as they were quite dirty when we arrived.

Host did not follow covid or standard cleaning practices.  Mildew throughout shower.  Food left in sink.  Staining from food/debris throughout sink.  No closet in ‚Äúbedroom‚Äù.  Broken door lock on front doorm

Beyond terrible. Do not stay here. Incredibly unsafe neighborhood, even from the airport the uber driver said someone was murdered a few days before my stay on the same street. Upon arrival neighbors were belligerent and yelling through their patios. Also, the smell of the airbnb was absolutely terrible, especially the bedroom. Total time spent in the airbnb was 10 minutes.

After trying to communicate with owners for days with an apparent English barrier, they gave the smallest amount of refund back. I hope this can help someone before staying here.
Floor was super dirty. Feet were black with dust and dirt after a night of walking around inside. The dryer unit ruined my favorite shirt with stains. Location was convenient to downtown.

I gave this place two stars instead of one purely because of the location. I HIGHLY recommend taking pictures of every square inch of this place when you arrive and when you leave because you might be charged for ridiculous claims made by the owner after the fact. Also, it should be noted that the curtains are in no way room lightening. So if you have kids be warned. What was a rental to attend my grandpa's funeral has now turned into a massive headache for our family. 10 out of 10 would recommend staying some place else.

Sin duda fue una buena experiencia haber rentado aqu√≠, los anfitriones fueron demasiado amable y atento conmigo en todo momento puede disfrutar de todo el apt y me brindaron lo necesario para pasarla incre√≠ble en este lugar! Todo 10/10 lo recomiendo.
The house had a great party vibe/decor as advertised  but was not as clean or maintained as we normally see at airbnbs. Also be aware that the beds are hard as a rock!

Ad says it is keep to a 3.5 star rating. Only if the highest start is 10! Place was not clean. Bed was hard like a stone. Furniture looked to be picked up off the side of the road. Spider web in the corner of the room so big I thought I was in the Charlotte's Web book. Good maybe for a quick night stay but not long term. The shower curtain was so funky I didn't want it to touch me. Had to ask to try to move Router closer because internet kept dropping. Privacy is just a sheet hanging in the hall.

Being in a relatively new building, this unit has been fine so far. But, the Host has not maintained it well, and it is now plagued with a moderate-to-severe roach infestation that will be very difficult to eliminate.

Book at your own risk. If you do go for it, try to guide the oily brown critters away from running under the appliances or bed. You can use the frying pan in the kitchen to smash them and be sure to always zip up your luggage to avoid bringing them and their eggs in your belongings back home. Warning: When you smash them, they *will* burst out yellowy, chunky pus. And, future guests: You may want to wash the frying pan if you use it just in case this advice catches on‚Ä¶ ;-)

Your mileage may vary, but I ended up contending with at least a dozen roaches during my stay here before relocating. While I noticed a couple during the first couple of days (which put me on guard but didn‚Äôt seem like enough to be alarmed), I noticed a handful more on the third day as I became more vigilant‚Äîthey were probably there all along. I succumbed to sleeping with them crawling around that night since I couldn‚Äôt catch them and needed to give an important talk at a research conference in the morning. Hot tip: Wear ear plugs so they won‚Äôt burrow into your ears.

Honestly though, I slept soooo bad. Seeing up to half a dozen roaches creeping around and having to sleep in a bed where you saw some crawling nearby just moments before is no small feat. It is a horror that can be scarcely imagined unless you actually experience it firsthand. I wouldn‚Äôt want to be subjected to such torture even if I was *being paid*‚Äîthe TV show ‚ÄúFear Factor‚Äù comes to mind‚Äîmuch less pay my hard-earned money to experience it. Periodically reappearing and eluding capture, the roaches were always still around even if hidden under crevices under the kitchen cabinets and appliances or unreachable beneath the bed.

The next day, about half a dozen more roaches appeared throughout the night after I finally had time to contact the Host and Airbnb about it. Mind you, I was incredibly busy giving two research talks and being involved all day at the conference and then having dinner with friends and colleagues so, yes, this was a day after I became gradually aware that the infestation was serious and widespread.

But, the Host didn‚Äôt care and still demanded me to pay in full for the stay‚Äînot even a partial refund for that night I tried to sleep with roaches around me after I contacted her about it. She said nope‚Ä¶ it doesn‚Äôt count since she was already peacefully asleep and didn‚Äôt see my message. Ironic, because here I was living in hell unable to sleep by the torment of roaches scurrying around while she blissfully slept. Not my problem... she says‚Ä¶ you stay, you pay. At least she knows how to rhyme, right?

In fact, the Host not only showed no compassion but was irate that I got Airbnb involved to help relocate me, culminating in a man working on her behalf entering the unit unannounced when I happened to be taking a shower. He demanded I talk to some property manager on his phone who vulgarly berated me about reaching out to Airbnb hollering, ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre acting like a child!‚Äù while I scrambled to grab a towel to barely cover myself. What the heck. BTW‚Ä¶ this violated Airbnb‚Äôs Policy for Guest Privacy and Safety not to mention flagrantly disregarded basic human decency and respect.

Realizing that the Host and her affiliates had gone madly vengeful while not thinking twice before freely entering my private space with no warning or permission (even while I might be possibly away), I vacated immediately and coordinated with Airbnb for my safety.

Update: The trauma of living amongst so many roaches is still lingering as I continue to compulsively check for them crawling on the floor or walls around me even when I‚Äôm back home. This may not happen to you if you‚Äôre psychologically stronger than me. I hope to get over this after a few more weeks.

Another Update: I wonder what the Host and her people would have done if I didn‚Äôt quickly vacate as soon as I sensed they were out for revenge? Since they stormed into my unit while I was taking a shower, they wouldn‚Äôt feel anything about entering when I‚Äôm not there, right? I saw a review for her other listing that someone came in while they were away and stole AirPods which later ‚Äúmagically appeared‚Äù in her property manager‚Äôs office after the guest complained about it. Yikes! I‚Äôm glad I left when I did.

The room itself is good for the value and the location is excellent, but there were several small issues with the room which compounded on each other which leads me to this three star review.

The room did not look like it had been cleaned when I checked in. The bed was bare with the sheets and towels inside the washing machine and the trash had not been taken out. The towels were visibly dirty with stains on them. The sheets were not the right size for the bed and so one corner would frequently pop off the mattress. The trash bags also were not the right size for the trash can. The window blinds are missing a blade so the window is not entirely covered. Lastly the room does not have a dining table despite one being in the listing photos. I had also asked about early check-in and the host said they would follow up on check-in day but never did.

All of these issues are small-ish things that could be very easily fixed by the host so it was disappointing.

The place was fine as a room to crash while I was in town for a symposium at UT Austin. But it is extremely bare bones -- no bath mat in the restroom for instance. Also, the pictures weren't entirely accurate. There is no table as shown or hangers for clothes. The building is fairly noisy and situated in an area full of fraternities and sororities, so people should know that in advance.

I ended up paying about $100 a night after fees and taxes, which felt too high to me for what it was. That said, there were no big issues and Susana was very responsive.

One last thing: The key fob for the elevator was missing upon check in, which wasn't an issue, but would have cost me a considerable fee if I hadn't reported that the first night.

-NOT CLEAN , there are hair all over the bed sheet and pillowcase in one of the bedrooms, which is very disgusting‚Ä¶
-And the microwave is not working‚Ä¶
- you can literally hear people snoring from the unit next to you..

Overall it was a negative experience. we don‚Äôt recommend this house.

Place was great. Would‚Äôve given 5 stars but there weren‚Äôt actual sleeping pillows on the bed (just three decorative throw pillows).

Luckily, we travel with our own pillows so it wasn‚Äôt too bad. Be aware of this and double check before booking.
Second time there. No issues.

Tv did not work. Back glass sliding door had no locking mechanism - only a plastic bar that could be put down. Bedroom lamps would not turn on.  Stains all over carpet on floor and VERY noisy neighbors - didn‚Äôt stop playing music u til 4 am. Location is good , easy to find but I was very disappointed. They responded to my complaints by saying ‚Äú we will report to maintenance ‚Äú. BUT did nothing about them.  I will not return to this property ‚Ä¶thank you

The house was beautiful and we loved our stay . The only thing that was disappointing was the back yard lights did not turn on ; we were really excited to spend some time by the fire pit but unfortunately we couldn‚Äôt turn on the lights

This location smelled very strongly of mold/mildew and my husband, who has serious mold sensitivity, started to feel very sick within 12 hours of being here. It was so bad that we had to leave. I alerted the host, Meghan, and she was very unhelpful. I understand it is hard news to hear that you have a water damaged building, however, I would have expected more kindness and compassion. She also refused to consider refunding us the 4 days we were unable to stay in her Airbnb. So I am now actively working with Airbnb to get a refund through them directly. I've had to involve our doctor who is treating us for mold related illness. I highly recommend that this home be properly remediated of all wet building materials before any further guests stay here.

Pictures did not match. Lights did not work, neither bedside. Bathroom missing a bulb. Shower curtain was broken, it floods every time you run the shower. Toilet paper was broken, falling off the wall. AC was on the fritz, remote didn‚Äôt work so it was humid inside or freezing. Patio was dirty, ripped canopy, stained couch. Fake branded soap, we broke out because it was labeled falsely. Did not appreciate the money grab of downloading a separate app, simply to charge more money. Basically paid an entire day stay for a late checkout. Sheets and pillows didn‚Äôt seem washed (stains on them). On top of that y‚Äôall have the audacity to request guests wash their dishes? This place needs a makeover before it‚Äôs this pricey. Hard pass.

Overall it was fine but there were a few issues.  #1, the front door was standing open when I got there.  I was afraid to go in so had to go to my sister's.  Hostess did answer my call very quickly and she checked into it and her housekeeper had left the door open.  So that was fine but it did cost me a little time-- I brought my sister's boyfriend back with me to check the house.  There were two wasps that had got in while the door was open, so I had to kill them the first night.  And, it was freezing.  Heater only on 60.  #2: there were no blankets.  Beds only had a thin bedspread.  #3: only one washcloth, and it didn't look new.  I bought a couple at Walmart, and left one there in the tub.  #4, water pressure is bad in the shower.  This could be fixed by buying a handheld showerhead for 30 or 40 bucks.  So, those are the down sides.  On the plus side, the living area is large, fixed up cute, the yard is nice, having a washer is handy, and the hostess was very responsive and nice.

Do not stay here. Very rough building and even rougher apartment. Black mold on tub surround. Upon entering we immediately saw
That it was not fit for human habitation and should not be rented out.

Unfortunately, a family emergency came up last minute and we were not able to make it. It was only 2 days after the refund window and the host was unhelpful in finding a way to resolve this. Could have been handled more professionally in the future.

Once inside, this place looks like the one in the photos. Unfortunately it is located in a rundown complex with an elevator that broke down on us more than three times in a two night stay. Additionally, we paid for early check in, and the day of were told they were delayed by an hour. When we showed up an hour later the cleaner was still not finished, hostile, and threatening. I shared this with the owner who did nothing about it and had us wait for another hour. I had to ask multiple times for a refund on the early check in.

Check in was supposed to be at 4, Christine messaged me around check in time and told me the cleaners wouldn‚Äôt be done until 5. I asked for a light reimbursement for the hour wasted at the airport, no response until 5PM when Christine claimed the cleaning crew finished on-time‚Ä¶ this still resulted in an hour being wasted with no reimbursement or accommodations. When my guests and I got to the unit, we used the check in code Christine sent and it did not work. We were outside of the unit for almost an hour waiting on the correct code to access the apartment. Very slow response time.

Cleanliness was a 2.5/5‚Ä¶ but Good location in West Campus. Wouldn‚Äôt book again.

First things first. If you‚Äôre going to stay here make sure there is a second person with you who can wait by the car. While grabbing the parking passes one of our cars was towed, this happened within a 9 minute span. Then our door pad stopped working the very next day, and after all that the sinks started flooding. The place was clean and the host were responsive through the air BNB app but they were extremely hard to reach via phone call. Maybe we were just unlucky but it seemed like there was problem after problem.

Listing is accurate, property is very nice and well-equipped with mid to high-end amenities throughout.  Driveway is extremely steep, would be difficult or impossible to park a car with low ground clearance (e.g. sports car).  I suggest you bring eye shades to sleep, as there are no window coverings and lights outside the master that are on a photocell and cannot be turned off.

Our group unfortunately felt dissatisfied with our stay primarily due to a late check-in and delayed, rushed cleaning service. Prior to our trip, the hosts had approved an early check-in for an additional $50 fee, but on the morning of our arrival, we were informed they could not honor that early check-in. This was already an inconvenience but we ultimately were okay with this. When we later arrived to check in ~1 hour after the normal check-in time (or 3 hours after our previously arranged early check-in time), the house was still in disarray and the cleaning service had not yet arrived. When the cleaners ultimately arrived, they did a rushed job, leaving behind areas of the house that were still not completely cleaned. We lost a significant portion of our day solely due to this, and it made us feeling uncomfortable for the remainder of our stay not knowing what else had not been fully cleaned.

Although the hosts did apologize and offered us a small payment for our troubles, we felt it was not enough. It is still unclear to us what happened that day, but it seemed like miscommunication between the hosts and the cleaners throughout the entire day, as they were never clear when the cleaners were coming at all and only knew what was going on through messages with our group. It was also a bit confusing as there were multiple hosts messaging us about our reservation and none seemed to take ownership for the check-in/cleaning service. This was in stark contrast to experiences we have had in the past with other Airbnbs.

Overall, we still had a great time in Austin but our Airbnb experience could have been better.

We did a month long stay as part of our traveling journey in the US and could not be happier. Awesome new home in a desirable hilly neighborhood of Austin close to everything! The house looks brand new and felt very much our home.  John was very responsive and accommodating. Highly suggested for an Austin stay!

When we arrived there were already some other people there and it was very dirty inside and the host just told us he cant send a cleaning person and told us to wash the bed sheets and towels ourselves. Very dirty
For the price, we enjoyed our stay. We had confusion with check in, as we were advised we were having our unit cancelled, but later told there was an error and we could stay.

It took days for me to get an Internet code from Ana (Amanda) that worked
There was no laundry detergent or fabric softener and too few kitchen utensils. I was told to say that I was invited friend or relative instead of a renter, I was very uncomfortable about it.

This was our second stay at Rajeev and Minal's home and I was less than impressed this time around due to poor communication and an unkept home.

The lights in the home are not labeled, and there are some that just don't do anything. Also, a few lights are motion activated but stay on for around 15 seconds. It's a pain to retrieve clothing in the master closet as well as the utilities area when lights are turning off and on.

The first time we came there were issues with the water that I mentioned in a private conversation with Minal. A few weeks later, the water situation is still the same with all bathrooms having issues. The guest shower does not drain and your family is left in water up to their ankles.

Additionally, the master bath spews water at 3/4 force from the spout as well as the shower causing massive water waste.

Last, there is only tap water-- the water filter on the sink does not work, and there is no water spigot on the fridge. This was not that big of a deal.

We had asked if we could arrive 2 hours earlier and were told they'd contact us. I didn't hear so I came at 3:30 PM (past checkin time) to find the housekeeper still cleaning. She stated there was a conflict about scheduling and that the family has multiple properties so it's been hectic. It felt peculiar to hear this news from the cleaning service and not from the host directly. She stayed for approximately 45 minutes and there was a completely stuffed full dryer.

Outside there were piles of dog poop. I had left rolls of dog poop bags when I left and it's disappointing to have a big yard that we cannot play in.

In the kitchen, pieces of the transition flooring had broken off in which someone could get hurt. There were dead ants by the knife block that were not cleaned up.

Additionally I did not receive an apology for losing out on time, and non communication. Later, I did not hear from Rajeev except when he ask if his contractor could come and drop supplies off while we were still here.


Prior to leaving, I received an email that I didn't previously and it sort of set a sour taste in my mouth regarding check out policies because despite that my family was being inconvenienced upon arrival, no APOLOGIES were offered. (See below)

1. Check-out time is 11AM. If you need extra time, please request it as soon as you possibly can. I can sometimes offer it, depending whether the house is booked and on my housekeeper's schedule. There'd be a 39 dollar convenience fee , to handle all the extra communication & co-ordination with my housekeeping staff, guests etc.

2. If you stay after 11AM without requesting for a late checkout, there'll be a $75/hr fee to cover our operational overhead and inconvenience to the incoming guest.

Additionally, at 8:01 AM, when checkout is at 11 AM; I received this message:

Hi Vivian, Just a gentle reminder that the checkout time is 11:00 AM. My cleaning crew usually arrives 11:15AM.

While none of the below is an absolute must, you'll definitely add a smile on our housekeeper's face, if you took care of any or all of the following before you departed:

1. Collect all used towels and load them in the washer and start a load before you leave. The W/D & laundry pods are in the Utility room next to the kitchen!
2. Remove used sheets, pillowcases from the beds & put them on the floor or the into the black hamper, if you see one in your room.
3. Take the Kitchen Trash bag out in the Trashcan in the garage. If its full, you can just leave it in the garage.
4. Put any used dishes in the dishwasher and start a load

Thanks again for staying at my property. Safe Travels home!

All in all, this was a disappointing experience especially given that I had privately mentioned all issues to the hosts and nothing was done.

I would give this home a rating of a 2 because communication is a must with our family and cleanliness as well. I don't think I would come back because it seems these people care more about finances than the environment and the comfortableness of their guests. I do like the location but the home has so many tiny grievances, it's is not worth the price.
Very noisy neighborhood with lots of construction and only sleeps 3 people max not the advertised 4. Just fyi.

Apartment smelled my dog piss and made me want to vomit every time I walked in, the shower was clogged, and found a grasshopper on our bed. The host was terrible at communicating and never responded when I told them the shower was clogged and asked about checking out later. The walls are so thin that you think someone is coming into the apartment all the time.

Unfortunately, most of the bad things in negative reviews were true. You know when you see good and bad reviews how you hope for the best and usually it's ohhkay and not as bad as the worst review. No this was bad. Usually a few things you don't get too crazy about but it was one after the other. A bit confusing to get in at first, smelled, dirty (like stains and spatter of all sorts everywhere bathroom, bed, walls, floors, just dirty), noisy, broken lamp with glass shards sticking out, broken couch "pull out bed" exactly 2 towels for two people for 5 nights, no washcloths, no soap to even wash the one towel. bare minimum. coffee machine spilled everywhere. no remote for the TV and when I asked, she ignored me so I asked again if she was able to provide one and she said "Unfortunately no" no iron which was included in the listing. pots were gross, no way we could cook, and it's located on Greek row of the university, very loud all night. I would not book here again. pay more for better
You won‚Äôt be disappointed

Jeremy will go out of his way to accommodate guests. Expect nothing but great things from the host. You have 2 spots to park a car and the fire pit has lights, the main living area has led lights with a killer sound system. Basically everything was amazing!

Unit is not the ones in the picture. And when I got there place was unclean, wet dirty towels on the counter, trash in the trash can and looked like bed had been slept in, no one was sent to clean unit until the next day at 6pm. Also door didn‚Äôt lock and was advised by the cleaning lady to move couch to block the door in! Very ghetto to say the least. I asked for a refund for the full first day and the cleaning fee since it was dirty to begin with and was not given a full refund for that first day‚Ä¶. I do not recommend this place as it isn‚Äôt as it is advertised and they don‚Äôt care about making it right !!!! I sent them pics and video of incident
Don‚Äôt let the lack of central air scare you if you‚Äôre from the South.  Stayed in August and it stayed cool.
no

The bedroom with the queen-size bed is too noisy. There is non-stop machine engine sounds make it impossible to fall asleep. Maybe there are lots of AC units or some kinds of vents on the roof top. The host tried to help us to switch to next door, but same problem for one of the rooms. So if you are not a deep sleeper, don‚Äôt rent this style of apartment unit. Also I think they need to clean the bedding, floor, and shelves better, since we have paid for the cleaning fee. We found some blood stains on the comforter, don‚Äôt know if that is menstrual blood, or someone got hurt and accidentally left a mark. Don‚Äôt walk with bare feet, my kids‚Äô feet got so dirty after walking up and down the stairs. We wouldn‚Äôt recommend this place.

Communication was excessive and unhelpful. I filled out a survey telling what time I'd be there, and yet it was not changed over from previous renters. Half of the $120 cleaning fee was refunded to compensate...

Check-in instructions were incorrect, giving wrong code and wrong description of the lock. Shades were missing going out to the patio.
Second time staying at this place. Could not be happier with the space and experience.

La casa est√° muy bonita. Y esta cerca de todo.
Es importante saber que cuenta con una barra de cocina pero no cuenta con comedor. Sin embargo tiene un patio agradable y unas sillas con mesa y asador fuera de la casa.
La energ√≠a es agradable y est√° muy iluminada. Si hubiera disponibilidad nos hubi√©ramos quedado m√°s d√≠as. Se las recomiendo!

Unfortunately my friend and I had a very unpleasant stay. We arrived around 8:30 pm and the door to the apartment was cracked open. Due to that we where too scared to go in, as we felt it was unsafe to do so. I reached out to the host multiple times and got no response until the next morning. I even called the number on the listing which was the number to the apartment management. The guy I spoke to told me it was probably an accident and the door just didn‚Äôt get closed by the cleaning people. He was sure it was safe for us to enter, not knowing how long the door could have possibly been opened for. We attempted to look for hotels that night but everything was completely booked, which left us with no choice but to stay.

The apartment is small and does look like the pictures, except it was not clean. There was a dead cockroach in the bedroom and random ants would show up on the bed. We had no idea where they where coming from. Since the bed had white sheets the ants where very easy to spot. We refused to sleep on the bed because of the ants so we slept on the pull out couch which was VERY uncomfortable. On top of that, the sink in the restroom was clogged and as soon as I got out of the shower I stepped on a cockroach.. it was very disturbing and disgusting.

We unfortunately did not stay for the rest of the weekend and ended up booking a hotel. It was a such an inconvenience and the lack of communication was just very frustrating.

My stay was disappointing for several reasons, but the most important one its that the sleeper sofa that the third guest was supposed to use was broken and the host didn't respond to this, instead what I got as an answer was (premade of course) was if I was planning to checkout earlier than expected. Ignoring my message and my aunt had to sleep very uncomfortable in the couch, I payed for three beds. I had nowhere else to go, it was late to book for another place. Wont be staying in this place again.

Could use better bug control, I get that bugs are a thing but we had multiple encounters. Unfortunately, the 2 other members I was with are afraid of bugs and wanted nothing to do with them, so it was left up to me. No toilet paper on arrival.  AC was broken on arrival. The bnb was smaller than expected, fortunately our 4th wasn't able to make it so for 3 people, it was fine. Couch bed was so uncomfortable that it wasn't even worth sleeping on, member just slept on the couch normally.

Great size for a solo traveler. Short Uber ride to Austin Convention Center. The bed frame was broken so the mattress is sinking in the middle. The coffee machine worked but leaked coffee each time used and it was annoying to continually clean the mess.  The initial blanket provided had a foul smell, though management provided another one the next day.  Except for the bed, I don‚Äôt perceive these issues as major, but I think it‚Äôs one of the cons of staying in managed airbnbs. If an owner lived there, they would be aware of these issues sooner. The price was decent though.

This was one of our most unpleasant stays. The apartment smelled like it was masked with Lysol instead of getting actually cleaned (kitchen had old grease on cabinets, living room dusty, etc). Coffee maker still had used coffee and filter with coffee grounds (among other things). The bed was broken, so slept in u-shape. Everything was pretty disappointing.

This place was ok. I really was no expecting to stay in a place with an unpleasant smoke smell. I would have wished the host had mentioned this in their property description. For the money I payed I would have expected a cleaner place. I told the host about this issue and they said they would reach out to facilities.

We checked in around 10pm due to a flight delay. The carbon monoxide detector was chirping indicating a low battery. When we called, the after hours answering service told us that we could either take the battery out or listen to the chirp all night and they would fix it in the morning. Acceptable since it was later at night. However, no one ever came to fix the issue.

TL;DR We were locked out at 2am and had to check into a hotel.

My friends and I booked this place for 3 nights. We were told that it was self check-in and the door had a passcode (that was given to us 24h before our trip). I confirmed that our arrival would be late at night. Our flight ended up being delayed, but we didn't think it'd be a big deal since we had mentioned we were arriving late at night anyways and it was a self check-in.

So when we arrived at the airbnb it was around 1am and we tried the code given to us and it didn't work. We thought it was us originally so tried it a bunch of different ways and when it still didn't work we tried to contact the host.

I believe the host uses a management company and they said they'd be available 24/7 during our stay should anything happen. That wasn't true since we tried contacting them over a period of 2 hours to try and figure out how to get into the property and no one responded. By this time it wasn't working and we had to contact airbnb to figure out next steps.

Thank goodness for aircover. Airbnb was able to help us cancel the airbnb and get a refund, but we ended up still having to check into a hotel (it was 4am at this point after going through all the process).

Overall, the check-in experience was frustrating and terrible. This hiccup could have easily been avoided, but clearly no one really checks the door between stays.

The management company did reach out afterwards and offer us to re-book the airbnb after our hotel stay for whatever remaining days we were in Austin to make things right. However, one thing of note is that after all of their cleaning fees and nightly cost, it was more expensive to stay at the airbnb instead of a hotel. We mentioned it was their original fault that we were locked out at 2am and had to go to a hotel, so why should we be charged even more for that, before they lowered the price just enough for it to be less than a hotel stay.

No grill was at the home that we stayed at in Austin. The listing showed a grill in the profile picture of the listing. An inconvenience at best, but really did derail our whole plans for the day. We expected to grill out I. The evening at the home. Even bought $85 dollars worth of groceries for our short 2 night stay. The grill was part of this plan. I was not impressed with how this was handled by Evolve. Think again before booking this house. At the very least, be sure to ask about the grill.
Broken dishwasher never fixed, smelly kitchen, untidy front n backyard. AC too slow for Texas heat  at upstairs and no hot/warm water in showers. Cockroaches in garage(game room).

We would have enjoyed our stay better if the house was left in a better condition before we arrived. It is a beautiful home, but so many things that management did not take care of ruined it. The grass was not cut, there was old trash left in the garage from the previous rental. The smell of the old garbage was horrible. We had to remove all the old trash and clean out the garage and the refrigerator before we could get settled, this was not how we wanted to start our vacation. The refrigerator had old food, bugs, and hair in it, even after airing out the garage and cleaning it, the horrible garage smell still lingered. The house didn‚Äôt have any type of cleaning supplies or disinfectant, not even a broom or dust pan. The air conditioner upstairs didn‚Äôt cool the rooms it was very hot in the rooms.
Also we had to kill several insects and bugs that entered the house.

LOCATION WAS GREAT!
5 min from liquor store, target and pluckers!
Experienced a couple hiccups and the AC went out, but overall our host Austin was very attentive and listened to all the concerns in a timely matter.
1/5 stars for cleanliness‚Ä¶. Not the most clean AirBnb, there was no paper towels, inside the fridge was dirty, the coffee pot is very stained and the oven toaster seemed like it hasn‚Äôt been cleaned in a while either.
Full kitchen tho, stocked with essentials and pots/ plates.
Overall okay stay!
Wouldn‚Äôt rent from them again. Cancelled our stay because it was not clean, and photos didn‚Äôt show bathroom - which turned out dirty and needing work.

Check in was awkward, keys under bricks, etc. cabinets and fridge had open food bags and containers in them, closet had sheets and blankets thrown in there unfolded, I couldn‚Äôt find a wash rag, shower caulking was black moldy

Despite the beautiful pictures, if nothing works, you have paid for an empty box.  4 floor executive building with elevator private garage, floor by floor sound and entertainment system.  The most exclusive and expensive place in Austin.  That is what I bought for a surprise 50th birthday weekend getaway.  What we got, was:  NO ELEVATOR-BROKEN, NO GARAGE-BROKEN, NO CAPPACCINO MACHINE-BROKEN, NO SOUND SYSTEM, OWNER LOCKED IT DOWN, 2 FIREPLACES-ONE WORKED.  Not only did all 10 of us feel let down and disappointed we were all exhausted from the daily trash truck noise at 5 am.  NOT SOUND PROOF., but walking up and down 4 flights of steps constantly.  IF WE GOT WHAT I PAID FOR, this place would still be expensive.  BECAUSE WE DID NOT IT WAS BORDERLINE ROBBERY.

The townhouse is very unique and a cool urban location to hold an event, meeting, or party.  The house has lots of space, trendy decor, and things to do.  However, staying in the townhouse for several days as a family was not a great experience.  First, the garage door opener was not working, so we could not enter the house from the garage, and instead had to enter from the front of the property.  The front door is directly on Congress with homeless people living on the bench in front of the house.  It was not a safe situation.  Second, the stairs in the home are steep and open, and renters do not have access to the elevator in the home.  There were too many trips up and down very steep steps.  Third, the home was not well maintained.  There was water turned off to the fourth floor due to a burst pipe, light bulbs out, broken appliances, no soap in the shower, dead plants, etc.  I do give kudos to the folks at AvantStay for their excellent communication and troubleshooting.
We did not have WiFi because landscapers accidentally cut the line. This was no fault of the owners or management. It was an inconvenience though.
Could not have been better
The stairs inside are not all the same depths & heights, I tripped & fell on them, sore & bruised!  Especially the 2nd one from the 2nd floor.  Plus I had to kill a roach in my bedroom, yuck!

The only thing I would complain about was the cleanliness of the apartment and the bed. The bed was very uncomfortable and you could tell it was cheap.
The location is amazing, there is so much to do in the domain. We would spend most of our days walking around the streets. The host is quick to respond and provides detailed information when needed.
Did not appreciate how the listing was not an accurate depiction of the house, the neighborhood, and the state of the lake

The place was not clean and my family and I had to deal with a lot of trash in front of the house that had an awful smell. We did notify the owners and they did reply fast but the cleaning crew they had never did come and picked up the trash throughout our stay‚Ä¶ the owner did offer us a discount because of the inconvenience.
This is a nice 1 bedroom unit with a balcony.  Very convenient - you can walk to downtown, the metro is one block away.

Can‚Äôt beat this location for the price. Unfortunately the internet did go out the first day and that was super important during my stay as I needed to be able to log in for online work meetings everyday. It took a few hours to hear back from the owner but she did eventually have the internet back up. The kitchen and restroom were fine and the living room space was good too. Only other complaint was that the bed frame is broken and held up by some stacks of 2x4s on both sides but the middle completely sinks down.  The comforter also smelled bad so we avoided touching it but the sheets were fine.

this is a studio, not a one bedroom as advertised.
The unit was dirty, all types of hair on the rugs and mats. not to mention there was only one bath towel that was stained and damp. It looked like someone was living there all week and they woke up in the morning and decided to rent their place out.

I would not recommend anybody booking with Charles. The first night there it was a water leak never stopped  &  the shower had no hot water the bathroom sink had very low water pressure and the kitchen sink was stopped up some of my personal items was damaged because of the water. I reached out to the host letting him know he had a major leak which he did nothing about and the baseboards already had water damage  when i got there my first night so previous it had to be a flood in the apartment at some point which am sure he knew all about it.
Amazing location and very clean apartment. Just know that there are issues with the front door that add a bit of difficulty when trying to lock the door. It's possible, but not easy.
Terrible host

5/5 as always - Jon‚Äôs place has no equal in Austin. I wouldn‚Äôt stay anywhere in town!

The place is as pictured but unfortunately Alex is not a good host. He did not respond to our messages regarding check in. I highly recommend this place to anyone, you won‚Äôt regret it.

Place was exactly as described.  Had a little problem with entry due to a bad storm the night before.  They responded and fixed it immediately.  Great hosts!

Unfortunately, water heater was out 10 of 11 days, we had to take quick showers & wait an hour between for water to heat back up. Plumber/host in & out several times.

Stove exhaust fan wasn‚Äôt actually hooked up to exterior ventilation, so when cooking first meal on the stove, smoke that would‚Äôve normally been vented out instead just filled the apartment & set off fire alarm, making us eat dinner on the dirty metal stairs outside the unit. Host saw us eating there & we explained the issue, which he didn‚Äôt seem concerned about.

The next day we cooked in the oven, which wasn‚Äôt clean & more smoke filled apt, setting off alarm again. Host said he would have oven cleaned but never did. Most of the food we spent money couldn‚Äôt be cooked. Asked host for 3-4 days refund, he offered less than 1 day if no bad review!
Not worth over $100 a night but a cheap option for just a roof over your head.
Never stay in this place. It is horrible.
Master bathroom not operational, front door lock not working, refridgerator water did not work, refridgerator seemed broken

I‚Äôll share my honest opinion about our stay in Austin this past weekend.
We were a group of 5 adults aging from 30-35 years old who also hosting and managing Airbnb properties in the DFW area.
First of, a night before the check in, our trip to Austin almost got canceled due to work schedules of some of us, so we reached out to the host to check if we could cancel and get refunded, and the answer we got after a few hours almost at night was that they can refund us 50% and charge for cleaning ($650) which we haven‚Äôt even left dallas not that we have arrived, but anyway we were able to manage to get to our Airbnb at 8pm the day of our booking, after a long day and a long 4 hour drive, we get to the Airbnb starving and ready to grill some steaks, we find out that there isn‚Äôt any propane tank for the bbq grill. We looked around and couldn‚Äôt find so we reached out to the host about this matter, at first they didn‚Äôt realize that there isn‚Äôt one on site and after we told them that, they started arranging one. After almost 2 hours waiting we drove to the nearest gas station to get a tank ourselves, and by the time we get back, the tank the host sent was delivered as well. In the meantime when we were wondering how long it will take for the propane tank to be delivered, one of the responses we got from the host was ‚ÄúIf you go to the gas station across the street you may be able to get propane much quicker. We don‚Äôt usually supply the propane or charcoal for the grill guests bring their own‚Äù, and ‚ÄúIf you‚Äôre unhappy after one hour of being there it‚Äôs probably best if you checkout tonight before you get too settled. I would hate for you to feel the hard work we‚Äôve put into the house was unacceptable for you and your group over propane for the grill.‚Äù
So we decided to leave it as it is and continue our stay and if something else would come up during our stay.

During our stay, we noticed a few necessity items that were missing at the house things such as a dish sponge and soap, a kettle, a cutting board, and probably one of the most necessary items in a house on an open land was an ‚ÄúAnt & Roach killer‚Äù, the amount of bugs, spiders, scorpions, incests and creatures we had to deal with and kill during this stay was incredible. They were everywhere, kitchen, bedrooms, showers, on beds and sofas literally in every part of the house. At first we kinda dealt with it by killing them, but then after it got out of hand, we sent pictures of those issues to the host, saying that there‚Äôs such a matter, they agreed that there‚Äôs a lack of a pest control treatment at that house, they asked us if we would like to relocate to a different house, and when we asked for details on that other property, we never heard back from the host.
When we got to the last day of our stay, we were so surprised to get such a rude msg from the host that we need to do the dishes, take out all the trash we had, put all towels in the laundry etc , when we‚Äôre charged an extremely high rate of $650 for cleaning.

I do wanna add that the house had a very nice remodel done to it and the finishes were selected nicely. But other than that, there was a lack in hosting experience that made us feel that weren‚Äôt been taking care of after considering the amount we paid for only 3 nights.
Property not great for kids or those traveling on business.

Everything was great, but the price could be lowered a little bit. Almost $500 for just one night is a bit overpriced. Especially since we couldn‚Äôt check in til 4pm, which was then 3:15pm at the earliest, and then check out at 10AM and couldn‚Äôt even get a late checkout either. $500 for less than 24hours. Either lower the price or fix the check in check out times, to accommodate your visitors, NOT your cleaners.
Jessica hat superschnell geantwortet. Es war alles vorhanden. Sehr verst√§ndnisvoll. Blitzsauber

Great location! Absolutely no wifi or at least wifi didn‚Äôt work and for whatever reason signal in that area is awful, so plan to get around with limited service..also the check in procedure seemed sketchy but we figured it out! Worth the price/location but a little odd

I had trouble finding the entrance, but that‚Äôs probably just me.

Other than that, I was a little disappointed in the bed and bedding.

Overall good stay and accurate descriptions.

Fantastic stay!  Would stay again.  Easy check in and check out.  Great location in the north side of the Domain near restaurants and bars.  You can hear some of the music from the bars/clubs at night but nothing we couldn‚Äôt easily ignore.

When we first entered apartment, there is terrible smell. Room was not clean. Also some amenities did not work. We rented for 1 month, it‚Äôs a long stay. It should have been handled before we check in.
Clean. Just uncomfortable beds and you can‚Äôt leave a key at the desk for a 2nd person on the reservation
Very basic Airbnb. Minimally stocked kitchen and bathrooms. It was quiet during the week but noisy neighborhood on the weekend.

This stay was awful. I was given two key fobs for the room, and one was the wrong fob. So when I went to get back into my room at night, the fob didn‚Äôt work, and they had no resolution to get me a new key. We called the owner multiple times and the front desk of the building didn‚Äôt have a solution either. So for one of my three nights we were told by the front desk we could sleep on the lobby couch or the street. Hours later we were given a temporary key, but the situation was never rectified, and the entire weekend I had a key to someone else‚Äôs room and they had a key to my room. It was a complete liability disaster and the first night of my trip was entirely shot. I do not recommend using this Airbnb or Unwind at all for your vacation stays

The air bnb host was very responsive and accommodating. However, the concierge that was provided through the host was inconsiderate and unresponsive. He ignored our texts and enforced a strict 10am checkout. When asked for 20 mins extra to checkout he ignored and barged into the place. He showed zero patience and asked us to leave even though we were on our way out. He was not very accommodating and the 10am checkout is very inconvenient.

24 hour pool parties that took place outside of our door, making it nearly impossible to relax in the living room/kitchen. While the house was relatively similar to the listing on the inside, the location and cleanliness were questionable. On the location, the neighborhood was not in the safest area from our opinion although it was convenient regarding proximity to the city. Regarding cleanliness, there was a used trash bag and rag in the house on the floor when we got there (a day late which gave additional cleaning time) which caused our lower rating. The renter was communicative and the amenities did function as promised.
Unfortunately we had to cancel our trip to Austin at the last minute .  Our communication was through texting. Lucia was prompt in her messages and seemed understanding of my situation.
No hot water. Location is not the best

The inside of the house was neat and clean and newly renovated. However, the backyard tables, chairs and pool were covered with leaves that were constantly falling from an overhead tree. We could not locate the pool vacuum and emailed the owner but did not get a response. We also got a charge after we checked out for a broken dining chair which we did see broken while we were there. The owner sent the request for reimbursement to Airbnb who ruled that we were not responsible.

It was a very frustrating and unsatisfactory experience. We could not enter the house on the first night because the lockbox malfunctioned, and we could not reach the host. As a result we had to find somewhere else to sleep. Cleanliness was also a concern - it was evident that the house had not been cleaned and at least one bed's sheets not laundered or changed. In addition there was hair on the bathroom floor, and in the tub, dust and cobwebs in multiple places in the main living area.

Located near austin downtown and convenient. Property needs significant upgrading. Furniture, rooms, utilities are dated. Blinds are broken and need fixing. Exterior is unappealing. Interior looks better in pictures than actual. With more information, I probably would not have booked the property.

When we arrived, the air conditioning was turned off, it was immensely hot inside. The rooms did not look clean. Carpet is old. We took one look and decided not to stay. It may be appropriate stay destination for some, but it was not the right property for us.

Apartamento en buenas condiciones. Muy bien equipado en cuanto a los utensillos de la cocina.

It‚Äôs clean and in a central location close to UT and lots of great restaurants. The hot water ran out fast so you have to take very short showers.
Terrible experience. AC doesn‚Äôt work and the host stopped communicating when we let them know. Don‚Äôt do this to yourself
Just the parking is limited

Perfect location, enough room for a big family! Went for a wedding in Austin and this apartment was 2 blocks away from the venue so this was exactly what we needed a bed, AC and a shower! The place is very spacious and convenient. It could use more cleanness  and the communication with host was not  as effective (but it did not impact my stay).
Fun/convenient location but very noisy because of UT frats. Took cold showers. A bit dirty

Beautiful house in a loud and not super nice part of town.

Upon our arrival, we found the front yard littered with trash, an electrical panel open and disassembled in the back, and we had to deal with a rotten smell of dirty diapers/grease the entire stay.

On the inside- circuits kept blowing with very LITTLE usage (a curling iron in a bathroom) and after NO REPLY we finally found the circuit box we needed to fix the problem ourselves. The stay was not what we expected at all and disappointing. The check in gate was unclear and was extreme bad lighting, making it hard to see and feeling of unease. The area was next to a vacant lot and a freight train, making it sketchy and very loud. The inside was dusty and had a musty smell to it, making it not feel homey. What a great location! The house was immacuately clean. The air conditioning wasn't working when we got there. Luckily, Todd remedied that problem very quickly!

There were some concerns, though. There were several broken pieces of furniture that hadn't been repaired, a panel to the jetted tub was broken off with exposed wires, there were only two pillows in a house that should have slept 5, and there were no paper towels or other basics like that. When I mentioned these things to Todd, they were ignored. We had two people who had to sleep without pillows for three nights, which is just not okay.

Although the house itself was comfortable, the property is not maintained well and lacks basic safety features. When we arrived, the front door was already unlocked. Upon leaving, we tried locking the door and it did not work. I contacted the host, who was responsive, but he suggested we leave - with the front door unlocked - and he would come by to change the keypad battery. We did not want to leave our things unattended so we waited for him. Our evening plans were delayed as a result. The keypad did not work again the next day. I asked the host multiple times for a spare key and he did not respond. Thirty minutes later, he unlocked the property remotely. We barely missed our class reservation. The two side gates that lead into the backyard do not have locks so anyone can enter from the back. Both bathroom windows have no covering; anyone in the backyard has a clear view inside. None of the string lights/one patio light in the backyard works. One of the showers didn't work.

El lugar es amplio y muy limpio. Esta un poco lejos del centro, pero se puede llegar en un solo autob√∫s (aproximadamente 50 minutos a una hora hasta la universidad de Texas, por ejemplo).
Tiene una cocina equipada y con suficiente espacio. La calefacci√≥n no es central, por lo que alg√∫n otro hu√©sped puede cambiarla cuando sea.
Juanita responde bien y r√°pido a las preguntas, pero tuve que solicitar la informaci√≥n para llegar, pues viajaba antes, y parece que la pol√≠tica del espacio es dar la informaci√≥n hasta el d√≠a de la reservaci√≥n. Se me provey√≥ de la informaci√≥n de cualquier manera. tambi√©n me habr√≠a ayudado saber que la calefacci√≥n no era individual, sino central. S√≠ me pareci√≥ una anfitriona seca, en comparaci√≥n con otros Airbnb, pero fue eficiente y veraz.

Overall, the stay was fine. It is important for future guests to know what to expect:
the house is on the border of a nice residential neighborhood and a more industrial commercial space--the adjoining neighborhood is nice to walk through, but that is not evident at first. It backs onto a loud road, so this room in particular had a lot of traffic noise in the evening. This has the feel of a rooming house--there are ~8 rooms rented in a medium sized house. The other lodgers were nice and no one made much noise, but if the house were full it could be a very different experience.
One note is that the kitchen and bathroom (at least for this en suite room) have very low counters (maybe ADA compliant?). I didn't notice too much (average female height), but anyone taller would be uncomfortable (including my average male husband).

Just pick a hotel. The parking was 40/day add the price of the room and of buying a simple breakfast and this place is the same as a hotel but without the rewards points or the on site service. I don't mean to say it's a bad place, the room was clean and fancy, but the arrangement between avantstay and natviio made for an awkward check in and a feeling of being out of place. Add the local construction making the walk to attractions treacherous and the constant roar of interstate 35 a hundred meters away, and it's not a place I'll go back to.

Disfrutamos mucho nuestra estancia en el lugar de Alex,

De ah√≠ en todo lo dem√°s, bastante c√≥modo, sin duda disfrutamos mucho la estancia. Alex tiene un apartamento muy acogedor.

Great place for short visits! Would not recommend for longer stays.
Pros:

Cons:
