Disappointing. Very worn out and dirty. There is a train that runs directly behind the house, at all hours of the night. Not worth the money.
The only downside was the Latch system that the entire building uses.  No fault of Eric‚Äôs.   I‚Äôm old and hate depending on electronics for everything

No parking included, host intentionally leaves off listing. $48/day to park in garage, clearance is 6'9", and SUV wouldn't fit. Street parking hit or miss. It is very misleading and intentional by the host. Great location and unit, but I won't be staying at any of his properties on principle alone

Not sure if y'all know, but two fans didn't work as it was very uncomfortable in the house. The room with double beds doesn't have an air vent and the fan was broken making it very uncomfortable and hot in that room. Being in Texas in the summer time I'd try to make sure y'all know every appliance is working before renting it out.

The check in was sent in a coded link and was very confusing on how to get in the house as we had to call to get in.

The listing said close to downtown and it's a good 20-30 minute drive to get there depending on traffic. Not very cost efficient if you're using Uber and Lyft.
Look no further, this place is a gem.
overall good stay. very comfy bed. but for anyone with sensitivities to smell - there‚Äôs an obvious febreze/synthetic chemical smell in the space‚Ä¶ that‚Äôs our only negative. thank you!

The host will say they have to meet you in person to give you the keys and if you don‚Äôt between 4pm and 8pm, they will charge you an extra fee. Truth is they Emailed us a video of where they hid the lockbox on the grounds of the property with the key in it and even though we were available to meet, no in-person meeting took place. One of the 2 beds is a pullout sofa bed but no bedding was provided except for a fitted sheet. It took the host 2 days to provide the bedding after our initial request. Not helpful on a 3 day stay. The fitted sheet which was on the sofa bed was stained, so clearly used by an earlier stay and not changed. There were dirty dishes left in the dishwasher. Used coffee pods in the coffee machine. Wet dirty towels in the washing machine. The floors had clearly not been vacuumed. We informed the host that the condition of the unit was unacceptable and even provided photos so they could see. In return, they shifted the blame to their housekeepers and prior guests. In the end: this Airbnb is not as advertised, not clean and the hosts when given the opportunity to fix it showed they don‚Äôt care.

There were pests indoor and outside. Place needs a deep cleaning. Neighborhood is right by a train track and even with ‚Äúno horn‚Äù it‚Äôs can be noisy when it comes through. 10 out of 10 for proximity to downtown and host response time.

Overall a enjoyable stay. Wifi wasn‚Äôt very good and it‚Äôs right next to train tracks. The train does run fairly consistently through out the night but only a couple nights it bothered us. You‚Äôre getting what you pay for.

I was in town seven nights doing archival research, not vacation, so I really needed things to go smoothly. They didn't.

The space is perfect for one or two people. Small studio with kitchen and full or double bed. Plenty of supplies (paper products, garbage bags, etc). It's clean. For central Austin, so close to the university, it's relatively quiet, even on the weekend.

The in-unit washer/dryer did not work. I was told that it would be fixed. It wasn't. I had to go to a laundromat. The hot water stopped working. I was told it was fixed. It wasn't. Those cold showers were a real pain. The dishwasher wasn't anchored, so it leaned forward when I tried to open it, and almost tipped over when I tried to load the bottom rack. The person living above this unit sounded like a stomper. I've lived in apartments for 20+ years and have stayed in more than a few AirBnbs with someone living upstairs, and this was by far the worst. It vibrated the unit. It woke me up in the middle of the night. Maybe the building was rehabbed with no consideration for sound insulation.

In the end I was left feeling like the host didn't care about the quality of my stay, which didn't sit well with me, especially when he owns the entire building of rental units and has a staff. Why get into this business if you're not willing or able to take care of the problems that will naturally arise?











st didn't care at all about the qua

Although the price is attractive and the place was relatively clean and up to date, I would not recommend this stay for a large group and/or group of girls. I did not have the best experience with this Airbnb and will not be booking with them in the future. The communication was not great and the hospitality was not there whatsoever.
I communicated to the host prior to arriving the time I would be arriving and checking in to the apartment. I arrived at that time, 10:30pm, and was unable to get inside using the keypad. They provided me with 2 codes, and neither one of the codes worked. I contacted the host, and did not receive a response. I had to find a hotel room at 10:30pm that night. I did not hear from the host until 9:00am the next day, after I messaged them again in the morning. I barely received a "sorry" from them. I also had to ask numerous time for a refund for the night I was unable to get inside the space.

Coming from someone who has spent their career in the hospitality industry, I was very disappointed in their lack of sympathy, response, or just care in general. Super disappointing.

Thankfully Airbnb was kind enough for a refund due to the owner being rude and not letting us get one. Please don‚Äôt stay here the owner is so extremely rude and does not care for his guest. The area around here is extremely sketchy!! I do not recommend it especially if you are a girl staying by yourself. When I arrived there were a large group of men outside drinking and partying right in the pathway I needed to go. As previously mentioned this was already a unsafe area and my local friends told me after this all ended it is not a safe area. I did not feel comfortable going into the unit due to this. I asked the host if anything could be done and he said no. I wanted to cancel my entire reservation, but the host said I would still have to pay the full amount. After talking to the host about something being done or cancelling due to me feeling unsafe he was not helpful. I contacted airbnb and was on the phone for hours with them, they tried to reach out to the host to work something out but he would not answer them Therefore they said they couldn't help me until something happened. I asked the host if I could pay for one night and cancel the rest, thankfully he allowed that. I did not even stay for the night I paid for, so I cannot speak on the condition of the unit because I never stepped inside. I went to another airbnb and just gave up on they money I would lose. very clean water is backwards in one bathroom but no biggie! will be booking again!!

Jennie is a terrible host y‚Äôll. Very uncommunicative and unfriendly. Why would someone do an airbnb when they dont enjoy hosting them?

Overall okay. And good for what you pay for because it can accommodate several people. So as long as you understand it‚Äôs a budget location for a reason‚Äî then all good there. Stained poor quality towels and the shower temp control is a pain to use. It was just myself and my husband and we didn‚Äôt spend all our time in the Airbnb so we weren‚Äôt looking for anything fancy and we managed but wish I brought some stuff from home. So it worked out in the end but this could have been a headache for others had they flown in or needed the Airbnb that day (host didn‚Äôt inform us until very late in the evening on check in day, I think due to poor communications/emergency by cleaner, and originally suggested to cut our cleaning fee in half which didn‚Äôt make sense‚Äî if someone is telling me the house wasn‚Äôt cleaned, I don‚Äôt want to stay there.
