La casa supera todas las expectativas y Eva es muy buena anfitriona, sin duda volver√≠a.
Horribe experience,  Dirty restroom,  very disapointed.

COCKROACHES! We were "welcomed" into this home by having to sweep up 9 cockroaches. All of the barstools and dining chairs were wobbly which led us to the discovery that many of them were missing screws - making them quite hazardous. The 5th "bedroom" is really just a concrete storage area next to the door of the garage that has two 4 inch mattresses on it. The floor was so dirty our feet turned black just 15 minutes after being there. It's very clear this home is not cared for. The host did not help us with the cockroaches and was overall unpleasant to work with.  The home LOOKS picture perfect, but don't let the pictures deceive you.

A lot smaller than the pictures depict but the space was fine for the two of us. Smelled a little stale and there was hair on the duvet cover that draped the bed. The parking lot felt a little scary near the unit but I parked in-front of  the mailboxes where there was light. The room price was fine, it‚Äôs the cleaning fee that bugged me. Also, with a steep cleaning fee that cost more than the room, I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs right to ask your guest to take out the trash and start a load of dishes. Nonetheless, it got the job done for a quick overnight stay however, I wouldn‚Äôt stay again. Also, there‚Äôs a keurig and no coffee. Not sure who travels with coffee pods‚Ä¶
There were a few concerns that FS addressed quickly. The bed is not firm or comfortable.
This place has a serious bug problem, no hot water, and on a 3rd floor walk up

The house was nice and as pictured. The amenities were as promised.  The only downside I noticed were beds.  Both beds were very low to the ground. We traveled with my in-laws and it was difficult for them to in/out of the bed.  Also,  our bed had a dip in the mattress and was a little uncomfortable.

Definitely not what it seems like on the ad. The ‚Äúhost‚Äù is terrible, she doesn‚Äôt get back to you at all on anything, also there is no parking provided from what residents at the apartment complex this Airbnb is at they said there is no such thing as ‚Äúun-assigned‚Äù parking and whatever the host tells you is a scam and you will get towed.

Communication was awful, Who is will try to kick you out at 10:30 at night without breaking no rules, bed was broken, she make rules on the spot no clear cut rules to follow, be aware she doesn‚Äôt like kids but she‚Äôs not gonna tell you that
Our only regret was that it was not long enough.

the place was fairly clean, except for the shoe prints on the bathroom floor and the red mold in the shower. the window in the bedroom was broken and wouldn't stay up, falling shut fast and dangerously. the drain in the bathroom sink wouldn't stay up, so you couldn't wash your hands without having to reach in the water, pulling the drain up and keeping it up manually (gross), I had to keep it up myself with a q-tip. for the cleaning fees that cost more than the rate of the Airbnb for two nights, I definitely expected more. the place itself is nice and comfortable. The pullout bed on the couch is really, really uncomfortable but the bed in the bedroom is fine. the biggest issue was the crazy hallways of this building. even though everyone has complete access to a garbage shoot on each floor, they somehow leave the trash out on the hallway (I assume to be collected later?), making the hallway smelly and disgusting and such an eyesore, but thats not on the hosts in any way,.

everything was good.
but the sofa was really uncomfortable.

This was a lovely apartment but everything didn‚Äôt go well as expected. Cleaning was one problem and I had to mop the almost black floor the first thing in morning after my late night checkin as I was travelling with 2 kids. When I mentioned this to host he said he will take it up with the cleaner and came back with a discounted cleaning offer 2 days later which was bit annoying. Also the AC unit malfunctioned and we were given a temporary AC unit 4-5 hrs later but it was not enough for 2 BR house and that night went rough in Austin heat with 2 kids. AC unit was repaired next day but that really took lot of interactions back and forth and I had no time for that. Also, i had to checkout early because there was a repair pending and workers wanted to come on 2 days of our stay. Host put in a request with the building management but he was not sure that it will be considered and asked us to turn them away if they did. This again took so much of time on asking host to not send them and We didn‚Äôt want to deal with that and so had to resort to checkout early. Not sure why this otherwise great unit was rented out if there were pending repairs.

Overall had a good stay here for a quick weekend trip.

Pros -
The apartment itself is spacious, in a good location, and pretty quite. The host are responsive and helpful. The mattress was so comfy I asked for the link!

Cons -
Filling out the guest portal before check-in should have saved time but it didn‚Äôt. The instructions on the portal weren‚Äôt accurate as the door was locked and the provided code didn‚Äôt work. Host provided another route for entrance but still, slightly inconvenient. The bathroom wasn‚Äôt the cleanest upon arrival and the towels had stains on them. There were no replacement towels available unfortunately. Lastly, for $175 cleaning fee having to do dishes, gather linens, and take your own trash out to the external trash chute (valet was available but not to be used by visitors apparently) is a bit ridiculous.

A solid stay but there‚Äôs a ton of options in Austin.
Killer spot you're really close to all the action you can practically walk everywhere

When we arrived at this AirBnB property we immediately noticed a really bad smoke smell all over the place. It seemed like someone had been smoking cigarettes inside the property for days with doors and windows shut. It was really bad. We continued to enter the AirBnB property and noticed that there was dirty bedding lying around the master bedroom. We decided to bring that dirty bedding to the laundry area. When we opened the laundry we found a pile of dirty towels sitting on top of the washing machine. This place was disgusting. We immediately contacted AirBnB; they requested description and pictures; which we sent. As soon as AirBnB saw our pictures, they immediately agreed with us and cancelled the reservation and refunded us 100%. We later received a message from the host scolding us for not contacting him about the issue before we contacted AirBnB (as if he would have been able to do something), and alleging that his cleaning crew said they had done their job. This was a very bad experience and it left a sour taste on our vacations. Think twice before you book this property; this review is 100% honest. This place is disgusting.

Very easy to access, close to many shops and restaurants. The apartment was clean.
The neighborhood was a bit suspect and a bit ghetto. The stairs to get to the apartment look as though they‚Äôre about to collapse. It was so much smaller and nowhere near as nice as the pictures! False advertisement at its finest.
Nothing but great

Unit wasn‚Äôt clean when we checked in.  We were contacted and asked to delay our check-in.  Making the most out of a bad situation, we checked in without it being cleaned.  We‚Äôre still charged with their cleaning fee - that they describe in their description is for precleaning.  Then three days after began harassing for payment on pets where there were no pets in the unit.  Outside of their odd discriminatory policies and their fee frenzy - it‚Äôs a decent place.

OVERAL, the apartment was OK for up to 4 people, but I do not believe that with the broken blind, the 2 people sleeping in the living room would have any privacy. The apartment was OK, but the owner or management was not friendly or did not care to reply when we contacted them.
Owner or Management threatened us to cancel our reservation and threaten to give us a bad review...

The house was cluttered. Bathroom had no room for my stuff. A box was blocking the shower window for unknown reasons.
They have a non working cast iron gate in front with 4 unused cars. It was the most uncomfortable and unpleasant stay anywhere. I left after 2 days and any refund was refused. Not a good situation at all.
Not a good experience with check in or communication.
Can‚Äôt complain for this price.

The place is very conveniently located and of great value with a small, yet major flaw. The WiFi would not stay connected to any device. Upon asking the host, they stated that the house did not have its own WiFi connection and instead shared with the main home via a WiFi extender. I understand this may not be an issue for some, but I needed to work remotely and this was a significant disappointment that I wish was disclosed prior to booking. We also were not able to locate the outdoor trash bin and asked where it was twice so we could empty our trash as stated in the checkout directions, but we never received a reply. Overall, the stay was fine and we had no major issues other than those stated above, but unfortunately, I wouldn't stay here again.

I just finished a stay at Laila‚Äôs place. Overall it was a very good stay.

Pros: for me the biggest plus was location. We were three women there to visit a fourth woman who had a baby during the pandemic. Laila‚Äôs place was around the corner from her house. It‚Äôs a residential area and the house is on an alley way so it‚Äôs quiet but you can walk to some restaurants, including the very hip Nixta.


Easy parking in front of the house.

It‚Äôs a small house so that felt nice, rather than just an apartment.

Great supply of towels and coffee.

Cons: the biggest: while we were there, the hot water didn‚Äôt work in any of the sink faucets (one and a half bathrooms or sink. The heat in the shower was not strong and when I was the second person using the shower, the water pressure was not great. When I reported this to Laila she responded to me immediately and told me that she corrected this after we left. But I cannnot verify this since we went the entire time with this issue.

Be aware that there are good closets but no bureau if that matters to you.

Finally, note that the alley way gets muddy when it rains. Not a big deal to us as we were casual but might be an issue if you were wearing fancy shoes.
Stayed for one night and i have 0 complains. Very tidy place 10/10 would stay again.
place was great, but host was way too Rude and take her time answering..

Apartment was close to where we needed to be, central to grocery store, shopping and restaurants. Quiet complex too. We arrived after dark, so it was a little bit of a challenge finding the unit as there are 2 entrances, both gates open, so it was a little confusing even with the instructions provided. Navigation led us to the wrong gate, not realizing there was a second gate (the correct one) because it was already dark and the street lights were dim. We backtracked, found the right gate and the directions made sense afterwards. Not the fault of the owner, and the directions were spot on, it was just a matter of the navigation map not leading us correctly in combination with the fact that it was dark out when we finally arrived.

Our little family of three stayed at this apartment in Austin. The location is close to the Domain (10 min drive) but about 20-30 minutes from downtown Austin. I only mention this because it‚Äôs a bit of a drive to ‚Äúgo into town.‚Äù We enjoyed our stay. The apartment is on the 3rd floor of an apartment building and that was ok for us but if you have mobility issues, this might be a challenge. The only con about this place is that someone on the lower levels smokes and that unfortunately permeates throughout the entire unit. Abigail has installed an air purifier in the living room and it helps some, but we suffer from serious allergies and we almost considered leaving early because the smoke smell was so bad. I realize that there‚Äôs nothing the owners can do over someone else‚Äôs smoking habits, but the smell definitely lingered the entire time we were there.
I will absolutely stay here again! Gorgeous, quiet space. Has a clean but eclectic feel. Zero complaints.

This is a newly added location in northern Austin. The location was great! As for the room, it seemed newly renovated, but with a number of flaws. Our room had a weird smell along with a sort of insect problem. Overall, the stay was average after being relocated to another room.

I checked in really late on Friday evening and discovered that the only toilet in the unit did not properly flush; water was not filling up in the toilet reservoir. I messaged the host that evening and understood that it was late and getting service at that time was not possible. I figured they would send someone out the next morning to fix it.
Morning rolls around and I don't hear anything so I send a follow up message. I get a reply stating that they are waiting for an update from maintenance and they will follow up. I hear nothing from them for the entire day and being stuck with a broken toilet is no fun so I decide to fix it myself. The fill valve needed some tweaking in order to get the water going. At one point I had to fill water from the sink into a pot and pour it in manually.

The place was nice and clean with new furniture and TVs; you will hear your upstairs neighbors.
I'm just disappointed in the lack of customer service and support as they never cared to fix the issue.

The place is 10 minutes or so from everything in downtown Austin and surrounding local spots are close by. It had all the necessities for a short stay. There was a downfall that wasn‚Äôt very ideal‚Ä¶the curtains in the room were broken and so there was no privacy in the bedroom. The apartment is on the first floor and the bedroom balcony looks out into the parking lot. There was construction going on so there was constantly construction workers and anyone else in the parking lot able to look into the bed room. We had to make do with covering the open spaces with a towel and bed sheets.

Only good part about this space is the view. Construction of new buildings going up right outside balcony make enjoying the daytime a nightmare. We could hear other rooms doors slamming at all hours of the night. Guests in rooms and balconies screaming obscenities until 4am. I expected noise from traffic and nightlife becuase your downtown, but being that you have to 25 to rent here, I guess I was expecting a slightly more mature crowd. If your looking for a nice place to take the significant other, LOOK SOMEPLACE ELSE.  Oh BTW, Austin is a dirty disgusting  city with homeless camps 100 yards from building. Texan native and I was saddend to see how awful Austin has become.

The location is fantastic and the rooms are cute and stocked well.  The towels unfortunately smelled really bad I had to rewash them.  We also were informed the day after we checked in that the roof top pool would be closed for planned maintenance.  Planned to me suggests they could have informed us prior to our trip so that we could make other plans considering we chose this location in part for the pool.  I asked avant if they could refund 40$ so we could pay to use the hotel poor next to us.  They never got back to me and have not responded to additional requests.

A little disappointed because of how many good reviews there were on this place. Our flight got canceled a day before arrival. I communicated that to customer service to inform them that we wouldn‚Äôt be checking in till one day later, that was never communicated over to the person who gives you the keys. I was called and text the day of the original check in date wondering when I would be arriving. When I called customer service the first time, I asked about power outages because of the recent storm. I was told the building wasn‚Äôt effected. Our electricity turned off 4-6 times for 10-15 min each time. We even got stuck in the elevator. (Not fun). The Wi-Fi password was also incorrect and I missed my meeting due to waiting for a response with the correct PW. Probably won‚Äôt stay here again.

Landing put us through 10 weeks without air conditioning in the middle of summer in Texas! The temperature inside our unit reached 85+ degrees daily, despite running two window AC units 24/7. Landing offered no solutions whatsoever to this problem. We followed up with them frequently about the problem, and they seemed to think that if they submitted many duplicate maintenance requests to the property management, somehow the problem would solve itself. After 6 weeks, we escalated the issue with Airbnb support, who were appalled by the conditions Landing was putting us through. After we did that, Landing ghosted us for the rest of our stay.

The AC problem was never solved and Landing never stepped up to provide legitimate solutions, so we suffered for 10 weeks. The only "solution" anyone at Landing proposed was for us to request to terminate our stay through Airbnb and book a different place, which would have costed us an additional $1,300 or more! That's an insane solution to a simple air conditioning fix that Landing could have contracted themselves for probably a couple hundred bucks.

The check-in process was a disaster and we almost had to get a hotel on the first weekend of our stay because Landing didn't have working keys to the unit. We spent 1.5 hours walking back and forth from the leasing office while our Landing host tried different sets of keys.

This particular unit also has frequent water outages. In one instance, our water was turned off for a full day without notice.

If you stay here, expect that no maintenance requests will ever be filled, and expect that Landing will do nothing to help you. We had other outstanding maintenance requests that sat the full 10 weeks without being addressed.

Landing claims to provide "an easier way to live," but they actually provide an extra layer of bureaucracy between you and your property managers. Landing will not help you solve your housing problems; they'll stand in your way.

House was great and management was great.   I hated to post a negative review but feel like out of a clear conscience I have to.   I wish I had know before that the street in not safe.   It is a new house but most of the houses around are very old and not in a great neighborhood.  There was a drive by shooting and our vehicle was shot 4 times.   A child across the street was shot in his house.   I hate to post a negative review but hate to thought of someone getting hurt here.
No thanks
Terrible

Pricey for what it was. Some staff were great. You are in the middle of 6th street action, and you will hear music if you are back in your room before 2.

The shower and phone weren‚Äôt working but we‚Äôre fixed promptly. The internet is not very strong.
Won‚Äôt regret

This stay is one the worst Airbnb stays I have ever had, and I travel a lot. I am also a veteran Airbnb host with over 400 reviews myself. Landscaping, exterior and interior of the home has been neglected for years. The only thing that looked clean was my bed and 2 towels left for me. The room itself was dusty, dirt on the floor, cobwebs on windows/blinds, dirt accumulation on ceiling fan, so I did not turn it on. The main air register in the hallway ceiling of the house was caked in dirt and grime and that's the air we, guests,  breathe in, I can only imagine how the duct work looked. I did not use the shower, as the caulk around the tub was dirty and moldy black. Near the drain was a big metal chipped area. I am glad I only had to stay 1 night, as I would have called Airbnb to cancel my stay and get a refund, if my reservation was for a longer period of time . I felt bad for the other guests that stayed in the other rooms, as they were longer term stays most likely. I do not recommend this host or this house.

Robert is a very warm and hospitable person! Very prompt in his communication.

But this place needs a serious overhaul. The house was full of dust. Like it wasn‚Äôt cleaned for many months. There were cobwebs on the fan, chandeliers, windows, and nets.

The toilet was unclean. No stock of toilet papers, no toilet soap; old and worn out plumbing.

The surrounding area (garden, parking, and backyard) were not maintained. All dry leaves and stuff lying there.

Also, the place is around 11 miles from the downtown and next to the highway. Nearest deli is 15-min walk; just 1-2 restaurants nearby.

Robert mentioned that he has some project team at his house hence the room was not ready at the time of my checkin which was a surprise!

This was the worst AirBNB experience I have ever had. I have stayed in over 20 AirBNB rentals for vacation and business purposes and I have never experienced anything as unprofessional as Evonify's listing.

On the first night, we checked in around 10PM. This unit was difficult to find because unit 119 was on the opposite side of the entire building as units 101-117. This was very confusing, and the customer support did not assist us at all and just said "There's definitely unit 119 there.".

Upon checking in, we had to kill a spider, two cockroaches, and there were multiple flies flying around the unit. In addition, there was no toilet paper in the unit. After contacting the customer support about both issues, there was no resolution. They said they would bring toilet paper in the morning and try to relocate us to a new unit.

The next day, there was no toilet paper delivered. In the afternoon, they moved us to unit 122. However, unit 122 was only a one bedroom unit and we had originally booked a 2 bedroom unit. This was very unprofessional, and when I contacted the support to tell them about their mistake, there was no response. We were forced to stay in our original room with all of the mistakes and complaints unresolved.

Both units were dirty. The walls were different colors, the shower curtain was stained yellow, the shower had mold, and the cabinets were dusty. I have kept photo documentation for all of these issues.

Evonify has not resolved ANY of my complaints, and has also refused to give any type of reimbursement for both impacted nights. I HIGHLY discourage renting with Evonify.

this place was very bad for our stay, the inside was Ok after we cleaned it more right after we entered, se washed clothes and the dryer's lint filter was completely clogged, I had to clean it to dry our clothes, thats also a big fire hazard and the exhaust is directly vented out into the laundry room so it gets super hot
the beds are very ok ( cheapest mattresses ) but you will fall asleep
the backyard, good lord this is the worst backyard i have seen on an airbnb, its full of weeds, underwear and trash, Once you see the backyard you just feel uncomfortable with the whole place
the pice is high considering the condition of the apartment
I do not recommend at least not for a family
we booked this one because there was very little options left that night

We booked unit #119 and when we went in, it was occupied. The fridge was full of food, the living room was messy, a lot of trash everywhere, there were luggages in the bedrooms, the beds were not made, and the whole place smelled so bad. I called Evonfy and they said they don‚Äôt have anymore availability for a different unit. It was so scary and frightening to enter a place that is occupied specially what is going on with our world now. Evonfy did not really help, it was a ‚ÄúI will have the management look into this‚Äù back and forth. We waited for hours in the parking lot. First worst experience booking with Air B n B!
Took us an hour to get into location as the instruction on how to use the Lock were unclear. In addition the entry gate also did not work correctly.

AUSTIN(sapphire unit):
We asked if we could check in 20 minutes early&did not hear back until the time of check-in. We showed up to see the crew still cleaning&had to wait 15 minutes AFTER check-in for a total of 35 minutes. The unit was not the cleanest; the sheets definitely did not smell as if the cleaning crew just walked out,&there was hair on the bed&in the shower. The unit itself had a strange smell&the dishes were very greasy. The wall paper shown was hanging by red push pins&it was missing panels. The neon sign doesn‚Äôt light- not that I really cared, but in case you thought you had a photo opp. To top the weekend off we were awaken by trains,the freeway, & even what sounded like‚Ä¶ shattered glass! 2 cars next to us were broken into & we woke up to watch them walk over to ours. We grabbed our keys, set the alarm off, & they sped off. BUT we had to go down&check our car at 3AM, tell the unit next to us(same host) his truck was broken into,&we got ZERO sleep! Wouldn‚Äôt recommend.
Other rooms are good but Room A is not. No wardrobe and no place to hang your wet towel, that is not acceptable.

Ich bin wirklich mehr als Zufrieden mit der Unterkunft. Wirklich sauber und ruhig, alle in diesem Hostel waren sehr freundlich und auch Juanita war wirklich hilfsbereit. Ich hatte au√üerdem noch nie so ein einfaches und simples Check In und Check Out erlebt. 5 Sterne!

Flight was delayed so I had to check in at the house night. I went inside my room with the pass code. Room had someone else's things, indicating to me that my room had either been stolen from someone else or the host double booked for the same hotel. The room key was not there. The room was also dirty. I immediately called airbnb to solve this issue. 5 minutes into the phone convo, a person entered the room using the pass code to enter the room. I asked him for his reservation but he couldn't produce one to me. I demanded he leave. He started to pack his things and then he approached closer to me, threatening me, so I left immediately. Took me until 4am to find another hotel.
The host didn't provide any explanation about the issue. Host was rude, questioning how I knew the guy's name. No assurance, nor explanation, nor remediation. Host never even apologized. But the worst part of this whole ordeal was that the Host wanted to still charge me for 1 night, which was outrageous.
It was not the best stay.
This is clean apartment. Kitchen ceiling has a light fixture but no lights installed which the kitchen is kind of dark.  Kind of noise squeeze sound from Master bed room and bathroom doors.

Incredibly disappointing experience. It‚Äôs a tiny space that does look exactly like the photos, so upon arrival, when I saw hair on the floor from the previous guests and a film of dust under the bed, I was surprised at the lack of cleanliness. I swept it, sent them some photos, and informed the hosts of the condition of the space.

Jason & Meredith (the hosts) said they would send a cleaning lady the next morning. The internet was out that following morning as well so I left to go work from a cafe & when I came back the place looked the exact same, even though I was told the cleaning lady had been there. With Airbnb's exorbitant cleaning fees, I do not expect to have to sweep or dust, or have to deal with hair around me. I've been to so many Airbnbs that are spotlessly clean that this was very unwelcoming.

I reached out to the hosts again and they sent the cleaning lady again (even though they expressed that it was not necessary). Nancy, the cleaning lady angrily knocked on the door and rudely asked me ‚ÄúWhat do I need to clean up?‚Äù She then pointed at my hair & my suitcases and said I was the reason the place was dirty. At this point, she was so angry with me, didn‚Äôt let me speak, and said ‚ÄúI‚Äôm having a day!‚Äù, I had no choice but to ask her to leave. I didn‚Äôt feel safe & her behavior was shockingly unprofessional.

I packed up my belongings and left right after this encounter (within 18 hours of my 5-day planned stay). Nancy has the code to my place and I was not going to risk another volatile encounter. I expressed this concern to the hosts and they said that Nancy would never behave like this‚Ä¶that they would not refund the days as they felt that they had addressed all my needs.

It was my choice to leave, but for me, a young woman staying alone, it seemed safer to lose the money than stay in a dirty, dusty, volatile & unsafe space. I ended up staying on a friend's couch and checking into a hotel towards the end of my trip. Looks like I won‚Äôt ever get my money back and once again Airbnb & unfit hosts will get away with unprofessional behaviors. I would skip this place & book elsewhere.
Host tried blaming us for damage we did do and find us a $1200 cleaning fee gif something that wasn‚Äôt our doing.

We did not have a pleasant stay and we had to leave the place a day before (without refund). We found many things that made us leave that house and look for other accommodation. Only an hour after arriving at the house we realized that the bathroom was clogged and that there was not enough hot water for 4 people so I had to take a shower with cold water. I sent a message to the manager and she didn't answer until the evening next day plus we have to wash the dirty bedsheets and wait until middle night waiting they get dry and make beds. Ridiculous because they are charging us $170 for cleaning and we had to wash the bed sheets that were dirty

Also when we were at lunch my 18-month-old baby opens the patio door and tries to get out and when my husband tries to lock the door we realize that it cannot be locked .

!Yes we sleep in a place where we can't use the garage for our car and we also sleep with the door insecure!!!
Overall a nice stay, air mattress was missing and host replaced it right away even though it was late. Nothing fancy but great space for the price.

Only stayed one night and had to leave, shower was gross and flooded during use, shower curtain was dirty, everything was dusty, dishes were crusty, super hot at night when you‚Äôre trying to sleep (77-80+)

I‚Äôm glad we checked out Austin the liked the neighborhood but I wouldn‚Äôt stay at this unit again.

Good
* Dishwasher worked well
* AC and heat worked well
* Being near the university and park was great

Bad
* Got a scary letter from the apartment complex saying we would be evicted in 3 days for not paying rent. I found another one from months ago in the unit so not the first time. Evidently a payment glitch happened and was fixed after messaging the host but I never received proof of that being fixed besides the host claiming so.
*Upstairs neighbor had such a loud awful fight at 2am the police came. Not fun listening to a woman scream. This was the worst time but extremely loud at 2am was a very common occurrence.
*Poorly lit outside of unit, not great coming home in the dark.
The place was just as advertised and there were no surprises.  Communication went well and I had no issues checking in or out.

The stay at the home was great. Very easy check in and cleanly. After I left the home she requested for me to pay $200 for outside chairs that I apparently damaged. They were wooden lawn chairs that were only sat at one night. I was not rough with them whatsoever, but she insisted I pay for them. I thought this was very unfair.
Great location, nice unit but would not be a good fit if you have trouble with stairs (4th floor, no elevator).

Absolutely horrible maintenance. A wasp nest on the balcony took 6 weeks to remove. The noise from the air conditioning was so loud that one bedroom was essentially unusable (even walls started vibrating). Repeated phone calls did not produce any action. Do not rent from Landing! Worst stay I ever had.

Thanks for letting us stay. The property is close to restaurants and bars that you can walk to. Quick ride to major areas in Austin. There were some issues. The wifi didn‚Äôt work most of the time. We had a sink faucet that wouldn‚Äôt turn off so we had to cut the water off to the sink. The sink was clogged and barely drained. The back bedroom barely has a bed and I wouldn‚Äôt necessarily call it a bedroom. Not an ideal for couples. There are a lot of rules and mentions of other fees. I‚Äôm not sure if I‚Äôm getting charged later on for other fees?
The furniture was dirty. We did not sit on couches. There was hair in the bathroom. The bedroom door came off the hinges. The shower curtain fell down.

No le doy las 5 estrellas Porqe el hidromasaje no estaba funcionando y fue el motivo Porqe me agrado esa casa y yo pregunt√© antes de rentar la casa me minimtieron as√≠ lo tomo yo Porqe me dijeron q todo funcionaba y no Avian suficiente tuallas limpias Porqe   Las dejaron secando y la secadora no funcionaba  pero la casa esta bonita y limpia pero tienen q mejorar esos peque√±os detalles

We arrived about 7pm and noticed the temperature was in the house was 88 degrees. We thought maybe the air had just been off all day so we lowered the thermostat and waited close to two hours but the house temperature did not change. The host was unable to get someone out to fix air so we had to find a new Airbnb at 1 AM.  The WiFi did not work , the back porch light was out , and the whirlpool was dirty. The house did come with a pretty cool pool table and games. Unfortunately we were unable to enjoy them due to the AC being out. No AC in Texas is a no go .
Hut tub was not available, we weren‚Äôt provided with clean towels, and yard was dirty.
Hot tub was broken. floors weren‚Äôt vacuumed

Walked in and the place was not cleaned from the previous people. They did issue a small refund and sent a cleaner over quickly.

The hot tub didn‚Äôt heat up and was dirty inside. Front and back yard also poorly maintained (very long grass).

The inside of the house is decent but wouldn‚Äôt have rented it knowing the situation with the hot tub.

Overall, this is a cozy little hole in the wall that‚Äôs good for people looking for a place to setup camp when visiting the area. The apartment was clean and exactly as billed, with the only downside being the rundown apartment complex and not so great neighborhood.

We loved this Airbnb! The home was clean and we had everything we needed. The neighborhood was not what we expected but that is not to the fault of the host and in the end we had no issues. Great stay!
Provided feedback and no response.

First Airbnb should not have this as a listing. The place is a mess dirty with human feces on the walls trash and other things left under the beds. The refrigerator dirty with some  kind of yellow stuff at the right bottom . The place was gross. I had to clean and spray everything. Wow please don't stay there or any of there properties. The place was a wreck. And no one from Airbnb stepped in to say here is another place to stay that is clean.

Pros:
- Good internet
- Good AC/heating that got us through a freeze comfortably
- Host was responsive and quick to get broken amenities fixed
- Close to downtown
- Comfortable work space

Cons:
- The complex was unsafe. There was no gate and homeless people went in and out and dumpster dived daily. One attempted to break into our unit at 5am when it was cold. Packages were stolen often from neighbors who approached me asking if I had gotten them by mistake. The gym was ransacked and most everything was stolen out of it. The mailboxes were frequently raided, one incident we witnessed. There were four police cars in front of the unit at one point and I am still not sure why.
- The dishwasher and toilet were not functional on arrival and we found a used pregnancy test in the bathroom
- The kitchen came with the bare minimum (only a single spoon and no oven tray)

High pet fee not included in price like most stays. Take a close look at the fine print.

Wrong address been provided numerous times right before the check in. I am new to the country and the city so was disappointed.
Lots of Strangers hair in the bed and bathroom
The locker is in deplorable condition
The light in the kitchen barely works

We have said at Shirley‚Äôs other property on our previous visit to Austin and had a great experience so we booked this place without any hesitation. But the experience was not the same. The blinds in the living room were broken, the drapes in the bedroom were broken and on the floor and the blinds were not functional. The walls of the apartment were thin and we could hear the neighbors fighting and arguing. Not the experience we were looking for our relaxing weekend in Austin. The apartment was not in a condition to have been put up for rent. We ended up staying at a hotel and requested a refund from the host and our messages regarding the refund haven‚Äôt been addressed. Will not recommend this apartment.
The place itself was awesome, so many things to do around there and sitting on the balcony in the morning doing work was so nice. The pool was really dirty but that‚Äôs not the Airbnb owners fault

Great space, even better location. Check in process was frustrating due to lack of communication. Vendor not super flexible as I was yes to add a night and was told I was no allowed to add on the day of even though the unit was available. Also, I requested a 2:00 pm check in via the app and was denied and did not hear that until I reached out

The bathroom was filthy. No effort put into making it to AirBnB standards. We didn't even want to take a shower the whole trip and tried to avoid using the bathroom. There was dirty underwear left hanging on the towel rack, hairs by the soap and all around shower, the sink and toilet weren't clean, there was toothpaste or mouth was splattered on baseboards (easily cleaned with a Clorox wipe). The trashcan was already overflowing when we checked in. The WiFi didn't work. There was just a small hotel shampoo that was almost all gone anyway
Todo fue espectacular justo lo que necesitaba, sin duda me volver√≠a a hospedar aqu√≠!!! Gracias Thomas

We did not have a good experience because of how unclean the room, bathroom, and we didn't feel comfortable staying somewhere that already had several things going wrong with it. Then the host told us that it's still viable to stay in. I'm sorry but a hotel will not let it slide to rent out a room that isn't ready to be stayed in so neither should a room that a person have in their home. Stay at your own risk. We were still forced to pay because we used the restroom but were only there for 30 - 45 minutes trying to cancel the stay and find a new location. This shows me that the host only cares for money, not the customers needs. Would not recommend.

The place was fine other than it was messy when we got there, no tp (i had to get some from my car). The room alone was clean no issues with that.
The only issue was that check out time was about 10 and he never mentioned there was another booking for the next day and wanted me to be out before 8am. But this wasn‚Äôt established until about an hour after and I asked him a couple questions.
Other than that there was no issue. Affordable stay for the price it was.

This place is fine for a crash pad for anyone wanting to be spending all their time exploring Austin. If you plan on utilizing the dishes left I suggest bringing your own paper towels and a sponge as there are none. Something I wish I had been made aware of was the fire ant problem. I walked into the bathroom and it was covered in chopped up fire ants that had gotten in through the window. There were a couple roaches crawling around as well..

The air conditioning unit was fairly noisy and spit out ice on the bed and myself while I was sleep. There were black specs in the ice that I‚Äôm hoping wasn‚Äôt black mold.

We needed a place to crash on short notice since our AC broke and Kunle's house was a boon! It's a comfy apartment with a small dog park on-site and a community pool. Kunle was very responsive and the house was just what we needed to get out of the heat.

The place was not clean and yet we were charged $175. It didn‚Äôt look clean. The kitchen was unequipped for a family of 4 (2 forks or spoons)‚Ä¶one dish towel‚Ä¶light fixtures broken on the island and the outlets don‚Äôt work. The shower knob was missing/broken‚Ä¶photos on Airbnb were deceiving. You can‚Äôt use the balcony. It was Called several times to get help‚Ä¶but a guy acted nonchalant. Was not relaxing at all. Disappointed. They offered to send maintenance over on our last night. I declined. I had my children in there alone while we had to go unload our belongings in a storage unit. I am sure they must have known. I would not recommend it to a family. Single folks maybe.

My stay didn‚Äôt occur - there was a mixup with the booking and the previous guest was allowed to extend their stay.

I received 9 phone calls while I was on the plane about this, but they thought I was the previous guest that would not leave.

When I landed, I called to clear this up and I was assured I could check in but it would just be a little later. Then, not 5 mins later, someone else called and said my booking should not have happened and they wanted to place me somewhere else.

This location was not ideal, so I declined that offer and had to scramble to find a hotel that would take me during the SXSW busy season.

There was never an apology, just a go through Airbnb to get my refund canned reply. It was extremely frustrating and expensive.

Cute air bnb in a great location! Only downside is the parking is absolutely HORRIBLE YOU WILL GET TOWED they are ON IT. Also, there was an iron in the air bnb but No ironing board. Was kinda confused on that but overall good üëçüèª

Overall stay at Alex's was OK. Location was great for our trip - but check in was not easy and overall the building did not feel secured. Check in instructions didn't work when we buzzed and we were unable to get into the building. As we stood outside with our luggage wondering what to do and contacting the host, someone let us in which was nice of them - but also a bit unsafe. We noticed other people coming into the building without access as well (a man who was previously napping on the sidewalk outside was seen walking in our hallway later that day). There were also limited check out instructions. Overall communication was poor from the host. He also contacted us at one point to let him get into the building during our stay as he only had one key (which we had) and needed to get something. We did not respond and overall just thought he was a bit unprofessional compared to other hosts we've had.

Following our trip Alex accused us of damage to the bedroom door which we did not do. After going through the claims process - Airbnb agreed that we did not cause the damage and closed his case. I would encourage anyone staying here to do a thorough check of any damage to the unit and document upon arrival so he does not try to accuse you of it and try to get $$.

Austin as city was great! After getting access we had a great time but unfortunately the false claims of damage felt fraudulent and overall safety was a concern while we stayed there.

Very limited on essential supplies (shockingly limited) No garbage bags anywhere, not even the kitchen trash. No hand soap in the bathrooms. The house was dirty (we had to throw out our socks after walking in the house. The walls all over the home were gross dirty (like afraid to make contact with a few spots). Multiple Spider webs around the home. We stayed at all kinds of homes threw out the years, this one was 2/10 clean. The host was a good experience  and very helpful always. I just think the cleaning crew is slacking hard. Also we had 4 towels for a three bedroom Airbnb.

The home itself was a good, clean space. But we had to buy everything down to paper towels there were no basic necessities in the house. The twin bed in the second bedroom broke when my friend put her suitcase on it. we had to put the bed back together for her to sleep in it. No dish rags. No Pool towels as listed. Be prepared to spend extra money on household items and groceries the house is empty. The living room tv was broken and no one came to fix it.
The place was exactly as described. Very comfy and the host had plenty of accommodations! Had no issues with checking in/out or really any issues with our entire stay.

Not at all what we expected. This is less an ‚Äúentire place‚Äù and more a converted garage with plywood walls and ceilings. The walls were warped, the ceiling bowing in, the place was dirty. There is not privacy from the home owner, there is not a backyard for our dogs just a patio that they used the whole time.  The pictures are trying to make you think it has multiple rooms and it is not. There was pubic hair in the bed and the blankets and covers were covered in stains. I‚Äôve never left a bad review but this is a misleading post and was not a comfortable place to be.

This host went above and beyond to accommodate us through some really trying times-a rapid freeze and downed power lines leaving half the city without power. They scrambled to find us an alternate place to stay, which they didn't have to do. They could've simply canceled the stay. It did not go unnoticed or unappreciated. It was consistent with the phenomenal service I had been receiving from them prior to the storm.

I don't recommend this property.
Only one good thing is location.

You hardly contact with the host when need help or ask something.
There were no number you can call the host directly. You have to send a massage via airbnb or call through the agent.

My family stayed 2 nights 3days and had a problem with toilet. It had a cracked and leaked so the floor wet.
I sent a massage promptly to the host but they didn't answer over 7 hours. Finally i reached out the host and they said just sorry and tried to reach out handyman. That's all nobody came there checked it out or fixed it.
We were very uncomfortable when we use the toilet. And we have to use our towels for wiping up the wet floors.

Second day, we had the craziest happening.
Around 11pm we got to airbnb and tried to open the door but didn't work.
We tried several times followed direction but we couldn't open it. I called the host but I only got the automatic massage. So i sent a massage through airbnb and finally i got new code for opening the door. They said that something must have gotten disrupted in the computer system. We had to be outside hot summer night with mosquitos with two kids over 30 minutes.
It was the horrible experience.

And there were only salt and papper little bit.
If you need other things.
There were no extra towels. We were 5 of us and got 6 bath towels and 6 hand towels for 2 nights.
My son and I stayed in Marks place for a week, and we had a wonderfull time. Mark answered any questioned we had in minutes!
Reported our concern that the windows locks were broken and posed a safety risk and was disregarded. The place was very clean but host was rude when issue was brought up.

Tried to resolve with First Stay but instead Airbnb saw the conditions and gave me a refund.

1.) There's a homeless guy sleeping on the couch outside the apartment for 6+ hours during the day with a red backpack. Had my package stolen within an hour of delivery by neighbor (homeless guy was still sleeping there so I doubt it was him). 2.) The "pool," "firepit," "lounge area" are all a facade. Either does not exist or gated and pool water was puke green and filled with trash. Unusable and misleading. 3.) AC/dishwasher did not work (I have footage). 4.) Cigarette smell. Refer to 2022 June user Uriel's review and First Stay response. Uriel shared cigarette smell. First Stay shared it's the upstairs neighbor and they've since fumigated the apartment. This doesn't appear to be true as both the Boathouse and Wild Flower still smelled like cigarettes in August 2022. Also gaslights Uriel. Accuses customer to have left marijuana behind. Should have cancelled this booking when I saw that response to a customer review.

This place is the cleanest airbnb I've stayed at. Everything appears new.

Host responded within seconds via the airbnb app. I accidently locked myself out, and once I notified Dylan I was back inside in a minute.

Austin is not as walkable as my hometown, but this place is very close and walkable to Zilker Park trails and Barton Springs. No coffee shops within walking distance, and restaurant row on Barton Springs is walkable although a lengthy walk.

Group of 3 in Austin for ACL Festival. Excellent communication with the host. We didn't have any issues with our stay but I did notice that there are a few things that should be updated in this unit. The front door is in very poor condition. Toilet seat was almost falling off. Both the stove and refrigerator are very unlevel. And unrelated to the actual unit, one of the steps on the stairs leading up to the unit is very loose and dangerous.

I think it‚Äôs over priced for what it is. Killed bugs all weekend, paints chipping in the bathroom, mold/mildew in the bathroom. Pictures make it look a lot nicer than it is. Bathroom isn‚Äôt the cleanest.
Unsafe and disgusting. DO NOT STAY HERE.

There were roaches in the place. The place was smelling like cigarettes and the bathroom was not clean properly. They charged a cleaning fee but they expect to leave the place w no trash, dirty dishes etc.
No need to look anywhere else
Not very clean.
So cute - I was a bit scared of the loft but I sucked it up!  Place is small but it has everything you need.  I‚Äôd stay again
Exactly as pictured, had no issues
Would recommend! Didn‚Äôt have a single problem at all!
Rent this place. You won‚Äôt regret it!

It was obvious that they didn‚Äôt clean the space very well. The floors were filthy with hair and food from previous guests. There were wet towels left in the dryer. They advertise a ‚Äúcoffee bar‚Äù in the amenities- there was a Keurig, but no pods to actually be able to use it. I messaged the host and politely told her about the issues and sent
pictures. She dismissed all of this as ‚Äúminor mishaps‚Äù. Not very hospitable at all, especially for the price charged.

I stayed at this Airbnb for my 21st, and it can not have gone any worse. When we first arrived, it was a sauna inside. The thermostat was set to 84¬∞F. We immediately changed it to 70¬∞. We left the Airbnb thinking it would cool down by the time we came back at night. As we arrived at the Airbnb, the thermostat had turned off and wouldn‚Äôt turn on. The Airbnb was still a sauna at night. All our guests were sweating, and some rooms didn‚Äôt even have a fan. The living room fan wasn‚Äôt working... At one point, being outside was more cooler than inside the sauna. I mean the Airbnb. Some of our guests had to resort to hotel rooms because of the excruciating heat, and those who stayed didn‚Äôt get much sleep.
We tried to contact the host, but it was late at night, so he didn‚Äôt reply until the following day. When it was fixed the next morning, it took over 10 hours to get it to 70¬∞. We also noticed ants in the bathrooms and our rooms. We had ants in our suitcases. Most of our clothes, including my 21st bday dresses/ designer clothes, were ruined. I got bit by ants all over my body and they all got infected and left a nasty scar, which is not what I want during my bday. We kindly asked for a 25% refund or something to compensate for our first nights stay or the hotel rooms we bought, and they only offered 10% discount (which barely covers one person).
Overall, I believe some action needs to be taken because offering 10% refund doesn‚Äôt even begin to compensate for ruining the stay of my 21st bday. This was not relaxing or a fun weekend at the Airbnb.

We got in around 3:35 from a long day of travel, I txt the owner to see if we could  check in 20 minutes early.  The only response I received was:  ‚ÄúCheck in is 4pm.‚Äù  I didn‚Äôt feel heard or acknowledged so we literally sat in the car waiting 20 minutes until the clock struck 4pm.   Started the trip off on a bad note.  There are maintenance opportunities in the apartment.  There is a view from the small deck out onto the street, but it did not inspire us to hang out there.  The house was mostly clean but we found a few areas that were overlooked.  Photo's sent directly to owner.  The beds were comfy but small.  We didn't feel safe in that area.  There is a homeless encampment literally .2 miles away; if you're on the balcony, you can see it!  That alone for me, was the main reason for the 3 star rating.   If you need to be up in that area and you're cool with the homeless meandering around, you might like this place.   We did not; we left 1 day early & went to a Hotel our last night.

We had the same problems as Areell (see review October 2022!!!)
Broken coffee table, leaking fridge (host acted surprised), drawers falling apart‚Ä¶
Help was only promised, we never received it! I even waited in the apartment for an hour and nobody showed up!
The location is not bad, but if you need a good night's sleep, this is impossible due to the busy street near the apartment.
Definitely a bad experience and I would not recommend staying here or any of their other apartments

I've never had a bad stay or interaction with an Airbnb host until this experience. I received a phone call as I was leaving for the airport informing me that the unit we rented was no longer available. They moved us to a worse, un-walkable location, even though we paid for a downtown location. When we arrived, we discovered there was no hot water, outlets that didn't work, the coils only partially worked on the stove, and the amenities did not match the listing. When I tried to work through the problems with the host, they were unresponsive. When I asked to be moved back to the location we originally booked, they told me they rented it out to someone else. So, they double-booked the unit, collected a higher payment for the condo we paid for, put us in a subpar location even though we paid for a downtown place, and then ignored our requests for basic needs like hot water. I'd say be careful dealing with this host.

Wayyyyy too many restrictions and clean up rules, Not enough towels, Pool is dirty, Putt putt course is not mentioned and wasn‚Äôt clean,  dirty hot dog buns left on the cabinet, Wi-Fi didn‚Äôt work, tv didn‚Äôt work. Cost not worth value here.

I booked the Airbnb and paid almost $1700 and couldn‚Äôt stay for even one night. The first night I checked in, there was a weird sound coming from the stove/kitchen area. At first it was a very soft sound I could barely hear, We tried to stay quiet to listen to it. It took awhile. Then it got a little bit more frequently, and then it got louder and louder non-stop. It sounded like someone knocking on the wall. We checked but didn‚Äôt know where it came from. Too terrified, my sister and I (2 women) decided to leave the house right away and booked a hotel after 30 minutes staying in the house. When we decided to leave, the sound stopped. It was very weird for me. I have anxiety/panic disorder and it almost gave me a panic attack. I was there for work and didn‚Äôt want any stress. The experience stressed me out. I contacted the host for a refund ($1700 is a lot), but they haven‚Äôt. I had to pay extra for my hotel stay for the rest of my trip. I will never book for another Airbnb again. I‚Äôll only stay at hotels from now on after this experience.
The roof is very annoying and low. There‚Äôs also no TV and I thought there would be. I also thought it would be more quiet, but there was a lot of noise

Clean and centrally located in the city, but I was disappointed. Sevin was immediately responsive when I informed him that the wifi failed to work, and the fix was quick. However, contrary to what is stated in the list of amenities, there is no indoor fireplace, no private patio or balcony, no fire pit, and no BBQ grill. There is a washer - actually 3, but note that they are shared by residents in the complex and appear to require a credit card (Sevin informed me they required a code, but I could find no way to type the code in). Also note that trash is collected outdoors in a large trash bin that was greatly overflowing during my stay, and the thin-walled complex is on a corner next to a heavily traveled (and, hence, often noisy) street.

I was also abit troubled that at the end of my stay, Sevin instructed, ‚ÄúIf your stay was unpleasent and things were out of the normal in ANY kind of way. Please kindly send us a private message, instead of leaving it on the public review.‚Äù Hmm...

Sevin was responsive and offered a full refund when the apartment flooded but afterward rushed me out of the place onto the street with my cat. I told him I was getting out as quickly as I could given the scenario, (being this put out due to lack of maintenance,) and he became very aggressive to the point where he began shouting that I shouldn't say that.

No matter how cute you decorate a place or how responsive you are, not caring about how a malfunction in the hardware of the apartment put a client out onto the street with all their luggage, a cat and no car is cold... and shouting at a woman, (who just cleaned up your place from being flooded,) that you're sending people to come kick her out while she's still undressed from trying to use the bathtub in the first place and trying to find a new place to go and get together the money to afford that new place since most of her money is still in escrow with airbnb for the next 3-5 business days from the whole mess... isn't a great look.

The place was a nice stay once we finally got in. We had a 3 hour delayed check in because the place was still being cleaned. Only one toilet was working. Difficult getting ahold of the host and they were not very understanding about our concerns or issues.

The unit was not completely cleaned when we checked in and one of the doors was open! I brought this to the attention of the host, then left to pick up dinner. When we returned, there was a stranger in the unti! They startled my daughter. It turns out it was housekeeping, returning AFTER our check-in without permission, so I asked them to leave (cleaning still unfinished). After our stay, I asked the host for a refund of the cleaning fee as I had to perform some of the cleaning and I adhered to all check-out procedures. The host ignored my request for cleaning fee refund.

The place was very accommodating, aside from some issues regarding cleanliness. We found hair in the bathroom, dirt on the floor, wrappers/trash scattered and dirt outside of the front door. Plenty of space, accommodated our entire group, and nice kitchen.
Internet was not working. Attempts to reach host unsuccessful

If everything goes to plan, Blueground is pretty smooth.

However if there are any problems, don‚Äôt expect to be supported.

My apartment had a flood in the night, so I needed to pack up and evacuate. In the moment, Blueground guest support was kind on the phone and offered me compensation (in writing) for my damaged items. However, when it came time to issue refunds, the support vanished. Upon providing thorough documentation of our agreements, I‚Äôve been ignored via email, phone and app. Blueground issued a refund they felt was fair despite promising a different amount and without prior explanation.

Overall, the ceiling leak wasn‚Äôt even the worst part of this experience. The aftermath has been exhausting, expensive and extremely frustrating.

Sadly, this property is not as advertised and the shortcomings are problematic. We expected two working showers and only one was working, prior reviews state that the shower was not working which means that the Barcle Group was aware of the problem prior to us renting the unit. The Unit was clearly not cared for, no dish towels, no iron, no hangers and terrible communication. We would not stay here again.
First of all, place is very dirty and dusty. Washroom showers doesn‚Äôt work. Host is not at all flexible.

Overall, stay was ok. The first floor and rooftop lounge and fitness center definitely helped make the cost worth it!! However, the area rugs were dingy and dirty, one of the window shades was broken, we had the hardest time locking the exterior balcony doors, the lighting in the condo is pretty bad, and the fire pit on the roof didn‚Äôt work. One of the bedrooms is right next to a public dog park when you step out of your balcony, as well. Let‚Äôs just say, you don‚Äôt want to spend a lot of time in the actual condo‚Ä¶

This Airbnb was in questionable part of town. When we arrived, had some difficulties getting in with the keypad as the code we were originally given didn‚Äôt work. Simone responded quickly and was able to get us in after a short wait. Walking in, the home has a stale smell, similar to something stinky that has been covered up with spray. Home matches pictures, but note that photos have been taken strategically to make it appear bigger.  Both rooms and full bath are upstairs. A problem encountered was NO outlets in either bathroom- making getting ready with beauty tools that need to be plugged in by a mirror impossible. Shower would produce only lukewarm water. Beds ok, sheets had knits and were mismatching. Had booked for two nights, left after the first. Neighbors were playing loud music around 9:30pm the first night, but it was silent when we returned at midnight.  Overall, an okay place, but not very clean/updated. Small and confined space, would not recommend for extended stay.
Well I was not able to leave a no star review or I would. This is a scam. The number was disconnected and check in instructions were useless. Arrived in Austin without a place to stay.

Adequate Airbnb but poorly managed.

The Good: The bed was comfy, TV and washer/dryer worked well, and the space was quiet at night

The Bad: The floors were dirty, bathtub didnt drain, wifi was slow, and location was on frat row.

The Ugly: I saw a cockroach in the bathroom and the apartment hallway was pitch black with no functional lights

The stay and apartment were as expected for the price, although the quality was more lived in then the photos show. For our first two nights there were no hallway or parking garage/stairway lights which made getting into our place the first time very difficult.

The place is updated and looks very nice! The parking can be rough. If you can't get a 25$ per night spot in the garage, expect to walk a couple blocks
through frat-central and parallel park using an app to pay. Plumbing backs up and we had gnats all over the place coming from drains. Major bummer!

The place wasn‚Äôt bad at all and susana did a wonderful job at responding very quickly when I had questions. The main thing that was a bother was the elevator bc it made very loud noises when anyone would go up on in elevator and we could hear in our room.

The worst part about this air bnb was the sleeping experience. The bedroom sits facing the parking garage so fluorescent lights shine through the cheap blinds 24/7. It is the MOST uncomfortable bed I‚Äôve ever experienced and I travel often. The pillows are old, lumpy, and gross with no pillow protectors between the crappy sheets. The AC is programmed to turn back up to 75 degrees at midnight and 4 am every night so even if you turn the temp down, you‚Äôll wake up sweating. The check out instructions require we fully clean (vacuum, remove every fiber of dog fur, start linens, etc.) and yet we are still charged a deep cleaning fee? The floors had dust bunnies and turned my feet black upon arrival so clearly not cleaned / mopped besides whatever guests do before they leave. Not sure what I am paying a deep cleaning fee for then? Also don‚Äôt make your place pet friendly if you then tell me I‚Äôll be charged $100 if you find any pet fur at all when we leave. Again WHAT is the deep cleaning fee for then? Bathtub is stained and there‚Äôs rust drippings behind the toilet, some of the blinds were broken so couldn‚Äôt pull up, the living room tv was broken, I could go on. Overall the location was the only good thing about this place. I am genuinely confused about the other reviews already written unless they are friends/family. This is the first bad review I‚Äôve ever left for anywhere on air bnb. The bed was SO painful we left a night early. I contacted air bnb support about this stuff during our stay as well and they could never get in touch with the host which is also sketchy.

The place was dirty, bathroom, kitchen, refrigerator, animal hair on the sofa, bathroom in poor condition ... I do not recommend it.
The only positive thing is the location
Todo muy limpio y no tuve problemas en nada !!

This host accused me of taking his hair dryer, when I didn‚Äôt see a hair dryer at the house, and I don‚Äôt even use hair dryers. He also accused me of having more than the specified number of people at the house, when we didn‚Äôt. I‚Äôm not sure why he chose to go that route, since I was a tidy tenant and did not cause any problems for him.

First, I want to thank Hunter and Shawn for their responsiveness and professionalism.
The fire alarm/carbon monoxide alarm went off around 12:30 AM due to low battery, and they responded to my messages with promptness. Unfortunately, they mentioned that it would be fixed the next day, but it was never fixed. We were forced to unplug the fire alarm and cover the carbon monoxide alarm with pillows and blankets to mute the beeping for 3 nights.
Second, when we arrived, there were no towels or toilet paper. Towels were delivered to us in a trash bag promptly, so we were appreciative of that. However, we had to go to the back shed in the middle of the night to retrieve their extra stash of toilet paper.
Some of the shelves in the closet were
broken and unstable, making them nearly useless. The front door kind of sticks, so you need to give it some force to open it. Finally, there are no mirrors other than the bathrooms, so if there are multiple people in your party, you need to plan it out and/or bring your own mirrors.

WiFi was consistent and strong, and we were able to login to our streaming accounts using their Roku. The house was cozy and clean, and the couch was very comfortable to play board games, watch TV, and hang out. Although we were warned by 5-6 Uber/Lyft drivers of the neighborhood, we never personally felt in any danger or seen anything that caused concern. The house was close to downtown making it easy for us to find Ride Shares to drive in and out the city.

The host cancelled my reservation within seconds of the booking. He asked me to request a cancellation so I did. He said I would be refunded fully. No refund. I messaged him twice more with no response. I reached out to Airbnb Support, they advised that I was not eligible for a refund because I requested the cancellation. I requested only because Alexander told me to. Airbnb said they will contact the host. I am due a full refund. I will get a full refund because I will stay on this until the refund is processed.

This place was so disappointing to stay in. We were told that the place was ready for us to check in early but when we arrived the cleaner was still there and the entire place smelled so bad and dirty. The location was not bad as long as you want to be near the University and across from frat houses. As we continued our stay we experienced more and more issues which the host did not even acknowledge,  apologize for or try to fix. We found gum stuck to a bedsheet, all the towels were dirty and stank. The place still smelled bad throughout our entire stay. The lightbulbs went out in one of the bathrooms. There were minimal essentials provided and we found ants crawling around in the kitchen. One of the grossest things was that we saw gooey, dirty stuff sliming out of the refrigerator water dispenser! Clearly this place is not well taken care of and I realized that the pictures on the listing look different than reality. Don‚Äôt let the pictures fool you- they are staged or another unit! The host did not accommodate to our needs or complaints. It‚Äôs too bad we had such a horrible experience staying here. It was unsanitary and we felt gross staying there.

We were in town for a sports function with our HS kids. At first it seemed ok, no hand towels in the bathrooms, fridge was leaking, toilet was running. Paul was responsive and sent someone to fix. Well the fridge kept leaking. Day 2 we realized the kitchen had tons of ants. Much of our food we had brought in had to be thrown. We moved ALL food to the fridge. Then we discovered the garbage disposal was didn‚Äôt work. Paul did come out and spray for the ants and did replace the disposal but he accused us of breaking it, which we DID NOT. The ants never went away. The bath towels are more like car washing towels. We had to use our own. We were disappointed in the stay. He did give us a small credit but I cannot recommend this place as it was.

The place was messing some needed amenities, so basically bring everything you need (even the towels were stained like the couch, the body wash soap cap was broken, shower head power wasn‚Äôt strong). Very noisy building, could hear neighbors all around morning and night. If you‚Äôre looking for a last minute one-night stay, maybe this would be worth the deal, but wouldn‚Äôt recommend for a weekend or longer. No natural lighting/windows, wifi was spotty, toilet seat was loose, toilet paper wouldn‚Äôt even sit in the roller, no hand towels. When asked for more amenities, it was just tossed on the couch and not much clear communication of when/what will arrive. Response time was slow. We arrived and the door/lock was open - which made me a bit scared to enter a new place - and there wasn‚Äôt any response regarding that concern. I‚Äôm not one to write negative reviews, just want to manage expectations. It was fairly clean and in a safe location in west campus.

Overall good price for a one bedroom but you get what you pay for. This apartment complex caters to college students so it can get pretty noisy. I even had to step over broken glass in the stairway from kids drinking late at night. Otherwise it has everything you need from a decent kitchen, washer &dryer and working AC.
Only thing was the parking, and a car mostly blocking our path to our car.

The location was great! Easy Uber ride to downtown!

However, when we arrived we found the airbnb filthy (dirty floors, toothpaste on the sinks and mirrors). The pictures of the furniture did not match what was actually there. One of the shower heads was broken (leaving one shower to 10 girls).
And there were not enough towels/toilet paper/ paper towels provided for the amount of guest it sleeps. And we were not asked to bring our own.

We were happy with the location, but disappointed with the overall experience.

roaches , termites, ants and broken AC this place was an absolute disgusting disaster of a disappointment. i can‚Äôt even explain how pathetic this stay was . please don‚Äôt book with this lady and or house .
This is a fake posting. Please be aware that the host doesn't respond to your messages and will leave you stranded without a place to stay

The structure and location were great--four levels built for a family to have fun. But it's really hard to get beyond what looked to be vomit in the drawer of the bedside table at check-in. If you plan to sleep beyond sunrise, make sure you bring eyemasks--rooms had some windows that don't have coverings. The place also lacked reliable hot water--some of us got about 2 minutes of hot water; others didn't even get that. Little touches showed a lack of maintenance--smoke detectors chirping at check-in; a floating shelf in the living room leaning downward with a candle about to fall; a missing doorknob on the laundry room door. The host was responsive--smoke detector batteries delivered, cleaning crew dispatched, etc. But I cannot recommend this place, at least not in the condition we got it.

For a $100 cleaning fee, this place sure needed some TLC when we got there. there were some unclean things and the apartment seems "rushed". Unsafe check in procedure (door unlocked, key in the bedroom) I just get a very "lazy" vibe from the host on the place, I do not recommend.

Very disappointed by this property. Do not recommend staying at this location.
The location of the house is out of the way.
Smell - HVAC system is old unit. The smell of the house from the HVAC unit is musty, old, mothball
Dark - lighting is poor feels like a cave
Cleaning - inadequate - not properly cleaned stains in the house from the previous quest.
Roaches - there were roaches in the bedroom and kitchen
Outside home - not maintained - upkeep is needed.
Air BB - client services - Air Cover tried to contact the property owner on my behalf and no response or support from the property owner. Very poor service.

My team and I were in town for work and decided to stay in an Airbnb since it was very close to where we needed to be and would allow for everyone to have their own space but be in the same location. That being said, we were disappointed by the lack of cleanliness of the two units we rented and a few maintenance issues that happened during our stay.
Said bathroom and kitchen supplies were given but there was a lack luster amount

The building was not clean at all. The hallways were dirty, the elevator was dirty. Inside the apartment, floors were also not very clean. Bathroom floors did not feel clean. The sheets had a somewhat unclean smell. Could not point out what the smell was, just not clean or fresh. The towels were very generic and commercial. I think spending a bit more on towels would make a difference. The showerhead was also very small for the large shower. These are just small issues. Overall, apartment was very centrally located. The price was good for the area. A small studio apartment. Susana was very helpful and attentive. Anything I emailed her about received an almost an instant response. The noise level from the upstairs unit was pretty bad. A lot of banging around during the night hours. But I don't feel that is something that can be controlled by the owner. Overall good experience.

Susana‚Äôs place was good for the money. It is right that in the middle of frat row (it‚Äôs up to you if that‚Äôs a good or bad thing). There‚Äôs a decent amount of restaurants and bars nearby, but it is at least a bus ride away to downtown. The apartment is small but we‚Äôll laid out, however the walls are very thin and the building itself is a bit rundown (broken outdoor lock allowing anyone to access the building, missing floor boards and trash bags in the hallway, etc)

The place wasnt at all clean from the previous guests, i had to contact Susana and she sent the cleaners to the place but i had to leave while it was being cleaned for over an hour and a half after having roadtripped all day. I didnt expect to have to leave when i just arrived. It was resolved and the place was cleaned, we moved my check out time as well as receiving a reund for the cleaning fee. But it was not communicated to the cleaning people on check out day and we had to send them away. It was all handled but all could have easily been avoided with some communication before our arrival, it was just very frustrating.

La recamara es bastante amplia, muy bien iluminada y con mucha privacidad. El ba√±o esta dentro de la casa principal. El area es segura, dejamos el coche en la calle y no hubo ningun inconveniente. Muy cerca del area de South Congress.
Bad communication and problems ahead

No coffee pods for the machine!!   No hot water in master bathroom and the tub literally may not even be connected to the water?   It was moved out of place and weighs about 10 lbs?   Weird.   Simple effort for coffee would be good.   I asked for the ability to drop bags off before our work conference and was directed to a link to pay more money    However they sent a link multiple times to ‚Äúhelp with cleaning‚Äù by letting them know if I was leaving early.    How about I send a link for you to pay me $25 to let you know if I‚Äôm leaving early ?     No hot water was most annoying , no lock code in the app or any email was also annoying.
Beautiful place and great location. But wasn't clean when we checked in. Dangerous wasp nest at entry and patio! Nervous thru out our stay.
Excellente emplacement pr√®s de tout! A recommander!
Had a good experience overall, the only bad thing was the check in process as I had to pick up the key in a placer further away and I was not given the correct key to the condo.
No major issues but this place only had the bare minimum at our stay e.g. only 1 garbage bag (already in use), no kettle etc. Fridge was not clean.
An experience! There are no other words for our stay. Perhaps ‚Äúvibes‚Äù would suffice. If you‚Äôre thinking about it. Just go for it!

The place was beautiful and very well located.
appliances were new, but the dishwasher was not working even before we arrived, which was not communicated to us,
the Leg of the sofa just broke, - I am only 100 pounds, and that‚Äôs potentially dangerous - leaving me in on the floor
we were told they were going to replace the dishwasher and the sofa, but that did not happen

The apartment is accurate to the photos and we were able to stay last minute with little notice which was greatly appreciated. The area is a bit worrisome and the parking lot is not well lit but we had no actual issues.

The little apartment
is close to downtown.

we were celebrating my friend's birthday.

We did a mini trip for 2 days and we like it.üëçüèΩüëçüèΩüëçüèΩüî•üî•üî•üî•
