Unfortunately this small flat was very dirty (kitchen very dirty with old food burnt into the hot plates and dead bugs under the sofa). Additionally the place is extremely noisy. The walls and ceiling are made of card board so literally every step of the neighbors echoe through the flat. Therefore we decided to cancel our stay after the first night. Unfortunately the cancellation policy in place did not allow for a refund of the other nights we had booked.
When we left one of us forgot a phone in the flat‚Ä¶again no help here to get the phone back.
So this has been our first very bad experience on AirBnB.
was informed two days before our trip that AC was bot working which was very unfortunate but the host was able to accommodate us at a different location for the same price and worked with us.

Unit was a disaster. Cancelled my reservation once arrived. It was a mess and did not feel comfortable staying. The listing isn‚Äôt advertised as what the place actually looks like. 3 different shades of paint on walls and stains on furniture and flooring.

The place is cheap and you get what you pay for,  great location easy check in, but past that its downhill, broken doors, wires out of the socket on roof in one of the bedrooms, a couple of cockroaches, broken couch arm, may be a little to many things to deal with for the price.
Bungalow just off the beaten path. Very chic and stylish.

Im not really sure where to start. First thing is, the AC was pre set to 78 or 79 almost our whole stay. We would wake up sweating in the morning to 79¬∞ on the thermostat. It was 104¬∞ outside and we were sweating while sitting in the living room. The carpet was filthy, there were stains and clumps of hair all over it. It looked like it had never been cleaned or vacuumed before.

The toilet seat was hanging on by one hinge, we had to hold it down in order to sit on it. There was only 1.5 rolls of toilet paper, for a 3 night stay with 4 women staying there. There was also only 2 towels set out for us‚Ä¶.. again, there was 4 of us so we had to go buy toilet paper and towels just so we could shower. The handle was broken on the fridge and there was still groceries in it when we got there.

We couldn‚Äôt sit on the floor to watch tv cause there were ants all over the place and the internet didn‚Äôt work so we couldn‚Äôt even use the roku. The other thing that was terrible was the air vent to the AC in the kitchen, FULL of dust and debris like it had never been wiped down. I took plenty of pictures to document how bad our stay was. It‚Äôs just not worth the money you think you‚Äôre saving by staying here.
Practical and what I needed to crash a night in Austin!
Great place. Only downside was that the bedroom light did not work properly but it didn‚Äôt bother us much.
Fue muy agradable el lugar, una zona muy tranquila, y el sitio s√∫per aseado! Sin duda me volver√≠a a quedar aqu√≠! Y la atenci√≥n es buenisima al llegar!
The cups are not clean and no dishwasher is provided for us to get them cleaned... Also, the light in one of the bedrooms is broken. Though I understand these might just be a very unlucky case.

This place was very well-priced compared to other options in Austin at the time of my booking.  It looks just like it does in the pictures and it is close enough (via Uber) to the main spots in the city.  Its a good spot to stay if you're in town to explore the city and just need a place to crash that has all the necessities.  The beds were firm and comfortable.  The neighborhood was quiet and there is a shared backyard area, though we didn't use it.  The living/kitchen area was small and the walls/doors are quite thin, but that didn't really surprise us given the price.  Checking in was easy and we didn't have any major issues throughout our stay.  The only minor issues are there are various forms to fill out throughout your stay in case you are going to arrive late or check out early, which was a minor annoyance.  And if you indicate during your booking that you are bringing a pet, they don't include the pet cleaning fee in the booking price, which seems misleading to me.  It is fine to charge an extra fee for pets, but it seems misleading to me to not see the entire price of the stay at the time of booking, especially if your booking information shows that you are bringing a pet.  I don't know if that is an AirBNB issue, though.  I'd probably stay here again assuming the price were in the same range.
Loved the space. Ames was very communicative. But the neighborhood was not ideal for us.

The home was lovely, well-equipped, adorable, very peaceful, comfortable and spacious.  My stay was great, but check in could have been smoother.  I paid $20 to check in early but the code that was given to me in automatically generated messages was incorrect - the ‚Äò0‚Äô at the beginning had been dropped and left me stuck on the porch on a warm afternoon with my toddler feeling highly frustrated.  I have communicated this to the property managers so that they can correct the problem, but want to give others a heads up in case this knowledge saves future frustration.

The good:
-location
-building is new but very busy with a lot of other guests
-fitness room was well equipped
-pool is nice but small, limited chairs, lots of other guests in and around the pool
-apartment was spacious
-balcony was nice

The bad:
-very dusty on and around furniture
-bedroom closet smelled terrible (I think from a very full and dirty vacuum stored in there)
-bedroom shades have large gaps that let in a ton of light from traffic at night (beautiful views during the day)
-stayed for 10 days and it was not well stocked.
-2 Nespresso pods (no actual coffee available)
-no kitchen garbage bags
-no kitchen dish soap
-only 3 rolls of toilet paper
-only a couple laundry detergent pods
-not enough bathroom towels, no kitchen dish cloths/towels
-Sonos sound system would turn on and off randomly. I‚Äôm guessing someone else had control of it, but was still quite unnerving. I eventually found where it was coming from and was able to unplug it.

-Billed $300 for a broken towel holder in the bathroom. I hung a small toiletry bag from it and it fell down in the middle of the night. However, the towel holder was mounted with a STICKER adhesive and not a screw. I notified the host right away and there was no mention that I may be charged for it, certainly not $300. I did have to pay but it ended up being less.

-AC didn‚Äôt work properly for 5 days which made it difficult to sleep, as it was 90+ degrees everyday. The problem ended up being a dirty air filter full of dust and pollen. This caused me to wake up with a stuffy nose and sore throat each morning. Host did drop off a fan eventually but then insisted on coming in the apartment to check the thermostat and another item in the bathroom. Although they were friendly, I felt very uncomfortable having them in the apartment multiple times. Did not get notified that maintenance was coming to check the AC. Just a knock on the door which interrupted a work meeting. I could have planned differently had I been given a time frame.

Overall:
Not bad but not the best. I would stay in the Natiivo building again, but not if Refresh Spaces is the co-host and onsite contact (new local business owner who helps since apartment owners are not local). With the vague house rules they can catch and charge an exorbitant amount of money ($300 to replace a sticker hook) for literally anything. You‚Äôll also have to be prepared to bring or buy some of your own supplies. I‚Äôm sure you could request more, but with a ten-day stay, it would have been nice not to have to worry about it. I‚Äôve never left a bad review, but I feel others should have transparency so they can make an informed decision on their own.
Do not recommend staying here. Place was not as advertised and when you try to get a refund due to false advertising the host will ignore your messages and ignore refund requests.

The place was as described. Everything was clean. Moya was always quick to respond. I had two major complaints. The first bring that all of the windows in the house are screwed shut so the only way to get fresh air in the house is through opening the doors at either end of the house. The second is the window shades can be seen through and the house is across the street from some very bright lights that shine right into the house all night making it difficult to sleep if you are used to sleeping in the dark. If these two things were fixed I would give 5 stars for everything.

Mi estancia fue muy agradable, los anfitrones fueron muy amables. Jing siempre estuvo atenta para cualquier duda y fue muy flexible en cuanto a mi horario de llegada. El lugar est√° muy bien cuidado, con un dise√±o excelente y ubicado cerca del transporte p√∫blico si no traes coche.

A cozy studio in Clarksville. Has what you need for a stay for 1 or 2 people. Washer/dryer, gas stove, dishwasher, fast internet and more. It is a classic Austin 60s style apartment complex that appears to have had a very recent renovation as of 7/22 (so thankfully not the west campus musk).

Wasn‚Äôt bad for me, but if you like being cold, the A/C is gonna struggle to get it lower than mid 70s even at night when the highs are over 100 outside.
Attractive and mostly well-equipped, except for dangerous bathmats that slide away as you step out of the shower

Place is what you pay for.
Very few amenities.
The smell of old smoke was horrible.

Very poor communication and response from first,  the place was clean but I noticed in kitchen drywall was broken behind the stove , and in bathroom behind toilet drywall was broken aswell ,  the experience was worth what I paid ‚Ä¶ definitely do not recommend , was a headache

We were three guests traveling alone for a girls weekend getaway, which consisted of me picking up a guest from the airport. Our third guest was to arrive the following day..

Our experience:

1. Poor Communication-

I attempted to reach host at 8 PM to ensure everything was ready, however did not hear back until next day, AFTER messaging multiple times at night advising we couldn‚Äôt get in, and reaching out to her again at almost 8am, I finally heard back next day. Star stated she had an emergency.

2. Terrible check-in-

Once we arrived we were unable to get in through the garage because we were missing the sticker from the box. We went back to the key box various times and looked around the floor to ensure it wasn‚Äôt misplaced. By the time we were able to get in, by following a car, it was 1:15 AM. Again, this was happening & no response from host.

2. VERY Unsanitary conditions! -

Dirty bed sheets, floor sticky, 1 bed had the wooden slats (frame) falling apart. Oreo packaging under bed. Dust. We SLEPT in dirty beds! (Wait for it) Dishwater was making noise, not fully closed - dishes were dirty inside. When we woke up in the morning, the second guest bed had blood stains and on bed sheets, I was so embarrassed as I picked this airbnb for the 3 of us to reunite. We sent pictures, Star immediately apologizes stating it was unacceptable. My bed had body fluids on sheets and frame. Star explained this has never happened to her before‚Ä¶ Asked us when we can leave for a few hrs so that they can clean the property. We had to leave for a few hours! She offered us our cleaning fee in return, but by the time we got back it was a whole day lost (after 4pm was the time to return). My party asked for half off, as we were only staying 2 nights. This was a reasonable request - given all that had happened. Host declined.

I do believe Star attempted to fix our experience. But the conditions of the property and, the body fluids noticeably on the bed and bedframe, the dirty towels and bedsheets full of oil, sticky floors. All of this was very unsanitary and we have pictures to provide as evidence. Although location was what we wanted, our girls weekend getaway, reunited after 18 yrs together, was a complete embarrassment and disaster. Unfortunately this was our experience- we would never recommend.

The room itself was really nice and clean. And the host‚Äôs communication was prompt and helpful. But the backyard area where you access it is a mess. There are construction materials strewn about (at one point I stubbed my toe badly on a piece of concrete) and there aren‚Äôt lights back there, so if you are coming in at night, it‚Äôs easy to trip. Also, when I arrived, I had been given the wrong door code (not ideal for a late night check in), but the room was simply unlocked (not exactly the safest feeling walking into a dark unlocked room from a dark back yard.

Communication and location was great. I like how they had a mini fridge, tampons and q tips for use.

However, I barely slept due to the AC being so loud. There was no hand soaps. I had to kill some mosquitoes there and I left with probably 12 bites all over me. The tub was not cleaned properly. Was not the best experience for me especially for paying $150/night

Unfortunately the neighbors were quite loud all throughout the night, which did not allow for great sleep during our stay, but that is obviously out of control of the host. Wish we were aware of the location of the apartment so that we knew going in that it was not optimal.

Large home and very clean. Unfortunately, due to the recent weather in area - the outdoor lights were not functioning and although the owner did deliver lighter fluid for the fire pit, the fire wood had gotten soaked so we weren‚Äôt able to use the outdoor patio much other than the hot tub, which was very enjoyable. Keep in mind the essentials are few; there were no trash bags and limited ‚Äúextras.‚Äù Overall the home was tidy and cozy for our family‚Äôs stay.

Good for the price. Very close to Capital, UT Austin and a bunch of restaurants.
Very old building with bad flooring in the main level.

The place seemed just fine when we got there. Then there wasn‚Äôt hand soap in the bathroom, no extra towels, no washcloths or hand towels, dirt on the floor, and just a general un-homey vibe. This place is managed by a management group so of course those personal touches won‚Äôt be as much, but not enough towels and soap is ridiculous. The price for Austin was fine but I won‚Äôt be booking here again.

Management was kind and efficient -- there were some problems on check-in related to cleaning delays, but they were helpful and sorted it out a solution quickly. The big problem is that this is really student-level accomodation. The building is old, inadequately served by elevators, and very noisy (people running and screaming throughout the night.) The apartment is nice enough, but again, is sort of student quality. For example, there's only about 5 minutes of hot water available, make showers brief and lukewarm. Which I might not have minded, given the price and convenient-to-campus location, but it was just so noisy (students partying) that I literally got no sleep or rest during my stay. Plus getting checking in and out if one has a car is complicated and time-consuming -- the check-out process took me over 15 minutes to move the car out of gated parking, find a public space, grab the parking permit, return it back upstairs, and then come downstairs to leave the key.
Lots of college kids but shockingly quiet. No issues at all with the noise.

Todo estuv√≥ bien. Las instrucciones de acceso y salida un poco complicado. Un video seria mejor. Las toallas no me gustaron, no secaban y el chorro del agua de la ducha muy poquito. La cafetera o la pude poner a funcionar. Todo lo demas excelente, la ubicacion es lo mejor. Gracias

The perks of this house are that it is very big and we liked the location. Beyond that, we were pretty disappointed with our stay.

The house rules say no smoking, but the master bedroom had a terrible odor and had clearly been smoked in plenty.

The house was not cleaned very well and had dusty shelves, cobwebs, dead cockroaches and poorly cleaned showers. I had to kill a couple of large cockroaches and a spider in our short weekend stay as well.

The kitchen is not stocked very well and the cabinets are very damaged.

also I thought it was private but 2 Windows have no shades and 1 looks directly at the main home which is kind of a turn off. only place to change is the restroom if you don't want to run the risk of someone seeing.. accidently or not.

No response during stay when we walked in to broken blinds, lamp that didn‚Äôt work, and a garbage disposal that sounded like there was something stuck inside.

It's a beautiful condo in a great location, just missing the attention to detail.  For example, there's no place to put luggage/ clothes, so we ended up keeping them in the living room. There were  no pool towels. The kitchen towel was dirty with the previous occupant's beans, there was a used nasal spray on the table. All the  I'm also not sure why there's an $150 cleaning fee when we were told to strip the bed, wash the linens, take out the trash, etc.

I booked one of his other properties and then was Told I couldn‚Äôt stay because of plumbing issues I was advised to request a refund I was unable to get in contact with a host for seven hours then I wasn‚Äôt able to receive a refund until three days later upon arriving at the Airbnb the couch broke and wasn‚Äôt replaced they put cement blocks under it.

Do not trust these people. Not clean! Cat bowls with food and water. Half eaten half scattered about, dried cat poop on the floor, litter everywhere but the litter closet, very dark lighting so didn‚Äôt look down until I heard actual crunching under my feet. I took multiple pictures of how gross it was. When I finally spoke with a property manager they said that maintenance people did it, but who brings their cat on the job and locks it in to scatter food and let it poop on the dining room floor and then let the smears dry. So disgusting and unprofessional and quite frankly dishonest.

Place was cheap and disgusting. Dirty laundry left in washer, if there was what you needed in the kitchen it was old and filthy (seriously how expensive is a set of silverware and cook wear from this decade?!), missing doorknob on bathroom door, huge rip in comforter, stains at the bottom of the toilet, shower head maybe 5ft tall, internet went out on average once a week,  beds/couches very cheap and uncomfortable (probably bought on Amazon), yard/exterior not maintained at all, and dirt/crumbs/dust everywhere inside. Only decent thing is the location and host responsiveness.

This place is located in an apartment building and has 2 available parking passes you have to leave in your car. At first glance, it's a decent place to stay and it has a nice patio view. Unfortunately, my family experienced the very stressful situation of what I assume to be the door code changing automatically at midnight during our 2nd night and we were locked out for hours waiting for a response. We ended up having to get a hotel and did not have access to our things until the morning. The host accommodated a late check out. While likely some sort of mishap and we were reimbursed, it was not worth the stress. Otherwise, pros include clean rooms and a spacious living room. Cons include the bathroom being just ok with no hair conditioner and the fact there was construction going out right outside the main bedroom.

The location was a very college student vibe. Do not recommend this if you are going with family. The pictures gave misleading impression that everything was very clean and spotless. In reality, we were forced to use the master bathroom since the other tub had a discolored taint on it. The patio door was shut closed and can only be accessed if you went through the master bedroom as well. Although there is no point checking the outside view since the chairs have holes in them.

Another point, they have their messages automated and our check-in was at 4pm. We got there couple min early but had to wait almost 20 min till the automatic door code was sent to us. In that time, they failed to answer our calls when we tried to reach out for assistance.

Since the group we were with barely stayed indoors, it didn‚Äôt bother us as much. But it was very much an issue when people needed to go on showers and try be hygienic.

This review is strictly for Barcl√© group as a host. First they are extremely unprofessional. I had originally booked an apartment with them several months prior to my trip at a good rate. Barcl√© canceled the booking with me for no reason only to to have the exact same listing on Airbnb at a 50% increase in price. When I reached out they said I needed to book the new listing at the increased price and they would credit my account. They never credited my account once booked. Airbnb gave me a partial refund

They were not responsive to my emails or chats on airbnb. The unit had insufficient toilet paper, towels and no soap for the shower. They did however message me multiple times to inform me when I needed to check out of the unit

They charged exorbitant cleaning fees while still requiring us to strip the beds, clean up and run all used silverware through the dishwasher

Their check in procedure was no in-line with the condos rules and we‚Äôre not very secure.

En general el Airbnb estaba muy bien, las camas muy c√≥modas (lo √∫nico que no me encant√≥ fueron las almohadas), en la descripci√≥n dice que tienen persianas Blackout y no son blackout, si entra la luz al cuarto. Y algo que si no me gusto nada (pero la verdad eso ya es externo), es qu√© hay demasiado ruido en las ma√±anas de las construcciones que est√°n haciendo a los lados. Son los √∫nicos puntos negativos que le veo.
Nunca dejamos el carro en el Valet, hab√≠a estacionamiento sobre la calle y eso hicimos y solo pag√°bamos las horas en las que est√°bamos estacionadas ah√≠.

Lo recomiendo ampliamente. üåü

Apartment is beautiful and well-furnished but there were a couple of hiccups in our stay. For one, the apartment hadn‚Äôt been cleaned in a thorough way. Surfaces were dusty, carpet had hairs, the bathroom floor, drain, and walls had long hairs in/on them - we‚Äôre 2 guys with short hair.

The apartment doesn‚Äôt have a mirror to get ready in front of/check outfits. The lighting is strangely situated (no ceiling lights in the bedroom) so the apartment gets dark at night.

In addition, some outlets weren‚Äôt working. The iron is not good at all and made ironing annoying. Further, the check-out instructions were very demanding in terms of cleaning despite their being a high cleaning fee. We likely would have cleaned anyway, but the instructions provided were borderline rude and threatening.

The rooftop pool and coworking spaces are great. Definitely a plus.

It was a horrible experience, the whole placed smell like urine . We reached out to the owner and the first thing they asked was it is the primary bathroom‚Ä¶ we only had one bathroom ! Then from there they did not help or communicate at all with us . The smell was terrible!

The most disappointing thing about our stay was the cleanliness of the unit, and the loud neighbors above us. The entire apartment smelled of urine, and it didn‚Äôt seem like anything was thoroughly cleaned. The owner was fast to respond but unfortunately nothing was resolved which was disappointing.

Walls paper thin. Noise from next door and upstairs.

Water pressure good but temperature was a problem. NEVER needed to turn on the cold. Hot first day. Less hot the second day. Barely lukewarm the third day.

Dishwasher not working when we arrived and not fixed while we were there.
Socket for the lightbulb on the table lamp in the living room ready to fall off.
Door to one bedroom looked like someone had taken a fist or foot to it. It also cracked the frame and strike plate.

If more than 2 people come, you must eat at the coffee table.

Kitchen is small but has essentials.

The management company closes their offices at 4PM. Very inconvenient if you have a question.

Not safe location. Approached by individual outside of home asking for money and sexual favors. When I contacted the host asking for a refund due to not feeling safe, I was told no. I didn‚Äôt stay in the home at all and did not receive any money back. Very old home. Not private ‚Äî neighbor is directly across from your kitchen. Unit smells.

We contacted Austin right after entering the place to share our issues, however he was not understanding and just suggested we should stay since our refund/cancelation policy had expired. Austin refunded nothing even though we did not stay in his place. He held to his policy, which is fine, but the pictures are not accurate, it had a bad odor, window unit air conditioners were purposely hidden in pictures, and the place has multiple doors throughout the place and don't even have bolt locks to make it safer.
It was disappointing that Austin did not even work with us for at least a partial refund since we didn't even stay. I will know in the future to take pics of the issues, however you can't take a photo of smell. I would not recommend this place for anyone.
Got towed displaying proper tags :/
It's a fairly old house with a gas heater. The gas heater suddenly broke down in mid night.

One of the bedrooms overlooks the parking garage. It was so loud all night. 24/7 you can hear car engines, honking when anyone locks a car, alarms going off, etc. There‚Äôs also a very bright light shining into the bedroom from outside. There is a blackout curtain, but it‚Äôs about a foot too short, making it useless. There was also no top sheet, which could be okay if there was a washable duvet cover - not a regular comforter. Unless you‚Äôre washing the comforter after every guest (not likely), that‚Äôs not okay.

Colin is a nice guy, but he waited until after the cancellation period ended (24 hours before check in) to let me know the unit we‚Äôd be staying in was different than the original listing. He said there was a leak 2 weeks prior and he ‚Äúforgot to let me know.‚Äù That should have been communicated up front. The switch ended up being okay, but it caused unnecessary stress. Because of the poor communication and last minute switch, he said he would give us a discount (but he didn‚Äôt).
One of, if not, the best Airbnb Ive ever stayed in! Location, cleanliness, decor, and price was unbeatable! Communication with the host was too notch. Highly recommend this Airbnb!

Most furniture in the apartment was broken or unusable. Couch broken. Ceiling fan scapes against light fixtures. Hot water was broken in the shower. Toiled leaked. Drive way was unusable. Air conditioner was broken. Pillows and bed not cleaned properly.

Julie ist eine wundervolle, herzensgute, f√ºrsorgliche Frau. Sie sorgt daf√ºr das es ihren G√§sten an nichts fehlt und gibt gute Tips f√ºr Ausfl√ºge und Unternehmungen. Ihr Tinyhaus ist in einer ruhigen Lage inmitten der Natur. Dort kann man die Tiere beobachten wie Rehe und V√∂gel, die bis zur Terrasse kommen. Wir haben uns sehr wohl gef√ºhlt und kommen gerne wieder. Alles ist sehr sauber und liebevoll eingerichtet.
I accidentally left my laptop at one their accommodations and the team bent over backwards to get it back to me. Really good people. For that alone it's 5 stars.

The apartment itself was fine and the view at night spectacular. But the lobby was a little run down and the rooftop deck was really gross. The furniture were stained, sloppy and fire pit broken. There was some miscommunication between the property management and the concierge - which is not the staff in the building but manager by an outside person who lived close by. I asked if there was any other parking than the $40 a day valet parking - which would not take our truck as it was too tall for the garage - and the property management didn't know about any parking. There is ample parking around the building that you have to pay for but less expensive than the Valet parking. Location is Ok. It's really close to Rainey street which is a total carnival with high volume boost bars for college students, load obnoxious music and a pretty unpleasant crowd. It close to the river which is great and really pretty. Doe the cost of $600 with fees it didn't quite live up to the premium cost.

Very comfortable at this condo for the short amount of time we spent in there daily.
The mattresses were tooo soft; they were not comfortable to us. Did not have good nights sleeping.

First off, this apartment is in a great location, that was the major perk. There are two beds and one pull out couch so a little small for 6 adults. But the renters were very stingy on amenities and supplies. Only exactly 6 utensils (6 forks, 6 knives, etc) , no baking sheet. Only 1 toilet roll provided, no dish soap or cloth, one dishwasher pod. Late check in (4pm) and early check out (10am) with no flexibility.

There were cockroaches crawling everywhere.  Around the refrigerator, in the sink, by the toilets.  The Nest temperature device kept resetting to 78, so multiple times through the night I had to get up and turn the air down.  The housie is facing an alley, with no access to the main road.  So, in order to get to the place, you have to park on an adjacent street and walk through a dirt alley to reach the front door. The listing said "parking on premises", which is inaccurate.  The only bed is on the floor, with no bed frame or box springs.  If you're couch surfing and don't mind bugs, this place will be up your alley, literally.

Questionable cleanliness, sheer bedroom curtains facing a busy street on the first floor, litter box smell, lack of kitchen supplies to cook or have coffee, a pitcher left on the toilet that noted directions to assist in flushing. The pet dander left triggered an allergic reaction that forced me to have find a new place to at short notice. Perhaps it was an off booking for them, but I won‚Äôt be staying again.

Pretty bad. Anyone can make a room look put together/ clean on the surface. The floorboards in the bathroom were lifting and leaking water, the toilet didnt work well, the shower was hard to turn on and off, the building itself was very dirty and unkept. Location was terrible. Felt like I was in the ghetto. Walking distance to one juice shop and thats about it, had to uber to do anything fun. Would highly recommend not choosing this place when picking something in Austin. This was a very uncomfortable experience. in addition to this, the communication was awful. i actually had to message them several times to even accept my request to stay there. Only picked this place because the two air bnbs I tried bookint prior ended up cancelling my reservation last minute for various reasons.

Great location and communication from host. They were flexible with early checkin. However, there were roaches in the kitchen and bedrooms so we couldn‚Äôt cook and were constantly trying to kill bugs. The apartment is not well maintained the vinyl flooring is coming apart in several locations causing you to trip over it. I‚Äôd find somewhere else to stay next time.

La ubicaci√≥n del departamento es muy buena, sin embargo:
* Mala limpieza
* Salieron 3 cucarachos de cocina
* Aunque habla de que es hasta para 6 personas, no hay sillas en el comedor para sentarse
* El lugar de estacionamiento nunca se pudo usar, nos dijeron que era algo de la app, sin enbargo, el resto de las personas viviendo ah√≠ si pod√≠an usarlo sin problema de app
* Hay un tema de seguridad con una parte del piso del departamento que est√° levantada y es peligroso.
We were not happy with the Evonify host. Was not a good experience.

Limpio, equipado, privado, seguro y cerca de muchos lugares para visitar y comer.
Es un segundo piso sin ascensor, tomalo en consideracion.

The apartment unit itself is very safe & clean. The bed is very comfy. We didn‚Äôt find any problem locating the apartment from the ground floor (enter through Domain shopping area instead of parking‚Äîthe gate is behind a barbershop). Located in a very central area at the domain, the apartment has everything that we need. We were there for only 2 days while relocating to Austin from out of state.

There was no hand soap (ample body wash & shampoo though), & there‚Äôs no decor (might feel a little lonely if staying alone), but it‚Äôs not an issue for us. If you need a simple & clean place to crash in the Domain area, it‚Äôs perfect. The building, unfortunately, looks badly maintained while we‚Äôre there (dirty hallway & elevator) but that‚Äôs not Irais‚Äô responsibility.

Will recommend to friends & family who are visiting Austin!
Convenient to locate and easy to get around. Unfortunately the weather did not cooperate as well as the accommodations.
Horrible

We stayed for 2 out of our 5 scheduled nights. The early check out was due to some of the living conditions that could not be overlooked. When we arrived there were stains on the furniture and the towels. There were also crumbs inside the cabinet drawers. John was great with communicating and refunded us one nights stay while offering us to use the laundry in unit to wash towels. This was a nice suggestion but was a bit off putting since we paid a cleaning fee and expect the place to be cleaned before we arrive. We decided to stay and wash the towels.

After this, due to the cold rainy weather we turned the heat on and smelled a burning smell which caused the smoke alarm immediately go on. Next, we noticed flooding on the floor in the bedroom which was due to the rain outside. Maintenance came in and said they needed to replace the wall that was causing the leak.

We decided we no longer wanted to stay due to the issues that kept occurring. Throughout this time John was very communicative and ended up refunding us for the duration of the stay while we checked into a hotel.

Our host Ames was great, responded quickly and provided clear instructions. I am a bit disappointed in the AirBnb, it wasn‚Äôt the cleanest I‚Äôve stayed in. Particularly the bathroom space, bathtub/shower liner were dirty upon arrival. The toilet would run consistently, I had to flush it twice after each use for it to stop. The hot water in the shower wouldn‚Äôt last beyond 5 minutes at most. The bathroom also had a slight odor. This Airbnb was a tad bit smaller than anticipated, it‚Äôs close to downtown but not in a desirable area, I did not feel safe. There is a convenience store directly across the street which is nice if you need it.

The good: the beds were comfortable enough and the space was alright for my mom and I to live in and work from for the first few days of our trip to Austin. The location is okay but there isn't that much to do in the area as it's pretty close to the university; we had to drive 15-20 mins to get anywhere we wanted to go.

The bad: due to the water leak mentioned in a previous review, there was no shower curtain in the unit when we arrived. Although the host had received a photo from the cleaners and noted that the new shampoo dispenser was in the wrong spot in the shower they failed to notice that the shower had no curtain.
I let them know upon our arrival at 10pm that night that it was missing, we were fine waiting until the next morning to shower.

The ugly: the entire next day went by without someone stopping in. I messaged many times but it wasn't until about 6:30pm that the shower curtain and rod were dropped off and we put it up ourselves so we could finally shower.

This property is as described, but there is no way to justify a $375 cleaning fee especially when they made us load and run the dishwasher before check out. After booking, I had to take a phone call meeting with Walker Luxury Reality to confirm the number of guests, guest ages, reason for visiting Austin, confirm no pets were on the property...all things that could have been an email and stipulations that were listed in the original booking that apparently needed reiterating. Then I was required to sign a separate contract for the rental and after that I received an exorbitant number of texts and emails from them including a text about when quiet hours are while we weren't even on the property. I will not book any listing that is run by Walker Luxury Reality as they clearly have no interest in renting the way Airbnb normally operates.
Place wasn‚Äôt a condo home looked like it was a bad area I‚Äôm also had a horrible smell inside home

Unfortunately I cannot agree with other reviewers. To start off with, this house is in a shady area right off one of the busiest streets in Austin without mention in the listing. We went here with my wife and 4 kids (all under 10) and did not feel very safe. There was a strong Odor of weed every night. There was previous tenants dirty socks, and my 2 year old found an old cigar in the middle of the back yard and started playing with it.

The house was not well stocked.

If you are going to venture down this road and rent this house, BRING YOUR OWN PILLOWS.

The shuffle board table and arcade are a nice touch, only the table isn‚Äôt level and there‚Äôs no sand/salt for the discs.

You have to back in the driveway because it is so dangerous to back out

When we arrived, we went out back and was greeted by the neighbors small dog barking non stop . I reached out to host but it continued on.

I really hate leaving a bad review, but I wish someone was honest about this place. Won‚Äôt return!
Very disappointing

This apartment was in a great location for exploring east Austin - plenty of coffee shops/bars/restaurants are within walking distance. The unit faces a busy street, and the metro runs along the north side of the building, so it wasn‚Äôt 100% quiet at night (but wasn‚Äôt so noisy that I couldn‚Äôt sleep). And as a previous reviewer mentioned, the glass door to the patio does let in some light at night.

It was my family and I‚Äôs first stay in Austin and the host made it very unpleasant. They didn‚Äôt try to understand my concerns or address them professionally at all. If your able to make it into the building with the very complicated instructions, the room is located all the way on the fourth floor, farthest room from the elevator. In addition, the parking garage is impossible to get through. Horrible instructions and hard to locate. Save your money and DO NOT book with them
Great place but no wifi so you can‚Äôt watch tv either

Firstly I would like to thank them for a lighting fast response on a last minute booking! It looks like they were in the process of installing wifi so there were some boxes and bags of equipment, but I cannot blame them as they had such a short notice from us!  I will say the road is not necessarily kept and would not recommend for vehicles with low ride height. Our mini van was scraping every time we came in an out of the road. There is a also a small rut/trench that separates the concrete parking from the gravel road and that did unfortunately damage our under carriage cover and pulled most of it off. Our van is pretty low at stock height and it was slightly hanging to begin with so I am not upset but definitely recommend driving carefully and if possible to have that rut/trench filled in!

It‚Äôs very nice and clean however it‚Äôs a newer Airbnb and has some kinks to sort out. I had an 8 person party which was known from when I paid however when we arrived it did not accommodate for 8 and 3 people had to stay elsewhere. They had an air mattresses but not enough bedding for them and no extra pillows. We also were not able to sleep in due to their being no curtains in the bedrooms. Being on vacation sleeping in is a must.

It was clean house but furnitures was so old .Beds are not comfortable.Bath room door in Master room in Unit B was not closed .You should push it hard to close it.There was some smell in house when you entered .A/C in unit A is not working well.

This is quaint spot close to so many great places in Austin. The host was really nice, but I will have to say that the management running this was not helpful in several areas. I arrived at night and there were no street lights on the block. When explaining that I couldn‚Äôt find the place and was struggling to locate the area the exact ‚Äútree house‚Äù was located, the woman responded by copy pasting the original guidance provided, which basically mentioned a green house. In the dark, you could not see any of the colors of any of the houses. I did tell them that my experience was not well after 30 mins of searching through several homes backyards looking for the place. Furthermore, the washer was broken and so was the handle to the shower. I complained about the w/d and the management company took 2 days to send someone to fix it(basically the morning I was scheduled to leave.) I was happy with the place, but felt the management company to be very inexperienced and inefficient.

Very cute apartment in a cool part of Austin, but we had many issues unfortunately - the oven hadn‚Äôt been cleaned (it set off the smoke detector as soon as we turned it in), the oven door handle was broken, the provided door code was incorrect so we could only use the key in the lockbox, and items I‚Äôd expect to see in an Airbnb (ironing board, cookware, oven mitts, etc) were missing. Nice if you‚Äôre looking for a place to crash and to be able to walk to E 6th, but doesn‚Äôt provide much more.

Nina es muy servicial, te ayuda en todo lo que necesites. La cama es c√≥moda, el ba√±o es compatido, se puede utilizar la cocina, el refrigerador y la lavadora, adem√°s te ofrece todo lo necesario para cocinar (aceite, sal, ali√±os) cafe y te.
Por el precio creo que tiene lo justo y necesario.
la √∫nica desventaja es que no hay tv.
te aconsejo que aunque est√© la oferta del 3r dia a mitad de precio, pagues todos los dias por la aplicacion para no tener problemas.
recomendable.

Es war wunderbar, in Masons Airstream zu wohnen. Wir haben uns direkt wie zuhause gef√ºhlt. Das Klo ist zu Anfang etwas ungewohnt, aber es ist eigentlich wie ein normales Klo. Bei Problemen war Mason direkt erreichbar und hat sofort geholfen. Wir w√ºrden jederzeit wiederkommen! Danke f√ºr die sch√∂ne Zeit! :-)
It was good value but place felt a little grimey very basic and almost not safe.

(1) Host not to be trusted; slow response or no response. Our questions and requests were ignored. I must contact Airbnb Support for help. There were discrepancies between what he described online and what I saw and experienced.  In the Airbnb website, it said "parking on premises", but before we checked in, the host told me street parking only.  (2) Disappointing inside home: No kitchen towels or paper towel when we checked in. Next day the host left ‚Äúkitchen towels‚Äù, some of that were just small pieces of cloth apparently cut off from used and dirty bath towels. No washing bowl; no salad bowl. Bathroom vent fan broken. Toilet not working well. Washer fixed with duct tapes. Flickering light bulb in one bedroom. It looked like blood stains on a bed sheet.  No vacuum/broom; (3) When I booked the airbnb online, it said the host offer "Book now and save 50%".  After I finished the reservation, it was "41% off" in my receipt; (4) It's quiet neighborhood and good location. That's two stars.
Cheap price, but you get what you pay for.

The management- does not communicate very well!  The place was trashed!  The shower doesn‚Äôt drain.  The tv that is huge doesn‚Äôt work.  The heat if on upstairs will make the downstairs cold.  Overalll the cheapest colonial built home in austin.  Beware of the management too - will try to get you on everything after‚Ä¶ cleaning fees for what? You end up cleaning everything up anyways‚Ä¶ DO not rent here - you have been warned

Pros:
- clean
- easy check in
- available parking

- washer and dryer available
- very responsive host; fast communication

Cons:

We never got to stay here because we had a death in the family and had to cancel our plans at the last minute. We didn't expect a full refund but we did expect some kind of consideration given the circumstances. Airbnb made an effort on our behalf to request some kind of refund given that we would not be able to check in at all but we were ultimately disappointed to learn that we were offered nothing at all.

There were lots of bugs coming up from sink drain in bathroom and the tub. After pointing this out felt like they did not care about how it affected my stay and tried to convince me it was a swarm from weather. This is an infestation because the place was not being kept up with. Dishes had food on them where they weren‚Äôt cleaned good. The sheets had other people‚Äôs hair on them. The baseboards havnt been wiped in a year minimum. They took until 1pm, after pointing out the problem late the night before, to offer another place similar. This is second time I stayed at one of their places. The first time there were some minor issues with things falling apart and they offered a $50 credit but that credit is only good booking directly with them. Essentially worthless now as I would never book with them again. If you have an infestation of bugs your priority should be getting your client into something different and doing what you can to minimize their disruption. Terrible service.
Casa muy limpio y grande üíØ recomendable  sin duda me volver√≠a a ospedar de nuevo ahi

Great location and the available parking right out front is a plus.
This unit is in need of urgent maintenance.

The kitchen counters are made of steel and the surfaces are heavily rusted. The TV is only for streaming services but would not connect to the internet using the password given, so was not available to us. All drains are partially clogged and so when the shower would not turn off and the tub was rapidly filling a plumber had to be called in immediately to stop the potential flood. It took almost 2 hours for him to arrive. The dryer also does not work. We did not attempt to try the washer function. The entry keypad did not work well and we ended up having to call property management to get in a couple of times. The small outside courtyard shown in the photos has not been cleared out and is full of leaves and so is not usable if you want to sit outside. Also while this format does not allow photos you need to know that the tub caulking tub is black from mold.
Very clean and quiet. I thought the location would be a little out of the way, but that‚Äôs not true. I rode scooters and bus, didn‚Äôt need Uber at all if you are site seeing in the city.

Ignored my messages, and became belligerent when I involved Airbnb. The code she gave did not work, I was stranded in the cold for hours, she offered insults instead of apologies and is why Airbnb penalized her and reimbursed me. I can not advise staying with her under any circumstances

I had an unpleasant experience immediately upon arrival at the property. Two bath towels were hanging on hooks and felt slightly damp. I was unsure whether they were cleaned given that I've never experienced clean towels hanging on hooks. The host called her clean-up folks who said that the towels were right out of the dryer. I was not surprised by their statements and uncomfortable with using them. I simply picked up a couple of towels from my daughter's home.
There was no bar or bottled soap in the bathroom, just shampoo and conditioner. There was a free standing bathtub, however there was no shower curtain. I felt that the 'amenities' were quite sparse.
Communication with the host was slow, although polite.
I'll use other hosts when traveling to Austin in the future. I should have paid attention to the reviews on the Airbnb website. So it goes ...

This is a good place to stay if you are planning on eating out and spending most of your time away from the house. Sleeping and leisure is fine, but anything more than a day or two could be a tough stay if you're working or trying to serve a meal to, say, a broke college student!
It was fine for the short weekend, and we ate out most of the time.
Note check out time is 10am - that's a little earlier than most places.
Place was dope. No complaints. Got what I wanted and more. Never met owner but didn‚Äôt need took. Smooth getting in and out, also comfy ass beds

Our entire experience with this host was horrible.
Rude from the beginning, telling us to just forget it and ‚Äúget an hotel at those prices‚Äù when asked for a place with 2 rooms.
Lied about about the BNB being clean, doubled down that he was actually inside there earlier that day, and only relented when I sent videos and pictures as proof of the mess that was there.
Tried to get me to cancel my BNB as if I would trust that he would switch it to another one on his end when in reality, hosts just wash their hands and leave us stranded since they are no longer responsible (this has happened before).
When we denied a cleaning service because we had no where to go for the next 3 hrs, he finally accommodated with another BNB, but wanted to cut our reservation for 1 night only, even though the mess had nothing to do with us and we need 2 nights. Again telling us to change things on our end, knowing full well how that goes.
When that got sorted out, he was very adamant and rude about not throwing the party which makes no sense since the party was in the other BNB from the looks of it.
Finally, he sent a 3AM message that we need to be out by 10AM, I‚Äôm assuming, in the hopes we don‚Äôt see it and he could charge another night.
Both BNB‚Äôs were actually rather nice, but if it means dealing with a host like this, we might ACTUALLY get an hotel, as so should you. Do not recommend at all.

Es un estudio bonito y con todo lo necesario. La ubicaci√≥n es excelente si vas en coche, muy cerca de downtown. El host es muy atento y responde r√°pidamente. El barrio no se siente muy seguro para caminar pero se que eso no depende del host, fuera de eso todo muy bien.

DO NOT STAY HERE UNLESS YOUR TRYING TO SELL CRACK OR YOUR A** this place is horrible smelled of piss mold mildew and widows where plexus glass and where taped in the widows there was floors rotting and coming up pictures did not match ac didn‚Äôt work mold everywhere we had to end up staying out side 3 hours u til the host responded and allowed us to cancel after being on the phone with support for about 2 hours he finally responded and said if I felt uncomfortable to leave very inconsiderate of the situation it says clean space and it was far from it and pool was closed by the health department there was people on the Conor selling drugs in front of my children even was approached and asked if I needed any
Decent location. Unfortunately towels were stained and unpleasant.
She had dog hair everywhere. She is a liar. Theres not two beds like that listing says. Strange smells. Thin walls. Rude as I‚Äôll get out.

wasn't ready after 1 as stated in listing. his maid, he claimed, was coming in after 5. he said "he thought" I'd come in after 9 to 11 pm, when I was just in general saying I'd be coming in late, but why is the property just not ready in general after check out time after 1 pm as advertised? he said he would give further instructions on Friday, not a word from him in the morning....I thought "fine maybe he will write in a couple of hours". NOPE. Got there at 3:30 pm on that very Friday, and still no instructions. Also it was AN APARTMENT COMPLEX. I couldn't get in because a gate code is required. He also was very vague with the instructions on the default messages "key in the lock box", which was an occurring theme.....which is dumb because WHERE IS THIS LOCKBOX? He didn't even tell me where the unit is. There are like 100 apartment units and probably 8-12 buildings and I'm supposed to just find a needle in a hay stack? And not only that....he said he didn't want me to go in there because it wasn't cleaned up yet, WHY WOULD HE LEAVE INSTRUCTIONS (however vague) TO FIND KEYS IF HE DIDNT WANT ME TO GO INTO HIS UNIT? So I tried calling him, 6-7 times. I texted him even. He claimed he was "on the other line" but we all know it takes 10 seconds to make a courtesy text while on a call. He was not very about his business with the whole thing and just seemed either highly incompetent or just a scammer. I am inclined to think the latter. now here is the kicker, I guess he thought I'd just give up after not hearing from him. I thought, maybe I'll ask if the front office of the apartment knows anything about this guy. Turns out he wasn't even supposed to sub-lease to anyone else on Airbnb. They asked to see the messages, and I figured, if he is going to treat me like an idiot I might as well. And as I'm leaving the property, lo and behold, HE CALLS ME. And somehow he knew I went to the front office. I guess that put a fire under him to be about his business. So this is when he was going on about "my maid hasn't cleaned the room yet, come after 5". So I'm being VERY PATIENT with him at this point and figured I would give him another chance. I went to Austin City Limits and MY VIBE WAS RUINED FROM THE WHOLE THING. I just wanted to check in on him, and the room, while I'm trying to enjoy the show. He texted back and said "it's best to cancel now, since this thing is a whole mess". First of all, WHY DIDN'T HE CANCEL AND GIVE ME BACK MY REFUND? It's bad enough I'm stranded now (I ended up trying to sleep in my own car, which I couldn't) but now if I myself canceled, I saw I wasn't eligible for a refund. So for the longest I tried to contact support throught text, as I was trying to multitask watching a concert while getting this mess handled, and I happened to misclick to cancel the booking. I NEED MY MONEY! I work all day driving strangers around, for 12-16 hours to make the money I did to spend on this reservation. HARD, EXHAUSTING, AND EVEN RISKY WORK. I would be open to rescind this review if I get the WHOLE REFUND.

First, the property was very nice! Great view, clean, and the valet folks were great!
However, if you are looking for a space with 2 king beds like the listing says, you will be greatly disappointed. We found out the day before our trip that the unit has 1 king bed and 1 queen bed and the posting on Airbnb is completely inaccurate and misleading.
After realizing the listing was incorrect and the beds would not accommodate our group, we contacted unwind and attempted to cancel for a full refund to which they declined. We escalated the issue to Airbnb and still we‚Äôre not able to cancel under the misleading Aircover policy. Although the listing was fraudulent, Airbnb only
offered $39 to be refunded, prior to check in on an almost $2,000 booking. Not to mention, Unwind was very rude and difficult to communicate with. We simply wanted to cancel to find appropriate lodging for our group and we were forced to stay or lose all but $39 of our money. Overall a horrible experience!!
muy recomendable el lugar, limpio, amplio, con todo lo necesario, toallas, shampoo, Jab√≥n, lavander√≠a etc. volver√≠a a hospedarme ah√≠ sin lugar a dudas!
This house was immaculate.  More than what the pictures lead on.  Could not have been happier with the home and our stay.

My family and I were in town for a 3 day workshop that went on for 12 hrs & in all honesty, I was very disappointed with the way the company (not really a host/one person owned) handled our issue with not having a working heater. I tried calling them to get a faster response but they told me to text them via the Airbnb app. So we spent an hour trying to ‚Äúdouble check‚Äù the heater was not working. After I sent them multiple pictures of the heater being ‚Äúon‚Äù and the vents being closed (thus no hot air coming out). Their response was to send someone out in the morning but we had already been without heat the first night since they did not leave the remote to the split unit in our room where it should have been. Instead we had to search for it and when we finally found it that‚Äôs when we learned the heater was not working. It was too cold to stay with the weather being 40¬∞~.

Me he hospedado en 3 ocasiones en este lugar, una casa muy limpia y un lugar muy seguro, estar√© en Austin por varios meses por cuestiones de trabajo y sin duda me hospedar√© de nuevo en esta casa, gracias por todo.

This place is very nice, but the inaccurate listing and soulless management were too much for me. I booked this very expensive place because it said it had a hot tub- it was going to be cold during my stay and it was really important to me to relax in a hot tub during my vacation- but there was no hot tub. I contacted the owner through the app and all they would do is tell me there wasn‚Äôt a hot tub (duh). In my opinion, if a place isn‚Äôt as advertised for a major amenity then some kind of discount or at least an apology for their inaccurate listing is in order. It‚Äôs not like the hot tub was closed- it just doesn‚Äôt exist. They refused to provide a small discount when asked.

Things the listing says it has but doesn‚Äôt:
-A ‚Äúdedicated‚Äù workspace- there was nowhere i could even sit and access a plug for my laptop.
-Cooking essentials- there was no salt, pepper, or oil.
-As mentioned, there is no hot tub.
-Didn‚Äôt see a high chair in the unit, not sure if they would be able to provide on request, but i doubt it.

If this place is trying to compete with the downtown or Rainey Street hotels then it has a long way to go- there was no hand soap in the bathroom, parking was crazy expensive, and the cleaning fee was huge- yet you are asked to strip the beds and take out the trash- what‚Äôs the $150 fee for then? Just save yourself the trouble and stay at a real hotel where there‚Äôs staff to help you, cleaning fees aren‚Äôt insane, and the amenities are accurate - Hotel van Zandt is nice, Hotel San Jose for south congress, or the Hilton austin downtown~actually~ has a hot tub. Not such a pleasant stay,
The property is close to downtown and the place itself was not dirty from the inside other than that we arrived to the property and the back door was extremely hard to open as it seemed it wasn‚Äôt working properly. There was dog poop all over the walkway to where we were staying, the property lock was not working, so we had to leave all of our belongings unlocked in the shed, and when we asked about it we were instructed to just leave everything unlocked as it was not a big deal to them. When we reached out he was fairly rude and said to basically figure out how to unclog the drain ourselves and he would look at the water situation later. We ended up leaving and booking something else due to the extenuating circumstances. El lugar est√° bien ubicado pues est√° muy cerca de todo, sin embargo, le hace falta mucha ventilaci√≥n a los cuartos y los ba√±os que est√°n dentro de los cuartos emiten un olor a alcantarilla muy desagradable. We loved the unit and location, unfortunately however there was a warm water problem our entire stay. We only had 1 min of warm water during showers then it would go cold. June is very good host. But this house was not good for me. The outside of house was not clean. The bathrooms door couldn't be locked. My room was clean and bright, but living room was very dark. I  didn't feel free in this house.

Apartment as expected. Location was easy to reach downtown and airport by public transport.

Also, upstairs neighbour is VERY NOISY, ‚Äòstamping around their space‚Äô on our ceiling during the night, we assumed a shift worker, they were very active 2-4am which woke us and kept us awake, not great but beyond control.

i feel like the place could be cleaned a lot better. There were ants crawling in the drawers in the kitchen all over the silverware, the window sills had spiderwebs w dirt and debris in them and then the bath tub had some type of slimy film in it so we never used the bath tub. the air mattress doesn‚Äôt hold air so i don‚Äôt think that should be listed as a 3 bedroom house since it can‚Äôt accommodate.

overall if all those things didn‚Äôt happen to us it would have been worth what we paid.

The house was good and what we expected. But we were very sad to find out that there was no hot water and very low water pressure in the upstairs shower. Extraordinario lugar para quedarse, c√≥modo, muy bien ubicado. Estuve muy contenta y sin duda regresare.

Everything was wonderful the bed was very hard and the pillows were too soft my neck is still bothering me. The front door was hard to get in door was jammed a little. If your just need a place to sleep and shower this is the spot. Nothing special or fancy but the shower works and a place to put your head.

The house is in a beautiful area, fairly close to amenities. We loved the view and the privacy. When we checked in this older house, we found that it was not completely cleaned, the dishwasher had dirty dishes still in it, the table in the kitchen had something spilled on it, there was some confetti, toys and straws on the floors, counters and table, the bath and pool towels had not been dried completely the kitchen garbage had not been taken out, the windows at the front entrance has cobwebs and dead bugs, there are lots of light burned out in the string lights on the patio area and we had to change the light bulb in the main bathroom that was burnt out and the kitchen floor was a little sticky in front of the sink. We could not get into the IPad  app to run the spa and pool heater, so they were ice cold and we never got to use them, which was the whole reason we chose this property. I did communicate with Emily on the issues we had from the moment we checked in and as I found things. Nice and clean place to stay in East Austin! Loved that there were good places to eat nearby and was within a 7 minute drive from downtown.

The one time I did receive a non-automated response was when there was an issue with the wifi (a note that the router is kept in the bedroom 1 closet! Our bad for unplugging by mistake).

Do NOT stay here.

Communication was poor. Check-in directions were not clear. Was not told where to park until after an HOUR of waiting in my car for host‚Äôs response.

Shower head had barely any water pressure. Made it difficult to take a quick efficient shower.

Personal items were left laying around, including Amazon 5 boxes that were piled on the porch.

Very unprofessional host, very unpleasant time
Good place but had some maintenance issues which were fixed in couple of days. Host responded very fast when we booked but was non responsive when we decided to checkout early due to bad weather.

I have never seen a comfortable airbnb place before, well equipped, had water bottles and some snacks, all kitchen stuff that you might need.
I wished if I had stayed more.

Will be my place to go in Austin when I visit again.

The bathroom was leaking in the back of the toilet they had a bowl with dirty water leaking from toilet water ran slow then the next day it was no water couldn‚Äôt shower or brush teeth and it‚Äôs very noisy they party all nite with loud music outside and drinking will never choose this place again
The place is ok. Host don‚Äôt care at all of u. And also replay mad at u. Not recommended it. Ana Maria needs to Lear about service and aptitude.
It was clean shower was dirty floods was dirty couldn‚Äôt use tv was working

Location (very accessible) and communication get 5 stars but cleanliness and facilities weren‚Äôt up to par. When we checked it it did not look like the floors had been mopped properly. The place was dirty. My baby crawls, and my wife has to change his clothes four times a day. It was also smelling weed. The hairdryer wasn't working, and the commodes were shaking. We left the place one night before our actual checkout.

If you just need a quick place to shower and sleep without spending much time there, this is for you. This is 100% my honest experience. The house was dirty. Very dirty. The photos are a catfish. The furniture is super old and tattered and needs to be replaced. The bathtubs have grime and old rust stains all over it. The floors were filthy and it was dust everywhere. The beds were sunken in the middle. We spent two hours after check in cleaning up. Deep cleaning! After we mopped the floor, the mop water was black. The dishes were not clean, like visibly had old dried food on the cooking utensils. Also, the fan upstairs stopped working in the middle of our stay, the light in the master bathroom completely stopped working and I had to reset the light for it to come back on. Also, the WiFi never worked and we all needed to work and had to leave to get work done. Out of all of the airbnbs that I‚Äôve stayed in, this experience was by far the most uncomfortable.

Place seems to be a student housing apartment, you can see that there is damage throughout the apartment and some things are broken. Overall the apartment is in a great location and great value for the price. But the place was not as aesthetically pleasing as the pictures on the ad.

Condo is as described.  Beware of the towing company patrolling the parking garage.  Went down to car at 7am to retrieve parking pass from car to return to condo, returned at 8 and the car was towed. Not bad for business stay, but area and place are quite dirty. Would not stay here if traveling alone

The unit was disgusting and a complete misrepresentation of the listing. Moldy showers, broken door handles, literal holes in the flooring. The unit is inside a college party building and it shows. The view is nice and it‚Äôs well located. Other than that it‚Äôs a total dump.

This place was filthy.  I had to insist that the host sent the cleaning crew out again.  The shower was appalling with a grimy film coating the shower floor. The mold was grey and brown and repulsive.  The host was terrible at communicating.  The times we actually got a reply it was dismissive and flat out rude.  There was no hot water for the duration of our week stay.  The host felt that a $45 refund was sufficient.  The entire place needed maintenance.  Some of the doors don‚Äôt even close all the way.  Chunks of the floor are missing and paint is peeling of the door ways.  The bathroom sink didn‚Äôt drain.  The bed were terribly uncomfortable.  The location wasn‚Äôt too bad.  Over all I would steer all people away from this unit.  I‚Äôm sorry to be so frank but our time was awful. I feel half of the reservation cost should be refunded back,  at the very least.

The Wi-Fi didn't work and they didn't solve it, they didn't answer my messages after 8PM,

I placed in the reservation that we were 3 people and they only put a towel on us, the TV control was nowhere and there was no solution either, the rest the apartment is as it comes in the photos and has all the other amenities!

The home was beautiful and had plenty of room! The bedrooms were large and felt comfy, the furniture felt luxurious and the patio was a plus for playing card and board games outside. Es realmente muy bonito, tranquilo y acogedor, te sentir√°s en casa.

My guests and I weren‚Äôt very pleased with our stay. We were in town to take the Bar Exam and there were a lot of issues we had while staying here which was an inconvenience. The apartment complex can get very nosey because there is a neighbor who sits outside across from the apartment blasting music and having very loud conversations with other neighbors. On the first night, we had a plumbing issue, which was promptly fixed but this still was an inconvenience. Also over the course of our stay EE we constantly encountered small roaches and also encountered a large water bug. The unit it‚Äôs self was clean but the small roaches were still appearing, probably a result of an unclean neighbor. Overall, if it wasn‚Äôt for our test we would left the first night and found somewhere else.

Le logement d'Hunter est tr√®s propre et tr√®s agr√©able. Le canap√© et les lits sont tr√®s confortables. Le logement est bien situ√©. Nous avons tout de m√™me appr√©ci√© l'appartement et le recommandons.

Let‚Äôs just say this‚Ä¶ thank goodness it was inexpensive to book because if I would have paid more? I would have been upset.

Overall, the place was clean. It‚Äôs a place to stay.

Pros:
1. Inexpensive
2. Clean

Cons:
1. TV is wonky and takes some added effort to get it to work. Not to mention I had to use my own personal hotspot the last day to be able to watch anything because the Wi-Fi went out for the entire day.
2. Train noise is major. PAPER THIN walls. I heard the neighbors the entire time.
3. Check-in was a pain. The MAPS don‚Äôt take you to the right building. Once we found it, he gave me instructions for the wrong lockbox and wrong unit. He never responded to my messages so I ended up figuring it out on my own.
4. He apparently didn‚Äôt pay his Netflix bill because we kept getting notifications on the screen that the card is null. It was the only streaming service.

His lack of response is also why I didn‚Äôt bother trying to explain Wi-Fi and tv issues because what‚Äôs the point.

Classic, flipped bungalow with a modern touch!

Obviously the house was flipped and converted from a duplex into a single unit. The execution was thoughtful, the look & feel is above average.

We have been a party of 5 persons / 2 families and we found everything we needed for a 2 night stay.
In this neighborhood you still find a lot of bungalows this age/size but the majority is still untouched and not renovated.

We enjoyed our stay and would come back!

Place was as advertised! I misplaced my key unfortunately and they were able to bring me a new one in no time at 2 o‚Äôclock in the morning. Even showed up with a smile even though I‚Äôm sure she was probably cursing me out in her head because I know that‚Äôs what I would have done if I had to wake up and bring an irresponsible renter a key at 2am. Me‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm the irresponsible renter! Thank you for accommodating me and helping me throughout my stay up until the very end!

Some of the lights weren‚Äôt working, including the back yard light, the living room light, and the lamp in the living room. We spent Xmas eve kind of in the dark. We wanted to use the fire pit in the back but there were no lights and it was pitch black in the back.

At night, it was freezing. The heat was working during the day, so maybe it was the weather. Nonetheless, both nights were very cold. Extra blankets would have helped but there were none. In fact, one of the blankets and towels were dirty. They looked like they had poop spots on them. Not sure what it was. I was disappointed to see the plants dying and uncared for. I also felt the amount of rules for cleaning were unreasonable. They even asked us to empty the water from the washer because it didn‚Äôt properly drain.

I think this property needs lots of work to be bnb ready.

For what it was, it worked ‚Äî three beds (and couch) one bath between me and my five other friends was a lil bit much but nothing to really complain about.

The houses condition though? The shape it was in? Terrible.

It was clearly under renovation (and in need of more). The pillars for the front porch were crooked and one wasn‚Äôt even touching the concrete ‚Äî whole thing looked like it was about to fall. The electricity was weird, lights were dim, and in the bathroom the light just wouldn‚Äôt work ‚Äî much like the washer and drier.

The water heater didn‚Äôt look to be installed correctly either, as any use of water immediately summoned the compressor demon. The towels, for usage after the shower, had large brown streaks on them ‚Äî make of that what you will.

To top it all off a city ordinance paper was staked into the ground in front of the place informing us that the house wasn‚Äôt even up to code or particularly safe.

Not overtly awful, but death by a thousand cuts level bad.

Decent Airbnb. Only thing we didn't like was that we paid an $80 cleaning fee, but we still had to clean the place up ourselves. Took out all trash, stripped bed of all linens, organize dishes, towels, etc. or we would be charged $50 more? Not super happy about that. Other than that, it was a good location and clean place. Its pretty private, except for the front window blinds were broken and anyone can see in.

location - perfect location to stay in if visiting / working remote in austin. breweries and bars walking distance that you can work in

building - apartments for post college crowd. hallways were a bit dirty, weight room was ok, didnt seem like rental office was proactive

apt - space was accurately portrayed in pictures. a bunch of things were broken on check-in and not repaired during stay. washer could not spin, dryer missing handle, microwave handle coming off. mattress is a sleepys memory foam (not a tempurpedic as mentioned).
Some unclear instructions for check in resulted in having to pay extra for parking and a difficult time finding the apartment. Was charged a fee for a pet when I clearly said it was a service animal.
Wouldnt stay here again. Hosts harassed my family and showed up to property multiple times unannounced.

Andrea was a very accommodating host. Unfortunately, there was something from previous guests in the broiler of the stove that we were not aware of and ended up causing a fire hazard problem. Andrea was quick to address the problem and relocate us apologetically. The place fitted our needs for our short stay and was at a perfect location for many restaurants and Austin activities. We booked 2 nights and decided to leave after 1st. Location was ok. Environment was ok. But the place is really old and needs maintenance and cleaning. There was a shoe mark on the ceiling above the bed, dirty walls, dirty water heater, etc.
it‚Äôs an ‚Äúok‚Äù place, maybe a bit expensive for what you get.

No basic kitchen supples such as salt and pepper or pot or a knife or glass for water. Spring mattress really hard to sleep on. No hangers, shampoo, conditioner or body soap. Balcony has no furniture.
Bare minimum unit

Chambre tr√®s cosy, avec une d√©coration haut de gamme, tout est neuf. Le quartier est tr√®s calme. Le r√©frig√©rateur et le coin petit d√©jeuner sont un vrai plus !

we had terrible experience in this location. we had a family visiting Austin and we weren't getting hot water. we messaged owner but didn't give proper resolution. our family ended up doing bath in cold water and some got affected with cold already. Really I felt awkward Infront of my family.

Good place overall just be prepared to walk uphill almost 1/4 mile for parking. There is guest parking located right across from the unit but it's mostly NEVER available. As in everyone seems to have multiple vehicles in this neighborhood and use all the guest parking since every curb is a no parking area. This won't stop the neighbors from parking their full size motorboats on a trailer in the no parking area. Guests of the house while I was there were allowed to park in front of the house (In the painted red no parking zone). I, however, was required to use guest parking 13 houses away downhill. The neighborhood is gated so walking uphill in the middle of the night is not very scary, just inconvenient.  Window wide open when I arrived.  Confusing but apparently the girl living upstairs smokes out of the window every morning. So if you check in and the windows open that's why. Same roommate may use restroom 9am-12pm daily so get your shower in early or don't make breakfast plans or any scheduled appointments before noon.  Empty Rx capsules on carpet. Would suggest double checking carpet if kids are with you. This was My first time with Airbnb.

Kleines s√º√ües Apartment in einer sch√∂nen Gegend. Supermarkt etc schnell zu Fu√ü zu erreichen. Auch der Bus ist um die Ecke. Marie und Matteo sind sehr nette Gastgeber, die immer ihre Hilfe anbieten und f√ºr dich da sind. Die Unterkunft ist sauber, die vorhandene Nespresso Maschine hilft dir morgens wach zu werden.
