Apartamento cuenta con todo lo necesario, c√≥modo y de f√°cil acceso, el colch√≥n es s√∫per c√≥modo y todo funcion√≥ muy bien, la comunicaci√≥n con el anfitri√≥n bien fluida y excelente tiempo de respuesta, el complex no es lujoso, pero est√° bien cuidado! 100% recomendado

I won‚Äôt be booking with Austin Vacay again. It felt very impersonal. They kept trying to find ways to charge me more. They sent me a message about cleaning up the place before I left. I don‚Äôt have a problem picking up after myself or leaving things tidy for them, but I do have a problem with the level of cleaning that was requested.  I‚Äôm not going on vacation to have to clean up. In addition, what am I being charged a cleaning fee for? The apartment wasn‚Äôt even that clean when I got there (the floors were dirty, the drain in the sink was clogged and smelled horrible because it had food in there for who knows how long). It didn‚Äôt feel like my usual Airbnb stays where you can tell the owner cares about their property.

Not at all as advertised. Tried calling, emailing, messaging.   NO ONE contacted me. Not even the vacay place.  The place was absolutely filthy.  Dog hair all over couch and bed.   Bugs crawling around both bathtubs. Neighbors blasting music 6:00am jumping up and down but worst was not even so much as a reply from anyone. Finally gave up and went to a hotel.
Was double booked and then cancelled on after charging me. I'm still waiting for my refund

On the day that we were supposed to fly out, our flight got canceled then rescheduled multiple times due to an ice storm. We contacted the host to try to cancel the trip, they pointed us to Airbnb. Airbnb came back to inform us that they could not convince the host to provide any refund other than the cleaning fees. So then we ended up going the next day. At this point, we lost a day of stay. When we arrived, there place didn‚Äôt have electricity when the outside temperature was hovering around freezing temp. We called the host but no one answered. They finally replied to our message on the app, again, telling us to contact Airbnb. We struggled for 4 hours being on multiple calls with Airbnb to get a replacement stay. The power outage most likely started the day before based on what we saw in the news. However, the host didn‚Äôt even bother to check to see if the place was habitable before our arrival. No sign of proactiveness in ensuring guest safety in face of an ice storm.
Excelente lugar !!!!, volver√≠a sin pensarlo 6 estrellas para este sitio

Close to Barton Springs but backs up to a tennis court and parking lot with no curtains on the balcony for privacy.  It‚Äôs also really really hot in the unit.  I‚Äôm sure it would be fine in the winter time but not a comfortable stay all the way around.  Directly next to a convenience store and you can hear every move the neighbor makes.

The location was close to the airport, the city. On the downside I don‚Äôt think the price we paid was worth it.
Check-in was pretty late and check out was earlier than normal Airbnbs. I think this was to try to get you to pay $20/hr for an early or late check out. Due to an emergency we had to pay for late check out but due to a miscommunication between the hosts and their cleaner we were still kicked before the time we paid for. The hosts gave us our money back however we still were forced out so quickly and it was extremely stressful.
The plumbing in this place was awful. The water would fill in the bathtub during a shower and the mat placed in the tub was disgusting underneath. The sink in the bathroom also was slow to drain and leaked underneath. My white socks turned black so I don‚Äôt think mopping was ever done. We had to pay a crazy cleaning fee but the check out rules made us do the majority of the cleaning. The internet all did not work for a majority of our 2night stay.

Just good. The pictures are accurate.
There are 2 detached bathrooms; no master bedroom/bathroom. It would have been nice to see that annotated.
The bathrooms were not clean. They had rust on the vents, dust/dirt on the floors and counters, extremely slick shower/tub combos, no trash bags in the cans, and horrible lighting. There was residue and fingernail clippings on the bathroom counters. The toilet across from the kitchen has a running water sound that cycles.
The brown couch (pictured) had so many crumbs and dirt on the cushions and in the couch.
Fridge/freezer had stains and residue.
The check-out requirements listed to check under beds for items and the floors were disgusting.
The bedroom attached to the living room had a yanked off smoke alarm and the first bedroom had a low battery alert on the smoke detector.
Check-in is 4-8 PM. May not be reachable after 8 PM. Check-out is 11 AM. With a list of to-do‚Äôs.
ONE parking pass for the garage.
Deep clean needed.
Same comments as my previous review, nothing changed :-)

Fine place but was frustrated by the list of tasks given to us before leaving since we paid a $180 cleaning fee. We had to strip the beds, put all towels away, load and run the dishwasher, take out the trash, and more. Would stay at hotel instead for about the same money next time.

I don't like writing bad reviews, In the beginning she came off as a nice person. but that surly changed when there was a Airbnb issue that she couldn't get her money from them. as we kept missing each other because I and my husband work. we just moved here and have two jobs a piece. so we are busy she as a host is very noise goes in the room when you're not there. claimed I left my dog out for two days without water , I went to work on a cool day and it turned hot I dont know much about Texas weather. I couldn't leave my animal out her cat kept terrorizing my dog biting at her hissing , clawing at her. to avoid her claiming my dog attacked I kept her away from her while I was at work  she would go and remove my dog from her room or cage without permission and text my husband not me about it  . her lying saying I had a unknown guest is crazy all she did was text my husband ü§£  has a terrible cat that bites, scratches and she DOESN'T do anything about it she praises the bad behavior.
No I do not wish to write a review
10/10 don‚Äôt recommend. Disgustingly dirty. In serious need of cleaning and updating.

First the good: the location was a walkable distance to plenty of food and drink, beds were very comfortable, the place was clean.
The not-so-great: older apartment that needs maintenance, cold water faucets in both showers don't work properly so it's impossible to get decent water pressure and not have a scalding shower, hinge coming out of master bath door, painted tub that's starting to peel. Also not set up for 4 people. Not enough dishes for 4. Sofa that is comfortable for 3 and a few uncomfortable chairs. Uncomfortable pillows, no kitchen towels or dishcloths, only 2 washcloths in whole apartment, no laundry detergent. Patio had potential to be very cute but was dirty, full of trash and cigarette butts.

Me gust√≥ la ubicaci√≥n y tambi√©n la excelente condici√≥n del inmueble. Lo recomiendo 100%.
Volver√≠a a usarla sin duda.

Adequate and affordable for a couple. Good hosts, great location. Unfortunately the water pressure in shower was very weak and the height was not adjustable to 5' 10". The room did smell of residual chemicals and smoke. Probably someone violated the non-smoking rules . My last morning there, my water was shut off to take care of a leak in another apartment! No courtesy refund or ability to change rooms.

It‚Äôs a great area and the listing was mostly as advertised. The apartment does feel a little dirty as floors and fixtures are kinda dusty and dirty. Light switches are grimy. It‚Äôs for sure not cleaned to basic hotel standards.

The place was clean, had plenty of space and a great vibe, but internet, wifi and tv not working the entire time we were there was a big disappointment. With what we were paying for the stay, you wouldn't expect such basic functionality problems.

Frontdesk in general is a very nice agency to book with. I've now stayed at two of their properties. The check-in and communication (through Airbnb messages) is great! Yet, for this specific apartment, there was one issue.

The listing says it has a washer and dryer but the unit did not have that amenity. I contacted Frontdesk, who couldn't move me into another unit so I had to stay in the apartment for the duration of my trip. However, after explaining the misrepresentation, they did make up for my inconvenience with an appropriate resolution. I appreciate that and would stay with them again.

If maintained, the space would have been great. There were many issues The tub and bathroom sink were both clogged. I actually fell from the tub because of the drainage issues. There were toenails in the living room floor, so evident that it wasn't vacuumed. Fans and vents all had a fair amount of dust build-up. I reported the dirty living room and bathroom drainage issues and was told someone would fix these issues, but ultimately no one came. The location is about 20 minutes away from Downtown Austin. Overall, not a great experience.

This place is part of what it seems to be a whole apt building owned by a group to do airbnb‚Ä¶managed almost like a hotel‚Ä¶ but then it‚Äôs not a hotel.. I guess you could say it‚Äôs like a really bad hotel. It‚Äôs these type of listings and groups that will bring Airbnb down if they don‚Äôt do something about it.

This one seems to be called front-desk, but there is no actual front-desk in the building‚Ä¶ but people who help you through the phone that are not even based in Austin. Usually all of my reviews are about the host, yet on this one there wasn‚Äôt even one.

I went down from NY on a long work trip and being Oct in Austin (ACL, F1) my options were limited. From the pictures it looked just fine, of course they sell you the pool, and the gym‚Ä¶ but then apt has bad quality bed sheets, pillows, basic and limited kitchen utensils. Cookie cutter decorations‚Ä¶ It‚Äôs all very cheap and impersonal - a greedy operation in my opinion.

I would recommended maybe for short stays but I think you might as well just find an actual hotel or just another airbnb. For a medium term/long stay I wouldn‚Äôt recommend.

Coming into Austin, my fianc√©e and I and needed a place to stay that was away from downtown traffic, but also close and convenient to shopping. There were many options in The Domain area, but this place caught my eye. Let me tell you that the pictures do not do it justice! Everything was just as described. The parking situation took a once over, but where I went wrong was trying to drive and read the instructions that Frontdesk leaves for you. Parking is conveniently located adjacent to the building in the Red Garage. An overnight parking pass and key fob are left for you as you walk in. The kitchen and bathroom were pristine. It is a good-sized studio apartment, but with all the amenities that you need -- dishwasher, Keurig, Roku TV, washer & dryer, ironing board, full body mirror, and a plush queen-sized bed. No refrigerator noise. The only issue was no hot water in the morning, but it was a non-issue and didn't deter from our stay whatsoever. Frontdesk was very attentive.

Well first of all it was dark as hell when I checked in living room kitchen spotless my actual bedroom spotless my shared bathroom dirty tub sugar ants and flies so I moved to the private bath because host was unresponsive I was under the impression that it was going to be me and a female travel nurse accompanying me instead it was another person there male But open that very soft convenient location

Notified DURING our 7-hour trip to this destination that no bath towels would be available upon our arrival.  Checkin was a disaster as the room had not been cleaned nor was there a parking permit as was noted in the checkin directions.  Instructed to move to different unit in the building, but when checking in to that room, there was no parking permit available in that unit either.  No communication from this host for over 12 hours about the parking permit.  The only good thing about this place is that it was close to the location we were working at in Austin.
No issues

The apartment was OK. However, it was incredibly dirty when I got there. There was dirt and beads and random things all over the floor (clearly demonstrating it was not cleaned), the toilet paper roll and trash can were both broken, there were dirty dishes in the dishwasher (that also did not appear to work),  and a dirty old rag sitting out on the porch. When I confronted Hunter about my concerns shortly after I got to the airbnb, I was told that he has a cleaning crew come in (which does not address the fact that it was not clean) and did not offer any solutions or to have them come back and clean further. I am incredibly disappointed with this rental, and wish I could have gotten my money back.

House was beautiful but for a spot that is advertising sleeping so many people, 2 parking spaces were not enough. Be prepared to carpool or pay for gated parking because the neighborhood is not very safe. Would not recommend street parking.

The dryer was not working, there were only 2 towels in the whole home, and one of the bedrooms ended up being unusable because the roof started to leak out of a light fixture and soaked the bed.

Host was responsive but not flexible with an early check-in time and would not let us utilize parking spaces even though we weren‚Äôt blocking driveways or inconveniencing others.

Communication was good, but things were missing that were listed. Only 1 lounge chair was useable at the pool, maybe not worth putting in description. Some items still in the packaging from the store so obviously not washed and no soap to wash it with. Only stayed 1 day, left early

Host became rude and demeaning when I mentioned roaches in the kitchen. She did send the cleaner to clean them but her response afterwards was not appropriate nor pleasant. Both Locks on door stick and when I mentioned that I  got told I was just complaining since I also said something about the roaches. She says they have company that sprayed two weeks before I was there and they were dying from that. I found 6 dead and two live along with poop.  They were all in different parts of kitchen mainly in cabinets. Book at your own risk.

Our check-in process was seamless and the location was great. Apartment was old but decently renovated. I found it a little strange that the check-out procedures were so detailed (e.g. absolutely nothing -no food or drink- should be left behind, run the dishwasher, take out all trash, set the temp to 68, put everything back where you found it, all subject to charge) but we were satisfied at first so I didn't think much of it. That being said, we found a baby roach on our first day and I sent a picture to the host to let her know that she might want to further investigate after we leave. She offered to schedule pest control and get some spray, which was very considerate although she never followed through. The problem was day 2. We continued to see baby roaches and medium-sized roaches which pointed toward an infestation. She assured me there was no infestation and claimed that bugs in Texas are common (which is not true since I'm from Texas but even if it was, does not mean we should be seeing ~10 within 24 hours in the kitchen). She offered to schedule maintenance the morning of our check-out, which was obviously unhelpful to the current situation.

We were left unsatisfied with the vague responses and lack of action the host provided, so we requested a refund and a place to relocate for the night. With that, she became very slow to respond and curt with her replies. For example, when we asked when we could expect any action, her reply was "I will see what we can do." and "As soon as a response is received." At that point I realized it was useless to try to reason with a host who was not understanding (a first for me) and denied your problem so I escalated the issue to Airbnb. In retrospect, I looked at her other reviews and there were some definite red flags I missed. One review mentions the host runs like a business which 100% sums up our interaction. No action was taken and she stopped responding to my messages altogether. Her cleaning fee of $75 was pretty unreasonable considering we spent a good chunk of time going over her procedures when we left to avoid any check-out charges. I'd advise those who are uncomfortable with roaches like I am or those who, when faced with a problem, want it addressed in a timely and respectful manner to avoid this listing and host as the situation was disastrous.

The only negative feedback I have was on the front door. The lock was not aligning with the door and we were not able to lock it from the outside.

Other than that, I think a shower curtain would reduce splashing water in the bathroom

and a curtain in the main bedroom would be nice to block out morning lights from the back door.

Me encant√≥ la casa de Maria, ten√≠a todo lo que pudieras tener en tu propia casa, la cocina muy equipada, sin lavadora de trastes pero yo no lo necesite.
Las fotos que muestra son tal cual esta la casa.
Pasamos nuestra estancia muy c√≥modos y muy a gusto. El barrio muy tranquilo y accesible de llegar

Unfortunately, we had a really terrible stay here. The wifi wasn't working in our room, to the point where we couldn't even do our work on premium wifi ($9.99+ charge).
Also, there was no balcony despite the listing showing such. Lastly, and this was quite unfortunate, our lock broke halfway through our stay and we were locked into our room for about 2 hours while the staff located someone to come get us out! We did reach out in the middle of our stay to Christian but did not hear back.

Wij (2 vrouwen) vonden de omgeving onveilig. De eerste dag zijn wij direct door een groepje bij het busstation lastig gevallen en we waren dan ook blij dat er een hek om het complex waar de airbnb zich bevond zat. Gelukkig zit het busstation naast de locatie en hebben we de dagen daarop bij het complex gewacht tot we de bus aan zagen komen. Met de bus ben je snel in de stad.
Onze kamer was prima en de badkamer was schoon. Daarentegen liep er ongedierte in de keuken.
Door het onveilige gevoel die de locatie ons gaf zouden wij deze airbnb niet weer opnieuw boeken

I go to Austin a lot for work and decided to use AirBNB for a better rate and amenities. I‚Äôll stay again, but a few complaints.

1. The directions was for driving only and not a taxi. Luckily I know the area well, but might be tricky for someone else.
2. It had bathroom supplies in the description. There was no soap/body wash. They did apologize but made no offer to provide.
3. The directions for the gym were unclear and confusing to me. It listed buildings without any type of map or key. I asked for clarity and they copied and pasted the info from check in.

Like I said, I‚Äôll stay again since it‚Äôs good value over hotels in the area, but the first time I‚Äôve not provided a 5 star review due to a few niggles that may or might not impact others

The place smelled like rotten food the sink has rotten food in it, kitchen stove was dirty, bed was uncomfortable and place was dusty, the blinds to the patio was missing like 4 pieces, over all the place was not the way it was described like the website.

Muy bonito lugar, muy buena ubiacion para nosotros. Las fotografias no demuestran lo bonito que es, super recomendable. Sandra muy atenta y muy buena anfitri√≥na. sin duda nos volveriamos a quedar ahi.

The apartment was decorated nicely, however; I was disappointed with the overall space. The apartment seemed merely "picked up" and not cleaned. There was dust on most surfaces and other peoples hair in every room...
Quick overnight stay. High points: location, coffee, porch, no tv, awoke to birdsong. I would certainly stay again though only briefly as there is no kitchen.
I was here for two weeks, and didn't want to leave! A sanctuary.

In general it was good. Distance to Austin was a negative Ie 40 mins. Walking through the the owners private space to get to my room was not comfortable. Driveway was very steep making getting in and out of car poor. However I requested minimum contact from host as writing a novel. They did that.

I didn‚Äôt actually stay in premises but for the 30 minutes I did stay, I felt very unsafe. The front door code was the same as the address number and the host refused to change the code. Windows did not lock. Roaches were found inside. Drawers needed to be fixed in the kitchen. The one, singular, sofa there, was broken. The lawn in the back was very overgrown and was not being kept up with. The neighborhood was very sketchy. Random vehicles would drive up and stop by the premises (even a white van pulled up close the entrance of the house, if that doesn‚Äôt give you red flags, I don‚Äôt know what will). Just an overall, scary and bad experience. If you‚Äôre a woman, traveling with other women, I do not recommend you to stay here. For your safety, look elsewhere.

Bed is comfortable and unit is nicely furnished, esp for the price. View is not great at all (just a solid wall across an open space, maybe 40' away). Access to Domain area is great. Wish I could consider staying here again, but I decidedly cannot...

I won't stay in another FrontDesk facility. And that is disappointing because they seem to own a lot of the places in the area. I spent an hour trying to get access to the unit/parking (they sent me the wrong door access code and I had to stand in a hallway for 15 minutes waiting to get a response/resolution) and then lots of driving around in their parking garage and going up/down stairs because the parking pass wouldn't open the gate repeatedly and the key fob only worked on some access doors. I don't blame the people (who were lovely, but I mostly got a lot of "oh no, sorry!" responses... I got a total of 7 "sorry" text messages in one evening), just their systems. Hell, had somebody offered a $20 discount for my time or some other nominal gesture of goodwill, I probably would have felt like they were feeling my pain a little. A local rep did finally offer to come out to swap cards with me and while I was waiting the 15-20 minutes for her to arrive, I found a workaround to get in so my car wouldn't get towed. It was just super frustrating and a giant time suck.

And this is nobody's fault, but just was another nail in the coffin of my experience... the LOUD building-wide fire alarm went off at 1:30am during my one-night stay that landed me and most of the other tenants on the sidewalk for half an hour while the fire department resolved it. I couldn't go back to sleep till 4am. Which means I spent 1 hour trying to get access to a place I only slept in for about 4 hours total.

This was my first trip of many (I was just assigned to a project in Austin and will be renting a place weekly for the next few months) and at least my trip there confirmed that the Domain is a great place to stay. But if you want a more personalized and well-run experience, I don't recommend a FrontDesk-operated space.

Also, if you see a contractor working on the first floor of a building doing overnight work and they're grinding concrete, but too dumb to wear a mask to protect from silica dust, they're probably also too dumb to cover the smoke detector or put the building fire alarm into test mode. Wish I'd made that logic connection at 9pm, not 1:30am.

Frontdesk has to be by far the worst Airbnb experience that I have had to date. The management is highly incompetent and their business model for their rental units can be understood to be completely money driven and lack professionalism. As a hospitality company, I believe they completely missed the mark for what it means to work in hospitality.

My experience:

Came to the unit for my check in, to find that the checkin code was wrong. The unit is located in an apartment building, and had spotty cell phone service. I tried to get onto the unit's wifi given the "detailed instructions" that Frontdesk provided - again, the wrong information.

I ended up waiting out on the hallway put on hold with the agents at Frontdesk for 45 minutes, to receive several wrong door codes while I was still frantically trying to resolve the issue on my side of things. 45 minutes later, they finally gave a code that worked.

WIFI password was never given to me correctly, I had to figure that out myself.

The condo is much smaller than the photos would suggest. The kitchen is so small that two guests cannot work there at the same time. The apartment is full of food, beverages, and other belongings. It is unclear which items are there for the use of the Airbnb guests and which are for the use of the owners.

Fortuntely, I checked in early, but unfortunately, I had to cancel due to the place being unprepared.

Also, smoking is allowed outside, close to the windows (not inside the propety), in case you're allergic.

Pouyan's apartment is close to the airport, the bedroom is confortable and the communication with Pouyan was fine.

The only hiccup was that is was not easy to find Pouyan's apartment in the large apartment complex.

The location was the only good part about this house.

The house was not cleaned before we checked in. We found a dead roach in the master bedroom within 10 minutes of checking in. We found 3 roaches in the kitchen and one in the master bathroom. The house obviously had a roach infestation and nothing was done about it. We booked the house because it had a pool and a jacuzzi. The jacuzzi didn‚Äôt work at all and everything was was cold and we couldn‚Äôt use any of it. After reaching out to the host about the issues. I was sent a video to try and fix the equipment out back which was not my job and didn‚Äôt work. And nothing was don‚Äôt about the roaches . At the end I was refunded $300 out of the $4000 I paid for the weekend. Whatever you do don‚Äôt rent from them!!!!! Don‚Äôt rent from this company!!!!! STAY AWAY!!!!

I really had high hopes to give this house 5 stars, but unfortunately I cannot.

Check-in was easy, and at first glance everything seemed fine. The space was adequate for our 6 adults and 2 children. However, during our quick 3 night stay, we discovered some problems.

There were some minor housekeeping issues, such as lack of hand and dish soap and paper towels, and the owners were quickly responsive and had a solution. It was difficult finding clean utensils and pots/pans in the kitchen, but we made it work. Some stains were found on the towels. At check-out, we threw all the trash and recycles outside in the bins, but for some reason they were all full already and didn‚Äôt seem to be emptied recently.

Most disturbingly, LARGE COCKROACHES WERE FOUND! According to the owners this happens when it‚Äôs cold outside (December)‚Ä¶ so I suggest not staying there when there is any cold weather!
Extended a third time, can't recommend this place enough.

Beautiful apartment in a very convenient location, but the most infuriating experience I've had since joining the Airbnb app.

What the listing doesn't tell you is you are required to provide the host with both your email and phone number (as they remain anonymous behind their "EA Rentals" name). This contact information is used to spam you with tediously specific instructions on how to circumnavigate a variety of obstacles which clearly indicate that the building owners don't intend for tenants to be renting out their places. Among these instructions are details on how to download, install, and register with the phone app Pavel invites you to which is required to open doors and use elevators in the building (more on that later), a request that guests don't mention to the concierge that they are staying at an Airbnb, and a completely flawed procedure on how to get the falsely advertised "free on-premesis parking". I was fairly busy before check-in and I had to pause what I was doing in several instances to coordinate arrival times, provide additional contact information, and confirm I received app invites.

The app to open doors was a pain to figure out and on multiple occasions we had to ask for help from people who live in the building (just to watch them struggle with the same thing). Cell service in the garage was bad, amplifying the annoyance. Worst of all, the "free parking" required that we use a key card on exit, but the terminal said something along the lines of "user has already left the building" and I ended up having to pay $48 for the night before bringing the keycard back upstairs to the apartment!

This place is a hassle and I would recommend avoiding it. I'm currently traveling across the entire country; I've stayed in cities in every state across the periphery of the US and I've never once had to jump through so many hoops to go to bed.

Post was a bit misleading with the home being touching distance from the host‚Äôs home. You are also in a very heavily gentrified area. It‚Äôs a rough neighborhood and then bam huge modern home. House was awesome and clean but just felt extremely uncomfortable.

I‚Äôll start with the good: the apartment was exactly as pictured in the listing. They had a few kitchen utensils and supplies but no spices, which is fine. The beds were comfy, but master shower was dirty.

However, I wouldn‚Äôt recommend a family stay here. We use a white noise machine for our baby while sleeping to help drown out noises commonly experienced in an apartment. The machine is quieter than a washing machine or dishwasher and it was setting off the alerts on noise detection devices installed in bedrooms. They messaged me and called throughout the night when we were all sleeping to inform me their alarms were going off. After the first time explaining, I would have expected the customer service staff to make a note to ignore any further false alarms. They instructed me to unplug the device but it was screwed into the wall and I didn‚Äôt have a screwdriver. They continued to call and message at night. We did not feel welcome here. :(

Since the moment we got there we had nothing but issues. The house was dirty and poorly equipped upon arrival. There was‚Ä¶

1) Old dog poop IN (the restroom across from the guest rooms) and outside of the house.
2) There was some pink sticky stuff on the living room rug (we noticed it while trying to move the wooden stools)
3) There was a water leak in the driveway
4) The windows were installed incorrectly and would not properly lock, unlock or open.
5) The drain in the master bathroom would not drain flooding the entire restroom within minutes
6) The main lock to the front door would not lock or unlock, and my husband had to fix it
7) There were scuff marks on the walls and dust under the TV
8) They shut off our water Saturday night and my husband had to go out to buy water bottles for us to use when brushing our teeth and cleaning our faces.

THEN they refused to offer ANY kind of accommodation or refund.
DO NOT BOOK THIS PLACE! IT IS NOT WORTH YOUR MONEY! High disappointed.

Pros:
- clean
- roomy
- parking
- Netflix included
- gym (no pull up though)

Cons:
- extra signup forms
- no flexible exit time (asked before exit date, wanted 45 usd for an extra 1.5 hours for a meeting I had to take)
- building door didn't work all 3 days of stay
- a bit far from the center (not too bad though).
- no kitchen essentials (salt or pepper for example)
This is a corporate listing. You‚Äôll have to sign a very long contract to stay with Cozy suites. Building was not as nice as expected. Hallway was stinky. Actual apartment was clean and as pictured.

Tuvimos problemas para hacer el check in debido a que no ten√≠an la unidad limpia y lista . Tuvimos que esperar 7 horas para poder entrar en otra unidad que nos dieron porque la que hab√≠amos escogido nunca la pudieron limpiar. Tuvimos problemas con el sensor de ruido en la sala que fallaba y dec√≠a que est√°bamos haciendo ruido y nosotros est√°bamos durmiendo. El lugar es agradable, espacioso y las facilidades del complejo son tal como dicen. Tienen muy buena comunicaci√≥n y responden r√°pido.

This apartment is in a nice location in the hills of Austin. The first apartment I booked was not available at the last minute and we were forced to go to another unit with one less bathroom. Unfortunately no one inspected that apartment before we arrived.  There was no heat or hot water. It took a long time to reach maintenance. We ended up moving to another apartment late at night because the water heater could not be repaired. The third apartment was nice and updated but it did not have a key fob for the amenities such as the pool and gym. Overall it was a bad experience.

room and duplex were disgusting. smelled really bad, carpets were badly stained throughout the house. bad neighborhood. House also smelled like weed. bed looked sunken in and lumpy. host had conflicting information about check in times and was very difficult to get ahold of. I refused to stay here and got a refund.

This room at Timothy‚Äôs house was absolutely terrible for my stay. The worst Airbnb I‚Äôve ever stayed in, by a mile. Yes, it‚Äôs cheap. I stayed for one week, and the whole house was pretty filthy and run down. I counted 3 or 4 dead cockroaches sitting around. Multiple beetles crawling around by kitchen sink.

The house isn‚Äôt really well equipped at all. No trash can in my room or bathroom. No paper towels or kitchen towels to even dry my hands. Lack of kitchen utensils. Weird smell throughout house. Wifi not very fast in my room.

The neighborhood is not that great, for those unfamiliar with Austin. The Lamar and Rundberg intersection area is relatively unsafe.

Timothy was also rude to me in person, and plays annoying rock music at midnight that was audible from my room. Avoid at all costs!

Do not stay here. On arrival, the host hadn‚Äôt yet made the bed or prepared for a guest. Looking around, it resembled a depressed adolescents man cave. A faint stench of weed gave an insight into a careless life with little experience of looking after themselves, let alone hosting. The walls were a patchwork of dirt and mould resembling a rather crude Jackson Pollock piece. Hair balls littered the carpets in the hallways, dust covered every surface and a layer of grime covered the kitchen.

After hastily making the bed and ‚Äòcleaning‚Äô the host kindly offered me a trip to the supermarket. I, in an attempt to give him the benefit of the doubt, accepted. He dropped me off and we arranged to meet each other outside the front in 20 minutes. I hastily did my shopping in an attempt to be outside before the aforementioned meeting time. Little did I know that an hour and a half later, with no phone signal and no means of getting home, he would still not be there. Confused and lost, I had to figure out a way to get Wifi (from a lovely security guard) and order myself an Uber.

Shocking experience from start to finish. Do not stay here.
Very disappointed. House was deficient as to furnishings, maintenance, appliances, cleanliness. In this condition it should NOT be held out as a comparable place to stay.
Old house, bad Hvac, not friendly corporate overlords

When I arrived, the room had not been cleaned. I called the host and he took responsibility immediately and got the room clean before I got back to the room from my meeting. Nobody's perfect, but the test is what happens when things aren't perfect. Shmuel was stellar.

It was a nice little stay, the power did go out 2-3 times but they said they‚Äôre gonna fix it and the water went out once for a little bit came back on. Both the water and electricity came on fairly quick so no big deal

El departamento est√° muy bonito y limpio , el ba√±o contaba con gran variedad de art√≠culos para nuestra estad√≠a: jab√≥n, shampoo, pasta dental y mas productos , el departamento tambi√©n contaba con lavadora y secadora , todo era genial , lo √∫nico que yo le recomendar√≠a a Mimi es tener una plancha para la ropa , en general el apartamento ten√≠a todo lo necesario para una gran estad√≠a.
Otra cosa que necesitas considerar es rentar un carro para poder llegar al apartamento y desplazarte dentro del fraccionamiento, ya que si no llevas carro y prefieres la opci√≥n de un Uber este tardara demasiado tiempo en llegar (20 min o m√°s), ya que no es una zona muy concurrida por los Ubers.

The only negative thing I had to say is we thought we'd have 1 king bed and 1 queen, but we had 2 queen. The beds were uncomfortable but everything else was fine.

Sadly, it was just so dirty. Dust everywhere, grime on all of the living room surfaces, floors hadn‚Äôt been cleaned. We found multiple clear baggies that contained dirty blue gloves for some reason.

On top of that, we had no issue with this but it did worry me that when we walked in the first thing we saw was a girl crying and telling someone over the phone that something bad had happened in the parking garage but there were no cameras so there was nothing to be done. Un anfitri√≥n excelente, cada vez que pueda recomendar√© sin dudar este alojamiento, es calidad de servicios.
Charges extra for early check-in or late check-out yet they were late proving the keys to the place. Had to wait 30min in the lobby.

The room and roof deck was nice and as pictured, the experience from booking to check out made me wish I had stayed in a hotel in another part of town. Loud construction and no sidewalks around the building, no one to call if anything needed, slow elevators and very large tall building, no option to cancel even months before the stay (especially stressful during this time of flight cancellations and sickness going around) and the threat around large fines coupled with trash in the bin and under the bed when I arrived was annoying.

Neighborhood feels dystopian between the construction and wild clubs with drunk people everywhere and super loud music from every bar on the street. Not a bad location to walk around town, parking is expensive. I‚Äôd stay in a hotel if in Austin again and skip this mediocre AirBNB. This experience honestly made me question if I would ever stay in an AirBNB again, think I‚Äôll spring for hotels or VRBO in future for a less stressful and nicer experience.

Do not ever book from this person. Falsely advertised dates. We could not check in to our first night due to a faulty key fob with only vague help after hours of waiting in a parking garage. We had to go to a hotel.    She really put us in a bad situation being forced to change our checkout dates. She said it was out of her control. We had to do a lot of unnecessary work moving out a week early and frustratingly, I had to spend a week through messaging just trying to get reimbursed  for money that was already owed to us. .  It was a huge waste of our time and effort.  She never offered compensation for this mismanaged stay.  Don‚Äôt waste your time with her listings, she‚Äôs not competent.

Sadly the apartment wasnt in the clean state it should have been.. floors had a unruly amounts of dirt on the floors, within seconds our feet were absolutely disgusting. I had to wash multiple dishes that were "quote u. Quote" clean all very dirty..
The blanket was very thin. And only having 2 towels was a tad ridiculous, there wasnt even bath mats hand towels kitchen towels... there was not silverware container no way to make ice. Chair was broken and my mom almost fell out of it. At 1st no wifi but the Host quickly resolved it.

The ads photos and description ddont completely match actually they dont match at all.

Dirty, lots of maintenance required, Host provided poor service initially, and should have been described as such but wasn't.

It had the following issues:

The only issue I had was that the door to the back patio was broken and wouldn‚Äôt stay shut, so I would come back to the unit and the door would be slightly open or wake up in the morning with the door open.

This is a sublet. You will not receive the ease or convenience of a hotel or the home-like experience of a typical Airbnb. They did not communicate when the apartment was not ready and we waited in the cold an hour, hoping for the key code, dragging luggage around the streets.  They were short staffed on cleaners but not in office people. We spoke with three different people through text, phone, & email but they weren‚Äôt all on the same page. The furniture is cheap and sparse. The cabinets empty, no salt or plastic wrap‚Äîor any typical non-hotel conveniences you go to an Airbnb for. The huge empty master closet makes you feel like you are in transition. The patio door did not latch and when I replied to a welcome text which asked how the place was,  I got another automated welcome text instead of resolution. There was horrible thick plastic on the bed and pillows which was extremely uncomfortable and hot, crackly noise when you moved. Thin sheets that had over-perfumed detergent smell.

Madalynn es muy amable y responde muy rapido. Sin embargo la unidad esta en condiciones lamentables no aptas para rentar. El basurero de la cocina estaba lleno hasta el tope, las papeleras de los ba√±os llenas, la estufa manchada, los gabinetes de la cocina con residuos de comida y sucios. Los ba√±os manchados de oxido en tina, griferias y tuberia, alfombra de ducha plastica sucia y con manchas grandes amarillas oscuras, cortinas sucias. Las paredes tienen muchos clavos y ganchos, huecos y manchas de liquidos que se han chorreado miy desagradables. La pintura esta en pesimo estado. Piso sucio de mal aspecto. Unit was reasonably clean, floors had not been vacuumed, mold in showers, furniture had wear.
The noise sensor was awful, we turned on the dishwasher and subsequently received several texts that were threatening, disconcerting and down right abusive. The texts threatened us with calling the police and evicting us all because the dishwasher was loud enough to trigger the bot texts. We were two older gentleman who were trying to have a nice Valentines dinner/evening, no music just conversation and the texts ruined it as they were abusive. I called the number they gave with no answer, after about thirty minutes someone called back and said they had no record of theses texts. She did cal back about thirty minutes after that and explained that they had no control over these texts and could do nothing about them. The abusive texts continued through the night into the wee mornings hours after we had gone to bed waking me up every 30 minutes.

The overall experience was good! Just a few things that I did not enjoy.

First, front desk kept sending me text about the sound in the apartment being to loud. At one point they even called me. My self and my wife had the TV on playing music while cooking dinner.

Come to find out there was a noise device in the living room. They even called me when we were out to dinner (everything in the apartment was turned off).

Second, the beds are hard and very uncomfortable.

I would stay here again but I would have to unplug the noise device. I did not appreciate the call or texts‚Ä¶

The place is very nice and spotless. The reason I wouldn‚Äôt recommend is because it is missing a lot of important details. For example, there were no napkins , so we had to use toilet paper as napkins, and to clean the counters after breakfast. They only give you one pillow per person, which unusual in an airbnb, is necessary to hve two options. The lamps in the bedroom did not work. We got a replacement the next day in the afternoon, still small details that shouldn‚Äôt go unnoticed. You only get one hand towel, there should be at least two, in case one gets dirty. The kitchen has a Nespresso, but no coffee pods. There was a coffee bag but no coffee maker. No sugar, no oil. The house sleeps four, but there is only sitting for two in the kitchen, no coffee table in the tv room.  Also no tv remote, had to request one. I would highly suggest that they get a keypad lock on the condo door, and avoid this checkin hassle for future guests. It's so nice to just to do a self checkin, without appointments and hassle, especially after a long travel day.

For those with skin sensitivities, the sheets are made from a very itchy polyester material, and not cotton. Also, the soaps/detergents used are all harsh chemical based, bring your own soaps/detergents.

The house was clean and comfortable. Unfortunately, the house is managed by a large impersonal company that denied every request we made.We asked to check-in hour earlier and were denied. We asked to check out a little later, (in a thunderstorm) denied. We ran out of toilet paper on day 2 and had to Uber to the store to purchase. The dining chairs were actually dangerously rickety and unstable. Would not recommend sitting on them. We provided feedback to the management company regarding this hazard. Finally, we never could figure out how to turn on the television which was frustrating. The actual owners seemed very nice and welcoming (they were in a back house) however, they were not the people who we made requests or queries to.  I had to reach out for the door code as it was not included in the Airbnb information and the initial code was frustratingly incorrect.

We had a few issues with this place.  The stopper in one of the sinks in the bathroom is not working.  Once it has been pushed down to hold water it wont push back up.  Its obvious this has been an issue as the stopper plate in the sink has knife marks all over it as guests have had to pry it up.  The toilet seat does not fit the toilet.  It is smaller than the toilet and moves side to side when using and the toilet lid falls and hits you in the back when in use.  Very frustrating.  there is only one towel bar in the bath room and no hooks to hang additional towels or robes.  We used the beach towels and there was no where to hang dry them.  They promised a sample bar soap and roll of paper towels as an amenity that were no there.  There is no coffee maker.  They provide an espresso machine but no espresso cups.  Had to uber to Target to purchase.  They sell coffee downstairs but its not cheap.  The bed pillows are so overstuffed we couldnt use them.

I would find something else. Shirley‚Äôs place was unpleasant from the moment I booked. Please know after booking & paying, apparently the booking isn‚Äôt confirmed until a lengthy third party contract is signed. You‚Äôre almost forced into signing it as you can‚Äôt cancel booking via airbnb (to get refunded) and yet it wasn‚Äôt considered confirmed by Shirley until her contact was signed. This was never mentioned on her booking profile - I would have passed immediately.

Beyond that, my sister and I ended up having a safety issue upon the first night. We checked in, dropped off our luggage, noted how dirty the place was & smelled of weed, and went to dinner. When we returned, the TV was on. We never touched the tv/remote prior. Additionally the sliding glass door was unlocked (we never touched the door prior). This was very unnerving.

Lastly, the place was DIRTY. There was a wad of dried toilet paper on the bathroom‚Äôs ceiling. Stains on the carpet. Very far from pictured or advertised.
The location is incredible, and the place is as-advertised.  The parking situation is slightly confusing at first, but you‚Äôll be able figure it out.  Would book again the next time I‚Äôm in Austin.

This Airbnb is decent! Two friends and I stayed there for three nights- a girls weekend in Austin. It is a fun location! But the space is very sparse and not the most welcoming. We also went on a cold weekend and we're very cold at night , but maybe we didn't use the thermostat correctly.

So much went wrong here. To begin with, the address that was given was incorrect and not descriptive so it was difficult to find the correct place. Then, the bathroom. Not to mention, the room was very stuffy and hard to breathe in. Finally, the host pushed back our initial check in time and moved up our check out time. Overall, very lacking as it seemed like only the bare minimum was being done. Never staying here again.

You guys are the best. So flexible and accommodating on a hellish day for me as my husband and I got married day before and we now have to be apart for 6 months. I appreciated being able to ugly cry whilst binge watching shows and ordering take out

The place‚Äôs hallways are kind of creepy and the location isn‚Äôt the best, but the apartment itself was nice and spacious.

My low rating is due to the fact that the host accused me of losing the key fob and parking pass‚Ä¶ I assured the owner that we had left all items in the correct spot, multiple times. But the host persisted that I would need to either pay a fee or return the items.

Only when I told the host to ask her staff for picture proof that the items were not there, did she listen to me and find out that both the key fob and parking pass were in-fact exactly where I said they were.

Upon arrival, we noticed a musty smell. The bathroom had not been cleaned from the previous guest. Drew did clean it while  we ran to the store. There were 3 bath towels and 2 hand towels for 2 adults taking 4 showers. we used 1 bath towel as a bath mat. Quick dry towels would have been bette  due to the dampness of the room. There was no hair dryer, as stated. i would have brought one, had i known. The rug next to the bed was filthy. it hadn't been cleaned either. The bed, while comfortable, was noisy! Every movement made it squeak. The dust under the bed was thick. We wore slides the whole time. there was no broom to clean up the leaves and dirt we walked in with. There was a coffee pot, but there was no plug near to use it. We ended up putting it on top of the toaster oven (which was also dirty), on top of the refrigerator. There was a picture sitting on the floor.  The room could use more flat top space.  I manage hotels and do not recommend staying here.
Great location for Oak Hill vicinity. Quiet and no issues. Great for no more than 2 people.

The place was basically just ok. We were disappointed that it was not as shown in the pictures.  It felt cold and had broken things (screen on back slider and towel rack) It was not very clean. Back patio would have been nice to sit in, but it was dirty and no broom to sweep it. Arrived to find only 2 bath towels, no washcloths or hand towels. Host said some would be there promptly the next day, however I had to contact him again at 6pm the next night and finally got extra towels after 7pm. There was excessive noise from unit upstairs. This was not the hosts' fault, but the noise made it nearly impossibleto sleep.  I'm sure Hunter is a fine person and probably just inexperienced in the hospitality industry. If you're a 20 something guy who is looking for a bare bones experience, this would be a perfect place for you.

We reached the place around 11 PM which is way past our check-in time. It should've given them enough time to clean up. The house was not cleaned after the previous guests left. Trash was everywhere. No sheets on the bed. Floor and kitchen counters was dirty. It was disgusting.

In the first unit the dish washer was not working and nor was the garbage disposal. So we were left with a mountain of dirty dishes to wash in the bathroom?? They moved us to a second unit where the washer and dryer was not working.  It‚Äôs an old run down apartment complex in constant need of maintenance.

El lugar esta muy limpio, bonito y c√≥modo. Pero tuvimos una mala experiencia porque no tuvimos agua ni en la cocina ni en la regadera no pudimos ba√±arnos, nos dijeron que mandar√≠an a alguien de mantenimiento para arreglarlo y nunca se presento nadie, tambi√©n tienes que tomar en cuenta que tienes hacer casi todo el proceso por medio de otra pagina que manejan ellos y pagar un dep√≥sito extra directo a ellos.
Would not recommend.

The communication from evonify was very good. When the cleaner didn‚Äôt leave enough toilet paper someone came quickly to bring more. The beds were comfortable.

However, the photos and description did not match the place. It is a very rundown building in an area of town that I would not stay again. The building is not well lit and the instructions were not accurate for locking and unlocking the door. The bathroom had weird stains on the countertops and floor. The place was very bare bones and cheaply decorated. The sheets were older as well as the towels and needing replacement. We arrived at night and the instructions about location to find the unit were not in the description. It looks like a very rundown motel. We felt unsafe as we are 3 female travelers. I have used Airbnb for years this was my worst experience

*RENTERS BEWARE* PLEASE READ THIS!! Terrible host. If I could leave 0 stars I would.
For starters, when my family and I arrived there was no running water. After making this complaint to the host, she decided to ignore the issue and instead gaslit me by stating that I broke the rules by bringing my pets. On top of these two red flags, the apartment complex was dirty, lacking privacy, and full of noisy neighbors that stayed up all night blasting music and partying. It was an uncomfortable and unsafe stay for my family and my pets. DO NOT BOOK WITH THIS HOST.

It has a lot of potential to be a good stay but just had a bad experience. The place was not cleaned before our arrival (sticky and dirty floors, the couch smelled,  no towels, dishwasher wasn‚Äôt emptied, and previous tenants personal items were left). Cobran deposito y aun no me devuelven el dinero de un arriendo anterior, demoran mucho en esto, creo que son de los pocos que cobran depositos, no los recomiendo por eso, hay varios arriendo mas sin depositos y al mismo precio

Apartment building close to downtown. Kind of noisey being these are units that are older and in an older building. The leasing agent tried to approach me after I checked in and was grabbing my bags out of the car. Per instructions I didn‚Äôt mention I booked through air BNb (weird encounter having the lie to someone) Tried to charge me for a new microwave when I never used the microwave. The place was great! The only issue I had were with loud, dirty, inconsiderate neighbors. Quite a few left trash that smelled & leaked for days. This is no fault of the listing. Just how it is in Austin I guess

I appreciated the quiet neighborhood and it‚Äôs close proximity to town. However, I don‚Äôt like that after making my booking, I was required to pay a $100 deposit before getting my check in instructions. The money was refunded but that should have been on the listing page instead of a surprise requirement after booking.

The apartment was not very clean. The bathroom specifically! The bath tub was worn out with a rusted drainage, the toilet seat was not clean and I had to clean off stains with my Clorox. The sink drainage was bad so whenever I opened the tap, water wouldn‚Äôt go down fast and end up sitting in the sink for a while.

My friend and I chose this place because the pictures show a very big mirror and large sink space for two people in a spacious bathroom but the bathroom was really small with a mid sized mirror and sink for one person. The pictures are not very accurate. The living room couch also had a weird smell.

This place was not a good value. We were in a hurry and needed a place for a few nights and unfortunately selected this place. The location was bad, the neighborhood was not a good place. The water was shut off for a full day of our stay. Someone tried to come into the house without knocking to deliver lightbulbs. We had no idea who they were, they just tried to walk in. The check in process was smooth, we had issues on our own end and the team was quick to help us resolve the problems. Unfortunately, We would not stay here again.

I have stayed with Envoy in the past at this same development in an alternate apartment. They have good rates and the apartments typically serve it‚Äôs purpose . However I am sad to say I will not be staying at this particular location. Unfortunately there was a ROACH ü™≥ infestation. Dead ROACH ü™≥ in the fridge and ROACHES crawling around in the kitchen and Living Room! This is not to bash the company however ROACHES are truly unacceptable!!!!

There are several broken or malfunctioning items. For one, the refrigerator door does not close properly, the towel bar in the bathroom is not fastened to the wall and will break off when attempting to use to hang a towel. There was an outlet by the bed that did not function.

Most importantly, there is a rodent problem. While probably legally mandated, there are rodent traps throughout the area outside, and that should have tipped us off. On the last day of our stay, we heard and saw rodents;we were awoken we by the clearly audible sound of something dragging the bag of chips across the counter and then dropping into the kitchen sink. Upon investigation, we found the bag of chips with in the sink with bite marks in the bag. The next morning, while practicing yoga, I finally saw the mouse run across the living room and into the kitchen where it disappeared.

We requested a partial refund, but they refused. AirBnB gave a modest refund, though.

When we entered the Airbnb, there was smelly water on the kitchen floor. We later realized it was because the dishwasher was broken and had brown sitting water at the bottom. The bathroom towel rod was broken, and the kitchen stove/oven didn‚Äôt work. We were disappointed we couldn‚Äôt use anything there. The only saving grace was that the host was responsive and nice.

Cute place. Says ‚Äúdogs allowed‚Äù but clearly needs to take it off. The house has plumbing issues!!!! Bad. The backyard stinks like waste. It rained the entire time and everyone that enjoyed the backyard would smell like waste (poop). The first toilet clogged, early into my stay. Then the second toilet clogged in about 4 days. It was disgusting. The backyard smelled like waste, the toilets were backed up, and now she‚Äôs trying to charge me 2,100 for washing her cheap sheets from Walmart. Which has all the waste mud from the backyard. I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôve gagged as much as I gagged at this place. It‚Äôs just gross. Unless you like the smell of waste. Never again. Get a plumber!!!
a great place to stay when in Austin. very quiet neighborhood, close to the airport, but close enough to downtown that it never felt like a long journey.

When I arrived at 4 cleaning hadn‚Äôt even begun, I came back around an hour later and cleaning was still not finished though I don‚Äôt know what took her so long, considering there were still candy wrappers on the floor from the previous renter. The dishwashing machine is leaking water from the last people, and when I come, the water is start to smell horrible! We have to wait 3 days after for the fixing. During that day, we have to keep cleaning the leaking water.!
The oven is sometimes stuck in the control and we have to find a way to fix it.

Haben sehr gute Anweisungen von Evonify erhalten.etwas seltsam war, dass wir trotzdem, das wir schon bezahlt hatten eine safe deposit hinterlegen mussten.

Fue una experiencia muy agradable, la casa esta muy grande cupimos 15 personas sin problema, el que hay 5 ba√±os fue incre√≠ble por la agilidad para todos estar listos.

I‚Äôm sure the host is a good person but this place is a dump. The door has been kicked in and ‚Äúrepaired‚Äù, there was dirty towels with human waste on them. The couch and sheets had stains. Left as soon as we found another place to stay

The location was beautiful. The Airbnb was adorable!


The host accommodated my early check in request, which was very nice.

Overall was a great experience


I liked that they had dishes and appliances but some of the amenities didn‚Äôt work which was a bit disappointing.

Also one of the bedrooms has questionable staining upon arrival, I only needed one bed so I just slept in the other room but I thought with the cleaning fee it was a bit unfair.

Mostly enjoyed my stay here. Nothing fancy but the interior is nice. Had some problems with air conditioning that were not ideal but sometimes problems happen.
Place is as described and is nice the only l am upset about us a bad smell on the room . Seems like cleaning wasn‚Äôt done properly and someone left dirty socks and trash under the bed .

The space is very minimally outfitted and could use with a few more personal touches so the space doesnt seem so empty. The location is good and is in a very walkable part of Austin. Please note that the space is right across the street from a fire station, which mean that there are sirens going off multiple times a night. In general, I had a hard time sleeping in the unit because of the siren and the very soft bed. If you are a heavy sleeper, I am sure you could learn to drown it out.

the apartment is good price/quality, and covers everything you need, but at the same time it has small stuff that bothers on a day to day basis.

you can't comfortably wash your head in the shower if you are taller than 5 foot, in my case it went straight to the shoulder and i had to almost sit down to wash my hair.

also, the kitchen is well equiped ( except the scissors), but most of the stoves are inclined on different angles, so oil goes to only a side of a pan and food gets cooked at different speed, which is really bothering

When we got there, there was no remote to the TV, which also had no buttons to be able to change the volume or channels or anything like that so both it and the kitchen stove were unusable, and he did nothing to fix it and then upon checkout, there was a guest  to check in right at checkout time which I Don‚Äôt understand. Then a few days after checking out and the other guest staying there probably not through Airbnb since he was there at our checkout time, he then filed a claim for damages resulting from a mess of some sort that I don‚Äôt understand because all I saw was pictures were water on some stuff that couldn‚Äôt be damaged by water. The entire experience was just unbelievably inconvenient, and then the claim he filed afterwards was  just flat out absurd. This is my first experience with  Airbnb after so many recommendations to use it rather than hotels from various people. Hi extremely disappointed I don‚Äôt know how this works. How‚Äôs someone like this is allowed to do business on this site.

checking in was a issue. there is some images on where the parking is at but not exactly on the map. even then, the parking can be full from other guests. The place has the bare minimum for any amenities. he bet sheet did have bugs on it. presented it to the host in the house. dismissed it as harmless. check the towels and there was dead bugs on the to again, the host did not respond back for the entire day. only then when I complain that's for partial refund due to pest issue. neighbor's dogs barking morning and night you can hear the footsteps of the neighbor above you and when people open the door and close an apartment next.. I've told the host I would like to leave earlier than my stay because the lack solving issues as I presented. Was looking forward to getting in to this abnb while in Austin, very disappointed, to say the least.
Fleas on bed and bathroom, got biten twice

Basic place for what host charges, this is worth 20 a day, if you are desperate.

Do not reserve this place, it is not what it says it is on her listing.

Terrible. Terrible. Terrible. I can‚Äôt give zero stars but this was a zero star experience. Please be advised these properties are not in the best area of Austin. ‚ÄúEveryone is raving about the convenient location, cozy atmosphere, and amazing customer service‚Äù, bold face lie.  You do not want this to be your first taste of what Austin has to offer. From walking into a dirty apartment, to the lack of communication, attempted break in, and lack of empathy, I‚Äôm not sure where to start. Upon arrival to a dirty Airbnb, Mayer offered to move me to a new property. Later that night somebody tried to break in. I immediately contacted Mayer and explained to her what unfolded. She responded by saying nobody else had the code and was I sure that happened‚Ä¶and to take the smart lock off because she wants it‚Ä¶ she then stopped responding altogether. So, I reached out to support because I no longer felt safe and Mayer was of no help. I left that night.  Revolting experience all the way around.

The parking situation was a bit unclear where to park because there were no signs but after like 15 minutes we figured it out it was written on the floor.  When we came in everything seemed to be clean and neat. but then noticed roaches came out one by one. We ended up killing about 30 roaches  Then it came time to go to bed and noticed that  the sheets were not clean. They had hair everywhere. Also  seems like whatever was on someone feet walking barefoot goign on the bed. My boyfriend and I had to sleep on the couch which was very uncomfortable. She did have good communication until the last part when I told her the problems we had and said she could help  me with a refund of the cleaning fee and that her sheets are always clean. I feel like she didnt have to say that comment because they were obviously not clean. Her response to the roaches was that since it was low season that is why the roaches were out. I do not recommend staying . No rest. Not clean.

no toilet paper, no hand soap

I struggled with the cleanliness of this Airbnb. The bed was amazingly comfortable! However I was disappointed that the Airbnb looked nothing like the pictures posted, it wasn't even the same layout, so that's kind of deceiving. The walls had a bunch of black marks and the couch had questionable white stains. Although the bathtub was clean, there were toothpaste globs on the back of the door. I hate to leave a bad review, but I just want to be honest.

The loaction was great, however the rest of the place was not. There was mold in all the airducts, on the ceiling, in the shower, and in the kitchen. There was a homeless man behind that house that screamed very loud around 2 am. The fire alarms in the home did not have any batteries in them. There was hair found in the towels.
