16 stories above Austin - Able to see the convention center (attended business conference) and was able to gauge the traffic from the walkout balcony

Nice location. Mediocre hospitality. Noise from outside was a bit much. They charge $50-$200 for late checkout, even though I reached out about having a late flight that pushed my checkin time after 8pm. I'm not very forgiving of the corporate hosts, since their processes should be tighter. I find that the individual hosts strike the right tone on Airbnb. The rigidity from Kasa and the forced reservation alterations in advance was a bit annoying.

I'm a superhost and never charge for late checkouts. You know: Because Airbnb is supposed to be different. Even hotels are more flexible about late checkouts than these people.

The key card didn't always work. The unit was tidy. Didn't use the amenities.

I was skeptical upon booking since this was a new host with no reviews, but pictures, location and price were good, so I decided to give him a chance. We arrived at time communicated to host. Instructions were incomplete so unable to get in the building.  I msgd host, but he didn‚Äôt respond. Luckily a resident let us in and we were able to go to the room. The space was great and as pictured, but trash was overflowing and all linens were dirty. Noticed old food in refrigerator.  I immediately messaged host, but did not get a response so I put all the linens in the washing machine myself.  He called 2 hrs later, apologized and said I could cancel, but I did not want to try to find another place when I had already paid for this one.  He said he would buy our dinner the next day.  Msg him later when there were no Wi-Fi instructions, but he never responded, so no internet or tv.  Hot tub was not hot. No coffee maker. Dishes dirty, no detergent. Great space, bad host.

As promised in the photos. Water pressure in shower was bomb üí£ :)

Helpful hosts.

Close to expressway

Will def stay again if in the area.

Ryan es muy atento, su apartamento es impecable y todo es tal cual se anuncia en la p√°gina. Todo estaba en orden y la ubicaci√≥n nos fue muy √∫til. Un detalle es que el apartamento queda un piso hacia abajo y no hay ascensor.
Lo recomiendo ampliamente para hospedarse c√≥modamente.

My stay was scheduled after the weekend after the ice storm in Austin. There were reports of 140,000 home and businesses without power.

We drove in 3 hours, and within 10 minutes of being in the city, the first power outage happened at the restaurant. Within 30 minutes of checking into the unit the first power outage occurred. When I asked the concierge, he said it had been happening all day. When I spoke to Vacasa Friday morning and again Friday before departing, they lied and said there hadn't been any power issues.

While the length of the outage was short, I understand from the concierge that it had been happening all day. This was also the case at the pizza place and grocery store we went to with one outage lasting at least 15 to 20 minutes.

My frustration is due to the fact that I tried to be proactive when I was informed of the large and individuals who are not even in the city are making uninformed decisions

Valet only parking is also ridiculous!
It is not worth it, the pool is closed, the spaces are very small and there is no where to park unless you want to pay extra 40 USD per night. Not worth it.

Great location, very nice facility and the room was what we were expecting. Not a complaint about Vacasa necessarily, but one thing that was a little disappointing was the shower. It's formatted as a "walk in" shower, so no closing door or curtain. It was a 6 foot wide shower and the splash barrier was only 3' so it was literally impossible to bathe without getting a significant amount of water splashed on the floor of the restroom so we had to pile up towels to keep it soaked up.

Outside of that, the place and service was perfect.
So good we were sad to leave.

it's as advertised. extremely busy building so there was no room at the pool on a nice day. it's a bit off of the path with some bad sidewalks so don't plan on walking there with your suitcases. you can't check in till 4PM and the check out time is 10am. honestly for the price, location and convenience I'd probably stay at a hotel over this airbnb again.
Young, inexperienced staff at front desk seemed overwhelmed and did not provide the best customer service. Condo itself was very clean and spacious.

The property was excellent, better than expected. Clean, modern, beautiful pool and fitness area, all amenities you would need. Found it extremely difficult to buy Nespresso pods so wasn‚Äôt able to use the coffee make which was a shame. The Vacassa online communication device was terrible. I was misinformed on numerous occasions so advice either call Vacassa or speak to the building direct as you will get bad information and/or no help from the online team.

I picked this apartment based on good reviews but we did not have the same experience as others. We picked this apartment based on their secure parking garage valet for security with our work equipment. The valet refused to park us and was unhelpful and rude. They told us to use the street parking (which is next to highway and a homeless community) and we could not take the chance of theft so we called the management company for help. We received a response that said they were working on our issue and would call us. So I stood around 2 hours waiting only to realize each response was auto generated and NO ONE EVER CONTACTED ME. We missed our work dinner, had to spend the night and next day on secure parking for work. Ruined our stay completely.
The apartment is clean but the pillows are overstuffed so bring your own pillow so your neck isnt stiff. Honestly there are a million other options in the area and with this type of service, its best to try another rental. I know I will. If you have a single issue they will not contact you to help. This was a nightmare and this is the first bad review I have ever written.

It was amazing on every level except for the 100% polyester bedding and horribly uncomfortable pillows.

What is the deal with AirBNB owners / managers not being willing to spend a few hundred dollars on cotton bedding and decent pillows.

It should a minimum requirement for any STR that costs over $100/night

The customer service from Vacasa was terrible. We experienced a power outage in our unit and had to move to a second unit in the middle of the night. The second unit did not have internet access or tv setup. After making the Vacasa team aware of the issue I tried to follow up for an update and was ignored. Neither issue was fixed during my stay.

Unit was just as expected. Great vibes and views. There was construction being done but I couldn't hear it with the patio door closed. It's located one block from Rainey street with plenty of food and drink options. Scooters are in abundancein the area so that was my main form of transportation to explore around.

Beautiful airbnb in a great area - absolutely no complaints about the actual place. I was disappointed in the communication from the hosts and the parking situation. I messaged the host company twice on the airbnb website - both times I got a canned response from an obvious bot that I only realized was a bot after I received the second response. This was disappointing to me because we were arriving to the airbnb in two separate groups and the first group had to wait for the second group because the host didn't bother reading their messages. Additionally, I thought that the listing should have emphasized the lack of parking. If you stay here, mentally add ~50 bucks to the price because of the valet parking that is not included. I parked elsewhere and walked about a quarter of a mile there, but be aware that this establishment only offers expensive parking and the parking in the surrounding area is very limited.

Really bad communication if you book  this on air BnB, This is a different vacation rental company that is not attentive to their posts on air BnB. I don‚Äôt even think they should be allowed to advertise on air BnB unless they fix this issue. Never have had a worse communication experience on air BnB before. Beautiful apartment though.

While provided with a door code, the front door was always open and there was construction and poor lighting in the area, which made it seem less safe.  The bedroom was cramped and much smaller than the photos.  No luggage racks and a small, undersized nightstand on one side.  Pillows and toiletries were of poor quality for this price point and there were no hooks for towels, coats or clothing.  Every time we turned on the bathroom sink, there was a loud gurgling noise in the water heater closet.  I alerted the front desk staff during our stay of this maintenance issue, but the staff seemed dismissive and I was told they would let Vacasa know but there was no response. The pool was heated, but shallow and crowded and there was no hot tub.  I was not impressed, cannot recommend and would have preferred a hotel in downtown Austin. This place might work for longer stays where kitchen is needed, but I found the main living/balcony area had too much highway traffic noise to be enjoyed.
Pool water was ugly and chips all over the balcony
Do it! You won‚Äôt regret it!

I thought the condo and building were excellent; clean, comfortable, modern, and had everything I needed. The view from this 31st floor condo was stellar. I found the rooftop pool and the gym space very appealing but sadly I did not have time to use them. I am returning to Austin next month and plan to stay in the building again. My only somewhat negative criticism is that the 4 pm check-in was a bit inhibitive for my plans upon arrival that day, but I understand that places need to be cleaned and reset after previous check-outs.
I was charged for four nights of parking but only had a car and parked it there for one night.

My frustrations with Vacasa fall under two broad categories: 1) Refusal to Communicate and 2) Failure to meet basic expectations.
Attempts to communicate with Vacasa resulted in no response, incorrect information, or incomplete information. All communication was cumbersome requiring calling an off-site number even when I was on site. Examples include, but are not limited to the following:
1) Beginning three days before my scheduled arrival at Natiivo in Austin, Texas, I began sending emails and texts and making phone calls to ask about check-in as I was transporting considerable luggage, food, and flowers. My simple request was to talk to someone onsite. Promises were made to call me back, but it did not happen. No response was received for most of my emails and texts.
2) Finally, I received a call one hour before I was scheduled to leave for Austin. The information I was given was incorrect. I was told that carts would be available for the luggage, but they were not.
3) At the end of our stay, I requested a late check-out and was told to call an offsite number, which I declined to do as I did not want to waste another two hours on hold with Vacasa.
I was told that Vacasa is attempting to marry the hotel and AirBnB experience. Unfortunately, the result is the removal of all the benefits leaving only the disadvantages. Vacasa failed to meet basic expectations, including, but not limited to the following:
1) One of the reasons we chose to stay in an AirBnB was we wanted a kitchen. When renting an AirBnB, one assumes that a kitchen will be provided and that that kitchen will have a conventional oven. That was an incorrect assumption. The oven was a fancy microwave with a detailed instruction book. Reading an instruction book is not what I want to do on vacation.
2) I assumed that I would be able to cook in the kitchen; however, very basic equipment was missing.
3) When staying at a hotel or AirBnB, one assumes that coffee will be provided, but Vacasa did not provide it. We brought K-cups because Keurig is the type machine most hotels provide, but Vacasa did not have a Keurig. Vacasa provided a coffee maker but no coffee. Again, poor communication, see point 1 above.
4) The ‚Äúpillows‚Äù were eight inches thick and hard as a rock. They were the most uncomfortable pillows I had ever encountered in fifty years of travel.
5) No luggage carts were available either when I checked in or when I checked out.

We stayed only one night and we wanted to be close to downtown. Location was really good , check in was also smooth however we didn‚Äôt get any check out instruction until after normal check out time! I sent message , contacted the number they provided and left voice but nobody replied. We checked out at 10 and I got a message at 10:38 about check out! Very poor communication! Unit was not that clean , floor was very dusty. If you are planning to stay more than one day you better have some shampoo, conditioner , body wash , etc because there is almost nothing there .

Place was nice. Host was not helpful. They said there was no bag check, but that was not true. He said there was no early check-in. That was not true either. Not at all helpful and they send standard responses that do not answer questions.

This rental is a great location, new and comfortable, but lacked the details and descriptions I expect when booking through airbnb. Full kitchen, but no essentials (EVOO, salt, pepper, etc), no wine key!!! Would have been good to know that the coffee brewer is a nespresso brewer and no pods are provided. Of course nothing nearby on foot sold nespresso pods. Details: Bathroom had no trash can and lacked enough towel racks/hooks. No mirror anywhere else so two people can‚Äôt get ready at the same time. The blankets had hair in them, pet and people ü§¢ And the description and communication about check in procedures was inconsistent which did not assure me I‚Äôd be able to get in after a flight that landed at midnight. I did, but it‚Äôs the assurance of knowing.

Floors could‚Äôve been cleaner, glass was dirty and showed streaks, tv remote had a mind of its own which was very annoying, no directions for the oven caused me to burn my cinnamon rolls. By the way, the smoke alarm doesn‚Äôt worküò∑. Also all the knives were dirty so I had to throw them in the dishwasher (took me a while to figure out how to use it). Other than that, very convenient location and a great view and amenities were great!
Sweet place with sick view
This view and location can't be beat! Loved staying here!

Absolutely DO NOT rent with this company. They misrepresent their properties, the service is THE WORST. They did not disclose we would be staying in a building under construction, they misrepresented a 1 bedroom as a 2 bedroom with the second ‚Äúbedroom‚Äù being a large, windowless closet with a Murphy Bed. The staff couldn‚Äôt care less about my immediate complaints about the accommodations, and after 6 messages, it‚Äôs been more than 5 days and they still haven‚Äôt responded. This is after nothing but wonderful stays with Air BnB. I‚Äôve instructed them this company shouldn‚Äôt be allowed to host! I also left something behind in the condo and they haven‚Äôt given any care to look for or return my item. They are the absolute WORST!!
Original booking had a water leak, so we were moved to a different home

This apartment building feels very much like a hotel, lots of short term guests staying and key card access to rooms. Our room was nice and clean, the furniture was good quality. Be warned that the pillows are very bad quality, way over stuffed and very uncomfortable. We had to buy pillows at Target after our first night of terrible sleep. And if you plan to use the sofa bed, be warned that the curtains in the living room are barely light filtering, so the sun blares through the east facing windows in the morning. The shades in the main bedroom also don't cover the windows completely so there are streaks of sunlight that get in that room as well. Overall our stay was good, but I would not stay here again because I am a light sleeper and those two issues made my stay not the best.

The views were amazing, there is potential for this to be a top Austin Airbnb but it was not ready for guest.  The Wi-Fi didn‚Äôt work, light bulbs were missing, no trash cans, blue painters tape on the walls and ceilings, toilet paper holders missing.  I‚Äôm sure they will correct for future stays.

This condo was 5* as far as condition, view, location, pool, and comfort. However we had a very poor check in experience and also the number listed as the Vicasa contact during our stay wasn‚Äôt answered or texted back. Hopefully this is just a growing pain as they are a new property. But it was unfortunate for during our stay.
Sliding door to the master bathroom was broken, and the fooseball table does not function properly (it needs to get lubed).  Other than that it was a really nice place to stay.

Everything was great.

The only criticism is that the bed wasn't very comfortable. Granted, I'm used to a foam mattress, but I had a hard time sleeping on the mattress.
You can‚Äôt go wrong with the location, cleanliness and Vacasa.

This condo has great views and the decor is tasteful.

TLDR; no coffee maker provided, not a functional kitchen, uncomfortable beds and linens, questionable cleanliness of all kitchen items

I was traveling with my 70 year old diabetic mother so having a kitchen where she could make a snack was essential. The coffee maker is a Nespresso machine for which no pods are provided nor sold in any nearby location this rendering it useless and misleading in their listing. The cookware provided consists of one sauce pan, a 6 inch pan, and a pot. There‚Äôs also a blender. They don‚Äôt provide a cutting board and their policy is to not provide any food items so there‚Äôs no oil, salt, pepper, or any of the other basics you‚Äôd need to have a snack at your home away from home.

Furthermore they do provide some dish soap but don‚Äôt provide sponges so I‚Äôm at a loss to how the dishes prior to us arriving were washed given that the dishwasher does a sub par job. This is supported by our experience with the sauce pan we used to boil water for coffee which smelled like pasta sauce, and the wine glasses that all looked dirty - not just spots and water stains but legitimately unclean/unwashed.

The beds are incredibly uncomfortable and the pillows also feel cheap and are very uncomfortable. The fold out couch feels like sleeping on a thin pad on top of a bed of coils.

I reached out to customer service and they were dismissive and useless. For the cost of this condo their responses felt flat out disrespectful.

In comparison, I stayed at a different condo in this same building for a week prior to check in that was managed by a different management company and I did not encounter ANY of these issues.

Overall, I would never stay at a unit managed by this company again.

Parking is a real pain. This is the first place I've stayed that didn't have at least one assigned spot. If you don't want to pay $40 a night plus tip for their garage, you have to monitor your street parking payment which disturbs your vacation. There is no "real" owner communication, so any help with time changes or specific questions won't happen. Other than that this place is beautiful.

Host company‚Äôs local team was essentially non-responsive. Told we‚Äôd be called when room was ready to check in, never called us. Cockroach found in the room, told there was not an active pest issue because the roach was dead. TV connection to wifi went in and out constantly. Area is great, right next to Rainey street. Space was sufficient for our needs, minus the pest and tv issues. Main gripe is with the host and lack of resolution to our issues.

The place is nice but not worth price. There were just. Few things that weren‚Äôt mentioned or noted. For example: there are no vending machines or little store. The fridge wasn‚Äôt working and our door didn‚Äôt close right. I called the helpline and didn‚Äôt get an answer.  You were expected to take your trash to the trash chute which was fine but there wasn‚Äôt a trash can in the room
Stop by front desk for digital keycard to check-in.
The TVS in the bedrooms did not work and we were denied a late checkout even though we asked at booking and twice while there.

Close to downtown. Was fairly clean, but dust under various surfaces. Biggest complaint was that the walls are kind of thin and the one window faces into the courtyard which I didn‚Äôt really open because of the lack of privacy

My terrible stay here started with small problems that turned into more severe issues.
- On check-in, I relayed to the host that some things weren't working outright
- A power outage left the place unfit to stay in. There was no communication from the host and it was on me to notify them and repeatedly ask for updates. They have no visibility into the maintenance process (their words) and instead kept asking me for power updates. I had to find alternate accommodation during this time as they offered up no assistance and no contingency plan
- A maintenance worker came unannounced to look at an outlet, deemed it to be an electrical issue, and left after 30 minutes of drilling and moving furniture while I attempted to work from home
- The following day I came back midday to find that the worker had arrived in my absence unannounced again, keyed in, and the inside was an active construction zone

At this point I contacted support and cut my stay short. I'd give this a 0/5 if possible.
dirty, no bedding host didn't respond.

Stayed at Mercy‚Äôs place with 4 other people and we really enjoyed our stay.

The place looked exactly like the photos and had everything that was listed on the site. The location was great for my friends and I and did not cost much to Uber to 6th street or head into downtown area near UT campus. I have nothing negative to say about the place:) The listing, however, says 5 people, but it really only accommodates 4 which is an error from Airbnb not Mercy.

I did have a bit of trouble finding the unit itself and the shower did take a little bit of time for the hot water to come out but overall 5 stars!
Not a pretty neighborhood, no privacy do to workers working at the house in our time and security cameras at the pool area(backyard). NO PRIVACY

My wife and I were fairly satisfied with our stay. The main issues were that we noticed the pillows and covers were stained with drool, the pillow and cover smelled like drool so it seemed fresh. Hunter was quick to resolve the issue but we also noticed a faint odor of Marijuana in the room which lingered throughout our stay. Dirty towels and shower equipment were left in the front door I‚Äôm guessing from the previous stay which was unpleasant to see as we walked in and out the apartment. The place did not feel cozy at all since it provides the minimum necessity‚Äôs for a stay. If you‚Äôre looking for a place to just crash this place seems okay if you don‚Äôt mind dealing with little nuisances.
Listing was very clean and host was communicative. There was no hot water during my stay. That was very frustrating because I had to find other means to shower.

The apartment itself was very cute and staged well. My issue was that I didn‚Äôt realize that when I checked in for four people there would only be one bed to sleep in. Apparently an air mattress is available upon request (which the host showed me was listed way at the bottom of the instructions). Then he offered to drop off an air mattress but it was never brought. Our last straw were the four baby roaches we killed, and the bug traps we found in the kitchen and in the utility closet.

Smaller issues were that there was hair in the bed, no trash bags, and no basics, such as salt and pepper.

We left our event a day early just so that we could leave this house.

Please don‚Äôt book here these people are a scam. The address provided was incorrect as well as the code. I filed a complaint and was refunded because they did not reply back. STAY AWAY THIS IS A. SCAM

Apartment was exactly what was pictured. Very clean and organized.

Kitchen had dishes, cookware, etc. but did not have anything like salt/pepper, water filter, storage container, etc.

Bed is Extremely Firm, I personally found it very uncomfortable. (My preference)

Hosts were sweet but i figured I‚Äôd write a review so there could be a few adjustments for the next guest. To start off my stay i kinda was rubbed the wrong way with the amount of rules. To preface i am a single woman traveling solo and it‚Äôs in an area in the process of being gentrified but not quite there could be sketch at night. One of the rules was i had to park on the street and not the driveway. Ok cool..then there was a rule about guests not being able to enter without giving the first and last name. As i had friends who lived in the city i found that inconvenient to say oh Karen Smith is coming at so and so time. There was also construction going on on the property. Also there‚Äôs a lot of check out rules like you‚Äôre doing chores on your vacation which is annoying. If i stayed at a hotel I‚Äôd just walk out. Overall i didn‚Äôt feel comfortable and there were a lot of inconveniences and i ended just going home and not using the last night because it kinda left a sour taste in my mouth.

Mold, toenail clippings, pet hair everywhere, no refunding, 3 allergic reactions, no vacuuming

While the host was responsive and willing to communicate, our stay at this Airbnb was incredibly disappointing. While we saw that it was pet friendly, we did not think that that was an adequate excuse for the pet hair that covered every surface (floors, sheets, couches, etc.) Nor did we expect the toenail clippings that were very visibly scattered across the couch. We first noticed the pungent odor and fur that induced allergic reactions in all three of us within an hour. It smelled strongly of pets which was surprising considering the $110 cleaning fee that was attached to our expense.

Upon seeking a refund, the host asked for us to provide evidence of the uncleanliness. After we did they refused to offer a refund or solutions. We had to scramble to find other accommodations, resulting in the loss of more money. Altogether very disappointing.

The overall place was nice and clean but the customer service from the host was horrendous.

We got in late Wednesday night and we‚Äôre missing the virtual key to get in the building. We messaged Jeremy to get the key and he took a while to respond. We finally got the key but had no fob to get in the elevator for the building. We had to wait for residents to let us in.

We were told the fob was in the place which it was not. Jeremy kept saying that he would ask where it was and advise and bring It the next day. He didn‚Äôt do that.

We didn‚Äôt know we would be right next to the Highway which was so loud and hard to sleep.

Overall the place was nice but the hosts basically ghosted us and were not responsive. We ended up staying one night and leaving.

I did end up staying here, although I had canceled, due to power issues after the severe ice storm. Over all I think this is a great option for students and kids who want to hang out near campus for some fun. It had a great view and was well stocked.

My main issue was that it was not made clear that this is a student living building, an elevated dorm. We‚Äôre in our 30‚Äôs and 40‚Äôs so we felt pretty uncomfortable here, especially after paying $180. It was mostly clean but there was pee in the toilet and the bathroom floor had not been swept. I ended up washing the blanket because I was uneasy after seeing the bathroom hadn‚Äôt been cleaned.
We ended up leaving at 3 in the morning because the bed was so uncomfortable, which maybe for young college students this wouldn‚Äôt be an issue but we were really uncomfortable. It was just really disappointing spending $180 for a night here after the storm which put us out of work for a week and out of power for days.
We loved the place, the bed was very comfy and it is very close to downtown Austin. The only thing we had a problem with was the low water pressure in both the kitchen and the bathroom.
Exceeded our expectations! I couldn't believe the deal we got (on the opening weekend of SXSW, no less). Would absolutely consider staying here again.

The whole point of the stay was for the hot tub and considering I paid almost $300 to find it wasn‚Äôt even working seems unfair. A few other things were inaccurate about the listing but the hottub not working was the most impactful.

La unidad esta bien, decorada bonito. Se parece bastante a las fotos. La distribuci√≥n del apartamento es muy c√≥moda, la ubicaci√≥n me sirvi√≥ porque se encuentra cerca de mi hija, el lugar es tranquilo y en general las √°reas comunes son muy agradables.

De las cosas que no me gustaron mucho: El colch√≥n de la hab principal se hunde un poco y para mi espalda fue dif√≠cil. Le falta cuidar mucho la limpieza y ordenar sus cosas personales en alg√∫n espacio privado. El cubre cama de la hab 2 estaba rasgado y en mal estado, los ventiladores de techo ten√≠an polvo negro en todas las aspas y lament√© mucho encontrarme con las cenizas de su mascota debajo del lavamanos del ba√±o al abrir el gabinete para buscar productos de limpieza. No cuenta con art√≠culos de ba√±o complimentarios, secador de pelo, plancha (le ped√≠ una) y otras cosas b√°sicas que uno se espera encontrar por el precio y la cantidad de d√≠as de mi estad√≠a.

Serena esta empezando en este negocio y seguro corregir√° estos detalles.

As a Superhost, I was very saddened to see such a great looking house be managed poorly. This house is hosted by a large company. So little things that you appreciate from Airbnbs like communication from an actual person, and not an automated response were not present. The listing stated that it could cater to 11 people, but there was not enough towels for my entire group. We also ran out of toilet paper. 1 roll of toilet paper for an entire group is unacceptable. The upstairs bathroom of the smaller house has a horrible ant infestation, I found myself trying to plug the hole in the wall to stop the ants from coming in. The drainage of the large house is also at question - leading to guests having to stand in their puddle of dirty water while showering. The house itself is very new and very good looking, however it is obvious that the host/company is attempting to manage the listing with a very hands off approach. Also, the check out instructions include starting a load of laundry. This is pretty counterintuitive since the cleaning fee is an included expense.
Stay at your own risk

It was difficult communicating with the host and they could not accommodate an early check in and late checkout. I called many times to ask without a response and finally 2 days before the trip, I asked again and they mentioned a fee per hour to check in early or check out late which I was fine with. I mentioned the times I would be arriving and departing, then they said they couldn‚Äôt accommodate it. Very frustrating and had to change our travel plans.

The place wasn't clean-clean but mostly acceptable.  When we opened the freezer it was just about completely full and had nasty looking open food (fish or meat of some sort but truly looked nasty). Every shelf of the refrigerator was also already in use, so we had to move some of his stuff to be able to use the fridge/freezer.  I don't think there was a coffee pot (we didn't find one) and there was junk/stuff in every cabinet/drawer.  There was a smell to the place that was probably from the hookah use (it was in one of the cabinets) or something else.  It's very obvious the place is lived in and probably by a guy. There was just too much junk/trash in the cabinets, dish towels stuffed in different drawers (dirty towels??), open whiskey, open food, dirty fridge/stove/microwave (there was even still a paper towel piece inside the microwave). Overall we were satisfied but didn't feel "comfortable" staying there.
Bugs in the sugar jar. Just not worth the price.

There was no hot water in the shower for my three night stay. Although the host was very responsive and partially reimbursed me for my inconvenience, I would not stay here again based on wanting to have the luxury of taking a shower with hot water any time.
Thank you so much for worrying about my reservation!
Was a great time at this Airbnb! The only bummer was the pool heater was broken, although they did point out to me that the night time temperatures dropped below 55.

This is a great Airbnb for a large group. I would stay here again, and the issues I mention are the issues most hosts running a lot of Airbnbs' at once (including me) face. High recommendation!

The good:
This house is stunning. The bedrooms were huge and comfortable, the showers had good water pressure, the kitchen was nice, and the hot tub was top-notch. The team replied quickly, and had some flexibility in their terms.

Less great:
The neighborhood's going through a transition, fine for us, but maybe not for everyone. Uber in & Out and who cares.
They sent a lot of automated messages that were wrong, with penalties. Such as, "If you lose the keys you'll owe us $500 dollars". This property didn't have keys.
Video surveillance of the hot tub/backyard feels a bit ick. Sound monitoring inside property is ick.
The whole scam of not writing rules on your Airbnb listing, then including endless rules and fines ($1000 penalty for smoking indoors) is lame. Just put your rules upfront.
The sheets were wrinkled and looked dirty, we bought clorox to wash all linens.

Let me start out by saying that the check in process was very smooth, the house was extremely clean, and check out was easier than anticipated. However, the grass had not been mowed in months. The new rehab of the house looks good in the photos, but was very poorly executed. The neighborhood is very suspect with cars on blocks a few houses down and a man exposing himself in the backyard of the house next door. The house also backs up to an apartment complex. We made it through our single night reservation but I will not stay here again.

Very low information was provided. Me and my husband did not know there was other guest that stayed in the house. Upon arrival we had issues opening the door the door had to be nearly kicked down in order for it to open. Could not hear the host when he called my phone for instructions. House was very beautiful although had a putrid smell of Marijuana covered up with cologne. Would not ever book here again. 2 hrs into the stay someone arrived we did not know others lived at the residence. I felt very uncomfortable and told my husband. 5 min later the host called us and told us we had to leave and to call Air b&b for a refund.
Filthy, terrible smell , was not able to stay had to leave immediately
This air bnb was excellent. Easy access to everything but still tucked away from the craziness. A+

It was nice and looked like the photos. But we had a bad experience, the door didn‚Äôt lock at all so we didn‚Äôt feel safe. Also, there was no hot water at all so we couldn‚Äôt shower the water was freezing. We never got help for either problem. Not worth the price.

For the price and location in Austin, it was a good value. However, it definitely seems like this group bought out several of these small apartments, decorated them all exactly the same and took pictures of the nicest one to post to the listing. But what you get is a little different.

Overall the complex was dirty (garbage and litter everywhere), not kept up well (wires hanging out, light fixtures dangling outside of the apartments, chunks of the ceiling on the overhead when you pass through from the parking lot were missing and open with insulation hanging out). Inside of the apartment, it felt run down and incomplete. The coating in the bathtub peeling off, the shower faucet was not connected properly and sprayed water in all directions when turned on, painters tape was left on the ceiling fan and dishes in the cabinet were dirty from previous use.

I was very displeased with my stay here. The apartment was missing amenities, maintenance was much needed, as well as broken and damaged amenities. Most importantly the stove was leaking gas when I was cooking which is extremely dangerous to everyone residing in the apartments. There is absolutely no reason for that occurrence. By the looks of the warning maintenance tags that were inside the kitchen drawer it looks like that issue had been re occurring in the past. Will not be returning in the future .
the rooms were small but as described. the shower was a bit difficult to work out but we got there in the end.

The airbnb was very unsafe a car window was broken, the window looking into the airbnb was very noticeable, the home smelt like smoke, the airbnb was very small compared to the picture while the design was very similar to the actual airbnb the stick flooring, thin walls and unsafe location was enough for us to leave before finishing our entire stay

NASTIEST PLACE WE'VE EVER STAYED! Unsafe getting to the apartment at night with NO lighting in the hall or front door. Broken deadbolt we had to go to home depot to replace, open window on arrival and all windows were unlocked, filthy bathrooms with ball of pubic hair on bathroom floor, and hair on most towels, used washcloths in 1 shower and dried urine in another shower! Nonfunctional electric outlet in living area. Stove was not usable, smoke detectors disconnected and on kitchen counter. Dirt and stains all over the floors. Texture mud all over everything. Silverware sitting in drawer, not in a tray or anything. WORST EXPERIENCE EVER!!! Would have left immediate if schedule had allowed. And now Evonify does not want to refund any money! This place should NOT be allowed to be rented out as it is not safe, completely disgusting, and nothing like it is shown and described in listing!  I wish I could attach the pictures I took!

Unfortunately for anyone thinking of staying here, the pictures of the place are not what you get.  I check in and start unpacking, the concierge called and said we are in the wrong apartment, unbelievable. We repack and move. There was totally different furniture, no outdoor furniture, the patio was filthy because the enormous building going up next door (which are not in the photos). There isn‚Äôt a real coffee maker, no iron or ironing board and when I contacted them about it they basically blew me off.  The one thing they accomplished was getting us an iron and a 24‚Äù ironing board made for a table top.  I had to reach out to them multiple times and then after speaking to a customer service rep who was full of excuses, I just gave up.  Then after I contacted Airbnb they told me the host is refusing to respond about our issues and there was nothing they could do for me.  Customer service‚Ä¶..actually no. There was none.

The apartment is not at all like the photos.  It is dark and dingey and there was a very noticeable foul smell throughout the apartment.  Did not feel comfortable staying so I had to book last minute hotel for double what I wanted to pay.  Host was unresponsive to myself or air bnb support.  Great location, but this was an awful experience.

The listing did not match the unit, there was trash left behind and no hot water. The host knew there was an issue with hot water reported by the previous guest and did not verify/ confirm that the issue was fixed before renting the unit again. Not very considerate when we notified them of the issues, was told ‚Äúwe find it odd that you are just not reporting this‚Äù. I don‚Äôt need to share my bathing routine with you, nor does it matter when I report an issue. No smoke detector, just wires hanging out of the ceiling. Will never use an Evonify property again.

Run. I arrived early this morning booking the night before so I could do so. The area is not that great although they tried to spruce up with painting building. The door is a bit battered and missing Inside lock. The outside yale lock was not working. unit was unlocked but could not lock when I tried to leave. The place looks like a football team ran through it with scuffs on walls all over, closet doors off track. Dirty walls In kitchen with stuff splattered by sink down to the trim which also dirty. Killed a large roach in the kitchen.  Trash left on top of the refrigerator. Kitchen table was dirty with food on it. Bathroom the shower curtain mold and mildewed. The tile paint is peeling off and shower you could not tell if it was clean or dirty. The sofa had stains and attempted cleaning of past stains on it. Look at the other listing in the building  to find same complaints. I can not recommend to other guests unless you are ok with feeling unsafe and not clean.
Die ruhige Lage ist cool. Die N√§he zur Uni und zu Restaurants und Gesch√§ften auf der Guadalupe auch. Wir haben uns wohlgef√ºhlt!

Pro: bed was comfortable, decent price for 2 bedroom Airbnb. Host responded quickly to issues.

Con: Was a completely different apartment than the one in the pictures. No TVs in the bedrooms. Oven stove top was not usable at all and missing parts. No consistent hot water, shower just goes between very hot/very cold every 30 seconds. One bathroom was not clean when I got there (they sent someone to clean it quickly.) Kitchen electric socket didn‚Äôt work, had to move the coffee maker to the floor to plug it in and use it. One bedroom shared a wall and a door with another apartment which I think/hope was locked but there was a lot of noise.

Due to the discrepancy in the listing accuracy and the multiple dysfunctions of the apartment, I asked to end booking early for a refund. Evonify would not agree and only offered to move me to a diff listing in the same building. So I went through Airbnb and left after one night.

Overall experience wasn't too bad. One day prior to my trip I was informed that Wi-Fi hadn't been set up and wasn't available. I asked if there were other alternatives that were available but besides coffee shops only other options given was that I could cancel my trip and book elsewhere. I asked if I could check in early and was asked to pay a extra fee for the service. On the day of my arrival, I informed Edouard that I would be in around 11am or 12pm to check in. He was confused and told me I never paid to check in early even though I had paid days prior to the trip. Thats when he let me know he was sending a cleaning crew and had to "kick out" those who were staying in the apartment before me. He told me the cleaning could get done in 30 min. The time frame didn't make sense for a cleaning that takes an hour or 2 to do properly but he said it could be done sooner but I didn't want to rush cleaning so i asked for my money back. Projector and Roku weren't set up and lacked batteries.

Dakota war sehr nett und hat trotz Zeitverschiebung von Deutschland und USA immer gleich geantwortet und auch einen sp√§ten Check-In gegen 22 Uhr m√∂glich gemacht! Die Villa ist super und mit allem ausgestattet. Sogar mit Getr√§nken! Der Betrag f√ºr die Miete ist schon hoch, aber wir waren 4 Einzelpersonen und 4 Einzelzimmer im Hotel w√§ren deutlich teuer gewesen.
N√§chstes Jahr ist wieder eine Reise zum ber√ºhmten Kunstfestival South by Southwest in Austin geplant und alle wollen wieder in diese Unterkunft!

stayed only 1 night because Host ended up being extremely rude and inconsiderate. while I was out at dinner boyfriend comes back to find Host putting our belongings on the street. there was no altercation until AFTER bf found our stuff had been displaced. now Host wants to over charge for the nights we won't be staying. there was no issues prior to this particular incident. luckily grabbed our belongings before they were wrongfully tossed! 0 stars if possible.
